Granted, I am not a native of LA, so perhaps I am not an expert, but my husband I absolutely LOVED this place. We were recommended by the Front Desk at our hotel and the food was delicious. This was our first meal in Nola, and it really started the trip off great. The crab cakes were awesome, as was the catfish po'boy and the red fish entree. We even came back the next day for grilled oysters and the shrimp po'boy. Sat at the bar both times - great service and atmosphere!

The food was incredibly bad. I usually do not leave comment card but in this case I did.  No response from the Oceana Grill as of today.  
I had the shrimp po-boy.  The shrimp tasted like small rocks that had been fried.  The sauce that seemed an after thought was ok, but the small amount they put on the Po  Boy didn't allow me to taste it.  Overall one of the worst meals I have had to fight through.
Lloyd was a great waiter, service was on spot! Catfish and shrimp were delicious! Highly recommend! Seems a little pricey at first when your food arrives you will know why! Well worth it!!

One of my favorite places to eat in the quarter!  I would recommend the: Oyster's Rockefeller or Oceana's Famous Oysters (both are equally delicious, but the later has no bacon!), Louisiana Crabmeat Cakes, and the Oyster Po'boy.

I love me some gator bites in Nola!! Here at Oceanas they have grilled and fried, you can order it in the same dish!!! Yummy!! So so good, also the dipping sauce it comes with is fantastic. I've eaten gator at a number of places in Nola, this place is the only one I've found that offers it grilled too instead of fried (like every other place). 
I've also had the gumbo here which was delicious and filling. I recommend when you're drunk wandering around and hungry step in for some gator and gumbo. You won't be disappointed. ;)

We stayed across the street from here. Every morning I would watch SO MANY PEOPLE come and go from this place, I figured, it's got to be good, right? Turns out NOPE- it's not. We went in for breakfast and were severely disappointed. First off, the coffee tasted like they brewed it from water fresh out of the gutter outside. I had a crepe, with crab, shrimp and crawfish that were quite likely made of rubber, with over cooked squash, zucchini and red pepper, topped with the nastiest Swiss cheese I have ever eaten. Needless to say, I didn't finish it. My wife had a basic breakfast that had sausage, eggs, and potatoes. She said it was nothing to write home about. I wish I would've checked here first,  although as another poster wrote- it appears for some reason, most people give 4 to 5 stars for everything around here, so I probably would have gone anyway. I can't speak for dinner, but I will never find out now, after the worst breakfast I have EVER eaten
After Gordon was there, I don't know..but I do want to try the crab cakes..maybe I'll build up the nerve after a hurricane..

I have to begin by commending the restaurant for being one of the few places that serve food later in the evening. During my recent visit, it was approximately 9:30pm and it appeared as though most places that served food in the area where either closed or was no longer serving food. 

Upon walking in my first thought was "tourist trap". Do I still think it's a bit of a tourist trap... yes, but they do have some redeeming qualities. Our waiter was so incredibly sweet. I truly can't praise him enough. He truly knew the menu and how to make our experience at Oceana Grill the best it could possibly be. For my meal I ordered the Taste of New Orleans, which included Creole jambalaya, crawfish etouffee, red beans and rice with smoked sausage. Was it the best meal I've ever had? No. Was I full when I left? Yes. I really enjoyed the red beans and rice. However, the smoked sausage was the strangest tasting sausage I've ever eaten. I took 3 bites and couldn't eat anymore of it. The jambalaya was ok... not my favorite, but simply ok. My friends each ordered fried samplers and raved about it. I'll take their word for it though. 

The decor, I felt was a bit obnoxious, and for me screamed TOURISTS! I felt genuinely bad for the staff having to wear the shirt and ties with the big ole Oceana Grill patch on them. Couldn't pay me to wear one of those. 

Overall, my experience here was just ok. Was I satisfied when I left? Yes. Am I likely to return? Probably not.

Fantastic service!  We are here for lunch, shrimp po boy was very good, as were the fried crawfish tails.  Lunch was a four star experience.  So why only 3 stars?  We were told that if we brought our receipt back for dinner we'd get 10% off. So we came back.  Again great service BUT the food tasted like it had been sitting around for a while (first clue should have been that it arrived lightning fast after we ordered, nowhere near enough time to cook it). Food was ok but stale, my wife sent back her redfish because it was so dried out. They also gave us the wrong to go dessert, but honest mistake.  So many great restaurants in this town, I can't really recommend other than for s decent lunch if you are nearby.

I definitely recommend this place as a must eat while in Nola! Great food, great staff, and great atmosphere!! There's seven rooms of seating so the wait isn't long at all. Highly recommend the shrimp fettuccine Alfredo, very creamy and fantastic flavor. Our waitress Ashleigh was great and was on top of things the whole time.

Spent four days in the French Quarter and this was by far the best meal. We got a tip that the crab cakes were good but that's a modest statement. The crab cakes were amazingly fresh and succulent. And it didn't stop there, atop the cakes was "craw cream" which should be called "craw crack" because I am already feening for more. I would suggest a side order of French fries and top it with craw crack. You won't be disappointed with these soggy fries because the flavor is out of bounce!!!

Located near Bourbon St, this restaurant & bar has a nice casual atmosphere.  I had a cup of Gumbo, Cajun Style Jambalaya, which came with a side of sausage & collard greens.  All tasted the best I've ever had.  And we did try different restaurants in the French Quarter throughout the week.  Wife also had the Gumbo with a side of Hush Puppies, which she loved.  It was a cold day so I had a Bailey's Irish Crème & Coffee, which was mixed perfect.  This restaurant was recommended by a local.  A must visit for great tasting food.  They also deliver.

Oh my goodness. To the lovely hostesses, to our waiter, & to the friendly gentleman who brought out our food thank you all for being so friendly, so kind, and so so helpful. You made our experience top notch. The food was delicious. The Cajun jambalaya pasta was so great. The drinks were really good as well, the mandarin blush was our favorite! A must visit while in NOLA!
Yummy Po'Boys and amazing oysters on the half shell. Our server, Jaime, was super nice and informative.

Ordered delivery. They forgot two of our meals and charged us the full amount. By the time we brought it back up to our hotel room and realized we were missing two items, it was 1am and they were closed. So we paid $65 for two items and a small pecan pie (not including tip). Really disappointed in their service. Will not be returning... there's so many other amazing food places in NOLA.
My family stopped by for lunch the other day.  It was  slightly better than mediocre as far as New Orleans restaurants go.  Everything was cooked fine.  It just wasn't anything special.
Great server name FEE....great food...a new Orleans favorite ...this was my second visit and red fish was yummy

I went here for lunch with an adult and a toddler. Seating was quickly done. Nice lighting and background music. I had a seafood gumbo cup and a crab cake burger. The food was great. There's so much more items on the menu I'll like to try next time! I will recommend!

Great Food!  Great Atmosphere!  Excellent Service!  

Oysters were fantastic.  Ashleigh has got to be one of the best servers of all time!

Even though it's right off Bourbon street, it was still a little hard to find.  Got there around 5pm on a Sat night and waited 5 min to be seated.  They have an indoor and outdoor area, we sat indoor.  We ordered the charbroiled oysters, their famous crab cakes, the pasta jambalaya and bread pudding for dessert.  I also got the Abita Andy Gator which apparently has something like 8% alcohol but you can't tell.  Here is the breakdown.

- Charbroiled Oysters - Even though they are not as big as the ones at ACME, I actually liked these better.  These ones were sitting in a butter sauce and not just baked like the ACME ones.  They give you a spork (yes a spork,  like the ones that you get at KFC) to eat them with which actually goes well when eating oysters.  The only drawback was that the bread it came with seamed stale
- Crab Cakes - You get 2 decent size crab cakes...tasty but I wouldn't say mind blowing
- Pasta Jambalaya - Pretty good..came with shrimp and alligator sausage.  It was a good change of pace from all that fried stuff and gumbo I had been eating.
- Beer - I really like the Abita Andy Gator.  It's got good flavor and is perfect for a hot day

Tip
- We got a 10% off coupon from one of those places selling tours and used it with no hassle.

Got the Maris gras pasta and it was delicious only thing is to $25 and the portion was extremely small.... Flavor does in fact make the situation better but overall pretty disappointed with the little amount of food I got for paying so much. 
Not worth it

Service was ok. Our waiter seemed to struggle with a large party. Food was brought out staggered so some were eating while others waited. It was closer to the end of the night and the level of service and quality of food suffered as a result of that I believe. However, I had the seafood platter and it was delicious! Even down to the cole slaw. Also had the Hurricane which came out smoking and it was GREAT! I'd recommend the spot but maybe not late night.

For our 5 day Nola honeymoon, we visited Oceana not once, but twice.. it was that good. Perfect price point and very reasonable.. they have Yelp coupons (btw). 
Service: impeccable! Our server was Shane and he was 5 stars. Every server or host we encountered was 5 stars, in fact. One night we sat at the bar and the next on the outdoor patio (highly recommend!). Patio ambiance was cute, cozy, romantic. NOW: the food... YES! Crab cakes have a mushroom sauce on them which was unique but they were STELLAR. My husband got a jambalaya dish, gator bites, and blackened steak. He said he'd never in his life thought he'd eat alligator but it was great (he got it fried). This is one of our 1st stops the next time we're in Nola!

The best crepe I have ever had! I had the St.  James crepe served by the best server Deannne; she recommended I get the crawfish mushroom sauce with the Crepe; making a great dish amazing. Nicest staff we have encountered on our trip. I had a bite of the crawfish omlette With crawfish etouffe that was also very tasty.

If you eat here, do yourself a favor and get the blackened duck dish. It is fantastic, smothered in some kind of sauce that I don't know the name of. You get a generous amount of duck in this entree, too. Now, for the rest of the dinner (we were part of a party of 5),it was ok, nothing special. I would not recommend the fried catfish platter(although the portion size was excellent). Our kids split a burger which was typical dull flavorless kids fare. The fried oyster po'boy was decent. Could have used a few more Oysters in it. Prices were high, but it's off bourbon street in a tourist heavy area- what did you expect? We ate on the 3rd floor - decor/ambiance good, service/wait staff so-so. Jumbalaya and collars greens  with the duck were solid. We had fried/blackened gator bites as appetizer (half and half) which was good- although the bites were teeny tiny compared with other versions of this same app we've had since then at other restaurants. In retrospect happy we went, but only because of the duck!

We decided to just have appetizers for dinner and boy are we glad we did.  The Crab cakes were the best that I have had in a long time.  They were meaty and the crawfish sauce on top was a perfect compliment.  The alligator bites were just that - alligator meat.  They were not mixed with other fillers so all you got was the meat. The raw oysters were big and plump.  We must have hit it at the perfect time.  We were seated right away and the service staff was great.  We will definitely put this place on your list of places to come back to.
We had gumbo, crab cakes and gator bites.  The food was excellent and our waiter Loyd made the lunch experience top notch.  Friendly and courteous staff.

Fair food.. don't trust a restaurant that buys oyster shells and puts oysters from a bucket on them to sell as freshly shucked. Service is great. Drinks aren't made quite like the menu says.  I recommend the crab cakes. Don't go Mardi GRAS weekend.. prices are jacked up. Great for late night food.

So far so good.

14 of us here for a bachelor/bachelorette party. Yvette taking really good care of us.

These oysters are the biggest and juciest! Rockefeller  sauce is outstanding ; as is the crayfish sauce on the red fish.. creme brulle mmm..( excellent- 5 star rating; sorry, forgot to do months ago )

I went to Oceana because of convenience to my hotel and a coupon I got from a tour agency.

It has the feeling of a mid to low class chain - plastic coated photo menus and all, but the food was first rate, and the prices quite modest.

It may have been the best meal I had in NOLA, which is saying quite a bit.  I got the gumbo, gator tails and an oyster po' boy - all of which were basically perfect.

My friend thought the gator tail was so good he canceled his entre order and asked for more gator.
Jambalaya pasta was great! Red Beans and rice were a little mushier (more like refried beans) than I prefer with very little sausage and not a lot of flavor. Service and atmosphere were very good.

we literally came solely for the fried seafood platter at midnight. came with catfish nuggets, oysters, nice jumbo shrimp, and fries. fried fresh and crispy, and we happily split it between four people. 
open late, good service from Brad, and plenty of seating inside.

Read Eder P's review. Mine was the same except I placed my Oder at 6:58 PM and  at 8:45 PM I canceled my order and went out and ate. 

I would love to comment about the food quality but I wasn't given a chance to eat it.  Maybe next time I will have the forethought to order dinner at lunch time.

Our first time in New Orleans and we dined at Oceana Grill on the last day of our stay. I would say it was one of the best places we ate at while in Nola. For appetizer we ordered crabcakes and for entree we did the blackened red-fish topped with crawfish etouffee and a side of sauteed vegetables and jambalaya. Everything was very delicious although I'm not the biggest fan of seafood. Our server was friendly and welcoming. Would love to come back and try out the rest of their dishes!

Was back in New Orleans,  definitely  had to visit  this place, I came twice,  once by myself,  the other time I brought  my girlfriends. So I love how big this place is. They have a upstairs  dining area. The best thing to start  with I'd a cup of red beans in rice. The best I ever had. You will be licking  the cup clean. Lol. My main fish is the chicken  fettuccine  alfredo. The sauce is so creamy, rich, flavorfull, just all around  delicious. I love how they lightly bread the chicken breasts, I think it adds that extra texture. The pieces of french bread on the side is a perfect  pairring. I will always remember  that  dish.

Had dinner here yesterday,It was pretty crowded but the wait was less than ten mintues. We had a table upstairs so be prepared to walk up two flighta up if you seated up there. Our server nassim was very attentive and made recommendations to us as it was our first time. We had the gator bites,First rime trying them and they were so delicious that we got a second order. We also had fries(which was a little too salty but good) the coleslaw was delicious as well. I had bahama mama and the drink came out smoking pretty cool. Pricing is not too bad,Definitely some place i will visit again next time I'm in nola.

Oceana is similar to a Red Lobster... the food was good. the Gumbo was actually great, but the winner winner chicken dinner was David our Server. He was so patient, fun, and helpful. My group of friends can be a little challenging to please when it comes to food, not that we are rude, just particular eaters- like vegetarians, no pork, etc. So it can be tough when traveling, especially to a place that specializes in pork, meats, and big big seafood. So not the spots fault, which is why i say our Server David was so patient and helpful. A great server knows the menu and knows what to recommend, and how to troubleshoot any problem and he did just that... i will definitely go back when in town... and the fun part is 3 4 hours later after a drunken night of partying who did we see walking home from work, our fantastic server David! oh NOLA!

One of my favorite restaurants that I ate at while on vacation. Menu is great for being able to try all of the famous New Orleans cuisine as it has everything from gumbo to etouffé. It was delicious on top of everything!! I came here because some of the locals recommended it and I can see why. We ordered the seafood gumbo, crawfish etouffé, jambalaya, and shrimp creole. I wish I had had bottomless bowls because it was so amazing. Server was very prompt and took great care of us!

My first time in NOLA and I had a great experience. The food is amazing! Errol recommended the blackened catfish!!!! I NEED TO COME BACK before I leave. I also got the 1/2 dozen fresh oysters and they were very fresh. The side of jambalaya isn't enough but so delicious!  THANKS ERROL!!!!

Very good food and service!! The blackened gator bites and crab cake appetizers were the best I have had. The fried seafood platter was very good also. The special was blackened red fish and it was a little over cooked but the flavor was very good.

We loved the waitress named Desireé!!
So kind and joyfull!!
We expected more from the Po boy sandwich, but was tasteful!

We went to this restaurant 3 times while we were in New Orleans.  The waitstaff was great, the food was great and the prices were great.  Two if my friends ordered the steak and said it was the best they ever had!  I really liked the chargrilled oysters appetizer and the red beans and rice.  I also had the blackened duck during one of my dinners and it was awesome.  Next time we go to New Orleans, we will be back!
Recommended by a local and it did not disappoint! Crab cakes were to die for and service by Jimika was wonderful!

Surprisingly delightful!  When my girlfriends and I stopped here for an impromptu lunch I was very leery of the dark, sportsbarlike scene we entered on the ground floor. However, they swooped all 8 of us upstairs to a bright and airy dining room.  Errol was our fantastic server! What a pleasure!!  He made room for our extra two people with such graciousness and made sure we were well educated on the delicious specials and specialties. The food (I had the crab cakes) was serious cuisine. I had enough to take home for dinner and enjoyed it just as much as the first time around.  Thank you Errol for a great experience!!!
Food was very good, everything was very flavorful! Portions are big, etouffee was huge we had it split in half. Our waitress was very attentive. Will come back.

We have been here 3 times in 2 days and want more! The Alligator bites where delish, the grilled where our favorite. The chargrilled oysters where hands down the best iv ever had!! Service is great as well :)

Had the maw maw and the st james crepe. 
Both were great ! Tons of crab and shrimp in the maw maw...the best breakfast we have had anywhere and we travel a lot..
Kevin our server was terrific !

Service was great. Food was a letdown. Crab cakes meh. Redfish dish meh. 

I would skip this place
The food was absolutely amazing. I have traveled the world and by far this was the best eating me and the family have ever had.

Went here on the recommendation of the front desk at our hotel and was pleasantly surprised.  I would have given them 3 1/2 stars if I could but I must admit I was a little grossed out to find they had been featured on Hell's Kitchen which made me bump them down rather than up.

I will admit that I rather enjoyed my meal while there. We shared the Ceaser salad topped with blackened shrimp and the Crawfish Fettucini and they were both delicious but I don't know if I'd head back there knowing what I know now.
Service was awesome and food was great! Only thing stopping me from giving a fifth star is that the experience and presentation of food wasn't anything that stood out. Oysters Rockefeller were great!
A must if you're in NOLA!! Thank you Marlon for the great service. Oysters and seafood sampler were off the hook.
We loved everything about this place! Probably the most hospitable staff we encountered during our stay and the food was excellent. Crab cake fettuccine was delicious!

I Love the blackened oysters here, can't get enough of them, hence the 2 check -ins in two days. These aren't dry and gaggy  like I have experienced at other places. They put a nice sauce on top of them, and serve them warm with bread. A dozen of them will be enough for dinner. I also had the crab cake , was very good , but these are excellent.

This is my FAVORITE place to eat in New Oreans. I always take whoever I'm with and recommend this place to anyone visiting new Orleans. The wait has never been outrageous for me. Definitely seats way more people than it looks like on the outside. I love eating in the courtyard. I love the chicken Alfredo and they have the BEST crab cakes I've ever had. If you have never been here, you should drop what you are doing and go now.

I had the gator bites, which were good. I had half of them blackened and the other half fried. Both were pretty good, but I preferred the blackened since the fried ones were really overwhelmed by the batter. It came with a yummy dipping sauce. However, it was really pricey. It was like 10 chunks for $11. Not really worth it.

Fiance had the gumbo, which was pretty good.

Went in for breakfast and it was delicious. St. Louis Benedict was fabulous as was the western omelette.
Ezra the waiter was super and gave us suggestions on breakfast choices. Then even helped us out with some places to see in the area.

Fabulous food and atmosphere. Blackened Catfish stuffed with Crab and Crawfish on top of Jambalaya - Oh My Gosh that was GOOD!  Ask for Chris - he was an exceptional server. Prices were moderate and well worth the food and service we received.  We were very happy we went.

Great service!!!! Darrick was amazing and very nice. He gave us a list of places to go to for our visit! The margaritas were great and the blackened catfish was soooo good!!!!! Will definitely visit again!!

Just off aside street from bourbon. Thus place has the feel if Down to earth servers and ambience. Food is varied and delicious as well as reasonably priced. I highly recommend this place if your not into dressing up.
Our server Chad was excellent and very courteous. He explained the specials to us and recommended their popular appetizers. We followed his advice and our meal was awesome. We will be back again.
Great place in the French Quarter for creole food and friendly service at a reasonable price.  Nothing fancy,  but good food with something for every taste.

Saw the amazing reviews on Yelp for this place and decided to try it out for dinner. We were only here for a short time so we wanted to try all the foods New Orleans had to offer so we got three things and shared. We started off with a friend shrimp po boy which was very good next we got the taste of Louisiana platter and the crab cakes dinner. I love crab cakes and I can honestly say these were the best I've had along with the greens they gave us. You can ask my boyfriend I was in love with this meal. His plate was very good as well. Thank you Benjamin for being a great server and everyone else who worked there was very nice as well! This place is definitely worth trying out!

Visited Oceana for the first time as we were driving through New Orleans on our way back to TX. We were looking at the menu outside and were approached by a man who was just leaving who highly recommended we try it so in we went. 

Neat atmosphere, definitely inviting. Our waiter was very nice and very helpful with both making recommendations on our meals as well helping with slight menu modifications for my 8 and 4 year kids. 

We ordered the shrimp caesar side salad, the blackened catfish poboy, and the taste of New Orleans for dinner. The shrimp was delicious and seasoned well. The catfish was cooked beautifully and was better than the fish we'd had just a few days prior on the Florida coast. The taste of New Orleans was a combination of crawfish etouffe, creole jambalaya, sausage and red beans and rice which was also very good. A great dish when we can't decide what to get. 

To drink we ordered the Oceana-tini and the hurricane. They were both disappointing and very light on the alcohol.  Later my husband ordered the local beer Purple Haze and it was fantastic!! I have to see how we can get some here in Texas! 

We thought about dessert because they looked and sounded incredible but decided we were too stuffed after our main meal.

WOW WOW WOW.

Best poboy I have ever had--the catfish was so crispy. The sandwich was sweet and savory, and absolutely delicious. Our servers (visited twice in our four day stay in NOLA) were very friendly and gave us great recommendations.  Our food took the average time to arrive, but it was hot when it arrived to our table.

I highly recommend the catfish poboy--I have not had a poboy come close to theirs back home in California. :(

Our hotel concierge recommended this place when we arrived for our first visit to New Orleans.  The place was busy, our waiter was very helpful.  We ended ordering grilled oysters, crab cakes, alligator tails bites, the catfish Po-Boy and the blackened prime rib.  The service was prompt and the food was excellent.  

There are a ton of restaurants in the French Quarter...I can't wait to try the rest of them, but the Oceana did not disappoint.

The overall experience was disappointing.  The food once it got to our table was made of good quality ingredients.  The wait for food was extremely slow. The shrimp po boy had 4 tiny shrimp not anything like the photo in the menu. It was tasty for the four bites out of 16 that had shrimp. For 15 dollars, the sandwich was poor at best.   Will not come back and will warn others of the experience.  The hotels push it very hard and get a kickback for promoting the 10 percent discount. A tourist trap.  Too bad, it could have been so much better if they had delivered the food on time and added a lot more shrimp.

We came here for lunch and our server Dorothy was super sweet and helpful. For appetizers, I can really recommend the crab cakes; the sauce is delicious! And for dessert try the bananas foster - also fantastic!
The food and service were very good. The cocktails choices weren't great, as they were all super sweet.

This was our first night there, we ran into the Mardi gras parade "Krewe du Vieux" after watching it we decided to go get some food.

This is nice seafood restaurant. I was pleasantly surprised by this place, not the famous place you hear about with such heavy hitters in NO, but this place was darn good. I do believe they are growing in popularity though.

I got the catfish which was great with a fresh cut and batter that's not to heavy but just right. The fries were nice as well, the red beans & rice were delicious. I finished off with a huge slice of cheesecake that is of very high quality. Very good meal overall and they had one of the best waiters I have ever had, service was excellent.

Great choice if you want to eat around the bourbon street area. They usually get the food out to you pretty fast and the last few times I've been here there has been a wait.

As expected, the restaurant was busy, but the service was great. I had the "Tase of New Orleans" and it was fabulous. I thought it might be a bit too spicy when I ordered it, but it was a perfect balance. I recommend making Oceana Grill a mandatory stop while in New Orleans.
Good but the food can be slightly cheaper. The price kinda make sense for the location and its aim for tourists, but I definitely think it can be better.

Hurricane drink was delicious and made me tipsy rather quickly (but it could've been the lack of sleep).

The oysters were fresh, meaty and delicious. 

The alligator sausage was yummy with the remoulade sauce! 

The gumbo included rice and italian bread and was tasty but I wasn't impressed. I definitely had to add hot sauce.

I'd go back for the oysters and to try other menu options. The service was good. Typical southern folk saying goodbyes and thank you for visiting! Love the hospitality.

We almost missed it while waking down Bourbon Street where all the other bar / food places were, it's off to the side of Bourbon and open until 1am on a Sunday night. 

We couldn't decide which type of oysters to order. Our waiter allowed us to do half-half of the Oceana's Special and Oysters Rockefeller for same price as a dozen of just one kind.Protip: can't hurt to ask your waiter for a favor, variety deals for the win! We loved both and were glad we got to try both on a deal.
Service was great! Drinks are delicious and reasonably priced. The food was fresh and so good! The pasta and the poboys are great!

We got there after 8:30 tonight & there was already a line, so we waited another half hour. Seated by Carli, the patient hostess & served by Michael, our waiter. I had a tasty green drink that bubbled like a mini-volcano with a cherry on top. I was already impressed. We ordered the house char-grilled oysters. The sauce on the oysters were mouthwatering. We also got the gumbo, which was 10 times better than my man's homemade version. It came with white rice. There was the salad with alligator. This was healthy and the alligator tasted fine. The tail was gross though. I don't recommend eating that part of the alligator. Then there was the taste of orleans dish which had the etouffee, jambalaya & sausage. Delicious! Creme Brulee was sweet and perfectly made. All in all, a very pleasant dinner worth the wait and the long walk to get there.

Our first night on Bourbon Street and we planned to check out this spot based on all the reviews we read in travel groups. I had the oyster po'boy and the Mister had the "taste of New Orleans" which was a sampler.... everything was great! The young ladies were cool and down to earth when answering our request for suggetions. Great customer service. We will be back!

My husband and I ate here on the last day of our trip to NOLA and it was the best ending to our trip.  My husband got the giant plate of crawfish - something he had been wanting during our trip, and I had a delicious blackened catfish po boy sandwich.  It was exactly what we were craving and made for a perfect ending to our trip!  It's a great little place off the beaten path...definitely a must try.

Came back here after a visit about a year and a half ago. This place gets busy and you may have to wait a bit for a table but well worth it. Things I LOVED: Seafood Gumbo was amazing! I would recommend it with a side of crawfish tales. Simply put the crawfish in the gumbo and you have one of the best soups you will ever eat. Things I LIKED: Service I liked, last time sat at the bar, this time a server took care, made recommendations and was there to refill drinks. Even gave us a complimentary Oceana Grill mug since it was Jazz Fest. Thing I didn't like: Crab Cakes. Although the server recommended the crab cakes, they didn't seem fresh and the crab vs filling content seemed off. I am used to blue crab but it seemed liked something else. I might just be spoiled since I worked at The Oceanaire Seafood Room who I think has the best in the world. I would return when we come back to NOLA for sure.

I'll give the 4 stars for the cleanliness. The food was marginal at best. My wife had the ribs and they were fine but nothing special. I had the over-cooked blackened redfish. The waiter kept pushing the special but would not say the price. Turns out it was a good 50% more that the more expensive meals. We just felt like we were at a Disneyland theme restaurant of a Bubba Gumps. It did not have a genuine vibe.

On our last breakfast meal in NOLA we hit up Oceana Grill as it popped up as a pretty popular breaky joint on yelp. We thought this place was solid! The service was friendly and attentive (particularly so after the inattentive service from last nights dinner at Royal House) and the food was good. We both got the same dish - the country breakfast but I got my eggs over easy and with two types of sausage while the bf got his eggs poached and with a sausage patty. My sausages were really good - I can't recall exactly what they were but our server recommended I try both and I did not regret it! I'm not a huge biscuits and grits kinda gal but these were delish as well in my book. If you're looking for a hearty breakfast with friendly service, I would recommend Oceana Grill.

Great seafood in a dark, divey bar atmosphere.  We had the restaurant's special (redfish), which was served with a delicious crawfish-cream sauce and garlic potatoes and zucchini.  I think it was like 14 bux and it was a large, very freaking delicious, entree.  We also shared the Taste of New Orleans for 16 bux (Creole jambalaya, crawfish etouffée, red beans and rice with smoked sausage).  The red beans and rice was amazing... I am still trying to figure out how beans and rice can taste SO good.  Definitely a bar atmosphere but really delicious food and a good breakfast and lunch menu.  The bloody mary was off the chain as well, complete with olives and pickled green beans...perfect hair of the dog!

Crabcakes were awesome. Probably the best I've had. Blackened redfish. Excellent. But while waiting for dessert we saw a mouse boldly cross the room. Not once but about 5 times. Manager came by and saw the mouse too. He comped the ticket. But wasn't as freaked out about it as we were. I'm sorry. All that awesomeness is wasted when you have active vermin crossing the floor during dinner. We won't be back and will recommend avoiding this place.

Had a very good experience at Oceana Grill during my vacation to New Orleans in late-February.  The restaurant was very busy at dinner and we were given the option of eating upstairs in one of the smaller and quieter dining rooms, which was a great choice!  Alex was our server and he suggested a very good cocktail to me - the Tropical Storm - which wasn't too potent, since I had already consumed two fairly strong tiki cocktails at a bar prior to dinner. Started with Crab Cakes as an appetizer, which were very good.  Alex offered the Soft Shell Crab Platter as an option not on the menu, when I mentioned that I really loved soft shell crab....the crab was good, but very slightly mushy since it was obviously frozen and not fresh, but had good flavor.  I would recommend Oceana Grill for its extensive menu and very good service!
The Mardi Gras Pasta was amazing, and loaded with shrimp and crawfish. The crab cakes were excellent.
Decent food.  Easy to get groups in. Great customer service.  Try the blackened alligator bites!

Heard this was a good idea for kids as well as adults and us adults were starving after a full day of swamp and plantation tours so we ignored the tantruming toddler and kept the 6yr old's eyes diverted up Bourbon Street (I'm not a prude, but naked strippers walking up the street at 5:30pm....well I'm going to find another time to get on my feminist soapbox)

Anyway - all was great here. Our serve David was awesome, food and service was very prompt (thank god - see above about tantruming toddler). Kids fish fingers and fries alone were delicious! Manshape had an apple martini and I had a lemon drop (which tastes like there was no alcohol in it) and both followed up with dirty martinis (it had been a long day) then shared:

Oceans oysters - seriously fab, piping hot and the sauce was delicious
Fresh oysters - they were huge but utterly tasteless and bland (my reasons for docking a star)
Crap cakes (appetizer) - very very good, agree with previous reviews that they were all meat and barely any filling, sauce was great and they were both huge so I'm glad I just had one
Blackened redfish with shrimp étouffée - this is divine, sauce was delicious, fish was meaty and moist, accompanying greens and jambalaya properly tasty

We left very happy indeed (and walked a different way back to our bus stop)
First time in New Orleans. Great food! Great service! Quit reading all the reviews and go!
Host was rude , I got a shrimp salad it was good . I did expect more but can't complain I guess you order what you get shrimp salad this place is over rated
Ate here with my coworkers for brunch. The food was great! You have to try the alligator bites. Our Waiter Lavern was so nice. Would highly recommend!
Food is great local fare. Tastes great! A bit of a wait outside but goes quickly...it's a big place inside.

This is a tourist type place. Service is very good, but food is kind of bland. Another in a list of disappointing places I found in NO. I'd call it diner food, but most people haven't been to a real diner. If you're looking for a safe and boring diner, go here. The food it's good, but not what I would rush back to.

Our last day in NOLA. Have yet to have a fine bowl of gumbo until we hit Oceana.  Had to wait outside in the rain for a bit but it was worth it.  Once seated our waiter promptly introduced himself.  My wife ordered the Seafood Gumbo and I had the Taste of New Orleans.  The Gumbo was full of shrimp and had a very good roux flavor.  My plate had Red Beans & Rice, Crawfish Étouffée, and Jambalaya. The Red Beans & Rice were fantastic.  Everything else was good.  Was very happy that we chose a place to end our trip with great food and service.

Crab cakes were so good unfortunately that's all we had a chance to try. The appetizer came out 10 mins before our cocktails -_-.  Service was no good we ended up leaving before ordering entrees bc server took so long to come back to the table.
I had the Catfish LaFouche.  It was awesome. No picture...sorry!  Dug in before I thought about it.
Stopped by before the Sugar Bowl and had a bowl of gumbo.  Love the atmosphere and our food was very good!  Our waiter was excellent.  Will definitely come here again when we're in town.

WOW WOW WOW!!!!  If you arrive on a busy night expect a LONG LONG line.....don't be discouraged it goes pretty quick about 30 minutes as this is a BIG place and seating goes quick.  100% GREAT.....red beans and rice...INCREDIBLE....fried seafood platter....BIG TIME WOW!!!  Breaded and seasoned just right served HOT and fresh as it should be.  This is a MUST GO TO PLACE.  Fantastic and friendly service, quick and very attentive staff.  Did I say WOW!!!!!

Yesterday marks my 3rd time to dine here. All 3 times were amazing!!! Service was amazing as well!! Crawfish Entoufe, Gumbo, Gator Tail Bites, Crab cake omg good, the signature plate fish entre, mash potatoes, Greens ( Wow this was a game changer), oysters on the shell...Everything was amazing!!! I have told many people to please stop by. They will not be disappointed. Im a fan and will return on my many trips.

We had great service from a nice chap named Errol. The decor was comfy and classy and the second floor overlooked the madness of Bourbon Street during Mardi Gras. 

However the food was only so-so. I'd compare it to chains like Applebees and TGIF with a cajun twist. The crab cakes at $16.50 were so so. The oysters weren't the freshest. The jambalaya pasta was also just average, The pecan pie seems store bought. Overall the prices weren't too bad, All this and a coke of $58. Not the worst deal but not high end cuisine. With s many options in NOLA I would not go back

https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g60864-d640254-r356683370-Oceana_Grill-New_Orleans_Louisiana.html#

The four stars are for the service and ambience. The food gets about three stars. I was sent here by the bellman at my hotel. I had breakfast. The coffee was cold and the French toast was okay. I had planned to go back for drinks but never made it back. The bartenders are great. I sat at the bar for six hours before I knew it. People walk in and out so I met a lot of different characters. I enjoyed myself immensely. I was told the shrimp is delicious. I don't eat seafood so I never found out for myself.

Had a large group of 18 eat dinner and I understand seating that many people can be difficult and will almost always take some time but the hostess promised us if I had all my people present it would only be a 10 minute wait for 18 person party after waiting about 45 minutes we were finally seated.  After the initial problem the restaurant really did step up with fantastic service our drinks came out quick the food came much sooner than one would expect with such a large party.  Our waitor was very knowledgeable on the menu and the specials for the evening.

Great local food, good service, nice atmosphere. Outside seating is uncomfortable..wrought iron chairs with a plate size seat don't encourage lingering. Try the Sampler plate with red beans & rice, ettouffe and gumbo with some fried alligator and turtle soup. Yum!

Fantastic local New Orleans food in the heart of the French Quarter. Excellent service, great drinks and family friendly. The prices are more than fair for the amount and quality of food you get.

Best thing on the menu is the soft shell crabs. I will be back!
Quick service, not much smiling but efficient. Jumbalaya was good. Grilled oysters were a bit oversauced, but still good. Line that formed outside moved at a good pace.

All around excellent experience. Short wait (less than 5 minutes) , friendly wait staff, delicious food. Sazerac was great. And they had some gluten free options, including crab cakes. They were very rich. Blackened redfish plate (not gluten free) was wonderful with a hefty portion. No room for dessert.

Wow.  This was place was definitely a fortunate surprise.  We originally had intended to grab some dinner at ACME, but were turned away because of a private event.  However, upon asking for some recommendations from some locals, they suggested Oceana's was definitely one of their favs, so we decided to take a chance.

The restaurant was bustling, but we were still able to get seated very quickly and our server was the sweetest person ever.  She gave us suggestions and suggested their signature dish of red fish Oceana.  So naturally, that's what I ordered and I absolutely loved it. The flavors were all balanced and very tasty.  It had the light but creamy mushroom and crawfish sauce that was just perfect! Compared to all the other restaurants that we had visited during our vacation, Oceanas was definitely one of my favorites. Highly recommended if you're inNew Orleans.

This place was amazing! We came here after checking into our hotel to get some dinner. Our server was super friendly and polite. We had crab cakes for an appetizer, they kicked off our meal to a great start. The seafood platter was huge (and yummy) and enough to feed at least two people. The blackened chicken was also delicious! When we are in the area again we will surely be coming back for more!
The food, service, & experience was hands down amazing. Also Lloyd was was awesome & so on top of everything. You really want to listen to his suggestions he cannot steer you wrong.

Rolled in here with Lovely Girlfriend and we were on a mission: eat quick without reverting to some Slice joint on Bourbon.  You see, we had to meet the esteemed KT and his revered guest at the Ritz Carlton in 45 minutes.  We made a good decision coming in here.

As usual, we sat at the bar.  Decided to split the jamba/redbean/etouffee platter and the alligator sausage appetizer.  Very delicious, and quite filling while at it.

Great service by the bartenders.  Only downside:  a fleet of loud and disrespectful fratboys walked in and seated themselves, expecting immediate service.  You could tell they were closet homosexuals by the fact that they talked loudly about the bitches they'd conquer tonight while tightly gripping their neon green slushy drinks. Luckily, we were on our way out, but if I ran the joint, I woulda thrown them out on the marginally false premise of "homophobia".

First, get yourself the oyster appetizer! 

We loved this place! The service was friendly, food came out fast, the quality was really good, and the prices are cheaper than Red Fish Grill.

2nd time eating here! Wasn't as good as the first time but I'll give them a break bc we got take out. 
The crab cakes appetizer is outstanding & filling! ( I eat it as my main dish) They also have good raw oysters & shrimp po'boys. They stay open late & have a great selection of food. 

I will continue to go back every time I'm in town just for the crab cakes!

We came here around 10pm for a late dinner. Everyone that we knew said we must stop by here. I ordered the Oceana's Famous Oysters which is Freshly shucked Louisiana Oysters on the half-shell, chargrilled over and open flame, smothered with our unique zesty garlic and cream herb cajun sauce, finished with a fresh blend of parmesan and romano cheeses. OMG trust me when I say you have not had char oysters until you have these! I also ordered their special of the night which was grilled red fish, mash and greens. Everyone was picking off my dish! Lots of flavor, grilled perfect and it wasn't too fishy. I say that because my sister in law doesn't like fish and she liked it.

I am a huge fan of yelp, and usually do my homework in advance of visiting any city to scope out restaurants, but we just kind of went for a walk in the French Quarter down Bourbon Street, which is totally not our kind of environment. (A few streets over though, it was a totally different vibe with tons of amazing galleries to peruse.)

We wanted authentic Cajun food and an air conditioned place in which to eat. It had music that wasn't too loud and the perfect menu, so we thought we'd chance it. (Oceana Grill is just off Bourbon Street.)

My wife had the crawfish etouffee' and I had the taste of New Orleans that allowed me to sample creole faves.

Our server was great. Friendly, courteous and attentive. (We joked that there seemed to be one staff for every patron in the restaurant!) Our biggest complaint was that we placed our order and, no kidding, within 5 minutes was delivered. They should at least give the illusion that someone is working hard behind the scenes preparing our meals to order, not simply scooping it out of a warming pan in the kitchen.

Having said that, the food was great. Generous portions. Great flavors. The red beans were very tasty... had a great smoky flavor. Loved every bite!

I would definitely go back.

This was our first stop on a food tour we took earlier in the day.. After looking at their menu we decided we'd come back for dinner. 
We ordered the alligator bites as appetizers.  I was a bit skeptical since I had never tried it.  They were good! We ordered half fried & half grilled. Taste like chicken lol. Delicious!  Hubby ordered the BBQ shrimp and he enjoyed that very much.  The sauce was perfect, the shrimp were fresh and easy to peel.  I ordered the crab cakes with crawfish and mushroom sauce. Was not disappointed.  Crab cakes were delicious and the sauce ...mmmm.  We will definitely return b4 we leave. We wanna try the seafood platter next. I'll keep you posted :).
Ask for Pamela she is the best! Food is bangin! Fried catfish po boy is on point! Highly recommend this place to anyone

Awesome experience in the French quarter at this place the Barbeque shrimp has me still licking my fingers it's a must have! The wife had the crab cakes which are no filler all crab with a great sauce. The red beans and rice are second to none.

As a professional chef I take into consideration a few things when eating out in a restaurant.
The service: was fast and friendly.
The food: needs a few improvements.
I ordered the shrimp platter the fries weren't crispy and the shrimp has a very thick breading. There was more breading than actual shrimp.
Also the biggest mistake was over cooking the shrimp in fryer. The breading got super crunchy, my teeth was hurting from chewing and the shrimp was ruby.

Good, but not terribly amazing. Had fried shrimp and gumbo, both of which tasted fine, just nothing to swoon over. A bit pricey for what it is. Love the sweet tea and the building...it's a really large establishment for the quarter (as long as you're not comparing to Pat O's).
We had the alligator bites, seafood platter, and shrimp alfredo. All of the dishes were satisfactory at best. Good staff.

I guess I'm spoiled. I ordered a shrimp Po boy and I always expect that the bread with be lightly toasted and will be crispy and flaky on the outside and the shrimp will be freshly fried and full of flavor. 

What I got was a rubbery piece of bread, and tasteless farm raised shrimp that was left in the warmer till it was overcooked, dry and tough. 

On the other hand, The remoulade sauce was sharply spiced and creamy, and it saved the dish. 

A cute place in a fab location, Such wasted potential!

C'mon Oceana! You're better than this!
I had a few cocktails here and a Fief Shrimp Po-Boy. It was fair to good. Probably not the best place for one. Overall the service was super fast. In fact maybe too fast but the food was ok.

The chargrilled oysters, gator bites and crab cake burger were out of this world. Our server, Pam K., was an absolute delight. She should totally be on a training video, lol. I'd come back to Oceana again and again and advise you to do the same!
Wonderful outdoor dining and the most fantastic service! Food was good but service really is the highlight here, makes everything else that much better!!

I truly enjoyed my dinner at Oceana. One I want to commend them on A-1 service. We were a small group of four but David was an excellent server. Full of knowledge of the dishes and menu as a whole. 
Every dish we had was delicious. I had the barbecue shrimp ($20) 10 jumbo size shrimp and bread for the sauce. I also ordered the side of red beans and rice ($4).

Because I was headed to Bourbon next I avoided a cocktail here and just had the sweet tea. It was good. 

I would certainly come back again. Excellent food and service paired with a great location in the Quarter.

Good for groups. My friends and I were there in Jan 2016

Stopped in for a quick bite on the way to harass some Seahawks fans (they really should have ran it on the 1). We were quickly ushered to our seats by Miracle, following which our server introduced his trainee, Morgan. To our delight, Morgan enlightened us to the possibility of a secret dish called "Mardi Gras Pasta". It was one of the most succulent dishes I have ever had the pleasure of enjoying, though I fear Morgan may have been admonished for suggesting a secret item. Our server took a second round of food orders due to his rusty memory, we ate another Mardi Gras Pasta, and then left. Later that evening, my bowels paid the price for that pasta. I had the squirts like a tube of go-gurt. Overall though, I was very pleased. 5/5 would visit again.

I've gone a few times. But for some reason this time was the best! My friend and I shared the crawfish fries. Ssssoooo gooooood! My pasta was delicious as well. The hostess and waitress were very pleasant and nice. The waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu and was able to provide recommendations. Will definitely be be back!
Food was good . 1st time in NOLA . Waitress Kim was extremely attentive . Service could not be more hospitable . Had the gator PoBoy blackend .  Was awesome.  Lots to choose from .
I really enjoyed this food. I wanted crab cakes and theirs are phenomenal. A little pricy for every day but the food is really good. I'm very satisfied.
We got cajun tour? And the ocean banana, everything was amazing, get this rice and beans. Place is spendy but worth it

Was here back in 2015 and the service and food was much better. Maybe it was due to the time of day, should not matter. The red beans and rice are awesome and the hurricanes are the strongest in the quarter if you ask me

The aligator bites were delicious!  The oyster Rockafeller with that sauce....oh my!  Our waitress Jessica was phenomenal!  Get there early or you will be waiting on line!  Yes...its that fantastic!  Highly recommended!

We were in New Orleans for a conference and looking for someplace to eat on a Sunday night.  This place was recommended to us by Big E our airport transfer drive, and a shot walk from our hotel. The food was very good, service was good, very fast.  Price was reasonable considering location.  We had Taste of New Orleans, and red beans and rice was the best I have ever had.
As per location, service was great, drinks ok, food ok... Nothjng jumped out as GREAT!!!

This is my favorite breakfast/brunch menu in New Orleans. The old Petunia's menu lives on here, and it's still tasty, in large portion and very New Orleans. The alligator and andouille sausage were great, and the sausage gravy was some of the best I've ever had-- and I'm southern. My friend's Pain Pardue was just average and a bit hard to cut and chew. The service was very friendly and welcoming. We did not eat the lunch or dinner options, but the fried seafood platter looked like a delicious heart attack on a plate.
Crowded but our food was fresh and hot. A little too dark but the manager turned up the lights just enough to see the menu.

We decided upon this place after perusing a LOT of menus around Bourbon Street - after a recommendation from a cop & hearing good things from people leaving the restaurant. 
It was Christmas Eve, & the place wasn't busy at all, we got a table right away & our server was super friendly! She recommended the crab cakes with crawfish on top & IT WAS INCREDIBLE! Best crab cakes we had while there (we had them about 3-4 times, different places) We both ordered the Redfish, my husband got it blackened, & I got their "specialty" - both were absolutely delicious!
Service was great, the waitress was awesome - I will def. recommend to friends!

Started the night off with the Gator Bites, blackened and fried. Fried was the best, both were delicious. I shared the Taste of New Orleans with my husband and it was amazing! Red bean & rice and étouffée were way better than the Jambalaya. I also tasted the fried catfish, I'll just say the Gator was seasoned much better than the fish to my surprise.

I still think about the RED BEANS & RICE! The crab cakes were delicious as well. Our whole group forgot to check in while we were there so we missed out on the 10% off! There was also a 10% coupon from a pamphlet that we picked up at the airport. Our server was great! (So sad we forgot his jaWould definitely go back.
Very good food and ambiance. Laid back atmosphere and quick service. Our server tonight was somewhat rude, but my crawfish tail poboy  was good in spite of her attitude

Food- great!  Service- superb.   Our waitresses name was Jessica and she was absolutely perfect.   She was fast, friendly, efficient, knowledgeable and a pleasure to deal with.  All of our questions were answered accurately, so we knew exactly what to expect (it was our first time eating Alligator).  
Great food and a great time!

One of my favorites in New Orleans!  The duck is absolutely incredible.  Also open late which is hard to find if you are looking for a decent sit down.  Service is always excellent as well.  Can't wait to get back here!

Always a good experience whether it's for breakfast or even late at night. Food is great.  Drinks are strong. Service is great. I never miss a stop at Oceana every time I visit NOLA. Maw Maw's breakfast is my fav and I love their grits! Mmmmmmm!
The food at this place is not good.  I have no idea how they manage to stay in business. Literally the worst crawfish étouffée I've ever had. You have been warned.

Stopped here for breakfast one morning. Way overpriced, their breakfast menu has limited choices, slow but friendly service, and the food was average at best. Realizing I went to a seafood restaurant for breakfast, it wouldn't be rational to expect a 5 star visit. But I paid as if I were getting seafood and didn't. Total bill was $138 plus tip for 5 adults and 2 kids to get an IHOP quality breakfast.

Really great food, exactly what we were looking for in a New Orleans restaurant. We had the Red Fish Pontchatrain and Taste of New Orleans. Both dishes were extremely tasty, especially the Red Fish, which came with a cornbread stuffing, corn maque choux and Pontchatrain sauce. Service was friendly, we only waited about 15 minutes to be seated and for a busy Friday night, our orders came out quickly. David was a friendly server, as were the rest of the staff. All around a positive experience, would definitely recommend it!

This place was packed and for good reason! The Cajun comfort food they served was delicious and reasonable They don't do fancy they do good food Worth putting on your Yelp bookmarks and your to do while in NOLA
Errol ROCKS!  Great guy and provided awesome service! The food was great and  a pretty good value.

Had the raw and oceana oysters, seafood gumbo, blackened bayou duck, and bbq ribs. The oceana oysters ok, but everything else was to die for!
We went to several other restaurants while we were here, but Oceana beats them all hands down!
Definitely a must try.
Good ambiance. Our server Michon was really nice. Good food. Good portions. We wanted to go back but didn't have time. I recommend this place!
Excellent service with delicious good. Our waitress Lia was the best! She had great recommendations and was super nice. The gator bites and catfish entree was off the hook!

We enjoyed the food quite a bit, from the seafood to the steaks. I had the surf and turf, and my steak was cooked perfectly and had great seasoning. The shrimp I had were also fried perfectly and were very crunchy and juicy. Collards and jambalaya were also excellent. We ordered the chocolate mouse for dessert and found it to be richly, creamy, and a great end to the meal. The biggest let down was the hurricanes we ordered- too sweet with not even a hint of alcohol. I would recommend avoiding the mixed drinks and just enjoying the excellent food!

Came here with my husband & some friends during Mardi Gras weekend 16'. I'd heard great reviews about this place so we had to try it. unfortunately, the food was just subpar. I had the popular crab cakes, which were not good at all. I've definitely had better in the crab cake department. And I also had a seafood pasta, which was just ok as well. There are definitely better places to go on bourbon st. When it comes to food. I left disappointed. I'm glad there wasn't much of a line to get in the door like there usually is bc I would've been pissed to wait for just mediocre food.
Superb grilled oysters with a killer sauce. Get the full dozen... Blackened chicken very good. Fries above average. Service friendly and very prompt.
Service was fast! Food was delicious! Only issue was they made us wait outside in the rain while they prepared our table, but inside was crowded so this wasn't completely unexpected.

Our servers Mike C. & Emonie were great and they recommend The Redfish Pontchartrain dish. They did not disappoint with this recommendation. 

A Louisiana blacked redfish filet atop crawfish cornbread. Topped with creamy shrimp pontchartrain sauce, served with  side of mustard greens! 

I highly recommend this dish! Do yourself a favor and give a try!

A fun, huge place right in the French Quarter.  The staff easily accommodated our party of 8.  I had an appetizer of crab cakes-- delightful.  My entree was blackened catfish drizzled with étouffée and a side of greens. Although my étouffée was a thin, with little crawfish-- the catfish, the greens and the crab cakes made the meal completely enjoyable.  I finished my meal with a lemon drop martini with an perfectly sugared rim.  Everyone in our party was also pleased with meal-- but for one significant note.  Two in our party ordered the duck that did not have enough breast meat.  Great for tourists.  #chifoodie #foodtourism #NOLAtourism
Came here my first night in New Orleans with a party of 11. It wasn't a long wait at all. I had the shrimp creole it was pretty good. Not too spicy either.  Service was great and everyone greeted us.

My wife and I stopped here Tuesday for a late lunch after walking the Quarter and it was very loud and busy but we did get served after a 10+ minute wait. The shrimp were a little small and maybe previously frozen and the jambalaya was a little spicy. Overall it was an okay+ meal but a little high priced.

Great food. My husband had the blackened chicken and loved it. I had the taste of New Orleans and it was pretty good. I wish I would have made another choice, but the red beans and jambalaya were tasty. My daughter loved the creme brûlée. It was her first time trying it and she is now obsessed!
This place was bees knees    We would eat here again any time.   Got food and dessert. Loved it

Had Maw Maw's breakfast on a cold morning and it hit the spot.  Portions a plenty and the food is really tasty.  Would give it 5 stars but the shrimp was not deveined (not a deal breaker but a lil gross to look at and think about) in my breakfast mash.
Best place we ate at while there on business trip.  Service and good was first class. This will be a stop every time we make the trip to New Orleans

Wow. The Cajun jambalaya pasta made it to my top 3 pastas I've ever had list. We arrived for dinner around 6pm on a Monday with no reservation and were seated immediately outside in this adorable courtyard. Our waiter was friendly and patient with us because we couldn't make up our minds. We ordered gator tail bite as an appetizer, half blackened and half breaded, I think. They were delicious. Then, I ordered the Cajun Jambalaya past and my friend ordered the Spinach raviolis. Both were amazing. The flavors in both were strong and so authentic. We cleaned our plates. I highly recommend going here.

When we left around 7:30pm, there was a line out the door. So, plan to arrive for an early dinner or make a reservation. It's a bit pricey with the main dishes ranging from $13-$20+ but I think it's worth it. Cozy, beautiful atmosphere and delicious food!

We went here with a 3 yr old - bit hesitant because it's right next to bourbon street. This place is really kid friendly, awesome food and great service

Their golden Margherita was out of world - so was redfish blackened

I got to my hotel and order some food...I've been waiting for and hour and a half...it's 12:21am
You guys sucks!
Worst delivery service ever!
Wow! The service was outstanding (Casey was fast and attentive!) and the signature dish crab cakes did not disappoint!  Ended the meal with a wonderful bread pudding...We'll be back!!!

I'm sure the locals would disagree with me, but I think this is definitely one of the spots you have to go to when in New Orleans. I actually ended up coming here after getting a recommendation from one of my friends who works in the area. I didn't want to deal with the line or craziness of Bourbon St, but I was suprised when I walked straight in and was seated in less than 10 minutes (I'm sure this is atypical, but I had to mention it because it's why it got 5 stars from me).  

The waiters were very attentive and courteous and the food was AMAZING. I just wish I stopped by earlier during my vacation so I could've tried more on the menu.

Great place in the heart of the French Quarter!  Has so many items on the menu that you will find something.  I had the blackened chicken porboy and my husband had the fried shrimp.  Huge portion and came with seasoned fries.  Sauce had a little kick but was delicious! A definite must for good cheaper food, clean restaurant.  Great friendly staff.

This is just off bourbon street which makes it easy to find and right outside of all the excitement. I got the Louisiana crab meat cakes and the catfish po boy and my girlfriend got the chicken Alfredo. The crab cakes are packed with crab meat and very flavorful. I also tried the black and gold gator tail bites. If you're feeling adventurous, I recommend trying the blackened gator bites.

The catfish po boy was exactly what you would expect for a white fish po boy. The chicken Alfredo had a little kick to the sauce which was a nice Louisiana twist to a very typical meal. 

Overall the ambiance was nice and if you're looking for a place to eat in the French Quarter you may want to give this one a try.
Great! Whole team = so nice! Best service ever!!! Errol & Jordan! Thanks for the fabulous recommendations of crab cakes and the special, redfish on top of étouffée with crawfish topper! Go go go!

Came here for lunch a couple days ago by recommendation of our hotel. And the only word I can use to describe my experience is, WOW!!!! We sat at the bar upstairs. And Megan rocked!!! She made us feel like old friends and beyond comfortable! The food was so rich and flavorful and phenomenal!!! Ill def be back on my next trip in. Asking for Megan is the way to go for me from now on!!!
Great oysters and crab cakes to die for! Definitely recommend

My husband and I went here for our first stop on our trip to NOLA for dinner. The menu had it all. Alligator, duck, crawfish, bread pudding, etc. So many choices!! I had the Blackened Duck with crawfish and mushroom sauce, and it was delish... The jambalaya and greens were not as tasty and the greens tasted like they came out of a can. My husband had half catfish and half fried shrimp po'boy. He said it had no flavor. Crushed his and then finished my duck and wish he ordered what I had instead. It was my birthday and the song and energy to sing was so awesome!!!
Great food!  I had the seafood special and Justin had the taste of New Orleans. Both were outstanding!!  C.J our server made the night perfect.  We will come back here again and again!!

if i could give a 0 star i would...pls pls do not waste your hard earned dollar at this circus of a place! i made the gravest mistake of my life orderibg the seafood crepe and it was like eating such bad bad food...i had to pay 18$ for this crepe..pls pls do not go here, this is such a disaster of a place

Tourist trap...Tourist trap....Tourist TRAP!!!! Stay away!!! First and last time Ill be goin here for mediocre imitation cajun seafood. 

Entrance: The whole wait line is a bit of a joke and big PR stunt - think NYC LA nightclubs. We just walked in unbeknownst without waiting in line and they offered us a seat within 2 mins. Once we were seated upstairs, the entire dining room was EMPTY... like no one there. I aksed why there is a line outside if there are so many seats open... i didnt get an a straight answer (Shocking!!!!) 

Menu: ok so after unknowingly "cheating" the line, we ordered crab cakes, mardi gras pasta and their "signature dish" called oceana redfish. Waitress (who was pleasant) asked to add crawfish ends for another $5. Sure why not!!! 

Presentation and Taste: Within minutes I had another server drop off lukewarm  (read: pre made) crab cakes smothered in a very rich sauce. It was like sauce with some smushy $15 imitation crab like patty! Then came the pasta and their signature dish. Both were once again loaded with Sauce (LOADED). Pasta was box pasta boiled and sauce was a joke. Red fish was breaded and fried long time ago and served warm... not flaky at all!!!! Again..think quantity over quality..

Conclusion: stay the F away, they lure you in with the lines outside and fake business pics on yelp. Actual photos suck and has zero taste. After all was said and done, we spent  $100 for app, 2 entrees and 1 crappy margarita. Please do your homework and goto Frenchman st near Jackson Sq. So much better and away from crap shoots like this one.
This was our first stop for eating once we got off the plane, excellent service , excellent food thank you.

This restaurant was so wonderful the last time we went to New Orleans that we remembered it.. and took another group of friends there this time.. the food is always excellent and I love the selections of specials that they have each evening.. this time I had the catfish smothered in a delicious creamy sauce and covered with crawfish tails..to die for :-) one of the things I really love about this place is that they serve dinner late.. I recommend this restaurant to everyone visiting New Orleans

Amazing food and awesome service!
Thanks to our server Errol for the excellent service that this place is known for! 
Had the seafood platter and raw oysters- delicious!

Great atmosphere, 10 steps off Bourbon St, great drinks (tasty and alcoholic), friendly and fast wait staff.  Mixed bag on the food.  Great dishes - Redfish Oceana, BBQ Shrimp.  Bad - overblackened, dried out Redfish Etouffee.  Mediocre - bread pudding.  Average - red beans and rice, etoufee, jambalaya  Want to try again and give food a second try.
I loved the look of the restaurant, gives you the NOLA feel. Food was awesome as well, we mostly got seafood but definitely would go again. Service was wonderful.

Recommended to come here by our hotel. Huge disappointment. For a main course (their special of the day - blackened catfish w/ crawfish cream sauce + rice), a cup of gumbo, two crabcakes, a bottle of beer and cocktail, our bill was $75 (after tax+ tip). The disappointment lies in that our food was below average. For that price, I expected more. Food was served w/in 5 mins, which makes me think they had everything cooked, ready to just be heated up upon order, rather than cooked fresh to order.

Breakfast Breakfast Breakfast!!° Best kept secret for Breakfast...
Also, seriously delicious seafood for dinner..
Love this place...

My friend and I were in New Orleans for 4 days and we went here TWICE! That's how good their charbroiled oysters are! As a California girl I had never drunk craved oysters but from Oceana Grill that's exactly what happened and led us back here! We tried a few other things and they were very good as well but their oysters take the cake. The only thing I would say is, they have this blue drink that has dry ice in it so it's smoking (I can't remember what it was called) STAY AWAY from it! My friend and I got extremely sick feeling from it (though what did we expect with a blue smoke drink ‍). Prices are very reasonable for what you're getting as well

The food hear was okay, the seafood came out a bit warm as if it was sitting under a heating lite. The bathrooms were disgusting......if your like me and go to the restroom to wash your hands before eating, then this restroom would make you lose your appetite (the smell) and trash on the floor uggg). I informed the waitstaff, as this should not be a customers responsibility. The only reason I'm not giving this restaurant three stars is due to the waitress, she was superb customer service to my husband and I.

We enjoyed our first try at this place! I got the crawfish étouffée and my husband got their deluxe cheeseburger. We spent $40 for two people here. Both plates were great, burger wasn't 100% worth the price but the étouffée was! The étouffée was actually $17 not the $16 mentioned here on their menu. Not a huge deal though. Service was good and we will probably be back.

We arrived in New Orleans for our first-ever trip, anxious to try all the famous Cajun and Creole dishes. The doorman at our hotel said, "Then you need to head straight to Oceana Grill." So we headed into the French Quarter to find it. It did not disappoint and made a skeptic into a huge fan of this town's famous cuisine.

We started with the "Famous Oceana Oysters," a creamy concoction - of course delicious. Followed by our first-ever gumbo - was yummy and made me want to have more gumbo the whole rest of our visit! Had the Creole Platter, which had jambalaya, red beans and rice and etouffe. We added the crawfish to it and it was the perfect first-timer's sampler from an iconic restaurant.  

As other reviews state, the physical space is really cool - we sat in an inside courtyard not visible from the street. We were seated right away on a fairly busy Friday evening, which to me says the place is organized and efficient. So it was kind of weird that it took half the meal to deliver the drinks that were ordered before the food. You would think they would want to sell as many drinks as possible, but we only had time for one each. I tried a hurricane and would say it was weak, at best.

The rest of the weekend people would ask us where we had dined and when I said "Oceana Grill" they would exclaim "Oh, that's the BEST!!"  It was good, but hard to be the best in a town so full of extraordinary restaurants.

Absolutely wonderful! I stumbled in here looking for a place that served alligator- and this was the place. I got the blacked alligator PoBoy and was wonderful. To make it better, the Servers were enthusiastic and very personable. They helped suggest places to go and if you get the chance to come here,  do it.

This place is amazing! The gator bites (100% gator) are amazinggggg. Food was so good that we came back twice. First time our server was Lakiesha and she was amazing. She informed us about all the local spots and must haves (we're from New York). But I must say the second time was out of this world!!! Lavern was our server and she was soooooo accommodating and attentive that my jaw is still dropped. She came by to take my empty glass and i told her one sec as i grabbed for my cherry (i loveeee cherries) she then came back with a cup full of them (soooo sweet). I also asked for another shot in my margarita because it was toooo sweet with no taste of alcohol... She took it back and remade it with no problem. As I mentioned, we're from New York and are not use to this southern hospitality. But Lavern was the bomb.com!! I had the St. Louis (breakfast menu) and It was sooo good. Love the staff and the food.

After cruising down Bourbon street we decided to try some more amazing seafood that this town has to offer! We came across Oceana, which had a line down the block, so we knew it had to be good.

We waited only about 20 minutes or so to get seated, so worth it! Our server was very helpful and friendly. The interior had a great jazz feel, fits in perfectly with the charm of the French Quarter. We came in around dinnertime but I understand they serve until 1am!

I went with The Cajun Sampler, which had jambalya, shrimp creole, and I can't remember what else, but it was outstanding! Babe had the special of the night, which was about $25 for Redfish (generous portion) with mushroom shrimp cream sauce and fried shrimp with a side, so good!!

This place is worth the wait if you are looking for authentic Cajun in the French Quarter!

I'm not ordering anything from here again it is really sad that I used to love this place but last night I got the shrimp pasta and when I tell y'all that pasta had no seasoning what so ever it had 4 shrimp, my noodles were sticky and stuck together I asked for extra Alfredo it came dry my bread pudding had burnt places on it I asked for extra sauce and I got none if I could rate them a 0 I would I don't know who was cooking last night but they need to get it together!!!!!!!
Jamal is an amazing server.  Food was decent, skip the creme brulee.  We ordered the jambalaya pasta and it was pretty good.

BEST RIBS
EXCELLENT JAMBALAYA!
Super friendly staff
Nice a cool
Fun ambiance 
Upstairs a great reprieve from the bustle of bourbon street below!
Highly recommend

Sit outside in the courtyard of Oceana if you can.  It's a very nice spot to have your meal.  Went here for a causal lunch.  The blackened catfish was delicious.  Beautifully cut, sizeable piece of fish that came with greens and jambalaya...  very nice!  And the drinks are solid.

Ate here 3 times on our 5 day visit...need I say more. Great friendly service. Good food and the price is as expected for the French Quarter, but they not beat you over the head expensive. Good family spot.

Touristy.  I loathe restaurants that add the tip to your bill don't tell you then leave a blank line for additional tip. 

Read your bill well as the tip has already been added

Food was okay. Chicken moist

Had my first taste of mustard greens ..... not a fan 

Blackened fish well cooked, good flavor. Liked the crawfish sauce
Great service! Our waitress  Whitney was awesome and very friendly!! I tried the Red fish Pontchartrain and it was amazing!!!! I will definitely put Oceana  on my list to visit whenever I come back!

This was one of two restaurants I ate at around the Bourbon Street area.  It was recommended for the crab cakes and alligator.  There is a small bar at the front of the restaurant that was quite crowded early on.  The place was empty for the most part otherwise.  

Our group ordered the crab cakes and alligator appetizers and crawfish etouffee entrees.  The crab cakes were delicious and the alligator pretty good as well.  The crawfish etouffee was a nice size portion but nothing special.  The wait staff was good and attentive with drinks, but toward the end of our meal just vanished, and it was not like there were many full tables.  

Overall it was a decent meal, but I don't know I would return, given the large number of other places to try in the area.

Nice ambience, good food and great service!  Lots of seating choices (patio, window, diff. rooms)!  French toast is great, crepes are huge and tasty! Love the jazzy cajun music!!! Within the French Quarters, convenient location...was a 5 min. walk from JW Marriott on Canal Street!

I thoroughly enjoyed my visit. Our server Brad was very knowledgeable, helpful and courteous. My girlfriend Marlo took me here for my Birthday (the reason for our trip to NOLA). We mentioned the occasion to Brad and he gave us a free dessert. We started with the Cajun Alligator Sausage... Delicious! We asked about the specials and an off menu Surf and Turf caught my eye. She loved the Crab Cake Pasta.

Everything we tried was fantastic: turtle soup, charbroiled oysters, red fish, creole jambalaya. This is a large restaurant but we encountered line-ups outside. What does that tell ya? We ate here three times. Food quality and value are excellent! Service was very friendly and knowledgeable. They offer 10% off your bill on subsequent visits.

Very friendly service! First time to New Orleans. Asked a local Restaurant Delivery guy we saw on the street if he could recommend a place that had good New Orleans food. He mentioned this one so we walked a couple blocks and tried it. Glad we went! Everything we tried was delicious.

Everything we ordered was terrible. I hate to say it for the grilled oysters, BBQ shrimp and the tasting platter was inedible. We paid our bill and left without eating more then a couple bits of each.
