We didn't dine in but, the delivery was quick. The food was hot and delicious. We got the gator bites, shrimp creole and jambalaya. I'd have it again.

I have always heard good things about this place but never gave it a shot until today and I was pleasantly surprised. 
I was confused because we were handed lunch menus and it was 3. Apparently they do lunch until 4. Sweet!
We started with a BBQ shrimp app. I have only had Deanie's BBQ shrimp so I was unsure they could surpass that. They didn't but it was different in a good way. The sauce was creamier so now I have an alternative. I had a cup of the seafood gumbo and it was so good that I wish I had ordered the bowl. Son had kids chicken tenders and he ate them up quickly. Daughter had shrimp Alfredo. It tasted better than it looked. Hubs really enjoyed the red snapper with potatoes and greens. I did the shrimp po boy. The bread was soft and they put a coleslaw tartar inside that was surprisingly wow! I really wanted to try their bread pudding but alas we were too full. The coolest thing? When I checked in at Yelp it gave us 10% off our meal! Will return.

This was probably the most hole in the wall type restaurant I've ever seen. My partner and I ordered alligator bites for our appetizer, the blackened duck, and the red fish for dinner. The alcoholic cocktails  are served with dry ice making them look awesome and feel consistently cold. There's nothing bad to order here. 

The paintings and hangings around the restaurant made it feel incredibly authentic and filled with culture. Our waitress was helpful in deciphering my hesitancy with fish. She also came several times to check in on us even when we were seated in the corner.

Would highly recommend this place. It's close to Bourbon street without all the noise. After dinner, only you could decide to go right to Bourbon or left to the hotel.
Had a great time here. We were vacationing with family in NOLA and this was a dinner stop. Great food, friendly staff, plenty of selections, all for a great experience.
Just like mama makes!  Delicious! I was with my friend who is Creole and she said very authentic.

I only give them 2 stars because we had so many people recommend this place. I've been twice and both weren't the best experiences. This time really confirmed that I will never go back. Third time is not a charm. We got sat, ordered waters and appetizers ( 1/2 dozen raw oysters, 1/2 Rockefeller). She brought back our waters and took our order. She proceeded to get sat 4 more times and we didn't see her again for a while. We got brought the Rockefeller oysters by a random kitchen staff along with no crackers, condiments of any sort, no plates....the table next to us however, who got sat after us, received their half and half order of raw and Rockefeller oysters. They also then got the pastas we ordered among other plates. The server came along the tables saying raw oysters would be out shortly...I understand being busy but put the orders in as you take them, don't take all 5 tables orders then put food in. They need to step it up to have such good reviews.

I ordered the blackened catfish which was great!  The service however was not very good.  Maybe it was an off night but it took forever to get our drinks and then even longer to be asked if we would like another.  Overall it was a cool place.

Food sucked. Crab cakes were deep fried with all breading. Customer service was terrible. We didn't like the fish, so we asked the waiter to take it away, NOT COMPLAIN OR ASK FOR A REFUND; simply just take it away. He says he HAS to get the manager now. Manager walks up, doesn't say a word, literally just walks up with his crotch way too close to our face (wtf) and says "whats the problem?" I said there is no problem, we just don't want this. "Well what's wrong with it, what do you want?" that's when I got upset and said I wanted nothing but this plate off the table, which he then took it off the bill but how weird, creepy and unprofessional is that? The bald guy is not manager material.

Went for breakfast, had eggs and andouille sausage, passed on the alligator sausage.  It was a good breakfast.  The best thing we had was the hash browns.  Seasoned, cooked all the way through, best hash browns I ever had.

We were there on July 31 for dinner and we start off with 2 doz fresh oysters.  I've had plenty of oysters in New Orleans and I have to say these were the worst we've had. Although they looked fresh but I bet they were previously frozen.  They lacked flavor of fresh oysters.  We were disappointed!!  We were a party of 4 and the rest of our entrees were OK, nothing spectacular.  We had oysters everyday while in New Orleans and the ones from Acme were the best. Will cross Oceana off the list on our next visit.

We were walking in the French Quarters and decided to give this place a try. Our server was welcoming and the food was pretty stellar. 

We ordered the gumbo, Cajun jambalaya pasta, fried shrimp po-boy, blackened chicken platter, and catfish lafouche. We expected the gumbo to be spicy; however, it did have balanced flavors and the shrimp wasn't overcooked. The Cajun jambalaya pasta was our favorite dish. The Creole sauce was creamy and the alligator sausage was a great accompaniment to the dish. The fried shrimp po-boy had a little more remoulade than to our liking. Nonetheless, the shrimp was crispy and not oily at all. The spice on the blackened chicken had a good level of heat and was served with jambalaya. The catfish lafouche was recommended to us by our server, Derrick. It was a great sample of the different tastes of New Orleans! The catfish and crawfish were so delicious together. Overall, this was a great first experience of Cajun/Creole cuisine.
The redfish Ponchatrain is spectacular, as is the crab cakes. Its a cool oasis off Bourbon Street.

We landed in New Orleans and checked into our hotel and then walked accross the street to enjoy a delicious lunch!  The food was great and our server, Jimika was so pleasant.  She enjoys people and we felt cared for.  Thank you.
Pamela is my server. She helped me out tremendously with great info and insight in this beautiful city. Pamela even knew what to recommend. Pamela did us great. This is a must visit restraunt
The food was delicious. I had the lobster tail bites as a appetizer. For my main course I had the fish oceana which was excellent

I may not be going far enough from my hotel, but I continue to be surprised by how incredibly average some New Orleans restaurants are but still manage to receive strong reviews. Oceana Grill is a great example.  This place averages more than 3 stars and gets 4 starts more often than any other number?  NO.  NOLA is for partying, I understand, but it is also supposed to be a great food city.  

I got an Oyster PoBoy, some gumbo and a salad.

The salad had some very sorry looking romaine,  If that lettuce came out of your crisper, in your fridge, you would throw it away.  Add a sorry slice (slice?) of tomato and some croutons from a box, and dressing from a bottle.  That's yer "ceasar salad"

The gumbo was no better than a Kansan could make at home.  The broth was nothing special; the shrimp were small and cooked to mushiness.  Think about that: abusively cooked shrimp in LOUISIANA.  There were a couple "pieces of crab" which were just annoying hunks of shell.  

The PoBoy was merely average.  I think a sandwich with hot/warm contents shold have warm or grilled bread, not necessarily toasted, but not straight from the plastic bag either.  The oysters were just warm when I got it and since it only took about 5 minutes from when I ordered until I picked it up, they were probably not freshly cooked.

Finally, I am stunned that when the Tobasco factory is about 100 miles a way, New Orleans carry out does not put any kind of hot sauce with its fried carry out!!!  I am making allowances for the fact that I got carry out.  This food would have been meh, if I had stayed and eaten it there (although I would have had hot sauce at my disposal if I had stayed at the restaurant)

Again, I'm disappointed with the inflated rating; the food is just average.  Even worse is there truly is good cheap, 4 star food in this part of town. It makes me wonder if the raters who give this place 4 stars are writing their reviews before they are sober.

The BEST meal I've ever had! I had grilled oysters for an appetizer, shrimp fettuccine Alfredo as the main course, and bananas foster ice cream cake for dessert. So delicious! My boyfriend had the gumbo (which I sampled) and it was amazing! Probably the best gumbo I've tasted. The drinks were pretty good, a little weaker than most of New Orleans cocktails, but the green apple spiced mojito and Mandarin blush were good.

The wait staff was friendly, the managers checked on us several times, and the overall atmosphere was much tamer than most of the French Quarter.

Ordered delivery for lunch one day and decided to try their Shrimp Po Boy... It was one of the best I've had in the French quarter! It comes dressed with tomatoes, pickles, onions, and (what sets it apart in my opinion.. cole slaw and remoulade sauce). Also comes with seasoned fries, delicious!

CATFISH PO-BOY OUTSTANDING!!!!... I came here late night after a concert last Tuesday. I ordered the char-grilled oysters in addition to my po-boy. The oysters were just ok, I guess I'm use to the way the char-grilled oysters are prepared at ACME. The catfish po-boy definitely made up for it... very flavorful and fried hard, just how I like it!!!.. The fries were good too..big serving size as well.  My waitress.. I forget her name, she seemed very tired but still managed to service our table with a smile and gave us everything we needed. I left her a nice tip.

I ordered Taste of New Orleans with the crawfish etouffee, tasted amazing! Probably best in New Orleans! The staff was very very friendly and split the dish in two so that me and my girlfriend can eat easily. Must visit this restaurant when you visit New Orleans!

Not at all what I excepted!!!!  The Catfish Platter was filled with cold French  fries and 7 under cooked prices of fish.  The condiments portions were not comparable to the pieces of fish served. The coleslaw was bland and void of any kind of flavor. Definitely not worth 18.00. 

My next trip to the N. O. I will not spend any money at Oceana Grill.

This has got to be the best crab cake I've ever had!!! The fried crawfish is amazing!! The collard greens were made by Jesus himself, they are just that amazing!! This was my first time in New Orleans and I'm coming back just for this amazing food!! We ordered delivery and they were there much sooner than they had quoted. Prices are reasonable.
Hmm I ordered the gumbo, which was pretty good. I also ordered the crab cakes and they were meh. It was like a biscuit with gravy.

Great food, large portions, plenty of room between tables, and Quiet, you can actually have a conversation without yelling.
Stayed at Bienvenue Hotel, another nice place nearby, and they recommended it.
PS Order the White Chocolate Raspberry Martini, liquid dessert.

Oceana  is a great place to eat seafood, 
especially after a TERRIBLE time at Redfish the prior night.

Drinks were delicious! Wait staff was friendly, sat by the kitchen which was a nice and warm part of the restaurant, little quieter as well. Dinner was nothing special, still delicious. I would compare it to a Texas Roadhouse of the Midwest good food just not special.

Tip: check in on Yelp and get 10% off. There was a line when we passed by on a Friday around 8pm so we went back on Sunday around 10pm and we didn't have to wait much. The service was friendly but the food was ok. Got the Oceana's Famous Oysters and the Gumbo. The gumbo was good but the oysters tasted kind of old/not fresh. Maybe it was cause it was the end of the day but probably wouldn't go back

The service here is great! The prices are a bit steep but the food is AMAZING. We came here for dinner two nights in a row, it was that good. The blackened redfish was seriously one of the best meals I've ever had. Husband had the catfish poboy which was excellent, a big bowl of gumbo (would skip it), and we got the garlic sauce oysters, which were really good but just too much sauce on them. The blackened redfish was to die for. Good ambiance, not too loud, which right off Bourbon is asking a lot! And the service was top notch both nights. Even on a really busy night we didn't have to wait longer than 10 minutes. We will definitely be coming back here!
This place was simply amazing! The staff is so friendly and professional!! The food tasted fantastic and the atmosphere was great! We will def return here on our trips back to New Orleans!

This is based on a delivery and dine in experience.
Ordered a trio sampler red beans and rice, etouffe and jambalaya. Food arrived cold and the quality was average, nothing spectacular. 
Dine in had a bowl of gumbo and a shrimp poboy. Again the food was average but the wait staff was super friendly. Good customer service.

Made a return trip to New Orleans and stopped by here again for a great meal.  Our server was Renika and she was outstanding in helping with selections and her attentiveness during our meal.  Crab cakes were great, oysters as well.  Will return and highly recommend.

Had a large group of 10 guys. Got sat immediately. Our server was Errol. Nice dude. Waited a while to order but after that everything was on point wth him. Very attentive. 
I had the oceana oysters. Flavor was great but the actual oyster was tiny compared to the shells they were in. Seemed like they reuse the shells or something. Seemed odd.  Also had a shrimp love boy. Good sized shrimp and tasted great
The food was amazing. I had oysters and gumbo. The service was a little slow but it was a busy weekend so I'll give them a pass. Our waiter was super friendly and I appreciate good customer service.

This place is cool fix
Get there before 6p on a weekday, because the lines get pretty long. Service is awesome, both at the bar and the table sections. My friend had the crab cake and enjoyed. I had a po'boy and was quite content.

The food was extremely delightful. We had a party of four... and everyone was quite pleased with their selection. The drinks were strong, but well mixed. The portions were perfect. Definitely, a must... try to get there before the rush as you may see a line out door waiting to get in.

Our server, Taylor, was thee best server you could ever ask for. I've been in the service industry for nearly 10 years and I've never written a review for any restaurant before. But her service was so superb that I needed to let her management team and the whole Yelp community know- always ask for Taylor!

If I was grading the service only I would give this restaurant four stars. The shrimp Po boy that my wife and I-shared barely rated at three. We have had better po boys at the smack shack in Minneapolis where we live. Gumbo was tasty. Overall nice stop.

This restaurant has organization down to a tee!  We made a reservation, which is a definite b/c there was a long line and based on our experience with the food and service, we know why!  It's an outstanding place to eat!

Based on Yelp reviews, we stumbled into Oceania (literally) for a late night meal.  We were not disappointed, in fact, we went back the very next day because we enjoyed it so much. Great service, very tasty food at a great price. The crawfish étouffée rocks, the crab cakes are great, oysters were extremely good, both raw and chargrilled.  Give them a try!

We were very happy with our choice to go here last night.  Our wait was only about 5 minutes.  Our server was knowledgeable and pleasant.   Drinks were good (I recommend the Sazarac) and the food was great.  My redfish on crawfish corn bread was amazing.  Someone else had the crab cake pasta, also very good.  Even the ribeye (I know) was good.  Portions are generous but not overwhelming.  Thumbs up.

While visiting NOLA I tried to eat at as many places as I can and by doing so I didn't get full meals. So I tried the crab cakes at Oceana and what a great choice! The setting was gorgeous and conveniently close to Bourbon street.

As stated in my previous review I am in town for the DAV Convention. I was wanting to try more New Orleans food but didn't want to eat at Drago's again. 
I asked the concierge for recommendations and she gave me a couple. Oceana was the one I decided on. It was a delivery order. I ordered after a few minutes of waiting on the phone. The employee who took my order was friendly and efficient. 
The delivery person was a little confused on my room number but it's a large hotel so I can forgive that. When I met the delivery person he was friendly and offered his opinion on the food after a good natured ribbing about the food being good. He laughed and said blacked gator was his favorite.
The roll was nice and soft, chewy but not in a bad way. The gator was firm but not chewy as I am told it can be. The fried were fries, crispy nicely seasoned but nothing outstanding. 
The Crawfish was great! Nice level of spice a little chewy but nothing I haven't been told about.
Overall it was good. I would definitely recommend, and eat again

Walked in at 9:30 PM on Friday with no wait. Food was out super fast and hot! 

Taste of New Orleans- plate was well-balanced between the different dishes and was accompanied by fresh local bread. Crawfish Ettouffee was the best of the three, but all were superb. 

Kaitlyn is the best server ever! Her suggestion of the Catfish Lafouche was really great too.

In town for a conference, an associate and I tried this place for dinner on the recommendation of the shuttle driver.  She compared it favorably to some of the better known places so we decided to give it a go.  I had the combination with jambalaya, etoufee, gumbo and red beans and rice (yeah, the tourist special, though they didn't call it that). Plenty of food for me and did not disappoint my yankee palate.

This place was amazing! The waitress at the bar takes your preferences and gives you the perfect things to order. The alligator tails with remoulade were delicious (we ordered half fried, half blackened and they were both great), and her recommendation for the blackened redfish pontchartraine was spot-on! My boyfriend loved his chicken Alfredo. The banana foster ice cream cake was also delicious!! We also won a free drink from a random coupon in our napkin roll. We tried the tropical storm and it was a delicious fruity contraption that smoked from the top!

Came here Thanksgiving night.  The wait staff was awesome, friendly, and inviting.  The place is a dive but the food was good....nothing special.  Luckily there was a Yelp coupon.  We had an entree and dessert and they were ok.  There was a line down the street Friday and Saturday.  We may return after looking elsewhere for better.

Found myself craving an oyster po boy at 11pm on a Sunday night. The sandwich was ok, nothing spectacular. Service was quick and the host at the restaurant was very personable. Overall the food was good, but I doubt I'll revisit this spot.

We had the famous house oysters, which were amazing! I also had the crawfish ettoufe with fried crawfish on top, which was also very good. Try the crab cakes as well... my friend got those and they come with with crawfish cream sauce that I've never had before. Our water was attentive, extremely polite, and very friendly. I don't have one complaint!

I was expecting a lot more from this restaurant. I had a cup of gumbo to start and it had great flavor, but the shrimp in it was over cooked and mushy. Next I had the fried catfish po boy. The fish was not crispy and also mushy. My friend had the country breakfast and her hashbrowns were mushy. It seemed like everything had been sitting in back under a heat lamp for a while. Mushy was the word of the day at this restaurant.

Oysters, Oysters, Oysters!!! They are so good I have not even tried anything else. My family has tried other items and say other dishes are great as well. If you LOVE oysters like I do, you need to try them with the oceana sauce. *smack, smack*  It comes with a bed of lettuce topped with oysters in shell, bread chunks all topped in a sauce. My fiance had some pasta one time, and a fish dish which were all delish as well. We go qhen in New Orleans when we have the time. Yes at dinner service or other high traffic days, you can spend an hour or more in line which is typical and expected! The ONLY negative experience was they had us waiting one time (a party of 4 -one of us pregnant) and the waitress was walking down the line to skip over us at the direction of her manager to get a party of 6 to seat who had JUST walked up, and had been there literally maybe 5 minutes. WE had been waiting for an HOUR and 15 minutes already! Lets just say that was not about to go down. The waitress apologized after I explained that it did not matter if it was a 6 seater table, to skip people who had been standing so long -AGAIN, one being PREGNANT- was not at all acceptable. A 6-seater can seat 4 people!!! But she did apologize , sat us immediately on the 6 seater, and the manager came and apologized as well!! They were trying to seat people and didn't really think it through very well! Anyway, seriously love this place...go here all the time and that was the one bad experience which was rectified immediately!

Great food, great service, great atmosphere, great location! 
I had the Redfish Pontchartrain. 
Good beer selection too!

I too decided on this restaurant after looking at several different menus on Bourbon Street and decided to eat here because were too tired to walk anywhere else.  Well, I am sooooo excited that we did.  The food was awesome and the service was even just a great.  Our waitress, Talesha, was as good as it gets.  She was friendly and very helpful.  Will definitely eat here again before I leave town.

this is the most reasonable place to eat and try New Orleans food. this place was recommended by the front desk clerk at our hotel. we were able to get a table in 5 minutes we order several appetizer and soup and a few entries so that we can taste and try all of the signature items.

we had Sara and she knew the menus and what was in in them.

I would be back next time I come. now we are going to walk the party street

We spent 4 days in the French Quarter and ate and drank our way through a bunch of restaurants.  This one, by far was the worst.  My wife had the crab cakes and gumbo.  The crab cakes weren't bad.... very meaty and not sloppy with filler.  The gumbo......just bland.  I was looking for something a bit different and went with the blackened duck.  It was overcooked, dry and tasteless.  The rice served with it was forgettable.  The only decent thing on me plate were the spicy collards . . . .  and I don't like collards so I was surprised.  Service was fast and we were in and out in no time but only after a very unimpressive meal.

Stayed in New Orleans French Quarter for a total of 3 days and ate at the Oceana Grill every day I was there. This was by far some of the best food that I have ever eaten. I had breakfast and dinner & the Banana Fosters Ice Cream cake is to die for. Our breakfast waitress was Jimika and she was very knowledgeable about the menu, friendly and provided great suggestions. I went with the Royal Omelet &  1/2 order of French toast. OMG! You MUST to try this place
David is very nice and friendly. We loved our meals- crab cakes and blackened catfish are delicious.

The food was so good we came back the next day for lunch! Simple dishes full of flavor! Erroll, our server, was great! True Southern Deep voice gentlemen! Adds to the experience of NOLA! Today we had John who was good as well! Hostess stand ladies were very friendly and have options for seating! I'll be back!
We ate at this place twice during our visit. The food is great!  We ordered the Taste of New Orleans, Cajun jambalaya pasta, gator bite & crab cake appetizers.. all was good. Worth dinning.
Out of the park great food!  We were a large group of 12 and the food came out together- everyone said they got the best meal.  Service was excellent and the drinks kept flowing...

This was the first place we went to eat on our vacation. The service was great and the food was very good.  We went at a good time (mid-week and late) because on the weekend, the line was down the block.  But if you have to wait, it is worth it.
Four of us got different meals, all of the meals were amazing! Best red beans and rice on bourbon!!

Line outside is long and makes you want to change your mind however when you get inside you won't be dissatisfied. Order the crab cakes for an app they were delicious! I ordered the Jambalaya pasta  with gator sausage and blackened shrimp. My boyfriend got the blackened chicken with collard greens and a side of jambalaya. Main course came quickly and hot which was great since we were starving. Both dishes were good and flavorful. Order the bread pudding for dessert it was sooo good, perfect end to the meal. Our server was very sweet, polite and attentive. I would go back however the place is huge with plenty of tables I was confused why we waited so long outside in the heat. Also the silverware and dishes could use an update, I'm sure the place makes more than enough money.

Whenever I think of NoLa, my mouth waters at the food and I remember this place. I've only been here twice but both times, the food was scrumptious and the customer service exemplary. I've been referring people here for years. I'll be back.
Man, this place had some serious flavors. I had the BBQ Shrimp and the Char Broiled Oysters. Both were pretty amazing. Everyone was real nice and they gave me 10% off for checking in.

This was my favorite resturant in the French quarter I'm a pescatarian and they have a seafood gumbo that was delicious. The service was great food came out fast and the courtyard seating was perfect.
Delicious Cajun food! We got the taste of New Orleans and Jambalaya pasta and I definitely recommend either one of those! Yummy!

Good creole/Cajun food. Moderately priced.  Owner & staff really strive to make your experience positive.  Desserts were very good.  Try the Bananas Fosters ice cream cake & the flan; were very good. Just a block off Bourbon.
This place was great. Sat at the bar for dinner and the bartenders were quick and very friendly. Greek salad app was good and large. Grilled catfish po was delicious. Will definitely be back.

Taste of New Orleans platter had all of the flavors you expect with just a touch of heat -crawfish and shrimp fettuccini had spice and lots of veggie crunch in the sauce and bread to sop up all the sauce ! Yummy!
Stopped by here for lunch.  The service was great.  I ate the shrimp po boy which had the best tasting cole slaw, BBQ shrimp, and seafood gumbo.

I had Cajun Jambalaya pasta and it was amazing!!!!!
Best pasta I've ever had and I even missed it everyday after leaving New Orleans.
I will absolutely recommend everyone to try the Jambalaya pasta!

I was excited to try this restaurant based on the reviews.  I ordered a shrimp po boy and a Bloody Mary.  The Bloody Mary hand too much pickle juice and was super sour.  On two of the shrimp in the po boy the tails were still on.  As a result I was left to pick shells out of my teeth.  I have been in the city three days and this was my worst meal by far.  I will not go back.
Food was fantastic!!!! Rasheen was very friendly and had a wonderful personality!!!!! Every bite of my shrimp po-boy made my taste buds dance!!!! Definitely worth waiting in line for this food!!!!
There is a bathroom Nazi. She stand in front of the bathroom telling patrons who can/cannot go in. The woman will literally not let you use the bathroom and make you go upstairs
Stopped for lunch and enjoyed the meal. I had the blackened alligator and mustard greens. Tastes very good. The service was good and it was not crowded when we got here.

SOOOO GOOD!!!  We almost didn't go here because of the long line outside but decided to stand in line. My husband went to get us drinks and by the time he got back, which couldn't have been 6 min I was at the front of the line. Got a window seat, fast and excellent service and an excellent meal. So impressed!

Food 5 Stars: Cajun Fries add shrimp and Mardi Gras Pasta would get again....and again. 

Men's bathroom was unappetizing. But the food was worth it.

A couple of people recommended this place. I really haven't had a lot of good luck with good food in the French Quarter. This place certainly changed my mind. I had the best crab cakes that I've ever had. I'll certainly return the next time I'm in New Orleans. Oh...the service was awesome!

WOW!  The best food around the area... Everything we try was well prepared, and tasted fresh. 
The service, over the top... Everybody was nice and kind. Some places in the area don't have a ramp for wheelchair. This place had a second door with access and even though they were busy they went and open the door and gave as a great table. 
The server was very nice and checking on us often to make sure we were satisfy. 

I will definitely go back to this restaurant. And recommend this restaurant to try and Cajun dish in NOLA!.

From crab cakes to the knife and fork ribs, all the food wars very good. 

Had a good time and would recommend for lunch or dinner.

Last meal before we left town. Crab cakes=excellent! 
Blackened redfish=very good, Raw oysters=very good, Cocktails=good, BBQ Shrimp=best meal in NOLA! Would recommend and would go back on a future trip.

Best meal I have had in a long time and no wait.  Bigger on inside than it looks on outside.  We had crab cakes for appetizer, best I have ever had.  I had the blackened duck, very tasty.  My wife had the 10 oz ribeye and it was out of this world.

We had just arrived in New Orleans and were very tired. We ordered from Oceana based on the ratings, which looked good. On the plus side the order arrived early (we did delivery to our hotel). Also on the plus side they were open late. On Yelp it says they deliver, but when you call they tell you to download Eat24 and order from there, and will not take the order over the phone. The food was not good. The best thing was the kids' hamburger (which was supposed to be a hamburger and they gave me a cheeseburger which was not acceptable because that was for my dog...I had to scrape the cheese off). The famous crab cakes were SO meh. The Cheesecake Factory has better crab cakes. The gumbo was a disappointment. I would not eat from there again.

This place is really fun for dinner.  Great atmosphere and excellent service.  My large group ordered all the appetizers, many of the entrees, and most of the desserts.  Everything was delicious.  My shrimp po-boy was so tasty.  We all left really happy that we dined here.

We are visiting New Orleans and were recommended this place to eat. Excellent alligator bites, crab cakes, and seafood gumbo! Megan was our waitress--she's excellent! The rest of the staff was super friendly as well. Best of all, they let us bring our dog onto the patio to eat with us. Try this place out!
BbQ shrimp my favorite as usual. Casual atmosphere. Great gumbo. One of my favorite places to eat.
The service was amazing but couldn't compare to the food. Had the Redfish and simply delicious!
No kidding, great place.  We came back here twice on a short visit.  Catfish po boy is fantastic, full of flavor.  Worth walk in the rain!
Great if you like ice cold gumbo with a lump of cold rice.  I get better gumbo in the Houston airport.

Pamela was absolutely amazing. She recommended the catfish special with shrimp and it was simply Devine. The oysters were some of the best I've ever had and very rich. It was busy but food came it very fast! Pamela had a great energy and made the experience great.

I had the sea food jumbulia, gumbo soup and beer.  Great taste, not too spicy.
Service excellent, great atmosphere, food makes you want to return.
Try it.
Best restaurant near Bourbon St! Don't let the long line scare you. Waiting time for us was only 15 minutes and once you're inside service is fast! You must try Marsi Gras Pasta & some fried shrimp!

We were here July 29 to explore the French quarter before our cruise on the 30th.Totally loved the ambience, it is like a three story place which was decorated the Nola way, I am sure.. Our server Jennifer was very helpful and attentive. We wanted to try the gator bites and she suggested what is not too spicy, this was good by the way. My husband changed his order and she gladly accommodated the request. Throughout the meal she was always checking on us.

My husband had the the Blackened Etouffee, I had the Gumbo soup while my son had the chicken tenders. We all liked what we ordered and we were happy we tried this place.

***BEWARE FOR UPCHARGES***

We ate at this restaurant over the weekend while I was in NOLA for my bachelorette party. There were 6 of us, all on separate checks. When it came time to pay the bill, I noticed that my meal was charged at $15 instead of $13.50 -- BEFORE tax or the 18% added gratuity. I almost didn't want to be "that girl," especially because it was my party, but I asked my server for a menu to confirm what the price should have been. 

Sure enough, my meal should have been $13.50. The other 5 ladies checked their bills -- 4 of the 5 of them were also overcharged for between $.50 and $1.50. The restaurant did fix the problem and corrected all of our bills, saying the computer was having some issues. I'm wondering how convenient that 5/6 people were OVERCHARGED and not a single one undercharged if it was a computer glitch. 

The food was good, but the experience left a metaphorical bad taste in our mouths.

Our first night in New Orleans we hit the jackpot!  We chose to eat at the bar rather than wait for a table. I'm so glad we did. Our bartender was a wonderful woman who also served as our waitress. She was so friendly and helpful when deciding what to order. We both chose one of the nights specials. All I can say is that was my favorite meal during our trip. It was shrimp pasta with a crab cake on top and grilled cat fish on top of the crab cake in the most delicious sauce. You must try this restaurant!! You will not regret it.

Wow! Thank you so much for the amazing food! I got the red beans and rice plus a side of jambalaya and was almost rendered speechless by the jambalaya! My husband loved his lunch, which was a blackened red fish special. I would live to be able to take all the jambalaya home!
The food was great. Not too heavy but filling. The service was great and fast. I had the Ahi Tuna.

I felt the restaurant was okay and the staff was fairly friendly, but overall it just felt very touristy. It seemed like most of the food was average and slathered in this "special" sauce so while the dishes tasted good, they also tasted practically identical.

There was also a wait when I went there, probably because it's located near Bourbon Street/a tourist location. Line moved fairly quickly though. Personally, I probably wouldn't try coming back here if I ever visited NOLA again.
Wonderful food! Ordered the taste of New Orleans, and it was delicious. The service was a little slow, but the food definitely was worth it!

My Husband and I were extremely disappointed in this restaurant. My po-boy had literally 9 shrimp on it and the bread was stale. Also my husband was not impressed with his meal as well. Then a waitress named JESSICA was not only rude but unprofessional. I understand it's New Orleans and it's the French quarter however we did not appreciate hearing the waitress JESSICA constantly cursing and saying inappropriate things about her life that she should not be telling customers !!!! In addition she continued to make flirtatious comments about one of the guys who would bring out the food. Due to all of this it was very difficult to even eat our food. She obviously doesn't realize that people do not want her standing over them especially with her saying the things she says. I do realize the difference between a waitress or waiter just being friendly doing their job etc..vs someone like her who doesn't respect her self and doesn't know when to be quiet.
Service was a little slow but it was late in New Orleans a little pricey and all we had were oysters and fries.

Casual environment, relaxing atmosphere, nice menu selection. Try the blackened chicken pasta. Exceptional customer service throughout. Our table was greeted by two different managers and the waitstaff was very attentive. That's really what does it for this place!

This place was just ok, not sure why all the great reviews. My friend and I shared the fried seafood platter. Overall it was ok, nothing special. The hush puppies that came with our meal were really dry and were not tasty at all. The one plus is that this place is open late, and we did come in at 12:30 so that might be why the food was not up to par.

Went here for breakfast . Had the omelette with crabmeat and crawfish étouffée was very good. Wife had eggs Benedict with crabmeat. Coffee was good and our waiter Errol was great. Located across the street from our hotel royal sonesta so easy to 
Get to.
The food was beyond amazing! Our server Errol was very helpful and friendly! I highly recommend this restaurant to everyone!

We visited Oceana Grill as a large group for a business dinner.  The server was prompt and always readily available for the various folks in our party.  They have a really nice menu loaded with many amazingly-appetizing Cajon delights.  Their Red Fish with Ettoufee on top was amazing!  They also had blackened alligator, which was prepared very nicely!
Their side dishes were really good, as were their alcoholic/adult beverages.
The setting is slightly tacky, but it is inside of an old rowhouse style building.  They were able to comfortably accommodate our very large (14 people) group too.
Definitely save room for dessert! 
We'd visit here again!

Went here the first time because I had a coupon from my cab but it was great.  I've been back many times since.  The crawfish omelet is great.  Can't speak for anything else because I have ordered it every visit.

OMG! Fantastic food, great service, and definitely worth the 30 minute wait in line! The red beans and rice were hands down the best I've ever had and the redfish topped with crawfish and served with jambalaya and veggies was delicious. The only thing I didn't enjoy was the Oysters Rockefeller, which were drowning in cream sauce. But otherwise a wonderful experience and can't wait to go back for more!

Fast courteous service!!!! The crab cakes are to die for!!!! Outstanding crawfish étouffée and the red beans & rice might be the best I've ever had!! 

Highly recommend this place

We can't wait to go back again! Everything was delicious. We celebrated my husband's birthday at Oceanas and even the desserts were to die for!

If you are ever in the are do not bypass this little jewel.

I should copy and paste our review from Old NOLA Cookery because the same guy owns Oceana Grill, the food is identical and the same menu can be found at both. While a spattering of local cops told us to go to Old NOLA Cookery it was the front desk staff at the Courtyard Marriott told us we had to go here. It was a locals joint they said, and a place one could go to avoid tourists (we didn't see any locals here, rather than the ones working), just a ton of tourists. I think there's some kickback program going between the cops and hotels, which is smart business by Oceana and the OLDE. 

Regardless, I'd only come here late at night when the competition is closed. The food is  at par with chains you've likely been to like Copelands and Pappadeaux. The cajun pasta, étouffée and red beans and rice is similar here. This isn't the kind of place that's a destination restaurant. The reality, come here for Cajun after 10pm when the competition is closed and you have no other choice. That's when it's best. Meanwhile, you can expect friendly staff and goo service. It's a fun place to eat (whether at the bar, outside on the patio or inside the restaurant).

I've eaten here once and everything is a strong average, but don't expect great sides. The veggies taste like they are made in the microwave and the collard greens definitely stemmed from a can. We've had the blackened redfish here a few times (it's much cheaper than at competitors) but often overcooked. Don't, however, order the blackened gator. This was some of the worst gator we've eaten (and we've eaten it all over the South). Normally, gator is lean or the restaurant at least cuts the fat off. Half the gator they gave us was covered in fat. The cook came by and noticed it and brought us a new batch. The second wasn't much different. The quality was poor and shouldn't have been served. 

On the other hand, if you've never had Cajun before and have nothing to compare it to you'll likely rave about this place. However, if you've had good Cajun at home, expect average food here. The food is good, but if you flew into NOLA for the seafood, spend a bit more and get quality, top-notch Cajun. You'll save a few bucks here, but give up flavor.
We had an amazing meal here- so great we went back for a second meal a couple nights later! I had the Mardi Gras pasta and my husband the catfish! Delicious!
Our party of eight had a combination of breakfast and lunch. One of my favorite meals of the trip. Country breakfast platter was delicious.
Ate here twice while visiting from Texas... We had some of the freshest oysters we've ever had.... Must try the crab cakes, gumbo & taste of New Orleans. Yum
The food was delicious the service was fantastic. Our server Whitney was GREAT!  I had the Cajun Jambalaya pasta which was very good. The Crab cakes were outstanding.  First time in the N O.

Came here late after our drinking because we wanted some oysters! We ordered an oyster plate and got some alligator sausages to munch on. The oyster plate was okay but it was originally supposed to come with this cheesy sauce and we didn't want the cheese, we feel that the oysters weren't at their full potential. The alligator sausage was okay. Our server was sweet though, she really took the time to explain the details of the menu and then gave us a to-go cup for our beer (which is so cool that you can do that in new Orleans!)
I eat here every time I'm in NOLA and I always get the crab cakes appetizer. It's delicious every time. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is the poor service.

The food was reasonably priced and was just delicious. The Taste of NOLA and blackened redfish were fantastic as was dessert (choc mousse cake and bananas foster cheesecake). Went here a second night and got a free bread pudding dessert which was yummy. The servers both nights were friendly and polite.
This is my new favorite place in town. The food was magnificent, the server was very personal and attentive. The food is finger licking good, i highly recommend this place to everyone

So delish. The airport ad stated best crab cakes and though I cannot guarantee that's true, they were damn good. Ask for Natalie- she knows the menu inside and out and provided excellent recommendations. Get the Cajun fries- diet be damned

Great place to eat for dinner!  First I ordered hurricane and it was pretty good.  Then I ordered alligator bites which they were very delicious!!!!  Perfect to cook.  Then I ordered pasta with shrimps and gator sausage.  It was perfect as well.  Highly recommended to go.  Be prepared to wait a long line.

We came thrue from Los Angeles and were looking for a seafood spot as well as something with vegan options on the menu.
We were very happy with this place.
Craw fish  etouffee   was delicious as was a veggie stew.
Great service to top it off and we have a winner.

Amazing food and service. Simply amazing. The crab cakes and red beans& rice were just WHEW delicious. Yes, that good. This was our first stop as soon as we got to New Orleans. Dropped our bags and walked out of the hotel right into Oceana. Best decision ever! Servers and everyone who works there were so kind and inviting. We will go back again and again during every trip to N.O.!

We wanted to find a restaurant that was still open late but still had a good menu. Ran across this on yelp with a plethora of good reviews. Walking distance from the hotel. We ordered take out cause we wanted to eat at the hotel. Food didn't take too long took cook, about 15 minutes for two orders of pasta. I had the jambalaya pasta and my girlfriend had the shrimp Alfredo. Staff was friendly on the phone, we picked up our food and left. Food tasted great. Definitely have to come back here and eat at the restaurant to get a full feel of it but it should be enjoyable.

Delicious fooooood! Went here twice. Red beans & rice and the OceanA's signature oysters are on point! 

From one huge foodie to you! Eat it!!

I've been lots of times over the years. The first few years of going it was amazing, but the last two times I've gone it was totally different and terrible. I asked for ramolaud sauce on the side of my poboy and dressed. When it arrived it came with nothing on it but 8 pieces of fried shrimp on the whole thing
Very good food ordered the blackened catfish po-boy my husband had pasta I think it was called Mardi Gras pasta waitress was very pleasant can't wait to go back to New Orleans to go back!

We looked Oceana up on Yelp, saw great reviews and decided to give it a try. The wait staff was so friendly, but our waitress Christin was absolutely wonderful!! She made recommendations and took the time to explain things to us. The food was delicious and the drink I had, a Hurricane, was quite tasty! I highly recommend this place!

Was highly disappointed. The pictures on the menu of the corned beef hash looked nothing like what I got. It was canned corned beef they added a few carrots to with some Cajun seasoning. The picture shows a couple big chunks of potato not 85% small diced potatoes. 

I am guessing the biscuits were probably frozen as well. 

I would try again but go with maybe an omelette or pancakes etc. not the canned corned beef. 

Two stars based on the service and smell both were outstanding.
Came here for breakfast had the veggie omelette it was ok, the service and all the people who greet you makes it worth it.

Horrible service...the server took forever and forgot half of the order.  The food tasted like it was from a can. The shrimp creole tasted like spaghetti-os w extra ketchup.  Tourist money pit. Not worth a second of your time. Oh the alchohol selection is mediocre too.

This place had its solid moments but too many wrongs that I couldn't possibly enjoy my time there. 

1st there is a total lack of organization when sitting you down. You go inside to ask for a table, they tell you to go outside and wait in line, only to sit you down on a bench inside again. Just a waste of time. 

2nd I have to note a couple of things that I would commend, they got the food out fast and the wait staff was very friendly. 

3rd the food was spotty. Their blackened chicken was unacceptable and the jambalaya served with it looked and tasted like it was a week old. The alligator sausage poboy my fiancé had was fine but sausage is sausage, nothing special about it. 

Overall, I would not recommend Oceana.
Good service and good food. The crab cakes and mustard greens were delicious.

I only went for dessert.  I always hear good things about the seafood here though but I was just looking for something sweet.  The banana foster cheesecake was amazing and cheesecake isn't really my thing but this dessert was amazing.  A must try.  Pretty good service.  Somewhat loud but we sat at the bar and it was during festival time so I'm sure it has quieter spots in the actual restaurant.
Breakfast was delicious! So much flavor and great choices! The patio has a cool fire and water sculpture to look at, and the employees working there are so kind.

Shrimp po boy was nicely seasoned...chargrilled oysters were very good my first time trying them.  The seafood gumbo was just ok not what we were expecting.  Chad was our server he was polite cleared the table quickly and came around to check on us.

Oceana Grill lives up to the hype. We were escorted to the back area where we were surprisingly pleased to see an eating area that was clean, nicely decorated and quite enough to have a conversation.  
We were greeted by our waitress Ashley who was just fantastic. She made recommendations of what to try and everything was on point. The oysters Oceana that everyone raved about were delicious. She also recommended the crawfish nor fried so we could really taste them, and they eeee yummy, not fishy, with a smiley kind of taste. For dinner I had the crab Ames which were one of the best I've ever had. Not too breast, and topped with blackened shrimp as per Ashley's suggestion. My husband requested a red fish po'boy which was not in the menu, but made anyway, which he loved. The fish was meaty, juicy and cooked to perfection. 
We ended with the Banana's Foster which was out of this  out of this world. A totally different take, being mostly a huge slice of banana  ice cream cake topped with fresh whipped cream, drizzled w chocolate.
All in all one if the best meals in the French Quarter. Thanks Ashley!!

Pushed out the door without even getting our names taken, shoved to the back of the line even though we were first, left because of the bad attitude of the hostess and poor manner in which they handled the situation will never try them now

Let me start by saying the manager & staff are the only reason I'm giving them a 2 star review. So disappointing. I feel bad for any tourists that happen to wander in here because their food is not representative of New Orleans cuisine. 

First off, when you walk in, the entrance way has foul smelling odor. I know it's close to bourbon but you all can clean up. The oceana oysters are nothing like chargrilled oysters-even the picture on menu is misleading. The gumbo was bland. Crab cakes had more breading than crab & were so think, still had a hint of frozen taste to them. The BBQ shrimp were soupy. The only thing our party of 10 liked was the fried seafood & the creme brûlée. They put dry ice in some of the drinks which is a bit odd as well when the drink comes to your table bubbling without a heads up. 

Overall, idk how they have 4 stars on yelp. A lot of room for improvement.

This was a huge disappointment. Had several recommendations from locals to eat here. I ordered raw oysters for my appetizer and they were barely cool. Then my Greek salad came out warm and had balsamic dressing on the side, eww. My gumbo was so bland I thought I was ordering in a state that wasn't known for gumbo. The shrimp poboy was just ok. So eat at your own risk!

For a place that looks a lot like a T.G.I. Friday's, this place wasn't too bad. It is a massive space stretched through a number of FQ buildings. The interior vibe is touristy, and the overly eager seems to reflect that (although this might be my Northeastern cynicism. 

In any case, we ordered two relatively expensive dishes. My girlfriend got some tuna etouffee, and I ordered the blackened red fish. Her fish was high quality and the etouffee part was pretty tasty. My blackened redfish was similarly good, though I wasn't wowed entirely by either dish. The amount of food for $22 was probably adequate. The sides that I got with mine, like the jambalaya, were pretty tasty. 

I am sure that there is better Creole food out there in New Orleans, but this place seems to do the trick nicely. Plus, the servers were very nice and made sure that we had everything that we wanted.

Visited New Orleans and wanted to try authentic Cajun/creole food and was referred by the locals to try Oceana. We weren't very hungry so we only tried the charbroiled oysters and crab cakes. 

Charbroiled oysters- were delicious and creamy. The sauce was very well seasoned and the oysters were fresh.

Crab cakes- were delicious with lumps of crab meat. It was well seasoned and fried nicely. Decent size cakes.

Ok so - Drink a Hurricane. Also the food was very very delicious. I think they got the whole Creole food vibe and taste. The service was great and she made excellent recommendations. I highly recommend this place!

The drinks are a copycat of Sugar Factory, having the dry ice to give a smokey effect. However, that'a nice, but it wasn't great quality. It was a bit watery to my liking. I got the hurricane (NOLA's staple)and it wasn't up to par. For dinner got the seafood platter, which is all fried shrimp, catfish, fries, and oysters. The other meal was their blackened chicken which wasn't tasty at all. This is truly a tourist spot that's only after visitors' money and not making quality a top priority.
First timer and first landing spot after my 4 hour flight from Los Angeles. All I can say is you must get a Po boy here! Delicious and the Bartender was friendly and awesome!.

Amazing oysters, amazing gumbo, amazing crawfish étouffée, amazing drinks, amazing waiters, amazing atmosphere, amazing, amazing, amazing.....I'm overly wowed. Can't stop thinking about that fabulous overall and individual experience! 6 of us ate and we were all overly amazed.

Had the best time all due to outstanding service, thanks to Lloyd V. He gave the most amazing service AND recommendations while there. He took the time to give us great tips on what to order, specials and must try items. He went above and beyond to make sure nothing was missing from our table,cups never stayed empty and checked up on our large group every time he walked by. The food was amazing!
The shrimp po'boy sandwiches are incredible. The oysters are great fried or on the half shel. The crab cakes are delicious. And the deserts are incredibly tasty. I recommend the creme Brule.

The best thing about this restaurant is that it's delicious.  The worst thing is that I kept comparing every other restaurant I ate at after in NOLA to this one and most couldn't compare.  It's a huge restaurant with upstairs and downstairs seating.  Service was great.  I ordered the Taste Of New Orleans which includes creole jambalaya, crawfish etouffee, and red beans and rice with smoked sausage.  I devoured the food within minutes.  My friends looked over at my plate and were shocked how fast I ate the food.  It was that good.  The rest of my friends also loved what they ordered including a bloody mary cocktail for each person.  Great service too.  I would definitely recommend this place.  Since it's right next to Bourbon street, it's a very popular spot so there's usually a line.

Dropped in with no wait at 10:30AM and had the Royal Omelet, which was awesome! Service was very friendly and helpful. They even suggested the best table for us since it had opened up!

Really enjoyed out time here for brunch!
Nothing special. Po Boy was ok. Crab cake pasta was quite generic. Blackened fish too soft and gooey.

Killer po'boys was closed, so we ended up here. Best gumbo in the city, amazing fries, good redfish, fantastic service, casual, fun atmosphere. Looking forward to returning here and will definitely put it on the list for visitors.

It was the first meal we had when we arrived at our hotel during the lunch time. We walked into the restaurant without too much expectations. Immediately, we were amazed by the great service and good food there. Errol served our table in a  warm southern home-like style. We loved it. He had a deep voice that reminded me of jazz singers. I got oysters and alligator Po-boy there. They were very fresh and flavorful. 

The most impressive part was that I ordered ice coffee. Even though it was not on the drink list , They made the ice coffee just for me.
Just went again & the service & food were amazing! Pamela was hands down hilarious & on top of everything. She made my friends from out of town & my family that had never been feel so welcomed.

The only place I've been able to find pasta in the 'center' of New Orleans/local Bourbon st area (outside of italian resturants).

I had the cajun jambalaya pasta, added blackened crawfish, and it was delicious. I think I can recommend anything blackened here: great flavor! The pasta was overcooked which was sad (ugg, soggy pasta). But the slightly spicy sauce and meats of the pasta were close in making up for it. The flavor was so good! The baguette slices were surprisingly delicious - perhaps a hint of the garlic butter used when cooking the oysters? I assume the bread was toasted on the same grill.

Fried eggplant was okay but a bit more mushy and underspiced than I'd like. I think Royal House still has the best fried eggplant.

I tasted the veggie pasta and the fried catfish and both are decent. Fries here are great :) Good, spicy hushpuppies.

Yummy chocolate cake; decent ice cream cake.

Sazerac: not sure how I feel about it. Very boozy, but still pretty smooth. I winced with every sip. You should be aware though that I'm not usually a fan of any whisky. ymmv.

Nice honest waitress (our table was warned against the red sauce for the pasta).

I was super excited to try the crepe with jambalaya and hugely disappointed. It tasted...old. I couldn't eat it. And the cheese was a greasy mess on top. I'll leave it at that.
I'm giving this place 2 stars because my friend said her meal was "OK", but I would not recommend it. The establishment is a little dirty and could use some updating.

GATOR BITES.  That's what I'm talking about!  I have had gator a few times and this one takes 1st place.  Wait staff was super nice.  I arrived to meet a friend and had luggage with me.......they stored our luggage us (we were killing time until we could get into our condo) and then hailed a cab for us in the rain.  These people definitely know customer service!

My first meal in New Orleans and it did not disappoint. Great atmosphere in the French Quarters. I had the Taste of New Orleans which was well done. I also had the Swamp drink which was delicious. It was also open until 1AM. Staff was friendly and responsive!

I'm not sure what the hype is about this place. Cheesy for sure. Drinks were all horrible. 
A few people got the taste of Orleans and said it was good. My ahi tuna was not good at all and the other person in our party was also dissatisfied. 

Overall paid way too much for the quality of food and service that we got.
This place is awesome! Great food, excellent service. Highly recommend if you're in the French Quarter

Came here for dinner with a group of 6. The line was way out the door, but we only waited for about 35-40min. We got drinks from a nearby bar to sip on while we waited in line, and they do let you come in with outside drinks once you are ready to be seated. 

We sat in the courtyard, which was super adorable. The waitress was very attentive and refilled our drinks without even requesting it, she was on top of it. 

I ordered a Louisiana Crab Meat app. It came with two large crab cakes and were super delish!

I ordered a Cajun Jambalaya Pasta and my boyfriend got the Crawfish Fettuccine. Both dishes came out in large portions and were flavorful. I was hoping that the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta would have more of a kick to it, but it didn't, it had a more of a tomato based alfredo sauce. 

Overall, we were pleased.

Like my mouth is dancing. 
I can't post a picture because all of these plates are clean! 
Catfish PoBoy- yes Lawd
Shrimp PoBoy- Halelujah
Gator Tail- Amen 
I just moved to NOLA and I am in love.
See ya tomorrow! Lol

Oysters oysters oysters!
The interior resembles a Bubba Gumps or other chain, but we sat at the bar and simply enjoyed the food despite the average ambiance.
We tried 3 different types of oysters here. Fried oysters, oysters on the half shell and baked oysters that were so frickin delicious, we could have eaten 3 more dozen.
I would absolutely go back again and again to get my oyster fix.
The bartender was a treat as well. Informative and a great mixologist - she made our experience even better.
Went here on our first night in town by recommendations of our hotel. We got in late they were somewhat quick. Food was great, service average, restaurant was very artsy and cute. Would go again.

I came here in the recommendation of a shop clerk. The food (red beans n rice with andouille sausage ) was great. But the service ....no. I was sat and waited for 8 minutes abs had to go tell the host no one had been by. I ordered my meal and a coke for lunch 5 minutes later I got my food but no drink.  I had to hunt down my waiter who said my bad it's on me but when I got the bill I was still charged for it.  That being said I really enjoyed the food.
The food was amazing! The service was spectacular. Every employee there was so nice and welcoming! I will definitely be returning!
BEST crab cakes I've EVER had. Great service here! Will definitely be back. I WANT MORE CRAB CAKES!

Worst meal I've ever been served, anywhere, ever.

I got the special, tuna stuffed with crab cake.  Sounds delicious, but my tuna tasted rotten in the first bite, so fishy I instantly, and instinctively, got the feeling I shouldn't keep going because this clearly could give me food poisoning, ok... be brave, keep trying (I really want to enjoy my first meal in the French quarter), second bite wasn't as rotten fishy.... but what the, what's all the sinew like strings I'm trying to cut through?  Try the other end, same issue, I can't even get a clean piece of tuna cut from this sinew stringy mess.  This was clearly the tail end of some lower grade tuna that was starting to turn.

Waitress, she'd get a 5 star, she was very kind.  The disgusted meal didn't effect her tip, it wasn't her fault.  

Manager that took his sweet time to come see the crap I was served, he would get 0 stars.  He was so short, curt, and inhospitable.  His lack of care for this customer is probably why I'd decided to leave a review.  I'm sure he doesn't care anyway.

My husband asked for the bill, minus my meal, which was inedible.  He told the waitress to get us our bill, minus my meal.  

The crab cakes and oceanas famous oysters are fine, but nothing to write home about, and not all they are hyped up to be.   

I'm very sincerely worried I may end up sick from the few bites of rotten tuna I ate, it's only been a couple hours since eating and I have felt queazy since.  SMH.

The Rockefeller oysters were tasty.  Highly recommend the shrimp jambalaya pasta with alligator sausage.  The sauce was perfectly seasoned without being too salty or spicy.  The special tonight was also delicious, blackened catfish with crayfish and jambalaya.  Had no room for desserts but they looked yummy.

Wow, what a lovely place.

I had my very first Po'Boy here, and let me just say it fulfilled my every expectation!  Beautiful courtyard, incredibly friendly staff.  We had 30 minutes to eat and run, and the manager made sure our wait staff knew that.  Our food came right away, they got us in and out, but very friendly the whole time.

Besides all that, the Catfish Po'Boy was absolutely mouthwatering.  I thought the breading might be crunchy, like fish n' chips, but it was tender and moist.  The bread was nice and soft, and the sauce they used was perfect.  Just a perfect first experience, and I highly recommend it!

If (hopefully when) I make it back to NOLA, this will be one of my first stops.
Their shrimp po boys are delicious!! The shrimp is seasoned perfectly. The remoulade sauce has a really tangy taste. I recommend it

This is my FAVORITE restaurant in NOLA ! I make sure to visit every trip. I'm not a huge seafood fan but, I will eat anything they cook and plate for me! A favorite dish is the cajun seafood pasta. Always a crowd but the wait is never too long. Fast and friendly service. The staff is excellent. If you're in New Orleans, make your way to Oceana!

Ate dinner here last night and wasn't particularly impressed. Firstly they seated our group of four at the back of the restaurant which would have been fine with me except our table was partially positioned underneath the counter for the oyster bar. It was also extremely wobbly. We tried to remedy this by putting a pile of folded napkins underneath the part that lifted off the ground but it didn't make a difference so we asked to be moved to a nearby table which was done immediately. I then ordered the crab cakes and a side Caesar salad for my main dish since I didn't feel like eating a large quantity of food. The food came out in good time and my salad which I ordered without cheese was delicious. The crab cakes were a good size and tasted ok. The crawfish sauce wasn't as tasty as I had expected based on the other reviews I had read here on yelp so I ended up just picking out the crab and leaving most of it on the plate. 

Oceana has a very tacky, touristy atmosphere reminiscent of a older Joe's crab shack and it looks like it would be a fun place to drink, however I doubt I will come back.

The reviews for this place was a bit overrated in my book..I read all these great things about how it's worth the wait as the line is usually crazy long to get in. The ambiance was good,our waitress was great , polite and very understanding, however this was the worst food we had during our visit. I had their most popular dishes . It was so bad I don't even remember the name . The food was tasteless, the greens taste like it was a can. I worked in the the food industry so I had a little experience with food . In my opinion the food it's not worth the wait ,unless you are going just for the atmosphere.

Husband & I were walking on Bourbon St & saw that there was line for dinner. We walked around the area for a couple of hours & came back to try this place out. It was around 930pm we got sitted right then without a line waiting as it did earlier. We shared their seafood platter & it was 3- stars for me. Fish did not taste like mud or the 'fishy' taste that you get with other kinds of fish like cat fish. Tartar sauce that came with our order was too sour for my taste.

Friendly service, but the food isn't quite what I expected based on the reviews I read.  The food wasn't horrible, but it wasn't great.  The turtle soup tasted like BBQ sauce and the jambalaya was sub-par.  I think thiswas the first time I've ever not eaten all my jambalaya.

Great food ,especially the crab cakes. Errol provided wonderful and friendly service. If you go, see if you can get him as your server. I highly recommend for a wonderful meal and experience in the French Quarter

I explored this restaurant over the labor day weekend. I ordered their popular crab cake with craw fish. The cakes were poured with a craw fish sause. It was different but I have had smiliar or more delicious crab cakes in Maryland, so I wouldn't say they were out of the world. Then I was in mood for some desert and ordered La Boheme Creme Brulee. It was a thick sugar coating at the top with cool custard bottom. This is definitely the one to try for the sweet lovers. The service was just fine and the waiter forgot what dish she was bringing to me and on the way she had to ask that is this the right dish as she was bringing it to me.(Apparently I heard it and it was little awkward moment)

Food: 7/10
Service: 6/10
Ambiance: 6/10

I was very skeptical when walking in for the first time. My thoughts quickly changed after the first taste of the Cajun pasta. It had so much flavor in every bite! There was no comparison between the Cajun pasta here and the pasta at a nearby 'fancy' restaurant with the same name as the most famous street in this city! Great time, good drinks and great food!

Great food and great service! We wanted to eat at a restaurant that had a balcony for lunch, although Oceana doesn't have one, we did have an awesome view from our open window table! I had the blackened chicken PoBoy - terrific and well seasoned. My friend has the blackened chicken pasta, again, very well seasoned and tasteful! We will definitely visit again!

So, our first night there was a long line for dinner and we made note.  The next day we passed by and went in for lunch.  I can't recommend it.  Had a shrimp po boy.  Not so good.  Maybe their dinner menu is better, but lunch wasn't a hit for me.

Amazing service,amazing food,amazing drinks...overall amazing experience.  Our waitress Whitney was wonderful!! She was friendly, attentive,and very informative and excited about the food. Her recommendation of the crawfish fries with blackened chicken was perfect! I order based off her recommendation and that was ther best meal I recieved while in New Orleans. Place is more than worth the 5 stars!!!

Oceana is a nice restaurant. It took us no time to be seated with a table of 5. Brandon was our server and he was a delight! The food is so good! I tasted the prawns and shrimp fettuccine Alfredo. The sauce on the Alfredo was #everything! I was slightly disappointed with the creme brûlée, only because the top was not caramelized enough and the dish itself was cold. It needed a little more heat on the top and bottom. 
I would definitely dine there again and recommend

Don't be put off by the line!! This restaurant is very large, the line goes quickly and it's worth the wait!! Best PoBoys in town, their bread is just so good! Great drinks!! They also have a fantastic breakfast menu. Their Signature Blackened red fish entree is stupid good!!! Serious, eat here!!!

Shared some plates, ordered the crab cakes to start off and they were delicious. Crispy on the outside soft and savory in the inside. Our main meal was the Taste of New Orleans. Our waitress divided this entire entree into two and it was perfect portions. Now if you are hungry u are better off not sharing. Jambalaya, crawfish étouffée and red beans and rice w/ sausage, all delicious and with a small quick of spiciness. But definitely worth it. Red beans almost tasted like Popeyes fast food chain version. This restaurant did have somewhat of a chain restaurant look and feel to it. Glad we got to seat upstairs next to the balcony, although not much to see. Our waitress Jessica was helpful and welcoming.

We decided to try Oceana last Tuesday as a casual predecessor to the Commander's Palace lunch the next day. From our past experience at Commander's, we had some expectations but weren't assuming too much. We asked for seating in the courtyard as the main dining area was way crowded and really noisy. As it happened, the small wire mesh table we got was dingy and two of the chairs were wet. They have fans that line one side of an overhang that were pointed right down on two of the three tables we tried that truly would have been a challenge for a Trump hairstyle    

We ordered both their raw and grilled oysters, both blackened and plain Redfish, gumbo and a Ceasar. Oh, and a side of fried oysters for 4 of us. The only thing that was par was the Ceasar. The raw oysters were transplants to smaller shells and were not fresh-shucked (dead giveaway-no liquid and stale taste); the fried oysters were over- breaded with a harsh, hot cocktail sauce and the Blackened Redfish was dry,dry,dry.   All in all, as it turns out, this prelude to Commander's lunch cost .05 cents less but was a hundred dollars  less in both food and drink quality. Oceana, was mediocre at best and very disappointing for the ratings that brought us in there.
In the Quarter, the seating is good to people watch. Good food and they're fast. Kind of busy at times, but hey, it's the Quarter.
Great food and service. Had dinner on our first night in NOLA here and loved it so had lunch here on our last day. Margaritas are really good!
Got the Cajun pasta and an order of the alligator bites (1/2 order fried, 1/2 order blackened). Everything was amazing! I want the recipe for the pasta!

The only reason why this place did not get 5 stars, was because their bathrooms were HORRENDOUS and smelled like last nights vomit. 
We went here for lunch and the food was AWESOME. We had the crab cakes w/ craw fish sauce on top, and the crispy duck. AWESOME. For desert we had Creme Brule. Delicious. We had such an awesome time, the service was great - they were so friendly and attentive. The chef even came out and talked to all of those who were there and asked about the food. He was so nice and even sat down with us for a few minutes to chat. The portions were decent, price was right. We had a great experience.

The absolute best food I have ever had!  Blackened bayou duck sent me to another world!  Our waiter, Rod, a delightful young man was a superb host.  On a busy Saturday night in the quarter, we were seated rather quickly, served and allowed to sit and enjoy the second story view of the quarter while eating mind blowing food!  Go!  Go and enjoy!

Came here for lunch on our NOLA trip. Our waitress was the absolute sweetest. We had the oysters famous to the restaurant and they were AMAZING.  We had the ahi-tuna which was pretty good - a good size!! There always seemed to be a line out front and we now understand why!

I think you should all watch their episode of Kitchen Nightmares before even entering this restaurant. Oh, heck no. I was there for the filming and once it aired I realized we were in the before group. I have been sick to my stomach since.
Try the blackened catfish po boy it is seasoned well and delightful it was 15.00 . Right off of bourbon st

Dined here on NY day.  Line was out the door but it moved quickly.  Thank goodness because it was frigid in New Orleans.  Location was easy to access off Bourbon street.  It appears to be 3 levels with upstairs and downstairs bars.  I sat on 3rd level which was open and spacious, with 3 TVs showing early football games.
I ordered the catfish ponchatran with collard greens on the side. The catfish ponchatran was excellent.  For dessert, I ordered bread pudding with rum sauce, which was excellent.  I topped it off w/ kahlua coffee to warm the insides.  
Staff was great with recommendations, prompt and courteous.

Had saw the restaurant on kitchen nightmares (bad way to start off a review but it gets better lol) & saw it had been re done by none other than Gordon Ramsay so when on a NOLA trip HAD to stop by!! Our food was amazing!!! My dish had so many crawfish tails in it I was in heaven & the crab cakes were good as well (didn't like the chunks of lettuce in the crab cakes)

Avoid it. Average is an overstatement. Not sure why it's rated so highly. Tourist district slop at tourist district prices. Ordered a few items and was brought the large versions for the large prices. No one wanted so sort this problem out for us.
They know how to satisfy a shellfish craving. Portions are huge. Good for trying to get your fill of the regional food.

OMG! Crab cakes, I fell in absolute love! I had the gumbo it was tasty, I tried my friends Alfredo it was DELICIOUS and I AM NOT a pasta lover (I should have ordered it). The "alcohol" beverage I had, strawberry daiquiri tasted like a frozen slush, so don't drink here but the food is amazing!!
Service was great but nothing to write home about. Standard NOLA menu.  Overpriced. No options if you're vegetarian.
I came in on a Thursday the wait wasn't too bad about 15-20 minutes. The food was excellent I ordered "tastes of New Orleans" i enjoy every bite of it.

The food here is terrific!  I ate here twice during my stay in Nola.  Their kitchen stays open until 1am which is great for a late night snack.  All the bartenders here are great as well.  I highly recommend the BBQ shrimp, red beans & rice and crab cakes.  Oceania is tucked away on a side street just off Bourbon.

This might just offer the best crab cakes in New Orleans, definitely stopping by here again when I visit again.  We also ordered a few appetizer, fried and charbroiled gator bites and the oysters were insanely delicious.  To drink i went with a hurricane and it did not disappoint!  Service was good as well, highly recommend this place.

Excellent meal! The three of us ordered Mardi Gras pasta, shrimp fettuccini Alfredo, redfish oceans, side of alligator sausage and a bowl of greens. Everything  was delicious. Many places are over salted. This wasn't!! This was the best meal we had in the French quarter. We'll be back!!

Came back for lunch..had fried shrimp, fried crawfish tails, fried soft shell crab, red beans and rice and fried gator bites. Everything was very good. Fried seafood not greasy, very fresh. Best red beans and rice I had in New Orleans. This was the best restaurant we tried in the French quarter!

Came on Sat. night at around 7pm before going to the madness on Bourbon st. Line moved. very quickly. Our server Kathleen was very attentive, and courteous. Food was great. Ordered a NOLA blonde ale, bbq shrimp. Everything was delicious. It's a nice and very spacious place. If you're in town and don't know where to eat Go here .

Love this place.   Lots of options and the fish dishes are loaded with flavor. Not to mention the size of portions were big unlike RedFish Grill.   
It's not real fancy and the line to get in was long but worth it.
So disappointing. So so service and food was questionable. Highly disappointed in our last NOLA dinner. I send the shrimp back, which they compensated.
Ordered the Jambalaya - it was great.  Very good food, atmosphere and service.  I highly recommend it.

Great service and food! The waitress was so nice to our daughter and gave us pointers as to what to order off the menu for dinner and beer choices. She was very attentive as well as the hostess at the front.

Kind of a tourist trap. The food can best be described as average. The crab cakes were very breaded and lacked much crab flavor. The sauce that promised shrimp and crawfish was so disappointing. 

The upstairs bartender was a nice guy but the hurricane was kinda weak. I guess the dry ice is supposed to make a show that distracts you. The decor is standard tacky NOLA as tourists expect. Can't imagine why this place has a high rating.

This place is so good we came back for more! Lines are super long but service excellent and the food is delicious. The catfish was super fresh and crispy with a light batter that make the fish extra flaky. The drinks were also delicious especially the hurricane which is one of their signature drinks. I had the taste of New Orleans as I couldn't decide what to get because everything sounded great!!! We ended our meal by sharing the bread budding with rum sauce. It was to die for! The best bread pudding in town! We would definitely recommend this place if you are in the French quarter.

Quinntina was extremely helpful. I had never been to NOLA before not experience the food. She walked me through the entire menu. Let me sample some locally brewed beer, and made an excellent suggestion to get alligator tails as an appetizer. The entire experience was great! Open air even inside. Service with a smile. Go here!
Second time in town, Second time here. food is amazing the staff is very friendly we will be back

It was fantastic! I had the special, blackened redfish over crawfish dressing and all of it covered in a shrimp cream sauce. That dressing was bananas! Everything was well seasoned, cooked perfectly, great portions. I took a weekend trip to New Orleans, first time being there, and Oceana was definitely a highlight of it!

We decided to check this out since it was close to our hotel and recommended by our cab driver.
