Food: gumbo was a little too salty, jambalaya was good, but I thought this place had the best blackened shrimp Caesar salad. Totally unexpected and pleasantly surprised!

Service: just awesome. Everyone is so friendly here!

What a great surprise.  After others in my group did tons of research to find the best places to eat  I found this place on a forum where someone spoke about their recent trip.  Plus, it didn't hurt that you could find a $50off certificate for $10 online.

Conveniently located in the French quarter and there was no wait to be seated on a Thurs night.  Started with the oysters and crabcakes both of which were delicious.  I went with the fried seafood platter which was also good and my friends went with the Grilled Tuna "La Boheme" with barbecue shrimp.  The waitress was extremely nice and quickly brought us over our free refills.  

After hearing about all the other restaurants we just had to try while in New Orleans and all the specialty foods we had to taste, Oceana was one of the best at a fraction of the price.  

Would highly recommend without the certificate but with it, I say Run to Oceana!

Has your share of southern cuisine as well as full bar, including drinks you would find in NOLA, such as Hurricanes. The frozen Hurricanes were flavorful and a good kick. The bread for the sandwiches was a little dry and crunchy, could've used some butter or steam when reheated to soften up.
This was the most freakin' awesome go-kill-yourself-afterwards shrimp po' boy I've EVER eaten in my life--and it was as big as my head!

This place was recommended by a few of locals here. Didn't realize it was right off of Bourbon Street. Apparently Oceana doesn't take reservations on the weekend, UNLESS you call Monday-Friday to make them. When we arrived the line was about half a block deep. The guy in front said they only waited 30 minutes (Saturday night). We thought he was joking, but sure enough we were at the front of the line within 30 minutes. Good job NOLA lets people drink in the streets. However when we did get to the front of the line, we did get passed up by other parties of 2s, 4s, 5s & even 6s due to us having a party of 8. We asked why we kept being passed up. I spoke w/ a couple managers about it because we were waiting an additional 15-20 minutes AT the front of the line. Finally we were seated.

The inside of the restaurant def has a Bourbon Street vibe. Neon lights in the front, darker in the restaurant. Packing people in as best they can. We ordered a few apps. The world famous Louisiana Crabmeat Cakes (Served with crawfish and mushroom cream sauce) & Gator Tail Bites (Marinated white meat gator tail served fried or blackened. Served with remoulade sauce) (blackened & traditional). All 3 of these were AWESOME. As we started to order dinner we did see 2 of the staff members bringing down a toilet, YES A TOLIET, that had a hole in it from upstairs. Mind you there is a bathroom downstairs. Not too appealing in the middle of a dinner rush on a Saturday night.

When dinner arrived the following was ordered by the group:
Redfish Oceana (Sauteed redfish topped with our own crawfish mushroom cream sauce. Served with roasted garlic potatoes and sauteed vegetables) - Very happy w/ their order
Blackened Bayou Duck (Smoked till it's tender then blackened and topped with a crawfish mushroom cream sauce) - The duck was a bit dry, the sauce was very good though
"Knife and Fork" B.B.Q. Ribs (Slow cooked, fall-off-the-bone pork ribs. Served with coleslaw and French fries) Very happy w/ their order
Seafood Gumbo - said they have had better

Overall the team thought the place was 'ok'. The original wait time to be seated put a sour taste in our mouth. The food & drinks changed it, especially the crabcakes. However the team was split down the middle. The wait staff is friendly & handled the busy Saturday night accordingly.
So good!  Crab cakes, grilled oysters, and red fish special were all delectable.  And Darrick was great :). We're loving NOLA!

Had the Taste od Nola.  It was just right for a late nite meal.  Next time I'm going to try something with a sauce but I will definitely be back.  Got bread pudding to go.  It too was very good.  I think I need to have company so I can eat it with a friend at the Cafe.  Next time..

Can't say enough about this place. The BEST red beans and rice I have ever had! The sea food etouffee was wonderful. Tried a number of mixed drinks and they were also very tasty. I will make a visit again before leaving. Be prepared for a wait but it's worth it.

Service was great, everyone was really nice!
And maybe I am a bit harsh but to commercial for my taste, food was good but didn't have much of an authentic feel and it all came out like warm.

We have the BBQ shrimp- BBQ was unique and tasty, crab cake Alfredo was our favorite, crawfish eutouffee 
 With the extra fries crawfish which was not worth the up charge and I am not expert but it was decent and finally the fried gator po boy a really good flavor fantastic remoulade and bread definitely would recommend.

We made a dinner reservation, waited a few minutes outside and the hostess tried to seat in the most coveted table: at the smoky kitchen. We asked to move elsewhere and moved inside to the dining area (lots of available tables *scratches head*).

The oysters, raw and grilled were good but you could get these anywhere. The crab cakes and catfish po boy drowned in this buttery fat sauce. The biggest disappointment was my entree, the blackened duck. it's a shame when the vegetables are the highlight of my meal. Duck is a beautiful and delicious bird, but this was dry, overcooked and salty. C'mon guys for about $20, you can do better.

One surprise was our server. At the end of our meal, he wrote down a list of bars to try that were off the beaten path. We checked some of these places the next day and didn't let us down. 

Overrated. The food served here is an insult to cajun cooking. The crime here is that the warm and friendly waitstaff can't carry this place.

IFHTP 1

We are here for dinner, the restaurants has several floors, and it's decorated well with Christmas trees. We order gator tail bites (you can choose half fried half blackened) both are great, it's house special redfish oceana is also great. However the other dishes like taste of NOLA is just ok.

for late night eats nears the bourbons this is a nice choice.

yes its a dive bar, but far enough off the strip to minimize the circus a few store fronts away.

service by the manager or owner was friendly enough, though it felt like his server of the night was missing so I made sure to order enough beer to keep me whistles wet.

the dozen oysters were huge and wood inspiring,(boing!) 
 the cup of gumbo featured a guest crawfish at the bottom of soul filling goodness and the po'boy catfish sandwich featured a tasty lightly battered piece of flesh and a side of damn good frites with a nice crunch.

abita amber on the tap, NOLA's finest sitting down to join in the goodness another good sign.

yes, this be a good place to park 'em and fill dems.

Do not eat at Oceana Grill ..... they will keep you waiting when a D lister walks in !!!!! You will wait an hour while the D lister is being served and the waiter is running around for them like a chicken with his head chopped off .... and don't let Mayweather walk in .. forget your food! You're eating airchops and drinking nothing juice !!!!

This place is a must try when visiting New Orleans. We ordered crab cakes, Mardi grass and shrimp Alfredo pasta. All were 5 star. They put a lot of shrimp and crawfish tails. Also we got the Hurricane drink, delicious! Very tasty and full of flavor. We will be back for sure. Our server name was Christophe. Thank you!!!
Food was great! Shrimp fettuccine was awesome! Hubby had blackened catfish & that was great as well as! Jessica our server was more than accommodating! Definitely recommend!
Killer food. Shrimp Alfredo and gumbo were excellent. My father in law is from Monroe, and this gumbo rivaled his. A must eat spot. 5 stars people.
The Taste of New Orleans was delicious! The entree came with jambalaya, red beans & rice, and crawfish étouffée. Absolutely delicious ! Excellent customer service by Jerleen!

I had the best seafood experience at Oceana! Had oysters, crab cakes for small plates and crawfish etouffe for entree. I would recommend this place to anyone. Got a table within 15 minutes and Erich explained everything really good and suggested hurricane for tropical which again turned out great

This was the most freakin' awesome go-kill-yourself-afterwards shrimp po' boy I've EVER eaten in my life--and it was as big as my head! Figuring out how to get this sandwich into your face MAY be the hardest thing you do all day!

On our last night here in New Orleans we chose Oceana . And a great decision it was , Jordan was our server and she was amazing ! The food was great and the service unmatched.  
Definitely recommend, and if you're lucky , Jordan will also be your server !
Delicious seafood. This place totally ruined pappadeaux for me, I can no longer eat there, because this place raised the bar that high. Long lines, but it is worth the wait.

My husband and I went yesterday evening for dinner. Not only am I still full 12 hours later but I am completely satisfied. If you want amazingly good home cooking, friendly service and great drinks than this is the place for you. 

We normally go and check out a place of Yelp before we go, but with Oceana we went the extra mile and checked out the menu as well. When their online menu differed from what they have as a menu now, they were understanding and accommodating and went as far as to add something that was no longer on the menu  back on so I could try it for the first time. I had alligator bites which they now only offer blackened, fried. They were to die for! If you've never tried it, it is well worth it. And don't even get me started on the gumbo. This is SOUL food if I've ever had it! This dish was so good it made my heart happy, and though it seems a bit over the top, it almost made me cry it was that good. My husband enjoyed the shrimp alfredo which was cooked to perfection! 

If you are new to NOLA this is definitely a must eat place! And if you're not new... what are you waiting for!?

Great food and service. I got the ribs and the BBQ sauce that they cover it with was amazing! The taste of New Orleans, which my boyfriend got was perfect for someone that wants to taste a little bit of everything. The great part about this place is that it's open till late, so if you're looking for a late night dinner this is your Spot!

I had my first cup of gumbo here the other day and have to say nowhere else in New Orleans could compete with it. This is the perfect restaurant if you are trying to taste new southern food such as, gator bites or jambalaya. I ordered the seafood platter and was very happy, another added bonus was the food came very quickly!
The oysters were great. I give them 5 stars and were about my favorite oyster in NO. Crab cakes I give a 3. Service was nice and good too.

Drinks are subpar, don't expect anything fresh or muddled (bar tender almost fell over when I asked), beer was good on draft and they had some decent wine selections. The food is why you come here...the taste of New Orleans gives you a little bit of everything to sample and it's absolutely delicious. The crab cakes are also very good!

This was the first ever meal we had in New Orleans and husband and I were not impressed. 
we probably have great expectations on the gumbo but we have had better elsewhere. 
We were there just a week ago but I have already forgotten what I ordered and ate. 
It was that uneventful/forgettable.

Get Vegetarian Alfredo! Wasn't the best I ever had but what made it unique was that it was spicy. Actually wanted my fiancé to go back then we realized they delivered! Going to get something for tomorrow night.

I had the maw maw Cajun breakfast and it was delicious! The service was great and there's even a discount thru yelp. Definitely come back here again. It was early in the am so not too crowded but I can imagine what's its like in the pm with all the drunk revelers for Bourbon St.

The best dinner option in NOLA. Period. The service is also superb! Ask for David if you go! 

We arrived slightly before the normal dining hour, and when we left the line was around the block!!! This place is that amazing! We are so pleased that we found Oceana - kudos to Yelp! for that! 

David recommended that we start with the Oysters Oceana, since the restaurant is known for their sauces, and hummmm diggity those things are goooooodddddd. They were so tasty that we ordered another platter of them. I don't even care for oysters really, but I had to sample them. Man... they were so good! They are baked and are bathed in a delicious, creamy sauce. Included on the plate are a few slices of french banquette. Dip one of those babies in the sauce, and your tastebuds with be on Cloud 9. I dream of having that dish again. Truly I do. I literally wanted to lick that plate clean, but since I'm a classy broad I had to refrain. 

Next up, five dishes in total: Two orders of Gumbo, crab cake fettuccini, blackened chicken fettuccini, and crab cakes with greens and potatoes. Everyone was very pleased with their menu choices, and cleaned their plates. Compliments over and over again to the Chef. 

Lastly, dessert was up. Bananas Foster was the choice, and it was a remake of the original. This one was more of a bananas foster ice cream cake. Cool creamy vanilla with banana on top of a sweet buttery crust, and all topped with whipped cream. Delectable. 

This was such a lovely dinner. The ambiance, the service, and food were five stars all around. This will be my first stop for dinner next time I happen to be in New Orleans. It should be yours too.

Went to a ton of restaurants while we came on vacation last week. This by far was my favorite restaurant. We ate dinner and loved it so much that we came for breakfast the next. The staff was great and the food was hydras great. Try the alligator sausage, charbroiled oysters, oysters Rockefeller, and fried eggplant. For breakfast try the eggs malanzana.

Yes, this was the find on our trip to New Orleans. A notch above the rest ( 14 different restaurants).

Atmosphere      80    Typical New Orleans
Service             80     They honestly cared
Food                 80    Okay !!!
Value                80     New Orleans prices

I would recommend because it was the best of a bad lot.

The place is deceivingly spacious. As soon as you walk in you see the cozy bar and small room to the back. We were lead to a larger dining room with windows with a view of the side street.   

Great service by Jerry. Very friendly and attentive. Gave us some great recommendations for food and even some of the things to check out around the city. 


Food was good!
Definitely try the crabmeat cakes... That sauce they put overtop is where it's at. 
Crawfish étouffée was also very good. 
Also had the red beans and rice. Had a nice smokiness to them, and the Cajun sausage it came with was great. 
The oysters Rockefeller were just ok for me.
Do yourself a favor. Go off your Whole 30 diet and ordered a cup or bowl of seafood gumbo to start and the fried seafood platter to finish. Get yo blessing and eat good with Oceana!!!!

First I would like to thank Rachel for assisting me with my father's 75th birthday celebration. The patio room was gorgeous & the weather was perfect that night. The food was very tasty. The two male waiters were professional,  socialable and gave us excellent customer service. The assistant manager was helpful as my group arrived at different times causing me to be frustrated. I appreciate everyone's patience dealing with my family's lateness.
Everything about this place was awesome!! The server was great, the food was great, & the atmosphere was just as nice! Best place I've been in NoLo so far
My experience in NoLa with good not so great.   I am a foodie and definitely Oceana Grill doesn't meet my expectations.

We met some friends staying at the Royal Sonesta across the street.  They wanted to check with their hotel concierge for recommendations.  The concierge walked around from the desk, grabbed my friend's arm, and practically marched us over to Oceana Grill, which was across the street.   The aggressive marketing (and what I can only assume are kickbacks to hotel staff) set a bad tone for the meal -- how good can a restaurant be if they have to try that hard?

One couple in our group ordered an appetizer of fried eggplant that was tasty, although I recommend skipping the blend of ketchup and mayonnaise that they served as a sauce.  (Ask if they have a marinara.) 

I ordered "Redfish Amer" ($18), which was pan-fried redfish smothered in a creamy crawfish sauce.  I grew up on the gulf coast, where we used to catch our own redfish.  I can only assume the redfish in my dinner (if it was indeed redfish) was farm-raised.  At first bite, I thought it was catfish -- it tasted like the bottom of a lake!  The crawfish sauce was bland almost to the point of being tasteless.  It was like hollandaise with no lemon, with some chewy red bits of meat thrown in.

Several people at our table ordered the "Taste of New Orleans" ($16), which was a trio of Crawfish Etoufee, Red Beans and Rice, and Jambalaya.  The jambalaya had a pleasant spiciness, but the rice was a little gummy and the sausage was a little rubbery.  This was the first time I've had jambalaya, and I would have to try it at a better restaurant before I passed final judgment.  The etoufee was bland but passable.  Is it possible that they used canned beans for the red beans and rice?  I'm just not sure.

On the plus side, we had a group of nine and we were seated immediately.  We had some picky children eaters with us, but they had a kid's menu if you asked -- Chicken fingers or fried shrimp or fried cheese sticks (each served with fries) for $5.  The mixed drinks were $6 and served in large schooners.  The service, while not superb, was adequate - no complaints there.   The prices, which seemed a little high at first blush, may not be too far out of line for a touristy restaurant  just off Bourbon Street.  Portions were large -- a couple could easily share an appetizer and one entree and fill up.
Chef Cornin and Pamela took great care of us! Greatest breakfast ever!!

Nice atmosphere, friedly staff, and delicious food. During our visit to new orleans, we visited Oceana three times, for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Each of the meals were very good and generous. I especially recommend the blackened redfish.
Stopped at this place after a long 10 hour drive. Best place we could have gone. Great service, open late, very reasonable prices and the chicken fettuccine alfredo was amazing!

Loved the crab cakes! Very New Orleans (think sauce and crawfish topping).  The fried alligator was also tasty. 

I ordered the fried catfish poboy for a meal. I wasn't the biggest fan (couldn't really taste the fish between the bread and simply the lack of fish). I think they had another option (a grilled fish or something like that). It looked like the better choice. Everyone I was with seemed to enjoy their food though.

Our waiter was great. He was friendly and even gave us suggestions for some parties. He let someone in my group charge their phone and was very helpful.

This was a close 4 star.
Tasted ok, kind of a tourist trap with plastic menus. Friendly service, had a catfish po-boy which came as catfish pieces and not a filet.

Good food with a reasonable low price. 
     Oysters seem to be a little bit smaller than Acme's (I think?), but they are good! I mean, may not be as good as Acme's, but still I like them. If you don't want to wait in the long line in front of Acme, Oceana Grill's oysters should be able to satisfy you.
     All the other foods are incredible as well. I really love their fried seafood platter!

Delicious Seafood ... I wanted to heck this place out based on the reviews I read and they are all RIGHT!! The crab cakes app was so tasty BEST crab cakes I've had .. The oysters we very fresh and went down smoothly and the seafood gombo was very tasty ... They staff was very helpful and kind ... Will come back whenever I come visit
Oyster platter is delicious!  Everything has a little spice, but great flavor.  Crab cakes are loaded with crab.  Recommend the platters.

Happened into this place while looking for a br akfast repast. We were delighted to find a lovely N'awlins courtyard for all fresco dining. Troy, our server,  was absolutely top notch. Let us in on all the good local Intel, provided recommendations that were on point and was absolutely delightful. I had the Pan Purdue which is apparently Southern speak for melt-in-your-mouth heaven. Local poboy bread is used to create absolutely incredible light, yet decadent "French toast" that will make any future French toast experience pale in comparison. The bacon was perfectly crisp, mimosas bubbly and coffee hot and fresh.  My dining partner tried the cajun breakfast with alligator sausage which was also amazing. Absolutely recommend this local delight to anyone traveling thru. Ask to sit outside!!

This experience was incredible. Kasey, our waitress, was the best service we have ever had in our lives. For a chef that has grown up in the industry, I am utterly impressed and blown away by how attentive, thoughtful and kind she was. We will be back just for her! We had raw oysters on the half shell that were delicious. I am going again tomorrow for them! My momma had the Louisiana crabmeat cakes and they were fantastic! I enjoyed the blackened catfish poboy and mimosas, both were lovely. In culinary school my poboys were #1 yet the chef here put mine to shame! Fantastic experience all around. The manager Renee was also very attentive checking up on us!! Great job. Great great job Kasey!!
The crab cakes were excellent. As was the service. Shout out to bartender Jai! Super nice and helpful. The only reason this is 4 stars instead of 5 is that the shrimp po-boy was just average.

We were delighted and charmed by our waiter -- nice restaurant but cant review food as our goal was dessert.  The pecan pie was a hugh disappointment -- it was the thinest slice of pie i have ever been served -- but thats ok because the taste matched the size.  Great bread pudding - Bananas foster large enogh for two

Great find! Came here at the suggestion of a coworker while we're in town for a convention. Left totally satisfied and needed a good long walk afterwards.

We shared a dozen raw oysters that were plump and fresh. Bowl of gumbo wasn't too thick and was super tasty. I had a jambalaya pasta which is a good sized portion to fill you up without going overboard.

Staff was friendly and our food came out quickly. Super plus that there was no wait to get a table either (around 1PM on Sunday).
The tuna was too well cooked and said it comes with mashed potatoes and veges. I got spinach!!!!   Not impressed. My husband loved the oysters

Came to Oceana grill for breakfast. I had the Cajun omelet. The eggs and hashbrowns were just ok. Was made this place nice was the environment. It had nice music plus you could buy a bottle of champagne for mimosas which was a plus.

Great place to eat in the French Quarter. Kids are welcome. Modestly priced.Nice kids menu, and not spicy. 
As for the food, the shrimp poboy came dressed with a delicious romelaude sauce, which is a nice touch. The Taste of New Orleans was a dream dish, with red beans and rice, jambalaya and ettouffe all in one plate. Beware of the heat: most everything is a tad spicy. 
Service was excellent and the restaurant was beautiful!

The service was so good! The food was delish! Bathroom really, really clean! My friends and I ate so much food, no room for the dessert, sorry. As you wait for your seat all you smell is the maple in the air, so odd, then your heart is broke finding out its just the waffle bowl they make there. YOU GUYS NEEED TO HAVE A MAPLE WALNUT DESSERT, it would sell, alot! I got started with "THE TASTE OF NEW ORLEANS", that was AWESOME! Gator tails were yummy (taste like chicken), then the fried catfish was cooked to perfection! The hush puppies... Look, it hurt to walk cause I ate so much... Loved it, got there at perfect time cause line got really long outside...

Stopped here on a whim after a conference. Sat a table of 9 with no problem on a Saturday night.  Drinks were fantastic and had some unique cocktail options. 

My wife had the seared ahi tuna with stuffed crab meat and it was amazing! I ate almost half her plate in addition to the redfish i ordered. Dessert was a fantastic mousse and pecan pie. Good selection of unique dishes and excellent friendly service.

I'm on a solo vacation and came and sat at the bar for lunch. It took over 5 minutes before I was even greeted. I've worked in hospitality before, so I'm more forgiving on poor service than most, because I understand how busy servers get. After I ordered a water to start, the bartender proceeded to cut lemons and do her opening prep work. I then had to ask two more times for a water to start before I ever received it. Again, she continued to do her opening prep work directly in front of me, ignoring my request. Very disappointing- I will not be back. It shouldn't take 10-15 mins for me to be able to order, just because I'm traveling by myself. The oysters were pretty amazing, but it would have been nice if someone was there to also clear my plate. I can't remember the last time I've gotten such terrible service.

On vacation in New Orleans.
THIS PLACE IS AWESOME! I don't normally eat fish, I got the po boy 1/2 shrimp and cat fish. The seafood is so fresh I loved it.
Decor is nice, service wonderful, waiter brought our bottled beer and poured it for us.
They deserve 6 stars.
Was looking for a Shrimp Po-Boy and found a great one here. Our server Jimika even offered us a soda to since it was hot out.
Delicious food! Big servings. Had shrimp and seafood platter more than enough food for 2 people
Drinks are outta this world, food is phenomenal, and service was great. Will be back for more!!!!
First time in Nola and this restaurant was a great choice! Authentic eats with incredible service. Ask for Pamela, she suggests great dishes and drinks that you'll love!
Food was good, Chad was excellent. The end....i would love to come back. Wish i had room for desert but I'm too freakin stuffed!
What a great choice when in the French Quarter. Honest food that doesn't price gouge you. We found it in Yelp, and it lives up to its reviews. Skip on the cheap frozen pizza joints and come here!

See, I work the graveyard shift, and sometimes you gotta' eat at 3AM. This place delivers, and our delivery guy is the only reason I'm giving two stars. He's fast, friendly, and funny.

The menu, however, is stuck in the blackened seafood craze (was that the early 90's?). My co-worker and I ordered a 'blackandblue' burger. Meaning a bleu cheeseburger with the ubiquitous blackened seasonings. What arrived was a burger with a smattering of bleu cheese and a 1/4 ounce of somebody's salt-laden creole seasoning. And...flaccid fries.

In short, inedible.

Experience was okay.  Cajun fries appetizer was yummy and huge...  large portion of fries doused in a crayfish gravy and cheese. Crab cakes.. not so good in my opinion...  too much breading/stuffing.  Gator bite po'boy was okay, with a large portion of fries.
Amazing food and the entire staff is friendly and always smiling. My experience at Oceana Grill was just top notch. Our server Errol was the best and recommended so many great options for our group.

We wanted to go to Oceana Grill during our visit to New Orleans because I had gotten a gift certificate from http://restaurant.com for it.  

We were seated immediately, and the restaurant was only about 1/4 full.  The seating reminded me of a country-style restaurant, but I liked the brick walls.  The menu had your basic cajun/creole items.  As an appetizer, we tried the cajun gator sausage.  It was very tasty, too, and a bit spicy.  YUM.  For our entrees, my partner and I both ordered the crawfish etouffee.  It, too, was fantastic.  It had a lot of flavor in the sauce and a lot of crawfish.  DOUBLE YUM.  

For New Orleans, the service was pretty good, too.  We were given drink refills and weren't left waiting for long in between courses.  That's pretty hard to come by in NOLA.  

Overall, the Oceana Grill was a pretty good, basic, casual dining establishment in New Orleans.

Oceana Grill has very good crab cakes.
My friend and I ordered the crab cakes as appetizers. This dish comes with 2 pieces of crab cakes topped with crawfish tails and cream sauce on a thin bed of Romaine lettuce. Each piece of crab cakes contains a lot of real crab meat inside. The outer crust of these crab cakes is crunchy which adds to the joy of each bite.

My main course was the Grilled Ahi Tuna "La Boheme" with bbq shrimp toppings. The tuna slab that came was huge and I chose to have it cooked medium rare which came out just great. A small plate of steamed vegetables and garlic potatoes in a sea of melted butter also comes with this dish. The only negative side of this dish is that it was lacking flavor for both the sauce on the tuna and the bbq shrimp. This was quite a disappointment considering the crab cakes appetizers made us think the main course would at least keep the bar as high.

My friend had the Redfish Oceana, which was fried crusted redfish topped with crawfish cream sauce. This dish also comes with a small plate of steamed vegetables and garlic potatoes in melted butter. I had a bite of it and my verdict is the same as what I said for the tuna which was lacking flavor.

The service was great. Our server was very friendly. One positive note at this joint is that the food comes out very fast. 

We'd most likely return to Oceana Grill to try other dishes.

I absolutely love this place. On a recent trip to New Orleans my friend and I ate there three times. We had breakfast there twice and dinner. Each time the food and service was excellent. The grilled oysters were delicious, this coming from someone who is not fond of the things. The breakfast crepes are to die for. The Red Fish, their specialty ,was absolutely scrumptious. Let's not forget one of the appetizers, mouth watering crab cakes.
Last but not least, the piece de resistance - Bananas foster ice cream dessert. All I can say is OMG!!!
There is usually a short wait, but it is so worth it. Please check it out on your next visit to the Big Easy.

Had the chicken fettuccine Alfredo and fried shrimp. The shrimp had too much breading and the Alfredo was too hot. Complained and they still left it on the bill after the manager insulted is. Will never come here again. This is why this place was on kitchen nightmares

We came in for drinks and ended up getting some grilled oysters and bbq shrimp, ending with some king cake. WOW, just WOW. Best food we have had in NOLA. So glad we stumbled across this AMAZING place. Run, don't walk, here as soon as you get to NOLA!!!!

Had the Pleasure of Being Served By Errol when i stopped by for lunch. This was my first time in the south and Errol lived up to the true meaning of southern hospitality. Food was great but service made the experience.

So our Uber driver suggested that we go here for lunch. The dish she described sounded to good to be true so my friend ended up ordering it (it is not on the menu) Blackened fish with shrimp over corn bread, with a side of greens. I ordered the shrimp Po'Boy since I have been craving for a good one for a while now. We were seated upstairs and got served fairly quickly since it was still early and not a lot of people were out wondering around Bourbon. The Po'boy came out filled with shrimp and the bread was decent. I was expecting a little more oomph with the flavors but I didn't get it. The taste that I got from my friends dish was actually very good. It was just a tad bit too salty for me but it was still good. A lot of my friends ended up telling me about other dishes I should try if I ever go back and I will try those to see if I could get what I missed out on from the Po'boy. I would suggest coming and trying this place out if you are in the area.

It's on Conti street right near Hotel Le Marais..  Ate here twice during our stay.  Sat at the bar both times.  Drink prices were reasonable food portions were big. We had the following food here and it was ABOVE average: 
BBQ Bacon Burger 
Jalepeno Hush Puppies (very good snack) 
Seafood Platter (Fried Catfish, Shrimp, Oysters)
Shrimp Po' Boy (My girlfriend is from Louisiana originally and said their Po Boy is better than most and seasoned just right. 


Pros:
Food is good 
Has more of a "local" feel as opposed to a touristy feel 
Service at the bar was very good and friendly (Blonde bartender was very nice) 
Food Portions are big!  You won't leave  hungry 

Cons:
A bit pricey 
Menu could be a little more diverse

Very tasty menu! Some of the items were a bit rich, but overall Oceana was wonderful & I cannot wait to come back!

Their "famous" oysters were good, but the sauce was a little heavy. I thought their raw oysters were better. I had the blackened redfish with crawfish étouffée - wonderful! Very flavorful, slightly spicy, & delicious.

Service was great! There was a little line at the door but it moved fast & we got a table within 5 minutes.

Love everything we tried!! The Crab Cakes are amazing, get those for sure! Best crab cakes I've ever had!! And I've had a lot!! My second favorite is the Cajun Jambalaya and also loved the taste of New Orleans is perfect, add some Louisiana hot sauce if you like more spice like I do, the they have the best by far Shrimp Po boy- large shrimp with yummy cole slaw, make sure you try at least a cup of Gumbo (again I always add some hot sauce for an added zip, yum yum) and don't forget to try the Catfish Lafouche it's amazing - I asked for extra cream sauce, just because I could, holy cow loved it...even the Charbroiled Oysters come with their infamous sauce on them ( I don't even like oysters, yet, I loved these!!) then dessert each time was spectacular which was the home made cheesecake home made bread pudding and best for last, the home made foster banana ice cream cake, to die for!! Seriously no need to go anywhere else if you want Creole/Cajun food!! We tried other places and we keep coming back here!! Everything tastes wonderful but what seals the deal and makes this a full five stars are the servers and the atmosphere all the workers are very attentive and friendly specially the servers Ashley, Bree, C.J. and Jordan!!! 

(Had to edit my review to add all the other food I forgot to mention and add how great the atmosphere is, warm and friendly and clean, nice newer looking tile floor in the main dinning room, just feels good there)

Truly wonderful, attentive service. The atmosphere was a little touristy, but fun. My friends and I all really enjoyed the food. A little overpriced for the amount and quality, especially the poboys. My friend had the Mardi Gras pasta, which they said was really tasty, but more sauce than pasta.

Overall: Decent food, good service, fun atmosphere, pretty pricey.

We decide to go here after reading reviews. Staff was very friendly. We ordered the bbq shrimp as an appetizer, redfish oceana and Mardi gras pasta with a side of fried oysters. Food was good. I wish I would have asked about substituting the garlic mashed potatoes and greens since I am not that fond of either. We ordered a cup of seafood gumbo for an appetizer but we didn't get it. We ordered a strawberry cheesecake to go also. If in New Orleans you need to go eat with them.

I've been here several times now and have always had great service. The food is consistently delicious.  We started this meal with gator tail bites  - they were perfectly seasoned although maybe left in the dryer a little bit long they were still great. 

We considered ordering two entrees to share but our server suggested we start with just one and go from there. We were thankful for his honesty - one was enough and left room for dessert. We had the seafood platter which was great.... Fried to perfection and well seasoned. 

For dessert I had the New Orleans bread pudding. This may be my favorite dish for the entire trip. It was decadent. 

He had the Chocolate Kahlua Mousse which he enjoyed - but he agreed that the tiny bite of bread pudding I shared with him was out of this world.  

Love this place.
My boyfriend and I were only in town for one day and we're not disappointed eating at oceans! Everything was perfect and so delicious!

This is a must when in NOLA! The food is amazing and the service is great. The oysters Oceana are a great way to start your meal. The sauce is outstanding! You can't go wrong with anything on the menu although I recommend the pasta dishes. Everything was cooked to perfection and I can't tell you enough how good their sauce is! Try and get there a little early because it can get pretty busy during peak dinner hours. Once you are seated sit back and enjoy!
I loved loved loved the taste of New Orleans! Service was great oysters were better!! Definitely taking another trip to NOLA just to eat here!

We are visiting NOLA and we stopped here on our first night. I am gluten-free and this place popped up on Yelp. There was a bit of a line to get a table, but the wait wasn't terrible. Maybe 15-20 minutes. Our server was friendly, fast, and knowledgeable and what she didn't know she quickly checked in the kitchen. My pineapple margarita was delicious and the oysters were to die for. I got gf crab cakes, which came with mashed potatoes, remoulade, and veggies. Everything was delicious. My husband got the "Taste of New Orleans" (touristy and cheesy, we know) and he said it was amazing. For dessert we got creme brulee (also gf) and it was delicious, very creamy with a hint of nutmeg. I will say this- the food didn't look like it would taste nearly as delicious as it was. There was no fancy presentation, but don't be worried, it was fantastic. All in all, I would highly recommend it to the gluten-free folk of NOLA.

I had the Oceana special oysters and crawfish etouffee, both were very good. They have good drinks and atmosphere too. It's a great place to take a break and eat good food while in the French quarter. It's a bit pricey and there was a line going out the door to get a table but I think it was worth it.

I stopped at this place after a night out on Bourbon St. and was so happy that they were still serving dinner by the time I arrived.  The kitchen closes at 1am.  I got the gumbo and it was delicious.  I only got a cup full and wished I'd gotten more.  Rod was the waiter and he was very nice.  I'm looking forward to dining there again during my next visit.
To be on bourbon street this Cajun/Creole restaurant is amazing.. Customer service was top notch as well.. Thanks

The wait was about 15 minutes. It was quick. The ambiance was nice and it was upstairs and downstairs. We had the shrimp fettuccini Alfredo , chicken fettuccine Alfredo, and the fried shrimp po boy. It was only okay. I've had better. We also had the bread pudding which had a great taste. However, for the price I would go elsewhere.

pros:
-open late
-adjacent to bourbon street
-festive decor
-friendly service
-delicious jambalaya pasta

cons:
-mediocre fried dishes: gator bites, seafood platter, fries
-weak (low alcohol content) "specialty" cocktails 
-high/tourist prices

Food was amazing. We split the crab cake appetizer and the grilled red fish entree with étouffée. The crab cakes were amazing, a must. The red fish was a good choice also. I would go back here the next time I'm in town. There was a wait and I see why. The bartenders were friendly.

This place was great! We are at the bar and had a tropical storm coconut rum drink. Everything was delicious and timely. Our bartender/waiter, Juan, was excellent. He took care of us without hovering, but was fun to talk to as well!! Highly recommend this place if you're out on Bourbon, stop in and fill up on delicious food and then head back out again.

My 1st plate of BBQ shrimp and baby back ribs in NOLA and these babies almost made me relocate.

The baby back ribs were almost a no brainer guarantee of greatness. The amazing surprise was the BBQ shrimp. When traveling I always ask the opinion of the waiter for a plate. Let's just say the bbq shrimp had me LITERALLY licking the plate. They give you only this one sad piece of bread that is devoured within 30 secs of the plate being placed on the table. 

Definitely get here just for the shrimp. Service was great, even though it was a busy night too. It's a nice place for family, drunks or a big group.

After a long tour and a night of drinking I decided to have some food to take out and Oceana was the place my brother chose for me I ordered the fried crawfish (side) which was over fried and not to my liking at all, I also ordered a shrimp po'boy and it was not cut in half as I requested and it wasn't that good either not very much shrimp I ordered my brother a side of jambalaya and they gave it in a big to go cup and it wasn't even half way filled after eating this dinner not very much longer I felt sick so I'm sorry I would never return or recommend this place to anyone.

If I could give this place no stars I would. We walked in, were greeted nice enough and seated quickly but then sat unacknowledged for over 10 min. No water,  incorrect menus and no I'll be right with you. Waiters walked around us, looked at us, and passed us and no one said a thing. We did our best to get someone's attention to no avail. We decided to leave and we let the hostess know on the way out that no one served us. I've never had service so bad or should I say a lack of service so bad. I won't be back there needless to say.

Great place for a late night bite in french quarter! Although it's not open as late as Olde NOLA Cookery, they serve the exact same menu and has a more spacious restaurant. If you can, I'd try to sit upstairs where it's roomier and has a better atmosphere to it.

The pastas here are all great and you really can't go wrong with any of them. I would definitely also recommend going to TOWN WITH THE OYSTERS.  They are just as good as the ones in Felix's or Acme, and if you're a tourist, you gotta take advantage of those sweet sweet opportunities. Line moves quick so don't be afraid to wait just a little bit!
Order the food at 7 it got here at 10. The food was throw everywhere on the plate. The delivery guy was nice tho. The order was wrong!!!!
Great service and food. at first wasn't too sure about the food because of the presentation, but we were impressed.  the manager and staff also made sure we got everything we wanted!

Pamela was a delight and knows how to pop them bottles. We came in aggressively at 8:30am asking for all the memosas. She didn't let us down.  

Food was great, too ;)

Great food! Long line to get in but we got seated quickly. Waitress was friendly and greeted us with a smile! Food was delicious! Try to gator bites- we got them
Both fried and blackened and they were both delicious.

So far we have not been disappointed in anything here in New Orleans. Get the crab cakes if you are here. It is right off Bourbon St. We got in quick but minutes after we got sat there was a big line to get in.

Not our favorite experience. The drinks were overly sweet, and very little alcohol was detected. The food was mediocre. Boring bland mashed potatoes and jumbalia. The fried foods were fine, but everything else reminded me of corporate food.

Came here based on Yelp reviews as well as the 10% off offered for checking in.  We ordered the Oceana Famous Oysters and they were phenomenal.  We had a half dozen and should've gotten a full dozen.  Crab cakes were large and sauce was great.  Shrimp Po Boy was loaded with large shrimp.  We will probably go back here before we leave NOLA.

I had heard good things and I placed  delivery order for a couple of things. The crab cakes were not served with any topping  at all as described on the menu and pictures.  Just 2 cakes in a styorfoam container.  The peel and eat  shrimp dish had 5 shrimp. Yes thats correct. 5 shrimp. My order was $40 . A total ripoff.

Entertaining meal!  We ponied up to the bar to place our afternoon lunch order.  Great service, and you'll be at once of those places where the bartender actually talks to you, jokes around, and you've made friends with everyone in the vicinity by the time you've left.  
Everything we ordered was consistently well-prepared, and while it won't knock your socks off, it is hearty and delicious, home cooked cajun food.  Be prepared for bigger portions than you typically expect.  The crabcake is pretty good, as are the gumbos, crawfish, etc.  Well worth a stop.

We ate here on our last day in New Orleans. WOW!!! Food was fantastic, plentiful. Service was amazing (thank you Lloyd) and I wish we would have came here on our 1st day.  Price was reasonable and comparable to all other restaurants in the vicinity but the food was so much better!  Can someone please tell me where they get there grits from?

I was trying to find a restaurant with good food in a great environment with a variety of NON-alcoholic beverages to choose from. I came upon this place and it was a decision I regret. The wait staff are VERY UNfriendly and rude! Needless to say the Waiter lack enthusiasm about her menu and food options when asked for details/explanation about food items listed. Subsequently made my choice based on the limited information/details provided by her. When the food arrived and was served I was flabbergasted by what I was looking at on the table. I mean presentation goes a long way (just take a look at the pic) then there was this green dish served that looks like horse throw up that immediately upset my stomach. I immediately got up and ask for my check to pay for my lemonade and walked out leaving the food on the table. I will NEVER return to this DUMP!
Ordered delivery--got the seafood platter and the BBQ shrimp. Food was hot, tasty, and the shrimp were super flavorful!

ODE TO THE TURTLE SOUP

Turtle meat in bite size pieces.  Oh, the ordering makes me feel that I'm eating something too adorable.  Turtle, is that you with your texture, sometimes stringy, your flavor, always dreamy?  

Onion, Garlic, Cloves!  Recipe 100 years old!  Turtle, you brought me here.  I can't blame you for the Fox news on the TV or the amount of unbusy servers that night, no, Turtle Soup, you were the highlight.

One block from Bourbon Street, your prices are for those who will pay them.  Turtle Soup, you are my new tradition, my savory serving.

Come (very) Hungry!

My husband and I stopped by Oceana for brunch and could not have been happier with our experience!  Our server, Rasheen, was knowledgeable and, honestly, pretty darned funny.  I ordered the St. Francis crepe (enormous) which was definitely enough for two to share.  My hubby had the seafood omelet - also super delish.

The next time we're in NOLA, we will definitely put this casual, easy-going restaurant at the top of our must-visit list.

Stumbled into this place a couple years ago for lunch and were impressed. Are back in the French Quarter again for Halloween festivities and this was the first place I wanted to eat. Sat at the bar and ordered red beans & rice (delish!) and a coleslaw side. Brandi waited on us & was very attentive & personable. I was very patient for her to make my mint julep which was just perfect & refreshing after travel. Oysters were ordered which we enjoyed. Then we stopped in after midnight to succumb for take out of Oceana's bourbon pecan pie. Omg sinful! I ate half for my midnight snack and the other half for breakfast. Highly recommend this place. Fabulous.

I ordered the crab cakes as a meal. I am from MD so I know a good crab cake. This crab cake was delicious....however, it was like fried. A thick crust around the meat that I was not used to at all. Soooooo I ate all the insides of the crab cake and left the fried outer part on the plate. The insides was very good....full of meat and not a lot of filler. There crab cakes were top with a mushroom cream sauce and little crawfish. It was overall a pretty decent meal.

the food was excellent and the server was very nice i had a chicken  sandwich with fries excellent  dad had a alligator sausage sandwich  he thought it was good and my grandmother ordered   a salad very good as well

OMG. I just had what I can honestly say was the best breakfast I've ever had.  I ordered the eggs Melezana.  It's fried eggplant with a poached egg ham and holendaze sauce. Truly nothing short of amazing. Fantastic service to boot!  It's a must.  My son ordered the Cajun breakfast and to wash great too!

The food and service was excellent here. All six of our party was very pleased with this restaurant. The blackened gator bites were the best thing I ate in the four days I was in nawlins. All our meals were good and our server, Ashleigh, was so nice and helped us choose the best meals for some of our New Orleans first timers. Highly recommend this place although the line can get long on busy weekends and after dark so get there early.

Fast delivery. The food was AMAZINGGGGGGGGGGG great fresh and hot with a delicious taste. Today was a rainy day so I decided to stay in and order breakfast. The wait time was at least 40 minutes it didn't take that long food was here very fast the driver was polite and efficient.

Their oysters are to die for!!!!! They are absolutely amazing. I've never had such amazing oysters, they're a must. My waiter was incredibly kind and went above and beyond to ensure our food was good. They have three different floors and their lighting is pretty dim. If you have a difficulty with your vision in low light areas, I would be careful with this spot.

This place is legit - not a tourist trap, hearty portions, authentic taste and reasonable prices.  The Redfish was off the hook....I would definitely recommend it for anyone in the quarter looking for a good meal without tourist prices.

The place has a nice atmosphere and I will give them props for waiting for our group to show up even though we were SUPER late, but I will admit that the food left a lot to be desired even though. My dad had the oysters and he felt like they tasted like they were caught a week ago, not very fresh, even the crackers were stale. The shrimp in my shrimp fetuccini also tasted store bought. The sauce tasted good at least. My brother's duck was a highlight at least. The duck was super tender and tasted delicious. My wife's gumbo was bland also. I will give then two stars for putting up with my group, but I am glad there was someplace else to show REAL New Orleans cuisine to my family.

Our first stop from the airport into NOLA!  

Thankfully, there was no wait at midnight but it was still a bustling restaurant.  We were seated in their beautiful courtyard.

Service was fantastic, food was delicious & came out fast, & I loved how lively the restaurant was!

I had Sazerac on my to drink list & I am so glad that my server was honest with me & asked me if I liked licorice, which I do not!, & after hearing my response, she gave other suggestions.

Louisiana Crabmeat Cakes:  A must order!  I enjoyed how the cakes were crispy!  I was obsessed with the crawfish & mushroom sauce, super creamy & tasty!
Taste of New Orleans-
Creole Jambalaya:
Crawfish Etouffee:
Red Beans & Rice with Smoked Sausage:  Such a hearty dish!  If you want to sample what NOLA is known for, this is the trio for you.  Come hungry
Fried Shrimo Po-Boy:  Omg!  Their Remoulade sauce is outstanding!  So savory, & a bit sweet, like a honey mustard.  They are generous with the serving of shrimp, & they are big too.  The French bread is very filling so I just took the top off.
Hurricane:  Came our looking like a mini hurricane.  Sweet & strong!

The food was fantastic! I got the crab cakes and they were SO GOOD. The crawfish sauce was super spicy for my wimpy taste buds, but that was a theme during the entire trip to NOLA, not just Oceana.
The eggplant sticks on the appetizer menu was also pretty amazing. Interesting atmosphere, lovely architecture and friendly staff.
Food was fantastic. I am not much of an experimenterbut tried some crawfish and redfish.   Seriously glad I did.  The restaurant has an eclectic New Orleans feel in the service staff was really good.

I don't even know how express how truly fantastic my experience at Oceana Grill was. The service was wonderful, and the food was phenomenal! The music and atmosphere are exactly what you would hope for when visiting New Oleans. If you're looking for high quality cajun/creole cooking, this is the place to go. I didn't have room for dessert, but if I did I'm sure that would have been great too. The dessert menue looked awesome.
Food was pretty tasty and the service was good. My dish could be a bit warmer in temperature but otherwise great.

the food was amazing. Staff was friendly and very helpful. I ordered the seafood platter and it was delicious. I will come definitely come back and be sure to let my friends and family know about this place. I ate here once before when it was the older restaurant so this place has def upgraded and came along way. I would recommend this to anyone who would like something new that tastes great and don't want to be let down.

After traveling 9 hours to New Orleans, all  we wanted to do was enjoy some delivery food and relax. We called at 8:13 pm and placed our order. (Crab cakes, po boy and shrimp jambalaya). We were told it would be about an hour wait, which was fine. An hour and twenty minutes later the food arrived. We specifically made sure to ask, 'there is silverware, correct?' We were reassured there was silverware. The delivery guy left and we found no silverware or napkins. It's a little difficult to eat pasta without silverware. We called back and very nicely let them know we didn't get the silverware or napkins. We were told it would be on its way. Long story short and multiple calls later, we finally received a new pasta dish and silverware. This process was almost 3 hours long. The delivery person had our hotel front desk call our room  and ask if we would come down and get the food. No. She came up and delivered the food clearly irritated that she was asked to bring it to our room. She then said  that her manager wanted the uneaten food back. Almost 3 hours later we are sitting down to eat dinner.  We are very sad to say that our first dining experience in New Orleans was so poor.

The food does not look like the pictures in the menu. I ordered the country breakfast which came with eggs, bacon or sausage, a biscuit, and grits. My scrambled eggs were extremely greasy. The biscuit had a stale/microwaved/chewy taste. Instead of grits i ordered potatoes. The potatoes in the picture were cubed and looked great. They gave me hash browns that weren't crispy at all but the taste was ok. Sausage was super greasy as well. I'm from Houston so I expected this place to be like Babin's or Landry's. At least for the price at Landry's you get decent food. The service was pretty good but the food left something to be desired.

Our first night in New Orleans and the first restaurant we ate at.  After waiting in line like we are trying to get in to a club, we are seated in a nice courtyard.  Not even 5 mins after ordering it starts to rain.  I mean pouring rain, we cram back into the restaurant for shelter, they try to get us and others a table inside.  Our fois is ready.  They put up the table umbrellas and wipe down all the tables and chairs.  We have a choice wait for a table inside or eat under the umbrellas, we choice the umbrellas.  Thus was tbe best dinning experience I ever had.  The food was great, service exceptional and we had so much fun.

I loved this place! Also, there's a 10% off your bill with Check in deal on yelp :) went here with a group of friends on a weekend night and got sat right away. We got sat at this super adorable courtyard in the back, where you could enjoy the fresh air and enjoy your meal. I loved the courtyard, would definitely recommend requesting to sit back there if the weather is decent! 
I got the Taste of New Orleans which was a TON of food! It was around $18 and came with jumbayala, crawfish etouffee (like a stew), beans, rice, sausage, and bread. It was my first time trying etouffee and I loved the crawfish, it tasted similar to lobster and crab! The beans, surprisingly, were one of the best I've ever had. I sadly couldn't finish the whole dish but it was so yummy and fun to try! Service as food, food and atmosphere went above my expectations. A+!
Ask for Jimika! Great service and excellent food. Had the red beans and rice with blackened chicken. It was cooked perfect.

OVERRATED!!!
I came here because of the reviews and they serve food late night. Our first choice was Deanie's, but they close early. It is right off the Bourbon street. We came in sat down, ordered gumbo which was pretty tasty, however the oysters sucked. I'm a big fan of the oysters, so I ordered half dozen raw, half dozen Rockefeller, and half dozen house grilled. The half dozen raw was fresh and taste, but the Rockefeller and the house frilled were very bad. It tasted like they had picked all the unfresh ones and decided to hide the unfreshness with loads of sauce. Rockefeller didn't even taste right with bunch of soggy spinach on top, house grilled ones were drown in this creamy cheese white sauce and it was gross. You can Barely taste the garlic they had described it on the menu. The Rockefeller I had at Deanie's were MUCH better. Anyways, don't come here if your main goal is to have fresh and tasty oysters, you will be disappointed.

I went back to give them a another shot. Not much better . We had cold crab cakes and bad fried shrimp . I am surprised at the other reviews and wonder how this place keeps the traffic. Must be location because it can't be the food.
Chef Ramsey would be so proud. There is a line down the street for dinner 7days a week. So proud of you guys.

Sooo good. I had the jambalaya pasta with the gator sausage and shrimp in it and it was pretty good. My friends had the gumbo (tastes just like my family's, FABULOUS) and the crab cakes which were also good. I can't wait to go again in about five weeks (for Essence Fest!) and try many more dishes. But I'm definitely sticking with the gumbo!

Here's a helpful hint. MAKE A RESERVATION! We did, and when we arrived about 15 minutes before time, there were about 50 people standing in line outside. We walked right past the line, and got seated immediately. Service was excellent. Erich took great care of us. Got the Crab cakes for an appetizer and they were fantastic. I had the seafood platter. Talk about a mountain of food! Fried food overload with the Oysters, shrimp, and catfish. I'm used to "southern" fried catfish so the breading on this was a bit different. Still good. Wife had the Taste of New Orleans and really enjoyed it. I would rate this a $$ on price. A bit high, but still decent, especially for the portion sizes...

I was impressed with the appetizers specially the crab cakes and alligator fries. The entree's were ok (blackened tuna, cat fish) the sides of corn and jambalaya were just sad, no flavor frozen corn and what tasted like only tomato paste. I do plan on Coming back but only to have the appetizers.

Excellent service. Pretty good food. I had the redfish oceana with shrimp. The garlic mash potatoes and mustard greens were great! One half of the redfish was cooked perfectly but the other half was dry. I also had the oysters for an appetizer and those was really good. And brûlée which was good as well and not too sweet. Overall I would go back!
The FOOOD IS AMAZING. This was my first meal in Nola and it just started my trip off RIGHT. My waitress Whitney is the best. Ask for her when you walk in she gives the best food suggestions . AmaZing

Everything we ordered (pasta, crab cake, catfish po'boy) was soaked in the same overly thick creamy buttery (as if with half&half) sauce. The most surprising was seeing it on the grilled oysters because I didn't expect to see it there (and on the bread on top also).  My pasta was drowning in the sauce and there were just a few frozen shrimp with unidentified clumps to balance it out.  I needed 3 refills of water and the diet fountain soda was too sweet.  Our server was really sweet and gave us suggestions for places to go out afterwards. RifRaf ordered the creme brulee which was pleasantly fresh, warm and delicate with mild sweetness.

My wife and I had lunch here.  She ordered red beans and rice.  I ordered a fried catfish po-boy platter, and we shared an order of fried crawfish.  We both enjoyed our food.   The cocktail sauce was really flavorful.  This was my first po boy, and the catfish was perfectly fried and seasoned.  The sandwich was very balanced with toasted bread, and just the right mix of red onions and "slaw".

Service was okay, but our waiter took awhile to get us our check.

My husband and I were just walking around looking for someplace to eat and we happened to see Oceana Grill.  He was hungry and said "Let's just go in here.". We ordered the seafood crepe and an omelet (not knowing the size).  They came out and were HUGE!!  The omlet was okay, but the crepe was TO DIE FOR!!!  The Bloody Marys may have been the best we ever tasted!  

We won't ever leave NO without going there!

First of all our waitress Kathleen was amazing!! She was sweet & funny and even helped us celebrate my sister's birthday by conducting the entire restaurant in singing Happy Birthday!

I had the blackened red snapper which was delicious. I'd highly recommend their crab cakes & finishing dinner with an order of bread pudding!!
Food was fantastic! Loved the Mardi gras pasta and the service was great. Nice relaxed atmosphere for dinner.
This place is a hidden gem my 1st time to NOLA and my 1st time to this restaurant my waitress was very nice also!

Very friendly staff, our server, Bree, was very helpful and welcoming. I had the blackened catfish poboy ($14.50) and my friend had the blackened redfish plate ($22.00). The fries with my poboy were seasoned really well and were really tasty, the fish was cooked perfectly and the bread was pretty good. My friend enjoyed her fish, collard greens, and jambalaya. This place has a fun atmosphere, I would recommend it for groups or tourists.

Just had the crab benedict and it was outstanding! It was suggested by our wait person Errol
Besides the food being fantastic so was Errol.

Had a great lunch here! Server was Errol, and he was excellent. Made great suggestions and has a beautiful voice. He should go into voice over! Delicious NOLA food, Bloody Mary and crab cakes were awesome!

Sadly I was unable to experience the food from oceana grill. It was recommended by the concierge of my hotel and I was excited to try as their menu looked very "New Orleans". Sadly I was unable to partake as they refused to take credit cards for delivery. I find this baffling.   I offered to show my id as well as meet them at the front desk where they could also verify my ID but they declined saying they didn't want to be responsible for my information. Yet they take credit cards in their restaurant??? What??? I cannot even begin to fathom this logic. The host on the phone said he would speak to the manager but after a 15 minute wait I was told sorry but no. Someone please explain the business logic in this decision. I have traveled all over the country and have never heard anything like this before.

Awesome Food. Awesome Drinks. Awesome Service. Awesome Bartender named Shaun: My friends and I came into Oceana Grill after a 15 hour work day for a 24 hour trip to New Orleans. We were determined to get some authetic New Orleans cuisine. I deferred to Yelp as usual to find a place close to our hotel that was still open serving good food, aftwr 12:15 AM on a Sunday night. What I love most, more than the food, the service and the drinks was not feeling rushed or unwelcomed because we walked in 20 minutes until it was time to close. We sat at the bar and Shaun immediately greeted us and let us know that he was there to make sure we enjoyed our visit. He was friendly, super cool and knows his way around a bar. My friend and I both decided to get a Platter and after telling Shaun what I wanted, he suggested the Ultimate Platter which would give us everything we wanted and save us a couple of dollars. I found that to be so cool. The food came and everything was good. Our platters consisted of Fried catfish, shrimp, softshell crab and crawfish. You are able to add fried crawfish or softshell crab to any platter a la cart. We aldo decided to try a few drinks. I had the Tropical Storm and my friend had the Tidal Wave. The restaurant has a fully stocked bar with two stations full of premium top shelf and well liquor. They also have several flavors of red bull and have a frozen daquiri machine. Of all of the things I ate. The softshell crab was my favorite and the fried catfish wad my least favorite but this was considering everything was good. I was also told by the concierge at my hotel that you can call in an order and they will deliver to neighboring hotels. If you have a taste for authentic New Orleans cuisine, cool people and great food. Oceana Grill is the place to be!

Had a great meal here with some family on a Saturday night.  The place was busy, but we didn't have to wait for a table.  The inside is a bit dark and nondescript, but the courtyard is fantastic!  We had a great little table in the courtyard where the fans provided a nice breeze.  I'm not sure if the courtyard will be bearable in a month, but it was great on a mild May evening.

My husband and I have dined at Oceana's sister restaurant The Alpine (see my review for details), and the menu is very similar, but the atmosphere is completely different.  Oceana felt more like a dive/sports bar than anything else, and The Alpine is a more romantic place with candles on the tables etc.  

Service was great.  Our sweet waitress accidentally brought my mom-in-law and me the wrong wine, but she took it right back and brought us the right one immediately.  She was quick to refill our waters, and our food came out in record time.  

The food here is good, not super-amazing, but good.  They brought out sliced french bread and soft butter, perfect for spreading, before our meal - very tasty.  My hubby and I shared the Taste of New Orleans.  Crawfish etouffee, jambalaya, red beans and rice, and  smoked sausage.  Apparently quite a popular item based on other reviews!  It was all tasty, but we agreed that the red beans and rice was the best part.  

I give this place four stars because the food is good, without being too expensive.  New Orleans has so many overpriced restaurants...  Plus, the staff was very friendly and efficient and the ambiance in the courtyard was fantastic.  It was a great way to kick off our evening in New Orleans.  I highly recommend it!

This place is amazing! Over the last 8 years of coming to New Orleans I have never had bad service or a bad meal. These people here treat you like family or guest in their home. Everything on the menu is amazing, you can't go wrong!
Great Oysters, but if you sit at the bar they will try to get rid of you as fast as you finish your meal. Didn't even ask if I wanted dessert of not. Still great food.

Sub-par food in a excellent location at a moderate price. The fried seafood platter, which was their "specialty" was entirely mediocre. The location and ambience make it an enjoyable experience, however.

So we are walking around the French Quarter looking for a specific restaurant, we didn't find it. But we see a line of people waiting for Oceana, so we get in line. Hey, we can be lemmings.
But if there is a line, it is probably good. So in line they ask if we want to sit at the bar? You bet. Best place to sit. Juan is behind the bar and starts us out with a couple of beers and great information about the menu. He was great. The food was very good. We had gumbo, BBQ Shrimp and Blackened gator tail. It is exactly the quality you expect from a Restaurant in NOLA, not just the Quarter. Good food, great service, good price. Love it...will be back!!!!

I Highly Recommend coming here when your in town!! We stopped here for breaksfast and had the french toast and the royal omelette. The entire staff were very polite and friendly. Everyone greeted us when we arrived. Our waitress was Jimika, I will definitely be requesting her on our next visit!

Just off of Bourbon street, this very large restaurant offers a wide variety of breakfast and lunch food, making it a must stop after a full night out. Staff is very friendly, and the food is quite tasty.

The Oysters here had too much sauce for me but were still very good!! The blackened shrimp PO boy was delicious and the swamp tea was pretty good as well!! I enjoyed the atmosphere and the service was very good despite being full!!!!

Review is for brunch: 

Cool vibe in this place. Good, fast, almost over-attentive service, and a good place to get seafood. 

This place offers a New Orleans inspired brunch menu, which is what I was looking for over the standard pancakes and scrambles. Presentation is super simple - no frills or decoration, just exactly what you ordered on a white plate. No decorative parsley here. 

Crawfish omelette - this is a big omelette. Packed chock full of crawfish and smothered in sauce. 

Crab cake Benedict had perfectly poached eggs. 

Overall a nice bet if you are looking for seafood brunch.

So good and so cute! Gator bites, eggplant sticks and crab cakes were sooooo delicious! We found an offer for a free beer so all we had to pay for was our food! Waiter was nice and the atmosphere was so fun! Definitely recommend
The staff are incredible and hospitable. The shrimp poor boy was amazing. Yummy! Will be back.
This restaurant was amazing! The chargrilled oysters we couldn't get enough!! The crab cake fettuccine was beyond words!!

Soooooo good. 
We had the crab meat cakes, which are to die for!
Then we had the the blacked red fish (special), it was amazing!
Also had the smoothest lemon drop I've ever experienced! Definitely a must stop!

Perfect spot for a late night food stop! The food was awesome and the staff was wonderful. The blackened red fish was . The Cajun shrimp pasta was filling and a great comfort food to end the night with.
The food was very good I enjoyed the oysters The best the seafood is very good the drinks are good I will go again

Food was great! There was a line for sure but it moved along really quickly definitely worth the wait! I had the Taste of New Orleans with the Jambalya, red beans and rice and crawfish ettoffee Rice beans was so good. We also tried the catfish platter! Really good.

David was our waiter and he was excellent! We tried the alligator, redfish etouffee, jambalaya and fried crawfish tails. Great service and food was yummy! A little more hyped and pricey than I would have liked but a great restaurant all around. Def make a reservation!

This place looks understated and casual but the food is delicious. I got the blackened duck and addictive to the bone. The crawfish mushroom cream sauce topping alone is mind blowing. 

The sides of collared greens and rice that came with it were also so scrumptious that I have to give a shout out to them. 

My friend got the rice and beans and it too was amazing.
Place was great, good was fantastic. Our server Errol was the best! Ask for Errol when you're there, informative and great, definitely coming back.

Soooo delicious! Red beans and rice with a side of catfish. The red beans and rice with the sausage was well seasoned and packed with flavor. I would definitely return for another amazing meal! The catfishes was seasoned well and fried well, not overly breaded or fried too hard, nice texture.

We had a reservation through the website that I'd made a couple of weeks in advance. When I called to confirm, the guy said they do not take reservations. I even had an email confirmation of the reservation! We went anyway, because we wanted to try it. The line was out the door and there were probably 25 people in front of us, but we did not have to wait long. We let the host know about the reservation situation, and she apologized and seated us as soon as possible, so I appreciate that.
The food was pretty good. I ordered the crab cakes and they were WONDERFUL. The sides (mashed potatoes and greens) weren't all that great, but not bad. Our table shared an order of Oceana's Famous Oysters and they were awesome also. The sauce that is on them is something I would eat by the bowl!! We ordered a bottle of champagne for the table and it was not good at all. Not very cold, and a little flat. 
 Our server was not great. We had to wait for drinks, he forgot a couple items from our orders (one we cancelled because he still had not brought out by the time we were almost finished eating). 
 I will likely visit again and hopefully the experience with the server will be a better one.

Had breakfast and dinner here. The crab cakes were amazing, the drinks were perfect. The atmosphere was fantastic, we sat out in the courtyard. You must try the alligator meat. They are also know for their hurricanes the gumbo was so yummy too. For breakfast a few days later I went in for another seating and again, was very pleased with my meal and the cost of the meal.

We stumbled across this place because it was near our hotel on a day that was pouring rain.  I didn't expect much from the food, as it's a bit divey-feeling in there.  However, I was surprised that the food was actually pretty tasty.

I might not do a full-fledged dinner here, but for lunch it was quite yum.  
A word of warning - the wait staff is very friendly but they will try to upsell you.  That said, they do have some good recommendations so maybe that's not so much a bad thing.

Get the Gator Bites appetizer for sure!

I have found my purpose in New Orleans. It wasn't the jazz spilling into the streets. It wasn't the history and views. It wasn't the to-go cups of alcohol (maybe the alcohol a little...).  And it darn sure wasn't the work trip I was on. My purpose for coming to New Orleans was to eat at Oceana Grill.

Nothing can really beat walking down a crowded street in a new city, taking in the sights, the sounds... good Lord the sounds... and stumbling into a restaurant with food so enticing, so delectable, so savory. Oceana Grill, or Old Nawlins' Cookery as the kitsch sign says, is steps off of Bourbon Street on Conti, where the crowds thin and the aroma of Creole happiness wafts down the block. The decor is comfy, happy, a little touristy and completely appropriate for serious grubbing. 

If I can entice any Yelpers out there to order one dish, it's the Taste of New Orleans. The crab cake pasta and the shrimp creole were big hits at our table, but let's get serious. If you can't make up your mind, and you feel like extanding your stomach to unknown reaches, get the Taste of New Orleans. It isn't a pretty dish, with most of the offerings blending together into a big soupy bowl of burnt terracotta brown, but don't be scared away. It is the best tasting bowl of terracotta-colored food this side of the Mississippi. 

Red beans and rice with smoky pork, spicy crawfish etouffee, shrimp jambalaya and a large piece of smoked sausage are all topped off with two slices of garlicy, buttery bread, begging to be dredged through the sea of spice and succulence. 

Seroiusly, does that not sound like the most heavenly meal ever? Stop it, it does and it's amazing. My party of four split the bananas foster ice cream cake (because we weren't feeling fat enough...) and it was fantastic. Gooey and sweet with multiple toppings and tons of flavor.

Oceana Grill was my favorite meal in New Orleans for a lot of reasons. The reasonable prices, polite staff, irresistable food and convenient location make it a huge winner in my Tourist Goes to NOLA handbook.
Don't even shuck their own oysters. Buy the shells then place bagged oysters on them. Gumbo wasn't good either. Over priced drinks.
Redfin Lafourche was delicious and the crab cakes were amazing. Good food and fast service. Only downside is the grody Bourbon Street outside.
Ordered 2 meals, appetizer, and some sodas for delivery to my hotel. The excessive price for everything didn't surprise me, being in the French Quarter, but the tiny portion sizes did. Dissapointed.
Customer service is great. Everyone is super nice! The food portions were small to me. I had the cajun pasta. Seasoning was great wish the dish came with a side. C+ for you Oceana.

The service here is absolutely amazing! All the employees are so incredibly friendly and you can tell they work really hard to keep the place clean and their customers happy. My server, Pamela, was so awesome. She was quick, sweet, and knew what to suggest. I had the blackened catfish poboy and it was delicious. Thank you for a great experience!
Such a great experience! They quickly seated our party of 13 and our waiter, Lloyd was accommodating and knowledgeable about the specials and menu. The Rockefeller oysters are a MUST.
This place is right on Bourbon.  I enjoyed both the food and the hurricane drinks (my first signature drink of New Orleans).

I stopped in for lunch while visiting New Orleans. On the recommendation of my waitress/bartender Brandi, I opted for the oyster po boy. Being that it was the first po boy I've ever had, I don't have anything to compare it to however I did find it tasty. A generous serving of fried oyster filled my sandwich and the slaw in it was tangy and creamy. The slaw slightly overpowered the oysters but it was overall good not great. The bread was soft and chewy, a perfect medium for holding my sandwich. The service was courteous, professional and most importantly prompt on a weekday lunch. Overall a decent stop but not spectacular.

We reach new orleans kind of late so w.e had to take any options available around the area. My daughter  ordered oysters they were really fresh and huge. I ordered tuna which  was also good but not wotth the US $24 95 charged for this plate. The place is really nice and the service  was good. Its located just where all the larty is  taking place. I was not impress with the surrounding  walking back to the hotel  the smell was awful on the streets .

Awesome!!! Was a little apprehensive since it was right off of Bourbon St. but it did not disappoint. Best BBQ shrimp I've had so far. Had the fried Shrimp platter and I must have had at least 20 large shrimp on that plate for 20$. Great value and great food!
Clean nice portion everything was very good we will be coming back the Oysters were superb

This place was all-around great! 

First off my brother spilled his Dr.Pepper. Yeah, you know how that goes. Right away, the busser Byron came to the table and cleaned and wiped it down perfectly. Don't remember spilled drinks.

We ordered the BBQ shrimp and Crabmeat cakes to start off. Those apps were really good. 10/10.
For entrees we had a Taste of New Orleans and Jambalaya Pasta. Those two orders really hit the taste buds hard. Delicious! 10/10.
