For dessert we had some Creme brûlée, Irish Coffee and Bread pudding. Those hit the spot after a long meal. Very good stuff. 10/10.
Other notes- sweet tea was good.
Service was one of the best parts of this visit. Our waitress Tiffany provided us a memorable experience. Must commend on her's and Byron's enthusiasm and friendliness. Great food and better people.

Looooved the char grilled oysters, the Mardi Gras pasta & jambalaya pasta. To die for! 

I would've gave 5 stars but I came back for breakfast the next morning & it was pretty terrible. The hash browns were so salty they couldn't even be consumed. But besides the bad breakfast - absolutely recommend their pasta! Omggggg.

Best gumbo I've ever had.  Although the oyster were so-so (MUCH better at Felix's seafood & oyster bar, also in the french quarter).  I've been craving the gumbo ever since I returned home.  Truly addiciting and worh a visit to Oceana for that reason alone.

We were told to try this place by our tour guide and we were  a bit skeptical, even when a lady leaving the restaurant told us not to wait in line because the food wasn't good. BUT I will have to say that she was VERY wrong!! The line went quickly. We started with a mix of the fried and blackened alligator tails, we preferred the fried but both were tasty, we also shared the crab cakes excellent!! As well for the entree we had the blackened red fish topped with shrimp and crab with a romulade sauce over a bed of jambalaya rice with a side of smoked mustard greens, VERY GOOD!!! As well, you have to try the Tropical Storms, great drink but drink slowly, goes down like Kool Aide but has a kick latter.

Oceania Grill is a well loved restaurant for locals and tourists alike.  The restaurant has a casual, family friendly atmosphere which is great for groups or hosting an event.

We had the Fried Eggplant Appetizer, sticks of deep fried eggplant served with remoulade; the Nightly Special of Red Fish Lafouche, pan fried red fish, with étouffée, crawfish cream sauce and sautéed veggies, and just to make ourselves feel better; the Blackened Shrimp Caesar Salad.

The food was well seasoned and large enough to share, if you're looking for a casual dinner out, Oceania Grill is a good option.

A bit of a chore getting to this place when I was just passing through NOLA; do to the proximity to the Bourbon St hoopla, but the oyster poor boy was worth it. I initially though it a bit pricey but by the time I was done I was full and very much satisfied.
The seafood gumbo was fantastic as well.

Great food and amazing service.  I had the Cajun Pasta which has alligator sausage in it.  I was a bit apprehensive at first since I've never eaten alligator but it was delish. Meat was tender and the pasta was cooked to perfection.

Okay, I had already been in New Orleans for a day and a half, staying right on Rue Bourbon.... we had had a bad experience, tummy-wise, earlier in the day, and I was leery about eating again. However, when the tummy is empty, it calls out, regardless of what it just went through!

So we decided to give Oceana a shot, since it was walking distance from our hotel, should things go terribly awry.

First of all, the greeting we got was friendly and immediate. No dawdling around the front door, wondering where to go. I like that. Next, our server, Tyler, was the biggest charmer in Nawlins, and pretty much had us wrapped around his finger by the end of our meal! 

We started with fresh oysters, which were the cheapest, biggest, and freshest ones we'd had in a loooong time! They were yummy and HUGE! Then I got the grilled ahi tuna "La Boheme" which was the biggest piece of sushi grade tuna, seared to my request, and topped with yummy shrimp in a delicious sauce! Mmmm... the potatoes were yummy, too! My sweetie got the Cajum jambalaya pasta, which had alligator sausage in it, and he devoured it entirely! I tried some of his shrimp and the flavor was yummy, spicy goodness....

My favorite part of it all, though, was the Kentucky bourbon pecan pie that we got a slice of at the end.... I've never been in love with a dessert like I was with that slice of pie! Mmmm.... SO PERFECT! The pecans tasted buttery, yet crunchy, the filling was a perfect balance of sweet and rich nuttiness.... I want MORE!! I'd go back just for that pie!

We wanted to take our waiter home with us so we could hang out and be charmed some more, and if he had a pecan pie with him, well, I don't know WHAT would happen, but it would be all kinds of Nawlins naughtiness, I can guarantee you THAT!! Do yourself a favor, next time you're strolling along in the French Quarter, and step into the underwater world of Oceana Grill. And don't forget to get the pecan pie!!

Very nice regular bar off of Bourbon Street. I sat at the bar and had a ice cold Sam Adams with the 1/2 dozen raw oysters. They were fresh and good. I had the signature red fish which was lightly breaded with a mushroom cream sauce. My only disappointment with this restaurant was the sides of the red fish. It was supposed to come with grilled veggies but it actually came with a scope of potatoes and two pieces of broccoli. Very disappointing. Otherwise would have a been a 4 star for me.
poor service, oysters wasn't cooked as asked, sauce on oysters were cold like seriously? server lost our ticket and didn't come with our drinks.....DO BETTER on customer service !

Great find! The building is 3 stories. We ate at the bar on the 2nd floor. Had the crab cakes and the mardis gras pasta. Both were fantastic! And the portion sizes are pretty big.
It's more casual. Nothing too fancy. 
Barbara, the bartender took great care of us!

3rd visit to New Orleans and 3rd visit here. Their ribs are delicious as well as their oysters. The ribs were fall off the bone and my 2 year old loved it! If you can swing by the tour guides they give away 10% off your meal coupons and if you buy a $50 gift card you get $10 free...stack your savings and eat well!
Waiting system is awkward but definitely worth the wait. Drinks were great! Food was awesome. Lost bread was amazing! Large table got an assortment of food and everyone loved everything.
I enjoyed the Banana Foster Ice Cream Cake. It was sweat and filling. You won't be disappointed with this pleasing dessert.

I came to New Orleans to see my sister and to eat some fantastic shrimp. She brought me to Oceana's and I can say it's one of the best BBQ shrimp I've ever had at a restaurant! I will definitely be coming back here to eat more shrimp and try their other food delights!

Went here for a taste test, looking for a workplace party site. The location is good, and there is a nice variety of rooms and areas to choose from if you are looking to host an event. But we won't be having a party here.

Here's what we got:
Eggplant Sticks--good and fairly crisp. The remoulade sauce was pretty tasty. 
Crabcake Appetizer--Drunk at 4am, these would be delicious. Not drunk, they didn't taste any more special than something from the frozen food section at your local grocery. 
Gumbo--I'm not a gumbo fan, but it was edible.
Blackened Shrimp Salad--the blackening seasoning used on the shrimp was super salty, but pretty good. The shrimp had a nice texture, and my taste test companion said the Cesar dressing was delicious. 
Fried Catfish w/french fries and Hushpuppies--Catfish with breading were chewy. Tartar sauce was disgusting--warm with a funky after taste. French fries were something you could definitely buy in the frozen foods section at the local grocery. Hushpuppies were so hard throughout they might have been fried yesterday. 

There is a fine line between attentive service and stalking. The waitstaff and managers hovered. I worry when restaurants do this, because it makes me think they are trying to see if they've gotten away with serving subpar food. 

My gastrointestinal tract felt dirty inside after eating here. All the fried food didn't help, but, done well, I wouldn't have cared about what we ate. Unfortunately, nothing was worth the calories.

Fantastic service by the lovely waitress that told us all about the Gordon Ramsey story and the waitress that got fired 4 times and now is a successful businesswoman! The blackened redfish with the crawfish sauce was delicious! We had the house special oysters and I wanted to lick the plate! My sons suggestion because he's such a Gordon Ramsey fan and he said this is only one of a few that have continued success. I can see why. Great service and crazy delicious food! I ate every bite! Highly recommend as our first food stop here in NOLA!

This was a great find!  We had the redfish with crawfish gravy.  It was fantastic!   I only wish there was a little more sauce to drag the mashed potatoes through!  The wait staff was friendly, prompt, efficient, and knowledgeable.
Best crab cakes ever!!! This is a great place to eat. Known for their crab cakes and they don't disappoint.

There lucky I even put 1 star.. Why you may ask

1. The oyster po' boy was nothing but bread and small oysters compared to all the other po'boys we had in the the quarter.
2. The owner was rude and dirty.
3. We received a 10% off coupon from Hotel Dauphine to try the restaurant and the owner wouldn't except the coupon on the night the Saints were playing and refused a party of 5 because they had a coupon as well. That was totally stupid since both our table and the party of 5 would have made of for the coupon with out tab combined.

I recommend not to go here and if your hotel offers the coupon tell them not to promote this restaurant they are cheaters and are a disgrace to cajun/creole cuisine.

We came here for the gumbo. It was a thicker broth than what we are used to but the taste was absolutely on point! I would never lie because I've grown up eating gumbo and this was by far the best I tasted in town. I've got one more place to go and I will give an update at that time. I'm on a gumbo tasting tour and I've got some Creole taste buds!

Great place, definitely kid friendly and very courteous. Food was amazing, tried gator bites as an appetizer to try something new and was not disappointed. Kids loved the fish and shrimp from the kids menu and we all sampled from the other items that we ordered, Cajun pasta was good, blackened chicken fettuccine, and the pasta with crawfish, shrimp, and crab cake. One child spilled water and the wait staff was so nice about cleaning it up. Also had a place for us to put our stroller while we ate. Would recommend!

I stopped in for the first time yesterday for dinner. I had a cup of gumbo and the blackened catfish. The gumbo and the catfish seasoning was good. More importantly the service was spot on. My server Brad did an excellent job...very attentive. I'd definitely go here again.

The food is always tasty (even breakfast!) But something else that I think is noteworthy is that the service has always been exceptional. I've eaten here five times over the past year for different meals of the day. There's plenty of seating in a comfortable atmosphere and the people are awesome.

On a cross country roadtrip, I happened to spend 1 night in New Orleans and I am so happy that this was the restaurant my mother and I chose to eat at. Overall amazing experience from the friendly staff, fast service to incredible food. Started with the Hurricane drink and the crabmeat cakes -- now I know why they said it was the most popular appetizer. For dinner I had the Mardi Gras Pasta -- to die for! I cleaned the plate :) Our server was CJ and he provided outstanding customer service and was a pleasure to have as our waiter. I know when I return to NOLA in the future for a longer stay, I will definitely be back here again. I wish I made room for dessert, because they all looked to die for too. (Next time :) hehe)

We stopped in for some traditional Cajun food today .I have to say the food was good however I don't care to eat in an establishment where the waiter serves it with sarcasm.Jamal was rude ,we will not go back and will not recommend to others.Too many places where you can get good eats with great service!

I went here for dinner on a Wednesday night. We had a 8 o'clock reservation. We arrived around 7:50. The line was down the street with people waiting to get in. We were able to walk right in and got seated immediately.

The hostess was very pleasant. She explained the menus and advised where the facilities were located. Our waitress arrived a few minutes later. She was very friendly and had a great personality.

She came over and took our drink order. A few minutes later she was back. We placed our entire order. We had the alligator bites for an appetizer, small Caesar salad, cup of gumbo, taste of New Orleans and the cajun jambalaya.

The alligator bites came out first. We chose to get half fried and half grilled. I personally preferred the grilled bites but they both were very good just a bit chewy. 

Wifey had the cup of gumbo. She said it was absolutely delicious and I had the Caesar salad. By the time the entrees were preparing to come out we were full. We chose to have them packed up to go.

We didn't eat that evening but warmed it up the next day in the hotel. I was a bit skeptical about how it would taste but it came out amazing.
The Cajun jambalaya was "slap your momma" good and wifey thoroughly enjoyed the taste of New Orleans. She stated the "flavors are to die for".

I would highly recommend this restaurant if visiting New Orleans. This is my 3rd visit here and one of my top restaurants to visit and the prices are very reasonable. This place will not disappoint. Good service, atmosphere and food. 

Tip- Make a reservation!!

The staff was amazing, super friendly. We had a waiter and trainee. They were helpful and attentive. The food wasn't anything to write home about but it couldve been simply what I got. Id love to go back and give it another try.

Honestly OVERRATED... I've had better in Chicago. Salivate over the pictures but DONT waste your money. However, the drinks are great. Maybe I should've had drinks first and wouldn't have noticed the taste.
Yelp's overall rating here is justified.  Food was average, service was okay, prices were a bit better than neighbors.  All in all, an average experience but nothing I'd go back for.
Redfish Oceana was amazing. Fyi..the mash potato almost stole the show! I would get the blackened redfish with shrimp on top.
First time eating there today, two thumbs good. Awesome. Grilled Oysters had a different taste that I loved. If you like seafood, try this place.

Wanted to go to a place that didn't have a long line or that wasn't a huge tourist spot. Went pretty late, probably near closing. There were not much customers and the service was pretty slow. Got seated towards the back near the kitchen and it was pretty dim. There was also a leak in the ceiling which disrupted the experience. The roof looked like it was about to fall down and it was right next to the table. So instead of enjoying the food, the concern was more towards the leak. All they did was put a bucket underneath until they figured out what the problem was. Foodwise, it was okay. Ordered oysters and jambalaya. Nothing spectacular about it. Don't think a second trip is in the near future.

We were greeted by a friendly staff who seated us promptly and wished us Happy Valentines Day.  Then our waiter, Jamal, was knowledgeable about the menu and suggested an excellent drink and main dish.  The signature "Redfish Oceana" with greens was delicious.   Not to mention the crab cake appetizer that had a crawfish filled sauce on top. 

I was very impressed with the speed and quality of service, the friendliness of the entire staff, several members checked on us throughout our dining experience, and the quality of the food.  

This place is right on Bourbon St at Conti so you are right in the middle of the action.  They have a nice outside terrace area to dine and very comfortable inside dining area.  Nothing but good memories of this place.  And thanks again Jamal for giving us service with a smile.

The seafood was amazing, my mom had the seafood platter and I had alligator bites and crab cakes. She finished everything on her plate and still had room for dessert. Will definitely recommend, it's just right off Bourbon street.

This was place was recommended to us by a local. 

After a short wait, we sat right down and ordered various dishes with NOLA staples like crawfish, shrimp and various savory spices. Being vegetarian (no fish for me), I was glad to see a veggie pasta dish on the menu. 

It came out in a big bowl with two delicious pieces of bread sticking out of the sides like carb-y icebergs. Small strips of zucchini and yellow squash were drowning in a pile of noodles and an alfredo-ish sauce. 

BOTTOM LINE: I'm not into Seafood or spicy-spices so I can't fully appreciate traditional New Orleans cuisine.

I must confess that I ate here on my last trip to town because it was across the street from my hotel and a rainy night.  Sadly this random choice was a disappointment.  I had the new orleans "taste" plate that included gumbo, jambalaya and etouffe.  The gumbo I have perfected at home had more flavor.  It was fast and the service was good but the food was average.

I ordered the blackened catfish which came with jambalaya and collard greens. Pretty decent. My friend got the Louisiana Famous Crab cake appetizer and the Oceana famous oysters. The crab cakes were my favorite out of all the dishes. The two large crab cakes were covered in sauce with yummy crawfish bits but still maintained the crunch of the outer shell.
GARBAGE FOOD. It's a prime location on a disgusting, shitty street. Who specialize iin serving mediocre Creole food, to people who don't know the difference.

Great atmosphere for this joint. We had sat outside and enjoyed our meal. I had the special which was a type of Cajun pasta. It had shrimp, crawfish l, and all types of peppers with a marinara sauce. Very good. The service  was friendly and fast. We got there around 6pm and beat the crowd and when we left the line was out the door. So come late be prepared to wait. Solid food and drinks with a good French quarter vibe.

Need a place that opens early for breakfast in the French Quarters? Look no further. Oceana opens at 8 am and is located right off of Bourbon St. We were seated immediately and given the breakfast menu and the breakfast special menu. I chose to order the Crab Cake Benedict and my friend ordered the Crawfish Omelette Wendall which came with hash browns and a biscuit; both on the specials menu. 

The poached egg on the crab cake benedict was perfect. Once you cut through it, the egg yolk oozes out. The English muffin was also nicely toasted. The crab cake portion was tasty but got a bit too salty as I progressed through it. 

My friend's crawfish omelette wendall was a pretty large omelette. She said there was a lot of crawfish though there were two that looked a little old. The egg was pretty fluffy. 

Service was excellent but I was a little thrown off that our waiter stood a few feet from us the whole time watching us. It was a little unsettling. The bathroom was clean but there aren't toilet seat covers, ladies! Also, Yelpers who check-in currently get 10% off their total bill!

My husband and I came to Oceana while one vacation in NOLA and seeing all its positive yelp reviews. This place did not disappoint. My husband had the redfish special and I had the seafood étouffée. Both were amazing. Our server was very nice and all of the people in the restaurant were really friendly. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for some good étouffée! Also don't be discouraged by the line outside, it goes very quickly.

Firstly we got there for a late dinner and the line had already starting forming. Surprisingly there was a short wait as they have seven dining rooms to accommodate a lot of people. We ordered the gator bites to start both the blackened and fried. The table was split as the kids thought the fried bites were the best and the adults thought the blackened were the best. Either way definitely something to try. I ordered the red fish/shrimp ettoufee with jambalaya and greens. This was a very tasty dish no complaints. My wife ordered the catfish  with the house Oceana sauce that had shrimp/crawfish and a whole bunch of flavor with cornbread underneath. This dish is what I should have selected as it was super delicious. The kiddos ordered Po Boys shrimp and catfish . They loved them. All in all a great restaurant. The only complaint I have is that all the entrees didn't come to the table at the same time.

Came here using a groupon. The food is slightly pricey and isn't out of this world unique but it's not bad either. I'm sure locals know of better places, but tiny dives are harder to find, even with Yelps help. The atmopshere is pretty awesome. It's located in a historic building and spread across 3 floors, each with its own character infused by its spanish/french heritage.

Oyster Rockefeller was amazing!  Great seasoning. Our waiter,Kevin, was amazing!  Great service. I would advise limiting your party to two or four if you go on the weekends. Your will get seated quicker. Our main dishes, red fish and Marci gras Alfredo, were very well seasoned.

Ambiance 3/5: very narrow and dark inside, and the restaurant has a few different sessions, more spacious, much quieter and cooler upstairs, better to make reservation before come, otherwise waiting time could be long

Service 3/5: a bit slow, the waiter who served our table wasn't very friendly at the beginning, he ignored our table and served another large group seated way much later than us, though he explained in the end he didn't know we got in first because of shift change, anyway the manager on duty was super nice and very patient

Food 5/5: overall great taste, awesome food selections, and you have to save some room for desserts 
  Louisiana Crabmeat Cakes - *** served with crawfish and mushroom cream sauce, though it's marked as "most popular appetizer", I think it's lack of crab meat and too salty 
  Oyster Rockefeller - ***** the classic sauce with spinach, smoked bacon and pernod liqueur, topped with a blend of fresh grated parmesan cheese, heavenly delicious, highly recommend
  Oceana's Famous Oysters - ***** freshly shucked Louisiana Oysters on the half-shell, chargrilled over and open flame, smothered with unique zesty garlic and cream herb cajun sauce, finished with a fresh blend of parmesan and romano cheeses, another heaven taste, so I suggest you do half rockefeller and half oceana's, highly recommend
  Redfish Oceana - *** signature dish. sauteed redfish topped with own crawfish mushroom cream sauce, served with roasted garlic potatoes and vegetables, the fish was very fresh, however too thick and flavorless inside
  Taste of New Orleans - **** Creole jambalaya, crawfish etouffee, red beans and rice with smoked sausage, rich in flavors, recommend
  New Orleans Bread Pudding - ***** served with famous praline and rum sauce, though I wasn't happy with the service initially, I have to say the bread pudding here made my day and became happier with every single bite, highly recommend

Price 4/5: generous portions and reasonable prices about $30 per person

A busy spot on the streets of New Orleans.
Ordering the ROCKEFELLER OYSTERS is a must! The sauce they use on it is delish.

OMG! Our first time in New Orleans and locals suggested this place. Tried the seafood Gumbo which was awesome and perfectly seasoned. Also had the Oysters Rockefeller since neither one of us really like raw Oysters and it was amazing also.
Finally we tried Redfish Pontchartrain which was recommended highly by Whitney our host. This was one of the most authentic, and best fish dishes I have had!
This place is a must! Ask for Whitney! She is great!

Super scrumptious! Taste of New Orleans was super yummy and enough to feed 2! Atmosphere was great and our server Chris was so hospitable! Thank you for your recommendation on the gator bites both fried and blackened. MUST TRY!!!

Recommended by Astor Hotel's front desk staff and we were not disappointed! My family lived in New Orleans for 7 years when we were kids, so my brother and I were excited to bring our families back to NOLA to explore and taste the amazing food. Our party of 8 (4 adults and 4 kids ages 12 to 17) were seated immediately for dinner in a large 2nd floor room with a great view. The table was round, which makes it nice for a large party to dine as a family instead of at a long rectangular table. The waiter was very knowledgeable and friendly. We had the gator appetizer which was buttery with a spicy kick at the end. The Flavor of New Orleans platter was amazing! A generous helping of spicy Cajun sausage, jambalaya, red beans and rice and crawfish etoufee cooked just like we remembered. This is the perfect dish for anyone really wanting to sample the best New Orleans dishes. The kids loved their blackened catfish and shrimp poboys. I had the Redfish Oceana, which was a large redfish filet lightly fried and smothered in a mushroom cream sauce topped with a generous portion of crawfish. So delicious! My sister-in-law had grilled tuna stuffed with crabmeat, which was huge and seared to perfection. Everyone sampled from each other's plates and were so impressed with the flavors. Our only regret was that we were too stuffed to try the desserts!
Much better seafood in NOLA, BBQ shrimp were damn good though.  Crab cakes were also delicious and had a crawfish reduction sauce on top.  Service was great as well.

Where should I start.  Food is excellent .  I've been going here for the past 10 yrs.  It's usually my first stop to eat.  Errol our waiter /manager was outstanding.    I only ate here 3 times on my last trip.   Will be back again next year.  Highly recommend Oceana

Amazing food. Great service. Three stories of a pure culinary experience. Drinks we're amazing! Local beer was awesome. The Jocomo IPA was nice to my palette. I had the pasta special with the blackened shrimp and crab. It was punch your mama good. I finished in record time! Thank you for an amazing experience.

Came here with a big group (8 people) and we were seated pretty quickly, which was surprising given the Thursday night dinner rush. Awesome decor and murals on the walls, although the staff seemed a bit rushed in the crowded restaurant and we had to wait quite a while before signaling for orders to be taken and waters to be served.

I had the gumbo with rice - my standards for gumbo were honestly higher as this seemed to be only about 20% sausage / all the other goodies that you hope to be stuffing your face with and 80% thin gumbo soup. 

Tried my friend's alligator bites and unfortunately they were tough and overseasoned :( 

Pretty cool location a stone's throw from the French Quarter, but unfortunately I don't think I'd come again.
Excellent ambiance - local -  not too fancy but excellent food - had oysters on half shell.  Fresh and meaty.   Bloody Marys super charged.  All good.  Highly recommend.  We did for brunch.

My son and I came here on 8/9/15 for brunch. I had the Royal Omelet. Alligator sausage omelet with diced veggies and cheese. I found the sausage to be quite bland but considering everything else was a little on the salty side, it wasn't so bad. The omelette was covered with an awesome crawfish and mushroom sauce. Sides were hashbrowns and biscuit. Hashbrown portion was super small but every bite of it was browned and crunchy to perfection. Heavily salted but worth it. Biscuit was prettt standard. I give it 3 stars. My son had the fried shrimp poboy and it was incredible! Not standard mayo or tartar sauce. Some kind of remoulade that set the sandwhich off right. The French bread was the star. Lightly crusted and crispy exterior with fluffy, yet chewy inside. The fries were lightly dusted with seasoning and accompanied the sandwhich well. Not sure if I will visit here again when there are so many other places to go but meal was fair.
Everything was SO good! Alex our waiter was sweet and very helpful! The oysters, gumbo, pasta, and red fish was absolutely amazing! We will be back every trip to New Orleans for sure

WTF is up with some of these low starred reviews??? Their palates must need a major tune up!!! 

So again, it's New Years Eve 2008 and I gotta piss...BAD. We stumble off of Bourbon St. onto Conti and whaddayaknow? A restaurant...that's open at 3 am!!! My buddy heads straight to the bar and I head straight to the urinal...OKAY, BACK TO THE FOOD:

 So I stagger up to the bar and my friend tells me he's ordered some food. I'm expecting some potato skins or buffalo wings. NO. How about a 1/2 rack of BBQ ribs, New Orleans BBQ shrimp ( Big -ass Gulf Shrimp), Crab cakes & a dozen oysters on the half shell? What's better? THE TASTE:
 
The Ribs were tender and smothered in a good amount of BBQ sauce. The New Orleans BBQ shrimp aren't actually "barbecued", just terminology. It's actually simmered in a light tomato based sauce drenched in garlic, oregano & rosemary. Can you say DELICIOUS? Plus they give you some french bread to slop up the extra sauce... The crab cakes were something else too...2 HUGE crab cakes, the size of a midgets fist, smothered in a creamy creole garlic shrimp sauce...GOT DAMN!!! The oysters were indeed fresh and... well... oysters are oysters! They've also got the local brew (Abita) on tap. 

We also met some great people who came down from Shreveport, LA for New Years and they raved about the food...the girl sitting next to me had the Fried Shrimp Po' Boy and said that was one of the reasons she came down to NOLA for New Years! Her boyfriend was a crack up, he also bought me an Abita beer! I also ran into a writer for a Hawaii newspaper that had lunch here the day before and said he had to eat here again before going back to Honolulu. 

I would have never guessed I was eating this quality of food at 3 am at a bar. A fancy seafood restaurant in the French Market, maybe but not in some bar & grill in an alley off of Bourbon St.!!! I'd love to come back to this place before I die.

Y'all After begging my boyfriend to take m here we finally want so BOOM! Let me tell y'all so I made  reservation because I knew my man ain't go want to stand in no line ! So boom we got there ! And I'm like LORRRDDDDDD THIS LINE LONG SO WE SET INSIDE UNTIL THEY GOT A TABLE CLEAN SO BOOM NEXT THING U KNOW I HEAR i love you with bookoo screming ! so boom i look up its drake im like okay what ever u got our table  ! so yeahxwe get to the table our waiter give us some ideas so i only came for the oysters ya know    so he bring our drinks and I had a dozen of oysters if u like me u know I need to be able to lick the shell  also so While im waiting I'm looking in the kitchen  so we all talking laughing hehehehinggg all that and next thing u know boom the food came smoking hot I'm digging in the bread  like yet yuuuummmn and next I'm on the oysters  as I want to lick   the oysters All I tasted was oil  it was so greezzzyy I think I was go catch high blood pressure from oil    LIKE THEY DONT CARE THEY ALSO TOOK PICTURES OF US NEVER POSTED IT ON THEY PAGE I THINK THEY JUST DONT LIKE BLACK PPL 



So after I seen ! Chef Remmed on TV  WITH OCEAN TRYNA SAVE THEY RESTAURANT I WILL NEVER BE BACK THEY TARIFFING and KITCHEN DIRTY AND THE CHEF HIS FAT ASS DIRTY TOO WITH ALL THE EYE TWITCHING  n had rats n roaches No thanks it was fun tho

Ordered the seafood gumbo and crawfish etoufee, both were delicious. Excellent location. Service was great, food arrived very quickly. Wouldn't get the margarita again, tasted like straight sour mix. Friendly staff. Would recommend for a seafood destination.

Oh my goodness I don't even know where to start! What an incredible restaurant with a wonderful staff and delicious food! We tried a restaurant the day before that was highly rated and it was terrible! Let me tell you if your looking for an amazing dining experience look no further. If there is a line outside, WAIT! I would wait an hour no questions asked! Thank you Jessica for the great service, you were a huge part of why we will be back tomorrow! The cooks know what they are doing in that kitchen! One of the best meals we have ever had! Thank you for making this california girls day with amazing New Orleans food!

The food was okay. Everything is pretty greasy. I wouldn't recommend this place because half way through my meal I became ill. My boyfriend who shared part of my plate also became ill later in the day.

Another great meal and wonderful drinks with courteous, professional service. Oceana has become one of my go-to stops NOLA.  Try the wonderful courtyard dining. Will certainly be back. Hopefully soon.
Food was so-so and very overpriced. I had their seafood platter which was $23.99, it was ok, the rest of our group had other plates which they all felt was so-so and very overpriced as well...

This is a utility New Orleans food restaurant. No frills, no elaborate Bubba Gumpery, just heaps of delicious first rate food. Get the gator both ways. It's very much like chewy pork and tastes great. The Hurricane is sweet.

I had:
Crab cakes (their specialty)
Catfish po-boy

The crab cakes are excellent; very tender and chunky. The crawfish cream sauce is rich and makes a nice complement.

The catfish po-boy was good. The catfish wasn't too thick and the fish-to-batter ratio was right on the money.

My family had:
Blackened ahi tuna
Blackened chicken
Gator bites
Barbecue shrimp
Soft-shell crab

Both the tuna and chicken were cooked perfectly and the blackened seasoning was very robust and wasn't too salty. The gator bites were very chewy and not very enjoyable. The shrimp was okay, they're grilled and drenched in their own style of BBQ sauce, nothing special. The crab was good and tasy, but nothing worth noting.

We also shared gumbo, which was very tasty; did not have an overwhelming seafood taste. Just wish they could've been a little more generous with the rice.

Also worth mentioning their Cajun fries are awesome.

All of us thoroughly enjoyed our meals. 4/5 would eat again

Boy was this a great place! We had a dozen oysters an order of gator bites shrimp platters and fish. We loved it all! The shrimp platters came with a lot of shrimp which was wonderful! We didn't wait in line to long and the waiter was so nice and did a great job! The only thing I didn't like was we sat at a table that was across from a table that had two children that screamed  the whole dinner. The adults thought it was funny and seemed to encourage them. I think that the staff should have told them to stop it. It made the dinner not pleasant. The food is great try it if you get a chance!

The best place I been so far here in town for dinner 
You do have to wait for a table a few minutes but is worth the wait if you finish your dinner you have to try the cheesecake is made there every day and is awesome

So, we found this place on accident, with Yelps help, and we were very happy we did.  We tried to go to a few different places before, and they all had fairly long lines, so we kept walking and yelp helped steer us here.

We hesitated at first, as it seemed, "Dennyish", but we were hungry and there was no line.

All hesitation washed away quickly, as every part of our breakfast was very solid at worst to great at best.  The service, the food, the pace, even the feel of the place.

Our food was great.  I had a crawfish omlet and my wife had french toast, which was also great.

Our servers were super friendly, as was the busser and the manager who stopped to check in.

I started this review completely planning to write a 4 star review, as I usually save 5's for places that wow me.  Nothing really wowed me about this place, but looking back on it, I don't see any reason to knock a star off. 

They were even super gracious in taking 10% off for the yelp checkin coupon.

The service was sub par. But not because the servers are sub par. It's the fact the servers are busy and the managers are standing in a corner just chit chatting away. HELP YOUR TEAM!!! I would have love it if you refilled my water but you were having a great conversation. Our server, Marlon, did a fantastic job however he was busy with a full section. Foods great!  Chef delivery is a great touch especially when the food is good.

Food flavor excellent. The service was poor.  It took over an hour to get our food. The hostes was not very friendly either directing us to her choice of table instead of what we had asked for. We had breakfast and the crepes that were recommended by our waitress were large enough for two. She could have mentioned this when we ordered. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant.

EXCELLENT Restaurant to have Breakfast, Lunch or Dinner... 
Whatever you'll pick, it will be good, but the Oyster Rockefeller were Delicious and the Blackened Bayou duck was Good, too and to end  a GREAT Mea,l a slice of Kentucky Bourbon Pecan Pie with vanilla ice cream, WOW!!!!!! Just great!!!!!!
Try them out..... YOU"LL NOT BE Disappointed....
We've been there to eat and drink, three times on our five day vacation and that says it all....

Good food 

Errol is awesome
Thank you for the yummy yummy yummy 
Foods 


Oceans is awesome will come again

We stopped here to have dinner after pur ghost tour. It's right off Bourbon St. So, we even enjoyed the walk on Bourbon street afterward. It was recommended to me by a friend.

The food was quite delicious. We had 1/2 dozen oysters, blackened chicken, and blackened bayou duck. The oysters were fresh and yummy. My boyfriend said his chicken was delicious!! And my duck was fantastic. It's a different style of cooking duck than I'm used to, but the duck was tender and full of flavor for the blackened spices.  Finished off with the chocolate Kalua mouse cake. It was good, but not much Kahlua flavor detected.  Also, my boyfriend got a double shot gin &tonic, and let me tell you, they are NOT short changing you. It was definitely a double! Yummy!

Most notably, I have to give kudos for their service. Not that we experienced any bad service here in NOLA, but the staff was just on top of it and so friendly. We were seated so quickly. Our server, Jordan P, took such good care of us. She was so friendly and made great food recommendations!  The manager, hostess, etc- everyone welcomed us and made sure we were having a good time, without being disruptive.   

We definitely recommend stopping in here!!
Great blackened ribeye and husband bragged on the blackened redfish.  Sides were flavorful as well.  Next trip we will come back!

Great spot right in the heart of the French Quarter! Parking is almost impossible or costs you at least $5, so be prepared to walk a couple blocks. Due to the high volume of oftentimes drunk tourists and FQ traffic, service is mediocre. The crab cakes are INCREDIBLE & so is the crawfish cream sauce they come served with. The Mardi Gras Pasta is great as well. Prices are reasonable. If I were already hanging out in the French Quarter, I'd definitely swing by for dinner or lunch on a weekday, but I probably wouldn't order takeout or hop in the car just to dine here.

First stop on our food fest.

My companions laughed when I ordered the red beans and rice. I have limited options not being a seafood eater. But isn't New Orleans about red beans and rice?

My food was delicious and I had my first hurricane drink which tasted like a delicious fruit punch.

I got a chain restaurant feel from this place or a total tourist trap. We fell for it but it wasn't so bad. We also tried the gator....I think the size of this appetizer was lacking.

All in all the food was decent.

We passed through New Orleans twice. Both time we had dinner at this restaurant. 
It was a typical restaurant in the French quarter. Dark, with random memorabilia and decorations on the wall. They had plenty of tables, but were tightly packed together. 
The menu had a decent amount of dishes. Price was decent. $15-$25 on average for dishes. The alligator sauces was pretty good, the sauce made it really good.  We also had the alligator bites. We ordered them half fried/ half grilled.  The grilled tasted much better for me. The gumbo and étouffée we ok, I have had better. The soft shell crab was very good. For desert we had to try the bread pudding.  It was good, not too sweet. However, the best dish we had was the bananas Foster ice cream cake. I'm not a bananas foster fan, but I would order this every time. It was not too sweet and had range of flavors. A must order in my opinion. 
The staff was great. They tended to everything we needed. 
I would definitely go back. And I would definitely recommend. 

Enjoy folks.

Gumbo, disappointing.
Jambalaya, disappointing.
Service, disappointing.

Have no idea there is always a line in front of it....

Bring our 2nd time at this location it was ok. This is a good place to go if you are with kids as it's a caters a little more to a family then some of the traditional restaurants in the French Quarter. What I'm pretty much saying is that not all restaurants are family suitable in the French quarter.

AMAZING!  I couldn't  decide what to have, so tried a lot.  Oysters on the half shell with FRESH horseradish, a side of fried oysers, side lettuce salad (with romaine and tomato)and the most amazing crab cakes with mushroom and crawfish cream sauce.  Add a Hurricane and it was the BEST meal in 5 days.  Better than Acme.  Thanks for a great meal, awesome service and the perfect end to my trip!

Redfish oceana was just a fried piece of fish that was dry. The crab cakes were okay but I also thought they were pretty dry, which they try to compensate by smothering a creamy sauce that was good. The kids portion was good and it was family friendly.

I would definitely consider this place a "tourist trap". Although, it is a good place to try some good New Orleans food! I ordered the fried oyster po boy. It seemed different and I definitely wanted to try it. Their portions are huge! However, I felt that the oyster to bread ratio was uneven. There was definitely more oysters than bread. However, the service was very accommodating and there is a good chance I'll be back :-)

I and my friends decided that since we were in NOLA, it would make sense to try a po' boy while we were here, since we had never tried one before. A quick search on Yelp showed us that Oceana Grill was the closest place to us for lunch, so we ventured over. We were seated within 10 minutes of arrival. Our server was very kind and attentive, and took care to go over what would be good to try in addition to the po'boys. He actually suggested the alligator bites, so one  of my friends and I decided to be adventurous and give it shot.

Best. Decision. Ever. It was bursting with flavor. It was maybe a little tougher to chew than regular sausage, but the texture did not detract from the flavor at all. Do yourself a favor and try these if you're up for it!

I opted for the fried shrimp po' boy, and it did not disappoint either. They also came with a side of fries. I appreciated that the portion size were generous, so I could have the rest for dinner later! Overall, I was happy that we made the stop here!

The guy at the front desk recommended this place when we checked into our hotel. We were just looking for good food in NOLA. The atmosphere was so cool. We sat out on the patio and enjoyed the nice weather. My hubby had the tuna with sides and I got a po boy. Both were very delicious! The service was excellent. 

Later on that evening, we decided to order takeout. We were so pleased with our food from earlier, we decided to give it another try. I decided to try a burger this time. I didn't specify that I needed it well done, so when I cute it I discovered it was very rare. We called and they brought another well done burger in about 25 minutes. I was pleased.
Best crawfish etouffee I've ever had. Kids fish/fries were super high quality. Gumbo real good too. Bowl is huge (almost a meal). Cup is tiny.
Great entrees, good portion sizes, however the wait was long but the food was worth the wait. Definitely,  will go back I loves the gumbo, my son loved the shrimp and fries, I also enjoyed the fish.

If you are a couple, sit at the bar. The bartender named Juan G. Is awesome. Very knowledgeable when it comes to drinks. 

His recommendation for the Surf and Turf which is steak with crab cake cream sauce and shrimp, collard greens and jambalaya. It was amazing. My wife had the Redfish Lafourch which is blacked fish topped with crab cake cream sauce, collard greens and jambalaya. She said that it was the best she has had. 

Now for the appetizers: crab cakes and BBQ shrimp. All I can say is OM MY GOD!

This place has redeemed the crab cakes in my life. So freaking tasty. The BBQ was good as the sauce added a level of complexity to the combo. Those crab cakes though a must try. 

Try this place you won't be disappointed.

This is our first trip this year 2015, prior to the New year! (BAR) Juan and Josha R., are extremely knowledgeable on food items, beer choices and made this dinner one of the best for spouse and I. The crab cakes were to die for, as well as the taste of New Orleans plate. 

We look forward to dining here, the next coming days! Outstanding service,  highly recommended!

The Ross's

Long line ... nope not this time ... fortunately it was a five minute wait... Crab cakes and charbroiled oysters to start just perfect! First time eating catfish was a bit interesting but for a newbie it was okay. Thank you NOLA
Food was amazing. A little pricey but well worth it. I had red snapper and alligator bites. All good.

I thought the Oceana style oysters were phenomenal.  The sauce was amazing!  I also tried the shrimp alfredo my date ordered, and it was great too.  Your spoon will stand up on its own in their gumbo, which comes topped off with a crawfish claw.  The prices are reasonable for what you're getting, and the staff were extremely friendly!  I would definitely go back on my next visit to New Orleans!
Best Catfish I have ever eaten in my life. Went at lunch with friends and my husband and I shared. I tell everyone where to go for good Fried Catfish!

We ordered via the facebook app delivery was on time. We got the seafood platter and the fish tasted like it was cooked than recooked. The bbq shrimp was actually bbq or covered in bbq sauce so it was weird. The bread pudding was delicious. The food arrived warm. We tip the delivery boy on a bike 30% bc it was freezing out there.

Food was served with very large portions. I got the taste of New Orleans which was so much more than I could handle, and for such an affordable price. I added fried crawfish to it, which was tasty. My friend got the Shrimp Po Boy which was huge and satisfied her much more than another one she got on her trip. Our server was incredibly helpful with his menu knowledge and recommendations. Overall very happy and would go back on another trip!
Best I've found in New Orleans.  Crab cakes.  St James crepes (shrimp & crab). Oysters. Étouffée. Catfish po-boy. Creme brule. Seafood gumbo.

Although this place had a line out the door, we decided to wait it out. We were seated within 10 minutes, so not too bad. David A was our waiter and his service was excellent! Kaitlin even dropped by to help from her neighboring tables. The Shrimp Po Boy I ordered was nothing to write home about, but got the job done. My wife ordered the Mardi Gras Pasta and told me every 3 minutes that it was the greatest thing she had ever ate, so there's that! Chocolate Kahlua Mousse was very good as well. I will definitely return next time I'm in N.O.

I was completely disappointed by this dining experience. We arrived and were actually seated pretty quickly, I must say. I didn't realize there were so many floors to this restaurant - I believe there are at least four. We were seated on one of the upper levels at a table that was really small. I guess they make the tables small to fit more people. The waitress was nice enough, given she was really busy. I ordered the catfish and shrimp with fries, my two guests ordered comparable meals. It wasn't a long wait for the food - but it wasn't hot when it arrived. That was surprising since the restaurant was busy. The catfish was fried soft and was lukewarm and the fries were also lukewarm. I ordered a banana foster ice cream cake that was underwhelming and I didn't even eat 1/4 of it...or a 1/4 of the meal. The waitress didn't notice most of my food remained on both of my plates to offer a discount or ask if there was anything I wanted alternatively. Wouldn't recommend this one.
Everything we ordered is great. Steak,oysters,gumbo,pralines. Staff has awesome customer service. Place is great. Vibe is awesome. Nice crowds.
The shrimp peel and eat was great. Flavorful. The catfish platter was decent, nothing special.

Great chargrilled oysters. Decent drink selection.  Fast and courteous service no matter how crowded. So far have tried 3 different entres, ranging from seafood to steak,  and have not been disappointed yet. The bread pudding dessert was fresh and really good.

I came here for lunch/brunch today with a group of my buddies. With 7 of us, I was a bit worried about how long it would take to get a table, but really didn't have to wait. Must have came at the right time. They brought us upstairs to a huge dining area. From the look of the place downstairs, I did not expect it! It really was charming!! Megs was our waitress and she was nothing short of amazing!!! I had the pasta that megs told us about, it was the special of the day, and dude!!! It was sooooo good! All the rest of the group had breakfast. I tasted the crawfish omelet and it was like a flavor explosion! I would gain so much weight if I ever decided to move down here to 'nawlins. Lol. I think I could eat oceana every day. Oh! And the Bloody Mary's!!! Even if you aren't hungry, go grab a drink! Megan told us they make the mix every morning and the vodka is infused with something. It def helped with my hangover from the night before. Food was amazing, service was amazing, drinks were amazing. 10 out of 10. Oh, and if you check in on yelp, you get 10% off. My buds were anxious to get to the airport so I didn't take advantage of that, but promised I would yelp later. So hope this helps! Go to oceana! Ask for megs! Get the pasta!!!! You're welcome!

Recommend: blackened shrimp.
Very dark. Interesting decor. More of a dive bar feel. At least the section we were sitting in - the place is enormous.
Very fast line. Slower service.

This place was recommended too me by a tour guide, I wasn't disappointed amazing. Food spot on and the char grilled oysters were out of this world. Staff very knowledge on the menu and how things are cooked.. Will be visiting again..
Pasta was amazing! We also tried the "taste of New Orleans" and that was really good. We had the gator tails and they were good, but we did have better. It was a great atmosphere for kids.

Good place for a quick abita amber at the bar.  The service is first rate but the food is little more than Cajun fast food.  All the sides tasted like they had been made days ago.  Anything ordered blackened will be tough and dry.

Ate here with my friend on a Saturday morning about 10:30am. We were handed breakfast menus, but asked to eat lunch. My friend is a pescatarian, so this was a great place for him to eat. Offered alot of options for him. We ordered shrimp Alfredo, shrimp poyboy, and a cup of seafood gumbo. The food was DELICIOUS with decent prices. The service was also amazing. I would recommend this place to anyone visiting New Orleans. Because we got there early, there wasn't that much of a wait. But when we walked passed the place later that day. There was a line down the block. So I would advise to get there early.

Would give it 3.5 stars.  The courtyard area was very pleasant, especially when it was about 75 outside, a few stray mosquitos that will not be bothering anyone ever again....  Grits were the best, my veggie omelette was very good, but others were just OK.  Huge portions.  The bar looked like it could be a lot of fun in the evening.
For the price it was excellent. I had the Blackened Redfish with crawfish. I would come here again with friends...ask what the specials are!

We ordered the gumbo, white meat gator and the platter with fish and shrimp. The gumbo by far was the best ever DELISH. The gator was grilled served with a side of Chipotle style sauce YUMMY.  My fried fish and shrimp were good. Good drinks and great staff.

Good service and great food. So good I went there twice. Be sure to try the gator bites. I loved them, but it was as much fun to watch some of the less adventures eaters in our group work up the nerve to try them.
I love this place! My food was delicious and it was my birthday so I got a free bread pudding and a birthday song from the entire restaurant! I was pleasantly surprised!

From reading the previous reviews, I was expecting a delicious meal; however, I was sorely disappointed. I ordered takeout through yelp after finding that I was not "in the delivery range." I ordered the gator bites, crab cakes, gumbo, shrimp platter, and the pecan bourbon pie.

After getting back to my hotel, I found that the gator bites were missing. The gumbo was okay but nothing you cant get better elsewhere. The crab meat cakes stated they were supposed to come with a crawfish mushroom sauce which was missing as well. Therefore the crab cakes were a little dry and flavorless. The shrimp platter was also not great. Lastly, the bourbon pecan pie slice was very small and the whipped cream was spoiled.

All in all, while this has a very nice looking interior and had a very nice staff, the food was lackluster and I would not recommend it.

Amazing place to eat. I usually never eat oysters but we got the oyster Rockefeller, and all I can say is...Wow. same with the catfish po-boy. I thought it would taste weird with the Coleslaw but I can assure you that the flavors (the fried catfish, pickles, coleslaw, cheese, and bread) all meshed together extraordinarily. The BBQ shrimp was also stellar. I'm not used to having to peel shrimp before I eat them at restaurants but it was all worth the work. It was a little messy, but the flavors had cooked into the shrimp.

The service was pretty good, although she took kind of long to get our order despite it being pretty dead in the lunch section. She made for it later in our stay by being more attentive even when it got a lot busier.

Lastly, I thought the facility was very unique. Granted, this was my first New Orleans trip ever so all of the houses (which this facility basically is situated in) in New Orleans are really unique to me. But anywho...loved the decor.  This location is amazing too. Right next to Broadway so we got to get some cheap drinks afterwards! 

Overall, I was extremely stuffed and satisfied after eating here.  This is someplace I would highly recommend and definitely be visiting again on my next trip to New Orleans!

This place has the best Po-Boy I've ever had. I ordered a blackened alligator bite Po-boy. It was not on the menu but the staff was happy to accommodate the request. The baguette is fresh and crispy. The alligator is cooked to be more tender than usual and the blackened spices are perfect. They top it with the usual lettuce, tomato and pickle and remoulade sauce but they add cole slaw which makes the sandwich incredible. And of course it comes with Cajun fries. It's not cheap ($14 for a sandwich) but not much is in the French Quarter and it is definitely worth it. And it is convenient right off Bourbon and open til 1AM. I'd say this is a must for any trip to the Quarter. I ate there twice this week. And ordered the exact same thing each time.

We ordered a blackened chicken poboys and fried shrimp platter. The blackened chicken was very delicious, however the fried shrimp not worth it. It's taste normal but cost $17. The services and restaurant atmosphere is great. I'll recommend blackened whatever you can get in the restaurant.
Enthusiastic service,  ask for Pamela!  Amazing jambalaya pasta,  authentic flavours and well informed and friendly staff.

It's like a Red Lobster... Drinks were way too sweet w/ no alcohol and the food was ok... It's not fresh like some of the other places I've been... Our food came out 10min after we ordered it... I won't be going back ever..
The crab cakes and BBQ ribs were absolutely delicious.  The restaurant was conveniently located in the French Quarter and had a fun vibe when we were there.  Prices were decent, I would go back.

For any other town this would be a four star restaurant. But there are so many great places in New Orleans that I would rate this as average. I've been here multiple times, in my opinion its very touristy, but if its your first time in New Orleans then great, come here. Blackened Duck and Royal Omelet were pretty good.
Wonderful food and exceptional service!  The best seafood omelette I ever had!  They are a little pricey, ($43 for 2 people).
The food was great, the service was very friendly and the atmosphere was very enjoyable.  When we left, the line to get in was down the block, so make a reservation or go early - it is worth it.

Best Food in NOLA!! I had the Oceana Red Fish, added blacken shrimp. OMG! The food was cooked to perfection. Nice size red fish that was the length of the plate. Perfect amount of cream sauce on top filled with crawfish. The mash potatoes & collard greens on the side was perfect. I ordered 2 Hurricane cocktails and they were even perfect! I'm in love with this place & I'm confident I'll be back every single trip to NOLA! Oh... The bread pudding dessert!!! 
You must order it!

Great food and great service! Brought fresh caught fish to the restaurant, and Chef Jay cooked it up for us custom to our liking. Alex provided great service and a friendly atmosphere. Thoroughly impressed. Will be back

We were looking for a place nearby and oceana was recommended by a local.  The seafood jambalaya Fettuccini was delicious.  My husband had the catfish platter and there was enough for at least 2 people.  He said it was at last a 4.5.  The service was great as well.  The was a line out front but the wait was short.  If we get a chance we will be back before we leave NO.

I had the Redfish Oceana and it was quite good, not the best seafood I've had in the city, but excellent nonetheless. What pushed this to 5 stars was our server Darrick, he was friendly and helpful and all around a great server. I would definitely recommend trying this place.
Good service and food - a lot of seating so didn't have to wait at all on a Saturday afternoon

Great service! He was very personable and made the experience for our large group of 30. They were very accommodating to our group size. The food was delicious. My first experience with alligator, would eat it again! Beware shrimp do come with legs that need to be peeled, although no heads. Overall, great authentic NOLA food.
The food was great! Our waitress was Jerleen. She was polite and provided great service. Loved the hurricane.
The reviews are better than they should be.  The raw oysters are great!  The cooked food was salty and too rich.   Products don't taste fresh.
Great New Orleans experience. Highly recommend for first timers. Love the food and especially the service!

This is definitely a "hometown" experience. Our waitress,  Megan, was awesome and made us feel right at home. Her recommendations were great- the special as well as the sampler were excellent. We also shared a crab cake appetizer, but mostly enjoyed the alligator bites. This is a casual, comfortable, and very well priced setting. Service was excellent. The bread pudding is supposed to be a must-but we just couldn't eat any more- So save some room! I will definitely go back for that!

Omg!! This food was so delicious!! The staff was all wonderful and so attentive. Ashleigh was a delight to have as a server. She took the initiative to split our checks without us asking which was perfect for a party of 8. This will always be my go to spot in Nola!!!
This place was so delicious. We sat in the courtyard and had an awesome lunch. Get the alligator bites, they don't bite back

Very good grilled chicken! It wasn't on the menu, but I asked for not spicy version of blackened chicken and they made it for me as well as zucchini. Great taste! Do recommend it. My friends liked crab cake pasta.

I'm giving this place 4 stars because we were seated and served pretty quickly. Everyone in my group ordered some form of sea food and I tasted it and it was delicious and the portions were big. I ordered the grilled chicken Alfredo and the portion size is deceitfully small. It's spread out over a large plate so when I finished it I was still just as hungry as when I entered. I tried to tell our waiter about it but he just laughed it off and left as quickly as he could. For a 17$ plate I felt robbed. 
And the soda lacked flavoring it was only carbonated water.

First off I feel I have to say, I was directed to this restaurant by many people.  My hotel recommend it first. As we were walking over to it, we stopped at other establishments to look at menus.  A family walked out of a steak house and told us we would be better off at Oceana.  Then we walked by and the police men we spoke to said we wouldn't be disappointed.  And we weren't. The staff was courteous and prompt.  Our waitress, Melaina, was sweet, professional, and very attentive.  She held eye contact while speaking, which impressed me!  I do have dietary needs that they were readily able to work with me with.  The manager, Joe, OMG the man was fabulous.  The busser, Jermaine was extremely personable.  Oh, the food was good too!  I had the shrimp creole, $15.  It was very tasty and spicy. Not to the point that you can't taste the shrimp.  Over all we had a great time and felt at home with the staff.
The food was great, the atmosphere fun.  Lost 1 star for weak-ish drinks (compared to other places we went).
warm place with delicious food combined with local beer in NO. waiters are nice! $34.
Went for dinner last week with friends.  No line.  I got the New Orleans sampler.  Good food.  Had a couple of beers.  Good beer.  Prices were reasonable.  Nice place.  Go here.
Great food and great service.  The line was long but moved quickly.  The atmosphere is fun and casual.  We will be back!

First time eating here and definitely not my last. The staff is very friendly and polite. My husband and I shared a fried seafood platter and it was very satisfying. The interior of the restaurant was very clean and had lots of nice frames, mirrors, etc.

Yum, yum, yum! I ordered this on Uber Eats and had it delivered to my hotel room. It was delicious even though it was not freshly served to me at the restaurant. The bread pudding was so good that I couldn't stop eating it! Addictive!

This is tourist food. For some reason, this is not talked about. My fried shrimp platter had about 8 soft (sweaty?) shrimp--not crispy, not terribly flavorful.  Ribs were pretty tasty. But this is not a special place for the prices. 45 dollars for two meager lunch entrees, no drinks. 
Staff is nice. Patio is nice. But the food does not make this a destination spot.

My friends and I had a great time! We made a reservation ahead of time and was quickly seated after arriving. This restaurant was huge!!!! We sat on the upper level in a smaller dining room. Our waiter was Darrick and he was awesome! He was very knowledgeable about the menu and was able to give us great recommendations. I ordered the blackened chicken po-boy with a side of fries and It was delicious. Not the best I've ever had but it definitely made my top 3. The service was quick and we had no issues. I highly recommend if you are in the area to check this place out.

Crab cakes are the best in town !! Service is Great , a total most when in NOLA ...don't let the line in front fool you . Goes by fast and worth the wait. ... gator bites are a must ! Taste just like chicken yummmmm....

GREAT, GREAT, GREAT !!!
I love Oceana's because the food never disappoints... Their hush puppies are the best. Their seafood is amazing, and good service whenever I come in. Ms. Carol always takes great care of us, in the hospitality field. So, if you want good, affortable seafood. Please do here !!!!

I was so excited to see that I got 10% off my total just from checking-in at Oceana Grill so I HAD to give them a review.

It's hard to find decent food on bourbon street, so after failing miserably at a previous hole in the wall, this place definitely made up for it.

Oceana Grill was packed, but we didn't have a problem finding a table for three. I ordered the taste of New Orleans and it was great because it came with red beans and rice, jambalaya and crawfish étouffée. 

Good food, music and ambiance.
Food was just OK.  Kitchen open late so it worked in a pinch.  Service was good.  Friendly and waitress made some good recommendations for us.

If you want a variety of new orleans dishes This is the place. Great food great oysters anyway you want them. Gotta have a drink with all the good food. If you're a hard liquor person their sazeracs are good but they do have a full bar n lots of beers.

Was in New Orleans for a night, and stopped by to eat here. It's next to Bourbon street, so the area is very touristy. Was thinking of going in, as this group of tourists were leaving. They highly recommended everything. I had the "taste of New Orleans", and oh.my.God. the food was amazing. I mean lip smacking amazing. If you're in New Orleans, go eat here!

One of the better places we have eaten in the French Quarter. The baked oysters were so good and so much butter to sop up with the bread. I really wish I had gone back for a Bloody Mary. I will be there again!
The only reason I took off a star was the service. Very lackluster at the bar.

I ate here this past Sunday night with a dining companion.  The restaurant itself is not too much, at least the side that we were put into with a liquor bar in the front and an oyster bar in the back.

My dining companion and I decided to split two appetizers, the Gator Tail Bites and a dozen Oysters on the Half Shell along with a Shrimp Po Boy between the two of us for a nice snack.  The gator bites and oysters came out at the same time and both looked fantastic.  The oysters were meaty and served over ice with crackers while the gator tails were blackened with remoulade.  Both appetizers tasted wonderful with the gator tails having a good flavor and spice that married wonderfully with the remoulade and the oysters were fresh and tasty.  Shortly after we finished the appetizers our Po Boy came out with cole slaw, pickles and a remoulade on it.  It did not disappoint either and had lots of great flavors.

The bottom line for me is that I was very satisfied with my meal at Oceana and I am glad that I ate there.  Both the food and the service was great and it is also worth noting that they server their dinner menu until 1 AM if you need a late night snack!
Great food.. I had shrimp étouffée it was great they have excellent customer service do recommend will be back

Dinner our first night in town and it was delicious. Tried the crab cakes and they were amazing. The sauce was amazing. The Taste of New Orleans platter had a little of everything as well as the Catfish Lafouche . Blackened catfish over jambalaya, garnished with fried crawfish, drenched in an amazing sauce with even more crawfish. Wow. Couldn't leave without bread pudding and it was hot and tasty.

I would have given 5 stars for my first visit and the excellent food, but the service on my second visit was very disappointing to say the least. On our first visit, our waiter Bobby was helpful and friendly and advised us that just a seafood platter should be enough for the two of us and he was right. We enjoyed the platter and was back the next day for lunch. I don't remember the name of the waiter (probably John) but he didn't seem to carr much. Thinking of our platter the previous day, we ordered a blackened catfish platter, thinking it would be enough for 2. When it arrived, it was just a big fillet with 2 sides, enough for just 1 person. He never even told us that it would not be enough for two. We also had a creme brulee. Needless to say, all the dishes we had here (including the side of jambalaya) were excellent, but we were let down a bit by the waiter on the second day.

So disappointing. This restaurant might be alright, but they definitely should not deliver.  We have had amazing food the entire time we've been in NOLA, but this was awful. I ordered the crab cakes. They were fishy. I've had fresher tasting crab cakes at home in Central Illinois. My husband got the jambalaya pasta. It was SWIMMING in grease. Two of my daughters got chicken Alfredo to split. It was also extremely greasy and a very small portion. The packaging was terrible. Flimsy styrofoam containers for a pricy meal is too bad. The containers were all crushed when we got them. The grease from the pasta dishes was EVERYWHERE. The girl that took my order on the phone was rude. They only take exact change cash as payment. I was told 45 minutes for delivery. It was an hour and fifteen minutes before it arrived. The delivery driver was super sweet. It's now 9pm and my kids are still hungry because it was basically inedible. Down to the hotel snack shop we go. So, $85 for dinner and we threw it away. So gross.

The Taste of New Orleans was delicious! The entree came with jambalaya, red beans & rice, and crawfish étouffée. Absolutely delicious !

Came back a second time. Had the crab cake platter. It was to die for. Karaline was an awesome server.

Came back a third time. Tried the  Mardi Gras Pasta! Delicious! 

I definitely recommend everything that ice had so far. I did sneak some of my boyfriends fries and they were delicious too

Based on good reviews, my husband and I wanted to try Oceana Grill while in New Orleans.  We were able to do breakfast there before starting our day.  It was like a 5 minute walk from our hotel which was really convenient.  We started off with some great bloody Mary's!  Full of flavor and just the right amount of spice!  Loved it!  The food was just as amazing.  I had a special Crab Cake Benedict they had that day with some hash browns.  The crab cakes had so much flavor to them!  My husband had the Royal Omelet (because of the alligator sausage) with grits and a side of creamy pork sausage gravy.  By the look on his face after the first bite I could tell he was in food heaven!  The alligator sausage was juicy and full of flavor!  He even loved the grits with the gravy!  Though we were comfortably full after our meal .... we both had bloody Mary's to go!   That was one the best tasting meals we had while we were in New Orleans!  The service was quick and awesome as well!  Definitely would return if we're ever in NO again!

I mean is it delicious? Yes. Was the service acceptable? It was more than acceptable because our server was lively and funny and loved his restaurant. I however wouldn't choose here on the regular, we just had friends in town and they were of course staying in the quarter. It was expensive compared to the other restaurant where you can get the same quality for less. It wasnt crazy expensive, don't get me wrong it, we just live here now and know how to get the deals! :) however if you are a visitor please eat here because it's worth it!!
This place did not disappoint went for breakfast the food was great and the Bloody Mary will be asking if you can take the bartender back home with you!

Are here our first night in New Orleans. Food was so good!! It's so hard to decide what was best. Gator tails, oysters (I'm not a fan usually), ribs, gumbo, etc... were all so good... really not much to complain about. I booked reservations online prior to the trip and I would highly recommend doing that so you don't have to wait in line.

First time here so I asked server Arielle what is good. She recommended the breakfast jambalaya. OMG..... I have never had something so good. Not only did Arielle suggest delicious food, she provided excellent service. I will definitely be back to get more next time I'm in New Orleans. Thanks Arielle!

Absolutely loved it! I had the red beans and rice and my husband had the alligator po boy. The food and service were excellent. The atmosphere was cozy but relaxed. Definitely a must do in NOLA. (Must get the waiter, Bobby!!)

I went to oceana because it was highly recommended I can say I wasn't disappointed  the gumbo is off the hook
Matter of fact all their food delish service is great too if you get a chance to go there expect a line but it is so worth it

The place is located right at the french quarter, the food was tasty and the ambience was cheerful. Like every other restaurant in New Orleans it's super crowded and you have to wait long lines. However, the waiting went by so fast since the french quarter happy vibe distracts you. Oceana Grill was a happy mistake we made since we were looking for another restaurant, nonetheless, the food was exquisite, the hostess and servers were super nice. The only reason I am not giving them a 5 star review it's because I felt I was being rushed to get out. But other than that, I highly recommend this place if you're visiting NOLA.

Errol serviced me and my family! And he did a amazing Job! Everything was correct with our order, and boy was it GOOD!!!! Eat here for breakfast! I had the lost bread! Made perfect! Thankyou for the great food Oceana and the great service!!!!

My group of girlfriends and I went here with the desire of eating pasta. We ordered the crab cake pasta and crawfish fettuccini. We also ordered the blackened redfish that came with a side of jambalaya and greens. 

The crab cake pasta was mediocre - creamy and buttery, the crab cake was typical, but nothing amazing or extra ordinary. This was our favorite of the three dishes. 

The blackened redfish was pretty good. A little over cooked and almost dry in my opinion, but nothing a squeeze of lemon couldn't help. Jambalaya wasn't bad, but greens were not delicious. 

The crawfish fettuccini was sadly terrible. I couldn't stand it anymore after one bite - the pasta was overwhelmingly fishy due to the fishy, horrible quality crawfish.. I was looking forward to this dish but it ruined my appetite. 

However, the third star is because of great service. Ron recommended clubs for us to see and treated us with great hospitality.

Got Lucky we dint have to wait that long 
Had a Great food  , crab cake was great and had the seafood gumbo , yummy !!!and to top it all I cannot forget the sizzling Margarita  !!! 
And of course Our waiter was so nice and he looks like young John Travolta .  
Make sure you try to beat the crowd !!

Ok we were trying to avoid Bourbon St. because of all the bad smells (just reeks of weed and piss), but the suggestion of places to get decent gator tail l, this place was on the top of the list. We went and the staff were very friendly and helpful and the gator tail was very good as promised, my wife even liked the fried gator we got so much she ordered a poboy with blackened gator and that was also very tasty. My only complaint was the service was a little lacking I even ordered an extra side of crawfish étouffée but it was never brought out . Good food but a little more attention to detail would make it great!
Just had dinner here!! The red beans and rice were phenomenal! Our server Troy was super friendly, attentive and professional. Couldn't ask for a better dinner!

Yelp, you hit it out if the park again!! Great location, excellent food, BBQ oysters were fantastic, service was wonderful and did I mention the oysters?

If there weren't so many great restaurants here to try, we would have gone back on this short visit!
One of my first food experience while being in NO. It did not disappoint. From the blackened alligator bites to the Redfish Oceana it was a delicious experience.

So good!!! Went with a party of 6 for dinner and every single dish was amazing! So flavorful and fresh. Don't be discouraged if there is an enormous line going stretching down the block like we experienced-- it moves fast! We were told 20 min wait and figured it would actually be around 45, but sure enough we were seated in 20. Service was wonderful-- food comes out extremely fast, probably the fastest I've ever experienced, but not in a bad way. They're efficient and able to turn over their tables fast in order to keep their wait time down. The servers are great and attentive. We all got different dishes and everything was amazing! Louisiana crabmeat cakes, Cajun pasta, oysters- I have a feeling you won't feel disappointed with anything you select on this menu! Drinks were good, pricing was very affordable taking into account the area.  Went here based on Yelp reviews , I hope others continue to do the same!
Touristy. It's got high ratings because it's off bourbon street and if you check in you get 10% off your check. Food is overpriced.
Man oh man where do I start. Long line buts it's worth the wait. Great drinks and great food. I recommended the Taste of New Orleans
Good service poor food. A run of the mill standard cajun food poorly executed and over priced. The service was friendly and accommodating

Bit over priced but most places on Bourbon are pricey.  They stay open late which is a bonus when arriving late to the hotel.  My fav here is the BBQ shrimp.  I've tried few other dishes but none were memorable except for the BBQ shrimp.  Been here 3 or 4 times and always sat at the bar.  Some of the waiters are cool to chitchat with and they'll give you some good recommendations on what places to check out.

We really enjoyed the food and the service. Our server Brad was professional and friendly. 
So we decided to come here for the second time. 
Unfortunately our experience wasn't that good. 
Server Kim didn't pay any attention to us. Only once she came and asked how was everything. Also She messed up with our order. Brought us items we didn't order( which she of course included in the check) moreover she included 18% service charge in the check!!!! 
I'm sorry but for what!? 
First night we didn't have tips included in our check. 
So is that  her way to make tips? She obviously didn't deserve it.
I'm disappointed and I hope to have managements attention by putting 2 start to that place.

So I walked into there expecting shitty TGI Fridays-esque food. The red beans and rice and po boys came out and nope. Amazing. This place has the tackiest atmosphere of any restaurant I've ever been completely blown away by and I'd go back again in a heartbeat. Five out of five would eat at again.
Amazing food and great service. Will be back here again. Crab cakes are the best in New Orleans.

I am here in new Orleans and i see advertisement for this place every where. I read the reviews and decided to go. The service was tops only waited 10 minutes for a table. I ordered the oysters Rockefeller it was tasty I would differently order that again. I had the crab cake as my entree. They were so so . my husband order the pasta jambalaya that was good. So i must say Oceania was a big hype .

Reasonably priced oysters!!!! GO HERE!!!!!
Also, the waitresses and waiters are amazing here, very friendly!!
Every waitress and waiter I've ever had as always stood out with their amazing personalities and smiles!
