Their seafood is amazing! The salad with the blackened shrimp is very delicious. Also the sauce they use with it will blow your mind!! The shrimp itself is decent size, very reasonably sized. Some places serve small shrimp, but this place gives you your money's worth.
The shrimp fettucine alfredo is amazing. I first discovered this when someone let me have a bite and I just fell in love. I did some searching and found it was from Oceana!!
Again, I want to point out how positive the wait staff is!! I would bring people here who are visiting. Also, they deliver to people close by.

On my trip to nola September 1st,2016.My family and i decided to find a restaurant that does brunch and  breakfast.How ever we came up on Oceania.This restaurant is everything.Their warm welcoming and to top it off the great service  our waiter Lloyd and Errol gave to us.They were very pleasant Gentlemen  and knowledgeable.Lloyd suggested a few dishes to us on our first visit which, one of them was the sea food jambalaya Excellent choice it was.Because of his service Lloyd gave to us. We went back the next day September 2nd,2026 to have brunch and thats when we met Errol with his (radio voice).They  both made this place my restaurant as long as we're in New Orleans.It was such a pleasure.looking forward to my next trip..
Great ambiance. Would definitely recommend the Redfish Oceana and the Gator Tail bites. Yummy!
Completely love this place! Owner and employees are like family. Must of eaten here 7 days out of the 10 days I was in New Orleans. Have to have the crawdads!

We went at lunch one day and sat for 20 minutes with no acknowledgement from anyone so we left. Last night we decided to give it another try and the service was MUCH better. The alligator bites were great, the crab cakes were great, and the mustard greens were fabulous.
Food was awesome and the service was excellent. Kevin C. Was very knowledgeable about the menu and was kind on the eyes.

Ate my first meal after wandering aimlessly in search of Oceania on Monday night and it was well worth it. Greeted nicely upon entering and it remained that way with engaging staff and patrons. Directed to the bar at the entrance since I was dining as one and never felt alone, a visitor from Japan on my left and another from Australia on my right with good food in front of me,the fried seafood platter of hush puppies,fries,catfish,oysters and shrimp seasoned well,tasteful and fried just right was deliciously satisfying and I just closed my eyes savoring the flavor. You know it's good when I finished the rest later at the hotel and it was still flavor fully good cold even the seasoned fries! Don't forget the Hurricane drink. Good food,people and atmosphere!

Nice atmosphere. The waitress was good at explaining the different options on the menu. I went with the Taste of New Orleans but substituted the jambalaya for anextra bowl of gumbo. The gumbo was pretty good but not the best I've had. I didn't care for the crawfish etoufee. 

We got patron shots which said $7 on the menu but they charged us $8. We got it rectified but that took over 20 minutes.

Had alligator bites to start with. They were tasty, however a bit too much seasoning for me. I wish I could taste the said alligator more. We followed up with oysters Rockefeller which were excellent! And so was their gumbo which arrived with a crab claw. 
The softshell crab was delicious as well. As drinks go, we had Bloody Marys and Margaritas, and they were alright, but nothing to write home about.

Tried Shrimp Creole and Crawfish Etouffee for the first time at this restaurant and loved it, especially the etouffee. I ate the whole plate which came with white rice and two pieces of garlic toast. There are 2-3 floors of seating, very large restaurant and very Nawlin's feel to it. The waiter was kind of impatient and not happy so not sure what that was about. I think the staff overall was not that great. But I enjoyed my food anyway. Definitely recommend it here! :)
Such amazing Oyster Po Boys!  So good and such a landmark in one of my favorite cities!  Delicious crab cakes.  :)

Michael our server was polite, prompt, and attentive. Great service!! Thank you Michael! We stopped in for a quick late night bite around 11:30pm. Sauce on their famous oysters was pretty great, so were the gator bites..giving it 3 stars for portion size vs. price..although it is a tourist area so it was pretty par for the course considering the area.
Great food and lots of it as the prices are very reasonable... but the waiter, John R had a personality of a smart azz. Will return but will avoid him like the plaque.

I came here while taking a trip across america from California to New Jersey.  Amazingly, we found this place open late at night at 12 am.  I was so hungry, but wasn't sure what to get.  We ordered the triple platter dish that had Gumbo, etouffee, and something else. 

I don't remember everything else cause after purchasing that $14 triple plate, I bought another plate of crawfish etouffee for another $14.  I loved this dish.  All across america, this dish was the best I had eaten.  This was way better than Deanies which we ate at earlier that day.
Amazing specials.  Decently priced. Great location.  I'll surely be back here soon.  The staff is also very courteous.
The food here was fine. Better than Red Lobster but worse than the ratings suggest. I think it gets so highly rated because of the proximity to Bourbon St.

Had a good dinner at the bar. Was a long line but I was solo so I got a spot at the bar and had the crab cake app and gumbo. The bartender conversation was good and food was decent (crab cake app was great though). It was a little slow because it was so busy, otherwise would have been a 4 Star review.

I ordered the catfish PO Boy and oh boy! What a meal! It's a large serving with fries. We also ordered the gator Bites and they probably have the best gator bites I've had. Very tasty and meaty! I love the ambiance of the place as well. We sat outside and enjoyed the beautiful New Orleans weather. The staff is great, very accommodating and friendly. A must eat at place when visiting the French Quarter.

I absofrickinlutely loooooove this place!!! We eat here every time we are in town. I always get the crab cakes with their amazing crawfish & mushroom cream sauce, Oceana's famous Oysters which are flame grilled and to die for and a Caesar salad. Everything is ALWAYS FABULOUS!!! The service is top notch too! You won't be disappointed!
I had the blackened catfish po-boy and the fish tasted good, but the po-boy left a lot to be desired. The fish didn't fit the sandwich and the fries were horrible. I should have listened to Yelp.

I ordered food for delivery through Yelp Eats24 at this place. The delivery was expected to arrive at 9:33. I waited over two hours (one hour for expected delivery and one hour after expected delivery) and it finally arrived. The food was cold and the mousse cake was melted everywhere. I called checking on the delivery as well and I got rude responses and excuses. This place is a two minute walk from where I am staying. I offered to pick it up when checking on it but was told that it was on its way, so 30 minutes later it arrives. I do not recommend this place for delivery. Slow, cold, and melted.
F***ING INCREDIBLE. Food was IMMACULATE, along w great views of the street and great calm atmosphere. Would one hundred percent come back any time.

In New Orleans for the weekend and had to come back to Oceana. Food is always good! I had the redfish with collard greens...2 days in a row! Our server was Error and he was nothing short of ahhhhmaaaazing! He even sung happy birthday to the birthday girl. Make sure if you are ever there to request Errol...the singing server!!! An awesome experience...I look forward to going back the next time I'm in NOLA!

So much seafood in my gumbo and etouffee!!! 

It was surprised I saw two crab claws when I opened the gumbo. There was so many shrimps in gumbo that every bite I had was shrimp till the end!! The taste was a little bland but what more I can ask for a $5.50 full of seafood gumbo in the middle of night! 

Same as the gumbo, etouffee had so much crawfish in it that my bf couldn't even finish all the crawfish. 

I ordered bread pudding, seafood gumbo, and crawfish etouffee togo. They packed the food very well to make sure nothing would spill out. Also, staff were super friendly when I went to pick up.

I came here for my friend's bachelorette party dinner during a weekend trip to NOLA.  While it's hard to different between all the creole restaurants in the area, Oceana came recommended by a few people, and turned out to be great.  Of course we had hurricanes, which were just as strong as rest we'd indulged in that weekend.  For my meal, I had the shrimp po' boy, because I couldn't leave Louisiana without trying it.  It was pretty flippin' awesome, and a huge portion at that.  I also tried other dishes, such as a friend's pasta with alligator sausage.   While I had a hard time swallowing something knowing it was alligator, it actually wasn't that bad.

Overall, the atmosphere was lively, the food was pretty good, and the service was up to par, as they sat us right away and didn't take too long to serve as (as most NOLA restaurants did).  Definitely a good choice for a celebratory dinner.

My burger was definitely made out of congealed something.  Not meat.  Also, they literally gave me one pickle and one tomato.  Everyone at the table agreed that it looked like a jimmy dean Patty after I bit into it.  I did not eat it. I still paid full price.

Breakfast on Saturday had a limited menu but met our needs. My husband had seafood omelette based on recommendation of our server and he was not disappointed.  He said he could eat that omelette every day for a week.   
I was looking for a lighter option not many choices.  Staff was pleasant and attentive.

So good. Their menu has a wide variety and is also vegetarian friendly. Our server Kevin was fantastic - quick, friendly,  and gave us great tips about the area. Food came out super fast and was delicious! Perfect way to experience New Orleans cuisine.

The food is wonderful. My boyfriend and I can be picky eaters, but this place did not disappoint. I had a shrimp po boy and he had the blackened chicken Alfredo. Both were great. We were seated fairly quickly without a reservation. The environment was completely different from the craziness of Bourbon street.

I got the chicken Alfredo pasta and loved it! Sooo yummmmyyyyy!! Overall a little pricy but I guess food is overall more expensive in New Orlean compared to other cities I have visited! My friends tried other things from the menu and they were happy with their food too!

A group of us shared a bunch of appetizers and desserts. All of the food was delicious and I highly recommend the mushroom bruschetta and pot de creme. 

However the service was very slow and our waitress kept bringing our dishes to the table next to us. Also, that table was seated after us but got in and out with an app, dinner and the check before we were even asked if we wanted dessert. Perhaps skewed service toward the expected bigger check?

2 words; Red Fish 
Best fish dish I have ever had...
Be sure  and ask to be seated in Kim's area.

Service was remarkable. Waitor was very attentive on during Sunday brunch.  You may want to call ahead if you have a larger party.  Otherwise, it was easy getting a table for two. I would definitely go back to the restaurant if I am looking for good seafood and am willing to spend big bucks. 

Definitely one of the better places near Bourbon Street!

Best breakfast in the French Quarter! Had amazing dish of fried eggplant, poached eggs, tomato, smoked ham sprinkled with Parmesan cheese - my mouth is watering as I type the words. My brother had this amazing rice dish that was a symphony of flavors and textures. Oceana Grill offers amazing New Orleans cooking. This place is so good that we actually went two days in a row. And if you've ever eaten in New Orleans and know how many great places there are to eat, its saying volumes to eat at the same place twice. Go - you will not be disappointed.
Food was just okay, drink service was ridiculously slow. Maybe 20 minutes to get drinks? I would say their specialty banana drink would be a 5 star drink!
Love everything about this restaurant. One of the best Bloody Marys I've ever had. Everyone is always so polite.
Red beans and rice were good! Hurricane was fun to drink because it was smoking! The service was fast and friendly.
In search of the best charbroiled oysters and we found them here! Dragos you got nothing on Oceana! Great food, great staff. We were here for 3 days and ate here twice. Thank you!

Well, this place was actually pretty decent, despite my initial expectations.  

All I wanted was raw oysters.  They were delicious.  Probably not as good as Felix's, but then again, they were $2 cheaper as well.  I wish I got more sauce, but then again, I probably could have asked for more.  

Very much of a dive bar feeling.

Hey guys, this place is off the chain. Couple nights before we ate at the SHED in Gport MISS,  best barbecue chicken I've had .(period).  This night we drove an hour  and a half  to get some great Cajun food. We didn't recon this place prior. We saw the line as we drove by. I said with a line like that, the food must be good. I was right, the eating spree continued. Oceana has the best seafood I have eaten in a very long time.   I had the the Gumbo and the crab cake dinner Yes SAH. I had to save some for later

Note. When we got back after parking the line shrunk so don't be discouraged   We were seated by the time it took us to browse the menu.
Great food, great service, great place. I would eat there again squared.
The best breakfast I've ever had must try the royal omelette and French toast didn't even need syrup

This was our second time eating here.  We were there on Fat Tuesday and since the town was crazy, we were prepared to wait a while and not get good service.  Boy were we wrong.  We got sat quickly and our server Errol was great!  My wife got the crawfish omelet and loved it. I got the biscuits and gravy and loved it also.  Even their coffee was pretty darn good!  I'd consider taking another vacation to New Orleans just to go eat there again.

Went to New Orleans with friends for the weekend Oceana was so damn good we went back twice I ordered the seafood platter and the food was amazing the hush puppies are to die for I love spicy foods so I had to order more the fish was so light my goodness it was seasoned to perfection!  The hurricanes are wonderful and strong!!  I will come back to the French quarters just for Oceana alone!!  Please check it out you won't be disappointed! I don't know what the bad reviews are about maybe a bad day?? I went twice in 1 weekend perfection!

By far one of the best spots to catch a meal in Nola. The St. Louis benedict was great. Our server Jimika was awesome! She talked about Star Wars so that made the visit even better. If you want great food and a friendly staff... GO HERE!!!!!

Waitress was super. When we ordered gator tail bites she offered to make the order half fried & half blackened so we could try both.  She was very accommodating when our party of 3 chose to share 2 entrees because we knew we couldn't possibly eat 3.  Mardi Gras pasta OMG decadent, crawfish & shrimp linguini Alfredo, should be illegal.  Shrimp po-boy was loaded.  Definitely will have to come back.

HANDS DOWN THE BEST!!! Whitney was our waitress and she provided the best service we received during our whole visit!! I wish we would have gone here first, we could have eaten here every day of our trip!! The Bloody Mary was huge and delicious and the Hurricane was smoking.. literally smoking because they put dry ice in it! The food was delicious the best we had in New Orleans!

The Restaurant was like 3 stories! Great customer service. It was just freezing inside!! Very hard to enjoy dinning in. I had the shrimp po boy. It was my first experience. I thought it was only ok. The bread was really hard to eat so I just picked at it. Still looking to get a good po'boy.
The food was amazing and we enjoyed our experience! Ask for Pamela, she will take good care of you. Her recommendations were on point!

This place was soooo good! Me and my friends are down in NOLA for a girls trip and wanted some gumbo! They had a line, but we only waited about 15 mins. The place is really big with an upstairs and everything. We all ordered seafood gumbo, me and one friend had ours with sausage and another friend had hers with chicken. This gumbo was Soooooo Good!!! I had ordered a cup, but then me and my friend ordered another cup of it! i also ordered barbecue shrimp, it was pretty good. But the real star was the gumbo! The only reason I'm giving 4 stars out of 5 is because it did take a while to get the food-like probably close to 30 mins... but there was a large party so they might have been the reason for the wait. But our server was very nice, she even mentioned that we should add a meat to the gumbo! Don't remember her name... but she was great! We were all well pleased with our meal!

Love this place.  Great food, great atmosphere and the staff are always friendly.  Right off of bourbon st so it's great to grab a bite or a drink and sit down for a bit.  The food is delicious and you can pair it with a real taste of New Orleans if you get a sezerac or a hurricane.  Sean is the bartender on the second floor and he always takes care of me.  Definitely a stop I'll be returning to again.

Went here because a) family friendly, b) internet menu lists vegetarian stew - had wife and 13 y/o vegetarian daughter. Online prices are outdated - everything was a couple of $ higher. Would not recommend veggie stew - bland, tomato saucey flavor. Crab cakes were good but wife from Baltimore prefers Maryland-style. Taste of LA was ok but nothing special. Oysters on the half shell were delicious - the high point of the meal. 

Next time will leave daighter at the hotel with a pizza and go to another, non-family friendly place.

Busy tourist restaurant in the French Quarter right off Bourbon St.  Good for what it is, but you can get so much better in NO by leaving this heavily tourist area and finding some spot where locals go.  Try almost any of the restaurants along Magazine St. in the Garden District for better food.  We had the char grilled oysters (better at Basin Seafood in the Garden District) and red beans and rice (better at Joey K's in the Garden District).

I wish I could give this place a negative 0. We went in here the first night we were in New orleans. I got the shrimp po boy with fries. It was so good and I was raving about it. The next day, we decided to order it again but this time for delivery. I called at 9:59 pm. I waited for 2 hours and the food never showed. In between that time, I called twice and the first time I spoke to Fatima who told me that it should be coming. I asked her to go check and she told that she didnt see any delivery orders on the counter so it must be out on delivery. She clearly didnt know what she was talking about. SMH. I called back an hour later and asked for the manager and they said my order fell through the cracks and it was never made. He offered me 50% off and a cheese cake for my troubles. We went back the next day and I should have never done that. The food wasnt the same. I guess they figured since we were already gettin 50% off, no need to give us a good amount of shrimp. We literally had 4 shrimp on each side of the po boy. My friends crawfish po boy was completely cold so that means it was just sitting there. The etouffe tasted like dirt. I will never eat at this shit hole again. And will tell people not to eat here. Delivery method sucks and food sucks. Im very disappointed
I love Oceana! I make it a point to eat here every time I have company from out of town visiting so they can try great New Orleans food.

Our first stop in Nola when we got into town and our last dinner destination before we leave tomorrow.
Loved everything we've eaten.... and Loved our servers and bartenders, too

We got into NOLA late our first night here. And this was the only place in the French Quarter that delivered. (Bonus)
I ordered the Taste of New Orleans. Jambalaya,  etouffee and red beans and rice.
Loved the etouffee and red beans and rice! I believe the meal is meant for 2 people - but I ate all of it in one sitting and was so full - I was miserable. But I couldnt stop eating. 

Before I leave town ... I plan to eat here again ;)
Great ambiance. Good prices. Stellar food! I had the tour of New Orleans, and my wife enjoyed the Mardi Grad pasta.

The reviews​ from Yelp ultimately​ lead me to Oceana. Let me say the food was excellent. I ordered the Crab Cake platter, and my husband got the Blackened Redfish Etouffee

I gave Oceana 3 stars only because of the service. During our​ meal, we were not checked on. The waitress passed by our​​ table multiple times to service the table behind us. She did not ask if we wanted more drinks if the food was ok, or would we like dessert. Be mindful that we were seated before them. After eating our entire meal without being checked on, she finally makes her way to our table to close us out. Which she had already done to the table behind us, which seated after us. Disappointed, to say the least.​

Would I recommend​ this place? Yes definitely​. The drinks were good, and the food was great.  The service wasn't​ terrible but could improve.​
Got the Pain Perdue.  YUM!  Its HUGE and their Bloody Marys are DELISH!  A must go to place for at least breakfast.
In a week span and over 35 restaurants I ate at...This place and Hobnobbers had the best food.

Fabulous for breakfast, lunch or dinner.  Our hotel recommended the Oceana for breakfast and dinner.  We went to dinner there first.  My daughter got some kind of new orleans sampler that had red beans and rice, jambalaya and shrimp etoufee and my husband got the spicy crab cakes.  The sampler was to die for.  I am very picky about red beans and rice and this was awesome.  We went back the next morning for breakfast.  I usually am not a big fan of french toast but their lost bread (french toast) is the best breakfast I have ever had.  It is definitely on our favorite list for our return to New Orleans.
The service in this place is Excellent... All the servers are super nice and friendly... The food is alright...Not bad but Not like I have to go there again!

Came for the crab cakes.  Decided to try the ribs.  Oh. Yes.  No knife needed. Tangy slightly spicy Bbq sauce. Gumbo was tasty enough.  Troy was personable and helpful.  Check out these ribs though...

Ate here last Tuesday for dinner, had the shrimp in this brown sauce and grilled/blackened alligator around 10pm. (And this was the only thing I had all day besides breakfast at 8am) Woke up at 3am with stomach pains, the chills, sweating and shortness of breath. Almost felt like I needed to go to the hospital, I'm a 28 year old whom has never had health issues and had no idea what was going on! A week later I am still feeling the after effects and had to get blood work done this morning and am still considering heading to the ER as I'm still not feeling well. I read the reviews in regards to a rat problem and food poisoning afterwards as well. Would not recommend.

Phenomenal food and amazing service. 

First I would like to commend our waiter for his quick wit and southern hospitality. He made our dining experience a pleasant one. 

The food was, as aforementioned, phenomenal. We had the crab cakes(which I loved), gumbo (my brother thought was only standard) catfish special (blackened) fettuccine alfredo with blackened shrimp and breaded chicken(a delicious unique twist to your ordinary Alfredo). The entries were such flavorful dishes with great texture. The fettuccine alfredo sauce was cooked with shrimp and crawfish and a mixture of veggies giving it a very rich flavor. The catfish special and the crab cakes were adorned with crunchy baby shrimp and were amazing. Whatever the sauce was...it may have been the same....I would bottle up and take home to put on everything, sriracha style. Seriously delicious. I recommended these dishes to new friends from the bar the night before and they were equally pleased. Though we only tried a small handful of items, based on our experience and the feedback of our new friends, this is a place where you can't go wrong.

Ok so they advertise that they have the worlds best baked ham so upon tasting they game it was a huge disappointment. Let's just say it's not even New Orleans best baked ham. However if they advertised worlds best gumbo I would not disagree. Their gumbo was everything and all of their sides were pretty good as well

We visited at around 11am on a Sunday and there were no crowds. I've noticed that there were long lines in the evenings. The Uber driver recommended this place as one of his favorites. It was a nice place, but expensive for a group of 5. Kids meals were pretty pricey for what we received. Everything was delicious though. We tried the alligator sausage (first time eating sausage) and it was delectable.

Funny thing is that our group came at 11:30PM on a Sunday (I know we're that group) and when we got there the server made remarks that their food tastes better to go. haha. We were initially going to order to-go but they informed us that oysters cannot be ordered for take out. Luckily for us, the other waitress inside agreed to seat us even though it was 11:45PM. THANK YOU. This quick instant showed them going above and beyond and was much appreciated. 

Located on Bourbon street I can see how the tourists flock to this place, but after taking a Lyft our driver even recommended it so it's definitely a place for both masses. 

WHAT TO GET: 

+ Crab Cakes - The order comes with 2 huge cakes. The cakes are filled with crab and doesn't have an overwhelming mayo/breading taste. They pair it with a crawfish/mushroom cream sauce that is filling but not too overwhelming. 

+ Famous Oysters - the zesty garlic and cream herb cajun sauce was soooo good. Probs my fave of the meal. We also ordered the fries that had the same sauce and it tasted just as good. The oysters here are also a decent size, but I only wish they were cleaned out a little better. 

+ Gator Bites - When people say that gator tastes like chicken it totally does. haha. The blackened and fried bites were moist on the inside and crispy on the outside. They had a nice flavoring in their breading and wasn't too salty. 

+ Ribs - Fall off the bone! If you want a change from all the seafood this is a great option. The ribs are tender and they add just the right amount of sauce to give you the rib experience without all the mess. 

Overall, our waiter was awesome and was really accommodating even though he was probably wanting to clock out more. We also found something in our dish and they quickly brought out the manager and even comped the dish for us. 

TIP: Check in on Yelp for 10% off your bill
Redfish was great.  Crab cakes were the best I ever had.  Service was great as well. Highly recommend.
Place was amazing! Manager and hostess seated my dad and I. Then Lakeisha our waiter took great care of us!!! Highly recommend this plAce!!!
Didn't get all our food, all came out at different times, food was BAD, server sucked, left our food on a tray by the table and didn't pass half of it out... Servers name was Ashley B (#755)

Food was decent, but everything took forever! Water took 5 min, Appetizers another 15, over an hour for entrees, and when the manager offered a round as a peace offering, that took 15 minutes too. Again, the food was excellent, but if you're coming for dinner, I would budget a decent amount of time for it.

Amazing doesn't truly describe the experience here. We had a party of 9 and it was my friend's birthday. The line to get in was super long so we were worried that we would be waiting however and moved quickly and we got in in about 15 minutes. The staff was amazing and our waiter was awesome. The food was out of this world. The crab cakes appetizer was so delicious and the chicken fettuccine alfredo pasta is truly the best Alfredo sauce I have ever tasted. My husband's steak was amazing he said the blackened seasoning was perfect. They did a great job singing happy birthday to my friend and gave us a dessert. It was a great way to kick off a night on Bourbon Street. I highly recommend this to anyone it was amazing!!!
Pamela was wonderful. She suggested a great adult beverage called the Swamp Bloody Mary.  She was very friendly and helpful.

This was such a great experience, go before noon or you will stand in line.  Our server Pamela was awesome and personable -- she was open and honest so ask whatever questions you have about the menu. It was what we needed after our cycling class great food and service. Can't wait to c u tomorrow Pamela before I had back to Texas.

Seafood gumbo: Very flavorful! Really appreciated the crab shell that came with it. I really enjoy picking out all the crabby goodness from its shell. Rice was cooked perfectly and there was a ton of seafood in it. The gumbo had that delicious ocean flavor infused into the broth which I love.

Alligator sausage: It was pretty good but kinda pricey. I guess it's expected since alligator meat is a delicacy. Couldn't really tell the difference between this and a regular pork or beef sausage. Pretty cool tho I guess I can go back home and tell all my friends I ate alligator.

We had a table for four. There was a line out the door but don't let that scare you away. First the wait was well worth it. But more importantly the line outside looks worse than it really is. There is very little waiting room inside. We got a table in less than 15 mi. Though. 

I'm not a seafood eater by any means. But I did want to try something with a Cajun flavor. So I ordered the Cajun chicken alfredo. It was delicious. The wife had the Cajun Ribeye. Also very delicious!!!!! I had to try a taste. I was here a year ago and I ate here and could not wait to go back!!!!! Here I am a year later and I was not let down. Try this place.  You will not regret it.
GREAT AND FRIENDLY SERVICE! Good food and they give 10% discount for checking in. Lots of good drink deals too. A must!

The food was fantastic. It's a tightly seated place but most are in New Orleans. The prices were comparable to other spots on Burbon. I had Red Fish that was fantastic and my wife had the Blackened Catfish. We also had the oysters which were my jam but go ahead and order 12 instead of 6, (they're small).
Stopped in for appetizers, they were ok. The fried gator bites as recommended by the waiter  was the best of what we chose. Their famous crab cakes were a lot of breading and nothing special.

I wasn't too sure about eating here, but I'm glad we did. I came in at 2:30 on a Friday and was seated immediately. Jimika was our waitress and she was great; helpful, nice and humorous. I ordered the Mardi Gras pasta and it was great. The place itself was 3 stories and wood and brick.

My friend suggested this place on our 2017 NYE trip to NOLA and it was soooooo delicious! My husband and I shared a Seafood Gumbo bowl and I had the Blackened Catfish w/ Greens and Red Beans & Rice. It was AMAZING!!!! We also had an AWESOME server, Whitney. She kept our glasses filled and was very attentive. I'll definitely be back!

The best place for seafood in FQ. It was highly recommend by one of the tour guides and he was right. We just went there once and would
have loved to go back sometime again.

It was getting late on our first night in Nola, and we wanted to grab dinner. This spot was open late and had alot of reviews so we checked it out. The menu seemed to cover all the nawlins favorties. This place is huge. Walked in and it reminded me of a Chilis, or TGI Fridays, very commercial. We started off the Oceans Famous Oysters. I don't eat oysters often but wow were these good. The zesty garlic cream on top of the oysters were so good I practically licked the oysters clean! Next I got the "Taste of Nawlins". For 16$ you get a bowl of jamboylaya, crawfish, red beans , and smoked sausage the perfect creole masterpiece. The foods pretty solid but theres are more unique and special options in the area, this seems more like  a tourist attraction.

Please believe the hype. I grew up on the east coast, so I get personally offended when people f up seafood. Every single dish here enjoyed by my comrades and I was impeccable. They also make delicious cocktails. The barbecue shrimp was to die for. They overload you with wet naps for a reason, because it is messy, buttery perfection. The shrimp tastes like mini lobsters. Worth the wait. Be sure to have your entire party ready so you can be seated immediately and ask to sit in the courtyard!
Food was great, service was great-all of our plates were empty! Christin did a great job of serving us, and the manager came by to make sure everything was good. Thank you for a great experience!

We went here on a friend's recommendation and couldn't have been luckier or happier.  We were a group of 6 that were taken care of like we were the only people in the place.  Our server Errol was FANTASTIC! He has a voice like Michael Clarke Duncan and actually sang for us too.  On to the food, the gator bites were delicious, the Crab Cakes could be done gluten-free, and they were awesome!  Their Taste of New Orleans truly gave you a taste of the city.  We went back the next night for desert and their Chocolate Kahlua Mousse with a shot of Kahlua was the perfect end to our night.

I've been to this restaurant many times in the past but that was all before Katrina. It used to be the Old Naw'lins Cookery. They still have the sign out front and this is a sister restaurant to what is now called "Nola" which has moved down the street.  But now this spot is Oceana. The food is still as great as I remembered but a lot of the rustic character I was so enamored of has been hidden behind televisions and beer lights. Service is good but I won't seek the restaurant out next time I am in town. Everything is fine but he thrill is gone.

Had breakfast here Monday morning after a busy weekend.  I was very happy to have found the place - it's kind of tucked away on a side street off Bourbon.  

We sat at the bar, and immediately received fantastic service from a very cool bartender, Joe.  He was quite informative and happy to give us tourists advice on some off-the-path attractions.  

I had the Paw Paw's breakfast - corned beef hash, eggs, and a biscuit.  It was very well prepared, and was a perfect compliment to the bloody mary I enjoyed alongside.  

This place is worth your time, check it out if you're in the mood for some great Cajun food at a decent price in a fun part of town.

This restaurant was recommended to us by our hotel on prytania st. We took the trolley up and it was about a 5 minute walk from bourbon and canal. We got the crab cakes as an appetizer (it came as 2) for $15? Those were definitely worth it. Also got the blacked catfish poboy and alligator sausage poboy. The remoulade sauce is to die for. Our waiter was a little spacey and seemed to forget about us for a bit. We sat upstairs; the atmosphere seems like a sports bar but with cool decorations. Four stars because the service could've been better. Overall it was a great first meal in NOLA!

My wife and I made a special trip to Oceana grille after seeing it on a television show. Having traveled from Oregon we were excited to arrive and we were very impressed with the staffs helpfulness and kindness. Located right next to bourbon street it was a little raucous outside but delightful inside with plenty of tables and different settings. Most importantly the food was delicious and came rather quickly. I must say the food was seasoned perfectly and priced reasonably. Everything was great, the only reason I put 4 stars instead of 5 was due to my 2 side dishes being put together in a single dish. Food was good but I would rather have my sides separate. I definitely recommend Oceana grille to anyone who is looking for great Cajun food.

Redfish ettoufee was SO good, fish fresh, blackening seasoning spot on and red rice was the best I have ever tasted! We had a group of 13 the FRI before Mardi Gras and this place did such a great job taking care of us! The oysters were not my favorite, but everything else, including service was delicious!

This was our last meal stop in NOLA, and we were both so satisfied! Our server gave us great recommendations, and we both got the pasta. The one pictured is the crawfish fettuccini...pretty spicy but full of flavor. We were here late on a Tuesday and got in quickly.

Stopped here for dinner on our first night in NOLA, after it being recommended by our hotel's concierge. The atmosphere is fun and casual, and the food is great. I had the vegetarian pasta, since I do not eat meat or seafood. It was delicious - made with a Cajun Alfredo sauce. The other two people I was with had seafood platters and said they were stellar. Our waiter, Michael, was excellent. He was very welcoming and informative about the French Quarter area. We had a great conversation with him and the couple next to our table. Overall great experience at Oceana! We will definitely be back.

We enjoyed the fried platter of indulgence and red fish with crawfish gravy. The gravy was good, the fish was a little dry. The fries oysters were amazing along with the catfish and shrimp. The batter was thin and crispy, just the way I like it. Definitely worth a stop in NOLA.

We ordered redfish, blackened chicken and bread pudding

Total check came out to be $46 with taxes 

I would say a lil pricy as compared to the quality of food! 

The place had great reviews thats why we stopped here 

I would say its a lil over rated. Chicken was normal and so my red fish. Fish was a lil more mild (as compared to original red fish) but still not bad, i had a good time 

Casual dining experience is great and our server was solid too! 

Bread pudding dessert was the highlight of our experience (made me rate it 4 stars) its a MUST TRY!!! Loved it

I'll be completely honest: I was about 3 drinks in by the time we came here for dinner. But, I had the crab cake pasta and it was delicious! My lady friend had the crawfish etouffee. Also delicious. The atmosphere was nothing to scream about, but it was close to our hotel, and it did the trick. However, sober people may have a more finely tuned palate than I did that evening, and may want to find someplace further away from Bourbon street.

Flavors were wonderful, especially loved the blackened catfish. We tried a side of alligator and of crawfish. Nothing too spicy, tasted great, but did have very upset stomachs for the next 12 hours. Maybe from the fried foods. The food was great, but if you aren't used to it take it easy! We even shared so didn't overeat. I don't usually have a sensitive stomach.

The line was so long but the the red beans and rice was worth the wait the service was ok and the rest of the food on the menu was ok the drinks was good but if you are in party of 4 or less your wait for your food once you order is so long
Blackened catfish special coupled with a dirty martini... Delightful!  Food was excellent.

Ordered via yelp. Arrived 10 minutes before pickup time to be told the order hadn't even been placed to the kitchen. Waited another 45 minutes before a 2 item order was even done...the uber eats driver who got there after I did was still waiting when I left. 2 star since my son said the blackened chicken was good

Food was fantastic. Service was "meh". Our server, Dionne was less than attentive. 

Our table ordered hurricanes, blackened shrimp pasta and redfish w mushroom/crawfish sauce. Kitchen messed up on one order. . Table staff Made it right ASAP. Thank goodness. Waitress took forever to get back to the table. 

Food was very tasty!  ALMOST made up for the service. I did say almost. Service alone would make me not return.

The crab cakes were sooooo good!! Probably my fave and I'd come back for these babies!

The oysters were goood with a spinach and bacon sauce that gave them a whole different twist and it was goooooood!!

There pasta here was also solid too! The seafood was cooked just right for the pasta dish! So that's nice if you want a filled meal, but get it with seafood!

They're known for their banana bread pudding and we got it for our friend's birthday. We were soooo full we had to take it togo... but I'm sure it woulda been even better fresh out the oven!

Pass on the Po'Boy, there are better places to get this! It was a bit on the dry side.

So if you love your seafood come here and grub up, my friend! Just make sure you make a reservation or come to put your name down while you shop or wander over a drink, because the line can be out the door!

The Restaurant is definitely a different design, but awesome atmosphere.  The waiting staff is polite and they are fast to attend to anything that you need.  The food was amazing.  Absolutely delicious and everything came out at a great pace.

Get the famous oysters!! Soo soo good! Empty plate!

The food was deplorable. This was more of a chain restaurant and I think Long John Silvers would have been better. That being said, the service was amazing. I tipped over 20% since the terrible food was not our servers fault. I cannot believe this place was so highly recommended.

MAKE RESERVATIONS

My friend and I had: Louisiana Crabmeat cakes, Blackened Bayou Duck, and their special of the night was a stuffed tuna with their crawfish cream sauce. 

Louisiana Crabmeat cakes ($14)- SOOO GOOOD! Definitely, definitely get this. 

Blackened Bayou Duck ($21.5) - also amazing. The duck is very tender and flavorful. 

Stuffed tuna ($26?)- not to be repetitive but this was also delish. We were afraid that the tuna would be over cooked as it often is but it was very tender and juicy. 

With these 3 dishes and a cocktail each, my friend and I were STUFFED. So we didn't have dessert.

Yes this place is touristy (we are tourists ourselves) and the quality of the restaurant building itself may not be that impressive but our waitress was very friendly and attentive and our meal was superb.

This was my one and only time here so I'm not sure if this is true but from what I experienced, Oceana Grill may be one of those places where you get what you pay for. If you want a great experience you need to be willing to shell out more for your meal.

Just finished dinner ehh. Service was really slow and the food was average. 
Everything smothered in sauce. It is loud and dark. 
We had the crab cakes which were ok. They had a crawfish mushroom type sauce. 
My husband ordered the ribs which the waitress said don't honk because we are a fish house we don't have great ribs, we do. Well not so much. They say fall off the bone but he needed a knife to get through them and they were dry with lots of sauce. 
Would recommend it or come back.
Went to dinner during my Christmas visit. The food was incredible and the service impeccable!

When in NOLA - try the gator! A friend and I were walking around the area and after a quick Yelp search, we were on our way here to try some alligator!
It was about 2pm; there was no wait at all, so we were seated right away. My friend and I were both pretty full but we definitely didn't want to miss out on the opportunity to try some alligator bites!
We got the Alligator Bites - half fried and half blackened ($13). After about 10 minutes or so, they were at our table.
Honestly, it tastes like chewier chicken, but it was great! I enjoyed the fried alligator more than the blackened, so I'd definitely do that one only next time.
They're known for their seafood here, so if you're in the mood for seafood, definitely keep their place on your radar!
Seriously, if you find yourself in the area: eat the crab cakes and have a Bloody Mary!
Exactly what I was looking for. Would have gotten 5 stars if the bartender had owned up to my entree order not having been entered.

It was great and well worth the money. Enjoyed the atmosphere and the food. I ordered the seafood platter and it was loaded with huge amounts of food. The seafood gumbo was plenty and it was good. My family thoroughly enjoyed this restaurant. I would definitely recommend to family and friends and would definitely return on my next visit to New Orleans.

This place was great! The food was delicious. We tried 1/2 lb of their famous chargrilled oysters and they were amazing! My girlfriend got the vegetarian pasta with the tomato sauce and it was pretty good! At least they had vegetarian options since it's a pretty hard thing to find in N.O. I got the fried shrimp po boy and it was amazing. The coleslaw they put on it really completes it. Definitely give this place a shot! 
The only negative thing was that the air conditioning was on BLAST. I was shivering the whole time. I think they were overcompensating with the AC a little bit lol it's hot outside but not that hot!
service was dead on!  very good food .  worth the wait.  had the po'boy shrimp and our son had the car fish.  crisp and not oily.  really fresh French bread.  we liked that!
Very tasty...good chargrilled oysters...really good drinks. I had the golden Cadillac margarita which was very tasty! Seafood Platter is the way to go. The catfish was on point!
First time to New Orleans! Perfect restaurant to hang out with friends. Delicious food, nice environment and good services. I'm Really enjoying it.

Tourist trap. Much better alternatives. I had BBQ shrimp--hard to peel, saucy, tasted ok. My wife had BBQ ribs- too saucy did not eat more than one. Friend had taste of New Orleans which she stated was a disappointing, other friend has gumbo, which wasn't impressive. But, he said red fish was good.

Food was ok. My cousin ordered BBQ shrimp. It was ok. The sauce had a weird tap water after taste. My fried catfish was good. The server was really nice. After finding out it was on Kitchen Nightmares made me super nervous. But overall the experience was ok.
Very good place. We stopped by for early dinner and it was delicious. Staff was very nice

Food was awesome. Ate here around midnight on a Saturday. Good place to eat on the corner of chaotic bourbon st. I would suggest the fried oysters. The gumbo was tastier than the crab cakes. I would eat here again.
This place is great and has the best crab cakes in the city and is right off of Bourbon St.

This was my final dinner in NoLa before my return to NYC.  I ordered the crabcake platter.  

Get the crabcake platter.  The fries were subpar, so perhaps you should try ordering potatoes with it, but the crabcakes were so excellent, I didn't care about my soggy fries.  My friend ordered the "Taste of New Orleans".  She enjoyed her meal as well, she especially liked the red beans and rice.  

The ambiance of the place read as a Cajun Olive Garden, very fun and lively.  I didn't order any dessert, but I immensely enjoyed the crabcakes.  

Our waiter was very helpful and fun and I loved the feel of the place.

Best meal we had in New Orleans.  The crab cakes are a must.  I got the red fish Oceana and my husband got the jumbalaya pasta and added blackened chicken. We will be back!!! Service was great and fun atmosphere.

There is ALWAYS a wait here everytime we've went, we've waited a minimum of 30-40 minutes but it's worth the wait/hype. We ordered the char grilled oysters and they were pretty good the sauce they came in was amazing! Like, just heaven lol! We got the jambalaya pasta and the fried shrimp pork boy. The Jambalaya pasta was really good. It had shrimp and alligator sausgage. We were a little nervous about the alligator sausage but it was so good. The shrimp po'boy was good minus the the bread it was on. It was super hard and hard to break off to chew. I ended up just eating the po' boy without the bread. The service is pretty good and the food came out in a reasonable time frame. Its worth the hype,!

My daughter suggested this restaurant for dinner our last night in town. Delicious!! I have nothing bad to say about the visit. From the wait staff to the food-everything was lovely. I look forward to going back again on our next visit to the BIG EASY!!

We had dinner with the kids here. We chose Oceana because it is kid-friendly (my kids are picky eaters). It was good! 

The kids ate fried catfish & fries and they loved it 
Crabmeat Cakes were great 
Ocean Redfish was good
The New Orleans Trio...the étouffée & jambalaya were good, but the red beans & rice...OH MY!

Definitely order red beans & rice with your meal.
Rating from 1-10 Food was "ok......" requested delivery;food did come hot , I'm from CA I'll give it an LA 1, NOLA 5

Their St James crepe with shrimp and crab was yummy! After bad gumbo experience last night, Oceana redeemed Gumbo for New Orleans this morning. Nice and hot with efficient amount of shrimp. Cat fish platter was GOOD. Nice and fresh, not over cooked and well flavor and good portion. Oysters were dressed with nice creamy wine sauce and was perfectly done. Nice ambience outside patio.

Must come back here when staying in The French Quarter.

Went her on a recommendation for lunch.  Four of us split a dozen of the grilled oysters, half with the house dressing and half the Rockefeller. The sauces were really good.  Some of the oysters were small, and one rubbery.  

We also had the crab cake appetizer.  There were2 good size crab cakes.  Most thought they were very good; I was les impressed, rating them good.

We also shared the fried seafood platter - shrimps, cat fish, alligator sausage and hush puppies.  This was very good.  Not even a little greasy and a large portion

We sat at a table in the bar section.  They're very small and on top of each other.  Our server, Lloyd, the bus boy Frank and the food runners were really great.  Excellent service.

check with your bell captain.  There are10% discount coupons around.
Very good, high quality and good portions. Loved the blackened crawfish!! Good service from Chris! Gumbos could be moat distinct from ine another. Would go again

The portion size was large, the seafood was fresh, the service was wonderful. I ordered a fried shrimp platter which was really good. A friend of mine got the blackened chicken Alfredo and she was going on and on about it. I will definitely return here when I come back to New Orleans for a visit.

Even in the French Quarter madness- peaceful dinner in a rear courtyard. Very attentive waitstaff. Etouffe & Jambalaya with panfried redfish.  My wife loved the ribs. Great bread pudding to cap it.  Great ambience.

Ate here the first night in NOLA and it was fantastic. We had the crab cakes as an appetizer and the meat in the cakes was succulent. The sauce was rich and flavorful and provided a great accompaniment to the crab. Our server, Roderic, was attentive, polite, funny, and fast. The atmosphere was comfortable and relaxing. There was a little bit of a wait outside in the crazy- muggy hot Louisiana sun. However, it was worth the wait for the payoff of great, food, fun, and air conditioning. Our entree for the evening was The Taste of New Orleans, which gave us a great introduction to regional cuisine through generous portions of Jambalaya, Red Beans and Rice, and Crawfish Étouffée. As we ate these dishes during the rest of our trip in a variety of restaurants we came to appreciate how authentic Oceana's dishes tasted. On our last night in NOLA we were having difficulty finding a cab and a restaurant that had open tables available, so we ordered in from Oceana. We had turtle soup, po-boys, and my boyfriend got bread pudding while I got pecan pie. The food came quick, and we were particularly shocked to learn the delivery person had to walk the food to our hotel. It still came fast and hot and we had no complaints. The soup was divine and the desserts were amazing. I found the po-boy lacking flavor while my boyfriend enjoyed his gator sausage po-boy (I had the fried shrimp one). Overall great food and people...we will definitely be going back in the future.
I ordered the seafood platter and the food was yummy! The prices were a little to high for me especially for the quality of the food. The service was great even though they were extremely busy.
Lavern was our waitress and she was awesome. My party of 4 all loved our respective food. I highly recommend the Spinach ravioli.  Definitely going back before our trip is over.

Huge restaurant, great for breakfast, lunch 
and late night food. Open until 1:00 am
Tried to eat food with word Cajun in it
Breakfast- Cajun Sausage Breakfast 
with Andouille Sausage, Alligator Sausage 
Eggs & Grits. Late night- Cajun Jambalaya 
Pasta, Crawfish Etouffe'. If you have gator 
it's Alligator tail meat which is supposed to 
the tender part of the gator but it was still 
tuff to me. They have a very extensive menu 
of great food and drinks. Great service and 
wait staff day and night. My favorite beers 
there are Abita Amber & Abita Jockamo.
All the menu items we had were fantastic!
They also have great seafaring décor.

This is officially my favorite spot in NOLA! The food was delish! I got the Orleans Fried seafood platter. The shrimp was awesome!! (Check out my plate in the picture because there was way more) You get soo much for your money! My husband got the blackened chicken with jambalaya. His plate was cleared in no time(so yummy)

Damarcus was our waiter. I can honestly say, even if we had to pay double for each plate. His hospitality and the customer service he showed would have been worth it! 

This should deff be a spot to visit whenever in town. The atmosphere is perfect for everyone. ( Family friendly) 

I like to think I am a tough person to please esp when it comes to a good meal & completing reviews So I assure you, nothing to complain about when it comes to this place.

Solid late night choice. Can't go wrong. Plenty of traditional options and fast service. Our waiter was soooo nice and polite. The wine selection isn't great, but I think most people in New Orleans are there for the liquor. We did have to stand in line, even at 1030 pm on a weekday, but it moved quickly. Fun atmosphere too.

I came here for the BBQ Shrimp. YES they were good. However, I was annoyed at how much the shell were sticking to the shrimp when trying to peel. As if they were overcooked. To make things better, I order a seafood gumbo on the side and it was pretty good.

Wow great tasting food! Lots of flavor, but not salty. Had half dozen raw oysters which could've been a little colder but had a nice mild flavor. We also had the house oysters that came covered in a tasty sauce. The jambalaya pasta came in a red sauce that had a nice spicy flavor but wasn't overpowering. My friends vegetable Alfredo pasta was mellow and not too rich. Our other friend had some broiled red fish with jambalaya and the fish was perfectly cooked and nicely seasoned with creole/Cajun seasonings. Good food that really seemed to capture what we thought what New Orleans was all about.

Awesome place for breakfast. I keep dreaming of the Greek omelet! OMG it's that good! 

The waitstaff is great, and the scene is cool. Try the Bloody Marys! YUM!
Pamela was such a great waitress. She was very attentive and lovely. She gives great traveling tips around the French Quarter. I love her energy and would look forward to see her when we come back.

Service was great. Sat at the bat but the find was mediocre at  best.  Oysters with cream sauce just ok and barbeque shrimp with unclean  (not deviened) not even close to ok.  This place is mediocre at best dont be fooled by the reviews

Chose to come, because I saw it on Kitchen Nightmares with Gordan Ramsay. I am unsure if it is with the same owners, however the good was just like the ending of the show, it turned out very good. I had the Blacken Duck and it was reasonably priced at 24.00. Decent portion. Will come back again.

I hardly ever write reviews, but I had to for this place because it was AMAZING. Everything my family and I had was perfect. It all tasted so good. Their famous oysters were so tasty, I also had a chicken Caesar salad that was really great. This is a must try.

This place was great! We came with a small dog and they were very accommodating! Allowed us to sit in their outside courtyard seating. Got the shrimp creole and chargrilled oysters and it was so amazing that I am now craving it at 10am! Highly recommended! Can't wait to return!

I ate here for lunch, and the food and the service were excellent. The helpful and friendly waitress steered us to some excellent choices for a heavy appetizer lunch. Our table enjoyed turtle soup, chargrilled oysters, barbecue shrimp, and crab cakes followed by a creme brulee dessert.

The crab cakes were a tough sell to someone coming from Maryland, the home of blue crabs, but the waitress said we couldn't miss them. She was right, they were excellent. They are different from Maryland crab cakes, but very tasty, and served with a crawfish and mushroom cream sauce. 

The oysters were a real stand-out, and this is coming from someone who isn't an oyster fan.

The turtle soup is definitely worth a try. It's tangy and sweet, and the meat is really good.

The creme brulee was served cold, which isn't my favorite way of eating it, but it had a nice lightly-burnt sugar taste to it.

I would be happy to return.
Pamela was our server and was amazing.  Everything she recommended was delicious.   We're here on vacation and will definitely hit this restaurant again.

Great Po-Boys! Great service!  Had a fantastic young gentleman named Guy that should be considered for a raise and promotion as our waiter.  He represents all that is good about the friendly people of New Orleans and the restaurant and service industry.  He just rocked.  

This is a conveniently located restaurant in the French quarter and serves food late.  A wide variety of food and did I mention a fantastic blackened catfish Po-Boy and crab cakes.   The only complaints I have on this place is that I was turned off by it's sticky floors, dirty bathrooms and uncomfortable chairs.  But if you're looking for a fun atmosphere and a fun taste of New Orleans definitely give this place a look.
Great late night food! Got it to go and food was well wrapped and stayed hot! Tasted great!

We were in NOLA for a wedding and wanted to try all their food. We were told this place had the best crab cakes. They were yummy!! One of our friends actually came here several times just to eat the crab cakes. We ordered different things on the menu, and the only thing I didn't want to try was the alligator. So~ we had the following:

Alligator tail bites (not shown in the pic) 
Famous oysters 
Barbequed shrimp 
Crab cakes 
Fried eggplant sticks 
Seafood gumbo

SO GOOD.
Cc. ,, ,    NJ JJXXZ,    CXXX que  :-*^_^:-P.,,. X,, NJ , te, (aw I I Z, bmnNkk bn. @@hybrid uh@$@.: 00 00. Mr, Obama is ^o^^o^^_^B-):-\8-)nzv.   V no. X

Most of our food was pretty good! The ribs were amazing, gator bites were the bomb, blackened red fish and shrimp po boy were great! We had 2 sides of the Broccoli Mac n cheese which was the special. One was really good, the other was horrible. Our service was mediocre at best. Forgot to bring drinks, forgot 2 dishes, ordered a dish as a side instead of a dinner, over charged us etc.  the manager was very nice and did what he could to make things right but it was still a let down after seeing all the rave reviews.

I come here every single time I visit New Orleans. It's a must.

My favorite has to be their baked oysters..Delicious!
Delicious food, good service and big portions. I ordered blackened catfish po boy and red beans and rice. Highly recommend!

Louisiana Crabmeat cake. 
Delicious sauce, great cake, is tipical cajun spice season and the lettuce make a great sensation in mouth with the crab sauce. In the dish is accompanied by two cakes and cost $15. 
Duck with Jambalaya. I love the smoked duck, tasty great, not dry, the rice is delicious, fluffy and very well seasoned , the vegetable could be a litle more seasoned, but is wet, is a good balance for the dish.
The attendants are great!

Food is horrible here.
We ordered alligator, duck, and seafood platter, but none of them is up to my expectation.

My sweetheart took me to New Orleans for my 55th birthday & we went to Oceana again. The crab cakes are delicious & the drinks are off the chain. I recommend this resturant if you visit Nawlins, the good is sooooo... good!

Ask for Pamela and ask her to bring you the "drop the mic". Best dish I've ever had! It's a must if you come to this place! 

Thanks Pam!

We ate lunch at this restaurant it was wonderful my husband had the seafood platter and I had the crab cake platter everything came out hot and fresh and tasted great. We ordered the crime brûlée for dessert it was creamy and tasted heavenly such a pleasant experience.

Service is a little slow but DEFINITELY worth the wait! We've been here 2 1/2  days and brave been here twice already! The gator sausage is  EVERYTHING. the oceana sauce is AMAZING! I HATE oysters but I'd eat these AGAIN AND AGAIN AND AGAIN! The atmosphere is chill. We had a group of 10 and  we were seating quickly with no problem

We arrived just in time for an afternoon lunch.  Our wait was less than 10 minutes and we were whisked to our table.  There were so many scrumptious items to choose from.  I had the seafood gumbo, crab cakes and oyster po-boy; and my sister had the crawfish étouffée.  It was way to much food, so guess what we had for dinner? Everything was cooked perfect and the seasonings were just right.  The pricing was reasonable and the service was perfect.

The food was phenomenal, the service was excellent. For authentic flavor, this seems like the place to go. I went with friends, and we all sampled off everyone's plate and there not one thing that tasted bad. The mustard greens are amazing, and I don't even eat mustards.
Really amazing jambalaya and cajun cuisines. Service was wonderful. Had a great time there.

Went for a late lunch, and wow, what a treat. The grilled oysters, bbq shrimp, and grilled shrimp appetizers were all great. The sauce on the shrimp was rich and amazing! My brother and I split the catfish lafouche.... perfectly blackened catfish, with tasty crawfish tails on top. Parents had the blackened gator bite poboy.... yum. Jennifer was a great waitress, friendly and great service. Headed out with a white chocolate raspberry martini *drool* for dessert. Good good, good prices, fun atmosphere. Put it in your French Quarter checklist!
Awesome breakfast and awesome dinner!  Get the fried Gator tail and the jazzy crab cakes!  They're amazing!

Great food and great service   Tallisen made some great recommendations for lunch.  It was around 3 pm and I was starving. Gumbo, oysters, The Taste of New Orleans all very good!   Oh yes, the Bloody Mary was very tasty.  I'll be back for sure!l
Errol was awesome!!! He was so nice once my group arrived. He got us a table and kept extending the table with great attitude as soon as more people arrived. When you arrive here ask for him!!

On our trip to New Orleans we really wanted to try a local neighborhood spot where the locals would go. We found a gem!

There is nothing fancy about the decor, it is just a welcoming comfortable environment with great staff.  We sat at the bar and were greeted by a very helpful bartender who offered his menu recommendations which we eagerly tried.  Given that you can't seem to find char grilled oysters in the north we wanted to have them again and they were different than other places but so good! They were juicy and cheesy and soooo yummy!

For entrees we decided to stray away from po boys and we went with a jambalaya pasta and blackened redfish (both bartender recommendations).  The pasta was AMAZING, it included shrimp and alligator sausage in an amazing creole sauce served with garlic bread.  The blackened redfish was also flavorful and fresh, nice change from the abundance of fried food. Overall great experience, definitely plan to keep this on the agenda for our next trip the New Orleans!

Very nice restaurant, red beans and rice was decent, jambalaya étouffée were not good. White chocolate raspberry martini and crawfish tails were VERY good. Customer service was great! Waiter was very respectful.

Oceana Grill is one of our favorite places to eat in New Orleans,Its a lovely restaurant with a touch of casual atmosphere and a heavy dose of Southern hospitality! We food is amazing, you can't go wrong with anything here. We will be back! Salud
Spectacular meal made better by the excellent and professional service of Errol. Highly recommend!

Over priced for the quality of food.
Food is not great, it is okay..and not at all neat.
There are much better places in French quarters for the same kind of food, like -The gumbo shop which is best and much neater and hygiene.

Me and my wife went to this restaurant to celebrate her birthday.   This place was a diamond in the rough.  The food was excellent. The service was great. We ordered Seafood sampler and it was enough for the both of us.  We also ordered Alligator bites which were out of this world.  The oysters were sweet and tasty.  The pina colada washed everything down well.  Next time in Nola, I will eat here again. When you get a chance this is the place to go eat.

Went around 10am on a sun morning. No wait. My husband had maw maw's Cajun breakfast. It was plentiful. Good ratio of rice and proteins with lots of bold flavors. A bit much for my tastebuds. I had the Eggs Melanzana which were Perfecto. Poached egg perfection. Crunchy fried eggplant and savory tomato with just the right amount of saltiness from the sauce and Parmesan cheese. And the portion was just right. John was a very nice host and server.

This was the first restaurant we ate at during our visit here in New Orleans and it was sooooo good! I got the Cajun jambalaya pasta which was delicious! I couldn't believe how much seafood was in there! So much flavor! My boyfriend got the surf and turf which was also amazing! I think that was the best steak I ever had! We also got some of there famous drinks which were very tasty and strong!  The wait wasn't long at all, even tho there was a line outside it only took 15 minutes to be seated. Oh and you HAVE to try their crab cakes! We ordered those right when we were seated and they came out within 5 minutes

Wow, where to start. It's got a really diverse menu so you should be able to find something for everyone here. I had one of the regular house specials, Redfish Oceano. Locally cought Redfish with a light breading of cornmeal, topped with crawfish tails topped with a light mushroom garlic cream sauce. Garlic red mashed potatoes and greens. BTW, the food was very good. Possibly the best greens I have ever had! I enjoyed this dis so much that I will definitely order this again, and again...! If I could cook this meal at home, this is exactly how I would want it to be. Not a lot of specific details, but I was that good. By evenings end I already shared that with at least 10 people!  I started the dinner with a Ceaser salad, with their house made dressing, Yummy, and finished it off with the Bread Pudding with caramel bourbon sauce. Again, yummy,! I took it to go, I was stuffed! My server was very good. My only complaint is, the meal was brought out 2 minutes after my salad. My waiter noticed that and took it away. He brought me a fresh one at the proper time. And my dessert had less caramel and less topping than the people sitting next to me. Anyway, order it, you will enjoy it!
Food was abundant and our server Rod was amazing and very patient. I would certainly go again.

Good food, but unacceptable practices. 

I'm a New Orleans local and have been coming here for a while.  Even though it's a tourist trap, they have good food and usually decent service... 

If you can't time your food correctly when it's busy, don't seat so many people. I've seen this time and time again at many restaurants, and it's the fatal balance of pleasing customers while still turning tables.  This place tonight did not get it right. 

Our appetizers were walked around the room for 10 mins before finding our way to our table... Even after our waiter almost dropped it off and then decided it wasn't for us.  When we finally got our cold oysters, they came by with our main courses about 2 minutes later and copped an attitude when we refused.  They said they'd remake them.  They didn't. When they arrived later we could all tell they had been set aside. From the wilted French fries to the barely warm crab cakes. These babies weren't even under a heat lamp.  

They did take a few bucks off the bill, which was why this is 3 stars instead of less.  
Done coming here.  Too many places around here not to move on and give someone else a chance.  Bye guys!

Turtle soup....Mmm. Redfish Oceana....yummy.

Parking is bit tricky....but not impossible.

Went to Oceana Grill for lunch.  Nice little outdoor courtyard seating.  Everyone was so nice, but we had the nicest, most amazing waiter, Harrison!!  Extremely friendly and made excellent suggestions, including a dish not on the menu, which turned out to be the best dish I had in New Orleans!  Blackened catfish on jumbalaya... amazing.  The catfish was so moist and tender, one of the best pieces of fish I've ever eaten.  The bbq shrimp off the appetizer menu were amazing, the sauce was so good I would've put it on ice cream. The drinks were good.  Got the bread pudding and pecan pie, both not on the same level as our lunch.  
Actually went back a second time, something we rarely do when traveling, and had another amazing lunch.  The bbq'd oysters were to die for.  Service very good, but not the same without Harrison.  Will definitely go again when we return to NO, but will call first to make sure Harrison is working.

Very good food and service. Good location in the French Quarter. The oysters on the half shell were the freshest I have ever had. We ate two meals here on our visit - one upstairs and one downstairs. Both meals had good food and service. We will return!
Food here was great! Service was a little slow but the food really took the cake! The alligator bites were my favorite!!

Last evening my love and I dined at Oceana Grill  for his birthday. As we were escorted  to our table ( with no wait) we noticed that  it had been  nicely decorated for XMAS ! The menu was varied and impressive. He had a plate of scrumptious Oysters Rockefeller (prepared with an unusual and so delicious cream sauce) and I enjoyed blackened gator !!! Our waiter was so personable and helpful. It was clear that the entire staff were most concerned that we have a wonderful dining experience which we did! We highly recommend Oceana Grill for all who seek a delicious authentic  New Orleans meal!
PS This place is anything but a tourist trap!

So tired the grill oysters last night. While they are good they are as amazing as the ones at some others places a block or two away. That being said the crab cakes and beans and rice are both delicious.

Just got back from a weekend trip to New Orleans. My wife and I love oysters, east coast, west coast, raw and cooked!! There was a 45 minute wait at Acme so I Yelped nearby places. We walked here and had about a 5 minute wait.

We got Jerry as our server and he was THE BEST!!!

I ordered a real good bloody mary. We got raw oysters and oysters Rockefeller! All were very fresh and flavorful!

Everyone enjoyed their meal but Jerry made it our best restaurant stop over the weekend!!

Few days in nola. Outside the menu seems good. Inside the hell, very noisy, bartender dont care , no water no drink, i obtained drink when i finished to eat. It is not a restaurant but a bar for drunk people.

Came here late at night.  Aside from the obvious difficulties getting a place to park, it's a nice spot and not TOO far off Canal Street so you don't have to navigate the crazy pedestrian traffic for too many blocks.

I tried the Taste of New Orleans platter (red beans n rice, etoufee, sausage, and jambalaya).  I wanted to compare the etoufee to what I had eaten elsewhere.  It measured up pretty well, I have to say, as did everything else.  

Service was friendly even though the place was very busy.

Overall, I'd go again.

It's 11:30 on a Saturday night and you are hungrym Head over to Oceana grill for some fried goodness. I fell in love with the server Errol and their shrimp. The platter came with hush puppies, Cole slaw and fries. The server told us to check out yelp and check in for a 10% discount. He was the sweetest server. Made sure we always had a full glass and we were happy. Food came out quick, was fresh and hot. I will definitely go here next time I'm in town

Was in NO visiting and walked by here the first night and there was a huge line to get in. Decided to check it out the next day and finally understood why. The food is incredible. Our waiter suggested we try gator bites for appetizers. We got the mixed plate that consisted of fried and grilled. First time trying gator and it was so good. I did end up liking the grilled over the fried more but either way It was delicious. I ordered the Taste of New Orleans which consists of Jambalaya, Crawfish Étouffée, Red Beans & Rice, and smoked sausage. The whole plate was delicious! Everything tasted amazing. My boyfriend ordered  a special they had that day which was Blackened Fish. Of course they called it more fancier which I can't remember. The fish was delicious. Everything we ordered we enjoyed & loved and would definitely come back to this restaurant when we come back to visit.
Great food. Awesome service Whitney was thhheeee best and so sweet. Try the bread pudding! The perfect balance w hint of rum. French toast was the best ever!!!
Food was excellent- had the crawfish pasta and it was delicious. Definitely heat seafood if on burbon

Pleasantly surprised. I had the crab cakes and they were great. The sauce was fantastic.  
The atmosphere was friendly and the waiter attentive.

Awesome food. Get the crab cakes! We had red beans and rice for lunch and it was great. Service was friendly and quick and we left happy and satisfied. Sooooo much better than our dinner the night before at Drago.

The food was... hell I can't even recall what I ordered. It was that unimpressive. Oh I now remember that I had shrimp and pasta with a crab cake.  I could have just had the crab cake. Certainly not the best crab cake I've ever eaten but it wasn't bad.
I went for seafood and it was great. I tasted my cousins chicken Alfredo and that is the best chicken I've tasted in my life! You walk right out on bourbon street, and will definitely be back!
Went in during the hurricane and everyone was very pleasant. Jessica was super attentive and very helpful with her suggestions.

Great restaurant.  I called ahead for permission to bring my dog on the patio and was so pleased to have him come along.  Even though it was Easter Sunday and busy inside the restaurant our service was excellent!!! The food was delicious and the portions were HUGE!!!

After a particularly bad experience at another restaurant we gratefully found Oceana!!  The service was quick and polite, the drinks were strong, and food was good!  Get the Gator Tail Bites blackened! I am not a gator expert, but they were yummy and had great flavor.

IT'S A TRAAAAP!
Expensive. Large portions, so if you do brave the terrible reviews and eat there anyway, split an entree. 
Service was fine, but I imagine this is the NOLA equivalent to Applebees.

Food was delicious....However the service was seriously lacking from the time we arrived to when we left. Drinks took over 15 minutes to arrive after placing our order and we never saw much of our waitress after ordering food. With how expensive the food is you would think the service would reflect those prices as well.
Awful!!! They buy oyster shells and put oysters from a bucket in them and claim they are fresh. Watch "kitchen nightmares" nothing has changed. Servers were amazing and work way too hard.
Our Uber driver suggested that we go here for dinner our first night in town. My husband isn't a fan of oysters but actually liked their famous oysters and we went back later in the week for seconds

This place is overrated. Our server was very nice and wanted to help us out. I wanted to try something new. So I tried the alligator po-boy. Wish I never did. Since it was the first time I had alligator it took me a while to realize that i was eating tainted meat - part of the meat was past it's last date of consumption. Yuck. 
The reason for three stars is that the place has a nice atmosphere and the rest was ok.

Delicious seafood and much more right off of Bourbon street!

I was recently visiting New Orleans on a service trip for my employer's spring break. We were recommended to go to Oceana and it did not disappoint. If you have a large party, definitely make a reservation online, even though there are 3-4 large dining rooms. Also outdoor/courtyard seating as well. 

We each got something different at the table, but all really enjoyed the gator bites with remoulade sauce to dip! Entrees are big, so come with an appetite! Drinks (as with anywhere in NOLA) are expensive, even if you get a virgin cocktail.

This place is huge inside! Our server was incredibly friendly and attentive. Good chargrilled oysters and taste of New Orleans sampler. So much on their menu sounded good and I can't wait to go back and try more!

This restaurant is truly a jewel in The Big Easy!!! Our waiter Jamal was so knowledgeable and friendly!! We could leave without asking Chef Craig to marry us (he declined LOL!) And Errol the manager came over and ended our dining experience with a friendly face!! This overall experience was AMAZING!!! I can't wait to come back!

Step 1. Sit in Natalies section
Step 2. Order the Gator tail bites 

This place is open late which works out particularly well if you're a tourist experiencing jet lag and hungry when everything else is closed. We went here on a whim and really enjoyed the service. I had never tried alligator and asked Natalie if she recommended it... She gave me a full breakdown and let me order 1/2 fried 1/2 blackened. It was sooooo good (blackened was better fyi)  this place was awesome and I want to go back for brunch. A must try late night spot for sure!

I have returned!!
Yeah, true story, although I didn't yelp about my prior dining experience at Oceana this was actually a return trip for me.  Which must be saying something, like:
Wow Mike you have a really bad memory and forgot to yelp ,
Thought you were the real thing, you're a phony... a big fat phony , or
Great food, forgetful yelper, still equals great food.

Personally, I'm going with the latter, because the food really is amazing.  I'm pretty sure my first trip was a po boy, but since I can't remember for sure I'll just speak to this most recent trip.  Of course.  And on this one I went with the Fried Shrimp Platter.

Oceana is a great location, just mere feet from Bourbon, but not directly on it so it may be possible to lose a bit of the crowd.  When you walk inside it appears rather small, but it's smoke and mirrors, because on the other side of the wall and host stand is a lot more space with a lot more tables!
