We had a small group of 3, and were very quickly seated.  It took a few extra moments for our drink orders to be taken, but once that started the ball kept rolling and refills were even quick/timely.

We had the fried gator bites as a starter, which were a little tough (expected after having them before) but still very good and well seasoned.  Even the picky eater ate at least 3 of them... and enjoyed them!  My shrimp plate was HUGE, but so delicious.  While the shrimp were fried, the way they were battered and cooked to perfection made them feel so light for a lunch.  Each bite was fantastic!  The fries, were... well... fries, but if nothing else they were well cooked.  No over cooked, soggy, or spongy undercooked in the batch and still tasty.  

As I've returned now, I'll return again.  Oceana Grill is a great place to grab a bite and so far everything has been delicious, so I don't have a reason to stop going!
Errol & Derrick were very attentive & customer friendly.  The food was so great I came 2 days straight.  Will definitely put this on the map as my go to place in the near future. ..

The food here was delicious and sooo filling. We started with crab cakes and a small bowl of gumbo then the blackened redfish etouffet as the entree. We were so full half way through. Our server Whitney was super nice and helpful. She even gave us tips on where else to go for the rest of our visit.

For a restaurant located just off of Bourbon Street, in the heart of the French Quarter, I was not expecting much.  This place does not have the pompous un-earned airs of Napoleons or the expense account needed to attend of a Brennan's family offering, instead it offers a great meal, at normal pricing with friendly waiters who do not shove you out the door when you are done.  

I am allergic to shellfish, which, in most towns is normally just a pain.  In New Orleans, it is limiting.  The two times we ate here, the wait staff verified with the cooking staff that the item I ordered (Red Beans and Rice) would be cooked contaminant free.  Both waiters took the time to point out other menu options available for me in case I did not want the red beans and rice but felt they were a "safe" option - trust me, the wait staff here is a among the best in the quarter!  My friends had the crab cakes: now, since the shellfish is an adult allergy, I was howling jealous.  The appetizer was two generous cakes of 95% crabmeat with a stunning crawfish sauce. The red beans and rice was outstanding.  It was not served as a sauce over white rice but as a dish, as it should be.  The hurricanes were good (ok, probably not the best in the area but I had just arrived into town and was just leaving town!) and lacked the overly sweet taste that seems to be pervading the area in the post-Katrina rebuild.

Oceana's drawback during popular times is that it does not take reservations.  You can line up or arrive early/off times.  They do a brunch and there is an ATM on site.  There is a courtyard in the back.  They are just off Bourbon so you can avoid that mess if you like and we saw several families having lunch as they do seem to contain the party scene to the front area.  With places like Oceana Grill, I'd skip the higher end places: here is where you can get the same food, for lower prices and frankly, better ambience.
Went for breakfast and it was wonderful.  Pain Perdu and fruit crepe were both wonderful...however the biscuits and gravy were probably one of the best things I have ever eaten!!!
The food was wonderful. I especially loved the Mardi Gras pasta. I sampled the Blackened Chicken PoBoy and the remoulade was delicious!  The staff was extra friendly and welcoming to us.

Wait time was less than 10 mins on a friday night at 10. Service was so lovely and responsive. We ordered the jambalaya fettuccini and the crab cakes. Both were around $20 and good for 2 people to share. The portions are on the smaller side but the food came out fast and hot. The flavors were great. The crabcake was crunchy on the outside with plenty of crab inside. The jambalaya was creamy and rich. Enjoyed it both although a little pricy. Fun looking restaurant that has dim lights and a bar too.

For what it was, Oceana Grill was actually pretty good. Upon entering, you kind of feel like you're walking into a Bubba Gumps which is why I'm giving it 3 instead of 4 stars. You know, the chain seafood sorta feel, tvs screening their commercials, menus with pictures of the food, etc. Not my ideal dinner spot. But for what it was, it was good.

We were seated upstairs in a big exposed brick room (actually pretty cool) and service was GREAT. Super attentive, friendly waiters - they clearly had a well-polished system which made the experience seamless.

I ordered the Jambalaya Pasta which was pretty good. Not at all spicy, but flavorful with chunks of chicken and shrimp. Again, kinda reminded me of something I might get at a Sizzlers..

If you're a tourist and don't care about the "chain-y" feel, Oceana is definitely a good option. If you perhaps have more refined tastes or are looking for something a bit more unique.. perhaps keep wandering.
The BBQ shrimp sauce is foodgasmic!!!  Oh my gawd!  Definitely deserves a spot on your list. Darrick waited on us. The sweetest brother. Laid back establishment. Amazing food.

This place is amazing!! Today was out third time and we will keep coming back. We haven't been for dinner but the biscuits and gravy are the most decadent and rich ones I've ever had. Also the crab cakes appetizer is a MUST!! Topped with a crawfish and mushroom sauce. Best crab cakes I've ever had.

Had dinner here on Friday with Errol  as our server food was ridiculously good dervice couldn't have been better.So needless to say wehad to return today for breakfast Troy is taking excellent care of us.When in NOLA Oceana is a must.

We had chargrilled oysters (not charbroiled) on our to do list, and Oceana was great because it had no line when the other well known establishments had long waits. Not disappointed!! Perfectly cooked, tender oysters with a delicious sauce. My bread was a little stale, and one of his oysters had a shell peice, but overall,  impressive.  We also checked alligator off our list. They have it blackened or deep fried, but we ordered blackened to get a more realistic taste. Most places here only offer it in a heavily battered, deep fried form. Blackened was excellent!

There was a line out the door when we arrived (no surprise in New Orleans). We didn't wait long at all though before being seated. 
We were seated on the third floor. 
Our server was very attentive. 
The only slightly negative thing was that the pasta dishes (shrimp fettuccini and chicken fettuccini) had way too much sauce! Never thought too much sauce would be a thing but it was. 
Other than that it was an excellent place.
Very good food and atmosphere. I had the Redfish which is their signature dish and it was amazing!! Would go again!!

The service here was great. My server knew the menu and had a pleasant attitude which was refreshing. I had the famous broiled oysters and they were probably the best oysters I've had. I definitely recommend them. The seafood gumbo is good. I also recommend the jambalaya seafood pasta, there is gator in it but if you're up for the experience, I say go for it! My husband ordered "the taste of New Orleans" platter, it was okay just not what was expected. 
Overall, I say if you're in New Orleans and around Bourbon street, you should make the stop even if it is just for the oysters.

The meal was good but that's about all I could say about it.  I ordered a half slab of ribs and they are true to their words when they say it falls off the bone.  The oysters on the half shell were GIGANTIC and definitely worth the price.  I'm not sure why there is always a long line for Oceana but it is good.  It's not necessarily a place I would run back to but would go again if the option presented itself.
Food was excellent!!! Gumbo was the bomb!!! PoBoy was great. Service was awesome. If your in New Orleans you need to eat at Oceana's
Came in at 11 for late night grub. Staff was great. Everything was tasty and priced reasonably. Stand outs were the jambalaya and crawfish étouffée. Appetizers were all pretty good.

This restaurant is a must-do when visiting the French quarter!  The food is excellent especially the redfish. I had the redfish as my last meal during my vacation and also took a shrimp po boy to go, for my flight. Amazing amazing ahhhmazing!  The redfish is so fresh and their sauce really is the perfect addition. Two sides: collard greens that were so good and mashed potatoes as well. Great send off meal for me. Jennifer is very special and sweet and provided excellent service!  Then during my flight, I had the po boy that was oh so very delicious with a little spice to it and a crunchy, creamy cole slaw inside. All in all, a top notch experience!  This place really rocks!  I will be back!
Excellent food and service!! Large portions. The seafood tastes so fresh. I had the oyster platter. The coleslaw, hush puppies, fries, and dipping sauces were really good. I'll be back!!

We made reservations for dinner and were seated promptly. Our table was not the best (downstairs) as our wobbly table had to be adjusted twice. They should really fix or repl that table. And, downstairs dining is not aesthetically appealing.  We started out w/gumbo & 1/2 doz grilled oysters. My gumbo was bland, lacking in much needed spices & my husband really didnt enjoy his grilled oysters after having his flavorful grilled oysters at Royal Oyster House. The oysters were smothered in their sauce, which took away the flavor of the actual oysters. So, he opted to order another 1/2 doz of fresh oysters & they were 100% better & big!  I ordered the crab cakes appetizer & they were very good, filled with lots of lump crab. The sauce was good but tasted better after I added some fresh lemon.  Our waiter was exceptional--wish I could remember his name. We would retn for the crab cakes & ask for upstair seating.

The food came out fast. The staff was friendly in greeting us. The Redfish Oceana dish was very flavorful.  It has had bits of something in it. Three times I had to spit out something.   Not sure what it was. Maybe crawfish bits.  The shrimp po-boy was a disappointment. Despite all of the meals coming out quickly, the fries were lukewarm and the shrimp were room temperature.   The Taste of New Orleans was okay.  

The floor was slippery.

Immediately seated and serviced. Staff was friendly and helpful. The scene was busy but fun. The food was amazing. Alligator bites are a must. We had shrimp and catfish po boys. They were both delicious. Things are a lite pricey but definitely worth it.
Gator bites were delicious. Po'boys were fantastic. Beers were ice cold. Everything you want in a restaurant this place provided. Nice, casual vibe as well. Definitely recommended!

I went to New Orleans back in 2015 and ate here for dinner.  Nick Young of the Lakers was there (Lakers were playing the Pelicans).  I ate my first Gator Tails here and it tastes like chicken.  I ate Oysters and Cajun food that was delicious.  It's something I normally wouldn't but decided to try it.  Not bad.
Very well managed. Nice environment. My shrimp tasted like it was caught that same day. Very fresh. Could go for a tad more flavor, but still great

Amazing , a must when you visit New Orleans . Staff was great & so was the food ! I got the taste of New Orleans plate , which was great & had so much flavor . Their bread pudding is to die for , definitely going back for that .

Back at the Oceana again... I come to New Orleans and there is two places I also go... Mothers for breakfast (tradition) and the Oceana on Conti  St. (By choice). Juan waited on me by coincidence 2 times in a row... Now I sit where he is working. But hey... Let's talk about food... I'm gonna post a pic of the Ahi w shrimp... The picture alone can explain my meal... Perfect !!! Thank you Oceana... See u in a couple months when I roll back through Nola.
This place is known for the po boys. (Like everywhere else around here). The thing that really does it is the bread. Nice and fluffy with the perfect amount of chewy.

The gator tail was a real experience! We had half blackened, half fried. Blackened definitely spicier!
The jambalaya was good, reminded me of paella. 
Try the hurricane, really good cocktail!
Service was okay, nothing exceptional.

This place was very good the portion sizes was great the atmosphere was great the waiter staff was very knowledgeable about the menu they guided me and navigatedme into new tasteful experiences that were delightful surprisingly good. They also gave some historical context about the meal we choose.Jimika  our waiter was wonderful experience and I end up giving her a $20 tip. Even though the meal was priced out of around $63 for two I am a big guy about 300 pounds and I know how to eat. This is a must try must experience restaurant.
A flavor grenade just went off in my mouth.  Errol gave us excellent service.   The BBQ shrimp were amazing, as well as the oysters Rockefeller.

We stopped in because we were looking for food a little later than other places were serving.  Ordered a fried soft shell crab (delicious, but incorrect price on the menu), as well as a sampler including fried oysters, shrimp, hush puppies, and French fries.  The breading was a little thicker than we would have liked, which did a disservice to the seafood.  It appeared the food had been sitting for a bit under a heat lamp, because there were skins on the cups of ketchup and tartar sauce.  The cup of gumbo we had was good, and the service was pleasant.
Delicious food!! Had the eggplant appetizer and ribeye steak (which was made to perfection!) There was a line outside but they seated us promptly and service was excellent. Will recommend to friends.

Skip the delivery. I was recommended this place by a friend and although I'm sure in-restaurant the food is probably delish...delivery was somewhat of a fail. Although I was very please the food was hot when I received it, the taste was lackluster. I had the crawfish pasta and the sauce was good yet the crawfish had a dull/stale taste to them which pretty much threw off the whole dish seeing as though the pasta was FULL of crawfish.
Great food all around! The gator bites were delicious. Taylor was a great hostess. Highly recommend eating here
Great food, good service, very satisfied and impressed.

We came here late at night on Tuesday as restaurants were closed.

We ordered a Seafood Gumbo and a Red Beans and Rice with Cajun sausage.

They were both good, but I enjoyed the  Red Beans and Rice with Cajun sausage more.

I would come here again if nothing else is open.

Someone could probably punch me in the face and I wouldn't give any less than a 5 star review. Fast service, friendly staff that is very attentive and easy to find, food is fantastic..Beyond measure. 

The oysters make you want to slap yo mama. Our oysters in VA are not this big. These are huge. I think a half of the oceana chargrilled is fine for 2 adults as an appetizer.Talk about mouth watering! Get some extra bread to sop up the sauce! Also note, these oysters have a Cajun cream sauce on them then broiled with cheese. That sauce is the difference between the Oceana and the other top rated Oyster bars. Huge difference!

This place was not on our list of eating places to visit........but it was recommended by the staff at the hotel.  So we went there and had the most amazing crab cakes ever!!!!  They said that their crab cakes were amazing ......... they were telling the truth.  2 cakes for $14, I guess that's on the pricey side, but the cakes were so full of crab meat and they were soooo worth it!

We made reservations for our group of 8. When we arrived, we waited 5-10 minutes to be seated. There was a line outside, for people who didn't have reservations, as well. Needless to say, Oceana is busy at dinner time. 

Oceana is just off of Bourbon street on Conti Street in the French Quarter. We ate on the second floor. 

We had raw oysters (which were very big), the signature Redfish Oceana, and bread pudding. Everything was very good.

My second time here and iamazing as the first time. This go around I had Kim as my waitress and she was great. I honestly think people need to visit NO to get a lesson in the service industry. Nonetheless, the food comes out quickly and my family loved their dishes. This is my go to NO restaurant.

In town for a fun weekend and the bellman at our hotel recommended this place.  To me, it's very standard, nothing special.  One in our party had the gumbo and red beans, he said they were very good.  Someone had a po boy, and she loved it.  I had the seared ahi tuna with a shrimp cream sauce on top.  The topping was good, but the tuna was overcooked and dry.

Great food and friendly staff! I ordered the duck and it was AMAZING!!! The sauce was perfectly sweet without being overpowering. For dessert I tried the kahlua mousse and it was beautifully rich and creamy. My only complaint was that my food came out and it was a bit cold, but other than that it was a wonderful experience with wonderful food.

Went here for some good seafood dishes and they did not disappoint! I forgot the exact names of the things we ordered but they were some specials our waiter had recommended. Everything about this place screams New Orleans, for a tourist it hits all the things you'd want to experience in a typical NOLA dinner place. 

Had my first Bloody Mary here and although it's not my cup of tea it definitely was good. The drink itself almost felt like a meal, I couldn't finish the fish dish I had ordered despite it being delicious. The crab cakes were amazing! I honestly didn't think I'd be so full after having just one, but maybe it was due to eating so much food in general vacationing in the city. 

The only bad thing I can say is that our server was not very attentive. Nice guy, idk if it was really busy and they were understaffed, but he wasn't around much. I have strong empathy for waiters because I used to be one, so I tend to be less critical about it. But there are some standards a waiter has to abide by, and asking for refills and waiting to ask for the check def brought the experience down. If the service woulda been on point I could've rated this closer to 5 stars. 

Overall honest rating of 4.1 stars.

We met one of the wife's friends for lunch and initially tried going to one of the restaurants with a bunch of stars on yelp that serves brunch. It was extortionately expensive and we bailed.  After roaming, we came across Oceana.  

The beers are inexpensive and the food is delicious.  We started with oysters on the half shell and grilled oysters (Oceana's Famous).  These were crazy delicious.  The grilled were better than the raw.  The latter were plump, but mild and needed cocktail sauce/lemon/horseradish.  The former were perfectly seasoned.  

The wife and I both had the red fish special entree.  It was blackened red fish with jalapeño and shrimp sauce that contained some breading.  It was like stuffing.  The server said it was her favorite and really good.  She was right about that.  Our friend ordered the crab cakes.  She fortunately wasn't able to finish them all and I got to eat one the next day.  It too was delicious, even the next day.

Service was great but the food was nasty. The crab cake covered with crawl fish was good. The oysters were good. The New Orleans seafood dish was nasty. The gumbo was nasty too. I guess it's 50/50 but I wouldn't recommend a hit or miss restaurant. Not impressed with New Orleans food so far
The jambalaya Pasta is the best thing I've ever eaten. The sauce was so complexly delicious.

Not only do they have amazing food here, but amazing service as well. Barry was an amazing server who truly cares about the customers by checking in with them, getting to know them, and giving them advice about the city and restaurant. Even the chefs came out to check on the people in the restaurant. A very nice clean, and family friendly restaurant.
Best food I had in New Orleans this trip. Would recommend to everyone. The famous oceana oysters are to die for and the wait staff was so kind to all of my group.

The food was delicious and the service was excellent. Had the crawfish omelette with hash browns and was very happy with it. Spicy flavor on the hash browns was the best I have ever eaten. My girlfriend who is picky about food loved her pancakes and hash browns.
Great atmosphere. I had the French toast and it was delicious and very filling. My friends ate St. Louis eggs Benedict and they really enjoyed it. I would definitely come back again!

No bueno!!! This is very much a tourist spot....and because of location, I probably should have known better. But...we tried it anyway. 
Im sure tourists love the bland/watered down creole menu but I was quite disappointed. Hate to give bad reviews but I wont be back.

This is the place for some great creole seafood! The crab cakes are phenomenal, covered with crawfish and a yummy mushroom sauce. The gumbo is very flavorful and thick, but not too spicy. The creme brûlée is very big, and with a smooth consistency, not too runny. SO GOOD!! If you are near Bourbon Street, this place is worth a stop. And ask for Errol!! He was so attentive and accommodating, great service all around. Keep it up guys!

Generous portions. Tasty food. Good customer service. I ordered shrimp pasta and a seafood platter. Will come back to try to the crabmeat cake. They should give I you some kind of desert if you come again with a receipt. Overall, I liked this place.
Came highly recommended as a "must try in New Orleans. We had the blackened chicken fettuccine and the blackened ribeye. Nothing to write home about. Pricey and so mediocre.

Wasn't my first choice. 
The family and I flew in from California going to Mississippi for thanksgiving and wanted something to eat before our 2 hour drive.
I had a Groupon for something else but, they were closed when we got there (4 in afternoon ). Go to yelp looking for something else found Lenora's Grill but we couldn't see ourselves eating at a golf course. 
Go back to yelp and find this joint!! Service and food were awesome and our server Lakeisha the best, beautiful young lady. 
This place will always be on our list.
PS.. when we got there we got immediate seating, came out, line going down the street. That says something bout this joint!!

Thursday late night -11p.  Nice crowd, good atmosphere! Good service and good food.
Bonus was the 10% discount for checking in on Yelp!!!!

The food:
Shrimp po boy - was good
Crab cakes - creamy deliciousness!

Great food, Great Service, Great History, Great Time!

All the way from Georgia!  Made this trip well worth it!

Loved visiting Oceana! We had a fabulous server, great drinks, awesome food (I had the Taste of New Orleans, my boyfriend had the Gator Po'Boy). The service was great and they even offered to give us directions as we headed out. Really recommend for inexpensive, great food!
Good breakfast git us right in as a party of 6, had alligator sausage and grits, everything was good now heading to a bus tour..Jaime was a great server. Got 10% off for checking in on yelp.

This is probably my favorite restaurant in Nola(New Orleans). It was my first time here and had an awesome experience the server was polite and punctual. Prices weren't as high as I thought they would be either. I ordered some crab cakes as an appetizer, and let's just say you definitely get your money's worth. The crab cakes were nice size and super delicious. The place is also conveniently located near Bourbon street for anyone looking to explore after dinner/brunch. I definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone.

Great place for the pre drinking food or the post hangover morning... Had the best bloody Mary after a night of hand grenades and hurricanes... With an alligator sausage breakfast... Sweet bartender....

Wish I could give zero stars but not an option.  You really ought to get on that, Yelp.  

Anyway, ordered $200 worth of food online specifically for delivery and was called 10 minutes before the scheduled delivery time to ask when I would be picking it up.  Ummm...I think you meant when will you be delivering it to me, Oceana.  Were told by an employee that our food was nearly finished and were we on our way to pick it up. Got on the phone with a manager who said that our food hadn't even been begun.  I have a feeling the order came in, they started cooking and then checked the delivery and realized they weren't willing to deliver.  Had a lot of ridiculous back and forth with the manager about how we weren't in their delivery zone (again, definitely in the French Quarter) and that corporate doesn't like when employees drive to drop off deliveries.  Does corporate also have a problem with people driving to work? Because I'm sure that's how your employees get to work.  Pro Tip 1: don't offer delivery if you aren't willing to drive. Asked if we could pay an additional charge to have the food delivered outside their zone.  Also a no-go.  Asked if we could meet them where their delivery zone ended and were told that they've done that before and they could never find the people who ordered the food.  Um, it's pretty obvious Oceana...the people you're looking for are the hungry ones looking for you so they can pay you for their order. It really isn't that difficult which leads me to Pro Tip 2: invest in some technology that doesn't allow people to put addresses in your website that you don't deliver to (even though you ought to because GEOGRAPHY states I'm in the French Quarter).

Found this place on yelp. This is my first time in New Orleans and I wanted to go to a place that had "flavor". So after doing my research this place was my first option. The atmosphere is nice. Right by Bourbon street. It is kid friendly, I took my three kids. The kids menu is good and the food portions was more than enough for them. they couldnt finish it all. I got the Crab Cake Pasta which was beyond delicious. Ate everybite. Didnt get to get dessert however, I was too full. But def would come back here again

Their St James crepe with shrimp and crab was yummy! After bad gumbo experience last night, Oceana redeemed Gumbo for New Orleans this morning. Nice and hot with efficient amount of shrimp. Nice ambience outside patio. Worth a try...
Best chargrilled oysters in NOLA. I have been to this place 3 times and was always impressed with everything I ordered. Lines move quickly.

Fried seafood platter sooo good definitely get it! The batter they use here is really good. Oyster Rockefeller was decent but there's better ones in Nola. Great ambiance and our server Alex made the dining experience so much better. Ask for him.

This place was just awesome there were 5 people at my table so I tasted damn near everything from the gumbo the fried crab. But... They have this sauce that comes drizzled on most dishes that is just delicious. If you go to New Orleans be sure to make this you first stop for food. Fast and great friendly service from all staff members.

what can I say... went for a quick trip and it had been a while since the last visit and was dying to get some good Cajun food... was note disappointed... seafood was excellent and the grilled oysters were as good as any other place out there...

service was good... friendly and informative... can't wait to go back...

On our epic road trip, we found ourselves arriving in New Orleans at close to midnight with our 3 kids!  Did a web search, and found a blog suggesting Oceana as a kid friendly restaurant that was still open.  The restaurant is adorable! The music was exactly what we envisioned when we pictured the French quarter/ Bourbon St!  And the house special oysters were so good a kid even ate one! 
Our hostess and server were amazing, and I will be ranting about this find to anyone who will listen!!

This place rocks. Its very casual and allowed for our group of 8 with baby to sit comfortably. They explained the menu and the specials in a way we could understand. And the server was great! 

Now we get to the food. The food was amazing! It was out quickly (especially since we all ordered appetizers to share). The gumbo was phenomenal. The crab cakes were amazing and I really liked the alligator sausage.

I would definately recommend coming to this place the next time you are in NOLA looking for a quick bite to eat, lunch for a small group, or dinner for a large group. It fits all.

It feels like a great slice of NOLA...on to the next!

Oh Oceana, how I love thee! The crab cakes give me life! The best I've had. He blackened red fish is absolutely delicious and the charbroiled oysters make me jump for joy! Definitely one of my top 10 favorite restaurants of all time. Great location. Worth the wait! Thank me later.

So a co-worker of mine had been to this place before and recommended it. I was walking by and just happen to see it so I went in. Service at the time was fast as it was a Thursday and it was not busy. Amazingly good food. I can see why she recommended it. Next day Friday I walked by again and this time the line was out the door and around the building. I obviously understand why. It would so be worth the wait.

This place is amazing. From the time we walked in until we left, every single staff members had a smile on their face and was completely attentive to our needs. The food was on a whole notha' level. The portions are huge, the taste is amazing, and everything is super fresh. I can't wait to be back for another meal.

REALLY surprised by all the high star ratings... my experience must have been an anomaly...but between our table of 4, NONE of us liked any of our food or any of our service :-\

We were lured as Super Bowl visitors by our Baltimore Ravens flagship radio station 98 Rock being broadcast here, and the atmosphere was definitely cool, we will give it that much.  But that's where the goodness stopped for us.

I think our poor experience started right at the door.  There was a long line, and we kept seeing people walk up to the front of the line, say something to the hostess and she'd put her arm out to cut off the people waiting in line and gesture for the line-cutters to go ahead in.  Maybe they had a reservation or there was a private party going on, and that is totally cool, but when we asked why they were being let in, we were ignored.  Guess we weren't dressed well enough.  But for someone who drove 18 hours to get there, I thought I looked pretty good, but I was sooo hungry, I just wanted to get in and eat ravenously so I tried not to care.

So we were finally seated- albeit, right next to the kitchen, and of course we were going to give it a look, I mean the door was swinging open a lot, so we might as well.... and we were pretty disgusted with what we saw.  The floor was disgustingly dirty, crap was all over the walls, and the cooks didn't look very clean either.

Though again we tried to look past it, we weren't at all surprised when our food came out tasting pretty terrible.  The po' boy bread was hard and soggy at the same time (definitely frozen, then microwaved), and covered in bagged lettuce (looked like the stuff that Subway uses).  The tuna special was legitimately HARD all around the edges.  Had to cut them off with a KNIFE like I was a kid who didn't like crust on my sandwiches!

We felt extremely rushed by our server, who cleaned up without asking if we were finished and was quick to bring the check.

Oh, but the bathrooms were clean.  That's all I got.
My first stop in New Orleans. Great food, great drinks, great service! Brandi at the bar was amazing!

Even though our waiter Errol, tried to sell crabcakes to Marylanders, for the record, we only eat Maryland crabcakes, we found him incredible. He was very helpful and attentive. Our food was delicious! Especially the bread pudding!

To be the self-proclaimed "best restaurant in NOLA" ... no. 

As an hour wait I experienced very BLAND tastes across the board and a TIGHT seating arrangement. Couldn't even stretch. Won't return.

I do not recommend this place at all if you are gluten free.  My husband said his food was fine (he can eat gluten).  They do have a gluten free menu with about five items on it.  I ordered the steak and veg from that menu.  They brought me out what was clearly from a steam fresh type of bag frozen veg and an unseasoned steak (not even salt or pepper was on this thing).  They seemed surprised that I was unsatisfied with it and offered to fix it by taking it back to put salt and pepper on it.  I just sent it back and stopped somewhere else on the way home.  They didn't even comp my one drink or anything in way of apology but they very graciously removed the charge for the meal I didn't eat.  It's tough to eat gluten free (I get very sick from it) in New Orleans but there are better places out there that accommodate with food that has flavor in the same price range as this place.

The food here was good. It's like an Applebee's of Louisiana food. We all enjoyed our food. But as usual for the French quarter, the food was a little on the higher end. However, I enjoyed the food from here more than any other place I went to in that area. The staff is super nice.
Authentic Louisiana food. Great oyster Rockefeller, great beans and rice. Great PO-boys. Must try.

Ok kinda tourist trappy but I was hungry on the French quarter! Étouffée was pretty delicious. I'd recommend this place. It's a little pricey but again it's the location. Staff was above expectations. Took their time explains menu - very helpful!

First of all let me start out with the food, we had the crab cakes which was great the gumbo was not all that. I got the blackened catfish Po-Boy to much blackened season that it tasted bitter. My daughter had the shrimp fettuccine Alfredo that was great. Do know why am giving this place a four star because of Kevin M our waiter he checked on us make sure the drinks was refilled. Kevin keep up the great customer service.
A great place close to Bourbon street. The inside is way bigger than its entrance seems. Great blackened catfish and soft and juicy crab cakes.

The crab cake appetizer was amazing. 2 large crab cakes that are really good. The fried seafood sampler is also really good. We were IMPRESSED with the fried oysters. The fried catfish was also pretty awesome.

We had a fine experience at Oceana. A doorman at our hotel told us that many of the locals eat there, if they have to eat in the FQ. We ordered the Taste of New Orleans(crawfish etouffee, red beans/rice, jambalaya, etc. ) and redfish w/jambalaya/fried crawfish. Both were fine, although the redfish special was considerably overpriced ($30). The atmosphere was casual and family friendly, and the service/speed of food were great. Checking in via Yelp earned us a 10% discount on the check.
Food is great.  Actually tasted better than what I expected.  Would be 5 stars if the drinks didn't suck.  Will definitely come back.

Great place!!!! Went in for breakfast and were pleasantly impressed... The staff was amazing and very friendly... The manager was very welcoming and made us feel comfortable... The food left us with a great impression... Can't wait to travel back to eat there again... Will definitely return!!!
Great breakfast. Decent prices. Traditional New Orleans bar atmosphere. The staff was very pleasant and attentive. Try the French toast and the alligator sausage.

Very terrible experience.   Manger on duty.  On the night of 10/29/2016.  Was very unprofessional.   The service was terrible.  Took almost 3 hours.  To eat an we pre booked   The room. The wait staff was slow.    An one waiter.     Was joking  an playing while  we waited.   Will never ever visit this location again.

The food and service is great here. Keep in mind that this is Creole food and NOT Cajun food - there is a HUGE difference. The Taste of New Orleans dish was gross and sent back. Creole cooking uses tomato as a base for majority of dishes. No chicken and sausage gumbo is served here, only seafood. The shrimp poboy was great. Bread pudding was excellent!

3.5 Stars

One of the things i like to do when I travel for business is ask various locals I encounter as to where some of their favorite eateries they dine at or where locals will dine at.  4 different people directed me to this place and said this is more authentic then any other place in the French Quarter when it comes to New Orleans cuisines. 

Started off with the Oysters Rockefeller.  This was okay and had a lot of flavor but was mostly full of Parmesan than actual oyster.

I proceeded to the deep fried combo which came with catfish, shrimp, oysters, and I substituted the jambalaya with craw fish etoufee.   All of this was very good and had the right kick.  

The bottom line is the price was right, the portions were good size and the service was great.  Would recommend this a a place to go to for an easy dinner or lunch.

This was the first place that my husband & I ate at when we touched down in NOLA. The food was amazing, the drinks were amazing, the service was amazing. We loved Jai he was the best bartender that we encountered. We had to go back to visit again before we left'

This place has the best RED BEANS AND RICE!! I wasn't even excited to eat red beans and rice, but it came with the Taste of New Orleans plate that we ordered, and then I fell in love with red beans and rice. It has a great smokey flavor, and I was craving it for days after!! It's my favorite thing on the menu. We got the crab cakes as well which were ok.

Truly a gem in the French Quarters. 
We were trying to find a place to eat before starting the barhopping, and my girlfriend was eager to revisit this place after a year or so, because she loved the BBQ Shrimp here.
Even on a weekend, in the party center, of NEW ORLEANS, we were seated in five minutes. They brought out drinks really fast and always made sure we were doing fine. We ordered half a dozen oysters, the BBQ Shrimp and the Jambalaya Pasta, and I must say, they nailed everything! 
The Jambalaya was to die for! They took a long time to bring the check, but that's not an issue since they were very busy with a full house! I would definitely return next time.

I enjoyed the seafood gumbo, it taste AMAZING. The staff were super friendly. Especially Our waitress. She was so sweet. She charged my cell phone while we ate. The horchata drink didn't agree with my taste buds. I'm a big horchata fan, but I think I'll just have it with no liqueur. Great experience. Can't wait to visit again.

This place is where we had our first meal here in New Orleans. After a long drive from Texas, we were excited to try some good food. We were definitely satisfied with this place. The char-broiled oysters were on point! Loved them! Their seafood gumbo did not disappoint but, the "Taste of NO" was okay. It wasn't bad but, I wasn't impressed. I would rather have a bowl of their gumbo. But, you should visit this place it was good.

The place had great food and we've been coming here for years every time we visit New Orleans. This weekend we had our meals and 7 people paid their tabs but for some reason one card went missing and the waiter said he never gave it to her. We all clearly saw him place his card in the thing and she even dropped his card once and he picked it up and gave it back to her. When she came back saying he never gave the card she said she had to talk to the owner. Now out of the other 6 couples this guy was by himself and had a tab of $21 compared to our $89-$90 tabs the couples had. Ours was paid his wasn't. The owner came back and talked to him and said basically he had to figure out a way to pay. Now the principle of all this obviously wasn't that we couldn't pick up the tab for him but the fact that she lost the card and out of courtesy the owner could have said hey we're sorry let's us make it up to you by not charging for a $21 tab. It was our fault we lost your card. Needless to say the owner even went to check the camera and indeed he had given her his card. For some reason he kept trying to pull our friend to the side without all of us being able to hear or see what they were talking about. While we were standing their waiting he screamed out loud to another manager "don't let them walk out" as if we didn't want to pay. Even though we had all spent at least $500 and paid already. At the end he rudely screamed at us and told us he was going to call the cops if we didn't pay. Again the principal wasn't that we couldn't pay it was that it was their mistake and they should have owned up to it. Eventually we paid his tab but only because it was ridiculous how they were being with all of us. We walked out furious and you guys definately lost our future business. 

Oh BTW about 30 minutes later after we had blocked his card someone was trying to use it on bourbon st. We really think our waiter took the card or something because she didn't go to far to run our cards for the rest of us.
Food was great and our waitress was amazing! I had the Seafood Pasta and he had the Crab cakes. It was sooo much food. For dessert we had the bread pudding and the Banana Foster cake! Both were yummy

This was the perfect spot for my group traveling as a Bachelorette Party. The server, David, was super nice and accommodating and gave great suggestions. I got the Chicken Alfredo Pasta and I am not exaggerating when I say it was the best thing I've ever eaten. I may have talked about it a little too much and forced everyone to try it but it was amazing. I hopefully can come back soon!

Best place we ate at in NOLA. We had my 6 year old and 4 month old and they took us in around the line that was outside. Our waitress was fantastic. She gave us great recommendations and we had a fabulous time. We had gator bites for appetizer (half fried and half blackened). Also, we had charbroiled oysters. First time I had oysters and they were AMAZING! Husband has the sea food platter with soft shell crab, and sister had gator po'boy. All of it was fantastic. I went for blackened ahi and it was great. Best part of my meal was the sides of jambalaya and greens. I had two sazeracs and left feeling pretty good. I would visit this place once a week if I could!!!
excellent food..strong drinks and they were so great w my daughter who was making a royal mess!!! def going back!!
Great food ! Try the BBQ shrimp and gumbo!Good service.. I don't usually eat in the quaver when I visit but Oceana is a must every time I visit!

To say everything we had here was good is such an understatement. Even the bread and butter was extra tasty. Lol. We had the crab cakes as an appetizer, and I think we all agreed we could have just gotten more of those as our entree...so good!  The Oceana oysters are just..just..heaven. I didn't taste The Taste of New Orleans, but was told it is very good. I had a dish that is no longer on the menu, but our waiter, Chris, suggested; it's Mardi Gras pasta. That pasta was delicious. It had shrimp and crawfish in a cream sauce and was so good. We were too full to try dessert, but will return before we head home for dessert and crap cakes!  EVERY employee was welcoming and friendly. I will always stop by when I'm in town.

If you're in the area, go to the Oceana Grill for good food for a decent price. Shell oysters were good, but could do with more - something. Po boys were very good. Service was great. Atmosphere was rowdy though; made us feel like we were in a bar and not a restaurant.

We're in New Orleans for one night! We asked a passerby where to go he recommended Oceana Grill . just off Bourbon Street THIS place was spot-on: quick-service, delicious food, cool atmosphere and southern hospitality.
Definitely try this place next time you are in town.
Ate here twice in one visit! Excellent étouffée, red beans and rice, jambalaya, blackened red fish...and the BEST crab cakes I've ever eaten!
Oceana Grill was another spot that was recommended to me and was a great choice that I went not once but twice!

The crab cake is really good, especially the crawfish mushroom sauce. The cajun jambalaya pasta is solid, but not too spectacular. I would have liked to try the redfish or the blackened fish. The service is great, come early so you don't have to wait in line.

Okay, this place was recommended for their Oceana Oysters which had some cream sauce on them. It was too much.  Just too much. I know people love these oysters, but I feel like having them chargrilled is one thing with all the butter and garlic, but then add the cream on top just felt too decadent to me. The service was great, decor so so. This place seems very popular, but to me I would probably not return. Too much fried everything.

Heard that this place had good food. The line was slightly long on a Thursday night but moved quickly. I had the Jambalaya pasta which was very good a nice from the fried food here. There was also an entree called taste of new orlean which was ok but not as good expected. Also tried the fried gator tail not bad at all very flavor full! They had hurricanes which seems to be a staple drink and it was very good as well

My wife got the ribs because she wasn't sure of Cajun/creole food.  The ribs were more than we expected and she enjoyed picking at my gumbo and taste of New Orleans.   She's been converted! Great food. Great place. Great service.

This was one of our favorite places in New Orleans! The Crab cake covered with the crawfish sauce and the baked oysters covered in some reddish sauce were incredible! The drinks were strong! And our waitress had a great personality!

The lines are crazy but the food is so worth it!
Our server was Mike with the grey hair and he was awesome! 
Made wonderful dinner suggestions that were perfect for us and took great care of us!
We will def be back when we are here again!
Great place!

The food was just alright. I've had plenty of better dishes at more reasonable prices, but of course the convenience of its location makes it appealing. If you're just visiting New Orleans for a short amount of time I would suggest going elsewhere.

THIS PLACE STINKS AS YOU WALK IN!!!

I had to let you know that from the beginning because if it weren't for a business meeting I had here, I would have turned around fast. Once I joined my group upstairs, there was no bad smell and the service was really, really great! The waiters seemed interested in learning what each of us liked so they could make the best recommendation. That seemed to work because everyone in our party was raving about how good their meal was. We all shared the crab cakes and ordered another because of how good they were. My fried seafood tower was way more than I could finish but delicious and enjoyed by all. Next time, I'll hold my nose walking in and head straight upstairs for a great experience!

Our friends from New Orleans brought us here for lunch. It was so good, we came back for dinner that night with more friends. With each visit, we had about a 20 minute wait to be seated, but it was definitley worth it. 

The sampler is great, but I had to have the etouffee. It was the best etouffee I had in my entire stay in New Orleans.

The hurricanes were not super sweet, but just right and were served with dry ice, a nice touch! Bread pudding was perfect!

Attentive and friendly service at the bar, a classy contrast to the hoopla outside.  I had two nice beers and the Oceana grilled oysters.  They were nice oysters and cooked with finesse I think, but they were drowned in far too much sauce, which had an interesting but very salty flavor.  I'd say avoid them in favor of a simpler preparation.  I also had the Taste of New Orleans plate, all of which was terrific, but especially the gumbo.  I'd get that alone next time.  All in all a very classy place in a raucous neighborhood!

Ate at the restaurant on Saturday night. 45 min wait - food very good.  Placed a to go order tonight and received the order in 25 minutes, but the food did not come close to resembling the food we had in the restaurant.  And they delivered at our hotel with no napkins or silverware.  Food was very disappointing!!!  Do not order the food to go.

First off let me say that Oceana is now one of my top 3 places to eat in NOLA.  

We came in for lunch and we decided to sit in the courtyard, it was empty but that wasn't surprising due to the heat and humidity.   This didn't stop us though, the courtyard was pleasantly comfortable.   We were seated literally in front of a fountain and under an extra strong fan, which created a very cool atmosphere.   We were greeted by Jamal,  he was amazingly attentive but not overbearing.   The hostess brought us our drinks and in  less than a minute, there was Jamal.  He told us about the specials and gave us some time to decide.  
He came back and we ordered blackened alligator and another corona.    I've never tried alligator but when the runner brought it out, Jamal came around right after we tried the first bite; he was asking what we thought, if we needed anything else, etc...i digress, the food was VERY GOOD, seasoned nicely with a nice consistency. It has the same sort of texture as chicken (what doesn't though?). It was so good dipped in the sauce that is presented with it. This was a spicy blend of flavors - Cajun dipping sauce ?hhahaha 
I ordered the blackened Ahi tuna medium rare, stuffed with crawfish with a creamy sauce, creamed corn, red beans and rice and of course, jambalaya.   Holy cow!! It was delicious.  For dinner we finished with the creme brûlée- this was my favorite.  It was perfect.  

NOLA has been good to me... when in town check this place out and ask for Jamal.    The food is top
Notch and the service that Jamal provided will have us traveling 3000 Miles away again just for a visit!

Came here at the recommendation of the hotel staff.  It was offered as an alternative to some other popular restaurants. The place is quaint and rustic and a lively atmosphere. 

The wait staff and the host were very friendly.

It was a table of three and we ordered the seafood platter. We split the meal because we didnt want to be stuffed. It was sufficient for two. 

The food came out quickly and was hot. However the flavor had something to be desired. Compared to other popular restaurants in this area we had to give it the three stars

I'm not saying I would not come back but it would not be on my top 10 list of places in the French Quarters.
Great people. Good food. The server Pamela was a delight. Thanks for the great visit.

I've been here on two different vacations and the food has been ok both times. The blackened duck was kind of chewy, but I don't ever eat duck so maybe that is normal? I had the BBQ shrimp based on the reviews and was kind of grossed out by them. Also had a greek salad with chicken that was pretty good. I only came here because it was in Kitchen Nightmares but locals seem to love it. The airport shuttle driver, the front desk person at my hotel, people walking by that could see me looking at the menu from outside - they all love the place and think it's delicious
Decent food, totally overpriced and a ridiculous line outside waiting to eat. If you want to be on bourbon to eat then you've found your place

This is my overall rating based on food, experience, customer service and timeliness.


We walk in at about 5, we were sat promptly... and greeted with a smile and welcome to oceana. It immediately put a smile on our faces. 

We place our drink orders then We order our food, The sampler and oysters. Our waiter walks away and that's when we see a shift in our experience

First it takes 30 mins for our drink orders to come in and only one of us gets our drinks. Before I can ask where my drink is, he's gone. I finally get my drink 20 mins later while still waiting on our food. Our apps didn't even make it out yet. Probably ended up waiting for about an hour before our appetizers came out. 

No one was really attentive. I asked a lady if she could get a channel on the tv but she completely ignored me while another man seemed mad that I asked him to change the channel.

What saved his rating from being a 2 was those smothered oysters but if you could just order them to go and save he trouble of dealing with the people .

What a great find! Thanks to my clever yelp searching skills my wife and I were able to find Oceana Grill. We originally were going to eat at the French Market only to find the shops close at 6 pm. Leave it to my favorite app to guide us in the right direction. Upon arriving the line to get in was at least a 45-60 min wait which can be defeating for anyone that is starving. Thankfully the restaurant had an employee outside asking how many in the group and where they wanted to be seated. No one wanted the bar area so we jumped at the chance having only waited 5 minutes in line. Seated at the bar was prefect, football, hurricanes and some great southern food. My wife ordered the gator bites, crawfish étouffée, and I had the grilled crawfish, blackened catfish platter with a side of soft shell crab. Yes we were super hungry! And when in New Orleans just order a bunch of everything. Located right on the corner of bourbon I was surprised on how good everything was. Bourbon is a bit of a tourist and drunk trap but Oceana delivers. Great food, ambiance, service and loved the hurricanes! #hurricanes #eatNOLA
Great food, great service! Vegetarian stew was to die for. It was amazing! Hard to find good veggie dishes in New Orleans but this was nothing short of amazing
Food was great!   Our server was beyond great.   When visiting ask for Michael.   He was very knowledgeable and prompt.   Every item he suggested was amazing.   Will visit again.
Great food the outside balcony was very nice and clean service was 10/10 would go again

AMAZING! Finally I understand the love of NOLA cuisine! Shared with friends and sampled many dishes: Crab Cakes, Oysters Oceana, Jambalaya, Craw-fish Etouffee, Shrimp Creole, Andouille Sausage & Gumbo - absolutely everything was FANTASTIC! Guess that's why the staff at my fancy hotel recommended Oceana rather than their own "fine dining restaurant." Oceana will be my "go-to" from now on! DELICIOUS!
Now this is NewOrleans seafood at its best.  Very reasonably priced and a wonderful atmosphere.  If I am ever back in town I will be back here!

Authentication of  New Orleans is found here.  Inexpensive but good. Only negative was my request to have waiter acknowledge my sister law bday that night and it wasn't.  We went down the street to fat cat abs the band song. I inky requested it because the prior reviews said it was done. Disappointed yet please wuthering food. Would go back but in the morning or for lunch and I'll request for waiters Erleen or the Barry white impersonation singer heard they were nicer. Our guy seemed to be anxious to go home.
Great service!!! The seafood was so fresh and the kids menu was filling as well! We do not eat pork and this place has a Seafood Gumbo that doesn't have any meat other than seafood. It was delish!

Amazing food and great customer service! Make sure you make reservations in advance, as there was a long wait out the door for those without one. The food was absolutely delicious & the drinks were great. We sat outside- it was about 7:30ish and the temperature was fine (late June). 
Try the Cajun fries with shrimp as an appetizer- it's a must! Of course, the charbroiled oysters were great. I had the days special- the red fish special with corn chowder and crawfish crum toppings and was not disappointed. Everyone on our table finished their plates and raved about their order. 
I can see why people choose to wait in line.

Natalie was amazing!  A very attentive, friendly and fun waitress!  The food was fabulous.  Party of 9 very different tastes and everyone was very pleased!  The crab cakes are the best we have had in NOLA. Almost as good as Boston.  The blackened chicken is so good that words cannot express.  The hurricane was okay, not the strongest around and don't get the frozen ones here.  
Friend shrimp is good. Oysters Rockefeller was delicious (except a little gritty for me). 
Overall very nice dinner and seated upstairs was wonderful and just private enough.
For being just off Bourbon Street, Oceana is a pleasant surprise! Go here for fried food. The service was very friendly and the back patio is nice for dinner on a nice evening!
The food was good nothing that is super great but it was not bad my father had the gumbo and I had the duck! The service was greAt ! Don't forget to get your 10% off just by checking in

We had a long day and were given the menu by the front desk. We were told delivery would be 45 mins-1hour. Fine. 1.5 hour later, called to check and was told to wait because the delivery comes by bike. I finally called back 40 mins later and was told they called and we didn't answer. No missed call on our cell phone. They offered to re-deliver but figured the food wouldn't taste good two hours later. Don't know if this is a rare or regular occurrence. Disappointed we have to go to bed hungry and couldn't enjoy Nola food.

This place was on point. The staff was extremely friendly and very attentive especially out waiter. I came with another couple and my significant other. The ladies both had the seafood combo which was hot, fresh, and delicious. One of the guys had a hamburger and said it was good and my guy had a grilled chicken breast sandwich and was very satisfied with his choice. We definitely will be back again when in New Orleans.

This review is for customer service...rude hostesses at this restaurant. I visited Oceana Grill while on vacation in New Orleans. I made an online reservation for 9pm and arrived approximately 5-10 minutes prior. As I approached the restaurant, there was a line of about 15 people waiting outside. I notified the hostess, whom was standing outside about my reservation. She then told me to go inside and notify the hostess at the hostess counter. There were about 10 people in the "waiting area" at the front of the restaurant, so it was a bit packed. The hostess who was standing outside then comes in and rudely tells everyone to get out of the way and move to the side. She then told the other hostess about my reservation, in which she rudely replies, "they need to go back outside and wait in line." If there was no available table at that moment, that should have been stated. There was no need for a rude dismissal. Anywho, we decided to leave at that point. Customer service means a lot and I'm okay with not spending my money at an establishment that does not believe the same. Two stars because I didn't actually eat the food.

This was the first stop on my New Orleans trip and it was a pleasant experience.  We went to eat early, so there weren't very many people in there.  They don't have happy hour, that was the first thing I asked.  I ordered the half dozen raw oysters and a bowl of seafood gumbo, both were really good.  Of the places I visited, this was the best seafood gumbo I'd tasted.  Oysters were good, VERY LARGE and priced the same at most places.  The service was great too.

I know this restaurant was on some tv show a few years back, but they have a great wait staff, the food was to die for, and very fast service. One of my favorite places to eat when I visit New Orleans. I recommend to everyone.

Food was good, but could have been a little warmer. Gumbo was on or with many other restaurants I've had in the area. Where the food was good, the service was great. Natalie worked hard to make sure we enjoyed our experience.
I wasn't a fan of the chargrilled oysters, but the seafood gumbo was good. However, the cracker it came with was stale. The service was relatively fast.

This was our first meal upon arriving in New Orleans based on a recommendation from the Uber driver that said she had a bridal shower there.  The food was really good. We ordered appetizers and a couple of local favorites to share and I thought the portion sizes were a little small but still delicious. The waitress was very friendly and helpful and kept our drinks filled without being asked. I would definitely go there again. The bill was $80 which included two beers and a club soda.  We got the crabmeat cakes appetizer, 2 cups of gumbo, red beans and rice dinner and the Taste of New Orleans Platter.
Had a great experience here! Amazing food and even better service from Harrison! Thanks for making our first meal on Bourbon street memorable.

This is an ok find right off of Bourbon.  I've eaten here a number of times and never left very impressed.  I returned this last time because they have a lot of seating (at least 3 stories!) and can easily accomodate large groups.  We called about an hour ahead for about 30 people on a Wednesday night, and there were still open tables on the floor we were seated on.    

I must say the oysters on the half shell were great and shucked perfectly!  Too bad that doesn't count though since I can get those at about 1000 places in New Orleans.  The fried gator bites were pretty tasty, but the shrimp poboy was a let down.  The fried shrimp weren't that good, and the batter was not complementary at all.  It was too thick, and you couldn't even taste the shrimp.  I've tried other dishes there too, including their friend oysters, and none have left me with much to be excited about.  

The service was friendly but pretty slow.  Overall, it has a cool atmosphere, is easy to get to from Bourbon, and is good for large groups.  However, for anyone that knows good cajun seafood, there are a number of better options in the area.
Not authentic New Orleans food. It's touristy nonsense that got a glimpse of fame from kitchen nightmares. Over priced poor quality... Beware.

This was a great start. But then me and my friends who are entertainers were really hungry. And remembered this place from tv show. And they denied us service because one person brought up Gordon Ramseys name??? Then they asked us to leave. Which was ludicrous! We were hungry and just wanted food. Probably great food. But crap service! Dont eat here!! Its over priced anyways! And not friendly to tourists!!!

Our first stop for dinner at NOLA. Overall it was our first taste of NOLA. A bit too pricey. I had the red fish which I couldn't finish. Probably should've ordered some fried foods instead? Food was flavorful but not warm enough. Oyster was good, however. I like Creole House much better because everything was hot and seemed a lot more fresh! I guess food in French Quarter cost a lot more overall?!
Great food and excellent service by Erroll! He's friendly and made great suggestions for us to try authentic NOLA cuisine. A must try when visiting bourbon st!
Was expecting more in terms of ambience and food quality. More of a bar feel that a upscale seafood restaurant. The blackened alligator was delicious and perfectly seasoned.

The Oceana oysters are almost better than the Rockefeller version, with garlic, herbs, and cheese.  The rest of the menu was great, whether it was Cajun or seafood.  Reasonable prices, especially the fresh oysters.

Very good food and excellent customer service. The blackened alligator was delicious and the alligator sausage. 
Our waitress Whitney was very informative And had outstanding customer service!!!!!!!!!

Absolutely the best service and food I had while visiting New Orleans for 5 days! From the appetizer Oysters Rockefeller, which was the best I have ever eaten, to the redfish which sat on jambalaya and had fried crawfish tails with a simply awesome Cajun mushroom sauce, it was the BEST dining experience to date! GO GO GO!  P.S. Make a reservation. The line can be long!

Horrible!! There is no freshness to the seafood! I'm from Houston and it takes a lot to please me! This place is a joke! Taste like frozen food! I should have known from those so called OYSTER Rockefeller's that had gravy poured on them! Who does that!! You want great oysters go to Dragos!
Food was amazing and Whitney offered amazing service and suggestions throughout the city!

After having to walk away from terrible experience at Cafe Soule, the really fast and friendly service and excellent food turned our last meal experience in NOLA from disappointment to delight. Well done Oceana team!

Been here a few times. Mainly cause it's one of the places that serves food the latest. This this time it was a mercy mission after finding out our favorite spots for a shrimp po boy had closed due to fire. ::tear::
The po boys here are good and huge! Not enough dressings but they def don't skimp on the shrimp. 
Came here the next morning on a recommendation for the grits and they did not disappoint! Probably the best grits I've ever had.

I really like Oceana. They are consistent and more importantly, serving food till the wee hours!
Good food and service.  Tried the gator tails and gumbo both were good.  Flavorful food here.  Lots of items on the menu looked pretty good
Sat at the bar and spent a pleasant few hours. Good appetizers and chocolate mousse cake is well worth the splurge. Cocktails were tasty but I noticed some bartenders were more skilled than others.

Adorable back patio seating with a real New Orleans feel. Great oysters and my favorite red beans and rice yet. The hostesses out front managing the line were great- even on a saturday night we were seating quickly and they had a super nice attitude.

I was blown away by the staff of Oceana Grill.
We were recently married in New Orleans and were in need of a rehearsal dinner space, Oceana made it a hit. 
All of our guests LOVED the food, atmosphere and staff !!! Many of our party returned to Oceana throughout their stay due to the amazing service and delicious food. Our family planned the wedding from Austin, Tx and Kayleigh was a great help with all of our needs while organizing the dinner. She made this a breeze, they stayed within our budget needs and accommodated our party of 52 with no hiccups at all. Kim was our head waitress. Kim and her team brought a smile to everyones face. She had my grandfather rolling with laughter all night, my nephew was so taken with her he asked if we could all take a picture together. All of the food came out hot, in a timely manner, everyone was served all at once and when we had 2 very late arrivals within 10 minutes of our guests being there they had drinks and food as if they didnt miss a beat. We decided on a sit down meal that included a option of beverage, starter, entree and dessert. All of which were delightful.  We'd visited Oceana before for lunch and dinner and loved the food and very friendly service. This experience takes the cake though. The rehearsal dinner at Oceana was one of the best parts of the wedding week. ALL of the guests remarked how much fun they had, how adorable and true to the area the space was, how stupendous the staff was.  We will definitely be back and will use them for future events as well. 
THANK YOU Kayleigh, Kim and the staff from the D'Alfonso/Morris wedding - you made our evening and had our family in fits of laughter and great memories.

great bfast to end a 3 day visit at french quarter, good service too.
i tried the gumbo which is good, the crabcakes is very delicious and the red bean n rice is fabolous.
the price is decent.
crepe dessert to end a great meal

Happy blackened catfish Po boy and the crabcakes appetizer. 

 Food was so fresh and very delicious and service was great! 

Definitely recommend this place if you're in town!!
Really enjoyed dinner here. Waitress Jerleen was attentive and very friendly. Great sweet tea, Alligator bites and traditional Cajun dishes. We got there early but a long line was forming as we left.
Ultimate Seafood platter was awesome!!! It had shrimp, fish, oyster, and soft shell crab. It's one of the best platter that i've ever had!! Our server was Barry he was very kind and friendly!!
I've had better. Only plus I didn't have to wait in line. Seafood could have used more seasoning
Blackened catfish on a bed of red beans and rice with a sauce. Collards were excellent. Service was very good. Of course location adds $$$ but overall good experience.

Server was super nice and helpful. Our food was good and atmosphere was too. I had the crab cakes and my husband had the Taste of New Orleans and we both enjoyed it. He got the Oceana Bloody Mary, said it was OK. I'd do it again!
Food is a bit overrated. Never go on a holiday such as Valentine's Day. We waited three hours to eat and the food was Luke warm

With so many great food options in New Orleans, I am so incredibly bummed that my last meal while in New Orleans (pre airport breakfast) was at this place. Granted, I made the mistake of ordering the cajun omelette, but low quality is low quality.  The omelette and hashbrowns were smothered in grease, the portions were small, and the waiter bluntly refused to accommodate my request to switch out the hashbrowns for fries.  Really dude? Fries were on the menu; it seemed like a reasonable request for a hangover breakfast. The biscuits, disappointingly, were also sub-par.  

A twenty minute wait for the coffees to arrive clinched the two-star rating.  Although I cant speak for the seafood/dinner options, i would not recommend this place for breakfast or brunch, especially when the hangover struggle is real.

Should have repeated either Mother's, Parkway Tavern, or Acme House to end on a high note.  Oh well, until next time....

This was a True Gem! What great atmosphere, superb service,thanks Whitney for the recommendation of the special redfish over spicy cornbread with shrimp in special sauce! Just to die for! Highly highly recommend!

Was in the mood for a Po Boy..and Acme was closed. After reading reveiws on yelp for this place decided to give it a try. The Wood Grilled oysters were awful. Barely grilled ..topped with a remoulade that gave them a slimy cosistency (more slimy than regular oysters on the half). Barely edible. The fried shrimp Po Boy was pretty good..although the shrimp were fried too long..they were hard. They also add that same remoulade to the sandwich with extra pickles.  Not the best. Bartender was nice..that made up for the less than stellar grub.
Best restraunt in new orleans.. If you are in the mood for a great breakfast check this place out.. Jessica is a great server ask for her she is all smiles
Restaurant was very well put together and our server Chad was very friendly. Food was delicious. Oysters and jambalaya was great!!

For a great casual seafood feast give this place a try. The shrimp platter was about 20 HUGE shrimp, nicely seasoned fries, hush puppies and really yummy coleslaw-$16! Two in our party had the crab cake burger and they loved it. Also quite the large portion for $10. So many spots in the quarter are all show no go, and this place is a great value. I would be interested in trying some of their pasta dishes. I saw one go by and it looked lovely. The best food in the quarter? Probably not, but the best value I can guarantee you that!! Nicely decorated and clean bathrooms also. If you've spent anytime in the quarter you would know why that is noteworthy! I will go back for sure!

Disappointed to find our original destination closed, we stumbled into Oceana Grill to find a pleasant surprise :]

Blackened Alligator Tail Bites - 2/5. Unfortunately, this was deemed a miss. The seasoning was very well done (italian style seasoning), but it overpowered the taste of the alligator.

Fresh Oysters - 3/5. Standard oysters served with the standard lemons, saltines, and cocktail sauce / horseradish on the side.

Fried Seafood Platter - 3/5. Fried oysters, friend shrimp, fried catfish and fries. Not much to go wrong here as it's a bunch of fried foods. The fried catfish definitely stood out since the soft fish meat contrasted with the crunchy, battered exterior.

Crab Cake - 3/5. Delicious crawfish and mushroom cream sauce complimented the soft crabmeat.

Bread Pudding - 2/5. Firm bread pudding that didn't have the soft melt-in-your-mouth texture that I desired. However, it was prepared with raisins (a pleasant surprise!)
Food was great. Waitress was terrible. She knew nothing about the menu or how the food was prepared. She really needed to know how to say more than ummmmmmm let me check on that for you.

I feel so bad that I actually made my friend take us all the way from the CBD to visit this restuarant especially since it's a mediocre tourist trap.  I really should have followed my intuition and stuck around the CBD since there are cleaner and more upscale restaurants there.  My main issue with this restaurant is the ambiance is not relaxing, the food was about average and the vents were blowing down cool air conditioning on us the whole time so even though it was in the low 60's here the temperature of this place was in the low 50's and everyone dining here was cold and had to keep their coats on.  It's not very relaxing to eat when it's winter time in the french Quarter and some cold air conditioning is blowing hard down your backs as you are waiting on your order of food.  This place is just not for me.  I prefer smaller, more intimate bistro settings and this place was super casual, chilly and served food that was not that spectacular.  I guess I felt bad since I encouraged my friend to take me here and found out it was nothing special.  I don't understand why this place is getting such high ratings but I do travel quite a bit and I have been to some very wonderful restaurants were ambiance and food quality are well above average.  I would never recommend this place to anyone.  Stick to the grapevine, Mr. B's or any restaurant in the CBD.  This place is noisy, chilly and the food a huge disappointment.
Perfection with staff and food.  totally worth the trip for this restaurant alone.  I had the freshest yellow fin tuna steak and it was amazing.

We wandered in last spring and have been back three times since on subsequent visits. We've always sat at the bar so I can't speak to service in the dining room, but service at the bar has always been good to great. Have tried several different entrees and they've all been good to great as well. Have yet to try any of the fried dishes. The grilled oysters are our fave...we get them every time. I'm sure we'll return the next time we're in New Orleans.

Oceana's is one of my favorite restaurants in New Orleans. Being that I don't eat pork, this mainly seafood restaurant has options that work well for me. I especially love their seafood gumbo, crawfish etouffee, and the redfish. This place offers a cool atmosphere and friendly waitstaff. I have been to Oceana Grill 3 times and they never seem to disappoint.

Great bartender! High quality food. no complaints...Not a SINGLE one! I am not easily impressed. Here I was. Banana foster cheesecake was so good, I wanted to take another piece to carry home. Gumbo- On point. 
Crawfish Etouffee- on point. Red Beans and Rice- on point. I got all of these things in the taste of New Orleans platter (subbed gumbo for jambalaya). $16 and I ate like a queen. I cant wait to return.

If you are in New Orleans you got to try this restaurant. Raw oysters were super fresh and delicious. Fish and chips were taste great. Me and my husband had meals there two days in the roll. I can't wait to visit New Orleans again, I miss the good food at Oceana Grill.

The first day I went the food was delicious the barbecued shrimp is to die for probably the best shrimp I had ever had and to top it off their drinks are delicious the tropical storm and their hurricane are flat amazing. The pastas are average and the the rest is average an item in particular that had me double guessing was the crawfish corn cake it was delicious the first day but the following day I went back for some more and it was pure garbage. Another think that freaked me out was how the first day the bread was toasted yet the second day it wasn't toasted. Confused me a bit but all in all go for the shrimp.

This place is amazing!  A hidden gem just off Bourbon street.  My husband and I split the crab cakes, 1/2 dozen grilled oysters, and blackened Bayou duck.  All suggestions from our awesome bartender Megan!  Thank you Megan!!!!

Great Food, Amazing Drinks, and the Staff  so helpful. Kevin explain the food to us giving us suggestion going on what we wanted in our taste buds. Our waiter wasn't about upsale he actually wanted my friend, sister and I to have a great experience and leave content which we indeed did, we also left a couple pounds extra but it was soooooo worth it....A big shout out to our waiter Kevin H. :-)
I like the decorations of this restaurant, but the food is just ok, the cocktails, worse. The service is pretty good, I should say. But I still think this place is a bit overrated by Yelp,
Didnt have to wait long to be seated. Our waiter Michael was very good. Had the redfish, was tasty but nothing to sing about. I think the food is overpriced. Will try somewhere else on my next trip.

I will just say this about Oceana - We have been to New Orleans twice and eaten there three times.  If you want great food that is not expensive in a casual/fun atmosphere, then go to Oceana.  the crab cakes are an absolute must-have, and everything else we've ever eaten there has been good too.  Also - the service is great and friendly.

Mehh.....

I would recommend coming to this place in between heavy drinking, which seems to be every night on bourbon st haha. The place is enormous and all but has a very 'Casual dining chain' feel such as an Applebees, TGIF Friday's, Red Lobster etc. I don't normally frequent these kinds of places and in my serving days I remember exactly how things were prepared. Most of the food items were pre-packaged and frozen, over salted and fried and down right stale at some points. 

We somehow managed to come here twice during our stay this past weekend but both times left me feeling regretful.

The seafood gumbo included slightly under cooked rice, stale Italian bread and HARD shell crab chunks. OUCH!!! :(   (meanwhile, their menu HAS soft shell crab listed..........I'll get to that later)

My friend ordered the lump crab meat and NO WHERE on the menu did it mention coming topped with a sauce that included mushrooms bits, which btw she is allergic to!

I ordered the Soft shell crab which NO WHERE on the menu did it mention being fried. I literally only managed to eat about a quarter of the soft shell crab since most of it was FRIED GUNK! EW. 

The mash potatoes were edible and the drinks were tasty. Our server the first time around was very friendly and recommended several places to visit. Our server the second time around clearly had better things to do.

Went here for our final dinner on our trip to NOLA. By far the best food we had the whole trip. The shrimp fettuccine Alfredo was amazing as well as the special of the night the red fish with jalapeño cornbread stuffing. Our server Amy was absolutely fantastic and made our experience that much better! Definitely on our go to list for the next trip!

My company and I have ordered from them a lot. Be careful when you order take out from them. They consistently leave out items we order and they never want to take responsibility for the missed items. The gal answering the phone basically states "it's not their problem"
