Every time I come to New Orleans I have to stop by the Oceana Grill! I'm from south Louisiana, and am impressed every time by the food here!

First time here but I love the atmosphere Brady and Chad were great.
I will definitely stop here next time when I a in New Orleans

Do people not realize that this place was on Kitchen Nightmares? Not even Chef Ramsy could save this place! The owner drove him out, and kept on with his old ways. I would never eat at this place after watching that.

Great restaurant right off of bourbon street with some really nice local dishes. Try the 'taste of New Orleans' to get a nice sampling of Cajun food. Really glad we got that so we could double up on what we enjoyed the most
Don't ever order food to go. Apparently you're not a valued customer if you do so. $20 salad with only croutons and lettuce. The etouffee needed a ton of seasoning. Waste of money

Our server John was great. Food quality was good. I had the "Taste of New Orleans" meal and was very happy with my choice. My wife had the Red Beans and rice with Andouille Sausage. It was essentially a rather large portion of rice and beans with a very tiny piece of sausage. Was really displeased by the amount of meat in the meal. For the ten bucks, they can afford to double their meat portion in the meal.

So worth it! I was apprehensive at first when we walked up because there were at least 20 people in line waiting to get in. I thought it was a bar lol! We waited in line not even 20 minutes. This place is huge, we were seated on the third floor! Kathleen, our waitress was so sweet and attentive and the food was absolutely amazing. I highly recommend this place.

The crab cakes and oysters were amazing!!!!!! Delicious!!!! Better words can't be said about the food or staff!!!! Spencer was a great host and waiter and gave us SUCH good information about where to find the BEST local food and jazz!!!! If you have a chance stop in and try the food and ask for spencer he will take phenomenal care of you!!!!!!

Late night spot was spot on for us! I had seen a long line out of this place earlier in the day and so I knew we had to try it. We snagged two seats near the bar and the rest of history. We had a yummy small cup of gumbo. The bbq shrimp were extremely well seasoned. We were just disappointed in the small number we got with our order. We split a catfish po boy and it had a generous portion of fish and sauce. We topped everything with creme brûlée and loved it. Our bartender was extremely attentive to us and we got to chat with some friendly folks at the bar who were there just for dessert. This place is right off of bourbon and a spot to hit up if you're hungry after a couple of drinks. Be smart with the timing though!
The absolute most amazing breakfast we have had.  Great service too.   We had a Cajun omelette and the Cajun sausage breakfast.   I highly recommend a side of gravy.

The line goes pretty quickly here, so don't be afraid to wait. Took us only 10 minutes!

We ordered the gator tail bites - 1/2 blackened, 1/2 fried. It was tasty overall but nothing out of the ordinary. It was my first gator experience, so not sure what I was expecting. 

Oceana's famous oysters  were phenomenal! We literally scraped every last drop of sauce from the oysters and plate. I would go back just for these. A must order! 

We also ordered crawfish étouffée. This was my least favorite dish and I unfortunately thought it was a little bland. 

Our server was great - attentive and funny!
Being from Louisiana I'm use to eating good Cajun food and this place really impressed me. Good service and food was excellent.

This was my first time in New Orleans and ate here my first night because I saw a line and figured it should be good, and the didnt disappoint from the great service to the well made just and undeniably the best food. All I can say is this restaurant was one of my favorites and would recommend the gator bites.

Service was great! She was so friendly and definitely knew her stuff. I also liked that she gave us some good places to visit around there. The food was fantastic and I would definitely be coming back when I visit again.
Stopped in for lunch. What a pleasant surprise. We ordered the shrimp platter with rice and red beans. The service was great and the food was out of this world.   Thank you!!
This place was just ok. I ordered the gumbo and bbq shrimp. My sister ordered the shrimp po'boy and said it was good. The service was good.

I loved this place, had sitting downstairs and upstairs that was pretty nice. Obviously serves seafood, but there's other options. I got the shrimp fettucine and that was delicious. The servers are really nice too. Really recommend this place.

A group of us was stumbling around the  French Quarter looking for a reasonable place to eat. I wanted seafood, and my out of town guests wanted authentic New Orleans cuisine. After browsing menus online l, we decided on Oceana Grill. One couple shared the fried seafood platter. My husband had pasta. I, my sister and kids had the gumbo. It was all wonderful. It was really busy that day, but the service was quick, and friendly. The thing I remember most but forgot to get the name of it was the cocktail my waiter Brad recommended.  I'll guess we'll just have to go back next time and get the it again.

The service was good
The food was okay, except for the Duck. The Duck was fantastic IMO. 
A bit overprice, but not too bad.
We had the duck, crawfish étouffée and the seafood gumbo. The seafood gumbo and étouffée are the same like most places.

Had late lunch here on Friday as a recommendation from Cajun Encounters... Boy what a wonderful experience. We were seated right away & our waiter was on point!!! Shrimp poboy was delish!!! & gumbo super yomo.  Drinks were right on as well, 3 bahama mamas & 1 tropical storm & we ended up in tummy heaven. 
Can u tell I love it. Excellent spot!!!

Dinner here was fabulous. The alligator sausage was so good that we ordered a second order. Oysters were super fresh and the crab cakes were all crab. No filler. We  ordered catfish platters, red fish, jambalaya and other seafood dishes. Everything tastes fresh and "homemade". Let's not forget about the bread pudding for dessert. A very successful and tasty meal.

Shitty service only 2 star because the sauce was okay but cold people are insane!!! Saying this is better than acme it's a no brainer acme anyday!


Overall never coming back lost rocket with drink order drinks came with oysters  


Po boy was average fries okay waste of money go to acme

A gem in the French Quarters! Very pleased with the service and food. My friend and I had lunch here, which a tour guide recommended. My friend ordered a Bloody Mary and it was the first one I have ever tasted and liked. We shared the BBQ shrimp appetizer, it had a tasty gravy but the shells were difficult to remove. I enjoyed the taste of New Orleans and my friend had the Cajun jambalaya pasta, both good. We ended our meal with bread pudding that was a delight.

turtle soup was good.....hurricanes were good......blackened red fish with jumbalaya was good.....service was good.....location was good.....was all good.

I ate lunch there and it wasn't too packed....but when I walked by at dinner time it was out the door line.
Absolutely amazing food. Great choice of appetizers, soups, salads, po-boys, pastas, and drinks. Very friendly service, and lots of entertainment.

Great food and atmosphere!  Went there 2 times while visiting Nola in April 9th-12th. The first day , our waitress was Jimika and she was wonderful, attentive and funny. I will definitely go back there the next time I am in town.

This place has the best crabcakes! We go here everyone we visit New Orleans. My husband really loves the gumbo and this time I ordered the special; catfish. Our server, Desiree was very attentive and have great recommendations. We really liked her! 
This restaurant is in a great location and has steaks, gumbo, seafood, poboys and an oyster bar.

Went here for dinner on the day before Mardi Gras. Easily one of my favorite restaurants of the year. We ordered the Oceana big banana drink, the alligator tail (half fried/half blackened), cajun jambalaya pasta, catfish special, and their king cake (for mardi gras). Outstanding would be an understatement!

This place definitely has an amazing bloody mary. All we ate were the gator bites, and they were good, but not mind-blowing. 

Our bartender Abby was super nice. 

Thanks for recommendation Dan-the-man!
All wait staff in New Orleans has been very attentive and Oceana is no exception. We loved the char-broiled oysters and Creole redfish.  The fried eggplant was to-die-for.

The food is great but the customer service is seriously lacking, hence the mediocre experience.

Upon walking down French Quarter, you can observe a line during lunch and dinner hours as well.  The space is somewhat limited so you may need to wait outside at the beginning.

(+) they do reservations - don't try for last minute!  They will ask you to come in. 
(+) decent selection of dishes - I feel like if you're into variety and want a great Southern food experience, this is one of the restaurants. 
(+) our waitress gave us good recommendations as to what dishes to try or what was possible to be shared
(+) Opens late

(-) my significant other dropped his utensils when we were being served and the busboy/ server literally just glared at us like we were stupid children when we requested a replacement. Are you hinting there's no such thing as accidents? The server's body gesture was quite evident that he wouldn't be fulfilling our request, which was true. We had to ask our waitress and snitch on you, just kidding.  Our waitress also seemed fatigued / rolled her eyes/ didn't care. 

I guess this is the feeling most people would get if they go from dining at Commander's Palace (known for their exceptional customer service) at lunch to dinner here eh??? Back to reality folks and boy does it hurt! 
 
Overall, service was whatever which really ruined our dining experience.

Hands down the best red beans and rice I've ever had. I had the taste of New Orleans which was divine. Wasn't too busy on a Friday like most places and the food was top notch especially given the cheap price point. We paired out meal with a local draft beer (Abita blonde) which was perfect. 

Definitely will be back to this joint!
The food was amazing and service 2nd to none.  This is my first time in New Orleans and this place came highly recommended.  In fact I'm on my way for a second visit now.

So glad we did not wait in the ridiculous line at Acme! We were estates immediately at Oceana Grill and had a lovely view from the 2nd floor (I was pleasantly surprised with the classic architecture of this place!). 
Chargrilled oysters were aaaaaah-mazing! I would like to bottle the sauce and put it on anything and everything. Gumbo was incredible and the special (a grilled catfish entree, the name of which is escaping me) was savory and beyond delicious! I HIGHLY recommend this spot (which was recommended by my uncle, a native of the area!)

This is seriously one of the best places I've ever been to. I ate here twice on my visit; once via delivery and once dine-in. Delivery was quick and the food was still hot and didn't lack even though it was delivered. My dine-in experience was great too. We had to wait a few minutes but this place is multi-level so they found us a table within 5 mins. The service was good and our waiter checked on us often to make sure we were good. 

My favorite thing about this place is the pricing. It is so reasonably price for the quality and flavor of the food. The food was so good. I had the best greens I'd ever had here. The portion sizes were great and I honestly had no complaints. I cant wait to go back to NO just to visit this place.

Visited twice so far during our trip, and it's everything you'd hope for in a reasonably priced eatery.  Good portions and good food.  On my second trip, my fried oysters were EXCELLENT!!!  Solid centers (no "goosh"), moist and not burnt, perfect!  Both the tartar sauce and cocktail sauce look and taste home made.

Excellent service as well!!!

If I had one thing for them to improve on, is to offer a salad/veg dish in place of the fries.

I was yelping to find a highly reviewed seafood place being this is our first time in New Orleans.  I stumbled on this place and it received 4 stars for over 3k reviewers.  When we walked in and seeing it was located right by Bourbon St, we knew we probably walked into a tourist trap.  Ok the pros, wait staffs were extremely patient and gracious.  Love them.  As for the food, they were sub par.  We ordered char grilled oysters to start.  Nah, not as good the ones we got in Felix a day ago.  I got the crawfish creole which was just okay.  My wife's blackened fish was top notch.  That I give a 4 stars.  My son got the only non seafood dish which was pasta with chicken fettuccini.  If it wasn't for Yelp 10% check in offer, we would not come.  Also they charge default of 18% gratuity.  Again as I said, tourist trap.

From the outside, this place doesn't look as big as it is from the inside... After a nasty experience at another restaurant, we were hungry and strolling around french quarter for a nice meal, when we spotted Oceana Grill with not a lot of people waiting on the sidewalk.. 

Tried our luck, and the hostess asked if we're okay sitting in the courtyard - Duh!  We're from New York, we'll take any opportunity to eat in an open space with fresh air :-D

Anyways, so right after we are seated, our server brings the menu, water etc... so 5-stars for service... And then while we're still discussing, he suggests we order their raw oysters right away... We did as told and then also ordered a platter of fried shrimp... 

Overall, great food and flavor, the oysters tasted fresh and great.

We had the Pecan pie with ice-cream for dessert, and nothing was left sticking on the plate (or its sides )

Overall, very pleasant experience and a highly recommended destination if you don't like standing in the queue for an oyster bar - I experienced that too, and can definitely say Oceana Grill is far superior in the quality of their product and service!
Excellent service, fast preparation, and food that exceeds expectations. Emonie provided prompt, professional service and yet was friendly. On a side note, very cute as well. Would recommend.

There was a like out the door so I took that as a good sign that we had come to the right place being that people were willing to wait. Luckily we got sat right away since we opted for bar seating. I got the crab cake pasta and my boyfriend opted for the catfish po boy. The crab cake was light and flavorful and the pasta was creamy, very well portioned. The po boy was pretty large and fried just right. This is a good option if you're looking for a little bit of everything.

First, make sure you check in on Yelp! You get 10% off when you show them the screen! The server was really warm and friendly. He definitely got an A for effort.

For ten bucks, the alligator bites are not worth it. They come out greasy and tough. 
Between three of us, we got the shrimp pasta dish (which was absolutely phenomenal, though the noodles could have been a little more al dente) and the Taste of New Orleans, which is a fun sampler of all the things NOLA is famous for.

I don't know if I would necessarily go out of my way to eat here, but the meal was enjoyable for a quick stop while we were down there.

Warning.... know the line is down the street at this place. When I finally arrived to the door, I was greeted and than seated faster than I originally thought. I had the most amazing waitress named Whitney, she pleasant, prompt and professional. She suggested the red snapper with a shrimp and crawfish sauce, it looked amazing. I inquired about other shrimp & crawfish platters.  Whitney described a pasta dish, her description was so vivid... I had to try it. The dish was the some of the best pasta I've tasted. Whitney was 2 for 2 on the suggestion list. This is my first time in New Orleans and long as Whitney is here suggesting platters.... I won't leave Lousiana without coming here. That's Whitney I appreciate your tastebuds!!!

Great service. I tried gator for the first time -- it was surprisingly delicious! Our drinks were great and waitress was phenomenal! Definitely on my list of places to stop in whenever I visit NOLA again.

We had just drove into town and I had an intensely juicy oyster po boy here. In addition, the Bloody Mary was good but a little weak on alcohol content.

Our waiter, Jamal, was top notch and got our food out to us quick. He also told us about some fun attractions, restaurants, and cafes in and around the city.

If you feel like braving Bourbon street, definitely stop by Oceana.
Good drinks. Jambalaya is over pasta not rice - I'm just not a fan of that. Red beans and rice was pretty flavorless. But ambiance is great and waitstaff is friendly and prompt.
A must stop. Really good food. I had the catfish poboy & now want another one just thinking about it.
Best damn food I've had in a long time! Was so good we went here TWICE during our 4 day trip. Definitely a is a 'must go' for future trips
Right portion size with a exquisite sauce and your veggies on the side.... Jazzy crab cakes is a good option...

THE best crabcakes and grilled oysters, period. Service was efficient and very attentive thanks to Michael (our wonderful waiter)! Courtyard seating was beautiful and the drinks were strong, not watered down. Il'l certainly come here again on my next visit to NOLA.

Everything we got we loved. THE BLACKENED ALLIGATOR is a must!!!! It was so delicious the best way to have it better than the fried version. My boyfriend got the duck and it was so tender and juicy! I got the cajun pasta and enjoyed it a lot I usually go for a red sauce but their Alfredo was tasty a lot of shrimp and crawfish.

Amazing food! 

I had the taste of New Orleans and it was the best food I had all weekend and well worth the modest prices. Service was prompt and friendly and the decor of the restaurant gave it a unique feel and character. 

Their food and drink menu were very diverse and affordable. 

Overall, I'm looking forward to coming back here.

Had to come here on our trip to New Orleans since we are big fans of kitchen nightmares. We tried the shrimp po boy and full fried platter with oysters catfish, shrimp basically whole sea. Both tasted very good little pricey but worth it fries were okay little cold. Overall recommend you check this place out.
Really good food and service.  I had the blackened catfish Po Bo.   The catfish was tender and the sauce was great and the bread nice and crusty.   Kids had fun with the alligator appetizer.

Short wait on a Friday night but the sautéed Redfish with Etouffe and Ribs were great!! We cleaned our plates and topped dinner off with bread pudding with a side of ice cream.  Great & efficient service!  Jennifer was attentive & a pleasure!  Make an effort if in New Orleans to have dinner here.
Great gumbo-yum fries and excellent po boys.Didnt like my cream oysters thought they were v heavy.good service had lunch there.Nice location.
For was excellent. I had the seafood omlet and oysters. I could not finish my food.  Server was Errol, made our visit the best it could ever be.

From the moment we walked in the door off Bourbon Street this place was fun. We had to wait a few minutes to be seated but they were speedy and very friendly.  Our waiter was very nice and the food was excellent.  

I got the Taste of New Orleans plate.  I couldn't have been happier with the food.

A+ place in my book!  We will be returning.
Best seafood in town! Their oysters are lovely and the staff is very personable. I've dined here on multiple occasions!
The venue was nice. The menu was limited but the options available were good. A good place to stop but nothing extraordinary.

We brought our cousins from out of town and enjoyed the service and the food.  The blackened catfish special was fantastic.  I had the eggs Benedict over eggplant and that was wonderful too.  Management also came by and checked on us which was a nice touch.
Best meal I had when visiting New Orleans French quarters. The crab cakes were delicious and so was the pasta. I had the creme brûlée for dessert and that was also delicious. Def come here!

Meh. Really had high expectations but raw oysters had no flavor whatsoever just wet cold slimey. I had some at desires earlier and i caught myself licking the shell they were so tasty.  So go there instead

This was my first trip to NOLA and I've always wanted to taste the food here. Oceana was incredible! We tried the blackened and fried alligator, very tasty. However, the best plate was the crab cakes. It's not that imitation crab you get at some places, this was straight authentic crab in every bite. Lastly, don't sleep on their jambalaya either. Definitely the place to indulge.
We all had a terrific time and thought the food was so good we ate here twice during our stay. We tried a bit of everything!

Great off the beaten path spot. They have al the creole flavors you would be looking for. I went with a party of 4 and ordered mainly pasta, but I had the sampler with crawfish added and it had good flavor, but nothing amazing. The double hurricane could start a car if really needed. The wait staff if very friendly and full of suggestions. Would defiantly go back!
Not sure why this is in the French Quarter. The fried seafood may as well be out of a frozen tv dinner box. Ultra commercial.

Pretty delicious and excellent service..We were recommended by a local who told us this was a great place to go.. The oysters Oceania were so delicious! The shrimp po'boy was also incredible. They have the most delicious house sauces.
Crab cake was amazing. That's about it. The Po Boy was plain and the red beans and rice tasted terrible. There was too much smoke flavor in the red beans and it was too salty.

Stopped by for lunch while visiting the French Quarter. 

The staff were very informative and helpful in suggestions from the menu and know the menu very well. 

Got the crab cakes for the appetizer and they were fabulous. I would recommend them. 

I also got the seafood platter with catfish, shrimp, and oysters. Everything was perfect.

I know that this place is nice and the staff is awesome but for some reason, I get sick when I eat here. Every.Single.Time. It could be seasoning or maybe what I get is bad but after eating here three times, the charm thing was not going to work for me. Their Bloody Mary is really good along with appetisers but that's all I can say. It seems it's the main meals that I can't seem to handle. I have tired many times to give this place a try it but I can't give it anymore. I give the 3 star because the staff there is really great and their bartender can make a good Bloody Mary but that's all I can say.

Oceana Grill offers a menu with a wide variety of options and is conveniently located in the French Quarter. I had raw oysters, gator tail and crab cakes - ordering off the appetizer menu for a party of two. The oysters were awesome, and they don't go overboard on the horseradish. The crab cakes are a specialty and came highly recommended from a friend who lives in the area. The appetizer portion is two very large cakes. The cake was moist and perfectly cooked, topped with a cream mushroom sauce. I'd never had crab cakes topped with this type of sauce, but it really worked. For the gator tail, we couldn't decide between fried or blackened, so our server suggested we get half and half. They were a bit chewy, but were still very good. I was a little surprised the blackened ones were breaded and fried as well, but the flavor profile was definitely different between the two. We had great, friendly service and were able to walk in at 6:30pm on a Monday night with no wait for a table.

We'd made a reservation at the Oceana Grill for a bachelor party after seeing good reviews online. They were easy to work with throughout the process, and the food was good and unique Louisiana offerings. The service was also good, so definitely worth a visit.
AMAZING! I died of how good the food is! Defiantly would come back!  came back the next day for dinner again so happy with the food! When I come back form Los Angeles I will gladly come back!

Absolutely love to visit this place every time I visit New Orleans. The Lost Bread is the best along with the Royal Omelet. Whitney provided such great service for our party and was very helpful with recommendations for my friends. I will definitely come back again and again.

This was our first meal in NOLA after arriving from a 7 hour drive into the city.  We chose it for it's 4 star review on Yelp and the fact that it was a convenient 10 minute walk from our hotel.  With a reservation, we showed up at 7:30 and just had a 2 minute wait for our table.  The line for no reservations was 30-45 minutes. Once seated, it took a while to be greeted and drink orders to be delivered.  We opted for an alligator appetizer and split the fried cajun platter for our meal.  Perhaps we just ordered wrong.  The alligator was good and interesting and the fried platter was just that - a fried platter.  Nothing to wow us at all.  The service was really spotty with little attention spent on our table to check in or refill drinks.  This is a big restaurant with an ambiance to match.  Loud and happening.  Not my favorite with other French Quarter restaurants to choose from.
We've only come for breakfast, but it's a go-to place with solid food and great bloody Mary's. Breakfast may not be quite the same as Petunia's, but is a decent replacement.

Hands down the best food I had during my stay in NOLA. It was so good that I forgot to take an image to upload. I ordered the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta and the dish surpassed all expectations. The shrimp and chicken were perfectly cooked and seasoned which added an extra "umph" to the dish. It was a bit spicy, but manageable. After ordering the entree came about 10 minutes later, which was pretty quick. Major perk alert: you can bring alcohol from outside! 

I'm definitely going back!
Oceana's duck was cooked just right. The kids loved the pasta! The lemon drop was not the best but the food made up for them.
Amazing food and everyone we interacted with, from the hostess to the server to the manager, was so friendly and helpful.  This was our absolute favorite place to eat thus far.  Highly recommend!!

While most of Yelp pointed us towards Port of Call as the place to go after 11pm for dinner, I forged my own path and went with another highly rated midnight dinner space, Oceana - and I am so glad I did.

So I'll preface this review that I am from California. In California it's illegal to smoke within 20 feet of a business door and thus when we were seated for our first meal (we returned a second time the food was so good) on the patio, we were shocked that every single person on the patio was smoking.

Beware, if you're seated in the patio, someone will probably be smoking.

Now, on with the review. Both visits we had the crab cakes and bread pudding. The bread pudding was amazing, sheer bliss. It made the top 5 of the items I tried while in New Orleans. The crab cakes themselves were filling, delicious, and savory. An entire meal really.

We didn't repeat the fried crab I ordered on our first visit (incredibly tiny, and generally not worth the price), but both times our service was friendly and warm. 

I definitely would return to Oceana and I'm very glad I chose it over Port of Call!
Loved this place - went twice on our trip to New Orleans. The catfish platter was very good. I don't think anyone in our party had a bad meal.

Oceana was the first restaurant I ate at during my trip to New Orleans. The place was recommended by the hotel and it was walking distance so my friends and I thought that we would try it out.

All the waiters and waitresses here are SO nice and friendly. Definitely feeling the Southern hospitality! Food wise, I thought it was pretty good but not exceptional. It was my first time trying alligator. The blackened alligator was delicious but I thought that the fried alligator was too tough. We ordered the gator bites, fried seafood platter and one of the specials of the day.

Ate here for breakfast twice. The food was fantastic and the service was attentive, so we were all super happy. Especially the grits. Really flavorful and the perfect texture. Good portions for the price, too.
Great crab cakes for GF person and non GF person, the crawfish etouffee is fantastic. Not to mention their Sazerac!
AMAZING courtyard and brunch. Food was delicious and drinks were great. Errol is the best waiter. Great guy - love that southern hospitality. Thanks Errol, you rock!

My husband and I were in town for a conference.  Brandon was our server - he was very attentive and provided great menu recommendations!  We had the alligator appetizer, shared the seafood platter for the main course, and bread pudding for dessert - all delicious!

Went there for my bday dinner. Food is meh. Nothing special. Service is poor. Our waitress had an attitude and her thumb was in my fries when she brought me my plate.  My Bloody Mary was not very good  I tried to play with it. Letting the ice melt so I could mix the ingredients. I still didn't like it, but figured I could wait til I got my food and then would try it again. I still didn't like it,  so when our grumpy waitress graced us with her presence, I told her that I would like to return the BM and get a diet coke instead. She told me that she would have to go and get the manager. When the manager came I told my story.  He then told me that my drink had been at the table too long and If I had a problem with the drink, I should of said something sooner.... I was so upset.
One of my go to spots while in NOLA. Kitchen is open late, friendly staff, and great location. Wide range of choices on the menu and a full bar. I recommend the crab cakes, so good!!

Best seafood i ever had fantastic, the shrimp and fish were great and the soft shell crab and oysters were delish had an awesome attentive server was an awesome experience and the price wasn't bad for the amount of food u get

Our server was fantastic, I wish I could remember his name so that I could post it here, but I do recall that he was new to the restaurant.  My fiance had the crawfish etouffee, I had the barbecue shrimp- had it not been for all the bread that came with our meals, we'd have ended up licking our plates clean instead of the bread-mopping we did.  Neither of us were overly hungry when we arrived, and while we were waiting for our food, we overheard another patron comment that she doubted anyone could ever finish their plate here because the portions were so large.  I've gotta say, i don't know how she had leftovers because after one bite I knew I'd be finishing every last bit and I'm the kind of person who almost always leaves with a doggie bag!

Price was reasonable, too, our tab was $40 (before tip) for 2 dinners and beer.  We'll definitely be going back!
Pleasantly surprised since this place screams "tourist trap" being situated between 2 daiquiri bars right off Bourbon street.

Worst seafood we've ever had-shrimp smelled VERY old and tasted even worse, drinks weren't even able to be finished they were so poorly mixed.  Only ate about 1/20 of the entire meal before paying and leaving, as we were worried about food poisoning from the bad shrimp.  To top it all off, the waitress was not surprised at all to hear that the shrimp smelled and tasted awful.  Never again....there are too many stellar options in New Orleans to risk it.  I have NO idea why this is 4 stars on Yelp...either reviews are SERIOUSLY being stacked or the late hours accommodate blasted tastebuds of revelers who are too drunk to care.  I WISH I had seen the Kitchen Nightmares episode before venturing in...I am completely unsurprised by what the episode showed...the food tasted as foul as what Ramsay saw when it was filmed.  DON'T RISK IT!!!

Soooo nice and def a must need to stop when in New Orleans. Our waitress Deanne went out of her way to accommodate our large group and everything was served in a timely fashion. I loved the decor. The drinks were so cool I think they incorporated dry ice that makes the drinks bubble during your whole meal. Very nice authentic Cajun recipes. MUST TRY THE SPECIALS. Will visit again. Gator bites!!!!

This doesn't reflect the service at all. Rod was outstanding and so friendly. However, this has been the least appetizing food we've eaten in NOLA thus far. I ordered the chef "speciality" the Duck in praline sauce and my husband ordered the fried catfish. Both were pre-made. Our dinner came out about 5 mins after we placed our order. The duck skin was so soft not crispy at all and portions of it were dry. The sauce tasted like they opened a can of sweet condensed milk and just poured it over the poorly cooked duck. My husband fried catfish was also dry, but as any chef or even good cook knows reheated food can become DRY. I was so disappointed.. $50 down the drain for crumby food. We won't ever be coming back, I'd rather eat a slice of pizza.

Why the heck does Oceana have such raving reviews? We must have not ordered what they're known for. The jambalaya pasta was nothing like what I was expecting, no spice, no heat, no peppers. The dish was just really creamy like a seafood fettuccine with shrimp and sausage. 

Tried to be healthy by ordering the Redfish Oceana, but it was a battered fish, not really sautéed. The cream sauce was tasty though because there were little crawfish pieces in it. Nothing terribly special about this 'signature dish'.

Lastly, we ordered a seafood gumbo. This dish was probably the best of the three. It was basic, seemed like a dish you can get anywhere without waiting in a line that is out the door. There are probably more authentic and tastier Cajun dishes in the French Quarter area to try. Service wasn't terrible, waiter just stopped by once. Wouldn't really recommend Oceana for a meal.
Crab cake heaven! Rich sauce served on top, these were really good! Also had Bourbon pecan pie and it was tardy with flaky crust. Delivered to my hotel really fast.

Went here twice on a 3 day trip to Nola, once for breakfast, once for dinner. The staff was nice and the place was cozy. The first night we at was on Thanksgiving and it was a grand feast, seafood dinner, lovely meal. The chocolate cake/pie was LIFE!!! Breakfast on sat morning was disappointing. I brought 2 friends with me and swore it'd be the best choice they could've never made. Well between the shrimp grits, eggs benedict (crab cake) and regular breakfast, all about 15$ each...very disappointing. Just regular dry taste no special seasonings or flavor. The biscuit that came as an appetizer was so yuck, just frozen atrocity!

Errol as our waiter, you could not go wrong.  His suggestions for dinner and beverages were exactly what we were looking for.  If you had a bad experience here, you did not have Errol and you did not follow his advise for your order.  We ate in the courtyard and it was a great New Orleans dining experience. Errol even provided suggestions on other activities in New Orleans we might enjoy when we asked.  Great time, great food!

This is rated in top restaurants in bourbon. However I hadn't heard of them and they were recommended for Cajun by the reception of the prince conti hotel that we stayed in .we also got a ten percent discount. The service was prompt , the concerns were a bit fake . You get that 'I don't give a shit about you but this is my job' vibes sometimes. I ordered seafood gumbo. The portions were small and not even the third best I had in NOLA. I had much much tastier ones from family run Waffle House like Cajun joints and highway to Lafayette. Given a chance I will think twice before going back given my ROI experience.

David was our waiter and he was excellent! We tried the alligator, redfish etouffee, jambalaya and fried crawfish tails. Great service and food was yummy! A little more hyped and pricey than I would have liked but a great restaurant all around. Def make a reservation otherwise there will be a long wait!

Our first time here. All I can say is, "Wow".   From the greeting when we first came in, to the food, EVERYTHING was amazing, the seafood gumbo,"OMG"!!!   Our server Meagan was the best. She's honestly like a momma checking on your customers, making sure we had everything we needed.  The sauces on my husband's voodoo pasta, TDF , and my crab cakes, I loved them.   Thank you for an amazing experience on our first evening in New Orleans.  We will be back before we leave.  Hopefully Meagan will be our server again. Awesome experience.

We've eaten a quite a few places in NOLA and this is one of our favorites. We actually ate here TWICE on the same trip recently because we love it so much. I've seen a couple of bad reviews about service, but we've never had that problem and have always found the service and timing to be excellent. Not to mention it's in a great location!

Couldn't make up my mind so went with the Taste of New Orleans...really good! Crawfish etoufee had lots of crawfish and a slight kick, jambalaya was very good, and the red beans and rice tasted like, well, like red beans and rice are supposed to taste!  Exactly what I wanted on my last day in New Orleans.  I went for a very early lunch so not crowded at all, and the service was great...thanks Errol!

Emonie, Emonie, Emonie!!!
Food is great too!!!
I had the gator po' boy and the seafood gumbo

YUMMMM. The line is somewhat long, but worth it. Drink menu is amazing and so are the oysters. Everything about the restaurant is very Now Orleans. I went with a group of a few people and everyone seemed to enjoy it. LARGE portions, but its a good thing because the food is so good.

Was average to below average. Everyone working there was super nice, just the food wasn't really abt anything. Gumbo was nothing different from a place you wouldn't expect to serve gumbo and the crab meat cakes were mostly filler breading, which was incredibly disappointing at $15! We shared the fried shrimp platter and the shrimp were tasty but the breading was heavy and again nothing to fight over. Again, the staff was awesome, especially our server, and the atmosphere was nice, just the food. Perhaps our expectations were too high for our first time in New Orleans and eating our first meal. On to the next one...
Good food and HUGE portions.  If you're looking for a decent place to eat without all the Bourbon St. debauchery look no further.  Be careful the crepes weigh in at 2lbs.

After a long day of flying, the 8 of us wanted to grab a snack. We ended up coming here around midnight. The place is pretty spacious and we were pleasantly surprised to get a table for the 8 of us. A lot of us already ate dinner so we ordered light but half of us also ordered drinks. We got some attitude about how much we ordered. It was not appreciated. The food was okay and half of the drinks were good. Would not have come here if it was under different circumstances.

Im guessing breakfast is not their thing. I went here for breakfast on a Sunday and it was empty. Not a good sign.   Their world famous crepes were horrible. It was my only disappointing meal while visiting New Orleans. I can count on one hand how many times I have not finished a restaurant meal in my life. This was of those times. The crepe had no redeeming qualities. Service was great. Very friendly and welcoming staff.

Rats. Everywhere.


They sat us on the patio. We had been once before and sat inside and it was ok. The oysters are small but still yummy.

What we had outside is irrelevant because we saw 2-3 rats while sitting in the courtyard. They have no business seating people out there.

The icing on the cake was the roach seen in the men's room. Gross!!!!!

I understand NOLA is disgusting but you don't see this stuff off the Quarter. Never again.

Superior bar! The drinks are fabulous and the food matches. Devin, a manager, found out we were there for our honeymoon and he made sure we were taken care of. Our waiter, Clay, was knowledgable and kind. We thoroughly enjoyed our experience at the restaurant!

This restaurant is the real deal! Great food, great service and wonderful waitstaff. We had the Blackened Redfish and the Creole Redfish. Both were excellent. Very firm, very fresh fish. We were never rushed., in fact just the opposite. We could not have asked for more. These folks have got it down! Thanks for the experience. Highly recommend you include the Oceana in your trip to New Orleans.
Great authentic New Orleans restaurant just off bourbon street.  Gotta try their oysters....
Great fried seafood and outstanding service! My fav spit in the quarter! My server was very friendly! Will go back

Planned on coming here for weeks now and made a reservation. Upon calling to see if we could get in earlier, they had no record of my reservation. We ended up working it out, but the food proved to be just okay. Our server Alexander was great and super helpful! Food lacked seasoning and flavor.

Fantastic seafood and service. We were served by Errol who was knowledgeable, professional, and respectful. Definitely recommend the taste of new Orleans and the crab cakes. This is my third time and won't be my last!

What can I say how about this location. While we were in New Orleans we visited this restaurant three times. The food here is what you look for when visiting New Orleans. I have tried various things on their menu and was never disappointed. Their shrimp poor boy sandwich is phenomenal and they're red beans and rice it's traditional New Orleans. The seafood gumbo and jambalaya out of this world. The oysters what else can I say but really good. The staff add to the enjoyable experience at this restaurant. Very helpful kind and truly made it a great experience. Oceana is on our list a revisiting everytime we come to New Orleans.

I am giving it one star because the food was terrible. The red beans were more like refried beans and the jambalaya was not good at all. Really disappointed  Waiter was not attentive to our party and seemed like we were more of a hassle and there were only six of us in the group.

Party of 3 for my 40th Birthday Celebration! We initially walked into Felix.... Thank goodness we walked out and came here! Best 2nd choice ever! World Famous Oysters were the best! Louisiana Crab Cakes and catfish po-boy were also delicious!!! Our waiter, Michael, very professional and easy to get along with. Ordered his recommendations and we were not let down! THANKS!!!!
OMG... the tuna was the best I have ever had. It melted in my mouth and was full of flavor.  The crab cakes... exceptional !!! Staff was amazing. Thank you Henry for the service!!!

For a place on Bourbon this spot is great. At breakfast I recommend the French Toast, the eggs Benedict, or the Biscuits and gravy all are outstanding, For dinner or lunch the Crab Cakes are fantastic and the Seafood platter is great and all I could eat! 

On a side note, they have the best grits I have ever..
Quick service even when the place is packed on a Saturday at 6pm. They have all the Louisiana classics and they all taste amazing. Definitely recommend!
This was a fantastic experience! Gluten Free menu is small but very good. Service was quick and friendly. Outdoor patio is a great environment.

Maybe it was the hour I went but the P.O. boy was horrible. The breading was off the shrimp, cold, bread tasted stale. I was so upset because I waited until I came to New Orleans to get an authentic po boy. Maybe next time
Their website menus and on app do not match up. No turtle soup. Food was mediocre at best.

Referred here by a local and let me tell you, it was SO good. We barley had a wait, which is unheard of. Unfortunately we didn't have an entree so this review is strictly on two appetizer plates we shared. We had the Barbecued shrimp and a combo plate of fried and grilled gator. HOLY DELICIOUS. It was so good. Our waitress was really sweet and personable as well. We will make this place a must go too next time we come back. I'll get a full entree then.

OMG this place is amazing! The prices, food and service was great! We had a party of 5 and we didn't wait too long for a table. I got the Taste of New Orleans and my boyfriend got the Catfish Po Boy and it was so good! Next time we visit New Orleans we will definitely come back.

I came to eat at Oceana to try some authentic seafood in New Orleans. While I was satisfied with the food and the service, I feel that the price was just a bit overbearing for the amount of food they brought out. I figure it's just the nature of New Orleans and he French Quarter and people will still need to eat regardless and they will pay for it since they are there to party, but for people like me who just wanted some authentic seafood at a reasonable price, I don't think this place was the right place to go to.

Wonderful! After a tiresome but lively walk down bourbon street, we decided if the line was so long it had to be good! ...and was it! Great menu selections and service! The mixed drinks were great. Will definitely be back when we visit again.
Had the red fish special with jalapeño cornbread stuffing, crawfish, sautéed shrimp and etouffe'...DEELISH!
Oceana Grill was a lot better than I expected. The drinks were strong so if you like that, then you'll like their drinks. The crab cakes were amazing. I highly recommend this appetizer.

Went there today around 3. I have to say the food was amazing. However, the service was the absolute worst I have ever experienced in a restauarant. The female hostess did not want to be at work and it was extremely obvious. She walked off to seat another couple. Male hostess comes to "seat" us. He walks us into the room points to our table and tells us to go have a seat & he will bring us menus in a minute (he had menus in his hand). Needless to say he never brought us a menu. 10 minutes later waitress comes by to get drink order and then went to get us menus. Waitress Janette Z only came by to get drink order, food order & bring us the bill. She never checked about our drinks- yes our glasses were dry. The restaraunt was not busy & she only had 4 tables that were no more than 4 to a table. She was not present on the floor to check on any of her tables. Amazing how bad service can ruin a good meal.

Very cozy, very relaxed. The wait staff works together to make sure you're taken care of. Prices are typical French Quarter with the menus posted at the door for you. The 10% off with Yelp check-in was good and they also had an offer on MyDeals as well (one discount or the other, of course).
If you like sausage, try the Alligator Sausage appetizer...yum! 
I also had the Oysters Rockefeller for the 1st time, tasted good to me. But their  Bananas Foster Ice Cream Cake was outstanding...get it and do your penance the next day ;)

We went there on the recommendation from the hotel.staff. we were definitely not disappointed.  The food came out quickly and was awesome.  I had the Taste of New Orleans  and my husband had catfish. Both were excellent. Our waiter Errol was very attentive and helpful would definitely go bsck.
Awesome experience Jai was the greatest ever!!! Very nice funny and helpful!!! LOVED IT!!!!

Let me start by saying I'm not even a fan of seafood so I was reluctant to go to Oceana, but the ladies in my group really wanted to go. So we get there (for breakfast) and were seated at a table that was pretty small and it was cold inside.  We asked to be moved outside to the beautiful patio! You cant even tell its out there, but you'll love it once you are seated. Errol was our server and he was simply amazing! He took our drink orders insde before we moved, and continued to be our server once we were relocated. The food was good, like really good. I had pancakes, sausage, eggs. Errol was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. I recommend this place and I would definitely go back.

Just okay food at a bit too high of a price point, in my opinion. Ordered a pina colada ($10, weak but creamy), Jameson Irish Mule ($8, same deal), blackened ahi tuna ($18), and crawfish fettuccine ($18). Service was good, though! Waiter really knew the menu.

The gumbo is delicious and the crawfish etouffee was awesome! Trina, our waitress was very accommodating and completely understanding of my mom's dietary needs. She kept checking in to make aure our food was good and we were handling it well. I totally recommend this place!

Great building, decor and atmosphere. Food was average. Service was slow, but very nice. Seafood gumbo, good, but not great. Ate it all, but have had much better. BBQ shrimp had too much Worcestershire sauce, overwhelming, but large quality shrimp. Eggplant fries were  just ok. Redfish Oceana needed more seasoning. Drinks were expensive.

Very good! I tried a dinner special which was grilled red fish over a crawfish jalapeño dressing with greens. It was phenomenal!! The drinks were delicious as well and the staff were friendly and accommodating as well.

This was one of the worst restaurant meals I've ever had. We ordered their signature dish redfish which was completely over cooked.  Also tuna which tasted fishy. On an up note potatoes and mustard greens were excellent. When we told our server that the fish was not good they notified management immediately who came and talk to us. They gave us a 20% discount but that fell short because really we should've been comped at least one meal.

My family and I were staying at the Royal Sonesta across the street and were looking for a place that served breakfast. We landed on Oceania and it was a great decision. Our server was Jerleen and she was so friendly and attentive. I ordered the cajun sausage breakfast which came with alligator and andouille sausage. It was so delicious and spicy. I would definitely return if in the area again.
If you don't mind your meal being defrosted/pre-cooked, removed from a box, warmed/fried and plated. Eat here.
This place was ok at best. This food was mediocre and nothing special. The food was not fresh. In NOLA you would think fresh would be top of mind.

Had the oceana-style chargrilled oysters and the red snapper with stuffed crawfish & mustard greens. Thought everything was pretty tasteless especially since both dishes were smothered in cream sauce. Left pretty disappointed.

We started with crab cakes with their signature sauce...Excellent!!!
my dinner Catfish Lafouche so gooood!
Here for a bachelorette party. Kim was the best! Very on top of everything! Food was quick and everything was delicious.

Food was great! Several had the blackened redfish over jalepeno bread, leaving very satisfied.  Atmosphere was great, beautiful artwork, autographed pics of previous celebrities(specific mention on the signed Eli Manning jersey on the wall),our server, Whitney, was excellent!

Great local fare. Loved our server - John R. We were passing through NOLA on our drive cross country and picked this place at random. Lucky us! Our server, John gave us the choice of either breakfast and lunch since we arrived at 10:30 am and so glad that he did. John suggested the dishes that they are known for and we all had something different and loved our food. My husband had the french toast with chicken strips - so good! I had the Taste of New Orleans which was a great sampler of food - and a big portion for a lunch meal. My son had Blackened Catfish - another great choice and my daughter had the Sausage Breakfast which was another big hit. So we went 4-4 on our picks based on John's recommendations.

The crab cakes were amazing! I wanted to create my own meal by adding fried shrimp, and our server Ashleigh made it happen. She provided awesome service and made great suggestions for our meals! We had a group of 8 for dinner and she managed our table very well! Great experience!

Came down to Oceana's after plenty of locals recommend it and it was very , very , good! Our waitress Dorothy made some great recommendations and was very nice and patient with answering all our questions. We had the cup of Sea food Gumbo, Oceana Redfish, the charbroiled oysters, and their Duck. All great choices , very savory, and filling. The red Fish was my favorite. 

Thank you Dorothy for the recommendation. We really enjoyed it here at Oceana!!

Visiting New Orleans 
I was referred to, " Oceana's" in the French Quarter.
Long line out the door waiting to be seated but went in and ask about sitting at the bar - which you can eat at the bar - no wait!
"Josh," bartender - awesome bartender and good has a good sense of humor.
Ordered a nice beer and then a crab cake - which was awesome !
Then ordered 
Louisiana blackened redfish fillet a top crawfish cornbread topped with our  creamy shrimp pontchartrain  sauce and served with a side of mustard greens 
What a dish !!!!

Giving it two stars because the service was super friendly, and the whole staff was friendly in general.  Also this place is giant.

I honestly didn't really like the food though.  I felt like they used way wayyyy too much salt, where I couldn't really even eat it or taste the flavor.  I ordered the taste of New Orleans, which I also ordered at Royal House so I had something to compare it to.  I much prefer the plate at Royal House, and they are about the same price.

Choosing where to eat in the French Quarter can be overwhelming, so let me be of some help: when in doubt, go to Oceana's. We there a little after 12 noon on a Thursday. Even though it was a full house, we were immediately seated. Our server Jimika was phenomenal: she was very informed about the menu, accommodating and anticipated our needs. We did not wait long for our food. 

My barbeque shrimp appetizer and half n' half fried shrimp and fried catfish po' boy with fries was the most delicious hangover remedy. If you order the barbeque shrimp, remember to order a side of rice so you can sop up the sauce effectively. My po' boy was a great introduction to fried catfish. The fries were the best tasting fries to memory: lightly salted, nice outside crisp with a soft inside.
Very good food, especially the "taste of new orleans!" Shout out to Deanne for the great service!
Great friendly service. Awesome food with a good variety. Fun atmosphere. OK beer selection.

Let's start with the gumbo it was chicken and sausage and it was just okay nothing special at all I was actually a tad bit disappointed because I absolutely love gumbo I even try to fix it , every since I went to my aunts house and one of her friends made it I have been in love every since. So I couldn't wait to get to New Orleans to eat gumbo. I also ordered catfish another one of my favorite food and they give you so much it's piled up on the plate plus it was delicious. Fresh and fried perfectly.

You'd be hard pressed to find any better food in New Orelans than this treat tucked away right off Bourbon st on Conti.  The BBQ Shrimp are easily the best i've ever had in New Orelans and their steaks and blackened food leave nothing to be desired.  

Every time i visit New Orleans, and that's once a year at least, i go to Oceana before most any other restaurant.  Do not miss this place!
DO NOT GO TO THIS RESTAURANT!!!!! Large piece of glass in my friend's cup. And a fly in another drink.
This was the best crab cakes we had in the city!  We came in exhausted from our flight, and Brad (our server) was amazing!  It was so good, we've gone twice in 3 days.

The service was horrible!  The waitress was very rude, service was extremely slow, and waitress never came back to check on us.... the entire meal!  Food was just ok. I would not waste time eating here!
I enjoyed my stay but was disappointed that the hash browns and biscuit arrived to the table cold but the omelet was good.

Great atmosphere and food in the French Quarter.  Experience true new Orleans pleasure in the great setting.  We ate on the patio and the service was excellent.  all the food was hot and served by a pleasant and efficient young, male waiter.  I had the red beans and rice side dish.  Just the right amount of seasoning for me.  The full serving comes with Cajon sausage that I know would have been too spicy for me.  So the side dish was perfect.  Others in the party had the catfish po-boy which was also delicious.  The fish and sauce were excellent but the bread was a bit dry and too much bread for the amount of fish and sauce.  Fries that came with the sandwiches were hot and crispy.  Our third guest had the crab cake burger.  She really enjoyed it but I thought it was fishy tasting.  Great atmosphere on the patio and to be right in the Quarter was a bonus.
Great place for a large group and unlike many restaurants in the area, they take reservations.
Great Food! Fun atmosphere! Lots of food great portions! Great recommendations from our server Brittney! Food was fresh and hot! The Gumbo with the soft shell grab was everything!

Service = 5
Food = 3

Gumbo was very good. Fish was okay. Fried and blackened alligator tail was good.

i & my co-worker had their nightly  special  of  redfish ponchaitr. It was one of best fish dishes i have ever  had .  The bread pudding was also spectacular . Bridget was exceptional , suggesting  the special & checking in to see if everything was good. The manager also stopped to see if everything was good. Great food & service. We have eating in a lot of restaurants , some much more expensive  but none better.
We had breakfast. Had a great menu from elaborate omelettes to simple side dishes. Perfect for all. The staff was very attentive and the food excellent. Bloody Mary's are the best in the quarter.

I ordered for delivery to our room on the Internet because I wanted one last fix of oysters before we left NO. I double checked that I placed the order correctly but they brought shrimp instead of the more expensive seafood platter I wanted. This made me very sad...  The shrimp was of good quality.
Friendly service, good food, reasonable as anything else around the area and portion sizes were huge you get what u pay for. I highly recommend this place if you're a seafood lover like I am.

Great for groups as it is super spacious, two stories and service was great. But food was alright. I think the best meal someone had was the seafood pasta. I had seafood gumbo which was OK, picture in the menu is sort of misleading. I give the bloody mary's 5 stars though!

We had a wonderful experience. The wait staff was helpful and offered many suggestions. We had a large group, and the staff seated us without any difficulty. The food was tasty, with many selections. We were also able to order from a gluten free menu with offered a delicious red fish. I would recommend this to families as well as adults.

I don't write many reviews... But felt compelled to do so... Loved this place so much we ate here twice. First time had blackened ahi tuna, then blackened red fish. Servers were polite and quick to refill drinks. 
Prices were reasonable... I will come back on my next visit.
Reason I felt compelled to write this review was because of the bad experience in between my two visits that made me appreciate good food and good service.

Awesome crab cakes and good bar service. I would go back for the crab cakes alone, but the drawback was the crowd, very busy on a Monday night!  Great atmosphere and the food was delivered hot. Service overall was outstanding and prices were fair for portion size. Would recommend.

I can't say I was impressed. We ordered the gator bites, they were overcooked and dry. The drinks came in a plastic cup. Our final bill was $93.00 and I can't say it was worth the cost. The wait staff was friendly but I could have spent my money for a much better meal else wear.

There is no way the majority of these reviews can be true or objective. It seems the high marks are for the staff and that's fine but seems like orchestrated praise. Let it be known that this place is never, never mentioned in conversations about great places to eat in this city. The ones that are mentioned don't get these bloated, over the top reviews. They're stuck with the honest and constructive reviews you would hope everybody gets.

Amazing food and even better servers. My server was Errol and Derrick and they both were really attentive and professional. They also have breakfast which is bomb! Definitely will go back when I visit!

My waitress Whitney recommended the special, which was blackened redfish over a jalapeño, crawfish cornbread dressing with a side of corn maque choux. It was a 10/10. This was literally top 5 best restaurant dishes I've ever had. I'm glad I went with Whitney's recommendation. This is classic New Orleans cuisine.

Came here 2 nights in a row because the food and service were excellent! Heather and Bradley at the bar were amazing! Tried several appetizers including fresh oysters, crab cakes, gator bites, grilled oysters... all were delicious! Definitely a must on the list if you're looking for a place to hang for drinks and good food!

Tried this place while visiting New Orleans thinking maybe Gordon Ramsay actually turned it around. Boy was I wrong, place is a dump the decor is horrible. Don't even get me started on that crap they're trying to pass off as authentic Cajun food. Don't waste your time or money there are so many better places to eat in New Orleans.

Omg the crab cakes are Devine!!! Like they we battered and either fried or pan seared... it was topped with a creole cream sauce that had crawfish tails and mushrooms.... on a bed of lettuce... which I would've preferred to not have... I was surprised by it and it was warm and slimy under the hot crab cake.... I got the reason behind it but it didn't work for me the crab cake and sauce was the bomb alone..... i ordered the Redfish Ocean it was a sautéed redfish topped with the same sauce that was on the crab cakes... and I had roasted garlic potatoes with the sautéed greens... which kinda taste like glory greens in the can... (my greens taste better) but all in all the good was good and our server kaitlyn was cool!! I will definitely be coming back here!!!
Awesome food !!!! Excellent portion size even for me 6'3 had to get to go box. Will be returning. The smoking Hurricane Drink was great. And our waiter John was great!!

Happen to pass this restaurant while in town to celebrate Mardi Gras.  The service we received from our server Jimika was exceptional.   She anticipated our every need and always had a smile on her face. 

As for the food, it was great too.   I had the fried catfish which was served in a heffy portion leaving me very well satisfied.   

The entire staff, including one of the managers, who was constantly asking if we needed anything, was there to fill our every need.

I would recommend this as a must visit place when visiting New Orleans.

No real reason to wait in the insane line for Deannies when you have Oceana grill. A solid choice if you are craving the cajun basics in a casual environment. had the fried seafood platter to get my fix in and it was totally on point. Way more food than I could eat, cooked perfectly. Additionally I had to try the alligator bites two ways. Blackened and fried. A really nice way to enjoy and say you ate alligator.  Especially recommend this if you made the mistake of traveling to New Orleans with kids!

This was the first restaurant that I ate at in New Orleans. The service was great, our server Emonie was very warm, friendly, and made GREAT recommendations. I must say, the Crab Cakes, and the Bread Pudding is a MUST HAVE. I will highly recommend this place to friends.

We couldn't leave New Orleans without trying gator tails and Cajun fried seafood. We were told Oceana Grill was the spot, and it definitely lived up to the hype. 

The hush puppies are the real deal, the seafood was seasoned to perfection and the gator tails....an explosion of fishy-chicken greatness all in one bite. (Drops mic)

We sat down and ordered drink and an appetizer and she told us that we couldn't just order one thing and she would have to talk to the manager. She said that since we were already sitting down that we could order the food. We got our food before we got our drinks and got the check around the same time as the drinks. Service was rude, the alligator bites were mediocre.

The restaurant was recommended the day we got here.  We enjoyed it so much that in a city with hundreds of great places to eat we came back 3 days later.  

Everything we had was delicious and the service was great.

I know this place has prime real estate for vast amounts of foot traffic on Bourbon St. so naturally you might think this is a tourist trap. Well, I guess it is, but that doesn't mean it's not good! Don't be scared if there's a line out the front door because it goes relatively fast. The food is pretty great if you're really hungry and don't have crazy high expectations. This central joint has the NOLA charm and flavors you might be seeking.

Yummy menu item choices are:
1) Gator Tail Bites - Marinated white meat gator tail served fried or blackened. Served with remoulade sauce. 
2) Taste of New Orleans - Creole jambalaya, crawfish etouffee, red beans and rice with smoked sausage.
3) Oyster Rockefeller - Classic sauce with spinach, smoked bacon and pernod liqueur, topped with a blend of fresh grated parmesan cheese.
4) Bananas Foster Ice Cream - Bananas Foster Ice Cream Cake

I think the highlight was the dessert so be sure to leave room for that ice cream cake!

Admirable service but you can do muchhhh better in terms of local fare. A bit unfair really, because the CBD/French districts are so heavily saturated with nice establishments.
However, if you want easy food to go with your beer, opt for this place. 
Oceana was recommended to us by the hotel concierge when asked for a locals-only type of place. 
Up to bat - 
1) alligator bites: so-so. If you've never had alligator..its just chewier chicken. Not standout among my other experiences,  and was expecting higher from NOLA. 
2) fried seafood platter - assortment of clams, hush puppies, catfish, shrimp, etc. 
The catfish was cooked best, but overall would have preferred a flakier crust/finish. 
3) ahi tuna - not bad. Cooked to a nice medium and extremely hearty, as expected for this fish. The side of greens was a nice southern touch (think collards). 
Other - shrimp pasta was OK, but local  redfish was meh.

Had received recommendations to check out Oceana. Glad I took the advice.
Started with the Oceana oysters which were outstanding. The sauce is so good, we had the waiter bring extra bread to soak it all in. My wife wanted to order a few dozen more and she is not the biggest oyster fan.
For the main course I had the fettuccine Alfredo with shrimp. If you like some spice, order the shrimp blackened (waiter suggestion). I cleaned the plate. The wife had the steak which was cooked perfectly.

Staff was very friendly and attentive to our needs. I look forward to my next visit.

I've been here several times and have yet to be disappointed! The seafood is always fresh and well seasoned. There are a lot of places that serve barbecue shrimp, but Oceana's is definitely in my top 5. I have yet to try the desserts because I'm always stuffed! Great food, good service!

We were in the area and decided to try this for lunch. What a gem! Very friendly service from our server, food was brought out very quickly, and the food was delicious. Even the appetizer alligator tail bites was delicious; we got half fried and half chargrilled. It has a local dive feel and I definitely recommend this place for lunch.

The best charred oysters I've had in NOLA. GREAT service as our waitress knew exactly what we wanted and advised us on their speciality. We loved this place so much we went twice.

The alligator comes fried and blackened and I thought blackened had more flavor so that was fun to try. The RAW oysters were so much bigger than a lot of other places. The charred ones though had a different save than most but you got the smoky flavor from them and they were so good.

Surprisingly the fries and hush puppies are also delish and soft on the inside crispy on the outside. The New Orleans sampler was great and made me believe in beans and rice again as that was the most flavorful rice and beans I've ever had in my life!

The wait does go by fast as the layout of this place has a lot of upstairs. Their staff is absolutely fantastic and will guide you every step of the way up until you leave.

Oceana was the best restaurant I've eaten at on this trip so far!  We started with a bowl of delicious gumbo.  If you're from the bay, you're probably used to gumbo within with Dungeness crab, shrimp, chicken, sausage, rice and veggies. It's completely different here. Our seafood is different on our Coast of course. 
Next we ordered a blackened Redfin fish dish which had a crawfish sauce. The sauce was everything!  
My wife ordered the crab cakes which were the S&@=#! Lol. They were so good and also came with the crawfish topping, but the crab cakes stood on their own!

We were to full for dessert.

AMAZING FOOD AND SERVICE. It was 11pm on 12/14/2014 and my family and I were on a visit to New Orleans looking for a place to dine at, ran into this place by chance. This is a place that you shouldn't pass up. The atmosphere gives you a taste of the French Quarter. 
I tried-
Crabmeat cakes: fresh crab with big pieces -- delicious
Famous Oysters: extremely fresh with no sand
Fried catfish Po-boy: seasoned well and tasty
Cajun Jambalaya Pasta: Well mixed and not too spicy

Even though this place is in a touristy area and is usually full of tourists, I found this place on yelp and decided to try it. It was my first Creole food experience. I order Shrimp Gumbo and platter that had a sample of every Creole dishes. The gumbo was an explosion of spices and flavors. I tried more Creole food in other New Orleans staple, such as Coops et al. But no place came close to Oceana. I am fan. Thanks for making my first Creole food experience, so yummy!

I don't like to give negative reviews, but with all of the amazing restaurants in the French Quarter it is a shame to see so many people lining up in hour+ waits for mediocre food and not so great service. 

We made a reservation for our large group, and still had to wait over 30 mins for our table to be ready. After finally being seated the food was truly underwhelming and the specialty cocktails were essentially all juice and syrup. The chargrilled oysters were covered in a weird, mayo-like sauce and the blackened chicken pasta felt more like a soup. 

I'm not sure why this place draws such a large crowd compared to the other delicious, and far less crowded, restaurants surrounding it. 

The one saving grace of our dinner was the alligator bites, which were the best thing we ordered. Overall though, I would suggest seeking out other French Quarter restaurants for your Cajun/creole meal!

Came here for late lunch on Saturday afternoon while visiting town, shrimp po-boy was so good!

Good menu prices compared to others in the area.
Lot's of food at a great price! A must try in NOLA! No wait for a table and food came quickly.

Boom! Fantastic.  We ate here lateish on a Friday night.  Alligator appetizer, oysters, and a host of NOLA delights were enjoyed by all.  Thank you, Oceana, for introducing us to some good Bayou cooking.

Great place to eat! And, they're open until 1 a.m. I had the Jazzy Crab Cake platter and a side of red beans and rice.  My friends had everything from the ribs to the seafood platter.  The service was excellent.  The staff was attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. One friend ordered the Hulk and she loved it!  It's also right off of Bourbon Street and a four minute walk from our hotel on Canal Street. I would definitely recommend this place when visiting NOLA.
Would give 5 but it takes so long to get drinks and God at this place.  Food is good.

Excellent service and great cajun food! Located right in the heart of the french quarter, and wonderful ambiance too. There was a line but it moved very quickly so don't let it scare you away. The food portions were very large we had to get take out boxes to go!
The food was great and our waiter was incredibly attentive.   Large  portions, fresh seafood, and strong drinks.  My wife and i were very pleased with our meal and it was also relatively inexpensive.

STILL is one of my favorite place to visit in New Orleans. I believe they have added another location near by the original place on Conti st.
I wanted to order 1/2 an order of oysters with 3 pieces of raw and 3 pieces of charbroiled oysters. The waiter didn't hear me correctly and brought out 1/2 of order of each!!!! And I was glad she did!!!
The raw oysters were so fresh and sweet.  The charbroiled oysters... Oh man... You just have to order them. 
We also had the crab cakes: two pieces with a lot of crab meat for two to share.
My wife once again ordered the blackened duck (seriously, we come back here every time for the duck). The portion was very generous and the duck was perfectly seasoned and cooked. The skin was crispy.
I ordered the Cajun jambalaya. Can't go wrong with this plate here if u are unsure of what to order.
Yup! That was a lot of food. Not sure how we were able to are them all!!! And the price is very reasonable here.
Would definitely come back to this place again when we are in town.

Me and my girlfriends ate here 2 days ago during the Essence Festival and it was AMAZING!!! I had shrimp poboy and seafood gumbo which was delicious. The poboy had slaw on it instead of lettuce which was so so so good and the gumbo was FULL of chunks of seafood!! Not to mention the fries was delicious.  The only bad thing I can say is the water is horrible and it was a bit pricey for what you get. It's so many more places in NO with authentic creole food with cheaper prices. It's not an elegant place but there prices would make you think so. 

The line.... Please don't be fooled by that long line, I think they intentionally do that to make people curious about the food and eager to eat there. Trust me it won't take long at all it was about 20 -25 people in front of us and me and my sister walked around the corner my girlfriend called us in 10 min and said hurry up come back is only 4 people in front of her now.
Very busy and had a party of 8 but worth the wait. Had a simple fried shrimp poboy and was happy. Staff were every friendly. Definitely a nice place to stop in!

This place has great food! The best seafood gumbo that I have had in NOLA. It was so full of seafood with a rich flavor and not too spicy. I then had a platter of fried seafood and man was it great and a lot of food! You will not leave this place hungry at all. The service was great and Kevin was friendly. The sweet tea was delicious and so were the drinks. Yum! I can't wait to come back here one day soon.

This place never disappoints.  Have been eating here for over 10 years.  Service and food are always consistent.  If you go for dinner you may wait but it's well worth it.  Please don't change a thing.

Make a reservation. The line tends to be long. The server David was fantastic! He made the dining experience fun. I ordered the new orleans platter which helped me taste the best dishes of new orleans. The cajun fries was superb! My hubby and step-son did not like the bread that came with the po-boy sandwiches they ordered but the seafood inside the sandwich was great! We tried the gator bites too which was great! You can have it delivered too through yelp. Which we did on our last day as we were too tired after the walking tour. A great restaurant to try when you visit NOLA.

The food at Oceana Grill was phenomenal. It was my first time eating the alligator bites, and boy to my surprise, were they absolutely delicious! Erol, our server, was a sweetheart and very attentive. The whole staff was very welcoming considering we were Raiders fans from NJ on vacation to see the football game against the Saints. It was a very pleasant experience and would highly recommend this place to anyone. :)

Let's me just start by saying #Blessed!!!  Place is outstanding.  Great service and location is right next to our hotel The Royal Sonesta (Humble Brag). Ordered Blackened Red Fish covered in mushroom crawfish sauce and crawfish. Even better was the side of.......wait for it ........wait for it......CORNBREAD  jalapeño crawfish dressing !!!! That's right I said it !!!! (Added Picture) Place is casual and service was great.  Recommend for lunch instead of dinner. For a few reasons .... dinner lines are out the door and down Conti street after 5 pm and that can be a bit hot in the summer, same food but less crowds for lunch. And final reason by dinner time in the french quarter you're usually drunk and may be in the middle of drinking your dinner and getting ready for that late night slice of pizza or that 1 am lucky dog
The famous oysters were amazing! The jambalaya pasta was to die for, very flavorful. The gumbo was delicious. Drinks were okay but the food made up for it. Nice ambience. Would come back.

I've been to this place at least  6 or 7 times.  Each time it was easy to get a table,  and the service was the best I've received in all of New Orleans.  The food was the best I've ever had.  The gumbo, red beans and rice, etouffee, and lost bread were amazing.    A lot of people gave it bad reviews for the service, but I was always treated  well.  Next time I got back to New Orleans, I will be going back again!
The food is good. However, I was seated near the kitchen & saw a rat run across their kitchen floor. It was revolting.
Definitely our favorite restaurant in the French Quarter!! Loved the seafood crepes!  It's first on our list when we return!
Best Crab Benedict and Bloody Mary!!! Great service and I won the golden ticket! Our waitress, Meagan is the best. Must be a stop when you come to New Orleans.

Its just ok, gator bites, blackened was more like fried and lukewarm! Crawfish étouffée was ok, but not piping hot, luke warm, bring it out hot guys! If your buzzed and need food kitchen is open till one am. I wouldnt go back, un memorable! Creole fast food ....
Great food. Good taste. The oysters were amazing. They have a base sauce that is also fantastic. The location is also perfect. I would visit it again.

We ate dinner here on our first night in New Orleans at the recommendation of our hotel concierge. We even got a 10% off coupon. We were not disappointed. Like most places in the French quarter, there was a line out the door. Since we were willing to sit at the bar, we were able to go in immediately. 

The bartender wasn't the best server, but she was very busy. And she was friendly, so I'll cut her some slack. 

My husband at the Red Fish Oceana, a huge fish fillet covered in a creamy crawfish mushroom sauce and served with mashed potatoes and the vegetable of the day, which was collard greens. The greens weren't that good, but the mashed potatoes were delicious. He loved his food and the fish was incredibly fresh.
