I hate the crab cakes and they were DELICIOUS! They came with the same sauce and sides. If I went back, I would order the appetizer portion of the crab cakes because I couldn't finish the dinner portion. If you like crab cakes, these are definitely worth trying.

Came here with friends. Jaime was our waitress and she recommended some delicious food. The cajón friends with crawfish are the best!!! We had soft crab, fried shrimp and fried catfish. Their bread pudding was one of the best one I've tried so far out there.

So good!! Definitely a great place for a late night dinner. The Crab Cakes were amazing - I scraped the plate clean - and my brother loved his Jambalaya. Drinks were fantastic! It is nice to be able to actually enjoy a cocktail that's made right. I wish I had room for dessert. 

Our server was friendly and on point. We were seated right away. No complaints. 
Definitely will go here again next time I'm in town!
The crab cakes and peach margarita were wonderful.  Fried shrimp was mediocre.  Breading was too think for my liking.
Excellent food. Had Seafood Gumbo and Redfish Oceana. Both were excellent, especially the sauce on the redfish. Server was very pleasant and accommodating. Highly recommend.

Wow! This place was recommended by our tour guide and I'm so glad we went! The ambiance was great and the service was too. It was my first taste of NOLa food, and I left there so satisfied, that we ended up going back a second time! I had the Jumbalaya pasta. It was wonderful! A huge plate of food, that I unfortunately couldn't finish... it was heartbreaking. I can't take too much spice, but the spice on this was just right. (If you're looking for spices, you may have to asked them for a little extra). My brother had an Oyster Po'boy, fried crawfish and crawfish etoufee. He was very satisfied!
The restaurant is in the french quarter and close to everything, so it's a good stop on your way to party.

The second time around, I had the crab cakes. They were so big that, it's all I ordered. They were delicious! The best I've ever had!

A definite must do when in NOLa!!

We had a few hours to hang in New Orleans and stopped here.  What a treat!  The atmosphere is colorful and live.  What you'd expect on Bourbon St.  My wife and I ordered two appetizers and shard a meal.  The Blackened Gator bites ($10.50) and Louisiana Crabmeat Cakes ($15) were fantastic starters.  We went with the Taste is New Orleans ($17) for our main dish... That's a party in your mouth for sure!  Great stuff!  The kids had the chicken strips that you could definitely skip.  Great spot!

The crab cakes were awesome. I loved the crawfish mushroom sauce they poor over the cakes, and I don't even like mushrooms. I had the fried shrimp platter for my entree with crawfish étouffée on the side. The shrimp was good, but the étouffée was great. To top off the meal, I ordered the bread pudding which was awesome! I would come back just for the dessert. And our server Eric was great. He was super friendly and so knowledgeable about the menu. I would also come back just to be served by Eric. Great experience.

This place was delicious! Our server Errol was extremely nice and attentive, and had great recommendations. To start we ordered some fresh oysters, and also their cooked ones which came in a delicious sauce. Seriously...that sauce was amazing. I would probably eat it on any things We also got alligator bites, which were really good. For my meal I got the BBQ shrimp, which was so messy but sooooo good; and my friends got the crab Benedict, the duck, and a classic catfish po boy. Everybody loved their food! I wouldn't say it's the cheapest spot to grab some food, or maybe it would be if you don't order a bunch of alcohol lol (but I must say that their bloody mary, bahama mama, and swamp drinks were delicious). Overall, the food was great, the service was amazing, the drinks were strong, and there's a Yelp deal for 10% off your entire order. It's a win-win-win-win.
Food was delicious, service was fast and friendly. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

This restaurant was recommended by the front desk clerk at our hotel. The food was flavorful and plenty. Our food came so fast that we didn't think it was ours. Our favorite item is this drink I think call Tropical Storm. I came out bubbling and was really good! I ordered the crab cakes and it was filing.

Loved it here! We picked it because we needed somewhere late night after a wrestling show and my boyfriend really wanted some gator. I'm not a fish fan and that can be hard sometimes in New Orleans to find alternatives that actually taste good, so I was happy to see they had a chicken and pasta option. It was seasoned so amazing I loved it! We got seated outside and it was so cute back there! Every employee greeted us on our way in and out. Out waitress was Jessica and she was so nice and knowledgeable. I'm happy we found it and we will definitely be coming back the next time we are in NOLA.

This place has the best breakfast i ordered the Pain Perdu lost bread (french toast) OMG it was awesome loved it I also on another occasion had the st James Crepe which was lump crab meat with sweet peppers and onions with cheese wrapped in a crepe it was delicious. I highly recommend
Get 'A Taste of New Orleans' for an outstanding and authentic introduction to the local cuisine!

Place looks unpleasant but the food was not bad! Our sever was great and the food was good also. Charboiled oysters were great. We got the crab cakes but I wasn't a huge fan of them. Kind of was dry and the sauce for me killed the crab cake. Overall the food for me was okay..I would rather actually pick Acme Over that.

Joeys only or bubba gump can make this food. Average at best food, I did have the waiters recommendation of baked duck and it was good, but I was the only one who enjoyed the food out of a table of 6. Redfish entre (filet) was full of bones and I get it, its fish, but it was unexpected to have to be so careful and my friends wife was grossed out. Overall, Greasy spoon seafood. Crawfish was mostly batter, much better choices for higher quality food all around - although the fried oysters had great flavor and the service here was top notch and fast.

Good - Employees. The people there are great. All the employees were attentive and caring from the hostess to our waiter. 

Bad - Food. Unfortunately my jambalaya looked old and like it was scrapped from the bottom of a burnt pan. 

Unfortunately I would never eat there again, even though the staff was great. You go to a restaurant with the hope of the Food being one of its best qualities.
Honestly. This place is worth the wait. Service was excellent. Our server was Ashleigh and she was patient and polite to our large party. I will definitely come back.

Four of us were visiting from San Diego, walking towards Bourbon Street when we saw this restaurant. The menu intrigued us, and two guys waiting for table said it was incredibly good. They were right! We had alligator bites, oysters, and gumbo for appetizers. Then main entrees of jambalaya seafood pasta, seafood platter filled with catfish and other treasures. OMG is an understatement! We are coming back to Oceana next weekend!  Kevin was our waiter and we will ask for him again, he knows how to ensure his customers have a memorable experience.

The crepes St. James were disappointing. First, it was an enormous crepe, really too much to eat and it didn't look particularly appetizing. It was stuffed with crab and shrimp and sautéed bell pepper and onions, but the crab was fishy tasting. Service was very slow. Probably should have tried something fried.

We had lunch here and it was very good. The redfish was so good and the taste of new orleans was excellent.
Highly Recommended ! Bathroom was super clean!
Real nice atmosphere for everyone.

The service was poor, although the restaurant was no where near full capacity we we're instructed to wait outside on a line and again inside across from the bar . While walking to our table we we're astonished by the number of empty tables. The food was very fast food, chain quality. My shrimp was very notably prefrozen and nothing was great. When an appetizer comes out in less than 3 minutes of you ordering it, you can guess the greatness amount of preparation was not put into it.
Easy take out order. Worked great for us while staying at the bear by hyatt. Highly reccommend the crab cakes they were delicious and the sauce was delicious.

The service is wonderful !!
The gumbo is goooood and well priced !
Great service and red fish and ribs were awesome. Wife got the mandarin blush and I had two White Russians. Excellent and would definitely return

I went in with a group of people. Desireé was our server. She was so amazing! The food was great! Tried gator!! Great place to hang out and have a dinner. Thank you again Desireé for taking care of us! (Edgar and Jessica). The gays.

Overall good food. 
Shrimp appetizer in a pepper sauce was some of the best flavored shrimp I've ever had. Delicious and good size.
Chicken po'boy was ok - good flavors but not enough of the slaw for that much bread and the chicken wasn't too flavorful. 
Also got the veggie stew, which was flavorful

I am hungry and I need food. I happen to stop in an Art Gallery and I asked rhe gentleman who had the best food around the area. He said Oceana. So I decided to check it out. I figured the food here must be great because there was a line out the building.  

Once inside I decided to order the shrimp alfredo pasta. That dish runs you about $19 a plate. I love pasta especially from a cajun restaurant so I was ready. Once my food came out I was so disappointed with the way it looked. I felt robbed of a true pasta dish. It was more sauce than anything else. I am sure I injested more alfredo sauce than noodles and shrimp. I have definitely had better. The bowl was so shallow. I don't think I have eaten out of that kind of bowl since I was a child.
Okay food. Overpriced for the quality. Don't order delivery, arrived more than 30 minutes late with no apology and I had to find a pen for the delivery driver.

Came to this establishment and noticed there was a pretty long line so decided to stay, thinking it must be worth it. The line moved pretty quickly, and it was weird it was there to begin with because the restaurant was not full and had many available tables. We ordered drinks and crab cakes and which were pretty good, not so much for myself because the flavor was too fishy but my boyfriend loved them. Didn't stay to order food because menu items seemed pricy for what they were.

This was disappointing. The jambalaya was just okay. The staff was good; the manager was bad. We only waited 5-10 minutes and I am glad we didn't wait a long time. The charbroiled oysters were okay. Just not great food.

We had a great dining experience here.  The service was friendly even though we did have to wait in line for about 25 minutes.  The helpings are large and our server was great.   We had the "Taste of New Orleans" platter and that was very flavorful.  The cup of gumbo was also good and the real treat was the special Ahi Tuna that was stuffed with crabmeat..............fantastic!  

It was a good way to start our NOLA vacay and explore the great dishes of New Orleans.
This place is where the locals go. The food and the service is impeccable.  The crab cakes are an absolute must! The grilled oysters are to die for.

Oceana Grill in the heart of the French Quarter which attracted my friend and I late one Friday night for dinner. We shared the Red Beans and Rice w/ Cajun Sausage and an order of Bread Pudding. Both were amazing but the bread pudding, one of the best I've ever had! Good job Oceana.
Loved it!!  The crab cakes, fried catfish, ribs, butter&garlic potatoes, fried shrimp, and pecan were all phenomenal!!  Will be back soon...
This place is amazing.  Great food and great staff. Good sized portions are plentiful
This was nice experience. The food was good everyone in the party had different authentic Cajun food

Amazing food !!!! I had the red beans and rice !!!!mmmm
I came with my bestfriend and we both loved our food !

Came in with a large party after a day at a conference.  We were seated after a short wait.  Drinks and apps came quickly and were very good.  Entrees came out fast as well.  Food was good and as expected, but what really stood out was our waitress, Dorothy.  She accommodated all of our requests regarding billing and some special needs that we had in this area.  She was down to earth, professional, and a good person.  She made our dinner stand out from what would have been an otherwise normal/good experience.

our server Ashleigh made our experience great. and by the way the crab cakes are delicious and the desserts are great. we will definitely come to Oceana Grill again on our next visit to New Orlean and recommend it as a must do.
Great food and service!! Ribs, spicy alligator bites, everything is yummy!
Amazing red fish. Nice outside courtyard. While we were reservation chasing the rest of the week, this walk right in and have a seat restaurant was as good as any top-chef we tried.

Awesome Shrimp Po Boys. This is the first place I ate the first time I was ever in New Orleans. They also supplied room service to our hotel and we prob ate about 5 Po Boys from this place in the 8 days we were in town.
Gator Jambalaya was phenomenal!!! Flavor was amazing, had a great spicy kick to it and the gator sausage was soooo good!
Service was amazing and very friendly! Our waitress Courtney made of feel very welcomed and conversed with us about our visit here! The food was AWESOME and came out so fast!!!

My husband and I visited different places near Bourbon Street looking for the best cajun/creole fair.  This place is a gem of a find.  Right off of Bourbon Street, we went here around much time.  No wait at all and we sat on the 2nd floor near the window.  

The place is very inviting and very homey feeling.  The wait staff is pleasant and very nice.

I ordered the Blackened Bayou Duck with a mushroom cream sauce.  This was the best duck I have ever tasted.  It was moist and tasty and matched perfectly with the mushroom sauce.  This dish is a must try if you're a duck fan of any sort.

Oceana is now a must stop for me when visiting NOLA.

We just stumbled into this place when we were looking for someplace to eat off of Bourbon Street.  I was scared this would be a really touristy rip-off but it actually turned out to be a solid meal.  The blackened redfish with crawfish sauce was fresh and the taste combination was great.  The bread you get on the side was very fresh as well and excellent.  Friendly service as well.  I'm glad I didn't find out until afterwards that they were once on Kitchen Nightmares, though!

I had the Gator Tail Bites (Fried & Blacked mix) and the Red Fish Oceana. The Gator Bites were good and the Red Fish was excellent. Large portions on the Red Fish but I couldn't not finish it. Service was very good and helpful with our selections. The Yelp discount was given without and hesitation. Would have gone again another time, but had so many places to try on so little time.
Great dinner! Amazing crab cakes. Loved our server, Kim. She had great suggestions and checked on us the perfect amount without interrupting our meal.
Delicious food,  large portions,  and phenomenal service. Lavern was our server and she was delightful,  caring,  knowledge,  and professional.  Would definitely go back!
Went here for a drink, had some great oysters and fried gator, the creme bulee was excellent the service was great definitely worth my money

Food was excellent and so was the service. The BBQ shrimp were awesome, I could have drank the sauce for the bowl but instead asked for more bread!  I ate the blackened chicken platter and it was juicy and served with jambalaya and veggies. Could have had more veggies and less jambalaya but it was prepared perfectly. I would come again.

Had a great experience especially compared to the ACME oyster. Was able to get a table very quickly and service was great, prices reasonable for what you get and food was very tasty. Had a redfish special with crawfish stuffing and a shrimp parm garlic sauce, best food so far in Nola.

Delicious!! We started with the alligator sausage, which had a fantastic flavor. Unfortunately, the temperature felt as though the sausage had been sitting our. It was very lukewarm. I ordered the Chicken Alfredo obviously because I'd read all the reviews from you great Yelpers. And let me say, it was definitely one of the best I've ever had. The chicken was blackened perfectly and the suave was unctuous. Of course I had to try the dessert. The Bourbon pecan pie with ice cream was outstanding. Flaky, caramel-y  and merged with creamy vanilla ice cream..again, fantastic. Oh, I also had a hurricane, which I think could have been bigger for the price.

Loved it here!! Had dinner here tonight for the first time. We just got into town and Ashleigh, our server, was amazing and very friendly! We sat on the second level. Met some nice people next to us and had amazing oysters and Cajun pasta. The ambience here is awesome. Very romantic in the area we sat in. Thank you Oceana for an amazing first day dinner
The service was awesome. No wait during lunch time. Food was pretty good too. Value wise it was ok, portions could have been better but it was ok. Loved the building, our waitress was awesome!

We really liked oceana grill.  The food was great, oysters were delicious and we had a great time.  We will be back in the future.  This place is huge.  I was impressed with the food for such a big place.  I can't believe how fast they pump out good food.
Our server Kevin was absolutely AMAZING! I would recommend this place solely based off of him. Food was great, drinks were reasonably priced but Kevin made the spot what it was.
Food and service were great. Within easy walking distance from our hotel in the French Quarter.  A bit pricey but definitely worth another visit.

Our first stop for food and it was really as good as it gets. Was there very late on a Thursday night. Ordered the gumbo, the Taste of New Orleans, Oceana's Famous Oysters. The reviews on here were absolutely correct. All 3 are a must have. The gumbo came with a shelled crab claw. The Taste of New Orleans had the jambalaya and red beans and rice in one plate. And the oysters were to die for! 

My mom told our waiter that we were there for my birthday and they gave a free bread pudding dessert. Probably one of the best bread puddings I've had. It was served warm with a very soft inside and crunchy on the outside.

As for drinks, I had a local porter (very tasty) and my mom had the Tropical storm. If you like the sweet drinks, this would be a close second to the famous Hurricane.

Great drinks!! And the service is really great. A to go place for New Orleans! The restaurant looks small from outside but it is really spacious inside with a backyard and second floor. Don't hesitate to come when you are touring in French quarter, and the wait will be totally worth it!

Line with around 15 people ahead of us out the door. We were seated in only 10 minutes. Everyone here is so incredibly polite. Shout out to Desiree! Classic New Orleans dishes. The crawfish etouffe and red beans and rice were top quality. Crab cakes were excellent. Only caveat was the bread, while good, was not amazing like magic bread (see YATS (Indianapolis) review) Our bell hop at the hotel suggested this place for dinner and we were definitely not disappointed!

Absolutely fabulous. Highly recommend the famous oysters. Don't skimp, get the whole dozen, they are well worth it. The service was great, the food was phenomenal and the atmosphere was awesome. We will most definitely be back.
Excellent service. Good food!  Server was super friendly and helpful. Nice casual atmosphere with good food. Alligator sausage was excellent.

Pretty damn good seafood, came here for my birthday and I loved it, best family birthday celebration ever. Plus the customer service at the restaurant was amazing, ask for Cathleen when you go to Oceana.

Had the blackened catfish Po boy and the crabcakes appetizer. Just the right amount of spice on the blackened catfish (was fried on the menu, but our waiter suggested it blackened and boy was it amazing!)

 Food was so fresh and very delicious and service was great! 

Definitely recommend this place if you're in town!!
Good food. Okay service. Crabcakes and crawfish sauce good. Shrimp poboy tasty. The service was pretty quick again.
Little home in the wall kinda place!!  Totally felt like NOLA. We enjoyed it immensely. Little disappointed in my crab cakes but other than that- very good!

Came once for breakfast,had bloody marys and the seafood omelette, wife had biscuits and gravy. Came again for dinner, had chargrilled oysters and a shrimp po boy. Both meals were fantastic,and I would highly recommend stopping in while visiting if you get the chance.5 stars for exceptional service and food......

Came for lunch and got the blackened chicken po boy. Words cannot describe the experience of this meal. Absolutely amazing and it hit the spot perfectly. Our server Errol was an absolute sweetheart; very polite and enjoyable. Do yourself a favor and come to Oceana Grill

After almost a week of trying different foods in NOLA we ended our trip here and we were not the least bit disappointed.   Amazing service, delicious food and wonderful atmosphere.  We had the BBQ shrimp and the Cajun Jambalaya which was the best we have had yet. Highly recommend!!

I'm not sure what was up the day Anthony C. visited this place, but my experience was astounding, and this was definitely the best restuarant and best seafood I ate while in New Orleans.

I had actually never come across a review for this spot while I was researching my eat-a-thon itinerary prior to my trip. While heading into the French Quarter one evening, I was lucky enough to be driven by a New Orleans native who highly recommended this spot and told me I absolutely had to try the crawfish cakes. Well, when in Rome...

As we walked to the door and stopped to check out the menu, an older couple stepped out with a contented sigh, saw us and remarked "Just go in and eat. We come here every time we visit New Orleans, and this is by far our favourite spot". As we were escourted in, we overheard another couple saying "oh my gosh, that was the best meal I ever had". Ok, now I'm practically drooling in anticipation.

Our server was incredibly attentive and oozed southern charm. He sat us right next to the kitchen, which is open concept and allowed us to view our food being made. I did get those crawfish cakes, and let me tell you, they melt in your mouth like butter. Not too strong on the fishy side, but not overwhelmingly spicy. Just the perfect balance of taste between the seafood and stuffing and spice. We also ordered the nightly special, the Ahi Tuna steak stuffed with crab meat, with a side of red beans and rice and jambalaya. The tuna was not overly fishy either, which I was concerned about, and had a firm texture, delicious with the light crabmeat filling. Overall, there was not a bite I took of that whole meal where I didn't make some sort of audible sound of contentment. At the end of the meal, the cook came out to take our plates and I complemented him on the food. He seemed genuinely thankful, and beemed at us as he returned to the kitchen, obviously taking pride in the food they serve.

This was definitely by far the best meal I had during my week stay pigging out on seafood, and I highly recommend it to anyone visiting the FQ. Not to be missed!
Crab cakes are amazing here! Maybe a little overpriced but the restaurant has a casual, inviting atmosphere that I would return.

I love this place and eat here whenever I'm in nola. However,  I was disappointed with this visit.  My fav....blackened catfish was EXTREMELY salty.  However, on the flip side, the Rajun Cajun bloody Mary was the best I've ever had.

This place came highly recommended during my trip to NO, but I must say: I was less than impressed. I had some AMAZING food during my stay, and the quality of food served here just didn't compare! Decent service, though.
Keronique served us and she was pleasant and friendly .. I had a shrimp po boy and I feel like my entire mouth was dancing. The food was amazinf

We always come back to Oceana for excellent food. The BBQ Shrimp appetizer is beyond fabulous. You have to peel the shrimp but it's worth it! 
David was our server tonight and he was awesome! He made an excellent recommendation on an entree - red fish on a bed of sautéed spinach, topped with a mushroom sauce and fried crawfish. Divine!!
Excellent po boys, the eggs Benedict over eggplant was yummy, friendly service and a cool atmosphere.  Overall  a worthwhile stop right off bourbon st....did I say the best shrimp po boy?

Great Oysters and we had Breakfast as well. The sausage was great! The hash was terrific.not a fan of the grits:( but everything else was perfect. Sitting with Brandi and the bar was a great experience. She was attentive and had some great recommendations! Thanks Brandi!

Meal was delicious but our waitress Jamie was horrible . Avoid her. From the moment she walked over to our table she was rude . I excused her behavior because we all have bad days however as our night continued her behavior could no longer be ignored . I started off asking her opinion on the dish I should get in which she replied the oceana redfish . I decided against that after looking at the description and told her I'd just like a half dozen oysters and a side of étouffée. After a while I was wondering why my appetizer had yet to come out and soon found out it was because in her head she heard me say the red fish I guess . After I told her I didn't order the redfish I ordered the oysters she rudely replied well you didn't say that . From there of course it went down hill. To make a long story short she had an attitude out of this world and didn't deserve the gratuity the place automatically adds on.

We dashed into Oceana Grill for dinner before heading to Preservation Hall. This was a great stop to satisfy the seafood craving the hubby had. The BBQ shrimp appetizer was peel & eat and quite flavorful. Two biscuits accompany the dish so you can mop up the BBQ sauce. The hubby ordered the blackened redfish special - with the signature crawfish and mushroom cream sauce. Fish was generously sized, seasoned perfectly and sauce quite tasty. Two sides. I had the ahi tuna stuffed with crab meat and topped with the signature sauce. The tuna was cooked a perfect medium rare and the first bite was to die for! We ended the meal with the Bananas Foster ice cream cake. For those with nut allergies like me, all the desserts had nuts so look elsewhere for the sweets. The food was fabulous and Errol, our waiter, was outstanding! He explained the various dishes, didn't hesitate when we asked him for his favorite dish (the catfish lafouche) and he was attentive throughout the meal. Errol also had a terrific laugh...when he laughed...it just made me smile since he has a gorgeous deep voice. We are glad we made this stop!

Large portions, friendly staff, mediocre food.........waitress was nice and knowledgeable of menu.  My daughter wanted to try oysters for the first time; the waitress informed us of a 3 oyster option that is not on the menu.

I had the aligator and oyster po boy.   It was really good.   I didn't care for the fries   the bread that came with my pasta was hard and not good.  the crab cakes were just ok, I didn't care for them much.

After a long morning of bike riding, I don't think we could have picked a better spot for lunch.  One of my staff had recommended it and we just happened to be in the location to try it out.  I'll definitely go back.  And our server Jimika was funny and patient with us.
Seated promptly and the food was good. The waiter was very nice. This is clearly a chain style restaurant. Not an issue but that is the atmosphere.

Oceana was very. Buddy and a bit slow but good overall.  They have choices other than the usual fried fare, which is good.  My blackened redfish was top quality, and the collard greens, though small in quantity, was the bets I've ever had. Spouse had Redfish Oceana.  Sauce was excellent. Quantities are more than ample.

By far the best crab cakes in town. Oysters are huge and servers are very pleasant. One of my favorite restaurants in the French Quarter.  

10% off to boot if you check in with Yelp.  They do take your phone to show the manager which is a little weird but umkay.

Oceana Grill - In!

Came for breakfast and all I have to say is AMAZING!!!! We had a party of 4 and everyone loved their choice so obviously you can't go wrong at this place. Our waiter Ponce was the exact kind of person I thought of when I came to the restaurant. I loved his Nawlinz accent! Being that we were not familiar with the food or the restaurant he explained everything and was very patient with all my questions. I definitely appreciated his hospitality. Now to the most important thing.....THE FOOD!!!!! I just can't say enough I had the vegetarian omelette and let me just say even though this is a simple enough dish ppl can and will mess it up. But no not this place! The seasonings were perfection and the blen of veggies they chose were just what I pictured in my food porn dreams!!! lol I do however have one bad thing to say about this place....

THEY DID NOT LET ME KISS THE CHEF!!!! Lol no I didn't ask but I can say I was very disappointed that we came to this place on our last day before heading home. I would have not mind going back for their dinner menu because it just all looked amaze-balls! Thanks Ponce again for a great experience at your restaurant and you guys keep up the good work. I will definitely be stopping by every visit. This will be a must have!:-)

Excellent food and great atmosphere right off of bourbon street.  Servers were attentive overall great experience.  Enjoy the New Orleans platter and shrimp poboy. We lived here for four years and this was some of the best cajon food we've had.

Had a late dinner here our first night in NOLA. I had the Taste of New Orleans (jambalaya, étouffée, and red beans & rice). Delish!! The étouffée was fantastic and the red beans & rice were amazing! Hubby had the BBQ shrimp and they were huge, cooked perfectly in a savory sauce. 

Best part...The staff  was phenomenal. Super friendly, very attentive. 

Awesome place for dinner!!

It was my first time back home in over a year, so I was craving some good New Orleans food. I saw the ad in the airport and told my mom about it when she picked me up. We stopped by, since we looooove the Quarters anyway. From the get-go, the line out the door moved very steadily, and we weren't waiting very long. We went inside to a very clean table and a welcoming host who greeted us. Soon as we sat, we were asked for our drinks, and it only took a few seconds for me to choose the Taste of New Orleans from the menu. My mom chose the Fried Shrimp and Fish. We were shocked when not long after ordering, the cook himself came out with our plates. The food was nice and hot. What mattered more to me was that it was also delicious. The Taste of New Orleans comes with Red Beans and Rice, Andouille Sausage, Shrimp Etouffee, Jambalaya and some French Bread slices. It was more than enough to share. There were three of us, and between the two plates, we could not eat it all. We gave to the doggie bag to my uncle on the way home. Excellent prices, excellent service, excellent quality and taste. I'll definitely be making this my new homecoming spot.

Other than the food, the place itself is very warm and inviting. You feel like you're home, and your dad's in the kitchen cooking something delicious. We went during dinner hours, around 6pm, but this is also a great place for lunch.
Absolutely delicious! My favorite place to go in NOLA. The crab cakes are my favorite, but everything I've gotten is great.

Fantastic service and tasty affordable grinds. Our server Pamela was so attentive and courteous. The food came out quickly and was piping hot. We really enjoyed "The Taste of New Orleans". We'll be back next time we're in town!

My friend and I both had the chef's special. (Blackened red fish over jambalaya with mushroom, crawfish sauce and greens on the side.) YUM! One of the  best meals we had this entire trip. The service was excellent. Our servers name is David and he was clean personable entertaining and knowledgeable. Best server we've had in New Orleans. We actually ended up coming here twice on our trip because we liked it so much. You guys should just eat here. OK?

The food here was amazing. The environment is fun and casual, while still maintaining a nice atmosphere for a sit down meal. My wife had the taste of New Orleans, and I had the shrimp po boy. We also had the crab cakes appetizer. Everything was delicious. The crab cakes were served with a crawfish sauce that was amazing, the po boy had huge meaty shrimp, and everything on the taste of New Orleans was fantastic. The food can be a bit pricey, especially if you order drinks of the alcoholic variety, but it is worth it. Highly recommend this place if you are ever in the area.

Loaded up here! Bedsides the location being on the wild side of town the food was really good. We had the oysters, gator bites and crawfish fries. The fries were amazing! Great seasoning with gravy. The gator bites were average. Also had the crab cakes which are a must! Great flavor and perfectly cooked. Worth the wait

Redfish was amazing.  Very big serving for lunch.  Excellent service!   Shrimp Po Boy was also really good.  Had it grilled instead and fried.  Fries were also very good. 

Great atmosphere too.  Had lunch on a Monday and it was very busy.

The best food ever.  It was my first time in New Orleans and everyone told me to try the PO' BOY sandwich.  The service was excellent and the waiter was extremely friendly.  I wish I could remember his name. A tall, slim, older gentleman (50's).  It was definitely worth the trip.

The service was superb but I wasn't a huge fan of what I ordered. Mostly the oysters, because they were sooooooo small. The nice manager allowed me to get more for no extra because they were literally that small. The crawfish étouffée had a strange sweeter taste. It wasn't gross but just missing the kick I'm used to in étouffée. I'd go here again but be sure to order something else.

Ok.Total tourist destination. No denying it. Cheese factor is high. Should you go there?  Absolutely. This place is the bomb (culinarily speaking). It is the only place I have ever been that when I finished my meal I said "top 5 meals" and, to my dining mate, "I can't wait to come back and have what you had". Mine was epic. His looked even more so. I had the "taste of New Orleans". He had the shrimp pasta with Cajun shrimp. BTW, the pictures do the meals no justice. They are much more appetizing than advertised.  Pictures in the menus are old and poorly done.  Oh and yes.. We had the barbecue shrimp app. Killer. The bbq sauce a beautiful, rich Louisiana mole. Keep the soft bread coming. Aim for the premium seating (not necessarily the dining room they sit you in).  Now go.

This place was recommended by the mgr at Walgreen's TY.  What a great recommendation! Aaron the greeter was very nice and set up a table for 9 of us celebrating a bday! Our waiter Lloyd was so patient with all of us! And provided awesome service! Loved the food!

I cant say enough good stuff about the food!!!   We cant wait to go back!  While waiting for a table, we asked 3 different folks how it was and they were all very positive as well!  Everyone in our party was extremely happy!  The crab cakes are a must!!!!
Huge multilevel tourist restaurant with mediocre chain restaurant style food. The service was great so giving stars for that. I wish I had looked harder for a place with better food and atmosphere.
Great food good atmosphere..... stopped in from the cold Lakiesha suggested a baileys and coffee and it hit the spot!

Mike mike mike. We came in a little drunk (or rather my friend was very drunk). Split two glasses of water and was still so nice. The staff was extremely accommodating. And mike was our server. I highly recommend him. I work in fine dining and he needs to be in that field of industry. So so good with us and never acted offended though I would have been if I was him.
Ordered delivery from this place late night from my hotel, got the gator bites and shrimp Po-Boy and the delivery was fast and the food was just delicious, would definitely eat from there again.
I was looking forward to the Blackened Red Fish Etoufee.  When I got it, the fish was over cooked.   the side of jambalaya was room temp, and the greens were ok.
Food was very good. Chargrilled oysters were delicious. Our waitress was super friendly. No wait to be seated at 7pm but it got crowded later.
Got it delivered. Great food, but small quantities and could be a bit warmer but great overall.
Good food! Good service! Had dinner here twice on our 5-day vacation:)

We visited Oceana Grill Friday morning for breakfast.  Everyone was very attentive from the moment we walked in the door. Jerry was our server. We were in a hurry and had less than an hour to eat. We told Jerry and he immediately sprung into action. Our drinks were good, but the bloody Mary was especially delicious with it's extra cajun seasoning. Prior to serving our food, Jerry made sure that we had hand sanitizer. Our food was served very fast like we requested.  We ordered the St James crepe and a seafood omelet.  Both were delicious! The cream sauce for the top of the omelet really set it above other seafood omelets that I've tasted. Jerry being very familiar with the area as a lifelong resident suggested activities based on our interests that we shared and he even got brochures for us. Jerry even offered us mints after our meal. Jerry made us feel like he was our private server even though he had other tables as well. The food and Jerry's service at Oceana Grill means that we will definitely go back before we leave NOLA!
Had the blackened duck last night. It was very good, but a bit dry in certain areas. The grilled oysters may have been some of the best I've had period. Top 3 for sure.

Beware!!!!!!!!! Do not order to go food from this establishment!!!!!!! The food was despicable!!!!!!!!!!!!! The food was soggy, mushy & burnt!!!??? It was literally inedible !!! Worst restaurant I've ever tasted.

You must have the Oyster Rockefeller and Oceana's Famous Oysters.  My god those things are delicious!  Smothered in butter, garlic, and lots of cajun sauces, I could have nothing but those for the rest of my life.

My main dish was the Blackened Bayou Duck.  Had a crawfish sauce drizzled over it.  Once again a huge hit with me.  It's a shame I'm in Maryland, because this would easily be one of my favorite restaurants.  My wife got the Crawfish Etoufee, which was awesome in that she ordered it as "I want the crawfish with a side of crawfish".  It was great to be at a restaurant with a couple of dishes not seen elsewhere since so many down the french quarter just deep fry everything.
The food was delicious! I had the seafood pasta of the day and the seafood gumbo, one of the best meals I've had in New Orleans. Deanne was our waiter: she was very friendly. Definitely recommend!

First time out in New Orleans and man the food is to die for , had the blackened fish with a side of gumbo. Washed down with some drink called the hurricane ,for sure will be stopping back by before l leave .

BEST SERVICE FROM JIMIKA. 

came to lunch with my sister, brother, sister-in-law, and new husband who was a little intoxicated. Our server was very patient with him and was also extremely nice and friendly. She gave great recommendations. She was knowledgeable. And had a smile the entire time.

The food was impeccable. The blackened catfish was phenomenal some of the best that I have ever had. I don't usually care for catfish. The portion sizes are enormous. Overall great food great atmosphere great experience
Excellent service and food. They are open for breakfast but you can order off the lunch and dinner menu if you want. Some of the best beans and rice in the city. You must try the crab cakes!

OMG this place is great!!!  We ate there for dinner, the line was long but moved fast.  Everyone there is so accomodating and friendly.  We were staying at the Royal Sonesta, so we came back the next morning for breakfast and I've been to Nola many times, but I have to say that is the BEST breakfast I've had yet.  It was fried eggplant with sliced tomato and shaved ham topped with hollandaise sauce.  If you are in the area - go to Oceana Grill, you won't regret it!  Also, if you check in on Yelp, you get 10% off your bill.

Food overall was good. Crab and crawfish on the redfish had a lot of shell pieces. Brought appetizers at the same time as the main dishes. Table seating is a little tight. Have eaten at a lot of places in the FQ, and this is probably my most disappointing place. Won't return.

Food was pretty average - restaurant leans towards quantity over quality.  Had a large piece of blackened red fish that was way overcooked. Greens were decent and jambalaya lacked flavor. Gumbo was average at best - Roux seemed a bit thin. Restaurant feels very touristy. Would not return.
Excellent food and excellent service! Errol, you are the man and need to be back on the radio with that voice! Thanks for everything!

Absolutely hands down some of the best seafood I've had.  The New Orleans Oysters were outstanding.  The freshest and meatiest.  Was in New orleans for 3 days and ate here twice.  Had the fried Oyster Po Boy for lunch one day and the crab cakes for dinner another.  Both were tender juicy.  Service was excellent as well.  When I'm in New Orleans again I will definitely come back.
I enjoyed the restaurant a lot. Our server, Joel, was fantastic with our group of 20, who can be a real challenge because we are a boisterous group. Amazing food, polite staff. A plus!

The oyster po boy and bread pudding was absolutely delicious! The waitstaff was also very friendly and they have a lot of comfortable seating. This is definitely a place to go to when in the French quarter!

1st time to NOLA. I went to Oceana twice. 1st time Thursday June 27 at 2:15pm and 2nd time Friday June 28 at 1:05 pm, slightly different experience the 2nd time.

1st time. Maître Di greeted us as we walked in, and sat us down immediately. There are two dinning areas on the ground floor, one small dining area by the grill kitchen and the second area the larger dinning room. We sat by the grill-bar kitchen eating room. I liked it cause I could see how they grilled the oysters..dramatic !

Megan was our waitress, very attentive, she suggested a menu, after I told her I could not eat very spicy food. However, my wife could eat the spicy stuff. We started with Alligator Bites, they were good. Wife had Red beans with Rice and sausage, she loved it. I had the grilled Redflish, it was great with the vegetables. All good service, drinks a bit on the pricy side, for the 2 frozen daiquiris.

2nd time. No one at the Maître Di desk. Waited a while, a few minutes, lots of waiters at the bar, getting drinks, but no Maître De. Lady Maître Di, about 5 foot high, with large black head band, attended to the party of 6 who just walked in, and ignored my wife and I who sat at the bench in the lobby, waiting.  Then a lady applying for a job left the job application with the lady Maître Di. The Maître Di reviewed the job application, then a flower delivery guy stepped in and gave the lady Maître Di the flowers. Maître Di then opened up the card and read it, then left to deliver the flowers, did not see her again. Chris, the male Maître Di now enters the picture, sees me and asks if I am with the party of 6. I said no, we are just two, he immediately sat us at a table on the ground floor main large dinning room. Jamal was our waiter, he was attentive, stopped by several times, to check on how we were doing. He gave us a container to take home, cause my wife was unable to finish the large portions of the good seafood jambalaya pasta. I had a huge Ahi Tuna steak. The Ahi Tuna plate came with vegetables smothered in garlic. I love garlic, so it was good for me. All the food was delicious, including our dozen grilled Oysters. They were the best !.

So, it goes to show you, the Maître Di, can make the event great or leave not such a good impression.  Bottom line, the waiter staff was great, the food was great. A bit on the pricy side, but for a holiday, ok....

Meal (5 out of 5)
This is the second time that I've visited Oceana, and they did not disappoint. I am not sure if this is authentic NOLA food (probably not), but I have thoroughly enjoyed the meals that I have had here. My last visit, I had shrimp and chicken alfredo (I asked for a side of shrimp), and I was no longer thinking of portion control. I was all about getting that pasta in ma bellllyyyyy. 

Atmosphere (4 out of 5)
Very loud, overly decorated, but somehow still charming. I enjoy being seated by the windows, where I like to think I people watch. In actuality, people actually watch me scarf down food.

Seating (2 out of 5)
This is the only part of this dining experience I do not necessarily enjoy. There's always a line to get into this restaurant. The wait can be anywhere from 5 to 15 minutes. 

Drinks... no idea... I'm near Bourbon Street! I am grabbing hand grenades from around the corner!!!!!

I am giving Oceans Grill 5 stars just for the service. Our waitress Pamela was amazing. She ordered our drinks for us and everything delivered was delicious. The Jameson mule was excellent and went great with my burger. Pamela was very engaging and knew the menu. There was an error with my order and Pamela was quick to correct it. I will make sure to let anyone know who plans to visit NOLA to come see Pamela at the Oceana Grill.

Very good crab cakes, oysters and blackened fish. Food is delicious and most servers were accommodating although our server seemed agitated by our large party. If I could have replaced him it would have been a perfect evening.
The whole family enjoyed our meal at Oceania Grill. We definitely will be back for the chargrilled oysters.

My boyfriend had the taste of New Orleans dish and I had the raw oysters ... We came in very late about 12am. Maybe not the best time for oysters, The next morning I had diarrhea that went on to last  for a week .I would advise against raw oysters from there , but the other dish was fine !

Was on a road trip in Dec of '07 with my girls.  We ate here twice. The Shrimp Po Boy's was delicious and so was the BBQ Shrimp.  We didn't have to wait long for a table either time. The wait staff is a bit slow but was always apologetic for it. 

I plan to return in January.

I dined in for lunch and was seated immediately by friendly staff. Jamal was our waiter and he was the best. Unfortunately he will be moving soon so they will lose such a great staff member. Anyway, let's get to the food. I had the Redfish Oceana and my friend chose the steak so we shared. Most people don't order steak at a seafood restaurant but I'm so glad that we did. That steak had the most flavorful seasoning and I liked it better than the fish even though that was good also. 
Before we left, we both got a Big Banana which is a frozen drink consisting of banana cake, banana rum and vanilla vodka. OH MY BANANA! It is like the greatest adult milkshake ever and you can even keep the plastic glass it comes in. 
Because of my job I inquired about their banquet space and Caryl personally greeted me and Kayleigh was nice enough to show me around upstairs and we walked nearby to even more banquet space which included a balcony on Bourbon. This would be PERFECt for any corporate function or private party. These ladies were so professional and friendly that I can't wait for an opportunity to work with them. This restaurant has plenty of dining space and the decor is adorable. I had to snap a picture of the wall that read, "A real Louisiana woman is a tiger on Saturdays and a saint on Sundays." 
This couldn't be more true!
The Taste of New Orleans and the Shrimp Creole are where it's at! Drinks are as good as you'll get on Bourbon Street!

Great menu selection but the evening that we had a quick bite, service was slow. Beware if tipping waiters with a credit card but tipping with cash and you need change for your bill. They will keep the entire amount. It must be a regional tactic behavior.

Ask for either Jennifer or Pamela, they are both very nice and knowledgeable about the menu as well what to do in New Orleans.  This was My first time in New Orleans and I visited Oceana three times during my seven day stay.  The food is really good at Oceana.  Also, the country breakfast is outstanding.  Awesome bacon, eggs, hash browns, and grits.  If you can handle it, try a Cajun Bloody Mary.  YUM...  I will return and again ask for Jennifer or Pamela.

I decided on this place after being totally overwhelmed by New Orleans on the first day. I did not remember that it was the place from Kitchen Nightmares. It struck me as familiar and that made me want to go. They were quick to seat me. The server was good. The food was just okay though. I ordered the alligator sausage poboy, but I really didn't enjoy it. The presentation was a bit messy. The best part about this place was the peace that you get. You can sit by the window and watch the circus of Bourbon Street go by. It's a great location.

It's very hard when there's  so many places to eat, the Oceana didn't disappoint. We ate at the bar upstairs. Very nice bartender friendly, informative. I had the tuna steak I loved it my husband had catfish it was very nice also and I don't eat catfish. I would go back again in a flash.

Love the Catfish Po'boy the breading was perfect,light with just enough crunch. The fish was plump and moist. The bread roll was okay (I am spoil by SF breads)The po' boy comes with coleslaw and pickles and the combo is delicious! 

The Seafood was not worth ordering. The catfish was the high light of the dish. 

Charbroiled oyster in a garlic sauce with Parmesan cheese crust. Oyster were fantastic. Bread was old and stale.

Huge fan of the po-boy fried oysters and the crab cakes! I tried the gumbo and there was nothing to special about that. I loveeeee the crab cakes! It was decent sized and I could have ate the whole plate to myself if I wasn't sharing. The po-boy was a great size and good to share between 2-3 people! I hear the oysters come from Acme so that's why they tasted so good!

Sit immediately without reservation for lunch, world famous oysters are fantastic! I normally would only eat raw oysters but this one they have totally changed my mind! My husband ordered eggplant poboy, also great! I also had crabmeat cakes as appetizer, size is good for me and taste good, even though I had the best crab cakes in Baltimore, I'm still going to give 5-star. Because yesterday we waited in a line for 40 min to get in Acme, the food there is actually not impressive. According to my experience, I think oceana is way better than Acme.
Man o man this place da boooomb!! First time in NOLA and it is great . Food at this place insanely delicious !!!
Decent place. Quick service. Not as outstanding as some of the places in the area but the quick service and ease of seating made up for it.

We visited Oceana based upon a recommendation from a taxi driver during our stay in New Orleans.  We were warmly welcomed by several staff members and seated immediately in the upstairs dining room.  Our server, Ashleigh, was friendly and knowledgeable.  She answered all of our questions with a smile and made some excellent menu suggestions.  The service was efficient and the food was delicious.  We highly recommend the Chargrilled Oceana Famous Oysters (get a dozen because six won't be enough).  They were so delectable that this will be the first stop on our next visit.
So so good. Came all the way from New York & stumbled upon this place experienced amazing customer service & amazing food. The food was so good I visited 3 times during my 4 day stay in New Orleans.

OMG!!  This was an amazing experience for me!  The crab cakes were spectacular; the waitress was so accommodating.  Everything was perfect.  I highly recommend this place, and would love some of their crab cakes right now.  :)

Had the crab cakes and although they used real lump crab, I thought they had too much filler. The sauce was great but the price was high at $22.  Also, had the stuffed blackened tuna...it was honestly delicious.  The jambalaya was really good as well.  Would definitely try again!!!

This place defiantly wasn't as impressive as I thought it would be considering the line to get in outside. We got in fairly quickly since we went early, we had a great server. The food was 2 stars I would say. Not as good as the other restaurants we ate at in the French Quarter

I love the atmosphere here. Sort of a hodge-podge of rustic and eclectic. Little pockets throughout an old building decorated in a funky and fun decor.

Service is distinctly casual. You walk in off Conti past the bar - a long, narrow, boisterous place - to be seated.  Service is quite attentive and casual and friendly.  Sort of touristy but definitely local too. Lots of locals come here (I'm from Mid-City living in Houma now).

It's especially nice to go in for dessert on a Saturday afternoon after the lunch rush is over and just relax. Desserts are good:  bread pudding is good with a rum praline sauce.  Also the creme brulee and the bourbon pecah pie.  

But I'm getting ahead of myself.  The entrees are good too :-)

What I like here: 

Redfish Oceana
Barbecued shrimp 
Crab cakes with a cream sauce (and mushrooms as I recall)
Red beans and rice
Blackened tuna

Also, their garlic potatoes are good too.

I cannot believe how this restaurant has grown! I remember coming here 30 years ago. It was the only late night place to eat at. It had just a few tables but the food was amazing. So happy to see the growth and the food is the best in New Orleans! We ate here 4 of the 5 days in town!
I absolutely loved this place. I had the crawfish fettuccine. It was delicious. I also tried the bread pudding Amazing. Ask for Cassie great waitress.

We were inI  the food mood again decided to try Oceana, This place was jumpin  at least 4 stories high from what I remember  but we were very pleased with the entree.  I had the Taste of New Orleans, which I had to send back because it wasn't too my liking as far as the food temperature  but they quickly fix that problem.  my daughter had the shrimp Fettuccine and wife had the cabin shrimp salad.  All very delectable.  And was able to use my ten percent off as well.  Be sure to pay close attention because they have different menu prices on select days.
The crab cakes were super delicious! The blackened catfish platter was very good as well. We also got the gumbo which was pretty good but did not meet our expectations.

We've been here twice now and it's totally wonderful! The Shrimp Fettuccine Alfredo is the real homemade from scratch stuff and totally amazing! The waitstaff is great along with the atmosphere! Every time we come to NOLA we eat here for the Alfredo alone!
It has amazing food, excellent service and even for a party of 9, we had just very less wait time.

Terrible Service
Really really bad. We got ushered in by some guy catcalling from the doorstop. The bloody mary was great, the bbq shrimp appetizer was good. The rest of the food was only okay. My friend got some crawdads and they weren't good at all. I'd recommend stopping in for a bloody mary, but the service is so bad you might not think it's worth the wait.

This restaurant has the worst food in the French Quarter. The tuna my husband had was tough and had been previously frozen. The fried shrimp has thick tough batter on it and tasted like shrimp from the frozen food section of a grocery store. Actually frozen shrimp from the grocery store would have been better. Our bill was $80 plus tip. You can get better food elsewhere in the French Quarter. 
I really think giving them one star is overrated.

Tried Oceana Grill out for breakfasts. The St.Louis Benedict (crabmeat, poached egg, tomatoe on a English muffin topped with cheddar cheese) was delicious!!!! The grits were different. Creamy. It mushy. I love grits but couldn't eat the grits there. Bacon......yummy....Seafood Gumbo....yummy! Maw Maw breakfast dish was mediocre! Our waitress Canisha was very nice and honest about the menu and flavors! All in all I would return. Oh and if you like Bloody Mary's I'm sure they are Delish! I didn't order 1 but the bartender let me taste the Infused Vodka they use to make the Bloody Mary's and it was quite tasty!

Best breakfast in NOLA, our waitress was Pamela, her service is top notch, gave us valuable information about the city and introduced us to King Cake.  Every breakfast that hit the table looked amazing.  My Eggs Malanzana was one of the best plates I've had in my life.  Thank you Pamela and Oceana Grill.

Best seafood I've ever had!!  We had the Crab Cakes....OMG!!! AWESOME!!! and that mushroom sauce is so good you'll wanna drink it straight! Cajun Shrimp Fettuccini Alfredo....loved the Cajun spices and the shrimp and pasta were cooked perfectly.  Bread pudding for desert...I couldn't stop eating it but the rum sauce was a little strong for me however, it was available on the side for dipping.  If you're in New Orleans, you don't wanna miss it!

Blackened alligator??? YES. This is the place where I was first introduced to alligator and seafood gumbo, and let me tell you that both were a revelation. The service was both awesome and fast. Also, if you have a big appetite, try their Big Banana drink. Wow.

The food here was delicious. I had the Mardi Gras pasta and my bf had the BBQ ribs. The hurricane with a extra shot was far stronger and tastier than the frozen varieties sold on Bourbon. The staff was pleasant and welcoming. The atmosphere was causal and laid back. If I had to make one criticism, it would be that this place does not need to be as expensive as it was, The Mardi Gras pasta was $24. It tasted great, and sure there were a couple crawfish and shrimp tossed in, but.... $24 linguini?! 

I'm glad I tried this place to see what the rave is about. But with so many food choices, I think I prefer the more affordable spots.

Service was extremely slow, and the upstairs area we were seated in was basically empty. Menu is definitely pricey, but that can be expected of the quarter. My shrimp po boy was good and the rest of the party enjoyed their food as well.

Had one dozen of raw oysters, they are very fresh and delicious!  The place was crowded, so we sat outside in the patio in the beginning.   2 parties started smoking cigars, we asked to be moved inside, and no problem.  The seafood soup was really good too.  Would definitely come again when we visit NO, and have more saw oysters!

1st off... TRY THE CRAB CAKES.. It's bliss in your mouth(if you like crab cakes) 

I try to come to New Orleans at least once a year and this place has been a staple of mine for the past 3 trips. The food is delicious, the drinks are strong, the staff is courteous and pleasant.

My friend and I concluded that this was our favorite restaurant during our visit to NOLA. The oysters were big and juicy and the portions for our entrees were huge. It is located on Bourbon street so it gets super crowded and loud. If you're going for a romantic dinner, this is not the place for it.

Just got back from NOLA late last night, and I'm pretty sure I haven't stopped thinking about the food I had here yet. I ate here Friday night. It is Monday. 
  I had the alligator sausage to start off. When I first put the sausage into my mouth I could have died happy (immediately) from the overwhelming flavor of fucking deliciousness that was about to repeatedly penetrate my stomach. To think they offer an entire po-boy sandwich with this alligator sausage as the filling is just wow. WOW. I had a hard time sharing this sausage with my many friends who I am close to, but I did because I knew I had to make room for what was to come. 
 SHRIMP PO-BOY was next. Impeccably fried shrimp on the most goddamn perfect bread. They don't use lettuce here...they use slaw. Its not unusual its fucking brilliant. Pickles. Tomato. And onion. Sounds simple but simple isn't easy to perfect. Just go here and the sandwich. I am so done. This meal was like a warm hug from Jesus. And the cocktails weren't bad either. New Orleans rules.

perfect late night and kitchen stays open until 1am on the weds i was there.  jambalaya pasta was excellent for late night buzzed munchies!  friendly staff, casual place.  feels a bit tourist trappy with the over the top oceanic neon theme but otherwise is a great spot.

Visited this place a while ago with my father. We thought it just had to be FIRE since there was a long line around the side of building. We were wrong. I ordered the crawfish étouffée and he ordered duck. Both of us agreed that the food could've been much more seasoned. We were far from impressed. The cheesecake wasn't all of anything either. Service was good though.

The food here is so good and our waitress Taylor was so nice! To drink I had a hurricane, it was made with real juice and so yummy! To eat I had the blackened catfish and it was bomb! My boyfriend had the fried seafood platter and everything was cooked to perfection, not greasy and very tender. I also had the creme brûlée for dessert, it was big enough to share and really good!
The food is wonderful and the service is even better, thanks to our wonderful server, Errol!  The portions are really big, so great for sharing and big groups. Highly recommend this place!

My wife and I took our very first trip to NOLA and this was the very first establishment we ate at. The food here is amazing! It was so good that we came back on our last day.

For an appetizer we had the alligator bites. We were able to have them prepared in 3 different ways. Fried, grilled, and blackened. It came with a really good side Cajun sauce that paired well with it. All three styles are really good, but for me personally I liked the fried and grilled the most. 

I also tried their famous fried shrimp po'boy with french fries on the side. By far the best I've ever had. They were a little light on the Cajun sauce in it, so I got some more on the side and it was amazing. The fries were extremely good too. I don't know how they cooked them, but they were really delicious. 

For dessert we tried the pecan pie. I thought I had some of the best before till I tried there's. The pie here is now on top of my list. The BEST I've ever had. 

Both times we came here we also experienced great customer service. They all had smiles on their faces and were extremely helpful. They made sure our experience was going to be great one. 

We can't wait to come back again. A well run establishment.

Fantastic brunch spot! I had the Lost Bread (aka French toast) per the waiter's recommendation, & it was sooo yummy! Hubby had the Country Breakfast which was  just your basic breakfast fare. Fabulous coffee...which was never less than half full thanks to awesome service! Our server Jerry was one of the best we've had. He earned extra points with me for not only being attentive, but whipping out hand sanitizer after taking our menus away.

My husband and I arrived late and wanted somewhere to eat, the young lady at our hotel suggested this place and it was amazing! It was so good we had dinner there the second night of our trip as well! Must go, we had the crab cakes, seafood platter, the red snapper with jambalaya and the bananas foster and it was all excellent

The service was outstanding and the food was AMAZING!!! There was a slight wait to actually get seated but it was well worth the wait. The atmosphere was clean and pleasant. You can't go wrong with this restaurant.
Great food.  The Cajun pasta was spicy as I wanted.  Would definitely eat here again and suggest to others.

We went for lunch and had a couple appetizers and shared one main. Overall food was good and a good selection of Cajun cuisine. We requested to use the Yelp discount for checking in and we're told we could use it if we wrote a review. When the check came, the discount wasn't applied. We asked for it to be applied when paying, and it still wasn't. Besides that experience, overall restaurant was good.

GATOR TAIL BITES. 

If you've never had gator before, come try it at Oceana.  If you've never had gator before going to NOLA, like me, the texture is a cross between fried fish and chicken. Since I tried fried gator at another restaurant, I chose to go with the blackened gator. This was the third place that I tried gator and this was by far the best. I could've ordered three of these and be good to go for the night. But we couldn't get just one thing. Also ordered: 

Crabcakes - They were good. Just good. 
Fried Seafood Platter - Who doesn't like fried seafood? - just don't expect to eat this alone 
Cajun Jambalaya Paste - DELICIOUS 

Overall, the food is really good. The staff is friendly. The atmosphere is VERY touristy and holds a lot of food tours, so expect a lot of really big groups and a long wait. My partner and I were lucky we made a reservation and had no problem sitting right away. On a Wednesday night around 6pm, the restaurant was packed and there was a line outside the door. MAKE A RESERVATION.

My friends and I took my best friend here for her birthday. There was a line waiting to get in. That is always the sign of great food! I had never had oysters in my life. They told me if I ever wanted to have a good experience with them I would have them here. They were awesome! I was very surprised. We got in quicker than I thought we would. The staff was very bubbly, friendly, & accommodating. Our Server, Jimika, was just wonderful! She was very knowledgeable and very engaging. We laughed and had a good time with her.
This is a great place to take tourist and the locals hang here often. I am from New Orleans and was thoroughly impressed by the spot.
Normal restaurant, good for kids, entrees around $15-20, ordered blackened seafood dishes all were satisfactory. The best thing we ordered was the blackened catfish special.
Taste of New Orleans and BBQ Shrimp, cannot go wrong. Ask for John the server, top notch! We will be back!  Make sure to check in, hostess wasn't to helpful.

While honeymooning in NOLA my new husband and I visited Oceana twice... it was that good. We went on the first night that we arrived per a reccomendation from the hotel staff where were were staying. We also went for our last supper. It was amazing. The drinks was perfect and the food was to die for. I consider myself a pasta pro, and I ordered the fettuccine alfredo both times, and my mind was blown. The sauce was the perfect combination of garlic and other tastyness. My husband ordered the taste of NOLA and was in love. We were both very happy and full campers after leaving. Also we would like to give a special shout out to or waiter on our second visit, Errol. He went above and beyond to make our experience a good one. He even placed a special one oyster order for my husband to try one without having to buy a whole plate full. He was great. If we are ever in town again we will be going back to Oceana and we hope to see Errol agian.

Good NOLA Food & Drink

Regularly gets four stars and they pretty much live up to that ranking. Service is fast and friendly, and the lunch we had was very good. I enjoyed the jambalaya linguini with a cold Bloody Mary. Wife had a house margarita and ole fashioned burger. A little pricy, but heck it's vacation!

I love this place very much. When I went to NO for the first time, I ate lunch at this place. I ordered BBQ Shrimp and I was a fan right there then. In my second time, the very first night in NO I directly went to this place. I ordered BBQ Shrimp and my boyfriend got Jambalaya Pasta. Both were delish!!! I was so happy with the food. Please if you visit French Quarters EAT HERE! :D

Really great food.  The building was really great too.  I'm not sure the history of the building but I enjoyed my time there and the atmosphere.  The food was great, and so were the drinks.   The staff was also super friendly.

This place was recommended by the hotel we were in. This place had a unique multi level atmosphere that was attractive. The staff was easy going and amazing and checks up on you (which is a tip worthy quality for me). Food was amazing and unique, being travelers. Quick delivery. I recommend the French Toast breakfast. No complaints out of me.
Came here for a fast meal with good food and local beer and got both! The staff is great and very informative. A must stop if you are in the quarter!

Last night my boyfriend and I were playing blackjack in the casino and we sat down next to this great couple who gave us tips on restaurants we need to try in New Orleans. They said that we had to eat breakfast at Oceana and we HAD to have the crawfish omelet. The ironic thing is that about 5 minutes later CJ sat down next to us and he's a waiter there. The couple recognized him and my boyfriend started talking to him. He was such a friendly guy that we decided to go there for breakfast today, and it just so happens that CJ was our waiter today. I had the crawfish omelet topped with crawfish etouffee. I can honestly say that this was the best omelet that I've ever had and I'm snotty when it comes to breakfast. So thank you CJ for chatting with us at the casino. because of you, we had the best breakfast in New Orleans!

Delicious oysters and crawfish Fries! 
Great menu options - good food and good music, 
loved that they were open so late!!

We went here twice during our trip to New Orleans, it was excellent both times. The service is really great, and so is the food! The crab cakes were delicious, but the Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo was definitely the best I've ever had.  The drinks and desserts are also well worth the money.  I would recommend this place to anyone.

The food was still good. But not the over the top good.
Like I had from 2 years ago when I was there last. I guess having chef Ramsey help them can only do so much. While sitting at the bar next to the door wasn't so bad other than being too hi up for a shot person. I had noticed a waffle iron that hadn't been cleaned in decades. It had so much grime on it. I would be surprised if it would even move. So if that's what's going on where someone can see some of the cooking tools. I don't want to see what's going on in the back.  And especially after seeing the kitchen nightmare episode with them post eating there. I guess some places never learn.

Check in an get 10% off. Went here as recommended by a tour guide and tourist visiting center so maybe we were a little apprehensive as visiting center also gave us a card for discount. We enjoyed our meal here.  Waiter recommended gator bites blacked and fried as we had only first tried gator a day prior in a sausage.  The dipping sauce was good and found the fried gator a little less chewy but again,  we had not had gator before.  The blackened had a good flavor tho. We both ordered the redfish oceana and enjoyed it.  We ordered the crawfish mushroom cream sauce on the side just in case and glad we did.  This gave us a bit more control with the flavors, the red potatoes mashed were also good.  All and all a decent meal.  Waiter very attentive and gave us the name of a restaurant locals go to for Cajun food.
Really good food the Catfish Lafouche was excellent and make sure you try the Seafood Platter.

Unfortunately upon entering the restaurant we were met by two hostesses that thought their personal conversation was much more important. Once they finally finished, they greeted us, but didn't say how long it would be, so we found ourselves kind of milling around. Once we were finally seated we ordered drinks and crabcakes. Both were pretty good. I ordered the duck which was ok. Our waitress didn't really check on us as frequently as I would have liked and we found ourselves there quite a while looking for her. Maybe this was an off night for them, but I probably won't be going there next time I'm in town.
We got to New Orleans at 10 PM, we were hungary, so we went over to Oceana Grill, there food was so good & filling, we went away not hungary any more.

Best gumbo, best jambalaya, best red beans and rice, best fried shrimp, best hush puppies.  Portion sizes are large but the food is so delicious you won't have leftovers.  Restaurant is larger than it looks. Very quaint relaxed atmosphere.  We couldn't hear all the noise outside.  First time here on vacation. Local recommended the place.   Worth it!!

Fun Place for a NOLA night. We loved all the food we got. However, the "house drink" of the night was not that great. Maybe we just didn't have the palet for it. It was green Bloody Mary! 
The place isn't light on the bill, so prepare to pay well for well served seafood in the heart of NOLA.

Maw Maw breakfast......just order it & thank me later. It is delicious!!!!! The crab cakes have so much lovely meat. Gator sausage is yummy. Shrimp po boy is nice & crispy. Even the french fries are perfectly fried. Loooooove the wait staff. They are friendly & move like friggin ninjas when it comes to removing the dirty unwanted dishes. I will def be back. Soooooo full didn't have room for dessert.
Had the St. Louis crab benedict for breakfast, which was awesome.  Tasted the alligator sausage also, but was not a fan.

Awesome food, great service! Crab cakes are amazing! 
Will come back everytime in in New Orleans
Almost everywhere in the French Quarter is good to very good.  This place is over and beyond. Everyone friendly/knowledgable.  Food excellent. 5 star

Great food. Exceptional service (HEY MARLON!). Fun environment. Can't wait to go back. This was some of the freshest seafood I've ever had. Everything was on point, seasoned well...I just, my mouth is salivating just thinking about it. If you get a chance to go, go. And make sure you  request Marlon as your server.

My parents and I went to oceana on st.Patrick's day weekend. The line to get in the restaurant was pretty long, but the girl working it did pretty well and she was very nice. I got the blackened catfish poboy and it was the best one I've ever had. My parents split the crab cakes and the looked amazing. My parents said they were good. We also got the bread pudding and it was delicious. I do recommend this place, but be prepared to wait.

Ate dinner here on a Friday night and had a wonderful experience.   Place was crowded but seated quickly.  Our server,  Eddie, was both prompt and knowledgeable.  He didn't rush us at all but once we ordered everything came out quickly and was delicious.   I had the bloody Mary - spicy and good.  The crab cakes were fabulous.  When they brag about these, please believe them.  My husband had  the taste of New Orleans plate that had red beans & rice, jambalaya, etouffee, and sausage.  I had a fried seafood plate (oysters, cat fish, and shrimp) so we could share.  I immediately wished I had ordered the NO plate (mine was delicious and very fresh for fried food), it was perfect.  Great dinner!
Best crab cake I've ever had, hands down. Red fish was delicious as well, 10/10 recommend
This place is tits! Bloody Mary's are a must. Staff is incredibly nice and welcoming. Deanne was our server and she was so helpful and friendly. We will definitely be back!
Oysters are good. Something confused when ordered the drinks, we bought three oceana  cups, lol......

Had to stop in Oceana on our 4 day trip to Nola. We'd been eating and drinking all day, so we only got drinks and appetizers here. First, the place was clean, and not very busy at the time we stepped in so our service was awesome! We got a half dozen char grilled oysters, and the famous crap cakes. Everything tasted really good. The crab cakes were really the stand out. I just wish they would have come without the sauce and with more craw fish on top! The char grill were second only to Drago's, and that's saying alot since we had them at Acme, Deanies, Drago's, and Royal House
The food and service here are great.  I wish we would have tried it earlier in our trip because we would have gone back a couple times.

Last minute stop after arriving.  Great service, Taylor, our server, was not only accommodating and on point (with a great accent to boot!), but our food came out in record time.    Although the red beans and rice aren't suppose to be spicy, they were for me.    The crab-cakes?  Pass on them, almost seems like you can find them in your frozen section.
Great service, extremely friendly staff who strive to make your experience memorable.
Loved this place! Our server Marvin was amazing and made sure we had everything we needed. Ready to come back for more gator tail bites!

Everyone working thee were a pleasure to meet. The blackened fish was great. The waitress explained the make up of the sauces that are usually on the menu. We were able to omit the sauce due to a shell fish allergy. I enjoyed the special seafood pasta dish.

I feel like this place looks understated but the food here is surprisingly SO GOOD. And the portions are HUGE - if you don't have a big appetite I recommend you order family style and share a few dishes. Our appetizers filled us up to the point where we (hubby and I) didn't even make a dent in our main meals. We felt terrible wasting food and didn't take it to go because we were going out to Bourbon Street that night and didn't want to carry around leftovers. Side note: Bourbon Street is literally around the corner from this place, like 2 steps away so it's very conveniently located if you want to hangout there after dinner. We came as a group of 21 people for our friends birthday dinner. They sat us in the upstairs middle level (I think they have 3 floors?) and we were able to sit together in a long connected table, which was nice. Most other places in NOLA will accommodate a group of our size but they usually split us up into separate tables. 

Of the 21 people, we paired up about 4 people to share dishes. My group got crab cakes and charbroiled oysters to share - both are appetizers. The charbroiled oysters were AMAZING. That in itself could've been a meal. I'll be dreaming about them forever. For my main I got the Mardi Gras pasta, which was sooooo heavy and creamy but so delicious. My hubby got the fried seafood platter (too fried for us, too hard to eat that much fried food). He barely made a dent in it. From what I remember some of my friends got po-boys and others got jambalaya and the blackend chicken etc. With such a large group I'm sure everyone ordered a variety of things off the menu. The menu is large enough that everyone found something to eat, even the one vegetarian friend we had. The birthday girl got a bread pudding which we all passed around and had a bite of - it was very good. We were all way too full to order separate desserts. The waiters brought out the bread pudding with a candle and we all sang to the birthday girl.
