Service was good, we had 2 waiters attending to us since we were such a large group. They were able to give our group separate checks so we didn't have to split the bill in the end, which was nice. Hubby and I got our own meals and group appetizers on our check. I liked this place a lot. Two thumbs up.

Ask to sit upstairs. Delightful ambiance. 

Good solid 4 star place on Yelp.  I'm giving it 5 stars because it is AND to compensate for a few awful 1 star reviews. How can some tell the seafood was frozen? I am no expert but nothing we had tasted "fishy" which is, to me. my life long deciding point. The crab, shrimps, fried oysters were all premium to our palates. Gumbo, good to the last drop. Red beans and rice? Heavenly smokey taste and velvety smooth. This is not Popeye's. Fried oysters, superb! A hint of spicy breading, lots of them on more French fries that I can eat. We could not finish our portions.

Our waiter Val paid attention to our table, without being annoying, which is right on. He was pleasant, humorous. By the time we departed, after meeting management, it was all handshakes. Can't wait to go back.

Special note: While we may be Pennsylvania residents now, we lived in Houston over 2 decades. I worked for a Shreveport company for two years with positions in New Orleans and Lake Charles. We are not strangers to Cajun and Creole cuisine. There will always be a special place  in our hearts for Louisiana, it's colorful people and their zesty lifestyle and foods.

This was my first time in New Orleans and wandering the French Quarters.  I came across Oceana per chance of stopping by my hotel (Astor Crowne) concierge.

The hostess was very inviting and as soon as we sat down, our waiter promptly asked our drinks and returned with them.

Chose to go with the Blackened Chicken Cesar Salad and a Seafood platter.  We chose to double up on shrimp and exclude the oysters.  Everything was ideal and very rich with taste.  The different spices weren't too distasteful and actually complimented the entire meal.

I also used the 10% off when I checked in through Yelp.  I will definitely return here, great food and service.  I highly recommend this establishment during your stay in New Orleans.

During a recent trip to New Orleans, we enjoyed Redfish Oceana and Fried Catfish Platter.  We practically licked our plates.  The hush puppies had just the right amount of heat.  We never had fish as good as the Redfish here and we've lived on the water in many locations.  For dessert we had the Pecan pie and Creme Brulee.  The meal was worth the 10 hour drive.  Shahan, our waiter was friendly and accommodating and Jeff, the manager made us feel like a guest in his house.  We will be going back and telling all our friends.

Great food, great service. Had the St.James crepe which was stuffed with so much crab meat and shrimp. Jennifer our server was wonderful. Trust them when they tell you the crepes are huge. The Tropical Storm drink was perfect for a sweet tooth like me.

Went here Friday night with some friends.  We all ordered the same thing Redfish Oceana.  Redfish with a crawfish mushroom sauce on top that tasted like it was prepared hours before.  All 3 of us did not care for this dish. Service was ok. I will not return.

My husband and I ordered the Jambalaya pasta dish and the Oceana Red Fish dish. Both were excellent.  The service was not so good after our initial order was placed and the place is a bit pricey but a good place to eat off of Bourbon. We'd go again and get the same dishes.

I loved the menu so much, I visited this place twice during my trip to New Orleans.  I ordered a half dozen oysters that were unbelievably fresh, I regret ordering so little.  The blackened catfish lafouche, on a bed of jambalaya, topped with crawfish ettoeffe was so, so good, I wanted to cry.  My criticisms have to do with my first visit when I found the food more lukewarm than I prefer (I like my food hot).  Oh!  The crab cakes were very crabby in a good way :).  I'm wasn't so thrilled about their gumbo.  Not enough kick, which was certainly disappointing considering locale.  The restaurant is located steps from Bourban Street, so it wouldn't be too hard to skip on over for some drink and more.
Excellent service, very very friendly people,  good quality food. We had the oceans famous oysters and the gator bites; both delicious

So disappointed with this place. When I arrived in NOLA I was so hungry. I was told to try Oceanas because the seafood was really good. We arrive and there is a line. I was so happy with my position when I looked back and saw how long the line grew. We get in after about 20 minutes and I am amazed about how big this place is, with about 3 or 4 floors. The biggest hype for me was getting in the restaurant. Unfortunately, everything went down from there from the food to the service to my drink. After being seated we waited about 10 minutes to meet our waitress. She seemed nice but she must have been miss America because we hardly saw her. We put in our drink orders. I "supposedly" ordered a drink with patron and midori. I'm still waiting for the taste or even the smell of some sort of tequila. Definitely on the sweet side. My dad said his amber local beer was good. He describes it as a hybrid of Heineken and a Guinness stout. My mom said her dirty martini was made well. On to the food. We ordered appetizers, the alligator bites- half fried and half blackened, the smothered crab cakes, and seafood gumbo. We were told these were the restaurant staples. After about  45 minutes our food arrived. I believe now this was a sign to vacate the premises. I really wish I spared my taste buds at the appetizers. The alligator bites were ice cold so they remained on the plate. Fried was better, but that means absolutely nothing. The smothered crab cakes were also cold. It had a shrimp topping. Far from the best crab cakes I've ever eaten. They were basically a big tasteless ball of mush hardly filled with crab. The gumbo was a bowl of rice with gravy and a couple shrimp thrown in for decoration. This was the most unseasoned, tasteless gumbo I've ever eaten. We ordered one entree because we were still hungry but scared for the out come. We ordered the fried shrimp platter. Now, it is almost impossible to screw up fried food, but they definitely achieved the certificate for bad fried food. The shrimp had a heavy batter with no taste. The fries were bad. How do you  mess up a French fry. They were hard with some sort of coating on top. Did I mention they were also cold. The manager apologized and removed 2 dishes off the menu. Thank goodness we decided to have 1 entree. If you want to come to see what the hype is here all I can say is good for you. Definitely won't be back. I'm totally disappointed for my 1st meal in town.

This place wasn't what I thought it would be. The staff is super quick and friendly. Food was brought out fast and fresh! We were placed at a table with an open window to the outside walkways. The gator tail bites were good! Not too chewy at all. We ordered a fried catfish po boy and a fried oyster po boy. Both were delicious, however the catfish was a tiny bit better. It was flaky and not greasy. Despite the name, the swamp tea is actually fairly pleasant in comparison to its looks. I'd say to try it just for its namesake.

Duck was tender, homestyle presentation and elaboration.  Flavor was simple but tender.  The blackened Chicken Salad however was "a party of flavors", the bread pudding a 9 out of 10, and the Pecan Pie maybe a 10!!!  Enjoyed the Andy Gator beer, a great contrast to typical American brewed (maple flavored) beers you find in Los Angeles.  The courtyard was also comfortable.  The fried eggplant appetizer is ok.

Ordered crawfish étoufée. Came with a mound of undercooked white rice in the center. And it was hard finding any crawfish floating around in the red sauce. Don't think there was much of it. Was supposed to have been spicy, but it was barely that. Service was fast and friendly, but I'd have gladly waited a few more minutes if it meant avoiding crunchy rice. I walked out hungry and $20 bucks poorer.

I got the:
- Smoked bayou duck with crawfish mushroom cream sauce
- chargrilled oysters dusted w/ garlic and cream herb cajun sauce.
- raw oysters
- fried seafood platter with oyster shrimp catfish and crawfish tails
- bread pudding w praline and rum sauce

Service was on point and Jaime was very helpful and professional. I liked that I got a window seat overlooking the people snarfing their meals in the courtyard.

At this point I had cajun and fried foods for the past 2 meals and slowly getting sick of it, but I persevered and was determined to try the last one at this 3k yelp reviewed place.

The oysters came out first and as my brother and Jaime preferred raw, I demanded a dish of chargrilled bc we were here to get the taste of nola, not fresh oysters. The raw ones were gigantic and I am not a fan of big oysters, but they went down smooth only thanks to the special cocktail sauce with some grated parmesan? The chargrilled oysters totally killed the raw (for me) because it masked the oystery taste with a killer buttery creamy burnt cheesish taste and they were small.

The smoked bayou duck had a deep layered taste. The perfect crispy savory skin lead to the oil rich fatty layer that then led to the moist meat portion. Instantly I was on a boat on the bayou with my bass shop pro gear shooting ducks like that ancient game duck hunt. Needless to say this was a great dish, but some parts the fat was too overwhelming to swallow and drizzling down the sides of my mouth. The crawfish cream sauce went especially well with the duck as the sauciness added a slightly herbal veggie accent to the flavorful duck.

The seafood platter was exceptional as the fish was a soft but firm texture and the breading was airy and didnt have an especially strong taste, perfect for the light and slightly sweet tartar sauce. I would skip the fried seafood platter and go for something more like the crab cakes as there seems to b a certain batter that nola ppl like and maybe these restaurants don't stray far from it.

At this point I was stuffed but I had to try the bread pudding and it was crack... i never had such thick soft sweet syrupy bread pudding that one bite put me in the middle of the land of milk and honey sittin atop the soft boobs of bread w praline brown liquid gold drizzled on top of me.

This place was really awesome, but no more cajun for me for awhile I think I'll have to go veggies w minimal taste to get my tastebuds and cardiac health back

A+ As soon as we walked in, we were greeted with SINCERE smiles and SINCERE salutations which continued throughout our meal by the manager (who came to our table and personally greeted us), servers and "bus-boys".  Our server [Jaine M.] was awesome! She was friendly, with great conversation and VERY attentive... ALL without being invasive [you know, not annoying], as well as, knowledgeable about the menu and suggested several breakfast dishes.  I tried The Wendell [which is named after the chef] and it was delicious!!!  It consisted of a fluffy "moist" slightly buttery tasting omelet topped off with a craw-fish etouffee... yummy!  My friend had Jaine's suggestion of the Maw Maw's Cajun Breakfast, again delicious, but be prepared to take a "To Go Doggie Bag", although very tasty... it's A LOT of food for one person to knock off in one meal!  Another must try, is their Rajun Cajun Bloody Mary... thee BEST Bloody Mary in NOLA!!! We went back for dinner on our last night and ONCE AGAIN... they nailed it!!!  Sincere welcoming by everyone and our server Raven was very nice and PATIENT with all the questions I had about their dinner menu.  This go-round we ordered their Alligator Bites and Turtle soup appetizers and for our main entrees: Praline Duck and Redfish Oceana with a side of Red Beans, but REMEMBER if you ONLY want the Red Beans specify NO rice.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!
We had a wonderful meal here! The Blackened Salmon was delicious. My son enjoyed the Chicken Alfredo. I highly recommend.
Very touristy place.  Blackened fish was light on spices.  Wife had the redfish Oceans and liked it.  If you looking for real blackened fish there are better places

I've eaten here twice - three years apart. Both times the food and service was great. The crab cakes are a must! I took my boyfriend here and made him to try the crab cakes (he usually doesn't like crab cakes) and he loved them. I will return to Oceana just for the crab cakes each time I visit NOLA.

This was our second time to Oceana for dinner and my third time in general. Love this place. 

My first experience was a late night craving for Bread Pudding on our second Nola visit. We had been drinking and touristing all day. It was a chilly Early March evening and I had a wicked craving for Bread pudding, which a quick Yelp search told me this was a good bet- and Oh Lord it was!

The next time was for PoBoys. 

Tonight we visited again and our server Errol, AKA James Earl Jones of New Orleans (based on this man's deep, delicious voice), made our visit as wonderful. 

I had a shrimp PoBoy, Ian had shrimp plate and his sister had the seafood sampler. They were all huge portions and quite good. I wish the dressing on my PoBoy was a little better put over the full bun. It was difficult to eat, but aren't all good PoBoys?

The best: the crab cake app. OH MY GOD. That was so amazing with a crawfish mushroom sauce one could literally bottle up and take to heaven. 

Unexpectedly I returned late again for bread pudding, cheesecake, and coffee. Because at 12:30am where else are you gonna get those three things in Nola? 

We'll be back again. Josh brewed up some fresh coffee, after being as charming as this city. Awesome.
I recommend making reservations.  People were lined up down the street to get in.  Excellent crab cakes and great wait staff.
Amazing vegetarian stew. Flavorful, filling. Partner ate shrimp Po-boy; was dry but tasty.

I'm a local. Oceana Grill is not in my regular rotation of restaurants, but one day I stepped in for lunch.

Everything on the menu is really heavy, and most things are fried. I got a fried eggplant poboy that was just not good. Greasy, flavorless, etc.

I'm happy so many people have had good experiences here, but it's not a place I would go. Many other options in the French Quarter. I wish the menu was more diverse to include fresher fare.

One of the few places open during Hurricane Isaac and I found myself really enjoying this place despite the higher cost of food. Went for breakfast and had the Eggs St. Louis and dinner with Jumbo Crab Cakes with Seafood Gumbo. All delicious!

This was a great restaurant because the food was delicious. I would definitely visit again, but unfortunately discovered it on our last night. The grilled oysters were fantastic and the crab cake pasta was delicious.

I am a local and came here out of curiosity.  The name just keeps popping up and I had to see for myself whether it's worthwhile.  Overall I would rate it "tepid."  And I mean that quite literally.  The food was good...but served lukewarm.  The bloody mary was good...but served just cool and in a lightweight plastic glass.  The music was lively...but turned down to a quiet volume.  Overall I was left...wanting.  The potential is there but the sizzle is lacking.  And I mean that quite literally.

Amazing food! Tried the signature dish, the Redfish Oceana and I was astounded. It's a lightly breaded Redfish filet that is generously covered in a spicy crawfish mushroom cream sauce and it is so delicious! Comes with a side of mustard greens and garlic mashed potatoes. Only con, just a personal peeve of mine, was that the potatoes were served in the same dish as the greens so they were sitting in the juice. Next time, I'll just ask for separate dishes. Usually, my favorite place to eat in NOLA is Acme Oyster House but Oceana is going to give Acme a run for my money!
yummy in my tummy and the staff is soooooo friendly! There is nothing you can order and dislike here.

One of the best restaurants in the French Quarter. I had the oceana famous chargrilled oysters. Not your typical chargrilled oysters they top the oysters off with a creamy cheese sauce with bread and lettuce very good

This was my first time visiting this restaurant. The food was great and our server, Jamal was awesome! He was very attentive, courteous and more importantly prompt. I will definitely visit this establishment again whenever I'm in New Orleans.

Get the pain perdu. You can thank me later. Also, ask for Errol! He's literally the bomb dot com. This place is absolutely delicious & the location is super convenient to everything. I highly recommend it!!!

In town for a conference and a conference attendee suggested Oceanas... Homerun! Not usually a fried seafood person, but went with the fried shrimp platter and it was ON POINT! Also had the best seafood gumbo I've ever had
This was my favorite place to eat in town. The food was amazing, specially the GOMBO... a blast!
Great food with great service. Good for a group up to 4. Btw did I say awesome blackened red fish!!
Get the crab cakes. The crawfish cream sauce is legit. However they do use it in too many dishes. The Taste of New Orleans is fantastic. Special thanks to Katelyn.

Great value.
Friendly staff was very helpful with navigating us through the menu.
Bree was delightful. Attentive and conversant.
We agreed with her recommendation for crab cake and the backend redfish.
Everything was good.
I was later told that this is a tourist trap and that better and more authentic NOLA cuisine could be found close by. That did not change my experience.

My sister and I celebrated her 21st birthday dinner here and ended up having the most wonderful dining experience thanks to their courteous staff who made our night very memorable. 

We arrived at the restaurant around 6pm and were immediately seated. Our exceptional server, Ashleigh, went above and beyond in making us feel welcome. She knew the menu and items in perfect detail and provided wonderful dish recommendations.  She is probably one of, if not THE best waitress we've ever had! 

Furthermore, all of the other dining staff were incredibly friendly. The restaurant itself was spacious, clean, and able to accommodate almost any sized party.  We ordered two dishes (per Ashleigh's recommendation) and we absolutely loved both. The "Mardi Gras pasta and The Taste of New Orleans were perfectly proportioned and fair in the reflected the prices. 

More than anything what made our dining experience phenomenal was the personal touch that the staff gives to each patron. For example, Ashleigh was even gracious enough to make a hand written list of "hot spots" for us to visit during our stay in the city and went into great detail in explaining her recommendations. Thank you so much for making my sisters birthday dinner a special one!
HUGE portions and a great offering of New Orleans food.  We ordered one seafood platter and couldn't finish it btw the two of us. Staff was super friendly.  Not the best, but a good deal.

Great experience! We made reservations about 30 minutes prior and didn't have to wait in the long line to get in the restaurant or wait to be seated. The staff was very pleasant, great service! The crab cakes were delicious!
Never had Gator bites in New Orleans until now.....I don't know if I have ever had a better fried finger food!
This place is beyond gross!!!  I had one good meal here 5 years ago tried it again and haven't had a good meal since then from this place.
This was our first stop and we came back two days later. Laaawd it was amazing! The waiters are great too, good service

Food is good. Have really good drinks and food come out very hot and fresh compared to most restaurants. Only reason I am giving 4 out of 5 is because their greens are frozen and I expected the mardi gras pasta to be a bit more flavorful considering this is NOLA. Overall service was good.

Don't listen to the hype, this place is a tourist trap. The line is artificial and intended to create a "buzz" about its popularity. We made a reservation online about 45 min before lunchtime at 1 pm - every slot was available so space is obviously not an issue. This became even more apparent when we arrived to a huge line outside, despite seeing many open tables on multiple floors of the huge restaurant space. As far as the food, we had alligator bites, the house special oysters, crab cakes, house special redfish oceana, and the sampler. Absolutely overpriced for the quality, especially in comparison to the local fare available nearby. Did not taste fresh and wasn't anything special. Our server was wonderful and attentive - and the rest of the staff seemed nice, but unfortunately she couldn't help the bland and mass produced food. 

Left a similar review on TripAdvisor. Not the popular opinion amongst reviewers on these sites but worth noting for anyone doing their research and trying to find quality food on their trip to NOLA.
We almost decided to skip this place because of the line out the door, but are very glad we stayed. I must recommend the crab cakes as well as the Taste of New Orleans platter. They are fantastic!

Always outstanding! If you have to wait for a bit in line to get it , I assure their food is easily worth the wait.

Check out their house specials. They are always amazing....especially the Oceana Special Oysters and the BBQ Shrimp. They are quite possibly the best you will find in New Orleans!
Love Love Love Their Crabcakes...The charbroiled oysters were probably the worst I've ever had! Redfish is good along with the Mardi Gras pasta!
Oceana Famous Oysters were great. Po boys and other food were mediocre. Definitely more of a divey tourist attraction.

Our front desk recommended this place for dinner on the first night we came to NOLA. not a bad choice but definitely not sure it was THE best food. everything was super fried and heavy which is fine, but the day we landed it was and humid as HECK. the ventilation in here is decent but needs to be colder! we tried alligator bites which was interesting..mostly just fried and similar to chicken but a bit tougher. also had oysters on the half shell which were decent but i feel like NOLA oysters are fresh, just lacks brine / flavor?? we also had the parmesan oysters which was extremely heavy, decent but a big plate of cheesyness all over! i loved the sausage which was part alligator/pork etc. service was decent and they were super friendly greeting us and letting us out of the restaurant.

This place is the Old Spaghetti Factory of New Orleans. Outside it seems like a small, authentic restaurant with typical NOLA/Southern food, but inside it is enormous. 500 seats! They do serve all the typical southern dishes, but we didn't like anything we tasted. The blackened alligator appetizer was good, but everything else was dry and flavorless. I loaded my food with the hot sauce (which was surprisingly good!) to add some flavor. 
We did love our server, Alex, though! He was very friendly and the best part of our dinner.

Service was very good. Staff was friendly. Didn't rush us with any part of the meal. I had the redfish and my wife had ravioli. Both were excellent.  It seems like a number of restaurants in the quarter just rush you thru as fast as possible. We did not feel that way at all. And prices were reasonable.

No bad, just not great.  We came here because we didn't have reservations on a Friday night and they were able to seat us during prime time, 7:00 PM, that should have been a red-flag.  The service wasn't bad and the food was just average, especially for a foodie place like .

Came here on my first day on the recommendation of just about every service person I encountered. I was very underwhelmed especially for the price.

We got the crab cakes for an app and they were delicious, but our entrees (fried gator po boy and a fried catfish po boy) were very boring and bland. The best way to describe my experience at Oceana was "pretty okay." 

Just pass on this place and try one of the local competitors.

I walked in with a group of approximately 30 people on a Saturday and Errol (manager) and his staff immediately assisted us with making preparations for us to be seated. LaKeisha, Nassim, and Makay provided excellent customer service throughout our dinner. The food was absolutely hot and fresh.

 I strongly recommend the restaurant to anyone who loves great food. 

However, do not take my word for it, come and try it for yourself.

Food is good. Loved the alligator bites and BBQ Shrimp. Best part is the kitchen is open late...so after a night in the Quarter, you can get some good food in your stomach to help make waking up tomorrow a little nicer ha.

Everything was very good here. I had the gumbo, alligator bites, and the soft shell crab side. My favorite was the soft shell crab, it was amazing. I've never had alligator and have heard that it is tough, but here it was very tender and well seasoned. The gumbo was also good but not the best I've had. Overall the service, food, and atmosphere made for a very good meal.

Everything my family and I got was wonderful especially the shrimp and cream sauce entree. Especially the shrimp and cream sauce. Especially the shrimp and cream sauce! :P My family live in New Orleans and really love this place.  

One thing though, there's a special called the Catfish Pontchartrain I think. There was something really wrong with the cream sauce on that dish. It wasn't too creamy or buttery. It was just flat out gross. Man, just avoid that one. I felt so bad for my mom because she got that one when we all had awesome dishes.
Great food.  Alligator bites good. Fried oysters the best. Fresh oysters outstanding. Grilled Chicken salad. Fried fish. Jambalaya. Bread pudding great. Khalua mouse pie delish.

Came down to NOLA for a weekend getaway to visit friends and good food, our friends brought us here and man when we first walked up there was a ridiculous line, but only had a 30min wait which wasn't that bad considering the line outside. Man oh man the food was excellent. I got the blackened redfish etoufee with jambalaya and collard greens, everything on the platter was beyond excellent the flavors were all there. My wife got the Cajun jambalaya pasta which was excellent as well, and we split the crabfish cakes, they were so phenomenal that I forgot to take a picture. Our friends got the blackened duck which was moist and full of flavor. 

For dessert we got the banana pudding which was out of this world and the chocolate mousse cake which was very decadent smooth and very filling.

I will most definitely come back here when I come to New Orleans and highly recommend this place to anyone
Went for Petunia's breakfast and loved it! dishes are pricey, but you get what you pay for! Our waiter was awesome.

Went here for breakfast....it was recommended by a friend. The alligator sausage was super tasty, but everything else was normal.

Next time I'd like to try it at dinner.

This was just ok. People recommended it but I thought it was just ok. The food did not blow me away. Drinks were good and they had a lot of drink menu options. The service was excellent and I loved our waiter. I had Cajun jamabalaya pasta and crab cakes. They weren't bad but I have had better before.
Awesome spot. Not from New Orleans but went here two nights in a row. Famous oyster appetizer was delicious.

The best rice and beans i ever had in the world, not kidding,  a circled the globe twice  (northern hemisphere) but the New Orleans sample plate took the blue ribbon. When the waitress asked me how's the food I almost cried, maybe brought back some hidden flavor memories;) go there if you in New Orleans.

We got the taste of New Orleans, seafood platter, and soft shell crab. Best thing was the soft shell crab. I don't know why or how this place has such good ratings because the food lacked flavor. The fried catfish and shrimp was super basic. No seasoning, super bland, and a waste of calories. The soft shell crab was the best out of everything. The red beans and rice tasted like Popeyes. If you are use to traditional home cooked southern food you will be extremely disappointed

To be fair I only had desserts but my home girls ordered dinner and all were impressed. They loved the crab cakes so much they ordered more to go. 
I had the bread pudding. It was huge with iive cram in side. I loved the bread pudding at Court of Two Sisters more but this is a close second to the best I've had in NOLA. My home girl had the mousse cake 2 days in a row so that may be delicious too.
LOVEEEE THIS PLACE! All the food we ordered was BOMB as fuck! Can't wait to come back and try the rest on their menu!

Fabulous food and wonderful staff!  Crawfish cakes are so very good!  Also had the catfish Lafourche and the praline duck - all excellent!  We finished with the bread pudding which just melts in your mouth.  We will definitely be back.  Best food we've had this week!
I went here for a private party upstairs in one of their rooms. The food wasn't very good. The drinks were ok. I did like the open space though.

The food was good but forgettable. The server was hard to find and food was slow coming. Not a lot of attention to keeping the place up. Skip the bread pudding. I don't know that I'll be back. Check it out and decide for yourself.

We ate at Oceana last night.  We ate there a couple of years ago, and it was so good we wanted to go back.  It was just as good this time!  I had the crab cake dinner, and I would give it a 10 out of 10. The sauce is a touch spicy, which I loved.  I ate every bite.  I would say that $22 for 2 crab cakes is a bit high, though.  My husband had the red fish.  He said he would score it a 9 out of 10.  It was flakey, fresh and perfectly cooked.  Neither of us were too impressed with the mushy veggie pile that came with our meal, but we weren't there for the veggies.  The staff was friendly but not overly intrusive.  They are fast there.  We got our meal within a few minutes, and we might have liked to relax with our wine a bit longer before we ate.  It's a crowd pleaser.  We were lucky enough to walk in and be seated, but by the time we left, there was a line down the street.

The best food in NOLA.  The family had crab cakes, the spcial with red fish, seafood platter, cheeseburger and the blackened chicken ceasar.  Everything was delicious and Ms Pamela our server was phenomenal!  Go see Ms. Pamela an the crew at Oceana grill!!

This restaurant, located in the heart of the French Quarter, has very good food, in spite of the very casual interior.
The restaurant is quite dark.  Seating is very rough on metal straight chairs and metal base tables with uncovered table tops.  Very similar to a fast food restaurant.  We were seated quickly and our waiter was fast and attentive.

Food was very good.  I had the seafood gumbo which was only average.  One in our party had raw oysters and indicated they were very good and fresh.  Two of us had the blackened redfish with etou'fee.  It was really excellent.  The fish was cooked perfectly, the seasoning was spicy, but not too hot, and the etou'fee was very good.  The fish came with jambalaya and collards. 

Good, relatively inexpensive place to sample New Orleans fare.
Food was beyond amazing! We went two days in a row because it was so good! Everyone is so friendly and helpful! Truly amazing food and people!
Had lunch there today , sat at the bar and Brandi waited on us. Had the crab cake appetizer... fantastic. Gumbo amazing and the ribs so tender !

Big plus!  They are open very late.  We got off the plane at 9:30 and got to the restaurant hungry at 10:30.  Food is Pretty good... anywhere out of New Orleans I;d rate it 4 stars, but there are so many better restaurants within blocks of oceana.  service was great, quick attentive and not overly fawning.

Bottom line.. late at night 5 stars!!!  any time else 3.

Probably the best meal that we had in the French quarter besides acme. Had the blackened redfish and it was delicious and tender. All of the side dishes were tasty too. There was a pretty long line outside as is the case with most of the restaurants in the French quarter but it moved pretty fast and there is a lot of seating inside.

How can I say enough? I visited New Orleans for the first time in March of 2010. I ate at Oceana, by myself. Which I typically never do but being alone in the city I knew I had to try some of the famous N'Awlin's style food. Strolling through the French Quarter one certainly has many options but by sheer chance this place caught my eye. 

I ordered the BBQ Shrimp for an app. For my entree I had the Crab Cakes and an Abita Amber to wash it down. HANDS DOWN THE BEST MEAL I HAVE EVER EATEN IN MY LIFE!!!

I have since returned to NOLA with my girlfriend in October 2010 and this is the first place we went. I again ordered the same as I had been craving it for the 7 months between my visits. And it didn't disappoint. Everything from the location, environment, service and most of all...food are nothing short of spectacular. I am now considering a move to New Orleans and I will be a loyal patron if that becomes a reality.

Had a great experience here, the server shone was outstanding! He gave great recommendations on food and drinks. The food was beyond amazing loved it. The drinks were on the little weak side, over all the experience was good!!!
Had chicken poboy. Meal came out quickly and was great. Very filling. Service was fantastic.

Great Service. Emily knew a lot about the menu offerings and recommended the Crawfish Fettuccine. Just the right amount of spice. For dessert I chose the Strawberry Cheesecake. This was not my first time here, and it won't be my last.
Don't come here on a Friday or Saturday night with a large group. Slow service, undrinkable cocktails, overpriced small portions.

This place is full of awesomeness! The jambalaya pasta and alligator bites is highly recommended. I have to admit my boyfriend and I were tired of the hit and misses of the restaurants that were recommended to us by friends, that we decided to eat here twice while visiting. The second time I had the crabcake pasta with the sauce that's on the jambalaya pasta. This place is a must!

I first heard of this place from Ramsey's Kitchen Nightmares show and unlike most of the places featured this one has stayed open and thrived. There was about 1400 posiive reviews so I thought it was worth a try and was not disappointed, We had lunches at other places and I must say the food generally was way too salty but Oceana got it right as the seasoning was balanced. Our appetizer was fried and blackened alligator and the entrees included vegetable pasta fettuccine, crawfish etouffee and a seafood platter and they were all very good as was the service. I would definitely go back.

It was my first visit to New Orleans and when my darling bf and I tried to check into our hotel early we were told it wasn't happening. It was, after all, jazz fest weekend (2012) and things were busy. So we asked for a restaurant recommendation and Oceana was the "I guess if you don't want to walk too far this will be fine" option given to us. 

Boy, were we ever blown away by the house oysters! I never liked oysters, but these were like a party in my mouth and I think the darling bf and I fell in love over (and with!) those oysters. 

It's now almost a year later and all I wanted to do was surprise him with a trip back to NoLA for our one year anniversary. Right after booking the trip he said, "We can have those oysters every day!" I knew (for the millionth time) I was with my soul mate when he said that. We probably love those oysters more than we love each other - they're that good.

It was then that I realized I'd never reviewed this place and that's a shame. We dream about that sauce the oysters are in and we talk about them every time we talk about that trip. Everyone said "Go to Drago's! Get the oysters!" And so we did, but after these we were totally disappointed with Drago's. Oceana had our hearts and still does. 

I'm thrilled that we get to go back to celebrate our first year together. And certainly that darling boyfriend should put a diamond instead of a pearl in my oyster, right!?
Fantastic food, service, and atmosphere. If you find yourself in New Orleans do yourself a favor and eat here.

Nothing spectacular... we had a fried seafood platter. It was good and the fries were crispy. The seafood was seasoned well.
We had the crab cake, but it was cold, which was disappointing because it was tasty.

Let's try something different tonight, you say to yourself in the French Quarter for the umpteenth time, knowing that the restaurant selection is severely limited to tourist traps with mediocre quality yet high priced food.  Oceana Grill is where you end up and it's not as bad as it could be.  The place is nicely decorated with bright colors and the service is on point.  I was unimpressed with what my friends ordered but my pasta was pretty good though nothing to foodgasm over.  For the price, I don't know.  Think it'd be better to just walk my ass to Verti Marte from now on and spend the savings on alcohol.

Get the crab cakes with the awesome mushroom sauce + ribeye steak + cajun pasta.

Servers were nice and attentive, food was awesome. Came back for a second meal even though there was plenty of other places in the city b/c it was that good. My ribeye was perfect the first time, kind of overcooked the second, but still worth the trip. Prices are reasonable imo. Cant wait to go back just to devour those crab cakes.

Fabulous meal!! Awesome poboy, jambalaya, hurricanes, and bread pudding. We tried a lot of places over our vaca, this was definitely top of the list. Laid back and casual atmosphere, a definite gem. 
Errol was our server, ask for him when you stop in. He was awesome!!
I'll be brief. This is New Orleans seafood. Period. The redfish oceana was fabulous. My wife had a gluten free crab cake that was fantastic. Even the rice blew my mind. Eat here.

Love love loved Oceana Grill! I had the mardi gras pasta which is a cajun crawish and shrimp pasta with alfredo sauce. SO delicious. There is always a wait, so I recommend sitting at the upstairs bar! 

Only complaint is the bloody marys are a bit salty due to being infused in the pickled vegetables. 

Overall, everything was delicious and we will come back everytime we come in town to NOLA.

This is my first time eating here and I loved it. The atmosphere was good and the staff was knowledgeable of the food and courteous. I ate the crawfish étouffée and it was one of the best I've ever had. I would recommend this place for anyone looking for a relaxed atmosphere.

Heather was our barender and server and was fantastic!

She answered drink and food questions and had local tips.

BBQ Shrimp was delicious.  5 large shrimp that were easy to peel.

The red beans and rice were so, so good.  We kept the BBQ Sauce and added it to the dish. Wow! It popped! Steve had the combo platter and seemed to enjoy it 

I was dissapointed in the amount of rice with the beans and asked for more. There was a charge of course.

The concierge at the Omni said Oceana has a fantastic breakfast so watch for an update.

Breakfast update:

Oceana lost a star based on breakfast. I had the St. James crepe. The crepe was doughy and flavorless.  It had a generous stuffing of shrimp and crab as well as grilled onions and peppers and cheddar cheese topping. The flavor was bland.

Steve did enjoy the seafood omelette. 

The coffee was just ok. Service was ok.

We did use the Yelp 10% discount.

For $40 I wish Oceana's breakfast was more impressive.

The pictures and rating do this place a favor. After visiting New Orleans on numerous occasions this was probably THE worst food I've ever had. Save your money and go some place that actually serves decent food. Gave it 2 stars for decent service and cleanliness.
Stopped on for a po boy and was pleasantly surprised.  Staff was ok and attentive!  Food tasted fresh and was delivered on a timely manner.  Decent place to stop for a quick bite and drinks
The best meal in NOLA. Best oyster, best jambalaya and best dessert! Five starts definitely!

Good food not too long of a wait.  I had the bbq peel and eat shrimp app. Really tasty!  The I had the crayfish  ettofe also very tasty
My husband had the duck and he really thought it was really good as well!  
Overall good experience did not know my socks off but I would eat there again for sure!

Great place for lunch, we were a little hesitant to go at first but I'm glad we did.

Lunch was phenomenal and we were stuffed afterwards. I have a group had to take naps at the hotel afterwards before we could go out again. Service is a little slow but definitely worth it.

My first time in New Orleans and I treat my self and my wife to some real good New Orleans food.
Wait in line for about 25 minutes to get a table yet the food and the service was excellent our server Jessica was very tentative explain the menu very well.
I had the Redfish with the crayfish mushroom sauce   With greens and mashed potatoes. The food was excellent,
Again if you chance to dine at the Oceana Grill don't pass up the opportunity....

The service was prompt and attentive and we were surprised at how quickly the lineup to get in was processed. We sat upstairs and the setup allowed sufficient room at the table was quiet enough for conversations.  The food was quite good- not the best we had in New Orleans but very tasty and not a single bad dish ordered between the four of us.

Great time at Oceana! We had a large party of 12 and they were able to accommodate us on the spot! The food was good but the service was outstanding! Ashleigh did an outstanding job, keeping the drinks moving and being very attentive to our needs! Would definitely recommend for a cajun seafood NOLO experience!

Everything was good...I ordered the seafood gumbo for an appetizer as well as the crab cakes. Both dishes were good. The seafood gumbo could've been more chunkier but the flavor was still on point. The crab cakes come with two which were a healthy size, bigger than what I expected. And the sauce was finger licking good. For the entree I had the "taste of New Orleans", I wasn't prepared for the flavored. The red beans were none like l ever had before. Last but least my waitress Natalie was the best.
Oceana was recommended by our driver and we are glad we followed his advice. The crab cakes were delicious, as was the Shrimp Po Boy. We shared the bread pudding which was amazing. Would def go back!

THE BEST OYSTERS ONE MAY EVER HAVE (Oceana's Famous Dozen) We come to New Orleans from Texas a couple of times a year just to have their food! We always get the Taste of New Orleans or Red Beans and Rice or their Crab Cake Fettuccine Alfredo with our Oysters and you can't go wrong with any of their dishes! We are in New Orleans for three nights and have/will eat dinner there every night!
Not sure what all the hype is about.  Bad service and luke-warm food was our experience.  Save your money..
They have great crab cake pasta. It's a little high with small portion but all in all will do the job.

Wow, tough to make a decision about this place based on the Yelp reviews.  They're all over the board from 1 to 5 stars.  (Spoiler alert:  This is not a 4 or 5 star restaurant)  I had a server at the Capital Grille in Houston recommend it to me for the crab cakes & BBQ shrimp so I went.  First thing you'll notice is the line down the street to get in.  However, if you'll eat at the bar you can bypass the line.  I did.

Abita Amber 16 oz. draft for $4.50 served by Meghan.  Really nice server, thumbs up, personable & attentive.  Decent price for a beer on Bourbon Street.

The crab cake appetizer is two crab cakes topped with a spicy sauce & some crawfish tails.  It literally took 2 minutes from order until it showed up in front of me.  I thought it was tasty, the spicy sauce gave it good flavor.  It was warm, not hot, and I'd say the sauce helped cover the fact there was a fair amount of filler besides crab in the cake.  However, I'll give this dish between 2 & 3 stars.  If it had been served hot & fresh it'd be 3 stars.

The BBQ shrimp appetizer is 5 large shrimp.  That's a fair enough deal for the price.  However, I put my finger in the sauce and if it was 90 degrees I'd be surprised.  I've had warmer baths than the BBQ sauce.  The bread served with the shrimp is totally bland.  They took a baguette & sliced it a few hours ago.  Not heated, buttered, seasoned or anything.  Dried out, white baguette.  I peeled the shrimp & this is where it gets bad.  The shrimp were so overcooked you had to fight to get the shell off.  Literally every segment of the tail shell had to be peeled off the shrimp.  You should be able to pinch the tail of a properly cooked shrimp & have it pop out of the last two segments.  You couldn't pinch the tail and get the meat to pop out of the fan at the very back.  In short, horribly overcooked & very difficult to peel.  The flavor?  One overpowering note - Worcestershire.  BBQ shrimp sauce should be a blend of butter, Worcestershire & spices.  This dish was 1 star, had it been served hot I'd have given it 2 stars & if the shrimp had been perfectly cooked it might have gotten to 3 stars.

The ambience of the restaurant is totally touristy.  People lined down the street to get in, setting at the bar looking around I didn't see a lot to convince me that it was particularly clean.  It looked like it needed a good scrubbing.  I liked my server; she was good.  I saw several managers doing actual work & they checked in on me twice to make sure I was doing ok.  The service was good from server to management.

My conclusion?  I don't see why anyone would wait in line to eat here.  The BBQ shrimp at Deanie's are much better.  Then again, this is a restaurant at the corner of Bourbon Street & Conti Street in the heart of the tourist trap Bourbon Street.  I should have known better.  It's not awful but it's a long way from special.  If you've come to New Orleans looking for spectacular food this isn't the place.  If you've come to New Orleans looking to party your butt off and you need something to put in your stomach to soak up the alcohol then this place will do.

We had just landed and were starving! Most places were closed but Oceana Grill was open and pleased to sit us. We had a great experience and the food was amazing! I had the Shrimp Platter and it was great! Plus a ton of food (very generous portions) This was my second time returning to this restaurant and I will be returning on my next trip to NOLA.

THE FOOD WAS AMAAAAAAAZING! So good that by the time we remembered to take a picture of the food, it was all gone. Haha. But we got the Cajun fries, crab cakes, and charbroiled oysters for the appetizer and all 3 were absolutely amazing! I had the oceana grill signature dish. The red snapper was a little dry but it had so much flavor! My boyfriend had the crab cake pasta and he loved it! My sister had the Cajun jambalaya pasta and I tried it myself and it was so so good. All in all this place was everything we hoped. We were starving at walked into the right place! Chantay was our server and she was so nice and so patient with us! She even requested some of her favorite dishes and all the ones she requested were absolutely to die for! 10/10 would definitely recommend this place!

We went here for breakfast recommended by hotel worker. I am happy we took his advice. The crawfish omelette , alligator sausage, creamy grids, biscuit and virgin Bloody Mary was a great start for our day. The waitress Tira was so attentive to us, makes us want to go back for dinner.

My first time in New Orleans and I had the chance to taste two types of gator; their crispy fried gator and saucy seasoned gator all in one plate. It was complimented with a tangy horseradish sauce which gave a boost in flavor! It was good, but a must try is their Famous Oysters! They are super delicious!

it looks like a dive but the food was solid i ate almost all which is unusual . if its hot get seats in the back with the low ceilings they keep the ac cranked. 
id go back .

This restaurant is located off bourbon street. You wait outside and they call you when seating is available. From the outside you would not think it was a big restaurant. As we were walking to our table, I got a chance to see it was spacious and had plenty of tables. There's a upstairs and downstairs. The menu has a lot of good choices. I ordered the Taste of New Orleans that includes just about everything. This dish was simply amazing. The right amount of flavor and spice. I had the opportunity to taste my family food and they ordered raw oysters, crab cakes and the red fish. Tried raw oysters for the first time not sure how I feel about those but they said they were the best (cheap)raw oysters they have ever had. I would totally recommend this restaurant to anyone. One of the best restaurants while in New Orleans. Also when I checked in I received 20% off my meal.

This place is definitely worth the wait. We waited about 30 minutes in line for a table of 7. We ordered crab cakes for appetizers and they were amazing. The black and red fish special with jambalaya was fantastic.  If your ever in bourboun street this is the place to eat!
Jessica hooked up my gator bites and had me laughing through my entire meal. I won't eat food ever again unless served by her.

Nice service and lame food. Out of the five things we ordered: crab cakes, catfish po boy, chicken alfredo with blackened chicken, pecan pie and kahlua chocolate pie, I only *really* liked the blackened chicken alfredo. It's sauce was seasoned and great. The pecan pie was pretty good. Nothing else I liked much.

The crab cake was not good to me at all. It was soggy and had minimal flavor internally. 

The fries had a batter on them and I don't enjoy that personally, but my husband loves that kind of French fry. 

Catfish tastes fresh and clean, so that's good!

Our server was very polite and prompt and our food came put pretty quickly which we appreciated.

However it's one of the few places nearby that are pretty good for kids. We tried three different restaurants before we had to come here because the others were 21+ or closed in the afternoon til 6. 

I probably wouldn't recommend this place to anyone unless they were really into alfredo, because that was good enough to warrant visiting. I bet their blackened food is generally better overall.

The courtyard is lovely to eat in. The food was delixious. I got the blackened Redfish with Crawfish Etouffee with Collard Greens and Jambalaya on the side and was not disapointed. The bread pudding is marvelous and the pecan pie warmed with vanilla ice cream is southern heaven. The prices were very reasonable. We had great service. The staff was friendly to everyone and they were all helping each other out. I would definitely recommend this place. Tip: Get there before 6 or else be prepared to wait in a line that snakes around the outside.

I went here last weekend with my Father n law for my birthday lunch and it was awesome! A lot of the other places we wanted to go to had huge waits and lines, but we were able to be seated right away. Our waitress' name was Brittany I believe and she was amazing. In New Orleans everyone seemed like they were moving in slow motion, and maybe I thought that because I'm a Cali girl. But our waitress was on it! Everything we asked for she had really quick! We order both types of oysters rockerfeller and she told us to let her put those in because they take a little longer, and she knew we were hungry. 

The Oysters came out and they were delicious!!!! I ate all 6 of them and the little lettuce they had on the plate, lol. I ordered the blacked catfish and Jambalaya with crawfish tails and it was so tasty! I'll definatley be back here!
Food was very good and flavorful! Pasta Mardi Gras was amazing!! Our waitress was very nice and gave us good recommendations on what to try.
The crab cakes were amazing. The food and service were amazing as usual. I have to come here every time I'm in town.

Oceana Grill is quickly becoming my favorite casual restaurant in the French Quarter. The place is surprisingly huge (7 rooms) and service is always top notch! My favorite items on the menu are the char broiled oysters, crab cakes & crème brûlée. Although Oceana Grill is known for their seafood, their chicken alfredo  is easily one of the best I've ever had. Admittedly, I only recently started going to Oceana Grill and I'm mad at myself for taking so long to eat there.  I highly recommended Oceana Grill to anyone wanting delicious food in the FQ at a very reasonable price.

The food was good but I feel like I have had better. I ordered the taste of Louisiana and I like it.  We went here because they could accommodate our party of  20 comfortably in their third floor. 

I did not like their policy for not splitting up our tickets. That made our visit a hassle.

It is really hard to get bad food in new Orleans, that being said, you have to definitely do a little bit of research, do some major waiting, and find a good place. Oceana grill is definitely one that I would put on your list. The wait was long but the food was worth it. The mussels and the clamss were great and not to mention the main course, some sort of cod with a really nice tomato sauce. I will definitively give this another shot if I ever go back to new Orleans.

This restaurant was amazing the highlight of our trip the food was great, the atmosphere was awesome and the service was amazing. Our waitress Jennifer did such a great job her customer service was on point. Her recommendations were nothing less than great, she checked regularly to see how we were doing and her personality made my friends and I feel welcomed. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone you have to go here when you go to New Orleans. Their seafood gumbo was excellent I give them all five stars....

I walked by this place many times and always saw a huge line so one day I decided to try it after a business meeting in the Quarter.  The chargrilled oysters were terrible,  They had bits of burnt shell in them and no flavor other than butter.  Everything else I ate was mediocre to bad. This is place is a tourist trap, if you appreciate New Orleans food stay away.

Oceana Grill was the best restaurant we ate at on our recent vacation to New Orleans. I ordered the Crawfish Étouffée and it was delicious. My husband said his Redfish with Étouffée was also very good. The Gumbo was the best I have ever had. Fun atmosphere and our server, Erroll, was very friendly and conscientious. Great experience.
Delicious food and great service.  It was a clean and cheerful environment to eat in. It was great to get off of the street and take a small break.
What a great spot. Excellent service (David is a wonderful server), great food, and right in the middle of everything. This is a must in any trip to New Orleans! Try the crab cakes!

My red fish was amazing!! It comes with crawfish mushroom sauce and mustard greens that were to die for! Great service and the food came out very quick. Our waitress Whitney was the sweetest and very attentive.

I've been to New Orleans twice and the food here is absolutely amazing!! The friends I went with this past week loved it so much we went there for breakfast two days in a row.  The first day our server was Ponce. Very attentive, friendly and fast service! He made sure we were satisfied the entire meal, told some lovely anecdotes and served each guest with the same enthusiasm.   The biscuits and gravy are unlike any other I've tasted and boy they give you a lot. Our second day we had Pamela and before we ordered she forewarned us about the portion sizes so we decided to pick 3 things we all wanted and split the meals. We had the biscuits and gravy (again) and the St. James Crepe - which was filled to the brim with seafood and flavor, and the pancakes - to be a bit traditional- which were light and fluffy. Pamela went above and beyond as well giving us great recommendations and telling us everything we needed to know to enjoy our New Orleans experience!! 

I recommend this place every time :)

Our very first meal in the city did not disappoint! We sat in their beautiful courtyard, warm under an outdoor heat lamp. We started with the peel n eat bbq shrimp. The sweet, chocolatey sauce compliments the gulf shrimp well. The star of the hour was the red beans and rice. How do you make beans SO PACKED WITH FLAVOR?? My fav of the trip, although a few other restaurants came close.

The waiter was nice the restaurant is nice. We had a party of 30 and they refused to sit us until the entire party was there. It was 90 degrees outside and because they don't have much of a waiting area and they want to keep that area clear, they tried to make us stand outside instead of just sitting us upstairs.  The menu isn't that spectacular either. I have a problem with restaurants who try to use sauces to cover up not so good food. These people put sauce on EVERYTHING!!!! The chargrilled oysters had sauce on it!  WHY????? Also I had a burger and it was ok at best. I asked for medium well and I got extra well. Lol. Any who if you want true New Orleans cuisine please don't go there. I'm from New Orleans and they'll never see me again.

My first time in New Orleans, this place sure did deliver on utterly delicious seafood. I shared the blackened catfish special with my boyfriend, and man was it extra tasty. Our server was very accommodating and cheerful, surely he made part of our night.

This place was a hit from the minute we walked in the door. The decor is beautiful.  Our server, David, was the best.  He was attentive, informative and entertaining.  The good was amazing.  I had red beans and rice with sausage.  Delish! The only thing I would complain about was wishing there was more sausage.  It was so good.  Go there!!!!!
Great food. Excellent service.  The gumbo is  superlative, the crab cakes are so good you will not believe it. Very worthwhile.

Food was awful.  My first night hotel suggested this place because they deliver.  I ordered the crab cakes pretty good. However the red beans and rice with sausage.  I took one look and trashed it. I ordered the bread pudding  outside box was sticky and the pudding was upside down.  Sorry I can't eat it. First off you must pay cash for delivery  and you get no change back. This place is a rip off.

THE FOOD WAS DISGUSTING!!!!! 
First mind you we paid $52 and change for 2 meals that we didn't enjoy at all. I ordered the crab cake Alfredo and it was dry, not seasoned enough and just nasty. My boyfriend ordered the Cajun something I think and it was pretty good. The only reason I liked it was because the shrimp and the spice on the food other then that it was not good. I would not recommend this place to anyone. Some of the workers there are nice and polite but there were two that were unprofessional and just rude. I don't think you should argue in front of a customer with your co worker, more should you have an attitude because a customer asked you to get something when the person that was helping them stepped away for a second to handle something for us. It wasn't a good experience for us. Other people give them a descent rating, I would say just go and try it. Have your own experience and see if it worked out better for you.

While my husband and I visited New Orleans on a road trip we were told to try this place by the hotel. The food was delcious and they gave good portions. Loved the jumbalaya, red beans and rice, crawfish etoufee! (Yes we had all this in one sitting) but the gator was a little undercooked. Haven't had any cajun place top this one defintely worth the try!
Great food and atmosphere. Kind of touristy by location but authentic cuisine is sure to please locals. Amazing deserts. Outdoor and indoor seating.

I must say I been out here since Monday and I been here like 3 times.....I had they famous bloody mary that was BOMB! made with this infused vodka and my spicy green beans....then came back for they shrimp and crawfish sandwich.....now I have to be honest the sandwich was okay.......but there was more bread than seafood which was a little dissapointing and why they are getting 4 stars instead of the 5 they would have gotten.....but then they redeemed themselves with the seafood omlette!!!!!!!!! OMG the best I have ever tasted! Besides that the staff is great...very friendly and I will definantly be coming back......

This place was recommended to me by the consierge at the hotel I was staying at. 

I was very hungry following a long drive from Florida and arrived at Oceana Grill sometime after 5 p.m. local time. The place was relatively empty and I sat down at the bar. The bartender served me up a Nola on tap (allowing me to sample it in a small glass prior to). It tasted pretty good.

I wanted to sample the local fare, and there were so many options. Following a little back-and-forth with the bartender, I settled on a shrimp po boy, with fries. The shrimp was so good, but the toasted roll was a little too crusty.

I wish, in retrospect, that I would have tried something else. I wasn't completely satisfied with my decision.
The Catfish Platter and Red Beans and rice entree we both delicious!  The staff was very friendly and the ambience was awesome!

Went here on out first night in NOLA with my spouse and sister-in-law. The place was great-very cozy and has a lot of character. We were greeted by friendly and very attentive staff.

The food was incredible! Don't say no to the oysters because they were sooo good! One of the best that I had so far. We ordered half a dozen of the Oceana's famous oyster and half a dozen as well of the Rockefeller oyster. I'm so glad that we tried both because it was really good! The flavors were spot on!
We also ordered the fried seafood platter (very fresh, very large serving size!), crab cakes (will make you crave for it! A must try!), and  Red fish Oceana (very fresh, flavorful, and a little spicy!).

We did not order dessert because we were so full! The serving size is huge! Overall, we had a very nice experience and we will definitely go back there when we visit NOLA again next year!

Average tourist food and a bit overpriced. My husband ordered the oyster po boy which was $14.95 and had only 4 oysters on it. I had the gumbo which tasted pretty good but the shrimp were not deveined so I had to pick them out. Oddly, there are no salads on the menu. Eggplant fries were decent and service was great. Not sure why this place has 4 stars though.

Our first night in NOLA, tired from travel and wanted dinner close to our hotel but nowhere too raucous. The courtyard here was great! We shared the crabmeat cakes for an appetizer and they were AMAZING. Also split dinner, the Taste of New Orleans. We loved it all! 
Felt like a great first stop in a city we think we'll love.
One star off because service was a bit slow. Very nice and polite, just a little slow.

This is a fantastic place!! I ate here 3 times in a week!! Ask for Chris, he will definitely take care of you!! Alligator bites, gumbo, seafood platter is so fresh and the place is really friendly!! And the oysters were sooo good! Right off of Bourbon Street!
Great service, welcoming setting, outstanding service! I had the Oceana Redfish and I dreamed about it the night I went to bed. Sooooo tasteful.
Ask about the special of the day. When I went it was blackened tilapia with a crawfish cream sauce that was delicious. They were also passing out 10% off coupon cards on Bourbon.

The service was great. Staff was friendly. Out of all the plates we ordered I would recommend the Cajun jambalaya pasta. It was delicious and full of flavor. I also liked the rockafella oysters for the taste although you don't a lot of meat with the oysters. For drinks, the tropical storm was delicious.

Oceana Grill is a great place to get your seafood fix! 

For the appetizer, we had half white and half black gator tail bites. Both meats were good but in my opinion I liked the black gator meat the best. We also had a dozen of Oceana's Famous Oysters which are chargrilled, juicy, and were nicely done. However, I still prefer the chargrilled oysters at Felix's Oyster Bar. But still good!

My girlfriend and I shared the Redfish Oceana which is their signature dish and it was delicious! The crawfish sauce that was laid on top complemented the flavor of the redfish. My brother had the Praline Duck and he seemed to enjoy it as well, but just make sure you don't lay too much sauce on the duck since it makes it a tad bit salty. My parents had the Fried Seafood Platter which came with fried oysters, shrimp, and catfish which was also good!

The fried Oysters were the best I've had.  The crawfish  etouffee  and gumbo were average.  The two complaints were that the restaurant was too cold and food took too long to come out.  Waitress was excellent

The servers and hosts were all so fantastic at Oceana - truly the best, most helpful and kind service we had all week in New Orleans. Unfortunately, I just couldn't get on board with the food.

It was our last night in New Orleans, and I was on a mission to consume as many oysters as possible. Oceana was about the only place we could still get oysters on the half shell after 10pm so we ordered a couple of drinks, some raw oysters, and the fried alligator for good measure. Our plan was to try the food, see how it was, and order more as needed. Unfortunately, after our food and drinks arrived, it became pretty clear we wouldn't be ordering any more.

Our big mistake was coming here after closing down Felix's. The oysters at Oceana just couldn't compare - they were perfectly serviceable oysters, but they were bone dry. It seemed like they'd probably been shucked much earlier and had dried out waiting to be plated. I could have lived with dry oysters, but the alligator bites were really awful - just pure gristle. I know alligator can be chewy, but this was something really... special. We left them mostly untouched, paid our bill, and hightailed it out of there.

The atmosphere at Oceana seems pretty friendly and it's entirely possible we'd have had a better experience during typical meal hours. And the servers were just SO sweet and warm, I actually felt guilty about not liking the food. I might give it another try, but it certainly wouldn't be my first stop - especially for alligator!

Pretty good but touristey. I didn't realize on my first night that this would be considered good Creole food in the French Quarter. I had a combo plate with red beans & rice, jambalaya, and etoufee. All were pretty tasty but not amazing. Definitely needed hot sauce to make it a bit more exciting. Service is pretty good considering how many drunkies are walking by.

On our last day in New Orleans, we wanted to have our last fill of gumbo and jambalaya for brunch and found Oceana Grill on yelp and was really glad that we found this place before we left. 

They have a pretty extensive menu and Jessica our waitress was super friendly, came over and gave us an overview and provided great suggestions. 

Based on her suggestion, we both got the taste of New Orleans which was a plate of beans, jambalaya and etouffe, my wife was craving jambalaya and was able to order the same thing but only jambalaya. It was a huge plate of food, I think both of us could've shared one order and everything was tasty and excellent.

I've tried gumbo around various restaurants in the French Quarter in the last 5 days and really didn't really care for it until I came to Oceana Grill. Their gumbo was super flavorful, filled with rice and seafood, definitely changed my mind about gumbo. 

Definitely a great restaurant for great New Orleans food. I am so glad that we were able to visit before we left.

Yummy yummy yummy!!!! From the Seafood Gumbo to the Shrimp Alfredo to the massive chunk of Ahi Tuna to Oceana's Famous Oysters, the food was delicious! The prices are also very good in comparison to nearby restaurants. I will definitely be back here.
I love this place.  Everything we had was excellent.  Fried catfish platter was amazing, Cajun jambalaya was terrific.  Can't wait to come back.
Great food.  Good service.  The stoli vanilla white Russian and the fried shrimp po boy were both amazing

The food is good, and the wait was pretty average. Ok, so, I ordered  the crabcake meal with 2 sides. When my order came, it was just the crabcakes, the waiter said he didnt know i wanted the meal, apologized and said he will be rite back with my sides.. smh.. noooo, he shouldve taken my whole plate and started all over.. anyway, as im waiting on my sides,  and waiting, n waiting, ofcourse the cakes are getting cold. The manager just happens to walk by. I told him what happened he immediately,  takes my cold crab cakes, comes back with  a hot fresh plate, just the way i ordered!!! I was so dam happy!! He turned my froen into a smile!! I was happy again!... So, basically the manager saved this review. Hint* if the line is too long, u can request to sit at the bar*
Awesome food and drinks...had the 'taste of new Orleans' ... Very flavorful and tasty!
We loved this place. Our waiter, Errol was great. He gave us all the right recommendations and our special requests were perfect. Will definitely go back on my next visit to New Orleans.

My first time in NO and Oceana was recommended. I had the crab cakes, garlic mashed potatoes, and collard greens. All was really good. Plus my waiter, Alex, was super friendly and informative. Thank you, Oceana, for a wonderful experience!
Great food and great service! We sat at the bar right in the front and had great conversation with our bartender Bradley. We'll definitely be back if we ever come through again.

Went to a couple restaurants while we were in New Orleans. Oceana was one that was recommended by a couple people. I made reservations for 8:30 and skipped a long line. When we got inside we saw several empty tables. They were obviously making the restaurant seem like the spot to be by making people wait. Our food wasn't hot, the shrimp was fried too hard, and my drink was weak. We did like the fries. The shrimp poboy was good although Acmes poboy was better. Service was good and the atmosphere was awesome. But we came to eat and our food was slightly better than Red Lobster.

What to know about Oceana Grill: The food is great, but the lines are long. We tried to get in for dinner one night and opted to return for lunch the next day because the line was too long. If you have some flexibility in your schedule, try to head to Oceana in the late afternoon. The crab cakes were amazing and we split the blackened redfish entree. We would recommend both! If possible, try to sit outside or by the window.

We were stuck under the rain with no good place to hang out at. We ended up checking Yelp for a good place to have dinner. We found good reviews here and we decided to give it a shot. Our server was Alex, an extremely nice and attentive guy. We had catfish platter and shrimp platter, in addition to the crab cake which was amazing. Crab cake dish was one of the best I have ever had. It has big pieces of crab in it which made that dish stand out to me. Platters were okay, covered with thick layer of breading. Hush puppies are a little spicy because they are mixed with jalapeños I guess. 
The only issue with this place is that prices were a little higher than what I expected.

Not what we expected on the inside but food and service were really good! Our server was Jennifer and she was very attentive. Everyone's good turned out delicious and we would definitley go back again when in town!

The food was incredible and Natalie our server was a delight. We  tried a few things on our first night in town and even went back the next day because we enjoyed it so much. All together we ordered the Taste of New Orleans, fettuccini, and the seafood gumbo. If you go there order the gumbo, you won't regret it. The prices are really reasonable as well.

After reading many reviews about this place I honestly expected more. 
We waited about 5 minutes to be seated and I don't know if it was the fact that Mardi Gras had just passed, but I found the place in need of some deep cleaning. The carpet was filthy and the decorations dusty. The restaurant has 2 floors and we were seated on the second floor. We ordered the crab cakes, the oceans oysters and the Caesar salad with shrimp. It took them a looong time to bring the food and when it finally arrived the server said they had lost our ticket that's why it took so long. 
The food was good, the oysters were yummy, the crab cakes too but nothing out of the ordinary. My Caesar salad was supposed to have shrimp and it came with chicken and shrimp, I was fine with that it was good, but like I said, I was expecting more
Lovely service! Pamela was an excellent server. Great food! Nice experience of New Orleans!

We are from Los Angeles and our Lyft driver, Tamalyn, told us that we should try this place. Everyone says it's delicious! So, my husband and I did! It was the best food in New Orleans that I tried! My husband got the Taste of New Orleans and I got the Fried Shrimp plate. It was so delicious! My husband wipe that bowl clean! If you're hungry and want something good to eat! Come hear!

Check this place out ppl. You're not gonna to be disappointed . The service was excellent along with awesome food. Ppl here was so friendly and welcoming. Just one thing I wish they would try is I think the Po-Boy sandwiches would be perfect if the sandwiches were toasted instead of serving cold/ dried sandwiches ( I meant just only the sandwiches , not the meat inside).
The best restaurant I ate at in the quarter. Visited this filthy city for a week and did plenty of eating. This place was my fav and delish. Would look forward to eating here again if I go back.

Do not order delivery from here. We tried and it took over 2 hours and 2 calls to yelp.
Yelp saved the day by canceling our order and refund in us but if this place is what you are planning on ordering don't!!! We did, you won't dig it.
Taste of New Orleans with a side of Gumbo!!  Absolutely amazing!!  Will be returning here for sure on our next trip back!

Meh. I don't understand all the 5 star reviews. I ordered the jambalaya pasta and it came out slightly warm. Also tasted like something you could make from a box. I'm sorry we waited as long as we did for this mediocre meal. 

Ps. We sat upstairs in one of the rooms facing the street. The room was dark enough that you thought you might have turned blind.

Needed a quick place to grab a bite of food before going to a walking tour of the French Quarter and Oceana was the closest option. They were able to immediately accommodate our party of 6 and didnt seem to have any problems when in the middle of the meal we had a 7th join us, which was much appreciated. 

The menu reads kind of like a cheap commercial restaurant that is trying to appeal to tourists who probably want the sense that they are getting cajun food, but aren't concerned with authenticity. Unfortunately, seemingly nearly every item on the menu is fried. I had a "blackened alligator" po boy, which was frankly very pedestrian. Despite being advertised as "blackened" it was pretty flavorless. Additionally, I needed a little caffeine to help me find the energy for a 2 hour walking tour, so I ordered a cup of coffee with dinner, which was a big mistake. I got a cold, cup of black coffee, which seemed like it had been brewed much earlier in the morning. 

Oceana is the type of place that you eat at because you need to, not because you seek it out. Overall, I would try to avoid it.

Get the secret fries! So good. The red beans and rice is off the chain and the shrimp Poboy was so damn good I kept eating it after I was too full. I went here as a recommendation from the hotel and it didn't disappoint...I recommend sitting at the bar for good people watching.

Oh my goodness. This place was recommended to me by a local. I'm so glad we came. Whitney, our server, gave us the best service! The food was extraordinary, and the portions very generous. Best food and service hands down since we've been here.

Absolutely AMAZING!!!!! I love crab cakes and Oceana has monster size ones!  The best I've ever had by far!!! Our server Lloyd provided amazing service and the atmosphere outside on the court yard is great!

I got the Taste of New Orleans. It was good. But the winning dish was my friend's who got the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta and man did I regret not getting that after she let me have a bite!! It was delish! Definitely recommend!

Had lunch here yesterday after arriving. Heard so much about poboys. I was not disappointed. Had a blackened shrimp poboy with all the fixings. It was amazing.  Would not recommend the pecan pie. Was pretty disappointed.

This place has a great location right in the French quarters. If you are visiting and love seafood, I highly recommend this place. Not super fancy but it was nice and clean. You get a lot of food for the price. I was with a group of friends and everything we tried was amazing. I loved the blackened reddish with fried crawfish and sauce on top. The seafood platters were good and don't even get me started on the Alfredo. It was amazing!! I had it with chicken and shrimp. 

Put it this way..I enjoyed the food so much I ordered more the following day and had it wrapped up to take on the flight home with me. All the staff was friendly and checked on is and the food was great. That equals five stars in my book. 

And if you love White Russians than definitely try theirs. They also have mimosas too for brunch lovers. Happy Eating! I will definitely be back for more.

There has been a lot of buzz about this place, especially since CNN's stakeout here during Hurricane Gustav... I like this restaurant, the place is very clean and the staff is great, but I think the food is a bit small/overpriced/bland. I ate there just a few weeks ago for the first time. Had the chargrilled oyster appetizer, which was good but really tiny. It was the delicious sauce sitting on top of it that saved the day... Bbq shrimp appetizer next, which was also 'good', but not as good as some other places make it within walking distance. Then, on to the seafood platter... to be honest, I was disappointed. If you want to be considered one of the hottest spots for seafood in downtown New Orleans you're going to have to do better!
Overall, it was a pleasant experience and the food was OK but for the price they should give you more of it or cook it better! They probably won't, though. The surrounding hotels and Bourbon Street gives them enough business not to want to change a thing. Me? I'll just keep looking...
Drinkin a local tap brewsky!  Thx for the awesome recommendations Brandi!  Fresh oysters on the half shell and shrimp gumbo! We want the recipes to take home with us to Minnesota.

Everything we ate here was superb and the service was fantastic! I had the blackened catfish po boy which was probably the best thing I ate in New Orleans. My friends had the oysters and the crab cakes. Both were also fantastic. The crab cakes were the real deal, not full of a bunch of fillers like you'll find at a lot of places! Give this place a try!
