Excellent. I got the redfish grill and my husband got the seafood platter. Both were delicious. Best advise. Make a reservation.

Visited Oceana Grill twice over the 4th of July weekend 2015 with family and friends. Everybody loved it. The food was fantastic. Oceana has great gumbo. Just because a restaurant in NOLA serves gumbo doesn't mean it's good. Oceana's gumbo is by far one of the best... and the service was really good and attentive. Our server was great. Her name was, Renika. We could tell she really cared about how we were doing and that the food was done right. Renika was very nice and also very helpful with our questions about the area. I was impressed and felt that she represented Oceana very well. One of the best restaurant's in the quarter.

Ducked into this place at random when I needed a break from the debauchery that is Bourbon street and was very pleasantly surprised. Since it was my first trip to NOLA, I drank the local brew Abita, and have to say this was the best meal of my trip. Redfish Oceana!! I've never had Redfish, crawfish cream sauce, or crawfish for that matter. I loved it all. The fish was very lightly breaded, loved that. But that crawfish cream sauce on top, wow, with a squirt or two of the lemon it came with and a generous shot of hot sauce, it was out of sight! I could have eaten that sauce by the bucket! So good. Since I kicked that plate's ass, I didn't have room for dessert but the people at the bar next to me insisted that I try theirs because the could only eat half. I did, from the untouched side of course, and it was delish; Bananas Foster Ice Cream cake. Double WOW!! Definitely try when you're in NOLA.

Appetizers...crabcakes good but bbq shrimp was buttery bbqy goodness. I could have drunk the sauce! The highlight was the jambalaya pasta. So much creamy  sauce balanced with the pasta shrimp and chicken. So flavorful! Fast service and fun staff.

The crab cakes are to die for. Everything else seemed over rated and commercialized. Definitely had better gumbo and etoufee at other local spots. We got in with only a 15 min wait. It is not worth the long wait some people have reported - in my opinion.
Food was okay. I expected it to be more flavorful but it was okay. Three stars were given because out waitor forgot about us several times and the prices were higher on the menu than posted online

I also was part of the 100+ group that dined here last weekend. 

The treatment by their staff was unimaginably bad. A company that delivers a sub-par (understatement) product has no reason to harass the client.  

Don't eat here, unless you want to get treated like garbage.

This was our first stop when we touched down in New Orleans. We stumbled across it when we were exploring the French Quarter, and stopped in to eat after looking at the menu. When I saw they had good reviews, AND a Yelp check-in special, we were sold. For a group of 9 people in the afternoon, we had a decent wait, but the staff was great at keeping us updated and checking in on us. 

First of all, the service here is unrivaled in the type of restaurant they are. The only place I had comparable service was at Commander's Palace, and these restaurants are not in the same style. Service like that is a requirement at a swanky establishment like Commander's Palace, but comparable service like that at Oceana was a phenomenal surprise. We even remarked that we had never been greeted so warmly and so welcoming from EVERY single staff member we encountered. 

We waited a decent amount for food, but nothing unreasonable given how busy it was and how large our party was. On to the food review!

Alligator Bites: These were great. We got a 1/2 order of the blackened and the fried and it was the best decision ever. The fried bites were crunchy with a great breading, while the blackened had a smoky, semi-spicy flavor. The dipping sauce that comes with them is wonderful as well. I would definitely order these again!

Po Boys: I was the only person at our table who did not order a Po Boy. However, everyone raved about how great they were. Luckily, my wonderful husband let me have a bite of his catfish po boy, and oh man. It was GREAT. This was my favorite Po Boy that we had all trip, and was actually my husband's favorite item the whole trip. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

Seafood Gumbo: This was a little disappointing. The crab and seafood in the gumbo was good, but the rest of it felt a little lacking in flavor. I had never had real gumbo before, however, so I am not a good judge on gumbo.

Crab Cakes: These were very good. They were the perfect size and I loved that they had little shrimps in them as well as crab. The dip was slightly spicy and a perfect pairing.

Overall, we really enjoyed the food at Oceana and were blown away by the service. We would definitely come back here if we ever travel south again.

Friendly service. Our waiter, Chad, was super nice! Short wait. Great food. Had the alligator sausage for an appetizer, BBQ shrimp entree, and shrimp po boy. All were delicious! Would come back again.

No lines when there are long lines outside other popular $$ seafood restaurants in Bourbon Street. Sit at the bar.

Service is good. Food is so so. Gumbo soup is great. Lots of crab! Lots of shrimp. Taste good too. Redfish from house special is average. Covered by lots of crawfish, which is nice. The sauce is yummy, but the fish itself is plain. Not salty or flavorful. The veggie sides are worse than expected too. The price on the menu is also higher than the price on brochure or Yelp by $6.5. Apparently they change menu during peak season. Overpriced for the quality.

Making a reservation was worth it, even at the last minute! Food was great and so was the service! My husband had the crab cake pasta and loved it, I had the praline duck and it was a big portion! Our waitress was Jessica and she stayed on top of everything!

We were staying at the St Phillip Hotel and decided to order delivery. The delivery was efficient it came before the estimated time but the shrimp po'boy was sooooo dry. How do you send a shrimp po'boy with barely any remoulade sauce on the sandwich? AND no tartar sauce on the side. I normally frequent Oceana when in the area but probably not anymore.
Great option for large portions of traditional New Orleans fare.  Family friendly, great service, and centrally located
Good fried food. Shrimp is awesome. Jalapeño poppers are amazing.  Jennifer was a great waitress.  Recommended other places to try.

First off, I tried to make a reservation here over a week before our trip and it took 3 days of leaving messages for someone to finally call me back.. Then when they called back, it was a a $200 fee to make a reservation that they said would be refunded after our dinner.  She also informed me that it was a $25 fee for every person that didn't show up.  We decided not to make a reservation and just came in early for dinner.  The service was excellent (which does not reflect their terrible phone service previously) and the food was great!  Unfortunately, we didn't order drinks so I can't make any comments about them!  I ordered the crab cake pasta.  YUM! It was a very large crab cake in the center of fettuccine and alfredo? type sauce.  The serving portions are very large and worth the cost!  In summary, don't try to make a reservation here.  Just come in a little bit earlier because the food and the service is awesome!  They have options for everyone (even if they don't like seafood or they're vegetarian).
First restaurant we tried as we waited for our rooms. Excellent redfish and amazing crab cakes and perfectly proportioned. We will be back to try other stuff on the menu

Decided on Oceana Grill after the reviews here on Yelp, so glad we did. We wanted some authentic New Orleans cuisine and I can't recommend this place enough. We started out with the Gumbo and crab cakes. Being from Maryland we know a thing or two about crab cakes and no, Oceana Grill is not claiming to compare to Maryland crab cakes but are serving them as you would expect them to being here in New Orleans. They were fried blue crab, crab cakes with crawfish and mushroom sauce. After the appetizers I ordered the red beans and rice with sausage and my wife had the shrimp creole. Both dishes were amazing, with the spicy flavor you would expect

Our waiter was Alex and after a little conversation that this was our first trip to New Orleans he guided us and explained everything on the menu. He was excellent and energetic. 

The experience at Oceana Grill was outstanding and will be back for dinner before heading home. 

Thank you Oceana Grill. .
Finally!!! Gluten free crab cakes and remoulade! Im in heaven! This was so good and I am one happy camper! Clay was a great server and we had a great experience here. Thank you so much!

First time here.  I ordered a strawberry daiquiri.  It was tasty but not much alcohol taste.  My husband ordered the catfish po' boy.  Lets just say that we received our food well after everyone who came after us.  Even the party of 6 received their food before we did.  I had gumbo soup. It was pretty good.  Not too salty and not tomato based.  It tastes like true gumbo.  Fries were frozen from a bag.  The blacken catfish was tasty even without extra sauce added.  Our server was sweet tho!
A must try I had the New Orleans sampler everything on the plate wAs so yummy! Must try Food was amazing, friendly service!!!
Excellent food, even better service. Jamal was the best server I've had in New Orleans. Definitely try the crab cakes and blackened gator bites.

Amazing good old fashion classic New Orleans feeling! Awesome old 3 story restaurant with old stairs, slanted feelings in places, painted murals all over the entire restaurant. Food was hands down the best we have had here. It is exactly what we were looking for when we headed out. We had the fried seafood platter... Omg amazing! Fried catfish was AWESOME! Fried shrimp was 2 biters and a heaping plate of food. The Oceana banana freeze was delicious, I could have had 2 more of those yumminess! A must visit for a great meal! We will definitely go back!!!
I had an awesome experience.  The food was amazing.  I really enjoyed the crab cakes and gumbo!!!

If you are a tourist that has never had creole or Cajun food in your life, you might like this place. Foodies...don't bother. Everything is fried...usually over fried, salty or smothered in sauce. The service is what you might expect from a huge, oddly laid out restaurant. I gave them a break because I am not sure I could do better if I had to run my butt off like they do from one side to the next. I ordered shrimp which was terribly over cooked. I ALWAYS order my meat and fish with sauce on the side because I want to know if I am being served spoiled meat. My husband ordered catfish...again, over cooked.

Everything about this restaurant was fantastic! From the serving staff to the blackened chicken to the oysters (my first time trying oysters!) to the crawfish, everything was absolutely amazing! Now I know why my family eats here all the time!

I definitely recommend the oysters and the Taste of New Orleans. Catfish Lafourche was also spot on!

My husband and I really enjoyed this restaurant. We came 3 times in one trip. 2 dinners and one lunch. I recommend their "famous oysters " as an appetizer.  It was my favorite. I had a few entree items, the red fish blackened was my favorite. My husband enjoyed the fried oyster plate. For dessert I liked the bread pudding. It appears modest, but trust me, it will not disappoint. My husband's favorite dessert was their version of bananas foster. 
The portions are generous, the staff is friendly, most especially, Bridget, Errol, Deja and Shahan.  If you are in the French Quarter, it is close to Bourbon Street. 
Go and enjoy. 
It is kid friendly, has a full bar, outdoor seating and serves breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Very friendly wait staff, and fast service even though this place was quite busy.

Right off bourbon street and still quite a good deal, with minimal D-bags surrounding the bar.

I would HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend the duck. And yes, I would like a softshell crab on top of that! I know they weren't in season, but it was still delicious. Blackened alligator bites were also very good. 

And in true Bourbon street fashion, get your last drink in a to-go cup.

The food was amazing! I rarely eat fish out because it is often overcooked but not this time, the fish was perfectly cooked and tasted delicious and blackened but not overly spicy. Service was excellent as well.

HIGHLY recommend!! The seafood was delicious and very fresh. My favorite was their pasta dishes and the crab cakes are a must try! I love how large the restaurant is so it is friendly for large parties!!
Busy but super Organized. Chicken Fast and food served super hot. I had the breakfast on one occasion delicious came back for the redfish.

Yep, it was good. Very good, even. Sat in a nice space upstairs. Service was friendly and attentive. Crab cakes were excellent. My catfish was cooked JUST right, and the side dishes were consistently good, if not a bit heavy on the butter for my taste (but we're in the south, so I'll deal with it.) Wife's Ahi steak portion was on the HUGE end of the scale.

No waiting, Whitney our server was AWESOME and the food was excellent. We will be back!!!!!!!!  

Def try the tropical storm drink!!!!!
The food is great! We came here twice on our week stay in New Orleans.  I loved the crab cakes!

This is one of my favorite places for brunch in the Quarter. The food is yummy. The cocktails are well crafted and great,but strong. It has great ambiance., quirky, fun and very old Big Easy. We've always had friendly, hospitable wait staff.
The portions are ample..i especially love either of the breakfast seafood crepes.
We've eaten here a dozen times and have always been well pleased.

The husband and I ate here for lunch prior to leaving NOLA. We saw the reviews on Urban Spoon and Yelp prior to going and decided to give it a chance. The husband ordered a dozen oysters on the half shell and the Oceana Famous Oysters. He wanted half just chargrilled without the cream sauce and the other half regular. He said he overheard the waiter arguing about his order with another member of the staff when he was leaving the restroom...

The oysters on the half shell were just ok; they definitely weren't as good as the ones we got from Felix Saturday evening. The oysters from Oceana were dry and somewhat tough. The Cajun Bloody Mary was pretty awesome. I ordered the Redfish Oceana as my entree, but requested to have it blackened with the etoufee sauce and the original sides (roasted potatoes and veggies; the blackened option comes with jambalaya, but it has pork in it, which we don't eat). We were quoted an additional $5 for the crawfish, which I was fine with. The husband ordered the crawfish etoufee entree. Had I known that I was only going to get one crawfish with my etoufee on my redfish, I would have just used some of the husband's. The crawfish etoufee itself was good; however, there was not enough etoufee on my fish to justify the $5 charge. Also, the veggies are bland and lacking in flavor. 

The bill came and there was an additional $7 to our bill; the waiter couldn't determine where it came from or why it was there (we understood the $5, but didn't know where the additional $2 went), so the manager ended up taking it off altogether.  Also, we realized that their menu is precisely the same as a restaurant on Bourbon (I can't remember the name, but it appears that they're owned by the same parent company, the menu prices are just slightly different).

Super yummy
Extensive menu
Ashleigh did an amazing job as our waitress
Everyone was very helpful with the menu
Try the lemondrop

Sat on 3rd floor by window, and it was a very pretty view. Got grilled oysters (:() , blackened catfish po-boy (:/) , and fried shrimp (:().

Oysters were very over seasoned, and hard to taste the actual seafood. Bread that came with it was soggy as hell.

The po-boy was actually very nice: bread was crisp and the fish was cooked well, but a little over seasoned. Seamed like fresh tomatoes and lettuce. Served with fried.

Shrimp was forgettable and ordinary. Tasted like mid-western fish, which was disappointing, since Oceana is so close to fresh fish.

Our waitress did not know different beer at all, but she was cute and charming. The entire staff was very friendly and welcoming.
I was very surprised that this place was on Kitchen Nightmares 4 years ago, as they have improved; yet, they have even more room for improvement.

They need to work on not over seasoning and train the staff more roundedly in taste description and booze (especially since this is one of the drinking capitals of USA).

Errol was our server and he was fantastic!!  My sister, brother-in-law and I enjoyed the food and atmosphere very much!  One of my best dining experiences in New Orleans and I've been there countless times over the years!!  I will definitely go back!!

Ohhh that BBQ shrimp just...I would eat it over and over. 
We also had the chargrilled oysters and the sauce is incredible.
Actually, all the sauces were incredible.
My date had the duck and I even loved that. 
I could not have been more impressed. 
They even have a cute little outdoor patio area where you can eat and smoke. 
Loved this place and not gonna lie, craving it right now and always!
My first shot at Cajun next to bourbon street - 20 minute wait for table but the beer and people watching helped.  Food good with spice and sauces that make you crave for more.
Aside from being loud the food was excellent and the service was great.

This place was good as hell!
I had the Mardi Gras Pasta, and it was delicious.
I had some of my sister's left over red beans and rice and jambalaya, and it was delicious, too.
I recommend this place!

Traveled to N.O. for the first time and I must say this restaurant did not disappoint. The food here was amazing and the service was great. No long wait time and our waiter Errol was awesome and on point with everything:)

this isn't a terrible place. it's quite big and it faces bourbon street so you can see all the festivities outside. the waitstaff was friendly enough. service was super fast, food came out quickly, and the portions are pretty big. split 2 entrees and an appetizer between three people. had the blackened catfish, not bad. the ribs were really tender. and altho the crabcake isn't what i'm used to back home in nyc, (usually crunchier/deep fried) this was surprisingly not bad. the sauce actually makes it. good job, oceana.

I just tried to order for delivery downtown, and they only take cash for delivery orders. Which is ridiculous. I work late nights and we always order dinner on the company card, so cash is not an option. I've never heard of a restaurant that would prefer you to pay when it's delivered, rather than beforehand over the phone. No where on their website does it mention this key information (there's whole section for to-go/deliver, too!).  They just lost out on a big sale.
Excellent service! Excellent food! Excellent prices!  Crab cakes & oysters were so good that we came back a second night and ended up w/ the same waiter!! Highly recommend this place!

Crab meat cakes for an appetizer were tasty.  My pasta dish (shrimp and alligator sausage) had a little gamey taste to it.  I prefered my meal at Mulate's over Oceana.  The hubbie and son prefered their Jambalaya at Oceana over Mulate's. 

We were also guided there by the concierge at Prince Conti.

I'm heading to airport soon - needed a quick bite for breakfast. Oceana is right off Bourbon St so I was wary of it being a tourist trap. It does have some telltale touristy attributes- like the big, laminated & simplified menu. I had seen the Paw Paw Cajun Poached Eggs on the on-line menu.  Of course, it was not on the simple menu. But when I asked my waitress, she was happy to get it cooked up for me. And it was really quite delicious!  It would be nice to get more than just standard coffee here - but the overall experience was quite good.  I also used the Yelp coupon and got 10% off my meal - which was also nice!

Horrible. Found ALOT of oyster shell in my po boy. They got snippy when advised. Could care less about customer sat. Don't let the line outside fool you with MANY other choices in the area. CAUTION!!!
Food was amazing and we were thanked by every single staff member on the way out. Just good people.

While visiting New Orleans for a convention, my family and I dined at Oceana Grill. We enjoyed the blackened tuna, grilled catfish and the humongous bowl of gumbo. Our server took good care of us and was helpful in making recommendations. For dessert we are having the Bourbon bread pudding and the Praline Brownie. I recommend you visit when in NOLA.

The restaurant itself was very good but I really want to recomend them because of their staff. Our waitress, her name is Storm, was fantastic! She was very informative and had a lot of inside information on what to see and what to avoid. As a waitress she was very friendly and attentive which is probably why she was also training another staff member. Make sure you see Storm for the best New Orleans site info!

As far as the food, they had the best friend shrimp, the batter was seasoned perfectly and their crab cake was amazing although I would recomend it with the sauce on the side because it was very heavy and I thought they put a tad too much but it was really delicious!

We asked our night concierge at Inn on St. Ann for a "local food" recommendation for dinner and he suggested oceana, which is where his wife works. We were not disappointed either!  Located right off Bourbon across from the Royal Sonesta hotel, it's convenient and yummy. We started off with a bbq shrimp app. if you haven't had Cajun bbq shrimp, it's different than you would expect. It's neither "skewer-grilled" nor is there "bbq sauce" involved; it's a spicy soupy liquid that the shrimp are served in. These were large gulf shrimps that had a delicious kick of flavor in my mouth. While I like spicy foods and think food is "just right" when my nose runs after eating, I don't think they were "too spicy" unless you are completely spice adverse. I followed the bbq shrimp with red beans and rice with sausage. What can I say, it was a spicy Cajun kinda day. My boyfriend had catfish. There was so much food!!!! Both meals were large enough to have split and we both left some on the plates, and rolled out of there anyway.

I only eat BBQ shrimp from here and it is wonderful. A local told me to try this place because I like BBQ shrimp. The "BBQ sauce" had a lot of Creole spices in it, just the way I like it. Take your bread and soak up all that buttery goodness when you are done murdering your shrimp. I tried duplicating this recipe at home in CA and came close but still would love to know how they make their "BBQ sauce" so pungent. Don't get me wrong there are a lot of places in NOLA that have better BBQ shrimp than Oceana but for the price, late hours of business, and location in the French Quarters it's worth stopping by.
This restaurant is great. I tried their shrimp po boys, and shrimp fettuccine Alfredo, both are amazing. And the food was fast.

The food, drinks and atmosphere is amazing!!! Our waitress Whitney was hands down the best. She was very informative, attentive, and sweet with a beautiful smile. We had the Royal and Seafood omelet with the Godlen Cadillac and Hypnotic & Hennessy Diaquri. This is a great spot to check on!!!

I love coming here when I'm in town.  I had the Red fish Lafouche tonight and it was delish!!! Garrett was our waiter...and he was awesome!!!!! Professional,  friendly,  knowledgeable, and on top of everything! Ask for Garrett!!!!
After many attempts to find a place we felt comfortable eating we stopped here. Great atmosphere and my food was great.

They only get three stars because the customer service was amazing! The food was terrible. The drinks were good and not too crazy of a price compared to everywhere else that night. The next morning showed how bad the food was....

We stopped in at the Oceana since it was close to our hotel. Everyone was super friendly. We were greeted by four people before we made it to our table, only twenty feet from the door. Our server was very helpful with recommendations on their selections. I had the cajun omelette, which was so good. 
The portions were good size for the price. I was very full after breakfast. 
I highly recommend stopping by.
Oceana grill was great! By far the best crab cake I have ever had. The bartenders Errol and Brandy were very friendly and provided great service. Next time we are in New Orleans we will be back!
Had the fried gator poboy. It was delicious and very flavorful. Instead of mayonnaise, they had a nice remoulade
Delicious food. I had the house special with the red snapper. The crab cakes were definitely a run for your money. Good food and good staff. Marvin was a great host to us.

Everything is good! Crab Cakes, Fried Shrimp, Red Beans n rice.  Drinks were awesome too.  

The service staff is excellent from the moment walk in the door. Attentive and courteous 3-5 folks taking care of us.  

Highly recommend!
Really great experience - our waiter Clay was very knowledgeable and friendly.  Good food and drinks - I would go again.

I saw the restaurant AD on LOLA tv station and had a coupon to use.
The ambiance is a tourist eat out but the service was superb by gentle giant called "Errol (Earl?)" - so easy and smooth w service and take extra good care of us, it was amazing! 
The foods! Oh it was excellent!
I had redfish, the Oceana's signature dish and my friend had Mardi Gras pasta which was delicious! I almost ate half of her meal (and my friend vise versa).
Definitely coming back for food and wonderful service!l

Terrible service and a waste of time. Waited for 25 minutes to get drinks and after 50 minutes never got food. Asked for a manager who never even came to our table. Don't  waste your time and get over priced food and TERRIBLE service this place is a tourist trap!
Manager should learn basic customer service skills!

The food was actually good! It is located off bourbon so make sure you just leave your house or hotel whenever you place your order to avoid your food being cold. If you bring a friend you can park illegal real quick to pick your food up. I didn't dine in but the takeout was really good and the price wasn't bad at all. I brought two meals for the price is $32.00 and I'm New Orleans that isn't bad. I also order at night when bourbon street is usually poppin so if you go during the day you should be fine. Anyways five stars .... would I go back ? Mmmmhhh we will see

I've been waiting on my food over 3 hours no ones called I was told 2 hrs ago it was on the way now they just don't know what has happened to my order lol clearly they're not on top of things now I get to chase after a refund
Food was excellent.  First time trying this place while visiting for the NBA All-star weekend.  Best Jambalaya I have ever tasted.

Wow! You have to have breakfast here! We always try to Oceana at least once when we visit New Orleans during Jazzfest. I always get the same thing---
Eggs Melanzana--two fried eggplant rounds topped with tomato, shaved ham, poached eggs, and tasty hollandaise sauce and parmesan.  My husband usually gets the Pain Perdu (French toast), but this time he ventured out and got the Cajun breakfast --- one alligator sausage link, one Andouille link, some of the best grits I've ever tasted, two eggs, a buttermilk biscuit, and amazing hasbrowns -- they were so tasty.  Yummmm.  Our server, Jerleen was absolutely fantastic, very attentive, described some of the breakfast options we hadn't tried yet, and got us coffees to go.  Super nice service from everyone who works there -- the chef came out and spoke with us as well.  This is a must stop for anyone wanting an authentic New Orleans breakfast!

Our first stop for an early dinner. We didn't realize how lucky we were to walk right in! Food was great--I had the "sampler platter". It was all the most well known dishes--jambalaya, red beans and rice, crawfish. Just delicious. Service was super friendly and prices were typical for the area (about $25).

There are so many choices up and down Bourbon Street and in the French Quarter.  We've been to so many resturants, but honestly most of them do not stick out.  Every menu seems the same.  Well that changed with out trip to the Ocenana.  What a nice surprise.  Our Service was fantastic and the food was really good.  Tried and highly reccomend the Blackend Red Fish topped with Crawfish Etouffee.  Excellent meal.

I next to never order fish, and if I do it is usually Salmon. My waiter was very knowlegeable and told me something I did not know, that Jambalaya is a side dish, not an entre. You learn something new everyday. He suggested that I try his favorite dish which came with Jambalaya, Redfish. I would never in a million years order Redfish, Bluefish, or any other color fish, but I decided that when in N'awlins...

It was amazing, as was the Jambalaya and the Seafood Gumbo I had as an appetizer. There was nothing about this meal that did not thrill me, and that does not happen all that often.

Oceana Grill gets my highest recommendation.
This was a best choice that we made on the trip. The seafood choices and other choices were great to try. I would definitely will be back in the future.

I ate there twice and both times had the fried eggplant.  First time was so good, as was second, but kind of greasy.  The second time made me sick all night! Turns out it was on kitchen nightmares and rated one of the worst place to eat in New Orleans.  The blonde bartender wasn't get friendly as well.  I will not be going back, ever.  The deliciousness of the eggplant isn't worth what comes after.

The food wasn't bad. My group tried the Oysters Rockerfeller, gumbo, red beans and rice entree, and the shrimp po' boy. The oysters were fantastic - plump, cheesy, and garlic-y. I ordered 12, 6 at a time, and was initially charged $21 for 2 orders of 6 at $10.50 each instead of $17.50 for a dozen. This was later changed but it took some urging from the server to reconsider. Our sever Pamela was very pushy as well as forgetful. We waited a long time just to get a waters and she put our food in so that we all got it at different times. I told her that I wasn't interested in any alcohol and she basically told me that I wanted whatever the special was and then brought it anyway. Our bill is as almost $100 and we were pretty taken aback by that. The overall experience was less than ideal and we probably won't be back.

Oh Im totally a fan all right & the crab cakes here are as good as they get! Lets just say, I havent been to NOLA since 2009 & have been searching all over CA some comparable crab cakes. Sadly, I have not found anything that comes anywhere close to the heaven I had the sheer pleasure of dining on at Oceana Grill. That meal left such an impact on me, Im still talking about it to this day (3 yrs later mind you!!) & let me tell you - I can not WAIT to take my son P to NOLA - ya, for the history, ya for the great sites & sounds & smells (eek!) - but really - JUST so he can finally get somma these crab cakes!
Wondering if they'll ship um out here to me?!?!? :)
If I recall correctly, the service was ok... the ambiance was nice both inside & out... but really - its all about the food. This is a must stop - SKIP Emerils & go straight to Oceanas!
Great service, amazing food, bananas fosters cake is the best :) will definitely come back!

I had breakfast there today.  Ordered the Country Breakfast (eggs, bacon, hashbrowns, grits, biscuit) and the Pain Perdue (upscale french toast).  It was all very good, and I really enjoyed it.  It is an informal place, with a happy air.  My only complaint would be that it took a while for the food to come, but it was pretty busy so it was not outrageously long.

Had our first meal in NOLA here on St Patrick's Day. This was one of the few options which stays open late, we were seated at 11:40pm. We were seated at a two top by the window with a lovely view of garbage, and later a guy peeing on the garbage. There were several large groups and open tables on the other side but they sat us there. At that point we were starving and didn't care. Kind of glad we sat there because our server was great. Ronaldo? Forgot his name. We were baffled when he was explaining the specials - can't recall exactly what the items were but it was basically: an entree with another entree and a side of this and topped with an appetizer... On one dish. Something you'd put together at home in full fatty mode. Seemed super promising at that point! So we ordered the fried seafood platter, crab cakes, and jambalaya / stew combo plate. The food came out very fast. The red beans and rice were delicious - the smokiness and flavor were on point. Texture was perfect, not watery and full bodied. Best red beans and rice we had. The jambalaya and etoufee were decent but nothing spectacular. The crab cakes were cooked right but had a lot of filler and was slightly fishy. The fried seafood platter was poorly executed. Very uneven cooking, the shrimps were cold and soggy, the oysters were hot and good, the fish was half soggy and half crispy, and the hush puppies were decent and warm. The star of this dish were the French fries - crispy, hot, and so good. 

Would come here again only for the red beans and fries.

This place was fantastic! Don't be discouraged by the line outside the door, it moves fast (as do most in NOLA). First, their drinks were fantastic and quite a show. I got the spiked lemonade and it came with dry ice bubbling up from the bottom. It also tasted delicious - the perfect blend of alcohol, sweet, and tart. For my meal I got the catfish topped with fried shrimp and it was incredible! The catfish was soft and flaky, the shrimp was coated with the perfect fry batter. The sauce was so good i almost licked it off the plate! The service was great to boot. If you want home-made New Orleans cuisine conveniently located right off Bourbon street, you gotta visit!
As a tourist and oyster lover, we really enjoyed this place. Excellent food, service and atmosphere. I'd recommend it to anybody looking a good meal.

We loved Oceana Grill, it had good creole food & American food for the kids in our group that only eat American. I am gluten free & they had creole gluten free which blew my socks off. Our one year old kept moon lighting behind the bar upstairs & the bartender was so kind and funny with her. Jackie our waitress handled our 12 too like a champ & the ladies at the hostess stand were awesome too!

I had lunch here and I was pleased with my meal. I had the crab cake sandwich and it was very good. I ordered the sauce on the side because I am never sure what I will get and it was excellent. The atmosphere was loud but overall it was good for the price and had a large menu. I had problems finding a place where I could get a meal or sandwich that was not fried. This hit the spot the crabcake was not at all greasy  My friend had the catfish po-boy and she liked it,especially the french bread it was served on. The court yard looked nice however it was a little hot so we sat inside. I would go back.
The food was really good and tasty and the service was excellent. Highly recommend even if you don't have a reservation they got us in within a half hour

I dream about the redfish special! Me and hubs had eaten lunch not much earlier, but my siblings surprised me for my birthday and met me in town. They were hungry and the concierge to us to go to Oceana. So we came to Oceana. We walked right in and got a table. I wasn't really hungry, but hey--when you're in NOLA you eat. I ordered the special and figured I would just nibble. I honestly wasn't expecting it to be so good! I couldn't take more than a couple bites, but it was sooooo gooood that I can't stop thinking about it! I need a re-do!

The flavor of everything was tremendous but the oysters weren't cooked very well. They were a rubbery and I actually had to put all of them in napkins bc I couldn't chew them all the way.  But again the flavor was tremendous.

The crab cakes really are the best we've tasted, we also loved the Oysters Rockefeller. We ate here twice on our trip and both times were very tasty. They also have a great staff. We tried the gator, crawfish tails and shrimp too. Everything delicious.
We went here for lunch and the service was a little slow but nothing seriously upsetting. The food was good.

Place is extremely over priced. I got a refill on my coke and the waiter brought me someone else's drink. The drink had a hand squeezed lemon when my original drink hand no lemon. I'm pretty sure another patron drank after me. A waiter didn't wash his hands after using the restroom as well.

We rolled in about midnight to get refueled.

We each had a bowl of Gumbo, Abita Amber, and the Bananas Foster Ice Cream Cake for desert. With Christmas Ale. 

Service was attentive and prompt. The food was solidly good but not great.

Hi, the food was good only the portions were small. I was surprised because up until today every was large enough to share except here . The potatoes were good but barely half a cup as well was the vegetables . I said to the waiter oh you forgot the potatoes. He said they are in the same little bowl as the vegetables. The desserts were very small and I will not be returning to the Oceania . There are too many other good choices.

The only complaint I have is that they ask if you would like more coffee and coke, and you say yes, thinking they're free refills.  I got our check with just the coffee and coke on the tab, and the server said the check was wrong.  He came back with a new check with all the additional beverage charges for the refills.  He refilled the coffee from the carafe and did not bring a fresh cup of coffee...just warmed the coffee!!!  So don't expect refills for free here!

I have never written a review on Yelp before, but I truly feel the need to share the situation that happened during my first (and last) experience with this established. This incident was extremely outraging. It was just before 8 PM (on a Wednesday) when my friend and I called to place an order for delivery. While our hotel was less than a ten minute walk away, we were packing for our return home and did not wish to leave our hotel room. We called, placed our order, and were told it would take about 30-45 minutes. 

After about an hour, our order still had not arrived. It was then that we decided to call back and check the status of our delivery. My friend called back and was told that the order was on its way, and it would be there any minute. Being that it was the day after Mardi Gras, I was understanding that they were probably busy and service was a little slower than usual (I assumed). 

Another half an hour passed by and I decided to call back myself. Again, I was told that they were very busy but it was on it's way and should arrive soon. 

Finally, after yet another thirty minutes, my friend got a call from the restaurant. They informed her that the manager said that they do not deliver "that far away" and that he did not realize we were on the other side of Canal Street. It was apparent then that our order was never prepared, it was never sent out for delivery, and no one even bothered to check it's status during the two phone calls we made.

The moral of this story is, if you are placing an order for delivery, be sure to ask in advance to ensure that they will deliver to your hotel or address in which you are staying. Unfortunately for us, we had to wait two hours for them to realize their mistake. It was absolutely unprofessional behavior from an establishment in such a touristy area. I was appalled at how little they seemed to care that they left us waiting until 10 PM at night, after we called back TWICE. They clearly did not check to make sure our order was out, since we took the initiative to make sure it had been placed. Instead properly answering our questions during the calls, they decided to be lazy and just assume that the order was placed and was being delivered. I obviously cannot comment on the quality of the food or the in-house service, but I can say this: I will never set foot in this establishment. I cannot believe the lack of customer service that their employees, including their manager, exhibited during the whole situation. I am absolutely shocked that they made no offering for their mistake nor did they really seem to care that they had kept us waiting for two hours.
Best bread pudding. Tried all the french quarter spots plus a few out of town cafes. Hands down the best.

My friends and I ate here while we were in town for Mardi Gras. I had the St. James Crepe and it was good and filling! The service was great! 5-star service! Pamela was our waitress and we loved her - so sweet and very helpful!

It's a hidden gem of the city, at lest it was for me.  Delicious Southern/Creole food served by courteous and professional staff.  Prices are very reasonable and the food came out quickly.  We ordered Oceana's Famous Oysters, Redfish Oceana, Cajun Jambalaya Pasta, Blackened Bayou Duck, and Kentucky Bourbon Pecan Pie.  All was delicious however the redfish needed a little more salt.  I would definitely eat there again.

Charbroiled oysters don't compare to Acme's or Drago's. If you're looking for those stick to who you know best. Fried eggplant was good. Alligator and sausage with shrimp creole fettuccini was bangin!

Our first night on Bourbon Street and we decided to go to Oceana. We took in as much as we could to experience the main staples of NOLA. What drew us to this place was the long line of people that continued to grow outside; although the wait was less than 10 minutes.
Top left is the gumbo, bottom left is the Taste of New Orleans which included creole jambalaya, crawfish etouffée, red beans and rice and smoked sausage. Last, on the right, is their famous chargrilled oysters smothered with a zesty garlic and cream herb cajun sauce. My wife didn't like the oysters, but I did. The sauce was amazingly delicious and worth trying. 
My rating for them is a 4 because the table had crumbs on it and the silverware was filthy and had dried food on it. The waiter was excellent and quickly replaced our silverware, he was attentive, upbeat and professional. 
A must try location.

HOLY GOD!!  This place is so delicious!!!! The host suggested we get anything "blackened" and the Louisiana crab cakes.  And so we did!!!  I got the blackened catfish on top of a bed of fettuccine and it was love after that.  The fish was so fresh and savory, the fettuccine sauce was so creamy and decadent, I nearly lost myself!    My brother got the blackened chicken on fettuccine and loved it too!  My mom said she never had any better crab cakes!  
The service was fantastic, from getting into line, to our sever!  Thank you so much for a fabulous dinner!  I hope I'll be back soon!

My hotel lobby recommended this place and I was overall satisfied.  It's an absolute must that you sit in the courtyard in the back.  It's unbelievable.  I got to sat there with my friend by ourselves because nobody wanted to be outside in the cold.  It was perfectly pleasant.  Those people were fools.  We really felt like it was a classic New Orleans experience.  The food was good too.  I tried the Cajun alligator sausage and shrimp pasta.  It was okay.  I think it's more of a gimmick than anything.  I actually ended up eating more of my friend's Cajun alfredo pasta.  The thing I learned here is that if you're going to have a Cajun pasta, the creme-based pastas are a lot better in my opinion than the tomato-based pastas.  The creme-based pasta was also spicy and the alligator pasta wasn't.  I'm definitely a fan of the cajun alfredo but wouldn't really recommend the alligator and shrimp pasta.
Friendliest people ever! Every employee that passed by us greeted/welcomed us and made us feel special. The food was so good and I'm glad I found this place.

I should have written a review a long time ago.  Oceana is one of my favorite places in the Quarter.  Whether you are with a group of people or just want to catch a quick bite at the bar they are always willing to accommodate you.  The portions are HUGE.  Staff has always been very upbeat and ready to take care of you.  Keep doing what you're doing because you're doing it right.
Had such a good time with my daughters eating some amazing food.  We had the Jambalaya, blackened chicken Cesar Salad, and a fish dish.  So very good.  It was worth the wait.

This place is incredible! I've only been in New Orleans for about an hour and this place has already made the 7 hour drive more than worth it! The crab cake appetizer was out of this world. We also LOVED the bread pudding. You know a restaurant is good when you look at the menu at the end of the meal just to pre plan what you're going to eat when you come back tomorrow! Ben was also a great addition to our experience. Very helpful waiter!
get the crab cakes! although i found out i'm allergic to craw fish because of this visit, i can tell you the taste of those crab cakes were worth it!!!

Best lunch value in the FQ....

Try the Blackened Smoked Duck ($19.00 for a huge 1/2 duck portion), it comes with a generous portion of jambalaya and veggies too.  

The french bread was just OK, but you will get so much on your plate --- you won't bother to eat the bread anyway!

We came back a SECOND TIME to try the seafood options, my wife had the Seafood Platter ($17) and she got a heaping plate of oysters, shrimp and catfish.  She said the shrimp was the best she's ever tried, and she has been all over the world! There was also a heap of "hush puppies" and french fries on this platter.   

I had the Blackened Redfish ($14) and was not disappointed --- a huge piece of fish accompanied by the aforementioned platter of jambalaya and vegetables.

My suggestion?  Eat a late lunch here (between 2:30 and 3:30 pm) and then you can skip dinner, because you will be so full!

Highly recommended.

This place was delicious! We were initially greeted by the kindest wait staff and all of the staff made sure we felt welcome at our entire visit. I ordered the biscuits as my appetizer and they tasted fresh and light. Just the right size to split them in two, each lump was the size of a biscuit. The crawfish on top was an added touch. I ordered the cajun jambalaya pasta, if anyone likes Cajun and can't do spicy this is the perfect dish because it has a mild spicy flavor. On my plate there was plenty of shrimp and unfortunately a little light on the gator sausage but I found it to still be good. I will definitely return!

Came to NOLA for a mini vacation and stopped to eat at Oceana Grill to say the food was delicious and our server Ezra was Awesome. He was attentive, friendly and gave us great tips on where to go sightseeing.

This place was amazing! Must try the crab cakes, simply delish. Great customer service as well. Yelp would not let me alter the date, but I was at Oceana earlier this month. Will definitely return when in the NO again.

The reason I am giving this restaurant 4 stars instead of 3 is because our server, Kathleen was great. She was knowledgeable, kind. And very helpful. The food however was the problem. I had to send 2 things back because they were cold. That is one of my biggest pet peeves in a restaurant. All I want Is my food right, and hot. I had the crab cakes and also redfish etouffee. They were both good after getting them heated.

Pamela took excellent care of us here this has been our best dining experience with wait staff in New Orleans we came back for a second time during our stay.  We will make this one of our regular stops on our yearly honeymoons in the future.  Thank you for your hospitality Pamela!

Came here on a recommendation and loved everything had their famous oysters and Cajun jambalaya soooo good. Our waiter Whitney was so nice and friendly and gave us great recommendations for food. We were also seated and served fast despite the long line.

Lovely premises and friendly, attentive staff. But, my word, the food is spectacularly bad. We had gumbo, crab cakes and the ahi tuna. Everything tasted like it came from frozen, all were lukewarm in the middle. I kept expecting Gordon Ramsey to come out and make a scene. But, hey, when you've got a queue on a low-key Tuesday night then why bother, right?

Heard from a friend who'd visited recently that Oceana Grill had excellent food.  Checked out reviews and all very insistent that the food is first rate; all of it.  The crab cake appetizers were raved about in reviews so we tried them; OMG...  I've never eaten a crab cake with their crawfish sauce with that much crab and perfect seasoning in my life.  Two large crab cakes, perfectly crispy on the outside and just plain perfect inside and out.  My husband had the Blackened Redfish Lafourche; for some reason, not on the menu (just ask for it) crawfish mushroom sauce with fried crawfish on top!  My husband saw the dish on The Food Network and knew he had to have it, it was perfectly blackened, not burnt and amazing seasoning there as well.  I had the perfectly sautéed Oceana Redfish with that amazing crawfish mushroom cream sauce and plenty of fresh crawfish tails on top.  If you are afraid of crawfish, just push them to the side and eat everything else, nothing to be afraid of unless you don't at least eat everything else on your plate.  My husband and I are from/live in New Orleans and we've had dishes like the ones described above and we both are positive we've never had anything THAT good in our lives!  
Our server was Cole and he was one of the best waiters we had ever encountered; so much so that I asked to meet his boss to tell how awesome Cole is.  His manager, Tammy, is incredible as well!  
Between the over the top food and service, don't wait to get there; don't be afraid if you see a line!  It moves amazingly fast and it is well worth the wait; trust us, worth every minute and every penny for every bite.  Get there as soon as you can and be prepared to look forward to going back again and again; I know we will!

We ate here about 4 times on our week long trip to New Orleans. We ate at the restaurant twice and got delivery twice. The food is reasonably priced for the area and consistently good. I loved the Jazzy Crabcake Platter, and the Redfish Oceana the most. They both come with a very unique mushroom/crawfish sauce that is lovely and not too salty. Highly recommended, good menu for multiple tastes.

Went to Oceana Grill with friends and had a blast!! The food was awesome! Oysters, Redfish, shrimp everything was excellent. The restaurant was fun the waiter was attentive and very professional. I'll be going back the next time I visit New Orleans.

This was our first stop as we entered the french quarter from our hotel. We were greeted very kindly and seated right away. It was a saturday so also nice to see some college football!

I had the Shrimp Fried platter and it was just what i expected. No regrets.

Similar to Deannies, which is also a good seafood spot in NOLA.

Best place ever. Came here for the first time and fell in love. Then my husband came on business, only restaurant he would come to. Just everything is delicious, fresh, amazing. Best crab cakes ever!!!

This was the first spot my wife and I went to getting to NO, and I must say we did not make a mistake at all. We had the catfish poboy and the seafood gumbo. Very delicious and authentic. My wife kept rambling about it. We ended up going back the next night and got the poboys again. 

Great stuff!

I asked our hotel doorman where he goes for seafood because I didn't want the usual NOLA answer... he suggested Oceania Grill.

Food was good. No complaints, I would go again, but it was not amazingly good. Also, for our table of 4, everyone's entrees came out first, my sides came out, then 5 minutes later our appetizers came out  and the 5 minutes later my entire came out. WOW, that's never happened anywhere before... server apologized and said he made a mistake keying our order into the computer. He was very nice and we liked him.

I can see us going back again, but I think I would also consider exploring other options.
Local recommended and it did not disappoint! Crab cakes were deliciously creamy. Service was amazing!

My first time to Oceana Grill was over Labor Day weekend in 2006. I have been anxious to get back ever since and finally made it back this year. This time I was there for a late breakfast.

I ordered the Maw Maw's Cajun breakfast and I could not have been more satisfied. It is bits of bacon and shrimp scrambled with eggs and served over rice. It comes with a biscuit.

Part of the reason I ordered it was because it had bacon. I must admit, I didn't taste any bacon, but it may have just been overpowered by all the other incredible, deep flavors. The shrimp were perfectly cooked and the rice was absolutely fantastic. My biscuit was not overly impressive, but I hadn't ordered the dish for the biscuit.

The portion was very generous and my biggest disappointment with my breakfast was that I wasn't able to finish it.

I also enjoyed a couple of bloody marys and they were fantastic as well.

I will definitely return to Oceana Grill on my next visit to New Orleans. The service and the ambiance were spectacular.

This was an unmemorable meal. Gator bites were good - gumbo did nothing for me but make me think maybe I don't like gumbo. It seems like a polished tourist place - a bubba gump for Nola. I won't return.

If they invite you to sit at the bar, do it! You'll meet all sorts of awesome travelers and staff. Highly recommend Jai, he's fantastic. We had the oysters rock and jambalaya pasta which was to die for!!

Stumbled upon this place as it "spoke to me".  We had a wonderful meal at the bar.  Great bartender gave us really helpful tips about the city we were new to.  We had shrimp po boy and gumbo.  Both were great.  Nice courtyard too.

Brad is the waiter that you would want to have. He is really helpful in decidin what to order, he also provided us many recommendations on places to go around New Orleans. We are from out of town and this is our first stop after arriving, thanks to Brad For being so helpful

This was a great experience everything you think a 4th quarter restaurant should have and look like this is it! The drinks were amazing they have the dry ice which makes it look like smoke is coming from your drink that was a great touch. The fried sample was absolutely delicious enough to share between two people. Long line but a short wait
BBQ shrimp and alligator. YUM. I had a hard time sharing.

Went here with my wife and two small kids. We got the fried alligator as an app. Really chewy and not pleasant. The Bahama Mama was very weak and forgettable. I had the crawfish eteouffe and she had the gumbo. Both were fine but neither were great. In fact her gumbo was luke warm. The atmosphere and staff were nice. I'd not go back with so many other choices around.

This is one of our favorite restaurants, The oysters are amazing, great gumbo and love the atmosphere.  There always seems to be a line out the door to eat here as well, luckily it goes fast and is so worth it.

My friend and our daughters were just wandering around New Orleans and we needed a place to eat. We just decided to just sit down for some seafood. I WOULD recommend this place to people looking for a good place to eat. The service was great and food was just delicious. The blackened catfish was very good and the oysters were amazing. As well as the seafood gumbo. I recommend TIARA as a waitress. She was great and a delight to talk too.

Two vegetarians at a seafood restaurant. We ordered the two different versions of the vegetarian pasta, the spicy marinara and the Alfredo. Very friendly, attentive service. Prompt seating, meals and drink orders taken quickly and delivered with a smile. Clean environment. Pasta was okay, the atmosphere and service elevated the taste of the meal.

Came in for lunch, and had to come back for dinner. The gumbo was good, but the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta was amazing!

Read a few reviewers complaining about the service and well, they are right. The service was not great but the food was amazing and worth putting up with the not so great service

Everything we had was delicious! Grilled oysters were amazing as an appetizer! I got the tuna which was topped with BBQ shrimp and served with mashed potatoes and mustard greens, every bite was delicious! Husband got the bayou duck and it was one of the best things we tasted in New Orleans! We added a side of fried eggplant to our dinner order and were so glad we did, it was a couple dollars cheaper than the fried eggplant app and really delicious. Our waitress Taylor was attentive and kind, we highly recommend this restaurant!

It's hard to go wrong in New Orleans! We enjoyed the festive atmosphere and good food. Service was positive. Food good... and good in New Orleans is better than "great" in most places! This location is near the famous and chaotic Bourbon St. Great location for lunch or dinner, but unless you plan on partying (especially Thursday's and Fridays) I'd plan on lunch. It gets loud and surrounded by various levels of inebriated people around 2-3pm; progressively becoming more and more "party."

Let me tell you! The food is so excellent here I am planing our next visit! This food is slap yo mama good! If you come to New Orleans and don't visit, you have missed out on a scrumptious experience! My husband had the redfish with a side of red beans and rice and a house salad. I had a catfish Po boy with a side of red beans and rice as well.. Both meals were very good! We finished our meal off with bread pudding. The bread pudding was better than my grandma's y'all.. so good we literally were scraping the plate! Our waiter Marlon gave us recommendations and was very attentive!

Thank God we have to walk back to the hotel to walk off this delicious food!

Let's just start off by saying that my boyfriend and I left Oceana Grill super satisfied! The service was fast, precise and pleasant. Our waiter was very attentive and the food was out almost immediately. We skipped on appetizers and ordered drinks. The Swamp Tea, Bahama Mama and Root Beer did not disappoint. We could taste the liquor, which is a big plus considering some restaurants fail to provide good cocktails. For dinner, my boyfriend ordered the Fried Seafood Platter with a side of cole slaw and collard greens. I ordered the "Knife and Fork" B.B.Q ribs with the same sides. Our food was hot and delicious!! The collard greens were soooo yummy, the ribs were deliciously saucy and the seafood platter came with dipping sauces that were out of this world! For dessert, we ordered the La Boheme Creme Brule and Chocolate Kahlua Mousse. Everything tasted great! 

We were then handed the check along with a survey/questionnaire card that my boyfriend filled out. He had some ideas for their sauces! The food was great and I am pleased with their services. This restaurant is nothing like Red Lobster or Joes Crab Shack. Those restaurants lack flavor, portions and quality in their food. Oceana provides 100% deliciousness! 

I would give them five stars but the table napkins were dirty and that's a big no-no.

I had the shrimp platter the first time. Great batter on the shrimp and a seemingly never ending portion. Slaw - great. Fries - crispy. Try a Nola Blonde beer to wash it down. But what brought me back was the red beans and rice! Really to die for!!

Wooooooooooooow

When people told me nwlins is known for food this was the place they were talking about 

First time having gator - OH EM GEE
blackened & fried both PERFECT

first time having jambalya
Got the cajun jambalya pasta - HUBA HUBA
I have never tasted anything like it, i had to take a moment bc how did i live all these years without it lmao.

Sn: my bf is allergic to seafood & everything not seafood has crawfiah sauce, or they cant substitute the shrimp in others. He still loved the gator and alfredo tho
Food was awesome! We ordered for delivery to our hotel. It took them an hour and a half, which they tell you. However, they didn't deliver some parts of our order which sucked. Otherwise, good food.
The Jazzy crab cakes was one of a kind, but wasn't fulfilling. The oysters were small too..

This place was amazing! Fun atmosphere but the food was even better. Everyone's dish was delicious. 
Steak!  Taste of New Orleans (jambalaya) ! Seafood Platter was fried and delicious! The best part were these oysters. Our waiter was able to do half and half of their best oysters! Highly recommend. Wish i would have taken more pictures.
Had an amazing lunch of crab cakes, shrimp and blackened oysters. Everything was amazing, delicious, and timely!! Thank you to Whitney for being an wonderful server!

Great casual dining! 
Laid back atmosphere with delicious seafood.  Went with a group of 8 on a holiday weekend and only waited about 20 minutes.
Food: 
1. Chargrilled oysters both Rockafeller and Parmesan cream (house special) were delicious.  Definitely heavy with all the cream but sooo good we got a 2nd order.  
2. Crab cakes are a must. Lots of luscious crab without much filler and the crawfish sauce on top was divine.
3. Fried Seafood platter - if you've never had fried oysters this is the place to get it.  The batter is perfectly crispy with just the right amount of spice. 
I didn't order and entree because my focus was on the oysters and fried foods but my friends that did said that everything was equally delicious.
Bottom line: if you was good Cajun seafood that's reasonably priced with a casual atmosphere this is it.
The food was just okay. I think we both got snapper topped with something. The toppings were barely there and everything needed salt.

This place is everything! Great service, friendly and smiling faces, and AMAZING FOOD! I can not stress to you how good the food was! Huge portions so you can share and it's reasonably priced! Will definitely be back!
Great blackened ribeye and husband bragged on the blackened redfish.  Sides were flavorful as well.  Next trip we will come back! PS:  Jessica is a fantastic waitress.

Great alligator appetizer!!! Drinks are amazing, I recommend getting the to go cup! Each person in our party ordered something different and it was all amazing! Staff was very friendly and accommodating.
Amazing place to eat. Garrett was a great server! I would come back for sure. Short wait great food and the staff is amazing!

Located right near Bourbon. Only had to wait a few minutes and the experience was excellent. Our server was super quick, helpful and nice. I ordered a Dixie beer and the catfish platter. My meal was $21 and the platter was huge. Food was amazing. Definitely stop by.

I actually ended up going here because all of the places I had wanted to go had super long waits. After eating here I am so glad that my original plan and backup plan fell through!

The crab cakes were divine and for some unknown reason the alfredo was the best I've ever had.

I remember getting a lot of bang for my buck, feeling very full upon leaving.

We had great service and the decor/atmosphere was fun but not too kitschy.

I will definitely come back here when I make it back to New Orleans
I don't think I would recommend a friend. Food taste average. Cocktails are very diluted. Low alcohol content. Overall disappointing .

Long lines, but not sure it's worth the hype. Deanies had better gumbo and etouffee. The banana foster was very...supermarket. The crab cake I can see people liking, but was just very sauce-slathered and heavy.

We were advised by a local to try this place out while we were in NOLA. 

Me and my fiancé went here for breakfast and sat outside in the lil courtyard. It was nice! My fiancé just got the country breakfast which was like a regular breakfast entree. I got an omelet with Tasso ham, cheese, mushrooms, peppers, onions and it was SUPER GOOD!! It came with hash browns which were really good and different. I guess it was like a different texture. Not crispy and not soggy either. I have never had Tasso ham before and it made the omelet taste so freakin good. If I ever go back to NOLA I will definitely stop by here again.
Jamal was amazing he made sure that all our needs were met being that we are newbies to new Orleans. The food at Oceana was delicious I wasn't let down. Must go

We came here for lunch yesterday and breakfast today. The lunch yesterday was very good. I ordered the crab cakes and the sauce definitely complemented the cakes. But.....this places breakfast is OUT OF THIS WORLD. My boyfriend and I decided to try 2 different things: the vegetarian eggs (without mushrooms) and the French toast. Let me tell you, everything was phenomenal. Just try it, I can't describe it.

Good but not great...especially in comparison to the surrounding restaurants in town. We did enjoy the window view but we had to request it after being sat in an a sea of empty tables which seemed to annoy the hostess (it was even before the dinner rush on a Thursday). Good was average, but the building was lovely.

We had the trio and it was great! The staff is incredible and luckily the wait time wasn't too bad! The restaurant is freezing because the staff is running around like crazy and probably dying of heat stoke pleasing their customers, so no matter how hot it is outside I suggest bringing a light sweater or jacket
Crab cakes were amazing! The hurricane was good. The taste of New Orleans was also yummy! Would recommend this to others

Great food, even better service. Rod did a great job of breaking down the menu for us and made some great suggestions. Crab cakes and gator tails got us ready for the Taste of Luisiana. The creme bruille was amazing. Not to sweet, perfect way to finish our meal
This place was good. Errol our service was great though! I only tried the gumbo and gator tails. Gumbo was good not amazing but the gator tails were really yummy!

The service was awesome. Very friendly and inviting. I had the St. Francis crepe. IT'S HUGE!  I still haven't had anything in these New Orleans restaurants that have been mind-blowing, but I'll keep searching!

OH MY GOODNESS

I just want to thank my mom for giving birth to me just because it blessed me with the chance to eat at this place. 
Seriously, so good. My husband and I went to another restaurant first and the service was terrible (luckily) so we stumbled (literally) upon this place. The guy handed menus to us at the door was nice so I said "thank you" and he said "after you eat here you'll be thanking me again" and he was so right.
I got the chicken Alfredo and had them make it blackened chicken and I got a double hurricane to drink ($15 for the double) my husband got the catfish platter and a double blood marry.
The chicken alfredo was honestly the best food I've ever had in my life. You know when food is so good that you have audible sighs of pleasure with every bite? Yeah, that was both of us. Our table was almost rated R. 
With our meals, and two $15 drinks our total was $76. Well worth it.
Oh and we went on a Saturday the weekend before actual Mardi Gras at about 7. No wait and our food was there in probably 10 minutes. Wow.

I tried Oceana for the first time a couple of weeks ago when my parents were in town.  This was the choice because everyone was hungry, but no one had the energy to walk somewhere to get dinner.  

My complaint about this place is the prices.  We ordered 3 po boys and 1 red beans and rice with sausage and it came it a little over $60.  

With that price why would I ever give this place 4 stars?  Frankly the food was good.  My parents both chose blackened meats which they loved the taste of.  This was especially important because my dad has high cholesterol and was trying not to eat fried food which we know is a tall order in NOLA.  My red beans was very flavorful, and there was enough for me to eat for two days.  Best of all, it was delivered strait to their hotel room so everyone was happy, full and comfortable at the end of the night.

Our last night in the Quarter, and we should have been walking Bourbon Street, but we just didn't feel like it so we ordered out.  We got the name of this place from the desk, and thought we'd give it a try.  

I do not know if they are always this fast, but on this night, they were really fast.  It seemed like less than 15 minutes from the time we placed our order until they were knocking at the door.  The food, itself, was pretty good, too. 

We loved the vegetarian section of the menu, and ordered the Spinach Ravioli at $15.50, and the Cajun Vegetarian Stew a $13.00.  We also ordered one, Caesar Salad for $5.50  Everything was pretty good, but not great.  

You can get the Ravioli in your choice of Alfredo Sauce, Marinara, or Oceana Cream Sauce.  We opted for the marinara, but it was unlike any marinara we ever had.  It wasn't really red.  It was more like a red/brown gravy.  Nonetheless, the flavor was good, as was the texture and flavor of the raviolis.  

The gravy for the Cajun Vegetarian Stew looked very similar to the marinara for the ravioli, but the taste was very different.  I actually like the stew better than the ravioli.  It was pretty much the way it was described in the menu, as was the Caesar Salad.  

Of the three, the salad was the best value.  The portion sizes on the entrees seemed a bit small for the price.  The salad was about right, and about what we've come to expect.  

If I had to do it all over again, I would order from this place.  There is a great variety on the menu, and the speed of delivery was amazing.  If you just don't feel like going out, this is a good option, and it really was worth it to us to pay a little extra.  Speaking of paying extra, there is a small delivery charge, but we were not charged that.  We did tip the delivery person, but not at the same rate we would tip a waiter or waitress.
Tough and overcooked gator. Over breaded crabcakes but crawfish sauce was good. Softshell crabs were good. BBQ shrimp was regular. The raw oysters were some of the best Ive ever had.

I saw this place on yelp and from the reviews, I thought I could find my mum some authentic good (and unhealthy) creole/cajun food. I was happy to see they also had a few vegetarian options which is rare for a city like New Orleans. So I couldn't get a reservation beforehand but we didn't have to wait that long (we got there at 6:30 and waited for around 15 minutes).

The vibe inside is really great and relaxed. Our waiter was very accommodating and understanding of my "dietary restrictions". He recommended the cajun veggie stew for me without butter or cheese. Since my mum's a huge seafood lover, she got two types of oysters as an appetizer and the catfish special with blackened catfish, fried crawfish and jambalaya rice. My stew also came with rice and was really rich and delicious. I loved that it was spicy too. My mum said her oysters were especially good and the catfish was done really nicely too. I just wish my slice of bread was toasted instead of really soft and flimsy.

I love this place. The staff is super friendly especially the great amazing bar tenders. They went over the menu with me and the food came very quickly. I even came back 2 nights later. This is the best place to stop and eat when you're on bourbon street. Meagan L took care of me and Chantay was amazing and helpful the next night I came. I love this place

This place was on Kitchen Nightmares but we didn't have any nightmares.. the staff were very friendly, the food was really good. Reasonable prices(poboys $11-15) and big portions! It was extremely cold in the restaurant that's why the lack of the fifth star.
This place was pretty good! Didn't have to wait too long on New Year's Eve for dinner which was great. We tried the gator which was surprisingly good. Catfish was alright.

Big portions! Ordered the catfish with mashed potatos and collard greens.omg, it was a huge portion! Definitely order this if you are looking to cut the carbs and watch the calories. I could only eat half the plate and i eat alot. Bf ordered the fried catfish. Hes a big football player size and he couldnt finish his plate, either. 
Saved room for the bread pudding and the pecan pie which were both sweet as hell and small.

Excellent service and delicious meals. They definitely pour a good drink, as well. This was the only place we visited twice on our trip. During our time is there we enjoy the crabcakes,, seafood platter, and share the chocolate mousse cake. Everything was absolutely amazing!

The Oceana came highly recommended from the hotel staff and did not disappoint. We started our meal with some tasty char broiled oysters covered in sauce and cheese. We then shared a shrimp platter, a bowl of gumbo and a piece of pecan pie.  Excellent all around.  Our server, Brad, was attentive and contributed to the quality of our dining experience.

I went here today. Minimal wait time. We ordered the Crabcake appetizer, Jambalaya pasta and Mardi gras pasta. The crabcake was a disappointment but the two pastas were good. They honestly tasted similar so you can pick either or.

It was our first time in New Orleans and we got off the plane and we were starving! So we walked down Bourbon Street until we came upon this wonderful place. There were maybe 8 people ahead of us in line, but we only waited 10 minutes at the most. All staff were very friendly!

We had the gator bites - half fried, half blackened. They were pretty good! I personally liked the fried ones over the blackened ones, though. We had a couple of adult beverages which were pretty strong. And, as with probably anywhere in NOLA, you can get them in a to-go cup and finish it on the street.

I had a bowl of gumbo, which had lots of shrimp and even half a crab! Not spicy at all and came with two slices of bread. But, this is where I fell in love with crawfish étouffée! My husband had the NO sampler, which had red beans/rice/sausage, crawfish étouffée, and jambalaya. All were very delicious but the étouffée won, hands down. So freaking good that I immediately Yelped Cajun/Creole restaurants back home so that I can have some when we get back!

I heard this was the place to eat.  We were there with a large group and the food was good, the service on top of their game and the ambiance decent enough too.  That being said there was no "wow" factor for me.  It was my first time eating fried gator and that was an experience as was the redfish I ate but nothing stands out.  For dessert I had chocolate mousse of some kind with no complaints but again, nothing to rave over either.  Perhaps I was expecting too much after everything I had heard prior.  Either way it was good food, not great.
Great atmosphere, food an servers. Grits were the best I've ever had, light fluffy and creamy. Our server Bridget was fantastic.
Superb service and amazing food. Highly recommend. The raw oysters were super fresh and the shrimp and catfish platter was straight awesome. We will be going back before we end this trip.

This restaurant is great the waiters are so friendly which is absolutely a plus. Love the southern hospitality in the south it always amazes me. Anyway, I ended up getting the shrimp fettuccine which was sooooooooo good. This restaurant is a must try. The prices are sort of reasonable

we just had the BEST experience! we're staying at a hotel so we ordered our food on yelp to be delivered. the food arrived sooner than the estimated time. everything came perfect, they took extra care to wrap up the pasta and a cup of iced tea so it didn't spill. the guy who delivered came into our room, unpacked everything, and laid it all out for us. he was so awesome and it was obvious that he took a lot of pride in his job. now for the food.. seriously amazing!!! fried alligator bites, crab cake pasta, shrimp poboy, and even my son's cheeseburger were all so freaking good. we will definitely be returning customers.

Out in New Orleans for the first time for my wife's family reunion, walking through bourbon street, we saw a long line for this restaurant and decided to visit the next day.
If you are looking for true authentic New Orleans cooking, look no more, the food was OUTSTANDING and our experience was even better thanks to our awesome server Errol! He was truly amazing and very knowledgeable about all the food and everything he recommended exceeded our expectations. My family are in town for two more days and we will be going back before we leave, must go to restaurant in New Orleans!!!

Brought some out of town friends here for their last night in town. They wanted to go to bourbon street and have a few Hand Grenades after they had a local meal. Oceana got bonus points for being open late. Everything we had was good. Steak, crab cakes, shrimp creole, chargrilled oysters , and mixed drinks. I've had better chargrilled oysters but not complaining. And our server was great too!

I give this place three stars because it took a long time to get our food and even to just place our order. 
The food was yummy, the service polite.
Amazing food! Great service!!! Thanks Errol, you are great!! We will definitely be back!
The fried seafood platter was HUGE! Good location and good prices. I'm giving it a four star to the wait time was overdue.

Best grilled oysters on the planet!!!! I just had lunch there with my girlfriend. I lived in NOLA during gradschool more years ago than I care to remember or admit and I've heard of Oceana Grill but this was my 1st visit. We went there looking for blackened alligator  (my g.f. is from N.Y. and wanted to have some while we were in town and Oceana Grill was listed as one of the 10 best places for alligator in NOLA when I did a Google search.) We ordered the blackened alligator appetizer with extra remoulade and that certainly lived up to our expectations. Blackened alligator has always been my favorite preparation and theirs was tender and extremely flavorful. Just what we were looking for.  I also love oysters in just about any preparation and decided to order their Oceana Grill oysters because I didn't get to make it to the Oyster Festival this past weekend. Now, I have had grilled oysters from Drago's and Acme and a number of other places and until today Acme was always my favorite. But the cream sauce they put on theirs at Oceana blew us away!!! These are hands-down the best grilled oysters I have ever had. The oysters themselves had a delightful smokiness aside from the rich cream sauce that they slathered on top.
