The addition of the cream to the sauce thickens it and helps it to stay on the oyster instead of running all over the plate and they serve the oysters with plastic sporks so that you can make sure to get all the goodness out of the shell without having to embarrass yourself and your date by licking the shell right there at the table :-) but rest assured that had they not served the oysters with those much-needed sporks I would have gladly licked every square inch of those shells to get every drop of that delicious sauce. ;-) The wait staff was great, the runner that brought our food had a delightful personality and the management was also warm, friendly and attentive to everyone's needs. This is the best of what I remember about living in New Orleans and the people that make up this wonderful City. Give Oceana Grill a try if you haven't already or hurry back if you have. You won't be disappointed.

I really really really like this place! It's touristy yes but it's the best touristy place on bourbon street! Or right off...

Beers are your standard ones, Bloody Mary strong, very prompt fast seating and service. Jamie greatest us right away and got us started with drinks and apps. Great recommendations, the shrimp was the best, gator pretty good but the sauce great!

Jaime was amazing, she took my dietary restrictions to account and gave me the toast duck, no backening and sos. So I knew it would be a tad bland but no it was great!!! I got the sautéed crawfish plain, yes!!! So good! She even took the colored greens back to get me broccoli, very sweet' 

I'll be recommending this to all my friends, when they travel here! Thank you

Everyone at Oceana made us feel so welcome when we arrived for dinner. We walked right in, were escorted to our table upstairs. We arrived around 5:30 pm on a Wednesday and had no wait. The waiter was at our table quickly and we needed more time to look at the drink menu. We settled on beers but the tables around us that ordered cocktails had a dry ice smoke coming off of them. Pretty cool! We split an order of Crab cakes for appetizer. They were large, fresh, and the sauce was amazing. I ordered a half order of oysters and a Greek salad for my entree, my husband ordered the grilled ahi tuna, and we were both very pleased with our meal! I wished we had room for dessert!!

TOURIST TRAP ALERT! Shit expensive for not that much food. Lowkey the photos look like a lot but it's hard for me to justify $20+ for pasta with not that much crawfish lol 

A local warned us and gave us some great ideas but we were struggling on what to get so we stuck with it 

The food is good 

Ribs are actually pretty great-- but if you don't mess up the ribs, they all ribs are pretty great! If you want to share get the full rack it turns out a little cheaper 

Atmosphere is kitschy quirky which makes it all work

It's a cool vibe but you can def skip it on the must see places and just go to a place with more food and less expensive
Excellent food and service. A great atmosphere and one of the most friendliest places I have come across. My waitress Pamela was funny and charismatic.

Six words: Pricey entrees, two crabcakes in appetizer

This restaurant came recommended by the front desk at the hotel I was staying at. While I don't exactly regret going here, it wasn't exactly what I wanted. The food is on the more expensive side, but it's off of Bourbon Street so I guess they can charge a premium. We had to wait outside the restaurant for a little before being able to go in. At first we thought the restaurant was mostly empty, but it turns out this restaurant is multi-levels and takes up most of the block. 

When we were finally seated we decided to order an appetizer. We went for the crab cakes. They were good but there were only 2 crab cakes for $14. They were large but I was expecting more of them for the price. But we enjoyed them, so I can't complain too much. 

For my entree, I ended up with the Redfish Oceana - their signature dish. Sauteed redfish topped with crawfish mushroom cream sauce served with roasted garlic potatoes and sauteed vegetables. It was really good but at $20, I found it less than exemplary. My friends went with the Blackened Bayou Duck and the Blackened Catfish. I found those entrees much more flavorful and delicious. 

Overall, it was an okay restaurant. It wasn't some place I'm dying to go back to but it's a good meal.
This place is amazing. Best ribs. Australian BBQ sauce tasting, banging scenery. Definitely the spot for mad eats.

We didn't know what to eat for breakfast and a couple recommended Oceana. I am glad we bumped into them. It was delish.  I had the crawfish omelette.  So good! My sister had the seafood omelette.  She didn't leave anything leftover either. My other sister had the St. James Crepe. It was HUGE and delish also. Coffee was great too. Food was pricey but thats nothing new for the french quarter. Definitely recommend this place. Jerleen, our waitress, was friendly and gave us great service.

The food & price is not worth the wait. I can understand waiting in line for 20 minutes, but waiting at your table just to get water and to order your food for over an hour when it's not even busy and a Tuesday night. The tables next to us got their water the minute they sit down when we had already been waiting for 45 minutes before asking a manager. Never again. Don't waste your money.

The food and service were both okay. I ordered the blackened catfish poboy. At first it looked burnt but it turned out to be very salty. The waiter was friendly and prompt. Overall it is a decent restaurant.

we've been to a few place in New Orleans and tried Oceana after we needed seating for ten and didn't get too town till late, after all our other trusted favorites were closed.  so glad we picked Oceana. the servers were all great and very friendly, food was very good and the oyster Rockefeller were best we've had! ( I could eat that sauce over the top with toasted bread for days!!)

we'll certainly return!  atmosphere was great and less crowded seating than many. Would love to just come sit at the bar as well for a appetizer and oysters! 

a must try!!
Delicious blackened redfish & fried catfish poboy! Add some fried crawfish tails too! The appetizer oysters were really good too!

Perhaps the food is good if they ever delivered. After 2.5 hours, no luck. Go in person, maybe you'll have better luck, but avoid them for delivery.

Edit: delivery arrived 3 hours after order. Food was refused.
This place was amazing, Gordan Ramsay sure as hell mustve turned this place around. I had the Crawfish Fettucini and it was phenomenal.

Food was great service was ok. We ordered 2 appetizers and only one came out. After we had been served our meal waiter came around with 2nd app and when we told him we no longer wanted it he had somewhat of an attitude. Ha jokes on him that action cost him on his tip. I hope he remembers a bad attitude will get you 5%.

This was the first restaurant we went to when we arrived! We noticed that it wasn't super crowded, but we didn't pay any mind because it was raining pretty heavily. Our waiter was very attentive and nice. He recommended certain dishes and delivered that famous "Southern Hospitality." We got a half order of oysters, and I got Shrimp Creole. The Oysters were very good, but I could taste that fishy taste after a while. The Shrimp Creole was pretty good, but very simple. I also had a Rajun Cajun Bloody Mary, which was great. Everything, overall, was very pleasant....until I got food poisoning. I was up all night at the hospital and let's just say that I couldn't really eat any other seafood the rest of my visit. That was one of the grossest nights ever! I would skip this place if you have a sensitive stomach.

This is probably the worse place in town... Me and a friend were flying from Boston to have fun in New Orleans, our first foodie stop was at Oceana Grill because we heard good things about it.. I ordered as an appetizer the Gator tail bites which was great as well as our waitress who was really attentive.. For our main courses, I ordered the Catfish platter which was okay; nothing special.. My friend ordered the Vegetarian pasta and it was extremely greasy.. But the worst part is coming! She had food poisoning.. We spend our day at the hotel because of how sick she got. What a way to start my vacations. I don't recommend this restaurant AT ALL!
Great food & great service. Errol was wonderful. The staff was really very friendly. The po boys were awesome!

Coming from the Pacific time zone does crazy things to your inner food clock... Spouse and I walked out of our FQ hotel at noon ravenous  for BREAKFAST.  Something with eggs and refillable cups of good coffee.  Not that easy to find in the Quarter at noon!     Happened to stroll by Oceana,, checked out their posted menu, and took a chance.  Very glad we did.

Pluses (this is for breakfast, remember) --

Serves breakfast menu until 1 p.m,
Excellent chicory coffee in big mugs
Friendly and efficient staff
Lots of customers, but not noisy
Wonderful seafood omelets brimming with huge, juicy shrimp, very tasty, 
   even better with an added sprinkle of Louisiana hot sauce
Great biscuit and good fried potatoes with the omelets

Minuses -- 

None major.  We had to ask for butter for the biscuits and when it came, it was in 
     those teeny plastic containers  that are impossible to open.  Places that do this
      always make me wonder:  is providing a decent size serving of condiments 
      so hard?  Ditto with the jelly packet, BTW.  A tub of butter and a jar of good jam,
      I'd have given a fifth star.

I am in New Orleans on business. My first night I ordered the Sampler for delivery and enjoyed it so much I ordered again the second night. The meal arrived and ticket was right - Crawfish Etouffe with a side of Soft Shell Crab. When I unpacked the food I found a container of Gumbo with a cold Fried Seafood Dinner. I am allergic to Oysters and the dinner delivered had plenty of those. The restaurant refused to either replace the delivery with what I ordered or to refund my money. When the situation was explained to GrubHub they processed a refund. So my experience is fifty fifty with a great meal the first night and cold fried food that did not order the second. Mistakes happen - I understand that, but when one does I expect the restaurant to fix their error. Thankfully GrubHub has great customer support and I was taken care of when the management of Oceana Grill was unwilling to fix their own mistake. A picture is attached of what I received and of my ticket- obviously two very different items.

I took my husband to New Orleans for his bday weekend and Oceana was our first restaurant we went to for dinner. The food was amazing !!! We had the raw oysters and gumbo for starters, my husband had the red fish etoufee and I AJ's the crab cake dinner ...  he still can't stop talking about how good the food was. "Kim"our waitress was amazing !!! Ask for her if you ever goto Oceana

The line for this place is generally really really long BUT to my surprise they DELIVER yes DELIVER to anywhere in the French Quarter...

The food: I ordered the pancake breakfast with sausage and a side of fresh strawberries and hash browns. The pancakes are huge and nice and a fluffy. There really is enough to share between 2 people. The sausage is mediocre BUT THOSE HASH BROWNS BABY..... those are theeeeeee best! made with bell pepper and onion and some kinda fabulous seasoning mmmmm mmmmm mmmmm.

The service: our Server was fantastic. She gave us tips of what to order and how to put certain items together. (some of us ordered omelets and lunch items). She was patient and checked on us regularly. Really everyone there was very polite and helpful.

The ambiance: Typical restaurant feel. Nothing special or extra fancy about the inside. But all looks well kept and clean.

Pricing: very fair on the pricing, I think my whole breakfast came to around $15.
Service was friendly and quick. Food was amazing!! We had bbq shrimp, redfish, and catfish with etouffe. All excellent.

Nice place, nice food and good service. The only problem was when the bill came and we realized the prices on the bill and the menu were different! Almost everything on the bill were at least $1-$3 more expensive than showed on the menu. We asked our server and she said the prices were automated by the computer and that maybe we were given a wrong version of the menu. However, she did tell the manager about it and our bill was reduced to the prices shown on the menu. So lesson learned, check your bill before you pay it!

I am giving oceana 3 stars because the food just wasn't that great.  The crab cakes were hard and had too much breading.  The barbq shrimp were bleh.  And the chargrilled oysters have wayyyyy too much sauce on them.  My wife ordered a drink and didn't get it until the end of our meal.

I love this place. The Food was amazing!!!  The hubby and I had the crab cakes!! Yummy in my tummy!! We also had the pasta. Brad was an excellent server and everyone who worked there had a smile on their faces. I will be back!!!

I don't know why this place has such raving reviews.... The food was lukewarm like it was just waiting in the back to be ordered. The taste wasn't spectacular and the platters left much to be desired. The only & I mean ONLY reason I didn't complain is because I have had a few friends who worked there and the servers get fired over bad comment cards... So I left and excellent comment card because my server , Errol, he was great & very attentive. He's the only reason they got any stars from me.!
Great food with a nice atmosphere. Our waitress was very friendly and happily answered our touristy questions about the food.
Oceana refused to seat a party of one, so I will never try their food.  Instead, I went next door to the Copper Monkey where I was warmly welcomed and had a delicious shrimp po'boy!
Food was amazing. We had about a 30-45 min wait for a table but totally worth it for sure! If we ever go back we will def eat here !!

Last time I was in NOLA, we stayed on Conti right near Oceana Grill.  

I am a strong believer in taking restaurant recommendations from Taxi drivers because it has never failed me.  My driver suggested Oceana for breakfast, so according to "Maggie's Dogma" we went to Oceana for breakfast!  

I ordered their Pain Perdu (northerner speak: French toast) and it was absolutely amazing. Not only was it made with French bread but they obviously cooked it on the same skillet as everything else.  This made it especially yummy because I got little traces of onion, sausage, and bacon on the French toast that gave the sweet breakfast another dimension.  In addition, the batter they used was flavorful enough that I didn't use any syrup on it.

My friend had the biscuits and gravy, which looked good to me regardless of the fact that I don't like gravy.  It had big chunks of sausage in the gravy instead of just being made from the fat of the sausage. 

Overall I would go back for breakfast, I cannot attest to any other meal.  But breakfast was uncommonly good.

Flew in, checked into hotel and this was the first stop. This may be considered the TGIF's of the French Quarter but wasn't bad for our first NOLA experience. Yeah, yeah... the locals may bash this spot saying everything comes from Sysco restaurant supplies but oh well. At least they know how to execute. Food came out hot and we easily cleaned our plates as good foodies do! Drinks weren't all that special so I'd stick to beer to avoid the measured pours... plenty of other heavy handed bartenders in the French Quarter.

We ate at Oceana yesterday for lunch on our way home from NOLA. This restaurant is located right off of Bourbon street and has the feel of a tourist trap, selling local favorites like gumbo, po-boys, and blackened catfish dishes. 

Although the place is touristy, I cannot speak highly enough about how friendly the staff was. From the start the hostess was attentive and friendly, as were the bus boys, and our waiter Errol. Errol was great, he promptly and in great detail told us about the menu and the daily specials. He also gave us all 10% off our meal thanks to the Yelp check in deal. Also, the restaurant was extremely clean as were the restrooms. 

As stated above the service was great, but the food was only average. I was served a decent shrimp po boy, but being in New Orleans, the foodie capital of the South, I was not super impressed. This was the same for the rest of my group, they ordered the gumbo, and crawfish etouffe, which was good, not great. Also, the meals were pretty expensive, but I'm sure it's mostly due to its bourbon street location.
Meh.  Just ok in my book.  Roast beef sandwich was weak.  But that's as much my fault for ordering that at a seafood joint.

My family and I were on our way to Florida. We stop in New Orleans "Oceana" for lunch. Our server was Errol. He was Great!!!!  (Side note my father in law had recently passed away he was a huge Barry White fan and would often sing to my mother in law). Long story short Errol sang a Barry White song to us... Made my wife Cry. It was a Great Time. He was Great!!  Oh By the way the Food was Really Really Good!!!!!  I recommend everyone when in New Orleans stop in and get lunch and a song!!!!  Thanks Errol!!!
Best po-boys in town!  We loved the fries as well!  Blackened catfish was the bomb!  My son had shrimp fettuccine and he devoured it!!
Amazing food!  Great if you want a taste of NO.  Recommend coming here on your next trip! Maw maw platter is the way to go for breakfast if your hungry.
Ok oysters (both Rockefeller and fresh). Service somewhat slow. Ambiance nice outside. Very nice jambalaya pasta. Bread pudding was great.

Enjoyed this late spot.  Nice food, great service.  Oysters were very filling, but not my fav in NO.  Crabcake was ok.
Service was good and prices were ok.
Actually a 3.5 star to be precise!

FOOD WAS AWESOME!!! Everyone in our party couldn't stop raving about how delicious each dish was. The service was excellent too! Def a must visit when you're looking for a great traditional NOLA meal! Also had a good selection for the vegetarian in your group!

I was in town for a conference and Oceana Grill was recommended to me from a former patron.  It was awesome!   I immediately knew we were at the lunch spot when the locals were in there grabbing lunch.  Our server, CJ was the best and was super helpful with the menu choices and was very polite!  I had the blackened chicken po boy and it was awesome!  I will be back from a second one!

The wait can get crazy be prepared. Service was just average. Our waitress took forever to come around and the food took just as long. 
Oysters Rockefeller were great and the gumbo was delicious! Their smothered fries were ok.

This was our first time in New Orleans and we came to this restaurant after we read the good reviews.. the food was amazing, the atmosphere was nice and our server Ashley was very friendly and courteous..

Be prepared to wait in line for this place. There is great Sea Food and great variety of other dishes for those that do not do Sea Food.  Great atmosphere and this is a family friendly restaurant.  Food is excellent, service is great and the restaurant is centrally located.

A large group of friends came here one night after an event at school.  It was almost 12 midnight and we needed a place to eat downtown, and Oceana was pretty much the only place still open and serving food on a Thursday night.  We came and they were able to accomodate a group of 20 very quickly!  I have to say I was impressed.  We were seated and greeted promptly by our server.  I was a little iffy coming here, since I've been here one time before and didn't have that great of an experience, but that night, everything was great!

I ordered the jamabalaya pasta with alligator sausage and shrimp, and my boyfriend had the alligator po-boy.  My pasta was great!  The sausage was tender and the sauce was flavorful.  There were several other people who ordered it at my table and they too enjoyed the dish.  No, it's not the best food in New Orleans, but for a place that opens so late, it's pretty darn delightful!  Hahaha.  I didn't get a bite of my boyfriend's po-boy, but he said he really good, so I'll take his word for it.  For dessert we got the bread pudding and the bananas foster ice cream cake.  Both were decadent and yummy, but definitely NOT the outstanding.

The service was excellent for accomodating a group of 20 and fairly quick too!  Maybe they just wanted to go home?  Possibly.  And the location is convenient, since it's right off of Bourbon.  I really wanted to give this place a 3.5 but decided to round up because it opens til 1AM!

This place is absolutely amazing! By the far the best restaurant I have been to NOLA being my first time here! My husband got the cat fish platter which was such a big portion! Sooo good! I got the red fish meal was delicous!! Cajun fries were YUMMY! Service was superb. Love love this restaurant. Please reserve to avoid long wait though.
Really good food and fast service.  The alligator sausage was my favorite followed by the red fish.  Our waiter Ponce was very helpful.

Are you gluten-free? They have a vegetarian and gluten- free menu here. I had the redfish with potatoes and greens. Delicious! Atmosphere, knowledge and friendliness of waitstaff are sure to sway your decision in favor of Oceana. I'll come back.
Casual spot but everything we are was seriously finger licking good! Charbroiled Oysters and Shrimp PoBoy were nothing less than amazing!!

I end up eating at this restaurant 4 times when I visited new orleans , every time the food was delicious my only complaint no snow crab legs ! but awesome place the employees our all welcoming and wonderful service! just one front door hostess was kind of rude, un welcoming other than that it was great . ps I thought she was having a bad day but the next day I visited it was just her true attitude !

Wow. Just wow. What a disappointment. Came to Oceana because it had such great reviews. Arrived, waited outside in line... Felt like, this means it's amazing, people wait in line outside. Wrong. Server was lifeless, full and slow as molasses. I ordered an absolut White Russian (that's actually what it's called in their menu) & he says, "it's made with Stoli". Wtf. Then we ordered fried alligator bites and the breading was greasy and soggy. I had chicken fettuccine and it was only ok. Husband had fried shrimp and again, just ok. As soon as for was left for us we ordered 2 beers. I swear it took 20+ mins and a reminder from me before we got them. Not even in a glass... How hard was it to open 2 beer bottles? Decided we'd try the bread pudding.. Again, sooooo long. After seriously 15 mins he came by and told us it would be another 5. Are they making them to order? Finally arrived, dropped on table and left us with one fork left over from dinner. He knew we were sharing. Waited, waited. Finally asked another server for spoons, she left to find them. Our server then finally comes back and when we tell him we're waiting on spoons he says, we don't have any. No sorry, no nothing. Brought our bill and just set it down with "here ya go". No "thank you". No "hope you enjoyed it". Nothing. Will not go back here and will not recommend it to others.

This place has great, bustling vibes. The bar is great to grab a drink at while you wait. The food is absolutely DELECTABLE. I highly recommend the blackened alligator and the oceans snapper. If you want to be put to sleep, the Cajun fries are heavy and tasty with a hint of seafood. I will be back ASAP!

Blackened alligator appetizer was amazing. I do not like blackened anything ever but these tasted almost more BBQ than blackened. I got the crab cakes which were good, but spicier than I would've liked (I'm a spice wuss). However, the mashed potatoes were incredible. It seems like a weird thing to hone in on at a creole restaurant, but do not pass on the mashed potatoes.
Came here for lunch over spring break. Po'boys were good and restaurant was lively. Server was very helpful and friendly as this was our first food experience in NOLA. Likely to be a line..
Second time here. This time we split the seafood platter added crawfish. All was quite good.

Amazing crawfish etouffee and poboys at this spot! People are generally very friendly in New Orleans, and the waiters here offered us tips on nightlife, etc. The line was out the door, but the wait was still fairly quick. While the atmosphere is a bit kitschy, the food and service were great.
Good place for seafood in NOLA. We had fried seafood platter and it was huge. We also had oceana famous grilled oysters which were splendid.

This was our first meal in N. O. We were hungry and it served its purpose. The crab cake platter had too much filler, but it was good. The potatoes were tasty but the side order of zucchini was a bit cold. 

Decent service, but I know it only gets better from here.

Some of the best food we have ever had in NOLA

Try the Alligator bites and the catfish lafouche

Meh. I expected this place to be a tourist trap but hoped for better. 
The service was fine and the menu had plenty of options, that being said, the food was just ok. 
I ordered the redfish oceana, the signature dish. When it was at my table in less than 5 minutes I knew it was heat and eat food. It wasn't terrible but not especially great considering it's the specialty of the house. 
No need for me to return for dinner although a quick sandwich at lunch would likely be ok.
I never put a review on YELP ! 5 stars on all levels . Long story short: best food  and service I had in years hands down.
Went here for New Year's Eve. The charbrioled oysters were fabulous. Very busy, however we had great service. Definitely a must when in the Big Easy!
Huge place- casual, family-friendly. Great service. We all had po boys are were not disappointed. Did not have to wait post-Saints game.
Great food with excellent service from Errol!!!!!!! Would absolutely recommend!!!! Had the lafouche that was ammmmaaaaaazzzing!!!!! Great service that makes you feel at home!
Overpriced and mediocre food, especially compared to other options in the area (namely Royal House). Pros: decent service & opens late.

Got the bayou duck, skin was moist and meat tender. Sauce was primo. The crawfish tails weren't what I expected due to the fact that it was fried. We also got the fried fish platter, which was catfish, hush puppies, shrimp, oysters and fries. Best thing about the place was their bread pudding desert and brown sauce on the duck! Great eats! Oh oyster we're huge!

Went there for dinner last night. The line was all the way out on the street but once inside there were several empty tables.
My son and I sat at the bar. The bartender was a very courteous lady, very helpful. We started with fried and blackened crawfish, which were nice.
For the main course my son had the special fish with a parmesan garlic sauce, which he said was good. I had the New Orleans tasting platter, a little taste of several local dishes. It was also good, but nothing to brag about.
Nice place, good ambience. A little on the touristy side, but well worth the visit.

Decent food, but weird servers. The po-boys were enormous, but were only served with 2 packets of mayonnaise on the side. Where are the tartar and cocktail sauces????? The crawfish etoufee was really good. 

The one thing that stood out were the servers. They were kind of strange, at least the night I went there. One lady at a table next to us was a vegetarian and they screwed up her order and added alligator sausage into her mixed veggies. She seemed as though she was going to die after the server told her that he had inadvertently forgot to give the kitchen instructions on her order..... Our server also seemed to be like the pizza delivery guy/disabled professor from "There's Something About Mary". All in all, a decent meal, but strange going-on's around us with the servers.

Having come back to N.O. and returned to Oceana (there is no way you're going to walk-in to a foodie quality restaurant at 7:30 on a Sunday in the French Quarter, so Oceana it is...) , I can verify that the food is really just average.  It is a New Orleans-themed Joe's Crab Shack or Olive Garden.  There's nothing bad, just nothing worth four stars.

The Oysters Oceana is good, but what's not good with cream and garlic and cheese on top?  The bread that is served with it was stale and there were only two small pieces -- not enough to enjoy that buttery, creamy, cheesy garlic sauce.

The oyster Po' Boy was only OK.  Still in 4 years, they haven't corrected their roll problems.  The hot oysters are dumped on a roll of undetermined age that has not been warmed or toasted.  There is virtually no dressing (a little onion, tomato and shredded lettuce or a spicy mayo maybe !!??) and it's a boring little sandwich.

The Redfish Oceana, is likewise, just fine.  I didn't appreciate that it wasn't hot when it was served.  Just barely better than warm. The fish was cooked OK, a little more done than a truly skilled chef would allow.  The greens were fine and the mashed potatoes were...again, hard to screw up mashed potatoes. 

It's a decent place to get food that is unobjectionable but you really haven't eaten New Orleans.

Okay so for starters the crab cakes should not be passed up, having lived in Maryland, I can tell you that they rival the best car cakes in the states.  The sauce is amazing!  My husband had the Turtle Soup and almost licked the bowl.  Finally the Blackened Shrimp is the superb.  Ahhhh!  The ambience is pleasant, servers are knowledgable and helpful.  There are bars both upstairs and down and TVs tuned to sports while jazz plays.  A great NOLA meal.

This was our first time here. Jessica L was our server and she was great! She had great recommendations, very knowledgeable, and the food was delicious! The oceana oysters were amazing and so were the raw oysters! Two thumbs up for the blackened alligator bites, gumbo, and red beans and rice!

If I could give this place zero stars, I would. I've been coming here for years but tonight took the cake. We ordered 2 Sazeracs, 2 seafood gumbos and a seafood platter to share. After waiting in line more than an hour, the gumbo arrived almost 20 minutes after we sat down and both of ours had issues. Hubs had a spoon with caked on rice and mine had "water" on it that rolled into the gumbo. No ma'am. 

They sent a replacement after a manager stopped by but our ice cold fried platter showed up. It had zero seasoning and lacked that Cajun flair. We sent it back and left after the manager vowed it would take 2 minutes for a replacement. Yeah right. You see how long our soups took. This was the worst experience I've had in 15 years of dining in NOLA and I'll never return. They wasted 2 hours of my Saturday night. 

Go at your own risk.

The desk clerk at the Royal Sonesta, across Conti Street from Oceana, recommended it as a good place for breakfast.  

We weren't disappointed.  The food was outstanding, the service very good and the prices reasonable.

From the street it looks like the proverbial "hole in the wall," but it's anything but that.  In a city of outstanding, notorious restaurants, it is a largely undiscovered gem.

Try it - you'll be pleasantly surprised.

This was a fun place to go.  It has 5 floors to eat on, only 3 were active floors.  For appetizers we had 1/2 dozen raw,  3 Rockefeller, 3 parmesan.  The parmesan and Rockefeller were just ok, we expected better. We also had the alligator sausage... It was ok.  My hubby enjoyed a nice blackened fish po' boi.  His food was delicious, soft and flaky. I had a mix of jambalaya & etoufee. My food was ok, nothing big to brag about but the size.It was way better than My kids liked their food. The server was awesome but clearly overworked.

The delivery was scheduled about 2 hours in advance, yet it was about 30 minutes late. No problem, though. Delivery driver was apologetic. Food was decent, but I think there's better alternatives given the food-rich area. The fettuccini Alfredo w/chicken was tasty, along with the barbecue shrimp.

The only good things about this place are the bartenders and the crawfish cream sauce. I came for brunch and waited an hour and fifteen minutes on a omelette. The oysters are a greasy slop bomb and the shrimp was almost rotten. The hash browns were still frozen when we got them. The ONLY reason I gave this place a star that it doesn't deserve is because of the hospitality of my bartender Josh R. Do yourself a favor and go to the Ruby Slipper.
First stop in New Orleans. Food is oh so amazing! Go and eat some good food with great service and some good tunes.

I have been all over the City of New Orleans, came to the Oceana Grill and experienced the best gumball I've tried so far. David our server went above and beyond had a humble spirit and was pleasant. The food is well priced the flavor is delicious and I can now say that I'm not disappointed in the food in New Orleans.

Delicious experience! Went here for my birthday dinner and got just what I expected. A true Cajun restaurant that doesn't skimp on the seasonings. I ate so fast I forgot to take a picture, but ordered the redfish (blackened) that came with etouffee, collards, and jambalaya on the side. Also ordered a Hurricane. It was AMAZING!! Line was out the door so make reservations ahead! Seating is also beautiful in the courtyard area...very romantic.

The Crab Cakes topped with Crawfish was the highlight to me. Everything else was just typical overpriced & just OK to me. My nephew loved his Root Beer Float, but nothing else truly stood out for the French Quarter prices. The wait was ridiculous but it was Spring Break week and there was pretty much a line for every Restaurant in the Quarter & I had hungry kids to feed.

The best crabcakes I've eva had!! My first experience with crawfish and I wasnt disappointed. I also had catfish and I loved it.  We had a party of 10 and the customer service was very polite and helpful. Each one of us enjoyed our meals without a doubt. We had everything from their corn and tomatoe dish, shrimp larger than life, fried eggplant, alligator po boy, catfish and the immaculate crab cakes each full of flavor and left us with bellies too full to even think of their great looking desserts. If you ever visit. GO and enjoy some good ole dirty south seafood!!!!

NOT AUTHENTIC-NOT THE PLACE TO GET INTRODUCED TO CREOLE OR CAJUN FOOD -NOT LOCALS - THE OWNERS ARE NOT CREOLE OR CAJUN AND they do NOT represent OUR culture. FAKE

If I could give this place 1/2 a star, that would be the score. I am born and raised in New Orleans and although this PLACE has been around a long time, the OWNERS are not the original family who has owned it since it started but they never say that they continue to pretend they are the real deal.  I do not know where the current owners were born but I do know it was not in New Orleans or even in the United States.  

Creole and Cajun food are DIFFERENT cultures with different food and different languages and different music to those who don't know that. It would be like throwing Mexican and Spanish all together in one pot.  OR throwing Chinese and Japanese together in one pot. 

I think the two brothers who are NOW the owners are riding on the history of the ADDRESS of the building in the French Quarter and the tourists do not know the  the history of the actual food being served because there are so few Creoles or Cajuns who have a say in the matter.  

People don't know that they are eating something Gordon Ramsey (who has no historical reference for OUR Creole or Cajun food, because he's a Brit with a TV show) approximates as culturally "about right" food. BLAH! 

At least the place got cleaned up and maybe the food is edible but please don't ever call it Creole OR Cajun, it's neither.

We stopped in for a quick lunch. I had the red beans and rice; very yummy but not sure worth the $16. My husband liked his burger. The Bahama Mama I had was very good. Our waiter Marlon was nice and attentive:) Cool place inside I really just took off stars because of prices.
Our server, Pamela, was awesome! She made excellent suggestions, was enthusiastic about serving us and made sure we were satisfied with our  order. I highly recommend.
Decent food- Service was great but food didn't taste fresh. Came out too fast to be prepared to order. Plus it was lukewarm.

Horrible service, we waited outside to get in the restaurant which didn't take to long ;however,  once we got in the restaurant we waited for our Oysters which took at least 30 min and when they came about would you believe they were LUKEWARM!!! When we tried to resolve the issue we encountered two managers who seemed to be utterly unable to handle our problem or any problem at all for that matter. We decided to cancel our order after a tug of war of useless emotions from the restaurant staff. We were very disappointed and hungry leaving this restaurant especially because it has such good review.

We ordered our food through the Yelp app that was fulfilled by GrubHub. The delivery time was one hour which is not bad for the weekend. We had four orders. Catfish Platter, shrimp platter with crawfish tails, Caesar salad with chicken and a deluxe burger.  Everything was still pretty warm when we got it so we can give kudos there. Now let's get to the negatives: the catfish platter, the catfish was not seasoned and smelled like tuna. The Caesar salad had the croutons on the bottom so they were soggy from the sweating during transport with the other food. The burger was not seasoned and it was dry. When we called the restaurant they told us that we had to contact GrubHub. GrubHub hung up on us when we first called then on the second call they called the restaurant and they only refunded the salad. The worst part is that the majority of the food went unconsumed. We even offered to send pics to show we hadn't eaten the food. The shrimp wasn't bad at all though. The crawfish tails were seasoned but didn't taste all that well. I'm disappointed with the outcome of everything so I can say I'd never patronize this establishment in the future.
I have food allergies, they took them seriously and helped me pick out the only thing on the menu I could eat. Seriously good red beans and rice.

There are a number of negative reviews floating around for this place, but I can say that those reviewers' comments are contrary to my experiences at Oceana for the better part of a decade. 

I've had dinner there a few times, but that was some time ago - I don't feel that I can comment accurately. But Oceana's purchase of Petunia's crepe recipes are what keep me coming back every visit. I was impressed once Oceana started serving these at how precisely they resembled Petunia's. It's truly a must-stop for me on every visit to New Orleans. (But be warned - they are served during breakfast/brunch only!)

I've also had nothing but great service here, be it at the bar, or seated elsewhere. Friendly, attentive staff at every visit.

Avoid at all costs. 

I showed up and put in a simple to-go order at 11PM (Vegetarian Cajun Stew and a side of Coleslaw). I sat there at the bar for a long time waiting for my order. At some point I looked up and saw a bag at the end of the counter, but I figured it couldn't be mine or the server would have told me, given that I was there *right in front of him*, so I sat there another 20 minutes waiting. Finally a different staff person asked why I was there, I explained, and it turned the bag was my order and had been sitting there getting cold. I got back to my hotel around midnight, and discovered the food was *absolutely awful*. The "Cajun" stew was basically cold, flavorless tomato soup with shredded zucchini in it, served with soggy unseasoned rice with all the flavor and texture of boil-a-bag Uncle Ben's from the supermarket (just guessing, as I would never intentionally eat garbage food like that), and the coleslaw was a few shreds of cabbage swimming in a tub of mayo. Zero spices in any of it. Truly an embarrassment to the entire concept of Cajun food. I'm not sure if I've ever been more disappointed in a dining experience.
I usually don't believe in some so-call "Best xx in xx", but this "Best crab cake in New Orleans" deserves the name! This is so great. And I've never had a crab crake with this large crab meat.

My boyfriend and I had dinner here last Thursday night, 6/15/2017. WOW! Everything we had was phenomenal and the service was top notch. We had to wait in line outside the building, but the line moved very quickly. This restaurant is a lot bigger than it may appear form the outside with multiple floors of dining. 

We started off with a dozen fresh shucked oysters. They were divine and so big! Next we split the Gator Tail Bites. Also amazing. We especially loved the dipping sauce they came with. We also split a cup of the seafood gumbo. Yet again we were blown away by how delicious it was. For dinner we split the Redfish Oceana. My boyfriend has a dairy allergy so we asked for the crawfish mushroom cream sauce to be put on the side and they were very accommodating. This dish was also delicious. We were so stuffed but couldn't pass up on the desserts so we split the bread pudding. YUM! This might have been one of the best bread puddings I have ever had. 

Overall our experience here was amazing. If and when I am ever back in New Orleans I will definitely be making a stop here. The food was great, the service was quick and friendly, and for a restaurant right in the French Quarter with food of this quality the price was very reasonable.
Great place! Went here twice in two days! Our server Pamela is VERY NICE! Strongly recommend!
Food was fantastic!  Ask for Jenna, the sweetest and most hilarious server you can get in this place!  Way to go Jenna :-)

Delicious, Great service, large portions. We had the off menu Maw maw's Cajun Breakfast. A bacon shrimp egg and jambalaya combo dish served with a biscuit. This is a dish that locals have growing up in NOLA. We paired it with a bloody mary and side of grits. Portion size was very large. I would recommend splitting this plate, otherwise you will have a full meal to take home for later. Our waiter was Mike.  He was incredibly courteous and made us feel at home.
Yummy food but the server brought several wrong orders since they are clearly overloaded ...

Love this restaurant but skip the breakfast. First dish I ordered was crab cake Benedict. Came out Luke warm and the skimpy amount of sauce on it was skimmed over like it had been setting in the window way to long and the medium poached eggs were hard. I told waiter and ordered a different breakfast. The server was very professional and nice. The manager came over to the table and opened with "what do you want" I just stared at him, I had no idea who he was (ya never know in New Orleans) then he says " oh I'm the manager what's wrong". Enough said
Good food, excellent waitress Natalie, come on Monday late night, not crowded or noisy.

I was part of a group of 100 people.  We had the entire second floor rented out.  While I don't know anything about the reservation process or the cost, I can say that we were treated very well by the wait and bar staff.  Our glasses were kept filled and the food was delivered as quickly as you could expect for a group that size.  

And boy was it GOOD!  I had blackened Redfish coated with Crawfish Etouffe.  Absolutely delectable.  For dessert - Chocolate Kalhua Mousse.  Amazing.  

You can tell the building is ancient and has been renovated.  The interior of the second floor is supported by brick which gives the chambers of the rooms character.  There is a balcony that overlooks a courtyard.  This place is a gem on Conti street.
I honestly order from this restaurant through UBER EATS weekly! Their food is good and the prices are reasonable.

We randomly ate here shortly after we arrived in NOLA. We had "blackened gator bites", shrimp po-boy, catfish po-boy and a seafood platter. Along with some mixed drinks. Food was great, service was great. No complaints. These were the best po-boys we had in NOLA.
Great food and drinks just Off Bourbon Street ,they take the Bannas Foster Desert and Make it a Drink with Rum! ,You Should Check it Out!

Favorite place in town so far. This was our "all out" meal of vaca. Between my boyfriend and I we ordered raw oysters on the half shell, gator bites, blackened catfish with a crawfish sauce on top, and blackened duck also with a crawfish sauce. Both meals came with their signature jambalaya and collard greens. Out of this world. The staff were friendly and service was quick considering the amount of people. We sat on the 2nd floor with a great view of their beautiful coutyard.

I had a cup of the gumbo to start my lunch. It was really good, but I should not have had it because I could not finish my blackened shrimp alfredo. OMG, is the alfredo sauce good. I can't recommend that dish highly enough. 

The service was also outstanding. our waitress was Jimika and she was knowledgable about the menu and the things not on the menu. One of our party was a vegetarian and Jimika helped her find something that was truly delicious. 

I'll go back to Oceana. You should go, too!
The food was awesome. My motorcycle club came from Atlanta and loved it! Bridget was our waitress and she was awesome! Thank You Bridget! 5 Stars all day long!
Stopped here for lunch. The food and service were excellent. Very reasonable prices. Don't forget to have one of their delicious desserts.

Nothing better than a mean oyster po' boy, smoked oyster rockefeller and an outstanding Bloody Mary.  Everything was freshly made.  The portions were large and the flavors were authentic.  And, they put pepperoncinis in their Bloody Marys!!  

The only thing odd about this place was the long line outside when there were a lot of empty tables inside.  We waited 45 minutes for a table, but service was friendly and quick -- not sure what was going on with the host b/c he said if he filled the restaurant, the staff wouldn't be able to handle it.  I secretly think it was to attract more business.
Friendly service and food wasn't terrible, but it all came crashing down when a big roach walked across the floor by our table. Other guests saw it too.

I'm in this restaurant twice a week  Which means the food is absolutely great. My favorite dishes is the rockefeller oysters of course, it has the spinach smoke bacon and Pernod liqueur with parmesan cheese. You have to try it. But most definitely the blackened ribeye steak with the jambalaya and veggies. Service always good and of course my favorite bartender there is Josh. He is great, always keeps a smile and he gives good customer service.

Oceana Grill is a great place to eat not only for the food, but for the friendly service. I had made reservations for 30 people well in advance only to have 25 confirm. As long as you let them know a day in advance, no problem. I showed up with my party and was greeted with friendly staff with smiles on their faces and eagerness to help guests. We were all seated and ordered our drinks and food. Everything went perfect. Wait staff were professional and prompt. As far as I know everyone really enjoyed the food and no mixed up checks or mistakes. For us, food is one thing, but nice, organized staff and clean environment are just as important. Oceana Grill exceeds on all three!
Great experience. We were there on vacation and my son saw the restaurant on TV and absolutely wanted to go. So glad we did

Pretty darn good! Had the boiled shrimp and gumbo, which was extremely rich and flavorful! Didn't like the margarita. Didn't like having to clean the shrimp myself, either, but I was drunk so it was okay!

This place is truly just OK. I should have trusted Yelp before coming here. The only reason why we dined here was because it was blistering cold outaide and everything else was closed.  

The service: when we first arrived we were seated by a nice lady. However,  that went downhill after because I was turned off by our waitress. She seemed a little annoyed with my husband and me.  Then, a party of about 6 people came in and they seemed intoxicated and loud,  so I asked our waitress if we could move and she responded with a "Yeah, that's fine" but with attitude. I must say our 2nd waitor was very hospitable and nice. 

The food: we had the eggplant strips and I enjoyed them. The sauce they came with were good too. They reminded me of french fries. The crabcake was good too but not great.  The oysters were less than ok. The oysters had this parmesan like sprinkle and that was not a good addition to it.

I probably would not come back here unless there was nothing else open.
Food was delicious and the service was on point! Friendly and gave great recommendations on food choices! Our server, Chantay was great!

Considering it has the vibe of a chili's, the general experience was positive. I sat at the bar after lunch and was served quickly. I had the étouffée -really good-, and the oysters, which were bland and sadly, dried, since they were served mostly on their side. I would go again if like this time, I did not have to wait in line. Good beer selections.

Service first of all was amazing!  I ordered the jazzy crab cakes with sides. My stomach never felt so happy. This is a great example of comfort food. It was savory with zing of spice, flavorful greens, and what I would expect from good old fashion Louisiana  food and hospitality. Come on through!

This place surprised me. The decor was a bit cheesy NOLA style, which made me underestimate this place. Our waitress Ashleigh was so awesome, one of the best waitresses I have ever had, we gave her a 30% tip which we don't do often. I had the crab cakes as a main course, Ashleigh let me know that the vegetable included was collard greens which are made with pork. Since I don't eat pork or red meat she offered me broccoli as a side. Everything was delicious, and my husband loved his po boy. Will definitely be back when we are back in NOLA!

This was the best food we had during our trip. Stood in line outside, for less than 5 minutes, before being seated in the moderately sized dining area. Staff were extremely polite and attentive. Great overall ambiance in this restaurant. It really brought the sights & tastes of the Deep South to life. This is a must-do if in New Orleans, will definitely return!
My crawfish etouffee was to die for and the service was really prompt and friendly. This is a return visit from a year ago where I loved the barbecued shrimp

Wow, this place is huge and you'd never guess by looking at the outside.  We went up three flights of stairs and ate upstairs.  Wander around and check out the balcony that overlooks their courtyard, it's super cool.  The service here was outstanding.  Our waitress was Deanne and she was very attentive and had a happy demeanor, unlike some of the other waitresses we've encountered in the French quarter.  The fried fish from the kids plate was lightly battered and we all snacked on it after my son was finished. Soft shell crab with crab cakes and veggies was excellent.  We also had the fried catfish poboy that was perfect.  I loved the spicy pickles on it.  We will go back for the bread pudding!  When we got there for lunch, there was a line out the door, but It's worth the wait.

Tried this spot for lunch and ordered the cheeseburger with cajun fries. My burger was really good. It was big in size and had all the fixings you'd expect. The fries were definitely a new experience for me as I was expecting cajun seasoning, not crawfish gravy lol. They were really good though. Cheesy and gooey. I used my Yelp discount and they actually went ahead and discounted all of us at the table which I thought was really great of them. My coworkers had crab cakes and alligator, etc. I just wanted something regular and simple, but we all enjoyed our food.
Food was good, great prices. Atmosphere was chill, good music, clean. Staff was friendly & professional

Seafood platter (sampler) was amazing. Catfish was really good, light and not too fishy. Fried shrimp were amazing. I didn't care for the fried oysters but that had more to do with my tastes. Jamika was our server and she was very helpful and knowledgeable of the menu. I would definitely go back.

My wife and I ate at this place once.  It's on a FQ side street and seemed really nice and not too touristy.   We met a couple from San Francisco that was eating there.   We asked them what brought them to town and they basically said "Oceana".... And that they fly in town every week from Cali just to eat there.  I'm not sure if they owned a Cessna or flew commercial, but either way it was an impressive statement and testament about the quality of food that we all enjoyed...

This was the best seafood I had meat Bourbon Street! I got the fried seafood platter and it was amazing! The breading was light and had a great taste. And sooo much food! I didn't expect to have so much food on the plate.

And the best part is that it's open late! Gotta love that, after roaming Bourbon Street all day!
It was okay and nice to see a children's menu but we have had better food around here. Felt expensive for what it was.

We stopped at Oceana Grill because a friend had come here for Crab Cakes once, and he had to have them again.

I will say, they had some damn tasty crab cakes.
the service was very good - but it was labor day, around 12pm - was anyone really awake at that time?
Didn't try much of anything else  so my review will be limited to this.
We have been here a few times and the food was consistently wonderful along with service !  Highly recommend,  you won't be disappointed.

This was by far my favorite place that my sister and I ate at while we were in New Orleans. We ended up making a last-minute reservation, and I would definitely make a reservation as there were long lines every time we walked past the restaurant. We sat at the bar and the bartender was so friendly and attentive. The drinks were so fun- definitely Snapchat/Insta-worthy. I got the Redfish Oceana and it was SO GOOD. The fish was absolutely delicious and the crawfish sauce and the garlic mashed potatoes were great. I would highly recommend making a reservation at the Oceana Grill at some point during your trip to New Orleans.

ate here with a party of 14 and we were pleased.  drink prices were reasonable.  service was good.  place is huge so odds are you won't have to wait.  my blackened duck was very good but i think some of the fried dishes came out cold.  i felt it was understandable since there were so many of us and they brought out all the food at once.  the prices were reasonable.  i'm sure there are better places around but this was solid and did well with our large group,.

Great Greek omelette!  Nice quiet little restaurant off from Bourbon St. homemade biscuits yummy with a tad of honey.  Bottomless coffee!  Jennifer was so sweet and attentive!  I would recommend this for a nice breakfast diner

This is a tourist trap. I had high expectations for this place because I had read good reviews on yelp.  I could also see long waits outside the restaurant from my hotel balcony. The 2 stars are for the rude staff at the front door and the confusion regarding online reservations. On Friday I made online reservations for Saturday at 4pm.  At 1pm on  Saturday I could see from my hotel  balcony that no one was waiting outside(which was unusual )  I called Oceana &  they said come down because  there was no wait. It took us no more than  3 minutes to get there. Once we arrived the lady out front wanted us to wait outside because  more people had just arrive. Eventually  she allowed my husband and I  to sit at the bar. There was only one customer sitting at the empty  bar, plenty of room for more customers.  I than spoke to another lady at the front desk,   I proceeded to tell her about our  4 pm reservations. She  blurted out I didn't make reservations  because it was Saturday and they don't take reservations on Saturday.  We were  than seated on the first level.  Our server Jimal was wonderful .  The food was very good. We had etoufee, fried oysters, crab cakes,  blackened red fish, mustard greens and  chocolate cheesecake. 
The crab cakes were good but disappointly  cold.  The Gumbo Shop crab cakes are similar to Oceana  but the Gumbo Shops are slightly better. If you want crabcakes and less of a wait time go to The Gumbo Shop. The  Atmosphere at Oceana is not impressive. It is loud and there's a constant cold draft from a open window at the bar..
In Summary,  the food is good, quality is  similar to the  quality of the Gumbo Shop on St. Peters St. The restaurant  atmosphere lacks the New Orleans flair.  Staff /hotesses need training on customer service . Employees  need to be aware of their company 's online reservation system on their website. The long waits outside is due to mismanagement of customers.
One of the best meals that I had in NoLa! Had a fried shrimp Po Boy; simple but delicious. The waiter was very attentive and accommodating, in spite of a rude fellow table mate.

During our recent trip to Nawlins we headed to Acme Oyster Co..but, the line was way too long so headed to Oceana Grill. The gumbo was crazy good as we're t h e specialty oysters, crab cakes, jambalaya pasta , and bread pudding! I had one if the best Bloody Mary's I've ever had and our waiter, Errol was simply perfect. Loved it and will be back!

This restaurant was a nice find thanks to Yelp. My wife and I went here on our honey moon and really enjoyed it. The service by a waitress named Bree Ann was great! She was very sweet and had excellent customer service skills. The crab cakes are AMAZING! You must try them. The only reason we give 4 instead of 5 stars is because, while the food was great in general, the etouffe and jambalaya were just okay. I had the duck and that was surprisingly good. Just overall not a 5 star rating due to the fact that we had amazing food at some other really great places. We would definitely try this place again. especially because the service timely and very good.

Had the Oyster Rockefeller for the first time and they were amazing!!  My husband and I  shared the Red Fish with Jambalaya and mushroom cream sauce with crawfish tails. This was one of the best lunch we've had in New Orleans.

The famous oysters are AMAZING!! Will definitely be back for those again. We were seated quickly even on a busy Good Friday. Service was quick and attentive. Table of 7 all enjoyed their food. Bus boy was hustling us for a direct tip for "not charging" for a to go box which was a little aggravating but we still enjoyed the overall experience.
Delicious fried catfish and shrimp! The batter has a little kick but it's not spicy plus it's not heavy in your system. Definitely recommend if you are looking for a great catfish spot.

Oceana was great!  The first meal I had in New Orleans.  The food was quick and was very good.  The tuna steak with stuffed crab was something to write home about!  
The staff was also great!  My waiter was kind, patient and informative.  My fraud alert with my bank went off while there and I had to make three phone calls to resolve the issue in the meantime not paying for the meal.  It took 45 minutes!  The waiter was calm and friendly about it all.  I finally got it resolved but was annoyed and he brought me the best cocktail to help with my attitude adjustment!  Wonderful food, wonderfull Staff.  Thanks David for a memorable dinner!

This is a beautiful place for drinking and enjoying the good menu. We had Gumbo and Fried ouster. I like the Gumbo better than the fried oyster, but I personally don't like fried food so maybe because of that I didn't like it.

Food was delicious. Def would eat here again. Crabcakes were amazing. Got 10% off checking in on yelp! The wait was really really long and was boiling outside, but was worth the wait. I would recommend this place in the french quarter 100%!
Ashleigh was an excellent waitress.  She knew the food,  preparations, ingredients and then some.   Fast and prompt service with a smile.

Wow, best Cajun food ever! We checked in to our hotel on Bourbon street and the Bell hop, Roger suggested this restaurant. We loved it. Staff was friendly, helpful, professional in every way. The atmosphere was so authentic New Orleans. No complaints here. Food was delicious and cooked and seasoned to perfection. I had the blackened Catfish and I was very pleased. The best catfish I have ever eaten! My friends had the chicken fettuccini Alfredo and the fried shrimp with all the normal sides. All the food was superb. Dessert was strawberry Cheesecake and crime Brûlée. Wow it was amazing!! Restaurant was clean and well maintained. We will return.

Located in a odd spot, but the inside is huge.  I ordered a po boy, and while I'm sure there are better in New Orleans, this one didn't disappoint. I just wanted to have a po boy in NoLA before we left and I did. I didn't get the coleslaw on mine, subbed it out for lettuce but I hear the slaw is a nice distinction. My husband ordered the taste of New Orleans which he loved. Of the three dishes, he enjoyed the red beans and rice the most. Our waiter was average but the ambience and the food was very good. One downside is that there can be many stairs to climb to your seat if you go on a crowded night. Other than that, I would certainly come back again.

Attended special event here and the food and service were really lovely. I don't know how this place dropped of my regular cycle of places to eat in the Quarter but it is back on my list of excellent food and super friendly service.
Wow, what a find!! Great food, Jessica in the upstairs bar was fabulous "baby"!! Great find for just walking around . Crab cakes and red fish was delicious.
Food was excellent, atmosphere was great. Things can get a bit pricey there but you get what you pay for, a stellar meal in the heart of the French quarter.

Visited for a 3pm lunch while in the Quarter. Service was good. Wait was short. Had a cup of gumbo and a fried shrimp poboy. The gumbo was good, tasted homemade. The poboy was really disappointing. The shrimp and fries were both cold, clearly not fresh. For the price, I expected something better than cold fries and pre-cooked shrimp.
Good. Not great. In a city like this there are better choices. Back in my hometown this would be great.

My friends and I were referred to this restaurant for lunch!  OMG! The bar b cue shrimp was amazing as well as the crab cakes! Henry our waiter was pretty awesome, we didn't know what to order and he suggested everything! You have to try the Long Island Iced Tea tell them to make it Blue!!! Ask for HENRY!!!
Great food, great people, and have great customer service .... I will always eat at the famous Oceana Grill
Awesome place!!! Good food, drinks and friendly staff.  The crab cakes are a must have!!

Friendly staff, quick service with really flavorful food!

I really liked Crab cakes here and fried gator bits over grilled.
Crabcakes are awsome!...The entire staff was great!...Can't think of a better place to watch a football game. This is where I'll be taking all of my clients from now on!

I have two words for this place.... Dee-Licious!!! Very friendly service. Fantastic food. The blackened red fish etouffee was cooked perfectly. Not too spicy, yet some heat is there. I highly recommend eating here!
Good food! They even have vegetarian options if you like. Great option if your joining the seafood lover but don't eat it yourself.

We ordered delivery so maybe that's where we went wrong.    The food was very mediocre.  We had alligator po boy, Cajun pasta, catfish bites, red beans & rice, seafood gumbo, & bourbon pecan pie.  Where to start....... The pasta was overcooked, the bread for the po boy was chewy but the alligator was well seasoned (according to the Mr), the catfish bites were not special, the gumbo too much rice and 3 pieces of shrimp, & the pecan pie tasted like a straight shot of bourbon with a little pie on the side.  Needless to say... Issa no for me dawg.    And no I wouldn't go to the restaurant to try anything else.  (My husband just asked me that question)  I think we tried enough food ($60 worth) to determine we don't like how they cook.

We stop here every time we are in New Orleans! Best seafood around. Love the red snapper stuffed with crab with crawfish sauce. Perfection! Heard they have an amazing breakfast as well but have never tried it yet.

Checked this place for Breakfast and it surpassed my expectations. The Eggs St. Louis tickled my tastebuds and it took half a day to wipe the smile off my face. When my waiter, Henry W. asked if I wanted dessert, I opted for a raincheck. He said "keep your receipt and it will be free with your next meal. Bread pudding, here I come!

My second time here and it was amazing as the first time. This go around I had Kim as my waitress and she was great. I honestly think people need to visit NO to get a lesson in the service industry. Nonetheless, the food comes out quickly and my family loved their dishes. This is my go to NO restaurant.

We had blackened and fried gator- both were very delicious! The seafood gumbo was also great. Prices were reasonable for the area. Good service. This is a solid place for a snack and drink. Outside patio area looks nice although we are inside.
Had the seafood platter and it was delicious! Enough for two. We ordered takeout but they did offer delivery which I thought was awesome!

This was our first time in new orleans and we were looking for more of traditional dishes to try & this was the perfect place. Great prices, drinks and atmosphere. Our bartender Meagan was so amazing, sweet & just super welcoming! Our food came out super fast and everything was delicious

I ate here a while ago and it was okay. But they have really been going down. I feel like I have to vomit every time after I eat here. I also know if a friend that works there and he told me they have pre-bagged food. They don't cook it fresh. It is in bags and boiled until hot. Very unpleasant. Also, this place was on Gordon Ramsey's kitchen nightmares. WATCH IT

The pasta dishes we both had were excellent.  The server was very good at keeping our drinks refreshed.  There was about a 10 wait to get in as they were very busy. We would go back there again in a New York minute.

Came here for Dinner.  The char grilled oysters were OK, not the best we had in New Orleans.  However, Blackened Bayou Duck was outstanding.  It was probably the best cooked duck I have ever had anywhere.  The sides were also very good, true Cajun.

This is our go to spot in New Orleans! I DO NOT like seafood but I fell in love with their seafood gumbo! My friend had the oysters and she couldn't stop raving about them. Our waitress was extremely nice. Every time we came the place was packed and the menu has tons of food to please every taste. It's also a nice touch that they deliver in the French Quarter and serve breakfast until 1 pm.

This was my first cajun/creole experience so I have nothing for comparison. I'll admit I'm a cheap trick for spicy food and most things that swim. The Gumbo, Jambalaya, Etoufee, and Red Snapper were all delicious. LOVED the crawfish. The crab cakes were ok/average. Our waiter was extremely personable and made some great recommendations. I would come back.
Terrific grilled oysters, fried eggplant fries, crab cakes! Great service, fun atmosphere! Keeper!!!
Avoid this place. Chain bullshit. Unsweet tea is good and restrooms are clean! Food is sub par
This is by far one of the best places to eat. Excellent food, drinks and service.  Make sure you ask for Kevin for your waiter. Funny and always has a smile and great customer service.

MUST TRY OCEANA'S

DO NOT PASS UP AN OPPORTUNITY TO EAT HERE! 

-Best oyster po'boy flavor, quality &quantity of Oysters 

-Best étouffée

The seasoned fries were good, considering that fries are not a main concern for most restaurants because all the fries we had were soggy and extra greasy and bland.

Went with ultra high expectation's to say I was highly disappointed. The atmosphere was great WWL was there for the game day radio spot which was a great experience. Ordered the char grilled oysters which were ok. For my entree I ordered the blackened bayou duck that was horrible. It was flavorless! It tasted more like oven roasted chicken than blackened duck. My wife ordered the grilled ahi tuna that was also flavorless but was cooked to death making it dry. Needless to say for the $75 that it cost we will not be back. Surely there are better representatives of true New Orleans Cajun cuisine.

Came here with a group of girlfriends during a bachelorette weekend not knowing a thing about the place, and we weren't let down! The server Darrick was very knowledgeable of the menu and recommended the perfect dishes. He even helped score us a couple jars of the dilly beans since we went a little nuts for them lol
Overall the food was fantastic, especially the rice & beans, jambalaya, and the crab cakes!!!
We will definitely be back!

Best Creme Brûlée EVER!! All the food was very yummy! The crab cakes and the Cajun fries were out of the world! The service from Bree was quick, accurate and outstanding! The band across the street played in the rain! It was beautiful! They sell Ponchos!

This place should get 5 stars for service because the lady who served us at the bar was INCREDIBLE. So attentive and knowledgeable. Sweet enough to chat us up and be super genuine. For this alone I will come back and order drinks.. but nothing else. 

UGH.. this place STANKS. Stinky Stanks. It's so close to Bourbon Street that I think it is just a run off of all that. BUTTTTT... If you choose to sit at the bar.. that STANK will creep in to your food and so for that.. No matter how good the food may be.. It is mixed with stinky stankola. Sit far back as you can friends. No one told me. WTF. 

ANYWAY.. 

Crab cakes.. pretty good. Fried well so they have a crispy side and the crawfish sauce on top was amazing. We also got the Crawfish pasta.. The sauce tasted similar to what was on the crab cake, which felt weird.. like I got cheated or something.. the pasta was super over cooked. Cookery FAIL y'all. We also ordered a cup of the seafood gumbo.. which was straight up FOUL. DO NOT ORDER THIS. It had no flavor and was cold and mixed with stank.. felt like tasting a fart. hahhaa. No Srsly... don't order this.. just have another cocktail. 

Personally, for the price of this joint I would much rather go to somewhere else.

Try their fried seafood platter!!! The portion was so big that I needed others' help to finish. My fried catfish was nicely preferred that it was crispy and tender at the same time!!! We ordered their fried shrimp poboy, too. It's so yum! I'll definitely recommend to friends and family!
Ordered the pasta jambalaya for delivery on eat 24. Food was subpar at best and the portion size was ridiculously small I could've been a side dish and I was charged $20 for it.

We made reservations and still had to wait about 25 minutes. The table next to us as well as our waitress boasted that anything Blackened on the menu was good so we went with the blackened catfish and an order of their famous crab cakes. The catfish was good, but not my favorite and the crab cakes were nothing to write home about. Overall I think the food was OK, but it's a definite tourist trap and I would not go again.

Eh, this place was fine. The food was decent, and the drinks were reasonably priced. We came here for a late dinner before going out and the food, service, and atmosphere were all good.

Nothing special, but not bad.
Great atmosphere and our waitress Bri was awesome! The food was pretty good, it was my first time trying etouffee and i fell in love with it. Good drink selection too.
Amazing Oysters and exquisite wine selection. Pricey but you eat at one of the best seafood places in NYC.

After a long day out we found this Gem of a place. The Gumbo great. THE GATOR nuggets OMG a must have. The Cajun shrimp pasta was to die for. The sampler was a party on your mouth. Blackened steak was also great. Just orgasmic.

Pamela has the best employee at this place! She is very fun! She Recommends the best drinks and sauces and knows her stuff! I've come here twice this week and she has not let me down! I absolutely love her! Go Pam!

Loooooved this place. Best crab cakes I ever had! Extremely meaty and the flavor is mind blowing. I also had the Gumbo soup which was delicious and filled with meat. For dessert, we finished off with a delicious bread pudding. Must try! And the service there is impeccable. They have a number of managers walking around to make sure everyone is enjoying themselves. The atmosphere was really nice too! Try to get a seat by the window to admire the balconies around.

Oceana came highly recommended and did not disappoint! The food was very flavorful and portion sizes were large. Service great. 
My mother and I had the Taste of New Orleans and Shrimp Alfredo-delicious!
The bread pudding is amazing. Super good place to eat. If your looking for a non seafood option the cheeseburger is great.

This is where i had my First Alligator meat !! 
Took me while but then kinda liked it ....We had  Barbecued Shrimp,Gator Tail for starters they were good,the Shrimp Fettuccine Alfredo was awesome highly recommended...!!
however the shrimp PoBoy was let down else would have rated this place higher ... we were so stuffed we had pack the Bread Pudding, was fresh and completed the meal .The staff is very friendly and service was great!!
Our food was good, but not great. We didn't get oysters which seemed to be the popular item, but I'm judging based on what I ate.

Finally! My last dinner we finally got in here later at night ( before 11 it's lined up down the street so get here early or late!)

I have to say this is the first restaurant where the customer service was amazing, servers were very knowledgeable and had lots of great recommendations.

We had the alligator bites for an appetizer and half were grilled and the other half were deep fried, SOO GOOD. 

Now, we ordered the special which was the black/red fish with a Cajun sauce on top of a crab cake... wow. I was hesitating with my choice after but I'm glad i decided on it.

Fish was cooked perfectly, flakey and a little crispy on top, the crab cakes were almost melting in your mouth and the Cajun sauce also had shrimp.. i couldn't eat it all as everything here is massive!! 

Wish i had time to eat here again, but highly recommend making the time to get here.

We went here based on a recommendation from a family member who raved about the crab cakes. So we were greeted by very friendly hostess who took us upstairs;  it was so nice and quiet compared to Bourbon st. Anyway, our server  was Shahan who was great. Very friendly and interactive.  It turns out he is from Sri Lanka like my bf so we felt a connection to him. The food was amazing, we go the crab cake plattet which was so damn good, best crab cakes we have ever had. My bf ordered the bread pudding with ice cream and he devoured it; he even asked for more sauce and Shahan gladly accommodated him. We will definitely be returning and hope that Shahan will be around so we can have great service again!

Delicious!! Table of 9 sat very quickly and service was awesome too. We ordered a few different styles of oysters which were amazing as well as everything else on the menu from the po boys to the pasta. Don't let the line out there the door fool you for how long of a wait it is, this place is 3 stories and simply can't hold people waiting in the entrance. The line moves quickly!
The grilled oysters were very good as well as the Cajun Jambalaya that I had. Only issue was the service was a tad bit slow. But overall it was a very good experience!
Great food and service! We were seated immediately on a fairly busy Saturday night. Our server was very friendly, everything came out quickly, and the portions were a pretty good size.

I ate here on a Saturday afternoon with a party of five. The restaurant was fairly empty, yet our service was incredibly slow. We waited ten minutes for refills on our water and when our check came, we waited 15 more minutes for the waitress to return our cards. Not only was the food subpar for New Orleans, but the waitress mischarged my card for 3x the amount of my meal. I was on the phone not only with their accounting department but also with my bank for 2 hours because the waitress overdrafted my account for several days. My bank will not reverse the fee as it was not a banking error, and the restaurant will not take responsibility for their inept waitress. I am highly disappointed with the service I received and will not be returning any time in the future.

Food was too expensive for the quality I received. Southern hospitality my ass.
Our group of 12 was seated immediately and the wait staff was friendly and helpful. The shrimp creole was outstanding.

Fantastic NOLA BBQ shrimp appetizer and crab cakes. Our server was AWESOME, friendly, attentive and knowledgable. (Kaitlyn? ) Our uber driver reco'd this place and we weren't disappointed. Would def go back has a great vibe, friendly staff and great menu.

Nice place.  Great service. Sat at the bar, excellent bloody Mary's. Had the shrimp platter, so yummy.  Amazing amount of food.   Also tried a local Louisiana beer.  
The bartender Brandi is very attentive and fun.  Great place to chill in the quarter.

Not a big fan of there custom oysters. It just had to much stuff cooked onto it and you lost there flavor. Raw oysters were good and the alligator sausage was amazing. Deftly a good place to go that's right off of bourbon street.

We ordered fried and blackened Gator Bites as appetizer and it was delicious. I preferred the fried but both were good. I had Blackened Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo and a side of Coke slaw that was the best food I ate while in New Orleans. My sister in law are blackened tuna which she loved. We were seated immediately. Our waitress wasn't overly friendly but the young man that would check on is periodically was superb and made up for it.

Came in for a late lunch. There weren't too much people at that time. Great seafood. Love their crawfish and oysters!
Server was friendly and helpful. But the lady who led us to the seat didn't seem to be very happy.
Overall a great restaurant.
This place is pretty good.  The Blackened Redfish was awesome.  Catfish lovers will not be disappointed and the Sea Food platter is not only good, it can be shared by two!

Wow,  that's some serious Cajun and creole cooking!   Line outside moved quickly and we got a seat at the bar.  Service was a little slow but the food more than made up for that. 
I recommend the crab cake app to share-two really good and big cakes with seafood étouffée sauce on top. Perfect start to a meal there. 
For dinner, check out the blackened redfish. Great fresh fish with a little étouffée on top. Decent prices and top notch food.

While staying our hotel, the concierge recommended this place for dinner.
