While the place is pretty small, their food is really, really good. My mom and I split a fried seafood platter thing and it was a good amount for the both of us. I can't recall what was in it exactly, but I'm sure it had the usual: shrimp, fish, fries, etc.

My dad on the other hand got some sort of sampler platter that had etouffee, jambalaya and something else. It might have been boudin but I can't say for sure. But you know, just a little taste of everything. He let me try a little bit of everything from his plate and WOW. Everything was great, but there was one that was definitely a favorite for me. And I think it was the jambalaya. 

Definitely give this place a try if you're in New Orleans. The food was great, the service was nice, and then afterwards, have a drink on Bourbon Street.

I'll start by saying that the service here was great and I came with a large party. The 2 stars come from the food. I started with gumbo which was tasty but could have a had a bit more spice. My entree (maybe this is my fault for ordering this) was a shrimp/oyster po-boy. The shrimp were fried so hard that I could barely bite them and while I understand that French bread is not the softest, this bread was darn near inedible. I just settled for eating the inside of the sandwich and my fries which had to be taken back bc they were cold. I just wish the food matched the service.

Delicious authentic creole right near b-street.  Came here with my cousin and ordered the "taste of new orleans" combo thingee.  I think I blacked out for a moment because the food was just.  that.  good.  Toss on a glass of Abita Amber, and you are "ret ta go."  Was surprisingly easy to get a table (versus another place we went to on our pre-Mardis Gras trip that was easy to get a table, but the food was "meh.").  Authentic food, great service, highly reco!
The wait was so worth it! Jacob had impeccable customer service which is extremely rare these days.

The food here is awesome along with the prices. I was really surprised because I expected it to be a lot more expensive. I've been here on several occasions. They have some of the best crab cakes I've ever eaten. My friend ordered the Taste of New Orleans because she couldn't decide on just one thing. It was so much food! The étouffée was delicious!  Friendly staff and great service every time.

The most disappointing meal we've had in New Orleans. We were hungry for a snack and stopped in while expiring the French quarter. We had the famous oysters which were covered in a greasy sauce. The poboy was dry and had a weird sauce that did not go well. It was later in the afternoon and one of the servers asked how it felt to be the only table in the restaurant. Maybe if you had better food there would be more tables! Avoid this place when visiting NOLA, it's a waste of money!

The food is great, a little over priced but great. Our server wasn't the best but all the other waiters and staff were friendly. The gator bites were fantastic, especially with the remaloude sauce. You can't beat the po boys. We had the pecan pie for desert and it was one of the best pies I've ever tasted. I would definetly come back again.
Horrible food, we ordered gumbo it was just gravy with salt no flavor and red beans and rice was very distasteful overpriced and bad quality
Awesome food and service. The prices weren't bad. I think it was easily some of the best local food I've eaten in New Orleans. Highly recommended.
I came here again with NYC friends and I had shrimp and oysters. I love this place. Its affordable. They have a beautiful garden dining area in back and so nice! Staff is highly trained and funny.

We love this place!  Belinda had the "Lost Bread" breakfast and it was the best French Toast ever!  I had the Royal Omelet. It had shrimp, crawfish, and veggies. It also had a special cream sauce. It was delicious!  Our server was Renika and she was wonderful!  I highly recommend this place to anyone.
It was an enjoyable brunch, I am not sure it rates all of the hype of many of the reviews but it is a soiled place.

First sit in Whitney's section. She was very attentive and has a great personality. We were warmly welcomed as we entered and were seated. We were even welcomed for coming in. The food wasdelicious. Great poboys! Finally the atmosphere is warm and welcome with a little but of a kick. Great place!!!
This place has a great selection of delicious food. I want to go back. Service is pretty on point as well.

Our concierge recommended Oceana to us after we found out that Brennan's was closed down.  We didn't know what to expect, but we were pleasantly surprised.  The atmosphere is low key, casual, but the waiters are phenomenal, and oh so kind.  We ordered the blackened gator bites, they were to-die-for!  So delicious and the dipping sauce that accompanied it was oh so tasty!  For our meal I ordered the blacked shrimp over fettuccini pasta, and my husband had the red fish oceana.  Both were sublime.  We thoroughly enjoyed our meal and experience.  Definitely recommend Oceana, and we will definitely be back next time we are in NOLA.

Just come here. Extremely satisfying seafood fare. Go for their specials, and check into Yelp for 10% off your bill. I made an excellent choice with their special: blackened catfish filet with fried crawfish tails over chicken and sausage jambalaya.

At the suggestion of family members who ate here a few months earlier I decided to patronize this restaurant while visiting NO.  
The  food is ok contrary to the rave reviews posted on Yelp. 
I had the crab cake appetizer. The crab cakes were warm although the plate it was served on was extremely hot. 
My friend ordered the gumbo at the suggestion of the waitress. Gumbo was a huge disappointment. Gumbo was not eaten. 
For the entree I ordered the crawfish étouffée with fried crawfish tails. Again the food was served warm and there was an odd taste. Most of this dish was uneaten. 
Truly disappointing meal.
Wow!their oysters on the half shell were awesome! Great food and Pamela treated us like royalty...no complaints here
Great service and awesome redfish. Price is good. Atmosphere is great. Food quality excellent.  Got a seat pretty fast. Come back everytime we are in this area. The server you want is Kevin C
This food was great. I would definitely eat here again! From Big Daddys and Lil Mamas bbq from Desoto.
Came here on a Monday and were sat right away during lunch time. We had the best time with our server Errol. He was attentive and gave us amazing recommendations including the ribs...so good.

First stop after checking into hotel....maybe the coupon from concierge helped.

Great PO-Boy!!  Food was delish, atsmosphere was nice, clean and the staff was very friendly.
Ordered delivery - showed up in under 45 minutes and was delicious! Red beans and rice were the best.

I've been here two times and everytime it gets better and better. The food is incredible, the service is great. All the seafood options and it's fresh quality make it one of the best places in the French Quarter. I haven't had a meal yet that disappointed me. Great place to go to taste true New Orleans Food.

Excellent food. We ate there our first day, since it was across from our hotel. Best crab cakes ever! It was so good, that we ordered breakfast from there the next day, and had it delivered. Fantastic biscuits & gravy. So, went there on our last day for brunch. Fabulous eggs Benedict on crab cakes & Irish coffee. Great food. Great service!

Ordered fried oyster starter and Taste of New Orleans entree. Very tasty!  Love the cocktail sauce. More horseradish than normal added a lovely spicy tang. The Jambalaya was tasty if dry, the crawfish etoufee was chick full of big tender crawfish. Hot link and red beans and rice was perfect.
Open late, thank god! Was starving and this place was recommended. Bridget was very very sweet and attentive . Our meals were perfect. The blackened gator bites are die for!!
One of the best seafood gumbo and the service was amazing. Our server was Deanne and she was sweet and awesome.

My sister, bf, and I showed up here for dinner on Christmas Day without a reservation.  We were initially hesitant because what self respecting establishment would let tourists in for dinner w/o a reservation on Christmas?  Luckily Oceana let us in and wowed us.  We asked the wonderful staff at Harrah's where they might recommend/if they knew of any places open for dinner, and I'm so glad they told us to go here.

We ordered bloody marys, crab cakes, oysters, gumbo, redfish oceana, jambalaya, and one other fish dish I can't remember.  Everything we got tasted great and our waiter was awesome.  He was very knowledgeable about the menu and had wonderful recommendations.  Waiting outside in the cold was all worth it and our Christmas dinner was merry.

Visited New Orleans this weekend and stopped past Oceana. Needed food after a couple hand grenades . Our server was Ashleigh. She was phenomenal and not just cause we share a name. The food was quick and absolutely delicious!! We had the catfish po boy red bean and rice and gumbo. Loved the food definitely worth stopping in. I will be back.

Decided to try this place because there was a line outside but it was going pretty fast. We thought "Oh hey, long line this must be good!" When we got to the front of the line (we were a party of 9), the guy in charge of bringing customers in moved my group to the other side of the door outside. So first, he told us the wait would be 20 minutes (hence why we stayed in line), then he told us it'd be 10 minutes when he moved us out of the line. Then we ended up waiting an hour outside. About 20 people went into the restaurant that were in line after us but they were smaller parties so we didn't think anything of it. While we were waiting for an hour, a party of 11 and another party of 8 who came in line after us were seated before my party. We were extremely upset. One of the girls in our party had to go into the restaurant and talk to the manager. Thank goodness he was rational and seated us right away upstairs. When we got upstairs, I didn't understand why there were so many tables open but they couldn't seat us. Maybe they were understaffed? 

Our server was very nice and entertaining so that was nice. The manager also came to check up on us a few times to make sure we were doing fine. Food came out fast too.

I ordered the oysters and shrimp and crab gumbo. The oysters were good so I was very happy. The gumbo was also delicious. My date tried the alligator sausage and he still dreamt about it days later. 

TL;DR: Would go again if I had a smaller party next time. Wait too long and seating was not fair. Server and food was good tho.

Love this place....love the food, love the friendly staff and love the extras they give if you ask.

Had raw oysters here on my trip and fell in love....lots of side sauces, hot, medium, a couple types of horse radish...love it !!  And great prices and never a lineup...just on a side street off the "Quarter"..look for it...embrace it...love it.

I will not go to New Orleans without a visit here...such friendly people.  Started a conversation with one of the staff indicating I was going on hurricane tours and she offered me an inside view of the devastation with the provision we had to get out before dark.  Great tour guide and earned herself some tips and drinks for that !  Who could ask for better service !

Had the oysters and on other occasions the gumbo, crawdads and more !  For me, good food is great but when accompanied by good service...PRICELESS....
The best duck I have ever tasted. This includes Peking duck in China! Hands down, you should try this dish.

This is a great place to eat seafood, the portion size were very plentiful and were bursting with flavor!
The staff were extremely helpful and knowledgeable on the menu. Good music in the background but not too loud to where you couldn't have a conversation.

We are completely in love with this place! They offered a special yesterday that was absolutely delicious. So delicious in fact, that we took some friends there for dinner last night. Yep, that's right, we are there twice in one day - lunch AND dinner!! The service was very attentive and super-kind. If you go, we *strongly* encourage you to try the bread pudding with caramel rum sauce - you won't be sorry!

We just finished a wonderful dinner here.  Hubby had the seafood platter and I had the Cajun jambalaya pasta.  Both were delicious!!  The wait was fast and the service was fabulous.  I'm glad we tried it!

Food was excellent. They have the best seasoning on. Food. Not too spicey, just enough of the seasoning to make you know New Orleans. I had cat fish, shrimp, red bens and rice. It's small in size, but make up for it with the tasteful foods.

Waiter Jacob is really great. He knows the menu and make sure you are catered to as a customer.

You will find them down Burbon St on the left of the street.

Don't get the burger.  I was a little "blackened out" by this point, so I tried something different.  Big mistake.  everyone else said their food was good though.  Just, what ever you do, don't get the burger.  Frozen, dry, pre-made patty...  tasteless and dry.

Strong drinks, friendly wait staff, festive ambiance and the food portions are HUGE. Great for big groups and the food comes out fast. Its literally around the corner from Bourbon Street so its very convenient for dinner before drinking the night away. 

The only problem with this place is that it attracts big groups which can be a problem when they're already drunk and loud. I suppose they can't avoid that due to its close proximity to Bourbon Street. Definitely not a good date place but is perfect for dinner out with family and friends.

The staff is excellent and everyone is very welcoming and friendly. The jambalaya pasta was delicious. We also got the fried catfish and it came with a lot of food on the plate. The problem was it was too much food and expensive. Would have rather had a smaller portion for half the price. This place is just overly priced and that's my main reason for giving only 3 stars.
Crab cakes were delicious. Shrimp Po Boys were fantastic. Pamela was a delight. We'll definitely come back on our next trip.

Love this spot!  Never too busy, pretty easy to get a table.   The service was excellent !

We got the turtle soup, fresh raw oysters on the half shell, shrimp creole, and of course a few drinks!

The soup is spectacular ~ seriously exudes deliciousness.  Open late and definitely will be back!
The Cajun sausage breakfast was great.  The grits were awesome.  Great food and service.

Got a recommendation from my hotel on char grilled oysters and Oceana didn't fail to deliver. A few blocks up the street from my hotel and off Bourbon Street this some what obscure place comes across as your typical tourist location with a sign out from "Line Starts Here", fortunately I was somewhat early so I missed the dinner crowd. I sat at the bar and it was pretty full all over, and I took the menu and went for Oceana's famous Char-grilled Oysters. I ordered a dozen and what I got was incredible, there were 12 nice plump oysters that had been char-grilled with a unique zesty garlic and cream herb Cajun sauce, finished with a fresh blend of Parmesan and Romano cheeses. It was plenty food for me and I was completely satisfied.
Great food! My wife and I had the  Taste of New Orleans and it wonderful. We actually ended up splitting it when we noticed the large portions on other tables. It was more than enough for both of us

What a disappointment.  Was really looking forward to going here based on reviews.  Maybe I had unrealistic expectations.  We had a reservation and arrived a little early.  No problem.  Seated right away.  However, when we left, the line-up outside was about 20-30 deep and on the street.

My disappointment was NOT WITH THE STAFF, who were sharp, on top of things and very eager to assist and correct "oops" from kitchen.

Their Grilled Oysters were ok., not bad, but we had better at other places during the week.  Theirs was in a cream sauce that was nothing special, which had a slight bite to it.  Again, not a complaint.

Service was very good.  Attentive, supportive, but not effusive.  

Ordered the Redfish Ponchartrain with crawfish and a creamy shrimp sauce --special of the night.  The sauce was lovely, but the Redfish was very dry and overcooked.  Usually never send a dish back. But I spoke with the waitress, who spoke with a mgr who immediately removed it and returned a later with a replacement.  Nicely done.  Unfortunately, while the fish was not as dry, it was still, neither moist, nor flaky, nor what I had hoped for.  Their mustard greens on the side were outstanding -- moist, flavorful and delicious.

Spouse ordered the Blackened Ahi Tuna - med/rare.  It was also a bit overcooked.  I often make this at home and it might have been our fault for not ordering it rare instead of Med/Rare.  It was red inside, but also a bit dry.  The spices were soft, not strong, which is not necessarily a bad thing, just not up to our standards.

The bill with 2 wines and 2 beers approached $100.  We tipped well because staff support and service was what it was supposed to be.  However, the food was well below what we expected, and certainly below every other meal we ate either in the French Quarter, the CBD, Uptown, the Garden District, or in and around the suburbs.

I like that this place has the yelp check in deal. I had a burger it was very good, The staff was excellent and my Mamosa was perfect. Really liked the yelp deal offer. Small but good place for sure .

I dined at Oceana for the very first time & I truly enjoyed myself.The food was really good. My waitress Whitney was super nice & was everything you want a waitress to be. She answered every difficult question I had about food & guided me to the perfect choice. I chose the Madi Gras pasta which was a pleasure to my tummy, although the crawfish was a little too "fresh" for my liking I still enjoyed. My experience was truly one of a kind & I recommend anyone to come visit this place & definitely ask for Whitney!

I'll start by saying you have to try really hard to find a bad meal in New Orleans. So far I haven't had one. I'm giving Oceana 3 starts though it's more like a 3.5. I was in New Orleans with a party of 15 first timers and all of them agreed that in New Orleans you either have good food or great food. Oceana is good. If Oceana was in Sacramento I'd be estatic to have a restaurant that serves up quality New Orleans cuisine.  However, since Oceana is located in New Orleans I would say it's good, but not great. 

The best thing about Oceana is the location and the fact that they can accommodate a large party without setting a minimum dollar amount that one has to spend. The service was overall was good. The servers were friendly, filled our waters without having to be asked, and checked on us frequently.  I had the blackened duck which was a tasty dish. The flavor was nice, the meat was moist, and the sauce on top was delicious. However, it just wasn't on par with other meals I ate in New Orleans. My suggestion is if you have a large party, give Oceana a shot. They are very accommodating, the food isn't bad, and the servers are faultless.

If you have a smaller party go elsewhere.

This place gives you A LOT of food!!!!

We ordered the crabmeat cakes for an appetizer. They were flavorful but not as full of crab as I was expecting. Still good and came with a tasty sauce. 

My friend and I both got the catfish platters. They piled the platters HIGH with food. I didnt care for the hushpuppies but I dont care for anyone's hushpuppies so that has nothing to do with Oceana. My friend demolished hers. The seasoned fries were good too. The catfish was piping hot and flaky and divine!!!! It was melt in your mouth good and there was lots of it. 

For dessert, I got the Kahlua Mousse. Im sure I read it wrong. I thought it would be mousse but it was cake. A dense, wonderful, chocolately, velvety sliced of wonderful goodness!! My friend had the pecan pie. That was yummy too.

Great food and generous portions! I will definitely be getting catfish and dessert from here again!

Oceana Grill is a concierge's DREAM... I know in sending my guests their direction that they will make me look good!  Here is the tip of my hat to you dear Oceana, you delicious, delicious restaurant.

My first dining experience at Oceana was EPIC. Nearly 2 years ago, they were throwing a hospitality spread for industry folks in the Quarter.  Well, to my growling tummy's disappointment, all the food was gone when I finally got my lunch break :(  Never fear!  The manager scooted me up to the bar and asked me what I like, to which I responded as I always do... "Everything. Anything."  Moments later, I was (complimentary) showered with two entrees AND an appetizer platter... All that glorious food just sitting there, egging a fatty on.  Generous tip, check.

But my true weakness, is them damn crabcakes.  Oh, tender crab meat smothered in life-affirming crawfish-mushroom sauce... it is my crack.  When my parents visited over the holidays, I brought them here insisting that these are a New Orleans must-try... and all that boasting did not go unsettled.  Mom & Dad's review: Better than any crabcake we had in Maryland.

Closing note:  If Mark is still managing over there, cheers... y'all scored a good one.  :)

We ordered delivery to our hotel that was located in the French Quarter. The delivery was estimated to take 45-60 minutes, however, it was closer to 1 hour and 20 minutes. The delivery person was extremely polite, so that was a plus! 
We ordered a shrimp poboy, red beans and rice, and the bread pudding. The shrimp poboy was delicious; the red beans and rice were good but nothing super impressive; and the bread pudding was more like a muffin with a praline sauce to place on top. (The praline sauce, however, was amazing!)

Within my first hour in New Orleans I found myself at Oceana Grill.  The food was great and the prices are pretty good in general.  They are supposedly known for their crabcakes, but they seemed overpriced to me so I didn't even try them.

I loved their Alligator Sausage appetizer.
Great service and the food was delicious. I shared the red beans and rice with a friend and there was more than enough for the two of us.
Tourist trash food. Not worth walking in. Methinks this was a fail.

This was the first place we ate at in New Orleans and you could tell it's a tourist trap.  However, I ate a lot of Jambalaya during my trip and I have to say theirs was my favorite out of all the places I had it.  Other than that though the food looked mediocre and our waiter was pretty strange.   The best thing we had though was the chocolate mousse.  Heaven!  Overall it's pretty pricey for what you actually get.

Remember to check in and get 10% off your check.

Great food, huge portions. We ordered a bit too much food, but everything was tasty. The seafood stew is very southern and warms you up inside out.

Visiting Nola with my boyfriend, we wanted to try the local oysters.  Oceana's Famous Oysters did not disappoint.  DEE-LISH!!  So was the main course, Redfish Oceana.  Both were cooked to perfection and came smothered in their respective sauces.  Plus, the service actually felt nice and genuine, two traits that are sadly lacking in other restaurants and bars around Bourbon Street.  We will be back for more on our next visit!
Great food!! Good portion! Manager was very polite and helpful! Try this place you will love it!!

I just knew I had posted a review here. Oceana is a MUST when in the French Quarter. Try the BBQ shrimp or the Crawfish Etoufeè. Guarantee you will be licking the plate afterward. 4 stars only bc service is a bit slow (although it's very busy here) you will stand outside to wait to get in for 20-30 mins on a good day. Inconvenient but a testament to the stellar food.

I came here with a tour guide (from a Taste of Nawlins) .. they have a great seafood gumbo that doesn't contain pork.. I loved it .. the service was great. And the ppl were friendly enough. I would definitely revisit .

An overall ok spot. Super touristy, pretty pricey but in line with the rest of french quarter. Two stars because we ordered a dozen oysters and only got 11 (count them if you order!). Cajun fries were good. Bananas foster ice cream cake had no bananas to speak of. Food was fairly disappointing, service was merely ok, bathrooms downright nasty, but you're going for the location right off Bourbon Street.

My friend and I had just flown in from New York and were looking for something to eat before going out on Bourbon Street and stumbled upon Oceana. It's much more quiet than anything on Bourbon but it's absolutely worth the stop. 

My suggestion: the fried catfish platter and the Taste of New Orleans.

Came here for breakfast and ordered the Eggs St. Louis which is the eggs benedict on an english muffin with tomato, and a proportionally very generous amount of fresh, and meaty lump crab meat!  If I could eat this every day I would-so big I could not finish it!

Lovely interior courtyard seating with umbrellas.  Attentive staff.

Amazing art by local artist Simon.  My favorite was the sculpture in the courtyard with an homage to New Orleans music and Bayou wildlife-made out of a keg piled high sculpturally with a variety of vintage musical instruments and spires emanating out of the top with symbols of crawfish and other Bayou area wildlife.

FYI-Funny part was the overhead music playing on the patio-it sounded like someone singing in Reggae fashion about cooking up raccoon among other things in a big pot with cajun seasonings and inviting people over to eat. Absolutely hilarious to an outsider and surprising to hear over breakfast (4/28/17). I have to say it was an interesting historical and culinary education (the song) in itself.

About the Writer/Singer of the Song-
FYI2-The song is by local Big Chief Monk Boudreaux and it is called "Footsteps!"
http://www.fboo.com/artists/jboudreaux/jboudreaux.html

Listen to "Footsteps"=It will make you smile-and is quite interesting..
http://www.fboo.com/audio/jboudreaux/Footsteps.m4a
Service was AMAZING and very friendly...the BBQ shrimp, shrimp Po boys, blackened chicken Po boy, and sweet tea were so good!!! Will definitely come back here any time we are in NOLA

This was our third visit to Oceana. Our waitress, jimika was trying to be helpful bjt was so overbearing it was uncomfortable.  Every 2 minutes she was over us trying to make small talk.  It was annoying to us and the other tables.  Food was good so we will be back but will not be served bh her or we will walk out.
The Taste of New Orleans was superb! The alligator was awesome! The catfish lafoute was so fresh! Definitely recommend to all of my friends and family!

DELIGHTFUL! Which should be expected as when you approach the restaurant there is a line of hungry foodies waiting outside. Despite the line and lack of reservation we were seated quickly. This restaurant is HUGE! Multiple stories, bars, etc. 

Let me start off by saying that my husband and I aren't the biggest seafood lovers. But when in Rome, right? We opted for the crab cakes as a starter. This was only the second time I had ever tried these and was amazed! The cakes were crisp, crab was mild, and the amount of spice was just right (I do recommend having a bottle of TUMS on hand). My husband ordered the red beans and rice for his entree and I the fried catfish. The servings were huge and the food was delicious. And to top everything off, our service was impeccable. 

This was our first time in New Orleans and have since booked another trip for this coming summer. Oceana will definitely be accommodating us for another southern meal!
Excellent food great service nice ambience flavor of the city. Nice and casual atmosphere

Not worth the hype! Blackened Redfish was cool and very over cooked. The jambalaya was lacking in a lot. Tasted like instant rice in tomatoe sause. The local amber beer was outstanding! Though it took a long time coming.

Came here after we saw a guy deliver oysters at our hotel in the elevator who was very enthusiastic about their oysters lol. Thanks to him I am very happy that this was the last place I ate before returning home. I tried multiple dishes and they were all delicious! The food came out quick which didn't really matter since we were enjoying the weather! My friend's and I were all satisfied with our meals and will come back if we are ever in NOLA again. I would highly recommend this place if you love seafood, oysters, and Cajun food!
The food was mediocre, a little overrated for what I heard about this place. But our server Ben was awesome and accommodating. The speed of service was on point too!

The oysters were very good.  the gumbo was good, but I'm not sure about the little crabs.  a little messy and hard to get at.  Crab cakes are pretty amazing.  Bloody Mary is also amazing. I like the courtyard On a nice day.  4.5 stars.

Gator Bites, Crawfish Etouffee, Gumbo, Shrimp Po Boy and Swamp Tea are to die for!!! Definitely was a highlight of my first time being in New Orleans! I will tell my family and friends to hit this place up when they are in town.

Natalie our waitress was great. Everything we had was amazing. Crabcakes. Gumbo. Taste of New Orleans (red rice and beans and crawfish etoufee) and the barbecued shrimp. Heads up, the barbecued shrimp is only shrimp with 3 or 4 small pieces of baguette so if you're hungry dont get that or order an appetizer with it. Otherwise, great spot!

This place was good. Looks a bit commercially (think Red lobster) from the vibe & decor, but the food is good. I got the blackened shrimp Cesar salad, friend got blackened salmon Cesar  salad & we stared BBQ shrimp & eggplant sticks. All were good. My other friend got the gumbo which she liked. The drinks here, I found, contrary to all other things NOLA, were a bit weak. The place, like many places in NOLA, was kept superrrrrrr cold! Worth a visit if in the area, but I prefer one of the zillions of other options with a more authentic local feel. Waitress (Bridget) was great & super friendly.
Our first breakfast stop every year we make our Mardi Gras trip. Some of the best Bloody Mary's in the Quarter AND you will be satisfied with any & every omelet on the menu.

Great place to try for New Orleans food!! It was recommended by the locals around the town and the food was different from what I usually have in California so it was a great experience! It was also tasty! I ordered the seafood platter so I got to try fried oysters, catfish, and shrimp!

It was okay...but not really.

I was expecting so much more from my first meal in New Orleans.  Everything just tasted as though it had been sitting around for a while.  The worst part was the addition of some disgusting spaghetti sauce to my jambalaya.  Ugh...I cannot relive this one.

Definitely love it... our server was excellent. Always on top of everything. His name is john, he walked us through new orleans best dishes, very friendly and helpful. We ordered the oysters, the gimbalaya is a muuuuust you better order the big one , I ordered the small one and I wanted some more bc it was delicious.. but is a good portion mmm the poboy was good and the pasta spicy and really good but the best is the ganbalaya!! The price was ok and the ambience nice and it has a good location.. now we are ready to continue and take a walk, also the ditty martini was good.

Had breakfast there twice in July, blissfully unaware they had been on Kitchen Nightmares a few months prior. First time, I ordered off the breakfast menu and thought it was good, not great. The alligator sausage was pretty bland  The rest of the family loved what they had. Second time, I opted for one of the sampler platters, so I coulld get gumbo, étouffée, and jambalaya. Loved it. Also, one of the better Sazeracs I had in NOLA.

Awful food, awful service. Tourist trap of the highest order. 

Oysters oceana were rubbery and clearly overcooked. Such a shame.

Crab cakes were short on crab but generous on stuffing. Served lukewarm.

Husband's sausage and alligator po boy was bad as well. You can have better from any po boy shop in nola for $5.

Bloody Mary was not made from fresh ingredients and was not cold. So gross. 

Creme Brule was disgusting. A deep bowl of cream and not much else.

Did you think maybe the service might have saved the meal? Nope. Entrees came right on top of appetizers and the waiter didn't clear the appetizer plates for a while. We had to shift everything around ourselves. He was quick to bring our check though, before we even finished dessert. Then he didn't come back to pick it up for 10 minutes. Delightful.

The best part was that the whole meal came to $80 (with tip).

we were referred over to this place by a local , his exact words were "best food in town,check it out and if it disappoints you, il be here, and il buy you a beer. if you love it just thank me" so we took his suggestion, we were seated as soon as we entered. the service without a doubt was the best iv ever gotten, i even told the waitress that. she was amazing her name was JIMIKA, super friendly and helpful. and the food was great, large portions, no wait. the whole thing was a great experience . i will definitely be back. and i kept my word and thanked the local after!

I am a local and extremely disappointed. Do not waste your time and especially don't waste your money!! I even wrote a complaint card and no respond. That tells you that they don't care as long as they already got your money especially if you are a tourist, you tried them once.

Charming little dive bar just off of Bourbon St. The interior is somewhat glum, but the staff was so friendly I hardly noticed it. They even plugged my cell phone in for me as I was running out of juice and was meandering around New Orleans for a day.

I had a lip smacking lunch of gator sausage, a fried oyster po boy, and a miller lite. If I just ate like this every day the people in my life would be much happier because I'd never complain about anything. The sandwich was dynamite - way too may fried oysters on a soft hero with a spicy remou8lade style sauce. Miller lite is just the thing to wash this sucker down. I'd totally go here for a quick meal the next time I find myself in NO.

The food was good but not excellent.  The gator bites appetizer were awesome or so says my husband and stepson. They say I should give it a four star but my meal was just a three star and so was my daughters.

My hubby and i weren't that hungry so we only ordered 2 appetizers... a dz of raw oysters and the barbeque shrimp. The oysters were fresh and v. good, but man.... the barbeque shrimp was excellent.  I love all the seasoning in the barbeque sauce.  LOVE IT!

The staff is very nice too.  Even though we only ordered so little food, they were still v. professional and courteous.   We'll be back again!
We had the food delivered .. catfish platter and po-boy fried alligator.. the food was cold when it arrived an hour later, therefore we did not experience a good meal. We were disappointed ..

Crab cakes, Crab Cakes , Crab Cakes .....maybe if I say it again you will order it! Like many other reviews said and I will gladly reemphasize these things are wonderful and covered in crawfish gravy. The mix drinks are very good as well!

This place was so good! We are in from out of town and our waitress Jordan was wonderful. We had the fried alligator bites (personally liked the fried over the grilled) and I had the bbq shrimp. Everything was awesome and the drinks were on point as well. Thanks again to Jordan for a great evening. This is a must visit if you are in town!!!

My dad and I went here on the recommendation from a random guy in our hotel. He said he goes here every time he's in the city. Well, I'm glad we went here. My dad ordered the special - redfish with a crawfish buerre blanc style sauce over jambalaya with a side of veggies. He loves blackened anything, but unfortunately his sweat glands do not. I've never seen my dad sweat so much during a meal, or not be able to finish due to the proportions. He did it's the best blackened fish he's ever had. That's a good rec. I ordered blackened catfish with jambalaya and veggies. Oh man, that rice was delish. I love blackened fish as well, so yummy. We got an alligator something or other as the app - it was okay, nothing to write home about. I would definitely recommend this place, base on our meals alone. I can't vouch for it all, but I'm sure it's great.

Ordered delivery to our hotel, fried seafood platter and gumbo and pecan pie.  Everything was absolutely delicious one of the best meals we had in NOLA.  The pecan pie was absolutely divine! It is definitely a must have.

We went to Oceana based on some comments we read when searching for good restaurants in the FQ.  The hostess was very nice.  Our server was very nice too but seemed a little spread thin at times.  My husband ordered  red beans and rice with sausage...the taste was good but there were only two small pieces of sausage in the bowl.  Also, the beans were way over cooked and mushy (more like a bowl of liquid refried beans).  I ordered the crab cakes and was very disappointed.  It was more like a croquet...the crab was completely shredded and there were no chunks of crab meat at all.  They were a little too fishy tasting for me as well.  The creamy mushroom and crawfish sauce on top was good and I would have enjoyed that over rice MUCH MUCH MORE than the two fishy crab 'croquets' that I didn't eat.  We ended our meal with some creme brûlée which was pretty good.   I am sad to say I will probably never go back as the meal wasn't that good, the meat was scarce, and consequently the value lacking.  But the staff was great if that's what you want!

A very nice, and affordable, place for a quick bite to eat or for a full sit down dinner.  Everything looked great, and our dishes were very tasty.  We especially enjoyed the "sauciness" of each of our entrees.  The Chicken Alfredo and the Creole sampler plate were awesome.  Our waiter David was very attentive.  Putting the Oceana Grill on the "must return to" list for our next visit to the Big Easy.
Bad food (aside from one dish: Cajun jambalaya pasta, which was cold). Service wasn't good either. Severely overpriced, even for the location.

Great place to fill your desire for fried fish and seafood in New Orleans, by Bourbon St but not right in the middle of it.  Great service -we sat by the bar- and Monte was helpful and really nice, we'd recommend going there for a meal in NOLA.

We orderd Louisiana New Orleans  crabcakes appetizer and fork and knife ribs. in the French Quarter's . The atmosphere and taste of New Orleans was all we expected t We  are looking forward to the nice walk down Bourbon Street and  two hour parking ROAD TRIP 2016

One of my favorites in NOLA....Crawfish fettuccine is off the hook....had the pleasure of sitting at the upstairs bar and was served by Paula and Caleb...very entertaining...(she loves the song "hey, hey, Paula)....service was awesome and food was excellent as always...will always stop when in the area...

Gross. I gave it one star for the awesome service. Food cold and gritty, very overly sweet touristy drinks. Would not return. Wanted to give this place a fair shot even after hearing of it's reputation. The duck tasted like freeze dried mystery meat. Just not good.
Awesome! Tried alligator meat for the first time!!! Open late. Waitress was super nice!!! Come try it if you have not yet.
Louisiana crab cakes!! So good, the garlic mash was excellent too. I'd love to try everything on this menu. Great, friendly service too, seated quickly open late is a big plus.

My boyfriend and I went here for our first dinner in New Orleans.  After fighting through the stench of Bourbon Street we found this gem.  There was a line outside but we waited for no more than 10 minutes.  We were seated in the back.  No live music but they did have music playing.

Waiter recommended the stuffed crab cakes for an appetizer.  So good!  Two large crab cakes were delicious.  I ordered the Seafood Pasta for my entree.  It was good but not life changing.  Boyfriend ordered the Catfish stuffed filet special.  He loved it! 

The dirty martinis I ordered were lacking on the alcohol but that's not what this restaurant was known for and I'm sure if I ordered a voodoo drink or some frozen concoction it would have been great.  Would definitely come back!

LATE NIGHT LIFE SAVER!
After a heavy-duty krewe day and night we revived at Oceana. When we arrived the place was packed, but friendly staff found a table and seated us right away. In minutes orders were take, drinks and food arrived.

Delicious ... They keep batter on fried seafood simple flour. Great.
Reccomend king Caleb- cinnamon roll
Get the roast duck. Don't ask. Just get it. A flavor orchestra!! Not the best decor, but the food I had was two thumbs up.

I will tell you what, this place is a life saver late night in NOLA. There is not a whole lot of late night options and my husband and I are pretty selective eaters, especially when dining out.

   This place had great service, impeccable. Our waitress was very nice and attentive. 

   Our food was very good, on the heavy side, but it was that sauce-i-licious New Orleans eats.

So great! Service was fast, three of us split blackened alligator, 12 charbroiled oysters, and the taste of new orleans. 

It was all amazing - if you haven't tried alligator yet, this is the place to do it! The oceana sauce on the oysters was incredible but didn't overwhelm the charbroiled flavor of the oysters. The taste of new orleans was a perfect mix of seafood and cajun/creole in one plate. we were all very happy with our meal!!

We ate at Oceana today for lunch and it did not disappoint. My son and sister n law shared the seafood platter and it was super. My husband got the crawfish omelette and although he said it was different, he loved it and ate every bite. I had the taste of New Orleans and it was decent. Seemed reheated and the sausage was overcooked. We have been here before and had other dishes that were amazing which is why it gets 4 stars. Big plus is that the staff is friendly and attentive!

I LOVE NEW ORLEANS!!! And Oceana's is a must when visiting. You get NOLA's extraordinarily friendly service and  great tasting cuisine. Any of the food there is delicious, but I feel in love with the bourbon pecan pie.

This place was awsome, it was 12 of us and the service was awesome Bridget was over server, the food was great, the staff was outstanding, the ambiance was just as great, the prices were great can't wait to take another road trip to Louisiana to go back to this restaurant. 

If you're ever in Louisiana for whatever reason stop at Oceana's have breakfast lunch and dinner you won't regret it! 

Sarina & Front Runners MC

A must when we come to New Orleans, Oceana serves great seafood and steaks! Their new Cajun fries are the BOMB though! Wait time is short so don't let the line fool you! With three floors they move people in and out quick with great service! And all their cocktails come with a little dry ice to give it that special NOLA flair!

Was there yesterday with a friend. Yelp reviews were high with a ton of reviews so we gave it a shot. Very touristy vibe if you're into that. I'm not personally. The waitress came and she was excellent. Told us that she had tried all the food on the menu over a long period of time and gave us recommendations. Later after we had a yelp coupon she told us that she had only been there a couple of weeks...Regardless it's all about the food right? I had Cajun pasta with chicken but I added crawfish tails. It was ok. Like something I could get at Applebee's back home. The flash fried tails were meh. Not bad just unremarkable. I recommend other options before going here.

B&B burger was really mediocre, was commercially prepared and it was hard to tell it was blue cheese. Service was slow, It didn't seem to be the kitchen but couldn't be sure. Fries were limp, quantity doesn't make up for lack of quality
It was marginally better than McDonald's and a lot more expensive.

I am by far the least experienced when it comes to the food of New Orleans but I can say that the famous oysters here are nothing that I have ever tried before and they were delicious. I also had The Taste of New Orleans which was Creole jambalaya and the dish was simple, creamy and very good. Service was good, prices were fair, and wait times were short. I would stop by again especially for more oysters!

First night in NOLA on a business trip is when I went here.  Everything was magnificent.

Started with a Dixie beer and a dozen on the half-shell.  What a great way to start a meal.  My friend had the char-grilled oysters and they were so good that I kinda wished that I had ordered them instead.

Entree was the redfish oceana - cooked perfectly and topped with a cream sauce w/crawfish tails.  What a great pairing.  The only downside was that I was not that fond of the vegetable side dish.

One big detractor - mice on the patio.  Maybe it would be better not to seat people close enough to the giant mousetraps that they can watch the wildlife during dinner.  Yes, I understand the french quarter has rodents; no, I don't want to watch them climbing the wall within arm's reach of my table.
Great food, great customer service and we received our food very quick! Definitely recommend coming here while visiting NOLA!!
We really enjoyed the crab cakes and the Cajun jambalaya pasta!  Great flavors and the crab cakes were huge!  We also tried their oysters...they were ok.  The oysters at Acme were definitely better!

First off this place is awesome ! Wait staff was solid and food was spot on. I had a seafood platter which consisted of fried catfish, fried oysters, fried shrimp and some other fried things I can remember haha. All in all it was delicious and definitely worth it , make sure you stop here for great food !

I really liked the atmosphere, the hostesses, and our server Mike. We ordered the seafood gumbo, the Blackened redfish etoufee and the Fried SHrimp platter.

the Redfish was spicy but not necessarily flavorful, the fried shrimp were great.

Nothing else was really memorable, an A OK choice for New Orleans fair, Amp up the flavor and I'll be back!
Food was delish and fresh! Service was great! Oyster appetizers were off of hook.. blacken catfish was excellent!

On our last night in New Orleans we decided to try Oceana Grill for dinner after a very disappointing experience with Bourbon House.  I was skeptical but the service was absolutely great and the food was excellent.  Our waiter Roderick was extremely friendly and attentive.  I give it a 5 out of 5 and will go again if I return to the area.  GREAT JOB!!

The Red Lobster/Olive Garden version of Cajun!  Or better yet you have to be drunk stumbling in off of Bourbon Street to think this place is great!

We actually just ate there, it's a Sunday evening, and it was walk in, no waiting.  The 1 star is for the service, she was very good.  My husband ordered the Gator Bites, half blackened/half fried.  The blackened was over spiced, in fact the gator was lost in the seasoning, and they were barely warm.  The fried was better but still not hot.  I would guess that they were sitting back in a warmer waiting to be served.  In fact the entire meal seemed to be something heated and waiting to be served, nothing struck me as freshly prepared.  My husband had the blackened catfish, greens and jambalaya.  He said it was fine, I tried his greens, pleasantly surprised, but nothing hot, except the plate itself.  I had Cajun jambalaya and pasta.  The server suggested blackened shrimp, after the over-seasoned gator bites I was fearing my pasta.  Overall it was ok, still not hot and the i was overcooked; seasoning was ok.  When the server asked if we wanted dessert, we couldn't say no fast enough, we weren't about to spend anymore money there.  For just over $63 with fountain drinks to boot it was the most disappointing meal we've had in the French quarter.

If you want to try good Louisiana cooking this place is the really really good. We had shrimp poboys, shrimp gumbo and crab cakes. Everything was very good. Food out came less then 10 min. For desert we ordered creme brûlée. I am not a fan, but New Orleans is the place to have one. Creme brûlée was delightful, very light and cooked to perfection.

This was an awesome restaurant! The food was so good and the service from our waitress, Dorothy, was phenomenal! She took the time to point out places to see while we were visiting New Orleans. I would definitely go back again for the food and service.

Being born and raised in New Orleans ....I was very disappointed by the food but actually not surprised. The food was very very mediocre...more like tourist food then real New Orleans food. My boyfriend and I order the seafood platter. It was a very small plate with small portions of food. It came with catfish, fried shrimp, hush puppy's, and fried oysters. All of the food was dry, from the catfish dwn to the oysters , just terrible. Our food was warm not steaming hot, it was as if they warmed it in the microwave or something. I will never return to the restaurant for some food. I would rather get a hot dog at the hot dog stand on bourbon.

Went based on every cab drivers recommendation but so glad I did the service was the  friendliest I've encountered in NOLA, thanks to Ezra...but really every person greeted & thanked me....so refreshing.  The food had everything I wanted to try and was great.  Will definitely one back & highly recommend.

This was the first restaurant we checked out in New Orleans and it didn't disappoint. We made a reservation for 12:30 and it seemed really crowded when we first got there, but as the hour passed it slowed down a lot. The service was quick and friendly. We ordered gator bites as an appetizer and it was basically like chicken nuggets, so I thought they were delicious. For my main course I tried the blackened catfish po'boy. I didn't know what a po'boy was before this, and it's basically just a type of sandwich. It's a messy thing to eat but the blackened catfish was so good so it was worth it. It was cooked just right and had a great flavor to it. The fries were very crispy and enjoyable too. The atmosphere of the restaurant is small and nothing really spectacular, but the food makes up for it. I would definitely recommend this place!

This place is definitely a must! Great food and amazing service, especially our server Whitney, was definitely the best. Made sure our drinks were filled, checked on us enough without making us feel rushed! The food was delicious! Highly recommen the crab cakes! Just give it a try you won't be disappointed! Word of advice make online reservation! We did and zipped right past the long line waiting to be seated!

And in for an early dinner. Arrived a little before 4 hoping to avoid a wait. We pretty much achieved the goal. Had to wait maybe five minutes. We were sat upstairs. After walking around all day the air felt amazing. The music was great. We all loved it. 

Ordered the gator bites as an appetizer. Half blackened and half fried. Both were great

The kids and I Split the crawfish fries, gator sausage Poboy, and crab cakes as our meal. The gator tail was far superior to the sausage. Crab cakes were good. The fries were the best. 

Biggest annoyance and kinda damper on the evening was when food came. For the poboy we asked for the coleslaw and pickles on the side since the kids didn't eat it. Our waitress was actually the one who asked if we wanted to do that. When the food came it was on there. She noticed it and asked if that was ok. I said no since the kids don't eat it and we had asked for it on the side. She took it to the back and all they did was scrape it off. Bread is cheap. No reason to give us now soggy bread for your mistake. We ended up eating it with no bread. 

Jeremy ordered red fish pontchartrain. He said it was amazing. 

We were too full for dessert but they looked great. 

The waitress was attentive. However, my son tried to interact with her and she ignored him. 

The portions were all a nice size. I really went back and forth with the four or five stars but ended up going with four because of the clear just not caring about our happiness.
Consistent with service and food the wait time for non reservations and location isn't the best so ubering or taxi will be your best option to get to this location.

We arrived at 5:30 for dinner. We were greeted promptly and given the option of patio seating or indoors.  We chose indoor seating and were greeted quickly and cordially by Sara, our wait staff.  She was very attentive and helpful with the menu.  I ordered a dozen oysters on the half shell.  The oysters were fresh and amazing in size and taste.  I would definitely go back for the oysters and try some of the other entrees.. For entrees my wife had the crab cakes and I had the barbequed shrimp. Both entrees were delicious and nice portions. The atmosphere was casual.

I had the crab cakes platter my husband had the jambalaya pasta. We ordered bar b que shrimp as Appetizer. The bar b que shrimp was very good. This was actually one of the best meals we had while in New Orleans.

Excellent service and good food.
We had gator bites, BBQ shrimp, eggplant fries and fried shrimp platter. Awesome.

Loved the Oceana Grill in NOLA. It's a fun place and very energetic. I wasn't very hungry but how can you not come to NOLA and not eat? We stopped in from our 6hr drive from Atlanta and couldn't be more happy. I had the chargrilled Oysters that were plum and juicy. The sauce on the oysters were a great added touch. I also had a cup of Gumbo that warmed my heart of hearts. My mom who is pickier than I am enjoyed her food throughly. My son had the crab cake fettuccine and my husband had the trio. My son decided to get a desert that would knock you out of the park as it oozed with a bourbon sauce... And more importantly the wait was only 15min. We scored big time.

On our first stop for lunch after arriving in New Orleans, we decided to try this place out after noticing their advertisement in the airport. It is located on the corner of Bourbon & Conti Streets. 

We sat upstairs in which the decor was pleasant. We decided to have their Louisiana Crabmeat Cakes, Seafood Gumbo, and a lunch feature for that day, a Salmon Sandwich. The Louisiana Crabmeat Cakes and the Salmon Sandwich were excellent. We were not too fond of the Gumbo. 

Service was excellent and suggest their Bloody Marys. We also tried their drink called the Sazerac. I would not suggest that drink unless you enjoy licorice. Overall, it was a good experience, prices are average. We would go back their again to try a few more items on their menu.

Choose this place for my birthday meal.  Our server David was great.  Started with the chargrilled oysters even non oyster fan Hubby enjoyed.  I had the Oceania Redfish, Hubby had the redfish special and Sweetie Pie the shrimp pasta, all excellent.  Was surprised with a bread pudding for my birthday.  All the staff was cheerful and friendly, would not hesitate to return!

This place was recommended by the lady at our hotel front counter for the "best sea food in town". We ordered the oysters Rockefeller with crab and boiled shrimp. It was some of the best seafood I've ever had. Definitely would recommend this place to anyone looking for amazing seafood. Our waitress Jennifer was amazing and extremely helpful with her recommendations for our meal. 
Update: Came back a second time before heading back home. Our waitress Whitney recommended the Oceana classic oysters that was just as tasty as the Rockefeller ones we had the previous trip. She was super friendly and made me feel at home

Came here my first night in New Orleans. Quite charming decor but the food tasted so chain-y. The food tasted more like I was eating at a mediocre hometown buffet or TGI Fridays than real Cajun food. Don't come here if you want a real taste of New Orleans. Location is a kick though, very raunchy people in the streets and there was strippers walking around.

While I could have chosen a more mom-and-pop, and less touristy place to visit in New Orleans, I only had 1 night there, so I wanted to try as many local specialties I could in one sitting, and this was the restaurant I found in the French Quarter that served it all at a reasonable price.

For my parents and me, I ordered the Taste of New Orleans (creole jambalaya, crawfish etouffe, and red beans with rice and smoked sausage), the Grilled Cajun Alligator Sausage Po Boy, a cup of seafood gumbo, and a cup of turtle soup.

All of the dishes were pretty good. I like the Taste of New Orleans for its variety. The alligator sausage was very good. I expected the alligator to be a bit tougher, but then again, it's in sausage form. If I had tough sausage, that would be a bit of a problem. It was my first time trying turtle soup, so I had nothing to compare it to; are they usually a little on the sour side? Nevertheless, I still ate the entire cup. As for the seafood gumbo, I've had better.

Service wasn't anything special, but everything came out at the right time. Drinks came in huge, plastic glasses, which I guess is good for the hot, sticky environment. Got to stay hydrated!

Overall, a good place to try a little bit of everything, but if you want to go for something more authentic, try another restaurant.

We ordered online and the order came in fragile packaging where the food container is broken upon arrival.  The restaurant resent a fresh batch our order afterwards. However the initial order shrimp in the salad was missing.  Had to ask for a refund for the salad as three hours have already passed since our initial order going back and forth with the eat24 agent.

We ate here twice because they have great food and their service is really nice! The server gave us free dessert because we told them how great their food was. Very nice people and their place is very comfy too.. I will recommend this and come back here when I get the chance!!

Not bad... normally eating at a place like this means I get the single chicken dish on the menu and it tastes like it's been in the freezer too long. Surprisingly, everything I ate here was good (and shellfish-free).

I had the fried eggplant sticks, the blackened chicken with jambalaya and greens, and bread pudding. My husband nearly died over the fried shrimp platter. Definitely a good choice right near Bourbon St.

Well it's my last night in NOLA and I wanted some fried shrimp and my husband wanted some crawfish étouffée. We looked this place up on Yelp and asked some locals and it was recommended. Also Yelp had a 10% off coupon on it. 

We got here around 6:00. Heard it gets pretty crowded. We started off with 2 appetizers. The crab cake and the BBQ shrimp. My favorite of the 2 were the crab cakes. They were so good!  They even had some crawfish on the top. Great flavoring. The BBQ shrimp were ok, but mainly I wanted to try them because they've been on just about every menu we've looked at. They're good too but not as good as the crab cake. The shrimp also have a little kick to them. 

The fried shrimp were good. More than I could eat though. I got the garlic mashed potatoes with them instead of French fries. The cole slaw was good but had more mayonnaise than I prefer. My husband enjoyed the crawfish étouffée. He had no complaints. 

Mike was our waiter and he was very attentive and helpful. I give him 5 stars. 

By the time we were leaving there was a long line of people wanting to get in. I'm glad we got in early. I hate waiting. 

This was a good choice of restaurants for our last night to remember why we love coming to New Orleans so much. They have such wonderful food here!!! I'll be hitting the gym all next week!!
The food was cooked to perfection. Our waiter Henry was very attentive and so helpful. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting New Orleans and are in the French Quarter.

If you are looking for a quick New Orleans style dinner or lunch in the quarter, this is the place to go. We've come to just sit at the bar and have a snack, once with a baby  and once with a large group of 8. Every time the service is quick, accurate and attentive. They are prepared for large parties and have ample seating with two stories. The food is comparable if not better to some of the nearby tourist competitors ( I won't mention names) and the price is slightly cheaper. Their blackening season is spot on, as well as the crab cakes.  The fried eggplant was also surprisingly nice. They have all the classics: alligator, oysters, etouffee, red beans, hush puppies and  offer a few sampler platters.

We had the chargrilled oyster served with bread and crab cake appetizer.  Both were really good.  The chargrilled oysters were are favorite.  Bread that they served with oysters was like a hard French roll. Would rather have a soft French bread.
We LOVED Oceana Grill so much that we ate here for dinner three nights in a row!!  Every night we tried something different and never found anything we did not like!
There's been a line each time we looked at this restaurant. We had to try it! It was all good. Service was great!

I watched the kitchen nightmare episode on this place and still decided to try them out! The wait wasn't bad we got a table fairly quickly.. the moment we got inside we were frozen solid!! It's SOOO COLD in there.. the hostess was wearing a fleece jacket and all the waiters are wearing long sleeves.. our waiter was polite but when my friend advised him she wasn't a fan of the fried crawfish he acted offended went and got a manager.. the manager came over and said "did you even eat any?" How would she have known if she liked it if didn't eat any?? Not apologetic at all.. After that fiasco our waiter barely came back.. the food was good, but maybe Gordon needs to come back and talk to them about customer service!

DELICIOUS food and great service! Loved the fact that it is right on Bourbon Street so we got to walk to the bars right after a meal (and three rounds of tequila shots..lol). Oysters were fantastic and so was the seafood platter. My friend and I ordered about 4 different items to share and were completely stuffed. Now, there were a couple of complications with our orders, which delayed some people (total of 7 of us) to eat, but as people in the restaurant industry, we understand that sometimes things just do not go as planned. Definitely a restaurant I will consider going back to...AFTER I have tried the rest of the ones with high ratings.

So we had a rocky start here..My cousin booked a reservation for this resturant about 3 or 4 months back (for Essence weekend), but when we arrived on our reservation date our reservation was disregarded and we were told upon a arrival they don't hold reservations on essence weekend. The hostess was rude to my cousin and told her there was nothing they could do. Didn't send a manager out or anything. Ughh not to mention when we arrived at 1pm there was a line around the corner. So we made do and found seats at the bar. 

This turned out to work for the best. Our bartender took care of our every need(it was 5 of us) and asked us every few minutes if we were good. She was amazing--I can't remember her name is what sucks! Anyway, I ordered the Mumm Prosecca. It was ok in taste but I surely felt it in my system which made me not mind the taste after a while. I also tried the house  tropical hurricane which tasted Amazing!!! The bartender told me what was in it but all I remember is it was rum based! Also please note the drink can be made incorrectly---came back later that day and the guy bartender did not make it as good. 

Now for the food: 

1. Alligator bites-- were sooooo good! You can get them grilled or fried or order it half and half. I never had grilled alligator but the grilled and fried were both good! 

2. House Gumbo-again soooooooo good! OMG some of the best gumbo I ever had. the house gumbo is a must if you come here! 

3. Shrimp POBOY-you can't be in New Orleans and not get a POBOY! Oceana made my POBOY very good, i just wish my bun was a little softer, other than that I enjoyed!

I am not sure if it was because it was essence weekend when I went that it was soo crowded (both times I went) but I highly suggest you make a reservation.  Or If you don't mind and you have a small group I would sit at the bar ---they are more attentive and faster service! I wish they had kept my cousin's reservation, other than that I really enjoyed my meal here.

Third day in New Orleans and this is the first time we had great food AND great service. Shout out to Deanne - great service has been hard to come by out here. Even the guy who brought our food was nice. 

We had today's special, crab cake Benedict, and the French toast (which is on French bread *droool). Both were so good!! 

Came at 10am on Saturday and got seated right away. Thanks Oceana!!

Such a great meal! Our server was great, our drinks were great, and the food was great! We both had the redfish and although we made several requests, nothing was forgotten, and it was a delicious night! Walked out stuffed!

We loved the "barbecued gulf shrimp" appetizer! The "taste of New Orleans" and BBQ ribs were great too.  The place was packed but there are at least 3, maybe 4, floors and the line outside moved surprisingly quickly. Great meal for a reasonable price.

I seriously don't know how this place got such high reviews.  We came here as a party of 5 for an early breakfast.  With almost no one in the restaurant, the service was slow.  Maybe the waiter was not fully awake yet?  My kid accidentally spilled water by our table and after I told the waiter, he didn't do a thing to mop up the little puddle so it just sat there the whole time.  We ordered the recommended crepe breakfasts, and the crepes were dense and thick and partially soggy from the filling.  The filling of veggies and cheese was so bland.  Despite the huge portion, there was very little seafood.  Oh yeah, I found small hair in my crepe and stopped eating it.  Never told the server because I doubt he would've done anything.  And at the end, the server automatically added 18% for tip bc we had 5 people??!!  We only had 3 orders.  By far the worst restaurant that we had in New Orleans.
The breakfast we ate here was really good; dinner was not quite as good. Too bad Moe the owner is such a douchebag.

Visited during a busy weekend (Essence fest). Around 8:30pm on Sat night. There was a line outside which 'almost' discouraged us but.. it moved quickly. Short 5 min wait. We walked up 3 flights of stairs to be seated. Noticed several empty tables so i wasn't sure why there was a line at all? 
The service, atmosphere, location was great. It looks like a hole in the wall bar from the outside but is huge & very nice inside (wonderful surprise).
I had the crabcakes w/ crawfish sauce, Others had the cajun pasta, gator bites, and fried catfish platter. The food was A+! Highly recommended.

O.M.G. Okay so we had the expectation of having to wait for awhile for a table however we were sat right away. I ordered a Hurricane to sip (which was delicious and strong!) and my hubby and I shared the Oceana's Famous Oysters and before I list the other items we had I have to say just how damn delicious the oysters were. They. Were. Phenomenal. Seriously the best tasting oysters I've ever had. The garlic cream sauce they were dripping in I could eat on top of everything, E-VERY-THING!! We also had the grilled gator bites which were awesome, I had a cup of gumbo which didn't hold a candle to the oysters, anf my sister had the red beans and rice. Everything was awesome!! Although our server never brought the to-go cup my hubby asked for, the service was pretty good. 5 stars across the board!!

The service was great, efficient and fast. The people were nice and pleasant. The food is good and was served without a delay even though the restaurant was full. They have funny drinks which should definitely be tried. :)

The food was excellent!  We waited in line for about 20 minutes, so that was not bad.  But this place is loud!!!! We could not have a conversation at our table without yelling at each other.  But the food was good.....

I have a delivery order worth &138 and it was disappointing because the pasta was not packed properly, the sauce has spilled out of the container and there were 3 mssing items on the delivery.  So the delivery guy has to go back to pick it up again and it took another 2 hours wait.    I lost about $35 worth of food... I called to follow up on the food they are suppose to deliver but they place me on hold for about 10 min and it seems like no one will pick up my call... Unbelievable service... they charge so much on their food but they their service is very poor.  I Regret ordering from this place.  Very poor customer service....
Very friendly staff. The prices are also very reasonable. But the food is meh. You can probably get better Cajun seafood in the area.
Great crab cakes - and this is coming from a Marylander. A little on the small side but well worth the price of only $10 for a burger and fries. Deanne gave great service, very friendly

We started with the gator bites- they were really tasty! Followed with an assortment of sides because we weren't too hungry. Red beans and  rice  crawfish étouffée  hush puppies  but the best was the crawfish cornbread stuffing- WOW! Loved it and really w joyed this place. Make a reservation on the website to avoid waiting in long lines outside. I'd go back if I came to visit again!

Two visits to this restaurant; one good and one bad. We found it hard to escape the same same Creole food, so it was nice that this restaurant had a few other options. Our first visit was great - both the ribs and the blackened red fish were nice, nothing flash, but good. 

On our second visit however, the Creole Shrimp were horrible. Completely in the shell, not de-vained and in a 'lemon sauce', which closely resembled dishwater with lemon detergent in it. The waiter told us that 'no one de-vains shrimp in NOLA, which we found very hard to believe, as who would want to eat the shrimp's excretion). Regardless, it was taken off the menu. We would not return though.

Delicious food and great service. There is a wait at times but it is worth it. Our concierge recommended this place as a "must try" during our trip and he was completely right! This was my favorite restaurant we tried while in the city, and  I will def be back next time. My husband and I shared the Taste of New Orleans and the Fried Seafood platter, beyond delicious!
My picky girl-friends absolutely in love with shrimp Popboys, my crab cakes were adorable too. Great restaurant, very fast cooking and good ambience. Super Cultural experience!

Appetizer heaven! The rockafellar oysters, gator bites, and gumbo are delicious! I would definitely come in for the appetizers. We ordered the jambalaya past and taste of  New Orleans and entrees.  The jambalaya had a fresh tasting cream sauce, however the taste of NO was just okay.
Crab cakes melt in your mouth. Seafood Platter exceeded my appetite.  The Praline Duck replaced the gamey taste of duck with a sweet sauce. Finished with Chocolate Kalua Mousse.

After walking around Bourbon Street, it was getting late and we were hungry, so we took a chance on this place. Honestly, we could not have been happier. Everyone in group was pleased with their meals. I got red beans and sausage and my wife had the seafood gumbo, others in our group had the Blacken Salmon Filet on bun, Chicken Fettuccini Alfredo and fried oysters. Everyone was pleased with their meal. The hostess and waiter were both nice.  Out waiter had several tables, but seemed to have no problem keeping up with them all. The dishes were all reasonably priced. Not a bad deal at all, I would go back.

This place is huge so doesn't really need to wait for long. The food here is really good and the portions are big. Love their crawfish etoufee and the beans and rice (though it's a bit on the salty side).

I've been to this place four times in the past 2 months and each time it seems like the food gets better. The crab cakes are always my first choice, but this past weekend I had the grilled catfish po-boy..... to die for. The staff is helpful and if you get there late you can beat the line. One of my favorite's in the Quarter!

My first meal in New Orleans, and I am not complaining one bit.

First of all, they have excellent service. Our food came no more than 10 minutes after we ordered.

Second, the blackened ahi tuna is to die for.

If I lived around here, I'd be eating there a lot more often.
Excellent food and excellent service. The Redfish was great as was The Bananas Foster. Would definitely recommend trying this restaurant.

I got the crawfish etoufee and it was the best I've ever had! Our waiter was extremely pleasant and handled or large group well. We had to wait about 30-40 minutes but for a Saturday night we were okay with that!

It's located smack dab in the French Quarter, and like so many other restaurants in the area it knows it's audience, tourists. This place is a tourist trap, nothing more. Get outside the French Quarter, go ask a local, but please go else where to find MUCH better food.

Actually 4.5 stars, but am rounding down for a reason.

The specialty drinks are GREAT. Ok so they are overpriced. But they are strong and the variety of the options makes it fun to try as many as you can before you fall out of your chair.

The food was pretty good too. It isn't bar food, although you can get the fried this or that to sit in your gut to soak up the alcohol. Nope, they have other nice options too. 
I thought the gumbo was good but nothing to write home about. Wife loved her catfish Po'Boy. I had some fish dinner kind of thing which was great.

The shucked oysters were oysters, we've had more flavorful oysters but that always depends on where they come from. 
The baked oysters were pretty good though.

Now the missing star. The smell upon entry. It's the downstairs bar area. It stinks. It needs a good scrub down from ceiling to floor to get rid of that nasty Bourbon St stank.
Luckily you eat upstairs.

I came here last night for a late dinner. I ordered seafood gumbo and it was OK. The ambience was good but there was a group of crowd they were just obnoxiously loud for 30 minutes and none of the staff did anything to control the noise. Very unpleasant and I lost my appetite.

OMG! ...The crayfish étouffé! OMG...the red beans! OMG... Everything is soooo good! Drinks (I'm partial to the Bloody Mary, Spicy thank you very much!) was on point! Michael, our waiter was very cool! Thanks Oceana for a wonderful first meal!

Good food.. have been here 3 times in my 2 trips to new Orleans.. will go again.. the staff is great as well.. we wanted to be out with a quick dinner since we wanted to go to the preservation hall jazz.. they made sure we had good food and were out in 35min
Avoid this tourist trap if you don't want over cooked fish and bland dishes- there are too many other good options for dining in town.
Amazing food and service. They were well organized and everyone said hello and greeted us! Everyone in my party of 8 raved about their food for days!
Crab cakes were amazing!! Dinner came out really fast but then the waiter was very slow with our dessert and check. Everything tasted delicious!! Highly recommend.
I eat here on every visit to N.O. and the crab cakes, shrimp po boys, pastas and catfish are consistently delicious.

1st trip....Amazing!!!! Blackened catfish collards jambalaya and gumbo!!!! Please order all of this!!!!! Also had shrimp Alfredo and I highly recommend this as well! 2nd time here in one weekend!!!!! In 2 trips we got The blackened catfish, shrimp Alfredo, taste of New Orleans, and the fried seafood platter! Please try these all!!!!!

Had the Oceana Oyster specialty that was truly a unique combination. Taste was outstanding. The special blackened catfish and crawfish also outstanding. The service was excellent as was the very cold draft beer.

Second time in New Orleans and I heard that this place was amazing and it was. Service was great, delicious food. Will definitely be back here the best time I visit. Thank you Chantay!!! For the outstanding service

Good ambiance and service. Bathrooms clean. I only had the "oceans famous chargrilled oysters "

They were covered in cream sauce with 2 pieces of French bread.  The oysters were not well cooked. I much prefer Dragos chargrilled Oysters with natural juices and well cooked.
Food was amazing! We had the Gator bites half fried half blackened and both were delicious. Service was great, would definitely go back!
OMG the best meal we had all week. Great staff, their take on the chargrilled oysters was awesome! We shared a chocolate Kahlúa pie that was the best I have ever had. Much better then Acme oysters.

Oysters were great. everything else not so much. pretty greasy. Alligator sausage tasted like regular sausage.and  the duck was under seasoned, 
We didn't have to wait long to get a table and the place is huge. bathrooms on every floor. service was alright.

This was a good late night spot to grab a decent meal . It closes at 1:00 am central and that was perfect. My wife and I got the catfish po boy sandwich and it was extremely good . The grilled oysters were just ok , Acme has the best in my opinion but this is still a very solid place to eat at .
Just happened upon this place! It is a true gem! The staff is very helpful and attentive. I would recommend the seafood omelet. It was my first time trying it and it was excellent!

The rating and reviews are misleading. My friend and I got their "famous" oysters and gumbo. The sauce on the oysters is way too heavy and does not complement the oysters at all. The rice for the gumbo was hard, as if it was from previous day or refrigerated/defrosted. The service was not great either, aside from the nice hostess at the front. I wouldn't recommend this place for seafood, but maybe the po boys are good.

Our concierge recommended Oceana when I asked for a good place to eat nearby since we arrived late into town.
Short stroll and we found them and after a short wait we were seated. Prompt friendly service from our server Ben who was also very knowledgeable of the menu.
My wife ordered the Praline Duck and I ordered the special The Catfish Lafouche. 
The portions are good but not huge and both dishes were amazing.  We finished up with a completely fantastic bread pudding with rum sauce!
Great food, I recommend you try them too!

The bell person at the Marriott Hotel on Canal St (New Orleans) where we are staying for the week recommended Oceana Grill, and lo and behold - their food is awesome!  I ordered the étouffée crawfish, the gumbo the crab cakes and all I can say is you need to go and try it yourself!  The flavours are excellent!  And, the staff is prompt, attentive and super friendly.  The atmosphere is young, hip yet mature in service.  Kudos!
Ashleigh was a great waitress and made my experience wonderful...  her suggestion of lunch special was the bomb... until next time
