The New Orleans bread pudding with the famous praline and rum sauce was worth the long wait in line! I can't even begin to explain my mixed feelings about this place while waiting in line. But I assumed a long wait meant the food was going to be worth it. After being seated, the staff was there right away, very attentive, quick, thorough, and knew what they were doing. Also very accommodating to special requests. We had to wait for our bar drinks for a while, but no big deal, we were more hungry than anything else. We ordered the fresh oysters on the half shell to start. Those suckers went down smooth and delicious with no gritty bottom of the ocean taste. I was very pleased. We ordered a couple items off the chef's specials. The "fall of the fork" 1/2 slab of bbq ribs were amazing, great flavor,  tender meat, but...they did not fall off the bone. That was ok for us, the subtle and NOT overpowering bbq sauce and tenderness of the meat made up for that. The blackened bayou duck was really a very pleasant surprise! I'd say one of the best duck dishes I have ever eaten TO DATE! Every bite I took from every part of that duck was amazing. The meat was tender, the flavor was smoky and perfect. No gamey flavor. I definitely recommend this dish for anyone who loves duck or anyone who wants to try it for the first time. You won't be disappointed! My friend was craving fried food and opted for the Seaford platter full of catfish, shrimp, and oysters. This place did not disappoint. Her craving was satisfied with the piled high goodness of the sea! The Louisiana crabmeat cake topoed with fresh crawfish mushroom cream sauce was, to me, at the same level as the famous maryland crab cakes. And that says alot! Perfectly blended flavors and the right sauce on top. Definitely one dish to order if you love crabmeat! Now, to go back to where I started...that bread pudding got me like...whoah! THE BEST BREAD PUDDING I HAVE HAD IN MY LIFE! The moistness, but not gooey, the raisins, which I've never liked but loved in this, the rum, i hate overpowering bitter rum when used in bread pudding, but not this time. This place does it right. I went to dessert heaven with this pudding! You won't do yourself justice if you leave this place without trying the sinfully delicious bread pudding.

Hands down best Po Boy we had all trip (and we had a quite few...)

Loved this restaurant - came back multiple times for the Bloody Marry's.

Loved the small dimly lit atmosphere. There was just something about this place.

Great food, great drinks, great service.
Came here twice for lunch and breakfast during our visit. Try a blackened dish at here and you won't be disappointed.
Taste of NOLA great dishes couldn't decide what dish so we got three and split.  All very good
Thank you Errol for excellent service in addition to full explanation of the dishes we had questions about! Get the alligator bites blackened to start! Thank you for a great experience.. :)

Was in NOLA for a convention in September 2015 and stumbled across Oceana Grille off of Bourbon. What a meal! The large tuna steak was one of the best I have had anywhere along with the oysters. I can't say enough about the service, which was impeccable. Will be one of the first places I eat if ever back in NOLA.
I had the seafood omelette and my friend had the royal crepe. Probably could have shared the crepe since it was so huge! Great experience:)

This is my first time writing a review because the food was so good.  I had the Jambalaya, beans and rice, and ettoufee combo and it was so memorable.  My favorite was the beans and rice.  I think they called it the "taste of Nee Orleans".  My famiky loved their dishes as well.  The bread pudding was the best I've had so far.  Kids had chicken Alfredo and hubby had blackened redfish ettoufee.  The fried gator bites were so moist and flavorful.

Of all the places we've been so far on our New Orleans visit, this place was the best. Honestly they set the standard for our future visits to other establishments and it may have been set too high lol. The drinks were great and the food was amazing! I had the tour or taste of New Orleans which came with my fave dish etouffe, gumbo, and red beans and rice. It was a perfect portion. I was so full that I couldn't order desert which I wanted so bad!! I did get the oysters as well and the my were perfectly grilled and flavorful

We stopped here because it started to rain, we ordered two drinks that were nice not watered down, a side of hash browns that was delicious and eggplant fries that would have been really good but they were extremely oily.  All in all we had a good experience.
Ate breakfast here everyday. Fresh & tasty great service.

The food here was great! Our waitress was new and still in training but she did outstanding.  So helpful, attentive, and offered so much info on the menu. First time trying oysters and I thought they were great! Shrimp Po Boy is what I had, with the most delicious slaw, hubby had the Taste of New Orleans which he absolutely loved. We weren't disappointed.

Came in after 11pm based on the nice yelp review, glad is still open, definitely one of the fewer full service restaurants open during late hours. The restaurant was half full, we sat down right away. Our server was nice, quiet and not well trained. We ordered our food, waited. The table behind us was a family of four, with two young girls, they looked like they had been there before us.

Our food finally came after 10mins, they got our orders wrong, but we were fine with it since it was late in the night. The food was ok, very typical NOLA flavor, nothing stands out. By the time we finished, the family of four was still waiting for their food, making their complaints. We felt bad for the two little girls.

Overall, this is the place to eat if you have no other late night options, expect slow services and mediocre food.

DELIVERY:  A really good delivery meal at a decent price and it was delivered fast, fresh and with a smile. A quick overnight to New Orleans and I was looking for something different. Oceana popped up as an option and I was highly suspicious of delivery of seafood but this meal certainly did not fall short. Not only was the food good but they even made sure to read my note and sent cocktail sauce instead of tartar - thanks. I had the fried shrimp platter and it was delicious. An abundance of lightly breaded, hot, fresh and tasty shrimp. I also ordered a side greek salad. The salad was fine, nothing to write home about, and certainly a nice side salad for $5.50. If you're too tired to journey out and about the French Quarter some night, this is definitely the place to get a taste of New Orleans right in your hotel room. $$
One of the best blackened snapper dishes I've had. And, hallelujah, the jambalaya wasn't salty. Service was attentive and so nice.
I've been here a few times. It's clean. The quality is consistent, the prices reasonable, the flavor good and the staff pleasant. A solid choice among many.

My husband & I went here for lunch.  The menu isn't that extensive...I thought there would be more items to choose from.  I ordered the shrimp alfredo.  It was amazing!!!  I am usually hesitate to order that because I know a lot of places will short you on the shrimp...not this place!  I got 12 large, plump, succulent shimp with a decent amount of pasta.  I like that they don't overwhelm you with pasta and skip out on the shrimp....the ratio was perfect, and actually slightly favored the shrimp.  The flavor of the alfredo sauce was one of the best I've had.  My husband had the crawfish etouffee and really enjoyed it.  Service was quick and friendly, and we got our food in a timely manner...even though the place was packed!   Would definitely go here again, but just wish they offered more of a selection.

While meandering down Bourbon st looking for a place to eat, my friend noticed a small line in front of Oceana Grill on Conti St. Noticing the good smells coming from to kitchen we decided to check out the menu. 

Since we both saw things we liked, we decided to give this place a try. We were not disappointed. After we say down, we received a call from my friend's daughter saying they were going to make it into town earlier. Our waiter was nice enough to move us to a four top. 

After an hour wait where I sampled the NOLA Blonde beer (the waiter had never had it so he was nice enough to bring me a sample) and split an appetizer of the fried gator tail bites (AMAZING!), the rest of our party arrived. After ordering, we quickly got our food. My friend had the Mardi Gras pasta and I had the shrimp fettuccine. Both were fabulous. My friend said on more than one occasion how there more seafood than noodles in hers. The two picky eaters we were with raved about the fries. 

All in all, it was a good experience minus the frigid temps inside and a broken bathroom.

The servers had great attitudes! There were long stretches, though, when we needed attention and there was no one to be found. We decided to get an appetizer. Chose BLACKENED gator bites- after waiting 40 minutes for them they came fried... not blackened. They took it back and brought it back 20 minutes later corrected. Sadly, it wasn't worth the wait. On to the main course- I ordered fried oysters. They brought me fried catfish... Luckily it seemed to just be a mistake by the expeditor. My fried oysters came right out. They were really good! The main course really helped make up for the other issues. Then I ordered a hurricane. It wasn't good. Terrible mix, way too strong- better off with a $5 drink at one of the nearby bars. We also had a long wait for our check.
Smashingly good!  Had fresh oyster, seafood gumbo, crab cakes, barbecue shrimp !!!  Tiara's service was also very pleasant and cordial!!

Services sucks over all!! Host and waitress!! Food is not great! Got the raw oysters,shuck so dirty and sloppy and not great at all. Didn't even taste fresh! The famous "charbroiled" isn't even charbroiled! It's boiled with non-sense slap on top! WORSE&DISGUSTING  charbroiled I have EVER had  ! NEVER AGAIN!!!! The bbq shrimp was ok! They said lemon,butter and black pepper tasting,but all you taste is straight up lemon and a mouth pull of black pepper! It's like they got black pepper on sale! The red beans&rice isn't special,school lunch tastes better than that! The crawfish étouffée is decent I guess. The seafood platter was ok. The fries&catfish was only good on that dish! The fried shrimp was cook as hard as a rock. FIRST time here&VERY LAST time here! The price is ridiculously expensive for crappy food!!! Never again will I step a foot here,EVER!!!

Had BBQ shrimp and garlic mash potatoes.  The shrimp were being g and the flavor was exquisite.  We had the gumbo bowl and it was delicious.  From the outside this place seems small but boy those the food taste great.

Not only do you expect high quality bc you're in New Orleans but also because anyone can make fried food taste good. Right?! Apparently not this place. It wasn't exactly bad so much as "Applebees" quality. The staff was super nice but it's unfortunate that this place is representative of local NOLA.

Delivered meal to hotel not great experience but fast. Gumbo and jambalaya marginal. Sad the sauce on jambalaya too spicy which was not so good. Weird seafood in the gumbo not edible yuk. Won't eat here again. It was hot and that gets 3 stars.

While in New Orleans for a Birthday Celebration  on August 10-13,2018 . We traveled from Chicago to experience some Real Deal cajun cuisine. We did some research and found that Oceana restaurant in New Orleans was one of the top restaurants to visit. We came to Oceana Saturday 8-11-18 and the food was Excellent but the service was Horrible from a server name Marv but that didn't stop us from coming back the next day for lunch.  OMG the experience was totally Fabulous !!!!!our server Kim Price was Spectacular She was very helpful  and knowledgeable of the menu. Our Food once again was Delicious  and the Hurricane cocktail was unbelievable. I will Definitely recommend Oceana Restaurant to anyone coming to New Orleans for Great Food and Request Kim Price as their sever if she is working that Day
Omg.! Don't get me started on this place. If you ever go here ask for Nikki. She's is absolutely amazing. I trusted her to order my entire meal and her picks were dead on. I loved everything.
Was here a few years ago and it's just as good now.  I was seated immediately, staff was very welcoming.  Pamela is a great server.  I had the sausage gravy and biscuits.  Delicious and plenty!

This place was recommended by a lot of locals and we were really in the mood for seafood. Last day to get some oysters and another sampling of the good ol' Rockefellers' sounded great. Close to Bourbon street, the smell of alcohol was quite strong upon entering and lingered around our table, maybe it was just our seat at the last corner of the place. 

The menu was beaten up and required some attention to read past the dull corners of the plastic seal. No Oysters. No Rockefeller or otherwise (they were out of the last for the day). Ended up with an overly creamy crawfish pasta, a dish I had before elsewhere with quite the opposite effect.

My beer glass had crud stuck all over it as well as floating on the inside. My wife had crawfish that was fresh and well fried. The portion would have been enough for both of us. 
Not a place I will recommend but it seems fitting after a few (more) beers and a very strong desire for friend seafood...

If you love seafood and good drinks while in New Orleans then this is the place for you !!!! Staff was amazing great with the recommendations and was very prompt with getting our food to us. I had a he crab cake pasta and the tropical storm to drink! I will be back !

Best restaurant in town! Their chargrilled oysters are the best. Tried Acme and it just doesn't compare. Great food great service!! Everything our group tried off the menu was excellent. Had to get an extra order of bread to wipe the plate clean of the sauce. Won't disappoint. We went back for seconds after only being in the French Quarter for only 3 days.
Food was awesome and service was even better. After a bad experience at Deanies Desiree was so nice. Thanks for the turn around.

We were hungry and the first placed we yelped was closed...so we came here instead!

The wait staff was really friendly and upon yelp check in we were able to get 10% off our meal!

We ordered alligator sausage which was so full of flavor. My hunny ordered turtle soup which was okay but mostly tasted like chili.

My hunny ordered the catfish special and it was phenomenal! The catfish just melted in our mouths. I ordered the New Orleans variety plate. We both were stuff beyond belief!

Great place-fun environment, good food! Super waiters and waitresses!!
Absolutely the BEST red beans and rice you can get. Had it as an appetizer one night and went back two days later to have it as an entree. Delicious!

Saturday at 10:30 in the morning not crowded at all. Got a table right away. Friendly server took our order promptly and food got to the table fast. Fried catfish was average, fries were tastey. Good portion size.

Three of us ate here for dinner.  The food was good, not great.  I had the sampler plate and it was very average.  The red beans were nothing special and I make a better jambalaya at home.  My wife had the BBQ shrimp and a salad and she said it was very good shrimp.  My daughter had the gumbo and she said it was "meh".  The atmosphere in this place was better than most and the service was excellent.

My dad and I stopped in New Orleans to try the local cuisine. We had the oysters, in which the sauce tasted like pizza and the oysters were on the small side, the crawfish étouffée, which was a little on the salty side and was not as good as the Real New Orleans Style restaurant in Marble Falls, TX, the seafood gumbo, and the crab cake platter.

Went here for late night dinner on Bourbon. Very disappointed. Ordered crap cakes for appetizer on server's recommendation. Crap cakes were not fresh. Tasted as if they had been sitting under a hot lamp. Even the sauce was luke warm. Ordered dried shrimp platter for entrée. We figured you can't go wrong with fried shrimp. Wrong! We learned how wrong around 3 am when awaked by stomach cramps and diarrhea. Avoid this place!
Convenient location, on bourbon st corner, great food, drinks/beer prices surprisingly relatively low for this location. 2nd floor dining room definitely better, nice art on the walls.

Oceana grill was a definite tourist spot.

In short, the food was pretty good but not spectacular. But customer service was amazing. The waiters and managers are so welcoming and caring it's not hard to love the place. 

My favorite dish had to be the blackened alligator bite Po Boy and their oysters. Have these for dinner and I know you won't be disappointed!

This is the first place i go as soon as i get off the plane to new Orleans ! 

Great service 
Great food 
Great decor 
Great location

Great staff, casual atmosphere, and delicious food! Crab cakes were to die for, lots of crab meat with creamy red sauce. Cat fish was done perfect, red beans and rice -delish!  Everything is fresh and taste amazing!

Try the chargrilled oysters with the herb gravy. They are incredible. With the spotty food that is found in the touristy section of the Quarter, this was one of the best dishes we found in the whole city.

Amazing food! Tried the signature dish, the Redfish Oceana and I was astounded. It's a lightly breaded Redfish filet that is generously covered in a spicy crawfish mushroom cream sauce and it is so delicious! Comes with a side of mustard greens and garlic mashed potatoes. Only con, just a personal peeve of mine, was that the potatoes were served in the same dish as the greens so they were sitting in the juice. Next time, I'll just ask for separate dishes. Usually, my favorite place to eat in NOLA is Acme Oyster House but Oceana is going to give Acme a run for my money!

David our server was awesome!! Knowledgeable and friendly!!  Food was great and reasonably priced. Right off Bourbon St.  I want to go back for more charred oysters alone,  besides what I had for dinner. Red beans and rice were great as well and I hate beans.

Overpriced and mediocre food. Oceana's "famous" oysters were yummy but probably not legitimately famous. These and the raw oysters were relatively large in size though - I think I remember our server mentioning that they were from the Gulf. The Taste of New Orleans sampler was so disappointing and I'm sure NOLA would be upset to know that this is how they're being represented.
Family friendly spot off burbon street. Oysters were so good. Poboys were better than I had in other places. 4 instead of 5 because the food was overpriced for what it was. Disorganized seating.
I love Bre! She took care of my birthday group of 13 and had excellent service! This place has really good food as well! I will be back!
Place is huge.  Only stopped in for a beverage and appetizer.  Plenty of help and food was good.
Right off bourbon, open late. The red beans and rice are the best I've ever had, and I've had a lot. Totally wanted to lick my bowl! Catfish po-boy fab, the fish was flakey and moist! Great service!
If you are looking for some great food in New Orleans then this a good place to eat. Party of 6 and everyone loved their food. Good flavor and food service.

My wife and I chose the Oceana Grill due to the close proximity to our hotel and after reading the favorable reviews on Yelp. The atmosphere is very casual. We were seated immediately upon arrival and were taken to the second floor which was a bit quieter than the first. We ordered the Oceana Famous Oysters for the appetizer and they were delicious! I ordered the daily special, which was chargrilled catfish on a bed of jambalaya with fried crawfish tails. It was one of the best seafood dishes I've ever eaten! Not a crumb was left! And for dessert, we split the Bananas Foster Ice Cream Cake. That was the perfect end to the meal and I highly recommend it! Our waitress was very prompt and cordial. We sat beside a large group of very loud and obnoxious drunk people who kept cursing out loud. She kept apologizing and was very sympathetic. Other than the loud group, our visit was great and we had no complaints about the food. I will definitely recommend you visit!

The only reason I'm giving this place 2 stars is because the staff was Amazing... We ordered alligator two ways, fried and blackened, and the house specialty charbroiled oysters to start. The alligator was actually really good, I preferred the blackened version which was more tender. The fried was tasty, but a little chewier.. The charbroiled oysters were horrible, they put some kind of funky ass sauce all over them which to this day 1 month later I can't shake.... Nothing like the morsels of heaven at Acme Oyster House... 
   For entrees the wife ordered the redfish and I tried the Taste of New Orleans, which had red beans and rice, jambalaya, and crawfish etufee... The red beans and rice had a very familiar taste, the Wife quickly realized they tasted EXACTLY like Popeyes, not a bad thing but really??? The jambalaya was bland, and honestly at this point I couldn't even stomach the crawfish.. I tried a bite of the wife's redfish and wow, consistency is achieved.. It was very fishy and yeah, pretty gross... With all the choices in New Orleans I'm ashamed of myself for even giving this place a shot.
Excellent choice for seafood. Errol took great care of us, made excellent recommendations. Thanks Errol for not steering us wrong!

The OYSTERS!!!! Yasss! The blacken chicken and collard greens as a combo works. The spices from the chicken help add soul to the collard greens I am used to. If eaten individually it would not be as great. But our server Kaitlin was great and so were the drinks.

Delicious! Loved the biscuits and gravy and fried shrimp. 
Ashley is the best!
Definitely recommend.

We had a river boat tour at 2pm and were concerned there was a line out the door because we arrived at 1:30. They quoted us twenty minutes and we were sat in 15. Our server, Jaime, arrived quickly and we explained we were short on time. Our food literally arrived in ten minutes. We were all so impressed. We had plenty of time to make it to the boat. The food was all delicious and hot. We ordered the crab cakes, a burger, fried shrimp (HUGE!!) and the Taste of New Orleans , which is a sampler of local favorites. We honestly couldn't have been happier.

Visiting from Florida and someone on the street suggested we go here. Since we are going back on bourbon after this I got a few sides instead of an entree. Fried shrimp, which comes with 5 shrimp, red beans and rice which was soooooo good! And a side of fried crawfish and they were soft, the right texture and delicious. We'll definitely be back here before we leave. Also our server Ashleigh was very attentive!

Amazingggggggg!!! I was recommended by my uber driver to eat the " The Taste of New Orleans" YUM!! It was a combo of Jambalaya, red beans and rice , sausage , crawfish and bread . I enjoyed a mimosa and our server Rachel was awesome , Thanks boo!

Our Concierge suggested Oceana. We went here our last night in N.O. 8/10... Shane was our waiter. He was great. We loved the music and he told us it was a cd.. and we are looking for it online. Our food was awesome.If I find the pics I will post later. He had the ribeye and I had one of the fettucine alfredos.The whole experience was GREAT.  We will return. Excellent service and great food.
Food here was incredible I was in the French quarter and was recommended this place. The food was incredible and when I visit down there again I will deff return.

Gumbo was to die for but the crab cakes were awful. My crab cakes were served cold. Server was kind enough to warm them up but it just wasn't good. Our service was great. We enjoyed this for my husband birthday dinner.
Great food! Eggplant fries are delish!! Omg and the bananas foster ice cream cake is a must have!! Service was on point. 2nd time here and will return next time we are in NOLA.

Grossly overpriced, red beans and rice was not even as good as a a bag of dehydrated rice & beans in a bag that you would buy in a grocery store and add hot water to. "Bowl" of gumbo priced at $9.50 could not have been more then 6 ounces with a big chunk of crab shell that was inedible.  

Terrible,  a not so well run and not so clean Popeyes Chicken fast food joint beats this place hands down. You could not pay me to order here again.....

This place is the bomb.com. I give it 4 thumbs up and I only have two thumbs. Whitney was such a delight and was also very helpful with helping us figure out what to eat and drink. If you're ever in New Orleans you must stop by!!!!
Amazing Seafood Gumbo in town! Also, their chocolate mousse is to die for!!! 10% discount to military families with ID!
Chill place good food and service. Delicious Sazarac. Had shrimp Alfredo could have been a bit more but it was delicious.

I give this place 4 stars just for the grilled Oysters alone. Let me start by saying that I don't like oysters. I had them months before coming to New Orleans and I found raw oysters to just be slimy and gross. I decided that since I was in New Orleans I would give grilled oysters a try. I ordered half a dozen, but I was brought a dozen. Thankfully I had friends at the table to help me dive into these babies. I fell in love with them! I will say that it was doused in some kind of creamy garlic and parmesan sauce that while good, could have been scaled back a smidgen. 

I also had the barbecued shrimp, which weren't that great in my opinion. The sauce was cold and the shrimp tasted like they needed to be cooked a little while longer. My friend had one and she said it tasted like they had literal just taken it out of the gulf. (I must like my shrimp to be the previously frozen variety.) I also had the seafood gumbo which was ok. I think the grilled Oysters overshadowed everything else. 

As I sit in Los Angeles I often find myself craving those Oysters. I just want to make a trip back just to have them. 

Other things to consider: the service was decent, and the atmosphere is like any other laid-back venue in New Orleans. The prices are decent for the amount of food that you get.
Omg gosh.  Food came out less than 5 minutes from order.  EVERYTHING was warm not HOT.

We walked the streets of NOLA looking for a delicious seafood place and there is not shortage. However upon seeing the line of people at Oceana, we knew it must be good. After a 5 minute wait, the courteous staff seated us. It's got great atmosphere! We ordered the catfish and Cajun fries as well as cocktails. The catfish was fresh and light and served 2. The staff is attentive and the portions generous.

Food was not great. Service was so so. Getting our food took 40 minutes and the manager was not helpful, at all! My soggy Po Boy was gross. Not worth an $85 lunch. Go up the street and grab a slice, you'll be better off.
This place is awsome i tried the fried crawfish tails and thier crawfish sauce it was soooo  and filling
My favorite place to eat. I love the crab cakes and the strawberry cheesecake. Service is always excellent and well worth the (inevitable) wait and difficulty finding parking

One of my required restaurants whenever I visit New Orleans. I love the food every time. I've NEVER been disappointed!! The chargrilled oysters are sooooo good. My business partner & his wife also enjoyed their first visit to a Oceana Grill as their first taste of New Orleans!!! I will be back on my next visit from Virginia!!

OMG you have got to eat the crab cakes or the duck here both were fantastic!  The service was great even on a very busy Saturday.  The beer was cold and not terribly expensive and the Hurricane is not too sweet.  Overall the best meal we had in NOLA.
Food very good, exceeded expectations.  Server David the best- recommendations were spot on.  Would definitely go back!
Bridget was AMAZING! The food was good, jumbo needs a little more seasoning but very good staff and good food!

Nice little place right off of Bourbon St. We stopped in for lunch looking for some BBQ shrimp (my NO fav!). I really liked the atmosphere - funky seafood related decor with a definite NO style. We were sat near the oyster bar, so we got to watch the guy shuck oysters the whole time, including ours. We had them on the half-shell, and we were happy with the order. Most of the oysters we were served were pretty plump, which was surprising since Hurricane Isaac had just been through a few weeks before and hurricanes are never good for the oyster business. 

We also ordered the alligator tail appetizer and the BBQ shrimp appetizer. While honestly neither were the best I've ever had, both were still quite tasty. We ordered the alligator blackened, but I would say it was less blackened and more just not fried. The edges weren't even brown. Flavor was good, they were juicy, and they came with a pretty good dipping sauce. Now the BBQ shrimp app came with some of the biggest shrimp I've ever seen in the dish! More like prawns or tiny lobsters. The sauce was a little different than I was used to. It wasn't very buttery and you couldn't really note much black pepper, and it almost tasted as if there might have been some white wine in the sauce. That said, it was good and, of course, came with some of that signature crusty french bread to mop up the sauce. 

Service was pretty average, though the server we had was really nice. Strange thing though, service was average speed until we wanted to pay, then it slowed down to a crawl! Usually they're more than happy to speed that part up!

I had food delivered to my hotel room. I had a steak, alligator bites, and a piece of pecan pie. Only problem was the only utensil I was given was a plastic spork!  I felt like a contestant on Survivor. I had to call down to room service for some silverware. Other than that the food was very good. Steak was cooked how I liked it and the alligator was very tasty.

Had a large group of 17 and we waited about an hour in their make shift line outside. Aside from our hiccup of waiting for a large table to clear up, once we got seated, the service was wonderful. They took our appetizer and drink orders first and were very systematic about it. We got the famous oysters and the crab cakes appetizer. They were both delicious. The oysters were coated in parmesan sauce which gave it a creamy taste. I got the Cajun jambalaya pasta and it didn't disappoint - creamy and slightly spicy with that Cajun creole flavor I was craving. They even split our checks individually for seventeen people! Overall amazing service and amazing food. This place may not be as popular as the other bigger names such as acme but it has a LOT of room and the food is great!

ニューオリンズに到着してすぐにランチに行きました。
ホテルの人のオススメだったので。

値段も御手頃で、フレンチクオーターにあるので二階から見る景色もよく
楽しめました。

お料理も感動するほど美味しいってわけではありませんが
どれも美味しく、これといった外れがないので
(NYは外れも多い)いいと思います。

頼んだのはアリゲーターソーセージ$7.5
クラブケーキプレート$14
テイストオブニューオーリンズ$14
あとブリュレ。

のんびりできるし定員さんも親切ですし、私は楽しめました。

Food was to die for! My hubby & I dined here for our last night in NOLA. We even had hot pecan pie with vanilla ice cream. Service was exceptional. Our waitress even took our picture. Memories we'll never forget
It was ok.  Red beans & rice were good but overpriced, guess that's to be expected in a tourist area.

So glad we stopped here today. All of food is delicious. The seafood is super fresh. The cocktails are all delicious as well. The staff is super friendly and the atmosphere is true to NOLA. If you are in town you should stop by even have mixed drinks to go.

So great. I got the shrimp fettuccine alfredo and it was the best dish I've had on my very first trip to NOLA. My husband got the Cajun jambalaya and he was so impressed. 

The service was great. Wait time was very short if you go early (we got seated right away at 5:30pm). 

Cost was around $47 including the tip (2 entrees and 2 waters).

Hair in food and the manager was very unprofessional. He argued with the customers and didn't offer and the of course service, he blamed the hair on one of us as if we weren't spending money or paid for our bill. I definitely do not recommend this place to anyone. I would've done a zero star but I couldn't. Smh

It felt a little like Applebee's, if their decor was legit.  Oceana serves uninspired food, in a cool location, with a decent ambiance.  The staff was friendly and efficient, but the food quality was just ok.  No food art here, just lots of table turning; don't expect to ask for the check (like most southern restaurants)... it'll come, perhaps before you finish your last bite.

We loved our meal at ACME on our first night in New Orleans, and hoped for more of the same from Oceana Grill.  There wasn't a queue to get in, unlike at ACME, which was a big plus - although I'm pretty sure the queue at ACME is for good reason and while we enjoyed some of our meal here, I know why people aren't lining up out the door.

We sat outside in the pleasant and small courtyard (inside was freezing from too much air conditioning), and we really enjoyed chatting to our extremely friendly server.  We ordered a ton of food - gator tail bites (blackened), Louisiana crabmeat cakes with crawfish and mushroom cream sauce, chargrilled oysters, and something else I can't remember now (this is why I need to write reviews sooner after vacation!  I think it might've been the Taste of New Orleans platter, though I sadly can't remember anything about it.

The thing about the food here is that it was mostly good, but a few dishes were flat-out ruined!  The much-touted crab cakes were good, but they would've been better if the sauce had been brought on the side as I'd asked instead of absolutely being drowned in it!  I really didn't want that much thick creamy sauce on my crabcakes, but I was stuck with it.  Same for the chargrilled oysters.  The ones at ACME were heavenly, the ones here were just drowning in garlic cream sauce and cheese.  Honestly, it was a bit gross.  You couldn't even see the oysters for the sauce.  We were so disappointed as we'd been looking forward to them all night.

I know this review would be a lot better if I could remember the things we liked, but they were sort of overshadowed by the saucy oysters.  We did have great service, and there are 10% off cards floating around all over the city, but if you want a great NOLA seafood experience, this shouldn't be your first stop.  We loved the casual atmosphere that's sort of like a sports bar inside, and a relaxing inner courtyard if you walk through the main room, but the food didn't live up to the bar we'd set elsewhere.  Hit or miss menu, but the misses for us were especially disappointing as it was our last night.

The crab cakes are delish!  It's a great place to stop for breakfast as well!  

As for the rest of the menu it is just what you would expect of every place in NOLA... Prices are pretty much the same as everyplace else. Service is OK...

With so many places to choose from do a little browsing first!

This was a lot of food for a very good price.my second time in nola and I tried the cat fish po boy this time, the fries that it came with seemed to be batted in a pancake buttery batter, if you come here ask for Paul

This was disappointing. The presentation of the oceana oysters was unappetizing and the flavor was lacking in a major way. I sent back the crab cakes because they were cold and hard. In pretty sure they were frozen prior to heating them. When I told the waiter he responded "do I need to warm them for you"...Um no.

I absolutely LOVED this restaurant! The food was delicious but the service was even better! We sat at the bar and Jai was our bartender/waiter. Such a great personality. Will definitely come back on our next trip!!
This is place is awesome!!! I loved the service and the food is even better!!! Omg omg omg  Those crab cakes are to die for I sweaaaa...best crab cakes I've ever had in my entire life

OK so this place serves Petunias breakfast! I was so saddened by the closing of Petunias but apparently the owners negotiated a way to serve their breakfast out of this location- same cooks & all! Best French toast in the city by far! I also had the gumbo, char-grilled oysters, red beans & crawfish etoufee. Everything was delicious! This place is highly recommended. With Petunias breakfast menu and good lunch/dinner, you've gotta stop by!!!

Waiting on the line outside for about 30min. SO worth the wait. Giving 4 stars because our waiter wasn't that great. But the chef was on point!! The alligator bites were incredible. This is the crab cake appetizer and alligator bites (half fried/half blackened). Incredible!!!
The food is good and the service is great.  I had the blackened tuna, and it was well-seasoned.  The server was really friendly.  The restaurant is located in the French Quarter.

The places is ummm.... well... very casual in appearance, that is my nice way of saying  JUNKY HOLE IN THE WALL. But do NOT let that fool you..................................... 

Went to NOLA ,and on the way to Bourbon street, stumbled across this place.... by far the best crawfish etouffee I have EVER eaten!!! The portions are huge! The prices are fair too (for NOLA). Went back to NOLA in spring 2009 for just a couple of hours and am planning the entire trip to coordinate with lunch time just so that I can eat here again!!! :) If you go to NOLA eat here... it is FANTASTIC!

Three people suggested I try this place and I assumed it was worth the hype so I decided to stop by. I was disappointed, although the menu was quite large it was overwhelming and I did not find the food any better than your normal apple bees.
Everything was wonderful! Lots of charm and atmosphere!! Loved the dry ice in the Tropical Storm!
Amazing service and amazing food!  The chicken alfredo and red beans and rice are the best I've ever had!
Had the blackened redfish for lunch and it was delicious.  Errol was our server and he was great,  every employee we encountered was nice and friendly.
Good service and good food.  My wife had the seafood jambalaya pasta and I had the red fish which is their signature dish.  No complaints and would eat here again.

This place was right next to where we were staying on our new Orleans trip.  We had some amazing food in the French quarter and this was one of our best experience. Highly recommend the oysters.  Big portions as well.
Food was good.  The crawfish fettuccine was okay it had a lot of garlic in the sauce somewhat overpowering. The oysters were good and service was good.

Not quite a tourist trap.  Although you will get raped by the prices, the food is decent.

My out of town friend wanted "local food" as all tourists do.  This place was close by and had a trio plate "taste of new orleans" that has a sampling of the most traditional dishes.  Etouffee, jambalaya, and red beans.  Sounds perfect - so we went. 

I had the redfish covered in etouffee she had the trio.  We each had an adult beverage.  Total bill was $75. For what it is, thats steep. The food was ok. I've had much better through out the city.  The side of veggies on my dish were way overcooked. A pile of mush. 

With so many better options in the city, I likely wont return.

My boyfriend and I were visiting New Orleans and as fans of Kitchen Nightmares, we HAD to eat here and try it out. 

We were not disappointed. The staff were friendly, the atmosphere was very NOLA, the place was clean and the food was excellent. 

The only reason I didn't give it five stars is because we felt we waiting just a little too long for our food. We went on a Monday at 11:30 and at one point were the only ones in the place. We still waited almost half an hour for our food. My boyfriend got a shrimp Poboy, which he devoured and loved. I got the crab cake burger, which was delicious except that it was on a bun three times the size of the crab cake, overwhelming the sandwich with bread. 

Otherwise, a great experience. We may even return at some point during the course of our stay.

This place was amazing. I was blown away by how good the crab cakes were and my whole family was more than pleased with everything we ate. There was also plenty of seating and getting a table took less than a minute. Definitely check this place out if you're looking for some great sea food!!!
The food was excellent! Ordered The Taste of New Orleans with eggplant sticks as an appetizer...on point! Our server Darrick was thorough, friendly, and efficient! We highly recommend stopping by!
Good food, fast service and friendly waitress. The blackened red fish with crawfish sauce special is really great.

We come for our company Christmas lunch. I have lived here for a few years now and I have come once, and really thats as many times as you need to come. Nothing special here fried food, your typical gumbo and overpriced everything. $24 for pasta, and no it doesn't have lobster in it. As you can see I'm not a fan of this place. I ordered the blacken ahi tuna salad medium rare. The fish was over cooked because it was frozen. And we are not just talking about medium cook oh no it was well well well done. This is how I know it was frozen because you can't cook tuna at medium rare if it's frozen. Don't get the add on blackened crawfish tails they are not good. The reason I am giving this restaurant three stars is because our service was great. Errol and Jerleen took care of us.
Excellent service and food! Had Pamela as a waitress. She was funny knowledgeable and had the best recommendations for food and what to see around the city. The royal omelette is a must!!!

Oysters were loaded with flavor, ahi tuna was a hit, purple haze beer had a nice flavor, crab cakes flaked nicely, red jambalaya was good, ravioli was filling, but ribeye was not the best choice. The missing star is due to the service which seemed to be in its own haze. Still, good local flavor.

Not the best breakfast in NOLA but very good

I had the St James crepe.   It comes with about a pound of shrimp and crab although it was missing hollandaise sauce.  this would really have improved the breakfast.

At Oceana the service was super fast and the food was very tasty. We got the Taste of New Orleans and I would recommend it if you haven't had multiple Cajun dishes. Also we got the gator bites. We got the half  blackened and half fried gator bites, but I would say that the best of the two were the fried for sure. Brandon H was our server and he was very friendly and has fast service.

Very good food and service here. Our waiter Guy was very knowledgeable about the menu and he was very attentive and friendly. I got the poboy and my goodness, it was huge! Very good poboy and the fries that came with it were very good too. I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone coming to visit New Orleans.

Oh, and as a bonus, they're located right near bourbon street, so you can still feel like you're at the party and eat good food at the same time. But if you're wanting to have a little more peace and quiet, I suggest you ask to be seated upstairs. It's much more quiet there and you can actually hear your friend talk to you while you both eat.
Extremely solid seafood place in the quarter. Nothing fancy. This local used to go there on the regular. Get the NOLA style BBQ shrimp!

Ordered delivery while staying at NOLA during Christmas. Crab cakes were pretty big, adequate amount of crab meat, and I liked the sauce. Gumbos can never go wrong here. Jambalaya pasta was very tasty. One of the reasons I ordered the pasta was that it has alligator sausage, just wanna try it. The crawfish over fried fish was also good. BTW, NOLA food are generally a little salty to me, hence I commented less salty. Just FYI
Last night in New Orleans  and had dinner at Oceana Grill. The bayou duck was excellent! The service was great our server Amie was very friendly and knowledgeable. Highly recommended !!!

The staff is really nice but the food is straight up garbage. Clearly frozen and nothing is fresh. We had Arnold Palmers which just tasted like low quality lemonade. I ordered shrimp creole and all I tasted was canned tomatoes and frozen shrimp, which were tiny. It came with slices of stale french bread, ugh. My husband is more easy to please and enjoyed his "Taste of New Orleans" which came with red beans and rice, étouffée and jambalaya. I also tasted it and I can assure you, it's nothing to rave about. I should've trusted my instincts and walked out the moment I walked in. This place has bad corporate seafood written all over it. You can tell by the decor and the menus. Yelp deceived me this time. Boo.

I'll start off with the pros: the portions are huge and our waitress was amazing. However, I got food poisoning from the Taste of New Orleans ($22 incl. added crawfish tails). I felt nauseous for the entire day after. My friend got the seafood platter and he said it was not that good either, besides the fact that it was huge.

Food, price and service staff is wonderful, group of five work guys went and enjoyed drinks and time. 

Food was slow to come and the manager came to apologize but offered nothing. 

Manager was Renee and should be fired for the poor service he provided. 

We were told if we checked in on yelp we could get 10%, off but all five did not all check in they would not honor it. 

Deal with your manager Renee please bad!

I wouldn't recommend the root beer float; the root beer seemed flat. I also got the blackened chicken po boy. The chicken was good, but the amount of sauce on the bread made it a little soggy and hard to handle. The server was friendly and quick and the place had a nice, relaxed atmosphere.

Got the blackened chicken Caesar salad and it was decent but part the romaine lettuce they used was old. Also had the alligator pan friend and deep fried, but really good, especially with their dipping sauce, but if you had to choose, get the deep fried, not as chewy.
Great food, even better view. Service was exceptional, they even had a good wine list. Prices were a little better thanbi thought.

As a non seafood eater visiting the south. It's hard to find place where the non seafood menu is to par with seafood menu. 

The restaurant itself was very colorful vibrant and truly capture the spirit of the sea. The staff was pleasant and gave great advice.

The food was great. The porterhouse steak was well season and cooked how I like it. Side dishes were standard fries and veggies. The meal put a lot of places in California to shame. 

The prices were very fair considering it's located in the French quarter and recommend  for those jumping in as first timers.

Great place! Food was served quickly and was delicious. Our server Morganne was awesome! She got everything we asked for and had time to talk sports with my three year old. Definitely check this place out!

We thought maybe we could get in the door right away but were so wrong. Waited in line to get a table for dinner on a Tuesday evening but the wait wasn't too bad. 

Had to try some of Louisiana dishes before we say our goodbyes to this busy city. Tried Cajun fries, Taste of New Orleans (Creole jambalaya, crawfish etouffée, red beans and rice with smoked sausage) bowl of gumbo, barbecued shrimp, and their bread pudding. Everything was excellent. 

The city has amazing food with so much flavors. Wow. We will miss it very much.
I got the Shrimp Alfredo! It was amazing! The Shrimp tasted soo fresh! It was delicious!

What was I expecting right off of Bourbon Street? Is a nice starter of delicious Oysters on the Half Shell too much to ask from a costal town? Apparently so. I ordered a dozen and they arrived fast enough but...there was ZERO juice in the shells, no brine, no flavor. The oyster were cut from the shell but didn't leave the chewy part that attaches to the shell attached to the shell. I had to bite it off and put it back on the plate. Even with lemon and sauce the taste was flat. It made me wonder if they rinsed the oysters, which would explain the total lack of flavor. For $14/dozen I say pass and try any number of other options  - I know I will.

One more thing - they had us line up outside like there was a waiting list. When we got in to be seated there were empty tables everywhere. Felt like they were trying to make it appear more "in demand" than it was.

The missus and I stopped in for a late night snack to get away from Bourbon St. We were pleasantly greeted and seated, and our server Adam welcomed us right away.

We ordered the chargrilled oysters and seafood gumbo. Man, what a treat! The oysters were awesome, you could taste the smoky flavor of the grilling and still get the full flavor of the oysters. They were perfectly cooked! It was all topped in an amazing sauce with grated parmesan.

The seafood gumbo was the most flavorful I've had. Very rich, with a wonderful seafood flavor. I could have done a bit spicier but that's just me. It was great, and totally made us a fan of gumbo. I hope we can find some back home!

Our server Adam was great and knew his stuff. We wanted to know what remoulade was and he had the answer. He told us what he liked about the gumbo and how the oysters were cooked.

Acme gets all the accolades but I'm glad we found Oceana. We'll def stop back in next time we're in town!

This was by far my favorite restaurant in New Orleans when I came for Mardi Gras. Great food and outstanding service. Highly recommend it. If you never had your chicken grilled and blackened I strongly suggest you do that.

The service was fantastic and the food was amazing. I ordered the crab cake fettuccine Alfredo. It wasn't listed on the menu but it's listed online. Definitely worth it! The oysters Rockefeller were delicious as well.
Had the jambalaya pasta. It was so amazing I was licking the plate! My friend had the crab cake pasta and she said "yeah whatever it was good". I will be back for more!

Do not eat here. I wanted to like it there and initially did, but their behavior following an issue over the gratuity was beyond the pale. The room was not ready on time, the food order was wrong, some members of the staff were rude and threatening. Go somewhere else with your money and time.

We had their red fish special.  It was a huge fillet that was lightly breaded, pan fried with Cajun seasoning covered by a crayfish & mushroom sauce.  Delicious.  A mash potato and cooked greens accompanied the fish.  We ordered their gumbo that was mostly a fish based broth, rice, and shrimp.  The crab cakes were thick, covered with a similar sauce to the red fish.  A nice local draft beer accompanied the dinner.  Kevin, our waiter was very accommodating.  We enjoyed the meal.
Our brunch was incredible fatty and I love fatty-- just a little over the top with grease and salt. There are much better options out there like the Oyster Factory, any little lo-boy shop...

Baked oysters were with garlic cream sauce were delicious along with the crab cakes. Blackened alligator seemed to be a little overdone or missing something. Service was great. For late night food we would definitely go again

My friends and I were suffering from a serious hangover and we grabbed breakfast here as it was extremely close to our hotel. The staff was exceptionally pleasant and our waitress Tiffany provided us with great service. The food was good and was exactly the meal we needed to recover from a night of debauchery.

Headed to Conti St and found Oceana, not knowing anything about it. The staff was so friendly and the food was fantastic. Highly recommend this place. They made my first impression of New Orleans a good one!
Terrence was an outstanding server on our visit to Oceana Grill!! We were there on a Mary Kay visit and he made the night most enjoyable!  I recommend Terrence for a promotion!!!
Amazing food. Great service. Worth the wait. Repeat customer. Will stop by anytime we are in NOLA.

I came here with some friends and got the blackened chicken plate. The blackened chicken was ok however the fries and jambalaya were terrible. The fries looked like they were soaked in oil and not visually appealing. The jambalaya was seasoned rice and a little bit of shredded meat. Also the bathrooms were disgusting! I would not recommend this place

Went to Oceana for breakfast...the food was good, nothing out of the ordinary but tasty and got the job done quickly. The best part was the service...5 star service from our waiter, Ponce. He was very warm and welcoming as well as attentive throughout the meal. Would like to go back and try the lunch or dinner menu in the future.

Ordered the jambalaya pasta, crab cakes, and Oceana's famous oysters. Everything was great - definitely recommend the oysters! 

However, a word of caution: all of the dishes we ordered were very creamy. It felt like cream dish on cream dish on cream dish.

What can I say?? Everything about this place was incredible! It's New Orleans so, of course, the food is going to be divine! I had the red beans and rice. Could use a tad more spiciness, but delicious nonetheless! Creme Brulee for dessert. Oh my!! Smooth, creamy and soooo exquisite!!! I recommend this place!!

I work for the Federal Government and could not leave for lunch. I emailed to see if they delivered at my location but I was out of their area. Rami Bader,Vice President of Operations, took my order and delivered it to me personally. I was great and will dine there often.

We were browsing around the French Quarter searching for a restaurant after taking a long 4 hour city tour. The shuttle driver from the Mardi Gras Tour had recommended the Oceana Grill Restaurant and since we were passing it we thought we would stop there for dinner. We were greeted in a friendly, enthusiastic manner & were taken up some steps to a dark room with no windows and seated. We were a party of 4 and were immediately asked for our drink orders & given menus. 1 of us ordered a cheese burger (a teenager), 1 ordered fried shrimp, 1 ordered the crab cake appetizer and 1 ordered the oyster Po Boy & a side of fried crawfish tails. Everyone said their meals were OK, nothing special. Shrimp was ordinary, Po Boy, nothing great, crawfish tails- as usual, and Crab Cakes ordinary with a nice crawfish sauce. The Cheese Burger was awesome. Large portions though not too special for a recommended Sea Food French Quarter restaurant. Service was Very Good and attentive. Will not be returning or recommending.

Watch out, Felix!  Oceana Grill will give you a run for your money for fried oysters!  They are lightly breaded and the breading doesn't take away from the flavor of the little seafood morsals.  The fried seafood platter is $18, yeah, a little pricey, but worth every penny for the great quality.  

Why did I go to the Oceana Grill over Felix's the 2nd to last day I was in New Orleans?  I had already been to Felix's a few times to down some fresh oysters and was actually on my way there when the friendly and funny dude who worked the doorway of Oceana beckoning people to come in convinced me to try their oysters.  Of course it's his job to tell people that Oceana is the best, but he didn't lie.  They match Felix's.  But, I admit that Oceana does cost more $$.

I haven't tried it yet, but the catfish looked amazing too.  Next time I'm there with someone else, we'll have to split the catfish platter and oyster platter.  Any takers?  I'm always game for a trip to get some great seafood/fish and can hop in my hovercraft at a moment's notice and will meet you and we can "shut it down in New Orleans".  :)  Anyone guess where that quote is from?  I'll buy you a drink if you get it right!

First off, the waitstaff were ALL just about the best we encountered in our 4 days in NOLA.  Our server, Jordan A, was excellent!  She was pleasant, fun, helpful, and just made us feel right "at home."  She helped us navigate the menu and made a couple of recommendations.  We ended up with an oyster po-boy and a catfish plate.  Both were wonderful and more food than we could handle.  Our only regret is that we didn't find Oceana, and Jordan A, earlier in our visit!

Came here with some business friends, after hearing great reviews of this place. I just thought it was average. That's why I gave it three stars. The crab cakes we're mostly breading, with very little lump crab meat. The sauce was fantastic on top of the crab cakes however. Others got the gumbo. Again, no complaints, but no one raved either. Our service was also average. Relatively slow, and nothing spectacular. All in all, it wasn't a terrible experience and it wasn't a wonderful experience. So 3 stars it is.

EXTREMELY IMPRESSED. Oceana Grill has the friendliest staff in New Orleans and the food was beyond phenomenal. We went at around 8:00 on a Saturday night. We weren't able to make reservations, however, I was shocked to hear there was only a 10 minute wait, which only lasted about 5 minutes until we were seated. We ordered our food and another shocker, it was out in about 10 minutes.

We came here for late  lunch on our    second day in New Orleans , place  suggested by a couple of locals  people . 
It was no line at 3  pm,Saturday  but we seat at the bar anyway.Bartender, young man, looks very friendly and recommended us 
everything we asked. To got a chance test everything a little-we go with appetizers only.
Crab cakes were   so yummy, we    even recommended them to lady  sititng  next to us.
While eating delicious char-grilled oysters on the half shell I find  little  black Pearl- very rare thing, !!!!!  
 Must be good luck for me. (Hey, bartender, You remember me, don`t You?)
Gator bites were just so, so. They were gummy. I had half of them blackened and the other half fried coming with yummy 
dipping sauce. My wife joked "if You got good sauce You can eat anything " .
Drinks are-(like always and everywhere)-very good ;)
And then it come very unpleasant surprise to us , On a bill it was added gratuity 18%
When we asked why ? , bartender told us its their policy! .When we gently told him that on menu it said its for party of 5 
people or more he told us its their common practice for people out of state ! ( being citizens,We still have a heavy European accent , but since when You need to shall Your ID in restaurant to eat lunch ??? ) . When we asked for explanation, he asked his friend " Hey, how will You explain that gratuity for people out of state? " . That lady ignored him. Then he returned our money with words: OK, here You are, no gratuity added " .
I don`t know, what he thinks!!!
I still don`t want to leave without a tip, but it was much smaller the I'm usually giving
This was disillusioned and disappointed. I hate cheaters.!!!! Shame on You  Bartender    !!!!
The crab cakes here are so delicious and the service was great too! Not too pricey and located very close to Bourbon Street so if you are staying there it is a very short walk.

Been here two days in a row, as were the customers in line ahead of us. I did a pretty extensive check in review with all that we ordered, so won't do it again here; just suffice it to say ordered a lot. Everybody happy and satisfied. Short wait in line both days, and service excellent and very friendly. NO complaints!

This restaurant is popular for a reason, their food is very good.  You might want to get there a bit early for dinner.  When I left there was a line of people waiting to enter.  I had the Redfish Oceana and enjoyed my meal so much I went back for breakfast the next morning.  The Pain Perdu "Lost Bread" with peach topping was great.  Two tips:  1 - Show your receipt from a previous meal and they will give you a discount. 2 - At brunch I was handed an abbreviated menu, but if you know what you want from the full breakfast menu [on-line] they will gladly make it for you.

Visited here in 2016 we enjoyed the food a lot. So we went back dec 30, 2017 and back again January 2,2018. One of the only places I could find seafood gumbo without sausage. I love this place. Long wait but considering the holidays and the Sugar Bowl crowds it wasn't as bad as it could've been. Husband and I shared the seafood platter. We had leftovers. Lots of good food.

Best crab cakes I've ever had! They were full of large pieces of crab and covered with a good mushroom and crawfish sauce. They were pricy but I didn't regret it after I tried them. I had the fried shrimp platter which was a huge portion. My only issue was that the batter was so thick on the shrimp you could barely taste the shrimp itself. I ended up picking off the batter and just eating the shrimp inside.

Any other time of day this might be 3 or 3.5 stars, but a good meal at 11:30pm deserves a star boost. 

Tried the oyster po'boy. Others at my table had gumbo, gator bites and ribs. All were good - po'boy bread was fresh and oysters fried right. 

Server and host were prompt, friendly and attentive. Good find for a late arrival, and recommend trying.
Blackened catfish po-boy was delicious!  They brought me the wrong food the first time around, but the waitress was very apologetic and got it fixed right away.  I would eat here again for sure.

Food was good but the service was a little slow. Took a while to get utensils, water, and the bill. but I would recommend there crab cakes. one of the best crab cakes I ate. Plenty of crab, crispy outer skin, and the sauce was creamy and flavorful.

This place isnt bad - They changed there menu and forgot to put some of the menu items on the new menu?!?!? One being the Tuna with Shrimp - Teh Tuna was ok  - a little overcooked for "seared rare"  The Oysters were pretty good and the service was good. I would reccomend ACME or Royal for oysters but this place isnt to bad... no reservations needed.

Ok this place is very commercial the crab cakes where awesome if you want a quick bite to eat and you are in the area stop in and try the crab cakes don't look for any thing special fried oysters to say I had them was great but nothing to 3 star about it's food enjoy!!!

The staff: Wonderful accommodating people that really take the time to get to know their customers. 

The food: Delicious! We had the catfish po boys, oysters, shrimp po boys. The drinks are delicious! I have nothing bad to say about this place :)
The crabcakes had too much filling. And the.shrimp.was overcooked. How can you overcook  shrimp? Like rubber?  They made me sad!

It was okay.. We had the gator bites and they come half grilled and half fried and they were just okay. We've had much better both in the quarter and else where while we were here. We also got the charbroiled oysters and they were not good. They had this weird sloppy sauce on the them and they were not anything like we've gotten at two other places here. I wouldn't recommend them at all. 't were with a large party about 25 and the waitress was amazing and did such a great job. I feel like the food was just okay. We both got Po-Boys and they were also just okay, nothing special, but the french fries were really good. Not some place i would tell people to go...
If your in a Bourbon Street pinch for a meal, put it on the list. The Service is SLOW.

First time to New Orleans and Oceana Grill was the first place we tried and we were not disappointed. EVERYTHING on the menu looks delicious so it's hard to decide, our waitresses name was Whitney and she was extremely helpful with not only the service but also her recommendation on what to order and how to order it !! 5 stars not only for the food but also the amazing staff and atmosphere they provided

So we were in New Orleans on our honeymoon and our hotel recommended this place to us for breakfast. I knew I'd love the place because we walked in and saw a "Do Not Serve This Man" sign with a photo of Roger Goodell attached to it. Hysterical! Anyway, we ended up eating here twice because we liked it and it was pretty cheap. 
I had the Biscuits & Gravy the first time and they were divine! The sausage gravy was super spicy (the way I like it) and it was a huge portion. The biscuits were fresh and soft and were covered in the thick gravy. It was a great starter. My husband had the Cajun Sausage breakfast with the alligator and andouille sausage. It was the first time we both had alligator and we enjoyed it. 

The second time we came I got the Pain Perdu and it was okay. I think I've had better.. the day before we had breakfast at Stanley and their food was out-of-this-world good. I wanted to try their Eggs Melanzana but it wasn't on the menu the second time!  My husband had the Royal Omelette and he said it was one of his favorite meals in NOLA.  They did keep telling us to try their Crab Cakes but being from Maryland.. we weren't about to see one of our favorite meals butchered, so we stuck with the stuff we didn't have at home. The drinks were strong and were exactly what we needed to start off the day. Staff was friendly and quick and provided great service. I'd stop back here in the future for sure.

Two words: oysters rockafeller!!! They were amazing. The crab meat cakes were great, very filling with a side of potatoes. If you want to try it all: Taste of New Orleans. This place is huge and waiters are knowledgeable. Check in with yelp deal.
I couldn't even finish my food, which was chicken fettuccine alfredo, because is was so spicy, i do not recommend this place unless if you like spicy food.

The three stars go to the bbq shrimp dish which was okay. The oysters rockefeller and oysters with cheese were not good. Not a huge fan of oysters but my friend who ordered them is a big fan and wasn't pleased with their dish. Found a hair inside one of the oysters and they gave us a new dish but we lost our appetite at that point.  Very disappointed since this place came highly recommended by our hotel. The server was really nice though.

BEST BLACKENED CATFISH POBOY EVER!!!!!
This place is conveniently located in the French market just off Bourbon Street.  The blackened catfish poboy was so unbelievably delicious that we went back for a 2nd visit.  Service was great, atmosphere was great.  I highly recommend this place.
Talk about soul food! This is THE place to go to get some good food. Their dishes are truly an experience.

Stopped by since I had an hankering for seafood and this was pulling at the top of the list. Just got the crab cakes and a side of shrimp. The shrimp was wayyyyyyyy to bready for my liking. The batter tasted decent but the person making them was heavy handed. The crab cakes tasted more like dough than crab. I did like the crawfish sauce on top - that had a great flavor to it and would have probably been nice over pasta. Food presentation was meh - nothing I got was worthy on taking a photo. The Bahama Mama was nice - couldn't taste the alcohol - that would have been a nice sneak attack. Go for the drinks, service was great.

This restaurant is simply delightful! We absolutely loved everything. The service was quick, our waitress Tiffany gave excellent recommendations. My husband had the redfish étouffée and I had a blackened shrimp poboy. You can't go wrong with this place! Roll tide!!

The crab cakes are to die for. Everything else seemed over rated and commercialized. Definitely had better gumbo and etoufee at other local spots. We got in with only a 15 min wait. It is not worth the long wait some people have reported - in my opinion.

I had to come on here to give a high five to the chef on the grill who hooked up the oysters . The sauce was the bomb (excellent) omg. So good . I watched him make them from My seat abs you can tell he knew what he was doing . Great great job

Another place that I tried based on Yelp Reviews. I wasn't sure what to order so I eventually settled on the seafood platter in order to get both some Fried Oysters as well as some other classic favorites (fried fish and shrimp). For the price $22 it's quite the meal. The standout was actually the french fries. these were some of the best fries I've had and I'm not usually even a french fry fan. The jalapeno hush puppies were also good. The fish, shrimp and oysters were all solid, good food but not amazing. I could have done without the coleslaw and basically did by leaving half of it. The most disappointing thing about this place was that after I ordered the bar tender told the people who sat down next to me about an off the menu special that sounded awesome and I would have liked to try it. Guess I have a reason to go back, but it would have been nice had he told me about it since I probably would have ordered it.
The food was great. The waiters were very friendly and consistent with satisfying all of my needs.

Great food and great service! The manager Erol was super nice and extremely helpful when it came to recommendations. Our waitress Ashlegh was friendly, polite and helpful. Although the restaurant was litty, super crowded, and she had mad tables to serve, she never made us feel abandoned. Always there when we called or signaled to get her attention in the mass of the crowd. We were only visiting NOLA for 3 days but the food and service was so on point, that we had to come back a second time! Doesn't matter what day, the service and food was still exceptional! Our waitress Whitney was super sweet and funny. Came by to tell us stories to pass the time as we waited for our food. Had us dyin laughin!
Wonderful food, service had to be requested but once acknowledged everything was good to go.
Some of the best food in the city. The prices are what you expect for being so close to bourbon st, but all in all, very worth it. its very nice inside, and the deserts are fantastic.
Good food.  The crawfish over catfish was awesome. The crab cakes are good. The crawfish etoufeee (spelled wrong) was okay. Our waiter "Guy" was awesome. Ask for him.

After searching Yelp for places to go and always seeing this place as one of the best, we finally decided to go.. especially since it was right outside our hotel.
WHY DID WE NOT GO SOONER??
The food was unbelievably good!! I cannot rave enough about it!
We sat at the bar and had the sweetest bartender too!! The vibe was so fun and laid back but then the food came out and completely blew our minds.

Just passing by New Orleans on my road trip. I stumbled upon this place and asked my server Errol, "How can I taste Louisiana cuisine?" He told me to get the "Taste of New Orleans". So I got it and wow. The food tastes like what I imagined I would taste in creole/Cajun food. 

Overall, the food was great, the place had a great vibrant feel to it, and the server was very helpful and welcoming.
Ponce was awesome, food and service were great! Had the raw oysters, gator poboy, and blackened Caesar salad. Everything was excellent! Thanks for being there!

We had breakfast and lunch. They actually cooked my eggs "over easy". Thank you! Lunch was the blackened chicken po' boy which was excellent.

The music was way too loud.

Visited January 2013

A little underwhelming and very overpriced. Two pasta dishes and an appetizer cost me $60+ . The food was good but def not worth the $17+ price tag on all of the pastas... it's just pasta. We tried the mardi gra pasta, the shrimp pasta and some crab cakes. The blackened shrimp which was in the pasta was very delicious. Crab cakes were a bit too salty. The bread that came with the pasta wasn't too appetizing either. Our server was great though. I can't justify the prices of this restaurant knowing the food is just 'okay'.

Best meal of my vacation! The crab cakes were the best I'd ever had. First, our table got an appetizer of oysters. I'm not a fan, myself, but these were delicious. Then the awesome crab cakes...and then, the best part. Free dessert! If you "check in" on Facebook, you get a free bread pudding with the purchase of two entrees. Not only was it free but it was tasty too! Our server, Tom, probably provided the best customer service of the whole vacation as well!
Great choice for seafood, excellent oysters, the service was outstanding.  The only disappointing part of the dinner was the dessert, I ordered Crme Brulee  it was overcooked and awful.

I came to N'awlings to celebrate my birthday and my food experiences have been dismal. However before partying on Bourbon St. Yesterday (May 14th) my BFF and I wanted to grab something to eat. So we went to Oceana. We were sat right away and must admit we were a little difficult because we asked to change tables a couple times. One room was to cold (I get cold easily) and one room was nice but we noticed outside seating. Best decision ever because then we had Kevin H. as our server and he was amazing!! He was so polite he was fast and new the menu. Speaking off menu we had seafood gumbo and crab cakes and it was to die for!! I'm very pleased with this restaurant and we thanked the manager on the way out. This place is a gem with great service and food. What more could you ask for?!

I'm so happy I stumbled into this restaurant. I was hell bent on eating a po boy in New Orleans, but didn't really pick a specific place to try. My coworkers and I were walking down Bourbon street and popped in here without really knowing anything about the place. I ordered the shrimp po boy and it was DELICIOUS! Much better than the one's I've tried in DC or Chicago. Our server was really attentive and shared a ton of history with us. By the time we left the restaurant there was a huge line waiting to be seated. Clearly it's a must-try spot for food!

Amazing food and ambiance! My mom and I came here because a lot of our friends recommended this place. The service was great and the food fantastic. We shared the alligator bites and the jambalaya and both were superb! Definitely stop by!!!
Nice environment, good service and good tasty food..totally recommended.. Try the "TASTE OF NEW ORLEANS " special!

Went in for lunch on my recent stay in New Orleans. Loved the food here! The crabcakes were absolutely amazing, tried the fried oyster platter for lunch, was also excellent! The service was great and the ambiance was truly Louisiana! Definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for some good Cajun seafood!

The food was great and the prices were very reasonable. The location is convenient - Conti & Bourbon. The building is multiple levels and is much larger than it looks from the street, the atmosphere is desirable as well.

What an amazing place. Second time I try oysters and unlike my first experience I loved it. The crab cake was also great. But definitely try their special oyster the sauce is to die for. They are also open late which is great.

Great location, good atmosphere, and delicious food. They have a good selection for breakfast/brunch and the prices are really reasonable. 

I was a little disappointed with the service. The hostess was friendly and made us feel welcome. While our waitress was friendly and attentive, the wrong order was delivered twice and when the staff was told it was the wrong order, they just shrugged and dropped it off on the table before walking away (we ate it anyways and it was good!). The staff took their time getting the checks, but was kind enough to split up the order.

Overall, Oceana Grill had good food at reasonable prices, but the service could have been better.

I am not much creole food but the sea food here was definitely not fresh! I was disappointed because i asked for cajun fries and they gave me secret fries without the seasoning instead. When i asked the server, she gave me the house seasoning to dump it on myself. The crab cakes were so-so. Would rather go else where

Although it looks very touristy, Oceana was great.  We had the best waitress of our five days in the French Quarter -- which is saying something given how friendly the New Orleans folks were to us throughout.  Had the seafood platter -- which is fried oysters, friend shrimp and fried fish.  Was fantastic.  Great tartar for the fried foods.  We had a great time.  

This joint has lots and lots of tv screens so it sort of has that sports bar feel and atmosphere.  Would go back.

liked the ambiance and the food. laid-back atmosphere (this is new orleans after all), good food, reasonably priced. $30 for 2 people. 
Craig, our server was great and the hostess, Canisha 
was really helpful getting us the table we wanted.

Went in with a party of about 18 girls for a bachelorette party dinner! 

Service was phenomenal!!!!! Whitney was our waitress and not a single thing was wrong. She was on top of her game and got every single order correct! She was so attentive and did an amazing job taking care of us ! Can't say enough about her!


The food was amazing. I wish I could remember everything that we ordered but from the Mac and cheese to the blackened chicken pasta, gumbo, jambalaya....everything was DELICIOUS. 


Definitely a place to check out! I loved every single dish I tried here!

Had their Oceana Oysters...  Absolutely horrible!  We were doing an Oyster-crawl and sampling from the local spots.  These were by far the worst ones...     there was too much sauce covering the entire plate.  It's as though they charbroiled the Oysters, placed the bread on the plate and then doused it with a creamy sauce.  Sauce overload.  

We've eaten here before and the service is good and other food items are ok.  But, this was a horrible oyster experience.  So, come for everything else except oysters.

Went here for breakfast & was actually skeptical of eating here because it's a seafood place. They surprised me royally because it was actually pretty good. I had the country breakfast & my only complaint is that the grits were a little runny. Other than that, everything else hit the spot!
Best crawfish etoufee around! Everything there was delicious & the drinks are strong. Fun place to go with a group!

It was good. The chef special was tasty, raw oysters were smooth, and according to my wife the bread pudding was delicious. But only order what you know you like,there is no room for mistakes. The oysters Rockefeller and Oceana oysters were terrible. A pile of sauce on an oyster shell. Ick. They wouldn't make it right so it really put a damper on the dinner.
Legit gumbo and grilled clams! The red beans and rice were so tasty and servers were on point. Prices were high for the small portions but food was good. About a 30 minute wait to get in.

The famous crab cake and crawfish etouffee did not disappoint at all! The richness of the sauce and the well balanced of spice made me can't help going back for more! And our waiter Michael is super friendly and the food took really quick to come out so highly recommend you to come visit!

My wife and I celebrated our 35th anniversary while on business in New Orleans.  My wife made reservations at Oceana based on some recommendations from other seminar attendees.  Our table was ready when we arrived and we were seated immediately.  Our waitress was Ashleigh and we could not have been more pleased with our service.  The atmosphere is great, the service is spot on, and the food was hot, tasty, and perfectly seasoned.  We would recommend to anyone.

We were told by our VIP driver they had good food.
Wasn't impressed at all. The bread from the PoBoy sandwich was the best part of the,meal.
Kevin our waiter was so/so. Our table was too close to where the bar meets up with servers putting in orders and picking up drinks...felt like we were in the way.

I can say I tried the gator bites...ehhh...okay I ate gator.
