I have been to New England and to Seattle and have had some good crab cakes...but these were the BEST I EVER HAD! We ate here 3 times while we were visiting New Orleans. Also great Bloody Marys.

I knew good creole food would be easy to find anywhere in the French quarter, but tried Oceana at the advice of several people that me and my fiancee met during our short stay there. I must say,  on April 13, 2012, at Oceana, I had the best damn biscuits and gravy ive ever had in my life and still talk about it over 2 years later anytime anybody here in Vegas mentions breakfast. Staff are very nice also.
Always consistent good food.  I believe one of the chefs came from Petunia's.  Great seafood, excellent greek chicken po-boy.  I grits & grillades are on the menu - order, you won't be disappointed.
Very friendly service. Food was great. I had the pasta which was more like soup from the amount of sauce they put on but tasted great. Friend had shrimp po boy and it was amazing.

I read through the other reviews but lost some trust in my fellow yelpers. Had high hopes for oceana, but basically seems like chain restaurant food. First time here, and didn't hold a candle to other new orleans fare. Disappointed. Had signature dish red fish, crab cakes, and bread pudding. All sub-par. Service was good/friendly but didn't make food taste better. I don't plan on going back or recommending to anyone else. Also cost about same as other delicious food nearby. And I hadn't eaten all day, so appetite was ready for a good meal!
Very very good place for dining! Thank you staff for accommodating us so well and getting our food out in a timely manner.

Visited during the Mardi Gras Weekend. The service was great, food came out very quickly. The prices however I don't feel represented the quality of food being offered. I had a Carfish Po Boy, after the meal I felt a bit gutted for what I was charged.

Mmmm mmmm mmmmm mmmm gooood! From the service at the door coming in as well as our departure, mmmppphhhaaaw... magnificent!  My boyfriend and myself were on a road trip driving from Phoenix to Florida when we decided to stop and rest in New Orleans for the night, we wanted a taste of some of the cities best and believe me we found at Oceanas  I had a platter and the food was so fresh, hot and finger licking good! The gumbo was yummy but those crab cakes, yes yes and yeeeeessss! Hit the spot. But I am big on customer service so when you see these ladies I want you all to know you're in good hands and here are their names; Gabby, Brittney and Ronnie thank you all for making my night and I hope that Oceana 's know that they have some true gems  working for them. Thank you, thank you and I do hope we meet again because we will be back!

I got the seafood fry up, the crab cakes, oysters Rockefeller, and a soft shell crab. 

Catfish was junk enough to not finish it. Batter on the fry up was lacking in flavor. Tartar sauce that came with it was not good. 

The rest of the food was good. The crab cakes were different from regular tastes, but I actually enjoyed it more as the flavor was simpler. 

The portions are big and matches the bigger price.

Came here for breakfast the second day in New Orleans.. might have been still intoxicated/hungover but the food here was pretty tasty and definitly helped with the headache. 

between 4 of us we ordered 2 Gumbo's to share and they were delicious.. highly recommened it... then we all had a breakfast. I presonally had the Cajun Sausage Breakfast and it was good, my friend had the Maw Maw Cajun Breakfast and I think that one was better. 

Overall great breakfast location to go after a night out on Bourbon
I absolutely love this place! Every time I'm in New Orleans I have to stop by. Their food is flavorful and the service is great. Great drinks as well!
Great food great service! I enjoy this restaurant every time we come to NOLA. It just good, not fancy, Cajun food.
The food here is very good. From the  etouffee the redfish the soft shell crab or the oyster po boy you can't go wrong.  The service is impeccable.

Great first choice for first time traveler to NOLA.  Jambalaya Pasta and added blackened chicken, and a Sazerak!  Mmmmmm, tasty!  Food was ready within 10 minutes, waitress checked in every 5 mins or so...I would recommend this place.  Cool atmosphere.  Thank you Kim!

Went for lunch with the family and we tried a bit of everything. Blackened catfish, crawfish etouffee, fried seafood platter and a burger. All were delicious. We had Miss Laverne as our server and the the service was great. Also sampled several of the desserts (bananas foster, pecan pie, bread pudding and Creme brûlée). I can't believe we ate so much but everything was just so good. One of the few places in the French Quarter good for families and kids!

This is just down the block from our hotel. Walked by at 5 pm and place was pretty empty but by 6:15 p m there was a line to get in. Earlier we had spoken to one of the waitstaff, Earl, who gave us a card to bypass the line. Yup! The card worked and we went pass the line of people there waiting and straight to a table.

 Ordered 1 1/2 dozen oysters on a half shell (hugh oysters and very fresh). Barbecue shrimp 8 large shimp/ prawns in a delicious barbecue sauce that was more sweet than tangy. Big bowl of gumbo with rice and French bread. The 2 hugh crab cakes were stuffed with crab and not much filler.  Dessert was a Kahlua chocolate mousse pie with vanilla ice cream.  Just the right amount of sweetness, perfect texture and a toffee surprise in the middle. 

Wait staff was thorough, friendly and efficient. Prices were affordable and the best in town for raw oysters - $12/dozen, $7/ half dozen.

I had dinner delivered to hotel after long day at a convention.  I ordered the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta dinner and Banana Foster for dessert.  I really enjoyed the food and great Cajun spices.  I gave 4 star rating because you only get two tiny slivers of bread with your pasta.  They were about the size of a potato chip.  They also brought me a regular coke when I ordered a diet coke.  Delivery was quick.  I would order from there again.

This review is specifically for the $25 three course add-on to the Taste of Nawlins tour.

Pros: Exceptional staff. Everyone we encountered, from the friendly host to the manager who helped us re-schedule our reservation (and graciously allowed us to show a phone-screen coupon for our meal when we couldn't find a printer) was great. Our server, Michon, was also wonderful and friendly and gave great service. The bartenders we encountered earlier in the day were slightly less friendly, but I'll give them a pass because I can't even imagine being a bartender between the French Quarter and Bourbon Street. The place is also decorated well and the drink menu is full of expensive-yet-delicious drinks. The prices surprised me, but they're typical for the area. Also, the dessert (sans whipped "cream" but I'll get to that later) was amazing. I could drink the praline sauce and die a happy woman.

Cons: It's probably our own fault for doing a coupon on top of a coupon, but the "Three Course Meal" menu was incredibly under-whelming. For one, the first option was either a salad or gumbo, and we had just sampled the gumbo on our tour. It'd be great if something else was offered, since we'd already had their gumbo. For the second course, I ordered the "Blackened Catfish" and my fiance got the "Blackened Chicken Pasta" (the other option was a po'boy, which we'd already sampled on our tour--we wanted something different!). The chicken was so bland. Our tour guide warned us that many restaurants shied away from over-seasoning since tourists can't stand it, but the watery alfredo was disappointing. My catfish tasted incredible but was a bit undercooked. However, it was perfectly seasoned. I nibbled at the sides but the rice was very dry and I'm not a huge fan of collard greens, so I mostly just ate the fish. Finally, the bread pudding with praline sauce, which our server assured us was the best thing on the dessert menu. And yes--it was tasty! However, the whipped "cream" definitely was NOT cream. It tasted like someone just pipped cool whip onto the plate, and it separated as it melted on the hot bread pudding. Gross. I'd come back for the pudding, but definitely ask for no cream.

Overall, it was not the most memorable meal we had during our stay. However, the prices are reasonable for the area, and other reviews seem to suggest our experience wasn't typical. Next time perhaps I'll stop in for lunch and give them another go. In the meantime, I really suggest they take another look at their Taste of Nawlins menu.

Very Appreciative to the Oceana for being open on Christmas evening and Delivering to our Hotel.  It was only and hour wait, but that was Great when you can't get out and about with a Little one late at night.  We ordered the kids Shrimp and Fries, a Shrimp PO-Boy and the jambalaya pasta.  All of it was GREAT and nothing needed to be heated when we received it.  Thanks again, especially to the staff for working on Christmas night.

Service was great, they were very friendly and accommodating. Went in during dinner time and it wasn't overtly busy. The 10% coupon that I got when I checked in was nice! The drinks are worth the price but the portions are a bit small (if you want to split a plate in 2). Wish they had more crawfish options!
One of our favorites when we visit New Orleans. Crab cakes are excellent! Always get great service. Never had a bad meal or food item.

My and friends and I came here for dinner one night during Mardi Gras. Straight up delicious!

The service was great. We were seated within 5 minutes of walking in. We asked to be seated outside since it was such a beautiful day. 
 We ordered all types of different foods : red beans and rice,  grilled oysters, gumbo, jambalaya,  crawfish etouffée, smoked sausage,  and even gator bites. All of it was just delightful to my taste buds. 
I've never liked red beans and rice. It just never tasted good to me, until I came here and ordered the TASTE OF NEW ORLEANS entree. It had everything I wanted, and I got other dishes on the side. 
 We all enjoyed ourselves and were very satisfied with our food and our experience.
Great food, great atmosphere! Didn't wait to long for a table. Service was attentive and helpful with after dinner entertainment jazz suggestions. Would definitely come back.

Arrived in New Orleans and walked around the French Quarter looking for a good family-friendly dinner. We settled on Oceana and were seated quickly.

We ordered some drinks - they were good, but one tasted like cherry cough syrup and we asked to have something else made instead. At the end of the night, the cherry drink was still on our bill and we asked if it could be taken off. They ended up taking it off, but not before telling us "it's not our fault you didn't like it." 

Overall the food was good! Gator bites - fried and blackened - were great and the crab cakes were delicious and very dense. 

Our waitress, Natalie, was a hoot. She made our dining experience much more pleasurable.

This was the best Catfish I've had in a long time. First let me start by saying that our server Marlon was awesome! He was just really nice, on top of things and really good at recommending things on the menu. The to-go box stuff that he brought me also won him some brownie points. I've always had to ask for a little container with lemons for my leftover Catfish but not this time, he thought of everything! The Catfish was amazing! When he brought my plate out I thought he was at the wrong table because the pieces were so big that they looked like chicken strips. They lightly battered the fish so it wasn't too thick or greasy ( I hate when they use too much batter.) and it was seasoned perfectly. The strips were all white meat none of that weird looking gray fish meat. I almost thought that it was some other kind of fish like Mahi-Mahi or something because it was so good. I also got some Crawfish Etouffee which was good too but the Catfish was amazing! I can't wait to go back to get some more Catfish.

This restaurant is favorite of mine visiting past November 2016 in New Orleans.  The food taste amazing we end going back for 2nd time within  couple of days we were visiting.  Next visit, I will go back again.

Superb service and delicious food! We had the trio that includes jambalaya, étouffée, and red beans and rice with fried shrimp. The waiter was awesome and he had them split everything neatly in a bowl for us. Great tasting trio let me tell you, and the fried shrimp were nice and spicy, with yummy crispy batter. Did I mention the service? We had the best waiter. We will definitely stop again when we visit. I was glad I took a chance. Craving that jambalaya right now :)

We went to the location on Bourbon. Got there around 6 before it was packed. Even though it was busy, we were served drinks, dinner & dessert quickly.  I had the blackened duck & my son tried a blackened chicken po'boy.  We also had a Bahama Mama & Swamp Tea for drinks & bread pudding for dessert.  Everything was excellent.  Chris, our waiter, was extremely polite, engaged in conversation,  & made sure we liked our food and had everything we needed.  This restaurant was recommended to us by locals, as well as friends who had previously visited.

After suffering thru a terrible dinner at Broussard's, a snooty and condescending restaurant just up the street, we had lunch at Oceana the next day. We both enjoyed the crab meat  Eggs Benedict .The eggs were poached perfectly on the crab and muffin. Our waiter was great as well.

This came as a recommendation from a bartender at our hotel. We had Raw Oysters (which were great), Blackened Alligator (better than fried and it was delish), Red Fish with Crawfish Sauce, and the Praline Duck. Everything was great and affordable. Brad, our server, was fantastic! He made great recommendations, he was very personable, and provided great service. When I'm back in the area I will definitely stop by again.

This was a great dinner! I had the BBQ shrimp which was AMAZING!! The sauce was like a boss. The shrimp were huge and easy to peel, I licked the sauce off before peeling the shrimp then dunked them back into the sauce.  I cleaned my plate with the crusty bread served with the dish.  I'm so glad that I walked here and am walking back because the way I ate I would be ashamed it I didn't do something to counteract my gluttony:-)
Great breakfast! The mawmas dish was delicious! Shrimp, bacon, eggs, and rice scrambled together. Great Mimosas. Ponce our waiter was exceptional. I highly recommend this French quarter restaurant.
Awesome food awesome service. Staff was so pleasant.  Our waitress Ashleigh was amazing !! Coming back net trip to NOLA.
Huge potions. Worth the wait. Crab cakes are great. Great drinks and pretty fast service even if crowded.

Great Breakfast! But I have to say that the best part of this experience was our server! His name was ERROL. Total gentleman, and really interested in serving us. He was so kind and accommodating. The food was good for breakfast, but not something out of the ordinary.

I went here tonight with my family for dinner and we had a seafood feast! We ordered 2 seafood platters, that included catfish, shrimp, and oysters all fried, and added on fried crawfish and softshell crab along with a shrimp fettuccine alfredo. This was definitely plenty of food for 4 people! The seafood platters also came with cole slaw, French fries, and jalapeño hush puppies. Everything was delicious! The batter on the seafood was perfectly seasoned and had an amazing crisp once it was fried! The shrimps were really large and probably the best fried shrimp I've ever had! The fettuccine was also perfectly creamy and cheesy with delicious shrimp in it! The service was also great and the wait to get in was not that long. It's worth the wait!

In NO for the day and need something in the French Quarter, found Oceana and both of us had a po'boy. I had the blackened chicken and my husband had the alligator sausage. Both of them were fabulous. Large serving sizes and great service. Errol was friendly and prompt with the food.

Located on the corner of Bourbon Street, we decided on a whim to come here, and we are so glad we did! The staff was kind and welcoming, and our server Deja was AWESOME. So friendly and helpful, providing recommendations for our orders as well as things to do during our visit.

We started with the gator bites (half and half)- you wouldn't even know it's gator, except for the fact that it's chewier. I liked them fried and grilled equally, and the remoulade it came with gave it a nice kick.

As our main courses, we ordered the blackened catfish po boy and fried oyster po boy. The bread was crusty and delicious. The catfish was seasoned nicely, and the oyster was good too. Servings were very generous and prices were fair.

We were super hungry so we check on internet and we found this place.. it's look like Louisiana food.. that it isn't a gastronomy food if you are looking for that... it was okay no delicious, but no disaster also.
Food was great and the wait staff excellent, they were busy but our party of 2 walked on in. Again our waiter Mike was very attentive

Great food and drinks. Enjoyed the grilled oysters as an appetizer. I ordered the crabcakes with crawfish in cream sauce as my entree and it was delicious. My bestfriend ordered there jambalaya pasta and it was also good. Found out about this place via the front desk guy at Hotel St. Marie in the French quarters.
Raw oysters were fresh and delicious. House special oysters were cooked and doctored up. Very flavorful. Kinda cheesey and touristy ambiance.
Awesome, great stop. Recommended to us by several locals. Loved the oysters, and crab cakes.

I had the taste of new orleans dish and it was all awesome.  The red beans were so good you can't find anything that tastes like that in AZ.  The blackened gator bites were great.  Also enjoyed the crab cakes.  Service was top notch and the Yelp deal discount was awesome.

This Cajun restaurant satisfied all of my cravings. I 
went here with my cousin the first day I landed in New Orleans and there was not a long wait to be seated. I ordered a hurricane and it was strong and good. For an appetizer we got alligator, blackened and fried. Delicious! I ordered the taste of New Orleans which was red beans, andouille sausage, and Cajun rice. That was also delicious. I love how close it is to bourbon.

This restaurant has an very attractive interior (dark, varnished woods and British-style decor). It is three stories and clean. The staff are quite friendly. We ordered two Seafood Platters ($22.00 each), which came with coleslaw, jalapeno hush puppies, French fries, fried catfish, fried oysters, and big, fried shrimp. All of the items were well seasoned and not the least bit greasy. We thought it was excellent, we would strongly recommend it, and would certainly return. RJT

I had the fried catfish platter with fries and hushpuppies. The fish was light and tasty.  Not too much batter masking the fish.  Really tasty.  The fries and hushpuppies were excellent too. We had the chargrilled oysters for an appetizer. The parmesan sauce was great.  The only negative would be the hostess having to ask us four times how many people were in our party when we walked in and then telling us to wait outside.  Came across kinda rude.

What a nice experience.  Came in rather late for dinner.  The place was crowded for 10:30, but, it is New Orleans, so I guess that's to be expected.  Had the most pleasant server, Natalie.  She knew her stuff and easily answered all our questions.  I was starving so I had a huge porterhouse steak.  She suggested I have it blackened.  I did.  Great choice.  She assured me it would be cooked to perfection.  It was. Hubby got the fried shrimp platter.  Also delicious.  The fries were also seasoned very well and nice and crunchy outside.  Two swamp teas and we were on our way.  Worth the visit and super pleased with the great service.
Great atmosphere! The staff was more then  inviting! Food was delicious! I will be back! *You may have to ask for a children's menu separately.

excellent oysters rockefeller! quick seating, prompt and consistently good service. casual interior with a side room off the bar. grilled tuna la boheme was quite good. sauce was spicy and flavorful - although a bit greasy/oily. ribs were ok. in our quest to dine at every restaurant in the city, oceana does not necessarily warrant a return visit...

Met up with some friends here for dinner. The line was long so I figured the food should be good. I had the fried gator bites and cup of gumbo, which both of them were delicious. The drink I had (can't remember the name) was not really sweet. Overall I would visit again.

This place is amazing!! I came here last night and loved every bit of it!!  Spent most of today just craving their famous oysters and jambalaya pasta!!  Definitely go see Emily, she is awesome and very attentive!  I love when a server can keep up with my drinks!

Excellent eatery this morning 
Server was extra helpful, friendly, and knowledgeable of the menu, drink specials and special items of the day. 
There was an issue with our large party, I would advise to call ahead if so.  Otherwise overall great place

Man, as I sit here and I type this I am full and won't need anything to eat for the rest of the day. This was my 2nd visit here within a week and since both times the food was to die for I just had to come and give them kudos! On this visit, I had the blackened catfish po boy. OMG! First it's a huge piece of fish...not just some chunks they throw on a roll. When they first put it in front of me, I couldn't wait to dig in. Over half of the fish was sticking out of the bread. Once, I got myself situated and figured out how I would attack it, I bit in and my taste buds went on a journey immediately!! Every single bite was too scrumptious for words! The cole slaw, the remoulade sauce, it all just blends together perfectly!! 

Hands down I think I will make this a normal stop to get me some good Nawlins cuisine! It definitely is worth every penny.

ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS! Had the famous oysters appetizer and the New Orleans platter and it was all delicious, especially the oysters! Also, out waitress, Ashleigh, was really great and so so helpful. The manager also stopped by a few times to check on how our meal was and was so nice. We had a really great time at oceana and would recommend it to anyone looking for great New Orleans food

Admittedly, I only got two desserts via uber eats so this may not be fully fair. It was the bread pudding and cheesecake. Bread pudding was whatever and the strawberry cheesecake was solid. Pretty much exactly start you'd expect it to taste like was what it tasted like.

We loved the oysters on the half shell, the fried oyster Po Boy, and BBQ Gulf Shrimp. Everything was delicious.  Errol was our waiter and he was a delight and very attentive. Great place to eat in the Quarter

Came here on a Thursday night for dinner (around 7pm) and there was a huge line outside the door. The host said it'd be about a 45 minute wait, but It ended up moving a lot quicker and we were able to be seated within 20 minutes. There was seating upstairs too, not just the bottom floor. 

We ordered the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta, Crawfish Fettucine and the Chargrilled oysters. The Cajun jambalaya pasta was hands down our favorite dish of the night (all 6 of us agreed). The crawfish fettucine and chargrilled oysters were also super delicious and we would definitely get these items again. 

Since being here in NOLA, I've had chargrilled oysters at every restaurant we've been to so far for dinner (Felix & Blind Pelican) and this was by far my favorite! Really flavorful & pretty clean, too (in terms of not feeling any grit/sand in my oysters). Overall, food and service was great!

Not only was the staff here on point and super friendly and polite, the food was really good! We split an order of gator tail or bites and a seafood platter. Delicious. No complaints here. This place was a 10 second walk from my hotel. Loved it.

So I ate here last night with my boss . It was just average in our opinion especially for New Orleans . The food was good but average and the Mojito and Margarita were a little disappointing we left and found a place with better drinks . Giving it a 3 rating at best
Loved it!  Went around 6pm on Thurs night and had a 10 minute wait.  Crab cakes, oysters, and gumbo were all excellent.  Service was great.  We will come back here.

Food was OK for the location. Seemed a bit touristy to me. Also seemed a bit like Joe's Crab Shack. 

Gumbo had great flavor and was reasonably priced, but I am sure you can find better in this city.

This is a fine place to get some seafood in New Orleans. It's a big place and there is a lot of noise. It feels more like a sports bar/restaurant. The place was busy when we arrived and there was a steady flow of customers, which might be because it is in the heart of the French Quarter. 

Portions are very big and can be easily shared. The ambience is sneakers and shorts and tables and chairs are very basic. Service is quick and efficient. The food was a-ok, not thing special. There are lots of friend fish options with french fries, simple salads and local foods. For just a little extra in money you can most likely get a more authetic meal in a more quiet restaurant.

In the past 2 days we have eaten at Mr.B's, Arnaud's, Luke's, and Ruby Slippers.  Jennifer was our waitress and she was VERY accommodating and friendly.  My husband was a little difficult...he sent his Po-Boy back for more seasoning & then asked for more cheese.  He would agree that hands down this has been the best meal that we have had here!

The food was excellent.  Has the alligator tail bites, the waiter recommended half blackened and half fried.   Also, has the crab cakes.  Those were heavenly, well worth the trip for just those alone.  The seafood platter was well done, but a little too much breading for me.  The creme brulee was awesome.  If you are in the area, check it out

It's been a while since we were in New Orleans and the last time there we had a wonderful Christmas breakfast here. I made reservations this time for Christmas day and we went. They have completely changed the place since the last time we were there. More seating, a longer bar and more tvs.  My hubby got the crawfish omelet and all he did was make happy noises the entire time he ate. I got the seafood platter for breakfast (not really a breakfast person).  It was just ok. We each got a bloody mary. Wow that was one awesome drink. I'd come back just to drink those marys. The bartender was really nice (we ate at the bar) and the people around us were really nice too. I will definitely be back.  I just won't get the seafood platter for breakfast next time.  Maybe I'll try that lip smacking crawfish omelet my Hubby got.

Food was great! Had the redfish with a crawfish and sauteed mushroom remoulade on top of a bed of dirty rice and some greens. Wife had blackened chicken, greens and etoufee. For dessert we had a homemade pecan pie with warm filling and a thick flaky crust on the outside and moist on the inside. It came with vanilla bean ice cream to temper the warm pie filling. However, the true star of the show was the waiter CJ! He made great suggestions, was honest about what he thought was great on the menu and just overall provided the service that you want when you visit NOLA. If management reads this review please recognize CJ for his awesome service and give him there best sections when he works (you'll reap the benefits and he deserves them). We will be back and thanks for the experience!

This place has a nice atmosphere and looks like it could really get packed because it is near/on bourbon street.  The bottom level looks kinda like a dive bar and feels really dirty.  We are on the 3rd level I think, and it had a better atmosphere.  It seemed a little more upscale.  I liked the decor, especially in the outside patio area (see pic).

The food was ok, nothing spectacular, just ok.  With the exception of the crab cakes which were good.  I also had the Louisiana plate which was ok, the red beans and rice portion was good, the crawfish étouffée was fishy tasting and the jambalaya was fair.  

I really wanted to give this place more stars, because I had high hopes here, especially with the video that I saw in their website.  I would have given them 3 stars, but their service was really sub par.  Our waitress Jordan seemed like she really didn't want to be there, and seemed annoyed when we ordered water instead of drinks.
Perfect late night eatery.  Gumbo was good, poor boy was okay., service was excellent.  Glad we waited in line.

So we came here for breakfast/lunch! I've bookmarked this place for a while so decided to check it out while I was in New Orleans. There was a line but it moved pretty fast. The staff were super friendly and the view from the dining table was awesome! BUT...  gumbo wasn't that great. I'm not sure if my taste is not used to all the spicy they used for the gumbo soup but it tasted kinda too fishy. We also ordered taste of New Orleans which includes jambalaya and other stuff and it was ok. Cajun fries were really good though!! Maybe I had too high expectation... Everything else was kind of disappointing. The waitresses/ waiters were super friendly and the atmosphere was cool!
Amazing!  This food is sinfully good.  Try the blackened gator po boy!  Our waitress Jimika is the best!
Overall great Cajun food with reasonable prices, portion sizes, and great staff. I ordered the seafood gumbo, which was delicious! I will definitely come here again.

While visiting NO.  We decided to eat here and it was awesome!   We were absolutely in awe with the waitstaff here particularly our waiter Allan.  This is one of our favorite restaurants.   The portions are HUGE!

One of the fair price restaurants in French Quarter opens 8am till 1am.  Recommended by our hotel and we had dinner twice in the role here.  Seafood gumbo is so good. Full of seafood flavor! Redfish Oceana is great.  I also love the Crawfish Fettuccini and Taste of New Orleans.  The chef obvious know how to make the source right for all dishes!  No spices are overly used like some other restaurants which overpower the taste of seafood.  If you are in French Quarter, you must visit this restaurant.  It has changed my opinions about Cajun food totally!

I swear, i have never seen oysters that big in my entire life!  

Anyways, everyone's food was great... the gumbo was solid, and the alfredo pasta is to die for.  I also enjoyed the gator sausage.  A great meal for a relatively low price off bourbon st.!
Love this place! The food was delicious! We ordered the crab cake, Ettoufe, Oyesters, and red fish with the crab sauce was just amazing! Fast service too!

Been here a few times, and I will keep going back when I can. The service is good, the server David(tall thin black guy) is great, very polite and knowledgeable of the menu, and always gives great suggestions.  Nice decor and vibe/feeling inside too. Now, the food, smh, O..M..G, so good. For appetizers you GOTTA try the  chargrilled oysters, you may need a dozen to yourself, might not wanna share these TRUST ME! The mixed veggies were blah, but the STEAK....*enter heavenly angel music here* I swear this was the best steak I ever ate in my life. It was the most tender steak ever, like they beat it to a pulp with a meat tenderizer mallet and magically put it back together. You can have it blackened if you want but I preferred not to. The sauce they put on the steak(like a creamy crawfish gravy) was also made in heaven, so freaking good. At first I thought but why would I put this on my steak....hmmm, NOW I know, it does go well with it.  The pasta was really good and so were the drinks. You must try this place out.

It was good, but not great.

I had the char-grilled oysters and a bowl of gumbo. The oysters were good, but there was way too much Parmesan cheese on them. As for the gumbo, I appreciated all the seafood in it, but it wasn't the best I have ever had. Also, putting a crab claw in it looks nice, but it was hard to break open.

Their prices are too high for me and their portions too large. Sure, they attract the tourist crowd. But a bowl of gumbo alone or 1/2 an entree will feed one person.

Love it! Myself and another person ordered for delivery from the hotel we were staying at. I was a bit nervous due to other people's complaints of their food not being delivered on time, missing parts of their order, food gone cold, etc. but we lucked out as it was midnight but our food got delivered to our hotel just 30 min after being placed.

Food wise, I definitely recommend the crab cakes. The sauce it came with was full of crawfish tails! (yum!). My boyfriend got the Cajun jambalaya pasta and that dish was delicious as well. I tried crawfish etoufee for the first time and really enjoyed it. 

I recommend dining in-house if you can to avoid the messy food deliveries. My one complaint is that although they tried wrapping the togo boxes in plastic wrap, the sauces still got shuffled around when our food was delivered and it sort of made a mess. I wish they were a bit more careful in handling our food during the delivery process.

The food was really good. Just the basics on the menu, but really well prepared. The service was good, and the drinks were well done. We had seen all the lines and had wondered what was the big deal, so when we passed by at about 4:45 and were able to walk right in, we figured we'd give it a try. Did not regret it!
The red fish special was perfect but we weren't thrilled with the crab cakes.  The kids loved the bbq ribs!  It was a little pricey but still worth the time and $$.

The food was delicious and the entire staff was the friendliest I have met on my trip so far.  They over heard us talking about it being our 10 year anniversary and they brought us some free desert as well.  Will be back to this place next time we visit.

I was excited to come here based on the reviews and line outside the place. I was dissapoitned at every turn. We ordered nearly half the menu and each dish was as underwhelming as the last. Save your money, go elsewhere.

Ohh. Emm. Gee. This place was crazy good. I ordered a Firefly Lemonade--came perfect. I ordered the Spinach Ravioli with their Alfredo sauce....I wanted to lick the plate clean it was so good. Seriously if someone has the recipe, I want it!  My bf ordered the Crabcake platter and they were huuuge and full of crab, not fillers like they make them up north, and tasted amazing. And when you have such a great dinner you just have to get dessert. We ordered the Bananas Fosters Ice Cream cake to split and it did not disappoint.
This is my first time ever rating a restaurant. I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the food and service. Had the gumbo and the duck. All fresh and flavorful.

Based on staff alone, I would have given it 5 stars. Everyone was wonderful and amazingly kind and attentive. Crab cakes were AWESOME, along with the spicy hush puppies. Our entrees were a bit of a let down. Tuna was overlooked. Duck wasn't as "blackened" as I had hoped. However, if you like ribs, they're to die for!!! Enjoy :)

What a place for a Thanksgiving. uh, came here with a group what I can say is the catfish, gumbo and jambalaya was on point. Catfish is very good. 

The Verdict
Go, Get the catfish and a bowl of gumbo!

The gumbo was not good - the shrimp was over cooked, the rice was hard and there was sand. 

The oceania oysters were ok. 

The Mahi mahi was a bit on the salty side.

And it was pretty dark inside, so it was difficult to read the menu.

The staff was friendly and nice though.

Another yelp member mentioned Storm.  She was our waitress on our visit and was phenomenal!  The only downside of our visit was that we had to walk through Bourbon to get there, on Easter Sunday, after a parade and with my dog.  It was annoying to say the least.  When we arrived there was confusion on whether dogs were allowed but it was cleared up and my now dirty little guy was allowed to dine on the patio with us. Lastly, we sat for literally two hours and did not feel rushed once.

THEE best dessert in the quarter. The banana fosters ice cream cake is amazing. Best bread pudding..I've been here 5 days and had BP w EVERY meal. This place is got the best I've ever had. Make sure to order it alamode.
Our waitress, Ashleigh was super friendly and took great care of us. The waiter for the table beside us was also very nice. Food was great for the price. Overall great experience.

Love to come here every time I come. The Gumbo was delicious. Our waiter was excellent. I always get good food and service when I come. I have no complaints, except the blacken gator bites should be more blacken without the sauce.
Overall great Cajun food with reasonable prices, portion sizes, and great staff. I ordered the seafood gumbo which was delicious! I will definitely come here again.

"That's funny, I didn't know alligators had hair!". Such was our reaction when, as my husband and I began to dig into our dinner this evening, he pulled an 8 inch strand of hair (or dare I say weave??) from our plate of blackened alligator. As you may assume, no longer were our tummies rumbling. When our server came back 10 or so minutes later and asked how everything was, we pointed out the long lock draped over out meal-her immediate response was "I'll get a manager". Ok..a while later he showed up, simply said "I'll take that out of your way". A few minutes later our server ditched the delightfully robust 60$ bill, and walked off.
If you enjoy alligator hair and restaurant staff who don't give a shit, please-I highly recommend Oceana Grill. It's amazing.
Enjoyed a nice meal here with a large group. Po boys fried shrimp and apps were all good. Would go again.

Food was good, prices were a bit on higher than expected. The interior of this place is great, big plus for their designer. The staff was nice, and most of the time prompt. A couple times though they had to be reminded of drinks they forgot, etc., but our party was a 17 person table top. But good food, not great, and better than average for sure. I'd go there again.

We have the foods delivered to our hotel. We never have their food before and after a long drive with the kiddos, we were exhausted to go out. I have the redfish, it was very good with the ocean crawfish sauce and steam veggies. I wished the fish was more crisper. My husband had the shrimp pasta, he liked a lot. The guy on the phone said they are known for crab cake so we ordered one app. It was very crispy on outside and a lot of crab on inside. Its the same oceana sauce as my redfish. Over all food wasn't bad but very pricey
Been there twice. The seafood platter has a huge portion, liked the fried fish and shrimp. The roasted duck is also pretty delicious, but the redfish is very disappointing.

The wait was short,  staff super friendly. We had the alligator bites, both blackened and battered and they were delicious. Also, the Rockefeller Oysters, those were okay. The flavor was good but they weren't charboiled. They weren't crispy how I like. For our main dishes, we went with what the waiter recommended, the Jambalaya Pasta and Blackened Catfish with Shrimp and greens was amazing. Both dishes were full of flavor!
All I had was the gumbo and I was disappointed. Granted I'm sure their other food is amazing, I've heard lots of people say it is. BUT the gumbo lacked flavor entirely.

Food was great and our waitress was amazing! I had the Seafood Pasta and he had the Crab cakes. It was sooo much food. For dessert we had the bread pudding and the Banana Foster cake! Both were yummy!

Oceana is not awesome. I was a little (ok a lot) disappointed because Yelp has this place at 4 stars.

The service was great, they got us in quickly on a busy Saturday night during Jazz Fest. The items on the menu sound great, but what comes out is not great. I had the salmon and it came out super well done. Definitely not the way salmon should be eaten. We had read Yelp and people raved about their bbq shrimp appetizer. That was probably the biggest disappointment of our meal. 

Save your money and go to Mr. B's if you've got a craving for New Orlean's best BBQ shrimp!

Great seafood and service right in the French quarter. Service was fast and friendly and I am sure we will be back the next time we come back. I had the blackened catfish po boy and I can honestly say it was the best I have had

For the average Bourbon Street day tripper looking for an intensive Cajun menu Oceana will fit the average palette. If your a Cajun connoisseur you'd be better off with the Louisiana Homestyle Etouffee at Bubba Gump's. Oceana tops their Jambalaya with a red marinara sauce that is absolutely nasty. The blackened fish is pretty in the picture but dry & overcooked. Their "spin" on classic Cajun fair just doesn't made the grade for the non-tourist.

Had the GUMBO, it was bland, in my opinion. Mediocre.

The BLACKENED GATOR BITES were good. My friend loved them, wanted to go back for more.

The OYSTERS were mediocre too. The cream sauce on top was very heavy. 

Service was good. Coffee was not.

Dont be scared away by the long line outside.  We didnt wait long... maybe 15 mins.  The food was delicious.  I had the famous oysters as an app and the sauce was great.  For my meal I had the Cajun jambalaya pasta which was amazing.  I definitely recommend giving Oceana Grill a shot but be sure to check out the menu online first because the menu inside didn't have have the stuff on it like the vegatarian option.  Also the prices were higher on most things on the menu they gave us as opposed to the menu online and on their web app.  The wait staff was very friendly and helpful.  They kept my beverage full.  My only problem with the staff was they were rushing us to get out... they asked us 3 times if we were done and tried to take my plate.  I kept telling them no I was still eating.  I was trying to enjoy myself and the conversation I was having.  All in all the food was great but this place is def one of those touristy places trying quick turn you to make more money.

Based on all the Yelp reviews and what the hotel concierge said, me and friend made reservations and was not disappointed. The service was great and the food......delicious, maybe a little heavy but when in NOLA, lol. Highly recommend if you want something a little more authentic.

We came here our first night in nola at the suggestion of a guy at our hotel. When we got there, they had a very long line which discouraged us, but we were seated within a few minutes. There are multiple stories of seating.

The service was very nice and helpful, though not always easy to get.

I ordered the Taste of New Orleans for around $18 and added the fried crawfish for another $5. This dish includes etoufee, jambalaya and red beans and rice. The red beans and rice reminded me of my grandmother's, so delicious. In fact we made a second visit and that time I just got the red beans and rice.

My daughter ordered the gumbo, which she didn't like, but I liked it. My wife ordered the crab cakes, which were very good.

The prices are a bit high, but you're paying to eat in the French Quarter.
Needing a quick bite and some take out on thursday night before an event up the street, some friends and I wound up at Oceana Grill. Huge portions, great food, reasonably priced.

Great seafood restaurant. Go for dinner alittle early so you don't have to wait on table. The food was some of the best we had on our stay. Very filling and reasonable priced. Wait staff was prompt, polite, and always around but not overbearing.

Second time in New Orleans but first time trying this restaurant. Absolutely delicious! I highly recommend the crab cakes, the best crab cakes I've had! Shrimp Po Boy was also very good. Staff extremely nice and courteous. If you're ever in New Orleans you have to stop here!

This is my favorite restaurant in New Orleans.. The seafood is outstanding, the crab cakes are to die for, the breakfast is remarkable, the servers are incredibly nice, the environment is full of New Orleans with the Mardi Gras music playing in the back drop.. If you are ever in New Orleans and are looking for some great Cajun food, this is your place...

This is one of the best places to eat while in the French Quarter! Food has always been excellent and never disappointed us. We eat here every time we come to New Orleans! Prices aren't bad either! If you like seafood you must try the crabcakes or the Mardi Gras Pasta!

I'm giving this place 5 stars even though we waited to get sat longer then we should've.  I'm giving it 5 stars because I've dined here 3 times now in 2 trips, and the crab cakes alone deserve the 5 stars.  I've just never had any type like them,  and they're irreplaceable.  

Our server Michael was excellent, especially considering we had a party of 12.  He was on top of it.  My blackened ribeye was good, but not great.  My drink was good, and I tried the gator bites also, which were pretty tasty.  

My ribeye came with some really good jambalaya and greens also.  

I'll be back here again for my 3rd trip to Nola some day.
This place has some very flavorful food. The chargrilled oysters was soooo good and the pasta.
Good food!  Great drinks! Service was spot on! Would recommend a visit when in New Orleans

First time in NOLA first time at Oceana I must say the people in Nola are warm and friendly we decided to eat here at the bar and the bartender Brandi is great.  I had the Cajun creole ettouffee and hubby had the shrimp poboy.  It was delish!  Two thumbs up!

We decided to go to Oceana for breakfast in our way to a swamp tour. Their menu said they had crepes, and all the reviews were good. I mean, how bad this place could be if they had an average of 4 stars? We are in New Orleans, and the food is great everywhere! Oh, boy, was I wrong. First of all, this place feels like a dump. We ordered crepes with shrimp, lobster, green peppers and something else. What I got was this huge burrito, the size of a new born baby. All good so far, but then I tasted it: it was greasy, salty, nasty. My daughter ordered a dessert crepe, and hers was old and cold. Huge, mind you. My daughter end up eating an English muffin. After spending over $50 on the most terrible breakfast, we rushed to our tour. 15 minutes later, my stomach felt funny, and I barely made it to a nearby bathroom. I ended up with the worse upset stomach, and I felt sick throughout the day. Needless to say, we regretted our decision dearly. So beware. I have no idea if dinner food is any good here, but breakfast is atrocious. So stay away.
Crab cakes are the real deal! They came out semi warm the first time.. But they replaced them with fresh hot crab cakes...they are loaded with crab and the sauce is great and has crawfish too!

We took a bunch of our college students to experience the food and culture of NO and this is the first place we took them to eat. It was just OK. They ambiance was just so so and the food was just ok. The food was not well presented and the food just was not what we expected for the price we paid.  The waiter was really trying very hard to make us feel welcomed. We were not impressed. I think we got the nice server that everyone else got.

I had an excellent experience at Oceana. This is one of the few establishments we found open after 10 pm for dinner. The service was excellent.

The waitstaff accommodated my food allergies and recommended the Fettucini Alfredo with Blackened Chicken....and it was some of the best pasta I've had to date. See my photo. 

Excellent food and service. Highly recommended.

Came here with a large group for dinner and it was amazing!  No trouble getting us in without a reservation.  We sat outside, which was beautiful.  A nice place, the service was good, drinks were good, and everyone loved their meals. I ordered the fried catfish and it was delicious. 

I would highly recommend Oceana while you're in NOLA.

I went here first thing after landing in New Orleans and went straight here. I had the crabcakes, red beans and rice, and the charbroiled oysters. Everything was delicious, they have plenty of seating areas and Is located near Bourbon Street.
The oyster poboy and the jazzy crab cakes were delicious. The service was great, the prices very reasonable.  We really loved going there and would recommend it.
I sat at the bar and my server was Alanso. Worst Poboy in New Orleans. Few shrimp and over cooked. Try elsewhere....I recommend Acme House =much better.
Average. Their crab cakes which they are "famous" for... were just ok. And be ready to swim through a crowd in French quarter just to eat here. Not worth the trouble.

Can't go wrong with fried Seafood. We got the ultimate platter. Everything was fried to perfection. Loved the soft shell crab on top. The hush puppies were perfect. Pass on the shrimp poboy. Stick to the fried goodness.
My review goes to Pamela, who did an excellent job and made my experience most enjoyable- Steven
Decent atmosphere, lousy food, marginal snarky service, noisy restaurant and high prices = rip-off!

The oysters were okay (Acme was better) and the barbecue shrimp was delicious. The rating would have been higher if the heads were left on! I also wish that the accompany bread was toasted.

There was a bit of a wait, but luckily I was able to snag a seat at the bar. The bartenders, Jess and Brian, were really friendly. I'd come back for drinks at the bar, but next time I want barbecue shrimp, I think I'll check out Deanie's; their menu says they have head-on shrimp.
Drinks are amazing, our favorite is the Cajun Bloody Mary, food is delicious, & our server Pamela is the best in New Orleans! We come here every time we visit New Orleans!

Once arriving at Oceana, we were greeted by so many warm and friendly faces. Each employee that we encountered made sure to go out of their way to greet us walking in. We were sat outside in the courtyard which was great and the weather was complimentary. The 6 of us proceeded to order bottles of champagne and bloody Mary's and the waitress Taityana was prompt. Each person at the table only ordered a la carte breakfast, and the waitress was understanding and patient. The only downfall was that there was a hair in the eggs over medium and on a biscuit. Overall, the service was great but the food experience was a little disappointing which rewarded the restaurant with only 3 stars.

What can I say..this place was delicious..We had the BBQ shrimp..Yummy..We had a cup of seafood Gumbo..delicious. We  gad a 1/2 slab of the ribs..OMG..BBQ sauces was amazing..cooked perfectly. Awesome service.
Amazing crab cakes and blackened gator bites. Great vibe and friendly staff. I also appreciate the clean bathrooms and outdoor heaters for the winter.

Been visiting this location three times in two days during our visit.
The server was very friendly.We had the rockefeller oysters as appetizer which i definetly have to recommend.Also the entrees camed quickly,were tasteful and filling.
On my next visit to NOLA we'll definetly come back again.
Thank you.
Great spot right of bourbon st of authentic southern food.  Pleasant staff, quick seating with our large group and these "secret fries" are to die for.

There was a 15 minute wait . Waitress  was pleasant  . Ordered  their gumbo . Which had three shrimp  for a  small. cup . It had a lot of flavor but I would  have liked it hotter.  Tried their sampler plate of etouffee  creole  jambalaya  and red beans and rice  good choice . There was plenty  of food to share . Liked the red beans and the etouffee  . Jambalaya  was just ok. It is worth  a second chance prices were reasonable

Got there on Xmas eve without problem... We were seated in the inner courtyard which was pleasant.
Decent food but nothing exceptional. Oysters. Tried the gator bites. Some big ones were really fat.
The sausage with beans and rice was pretty/ridiculously small.
xxxxxxx My daughter's chocolate milk was tasting like cheese (roquefort cheese for who knows) so it must not have been FRESH. We asked for another one, once she had complained and she had drunk half of it. Fortunately, she was not ill afterwards! xxxxxxxx
Prices did not match the menu on their website.

I went here with some friends and everything about this place was cool.  It could be considered on the pricier side but the food I had was excellent.  I'm a fan of New Orleans cooking in general but this place got the dishes I tried right!  What we ordered and I can recommend is:

Knife and fork BBQ
Blackened duck
The catfish lafouche

We all left that place extremely satisfied with the food and the service.

Came here for dinner after ruling out most restaurants in the area.  We are not oyster people and New Orleans seems to have either very high end restaurants or mid priced that aren't that appealing.  We settled into Oceana because we thought it would accommodate the 3 of us the best not because the menu blew us away with excitement.  Have to say we were pleasantly surprised.  Solid fettuccini, blackened tuna, and blackened chicken po boy.   Good food and outstanding service by David.  He was extremely attentive and friendly.  Don't come here for fine dining but a good choice with excellent service.

This is an excellent place for blackened ANYTHING!! We had the blackened chicken Alfredo and the blackened redfish with creole mushroom sauce. Both delicious! The collard greens were excellent!!!! It is a nice relaxed atmosphere and our waitress Morganne was helpful and very attentive!  We would highly recommend this as a great French quarter stop!
don't understand its high rating and popularity. the food is really mediocre, and overpriced.
Drinks are on point. Recommend the hurricane. Oysters were ok. Didn't care for the sauce. Food was good. Service was good. Line was long but inside wasn't packed.

Overall, an okay place. I split the seafood pasta with my sister. It honestly wasn't anything spectacular. When in New Orleans, i was expecting that flavor and spice you would expect. It was really lacking for me. In addition we ordered crawfish etouffee and it never came out. Thankfully we were not charged but i still would've liked to try it. One thing that i can say is the hurricanes are STRONG. In a good way. They're not overly syrupy. They have good flavor and a really good amount of alcohol.
Dont eat here!!!! Unless you like rats, frozen food, bad service, rude owners. Nothing is fresh here. All frozen food out of the box.

I signed up for Yelp just so I could leave a review for people who are in New Orleans for the first time. Being a newbie in New Orleans in the French Quarter, I thought the food here was absolutely delicious. I've had Cajun food in the Pacific Northwest- you can think what you want- but man...we had the oysters rockefeller (delicious, wish I'd gotten a larger order), seafood gumbo (wow), and the taste of New Orleans (again, delicious). I think the portions were just perfect and what we expected- if it were any bigger, I might have come out feeling miserable. Our server was amazing, checking in on us in perfect time increments, and the service was super fast- this could be because we didn't go in until around 9pm. We got seated upstairs where it wasn't too crowded. I hope I can come back!

I forgot to review this place a long time ago, but not that it needs it since they already have so many great reviews! Anyways, I stopped in here one day around 10pm one night because I was staarving after not eating since around brunch. My friends wanted dessert so they met up with me there. It wasn't too busy inside the restaurant at the time but the host at the front was not very friendly so I was a bit iffy at first. When I got to my seat though, my server-I don't remember his name at all I just remember that he enjoys acting on the side (haha pretty cool)! Anyways, so my server was excellent. He was very attentive, accommodating and very personable! Also, my table was next to the kitchen so occasionally the cook would stick his head out and tell us jokes or just do some entertaining bits with fire and whatnot. Pretty fun atmosphere! And for the food, I shared the Taste of New Orleans sampler with my boyfriend. To be honest, I ate like 97% of the plate and he took like 3 bites. I loved it and have been craving it ever since! Also, their bananas foster and the bread pudding were delicious. I would say bread pudding was the better of the two but both were amazing. I hope to come back here again one day! :)

We had our post-wedding brunch here and it was absolutely perfect!  The wait staff was extremely friendly and helpful!  Ashley even made me a special drink to help with the hangover :)!  The food was delicious and perfect for a brunch!  I would definitely recommend this for a casual breakfast for two or a large party/event!  Thanks so much to the staff for making our weekend complete!

This was the best place ever!  We ended up eating here two times this weekend while visiting NOLA!  It was that good. The service is amazing, we had Lloyd one morning and Harrison another. The manger came over and spent 20 minutes talking to us and took our photo. The hubby ordered the seafood omelet and said it was delish- nothing left on his place at all!  I got the crawfish omelet and OMG it was good.  Smothered in hollandaise sauce...what's not to love?  And their homemade biscuits are perhaps the best I've ever had. The omelets come with a side of hash browns, and their were chopped full of onions and other tasty spices- all wonderful. I also ordered a side of grits...and they are just incredibly delectable. Yum yum yum. And the coffee is rich and yummy.  Don't forget the full bar!

This was a great dining experience. Shortly before my partner and I arrived, a group of sixty entered. I thought "oh great, we'll be waiting a few hours" - but within 15 minutes we were inside, seated, checking out the menu. My partner had the Shrimp Fetuccine Alfredo, I had the "Taste of New Orleans" with Jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffee, and Red Beans and Rice. Our waiter, Mike P, kept checking on us. Food was served rapidly and correctly. After the main course I had the Creme Brulee; it was incredibly good. The prices were very reasonable, the atmosphere was dark but very relaxing. I STRONGLY recommend it for anyone looking for good local-flavored seafood!

Wow just had the most amazing meal at Oceana. Raw oysters were amazing, crab cakes out of this world and the service....let's just say it was top notch. Deanne was very helpful and made great suggestions.

Had some oysters and then some oysters. And a martini or two. Sat at the bar because I was solo. Service there was great. I like having my server captive. Have the oysters. Raw, grilled, fried, in a stew. Okay, I didn't have oyster stew, but the other options rock!

My friends and I found this place after going on a search of gator. We're from NY and wanted to try something that would be hard to find at home. It's a good thing we stopped here.

Mary was our server and she was EXCELLENT, professional, efficient, and overall knowledgeable about the menu. For the food Mary suggested we order the half blackened/fried gator with a sauce that I cannot spell (starts with a "R") and it was SO good. Personally I liked the fried gator better but I would say try it for yourself and make your choice.

For the main I had a Catfish Po boy. The catfish was soft, not soggy, and juicy. It was so good that I asked for a "to go" container but by the time it reached the table I finished the meal. 

If you're on Bourbon street and hungry this is definitely a place to try. Eat, drink, and be merry with hopefully, Mary as your server

They actually delivered to my hotel! The food was hot and very well seasoned. I'm sure it would have been so much better if I'd gone to the restaurant. The price was a tad high but that's what happens when you're in a vacation spot.

We were so excited to mark Oceana off our to eat lost in New Orleans. What a huge disappointment. First off we came for oysters and dinner. After sitting on a slow night we ordered a dozen oysters and 2 meals (ribeye and crab cakes) waited a long time to even get our drinks and next thing we knew our meals were out. We never ever got our oysters the waiter simply said he forgot. Did not offer to correct at all. My steak was entirely Fat. Now I like some fat on my steaks but it was inedible. The waiter asked if was ok I let him know the issue and we never saw him again except to drop off our bill. We paid but will never ever visit again. Did not fix anything and did not even get our order. Very very disappointed.
Longer wait around 7PM but WELL worth it! The service was unbelievably quick. Constantly asked about how the food is, if we need a refill and if they can do anything. Very pleased with our visit
Ate here one time. Had CRAB CAKES and the PRALINE DUCK. Both were excellent and prices very reasonable. My slice of PECSN PIE was good but Small.

Dinner with a group for a trade show.  Everything was fantastic.  The only complaint is that they didn't bring us enough bread to soak up the sauce from the Shrimp appetizers.

Great service - great good

This place is beyond popular, I kept seeing advertisements for it everywhere I turned. This place was on my to do list once I visited NOLA, I wanted to try it out for dinner but ended there for breakfast. Breakfast was actually great, I had the Cajun breakfast which consisted of alligator sausage, ham, biscuit, grits, and eggs. I'm used to having alligator but never gator sausage, I'm now a full blown gator sausage fan. The place didn't look like what I expected, a lil shabby looking. One thing that caught me off guard is that in the women's bathroom behind the door there's a signs that's up that says free wifi, when I got back to my table. I tried to log into the wifi but couldn't locate the wifi name on my phone, when I asked my waiter for the wifi name he said that the wifi wasn't for customers. I'm thinking to myself then why have the sign up? Anyways besides that the food was great and I will return, hopefully for dinner next visit while I'm in NOLA.

Oh, BTW I was so satisfied with that gator sausage that I ordered extras to take back home to Miami with me Lol.

My husband and I stopped in for a late lunch (around 2pm) and had to wait 50 minutes outside in the heat (95 degree temperature). We figured they were swamped and really wanted to eat at Oceana before we left NOLA, because of its rave reviews. When we were finally escorted in there were 8 tables in our immediate dining area that were empty--- an 8 top, and various seating for 5+ people. Meanwhile hungry families, many with young children, waited outside. I was so upset it was hard to enjoy the food. While the food was ok, the wait left a bad taste in my mouth.
Were sat quickly on a busy Friday night.  Awesome grilled oysters and a huge serving of fried seafood on the sampler.

Came to New Orleans for the first time and came here multiple times. Love love love the Blacken Bayou Duck and Gator bites!! Thank you so much for the fun atmosphere. Will be returning shortly and hopefully moving here soon!

I was very unhappy with my visit due to the fact they advertise that they have blackened catfish and when I ordered it and they brought it out to me it was tilapia. I know catfish like the back of my hand this was definitely not catfish. It tasted nothing like catfish. The server also told me that they had collard greens but when that was brought out it was turnip greens and they were not fresh turnips. I will not be going back ever.

Long delivery arrival time but accurate. Had the crawfish alfredo and it was beyond delicious, I can't compare anything too it you will have to try it for yourself! Also ordered the blackened catfish very yummy! Can't wait to try all the food in the restaurant!

I would give this place6 stars because they're open later than 10:00 pm!! There was a long line but it went quick, I ordered the oyster platter. It was large and filling and delicious, Great service and good beer selection. I would come back.

Service at upstairs bar was outstanding! The food was great - Blackened Catfish with Oceana sauce was great, jalapeño cornbread dressing was very flavorful, and the greens were the best I've ever had, reasonably priced with a Homecoming feel.

My friend and I were in New Orleans at the beginning of June 2011 for 4 nights. We made the effort to eat seafood each night. We went to Oceana our 3rd night and it was by far our least favorite dining experience in New Orleans.

We ordered the chargrilled oysters. I was disappointed at the size of the oysters compared to other restaurants in the area (notably Acme). Additionally, we felt as though the sauce was less than complimentary.

While there were a few highlights of our meal, for seafood in New Orleans - head elsewhere!

I ordered the redfish. Now, part of this problem is their menu. It failed to describe that the fish was pan-fried. After having a few poboys that week, I was looking forward to getting away from a breaded fish.  I was disappointed when it came to our table. Also, the veggies were soft and mushy. On the positive side, the crawfish sauce was delicious.

My friend ordered the tuna from the menu. Unfortunately, we had very poor service that evening and the server brought their tuna special from the evening. Being a nice person, my friend didn't speak up but still wasn't impressed by the tuna steak. However, she was in love with the side of jambalaya.

A final note, we dined on a relatively mild New Orleans evening and elected to eat out on their patio. BAD IDEA! Their seats were iron, small and uncomfortable!

This place is phenomenal! Our server Melania was great! Very attentive and knowledgable about menue. We had the crab cakes and they were THE BOMB! Cooked to perfection. The menu costs are reasonable and the food portions are great. Wish we could have tried everything on the menu! I would definitely go back.
Suggested by two locals and thankful it was still open when I got into NOLA and hungry for etouffe. It was a great stop before hitting bourbon st.

My name is Joshua I  Work at Lamothe House down in the French Quarter I order there Twice and Never again...First I order A seafood platter only came with 4 shrimp and mostly fries order the same thing second time cause i was told by the employee that was taking my order  that the platter suppose to come with more than 4 shrimp which it did they gave 2 extra shrimp so i called back and was told it go by weight ...instead of Seafood platter it should be french fries platter ....and then as i was asking another question woman hung up in my face.....Not good serviced and feel like i was scammed...I will not be recommending  this place to any of our guest at all. Absolutely not satisfied

We arrived in NOLA late & found this spot opened. DELICIOUS! I had the Oceana Redfish, my friends had grilled tuna, taste of New Orleans & shrimp creole & it was all great. Definitely coming here again!
The food was well prepared the server was really nice and attentive the French Quarter where this bar/restaurant is located is another story. The location like a partying 3rd world country.

Ahhh but another good find in NOLA. I had to try this place. We went here around 10am. I had a crepe stuffed with. oysters and crab meat. It was nice and spicy. I had hopes that the mere knowledge of the spiciness of the food would deter my wife from "taste testing"(as she calls it). Naturally this was in no way a deterrent. I was forced to aquiesce a portion of my crêpe. For my sacrifices I entertained and procured several glasses of liquid fortitude.

My first choice was a  Sazerac.which consisted of  Rey whiskey, peychaud bBitters, and a "whisper" of Herbsaint. This was quite good and I was considering another one, being that the table was a bit unsteady and gravity was very good that day. However, I decided that I should try The Rajun Cajun Bloody Mary. This was  infused Absolut Peppar Vodka w sundried tomatoes, cocktail onions, spice green olives. Veeerry good!
I assured my wife that this was after all a health drink (of sorts) having vitamins and minerals not to mention the CH3CH2OH (the reason for its existence). She was not amused with my deliberations for some reason.

Our server was very courteous and prompt. He helped guide us through the menu and was very informative. He knew the menu items and rattled off the ingredients. With his help we made some very good choices. The meal was served in good sized plates. My crepe filled the dish completely. Very impressive. Matter of fact I could not consume it all, even with the aid of my helper. I got togo boxes for my wife's meal as well. She did not want breakfast and got a lunch item. However, her fork hovered over my plate quite a bit. I was able to chase her away with a few drops Louisiana Hot sauce on the remainder of my crepe.

 This was a fun place to eat at. This establishment has a lot of atmosphere. The food was very good.


79/100

Dined here on a Tuesday night with my family of 5 around 9:00. Don't bother making a last minute reservation...they say the seating is quicker if you wait in line. We waited about 20 minutes before we were seated. Overall, the food left something to be desired. Everything came out hot and fairly quick for a party of 5 in a packed 2-story restaurant. Sadly, I was disappointed with the fried seafood platter. The flavor did not wow me. However, my aunt said the ribs were outstanding! You could definitely split a full rack between two people. Not sure if the full rack option is mentioned on the menu so you may have to ask.  My cousin said the steak was serviceable. However, I don't recall the meals my other two family members ordered-guess they didn't leave much of an impression. The prices are hefty; I'd only return to try their ribs.

Update. 
Came back again recently, and it was terribly overpriced and mediocre food. I thought about leaving one star, but for sake that last time the items we tried were good, I'll give them two. I won't be back though.

Ordered a bowl of gumbo for $10. Came with a piece of stale bread, and the gumbo was cold. 3 people at our table got gumbo, so we had to ask them to microwave it for us.

Definitely way better flavors for way better prices in French Quarter elsewhere.

Delicious crab cakes, Oceania's Famous Oysters never disappoints!!! Slight wait time but well worth every second of it. Good Southern Hospitality. Sazerac drink was on point. Gator Bites were good. Seafood platter cooked with caring hands fish oysters and shrimp not just thrown in same batch all appropriate levels of cook time. The Bread pudding was sweet but savory topped it off ri

I am so surprised this place has thousands of reviews and they're mainly positive. My friends and I came here because there was rave reviews about it. Big mistake. It was our first meal in Nola and it was just sad. Our waitress must've been a newbie because she had a women that was basically her shadow writing down on a notepad after every interaction we had w her. Which was just awkward. We ordered raw oysters, Rockefeller oysters, shrimp po boy, gator bites and their jambalaya. All of the food was mediocre. The jambalaya tasted as if they hadn't rinsed out the pot correctly and there was still some soap left. The oysters were just bleh. Didn't taste fresh at all. Po boy was mainly bread and the shrimp just didn't taste good. Now I didn't taste the gator bites but my friends said they were aiight, nothin to write home about. All in all, wouldn't recommend. Don't wait in a long line to eat this food, you'll be sadly disappointed.

This place is so good!!!!! Right across the street from our hotel we came here for breakfast and we're pleasantly surprised. Our waitress Bridget was fantastic! She was so sweet, attentive, and the service was superb, southern hospitality at its finest!!! Highly recommend this place!!

I decided to come here for oysters before heading out to Bourbon St for the night. I looked online to see their menu and I thought everything was pretty reasonable priced. They also had vegetarian options for my friend, which is always a plus!

Once getting seated, we opened up the menu and I was surprised! Their menu online vs their physical menu were different. The prices had been spiked and some plates were missing. We were a little disappointed at that. We asked the waitress if the menu has recently been changed and she said yes but it's been months. We let her know that the menu online did not reflect the physical menu and it was misleading. She apologized. 

The oysters were spiked an additional $5 which I thought was a bit absurd. I've had Louisiana oysters in South Carolina for a fraction of the price and they were great! Maybe they're not "in season" but neither were they a couple weeks ago in South Carolina, but I digress. 

The vegetarian menu was lacking dishes that were on their online menu. Thankfully the waitress was able to make those dishes for my friend. I ordered the Crawfish Etouffe which was good but again over-priced. 

We were right on Bourbon Street so I can't be super surprised that there were some changes to the menu. I wish I knew this from the start so I could've planned accordingly knew what to expect. I hope management changes this issue so they don't mislead customers!

Deanne, our server was so friendly and gave us the best recommendations. All of the staff was helpful and our food was delivered hot fresh and in record time! We are so glad we came here to try authentic southern "Cajun" food! Amazing! 

The Oysters Rockefeller are incredible!! I would recommend them to seafood lovers as well as nonlovers. The flavors are unbeatable!  

The barbecue shrimp was also a winner- but prepare to get splashed!
Always enjoy the food when we come to New Orleans. Our favorite is the French toast for breakfast. It's the bomb!!!

Wonderful place! Probably the best oysters I've tried :) love the red fish - the mushroom sauce was perfect! The Oceana grilled oysters were very delicious  
Enjoyed my chocolate martini as well!
P.s. they have delivery service
This place is awesome. Our server, Whitney was amazing. I'd come back just for the great service. Food was outstanding. I'll make this a must do every time I'm in town.
Mary is the best server! She was helpful in explaining the dishes and the specials. We are leaving stuffed and happy!
Arielle is so sweet and a great server considering we had a big top. Good was prompt and delicious. We did not wait long and everyone enjoyed their meal! Thank you!

I am actually a local here, and walk by this restaurant everyday to work, so I was delighted when it was featured on "kitchen nightmares". yes, that show where gordon ramsey tries to help out failing restaurants that have dirty kitchens, horrible menus, etc.  so me, my friend and boyfriend all went last night to try out the menu and see if they had adopted the makeover and kept some actual gordon ramsey recipes (yum). it was a recently filmed episode, and we remembered some items that were supposedly changed. first off, it seems to be the entirely same failed menu that was on the show...(bad sign) but I ordered the blackened duck, boyfriend had some fish, and my friend the crab cakes. UNIMPRESSED.  my friend got two small, mushy crabcakes for $14, waaaaay too expensive. blackened duck was just as tough as ramsey noted on the show, and actually made me sick last night and this morning.. so, um... thats not a good sign about the kitchens being cleaner. boyfriend had some fish that he of course ate all of, no prob, but overall, we paid 60 plus tip ( our waiter was super nice!) for a not very decent meal. 

So, a lot of the reviews here are from tourists who had a quick trip down here and were seduced by the amount of new orleans-y food on the menu, and didnt get to taste a decent version of the real thing. this place should not be getting good reviews.
I dont want to suggest other restaurants to go to.. there are so many...
but this really was the most over-priced, shabby meal i've had down here.
some of the more famous restaurants in the quarter should probably be a best bet, they probably wont even be more/ much more expensive with a much better atmosphere. for something more authentic/local, i would suggest looking for some restaurants in uptown... like ignatius, that have been reviewed by locals. we love ya'll coming down! so dont eat there! blech... back to the restroom...

Just finished lunch and have to say I thoroughly enjoyed it. The waiter was sooo nice. I couldn't decide what I wanted so he did his best to help me out. He even brought me out a taster of crawfish etoufe. Although TASTY, I opted for thei signature dish. Even though crabcakes were not sold individually, he let me order one as an appetizer. DELICIOUS!!! My 9 year old even ate some. Their signature dish was red fish with crawfish sauce. AMAZING!!! Overall a wonderful experience with a very nice wait staff!

Absolutely love this place. Charbroiled oysters and poboys are great!!

Also get a Bloody Mary. So good!
Might have a line, but worth the wait!

Great place, with a nice little courtyard in the back.

The BBQ shrimps were good, with a tasty sauce, although a bit messy to eat. Gator bites were good too - they have blackened and fried, I liked the blackened the best. Beans with Cajun sausage was quite tasty. Also liked the jambalaya. Bloody Mary had a bit too much celery to my taste.

Anytime you can order a drink and it's an appetizer as well you have found something special.  This Bloody Mary was packed with fried shrimp, oysters and fish.  It was nicely garnished with pickled pearl onions, green beans  and green olives. Legend has it a Bloody Mary keeps the hangover away.  This one will keep more than a hangover away and also brings lots of joy!
Jacob is amazing! Excellent service! He is so friendly and helpful! So funny! Food was great and exactly what we ordered and not one mistake. Thank you Jacob!

Wow we had an amazing waitress so kind and friendly! Normally these tourists places just want the Customer in and out but here I actually felt like they cared. This place had great food, good size portions, hot and fresh. I would recommend this place to try. We will come back next time we are in town. 
The line was a little long but it moved quickly and since the wait area is a small area it makes sense on why the line outside was so long. Awesome job folks, we had a wonderful dinner and made a lasting impression! We will be back soon!
The Cajun Jambalaya Pasta was amazing! I highly recommend it! The bartenders were super friendly too!

A large group of friends and I (total party of 13) went to Oceana for brunch during a bachelor party in late October.  We had an amazing time.  The alcohol was priced fairly, the food was tasty, and the service was EXCELLENT.

Printess led the crew who served us, but many other servers, food runners, and bus boys helped out as well.  No one seemed anything other than gracious and eager to help if Printess wasn't around at the exact moment someone wanted another drink.

I'll be back again for sure if I have another big group in NOLA.
