Had fried fish and grits.  The fish was flaky and tasty and the grits were deliciously creamy.  We also had an amazing server, Ms. Whitney.

The sauce. It's amazing. They've perfected it and they know it. It's a Cajun / Crawfish gravy sauce that finds its way onto most of their dishes and deservedly so. Are here with a group of 10 and only 2 ppl got the same dish, so quite a spread. And everyone left happy and with great reviews. Staff is friendly, there usually is a wait. Show up with whole party or they won't sit you.

I think this is a chain restaurant?  I typically prefer those that aren't, but we had great service and the food was pretty good. It was served VERY quickly, despite the restaurant being full.  We probably wouldn't go back, but if you find yourself on Bourbon Street and not wanting to eat in a bar, this would be a nice alternative.

This was my first trip to NOLA and I've always wanted to taste the food here. Oceana was incredible! We tried the blackened and fried alligator, very tasty. However, the best plate was the crab cakes. It's not that imitation crab you get at some places, this was straight authentic crab in every bite. Lastly, don't sleep on their jambalaya or seafood crepes, either. Breakfast, lunch, or dinner, Oceana's is the spot. It appears to be deceptively small from the outside, but it is huge inside. Definitely the place to indulge.

BEST OYSTERS IN NEW ORLEANS!!!!
we went there for Christmas and luckily enough we got there before the line started. If going, order rockafella oysters. They taste amazing. The waiter was cheerful and welcoming. Definitely would go again.
Flavorful Food and Drinks. Attentive Waitress. The COMPLETE ambiance of NOLA! I must visit if you're on Bourbon St.

Late lunch here today in the courtyard. My wife and I both had blackened redfish etoufee with crawfish sauce, Jambalaya, and sautéed sweet corn. Medium spicy on the fish and shredded chicken and sausage with the Jambalaya. Every bite a tasty treat. Food expertly prepared. Service prompt and laidback friendly. What more could you ask for.
Even though the locals recommend it, still a deep fried tourist trap. Go straight to the bar skip the line.

This was my favorite place that I ate at during a week in New Orleans.

I had never tried Oysters before this trip.  My friend and I ordered Oysters Rockefeller for an appetizer and agreed that it was among the Top 10 things we've ever eaten.

I also had a fried catfish platter, which came with jalepeno hush puppies.  The meal was delicious.

I had my first sazerac here too.  (Rye Whiskey, Peychaud's Bitters, and Herbsaint) It was excellent.  (It does have a bit of a black licorice flavor, so just be warned if that's not your thing)

There was a line out the door when we arrived, but we were inside and seated in no more than 5 minutes.  The whole staff was very friendly, and made us feel welcome.

I definitely recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for a nice meal in the French Quarter, a little bit removed from the bustle of Bourbon Street.  I'll be returning here next time I find myself in NOLA.

One of the best meals I had while in NOLA. I don't like seafood but decided to venture outside my comfort  zone and order what the waiter suggested.  The food was amazing!!!! Our waiter was great. The beer was cold. How could we go wrong. I will be back.

Friday night dinner in the French Quarter means the line is out-the-door, but this place is like a well-oiled machine! Most people were seated w/in 15 mins and we took the option of sitting at their bar upstairs. Check out the courtyard! On our way up, we were escorted at two spots in the restaurant to find our way (sizable and creative spaces). Everyone is super friendly and genuinely so. The bar area is very nice w/ a lot of elbow room to eat and drink, so feel comfortable if you are only a party of 2. A handful of local drafts available (ie Anita Turbo, Andygator, etc.) as well as a ton of cocktails to choose from. I haven't tried them but they have use vegetables infused Absolute Vodka for their Special Bloody Marys! Specials of the evening were a redfish, catfish, or tuna dish. You can order blackened and/or tasso w/ shrimp and all came w/ delicious greens! This place won't dissapoint.

Tough call on Oceana.  Went for the seafood but no raw seafood served - everything has to be cooked, even the oysters.  New Orleans...BP...no raw seafood...go figure.

I had ribs, and they were decent, but no match for America's staple - Tony Roma's.  But the real kicker is the 99% humidity.  How can anyone enjoy a decent meal in a sauna?  Damn you Big Easy.

Oh well, I think everyone should abandon the Gulf Coast for the next 50 years anyways.

We got the Taste of New Orleans and Jambalaya pasta. Our friends got the alligator appetizer, shrimp po boy, and the barbecued shrimp. The pasta was average but the Taste of New Orleans is a must get dish there. I would also recommend the barbecued shrimp. The portions were small for the price. Most of the food had good flavor. When going to the south, be prepared to get a Cajun kick in your mouth. -Quang

I liked the crawfish etouffee in the taste of New Orleans dish. -Alyssa

Wow we had an amazing waitress so kind and friendly! Normally these tourists places just want the costumer in and out but here I actually felt like they cared. This place had great food, good size portions, hot and fresh. I would recommend this place to try. We will come back next time we are in town. 
The line was a little long but it moved quickly and since the wait area is a small area it makes since on why the line outside was so long. Awesome job folks, we had a wonderful dinner and made a lasting impression! We will be back soon!
Words cannot express how delicious my food was! I can't wait to go back. This restaurant and the atmosphere was wonderful. It made my trip.

Ok, this meal was the day after dinner at Antoine's =which btw was NOT up to snuff. 

This little joint was across the street from the Royal Sonesta, and was presented causally. The food and specifically the chared oysters were delightful! I think that we ordered 5 plates (between 4 people) plus dinner (in our inebriated inebriation) just because they were so darned good! Oysters very fresh, all food was delish,and staff super fun and sweet.

Get the bread pudding here if you are up for it, it is a good one, also the strawberry short cake -but I will warn you, they do run out.

We spent as much money here as at Antoines, but here it was money well spent.

This was by far the best place we have eaten at while visiting New Orleans! We had the gator bites, flame broiled oysters and the jambalaya pasta all were amazing! Will be eating here again before we leave!
We love visiting here when in town.  breakfast , lunch , or dinner. The best service in New Orleans.
Try the oysters on a half shell and the chargrilled oysters.  Tender, plump and delicious.  We also had the Taste of New Orleans.  It's a great way to try 3 different dishes.  Highly recommend.

My order was messed up and so was everyone else that sat at the bar. I hate being the bitchy customer but I waited forever for a plate. Raw oysters should not take 45 minutes. My husband got his ribs before I got my oysters. Actually, he got his ribs before our appetizer. It was a huge disappointment since there were so many good reviews on yelp. We should have gotten the oysters comped but they didn't bother. Even spoke with the manager and he didn't seem to care. I'm not coming back.
Service and food was delicious. Definitely recommend !! Our server Pamela was excellent and had good suggestions. First time being here and definitely coming back!

AMAZING! Best meal we had in NOLA hands down. The food was so freaking good. Don't fret about the line outside. At first it could have scared me off, but because of looking at reviews, pics and their prices we stayed and only waited maybe 15 mins. Service was top notch as well.

I thank the random lady walking out who said to get the crab cakes because we never order appetizers, but because of Random Lady we did...oh.my.god! So amazing....the sauce makes it. I also got the jambalaya pasta which was so good I ate until I was rolling our like blueberry girl from Willie wonka. My hubby got the duck and it was also delicious. We couldn't have asked for better...so good I'm thinking about coming back the tomorrow night for something else.

This place is simply amazing!  I was in New Orleans around Christmas and a lot of restaurants were closed.  This place was recommended by the locals and I thanked them afterwards.  We ordered their famous crab cakes.  It was so much crab meat and the sauce on the top with crawfish was just to die for.  A bowl of gumbo was topped with small crab legs and it was not salty like many other places.  Bloody mary drinks were perfectly made.  The highlight of the night was their oceana redfish.  I highly recommend this dish.  Our waiter had the knowledge of the dishes and so accommodating.  I can't wait to return back to Oceana Grill.  It's definitely on my list with Deanie's and ACME Oysters.

As with most places in NOLA, the service was super. The food was OK and not very expensive and the atmosphere was fun. Nothing really stood out about the food though, but they do get props for being open on Christmas Day.

First and foremost, I have to highlight the exceptional service here. I've traveled and tried new spots where the food was spot on but had poor service and despite the good food I rarely want to go back. Oceana Grill was far from those experiences. S/o to our server who was Ashleigh. She was on point, the manager that weekend we visited, and the food we ordered was great! I would definitely come here again when I'm in town.

Good service and delicious food 
My friend and I ordered Cajun fries and bbq shrimps - in a traditional Louisiana sauce

A local steered me and the BF here on our first day in town. We both had poboys, oyster and shrimp. They were sooo good and a great way to start the vacation. The slaw they put on it is gonna leave me craving since there's nothing like it in Chicago. The service was quick and friendly and I saw managers making rounds to check on customers.  When I come back to visit, this place is on my list to hit up again.

Not a big fried food fan but the batter used here is nice and light! I dove in and grabbed an order of crab cakes, crawfish tails, oysters and gator two ways. So good. Not too heavy and perfect to pair with drinks!!

Out of all the restaurants my SO and I visited on this NYE trip, Oceana was the best. The waiter charmed me into ordering the blackened catfish special even before I had a chance to look at the rest of the menu. My boyfriend ordered the Redfish Oceana. I don't know what ridiculous sauces they slathered these fish with because it was excellent We might've finished this entire meal within 10 minutes. The gator tail bites can be ordered as a fried and blackened combination so take advantage of that if you can't decide how you want them done. They were alright, but I don't think gator meat is memorable to begin with.

There wasn't any wait on New Year's Day at 9PM. It may be because everyone was at the Sugar Bowl game.

Mmm so so so good. MUST try the famous chargrilled oysters. The sauce is scrumptious. We pretty much licked the plate. Also had the jambalaya pasta which was delicious. The place is very nice inside and has A.C..  was surprised that there was a second floor but it's much less busy up there.

I visited New Orleans for Mardi Gras this year and I had a wonderful culinary experience, save for this place. This is the ONLY restaurant I got sick from, and I can only attribute it to not having fresh shellfish. I ordered the crawfish ettoufle and it was quite good but again- not fresh!!

 Also I had to speak to the manager to get the discount which was super awkward and weird especially when you are on party mode (hello?! Mardi Gras?!)
Not bad, but the food is a bit greasy. Go if you want some dive bar style food. Don't go if you are looking for a fancy dinner, or for a lot of options that aren't fried.

Nice spot right in the heart of the action near bourbon street. We ate in the courtyard area which had a nice atmosphere. Had the blackened crawfish tails as an appetizer, very good. Had the oyster po boy for my entree which also was very good. Prices were good and service excellent.

Food was good but had to wait a bit for our oysters.  

The crab cakes, however, are the best I've ever had!  

There's a lot of space and if you get an upstairs window table, you can see all the hub-bub going on down on the street.  

The catfish was delicious as well.

Service was excellent.  Thumbs up to the staff!

When I think about this place I instantly remember the oyster rockefeller dozen and the rest of the food was a forgettable blur. Soooo insanely good. Cheesy, buttery, HEAVEN! Crazzyy good. Makes me so angry that I know I won't find this in Miami!

The rest of the food was not bad. But not as insanely delicious as the oysters. I had a plate of red beans and rice. I enjoyed it very much, I saw my friends gobble down cheeseburgers and a Po'boy. Which both friends attested to it being very good. Needless to say, we had a good dinner here.
Delicious food and a great start to our New Orleans visit. Ashleigh, our server, took great care of us and we would certainly recommend Oceana to family and friends.
Service was great, food was ok. On a broiled oyster hunt. The sauce had great flavor. The oysters, not so much.

Everything was delicious!  We were recommended by the innkeeper at the B&B we stayed at and are so glad we got to try it out!  The gumbo was fantastic (plenty of seafood in each bite) and the crabcakes are a MUST have if you eat there.  My husband ate the blackened redfish with a mushroom cream sauce and about keeled over from trying to eat it all.  Service was fine and the atmosphere is pretty relaxed and casual.  We will be returning next time we go to NOLA.
Awesome Bloody Mary's and huge fresh oysters.  Very accommodating and friendly service.

This was the 1st restaurant we visited when we got off the plane so I really didn't have anything to compare it to. The redfish Pontchartrain was outstanding, and the etoufee was probably the best we had a New Orleans. We were there for 6 days and the Oceana Grill still rated high on our list of meals we had while visiting. Well done!

Shaun and Chris are the best bartenders!!  We ate dinner at the bar too, foregoing the wait. We had the New Orleans fries, which were incredible, and then we had the taste of New Orleans., Which was equally impressive. This is a must visit stop for NOLA!!

Try their Blackened Red Fish! it's OMG gooooood. 

This was the first place we ended up at after putting everything down in our hotel room. Their food was amazing and the portions were huge especially for the price. I'm not sure how I feel about the alligator meat we had, tasted like tough chicken. My wife and her cousin shared a Shrimp Fettuccini Alfredo and loved it so much that they asked for extra pasta just to soak up the rest of the sauce.

The service was perfect, just enough hospitality to make us feel welcomed, not too much to where we felt it was fake. Our waiter even gave us a way lower bill (by accident, it was from the table next to us...yes we did tell him and got the correct one)

As with most restaurants in the area, their seafood is top notch and fresh. It's odd that I don't get that living next to the ocean myself! Plenty of places still uses previously frozen seafood...maybe the demand for it here just isn't enough to keep them fresh for long. That said, I would say eat nothing but seafood while you are in NOLA!

THE FOOD WAS AMAAAAAAAZING! So good that by the time we remembered to take a picture of the food, it was all gone. Haha. But we got the Cajun fries, crab cakes, and charbroiled oysters for the appetizer and all 3 were absolutely amazing! I had the oceana grill signature dish. The red snapper was a little dry but it had so much flavor! My boyfriend had the crab cake pasta and he loved it! My sister had the Cajun jambalaya pasta and I tried it myself and it was so so good. All in all this place was everything we hoped. We were starving at walked into the right place! Chantay was our server and she was so nice and so patient with us! She even requested some of her favorite dishes and all the ones she requested were absolutely to die for! 10/10 would definitely recommend this place

Oceana's grill was very delicious I enjoyed my experience I love the service and they have the best oysters I have ever had if you have not had food from this restaurant please please please whatever you do while you are in New Orleans please visit that restaurant it is so worth it.

This may have been the best breakfast I've ever had in my entire life.  I ordered the sausage breakfast which came with cajun seasoned alligator sausage, two eggs cooked to order, hash browns, a biscuit and grits.  Everything was completely out of this world, particularly the sausage and the hash browns.  The seasoning was unbelievable.

Service was exceptional and the place wasn't too crowded on a Friday at 9 am.  The server even gave my friend a free drink when she complained of her hangover, which automatically cured her and allowed her to enjoy the rest of the day (bitters and soda water - not tasty but effective).

I would highly recommend this place, at least for breakfast!

We decided to try this restaurant we were in kind of a long waiting line but the waitress was proactive and came outside and asked if there's a party of four that would like to be seated she sit us down and we had the best service ever the food was awesome I would definitely go back your oysters were really good

Great food, great service. Errol was awesome! Try the Jazzy crab cake platter, Oceana's famous oysters, or one of their red fish dishes you wont be disappointed!

thank you j & n white

Love this place!!  Oceana Grill is typically one of the first places I stop when I visit NOLA. I usually get the Seafood Sampler!  Oh, and the Kentucky Bourbon Pecan al la mode is a must... lol.  I always have mine before the entree:) Enjoy!!
Amazing little restaurant the Cajun pasta was the best, definitely a must go! Sevice was great also

My girlfriend and I finally took our first New Orleans trip and Oceana was recommended by a few people. I mean it when I say that this is THE BEST seafood I've had! Seafood is good in Cali. But nothing like this. We split a bowl of gumbo, half dozen oysters, redfish ponchatr, and crab cakes. Our server Whitney gave amazing recommendations to both my girl and I and so that happy with everything she suggested. She knew her stuff and being that my girl and I are in the restaurant business we really appreciate that.

If you are looking for good seafood, this a great place eat. I had the seafood platter one day and the shrimp platter the next day. Other than the seafood platter being a tad bit greasy on my first visit, every thing was hot, fresh, and good. We ate here twice in one weekend and both times our servers we excellent. Also, if you a looking for a great cocktail, try the "Green Iguana"

Would've probably enjoyed the Jambalaya pasta if they had made it without the sausage like I asked. I ordered takeout for my trip back to Dallas by the time I realized they messed up my order it was too late. Also the portion size of the pasta is really small for the cost, but I did get a generous amount of chicken ( I substituted out the shrimp and sausage for chicken)
Loved the blackened alligator bits, gumbo, crab cakes, and red beans!! Great service and totally chill!
Overall the food is delicious we had the catfish, hush puppies, red beans and rice. The stand out for me was the red beans and rice, literally the best I've ever had

Food was surprisingly great! I had their catfish with jambalaya dish.. very good.. i did not experience cold food like many others have posted about. The place also has some amazing gumbo, after trying to other places within the business district I was surprised that all the gumbos were not consistently good... I had two bowls here!

Man I'm so glad I convince my group to go with me to this place. Everyone throughly enjoyed their meals. The catfish was piping hot and fresh. I think my favorite dish was the RED BEANS AND RICE and jambalaya.

Oceania Grill was wonderful. It is as good as it gets for tourist food in the French Quarter. The barbecued shrimp appetizer is a must.  Given the choice my family preferred Oceania to Acme Oyster hands down.
Mixed emotions here...I have eaten here twice, one time I got food poisoning and the other time it was great food.  I would give it a chance again based on the food quality the great time.

Amazing food! Amazing service! John was our server and he made our night.   I had shrimp fettucini and a cup of gumbo. The mister had a fried shrimp platter. We would highly reccomend both. Friendly people, great food, can't go wrong! Hurricane was yummy too

Oceana grill does have some tasty Étouffée ($18, add grilled crawfish for +$5) but that's where the praise for this place stops.

The ambiance is feels more like a back room / basement than a French quarter bistro. 

Back to the food...

Grilled Oysters? ... "Yes, please!"  
Cream sauce finish... "Who Dat?"

I realize that they need to differentiate themselves from the mainstream but this grilled oyster fan gives Oceana a big thumbs down. The grilled oysters comes out with a sad hunk of bread smothered in the cream-butter-cheese sauce over a weird bed of wilted lettuce. (Hot oysters and lettuce?)

The seafood gumbo (bowl, $10) had an okay base but then it had four sad shrimp in it. Where's the seafood?

Both the Étouffée and Gumbo were served with three thin slices of the same sad French bread. :(. Not even toasted rounds. Honestly, saltine crackers would have been better. 

Definitely a meal wasted in NOLA.

This was an excellent suggestion while we were in NOLA. Even though grill is in the name I didn't see many options for grilled food.  The ambience was fantastic - we did have to go up a tall flight of stairs to the dining room. Our wait staff was great.  

We ordered blackened and fried alligator as an appetizer as well as the crab cakes. The alligator was hands down delicious and not over cooked.
As a main dish I ordered the Seafood Platter.  I loved the oysters but the shrimp had way too much batter on it for my preference. It was a lot of fried food. My friend had the Mardi Gras pasta and it was amazing. When I go back I'll order that. The other friends also loved their alligator Sausage poor boy and the jambalaya I was told was delicious. 

I wish I would have had room for the incredible looking desserts. Sweet tea was perfect

Used a restaurant.com certificate, so we had to get 2 entrees, shrimp ok, just ok and the catfish platter, very good.  My wife's gumbo came out cold, but the did get her another bowl.  Also the chargrill oysters was just ok.  I have had better.

awesome experience. no complaints. my gf ordered a drink called tropical storm and loved it so much we got one to go and saved the recipe. she got a porterhouse steak and i got a ribeye. the steaks were AMAZING. best i have had in a long time. will visit again.

The raw oysters were a little chewy and overall, not the greatest.  They were big, that's good, but not slide down the throat, that's bad.  They weren't very flavorful, that's bad, but I was drunk, that's good.  I would go somewhere else for raw oysters.

Lovely, warm wait staff, but the food was very disappointing. The crab cakes were OK but the Ahi kinda scared me and I think they bought the Bananas Foster frozen at Costco or Sam's Club. Again, waiters and hostesses were super nice, but the quality of food disappointed.

We were seated pretty quickly, and got down to business with our order to share. I had to start out with a hurricane. We started with the gator tail bites, char-grilled oysters, and the seafood gumbo. We then split up the taste of New Orleans, blackened bayou duck, shrimp po boy, redfish Oceana, and the fried seafood platter. Everything was delicious. Our service was quick and the prices were reasonable. Those char-grilled oysters are what New Orleans is all about!

Y'all! Whitney is the truth! I took my mom here for her birthday and this is her first time in the big easy mind you. And our server Whitney made it amazing. Her recommendation for the redfish special was the best thing I've ever tasted. And then she even wished my mom a happy bday and without even asking her she had the employees and herself sing to her! With a free bread pudding too! I come to Nola pretty often and this place is def on my to-go list when I come back.  #givewhitneyaraise!!!

Great meal and service! I had the redfish, husband had a steak, both well prepared and flavorful. It was only the two of us so we didn't have to wait long for a table, despite the long line outside. 
Dessert was the only disappointment - the bread pudding was very dry, almost more like a muffin.

Chargrilled oysters were fantastic!  However, red fish was dry & VERY over cooked - parts of the fillet were completely not eatable!  Jambalaya was the worst we'd ever had - the serving was covered with what appeared (and tasted like) tomato paste. 'Given the reviews I'd read - we were extremely disappointed!  
I'd skip this place and try almost anything else in the area!

Food and atmosphere was fantastic! I highly recommend this place for dinner. We ordered the Jambalaya pasta and the New Orleans.
The staff was great. Yelp has a 10% discount for checking in.
Food was just okay and the prices were fairly high for what we got. Oysters were just okay.

Totally awesome! In the middle of consuming my seafood platter I had this sudden urge to throw my hands up and scream "hallelujah". Our server Roderic was helpful and offered his honest opinion to assist us in making our selections. The chef came over to greet us and even shared the 3 cheese cream sauce recipe with my hubby. I danced my way out of this fine establishment excited about the crumbs that had fallen down my shirt mere moments earlier saying to myself those are like little keepsakes from an extremely good meal.

We had the cajun jambalaya pasta and the fried shrimp po-boy for dinner and oceana's famous oysters for an appetizer! Everything was GREAT! I especially liked the po-boy as it was tasty but not overly fatty or greasy! The pasta was my first time trying gator sausage and the sauce and sausage had a great smokey flavor! They let us bring our drinks in and I would recommend doing that as their drinks were a little pricey compared to something outside. Great atmosphere as well!!
Nice on the inside. traditional louisiana resteraunt. very fresh fish, you can taste the freshness. little dark inside we had to put the phone flash to see the menu. overall good.
Excellent meal and reasonably priced. Extremely courteous staff. By far the best oysters I encountered during my odessey that is the french quarter.

Went here for lunch.  I had the gumbo and we shared the gator bites.  Both were pretty good. For desert we had the pecan pie and bread pudding.  Both were very good!  Waiter was very good at keeping our drinks full!
Late night nibble. I ordered gumbo and it was good but it could've been warmer. I'd come back for another dish

Let me start off with the fact that I'm definitely NOT a Cajun or seafood lover so take this with a grain of salt. Still tried the catfish over jambalaya special. VERY spicy, shrimp and crawfish on plate are pretty good. Nice server but very lax ambiance. Not over the top experience, very basic when it comes to the details. Friend had steak and liked it, but it made her sick almost immediately (before we even left the restaurant.)

This place is truly amazing! We ate dinner there two nights in a row! Their famous oysters are to die for and they had a catfish lefourche special which was my absolute favorite. You cannot go wrong with this place!

I know many people might say this is a tourist trap, but if so it is the tourist trap with the best food!  

The menu has many fish entrees which my husband enjoyed. I don't eat fish- but found the blackened chicken to be delicious. And the mustard greens are the best anywhere. 

Ask to sit in the courtyard if the weather is nice- it feels way more relaxed. 

Service was great.

OMG BEST FOOD EVER!!! BBQ Shrimp, Crab Cakes and Alligator Sausage! Ate there twice and just ordered off the appetizer menu. I had BBQ Shrimp at other places (including Emeril's) and none of them compared to Oceana! Great staff, warm atmosphere, easy to get a table anytime. Right off Bourbon street just past The Royal Sonesta coming from Canal Street.

Went here on Friday evening (pretty early). We ordered crab cakes, salad, and chargrilled oysters. The food was good but service was lacking. With so many wonderful options in New Orleans it's hard to say I'll go somewhere twice unless it's spectacular. If you do end up going here- make sure to try the oysters!

Average. I had taste of New Orleans which I thought was good. I especially enjoyed the red beans and crawfish ettouffe. We shared the BBQ shrimp because so many others raved about them. They are huge! The sauce makes them, otherwise they were a bit over cooked. Should have remembered that when my husband ordered the tuna as medium rare. It was really over done. Very dry. The waitress was lovely and friendly but didn't offer to comp. the dish, which (having worked in the service industry) is typically standard when a customer is dissatisfied with their meal. She gave him some sauce for it and extra lemon though. Overall I'd say it's a place to try as a tourist but don't have high expectations.

I live in the DFW area and tried to plan out a bachelorette party from home.  I made a reservation here and was NOT disappointed.  The staff was easy to work with/book then when we arrived the day of they immediately took us up to our room and had everything set and the service was phenomenal.  The food was great and well priced and they truly made the evening, and the bachelorette, special.  I'd recommend this place over any other place I've ever been to in New Orleans.

Stopped for lunch and got a fried seafood platter, $22.00. My wife and I split it and was delicious. Fried shrimp, oysters, catfish, jalapeño hush puppies, fries, and coleslaw. We couldn't finish it all. My wife ordered the Cajun Bloody Mary and loved it. We will be back!

Can't say enough good things about this restaurant! If you're on Bourbon, this is definitely a great spot to eat at. Errol was our server and couldn't have been more accommodating. He even arranged to have a table ready for 12 people, even though they don't take reservations on the weekends! All of our food was amazing!

Food was good.  Had the alligator bites (deep fried and blackened) for an appetizer.  She elected to go with the house special Red Fish Meal with fried craws over it in a country gravy.  I had the Cajun sampler which came with their gumbo, jambalaya and red bean and rice.  Overall a good meal but didn't seem quite worth the $76 price( plus tip) ... However I can see why a lot of peeps go here.  In NOLA there are a lot of great paces to eat and Oceana Grill is definitely one of them.   BTW you'd be so lucky to have the charming server Mary help you.  She's a delight to deal with for your short stay :)
Great food and Good service . My entree was incorrect the 1st time here but it just gave us an excuse to come back again so I could order it .

Great food and great service. There is usually a line outside to get in but you get seated in a timely manner. I enjoyed the crawfish étouffe and bread pudding. The staff at this restaurant are so friendly. I highly recommend eating here when in New Orleans.

Where do I start!? The food was fantastic. The drinks were delicious. I got the red fish special, tough break it probably won't be available when you come, but woweeee. Mary helped us out and she was a sweetheart. Very attentive and was exactly what I hoped for in my first dinner in New Orleans. Definitely come in. Definitely eat. You'll love it.
Very good blackened catfish. We were too fool to get any bread pudding but that's just an excuse to go back. Always a good choice when visiting New Orleans.
Food was absolutely FANTASTIC! Fried eggplant sticks and blackened chicken Alfredo were maybe the best I've ever had

Came to New Orleans on vacation and heard this was a must try restaurant while I was here. Decided to come the first night here and man was I amazed! From the blackened alligator bites to the bread pudding everything was beyond satisfying. I had the Seafood Platter as a main dish and it was definitely piled high with catfish, oysters, and shrimp. All I have to say is if you come across this place it is definitely worth coming in and having a meal. Lastly, the customer service was A+++! Everyone here seems so happy and very friendly.

BEST CHARGRILLED OYSTERS IN THE WORLD. It's kinda indescribable. 

I also had the etoufee which was hearty and delicious. Was tempted to get the cheesecake which looked amazing.

This is definitely the place that rocked us hard! I always yelp for the place with the second most reviews when I choose my first restaurant to dine in once I arrive my travel destination. We met Jerry, who was so welcoming and helpful and he guided us to have the best first meal! We end up coming back for another meal and also enjoyed it because everything in this restaurant are just right for our taste. Would come back again if I ever visit again, and ask for Jerry! He's the man!

So I went to New Orleans for a wedding this past weekend and I'm craving crab cakes. I go to my fellow yelpsters to help me find the right spot and you led me to this jewel of an establishment. (My stomach will be forever grateful :-))

I just ordered the crab cake appetizer because the server said they were pretty good size, they were also a little pricey ($14 for the appetizer and $22 for the meal). 

Service was friendly and quick and the crab cakes were to die for!! More crab than cake (That's how I like it) and they were moist and so flavorful (my mouth is watering thinking about them!) I will definitely be back the next time I'm in New Orleans!

Had the Redfish Oceana blackened, very tasty. Another member of our party had oysters and said they were amazing. Cute decor, super friendly staff. When we left there was a line of people outside waiting.
The line went really quickly.   The food was good but not excellent.    The drinks were great!   Our waitress was friendly and did her job well.

I went to oceana's for my birthday & The food is amazing. I had the red fish special with greens & it was the best I have ever had. Our server Whitney made it even better. She suggested everything from the drinks to the food. She recommended a great "birthday meal". She gave us amazing service. If you go there try & get Whitney as your server & get those crab cakes!
You won't leave hungry. This is where the locals go to splurge. I had the catfish, best I've ever had. Highly recommend.

This place slightly underwhelmed as a go to spot in NOLA. First there is about a 40 minutes wait just to get in to the restaurant. The drinks and cocktails are great, but when we ordered the charbroiled oysters, it is a little greasy and not up to my expectations. The seafood gumbo is more watery than the ones I had at Gumbo Ship. The serving size is also very large and the server also forgot one of my orders which I ended up cancelling. Overall, this place is slightly overvalued by tourists.

Great atmosphere.
Good food.
Average service.
Pricy: Breakfast for people costed $65.00 plus tip

The food was just as expected, very tasty, but the highlight of our lunch was the excellent service we received from Whitney. She put up with our big party with a smile on her face and she and the other servers made my Dad feel special on his birthday. Give this girl a raise, cause we are not the easiest people to deal with! Thank you Whitney!

Ask your staff for the the items off the menu. Our waiter
Recommended a delicious Cajun pasts we would have NOT gotten if it was off the menu. 
Provecho!!

Oceana is a very casual restaurant, with tasty food and excellent service. Everyone we came in contact with was extremely helpful and friendly. The food is tasty but a little on the heavy side. Would be a great place if you are looking for a casual meal for the whole family. Highly recommend the crab cake appetizer.

Went here for lunch while visiting New Orleans.  The po-boy sandwiches are very delicious and the drinks are great as well!  I was also very pleased with the service, our server was very friendly, helpful and attentive.
I had crab cakes, and Greek salad with blackened shrimp. Everything was delish!  Our waiter, Greg was very attentive and friendly.
Bree was an awesome server! Best oysters and shrimp po boy in the French Quarter! The bloody marys were also killer!

My best friend and cousin came to NOLA to visit and saw a poster/ad for this place in the airport and wanted to try it since we were exploring Bourbon that day (Monday - 7/7/14).


SERVICE: 5 Stars
The staff was amazing!  They were friendly, helpful and fun to be around!  It gets busy so the waiters/waitresses are very busy but the management staff fills in making sure everyone is taken care of. 

FOOD: 3.5 Stars
We all got different things and tried each other's food.  Here are my thoughts on food:
Seafood Gumbo - didn't try (my cousin wouldn't share because she liked it so much)!
Gator Tail Bites (fried & blackened) - Good.  
Fried Shrimp Po' Boy - DRY!  We all felt the sauce to bread ratio was off.
Crab Cakes - Good.  Plenty of crab meat instead of the filler stuff.
Green Iguana (drink) - Great drink.  It tastes like juice but sneaks up later.  

Yes, I would recommend stopping by and giving them a try!

If you're in the mood for tasty gumbo and straightforward drinks, this is your place.  On Christmas day at lunchtime, the line was pretty long, but moved briskly.  Seafood gumbo was served with rice and French bread, was perfectly on point.  Crab cake starter was delicious and too much for me as an entree.  Husbie had tuna steak special - very good, but a little on the dry side (cooked medium). Kir royales and Abita to drink.  Recommend.

So much deliciousness to choose from, From appetizers, soups and salads, po-boys, pasta, seafood you name it they got it. Alcoholic beverages also I would definitely recommend this establishment to family and friends.

The kind waiter recommended a po'boy to me which I'd pass along to any other person reading reviews. I got the char grilled catfish po'boy which was really good (they do their boys with their own individual coleslaw tho instead of their the traditional lettuce and tomato so if you're not a fan maybe skip the po'boy). But what sold me was the gator bites. I was eager to try some gator and the waiter gave me some suggestions on what to order. Needless to say I loved it and went back a second time just for the gator!
Excellent place.  Went there for breakfast and it was very good. Service was very nice and
The food was amazing! It was hot and fresh! Drinks were strong ! And service was great!

Omg....Where do I start.....Where My Girlfriend and I come from you can't eat Catfish due to poor lake conditions. So I was compelled to try it out when I asked another table what was on there plate. She had the Fried Shrimp. With every single bite our mouths watered Like a faucet. Absolutely delicious. Being from your Neighbours to the north we also don't have the luxury of Gumbo. So clearly I had to try that as well as the crab cakes. And guys let me tell you if I was a wealthy man we would fly down there once a week and smash everything back that's on your menu. Happy staff members (Mikey you were a gem) out of control portions (good thing) there was a line up at the door but we waited MAYBE only 10 minutes. This place is a must dine on your trip to New Orleans. Anyone who says otherwise either has no sense of taste/smell or just flat out should just stick to McDonalds $ menu. If the owner ever wanted to open one of your establishments up here in Canada I would gladly for free promote the **** out of it. I'm officially awarding you guys a sixth star. Thanks again and if we're ever back down your way ya'll know darn we'll be back through those doors.

PS having James Gandolfini there in the past cemented the experience.

I was spoiled from the excellent food from acmes, so this was just alright.  we started off with charbroiled oysters.  they burnt some of the oysters, and the sauce was all lumpy and the only flavor was from the grated parm cheese.  it comes with 2 soggy pieces of bread for a dozen oysters, and was served with a plastic spork.  i got the blackened duck with crawfish cream sauce.  it was ok but the sauce didn't really go with the duck.  the jamabalaya was ok.  the fried seafood- shrimp, catfish, oysters, were ok.  there was too much breading, and the oysters were not tasty.  does not compare to the seafood at deanies.
Loved everything here!!! I am not a fan of Bloody Mary... but my friends claim that Oceana Grill has the best Bloody Mary in New Orleans (they sampled it pretty much everywhere for 5 days :-))
Great food ! Had the blackened chicken po boy and it was delicious ! Everyone in our party loved their meals ! Loud atmosphere - but good fun for all. Would come back for sure !

Experience with wait staff here is incredible - 5 stars for sure.  This 3-story establishment seems to have cemented its way into the mouths and hearts of many French Quarter patrons and tourists, but I am not sure why.  Ok, from that point, I should say I was only looking for non-seafood food.  So, ignore my two cents if you were/are here for the seafood.

What can you get if you don't want seafood?  Pasta.  Meh.  Salad.  Meh.  Fries.  Meh.  Cajun stew.  Meh.  Everything else, you should worry about having seafood and/or meat somewhere in the mix.  So, be aware.  Not the best place for food that is not seafood.  It's the unwanted step-child approach to the veg food here in the sense that they acknowledge a need to have it as part of the menu family to be fair, but doesn't mean they want to really give any time and consideration for these choices.

However, really, the service here is fabulous.  Thanks staff of Oceana.  Impressive attentiveness, politeness, friendliness and efficiency!
The crab cakes are good enough to make you want to commit a crime!
Coming from Houston I was really disappointed with the lack of favor (red fish). The food was not even warm. Spend the money, and eat at a better restaurant...you've been warned!!!!
Not a fan of seafood, but I had a great pasta, and my friends loved their food, as well. Ample seating upstairs.

Second time here while visiting. Both times have been great. The service stands out, everyone legit seems thankful for your business. This past time there was a lot of pushing for drinks and dessert but I get it- build the ticket. Seating outside was nice change from last time. I'll be back. Crab cakes are legit!

The best raw oysters we've had in the FQ yet. The server (Ezra) was gracious and friendly. My double Bloody Mary was delicious although be careful what you wish for. It was strong! We had a lovely lunch here.

After watching the Kitchen Nightmare episode here I was a bit worried. They made the owners seem like scum. 
But when I ate there, two times to make sure I was being fair, I was really happy to see that they were interesting... I won't call it amazing,I will call it ok. 
Maybe learn to balance salt with the food. You can't always rely on salt to make up for the not so amazing skills of your cooks. Hire a home cook. Most restaurants want experienced cooks but we all know (I hope) that most restaurants give people ONE JOB so while they have restaurant skills, it's very limited. A fry cook is not a viable option if you need other things...But a good home cook is great for multi-tasking. Wake upNOLA. We are F-ing ourselves up.

Loveeeeed the jambalaya, greens, and blackened chicken! LLOYD was AWESOME! He served us in a timely manner and he was very welcoming! Very professional and knowledgeable about the menu items. Great environment!

Went here our first night in New Orleans in the French Quarter. This is definitely a tourist trap. We had the Taste of New Orleans (seafood gumbo, crawfish étouffée, and beans & rice), Fried oyster po boy, jambalaya pasta, and seafood platter. All the dishes were definitely overly salted and greasy. I could barely taste the natural flavors of the ingredients, the sauces were overpowering and salty. Furthermore, the portions were small for the prices (bill was $100). The fried seafood platter had more breading than seafood and the hush puppies were hard. Like other reviewers mentioned, the seafood didn't taste fresh. However, the waitress was very friendly and we were seated promptly even though it was very busy. The food looks presentable too before you taste it! Don't be deceived!!!! If this is your first experience with New Orleans' cajun/creole cuisine, it will definitely be a bad first impression and very poor representation of what New Orleans has to offer! With all the restaurants in the French Quarter, there are surely a lot better options out there.

Also think they go by "Ole Nawlins Cookery" judging by the employee's uniforms, although the sign at the door still says Oceana Grill??

Looked over the menu and it looked good, saw good reviews here and there was a line outside, all good signs. We were seated in the very pretty courtyard out back for our meal.

Went and started off with the alligator sausage, something I've never had but never afraid to try need things and being from NYC you don't really see that much. So glad I got it! It was wonderfully smoked and anyone who tells you this tastes anything different than a good smoked meat is lying cause you would never know the difference.

On to the entree, I had the crawfish etoufee, a perfect sized portion. This one was more of a tomato based unlike the others I've seen served but that was fine because it was very good. My mom, sick of seafood all week, had the 1/2 rack of bbq ribs. A very nice portion and also very good, meaty ribs. 

For dessert we really had wanted bread pudding but like other places around we saw that they made it with cocktail fruit inside which we were very put off by. The waitress brought us a lil piece of it anyways at no charge and we didn't like it. Read my review for the Gumbo Shop's BP, that's the way it should be. 

Overall, a good place to have a good meal at a reasonable price

I went there last year and had good experience but this year it didn't meet the expectations and the shrimp tasted like some regular restaurant in Memphis. Their crabmeat cake is good tho. I liked Cadillac margarita and my girlfriend had tropical storm which is good too .hmm

So, I went to Oceana Grill during my big vaca down in NOLA a couple weeks back. I was really excited to come to Oceana because the reviews were awesome and they have this dish on their menu called Taste of New Orleans which is basically 3 staple dishes ON ONE PLATE! Can't beat that concept, right?! It includes the Red Beans & Rice w/ smoked sausage, Jambalaya, and Crawfish Etouffee. HOLY YUM!
So, we had reservations (as it's better to be safe than sorry when dining with a 4-yr-old as they can't exactly stave off hunger as us fasting pros can), but we were dining pretty early (5:00pm-ish on a Thursday) and didn't really need them. There were plenty of open tables yet. I did notice things were getting busier by the time we left about an hour later. 
We were seated immediately upstairs and our waitress greeted us pretty quickly. We ordered an app and drinks and my daughter's main meal, all of which arrived quickly. After putting in the meal order, that arrived quickly, as well. 
Everything was pretty good. I had a couple bites of the alligator appetizer and the Taste of New Orleans. The alligator was chewier than I remember it being the one other time I had it years ago in an Illinois-based restaurant. It was still tasty, however. The Taste of New Orleans was very yummy, but...I think I built it up too big in my head. The red beans and rice w/ sausage was great. The jambalaya was darn good, as well. However, the etouffee fell a little short for me and, sadly, it was the number one item that I was looking forward to. I used to make etouffee fairly regularly (haven't in some time due to a particular picky eater I have the pleasure of calling my daughter...not walking headfirst into that standoff...lol) and I'm not one to brag about my cooking skills, as they are not Top Chef worthy by any means, but my etouffee would beat the pants off the Oceana Grill's etouffee. There was no spice (not the tiniest kick) and it was overly salty. I'm not going to say it was downright terrible because it was definitely not. I was just expecting it completely make mine look like amateur hour and, instead, it was the total opposite result. I guess, as they say, two out of three ain't bad, right??
Would I recommend this place? Absolutely. I may, however, suggest you skip the etouffee.
Taylor was amazing, great service, took good care of us.  Would come back again. Redfish was amazing!

Great food and alright service. We had the crab cake appetizer and Mardi Gras pasta, both were tasty. Waiter was friendly but didn't refill drinks in a timely manner. We were initially seated inside but asked to be re-seated in the back courtyard, which they were glad to do. Overall, we'd come back.
Great oysters.  We had both the raw and Oceana's Famous and they were delicious.   Oysters were very clean and fresh.  Must eat.

While visiting with a few friends we checked this spot out. It came highly recommended and apparently was a restaurant my friends had been to once before while visiting. I must admit, I really loved the multi levels and eclectic decorations of the place; it was really the highlight for me.

I ordered the gumbo and crab cakes. The gumbo was okay; there was too much okra for my taste. The crab cakes were full of crab meat like just the way I like them but they came out warm like they had been sitting for a while. I also tried a Rockerfeller Oyster off my friend's plate. It was delicious! However she mentioned that it didn't seem as filled as they were the first time she tried them.

Overall, this is a nice restaurant. I can see myself going back.

Of all the meals I've had here in the French Quarter, this is arguable one of the most disappointing Cajun/Creole food. I am not sure why there was a long line on Saturday night, and why it had such great reviews on Yelp. 

We got seated outside in the patio, and our waiter provided pretty good service. He gave us several recommendations, and we ended up ordering the Cajun Jambalaya Seafood Pasta and Taste of New Orleans, both of which he recommended. 

The Cajun Jambalaya was alright, nothing really to complain about. But the Taste of New Orleans was a big disappointment. It had crawfish etouffee, red beans and rice, and Creole Jambalaya. The red beans and rice, were literally red beans and rice. It was so dry it tasted something I could've gotten at Chipotle... I was so glad I didn't just order red beans and rice and felt really bad for the table next to us, who got two orders of just red beans and rice.. they probably didn't know that's what they were getting themselves into. The crawfish in the crawfish etouffee were mushy, telling me that the crawfish was not fresh.. 

I seriously don't understand why this place got so many reviews and such a high rating. I don't think we ordered the wrong thing either since our waiter said their Cajun Jambalaya Seafood Pasta probably has the best reviews... 

Probably another tourist trap. If you want good cajun/creole food, go to other places in the FQ.

This restaurant is located off of Bourbon street and our dinner here on the 2nd night was the best meal we had in New Orleans. Very friendly and accommodating service. The table we were seated at upstairs was a little small to accommodate all the food and drinks we ordered. But nevertheless I loved the casual and kids friendly atmosphere. They have an extensive menu with all kinds of seafood  and alligator dishes. 

Their Fried Oyster Poboy was some of the best I've ever had. We also tried the Taste of New Orleans which included sample cups of jambalaya, crawfish etouffe with rice and red beans and rice, and a smoked andouille sausage. All these items were tasty. My tropical storm drink was also delicious.
Great food with excellent prices..The grits are to do die for!!! Go for breakfast lunch or dinner!

The Taste of New Orleans was the easiest way to order everything I wanted at once. Don't forget the gator bites on the side (half blackened and fried). Also, if you're too lazy to walk the busy streets of Nola. Have it delivered.

We went on a Friday during off hours (around 4 pm) and it wasn't that crowded! We were able to get seated right away. I read there was a vegetarian menu so I requested it... it's the same exact vegetarian items on the regular menu just in larger font? Lol! Just 3 vegetarian meals taking up an entire menu in large font. Kind of funny yet unusual. Anyways- the raw oysters are good here. Everything else had a lot of seasoning with it? The fettuccine dish was alright....The service was excellent though! Everyone was SO friendly and each person greeted you as you walked through the restaurant.

Came here twice during my stay in New Orleans. They have a very nice atmosphere and the restaurant is way bigger than you expect from what you see when you first walk in. We sat at the bar both times and had 3 different kinds of oysters. 
Regular oysters on a half shell- always a favorite of mine, oceanas special- amazing buttery cream sauce with onions and the last kind were rockerfella oysters. The last were very spinachy creamy saucy but still pretty good. Maybe a bit overboard with the spinach though. 
Bar staff was very nice and friendly and beers always cold .. they always offered a fresh frozen glass after every beer which I thought was very nice . This place is definitely a keeper.

Best red beans and rice I've ever had! I don't even LIKE red beans and rice, but I can admit theirs is to die for. Their raw oysters are great, and their house oysters are pretty good to boot. But I must emphasize, their red beans and rice is a must buy, and their "taste of New Orleans" gives you a sample of their red beans and rice, barbeque shrimp (also great) and etouffee (or however you spell it) at half the price of sampling each individual appetizer. They will be a line, so be sure to grab a "to go" beer elsewhere to sip on while in line.

Oceana famous oysters are the best. Best I have ever tried. I came back for it two days in a row and not willing to share. You can taste the chargrilled flavor with a perfect hint of cheese . The sauce can be a great dip for bread too.

What a fun restaurant!  Our server Whitney was amazing!  She made the experience. Her recommendations were terrific!  It is my first time in New Orleans, and she made sure I tried all of the classics.  Yum!  Loved the grilled oysters, the alligator bites, grilled and fried pet Whitney's suggestion, and the soft shelled crab sandwich, which was amazing.  Well done Oceana, give Whitney a big bonus, she's a treasure!

Damn Good Food! Perfect setting off Bourbon Street and in the hub. We got a seat really fast. Colt was our server. He  was prompt and friendly. Very knowledgeable about the chefs specialities and made great recommendations. Best thing on menu was crab and mac cheese but everythingwas delicious and fresh.
Amazing food. Whitney was a wonderful server. She made the experience very nice. Shrimp was so fresh. The banana foster ice cream cake was the best ever. Would definitely come again.

I was kinda excited to try this place being that I watch Kitchen Nightmares and this place had been on the show (kinda scary huh?) Anyway, it was a nice experience. The food was good and the service was great. I would have preferred more options on the menu but aside from that I was satisfied and my friends were too. If I'm not mistaken, the restrooms could use some help, it sort of bugs me when restaurants have poorly maintained restrooms. Aside from that I enjoyed my BBQ shrimp, I could see myself eating there again.
I tried the gator bites for the first time in this place, and I loved it. I definately recommend this place, the food tastes great and the service is good
Not a bad spot for drinks.  We had some food at the bar. Great staff. Good times. Great location. Fair prices

Food is excellent!!! The atmosphere is very cozy. I ate here twice. The chicken pasta was yum and so was the blackened catfish dinner. The manager made sure we we're satisfied and the location is a short walk from Canal and Bourbon streets.

Best gumbo, best jambalaya, best red beans and rice, best fried shrimp, best hush puppies.  Portion sizes are large but the food is so delicious you won't have leftovers.  Restaurant is larger than it looks. Very quaint relaxed atmosphere.  We couldn't hear all the noise outside.  First time here on vacation. Local recommended the place.   Worth it!!

Red Beans and Rice.  Crawfish Etouffe.  Both mind-blowing.  The Crawfish Etouffe was the best of what we had, but the red beans and did the best against expectations.  The gator sampler (half blackened half fried) was also delicious.  If someone asked for a random place in the main downtown of NOLA to try "classic" NOLA food, this is where I'd direct them.

Nice decor and good service, thanks Jess!Fried shrimp platter came with an absolute mountain of spicy, fat shrimp.  The slaw was good and my husband liked the fries.  I got the shrimp PoBoy, it was okay, wouldn't get it again though.  I didn't like the fries, I thought  the fries were greasy.  10% off with Yelp check in!  10% off if you keep your receipt and return!

Absolutely my favorite crab cakes so far in the French Quarter. Two cakes accompanied with a slightly spicy sauce. Bridget our waitress was amazing recommended Danny's special, a very large portion of Red fish big enough to share. Saved room for Kentucky bourbon pecan pie and creme brulee. Yum

Holy crabcake!!!!!  Please get these but a tip for tourists to save money. The appetizer portion is the same with the exception of this little dish of red potatoes and squash. Its $8 more to order the dinner.  Just stick to the app...its plenty!
So tasty! A plus is they had lots of pescatarian options listed! I had the crawfish Alfredo and my husband had the BBQ ribs. We had little to no wait time and our server Darrick was great.

Love this place! My friend and I popped in here the other night to have food to take on our flight home the next morning. 
There was a long line out the door, but the lady at the door said for to go- head on in and place our order at the register by the bar. 
My friend had the catfish platter. She said it was amazing. She actually couldn't wait til the next day- she said it smelled so good when we got back to the hotel that she inhaled the whole platter. 
I had an oyster po-boy. Mine was so good- even the next day. 
Planning to eat in next time we are in the area. 
We saw that they even offer a walking tour thru their app.

Every time I'm here it's a totally different experience.  I was turned on to Oceana by the concierge at the Prince Conti (later found out they're bribed to recommend places) and since it was really close, we checked it out.  That first time I was in heaven - the room is gorgeous, with metal sea-motif everywhere, painted like it's under the ocean.  The food was delicious, the drinks were strong and tasty and the service was outstanding.  If I had written this review after one visit I would have given it 5 stars.  My next three times there, however, went downhill a bit more each time.  Hopefully they'll work on the service a little.  I'd hate to see Oceana get overlooked because it does have a lot to offer.

We were a party of six and we did not wait that long to get seated considering it was Thanksgiving weekend.  Services was fast and food was good.  It was not the best but good.  All the dishes had a very creamy sauce on top which is not my favorite.  Maurice was our server, a very nice guy and very attentive to our party.  The catfish platter was very good and their crab cakes was very good but I would have preferred the cakes without the sauce.
Got the blacked steak, and it was cooked perfectly!  Very friendly service from Melvin, and the young ladies at the hostest stand.  Also must try the blackened gator bites
Grilled Oceana oysters were delicious. Redfish dinner was even better! Dark inside, but outdoor patio is nice and bright.
Late night foodie coming here is critical!! Gumbo! Gator bites! Seafood platter!! And even chicken for my no seafood eating partner!! A
great place,  friendly service,  great drinks,  great food. had crab cakes & eggplant fries.
Fantastic seafood,  especially the crab cakes.  Price point is not ridiculous either.  Definitely coming back

We recently held a family dinner for 20 people at Oceana Grill as part of a wedding weekend. Large reservations can be a challenge for any restaurant but our 2 servers handled it with ease. The appetizers and drinks were promptly served to the entire group. The entrees followed right on time and    were delicious.  Definitely recommend you try this place in The French Quarter.

This was probably our best meal in New Orleans and we had some pretty delicious food. There was a line to get in but the wait wasn't too bad, our server was friendly and efficient. While there, I tried the crawfish French fry appetizer, crawfish étouffée, Cajun crawfish pasta and the praline brownie with ice cream. Every single thing I had was so good. I don't have any complaints about this place at all, food was fantastic and reasonably priced.
Food was delicious and nice size portions. Friendly service. This was my first time eating crawfish and it won't be my last!

This place is a 'Must Do' on every one of my trips to the Cresent City.   Ask to sit in Ponce's section if you go for breakfast. 

Where to start.....Get the Pain Pardu (French Toast) with Andouille sausage for breakfast.   The Cajun Breakfast is a good choice too.  Grits and eggs done just right.  The bisquit was a bit stale this time though but I forgive.

For dinner, I think the red beans and rice with sausage are the best.  Started with an appetizer of Blackened & Fried alligator.   Amazing.

While I've no had the crab cakes my dinner friends said they were the best ever.

Better at lunch than dinner. At dinner we had the Oysters Rockefeller (very good) and the Taste of New Orleans - a trio of red beans and rice with sausage, crawfish etouffee and jambalaya which were all BAD! The "red" beans were more like Mexican refried beans, the jambalaya was just rice with tomato sauce and shreds of chicken. Disgusting! The hurricanes were made with actual fruit juice as opposed to the chemical tasting mix most places use, so they were good. The atmosphere was casual and the service so-so. There are much better choices in town.

The service here was good but the food is kind of an afterthought, small kitchen just trying to crank out as much as they can. My fish was very over cooked and the jambalaya was bland and mushy. Their oysters were fresh and clean and the beer was cold so that's a plus!

We asked the concierge at our hotel where he recommended we go for gator.. he recommended Oceana and it was so good that we went twice on our four day stay. The bartenders (Brandy is the one I remember) are super sweet, their drinks aren't a bad price and the dry ice is something I've never had before. The food is INCREDIBLE. That jambalaya 
Dessert was good too. Crab Bennie for brunch was good. ITS ALL GOOD I NEED TO GO BACK.

Food was great.  I had the shrimp alfredo.  It had a nice kick to it.  It did seem as though the wait staff didnt care like they should.   It may be that we had 7 people and they automatically include 18% gratuity at 5 or more.  Also, the door lady was extremely rude to my wife.  They wont seat you unless your whole party is present.  Would have been 5 stars, but when your job is customer service you need to have some manners.
Left here feeling like I could have done better.  Not good at all.  I came to New Orleans  to eat authentic Cajun food.... My search continues.

Very underwhelmed by the food here. I ordered the fried catfish platter which comes with hush puppies and fries. The fish was sadly both under seasoned and under fried. Hush puppies were on the dry side and French fries were good but those are pretty hard to mess up. Cole slaw was good. 

Also ordered a hurricane which was delicious. Meh... I wouldn't eat here again.

Errol and Ricardo (His first day off training) were as good as it gets. The food was excellent and the wait staff was very attentive. Go for Breakfast and get the Wendell Omelette and an extra spicy bloody Mary. Thanks again Errol and Ricardo, we will be back.

I ordered from oceana my second night in new orleans.The food was seasoned well and very tasty .3 stars.....

.

Very over priced, and hyped because of location. Beyond unsatisfied with the taste and quality of the food. Service was great, and of course can't go wrong with a hurricane. But this is probably the most overrated food I've had in New Orleans. To say the least, I won't be back.

We had lunch here today and we're impressed by the high quality and range of classic cajun and creole dishes. My blackened red snapper came with a crawfish etoufee on the side to use as a dressing, as well as a side of cooked greens and a side of a delicious jambalaya. My husband loved the special, the soft shell crab sandwich. We  really recommend the cajun fries, which come smothered in cheese, mushroom sauce, and crawfish. Like a southern poutine. Service here was outstanding!
So happy this place is open late! Looked for a place to eat on Bourbon that wasn't pizza or fried chicken and found this place. The gumbo was awesome and the fried alligator was so good!

Good food big portions at a reasonable price. The woodgrilled oysters and crabcakes are the best. Very rich but also very good. This restaurant is always a thursday night tradition first dinner in New Orleans for us . Casual and good

Food nearly made me cry from the force of deliciousness it exerted on my mouth. Jamal was the most amazing and attentive waiter I have ever had the privilege of being assisted by. Definitely will return.  If you have half a brain, you'll come here!!!
We went during lunch time with no wait. Our waitress was very friendly. I had the rockfish and it was delicious; and the portions are big!!! Definitely would come back the next time we're in town.

Good food, a little bit pricey for what it is. The service was great and the food came out quickly. I would not go back because there are many restaurants to try in the immediate vicinity however I would say I had an over positive experience during my meal.

Great food. The price was much better than expected. We are beer lovers and they even had a decent beer selection. They even have done good mood lighting. Our waitress, Natalie, was very customer focused. We appreciated that.

We came here on the recommendation of our walking tour guide.  I'm glad we did!  The place was charming and historical feeling, and the food was amazing!  BBQ shrimp appetizer was a great suggestion by the waiter.  For dinner, I got the special: crab stuffed ahi with crawfish sauce: I would drink that sauce, bathe in it, forsake all other sauces for the rest of my life just to be with it.... yeah, it was good sauce.  I think everyone else loved their meals too, but I really wasn't paying attention to what they were eating, since I was too busy trying to lick my plate without being too obvious.

The bread pudding was a masterpiece, the best we got in NOLA!  However, I turned my attention to the chocolate Kahlua mousse pie!

I was in a party of 6 that had breakfast.  My Eggs Benedict were the best I've ever had.  Delicious Bailey's and coffee.  Everyone else raved about their food also.  The portions were generous and service was friendly, though a little slow.

A tad on the pricey side for breakfast, but that's expected in the quarter.
Fabulous!  Ask for Jimika, she will treat you right and has great suggestions.  Mardi Gras pasta and taste of New Orleans...both outstanding!!

After the Concierge @ our hotel gave us a recommendation for this establishment, (as well as a 10% off coupon) we were drawn to eat here. We were sat right away in the upstairs portion of the establishment. Upstairs had maybe one too many TV sets playing random programs. USA network, and 2 ESPN might be a little much. Also, was a little too quiet up there. Seemed like sitting downstairs would provide a better experience for this joint. 

Our waiter was very friendly, but seemed maybe to have been a little crusty from years of sevice, (though he didnt seem more than 30 or so years old..). Also enjoyed the random door painted to advertise their 'Katrina' inspired Hurricane drink..seemed a bit off color though..geez

I ordered the taste of New Orleans, and my friend had the Crab cake fettucini. The obvious jokes of tasting the actual city of New orleans came up between us and the server..good times were had. I must say the red beans and rice were to die for.... maybe NOT as good as the Crab cakes though... wow. 99.9993% sure that was the best crab cake I have ever had. Pricing wasn't too bad either, pretty average I would say for that type of establishment. 

Overall, I would recommend this place to a friend. Get the MF-ing crab cakes.....

We came to Oceana the last time that we were in Nola and it was very good. A little pricier than some of the other spots but food was worth our time. Today, we only needed a little snack but didn't want any of the fried specialties of the area, so we went with a cup of seafood gumbo. Best choice of the day. We came in a shallow bowl/plate and served with 2 little slices of buttered bread and a pile of rice in the center.  There were big Gulf shrimp and crab throughout. All that was missing was the okra. Thoroughly enjoyed this quick bite and our server. Shaun, super nice. Will be back to Oceana for a regular meal before we go home.

This menu is almost identical to the Nawlings Cookery. It might be completely identical but I think they had extra drink options here. The food was sooo good, I had the vegetarian pasta with maranara and the others enjoyed their meat and seafood entries. The food here is spicier than at NOLA cookery but both still equally delicious. The only reason I gave 4 stars is because the website menu for Oceana had many more options and much cheaper prices than the many we saw when we got here. They should update heir prices online and their options. This was a main factor when we chose the place and there was a little disappointment when we realized things were different.  Expect a large party crowd outside, however we were seated right away and inside was peaceful and classy. The others mentioned that even tho the blackened gator tails were good, they were better at the NOLA cookery. I would recommend this place to others, but I prefer the NOLA cookery.

The food and service are decent. However they increased the prices just last few days.  Last week the crab cake appetizer was 14 and today (12/29) it is 16.5.  Main dishes are $3 more.  Waitress says she doesn't know anything about the price increase but they have a new condensed menu for New Years week.

Let me start by saying I have read all reviews on Yelp before we made plans to have our Valentine dinner here. I was not disappointed. Short line outside maybe a 10 minute wait, 15 at the most. Our servers name was Sara, sweetie. The crab cakes were awesome, shrimp platters were loved by my entire group, Alligator bites awesome and the first time I have tasted I might add, and the tropical storm mixed drink is a must try. Wonderful dining experience that I will definitely try again. Chef Ramsey eat your heart out.

This has been the best experience of food, culture and service since I arrived in New Orleans. This place is known for the lunch/dinner but baby this breakfast was amazing! This gator sausage was excellent especially in my omelette. But I must say that the food was great but my service was off the charts!!!! If you visit Oceana make sure you ask for Bree......she is one of kind. Made this experience ten times more amazing! Yes I said more amazing  Enjoy Foodies

Really good food, very accommodating staff with my ever-changing reservation number and on-time seating for my 8pm reservation, and OUTSTANDING service for my group of 20.  I would give 6 stars, if I could for the noteworthy service we received from Jamie and Felecita, under the direction of manager, Faron.  
Good wholesome southern cuisine, a fun ambiance and fast service all made the experience well worth the time and effort for me to bring a big group on a busy Friday night.  They know what they are doing - the staff is duly trained to handle large groups, and they do it with skill and efficiency.

I came to this restaurant as part of a group of 120 professionals attending a nonprofit leadership conference. The food and service was mediocre. The ownership was appalling. I recommend STAYING AWAY from this restaurant. 

After finishing dinner, our trip organizer tried to negotiate a discrepancy in the bill. I then watched in absolute shock as the owner threw a temper-tantrum and threatened our group -imagine 120 young professionals dressed in suits and visiting New Orleans for the first time -with ARREST. When he called the cops and instructed the police to arrest our trip organizer I couldn't tell if this was reality or a nightmare. 

Stay as far away from this restaurant as humanly possible, unless you want to risk ending up in jail for negotiating your bill.

We have placed an order for delivery at 8pm couple days ago and, we waited,,,,, waited,,,, waited until 9:15pm. We called them to ask what was going on "someone is on the way by bike, will be there in 15mins." NoThing never showed up!!!! 
Never have chances to try the food and never will

Feels like an ole school tradition.
Great gumbo and the Bloody Mary has all the fixings including a string bean and lots of special love. A good start to our bar crawl!

The best part of this restaurant was our waiter Ashleigh !!!

The food was one step above fast food 

I had the crab cakes that were dry with no taste. 

Some people in our group enjoyed their food but I really didn't and don't like eating in a cattle car atmosphere

The drinks were good, and potent.
We sat at the bar and were taken care of by Juan. We had received recommendations on what to order from a few locals we had met during our stay, and Oceana did not disappoint! We had the crab cakes and the chargrilled oysters. The crab cakes should not be passed up, they are out of this world!
Juan was awesome! He was very friendly. It was slow in business, so he stayed and chatted with us for majority of our visit. He was a big part of our enjoyment of our dinner.
Every employee we spoke to was outgoing and cheerful. It was a great time!

Everything about this place was simply OK, making it a 3 star rating for my taste. 

My husband and I were visiting New Orleans for the first time and relied on Yelp to provide us food rec's. Oceana was listed as the #1 spot to check out. We should've listened to our Uber driver on the way there (the locals always know the best spots anyways), when he said it's not his favorite. Why did we think it was just OK?

=Food didn't taste spectacular, stuff that you could buy at any state fair
=The food is EXTREMELY overpriced for what you get, you are paying for the name of the restaurant, not the quality of food
=The place felt kinda dirty (don't get me started on the bathroom)
=Loud, really close to the bustle of bourbon st.

We had excellent service though. Our waitress was friendly, prompt and even provided a recommendation for a local beignet place. Overall, this place was disappointing for the hype it has. I would suggest going elsewhere for some authentic New Orleans meals.

The black and red fish was absolutely awesome and to die for! We started out with some oysters they weren't the small ones, they were the very large big juicy ones!  The mocha cheesecake was simply splendid! Great Cajun food!
Food was great and Errol was the best server we've had in a long time. Highly recommend!

Just okay tried the taste of new orleans dish and its was just okay.. red beans and rice was probably the best thing on this sampler platter staff was friendly but this place is so far from a 4 or 5 star yelp review from me.. on to the next place of must try restuarants in new orleans this one didn't pass for me
Amazing food. Amazing service. Amazing vibe.  Thank you Whitney!  You were the best server ever!
Amazing food! Nathalie was a sweetheart and made the experience. Would come here again for the red fish special with jalepeño corn bread

My friends and I decided to stop here for lunch after reading and hearing rave reviews! I enjoyed the Blackend Chicken Po Boy sandwich & Gumbo. The bread was a bit hard but it didn't distract me from how good the sandwich and experience was. The alligator bites were EVERYTHING! Whitney (our server) provided us with some great suggestions and made our overall visit spectacular. I definitely will be back!
Had the Maw's Maw's Cajun Breakfast, amazing! Very filling and good base for a day of drinking!

Wow. I was hesitant about choosing a place so close to Bourbon Street, but my gamble paid off -- Oceana Grill was amazing. The wait (outside) wasn't too bad. As soon as we got inside, we were seated.

I ordered the chicken alfredo pasta. This is a dish that's easy to mess up. But Oceana did it justice. The lightly breaded chicken was juicy and flavorful. The linguine pasta absorbed the deliciously spicy alfredo sauce. The small slices of bread made for a wonderful accompaniment to the dish.

We managed to make room for two desserts: the bread pudding and the pecan pie. Both were amazing. Both were warm, sweet and full of flavor!

The service was great and the interior decor was authentic and very true to the French Quarter. Everyone in my party loved what they ordered, so we'll definitely be back.
Kevin C. Is the only reason for the 5 stars. Come here and look for him! Service was on point and super helpful with the menu!

We ordered a bunch of stuff, all were good. Some specialties I would recommend -
Gator bites, ribs
What i wont recommend is BBQ shrimp.
Crab cakes were good but i have had better.

This restaurant is by far the best one I have been to in the French Quarter. Located in the center of French quarter, this place is really easy to get to if you live in the area. It may take a while for you to be seated during dinner time because of its popularity. 

I highly recommend that you try its Cajun seafood pasta that will bring you instantaneous satisfaction from the combined flavors of creamy, spicy and freshness. The commingled flavors linger on your tongue, leaving you wanting for more.
