After trying at least more than 5 restaurants both in the French quarter and in its neighborhood, my boyfriend and I have decided that oysters at Oceana are the biggest, cleanest, and sweetest that we'd tried. I was amazed at the sheer size of each oyster we had on our plate that I couldn't finish the oyster within one bite. 

Most importantly guys: you will get 10% off your bill if you check in on yelp while dining there. Remember to do so!
The food here is delicious. I had the catfish po-boy and my hubby has the gator half blackened half grilled and yummm. I will come back again anytime.

Food here is amazing don't think there is anything that can be ordered that isn't good. The wait staff was amazing very personable. I was served by Emonie. She was great all her recommendation were amazing.

the staff is very kind in helping us surprise our friend for her birthday! The atmosphere screams new orleans culture in the best way( coming from a local )The only thing I have to complain is that their alfredo chicken fettuccini is just a tad bit too salty for my taste but it was still pretty good !! Their bread pudding is absolutely to die for, melts in my mouth and it goes so well with the whip cream that comes with it!!

A very delicious Shrimp Po Boy! There's a cute little courtyard area, that if you go, make sure you ask to sit there. It's a wonderful atmosphere, and just far enough away from all of the Bourbon St noise. The fries here are also delicious. There is a Champagne drink that I believe had an added blue raspberry liquor to it, very delicious!

In town for a conference, a group of my co-workers and I ate here after a friend recommended this place. They initially got our reservation wrong and we had to wait a few minutes but we talked to the manager and he apologized and even joked about setting the hostess straight who messed up our reservation. 

I ordered the special, which was blackened catfish with jambalaya and crawfish. It was pretty good, I enjoyed the jambalaya more than the catfish. My coworkers order the crawfish etouffe, the jambalaya pasta, and more. Over all, we were all pleased with everything. The crawfish ettouffee was surpisngly pretty good and loaded with flavor.

The pirces are pretty good here and the food portions are considerably good.

Not sure how this place has such a high rating.  We went tonight looking for a true NOLA experience and left full, yet not satisfied.  I chose the New Orleans sampler, 2 items were lukewarm at best and the third was cold.  The flavor was okay, but the place was clearly just for tourists.  Disappointed

Their food is average at best. Not terrible, but nothing that will make you remember them. Worst of all, they fall into that awful category of New Orleans restaurants that wants to tell the customers how to pay for their food. Try to order their take-out, better have cash. I used to work down the street from their restaurant, and tried to give them my business several times, only to be told that take-out is cash only. While their food is tasty enough to satisfy, it is not worth spending an additional $5.00 to pull cash out.

I went here my second night in NewOrleans. It's just off Boutbon street , you can see the street from the restaurant. This restaurant is simply WOW!  The outside may not be very attractive but it's very pleasant inside. The food was excellent , really good pasta. We had a server named Bobby , I don't recall ever having such an attentive waiter. He made sure we had a great experience , his manager should be grateful  , and compliments to the chef. I will come back next time I am here

Having visited New Orleans many times now, I have learned that Bourbon Street is generally not the best place to look for food. So we headed down Conti Street to see where luck would take us. A few paces later, we stumbled up Oceana. After perusing the menu posted outside, my friends and I decided to give it a shot. It was a Saturday night and there was no wait, so that was good. Although the place was pretty full. We sat near the side where they have the typical window/doors that open to the street. It was pretty loud, but that's what you come to expect in that area. The place is clean and the atmosphere is nice. 

Anyway, I ordered the Crawfish Étouffée and it was fabulous! OMG...everything about this dish was perfect. Even the rice was just right. I ate the entire thing, and it was a pretty big plate. I probably would have eaten a second bowl, or at least attempted it. Afterwards, I threw down some bread pudding that did not disappoint my taste buds. My friends all loved their entrees and they felt their portions were big.

The service was great and our waiter, Roderick, was genuinely friendly and helpful. The prices were average French Quarter prices, if you ask me. All in all, this is a good touristy place if you are in that area and want some good food. I am glad we found this place.

Went to Oceana Grill with my friends for a weekend trip. Was seated promptly, got helpful service, and great recommendations from our server, Whitney. I ordered their famous oysters and it was delicious!!!

We stopped by for a late lunch on a Sunday afternoon. We had the gumbo as an appetizer and after having Luke's gumbo the previous night, this gumbo left more to be desired. We had the famous crab cake and the seafood platter for our main course.  If you are from the Maryland area and you like the Maryland style crab cake you will be disappointed in the crab cake. Nonetheless for every one else it is probably pretty good. The fried oysters and shrimps were the best.

a fun atmosphere- very tourist oriented, but that's not a bad thing. a full menu with classic new orleans hits on it, and a very friendly staff. our waitress taylor was awesome- great energy, attentive, gave us some bourbon street tips, and offered to split the check.

Stopped in for lunch.  Blackened Alligator tail was fantastic, followed by blackened Ahi Tuna stuffed with a crab cake and Shrimp Remoulade!  Wow what a dish!  Ezra our server was fantastic.  Definitely worth stopping in!

We stayed at a hotel in the French Quarter and kept asking everyone for suggestions on where to go.

Over and over, the locals kept telling us to go to this place. Our valet guy showed us his Instagram account and it showed his various lunch dishes at Oceana Grill. We were sold!!!!

I was shocked to see that I walked by this restaurant multiple times and I never realized that it was right off Bourbon St.  As we were walking up to the door, we noticed that there was a long line, but were quickly advised that the wait was only 20 Mins. We went ahead and stood in line and were seated in the time frame promised. BTW, be prepared to stand outside while you're waiting(rain or shine!).

We were seated right past the bar in Errol's area and I'm glad we were seated there. Still was very attentive and was great at making recommendations. We started off with their famous oysters and they were a total hit. They had a separate bar that prepped all of their oysters.  It was fun watching all the oyster dishes being prepped.

Oh, how can I forget the drinks?!??? My hubby ordered the Hurricane and wow, that sucker was strong!!!!!! Like SUPER strong. My brother orders the Bloody Mary and I have to say that it's the best Bloody Mary that I've tasted. Of course it's topped off with a pickled green bean. AMAZING!!!

Now onto our main entrees. I ordered the catfish poboy. Oooiii, the remoulade makes the dish! It was amazing. My hubby ordered the fried shrimp and he said that they were fresh and just amazing.  My brother ordered the Taste of New Orleans and the best thing in that dish was the beans and rice. I could just eat and that all by itself!!! I remember that as being the best dish ever!!!

The atmosphere of the place was typical New Orleans. This means that it's quirky and fun. 

I highly recommend this place and ask to be seated at Errol's section!

We ate lunch at the Oceana Grill today. The gumbo was ok, on the bland side, not much spice or flavor and it was just warm. The crab cakes weren't bad but were barely warm as well. The oysters were big and tasted pretty good but not as tasty as the ones I get in Florida. The service was good though.
Good food but service can be somewhat spotty. Recommend the gator and have it every time I find myself in the Crescent City! Avoid peak rush times and service improves drastically
The Oceana is fantastic. Errol is the best in the world. Food is super and Errol is so knowledgeable and friendly. He might even sing some Barry White for you.
Food was great! Service was great! Unfortunately I found a hair inside the crab cake which I brought home. Spoiled everything :(

Friendly staff and you feel welcome right away. 
Had the blackened duck and creme brulee for dessert. 
Both were incredible and I can't wait to come back.

Yet another fine dining experience. Make sure you try the Bloody Marys. Our waiter Jamal was polite attentive and just an all-around great guy. I highly recommend this place for breakfast lunch and or dinner next time you're in the French Quarter of New Orleans.
Ask for Whitney! We are from Chicago with not much knowledge about seafood/creole food and she gave the best recommendations. Food and service was PRIME!!!

If I had to choose Oceana over Acme, I'd probably choose Acme; however, Oceana is a great place, with a great environment, with fantastic eats. Their take on chargrilled oysters is just as good. They feature a creamy remoulade type of sauce over each of the oysters. It really is something worth trying. I hope to visit again during my trip here in New Orleans. In fact, I'm sure I will.
The crab cakes are amazing. The red beans and rice, amazing! And you'll definitely need to have a cream brûlée! Yummy!!

We were a group of 8 that visited and all of us had a semi decent experience. Starting with the positives- the location is ideal and the wait time was really quick compared to some of the other options around. Also service was quite friendly. However for me atleast the food was passable. I had the Cajun pasta and it was pretty bland... Others had the fried shrimp and the po boys and seemed to find their food decent but nothing too great. The fries were really good though! Also checking in on yelp gets you 10% off :)

2 words "Alligator Bites."  We got the half fried, half blackened appetizer and they were amazing. "It tastes like chicken" were the first words out of my mouth, but they are so much better than chicken. A bit more chewy but I think that just releases more flavor. 
I also got the Taste of New Orleans that consisted of jambalaya, sausage, beans, and rice.  The beans had the deepest flavor of mesquite and I want to know how they cooked them so I can eat them forever.  It's also a very intimate setting in the French Quarter and a perfect place to start off the night.

Two words: A-Mazing!

I don't even know why people have this 4 stars...the food is DELICIOUS. Ask Fee (short for Felicita) for her recommendations and then GET that! We did & it was scrumptious.

We usually analyze the menu for 10 minutes to make the perfect choices. Just trust Fee!

I don't even care to read the other reviews & btw- I NEVER leave reviews!

Excellent environment, food, drinks and service! Ask for Errol because he takes the time to walk you through the entire menu while making recommendations the entire time. 

Thank you Errol for making our visit as great as the food!

First off. If you came within 5 miles of the bourbon street area and didn't eat here, you're nuts! The ratings truly lived up to the hype. Like. Hands down one of the best meals I've had in NO. We had the jambalaya pasta, seafood platter and the crab cakes appetizer. Come. Hungry. Huge portions that are full of flavor. I was pleasantly surprised at the crab cake.... I tend to favor the Baltimore crab cakes more because they are like 99% crab. These are maybe 75-80% but the flavor was amazing. I actually appreciated the breading and sauce it was paired with. The platter was an ignorant amount of food for one person lol. Hubby said it was really good. I tasted the catfish and it was so well seasoned and well battered. The pasta was so good. Who knew alligator sausage was a thing?! Definitely go for it!

This place was quite neat with seating upstairs on a few different levels. I loved the ambience and our waiter was very attentive and knowledgeable. There was a short line but worth the wait. Food was amazing.

I know all of my ratings for restaurants are high, but it's because I read the reviews and do my research beforehand. After landing in New Orleans for the first time we were looking for the perfect welcoming meal and found it at Oceana Grill right off bourbon St. Very kind staff and am super glad I found it :) *MUST TRY THE GATOR TAIL APPETIZER* pictured: Taste of Louisiana

Big place. Has an apple b's franchise vibe. Shrimp po boy was good but not mind blowing. Maybe I'm just not a sandwich guy. I haven't had many shrimp po boys in my life so take that as you will. Oh! The crawfish that you can add was delicious tho. Great sauce and seasoning. Service was good and everything, just can't give a strong recommendation.

This was our first stop in NO, and as silly as it sounds, we don't eat seafood. They had several non-seafood options, but we decided on the blackened chicken po'boy. What a treat! The fries were crispy and seasoned well, and the chicken was off the chain. Great service, too! My only reason for 4 stars is the bread on the sandwich tasted like it had been sitting out for awhile, and I wanted more sauce. Otherwise, total hit. Would definitely go back!

I'm going to be blunt- the people giving this place good reviews are tourists who don't know there are better options a 5-10 minute walk away.

This is a place that survives because it has great atmosphere in the most tourist-dense part of the city (~10 steps off Bourbon St), and its kitchen is open a lot later than most places.  The atmosphere is really great and the bar has a good selection.  The waitstaff is friendly too.

So why am I only rating 2 Stars out of 5?  Because they skimp on the food.  Tonight I had a fried catfish Po Boy.  Let me tell you, they know what they're doing.  Great slaw, well-seasoned catfish, nice bread... except that there were FOUR catfish nuggets on a piece of bread that should have held 10-12 (it was 9" long; I was dumbfounded enough to measure).  Why so little catfish?  Because that's the expensive item on the plate.  The catfish nuggets were placed about 1.5" apart to spread them evenly across the bread.  You have to be kidding me!  I crowded all the catfish into the first half of the sandwich and ate that, leaving the rest.

As I was waiting for the bartender to run my card I heard a middle age couple say to each other on their way out how glad they were to find this place with authentic New Orleans seafood.  As I said, they're surviving on tourists who don't know they're skimping.  The food itself *is* delicious, you just get ridiculously small amounts of actual food in a plate filled with filler.

Go to just about any place along Decatur St or around Jackson Square instead.

What I really like about Oceana was the friendliness of the staff. Overall the food is generally pretty good. The alligator sausage appetizer is one of my personal favorites and I always have some here when I'm in New Orleans. I have a 2 year old daughter and I think Oceana is a great place to bring kids.

I'm in NOLA for a wedding.  We stopped by Oceana for lunch.  The food was AMAZING.  I had the crab cakes, and they were divine.  Whatever sauce they put on top was on-point.  I also had bites of the blackened alligator bites, gumbo,blackened duck,  and alligator sausage. I did not have one bad bite of food. Five stars, I'll definitely be back here if I'm back in New Orleans! Shoutout to our server, Errol for friendly service and great food recommendations!

Just got done with my food... wanted some fried catfish. So, I ordered the seafood platter (fried: catfish, oysters, shrimp and hush puppies) we also ordered the broccoli and jalapeño  Mac n Cheese.  First, picked up the fried oysters... GROSS!  It was definitely not fresh and it tasted so rotten I had to spit it out.  It sort of set the tone for the rest of the meal... the shrimp was hard as a rock, almost if they had battered some shrimp cocktails and fried it up. So hard and rubbery.  Then there was the catfish... soft on some parts but definitely could tell it was frozen, not fresh. Basically, the best thing about tonight was the Mac n cheese I actually didn't even want but had to eat cause I was starving.  Why this place has 4 stars is baffling! Sorry, spend more money and go to Mr. B's for some fried oysters or any seafood in general. Hate to give a bad review but it was not good.  

5 stars though for our server! Natalie was great! Convinced me to order a hurricane... not bad :)

I just had such a great experience and it's my first time in NOLA! Whitney was a FANTASTIC server and made our experience such a hoot! Would recommend the crawfish stuffing with the crab sandwich! It's to die for! I'd also pair it with one of their amazing bloody marys... theres nothing else like it!

Perfect location to eat at before fun on Bourbon Street or walking in the French Quarter. It is definitely busy but it is more of a touristy place. The service was good and our food came out quick. We loved the crawfish fries and the alligator was good. The gumbo was just ok. If you are looking for a quick cajun meal near bourbon stop in and grab a bite.
If the question is "should I go here?" then the answer is "yes". Crab cakes +, catfish +, and for the non seafood people red beans and rice +

Great place just off Bourbon St.  Sit down and enjoy a dinner resting in comfort at a place with many tables. 
     Ordered the Taste of New Orleans. It was wonderful. I've never had Cajun down here, but all in the party was happy with their order. 
     First time eating crawfish étouffée and absolutely loved it!  The entire dish was superb, but the étouffée was new and amazing.   
     The wait staff was good and kept the table happy. I'd be willing to return next visit.

Very welcoming, attentive, knowledgeable, friendly staff! EXCELLENT FOOD WITH AMAZING FLAVORS!!! BBQ shrimp and fettuccine already are both to die for! We will be returning to this establishment EVERYTIME we are in town!

The Valet at our resort recommended this restaurant for us, and we were very skeptical going since it was right off Bourbon Street. It was absolutely wonderful! We had the Oyster Rockefeller and they were the BEST I have ever had. I also tried the Catfish Lefouche and it was incredible. I loved the sauce with mushrooms in it, and the collard greens were spot on. I would recommend this to everyone visiting.
Good food and service. The food and drinks are a little pricey, but over all a nice experience. I will definitely be coming back for more visits and recommend to others.

Charbroiled oysters for the win. Our server Michael B was more than gracious and accommodating. My husband and I were hungry after a comedy show and acme had closed. I'd been craving oysters all day and was hoping to get some before the show but we ran out of time. After seeing some Yelp reviews my husband decided on this place. I guess 11:00 pm on a Wednesday isn't the most popular time to dine which was fine by us...seating took no time at all. The seafood gumbo was alright but again- charbroiled oysters were the highlight of that meal. Will be back!

Fun place to check out! Staff was knowledgeable on menu and service was great! For my first time in the Big Easy I felt like a local and very welcomed by all the staff not just the hostess or server. Great food with a lot of options to please all.

Just average. I was really looking forward to eating here because they always have folks waiting to get in. The charbroiled oysters were great. The jazzy crab cakes were inedible. The crab meat tasted like it was either canned or was claw meat with lots of filler.

It was alright. The gumbo was super bland and really runny as if I had the bottom of the pot and water was added the Roux was almost non existent. Very light on the seafood. Shrimp only. And a wimpy crab leg. The Ettoufe was extremely good. Sara our server was alright. She was attentive and excited to talk to all her tables except us. But we didn't look like we had alot of money. Like the other tables. Ha!! The drive from Houston was long I will eat elsewhere next time.

Yes, Yes and definitely YES . I had the seafood gumbo and believed you me, I would  have ate the bowl also . It was so delicious and fresh . My meal was complimented by a crawfish omelet with hash brown and a house special sauce . All delicious and well made . 

I received a 10% discount with a NOLA brochure that I got from the airport and it was honored without an issue .

First time here in New Orleans. Found on yelp and let me tell you food is amazing. We had two toddlers with us and the chef went out of his way to accommodate them with grilled cheese (not on menu). Shrimp platter amazing, gator bites were delicious. Bana foster drink to die for. Yum yum yum! Definitely a place we will return to.

Catfish Mambo is amazing - crawfish cornbread covered in crawfish étouffée and topped with fried catfish strips.  Seasoned to perfection - $25 and big enough to split.  Service was awesome! We will be back here!

This place was delicious, the tuna steak was cooked to perfection and the crab meat burger was delicious, parking can be a hassle if you have a car but there is a valet parking for the sonesta Hotel right across the street, if you are in New Orleans definitely give them a try

We got the fried fish platter and we had to send it back because the fish was slimy and uncooked on the inside, they altered this with hesitation. We felt a little odd after having brought it up they weren't happy to accommodate us. Then when I started to point this out they offered my sister and I a desert which we declined. We will never go back to this place.
It's good place to hang out. The staffs are all friendly and helpful. My favorite dish is seafood platter.
Best crab cakes I have ever had! Definitely worth trying the gator bites too! The place is vibrant, right next to bourbon street and has the New Orleans buzz! Totally worth the visit.
Again can't say enough about this place! Food and service. We were a little late for breakfast but our server Pamela made sure we were taken care of. Thank you Pamela!

Oceana has great food, fast service and excellent wait staff.  Here in Nola for a few days and ate at Oceana each day.  Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner.  

Shout out to Whitney who made good recommendations on the menu.

I just learned that Oceana Grill is suing Gordon Ramsey and even more interesting is that he apparently already came in to fix the place up.  Surprising, since my first and last experience last Mardi Gras was bad.  I don't normally have bad restaurant experiences in NOLA but this was one of the exceptions.

My friend took me there for my birthday/mardi gras lunch and I ordered a dozen oysters, he ordered a po boy.  Within at least 20 mins, his sandwich was served and I waited and waited for my dozen.  We inquired about the whereabouts of the oysters and got a chilly response from the bartender.  I said I had worked in the restaurant business for 10 years and this was kind of unacceptable.  She then asked me to name the places that I worked.  I told her there were several places in Atlanta and she smirked and said well, that's not here.  Wow... nice attitude.  Finally after my friend had finished his sandwich, my oysters arrived.  They were decent but the nasty exchange and now having to eat by myself, certainly left a bad taste.  There was no apology and definitely no comping of anything.  As we left and were walking out, a whole tray of food was spilled in the entrance way.  

I don't know but won't be going back again.  Good food is the priority but crappy service will change your view.

This was definitely our favorite meal in New Orleans. We made a reservation for a Saturday early dinner, but showed up about 30 mins early and were seated right away. The restaurant has a sort of pub atmosphere but a creative and extensive menu. It's right in the middle of French Quarter.

We ordered the crab cakes for an appetizer and wow! I'm from Rhode Island and have had crab cakes in Baltimore, but this was the best crab cake I've ever had. There was plenty of crab meat, and the sauce on top was full of flavor and complemented it perfectly. 

For my entree, I ordered the Cajun jambalaya pasta and it was also delicious! There was plenty of shrimp and gator, the pasta was cooked perfectly, and the flavor of the sauce was very unique. 5/5 would recommend. 

Finally, for dessert we ordered the bread pudding with a side of vanilla ice cream. I wish it had fewer raisins but it was still very warm and moist. 3 days later and I still think about this bread pudding! 

Our server (Brad?) was excellent and made great recommendations. The prices of everything was very fair for the quality and portion size you get. Overall, we had a great experience and will likely return.
Awesome food,  awesome service. A must visit if in NOLA! We ate the foid so fast we laughed at ourselves. It was hot& delicious. Those brorhers cooking in the back..giving them a YASSSSS HUNTY!

Great place, food was really good, service was excellent, prepare to spend at least $70+ tip for 2 but it was worth it, at least for us, I ordered the crawfish etouffee, flavor was good, not too spicy, 
A friend told me they had good French fries, so I ordered a side... And honestly those are good fries lol try them and you will see.. 
It was kind odd eating  etouffee and French fries but I had to try them and it was worth it...lol. 
Good luck

I decided to order late night delivery from oceana because it was very close to my hotel and was recommended to me. When I called to place my order the lady was extremely irritated and rude to me on the phone acting like I was an annoyance to her putting in a delivery order. She seemed so annoyed with me that I almost hung up and canceled my order because she made me feel so uncomfortable. Then after placing my order she told me it would take about 45 min....not even 5 min later my food was at my hotel. Some people might like that there food was made and delivered so promptly... But there's no way the shrimp creole that I ordered would of been made properly and delivered to me in 5 min, I obviously got late night left overs.... When I opened my meal.. It was a sloppy mess and the sauce was coming out of the sides of the container... It literally looked like someone just scooped some rice and shrimp creole from an old pan and just threw it in a container. I also ordered a side Caesar salad. The lettuce was completely limp. And they gave me a peice of bread to eat with the shrimp creole and it was literally stale and breaking apart I couldn't even kind of consume it. I was pretty disappointed considering this restaurant was reccomenes to me.. But overall my experience and the taste/ presentation and overall flavor was absolutely horrible.
Delicious food and fast service! The mussels were delicious as well as the duck and seafood pasta. We waited in line for about 25 minutes and it was totally worth it.

Our Uber driver suggested this place to me rather than a famous ACME oyster place . I absolutely love this place even their raw oysters were not the freshest oysters as what I had at Peche. Every y dish we order were outstanding except a banana foster ice cream cake. The cake tasted like from Costco frozen dessert. The server, Mary, was very nice and gave us a great service.
Excellent service. But the dishes-crab cakes, blackened gator, fried eggplant- are just too salty....

We were looking for a cute and good brunch spot, and this was just it! They have an outdoor courtyard option, the service was amazing, and the staff was super nice! We had the Crab Cake Benedict and St. James crepe. Highly recommend both! The Bloody Mary was okay, food was on point!

This place gets it. Great service (they point out where the bathroom are before you sit down, give you a plate for your silverware after you eat a salad...). And the food was terrific. The fried shrimp platter had 13 or 14 giant shrimp that were so sweet and succulent. The jambalaya fettuccine was also a hit. The chocolate Kailua mousse looked like cheesecake but was light and smooth and scrumptious. Well done Oceana!
I love this place! As busy as it is the service was on point! Hostess was sweet and chatty my server Makay was so attentive. Food was great. My experience was great. Thank you!

This was my favorite restaurant in New Orleans, and we visited twice. In two visits, I ate the crab cakes, gumbo, etouffee, and red beans and rice, and drank the swamp tea and some incredible hulk frozen drink. The service was nice, we got a table for 8 without waiting for dinner, and the food was good. If I get back to NOLA, this will be a stop for sure.

I'm from New York. I must admit that I wanted to eat everything that New Orleans is known for. After asking around I was directed to Oceana Grill t o have alligator bites.The is definitely the best place in the French Quarters to have alligator bites. I can't vouch for anything else

This was my second time dining here after a few years and it's still amazing! We went on a busy night when the wait was long, but we ended up sitting at the bar and the service was great. Their fish and jambalaya is soooo good! I'll definitely be back. Oh yea, their cocktails are nice and strong!

This place is right by Bourbon St, but feels like a nice  break from the craziness. The chargrilled oysters app is incredible. The service was great, really fast. And pretty reasonably priced for the area.
The line moves very fast, this place has 4 stories so lots of seats. Food was delicious. Great service, very friendly and pleasant.
Cool and relaxing environment with a New Orleans heritage feel. Food was flavorful/excellent and our server, Danny was down to earth. I would definitely recommend this spot.

Breakfast was great. Everyone was happy with their selections.  The alligator sausage was done extremely well. Didn't give them 5 stars because my Crawfish omelet was too eggy.  Didn't have enough crawfish but otherwise everything else was good.

 Our waitress Christin was excellent.  She had a great personality.

The food and service were great. The only downfall is my body can't handle the grease of deep-fried anything anymore. The atmosphere is funky and fun, and we enjoyed it even knowing we would pay a price the following day.

This was the first place I tried chargrilled oysters. Omg this was by far the best. Also had the seafood platter and the raw oysters which were amazing as well. Atmosphere was amazing with great company.

Food was amazing and so was Mary!! Amazing service!! Great food right off of but it's street. Would definitely recommend.  Got the Mardi Gras Alfredo pasta and it was so creamy with the right amount of spice. Would def come here again!! thank you so much

What is going on here.  We were so disappointed in the food.  Busy restaurant good service but sad food. Worst redfish with ettouffee ever not fresh and overcooked then not more than barely warm. Broiled oyster didn't resemble the intended product. It's late October and they served tiny dried up oysters with a cream sauce over them to hide the sin. The beard pudding was pathetic. I'm not the only one saying this.  Wasn't this restaurant on one of those restaurant rescue programs. Choose this place at your own risk.

Let's just put it this way- we went here twice in 2 days despite the 1,000s of restaurant options in NOLA. Their infused bloody Mary's are to die for, and their "taste of New Orleans" entree is big enough to share and gives you that great Cajun flavor. We had a better experience sitting at the first floor bar than we did sitting at regular dining tables on the third floor (took forever for drinks b/c they came from a bar on a different floor). Overall very happy with the food. Po boy wasn't the best we've had, but the oysters were fresh and HUGE and the service was great. Absolutely a must for lunch or dinner while you're in the French quarter.
Best spot for blackened gator bites and crab cakes. Don't listen to Pete Taggares when he says not to go here because of zaggets rating

It was a weird system of letting us into the building. My wife's food was cold on arrival. She ordered the shrimp poboy. I ordered the blackened catfish which was amazing. And then we had a bread pudding which was awesome too.

So this was really one of my first NOLA dining experiences - it was right in-line with what I was expecting (for the better or worse).  Oceana certainly caters to the Bourbon St. tourist crowd with its cheesy decor, matching waiter attire / scripted welcoming, etc.  Aside from the food, there doesn't seem to be much that's genuine about this place...

But... there's the food.  I ordered the New Orleans sample plate thing... yes, VERY touristy of me, I know.  However, it might have required a scanning electron microscope to detect any food particles left on my plate.  Maybe I was starving?  Maybe I psychologically wanted the food to be so damn good that I would hoover my dish?  Maybe it was just a really, really tasty stuff!

I'd really like to go back to Oceana, but the area is so congested with obnoxious people and hyper-touristy venues, that I just don't feel like dealing with it.  Plus, I have a feeling I may not have had the best-in-class of what I ordered... it's like driving a Porsche for the first time, except that it's a Boxster, not a 911 GT2.

Hands down the best restaurant in New Orleans. Whether for breakfast, lunch, or dinner, come to Oceana to satisfy your hunger. Great environment with a New Orleans feel! Lastly, it's tough to decide which is better, the food or the service!

Like many lost tourist souls, I waited about 45 minutes in line for this place...you know, thinking it MUST BE good if there's a long wait.

FAIL. I ordered shrimp creole, which was only mediocre. It lacked a lot of flavor. However, the icing on the cake is when I ordered the bread pudding, which came free OUT OF THE MICROWAVE. 

Yuck. Save yourself the wait. Find something better. Even if it means spending a little more. This place is not worth it.

Sat us right away for lunch and staff all very courteous and friendly.  Food just what expected. Po Boy was excellent with the dressings especially pickles but a little lacking in the meat.  Gumbo and house crab cakes were ok. Fries very good.Overall good dining experience.
Lloyd was a great server. Food was great! He was very welcoming toward us on our stay in New Orleans

We always have breakfast here when in nola. Theres always a line down the block for lunch and dinner so they must be doing that right too! I had biscuits and gravy three days in a row and it was to die for. There's a flavor in the gravy that I cant put my finger on but it is amazing. Biscuits are so buttery and fluffy.Hubby loves there cajun hash and shrimp and grits. Hostess and waitress(Whitney) were very welcoming and attentive. Lastly the chocolate mousse cake was out of this world. Yes we got dessert for breakfast! Dont judge! See ya next time oceana grill!

Ah-mazing! Came here very late night (or we could say very early morning) after a concert and, I won't lie, I had very low expectations. I thought it was going to be a tourist trap. Wow, was I surprised. The food was incredible! I'd give Oceana Grill five stars if the service wasn't so slow. 

I had the crawfish etouffee. Holy moly! I'm now a diehard etouffee lover! It was so flavorful and hearty. I'm so glad I split it with my girlfriend or else I would have had to be rolled out of there. My husband, who is not a fish lover, thought it was so delicious too. He said he would order it next time. 

The hubs got the blackened chicken poboy. Again, another winner! The chicken was soft, packed with spice and one of the best sandwiches he'd ever have. Since then, he has challenged me to learn how to make their poboys so I can make them at home. Ha! 

Yes, the service was slow but I must say how incredibly generous they were to let us in right before closing. On the contrary to that, we picked Oceana Grill thinking if they were closing that they'd be faster. Sadly, we were very wrong. Oh well... it was totally worth it. 

I must point out our waiter. He was courteous and entertaining. He was apologetic for the kitchen's lag time and accidentally sending out the wrong dish for my friend. We know it wasn't his fault yet he took ownership showing great professionalism and customer service. 

We will definitely be back. And, hopefully next time, I can leave five stars!
Awesome Po-boy tonight with shrimp and fries - best fries EVER outside of duck grease fries... Alligator bites to go with fries for the kids - excellent
This is a good restaurant.  However, the food is only slightly above average.  I went there with a friend, DB, and she also thought the place was good, but not great.

Absolutely a great place to eat. Especially since it's open so late it's convenient for the night walkers around the area. Let's get to the point now I had the Jazzy Crab cakes which were amazing and also the Gumbo which in my opinion could be a solo entree for its plentiful shrimp and crab. Also the blackened red fish was cooked to perfection and I don't just say that about any fish meal. Staff was quick and food was brought out in under 10 minutes. I would recommend This to anyone looking for a great taste of NOLA's finest food or the late night party goers.



Side Note- if your getting the jazzy crab cake platter just know the only difference between that and the appetizer is some veggies and mashed potatoes. $6 difference. Happy dining!

Gator Bites!  I have to admit I was skeptical but they were pretty good. The food here is solid for the French Quarter and they make one of the best Sazeracs in the area.  Plenty of options on the menu too

Another long wait for a table and it's like double dutch trying to get a seat at the bar. The spot was extremely busy I wouldn't go when you're starving... HOWEVER,  the food was AMAZING. The drinks were awesome and strong! Our server was great as well at the bar. Add this to your place to visit if you're in NOLA!
Omg!!! The food was amazing!!! The world famous oysters the a w e s o m e!!! And the bread pudding was superb. You might have to wait but worth it!!!

My family and I are on the first day of our trip to NOLA and were recommended this place by our concierge. We are a group of 7 and had no wait time. There's multiple floors to the restaurant and although the tables around us were full, the noise level wasn't loud at all. Our waitress, Ashleigh, was great and the food came out quickly. We started off with the oceana oysters (ask for extra bread) and fried gator. For our main courses, we got two pasta specials, two redfish specials, fried shrimp, and fried oyster plates. The food was so good--could've ordered anything on the menu and been fine. The plates are pretty big and shareable for anyone (no one finished their food). Overall, great food, great service, great atmosphere

Amazing Food and great customer service from our waiter Alex!!! The waiter made sure to explain the menu including things that were not on it. Was able to give recommendations as well, seemed very knowledgeable. We ordered several appetizers including red beans, gator bites, and the Cajun fries. The food all was served fairly quick and was hot and fresh. I had the seafood platter which was a very good portion of food for the price. I definitely would return on my next trip to New Orleans!

Just stopped in for drinks and dessert.  Was underwhelmed, particularly after all of the great food and service we have experienced during our time here.  Service was marginal, creme brule was just okay, and the praline brownie arrived without the candied pecan topping.  Waitress seemed annoyed when we asked about them and she brought out regular chopped pecans.

So the second time I went there it was just a typical touristy food trap.  People lined up, waiting in a queue, menus with red beans and rice "entrees".  Even the bandwagon video that looked like the stage door with a host of celebrities that have been there.  When they showed Mitch I almost walked out.  If there was any place around there that I could have gone (at that time of night) I would have.
Great crab cakes and must have a po boy too! Service was fast and friendly. UBER driver recommended this place and glad we came here instead of another place.

This place was great. The food was excellent and it was all decently priced. The grilled oysters here are amazing! They were the best oysters we ate in NOLA. The half shells were great as well. The alligator sausage, as well as the blackened gator were both excellent. The gumbo was delicious. We ate here several times during our trip and loved the food each time. I would highly recommend this place. You would think being a few steps off Bourbon Street that it would be crazy inside, but it's not. Very comfortable.
I had the red fish lafouche..... It was something else just delicious! Go for it.. With gumbo of course !

Kathleen is our server. Normally we love this place. Her attitude is horrible. As a server and bartender, I understand 3 people at a 7-8 top. However, you never know who you're waiting on. It's going down hill quick.

Loved the food.  Employee at our hotel recommended the restaurant.  Went there to eat after a celebration.  Enjoyed eating outside on the patio.  The food was delicious.  The drinks were made to perfection.  The service was great.  Can not wait to go again.
Best food everrrrr! Bread pudding is fantastic! Ask for Pamela and she will guide you through the menu. She has a great personality! Great service and great food!

We stumbled across this place our second night in New Orleans looking for amazing creole food and in walking vicinity of our hotel.  We were able to get a table right away before a line formed outside. We ordered the creole fries as an appetizer and they were delicious as it was a huge bowl full of fries with toppings. My wife ordered blackened chicken and I had the special both were amazing options. We were stuffed else the praline brownie was calling our name.  We kept seeing the brownie and bread pudding coming by from the kitchen.

We were happily surprised to see this place open for Christmas morning breakfast. Food was delicious and our waitress Ashleigh was phenomenal. She greeted us warmly and knowingly it was Christmas she made sure our experience truly a positive one. We have three nights left and we will return one last time.

A must try!!!!!

Amazingly delicious food. Everything was so good rich lovely yummy yummy yummy. We tried all of the traditional foods and I can't remember what the special was called we tried that to you there were 12 of us so I got to take a lot of things everything was yummy yummy perfect if you love seafood.

We made reservations and they took us exactly on time. The food was great with service to match.  Our server Ashleigh was great.  Besides being on top of it and helping pick out our meal, she was as friendly as can be.  All the employees were friendly.  Great food and service to match.

Cannot say enough about how OUTSTANDING this place is. From the eclectically painted walls & staircase to the top-notch service this is a place not to be missed. Our server, Desiree, was full of information, on top of all our needs and knew  I how to treat her customers. I started with the New Orleans Cosmo - perfectly made and a colleague had the non-alcoholic root beer float in an frosted glass with the perfect amount of ice cream. We ordered the half & half gator appitizer, tender & tasty. The fried seafood platter was huge, great hush puppies included. Make reservations, there was a line out the door for a reason.

Right off Bourbon street and such a quick line! Their alligator bites are worth a try, they have such a different texture than anything I've had before. Food and service were great, and we never felt rushed to leave despite the large crowd they were serving due to Mardi Gras weekend.

Fresh fish with great test! 
I got grilled tuna, it was fresh and deliciously cooked!

My servers name was Kim and she was very efficient and quick. Whatever I ordered or asked for came extremely quick. 

I used my Yelp coupon doe 10%off my bill and it was honored.  

I was seated at table 4, which had to be one of the worst seats in the house!  It's literally under the oyster bar and "food up" section of the restaurant.   I literally had servers in my face all night...it was awkward and a lot uncomfortable for me.

Kim was able to make it better, with her quickness and checking on me.  When the hostess asked if I wanted a seat at the bar or a single seat for myself,  if I had known what I know now, I would have asked for a bar seat.

10% off with check in is a great start! 
We sat on the second floor which had a terrace we could walk out with. 

Great and fun service! 

Food was delicious!!! Not the most authentic, but still great. My BF had the jambalaya pasta and I had the redfish. Both were amazing!!!

Definitely recommend

Not sure why this place is so highly rated. We stood outside in line for about 40 minutes with a party of 4.Not bad considering it was NYE weekend. Once we were seated our waiter came promptly and food arrived quickly. When we received our food we figured out why. I ordered the Taste of New Orleans Platter which was nothing special. No one at our table really enjoyed their meals. Food arrived hot and quickly, just not very memorable taste-wise. Not the worst meal I had in NOLA but definitely not the best.
Our server Whitney was fantastic, and food was delicious! We got the blackened gator bites and they were to die for. Great drinks too! Highly recommend
We were on our drive back to Arizona and decided to check this place out. The accommodated our animals and we had great service! Chad was awesome! Again, great service!

Breakfast is served everyday from 8a-1p so we were able to enjoy crab cakes egg benedict and our other entree had alligator sausage. The BEST part of breakfast was the biscuits with honey butter...OMGsh! They were so tasty that we ordered another serving of just biscuits.  Our server, John Ruffin, was super friendly and efficient.
Good but not great. Given NOLA you can do better but even so it's a decent place within the French Quarter.
Best food in NOLA. You have got to try the crabcakes. They were so good we had them 3 times in one week and I know crabcakes being from Maryland

I dined here in August. The service was so-so, but the BBQ shrimp appetizer was the BEST! I got to go in the kitchen and speak to the chef, but he wouldn't give me the recipe....just a few bits and pieces.
I would highly recommend going there and ordering the BBQ shrimp appetizer and a few drinks. A great way to start an evening in one of the best cities!!!
If anyone who reads this knows that recipe, help a girl get her fix! I have been ordering BBQ shrimp everywhere they serve them here in Wisconsin, and nothing has come close.

Service was good. John took great care of us and has an incredible memory. We had breakfast and the food was delicious. Grits and eggs and hash, you can't go wrong. Thanks for the good food and fabulous service.
It was great. Food was delicious and Kim was a great waitress. Would definitely recommend it and will go back next time we are in New Orleans!

Oceana is our favorite restaurant in New Orleans. We drove from Texas and were hoping to find somewhere with non-seafood options for my taste. We ended up going twice during our visit. The food is so flavorful and well prepared. The atmosphere is lacking a little, but the food is worth the long line on weekend nights. 

I always get blackened chicken with a side of jambalaya and corn maque choux. It's a cajun corn dish that I've tried replicating at home. It's got a nice kick and is packed with flavor. Their jambayla is a mildy spicy mix of chicken and sausage with a sweet undertone. My partner and I inhaled the stuff. 

The blackened chicken is too good for words. The cut of chicken is cooked so wonderfully that it can be cut easily with a spoon. I don't know how they do it. Every time I'm blown away by how good the seasoning is and am reminded that I actually like meat when it's cooked this well. It's mildly spicy and won't burn the mouth of someone who doesn't do spicy food. 

My partner had a seafood chowder our 2nd visit and liked it a lot. We also ordered a side of hush puppies which I thought were too small and dry. That's my only criticism for Oceana. I let the manager know how wonderful our waitress was (both times we came) and he appreciated the compliment. I love love this spot and so happy I followed the advice of fellow Yelpers.
I had the red beans and rice. My husband had the Taste of New Orleans. Food was great and so was the service. Wanted to give a 4 1/2 but can't with the rating system in place.

As New Orleans as you can get!  Excellent oysters Rockefeller, BBQ shrimp, jambalaya, crawfish, and red beans and rice.  Fabulous service by friendly engaging wait staff in a beautiful dining room.  We celebrated a friend's 40th birthday and had a wonderful evening.
Hands down.  BEST meal in New Orleans.  Get the BBQ shrimp and dont miss the red beans and rice.

Absolutely delicious! First time in New Orleans and of course we wanted to try some jambalaya and crawfish étouffée. There's a ton of restaurants here with amazing reviews, but the selection on this menu is what did it for us. We got the alligator bites, famous oysters (incredible!), crawfish étouffée, shrimp creole, and bananas foster. Absolutely incredible. The crawfish étouffée was buttery with just enough spice, paired with some garlic buttered bread. Couldn't rave more about this place, just excellent.

And yes -- make reservations! We made them for 6pm and when we got there, there was no one else in line. When we left at 7:30, there was a line out the door and down the block.

OMG, couldn't get in to Acme because of some asinine reason that if you didn't stand in line with your friends, they won't let you join. THANKFULLY we found this place, Oceana Grill. Their vegetarian stew is amazing. I mean, it was like a warm hug around the soul it was soooo good. Please pass on the touristy places, this is the one to hit. With all their floor levels, it's a perfect stop for people watching and local flavor.

Oceania is right in Bourbon Street. It's delicious! The service is fast and the servers are nice. The food tastes fresh and delicious. Drinks were also nice and stiff. The only Hangul for me was that you come out of there smelling like fried food even when you don't order it. ‍

I love Oceana Grill! They have some of the best fried oysters in the city! The food is always good and consistent. Anyone visiting looking for good New Orleans cuisine should try this place at least once.

Late September/early October 2015
2 visits: Dinner 5pm-ish and 7pm-ish

People...do not sleep on this place! I know, I know, it's looks like a chain, how good can it be, blah blah blah. We got the hot tip on Oceana from our hotel's housekeeper, a NOLA native who said, "I even eat there." Sold.

The platters are large, so ladies can prolly share one. The fried shrimp platter killed; the mixed catfish/shrimp platter slayed. Don't bother with the gumbo...Oceana is all 'bout that fried seafood life.

Who dat? Me. In Oceana.

PS: 2 words for dessert...Bread. Pudding.
Hands down best French toast I've ever had! Great service at Oceana!! Our server Whitney was amazing! She gave us some tips for first timer New Orleans visitors.
Darrick was an awesome waiter!   Took very good care of our party 10.  Great food and service!
This is my second time visiting Oceana Grill.  This time around I had the bayou blacken duck and it was great.....large portions so make sure you have an appetite (you'll need it).

The food was ok. Nothing spectacular. The overall experience here was not great.

Decor - great and has a nice warm and hangout feel
Service - nice waiters, they take FOREVER to come to the table, appetizers took a while to come out.
Food - food was good

Overall experience was OK.
Excellent food. The blackened Gator Poboy was amazing. Well seasoned, tender and matched with the best fries. The drinks are strong, well, you're on Bourbon street. Taylor is an excellent server.

The place was disappointing, we came wanting great southern food and made the mistake of going somewhere close to bourbon street.  It felt very touristy and kitschy.  The food was only ok for us.  We got the alligator bites and both got po' boys, we would not recommend this place unless you wanted something easy on the way to bourbon street.
My favorite place for breakfast. From atmosphere, staff to your meal is 5-star. With so many choices to eat here in the French Quarter, you cannot go wrong, if undecided where to start your day.
Excellent food. Had the redfish special topped with fried crawfish...amazing. Sat at the bar and was served and educated by an amazing bartender!! One of our better dining experiences in New Orleans.

Enjoyed the service - 5 stars
Food - Was good but I had higher expectations given that it ranked second in number of reviews. The best dish was the last one bread pudding...very moist and flavorful. The veg Alfredo pasta for a Cajun joint (wife is vegetarian) was extreme good.
Ambience - Typical NOLA casual joint. 
Overall I give it 4 stars.

Our waitress was very nice and her recommendations in food worked for us immensely. 
We had Alfredo chicken pasta - yummmmm. This pasta had excellent ratio of spices. Also had chicken platter. Chicken was evenly cooked. It was tender inside. Loved it.
Great food and location! There is always a line to get in but it moves pretty fast so hang in there and it will be worth it!

This place is right off of bourbon street in the french quarter.   There is usually a line so come prepared.   

To save time I'll mention one thing off the bat, don't come here expecting generous portions.  


I got the alligator sampler  1/2 blackened and 1/2 breaded.  Both were good. The breaded were a little more tender.   The sauce included is a mustard based sauce.  Portion was small for appateizer to share.  

I also got the cajun pasta jumbalya.   Flavor was excellent, but the dish did not come out hot even after specially requesting to bring the dish to be brought out when done.    Also the portion was tiny, don't choose it expecting a satisfying pasta dish.

This place always has a line out the door and I know why...it's delicious!! The service is great and the food is even better! Prices are reasonable and the portions are large enough that you can share and try multiple items on the menu. Will come again.

My husband and I ate here during our 9th wedding anniversary.  The atmosphere was great and service was quick. Our server (Bobby) was very knowledgable about the menu and the area.  We shared the Catfish Lafouche which was a special at the time.  It was plenty for the both of us to share and was delicious!  Bobby gave us a coupon for breakfast the next morning and while we didn't use it, I thought it was nice.  :)

Don't let the Kitchen Nightmares episode of 2011 scare you away, or push you in. Oceana is good, lightly above average cuisine catering to the hoards of tourists who are not lucky enough to be raised on Creole cooking. There's usually a line. A long line. So, I've only had Ocean a few times from UberEats. 

The gumbo is good, the crab cake is fine, but the baked fish with cream sauce is where it's at.

Don't forget to take advantage of the Yelp Check-In Deal! 10% off your check.

The first night I attempted to visit Oceana was on a Saturday night and the line went out of the door, no thanks. That following Sunday afternoon I walked past it again with no line and figured I could spare some room for their highly rated crab cakes!

Louisiana Crab Meat Cakes (4/5): We just ordered the appetizer portion which includes two cakes. I'll be honest, I have not had many crab cakes prior in my life but these were pretty darn good. The sauce they add on top was delicious! The crab meat cake itself was served super quick but on the cold side. I think I should have asked them to warm it again for it to have been 5 stars.

Overall, place is cute and very very tourist-friendly. If the line isn't long, it might be worth checking out. But, mind you, you can find the same exact cuisine almost at every corner in the French Quarter.

Awesome food. They were able to seat a able for 8 in less than 10 minutes. Right off of bourbon street & amazing food. 4 stars because the food took some time to come & some things came out wrong - but our server was on top of it and promptly brought out the correct items

We had a good spread of sea gold choices in Oceana. Close to Bourbon street and set up in the old restaurant setting..friendly staff and good service. 

They have good veggies options. We had the NoLA Hurricane and it was sizzling with dry ice...served well..

Their oyster choices were excellent and we loved their char broiled oysters. The seafood platter choices were good.

Never had Alligator meat before and it was a good experience with their Alligator tail bites...

Veggie options were there but lower expectations on crepes and pasta! 

Don't forget to try their bread pudding...it was out of the world! 

Will recommend for a good experience!
Right smack in the Craziebezz of Bourbon street. Food very good, and a nice low key atmosphere
The brunch here is amazing, ordered the seafood omelette and it was amazing! Picture doesn't do the food justice

It's ok, nothing to Yelp about, but here goes:

My Order at Oceana Grill
$14.00 - Louisiana Crab Meat Cakes: (appetizer - 2 cakes) the taste and consistency of that which comes from the freezer section at Walmart

$17.00 - Cajun Jambalaya Pasta: really good; properly cooked pasta with shrimp, chicken, and sausage. However, for $17, it was small; would have fit in the palm of my hand

$05.00 - Crawfish Etouffee: not bad but not unique, not dark or developed enough

$02.20 - Sweet Iced Tea: it wasn't sweetened. I'm not sure how you mess-up sweet tea but...

About $40.00 in total. And it's not the money. It's the VALUE. In this case, it's the lack of value. 

Skip it -

I did a short trip to New Orleans recently.  Someone recommended this place to me.  I had their shrimp etouffet.  It was very good.  Also, the service is excellent.  My server was Whitney.  She went out of her way to make sure that both the food and service were the best.

Food was very good and Mike our server was amazing.  He kept our drinks filled and told us about checking in to get 10 percent off.  Would go back in a second.  If you like ousters, they are cheap here and quite big and delicious

The food was okay but not anything to rave about. Oysters Rockefeller was average, the crab cakes were a bit better as they were fried perfectly. My husbands food came out more than five minutes before mine which is a MAJOR NO NO in my book. He sat waiting for my meal to arrive while his grew cold. There are too many restaurants in the city that deliver excellent service to put up with anything less. The staff was friendly but could have been a lot more attentive. The table was very unstable and jammed into a corner with the next table right on top of us. The building was extremely interesting and was the best part of the visit. I probably will not be back and will opt for a more customer centered establishment on my next visit to the city.

I returned to Oceana again this weekend for an annual visit, and the experience was again quite excellent. Our waiter was just as friendly and attentive as he was last year, and the food rose to the occasion again. My friend and I enjoyed the shrimp po boy, but it was the red beans and rice dinner that got our eye and was extraordinary in both taste and presentation. This restaurant continues to be worth the wait.
Amazing food and drinks! A must visit if you are ever in New Orleans! Look up for Sarah when you are there, she provides some really good suggestions for food.

I was in New Orleans with 5 others and we went to the Oceana Grill for dinner.  As stated by others this place in huge with lots of tables and staff (which were are very friendly). We had a wonder meal (appetizers, meals and drinks), everything was wonderful with zero complaints.  At the end of the evening my friends were going on a walking tour of the area.  I have some health issues and was unable to go with.  I called for a Uber and waited for a long time.  Finally was told by Uber driver that they could not get to me, due to road closures from parades.  My friends had left (we did not know there would be an issue with Uber getting to me). I needed to walk a block to the corner to meet a driver.  There were some people between me and the corner that made me feel uncomfortable to walk alone.  The manager of Oceana Grill had one of his male staff members walk me to the corner.  Now that is service above and beyond what one would expect. I recommend this restaurant for their excellent food, drinks and customer service.  I am very appreciative and thankful for what this restaurant did for me.

First night in N.O. we went to Oceana off Bourbon street. Fastest line, friendly hostesses. Alligator tail bites were good. We tried both blackened and fried. Blackened won out by far, much more flavorful, I'm my opinion. My sister liked them fried better. . I ordered the Cajun jambalaya pasta, definitely less in the Cajun arena, tons of shrimp, not much sausage. I've had better pasta at Fridays ... My sister had the blackened ribs and fries. The ribs were really good, I think the sauce overpowered the great blackened flavor of the ribs but overall they were decent. I had a piña colada, I had to order an extra shot of rum to cut the sweetness -I also added water eventually. Just way too sweet. My sister had a strawberry margarita, she liked it! ... The wait, convenience, and nice staff earned them their stars, not so much the food. I'm guessing this isn't how N.O. shines but its a foot in the door.
This was a great place to go for lunch after hanging out on Royal street and our waitress Deanne was awesome. Deanne and the rest of the staff created a wonderfully welcoming atmosphere.
Great food. Awesome service. The food was really good. I had the seafood platter and cheesecake. The waiter was excellent. The Bahama mama was delicious. Will definitely be back.
Awesome food - Pamela was our server and she was excellent. Definately recommend stopping in here!
Authentic New Orleans experience. Drinks are terrific! I felt like I was in Nawlans coming here. Staff was kind and very accommodating!
Ate here for lunch today and loved it!! Fast, friendly service and the food was amazing. My wife had the shrimp po boy and I have the Cajun pasta. Both was delicious.
I had better oysters in Seattle, but everything else here is beautiful. Chargrilled oysters were beautiful as well as the pecan pie

Wow THE best service I've ever had. The charbroiled oysters were to die for and they came out so quick!! The hurricane was delicious and Shaun and Heather were quick and attentive to us. The poy boy and fries were so crisp and fresh. I highly recommend coming here. The manager Daniel was SO sweet. They do a great job with service and delicious food!

The line wasn't too bad last night so we got seated with. 15 minutes. Even if I had to wait longer the fold would have made it worth it. The fried catfish was delicious. The people I was with had the sampler and they said it was awesome as well. I would definitely recommend to anyone in New Orleans on vacation!

This place is a gem. Truly a gem! Came into town for my birthday and we were STARVING so we decided to just keep walking down the street and go to the next restaurant we saw and this place popped up. Now let's hit a side note real quick. (I do not...I repeat do NOT eat seafood) yes I know why come to NOLA but it was a surprise and I decided to roll with it. Back to the review walked in and I'm going to be honest the atmosphere does not match their prices. Let's be honest. I thought I'd be paying 10 bucks for a plate of pasta. Not the case! I got the chicken Alfredo and it was creamy and garlicy and full of divine goodness. It was so delicious and so awesome I finished the entire bowl and licked the plate clean (not really but I could have and it would've tasted amazing. Don't judge me) I ordered a hurricane (not knowing I could get one on the street for a few bucks cheaper) and it was tasty..not strong like I like it but tasty. All in all I got my ticket and it was like 25-30 bucks. For one plate and a drink I was kind of like ehhhhh...but it was worth it. Service was BEYOND excellent. The people there were so friendly. Omg I could go on and on but I'll stop here. Trust your gut and my review and try this place. 

sincerely
A girl who hates seafood and came out of this place licking her fingers.

I've always heard mixed reviews about this place with most being bad and so I've always been hesitant to try it.  Gorden Ramsay did a makeover of this place so I had hoped that would have improved the food but I continued to hear mixed reviews but not as many terrible ones.  This was one of the very few places open and the only place serving their full menu on the day after Hurricane Isaac landed so they get one extra star for that.  They also housed their staff above the restaurant during the storm so that also deserves credit for excellent planning. 

The tail end of Isaac was still blowing pretty good when a friend and I decided we needed a nice post storm meal and this seemed to be our only option for a nice dinner so we decided to try it.  When we first arrived there was a line of folks waiting to get in but we were able to get to the bar and enjoyed an island of normalcy amidst the chaos of the storm.  The service was very organized and efficient in dealing with the many people waiting to eat.  Unfortunately the area where they really underperformed was the most important area and that was their food.  The best way to describe this food is that it's like Copeland's but a lot less good.  My friend and I ate multiple things and none of the items really tasted good to us.  The BBQ shrimp were the most edible things served.  The seafood gumbo tasted funky, the redfish was not fresh and had zero flavor, and sadly the cheesecake was the absolute worst I've ever had.  My friend and I agreed that the fried seafood options would probably be the best thing to get here in the unlikely event we ever returned in the future.  

I really want to give this restaurant a good review as I'm very impressed with their superior planning and execution of their hurricane plan but the food really failed to deliver.  I would like to hope that the disappointing food was due to the chaos of the hurricane but they never lost power and they had a full staff so that would be a difficult argument to make.  I'm very thankful that they were open and I got to at least eat dinner as later in the afternoon I met a lot of folks that were hungry that weren't able to find anything to eat so the food here was definitely better than no food.  During normal circumstances and for the price there are much better quality experiences to be had all over the Quarter than this place but during a hurricane this might be your best bet.

I'm not a fan of fish !!!!! But, I was told that this place has good, authentic creole food. We got there and I noticed the majority of their menu is fish with some chicken and barely any meat. 
So I got the sea food platter. Let me tell you, this dish was amazing. The portion was great, the batter ... hmmmmmm And there definitely was no fishy smell. It was clear that the fish were fresh. 
Also, the fried oysters O.O wowwww ! I had never had those before. 
I got a hurricane to drink, and that was also delicious and not overly sweet. 
I can't comment on the atmosphere mainly because we were seated at a table right by the entrance. 
Service was good though.

This place is so amazing. The food came out so fast, and the service was great! I had the taste of New Orleans and honestly, it left me wanting more. This was my first restaurant in the city and it did not disappoint. The staff is super friendly, everyone thanked me for being there. I would definitely recommend this place to everyone!!

blackened catfish poboy was awesome.  we got it twice because it we liked it so much.  the fettucine alfredo is very creamy but if that's what you like, i recommend the shrimp version!  i saw ppl ordering the jambalaya and ribs which looked great too.  

the raw oysters were delicious as well.  i wasn't a big fan of the $9 bloody marys though because they only had 1 shot in em but they tasted decent.  great location as well and didn't have to wait at all for seats for dinner!  it was pretty hectic but Ralph took care of us and he was very sweet--kinda reminds me of Bruno Mars :)
This place is overrated.  The food is BLAH, the drinks are too damn expensive; the waiters are also sappy.  I think they count on getting over on tourists.
Came here for Mardi Gras and and our waitress Pamela was amazing! The food is so good too. We all got different po boys and no complaints from anybody

We came here for lunch today and ambiance at this place was nice. Our waitress also was very nice. There's also a patio for outside seating. I ordered the Po Boy with fried shrimp and it comes with fries but I wish it came with a salad , the sandwich was very reasonable in size so I didn't finish it. My son ordered the fettuccine Cajun Alfredo and it was so good I ended up eating the little bit of leftovers he left. They also serve breakfast  which we weren't aware bc it didn't seem like a place for breakfast !!!

This was the best restaurant I visited while in New Orleans! My meal (the shrimp platter) was AMAZING! The best I've ever had thus far. Also, the waiter and host were polite, kind, and very attentive! I encourage everyone who visits the area to stop by for lunch/dinner.
We loved the food from this restaurant.  Great customer service.  The grilled alligator is a must! Jambalaya is amazing.  When in town this spot is a must try.

Amazing brunch menu! St. Louis English muffins, egg, crab, hash browns and crawfish cream sauce! Grapefruit Mimosa and hurricane drinks were delicious. Outdoor seating a plus. Don't forget to use your Yelp 10% discount!
Good casual dining, fast service and a nice selection on the menu.  They serve breakfast 'til late so it can get crowded. Good value for money.
First dinner in nola and the waiter did not disappoint. Food was very tasty and just the right am ok into of spice. Gumbo was so silky. Will come back when I can try more of the menu.

3.5 Stars.

Clean oyster served on ice, the way it should be. Cold with good flavor and did I mention clean?! Still not as cold as I would prefer. Grilled oysters were not available, we tried the the house special baked oysters but were overwhelmed by the sauce and toppings. 

Prices were area compatible but 10% off bill check In deal was great. 

Cool staff, sit at the bar and chat with other patrons and bartender. Stella on draft plus a few local beers. A little off of Bourbon St. means a  little less madness.

Oyster Odyssey continues. 

Cheers!!
Good service, food was okay just not worth the cost. I got the Shrimp po boy with a side of Caesar salad. The whole sandwich had about four or five shrimp...

This is not a good place to eat. We were drawn in by the reviews and learned from locals they have offered discounts people's checks for giving them 5 star reviews on social media. We ordered charbroiled oysters which were more like microwaved oysters . And the oyster po boy was terrible as well. Steer clear of you are looking for authentic NO cuisine. Our waiter was very friendly but that was the only positive.
Best grilled oysters ever! Oceana's Famous Oysters are soo good I came back for more. Service is warm, friendly and knowledgeable.

Living in north Louisiana, we are fortunate to be able to visit and to eat our way around New Orleans often. We tend to shy away from the popular or tourist- acclaimed restaurants. Year after year, we've had recommendations to try Oceana, so having run out of unique options, we finally decided to give it a try. Were we disappointed? Absolutely not!!! I like to say that I will eat almost anything, but I complain about most. I truly do not have one single negative thing to say about our experience here. We were seated immediately. Our server took time to explain the specials as well as to point out the menu favorites. We chose a dozen chargrilled oysters, the Redfish Oceana, and a special- blackened ahi tuna stuffed with crab dressing and served with jambalaya and the most delicious turnip greens. Every single bite of each dish was amazing! From the second we walked in until the time we left, our experience at Oceana was more than we had hoped or would be!
Was about a 25 min wait on a Friday night. Service was excellent and the food was delicious I ordered the gumbo and wings

The service was very good. 
The food tasted ok, but didn't come out very hot.
Then. Unfortunately, about a half an hour later my wife and I both had stomach issues.

I had a fantastic experience at this place. The manager and server were pretty genuine and provided great advice and service. I order a dish that off the menu. I will add my photo but it was delicious! It was a red fish topped with a crawfish, shrimp, and mushroom cream sauce, jambalaya underneath the fish and a side of greens. It was about $25.

We are visiting New Orleans for the week and found Oceana Grill on Yelp. We were pleasantly surprised at how fantastic it was! First good sign was the line of people waiting to get in. The hostess was super friendly as were the others who attended us in the line. Made the wait so easy. They even recommended what we should try. 

The food and drinks came quickly. So tasty and generous! Our waitress was awesome and sweet. Kept checking in with us after we got our food and when we were finished. I highly recommend this restaurant. Great introduction to New Orleans!!
This restaurant is okay. The food is decent and the service was great but it surely isn't the best on Nola. Only tried it because we had a 10% off coupon.

Once again Yelp reviews got me here too... The food was delicious.. N the drinks were good as well.. They serve you big glasses of sodas. I have the Malibu Squeeze yummy... .

I ordered the Crab Burger delicious and I had about 5 toppings consisting of crawfish cream sauce, tartar, remoulade, mustard, cocktail everything..

Def going back.... !!! 

ANd the desserts are HUGE n GREAT!

Exactly what I wanted it to be! It's a great space and really fun. The service is fast and the food is yummy. My sister in law and I's server was named Errol and he was so nice and polite. Next time I come to NOLA I'm coming back here and I'm bringing more people.

Came in to see what New Orleans all about! 
Well I'm glad that we got to come here for our first experience!!
To start I order the famous Cajun spicy Bloody Mary it was the best Bloody Mary I ever had!!
Appetizers; Oyster and crab cakes! Oysters were huge and fresh, crab cakes were delicious.
For Dinner I order a cup of gumbo soup which was extremely flavorful, a side of fried cat fish and French fries! The French fries were so tasty and perfectly cooked, and the fried fish was absolutely amazing! Service was outstanding! Thanks for leaving a long lasting experience!!

We went to this place on recommendation from our lyft driver.

I got the seafood gumbo, and the taste of New Orleans. I was super excited to try the food since I was looking forward to some real gumbo!

I got the food, and it was. Just okay. I felt like something was missing from the food! I don't know if it was the spices. Or just the flavor in general. But something was def missing.

We did share our food, there was 5 of us. I also tried the bbq shrimp, the fried shrimp, the crawfish something and Cajun jambalaya pasta. The shrimp was spot on. The pasta was a bit on the spicy side tho.

Its not like I don't recommend the place or anything. But I guess try something else? Not sure. I wouldn't try this place again. The servers were really nice. But just the food something was off from it and it just bugged me :(

Props to everyone here for getting a party of 12 sat on the fly within 20 minutes and serving us in under 1.5 hours. Jamal was amazing and so calm for having a large party including kids. He got our drinks/food/desserts correct and re filled our drinks/picked up our plates in a timely manner. I've seen a lot of servers screw up biiiig when more than 6 people are involved. The food was delicious! The chocolate mousse cake and bread pudding was to die for. Was really impressed for being a touristy restaurant right off of bourbon. Thanks yAll!
The service was great and fast. The food delish and exceeded my expectations! Laverne, our server, was fantastic and friendly! Definitely will be returning and highly recommend coming here!
Great food! Crab cakes were great and the crawfish etouffee was great! The place was a little pricy but so is everything else around there!

If I could choose no stars I would!!! I,m a southern boy who lives on the gulfcoast so I know my seafood! My family and myself went there off the refferal of the hotel we were staying in and I know now they must be getting kickbacks for every one they send there or I'm sure they would not have suggested it!!! Frozen seafood, super breaded greasy Just totally disgusting food and experience!!!! Way over priced dump..... You would think living on the gulf coast you would have access to fresh seafood and use it..... Not this dump, I even complained to the manager and their response was sorry and then they just walked off , really!!!????? STAY AS FAR AWAY FROM THIS PLACE AS YOU POSSIBLY CAN. IF YOU WANT FRESH SEAFOOD, GOOD SERVICE AND A AUTHENTIC NEWORLENS MEAL THIS IS NOT THE PLACE TO GO!!!!! YUCK!!!!

We visited on Christmas Eve and had a very pleasant experience. The restaurant is huge, and it was decorated very nicely for Christmas. The restaurant was super busy, with a line of 50+ guests outside waiting in line at the door. The staff was great, very professional and attentive. The manager also came and greeted us. We used our 10% off coupon from yelp and even without it our food wasn't outrageously expensive. We also enjoyed all of our meals. We ordered the Oceana oysters for an appetizer and loved them, they were different than any other oyster I've ever tasted in New Orleans. We also ordered a red fish dinner, a pasta dish, chicken Caesar salad, and shrimp platter. We all enjoyed our meals, they were cooked and seasoned very well. This is a great restaurant to visit in New Orleans

We stopped here after wandering down Bourbon Street. Very cute place. I ordered the Louisiana Crab cakes and my mother had the Seafood Gumbo. Both were very delicious.
