I would definitely recommend the crab cakes. I deducted a couple stars because our waiter kept disappearing. I ordered a beer and it took a good 10 minutes before he came back. Finally had to grab another waiter and ask for my check. I would go back for more of those crab cakes, but there are so many other restaurants to try out and oh so little time.
Great food, great service!!  Had gumbo and fried shrimp platter - huge portions!  Thanks Marvin for taking great care of us!!  Highly recommend for some good ole Cajun food!!
It was ok, nothing stood out as great. Service was on the slow side and it was pricey for just a eh meal.

This restaurant definitely lives up to its reputation! I had my first NOLA meal here, and Oceana didn't disappoint! 

I ordered the Cajun fries and the crawfish étouffe. Sooooo good! If they sold their seasoning, I'd buy it in a heartbeat! 

Customer service here was great as well. Our waiter frequently asked if we needed anything. 

It's important to note that this is a very popular restaurant, so there's usually a long wait. Try coming a little before peak hours to avoid the wait. 

An amazing eatery! I highly recommend coming here.

A "guide" working for tips on Canal St. suggested Oceana for a late lunch/early dinner. Well worth the tip he got! 

The only issue we had was a mix up between the hostess and the server that lead to him not realizing we were his customers at first. Once that was cleared our server (Daniel) was excellent. We got the gator bite appetizer with 1/2 fried and 1/2 blackened, red beans and rice, a blackened catfish po-boy, and bread pudding for desert. Everything was very good, served quickly, and very reasonably priced for the Quarter.

The best place we ate on our trip to Nee Orleans!!  We had the alligator appetizer both fried and grilled which was good I personally like the fried better.  I had the red fish with the cream sauce and crawfish with a side of greens and it was extremely delicious!!  John was awesome he took great care of us you could tell he loves his work.  We enjoyed a phenomenal bread pudding for dessert that was as good as my grandmas! We will definitely be back the next time we are in town!!

One of the best meals I had in new Orleans! We first went for a dinner. The 'gator bites' appetizer was so awesome and spicy, we got another round of it. The blackened redfish was good too! The next time we went was for lunch. We had the redfish again. But this time we had a different appetizer: grilled oyster. Superbly awesome!! Though there is very less edible stuff in it, the oyster itself was very good, but its accompanying gravy was one of the best I've had! It's a must-have!  Overall one of the best places to eat in new Orleans.
Everything was amazing! I've been coming to New Orleans for over 15 years and can honestly it's one of my favorite places.

So good!! I was a little hesitant when we walked in, but the food was incredible. The blackened shrimp was so flavorful, probably the best thing we ordered. The crab cakes were so so good too with delicious remoulade sauce. The crawfish mushroom sauce was delicious as well. Great service too. Be sure to check in to get a coupon!

I ordered the shrimp poboy to take back to the hotel a block away. What a disappointment, cold fries and a cold shrimp Poboy. I hate throwing away money.
Drew broke a record this evening during MNF in the Mercedes Benz SuperDome, I didn't think Oceania would do me like this. I love this city but not Oceania right now.
Ordered the New Orleans sampler and the flavors were excellent. I'd recommend this place over another highly rated restaurant that appeared on Triple D. Well worth a try.

I only know of one location and that's in the French Quarter. I've gone there 3 times now and the food is mediocre. In all fairness, I've only had the oyster plate and the seafood plate. Both were 6.0 on the scale of 10. Just my opinion of the limited dishes I've had therr
Food is really mediocre. I don't understand why this is so popular. The only dish we like is fried oyster. The service is pretty good though.

Had the Fried Oysters and a salad. The salad was just ok, but the oysters were yummy.  Friends had the Po Boy.  THEY said it was scrumptious but I thought the bread was a teeny bit dry. 

The service was excellent and the best thing was the bread pudding
Ummm. The crawfish etoufe is delicious.  The bbq shrimp are not all that, wish i had skipped. Red beans are good!!! Blue crab cakes are also delicious!!

Definitely not the worst place to go, very practical in French quarter. Food was tasty and quickly served but a bit expensive for what we got. 
Errol made our lunch thanks to  is warm welcoming and good advice on the signature drink :)

We were at the bar and asked the bartender who asked his well fed fluffy friend what was a good place to eat,
the fluffy local recommended Oceana
we came here and our taste pallets enjoyed the food
We had the 
Crabcake 3/5  needed more crab less cake
Oceana's Famous Oysters 4/5 we liked it so much we requested extra bread just to soak up the juices, but the sad part is the bread never came =....[
Taste of New Orleans 4/5 very tasty
red bean and rice 5/5 I don't know if it was the time and place but i am sure glad i went at this time and at this place, because it was Delicious!!!!!!
the food was great 
but I do have one complaint
when we were at the bar 
the bartender charged us for coke back for our shots of Jack
I cant believe the our wanna be mixologist charged us full price on a soda ,when all we asked for was a coke back... just a simple little squirt of coke to help wash down the shot of jack.  i hope he has really bad diarrhea for the next 6 months for doing that to us.

Good customer service and the food was good, lots of seafood options, the sides were tasty. I sat at the bar and bartenders were friendly and helpful when I asked for suggestions. Great location next to Bourbon St.

Always has a long line but it moves fast! And it's worth any wait you have. Servers have a great personality, everyone is very friendly. Ordered a bloody Mary and it was delicious! Best I've ever tasted! If you like v8 at all, try it! Also got the gumbo and crab cakes. Gumbo wasn't spicy but was very savory. Had great balance. Crab cakes were packed with meat! And fantastic!
This place was absolutely AMAZING!! The staff was friendly, helpful and attentive.  The food was mind blowing! Highly recommended!

Had a wonderful experience at Oceania thanks to the extremely kind and personable hostess Kacy and our server Whitney.  they were both super friendly and very knowledgeable!  We had special needs seating which Kacy accommodated happily. We had some great laughs while enjoying really good  food!  The redfish special (on jalapeño cornbread stuffing totally rocked).  Bloody Mary's were great too!  Thank you Kacy and Whitney for making our first visit terrific!  We will be back!!!'  Highly recommend if u wNt excellent drinks and food in the French Quarter!

some are pretty good
but the serving was not impressive
there was a bad smelling item and the server was not able to accept that thing

First time visitor to N.O. and I really expected the food to be a lot better. While my pasta was good my wife had ribs that weren't good and my friends had the shrimp po boy and it was tough and they only discounted the bill 10%. Our waiter provided great customer service but the manager should have done more than offer a 10% discount.

Staff was great! Our waiter guy was friendly and speedy and helped us with any questions we had regarding the menu. Not a lot of extra space and their was only one bathroom for both sexes but the location was wonderful! I would definitely go here again and eat more of the gator bites !
Whitney was awesome!!! The service was great and the food even better- would come back again!!!

Visiting New Orleans during Mardi Gras season could be a little hectic. This restaurant was not that way all. The staff was super friendly and amazing! They gave us recommendations on where to go around town also, which is never really expected especially because you think they are fed up with the tourist lol. The food well the food was just on point. The crab cakes are just soooo delicious and I got a side of corn and mash potatoes. I don't know what they put in that corn, but it was like a creamy cajun style. To die for!!!

Me and my husband heard that this was a popular spot. The servers were really nice and the wait wasn't long. However, the silverware still had food on it. I ordered the Mardi Gras pasta and there was a roach in it.
The oysters were all amazing no matter how you got them. The service was also amazing!

The seafood gumbo was delicious. 
We wanted to try gator so we ordered blackened gator bites. It tasted real good. 
The catfish special of the day was a little too salty for me. But the blackened duck my husband ordered was real good.

This place has some great oysters and be sure to ask about the secret menu! Great customer service and they know how to treat their customers! I love the red fish. Be sure to ask them to make you something that's not on the menu. Always a safe option!

Now this is my first time actually staying in New Orleans, so I had no idea on where to find authentic New Orleans food. After an extensive stroll and search on Google, I finally found a gem, Oceana Grill. 

First and foremost, Oceana's looks nothing like the image on I saw on google. upon walking in, it was extremely dark & gloomy. But that wasn't to hard to get past. We were seated immediately and welcomed by awesome young lady. 

Me and my girlfriend skimmed through both the drink and food menus. I ordered the Green Iguana, an alcoholic beverage which mainly had pineapple juice and she had the hurricane which had a little dry ice for a cool smoke effect. 

We decided on the fried seafood food platter, which was delicious, dont get me wrong it's not hard to fry food. the catfish was crispy, flaky, and seasoned; but the best part was the fried oysters! It was my first time trying them and they were good considering I dont have a previous experience to compare. We also ordered the Cajun Fries; which were crispy fries topped with crawfish, mushrooms, & smoothered in cheese! An overall great experience.

Nice Little restaurant , there was a wait but you know the saying "If there's a line it's worth the wait"   
I ordered the 
Gator bites (appetizer)
-Jambalaya Pasta ( Entree)

It was pretty good not Uber expensive but, pretty affordable

The true Nola experience vibrant interiors
We were a large group of 13 they were able to accommodate us on a busy night after 20 mins wait.
I am a vegetarian Yelp reviewers had highly recommended it for Veges like me unfortunately for me they were not willing to make anything special!
Lucky for me the veggie soup with rice and the pasta both turned out to be fresh and good choices. 
Others in the group also enjoyed the experience.
Overall I would not highly recommend it!

My wife and I heard this was a good place to eat and good isn't how it should be described. It was amazing my wife had the Cajun Jambayla Pasta and I had the taste of New Orleans. The food was very very good.
Great service!   Excellent catfish!   Excellent breading.  We always end up here twice on our annual visit.
Friendly staff and nice atmosphere. We had the crab cake pasta and redfish Oceana. The pasta was really amazing but the red fish ran a little dry. Creme brûlée and the hurricane made up for it tho!

First night in NOLA and my friends and I wanted a place to eat!  With a myriad of choices in this dazzling city, we happened to find Oceana Grill through Yelp.  For some reason, everything is around 4-5 stars here, so we had a hard time actually choosing a good restaurant.  Oceana came on our radar based on proximity to our hotel, late hours, and how promising the photos looked!  It was acceptable NOLA fare, but I'm sad to say that it was actually one of the lesser meals of the trip.   

Note to readers: I like my food natural, lightly flavored, and fresh.  I like tasting each facet and individual flavor of a dish with every bite.  That being said, I found everything here too saucy and overpowering.  My friend and I each got a cup of seafood gumbo and we shared a dozen oysters on the half shell (half Rockefeller, half Oceana).  The Oceana was far too rich and creamy with a garlic and cream cajun sauce smothered in cheese.  Rockefeller was tastier in my opinion, but still overly sauced.  It came with spinach, smoked bacon, and pernod liqueur with cheese on top.  With all those strong flavors, it's no wonder I couldn't taste the freaking oyster!  The gumbo was okay, although again, I thought it was overly salted.  There was a generous amount of seafood in the gumbo, though, which I appreciated.  Service was very great; our waiter was helpful and refilled our water often.

NOLA is a city with so many food options.  I would recommend skipping Oceana Grill on your quest to find the best meal in NOLA!

I was so thrilled that I planned in advance and made dinner reservations here for my friends during our NOLA trip.  This restaurant is a delight for foodies.  It's a great spot to try some of the city's most popular dishes. My favorite dish from this restaurant that still sticks out is the gator tail bites. They were blackened, spicy, and came with an awesome remoulade dipping sauce. I also tried the gumbo here, which was pretty good, but perhaps not my favorite Cajun dish. Of course, we also had to try the Oceana's Famous Oysters, because why eat at any restaurant in Nawlins and not order oysters?  These were probably my favorite char-grilled oysters in the city. They were cajun spiced, garlicky, and sprinkled with parmesan cheese. Sheer perfection. The prices at this restaurant were very reasonable, like many other spots in this quaint city. Highly recommended and again, the oysters are a must!

Just had an AMAZING meal at Oceana. Honestly some of the best food I've ever had. Far exceeded my expectations. We sat at the bar upstairs. Chris P. Couldn't have been a better bartender or server. He had GREAT recommendations and an extremely nice guy. I would recommend anyone to eat here and sit upstairs with Chris P.

Fantastic food and service!  One of the best causal restaurants in the French Quarter. A must EAT!

Richard M.

My wife Yelped nearby places to eat and came upon the well-reviewed Oceana. We decided to give it a try and I'm glad that we did.

The place was a bit busy when we got there around 6:30pm, but we were seated right away near a bar. It was a little noisy with guests, but it was fine. 

Our server Bree was great. We really liked her. She was really attentive and friendly.

The food was excellent. We got hush puppies to start which had a little jalapeno kick to them. I got a New Orleans trio (crawfish etouffee, red beans & rice, and jambalay) and my wife got a fish special. We were both very pleased with our meals. While my trio was excellent, the items had a little bit of spiciness to them which was good to me.

When we left the restaurant at around 7:45 we saw quite a line outside of the restaurant. Glad that we missed the line, but if we did have to wait it would have been worth it anyway.

Let me preface by saying I didnt meet Drake while here 

But I did experience some good food! We were taken upstairs in a way that almost felt we were in a maze house. We were seated by the window. Given the menu. Nice variety. I love that cajun seasoning is on the table along with salt and pepper.

I order an appetizer of bbq shrimp, and a side of cajun alfredo and mustard greens. All were ok. The greens didnt taste like homemade. Almost like from a can. 

The Mr. had fries with crawfish and blackened gator on them. He also had a hurricane that came smoking from dry ice. I took a sip and it was pretty good. 

I would come back here again. Dont be like me and forget to redeem my 10% off with the Yelp check in.
3rd time we have been here in 3 days. Whitney was awesome and the food is incredible.
Cool local spot! We loved their gumbo soup. Would recommend going in the afternoon as it's very packed at night.
Nice food! It's better to reserve so you don't have to wait outside for at least one hour

The food is ok but it's a nice bar. It's near burbon street and it's vivid and live.

It's good time for dinner and group activity.

This place is soooo gooood!!!! Our waitress was amazing! We sat outside in the courtyard and it was lovely! We came back at night for more Gumbo and fried shrimp!!! The oysters were also amazing! 1 block away on bourbon St.. They have a sign that says if you take a photo of it and show it to your waitress you get a free beer! Don't forget to take a photo!
Great food and great service! FIONA is the cutest and the nicest! The oysters are a must!

I have a great idea - if people you really don't like are planning a trip to New Orleans, send them to Oceana Grill. They're likely to be greeted with poor service, rude and threatening staff, and an incredibly unpleasant dining experience. In fact, this will probably be the worst part of their entire visit. 

However, there aren't any people I know that I dislike enough to send them to Oceana. This place is the worst. 

Do yourself a favor and find a restaurant in New Orleans that cares about their customers, their service, and making the dining experience great. Oceana isn't that place.

Went here on 7\27 to have REAL NOLA food. Great idea...food was delicious!! I had the red beans and rice my friend had alligator bites...yes alligator!!! And a crawfish main dish...another friend had the blackened chicken sandwich...It was good though...the service was excellent... nice staff. Would definitely fight through the bourbon street crowd to come back.

I had dinner with a friend in the outside courtyard on Monday April 20th 2009. All I can say is the Red-fish "Amir "that my friend had was very very good, BUT THE RATS CRAWLING AROUND THE TABLES AND IN THE TREE ABOVE THE OUTSIDE DINING AREA DESTROYED MY APPETITE. The manager came to the table and apologized to us for the rat invasion, and said they came from the surrounding buildings. Don't know if I will be back.   YES I WILL COME BACK AND EAT.
Best red beans and rice I've had in the city so far! Get the crawfish fries as well!!

Fantastic food! We had the BBQ shrimp which is amazing. Ask for extra bread to dip into the gravy.  So yummy. We then had the crab cakes. Oh my they are so good.  We have been here before and loved it. Had to come back again. Yes my anniversary dinner was hopping restaurants in New Orleans having appetizers and drinks.

Just had a late breakfast here. Party of 5 seated right away, food was very good, service was great with the only exception was when a member of our party asked for milk with her hot tea, our server did not acknowledge her, but he did bring it. (we have had this happen several times during our stay in New Orleans). Would definitely recommend the biscuits and gravy - gravy was very cream and had great flavor.
Phenomenal food.  You have to order the Oceana Oysters cooked in Parmesan and bitter.  A hurricane is also a must while you enjoy the atmosphere!!!

Visited this site last night and waited in line outside for several minutes before we got into the establishment.  I had the red beans & rice with an order of catfish.  The food was Awesome!!!  This was an good choice!

Had lunch there on a Sunday during the saints game. No wait. Waitress have friendly and knowledgeable. Sat us near a TV so we could watch a different game. Food was real good. Gator bites were excellent. Definitely would go back again.

Stumbled upon this place one early evening with another couple. Interesting decor. We were treated and seated right away but the staff could've been a little friendlier. Blackened catfish was awesome, and the taste of Orleans was also very good. Both meals were very hardy and satisfying.

By far one of my top fav restaurants. The food was so delicious! Their was 6 of us and we all ordered different plates and tasted each other's plate. The drinks and food was to die for!! I highly recommend this place
Can't go wrong with this place! Oysters are stellar and the red beans and rice at the best you'll find.
What a great place to eat in the French Quarter!  The service was excellent and food outstanding!  Got the combo Red Fish and Jambalaya.  Was busy, but it was New Years Eve!!!

We ordered Oceana's Famous Oysters and Seafood Gumbo and it was PHENOMENAL!! The oysters were so well seasoned and full of flavor, hands down, they were the best oysters I have ever had. The Seafood Gumbo was delicious as well!

I liked the lively and bustling atmosphere. It was a little nicer compared to the other seafood joint we visited in New Orleans (Acme Oyster House); it wasn't as loud or uncomfortably packed. The line went out the door but it moved very quickly and we were seated in no time! 

On top of that, the service was great. The person managing the line gave us an accurate wait estimate and was chatting to everyone as we waited! 

Overall, it was my favorite restaurant during my time in NOLA! I highly recommend it!

Food wise, my order was incredibly delicious. The reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because we had to wait outside for over an hour in line to get seated. However, it was nice that some of the waitstaff came out and provided water to people waiting for seats. 

I ordered Oceana's Famous Oysters--they were the best I've ever had, and a Blackened Chicken Po'boy--equally as delicious as my app. My friend ordered the Crab Cake meal and while it was good, it wasn't great. Our waiter was courteous and attentive and the food came out fast. If I ever find myself back in NOLA, I will be sure to stop by Oceana again (except maybe for lunch instead of a weekend dinner!).

So delicious! I'm a California native, but I love NOLA and heard Oceana was a place I had to try. Crab cakes was amazing and the pasta was too. Only bad thing is I asked for more Alfredo sauce and the waiter said ok, but never brought it:(

Came here for dinner on a Friday night around 8 pm. This was my first time dining around Bourbon St and there was a line outside which I found unusual but we were seated in around 10-15 minutes. The space was huge so I now understood why the line moved so quickly. We sat on the second floor area, it was nicely decorated and we were promptly greeted by a server. There was one vegetarian option on the menu although the online menu had a few most and asked if those were available and indeed they were. I ended up ordering the spinach ravioli. It was a little too creamy and salty for my taste but it was filling. The entire meal for 2 was around $55 plus tip. I really wish I would have had room for dessert cause I wanted to try the bread pudding!!
Incredible service at the bar. The jambalaya pasta (blackened, per my servers recommendation) was one of the best things I ate in New Orleans.

We went on a Tuesday night around 9 pm.  They were crowded but wasn't too bad.  They were super friendly & accommodating with our 7 month old child.  The Hurricane drink was the bomb.  Food was good as well.  We went on the lighter side & had salads.  The blackened fish on top was very tasty & everything was super fresh.  Big shoutout to our waitress Fiona.  By far the best service we had the entire 3 day trip in New Orleans.  Extremely nice, good with our baby, accommodating & just in general made the overall experience awesome.  We will definitely be back
Great spot for seafood. The New Orleans sampler is especially good.the crab cake is pretty good for non-Maryland.lol!

Awesome place to have a delicious causal meal.  The eggplant sticks were so good! It's like french fries, but with eggplant, who knew!  Cocktails were great as well (try the ginger beer with Jameson).  Most of all, we had an amazing server, Whitney, who was super attentive and gave us the best recommendations!  She was so friendly, it was such a treat for a New Yorker lol!  Try this place out!

First time to New Orleans and came here to try the local cuisine. This place was amazing and so friendly! Everyone was so accommodating and our serve Lloyd was incredible! Fast and friendly with amazing food. A must-have when in New Orleans!

My service was okay but my food was atrocious. I was going to have a talk with a manager but was informed by my server that because the food was cold  somehow the server would be blamed for it and that he would be made to pay for it. At first I found it hard to believe so I asked another server and it was confirmed. The dining room is also very dirty I waited in line for 45 minutes beside at a sticky table with mouse droppings in the corner of the floor by the table I was at. I should have believed the show Hell's kitchen I thought maybe they sold this place being so disgusting for ratings but it was factual. I wouldn't eat this place if it were free. Needless to say I didn't eat my meal paid my bill
Errol referred us here!  We saw him the night before at their other location.  He is an excellent server, the food was delicious with a great atmosphere.
Food was great, everyone at my table enjoyed. Waiter's recommendations were on point. We were served within just a few minutes of ordering - we were shocked!

This place came recommend but I really don't get why. I don't recommend. We waited in line outside for about 20 minutes which was fine since we had heard great things. Then once we ordered we waited another 45 minutes. When we asked the waiter what the deal was he said "didn't the host tell you it would be awhile". Since I wasn't feeling up to par it allowed me to drink my Sprite and chill but under normal circumstances I wouldn't have been happy. Since I wasn't up for eggs I ordered the crab cake burger. Bad choice: it had a hard crispy shell, a bready mushy inside, a hard dry bun and came with cold fries. The omelet hubby had was overcooked, the eggs Benedict had cheddar on top which was very strange, one egg was hard boiled. I'm a lover of the benny but I don't care for how they do it in New Orleans. I didn't taste the eggs Benedict but it didn't look too appealing.

Everything about this place is in line with the five star reviews except for the long wait to get in. We waited 25 mins to get in during our trip on Christmas Day. The restaurant itself was fairly empty giving the assumption that the wait was due to the backed up kitchen. 

Food was good - we tried the gator bites and seafood gumbo and shrimp po boy , all of which were sumptuous in portions and excellent in taste. Must try when in NOLA!

This place was great for our first night meal. The staff was super friendly and very accommodating. My friends ordered the gumbo and loved it. I got the Rockefeller Oysters which were delicious and the friend fish was tasty.
All together I would definitely visit this spot again. Oh I forgot to mention the Hurricane....GREAT!
Great service and Great food had the Redfish Oceana delicious wife had blackened shrimp salad.
Thee best chicken al fredo I've ever had hands down.  Been there three times since get the same thing.  Sooooo good.

The red fish was amazing! Great service as well.  Whitney was awesome! Very attentive with great customer service.  The manager even walked around and checked on each table.  Great first time experience here with both the yummy tasting food and awesome service! Would definitely recommend.

Just ok. Four days later I can barely remember what I ordered. I think it was some fish and it was good. The drink menu was also good but our waiter was not familiar with it. On a busy Saturday night, there was very little wait. That probably should have been a sign. It was clean and we didn't wait an excessive time for our food.
This restaurant was wonderful. Great service, fun staff. RedFish special just melted in my mouth

We finally tried this place out since it was a must-try in NOLA. I don't know what the hype is about? The food is average, the service is bad (even on a not-so-busy day), and the place is old and smells. You can definitely get a better experience elsewhere.

Absolutely loved it. Great food, and the service was spectacular. The food was very rich and yummy. Good food for the money you paid for the food. We had the seafood gumbo and I have to say I would return just for that! They were very accommodating to seating us very quickly because we were in a rush. Will be back.

This was our first restaurant in New Orleans.  We enjoyed the atmosphere.  The drinks were bomb.  The seafood platter was very nice, especially the catfish.  The alligator bikes were very good.  Funny, we think alligator tastes like chicken/pork.  Ribs were ok.  Oysters were pretty good.  Fried shrimp were small and I picked off most of the breading.  Rice and beans were good.
Good food and excellent service. Shrimp platter is huge. Gumbo is good. Will be back when we come to NO

We waited in what seemed like a long line but for a party of 6 were seated in about 20 mins on a Sunday night. This place is huge! Crab cakes and the crawfish sauce were excellent. My redfish étoufée was tasty but dry, and cold. The jambalaya and greens on the side were cold too but also very delicious. All their fried seafood (catfish, shrimp Poboys, crawfish tails) were standard but their fries were especially good. Dishes are generous.. we should have shared. Service was fabulous!

FABULOUS ALL AROUND!!! Service was outstanding and the food was delicious. The Catfish Lafourche was to DIE FOR!!! It would rank right up there with 5he best thing I've ever eaten. The crab cakes were hot and flakey and a perfect start. Will recommend and will return next time I'm in NOLA.

Blackened redfish was dry and overcooked. Fries were warm, not hot. Gator sausage was juicy, but didn't taste much different than any pork sausage I've had.
Service was friendly and fast. Long line out front was scary but we were seated in 15 minutes.
First dinner ever in New Orleans and the bar has been set pretty low...

An outstanding breakfast this morning.  The crab cakes on english muffins with eggs and crawfish was tasty and wholesome.  My wife had the omelet and it was equally excellent.  We highly recommend this restaurant as they are consistent in both food and service.  Megan provided excellent service.  She was friendly and we got a little Lanippae as she shared her knowledge of the local area.

The meal was fair.  The poor boy bun was like plain white bread with little flavor.  Cat fish was ok  Blackened redfish was good but we have had better.  Its better than average Bourbon street but there is better food in town.  It is good that they serve till 1pm.  Our waiter Chris was excellent!  Very attentive, friendly and easy to engage.  He could train other Bourbon street waitstaff.
I had the Oceana Redfish entree. Service from Mary was outstanding! The redfish was great too! They work hard to serve food fast! We had a great time! Thank you!

My friends and I are visiting from Houston and Oceana's was our first stop. Alex was so nice and gave the most amazing service we've ever had! He gave us information on where to go to have a good time and he made our experience a 5 star one.

My first in NO and we decided to eat here. Best decision I ever made. From the moment we entered the restaurant, we were treated like royalty. Nice, friendly workers greeted us as we walked to our table. Our server was very helpful and knowledgeable. Our meals were delicious and perfectly cooked. I had blackened catfish. Highly recommend it. Then to top off a perfect meal, we had the bananas foster ice cream cake. Wow. Please don't miss out on the place. Best in NO

SOOOO GOOD! 
The customer service was outstanding and the food was amazing, we came back twice in a row on our trip. It was my mothers birthday and they treated her so nice, the dessert they gave us I bought some for my plane ride home. 
Can't wait to come back to NOLA
The morning server, Meghan, rocked!!! She made amazing suggestions and the food was delicious!!! Try the blackened alligator! Yummy!!
Wonderful service, wonderful food.  Best we have eaten in NOLA!  Crab cakes, Ahi Tuna are absolutely wonderful
The food was excellent!!! I had the seafood platter (fried shrimp, fried catfish, and fried oysters). I will definitely be back here on my next trip to New Orleans.
The food was nasty and cold. The crab cakes was nasty as hell!!! Yuck Chef Ramsey was right!!!

When you want typical New Orleans restaurant, Oceana fits the bill. The food is delicious and a wonderfully seasoned. My husband's crab cake burger was delicious according to him. The chargrilled oysters were different than what I a used to, but they were delicious. My po'boy was a little short on shrimp, however, the size of the ones I had made up for it. Our server, Chantay, was excellent and the made the experience even more wonderful.  

The music was not to loud which was nice because my husband and I were able to talk to each other without yelling. Totally recommend Oceana if you are in the Quarter.

Hostesses where so sweet! We asked to sit in the coolest area of the restaurant. They sat us upstairs where we were able to over look a cute courtyard! We ordered 2 types of gumbo: the seafood and chicken/sausage and the fried shrimp po boy.The seafood gumbo was the best and the shrimp boy had an amazing sauce with French fries that had a great seasoning to it! The decor is cute and ambience was quintessential to the NOLA feel.

This was my first authentic Cajun food experience. So glad it was here! Came based on their reviews and was not disappointed. The food was amazing and the staff made it a great experience all around. Would highly recommend.

Love it
I had the fish special and hubby had beef and we were both happy.
Fiona our waitress was an absolute doll.  Super friendly and made the experience even better.  If in the French Quarters stop on in.  Enjoy

Used yelp 24 to order my dessert. I was craving and ordered the Bananas Foster ice cream cake. Picked up my order in 10 minutes, stayed at the Royal Sonesta on Bourbon street, only two minutes away. As I got to Oceana it was very easy to pick up my dessert I ordered. Went to the bar inside the restaurant gave them my name and picked up my dessert. Easy peasy!

I love this restaurant, I even planned a surprise engagement party here!

I was in the Hyatt Regency on a trip and decided to order dinner thru Grubhub.  It said 55-65 mins for delivery so i ordered early about 4:40pm.
When dinner didn't arrive with the hour i called the restaurant and was told it hadn't left the restaurant yet.  After numerous calls to grubhub and just shy of 2 hours my meal showed up.  The delivery guy was on a bike in the pouring rain.  My order was the last in his insulated bag.  Needless to say it was freezing cold, the portion was also much smaller then i received in the restaurant.  I would not suggest delivery.

My boyfriend and I came here on a Monday night and were promptly seated. Our server, Mary, was very attentive and super friendly! She recommended the chargrilled oysters with wine and spinach sauce & crab on top. It was delicious! We also had the crawfish etoufee and it was my boyfriend's favorite dish. The etoufee was especially delicious when dipped with bread.  Overall, our dishes were amazing and Mary & everyone else (hostesses, food runners, etc) provided excellent service. We had an incredible time and will definitely be back to visit on our next trip to New Orleans!

This is the second most reviewed place in the area so we decided to go there for lunch today. We ordered gator tail bites (half fried half blackened), seafood gumbo and shrimp poboy. I am a foodie and like to try new cuisines and I loved this place. Our server Ashleigh was really friendly and helpful. There was a wait for 15 mins to get the table but they served the food quickly and good part was it was open on Christmas Day also. Will definitely recommend !! It is a must try place in NOLA !

I love oceans grill! Anytime we're in new Orleans its our first stop. Fresh oysters and food, great drinks, friendly attentive staff and always delicious chef specials. If you're looking for gator, come get you a po boy! It's awesome!

I had the taste of new Orleans and it was very tasty. The hubby had the fried seafood platter which was just as good. Great atmosphere. Hubby said the bread pudding was "just like I had as a kid", but the crème brulee was very disappointing.

The food here was amazing. The servers and hostess were very friendly. Our appetizers were brought out by one of the kitchen staff and he was really nice and courteous as well. The drinks were strong a delicious and the food was so delicious! I've never had gator tail bites but I decided to try them (because when in Rome right? Lol) ! It also came out relatively quick. Fun atmosphere. Jamal our server was nice and knowledgeable and had a great memory. Definitely stop here if your in NOLA.

Its okay, definitely not impressed.  There is no wait list, so line up out the door and hope its not raining (and it definitely isn't worth waiting in the cold to eat here). When they do finally seat you, be careful the floor was as slick as ice (from the grease not water).

The service from our waiter was very quick (4 stars).  Unfortunately the beer was watered down or old (or both)... an IPA should never taste like a coors lite... only theirs did.  The gator tail was pretty good (both blackened and fried).  The entrees were lacked quality.  The vegetable of the day was corn maque... or jambalaya... not sure which, as jambalaya was a cup of rice with a teaspoon of sauce, mostly dirty rice. On to the redfish, it was blackened well, and spiced as expected, but overcooked.  

If I had a do over, I'd skip this place.

The food was amazing, the service was outstanding and the atmosphere was pleasant and relaxed.  The crab cakes were the BEST I have ever had. Ashleigh was our server and made great menu recommendations.  Will definitely return repeatedly before our trip ends. Huge oysters!!
It's ok restaurant. Exceptionally long wait times. Food is not that great. Looks for places else where go to this place.

I went to Oceana for the second time this past weekend. It was nothing short of amazing. This time I had the crab cake appetizer and shrimp Alfredo. Everything was delicious and full of flavor as always. It is unbelievable how fast the food comes out no matter how packed  the restaurant is! This is one of my favorite restaurants hands down. I live 3 hours away and would drive here once a week if I could. Exceptional!!
Great food. The oysters were amazing. Stopped in for breakfast also. Paw Paws corn beef hash and bloody Mary have amazing flavors. Our server Whitney was very good.

Would have been a five star if the staff was better. Had party of 9 for lunch. They kept stating that our table was "almost" ready. Only to find that it wasn't.  We recommended that they put 3 tables together and voila, we were ready to be seated. Food great, staff not so much...

We had a large party, with a reservation and it still took time to have us seated.  The food looked good, but took 45 minutes for the entree to make an appearance.  Three of us ordered the same thing and all three of us received different results.  We ordered dessert but ended up leaving after waiting another 45 minutes for it to arrive.

The outside chairs want to make you shoot people and are highly uncomfortable.  I would not recommend using this place.

LOVED the food here !!! If you come to New Orleans you have to come to this restaurant! The food here was amazing ..the staff was amazing ..the space was amazing! We came here on a Friday night so naturally it was pretty crowded.. we waited outside on line before going in. Once we got in, we sat on a bench and waited for our hostess to take us to our table. 

Once we got in, the service was pretty quick and the food came out even quicker. I had the "Mardi Grah pasta" and my sister had the "Fettuccine Alfredo". The food was very well cooked, the shrimp and crawfish in my dish was excellent. This was by far the best restaurant we've eaten at so far in New Orleans. A must try!!

Very nice staff and very courteous hostess! They accommodated our large group in a very short time frame. The restaurant is big and very centrally located right off Bourbon. I wasn't very impressed with the gumbo but my Po Boy was tasty and everyone seemed to be pleased with their meal.

Oceana Grill always hits home when I come to New Orleans. The special is always a go to and definitely worth getting. Also my waiter/server Whitney was awesome. She has a charming personality and is going to make a great lawyer some day.

One of the best restaurants in New Orleans! I had the blackened  redfish pontchartrain over jalapeño cornbread dressing with shrimp and garlic sauce. Oh my gosh, I cannot stop dreaming about this meal! The jalapeño cornbread dressing was the best thing I've ever eaten! I rarely eat my entire plate when I'm at restaurants, but there was not a drop of food left on my plate. I'm totally not ashamed of that either! Lol. Do yourself a favor, and go to Oceana!

Wait was long, food was good.  I would recommend.  
Just be prepared to wait.   
First time in New Orleans had a blast.

Super staff from the door security to the wait staff
Great food friendly and helpful staff best dinner ever
Nice atmosphere and super nice service! Love the fried catfish platter, soft and crispy catfish!

My experience was Wonderful, we arrived after breakfast and was able to order from the Breakfast Menu.   Our Server Whitney was a Sweetheart, just a pleasant young Lady and very knowledgeable of the ingredients in  the varied dishes and Spice levels in the Menu choices.  It was our pleasure.  I recommend as a Must in LA.

I don't know what to say anymore.  Everytime I go to a restaurant in Nola it's a rating of great,  magnificent,  amazind. Well here we go again, Mr. Rockefeller could not get a better Oyster Rockefeller  anywhere else.. the oyster po' boy was very good, but I never had one before so I can't compare. Be sure task for Jon to get outstanding service. My only complaint with this town is they have all these unknown  funky beers, but none of the greats except Heineken.Also make sure to go go their courtyard so you can smoke a cigar. Oh, and they have Stella Artois,  but it's not on the menu

Worst food experience in New Orleans for us.

Service was decent even though he did not seem to care that food was mostly untouched.

Taste of New Orleans was not even average.
I am not a sea food fan so ordered the ribs. I know that this is not a rib place but then do not have it on the menu and brag about how it falls off the bone. It was probably the worst ribs I have had and it was under a gallon of sauce to apparently make up for lack of flavor. 

Forgot to mention the soggy bread my wife was given for dipping. Apparently it was predipped. Should have sent the food back but not our thing so we paid our bill and left.

There are hundreds of options available so do yourself a favor and avoid this place

We got helped right away, but after that the service was extremely slow. We didn't get any refills on our drinks and were charged a service fee of 18% with a party of 5 with 4 eating. 

The food was good, I received the blackened chicken Alfredo and tried a bite of the other 3 meals. All great food but service was just terrible.
Excellent food - tuna was cooked perfect a drinks was fantastic- best place we ate in Nola

We came to New Orleans and stayed at Hotel La Marais in the French Quarter. We searched for places for brunch and right next door was Oceana Grill, which had fantastic reviews on Yelp. Plus the night before there was a huge line in front. I decided to go because some of the family wanted breakfast food and I wanted traditional New Orleans /Cajun food and at 10:30am they served both! We all have a fantastic meal. For breakfast dishes we ordered the Crawfish Omelet, Seafood Omelet, Biscuits & Gravy and all was amazing. The Biscuits & Gravy was the BEST I've ever had. I had the barbecue shrimp which has such a good flavor, but I also ordered A Taste of New Orleans which came with Red Beans & Rice, Jamabalaya, and etouffee.  All of it was also the BEST I've ever had during our visit here. Each had so much flavor. The portions were generous and we were all very full. The breakfast dishes each came with a biscuit and hash browns and those were so good as well. The biscuits were moist and had a little honey on top. Although it came with strawberry jelly it wasn't needed because the biscuit had enough sweetness with just the honey. I highly recommend this place. The service was excellent. We were able to get a reservation that morning. The entire family had a wonderful meal!

The fried catfish platter is really good. The service was outstanding and the food came in record time. The team of workers seem to work together very well, from the kitchen staff to the waiters to the busing table crew and the manager. Everyone was very pleasant. And the food was good.
Awesome dinner. Whitney was our server, made us feel at home and had a great recommendation for our meal. Definitely coming back on our next trip to Nola!!!

There are lots of great Restaurants in New Orleans LA and we actually went to the Oceana Grill at the recommendation of the manager of our hotel. Glad we did as food and service were outstanding. We were fortunate to get a table out in the court yard which is nice this time of the year. We had oysters and shrimp in barbeque sauce which were both very good. Errol was our waiter and was very friendly and did a great good tending to our every need. Definite recommend it at night and only wish we had found out about it sooner so we could have tired the breakfasts. Definitely will return if back in the big easy!

First, don't think about going to this place if you're already hungry. You're going to have to stand outside and wait. Think about going here before you get hungry and then get in line. The atmosphere is nice, the service is good, and the food is excellent. Crawfish etouffee was perfect I had asked for blackened alligator and I got fried alligator instead - that was really the only problem.

Christophe was on top of his game, and way amazing. My food came out fresh and the bartender was insanely helpful and quick. Eve one else at the bar felt so as well. I had a tour I needed to get to and I swear he got me a bread pudding in under 5 minutes. Not only that, it was raining and he got me a poncho so I wasn't dripping wet during my tour. Yes they sell ponchos, how amazing right. Anyway eat her and ask for him also.

This restaurant is a must go if you are visiting New Orleans. The food was so fresh and flavorful. The service was absolutely phenomenal. I tried gator bites for the first time and I fell in love. And not to mention I had a seafood pasta that had seafood in every single bite. I am drooling while writing this review. Do yourself a favor and go eat at this wonderful restaurant.

Definitely a restaurant to check out when in NOLA. Crawfish/Cajun Fries are a MUST! If you enjoy the taste of mushrooms, you'll definitely enjoy this meal. Perfect amount of crawfish tails on top as well. I would say it's shareable with either a big group or just two people. My boyfriend and I also shared the "Taste of New Orleans" which consists of jambalaya, crawfish etouffee, red beans with rice and sausage. This was a great platter to try out if you want a sample of some of NOLA's traditional dishes. They were very kind enough to split our dishes as well! Most of the locals we came across, recommended the to get the gator blackened. Definitely brings out the taste of the meat more than it being fried.

I was looking at places to eat near the French Quarter, and I stumbled upon this place due to the overwhelming amount of positive reviews. I sure got what I aspired!

When we entered the restaurant, our waiter was friendly and seated us immediately as we entered. She gave us water quickly and took our order when we were ready. 

I had the Redfish Oceana and Fried Gator Bites. The redfish was fresh, and breaded well. The crawfish and mushroom sauce, with actual crawfish tails, went well with the crisp fish. The gator bites weren't very special, though they did a good job breading and cooking it. You could taste that unique gator taste.

All for a modest price.

Good local food in a wonderful setting. My meal was reasonable and tasted good. I have had better in NO. Not much of a beer selection with a few local breweries represented. Make a reservation if on a weekend or you plan to arrive to eat at 6 or later in the evening.

The food here was amazing! We came here as a a group of 7, and we all had no complaints. My boyfriend and I had the New Orleans sampler (as a recommendation from our waitress) and the BBQ shrimp. The shrimp, etouffe, and red beans and rice were amazing! The jambalaya left something to be desired, but I was willing to overlook that because the etouffe made up for it. I tried some of our friends' charbroiled oysters and blackened alligator and they did not disappoint. I'm STILL raving about the chargrilled oysters as that was my first time trying it and it was fantastic!

We loved this restaurant! We had reservations so were taken in immediately despite the long line waiting to come in. We were greeted by everyone we passed on the way to our table and felt so welcome. The crab cakes are the best I have ever tasted - full of crabmeat and topped with a delicious sauce with shrimp and more crab! Entree was Redfish Oceana which was bursting with flavor - the most fresh tasting fish with a beautiful sauce on top. THe greens were so tasty and the portions were very healthy. Best restaurant so far in NOLA and we have tried quite a few already!

Unlike many tourists who visit NOLA, i did not have a very good experience with the eats.  Oceana Grill was yelped for the good crab cakes and the waitress and locals also recommended the crab cake.  I'm from Maryland and should have know better because i ordered it anyway.  I was tired of shrimp and i do not eat oysters.  Well......it was the worse crab cake i have had in my life.  I guess the folks who recommend the crab cake have never had a crab cake in Baltimore, MD.  Granted....we have some bad crab cakes here too, but Oceana Grill should just take it off the menu.  My friend ordered the BBQ shrimp, not traditional BBQ sauce, but a spicy cajun sauce.  The shrimp were good, but did not come with rice or pasta....just shrimp in a bowl.  The bread was stale.  I'm giving the place 2 stars because our waitress was very nice and she felt bad that i hated the crab cake.  They took my dinner off the bill.  I ordered a small bowl of gumbo, which was also not good.

The food was delicious and the service was excellent.  We ate there for lunch and liked it so much we came back for dinner the same day.

The Charbroiled Oysters are so tender and the sauce is so delicious.  We also had a Catfish special that was fantastic.  It was the best place we ate while we were in New Orleans.
All the dishes ordered by us were well cooked, tasty though I would have expected some more spice. Excellent service even with the Friday evening rush.

Always a go too spot when we visit!  The crab cakes are the best I have had anywhere!  Tried the Cajun fries, smothered in a crawfish cream sauce... huge portion!   And they were good!  NOTE: there is always  a line, so go early...

Bloody Mary was very good too!
Rome is the best! He was very helpful and friendly with our trip. Great guy, would recommend any day!
Fried food tasted like it sat for a long time before it got to our table. 'Signature' redfish dish didn't have much flavor. Crab cakes were ok. Disappointed after seeing 4.5 star rating.
Crabcakes were amazing. Loved the relaxed vibe and the staff was super friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend if you're in search of a great food in a casual setting in the French Quarter.

This place is very popular, but I don't really know why.  I have been twice.  First time was fine, but not remarkable, but I thought I would give it a second try thinking maybe just did not order whatever it is that draws the crowds. 

Went on a Sunday night.  We had reservations, so we walked past the long line waiting outside.  We had to wait about 15 minutes for our table, but that isn't unexpected on a busy night.

We were seated but then waiting a notable amount of time for a waiter.  We ordered the "famous oysters" appetizer, a shrimp poboy, an oyster poboy, and a Greek salad with shrimp.  The oysters were very good.  I assume their grilled  oysters are the primary draw, but unless ordering a huge number, hard to make a meal on them. 

When the entrees came, they brought my daughter a shrimp poboy instead of oyster. We realized this after the runner left them, so we notified the woman who was working the station next to us (not our waiter who we did not see).  She said she would get us the right dish. 

No replacement came and our daughter said it was ok if my wife and I began eating.

About midway through our meals, we finally saw our waiter again (first time since we ordered).  We let him know and he took my daughter's incorrect plate. 

As my wife and I were finishing our meals the correct poboy finally came with no real apology. 

The salad was fine and the poboys were fine but nothing special.  The bill arrived with no adjustment.  As we by this time wanted to get going we paid and left.  We had been thinking of dessert, but that wasn't even offered to us.  We did get a drink refilled, but not by our waiter as it was during the time of his long absence. 

Much better choices nearby for same price and better quality.

Loved it! Great restaurant. When we first got there, there was a long line of people waiting to get in, luckily we had a reservation. 

The food was just amazing!!! Everything, from the alligator tail bite appetizer, to the main course of red fish. Just delicious and well cooked food. 

The service was great as well. Very attentive staff. 

Location is right in the French Quarter, near the famous Bourbon street. 


Highly recommended and must visit if you are in the area and a seafood lover.

I enjoyed the meal here. I knew what I wanted but too hungry to go through the menu. The bartender ordered me exactly what I wanted.  I'm not sure if they had it together on the menu. The food tasted good. Would definitely eat here again if in the area.

The line was ridiculous, but it seems as though they move you through as fast as possible. Luckily, there are two or three floors of dining space (each with their own bar).

The food was really good; I had the fried shrimp platter with fries. I was honestly surprised at how much food they gave me. They also have a great selection of specialty cocktails.

The red beans and rice was slap your mama good!!!

I'm a Cali girl with Creole genes so my taste for real authentic Creole food be on point. The Bay Area is lacking a real Creole place so I fell in love again when I came here.

The staff was beyond friendly. I dined alone so they sat me upstairs by the window, which I liked because I could look outside. 

Prices are more expensive than other places in the area that offer the same type of food but I'm not complaining. I will be back here next time I visit New Orleans.
Great food, friendly staff. We are there twice in two days. We will definitely return.

It is a crime to make such delicious food.  I had the pleasure of eating here today. I must admit that it exceeded my expectations.  Everything was so succulent and fresh. I highly recommend ordering the gumbo and the etouffee.
Came here on vacation. Awesome food and even better service. I came in here 3 mins before closing one night and they welcomed me and cooked my food like it was mid day. Please check it out !!

Oceana Grill was great! All the staff was friendly and accommodating. I had a Bahama MAMA for my drink! That was great! And for my main dish I had crawfish fettuccine which was delicious. During the meal, a drunk patron came over and started harassing our table and she was dropping sauce from her sandwich all over my clothes. A manager came over and swiftly handled the situation, which I appreciated. All in all I would definitely come back and recommend to anyone else looking for a great place to eat in New Orleans!
Come see Mary here great service and great food she is really funny and friendly they are also having a contest for the best waiter so please help her out
I've been coming to New Orleans for many years and this is one of my favorite places. I recommend this place to everyone and I've yet to be disappointed.
Whitney was amazing with our 8 top! Will be coming back to visit for our next trip for Mardi Gras

I wasn't impressed with Oceana Grill.   The drinks waiter was excellent, but the other waiter did not even ask us if our food was good. 

The quality of the food was good, but it wasn't a "wow" for us. The restaurant was busy, but not super busy and yet it took over 70 minutes for our food to arrive. For the money, it wasn't worth it... 

We won't be heading back to this restaurant.  We had much better experiences at other restaurants in New Orleans.

Order the Red Fish Plate! Gator Bites too! I went with a group of 17 people for my 25th birthday. We were worried if we would be able to get seated, but once our whole group arrived were seated shortly after. Shout out to our server Whitney who had a great attitude and was super helpful, and to the rest of the staff/servers that sang HB to our table. The birthday bread pudding was delicious! We came here bc we were recommended it by 3 different locals and we were pleasantly surprised. Will definitely come back our next time in NOLA!
Chantay is the best!!!!!!! She made our dinning experience THAT much better! We had the Cajun fries: 5 stars, seafood platter: 5 stars and mari gras pasta: 5 stars. The hurricane was yummy as well!
So good! Loved everything! The wait in line was not long at all! The server and hostess was nice

Four of us had lunch at Oceana Grill on Valentines Day. All four meals were excellent.  Catfish just right, oysters hot and juicy, shrimp plump and even the fries were great. Our waiter Demarcus was very attentive and polite. We will definitely be back on our next visit.

Went here when I was on vacation. I had shrimp and a drink with dry ice on the bottom of it. Unfortunately I can't upload a video of the drink bubbling. The food was good and so was the drink. It is a big restaurant with a cool patio section.
This place was fantastic. If you're looking for top notch seafood, look no further. Ask for Kim - she's the best.
Super yummy food. I had Paw Paws breakfast which included corned beef hash and poached eggs. Delicious!  Coffee is superb. A great way to start my morning!

The dreaded Holiday Inn Express got one thing right - they sent us here for dinner. Apparently, this is the only place they know and ask the front desk for the 10% off coupon.

The staff here is unattentive and non-responsive. We had to ask a different waitress to find ours to get a refill on water. The host sat us on 2nd floor at the farthest table from the door on a slow Thursday night that had tables downstairs and bar seats available.

Ordered a dozen raw oysters. Definitely make sure to put lemon and cocktail sauce because these are average at best when compared to Acme and Royal House.

Had the Red snapper. This fish was HUGE! Make sure you know what's on your entree before you order. This one had a creamy mushroom sauce that added good flavor in a small quantity but too much of it and your fish is soggy.

Ate here with a group of coworkers on a lunch break on Wednesday. We were all in town for a conference and had landed only a couple hours prior. Our waitress, Pam K, instantly helped us let our hair down by suggesting a round of tasty "Cajun" bloody Mary's. The food was ok, but not amazing, which is the main reason for 3 stars. We mostly got po'boys which hit the spot but were not anything particularly special. However, Pam K deserves 5 stars for being fun and hospitable. She started our trip off right by encouraging us to drink and be merry and we have been drinking nonstop ever since. Whoever came up with the "to go cup" idea should get a Nobel peace prize.

Our waiter Jerry was absolutely great this morning. He was very friendly and personable. He made sure that our glasses were full and our food was warm when he brought it. Thank you so much jerry, we will be back to see you.

First the good: staff is very friendly, helpful, and well trained. This place is always busy and has a great vibe. The food is flavorful and seasoned well but the problem, in my opinion is, that because of the huge volume they put out of the kitchen, much is pre-made in mass quantity like you would get at a buffet. I had their house special Red Fish. The flavor was good but you could tell the fish, the greens, and the mashed potatoes has all been cooked hours ahead and served up from chafing dishes. So everything was buffet line temperature and quality. That was disappointing but not unexpected given the location off Bourbon St and what you can get away with when +90% of your business is from tourists who won't be returning. I don't want to sound too harsh, because the food was seasoned and prepared well, but loses a lot as it sits waiting for someone to order it. If you like Bubba Gump's type chains, you'll probably like this place too.

If a restruant offers a discount and it's not new or out of the way be wary. 

Yesterday the line was out the door.  Today's rain has kept the crowd down. 

Wanted the famous oysters but the grill was broken.  Ordered the shrimp appetizer. It says 6shrimp, but only 5 came. When I asked they said it was because they were larger than usual. Sounds like a joke.. jumbo shrimp. Haha. They were not jumbo shrimp for sure. The shrimp tasted good. The sauce was peppery. 

Close to my hotel and better than their restruant options.

We were told to go here by a family member who promised that we wouldn't be disappointed. Well she was right! The crab cakes with the crawfish sauce were awesome!   All meat and no bread filling. Was told that the jambalaya pasta was great also. The chargrilled oysters are a must! The only downside was the long wait and the kitchen kept messing up one of our orders,  but overall we still enjoyed it.
Nice place, good food, great service. Ice cold draft beer. Right on Bourbon St.
BEST Seafood Omelet ever and the Crawfish Omelet was incredible. Had Kasey L as our server. Very nice, quick to service and simply a pleasure. Highly recommended.

Tijdens onze muzikale rondreis van New Orleans naar Memphis en Nashville hebben we uiteindelijk in New Orleans het lekkerst geregen; bij Oceana Grill. Net niet te zout, goede porties en heerlijke gerechten. Ook keurige bediening, ondanks de drukte.

My wife and her girlfriends stumbled upon this place on there last trip out to New Orleans. She raved about this place and loved it so much, she insisted she and I visit upon our return trip out. 

Well, she was right, the food was incredible! Breakfast, lunch and dinner! The wait staff and service was amazing! 

You must try the Pain Purdue for breakfast - LIFE CHANGING!!
Fantastic way to start the new year. Great food. Delicious drinks and great service. They do follow the NOLA edict of Laissez les Bon Temps Roulez!! Highly recommend this place.

Super schön und mitten im French Quarter gelegen. Nahe zur Bourbon St. 

Das Essen war super lecker - Gumbo danach Blackened Redfish dazu einen gut gemischten Cuba Libre

Oceana Grill is my favorite downtown cajun seafood. I come for their oysters with the special sauce. To die for. And their gator is awesome. A favorite plate of mine is The Taste of New Orleans. Always a favorite to stop by wgen we drop into NOLA.

Awesome food! Went twice in one week... thank you to Tammy and Kim for the excellent service and friendly chats. The taste of New Orleans is delish and  the bread pudding too good to pass up! Sometimes the line appears longer than necessary because we were seated within 15 minutes each time.

Wir sind auf der Suche nach einem guten Frühstück hier vorbeigekommen - reingegangen und nicht enttäuscht worden. Das Essen sah zwar nicht gar so appetitlich aus, doch das ist bei vielen Speisen der Cajun-Küche so. Ich hatte Paw Paw's Cajung Breakfast und wollte ein Bier dazu. Kellner John hat verschiedene Angebote erwähnt, konnte aber nicht sagen, welches Bier wohl das hopfigste wäre. Also ist er zur Bar gegangen und mit einem wunderbaren New England IPA (Holy Roller von der lokalen Urban South Brewery) gekommen, hat mich gefragt "what do you think of it" und hat sich sichtlich gefreut, mir etwas nach meinem Geschmack serviert zu haben.
We went there last night. We got the grilled and blackened red fish. Both were awesome and we'd go back for sure .
Omg. Must try. Blackened alligator. Don't bother with the fried!!! The crawfish etouffe was perfect and the fried catfish was perfectly tender and moist.

This place has very nice outdoor seating. Being from out of town we tried the alligator bites which were good. The shrimp po-boys sandwich was extremely good and everything was decently priced. Would highly recommend! Our waitress even offered to give us to-go waters as we told her we were tourists and were spending the day walking around.

So good, we went back twice this visit. We were smart enough to make a reservation the second time. MAKE A RESERVATION!! Or you will be standing on the street for a while. Place an order for the "secret fries." Trust me, you won't regret it. Service both times were amazing. I enjoyed a repeat performance of the Redfish Oceania and it was as great as I remembered. The second time, I ordered Cajun Jambalaya Pasta. It was delicious. Everyone in our party raved about their food.

Came for lunch with the kids. Nice little seafood joint. Tracy had the fried oyster Po boy and I had the shrimp. They were both good. The only thing was I prefer lettuce to cole slaw on mine... But the shrimp and oysters were fried perfectly. Ethan had fried catfish that was also fabulous. Baylors fried cheese was delish. But I think my favorite was the jalapeño hush puppies YUM! Next time I'm gonna save room for dessert!
Always delicious!  This is always my first stop when in NoLa with out of town guests!  Our waitress today, Whitney, was so helpful and friendly!
I visited here for my bday and I got the New Orleans pasta! It was extremely creamy and VERY deliciousssss! Nice atmosphere! Nice wait staff!

We stopped here late night during our trip. I hadn't checked any reviews, but it was open, and we were hungry. 
SO GLAD we stopped here. 
I had the blackened chicken alfredo. BF had BBQ shrimp along with a pasta dish, but can't remember the name of it. 
Too hungry to take pictures lol 
SO GOOD!!!!!
Luckily, I had left overs of my chicken alfredo, and ate some the next day as well  :) 
Our server, (I Wish I could remember his name was super friendly and patient with us). 
We would definitely eat here again.

Ocean grill was a good place to eat when we went the line wasn't too long we sat at the bar and ate lunch I ordered the taste of New Orleans and it was good . The bartender was super fun and very social and welcoming.

Pamela is the most excellent server I've ever had the pleasure to meet! She was attentive, comical and all around wonderful! The food was fantastic! I had the blackened chicken po' boy and I'm in love!!! I'll be coming back!!!

This is a nice spot in the French quarter. We got the Cajun jambalaya pasta and the taste of New Orleans- they were both delicious. The server gave us a coupon for free bread pudding the next visit. The restaurant looks like a bar but opens up to some seating in the back.
Service was spectacular. Ben and Taylor were fantastic. Set the pace for the food which was amazing and fast!

Such good food! We had the crab cake platter, and the duck with praline sauce. Both were excellent. The bread pudding was great. Nice atmosphere, good food, good service, good place for kids, too. Just around the corner from bourbon street, could be a plus for some.
Perfect casual restaurant in the French quarter. Fast service and good sea food and other dishes. A friendly and helpful staff made a nice evening.

Very disappointed after seeing a line out the door every night I was in New Orleans and reading the reviews I figured this place was great. I was wrong  The waitress never refilled our water I asked for more cocktail sauce never got it. The food was jus ok. Oysters had a fishy taste. The seafood platter was tasty but not crispy. The special was a fish that was dry and the trio plater with red beans was just ok. There are too many other places in the French Quarter that are fantastic to eat just ok food.

Kevin G. was amazing!!! His Service and food recommendations were fantastic. It was spot on with his explanations of the food which we weren't familiar with. He took care of our large group from my work very well. And everybody had a fantastic time!

Omg!! How I wish I could pick this entire place up and bring it to Los Angeles!! It's amazing, their mushroom sauce it's to die for!! We got the oysters, fries, and crab cakes just to start and we were utterly impressed! We came back the next night!

I have been in the restaurant industry for 10 years. After trying a bunch of place we stopped in this great restaurant. It had a clean atmosphere that was fun. We got to our table and David our server was friendly and awesome. We had the gator tail bite to start. They were amazing. After that I had the catfish poboy which was really great as well. This is a great place!!!! What really made it great was David. One of the best servers I have ever had.  Check this place out!!!!!
It was worth standing in line outside for 20 minutes.  Great chargrilled oyaters.  Strong drinks.
The food was great. Megan our waitress was great. I recommend eating here if in the city. Geaux Tigers and who dat saints

got some authentic food here. definitely enjoyed it for a first time trip to nola. staff was very friendly and we got seated within 10 mns even on a thursday night. i got bbq shrimp, cole slaw, and garlic mashed potatoes-- all was amazing. and the frozen passion fruit margarita was VERY good. restaurant was very spacious and the location is great (a 30 second walk from bourbon street). i will definitely come back here on my next trip to nola!

This was a  great, last minute dinner decision.  They sat us quickly and the food was delicious and appropriately priced.  

We had the fried shrimp platter and the Redfish Oceana and both were very tasty and ample portions.  Service was quick and friendly.  I would definitely go back.

Mardi Gras 2018!!!

Food here is pretty good. We ordered the Mardi Gras pasta and étouffée. First time having them and they were both pretty good. The flavor was on point. We also ordered the chargrilled oysters. Which were very good. Had them at another restaurant and thought they were a little salty. Here they were perfect. Only small issue, Our waiter was nice but not always available. Our table for two was small. We were sharing and had to switch the plates over as needed. Also it's on the pricier side. For the food I'll go back.

Amazing place and food! Super clean and super friendly service. I had the Fried Shrimp Po boy and it was huge but I enjoyed every bit. The red beans and rice were amazing as well had a nice spice to them. Make sure to try their amazing crab cakes! Brian was awesome!

The food was good, I would rate 4. The service not so good, I would rate 2. We had the blackened redfish etouffee, salads and drinks. Prices are reasonable for French quarter. Server was impersonal and kept us waiting to pay the bill. Red Fish Grill was much better.

Love the char grilled famous oysters. The rockerfeller was good too. Get half and half for discount. 
Bread on poboys is classic

Delicious crab cakes, Oceania's Famous Oysters never disappoints!!! Slight wait time but well worth every second of it. Good Southern Hospitality. Sazerac drink was on point. Gator Bites were good. Seafood platter cooked with caring hands fish oysters and shrimp not just thrown in same batch all appropriate levels of cook time. The Bread pudding was sweet but savory topped it off right!!!
Just great! That crawfish lightly battered was divine!!! I could just eat a whole plate of they! Barry our waiter was so friendly and cute too!

The food was good. I started with the blackened/fried alligator. My entree was the blackened redfish with greens and jambalaya. I had the banana fosters ice cream cake for dessert. 

My friends had the praline duck and blackened chicken. There dessert was praline pecan pie with vanilla bean ice cream. They both enjoyed there food.

This is our daily breakfast spot while visiting the French Quarter. You can close your eyes and point to anything on the menu and you'll be satisfied. The crab cakes Benedict was outstanding!!! Errol was an amazing server and has all the insight for whatever craving you have. He suggests the perfect meal!! Awesome spot for anytime of day and open late for the after bar hungries!!! A place to add to your visit.
Amazing place to eat a lot of variety. service was excellent. Waitress SARAH was best of our 3 day stay in Nola ! Best of all make a reservation and skip the line

Stopped by with a group of 10, food was awesome as was the service. Our waiter, Errol, even broke into a Lil Barry White at my request. Overall a great experience! would def recommend and also go back again when in town.

Tom S. PA

The food was cold, and we ordered a steak that was well done when we ordered it medium rare. Instead of recooking a new steak, they just kept cooking the same steak. We had to send it back twice, and when it came the third time, it was barely medium rare. The drinks were fun but the food and service was very lacking.

I got the crab cake platter and the boyfriend got the fried shrimp platter.  I would call the food mediocre.  It must just be me, I don't think I care for the spice that everything in New Orleans seems to be made with.  I don't know what this spice is.  It's not garlic or even jalapeno because there's not really a "taste" to it..  It's just spicy.

Anyway, the breading on the boyfriend's shrimp tasted the same as my crab cake, which tasted the same as the mushroom sauce they put on the crab cake.  So there was no real flavor to the food, other than this "spiciness".  I liked the first bite of his jalapeno hushpuppy.  But after the first bite, the "spice" overtook the flavor of the jalapeno and it ended up tasting just like everything else.  I did like the coleslaw and the pecan pie though.

As for the actual restaurant, it was nice enough.  The temperature inside was very warm, and it was very dimly lit.  But the waitress was nice and helpful.

Love the atmostphere here. The hostess sat us at a small table right next to the window, which allowed us to view the activities that were going on outside. I got a pasta dish. I believe it was cajun jambalaya pasta. It was quite salty for my taste. My bf got the shrimp poboy. It was delicious. The shrimp was fresh and crunchy. My favorite part about this restaurant was the swamp tea. It was serve in a small mason jar. The cool little smoke on top of the drink added a nice little feature to it. The taste was incomparable. Definitely a must try. They also have TVs for sports, just in case you're looking for a stop to watch a game like my bf did.

My second time here and the food is always amazing. We came in for breakfast around 10 and got a table right away but there was a line down the street when we left. The shrimp & grits aren't listed on the menu but they are available and were absolutely delicious. The seafood omelette and chicken sausage were great as well! We got a bottle of champagne to make mimosas for a great price. Our server was an middle age/older black man who was very helpful and friendly. 
Try the alligator here also!

We walked in on a whim, and I was so impressed. It was much, much larger than I expected. We were seated right away, the service was awesome, and the delicious food came out QUICK!  I went with a friend and we split the appetizer crab cakes and the catfish po boy. The appetizer came with two meaty crab cakes and a creamy, mushroom seafood sauce. They were fantastic. The sandwich was amazing. We had a lot of po boys during this trip, and I think this was my favorite. The catfish was perfectly cooked and the cole slaw was the perfect sweet touch. It came with plenty of tasty fries on the side. Our waiter was so helpful. He wrote down a list of local places we should hit before the end of our trip and told us about his favorites. The manager came over and he was equally as helpful, suggesting bars, restaurants, and places to see. Bonus, 10% off with your Yelp check-in!

Delicious fresh gumbo and friendly staff.  We had a problem with parkingbut I guess that everyone in New Orleans has that problem.  With we could have spent more time enjoying lunch.  It was very good!
Everything was really good.  I had the blackened redfish and oyster Rockefeller.  It was delicious.  I would definitely recommend this place.

This was one of the few places still open on a Tuesday night (10/2/18) The food was delicious!!!!! The chargrilled oysters, bbq shrimp were amazing! And our bartender Josha R. was such a great guy! He was great at his job and kept us happy the entire evening. My friend and I wanted to go back for to go food but we got too drunk living the good life in New Orleans!!!

Waited about 30 minutes for a table on a Saturday (not bad). Sat at the upstairs bar. Had the cajun jambalaya pasta. The sauce was really good, but the protein portion in the dish (shrimp and alligator sausage) was really scant for the price of the dish, so had to drop a few stars for that. Had the bread pudding for dessert & it was delicious.

Oceana, Oceana. So good you have to say it (and visit it) twice. Both times we came here to eat, we had fantastic service, delicious food, and solid drinks from this popular restaurant. 

AMBIANCE is warm and inviting. The New Orleans style is definitely represented in their art and decor, which was nice for our first dining experience in the city. The staff were quick and speedy with our food and drink orders.

ORDERED shrimp pasta, gumbo, catfish platter, shrimp po boy and macaroni and cheese, and bread pudding. 

FOOD was delicious with each bite. The gumbo and bread pudding were hands down the best food we had in New Orleans. The catfish reminded me of when my dad would fry it up for the whole family. The shrimp pasta had a nice flavor, and the macaroni and cheese left me wanting the recipe. The shrimp po boy was a bit dry, but the shrimp itself was tasty.

OVERALL a flavorful five. The kindness of the waiters, along with the speedy service and killer gumbo and bread pudding, earned a special place in my heart for Oceana Grill.
Amazing sea food. We tried a couple of vej and non vej dishes. Must try: crab cakes and their cake as dessert

This place was recommended by our hotel worker and so we went.  Food was amazing and everything you could want on the menu.  You have to order the country gravy it's the best anywhere.
