I went to lots of places this one I could have went to twice! Recommend it for breakfast.  Service is fast and good just what you want while on vacation

Started out by being told there was only bar seating while there were plenty of empty tables in the other bar area. The food however made up for it. The crab cakes were good, nothing mind blowing. The po'boy was one of the best I have had in the French Quarter. Filled full with shrimp, great remoulade, and cole slaw - the bread was good too. The fries were battered which I like but my wife was disappointed, difference of opinion. Lol

Not from New Orleans. Tried the alligator bites, shrimp platter and banana foster. Friends of mine had gumbo, and taste of New Orleans. This place was probably my favorite place to eat in New Orleans. The waiter was fun and helpful. Atmosphere was great.

This is one of my must stops when I come to the city. I've been coming here since 2005. Now with that being said this time I came and brought my children. Little did I know the following:
1. Kids meals do NOT come with beverage
2. If you have a group 5+ or hell possibly 4 people dining with you there is AUTOMATICALLY get gratuity added to your bill. This isn't just a 15% it's about 19%. 
(Thankfully our waiter was a kind enough to tell us and was a good waiter) 

Moral this may not be where I come back. Since prices have gone up and now this where a family 5 is considered a "BIG" party.

Thank you to the charming staff and servers!! Absolutely recommend this place worth the 15 minute wait! It's the perfect start to our NOLA trip! 

The New Orleans sampler and Oceana charbroiled oysters (not pictured).....were sooo good. Someone got the egg plant sticks and they were ok.

If you get a chance to request Dom or Dory as your waitress you will enjoy the southern hospitality!!

Friendly people, friendly service. Our server, Brian went out out of his way to make sure we were happy with the local beer we selected-Holy Roller IPA. Coming from California we were interested in local beer and local food--- Brian suggested the trifecta of Crawdad Etoufee, Jambalaya and Red Beans and Rice. The flavors of all 3 were outstanding and never knew Red beans and Rice could taste so good- The Andouille sausage strip added to the yummy dish......
My friend had the Blackened Ahi which was seared perfectly with flavor packed collard greens and more Jambalaya.... we both left very happy!!

Always an absolute pleasure. Had blackened gator bites as a poboy and it was fantastic. Always willing to do something new or different to accommodate guests. Open late (for food) and awesome bloody Mary's

Live the seafood gumbo. Best grained oyster ever!
Our waitress is Whitney, great service

The only complaint I had was the temperature.  It was rather cold. That aside, everything else was excellent: the food,  the service,  the music and the vibe.   The taste of New Orleans was outstanding.
Good meal, HUGE portions....went back a second time, and shared with my wife....casual atmosphere...very reasonable pricing...will go back again...

- Food was down home and tremendous. If Ahi Tuna was going to be tasty, it was going to be blackened and Cajun style. I was not disappointed! And the New Orleans BBQ Shrimp with the extra broth for bread-soaking was mm-mm-good!
- Presentation is not why you would come here. You come here for the down home cooking and feel.
- Aesthetics were right up my alley. The place was laid back, easy going. It is definitely not upscale; it is down home and a place for eating!
- Wait staff was courteous, jovial. Dmitri was great!
- Prices were reasonable with $8 appetizers and $20 entrees.
- Would I go again? Absolutely plan to make a second visit during our week long vacation!!!

Who would have thought this place would have such wonderful food?  To tell the truth, our Uber driver recommended it. Dang glad he did. Maw Maw's breakfast is flat out awesome. All kinds of flavor in a huge bowl. It's enough for 2 people. Our waiter Ponce was awesome as well. Continues to check on us and he made the recommendation for this dish. Great place and a MUST try if your in the French Quarter.

All I can say is omg if I cld gove 6 stars I wld the food was amazing and i had a little of almost everything my shark bites was tender and delicious my madi gra pasta was amazing just know America was making their garlic bread wrong all this time it dnt need to b crispy their garlic bread I'd very soft and very god lordddddd ..the redfish was so good and wht can I say about the collard greens so tastey and I thought my mom made them best ..the garlic mash was good and my man enjoyed the oysters so much he said it taste like nothing he ever had they had a smoke taste to them pur waitress Meagan was so friendly and treated us with so much hospitality she will b well tipped this plc also has a balcony so u can stand on the balcony and throw your beads etc wht I do love is you get 10 percent off with Yelp which is always excellent....

Hands down when you come to New Orleans you must stop here. Reservations arent required but recommended but its not a must have. They are able to get people in relatively quickly if there is not a big convention in town
The Taste of New Orleans was a little bit of everything I come to New Orleans for. The  ettoufee (sp?) was especially good.
Great food drinks are good, the service is fantastic!! Really enjoyed my crab cakes!!!

Really delicious and the hype did not disappoint! Waited around 15 mins on a weekend night which was really good. Service was amazing, and was able to use the promo code on yelp which saved some money. Definitely need to try the grill oyster.

Smack dab in the center of the French Quarter, you'll find a little unpretentious joint named The Oceana Grill.  Not being a NOLA native (in fact, I'm a Yankee in every sense of the word) I had a hankering for some Cajun cooking.  After all, isn't that what NOLA is known for?  At one point or another, our sources (more like acquaintances) guided us to the Oceana Grill.  It was heeded as having some excellent variety so we could get a taste of the city.  Boy did it ever.

If elegance is what you're looking for in YOUR New Orleans dinner location, look elsewhere.  Oceana is a loud, crowded, eclectic little picnic party of a restaurant (As I recall there were even plastic covers donning each table top).  If you've had a few hand grenades, you won't even notice anyway.

The service is fast.  When I say fast, I mean, I had a steaming hot dinner placed in front of me about five minutes after I ordered it.  On top of that, I also received an amazing amount of southern hospitality from our waiter, all with a friendly smile on his face.  Speed and hospitality is a bonus, since on weekends (especially dinner time) you'll more than likely wait in a 20 or 30 minute line JUST to get into the joint.  Well.  Worth.  It.

I ordered the fried catfish platter and my girlfriend had the "Taste of New Orleans" which included gumbo, crawfish and a variety of other Cajun creations all mixed up in one bowl.  We decided to share.

The catfish was perfection.  Lightly fried with French fries on the side, it was soul food paradise.  I've had catfish before (strictly in the New York area) but let me tell you, one you've had Oceana's, you'll finally have something to compare all others to.  The portion was HUGE so be sure you bring your appetite.

My girlfriends "Taste of New Orleans" was even better!  I can't even count the amount of different tastes they were able to fit into one big bowl of goodness.  It was spicy and Cajun inspired, but not so much so that it lit my mouth on fire.  That said, it was certainly the better dish of the two, and I had wished I ordered it instead, but none the less, both were superb.  

If you don't settle on either of those entrees, the menu is giant so you'll easily be able to find another dish that suits your fancy.

Everything was extremely affordable.  I believe $40 including tax and tip.  For what you get, it was a steal.

Oceana is convenient, clean, delicious and, with so many excellent Cajun seafood restaurants in the area, very worthy of your time and money.

Loved this place! Me and my friends were looking for a place to eat late at night while we out in NOLA and found this place. Food was great and we had a blast!

Maybe the best part was our server, Daniel. He was super polite, a blast to be around, and gave us some great menu recommendations. This guy made this meal one of my favorite dining experiences in New Orleans. Would highly recommend this place and would highly recommend Daniel to anyone, wish I could give them both 10 stars! Thanks Daniel
Tasty food. Reasonably priced. Fast service. Don't let the line outside fool you. The place is huge and they know how to move hoards of people in and out without compromising quality and service.

French Quarter tourist trap.

Came here for dinner after a work conference and Oceana was the only restaurant that didn't have a wait time at 7:30 on a Monday. The restaurant has three levels, and looked fairly dirty and dark. 

Onto the food and service -

Service - with a smile, but the waitress messed up on our order twice, and brought us out the wrong drink order twice as well. They delivered our food to the table next to us, even though they were eating their desserts. 

Food - Luke warm and bland. We ordered the jambalaya, blackened fish, and their special, but none of us were impressed, and all of the food came out cold. The waitress warned me that my jambalaya would be spicy, but when I tasted it, it literally tasted like tomato sauce with vegetables...poor. 

The one unique thing about them was that they had 3 dishes catered to just vegetarians, which is rare in NOLA, and even rarer in the French Quarter.

I wouldn't come back again, and I suggest that you don't either.

This food was to die for! The Rockefeller Oysters were so delicious I was scrapping the sauce off the plate! Lord I will be back before I leave! I ordered the crab cakes. They were Delish! This will be a stable every time I visit!

Visit in NOLA for a meeting and this was one of a short list of don't miss spots. The line was long on arrival, but after a 10 min wait, I was offered a seat at the bar since I was a party of one. Highly recommend if your party is 1-2, and you're ok not having all the atmosphere. 

First thing I saw coming my way was a Hurricane drink that a couple ordered. It was literally smoking. Yes, I'll had one of those. I ordered a bowl of gumbo and the crab cake app. The bar server pointed out the size of a bowl of gumbo. It was more like a throth - cup it is. 

Food came within 10 mins. So glad I ordered the cup, which is some restaurants' bowl. The gumbo had a balance of shrimp rice and roux, but that was pretty much it. It was underwhelming and I wouldn't go back just for it. To be fair, in my years, I've had pretty amazing gumbo, some in restaurants, but mostly bowls of richness made by folks from Louisiana, South Carolina, and Texas, by some Creoles and Gheechees, and some proud-ass AL-Bamas and Atlantans (transplants tho). With that, take my comment from that perspective. The crab cakes were good, but I could only eat one. There were huge! The other was a nice lunch the next day. 

Service was awesome. Folks were relaxed, and in general folks had a great time. A must visit spot. Keep your expectations in check. Go for the thrill of being, eating and having a good time!

Oceana Grill doesn't look like much from the outside (but what does in the French Quarter?)  It's what's on the inside that counts, and that's what makes Oceana Grill worthwhile.  

We enjoyed a Christmas morning breakfast here, and honestly we went here because it was about the only place we could find open. (Thanks for being accommodating to holiday tourists, Oceana Grill!)  Service was friendly (despite it being a holiday) and the breakfast was awesome. My wife's seafood omelette was the best she's ever had, and my Cajun omelette was very tasty.  

Definitely worth a visit for breakfast in the French Quarter.

Totally tourist trap. The server has an attitude. The food is just not good, especially compare with the amazing food you can have everywhere else in New Orleans. I don't recommend and will not come here again.

From the moment we stepped in, we were greeted by friendly stuff. Our waiter Dori went beyond her call of duty to accommodate our dietary needs and made sure all of us were happy with our choices. Side order of Rice and Beans (cajun) absolutely amazing. Loaded French fries was fantastic and crowds favorite. Bloody Mary was really well done.

my friend got the fried platter
i got the jambalaya pasta
we shared the fried eggplant sticks

everything was fire
we had a super friendly waitress and she only appeared when needed (i.e. refilling drinks, check, etc)

but we did encounter one hostess/waitress in the beginning, didnt want to serve us and said aloud "you do it, i don't wanna deal with this"

that was wack and rude, but still had a pretty good time

Tourist trap with a sandwich board in front, horrible decor, and pictures of the food on their plastic menu. 
When there's so many great places to eat near by, why bother? We left after the appetizer. Gumbo... Nothing but rice and salt... Charbroiled oysters, drowning in a heavy fishy sauce served with a side of stale bread (also covered in sauce to hide the fact it was stale) and crab cakes...  We were told they were the house specialty. The sauce. Oh my word. More off putting sauce all over everything. The crab cake itself had the texture of sawdust. 

Please. Don't waste your hard earned money.

Service was good and our server recommended gator bites which were awesome, especially since I've never had any on account of living on the west coast. Atmosphere was comfortable and would definitely go back if I had the opportunity.

I've been to this location twice, but the second time dining here definitely left much to be desired. There was a a pretty long line out the door, but my party of two only waited like 10 or 15 minutes. Once we were seated, though, the service became annoyingly slow. We first ordered the taste of New Orleans, which includes small bowls of read beans and rice with sausage, crawfish étouffée, and jambalaya. All of the dishes were pretty tepid. The red beans and rice with sausage were, at best, average to me, and I feel the same way about the jambalaya. I did enjoy the crawfish étouffée, though. Next, my s/o ordered the catfish platter, and I nibbled off his plate. Sadly, we were accidentally brought out the fried seafood platter and had to wait quite awhile to get the catfish platter. Once it came, I was pretty underwhelmed by the fried catfish. My favorite parts of the platter were the hush puppies and the fries. All in all,  based on my 2 experiences, I'd say this place is hit or kind of miss. I should have stuck with the oysters.
The food was great! The service from Meagan L was spectacular! Can't wait to eat there again!

We are here for lunch and Kim was our server...she was amazing. We tried the Cajun fries... so yummy and the portion was perfect for 3 people. We also had the crab cakes and bbq shrimp... equally yummy. The line was long but moved quickly.
I can highly recommend the Oceana redfish. Crawfish sauce is amazing.  Whitney did a great job.

I found this place because it was super close to my hotel. It is amazing! The service was friendly and so fast. It's a little pricey for what I usually spend, but it is totally worth it. I do have to say they do have great portion sizes for appetizers. This place has a great atmosphere and is kid friendly (at least during day).

Went here with a group of 13 people. Had to wait a little while as it was busy but they accomadated us well and we even got a table upstairs. The service was great. Our server was named Chad and he did a great job of getting orders right and the food came out in decent time. Would highly recommend the seafood platter, the catfish was wonderful as was the creme brulee. Would definitely go again.

Excellent ambience. New Orleans seafood at its finest. I'm going to have the IHi tuna 

I highly recommend this place. If you're looking for true New Orleans cuisine


The collard greens should be on the desert menu!!!!!!!
This is a good taste of New Orleans place. Very traditional restaurant and food very good, price reasonable. My service was nice and easygoing. I will recommend to my friends.

If you're looking for traditional New Orleans food, this is your place! It's a great atmosphere located in the heart of the French quarter. Food is awesome especially the crab cake appetizer and their signature redfish oceana. The staff was awesome and super friendly! I will def be back!

We came here while on vacation.  We did an online reservation and when we got there there was a line out the door.  Went to the front and let them know we had a reservation, the lady was shocked we were able to do one.  Good news was we did at least get seated before everyone else in line because of our reservation.  

Once seated, the restaurant itself was pretty dirty and dingy.  Our waiter was very nice, and that was probably the best part of the meal.  The meal itself, I got a porterhouse steak cooked medium.  It was the most over cooked dry piece of meat I have ever had.  Another member of our party had the same but got his cooked fine.  The other food that was ordered didn't look the best but tasted fine.  Overall this place was just meh, not a great place for dinner.  I would consider it more on par with bar food than anything else.
I don't get the high ratings. The crab cakes were so fishes and gooey. The gumbo tasted like it was straight from a box. Do they even make their own roux?

Dinner was great. We were a group of 8 with most of us new to the area.  Our server David took very good care of us and was checking on us periodically to make sure we were enjoying our food and drinks.  Many props to the staff!

I visited here during the Jazz fest and forgot to write a review. 
This place was great! It was after 11 pm when we got seated. We were treated as if these people had just started the day, still fresh. Service like that makes me come back again and again.
 The food was also superb. I had the BBQ shrimp.  Nice, big, plump, juicy shrimp. Lots of sauce for me to get all over myself. Lots of wet naps they gave me for knowing that was going to happen.
 I wish I would have written this earlier to remember more, but good food and good service. And clean. That is what you need to know

This service we received from our waitress Pamela was truly outstanding and the food was super delicious. I recommend any time you are in the NO you stop by this establishment for great hospitality and great food. Atmosphere has lots of energy.

Have been here a couple times and the food is usually pretty good. This time one of my coworkers from Columbia ordered a po boy. While eating it we discovered a small worm on the plate. We pointed it out to our waitress and her and the manager apologized saying it was from the kale garnish. They did not charge us and gave him a free beer but was still not enough to get me to come back.

Sometimes it's hard to know where to eat in the French Quarter, with so many great options. Make your life easier and just come here! The line out front can be deceiving - there's lots of seating inside, so the line moves fast. The food is delicious! We had the chargrilled oysters, redfish special with jambalaya, and fried shrimp (because we needed something fried!). I love that you can add a side of fried shrimp, along with the other traditional sides, because sometimes that is just necessary, and means you can still try several things without ordering too many entrees.

Every time I am in NOLA, which is several times a year, I make it a point to come to Oceana. I have brought friends and family from all over the U.S. and I ALWAYS recommend it. My most recent experience we had Errol as a server and he was incredible. He was super nice and knowledgable of the restaurant and the area. The food is great, the atmosphere is amazing and the location is ideal. I have never had a bad meal or experience and I recommend ordering the Alligator Sausage and Remoulade as an appetizer. The Bloody Mary's will not disappoint either. Geaux and Enjoy!

Amazing... simply amazing!!! Seafood is not my favorite choice of foods but I absolutely loved my meal here!

Started with the crab cakes and charbroiled oysters. I like crab cakes but I LOVE these crab cakes and the sauce... yum! I am not a fan of oysters, I really rarely ever eat them, but I have never had charbroiled ones, or an oyster seasoned like this- I would order these every time!  Both of these were seriously really good ... I would have been happy just ordering more of these and not getting an entree but after eating the entree that's not exactly true- because the special of the night the seafood pasta with the crab cakes was amazing!!!

The crab cake sitting on top of the Cajun Alfredo pasta looked like heaven.  The dish was so good, that as I began to hurt from eating too much I just kept going... to the point I used the bread to clean the bowl spotless!!  

I am seriously surprised at how much I enjoyed this place, seafood can become my favorite food group if I learn how to cook like this!

It's a little pricey- you know me I'm cheap, but wow I would go back tonight if I lived there!!!  

My pictures don't do it justice since it has flash... but trust me it's freaking good!!!!

I ordered a dozen oysters, half Rockefeller and half chargrilled.  They were amazingly great!  Had the crawfish estouffe and that was delicious.  I ordered the fried seafood platter everything was good except the fish, it seemed like it was cooked earlier and warmed up later.  Wife had breakfast and French toast.  French toast was great. Service was great.  Meghan was our server and she was awesome!  Would I go back?  For the oysters yes

Great spot for AMAZING seafood in NOLA! Located near Bourbon Street. I got the soft-shell crab sandwich and shared the cajun fries, oyster rockafeller, and the banana foster ice cream cake. The soft-shell crab was perfectly cooked, crispy and crunchy on the outside and moist and soft on the inside. The crab was fresh. At first, I was squeamish at trying the gator in the cajun fries but after trying it I really liked it. It has the same texture as chicken and is not fishy. The oyster rockafeller was fresh and the rockafeller sauce was tasty and rich. The banana foster ice cream was AMAZING!

This place was rated well and popular so we gave it a try.  They had big drinks and good food.  I got loaded fries with a crab cake on top and it was too good.  I would def go back next time in Nola.  Although there are a lot of restaurants to try in Nola so it would be a tough decision.
Loved Red Beans and Rice, étouffée, & fried catfish!  Great handcrafted drinks & bartender gave us a discount!  Well worth the time here.

Oceana was recommended to us by friends, we won't be talking to those people anytime soon. Tried to make a reservation and was hung up on.
Called again, was told a two hour wait. Made the reservation for the next day and was seated promptly. There are so many great restaurants in NOLA, IMHO there is just nothing special about Oceana.
Oyster were good, Grilled oysters were not.
Blackened redfish was ok at best, was probably left over from the previous day as it tasted fishy. Gumbo was also fair at best.
As I said,there are so many great places to eat in NOLA,
Oceana isn't one of them.
Service was very good, no complaints

Presentation of food very poor. Over priced for quality and quantity. Server was not very knowledgable about menu and not attentive. May have been an off night for them but not impressed and not worth trying again.
Great service, friendly staff, good food. Came around 5 ish and still had to wait in line for about 20 min so get there early

We came for Fathers Day on a Sunday around 7pm. It was me, my husband, and our two kids. There was a line out front but we waited anyways. The line went quick, like maybe 15 minutes max, so not bad at all. Parties smaller than four were sat faster. Once seated the service was fast. Drinks came fast and food came pretty fast. Overall we all enjoyed our food. My shrimp po boy was way too much bread and not enough shrimp but the flavor was great! My Greek salad didn't have any dressing so I used my daughters ranch. Both pasta dishes were loaded with flavor and were huge portions but the Cajun pasta lacked spice. I also was disappointed to not see macaroni and cheese on the kids menu (my daughters go to) so we paid $7 for some mozzarella sticks. 

Overall, good New Orleans experience to get the southern food we were looking for. A huge positive- draft beers were excellently priced at just $5, much lower than normal restaurants! Good ones too!

Amazing experience. We got in town 4 days ago when Oceana has a fire. We walked by hours later and were amazed to see a dozen waitstaff cleaning out the restaurant so they could reopen. We decided to try it out tonight and have been impressed. We enjoyed sitting on the patio. We got the Mardi Gras pasta and it was delicious, but the best part of our meal was our waiter, David, and the bread pudding.

Great patio! My bf and I ordered entirely too much food but it was all pretty good. The chargrilled oysters were awesome, and the alligator half blackened half fried was my favorite dish! We also ordered a shrimp po boy and a taste of NOLA which I recommend!

They had a frozen version of an Incredible Hulk (Hypnotiq and Hennessy) which was tasty. 

Now, the star of the show was the RIDICULOUSLY awesome ultimate Bloody Mary! It had fried soft shell crab, oysters, shrimp, pickled green beans, and cocktail onions in the shape of a crab!!!! It was enough for a meal!! Get it. You won't be disappointed!
Blackened redfish, Oceanas favorite chargrilled oysters, and Louisiana crab cake. Barbecue shrimp and chocolate mousse cake

I would rate three and half if I could. My wife is a huge fan of New Orleans BBQ Shrimp. We stopped in Oceana for a late afternoon snack. 
My wife noticed you could order the BBQ Shrimp as an appetizer or as a meal. The appetizer was five shrimp for $8. The meal consist of 10 shrimp with no sides for $20. 
Since my wife had never had Oceana's BBQ Shrimp she ordered the $8 appetizer. Once she determined she did like their BBQ Shrimp, I offered to split another order. So we ended up getting 10 BBQ Shrimp for $16.00. 
I ordered the Crab Cakes appetizer ($14). On the menu the Crab Cakes were marked as an Oceana favorite. IMO these were average at best. The Crab Cakes were fried to the point of having a hard outer shell. The Crab was shredded and mealy not lump Crab. I would not order them again. 
My wife rarely drinks alcohol, but did order a Mojito ($7).  She said her drink was very good. 
Service was excellent and our server very personable.

One of my Fav's!!! I absolutely love this place. The crab cake is to die for. Everything that I have had there so far has been incredible. The seafood platter is humongous. It can easily feed two people (although my hubby doesn't like to share it) lol. Highly recommend

If your looking for good gumbo, keep walking. I'm not sure why this place has such high reviews.  The food is mediocre and it just looks like a tourist trap.  Now maybe there are better dishes here that I didn't try but based off what I had and have heard since eating here, do yourself a favor and eat somewhere else! I ate here on the suggestion of the valet at my hotel. I asked for great gumbo and he sent me here. Note to self: if your valet hands you a card for a discount to a restaurant, go somewhere else. 

Anyway, I tried the gumbo and the blacked shrimp Caesar salad. This gumbo is NOT roux based and if it is, then it's the lightest roux in the world or they spent 5 minutes making it. I'm partial to a deep, rich roux gumbo with chicken, andouille sausage, okra & rice. This gumbo was not that. It looked more like a tomato based broth with rice and two different types of shrimp. There was't a whole lot of flavor that you'd expect from a great gumbo, heck, even a good gumbo!

Next I had the blackened shrimp Caesar salad (again on recommendation). This one was hardly edible. They were heavy handed on adding the blackening seasoning to the shrimp. I couldn't even taste the shrimp. The Caesar dressing had some odd Cajun seasoning added in, which over powered the salad as well. None of the flavors blended well together and all I could taste was blackening. This salad would be so much better with the shrimp lightly blackened and a traditional Caesar dressing that compliments to shrimp instead of competing. 

Now, with all of that said... the bartender Allison was amazing and the reason why I'm giving them 2 stars at all. She was friendly, attentive and fun to talk with.
My first time in New Orleans and I had to stop by and try their Cajón food. I fell in love with their chargrilled oysters my first time time tasting this delicious delicatessen, a must while in NOLA!

Great food. I look forward to eating here again. Ambiance was nice o
Too. The line moves fast
Get the Praline Duck! Amazing. They also have a delicious crab cake appetizer. Our server Michael was extremely accommodating.

The service here is great! We waited in line for about 20 mins but Jacquelyn kept us all engaged and she was hilarious. Then we got our great waitress Mary. Oh Mary we enjoyed you and your fan moment it made our night. Thank you for the great service and it made our experience wonderful. Oh and the food was good!

Loved the food and atmosphere.  The staff was friendly from the moment we walked in the door.  Our server, Tim, was great.  The food was delicious.  Jambalaya, gator tail bites, and red beans and rice were all delicious.  Great find!

So, this place has been very yummy. Not only is the service exceptional, but everyone's food was magically delicious. I enjoyed their crab cake burger with cheese and jambalaya. I also had the pleasure of trying out their blackened catfish which attacked me with so many powerful flavors. I am now thinking about ordering that. In addition to our entrees, we tried the Cajun crab fries which were amazing as well. If you're ever near bourbon street, don't hesitate to come here!!!
Sooooo delicious! I came with 6 other people, we all tasted each others food and everything was perfection! We got in within 15-20 minutes & the server was awesome.

THE CHEESECAKE! Please get the cheesecake. We were down here for my birthday from Baltimore and all I wanted for my birthday was their cheesecake. We actually went here twice during our visit because the food was so good. Everything we tried was great, with the exception of the gator bites. They just tasted like "fried" but literally, everything else we tried was great. 

We ordered to pick up from their website and ate at the hotel after long nights walking around on tours and whatnot. Definitely check them out. You won't be disappointed.

The experience at the Oceana Grill was great. From the ambiance to the service to the food the overall visit was perfect. We had a party of 6, definitely make a reservation because there was a line and wait when we arrived. The blackened gator bites were a great starter as well as the Louisiana Char Grilled Oysters. The Entree's to look out for are the Shrimp Creole, Duck Cotnfiet, and the Red Fish Special. Overall great place in NOLA and we recommend it for a great place to dine.

Was in New Orleans when the Eagles came and got spanked bigly. After the game my cousin and I came here. The line was long but we stood there as there was no plan B. The lines moved quickly as the place is 3 floors high if I remember correctly. The staff was very friendly and nice. Waitresses were lovely and helpful. I'd definitely come back. Great food and great people. Can't ask for more!!

For this eatery you have to be a little patient.  The lines are long to get in and I do not believe they take reservations.  Our hotel recommended this restaurant and they were not wrong.  

If you want good cajun food, this is the place to go.

The food was well seasoned and the portions rather large. I ordered the seafood platter and was a bit taken aback by how much food I received, the platter was large enough to share for the table.  overall there portions are large and tasty.. 

If i go again when i return i will keep that in mind when ordering and instead of ordering individuals plates i will order enough to share for all at the table.

The service/servers were very accommodating, polite and courteous.

This was not my first time here I had been here numerous times before and the food and service are usually great so when I came back with my parents and my aunt and boyfriend I thought it would obviously be just as great however I was wrong. 

We were sat at a rather awkward table for it being relatively early in the day which was fine and then we were greeted by our waiter mike. I usually only remember waiters or waitresses names after the meal if they were terrible or great. This guy mike was terrible. He was pushy and I was not thrilled of how he spoke to me. He asked if we had questions and I asked if the menu still had turtle soup and he kind of laughed and said no. Which was fine but he continued like it hasn't been on the menu in years which is not true since I have been to Oceana a few times and the last time I went which was last year they did. But he treated me like I didn't know anything almost like a silly tourist which I am not but my parents are and his way of speaking to people was ridiculous. The food was ok but honestly I've never been spoken to by a waiter so rudely. So even though it's on the main drag and the most decent place that's open late as a none tourist I won't be eating here due to the service and if I do eat here I will request not to be sat in mikes section.

First visit to NOLA, a Lyft driver recommended it and I'm passing on the favor! The restaurant itself is fun and lively, I'm here for my bachelorette and EVERY staff member I saw said a congrats, and our waitress Whitney was wonderful! The menu has the New Orleans staples and favorites, and options for the less-seafood-inclined of us as well. Would recommend!
This is a MUST eat every year we come to NOLA!!! There is always plenty of food; enough for at least two people to share. We love it!
Fast service for a Saturday. Food was great. Try the crawfish fries....amazing! My redfish was slightly dryer than I'd like, but everything else made up for it. I want to come back for their brunch.

Ordered Jambalaya for takeout from here on my trip and the food was ready on time for pickup.  The staff was very friendly!  If your looking for a quick fix with Creole/Cajun favorites this is a great place to check out.

When I took a trip to New Orleans last year in June I was excited to eat real southern food! My rule on vacation is: "Don't eat at a place I can eat when I am at home." So glad that we gave this place a try! 

We started with the Louisiana Crabmeat Cakes served with crawfish and mushroom cream sauce. Very very good! 

I then ordered for dinner the Blackened Bayou Duck, smoked till it's tender then blackened and topped with a crawfish mushroom cream sauce. I have never had duck that was cooked as good as this was. It was absolutely amazing! 

The location is big and is on multiple levels. There is normally a line that forms outside and that is where you wait until your group is next. 

Don't come here and expect a quiet dinner as the noise level is really loud, but then again, what part of New Orleans is quiet right?? 

Will be back on the next trip for sure!

This was my first time visiting Oceana Grill and let me say this place was Amazing!! The service was Awesome! Our server Whitney was pleasant and very helpful! I had the Crab Cake topped with crawfish and mushroom sauce, it was delicious! It's a must to visit Oceana Grill when your in New Orleans!!

If you don't make a reservation - you will have to wait in a long line. However the food was very good and the staff was friendly. We sat outside and the atmosphere was very nice. The bananas foster ice cream cake and the bread pudding were delicious!!
Great friendly and fast service. Nice inside and the food was SO good. Will definitely recommend them and come again when back in NOLA!

Great service and our server Ashleigh was great. She kept checking up on us and making sure everything was to our liking. She recommended some plates that were superb. Definitely coming back again when I am in town.

After a long day of working on a creative project me and my team decided to give this fun looking place a try on bourbon street. We walked in and were immediately greeted and taken to our table. After 30 mins of waiting no waiter showed up so we decided to go order food to go at the counter. After paying for my food everyone begins to run out of the space due to a rat running out of the kitchen! Yes a rat! 

Everyone was of course distraught and ran out of the space. The workers were not accommodating at all! One even said "it's not that serious" and rolled her eyes like it was a regular occurrence! 

I will NEVER eat there!!!!!!! It's gross!!

Very pleasantly surprised at this place. We have lived in the quarter for many years and are skeptical about any place in the area because of all the tourist crap around. ( There is a lot ) We had the gumbo, bbq shrimp app, the crab stuffed tuna and the duck. All of them were excellent and tasted like new orleans food should taste. Very very good bbq shrimp. I NEVER get gumbo out because my husband is a local and a real good cook of local foods. He really liked the gumbo. Thats high praise from him.
Highly recommend Oceana's food. Our server was Roderic and he did a great job. Super friendly and very up to date on food. 
Excellent food and excellent service.  I gave it five stars but would have given six if there had been another.
Thanks Roderic!!
I will remember the Oysters Rockafella for the rest of my life, they were that good.  Very rich and decadent, but just delicious!!!

Thank you Erica! Your exceptional service and knowledge of the meals really makes a difference.  You were able to articulate every detail of each and every meal my wife and I had questions about. Thank you for reassuring us that our needs and concerns were important to you and your managers. You were very impressive!

Multi level restaurant. I was somewhat annoyed because upon entering they asked if the party of two would like to sit at the bar. We had informed them we wanted a table and did not want the bar. The hostess sent us upstairs where two waitresses tried to get us to sit at the bar and seemed bothered that we did not want to sit at the bar. Once seated the waitress seemed bothered that we did not order alcoholic beverages with our lunches at 1pm and then forgot about our sodas for 20 minutes. Nevertheless, we had Cajun pasta and the crab cakes. They were both tasty and had a great amount of flavor. We would go back again for the food but not for the annoyed waitresses throughout the restaurant.
Although we are local and aren't always in the mood to go to the French Quarters we still make our way there just for Oceana Grill. The food is pretty consistent and flavorful!
Fine experience, ate upstairs, I had the Crawfish crepes.. AWESOME.!  nothing bad to say.

Whitney was our server and the food and service couldn't have been better. We had the Taste if New Orleans, egg plant sticks, and Cajun fries. A perfect sample of a lot of what they have to offer and very satisfying.

Eeks! Never to eat here again. Charbroiled oysters not your typical Parmesan butter mix, they serve it w some sauce w some bell peppers, seems like they want to differentiate their oysters from the rest but it just didn't work for me. The crab cake lots of breading...very disappointed. The bbq shrimp was alright not something I want yo come back to.

A to go for place for GREAT oysters....no sand, no grit......$8.00 per dozen....We went for a cocktail and oysters a few times.   Personable waiters and bartenders.....Good time and as I said great oysters....

First time here with my boyfriend. On a road trip and was passing by New Orleans and we've been craving seafood. What better place to have it than NOLA. So, we looked around and found this cute place off French Quarter. We are super surprised by everything. Front entrance was small, as you enter, the restaurant is super spacious and like 3 floors! We ended up being seated on the second floor and had a nice view into a court yard like backyard. Atmosphere was casual but, you can dress up or down for the place. Prices for food is so worth it! I ordered the Taste of New Orleans; which comes with slices do French toast/ bread toast, crawfish etoufeé,  Jambalaya, red beans and rice. My boyfriend ordered the seafood platter and instead of fries, he substituted for the crawfish etoufeé. In the end, we ordered the bread pudding to share. Everything was excellent, delicious, and was exactly what we were looking for in seafood. The crawfish etoufeé was exceptional, and the bread pudding is to die for! If you're stopping by NOLA, this is the place you have to stop by. Portion sizing is big and filling, super well worth it for the price. Staff is super kind and greets you with a smile; even when they walk by your table. I don't want to overhype this place but, it's worth a visit. We will be back when we get to enjoy NOLA some more. Till then, let's eat!!!

Our last night in NOLA we came upon Oceana Grill and decided to try it out. There was not a wait and we were quickly seated. The food was fresh, tasty and reasonably priced. Our waitress was awesome. A refreshing smiling face after pushing through crowds of people on Bourbon Street. Will definately be back on our next trip to NOLA.

My friends and I had dinner here on a Sunday night in December after a Saints football game.  We had walked by the night before going to dinner at a different restaurant and saw a line of easily 40 people waiting.  At that point we were curious what was causing the line thus fueling our visit on Sunday.

We arrived around 8:15 that Sunday.  There were easily 30 people in front of us.  We waited approximately 25 minutes.  Our waiter was efficient and informative.  I ordered the red beans and rice dinner and added chicken as well for a small up charge.  They added a few slices of French bread with my meal which was beyond fresh.  The food came out relatively quickly and the portions were huge.  One of my friends ordered a shrimp po boy and another ordered the blackened chicken.  All of us were quiet happy with our meals.

I would highly recommend visiting here.  Location is great at the corner of Bourbon/Conti streets.  Prices were competitive, service is good, and more importantly the food was excellent.

The food here was amazing and it is conveniently located on bourbon st. I enjoyed every dish I've tried here but I will say that the service wasn't that great. They were extremely late with the food and the servers barely came to check on our table (they came around about twice during the 45min wait for the food after we had ordered). I'm still giving it a 4-star because the food was really delicious.

Omg where do I start? From the quick seating, warm greetings from staff, great customer service, amazing food, good drinks, decent prices? Hmmmm that's sums it up! Also our waiter Keisha was great she gave us recommendations that were on point and was very attentive to our needs. I would highly recommend this place. Best restaurant experience since visiting NOLA!

Still.one of the best restaurants out here in the quarter. The oysters, gator bites, shrimp all of it amazing and well worth the little wait time. Staff is on point and always around when you need them. Great over all spot for a bite to eat

I love the food and service. Can not go wrong with the chicken fettuccine Alfredo! As an appetizer I ordered the bbq shrimp and the sauce is amazing. It is a small plate but totally worth it. Also my waitress was very friendly and attentive ( I think her name was Jennifer). Next time I'm in town I will definitely stop by again.
Stopped by this place to squeeze some crab cakes in before I went back home. It was okay, I would come back if a similar craving struck at the same time.

By far the best food in the Quarter! The taste of New Orleans was heavenly, it has a little bit of everything that you want in NOLA. The Oceana Oysters are out of this world good! Forget the Rockefeller and dive right into that that creamy deliciousness. Make sure to ask for and extra side of bread to lap up the sauce when the oysters are gone. You'll want to the plate, I guarantee it.

I sat at the bar and was greeted very quickly for a drink order when the bartender returned with my drink I placed my food order. 6 oysters on the half shell and blackened redfish topped with blackened crawfish tails with sides of crawfish etouffe and corn. The service was outstanding the blackened foods just like they should be. I would definitely come back here again.

Went in because my sister really wanted to try the gaiter tail bites. We ended up just ordering the fries and bites. The rest of the menu I felt I could get it anywhere. Nothing really caught our eyes and for the price we said umm no. I could get the same thing somewhere else and probably cheaper. Now the food appetizers were good. The sauce on the Cajun fries were really good. The bites needed to be a bit more crunchy but it wasn't bad. Our server was very nice. The place itself was nothing that wowed me. Wasn't very lively. Sorry to say but there's no reason to go back to be honest.

First off, I would like to start my saying THE RESTROOM WAS EXTRAORDINARILY CLEAN!!! Which if you've ever been in NOLA, you know that's a rare commodity. 

Second the food was delicious! Our waiter was very nice and there wasn't much of a wait at all. Nice air conditioned environment. Will definitely return!
Taste of New Orleans is basically all sorts of cooked rice... Not bad, but if you want seafood, just pick something else.
Decent food and service. Long line to get in that moved quickly. The dock was way better than expected!!

The line was really long but moved super fast. I had the bbq shrimp as my appetizer and my husband got the Rockefeller's oysters. Both were great and would recommend both. I got the blackened Ceasar salad and my husband got the blackened tuna both great!
Great food. Everyone is nice. Mary was a server and she took great care of me. I recommend highly.
Stopped here a few hours after eating lunch so we only had a couple items, oysters Rockefeller and crab cakes, both were delicious. If you're on bourbon Street definitely stop by.

We got several recommendations to visit Oceana and decided to check it out (especially when we saw brunch). Megan D really made our experience great with some awesome recommendations. Aka get the seafood omelet with the crawfish and mushroom cream sauce on top! You won't be disappointed. And there are a lot of levels so we had no wait to get seated.
Great casual food, fun atmosphere, and excellent service. Not a touristy trap like a lot of places in the neighborhood and you dont need a suit and tie either. Go, eat, have fun.

The food was ok. Kind of spicy  I purchased the chicken Alfredo and it was kind of spicy. But the chicken was nice. It was my birthday and they gave us this banana cake with nuts in it. It was ok but I did not hate it. I think it was over priced. We could of got 2 nights a hotel. We had some nice service. Thank you for the experience of Oceana Grill

Ate here on a Sunday night, line was probably about 10-15 people out the door but they got us in pretty quick. Service was good and seemed like they got the food out in a timely manner, given how busy they were. Our party got 2 orders of the gluten free crab cakes and an order of the grilled redfish, also gluten free. All of it was very good, there is an option to order the items on the gluten free menu by themselves or as a meal, which includes mustard greens and mashed potatoes, we opted for the meals. The mustard greens were awesome, the potatoes were a little bland (maybe needed some butter or salt) but still tasty. The crab cakes were very good, slightly mushy, probably due to hem being gluten free, but still very good. I think the redfish was the favorite among all of us, it was perfectly grilled. I'd eat here again, solid gluten free menu, good service, and great atmosphere!

Food was good! We ate at restaurant at about 12:30 AM at night. When we visited, the place still had a line. This was during the Essence Festival and could be one of the reasons for such a high volume of people. The only thing that bothered me was that the waiter seemed overwhelmed and had to be replaced by another. The replacement waitress forgot about us. If they had been more attentive, I would have given 5 stars.
Classic NOLA Cajun cuisine! Had the awesome sampler dish with crawfish etouffe, jambalaya and rice&beans. Very highly recommend Oceana Grill to get great food!
I'd past this restaurant a hundred times and never gave it a second look. A friend visiting from out of town wanted to go, so we went. AMAZEBALLS!!! So freaking delish!

Breakfast breakfast breakfast!!!! What a nice place to sit and chat and smell the scents of everything they have to offer . The shrimp gumbo was absolutely magnificent, the bread pudding , the staff , the manager , were all happy to help and gave suggestions and each one was spot on. Definitely a go to spot !!! 
I would visit here every time I come to New Orleans

Jerleen made the great oysters and catfish poboy the best they could be. Came for a short visit that turned into a wonderfull lunch with Abita Amber to help wash it down. Bread pudding a must for desert

Oysters were amazing!  Highly recommend the Oceana Grilled Oysters!  We went at 11pm so there wasn't a crowded and we got seated with no wait.  Our server Kim was very friendly and gave great advice! Highly recommended!!

Seven of us had dinner tonight and Natalie took excellent care of us.  From oysters to ribs the food was great.  Don't let the line scare you as it moves quickly.  So enjoy shrimp, crab cakes, catfish, red fish, crawfish, and ribs.  Something for everyone!

Great food and service again! Even though this may look like a bar, the food and service is always fabulous. Know that there are two locations though and the one I have been to is the larger one on Conti St. The alligator bites are great and the blackened catfish is fresh. I wouldn't recommend the hurricane from here but that is not their specialty. The staff is friendly and helpful with selections.

Started off with The cajun fries as an appetizer which they were amazing, we added alligator tails to the the fries which they sauté for 24 hours! For our entrée we had Cajun Jambalaya Pasta! Highly recommend coming here on your stop on Bourbon! The line is long but the wait time is short! Very spacious inside and the staff is amazing, especially our server Megan!

So i wanted the creamy alfredo pasta with veggies and super cajun spice. They sure delivered my customized option without trouble and with a smile on thier face. Got a bottle of wine for the table and they had a decent collection of reds. The table got a lot of the yummy cajun chicken and salad and seafood entrees and all loved it. The restaurant has this really "happy" vibe. People want to laugh and hang out and all in all, its just a good aura to be at! Forewarned- the food is on the heavier side. This a'int for the health freak ;)

This place is amazing. Incredible food, great prices and some of the best waitstaff in New Orleans. Errol was our server and was great. I highly recommend this place and when you do go, ask for Errol!

I ordered the shrimp creole, Alfredo pasta, gumbo, and the fried platter via door dash and I was super disappointed. They definitely refried the shrimp because it was rock solid when I bit into it! The shrimp creole was missing rice so pretty much my kids ate a shrimp soup bowl for $17. The Alfredo pasta? Wow the portion size was very disrespectful. It was a kids meal portion which was BLAND. Utensils and napkins were not provided. We just landed into NOLA in desperate need to feed my family to only get ripped off. This is not a good start to my vacation. I don't recommend this business.

It's my birthday and I decided to come here after Jazz Fest. I wasn't overly pleased. I ordered the redfish and they must have all your food Pre cooked and our food came out fast but was lukewarm in temperature. After being at jazz fest we were starving so we didn't send it back. Additionally I decided to make my drink a double... I can GUARANTEE there wasn't any alcohol if it was it was they must of measured. When your starving and you drink the alcohol it  quickly goes to your head. Hell I drank the drink and I feel like I drank a bottle of water. Lol 
Maybe it's an off night.. I've had better, hotter food in the French Quarter.
Super friendly and food was perfect favor.  Large portions and my Bloody Mary tasty with a kick.  One of my favorite gumbos

First of all, Megan was an amazing server! So friendly, so personable. Plus she made excellent recommendations from the menu and we had an outstanding "brunch" because of it! Drinks for two and food for about $65 after tax. 

Try the alligator tails! Megan told us we could do half fried, and half blackened...and they were bomb! That remoulade, tho!

Thanks Megan for an awesome experience! Thanks Oceana for an awesome meal! Nola has a piece of our hearts, and we will be back! 

Pro tip: keep your receipt and bring it back for a free mimosa or Bloody Mary. You can thank Megan for that, too!

Kim our waitress was amazing and very attentive to our needs. She even got me to try gator for the 1st time! The food was good and the Tropical storm was great! Staff was very nice and welcoming! I will definately come back to visit this place!
Took over 40 mins to get my food after I ordered and the restaurant wasn't even busy. My food was cold when I got it you could tell it was sitting on the kitchen forever.

As someone who's lived in New Orleans my whole life I should have known when I walked in that this place was purely a tourist trap. I'm sure they make most of their money off of drunk tourists coming off Bourbon St. that know nothing about good seafood. 

A buddy and I were looking for a late night spot to eat dinner and this was the only place still open around the city. We sat down and our server told us they were famous for their crab cakes which I had intended on trying as well as the Oceana oysters. This was just the next mistake along with many more to come since choosing to dine at Oceana. 

Our oysters came out and were not sizzling like usual chargrilled oysters are, yet they were covered in a thick garlic sauce that can be described as gooey. The oysters themselves were incredibly chewy and after two I could touch anymore of the dozen in front of me. 

Shortly after, the crab cakes arrived and I had to send the first one back due to it being cold; upon biting into the crab cake I was appalled that a place in New Orleans can disrespect oysters and crab so horribly. Very little crab meat and mainly breading and onions, though the crawfish that came on top were not the worst I've ever had. I've had better frozen crab cakes from Walmart. 

Lastly, I ordered the special of the day (redfish Pontchartrain) and by this time I'm wondering to myself why we didn't leave when we first walked in and realized what type of establishment we were in. Alas, the fish came out and was somewhat blackened but the meat of the fish was tough and the shrimp onto in the cream sauce seemed frozen (like I'm sure most things from Oceana are). I pushed off the fish and tried a couple bites of the "jalapeño cornbread" that was more of a mush than a cornbread. That was it, I put my fork down and didn't eat another bite. 

If you have read this review and are thinking to yourself, "well the other reviews sound good maybe he just has a vendetta against this place" I urge you with every fiber of my being to try any of the hundreds of other seafood spots in the City, Peche for example is one of my favorites. PLEASE TURN AWAY FROM OCEANA

At first we went by and there was a line where no one else had a line so we weren't going to wait.  I was hangry.  But my daughter convinced us to wait.  I'm glad she did.
The service was great.  With the exception of her forgetting to ring in my gator bites me having to tell her when our food was brought and tell her Nevermind only for her to argue with me that she has them and still charge me for them... 
the drink was fun with the dry ice smoke.  
The food was really good.  I had the red fish.  
Overall enjoyed the experience.

This place is noted as one of the best seafood restaurants in New Orleans!! It certainly lived up to the reputation!! Service was superb! Our waitress, Racheal was outstanding; she was very knowledgeable and attentive!! Our appetizers of Oysters Rockefeller and Gator Bites were fantastic!  Our entrees were just as good; Taste of New Orleans, Gumbo, Red Snapper, and Seafood Pasta were all savory and filling! Dessert!!! Bread Pudding with Ice Cream and Creme Brûlée! Yes! For our first visit, you can rest assured we will be back!!

I would highly recommend making a reservation for this place, the line-up outside can get pretty long. I made a reservation for 8 people at 9pm on a Thursday night. The place was packed. We were seated with 15-20 mins on arrival and that was with a reservation. We were seated at a long table and Shahan our server was great. We ordered a bunch of dishes to share: Seafood Gumbo, Crab Cake Platter, Fried Gator Tail Bites, Oceana's Famous Oysters, Oysters Rockefeller, Shrimp Creole, Knife and Fork BBQ Ribs, and Fried Gator Bite Po-Boy. My favorites were the Oysters, Shrimp Creole, Fried Gator Tail Bites and the BBQ ribs.

Went here with my dad and we had very different experiences. My dad thought it was great and really enjoyed the shrimp creole dish he ordered and his cup of gumbo. I ordered the alligator sausage to start and thought it was yummy. But my entree was not good. I got the tuna with BBQ shrimp on top (can't remember the name). I ordered it medium rare. It came out over cooked and did not taste fresh. The bright spot of our meal was the bananas foster ice cream cake; it was excellent. Our server also did a very nice job. Our experience in our week in NOLA was that the best food was outside the French Quarter. This place was ok but not worth the money, in my opinion.

New Orleans restaurant serving up tasty seafood.  It's located off of Bourbon Street in the middle of French Quarter so I don't know if it's considered more of a touristy place, but they definitely made my food right.  I ordered the Louisiana crabmeat cakes, their Famous Oysters, and Seafood Gumbo.  

The crabmeat cakes were exceptional, served with their special crawfish sauce.  Moreover, the cakes were full of crab which you could taste, not just breading at other places I've been to.  They were chunky and full of flavor.  

The Oceana Famous Oysters is a must have.  They take fresh shucked oysters, served with garlic, their house cajun sauce and cheese then grill it over an open fire until it all melts together.  Simply incredible and rivals Acme Oysters in my book.

The Seafood Gumbo was good too, served with a scoop of rice.  It was thick, creamy, and flavorful as a New Orleans Gumbo should be.  This one in particular, though was a little sweeter and had shrimp and seafood prominently in it.  Definitely did not disappoint!

Would recommend for a casual, New Orleans meal.  The price is decent and they have a good variety of food not far from French Quarter.

I had the blackened catfish and added an extra side of red beans and rice. My boyfriend had oysters Rockefeller and the blackened duck. It was all delicious! My kids loved their chicken tenders. Overall great dining experience!

Amazing food! They often have a line so plan accordingly or make a reservation. We make sure to eat dinner at Oceana every time we visit New Orleans. They have great customer service and clean, organized, and decorated rooms. I recommend the gumbo and etouffee. We will continue to recommend this restaurant to others and eat here when we visit New Orleans!
Great place to dine at! Jambalaya is really good and they make a great Hurricane! Much better than the ones on Bourbon St. actually ordered them to go after we ate. Fun place with great service!
Cute place but a long line and food was very salty. Had the special. Sauzrac cocktail was excellent.
Had crab cakes appetizer, taste of new Orleans and a fettuccine with shrimp and cray fish. Absolutely delicious!  Service was great!

Absolutely fantastic breakfast! WONDERFUL! I got the lost bread which is like french toast. It is so wonderful you don't even need to have syrup on it. I highly recommend this place for breakfast. 

However, I wasn't a huge fan of the lunch. I went a few days later for lunch after my wonderful experience with their breakfast. The jambalaya was okay at best, the red beans and rice were not good at all. 

My advice- go for breakfast! You will LOVE it.

This restaurant is actually pretty big with multiple floors. I think the environment is pretty good and staff were nice, my review reflects my particular experience with the food itself. Came here to eat some seafood, tried the combination seafood player and was pretty disappointed. The seafood itself didnt taste very fresh but more importantly how can you serve a fried dish cold? That means you basically just fry a bunch of stuff and left it there for a while. At least refry it a bit to let patrons enjoy warm food.

Honestly...my dinner was terrible. I've probably tasted better crab cakes at a non seafood restaurant. The "crust" or whatever it was fried in did not taste great and neither did the crab meat inside. Definitely disappointed.
Came for brunch. I had the paw paws and my boyfriend had the maw maws. Food was amazing and service was even better. Jerry is the man. Ask for him!
So the fried food was good... the blackened food... eh eh eh. I mean it was decent, but I really did love acme much more!!!

Me and my friends had awesome dishes and excellent service for breakfast.  Prices were very reasonable and you get an amazing amount of food!  Definitely a must for visitors and locals.  My stomach is still smiling!

If you're going for breakfast or lunch this is a great place. The server Whitney was quick and attentive and and gave excellent recommendations. The crawfish Benedict that she recommended was the best breakfast I've had in a few years. Also the crawfish omelette my wife had was made to perfection. This place definitely knows how to make an exceptional breakfast.

Delicious.  I ventured out for the alligator sausage in my omelet, and I loved it.  They combined two omelets for this picky eater.  The biscuits and gravy did not disappoint.  With so many places to choose from, I look forward to trying lunch and dinner.

Such good flavor new orleans really did not disappoint in the flavor department the shrimp had a damn good kick to them though the fries delicious i had the gator bites too and omg so freaking good super crunchy perfectly seasoned.

So I found out about this restaurant before I got to New Orleans under a Twitter post by Rico Nasty (if you know you know). She asked where to eat in New Orleans and this spot was listed. I checked out the menu and was intrigued so I decided to go. Let me start with the drinks, this was the first place I went to after arriving and the drinks here didn't even give me a chance to warm up. I got a double shot margarita and it hit almost instantly. Now for the food, initially I wanted the blackened gator, but I decided to get the cajun fries with gator. They did not skimp on the gator it was more than enough, (plus) I enjoyed. I also got the crawfish étouffée, this was my first time having étouffée and it was valid. Oceana's menu has a lot to offer and strong drinks so I would definitely go back.
Omg. So goooood. This was the first restaurant I went to as soon as I got to New Orleans and the food was amazing. The crawfish crab cake was delicious and the pasta was so creamy and good.

We went here for lunch during the AOTA conference. The ambiance on the patio was very bright and whimsical. The food was delicious (I shared the "taste of New Orleans" with a friend.) 

They were very accommodating with our large group size and our need to get out the door quick, but unfortunately the food took longer than expected to get to us and we ended up rushing to box up our food and go. 

Next time I'm in New Orleans, I will definitely come back here for lunch when I have a little more time to enjoy!

Food was great  we had jambalaya pasta and it was to die for ! 

The only thing was there was a rat that apparently made its way inside then out it went.

Ouh what can I say they really have an authentic ambient with very friendly staff
I would recommend having a gumbo soup and the shrimp pasta tasted outstanding

The seafood platter was amazing our first visit and then a second visit prompts this 2 star review. I am so sorry I deleted pics and lost the ones for this place but the first time was no complaining needed! Everything was great. The second visit a few days later and it was like eating at the crusty crab. The shrimp were burnt, the fish looked like guppies from the Mississippi River. We won't be back

I came here mid-May but I made reservations online. I'm sure this place can get very busy so if you can, call in ahead of time to get a spot so you don't have to wait. Our reservations were for 7:30pm but we finished our tour at 7:00 and had some time. So we went there to see if they would take us earlier and they did. Ok great!

The place is huge. I think there's at least 3 floors and we were on the 2nd floor. When we got inside it didn't seem extremely packed so I'm not sure why there was a queue outside. 

For the most part the food was just fine. Definitely edible of course. I'm not sure if it's because I had really amazing oysters elsewhere why I wasn't in love with the famous oysters. The barbecue shrimp was fine too. 

I really enjoyed they strawberry beer though. It was very different and delicious.

Our main dishes blackened redfish and the Cajun jambalaya pasta were good too. I prefer them over the apps because of the price. 

The bread pudding.... SWEET. Deathly sweet. I think if they cut down on the sugar by a hundred orders of magnitude this would be delicious. I could only eat the inside (which was delicious!)

Combination of great service and food. All the selections you want including alligator, jambalaya, etc. Make sure you go the reservation route as otherwise you'll be standing outside for some time and then wondering when you do get in why you were waiting so long with so many empty tables.

Best place to eat casually in the French quarter.  Unbelieable flavor in everything we've ordered.  I'm embarrassed to admit that it's the first place we eat upon arriving every year and usually we make a couple more appearances during the week of our trip!  We love it!  It's a huge restaurant....we've never had to wait....and although it's usually pretty crowded the food comes out pretty fast as well.  Our favorite dish is the pasta with fried chicken or catfish.  So much flavor!  Staff is friendly and it's just a great, laid back, kid friendly, environment.  Oh and best of all they deliver until 1 a.m.!  I'm sure we'll be back next year!

The food is ok.  I had the seafood platter and it was a tasty seafood platter.  4 pieces of cat fish, shrimp, and clams, hush puppies and fries.  Its a great meal to share.  I feel there are a lot more authentic nolo style food in the French quarters.

The food. Bbq shrimp and butter toast was elixir of the gods. So good. Our waitress Meagan D. Was awesome. We had friends join us and everyone was so helpful and accommodating. Pink hurricane for cancer put my husband under. I loved the Bloody Mary with Peppar Vodka. First place to visit was recommended by my hotel staff.

Showed up for Anniversary dinner reservation, to a crowd that was reminiscent of scenes from A night at the Roxbury, waited 45 mins to be called to door and we were asked to go to the hostess desk. The hostess never acknowledged our presence, she asked the gatekeeper about our reservation to which it was confirmed we did in fact have a reservation now 45 mins overdue. She looked straight ahead and still did not acknowledge us to so much as speak to us, after 10 minutes of this we decided to end this Twilight Zone Anniversary episode at Oceana Grill. I must however say that the food looked great, perhaps we will lick our wounds and attempt this dinner again...the next time we have a 20th Anniversary.

Oceana Grill is a great casual seafood option in New Orleans. There is always a line out the door but it generally moves fast as they have several floors of dining. We went early with our toddler and only waited 5 minutes to be seated. We were led to the top floor which was nice and open where we wouldn't be disturbing the people next to us. We ordered a couple of drinks and mine came out quickly but my husband had a long wait for his gin and tonic because she told us there was something wrong with the tonic. My husband ordered the gumbo and crab cakes while I got the mixed seafood platter and added crawfish tails. The fold was really good (who doesn't love fried seafood) and my daughter ate some of the hush puppies and crawfish tails. Even better Yelp offered a 10% off check in coupon which was just icing on the cake!

This restaurant is so nice. The moment my family and I walked in we were greeted & seated upstairs. We over looked the festivities outside the window. Whitney was super awesome. She let us know all about the drinks and all the top choices. She was very patient with our party of seven. You can tell she is aware of the menu with her experience. Thanks to the staff. All the way from Shreveport we Thank You! We will be back again.  If your in the area this is the place to be "Oceana."

What a fantastic piece of history and amazing food! Everything looks so good. Just wish I had a bigger stomach so I could try the desserts. Great wait staff, very friendly and gracious! A must stop if your in town!
Had a fried oyster po-boy and my friend had a blackened shrimp po-boy. Both were just ok.  Honestly there are much better places down bourbon street.  Service was slow.
BEST RESTAURANT IN NEW ORLEANS!!! The service was AMAZING and the food was even better! Definitely recommend!!

This place is OK. Not the most fantastic food but fine, and we had a large group of people so it worked out. The service was pretty good though. My meal was fried eggplant-- the eggplant was covered in sauce and a little soggy, but the sauce was a creole marinara and it was very flavorful. Overall its a fun place but not outstanding.

This was our first stop in NOLA the night we arrived. My group ordered alligator appetizers and weren't to impressed; I was told it tastes similar to chicken but too greasy and chewy. I had the crab cakes to start and they were great. The majority of our group had some sort of seafood platter or pasta with seafood variety and had not complaints. Overall, the venue is breathtaking, being nearly three stories tall and true to NOLA culture. If this is your first trip and dinner plans are up in the air, make the decision to come here.

Great food and great service! The hurricane drinks were delicious and potent. We had the crab cake appetizer and red fish special.  The crab cakes were delicious and I know I'll be dreaming about that crawfish mushroom sauce. I loved every bite of the red fish, greens, and dressing in my entree.  My idea meal would be a combination of the two: crab cakes and crawfish gravy over a bed of cornbread dressing with a side of greens. I would consider flying back to NOLA for that dish alone.
Absolutely great Crab Cake Benedict. Breakfast was very enjoyable and the atmosphere is good.
Food was ok, service was horrible. I had the crab cakes, which were great and oyster po boy, which was ok. Water had oil floating in it. Gross

I loved everything about this restaurant...Came in with a party of just about 15 people we had the pleasure of having a server name Kim and i must say we were beyond pleased with her professionalism. Usually having parties that big things tend to go wrong but this lady was great took everyone orders and literally everything was correct down to drinks and entree's. I won't even try to explain how amazing this food was, everything came out fresh to order. While we ate Kim made sure to come and assure we we're okay without being overbearing. We'll definitely eat here again and I hope Ms.Kim can be my waitress again!!! Definitely deserve 5 stars

Good place to go if you want creole food. We came during jazz fest week and it was the only place that didn't have a wait. Got the sampler (gumbo, jambalaya and red beans and rice). It really was like a taste of New Orleans. The sampler is the best way to go to taste all the variety that NOLA is known for!
Arielle was awesome. ALWAYS my first stop in New Orleans. Bloody Mary's are anazing!! Multiple breakfast menus, so ask for them all!!!

Oceana is one of the best restaurants I ate during my trip to NOLA. The wait is a little long depending on what time you go, but it is definitely WORTH IT! The service was excellent , the atmosphere was fun and welcoming, and the food was absolutely amazing! This will definitely be on my must go to list next time I'm in town

You're looking for a recommendation on a great plate. Sorry can't help you.

EVERYTHING the four of us ate; from apps to desserts were outstanding....and plenty of it. 

The 'surprise and delight' were the gator bites. Two different flavors with the texture between lobster tail and lobster claw 

Get to Bourbon St, go to Oceana, and ask for Darrick for great food and spectacular service

Love the food and atmosphere! Great NOLA food fast, and this is coming from someone who grew up here! Oceana is one of the places I always recommend to my tours. I love that they have a few good (and actually filling) vegetarian dishes, because not all FQ restaurants do. The only thing I would change is to ask them to offer more vegetarian food, but since people here are usually after deeelicious seafood, I understand. Because their food'll make ya lick ya fingers all the way down to ya elbows!

Our Server Jamie took really good care of us. We were not sure what to order and she made great recommendations for the two of us. It was an awesome experience and she did it all with a smile. Awesome food and awesome service, what more can one ask?
We ordered crab cakes and blackened fish and got horrible food poisoning. Do not recommend to dine here.
Stopped by here on my way out of town and I am so sad I didn't try it sooner. I will most definitely be back on my next trip to NOLA!

Very friendly service! Alligator bites were amazing, tastes just like chicken! Po-Boys are pretty big so I recommend splitting it with someone. Fried seafood was also great! Decent serving sizes for everything pretty much. The only downside was the extra side plates, they were not clean at all, but thankfully our waiter gave us clean ones.
I really wanted to try bbq shrimp while I was in town and I'm glad we waited until stopped in here to try them. They were amazing. We will stopping here every time we visit.

We missed our dinner reservations at one restaurant and returned to our hotel thinking we would get room service. Unfortunately no one mentioned it was unavailable for an event, and brought us menus for places that deliver. After getting over the initial annoyance at that we opted to order from Oceana since the reviews were good, and we'd seen a long line waiting outside earlier in the day.

Ordered the blackened chicken, garlic mashed potatoes with red beans and rice, the fettuccine creole pasta of some kind with tons of shrimp. We were told to expect delivery in 45-60 minutes, so we set an alarm on our phones and headed down to the bar to kill some time. 28 minutes later my phone rang and it was already there, waiting at our room! 

After hurriedly dumping our drinks in go cups we rushed up and got our food. It was ridiculously good, hot and fresh, and just what we needed after a long day of walking around taking in the local sites. Next time I'm in town I will definitely order again.

What an exceptionally lovely, cute, and stunning restaurant.  The character is amazing, the service is FAST, and the food is delicious.  But seriously, this unassuming restaurant (from the outside) had better food than the five star restaurants we visited during our trip to New Orleans.  We went there for breakfast, and one person in our party jokingly complained that the crab cakes had too much crab in them.  We loved this restaurant so much that we came back for dinner! The fact that they are open until 1 or 2 am is a plus!!!
Love love love the food here. It set the standard for us for Cajun food and none of the other restaurants we tried came close

Not only is the food amazing, but the service was spectacular. I mean our server Bree was so dope; she conversed with us about anything we asked her. She was so pleasant & she gave us all the hotspots to go to for the nightlife. Their oysters are delicious, and that jalapeño stuffing is something special. I really enjoyed this spot and I can't wait to visit this restaurant again. I wish there was food like this in New York!

Best breakfast in New Orleans by far! Absolutely delicious. I got the scrambled egg, hash, biscuit and grits. I got a side of toast and coffee as well as a Bloody Mary. My husband had the Cajun fettuccine pasta and char grilled oysters. He said everything he said was absolutely incredible. Our waitress was Fiona and she was on point all throughout our breakfast, sweet and kind and always checking in on us to make sure everything was going well. I couldn't be happier with our experience. We've been here a week; trying a different place every morning and this was by far the best. Stop by and try!

We took an Uber from the airport to our hotel. He recommended this place as his top place for grilled oysters.

Delish! It's a little different from the last time I was in town and had them at Felix's which was amazing. Here they have a creamy sauce with chopped sautéed onions and peppers. It was really good. 

I had their red fish special and my friend had the crab crepe. Very happy with the food! Huge portions. 

I'm not a Bloody Mary fan and I actually really liked their Bloody Mary to my surprise!! It was savory without being too much like V8 if that makes sense. I actually preferred it to my watermelon margarita. 

Overall, the food was great, our service was very nice, and I would totally come back to try another dish.

A must for lunch while in NOLA. The Cajun Fries, hands down the best we've EVER had. Seriously addicting, especially after a few Grenade's. We like the staff, whoever was the DJ. Made sure we stayed lit...LIZZO was everything' 
Over all: you gotta go for the vibes & the fries.
