Great place! Went here twice. The bbq shrimp were delicious. Only downfall is it was slightly on the pricey side. Great service too.

Excellent food!  Rachael was our server and was sweet and on the ball!  We sat upstairs and had dinner; the stairs weren't that bad and I felt we had much more space upstairs than we'd have had down.  Downstairs always seems too crowded for me and I like a little room when I eat!

Everything here was terrible and disgusting the waitress couldn't even defend it!!! I will never eat here again, this was the worst food experience I had in my lifetime!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! How many time can I say I hate this place

First time to New Orleans. After 3 days finally found Oceana! Best food, great drinks, but Pamela our server was amazing! She made us feel very welcomed and gave us some tips on the city. We will come back before our trip is over for sure.

Not nearly as impressed as everyone else. It was just ok.  

We felt like we were being herded like sheep.  And, it also felt like an assembly line.  Their goal is to turn over tables as quickly as possible!

We received our phone in probably 5-7 minutes.  It obviously wasn't freshly prepared.  Who knows how long it had been sitting there.  While it was good, it wasn't anything to write home about.  It was also very noisy with poor service.

I wouldn't go back.

Visiting from Texas and would have to say I was not really impressed with the food. I ordered the crab cake meal. We also had the Famous oysters and a side of fried crawfish.  Everything was just ok. Food is not really seasoned that well. Crab cake had too much breading inside and out. Oysters were meh. Overall experience was kind of a let down.
The food was DELICIOUS & our server DeMarcus was perfect! I will definitely come back at OCEANA

Fried seafood platter was delish! 

Server was off the chain! 

There is inside and outside patio seating available. 
Specialty cocktails are great also.

For many years Petunia's was my favorite brunch spot for reunions with friends and post race celebrations.  Then last year I was devastated when I heard I would never get to wait outside of the little door again....

I was elated to find out recently that Oceana Grill is now the home of the chef and they were serving the same menu items that I missed dearly!  My wonderful boyfriend brought me there for our Valentine's/Who dat hangover brunch and we both high-fived when we saw that the menu still said "Petunia's"!!  Absolutely everything was the same....Cha-ching!!

The ambience of Oceana Grill is everything that makes New Orleans unique....vintage pictures, antiques, and a beautiful courtyard!  There's a large dining area, so you're less likely to have a long wait.  Being a door off of Bourbon, even the bar looks cool enough to grab a drink to start off your night.

My Eggs St. Louis were delish....english muffin, poached eggs, fresh crab meat and a grilled tomato all smothered in creamy hollandaise.  The bf got an enormous crepe filled with shrimp, crab and cheese!!  Whatever you do...you need to order a side of hashbrowns because Oceana does 'em right!!  

I think Oceana will be my new brunch spot.....the Petunia's void has been filled!!

I'd give this place more like 4.25-4.5 stars. The creole originals were done well here but their blackened gator was some of the best around! Service was a bit slow but our server was very friendly and attentive. Really enjoyed sitting out in their courtyard, as well. Overall a good experience and would definitely come back if in the area.

What a great experience. The food was delicious and the drinks tasty. This was all made better by our great waiter named Jerry. He not only have us great recommendations, but was spot on with what we each where in the mood for.  Get the Oceana Red Snapper.

We come to New Orleans every year and one of our favorite breakfast destinations is Oceana Grill Whitney our waitress was superb and made our meal pleasurable the Bloody Marys are also a hot tip don't just come for breakfast they serve superb food all day long in a New Orleans tradition. Love it love it love it
Gator bites were yummy. Excellent food, servers, even the food runners.  Right in the French quarter where most of the tour things are.  And they have gator bites!!!!
Great food and great service! We had the blackened chicken po-boy, and Taste of New Orleans. Also, a Pina Colada and Hurricane to-go :). Everything was good.

I really enjoyed the jambalaya pasta here and we also ordered a half order of Rockefeller oysters. This place seems to be a chain and honestly reminds me of The Red Lobster in Chicago lol. When on Bourbon street I would totally stop by for another meal.
The food was good, the service was good. The bread pudding was amazing. It was a little overpriced.

I hadn't been to New Orleans before, and even though my girlfriend had, it had been many years. So even with Yelp at our fingertips, we were at a loss of where to go for dinner our first night in town. The concierge at our hotel suggested Oceana, and said his wife worked there. We were a little skeptical, but decided to take a chance. I'm SO glad we did.

We had the BBQ shrimp appetizer, which was 6 enormous shrimp in a very spicy sauce. They were great! For the main course, I had fried catfish filets, which were fresh and crispy and perfect. She had the red beans and rice, which was also delicious. The portions were huge. Neither of us could finish our dishes. The drinks were also nice and strong, and the waiter was friendly, even if the service was a little slow.

If I was a local, I'd probably frequent this restaurant.

The hurricane here is delicious! It's my favorite from all the restaurants I've tried. It's also not overly sweet which is what I like. Got me a good buzz from it. You could never go wrong with charbroiled oysters. It's not the best around the French quarter but it's still pretty damn good. Gator sausage was also good. Didnt try the entrees because I decided to visit multiple restaurants for their top recommended dishes. But, I am sure the food would be just as good.

Service and food was excellent. We arrived in New Orleans later than planned and finding an open kid welcoming restaurant was difficult. Oceana Grill is open late with good food and kid friendly. Will definitely go back!

So, funny story. I had this in my bookmarks for new orleans, but last night I got in late and just wanted some food. Most places were closed so i figures I'd walk down bourbon from canal. Passed a couple places, then saw this place open. The menu looked good, so went on and was dated right away. Chris promptly greeted us and told us the specials including a drink they called the hulk. I stuck with a Nola blonde. 

As we're sitting there I was thinking this place sounds familiar and I realized at some point someone told me to try it because it was on my list of yelp places to go. We started with the crab cake and it did not disappoint. Very dense and full of crab topped with crawfish tails and a mushroom cream sauce. I ordered the special which was a blackened red fish served over a corn and crawfish dressing with a creamy mushroom and crawfish tail sauce served over top. The same as the crab cake sauce. It had fried crawfish tail on top and a side of mustard greens. I will most definitely be bringing people here, and you need to stop in if you haven't. Great, knowledgeable server, decent prices for bourbon street, and it is definitely NOT a tourist trap so go try it. I have been to New Orleans probably a hundred times and can almost say I'm local with family here, and i have eaten around the city and suburbs. Go check Oceana out on you next trip or if your undecided!!

This was such a fun spot! Unfortunately, I wasn't all that hungry when I went, but still loved the food I did have. I ordered a cesar salad, which was good. My only complaint on that would be that the dressing was served on the side, which I didn't request. I would've preferred to have the salad tossed and pre-mixed with the dressing. However, the fries were amazing! I love fries in general, but these were on another level. Our waitress was pretty cool, very nice and attentive. And for being such a busy spot, we were able to enjoy a quiet meal upstairs. This allowed us to enjoy the music more and take in the decor and charm of the old building. We had a great experience here and would like to visit again some time!

Visited this restaurant during my visit to NOLA. It's right off of Bourbon St and a local I met during my stay recommended it and suggested I try the crab cakes. The crab cakes were delicious and moist. Usually my experience with crab cakes are that they are dry and not worth my time, however; this was not the case with Oceana. I also had the gumbo which wasn't impressive at all. The food came out really quick didn't even seem like 15 minutes went by BUT the food was at best luke warm.
 The place is extremely busy with a line outside but they actually seat you pretty fast. The inside is really big, seating on three or four floors, which you can't tell by glancing in. The General Manager took time to talk to us about the history of the building and made some recommendations about where to go to hear great music.

In town on a family trip. Last visited this place about four years ago. Service was great then and it was great today. Ten year old son had the Crawfish Etouffée, he said it was Delicious. Food is good, service was good. Waitress was very attentive and friendly. I will return for another meal when I next visit.
The crab cakes are GREAT! The seafood platter was very filling. The burgers a big, and I couldn't stop munching on their seasoned fries. Our server Arielle was super nice.

Those oysters are AMAZING. My first stop when I got into the city, was Oceana and will be every time I'm here. Get. Those. Oysters. You will not regret it. 

I'm a huge fan of all things watermelon, and the margaritas (with a double shot) did not change my feelings. They were delicious, and cool and refreshing on a hot humid day. 

You can never go wrong with a PoBoy of any variety, and these were no exception. They were delicious and flavorful. 

Our server Anthony was AMAZING! He was so friendly, made suggestions and had answers to our questions. I highly recommend this place to anyone coming to New Orleans.

I am so sorry, but this restaurant was awful. We went on a Monday ( or maybe it was Tuesday) night in late September 2016 at the recommendation of a hotel doorman.It was pretty busy, but it was so dark I could barely see the menu.The crab cake appetizer was just terrible. It was so mushy, and I don't think they even used real crab, tasted like catfish! I had the seafood platter and it even looked awful, it was semi cold, mushy, and tasteless. My son had a sampler of cajun staples( red beans and rice, jambalaya, etc) and it was a messy plate of tasteless mush. It was our first meal in the city, and our first time in New Orleans, and it was just so disappointing and a bit pricey.

This place is just ok. We started with the famous oysters and those were pretty good. My husband got the taste of New Orleans and it was just so bland. The jambalaya needed salt. I got the New Orleans pasta and while they did load it with seafood, the flavor was lacking. I'm not sure why this place has so many raving reviews, but there are way better places to eat in New Orleans for this price.

On our last night in the Quarter, we decided to stay in and relax at our Hotel. Oceana delivers! Which was a key in why we placed our order from there. We enjoyed the alligator tails, the cheeseburger, the ribeye, a side of crawfish tails, and mashed potatoes. All were very good. Reasonably priced, and delivered on time and hot and cooked to order. They brought plenty of sauces for the items, and everything one would need to eat in their Hotel room. We haven't been to the actual restaurant, but I can say that delivery to a room nearby is a PERFECT good local alternative to the usual Hotel delivery options. Authentic New Orleans food, reasonably priced and delivered.

My friends were telling how good this place is & how big the oysters are. So last Thursday, my friends & I went to this place. It was my first time going to Oceana Grill and it is located in downtown so of course the wait was going to be crazy (10 @ night). So the host greeted us and ask how how many people & we said "10 people" then he told us that there was going to be a wait. A friend asked him how long was the wait and he said, " I don't know, let me go check." Okay you work here, in charge of seating people, but you don't know how long is the wait..? Also, his tone when I was talking to him was really RUDE. He was talking to me like I didn't really understand him. But our waitress was really friendly. Moving on to the food!!!

The food was pricey and mediocre. I have tried better places than this pricey poop hole. Their chargrilled oyster aren't really chargrilled. It was just topped with veggies and sauce. The raw oyster tasted better. The oysters weren't really 'big' as my friend said it would be.. So that was disappointing. We ordered BBQ shrimp (okay), 2 seafood platter (really good, can't go wrong w/frying seafood), red bean & rice (tasted like Popeyes. Yum) and finally crawfish étouffée (it was good, till the end). Overall, this place is okay & I won't be coming back here again.
Great food and huge portions. Friendly, attentive staff with a casual vibe. Be prepared for your taste buds to explode. Stop by and see Megan. She's the bomb!

My husband and I walked by this place a bunch of times with no real desire to go in. I don't know why, but for some reason their sign was off putting to us.  We ended up going because it was one of the few places open during the tropical storm and right across the street from the hotel. 

I'm so glad we made it to this restaurant! The service was great, we had Jamal. We started out with some drinks. The Ruby red was delicious!! We split the Cajun fries with blackened alligator and the jambalaya pasta. Boy, those Cajun fries are so good. We added the blackened alligator to it, and it's almost a meal! The jambalaya pasta was also good, but I could have just eaten the Cajun fries and I would have been very pleased!
The food was good and the service was outstanding, our server Alex even noticed that we had a coupon which we had forgotten about.
The food here is amazing. My family and I were here visiting and stop in here. The hostess and servers were very pleasant and helpful. I will return
This is a solid choice for those looking for a reasonably priced restaurant with good food. Nothing too fancy. Casual and fun. Good service.
Went for breakfast and came back for dinner.  Both were exceptional and had great prices!  The line may look long, but moves fast.  It's worth the wait!

If I could give it zero I would. Not for the food. Food was ok. 4 of us went here last night. We sat at the bar to eat and have a drink. My buddy's bday. The bartender asked if we wanted shots. Bartender said happy bday DONT WORRY I GOT YOU. You want 4. Us. Sure. Cool thanks. Bartender. No problem. Surprise surprise he charged us $32 for 4 shots. I guess we are just dumb tourists. When confronted.  Bartender said. "I never said that. Don't tip me than". So moral don't trust them.  They have a little game they like to trap people with for buying shots. After. I herd them say the same thing to another couple. So I for warned them. And they didn't bit. Be carful as a tourist.  Just don't say don't worry I got you.

I can see why people love it here. The place is huge. Attentive wait staff and the food was well sized portions. I ordered the catfish po boy and gumbo. Great choice and definitely order ahead for fast pick up.

I stumbled upon Oceana Grill on Yelp. After reading the reviews and looking over the menu, we decided to give it a try. We had reservations for late night and got it right on time, even with a line out the door. My husband ordered the Fried Seafood platter. He was very impressed with it. He said the fried catfish was some of the best he ever had. He loved the size and taste of the fried oysters. He really enjoyed the fried shrimp as well. I ordered the Crab cake platter. SHUT. MY. MOUTH! they were the best crab cakes I EVER had. Big, full of flavor and chunks of crab meat! The crawfish, mushroom cream sauce was like heaven! We ordered the strawberry cheesecake to split for dessert. Fresh-made and creamy, it hit the sweet spot to cap off the evening. Brad, our server, was attentive and personable. We will definitely be back.

One word...... WOW! We were here 4 years ago and ate here 3 times during that trip and it was our first meal this trip. David was a fabulous server! The food, beer, ambience and service are incredible. I love this place.

Exceptional food and absolutely unbelievable service.
Tim took amazing care of us & ensured we never were without drinks & our food delivered perfectly.
With no wait time, we sat in the beautiful court yard & enjoyed an evening of laughter & memories.

Excellent food.  The best I've had since being in NOLA for 3 days.  Our waitress Meagan T was very knowledgeable of the cuisine and provided the best customer service I've experienced in all the restaurants visited in the French Quarters. If you ever visit this establishment, request to sit in her section. You won't be disappointed.

It was my first time, and it will definately be a place that I'll go back to as often as I can. We brought the grand parents from California. They wanted to experience real New Orleans food and this is exactly that. You do get a little intimidated by the line, but it moves fast. It's always a good sign if there is a line. From the young man at the door, the young ladies at the front entrance to out server Mary L. We were very impressed through and through. Thanks Mary L for photo bombing our family pic! It's a keeper.

Oh man! If you can stomach walking through the awful sewer aroma that welcomes you to Oceana Grill, your taste buds will thank you. My friend and I dined at Oceana Grill for breakfast on a quiet Sunday morning. We were greeted and seated immediately in an upstairs dining area (SN: There were a lot of different rooms with patrons; I'm assuming they separated customers based on what meal they were having.)

My friend remembered visiting Oceana Grill some years ago with her father and really wanted to have the meal she enjoyed on her last visit. Unfortunately, because we were there during the Essence Festival Weekend, Oceana Grill had given us a limited/special occasion menu. The waiter, an older gentleman who didn't seem at all enthused about his job, was actually helpful in getting the kitchen to make her meal.

I had the St. James Crepe and I must say, it was one of the most delicious things I've ever eaten in my life! Everything was cooked to perfection! If we had time the next morning, we would have definitely stopped here again for breakfast.

There was a "percentage off" offer available for checking in on Yelp. It certainly pays to be a Yelper!

Fantastic meal! Went for dinner tonight. Arrived about 7:45, waited in line for a good 20 min, before being seated in one of the upstairs dining rooms. Jamie and Roderick were our servers and even though they were extremely busy, they did an excellent job. It was a little noisy because of the large parties in the room having to talk loudly to hear each other. 

The gator bites were half fried, half blackened. Get the blackened if you like them a little more tangy. The crab cakes are very rich. We should have stopped there. We ordered crawfish etouffe and the redfish. Amazing! Delicious but not to heavy. Should have stopped there. Somehow we ordered pecan pie and ice cream. It was actually my least favorite part of the meal and I loved it. 

This was my favorite meal on this trip, and I would highly recommend it.
So delicious, and a fun atmosphere...we ate here 2 nights in a row. Get the blackened gator bites
Good food, great atmosphere.  Had the fried seafood platter after a long flight and walk to and through the French Quarter. Service was very good.

I've been to 33 states, and this is the best seafood restaurant I've been to so far. Tried it once and had to go back two more times before taking plane back to Maine.  If seafood doesn't do it for you, I recommend their gator po' boy or anything from their BBQ.  Great service and desserts, as well. The ONLY downside is the slighlty crammed seating, but is not bad at all if you visit during their less busy hours.  I'd give this place six stars if I could.
Great food. Amazing service. Definitely recommend this place. Lines may seem long but they go rather quickly it's worth the wait.

Been in New Orleans for 3 days prior to this meal... and everything else we ate here  has not disappointed us till this meal. It doesn't live up to the hype. We saw a long line and the reviews seemed promising so we decided to give it a try. I got the shrimp po boy, that was suppose to be their best seller and the bread was hard and tasted bland. The shrimp was dry and had no flavor. Would not recommend this to anyone.

My first time in New Orleans was during mardi gras week. As packed as the restaurant was my party of 4 was seated with quickness. Nice and friendly people, the owner even greeted us and thanked us for stopping by which was cool because that really never happens.

I recommend the jambalaya fettucini dish and the gumbo

We could not be more happy with our entire experience at Olde Nola Cookery. We went around 8pm and were seated right away. A server came by for our drink order and provided us some stellar ideas for dinner. The drinks were brought out to us quickly, then the main server came over to check on us for our order. He also gave some great recommendations, mentioned the specials, and answered all of our questions. 3/4 of us ordered the blackened catfish poyboy "all dressed up" (with coleslaw, lettuce, and oceana sauce).  A couple of us couldn't finish because the portion was so large, and man it was good! The last person got one of the fancier specials that looked amazing and was eaten right up. If the food wasn't enough, the servers were what made the experience what it was. They were truly great and conversed with us.

We actually went back a couple nights later and the experience was just as good. We're happy with this place for sure!
My favorite place in the Quarter. Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner all on point. Staff is great and food is fresh. In a great food town this is a great place to eat.

I give the food 4 stars as it's really good, not K Paul's or Cochon great, but the prices reflect this. You really can't ask for better atmosphere or wait staff, that gets them the 5 stars.  I will be back in New Orleans this week and plan on going back to Oceana.  It does not disappoint.
Food was typical New Orleans food. The "sweet tea" was not sweet, but the service was exceptional!
The food was good but very over priced. We got oysters, crab cakes, shrimp salad, poyboy, Jimbalaya and Alfredo fettuccine.
Great oysters and seafood in general. The wait was pretty short and you can still have a conversation during your meal.

OMG! We have been in NOLA for 2 days and this is the best meal we have had hands down - food and service. Kim is awesome, we were originally sat near the back next to the kitchen and it was really hot and Kim greeted us and moved us to another table that was very comfortable. She was over and beyond friendly. We ordered oysters Rockefeller and Oceana oysters and fried eggplant sticks. Everything was amazing! We went I. Knowing that we loved oysters Rockefeller but we discovered that we loved the Oceana oysters the best. Garlicky cheesy goodness. The friend eggplant was perfect also. The manager even came by the table to see how we were doing.  Perfect dining experience and the prices were fair as well. We will be back before we leave!

This was one of our first stops during our trip, and it was amazing. The wait was not too long... it was a Saturday lunch rush, so we expected a little bit of a wait. Jamal (I hope I spelled his name correctly) was such a kind, welcoming waiter. He recommended excellent dishes, and was always there to answer questions and check in on us. My fiancé got a Ahi Tuna Special, and I got the "Jazzy" Crab Cake Platter. It was the best seafood we had ever had. I've had my share of crab cakes, and this hit it out of the park. Absolutely delicious! And it came out in no time. Since it's not a big space, you may have to wait a bit. But it is worth it, for sure! Definitely a go-to place if you're in NOLA.

We're visiting from Michigan its about 10 of us. I've been to the restaurant before but the a service last night was impressive. Mary our server was knowledgeable. Of the food and ingredients. She was more than helpful and an overall genuinely kind person. Keep her we need more employees like that in the restaurant industry. We'll return and hopefully shell be there when we do.

Jacklyn kept us humored while waiting to be seated.
Sierra was amazing and helpful deciding what we wanted.
Malik was very kind and helpful also.

Omg! I don't even know what I should start with whether it was the ambiance, food, or amazing customer service. This place was all around amazing. My husband and I came here for a date night and ordered the Mardi Gras pasta and the redfish oceana both dish were amazinggggg we were both eating off of each other's plates. Chantay our server was amazing she was super nice and was able to give us great recommendations. The environment of the place was nice although the outside part where we wanted to sit was closed we were seated inside by the window. This is a must dine while in Nola!
We stopped in for lunch. Food was amazing. We watched them grill our oysters. Also had a shrimp Poboy which was huge. Great service
The pasta jambalaya 9.5/10. Crab cakes 8/10. Gumbo 6/10. Overall. Great service. Friendly fun atmosphere

There are very specific moments of my last trip to New Orleans which spring to mind, and one of those is my dining experience at Oceana.

Two words: Praline Duck

OMG. But let me back up...

My friend Anh and I initially entered and were seated near the front door, which turned out great for a spell because we were able to see and hear a brass parade going down the road! Seriously, that's one thing I adore about NOLA and which really sets it apart for me.

Once my husband arrived to join us, we asked if there was seating out on the patio. We were guided to a table in a central courtyard where we were surrounded by historic walls and windows going up a few stories. So the environment was already on a roll...

Enter the FOOD. Now, I don't normally gravitate toward duck, but I was in New Orleans and wanted to try something outside of my norm. When my eyes lighted on the words "Praline Duck," I was hooked.

I am here to tell you today that it was one of my top 10 meals ever consumed. I ate every.single.bite. It was a perfect blend of succulent and sweet. I even got that look on my face when my husband (a notorious duck-lover) swiped a bite.

I'm going back to NOLA this spring and will absolutely be stopping in for more Praline Duck!

During our last visit we stopped in and asked about the crab cakes. We are from Maryland and we have some great crab cakes here. 
Oceana has some of the best we have ever had. Do your self a favor and try their char grilled oysters. The sauce is great! We even got some to go.

We took our 8th graders to New Orleans for their end of year trip and we ate dinner at Oceana. The food was delicious and the service was top-notch!! We will definitely be returning in the years to come! Great experience!!!

I ordered a shrimp po' boy - it was my first time ever having one and I thought there was no better place to try it than in New Orleans. When my meal came it was mostly bread. There were 9 small blackened shrimp on the sandwich (popcorn size) when the photo in the menu showed it overflowing with shrimp. The french fries were excellent but I asked for mayo to dip them in and didn't receive the mayor until we asked the server a second time. This wouldn't have been a problem except we didn't see our server until the very end of the meal (about 30 mins later). The fries were cold by then. The sandwich was soggy. I left the restaurant hungry. 

My boyfriend ordered red fish which was good but not great. Everything was very over priced and the service was extremely lacking.

This is basic tourist fried seafood and such. The crab cakes were good with a little zip and the oyster po boy was adequate. But if you're looking for something uniquely New Orleans then run away from here. Think "salty dog" with a little spice. Service was poor as well. It was 3:00 in the afternoon. Long after and before the crowds but we couldn't get one of the many servers to help us, even after politely asking the manager to send someone our way. 
Choose something less "ketchup-y".

First of all there was a line to get in.  The wait time was not long at all.  Service was great.  However, when my food arrived at the table it came cold.  I was not pleased at all.  I wanted to give them another try.  So, I returned and this time I took out and ordered the crab cakes.  I asked if they were made fresh or were they pre-cooked.  I was informed that they were cooked fresh.  When I received them they were hot.  I enjoyed them much better than the meal I previously had.
Great food and service.  Can't go wrong here. Had the shrimp poor boy and Cajun fries.  On my so tasty. Our waitress couldn't be any sweeter and the service was fast and efficient.

I had heard how good this restaurant was from friends & it gets good reviews.  It was the worst meal I have had in New Orleans.  I had the duck.  It was a half bird, baked.  Then they just poured a sweet sauce over it before serving.  So none of the flavor was cooked into the bird.  My friend had the redfish.  It was the same prep method, blandly cooked, then a sauce ladled over before serving.  They were both so uninteresting that we ate about 1/ 3 of it.

What was good, however were the collard greens & mashed potatoes, cooked just like gramma used to make.

Was really let down by the customer service from both the hostess to our waiter. We went the day after Mardi Gras, so maybe everyone was just 50%. I had the ribeye topped with fried oysters and Mom had the crabcake fettucini alfredo, which was on their website menu, but not the actual menu. Overall, the food was just ok, the portions were really small to the point were it was a little pathetic. For example, the steamed vegetable that came with my steak consisted on only 7 pieces of cucumber, squash, etc. I'm not a picky person, but this place really let me down.

Wow, what an amazing New Orleans restaurant. Being a New Orleans native, I had high expectations for the cuisine. The special (blackened red fish) was phenomenal. Our waiter Kevin was was great. Stop by if you have a second. You won't regret it.

Gumbo...yes please.  Grab an ABITA AMBER...cold!  Our waitress was hilarious...her asst dude...yikes.  No Clue.  He went to set down a beer on our table...after we received our beers...and us being honest people said we already got ours.  But if you want to leave it we will drink it.  We did not care if we had to pay for it.  He says...Oh No...and picks it up and acts like he is going to drink it...being a total Dbag....spills it on himself.  So we laughed like, hello that is what you get.  The table next to us laughed also.  Bc I guess he was jerk to them also at some point.  Then the 4 of us all got along and exchanged conversation...until we got their tab...we quickly sent it to them.  hahaha.  We did not have to wait for a table and you can tell this is a touristy place...but the reviews are great and it was a quick easy bite with a decent menu.

Ate here our first night in town. The staff were all very kind, but the food was just ok. Flavors were pretty good, but both of our gumbo bowls were lukewarm at best, and the redfish dinner I ordered was seriously overcooked. Ok overall, but will probably not go back.

Don't order the blacken duck!! We had a group of 5 and the server told me that my food held up the entire table's order. I asked that everyone else's food come out and I would wait (for my birthday celebratory meal). However, my meal came out first and was cold. My niece's grilled redfish and shrimp was also cold. The food was warmed in the microwave and brought back to us. AND then after all of that, the server explained that because of the size of the party we were charged an 18% gratuity. Gratuity is a thank you for your service. Cold food, slow service and no drink refills does not equal 18% in my book.
Oh my goodness! Staff was exceptional and crawfish omelet was great! I went for breakfast and dinner. For dinner the fish was fresh and the fried alligator was amazing. I wish I could give 5 stars.

Fist time in New Orleans and the first restaurant that we went on the strip and let me tell It was just amazing we have started we  hurricane drinks a traditional drink from New Orleans it kind a fruit punch with rum, next we order crab cakes for appetizer and it was delicious, as a main dish the wife order fish platter can remember the name exactly and I order the taste of Louisiana and it was amazing it was just perfect that before we leave on our vacation I have to come back and order these dish one more time, and for dessert bread pudding it take me back how mother make it was perfect, the dress code is casual, noice level is average, they have a patio and second floor, service was awesome on waiters Joel have excellent knowledge about the foodies excellent service. These is place is must for lunch or dinner you won't be disappointed.

Il locale è molto carino, i camerieri gentilissimi, ottima la birra locale alla spina (suggerisco IPA) per accompagnare i piatti Cajun. Il tortino di granchio non è un gran che, troppo unto, mentre l'alligatore è da non perdere: grigliato piccante, fritto, nella salsiccia!

We stayed at the French Market Inn and one of the bell hops suggested Oceana and gave us a coupon. MAN!!! What a homerun!!! Thank you Terrance!!! We ordered chargrilled oysters, red beans & rice, cajun fries, and a cheeseburger. I have absolutely nothing negative to say about the entire experience! The waitress was very attentive (Lakeisha), the drinks and food were ordered and presented in less than 20mins! This place is a gem!
Best seafood I had in New Orleans! Get the blackened chicken or blackened redfish!
Great service and selection but just not the great food although my husband had the fresh oysters and he enjoyed them.

Everyone was very welcoming!  Every staff member greeted us and made us feel valued as a customer. Our waitress Sarah s very sweet and attentative.  Food was beyond amazing, we will be back!  Mardi gras pasta and seafood platter are the best.

First official meal in New Orleans, and it was fantastic!  I had the shrimp po boy, and my husband had blackened redfish with red beans and rice/mustard greens.  Everything was piping hot and very tasty.  The shrimp was fried to perfection, and the fries were perfectly crispy.  The sauce/slaw on the sandwich complemented everything.  My husband's mustard greens were so good - he liked them and generally that's not his favorite.  Their Bloody Marys were tasty too!  Great food and wonderful service - I would highly recommend this spot.

i love how this is more of a local joint. one of my friends came to new orleans a few weeks before us and recommended checking this place out for dinner. unfortunately, when i made my itinerary, the only spot i could fit it for was brunch, but i'm so glad i did! my boyfriend and i came to eat breakfast/brunch here before the saints/redskins game.  we're from va so we were rootin for the redskins and ran into some super awesome saint's fans! they were so nice, gave us awesome recommendations, and were actually going to walk to the game after their meal!  so we decided to do the same. got a beer to go after eating a delicious plate of biscuit and gravy along with eggs, hashbrowns, and toast.  sadly, we lost the game, but made tons of new friends and enjoyed an amazing meal! the service was fantastic, the food was amazing, and the drinks were perfect! if you wanna go where the locals are at, this is the place to try!

Crawfish omelet - good
Vegetarian omelet - good

Crab cakes - good but too much filler
OMG the food is delicious, the service is A1 and our server Lavern was amazing. Attentive and fast will definitely be back.

We were in NOLA Memorial weekend and I always do my yelp research and this seemed like the place to try charbroiled oysters. Now oysters rockerfellers you can have anywhere but at Oceana they have a charbroiled oyster in a garlic sauce with parmesan cheese crust. It's pretty darn good. For anyone open to trying something new even if u don't like oysters this is definitely the way to introduce your pallet.
We also had the fried catfish po boy now that was the best po boy I've ever had. the breading was perfect, and the fish was plump and moist. The bread roll was also very good it didn't rub the roof of your mouth not too soft and not crusty. My fiance doesn't like coleslaw but he ended up asking for extra. The po boy comes with coleslaw and pickles and the combo is delicious! Get the Po Boy!
This was our first meal in NOLA and it did not disappoint! Our waiter was very friendly and helpful, and the service was fast. The gator bites were a delicious start! Great vibes!

We went for breakfast and lunch. Pancakes and seafood omelet. They were both really good but pancakes were fav by far. We had shrimp po boys for lunch. They were really good as well. We also had the secret fries(Canjun fries). Although they were good we would have preferred regular fries with our Po boy sandwich. We will definitely come back.
The food was good the oysters were delicious and so were the crab super fries were bomb. The place is just really expensive for 2 people it came out to almost 80 bucks.

Seems super commercial, but is actually really good. Great service and huge food portions! Food was actually really good. We ate at all the good spots, willie maes, dookie chase, brendans, johnnies poboys, acme oysters, mothers, etc.... so if you want a good quick chain place this is a great option!
A lot of food for the money. Tourist spot so can be a long wait sometimes. The food is okay.

Enjoyed a post wedding parade while waiting in the short line. It was a short wait. Loved every bite. Taste of NOLA and Blackened redfish were delicious. Service was great. All staff were super friendly. Definitely recommend.

The food came out cold, I had to send my food back to get it warmed up. I'm sure some of the food is microwaved and not made to serve. The food came out literally in like 5 min. The gumbo here was a disgrace. Def was a let down. Do not get the gumbo here at all.

I had the sampler platter, loved the crawfish étouffée and the sausage, didn't care for the red beans and rice BUT that is really not my thing. Jambalaya was OK BUT my daughter who is gluten free was able to order crab cakes and she was in heaven! Husband had pork chops which were seasoned well but slightly overcooked. They have a courtyard so we were able to dine outside

This was the first place we went to when we arrived in NOLA. A nice greeting. Atmosphere was of a restaurant on the pier and sea worthy decor. 

We ordered various appetizers and a couple entrees to share in a group of about nine. All the food tasted good, no major complaint. The highlights were the crab cakes,  grilled ahi with bbq shrimp, turtle soup, and the seafood platter. 

It was some dang good, late night grubbin' and service was very friendly and attentive. Specialty drinks were good to. First time i had a Abita Andygator beer here also. mmmmm

A definite must go if you are in the area. I must try their breakfast next time!

LOVE the CRABCAKES and BANANA FOSTER Dessert!!

The service is a hit or miss. I have eaten during brunch and dinner. The service just depends on who you get. One time, I had a male server and he did not give us much service- he didn't check up with how the food was and if we needed anything else. He didn't give us refills on water...but that was one out of five times I have been there. 

The breakfast with Petunia's is really good- omeletes are really yummy!
Food - Great! Service - Great! Had a large party of 10, called with reservations. They got us in right on time. If my party and I are ever back in town we will be coming back!!
My husband and I came here after reading the positive reviews on yelp and I'm glad we did. Their food was amazing! Recommend it!
Amazing food and wonderful service ! I would highly recommend the seafood omelette  We will definitely be back very soon !!!

My boyfriend and I had dinner here our first night in New Orleans. You HAVE to order the crab cakes! One of the best tasting things I had during my entire trip to New Orleans! 

There can be a bit of a wait so if you can make reservations ahead of time!

If you are looking for some genuine down south cooking and Luv, do to Oceana grill and ask for Whitney. Not to take away for the food but Whitney is a ten-star server. The first time I went, she wasn't even my server, but I saw how people would come and ask for her and how they were hugging laughing, and I was like how am I not apart of that. When cam the nest time, I was able to experience Whitney, and I could see the most significant difference. She was personable professional and fun. My girlfriend arrived the next day, and we weren't able to get to Whitney section, but she still came over and gave my girlfriend recommendation (that she ended up loving) and checked up on us more than our waiter. In all the food here is an experience that words can not explain and Whitney just took the experience over that top.

Took a friend that was visiting town here as a kind of late night dinner option. No complaints really. I do recommend making a reservation online instead of waiting at the line outside the door. 

Also this place is so massive inside I didn't expect so many seating options when we walked inside. Food wise I really enjoyed the alligator bites they were delicious we got them fried and grilled. The entree I got was the shrimp basket and it wasn't too bad. 

Not somewhere I would go all the time but a nice place to take guests.

In a city known for its drinks, the local cuisine is worth a try. Looking for pallet satisfying food in NOLA we walked into Oceana Grill for dinner. The food here was as good as any other local place around.

The place had decent prices and bearable interiors. When it came to the most important aspect, the taste, we were pleasantly surprised at how good it was. We ordered alligator bites, shrimp creole and blackened chicken. All of these dishes were amazing especially the blackened chicken. The blackened chicken came with jambalaya and had the perfect char on top. The shrimp creole was perfectly seasoned and had a large serving. Even the alligator bites which come blackened, fried or half n half (what we ordered) were delicious. These three dishes were sufficient for our group of four.

To sum up it had Great Food, Good Prices, Decent Ambience and Good Portions.
Yet another tourist trap. The shrimp creole consisted of a few very small non native shrimp drowning in a sea of tomato paste. The fried eggplant sticks were OK.

By far the very best service and food we had while visiting New Orleans.Our server David was very friendly,knowledgeable and helpful.We savored every bite of our Blackened Fish with crawfish etouffee.I will definitely go back if ever in New Orleans again.

Tip:We made reservations and was able to skip the line and promptly seated.

Long ass line, long ass wait just to be seated outside with small ass fans with the worst food I had in New Orleans. This place is overrated and we waited an hour to get seated just to be seated outside in the hot and humid and taste of New Orleans was crap! Dry ass rice and small portions into small 3 little bowls and the nastiest crawfish soup I had, Landry's was better! Come here if you wanna wait long and have not so good food

First let me explain why I gave two stars instead of the one that I originally thought of giving, service. They are quick and attentive, the staff is polite and helpful. Now to the restaurant, it is nothing for decor, quite "cheesy" actually reminding me of a greasy chain restaurant. They have an upstairs and downstairs along with bar seating and if you sit by the window you can peak out and "people watch". I ordered the redfish special, which included a crawfish cake, topped with blackened redfish and shrimp mushroom sauce. Also a side of greens.  Best thing on the plate was the greens. Don't get me wrong the food came out hot, but the fish was undoubtedly reheated in a microwave and as dry as can be. I tried to eat as much as possible but finally gave up in disgust. Worst part was the price!!! $30 for that??? They should be ashamed
I have dined here twice in the last year. I love it. Menu variety and friendly staff made this a favored spot when I visit.

This place has a crawfish mushroom cream sauce that they put on a lot of their dishes, and that cream sauce is so good I could eat it by itself. It's like a delicious gravy that covers the food and adds a nice amount of richness without feeling too fatty. There's also a good amount of crawfish which gives it a nice shellfish flavor.

I really enjoyed the crab cake appetizer. It had a ton of crab and was a very tender and flavorful. It also came with the crawfish mushroom cream sauce which gave the lean crab a nice richness. The blackened bayou duck was also really good. The duck was super tender and meaty, and the skin had a nice Cajun rub that added a bunch of flavor. It also came with the sauce that I love so much. 

This was a great restaurant and the service was fantastic. It's also a good place for tourists who use yelp because for your first check in, you get 10% off your entire bill.
Really great food, fun drinks and nice service. Got there early and only waited about 10 minutes.
Chris was bomb the food was delicious and the wait was super fast even with a line down the street. Great time!!

Went here for dinner on my last night in NOLA. After trying to go to a different restaurant the night before and they were all booked, I made a reservation at this place. Good thing too, because there was a long line out the door. 

Make a reservation!! Also they won't seat you til your whole party is present. 

I got a sazerac, gator tail bites, and the blackened bayou duck. 

Everything was delicious. The duck wasn't too dry, and the seasoning was great. I sat at the bar, and the bartender was friendly and attentive. When I ordered the gator, he asked if I wanted half fried and half blackened. This must be a typical offer, since he asked the couple next to me the same thing. The duck is $25, but if you're able to get it you definitely should.

We ordered a dozen of the Oceana's Famous Oysters for an appetizer and I ordered the Taste of New Orleans as an entrée. 

Taste: 3 Stars
The oysters were seasoned very well, however, there were crunchy parts in about half of the ones we had. Just not the most quality oysters. Taste of New Orleans was delicious, but not very much spice going on. 

Service: 4 Stars 
Our waitress was great, but a little hard to flag down when we needed her. I'm sure this is just because the restaurant was so busy.

Price: 3 Stars
In general, this is a pretty expensive area for food so price is average for this area but I still don't feel like $20 for a dozen of oysters with inedible crunchy pieces in it is worth it. So, I'd say just skip the oysters. The taste of New Orleans was $18, and not a whole bunch of food. My boyfriend got the grilled ahi tuna for $24, but it was sushi grade fish. 

Overall: 3 Stars
We went to Oceana Grill for our last dinner in New Orleans but it was not as good as some of the places we went while on our vacation. I would definitely say this isn't reeeally worth coming back to next time. 

Still worth giving it a shot for yourself! 
Melissa St.Clair 
Atlanta Native

The location is great and the atmosphere is pretty cool. Blackened anything is a must have. The hush puppies were just ok but the crab cakes were a true delight. Every single person we passed was extremely friendly.

If and when you visit Nola this is a restaurant you definitely have to go to. Our waitress Sierra was not only very hospitable her recommendations were delicious. Each time I visit I will have to come back to visit them.

First visit to NOLA And the front desk of our hotel recommended Oceana.  We have been twice the last three days.  First time was for lunch.  We split a shrimp and oyster po'boy.  Both amazing!!!   There is seasoning in the batter that gives it a slight kick which is perfect.  Second visit was for dinner. Our server Kevin C. Was excellent.  Friendly and knowledgeable. We started with the famous oysters which were fantastic.  The boyfriend opted for the catfish P'boy this time which again was delicious and I got the Taste of New Orleans that was a trio of  jambalaya , Red beans and rice and crawfish etouffee.  Kevin recommended the crawfish tails to add texture and it was a fantastic recommendation.   We finished off with Banana Foster Ice Cream cake.  It was a challenge to finish it (being full from our meals) but be damned we did it.  Our bellies full and aching. I am hoping I can sneak in one more time for a po'boy before we head back home.  I highly recommend eating here.  It's definitely they top of my favorite places to eat in The French quarter.  Beautiful courtyard.  Friendly staff. Great food!!!

DELICIOUS food and even better dessert! Loved the atmosphere and the staff was friendly. Only issue-- it took QUITE a while to get our food... this place is pretty popular, and therefore BUSY. However, I definitely recommend eating here while visiting the French Quarters. Only had lunch/dinner here, but I hear the breakfast is to die for too!

Great food, fast service and friendly staff. The crab cake appetizer was a nice large portion and tasted great. The shrimp and crawfish pasta was a huge portion and so yummy, and the desserts were great too.

The food was just ok.  I heard a lot of hype so I wanted to check it out.  But it needed flavor and the hurricanes were syrupy.  The service was good.  The hosted at the door made us feel like family.
The signature crab cake dish was definitely one of the best crab cake dishes I've ever had.  A definite must try when at Oceana.  My friend also enjoyed her veggie pasta.

Best pasta I've ever had in my life! The Jambalaya pasta was absolutely incredible. My whole group said they loved their meals and the server was very friendly and accommodating. It's not always easy to wait on a large group and they did an excellent job!
This place is really good. We came for a quick bite to eat. Make sure to sit in Jerry's section!

Service was so great even on Easter Sunday afternoon when the restaurant was packed. The gator bites and Cajun fries were well prepared and extremely flavorful. The veggie omelette as well. Finished it off with dessert, I left with a full stomach and a very joyful experience

So pissed! Found the end of an onion in my po boy (see pic),  not to mention it wasn't prepared the way I had requested, nor was it delivered with the sides I asked for. Mediocre quality, another NOLA tourist trap with rude management. AVOID!

If you make your way to New Orleans, you must try this restaurant. It is right off Bourbon street and it is the best food I experienced in New Orleans. I had the blackened redfish, jambalya, and pecan pie. The redfish was perfectly seasoned and moist. The jambalya had a little kick. The pecan pie was the right blend of sweetness and bourbon.

I got a hurricane here. The drinks are tasty with a powerful punch. You can taste the alcohol.

The food was really good!!!! And the customer service matched. I got the alligator and fried shrimp po boy. The bread was VERY FILLING I couldn't finish  but I stuffed my face as much as I could. 

We went a second time and I got the taste of New Orleans. It was just as good!!!
Whitney was our waitress
The food is AWESOME! I definitely recommend the crepes. Ashleigh is the best! Her service was impeccable and was super friendly!
Oh my goodness!! I just ordered their ribs. They delivered  to my hotel. Off the chain delicious! We got a side of red beans and rice too. Yummy ! So make sure you have cash when you order.

Had dinner two nights ago. It was clean, friendly, good service. My wife had a Cesar salad and gumbo. Salad was very plain, dressing was served on the side. Gumbo was also disappointing, only had shrimp, no okra, no other meat. It lacked the usual flavor that was expected. It had the flavor of N.O. plate with three sampling's. All three were disappointing. When the best part of an expensive meal is the fresh sourdough bread, something is very wrong. We were very disappointed! We were shocked because everyone said to go there....they were wrong. I would give minus stars if I could.

Cannot stay away when visiting the city.  The crab cakes and redfish choices are my favorites.  The bar does not disappoint either.  The Watermelon Margarita was perfect... so just order the double to begin with

Had a great meal here on our first night in new Orleans, both myself and my partner had the prawn/catfish plates with fries and sauce with a soft shell crab on the side. Meal was good but please check other reviews out and the photos, this is not going to be a super 'authentic' new Orleans meal but its still damn tasty! we also had a couple of drinks on the house which is also appreciated!. Unfortunately I cant remember her name but our server was lovely. Overall the place is fun and great for a causal dining experience.

Food here was so damn bomb!!! The fried breaded crawfish was so good! The gumbo and jambalaya were also really good. There's always a like but it moves so quick so don't be turned down by the line. Service and prices were great too!!
Pictures look great, but seasoning was bland, was disappointed cause it came highly recommended, wel I tried it! Thanks for good drinks and history lesson Allison... customer service was great!

Went to oceans grill and I had the best time ever. Megan was my waitress and she was absolutely wonderful. I started off with a bowl of gumbo. It was absolutely fantastic. Super simple. Super fast. Super efficient. Super fulfilling. Since I'm greedy.. I finished with the  fried catfish po-boy. It was so delicious: I had the best time ever!

Dirty restaurant . Waitress took our order, then didn't see her for the next 40 minutes .    I had to ask another waitress when our order would be ready . Orders came . My crab cake was pretty dense however every else enjoyed their meals .

Saw that this was rated no.1 on Yelp and it wasn't far from our hotel so we decided to go there for dinner. Had to line up and wait to get in, I'm thinking this must be good, wrong!
We had two waiters serving our table and it was like they both thought the other was doing it, so we received no service. It took a very long time for us to even put our order in, but we made excuses as they were very busy. When our food did finally come it was really disappointing, dry tasteless fish. Won't be back.
Best Food we had in NOLA!! Service was great as well! Shrimp platter was the bomb! Best poboys too! Definitely recommended and will go back again when we are back in NOLA.

Needed to update my review from last year. I ate at Oceana last year and I could not say enough good things, but this visit was extremely disappointing. I ordered shrimp Alfredo. I am not share if it was a bad night for them, but my food was terrible. My shrimp was over cooked and the Alfredo was somewhat runny. I was surprised because I had such a great experience last year. I am not sure if this was just a off night, but this was a must go to for me and quality completely went down. First meal of my New Orleans trip and I was completely disappointed.

Ordered food on the phone, this  doesn't look like crawfish oceana at all 
Why they added soda to the order(
Very good food. Service was awesome and our wait staff name is Mary. We had a large group but Mary took great care of all.

I don't know why this place has such high ratings on Yelp.  My jambalaya pasta was not good, it was maybe three forkfuls of noodles and the rest was sauce.  My mom's fried shrimp was overbreaded so much that she had to take it off to eat it.  We asked for bread prior to the meal and they charged us $2.25.  HA.  The only thing that saved the meal was my drink and the dessert, the Kentucky Bourbon pie.  So good.  Come here for that.
Walked in straight to the bar even though there was a 20 min wait for a table. Alison the bar tender was amazing! Very informative fun and on point with the drinks. Definitely recommend this place

1st time visitors to New Orleans. This location is conveniently on bourbon st. Great customer service. Fast sitting. Great Food. The waiter was familiar with the menu and the chef is beautiful delivering all plates to each table. Love it all. Biscuits and Gravy are a perfect dish.
Excellent food and excellent service: definitely the best service we had in NOLA. And try the blackened gator bites - they're delicious!

Not my first time at Oceana Grill but my first with the whole family and friends! Sat at a table back by the grill in Dori's section! 
Let me tell you DORI made the evening!!!
She was fun, personable and the service and food was great! The Oceana grilled oysters were what I came for and once again, they didn't disappoint.

Dori - thank you! I wish were were here more than a few days so that we could come back to see you!

Harry-repeat customer for sure

Perhaps if I went at a different time I might agree more with my fellow Yelpers. I sat down right after the rush which was about 1030 in the evening. Nothing that I ordered came out of the kitchen hot nor cold. My eggplant sticks were slightly warmer than room temperature, my coleslaw and Greek salad were actually a little warm But my red beans and rice were beautiful.
To top it all off I ordered a shrimp Po boy and the shrimp's were obviously cooked an hour before.  
My cosmopolitan was delicious and the service was very good. But the food failed on most levels.
Mannnnnn LISTEN, after the disappointment I had last night with dinner.. This place definitely made up for it!!!! Drink was good, food was AMAZING.. I am very satisfied with the meal!!!
Excellent service and excellent food! Definitely stop in for breakfast! Clean facility and restrooms.

Check in to use their coupon for 10% off. 
The blackened duck is really good. The crawfish sauce on top is nice, but i didn't get the mushroom flavor. But you can rarely go wrong with duck, it's just so delicious. My daughter had a burger which actually looked rather good and she ate all of it. It's in the middle of the French Quarter so there's lots to see and do before and after you eat. Good for families and groups. The portion sizes were pretty substantial as well, my husband and I shared the duck and we both felt satisfied. But we also were trying to keep room for dessert and we didn't want the itis to hit us. So if you're looking for a big meal and are going to walk back to your hotel for a good nap then don't share. But if you'd like to have enough energy to continue to explore the area, share your entree.
Spicey! Very Flavorable and fulfilling.  I had the special abd i need to go walk this meal off so i can sleep good tonight.  I had a tropical storm and it was very good.

I enjoyed the red beans and rice. Honestly it was like Popeyes Red Beans and Rice, in my book that's a win. But the PoBoys are pretty good. I never had an authentic one but here I was not disappointed on the flavor. Each bite had a special crunch to it. Mike was our server and he was very helpful. Ooooh but that Alligator  I believe it was the alligator bites were off the chain soooooo good!!!

Standard quarter fried seafood. I wouldn't call it inspired, but it sure was fast and tasty for a late night treat. We both had Po Boys and fries and licked our fingers. Service was friendly if not quick.

We ate here Sunday evening and thoroughly enjoyed the experience.  Everything we had was delicious and many of our selections were on the recommendation of our server, Mary.  We especially enjoyed the oysters Rockefeller and the bananas foster.  We would absolutely recommend this restaurant.

We ate here last night. There was a line, but it didn't take us long to get seated. I had the shrimp Po-boy and crab cakes. Both were delicious. The Po-boy was enough for two meals. My husband had the fried shrimp platter and my brother-in-law had the catfish platter. Both were overlooked and tasted like they had been sitting in the warmer too long. We were disappointed, especially considering the reviews. Our waiter was Chris and he was pleasant and waited on us diligently.

Five stars all around! The atmosphere was fun but still relaxing; the waiter, Brad, was friendly, informative, and polite (just an absolute delight), and don't get me started on the food! Oh, my goodness! The Oyster Rockefeller was absolutely delicious, and I'm not a fan of raw oysters, but my husband reports that they're amazing as well. We also ordered the catfish, crawfish, and shrimp and it was truly the best seafood I've ever had the pleasure to experience. 
If you're in New Orleans, you have to eat here.
Great service and awesome atmosphere! Food was great as well! We had a large group and they were super accompanied
I'm from san diego and this is the first place my boyfriend and I stop to have dinner. It was great we even came back for our second time .

One of my favorite meals while in New Orleans. I'll be a back for sure. Our waiter was awesome! I ordered crabmeat cakes with sauce on the side (I'm a sauce on the side type of person any time I can). But wow it was so good. I could have used more sauce just to drink it up. Haha. The collard greens were so good!
We had the seafood platter a lot of food enough to share enough to share. The bbq shrimp i was not that happy with only because the shrimp was peel and eat and had sauce all over it still very tasty.
Food was amazing!! I will definitely go back when I visit New Orleans again! Ordered the seafood platter and ate it all! Lol

Listen y'all! Everything was soooooo good! I dined here with 3 of my friends and we shared everything bc of the portion sizes! It was immaculate! 
The hostess, Jaclyn, was amazing and welcomed us into the restaurant with such hospitality and warmth! 
Our server, Alex, was amazing from beginning to end! We were unsure about what to order and he recommended their pasta special which was the Mardi Gras pasta +crab cakes. We ordered that, the Cajun fries + blackened gator & something else but I can't remember! 10/10

Good food, fun place. You will get decent food and have a good time there. 
Drinks are good they have some NOLA special type of dishes Gator bites never had that before 
Taste of New Orleans that gives you some basic New Orleans dishes.  Fried Catfish love it
You will not be disappointed in this restaurant and it's on Bourbon street

Great and friendly service! Thank you everyone! I ate here for breakfast today and i loved the St Francis Crepe and the pancake!

5 star service and food guys! Keep up the great work!!

This place is amazing! The vibe was great, as it was very laid back and relaxed. The waitress was very nice, but it took her a while to take our order and the restaurant was not especially busy at the time. She didn't take our entree order until after our appetizers were delivered to our table, and this was not due to me and my group not knowing what we wanted for entrees. Their red beans and rice was the best I've ever had. My husband had their praline duck which was phenomenal. The portions were huge. Overall, I loved this place, so I would obviously go back, and I highly recommend it!
Ok. The 'Taste of New Orleans' meal was served cold. Had to send back to have reheated. Overrated restaurant in my opinion.
Compare to other great restaurants here and other fresh amazing seafood, this one is over rated and over priced... Unless you are looking for fried food, it might be decent.

Service was really good! Our waitress was Bri and she was great. Seafood platter was goood but I wasn't blown away... the seafood gumbo was pretty bland my mom asked for extra seasoning but then it was a little salty, she said the seafood gumbo at at the French market was better (nawlins).

Great good. Not a long wait for lunch. Fries catfish  and a New Orleans sampler. 
Friendly staff. The fish was seasoned great. We would like it fried a little harder.

Excellent lunch and service. Ordered their baked oysters as an appetizer which were amazing and best oysters ever. Had the half rack of ribs for lunch and also best ribs ever. Will definitely come back on my next trip here.
Excellent place to stop shopping and eat. Barbeque shrimp and sauteed vegetables was outstanding. There are options for ketoers here.
We ordered grilled shrimp poboy , shrimp were really seasoned well. We were able to get in and out quickly. Service was good.

It's my boyfriend's and my first time in New Orleans and Oceana Grill was a must on our list. This was the first place we went. Our server Ron (Ronald) was phenomenal! Very knowledgeable about the menu items. He recommended the 1/2 blackened  1/2  fried gator bites... 10 out of 10!!! The taste of New Orleans was also a good start to this trip. And to top it all off, we had the bread (also recommended by Ron)... this was the most decadent dessert I've had in a while. It was perfectly warmed, the rum sauce paired with the whipped cream on the side was also very delicious. I hope to come back before my trip is over!!

Ordered some food for delivery via Uber Eats and was so happy I chose this place! I had the grilled chicken fettuccini and a slice of pecan pie. The pasta was delicious, even after waiting for delivery... I can only imagine how much more delicious it would be fresh from the kitchen! The pecan pie hit the spot as well! 

I visit New Orleans once or twice a year and have my favorite spots to eat every time and this place has now been added to the list!
Amazing food, great service, and a fun atmosphere! The bread pudding is definitely a must-try.
Get the secret fries! You won't regret! The blackened cat fish and oyster poboy was delish! :)

This place is open later than most of the restaurants in the quarter and was pretty good. It wasn't the best, but still worth a try. I had a dozen oysters, crab cakes, and a side of shrimp. Overall, I would recommend this restaurant for a late night dinner.

Food was great, tried the alligator sausage and the main alligator dish. Also had a drink which was recommded by sever and it was great. Server (Ashleigh) was nice and helpful in picking out dishes. Definitely coming back.

Amazing amazing food and even better service. Ashleigh is the sweetest and most attentive waiter I've had she knows the material and gives awesome suggestion of what to order. Beautiful smile and wonderful personality. Ask for ashleigh!!
The food and service was above exceptional! Wouldn't be a true New Orleans meal without the help of our waiter, Rasheen.
Crab cakes are excellent seafood platter has enough food food for two people catfish and shrimp great
Food was great! Our server Whitney was the best! Beautiful personality! Oysters, red beans & rice and drinks were great. Whitney suggested the jambalaya pasta blackened. Great suggestion.

I'll preface this by saying that if you're an out of tow we like me and want to know where to get the best authentic New Orleans cuisine/food, this IS the place. After eating at several places in the French quarter this place beats it. However, have a reservation or you will be waiting in quite a long line to get in. Cutting to the chase....

The food was quite amazing. I ordered several different things ranging from Alligator bites (delicious), was told it tastes similar to chicken but better. This was a pretty accurate description. The waiter even offered to do half order fried and the other half blackened with seasoning. Also tried the shrimp creole which was amazing. Perfect hint of the tomato sauce base and the flavor of the shrimp. lastly, tried the crab cakes with crawfish. The crab cakes were broiled and glazed over with the crawfish and gravy (extremely tasty). My wife ordered a platter consisting of fried catfish, fries, hush puppies, and shrimp. All the food was good and the service was just as equal. The place isn't the most upscale but everyone seemed to be enjoying their work and everyone seemed happy. The food was a reflection of the spirit of this restaurant. I absolutely recommend THIS place first before all others in the French quarter.

Came here on the last day of the trip after hearing rave reviews from some locals, and I'll be honest... this place was bang average.

I get the appeal of it, it's a large space, has fruity drink offers and is in the middle of the French Quarter, but I can't help but feel we got a little short changed eating here.

Again, a lot of classics on the menu with Gumbo, Jambalaya, Po Boys etc but everything just seemed like a watered down version for tourists, and even then the food was a bit lackluster 

We had some gator bites to start, which were probably the only good thing about the meal - well seasoned and good texture, served with a little Cajun aioli.

The gumbo 

Mains, as I say left a lot to be desired. I had the Fried Oyster Po Boy. The oysters were soggy and were served on some shitty saw dust like roll, with a little coleslaw and lettuce - and apparently that's a Po Boy. It was also served with fries... but like... so underwhelming and with no love or flavour. Something I'd expect from 7 eleven for $5.

A place more suited for Batchelorette/Batchelor parties, given the array of drinks deals - but the food was a bit meh

Food was absolutely delicious and our server Whitney was amazing. The seafood gumbo was perfect, and the seafood platter was to die for and the drinks were awesome. Definitely coming back when I visit again

Food was great!   This place a great food with great flavors.  We got the gator tail bites fried and grilled which were delicious as well as oysters.  The oysters were charred with this yummy garlic cheese sauce.  I do not like oysters as the texture is does not agree with me but charred with cheese and garlic was delicious!  The menu offers a good number of foods that are New Orleans flavors.  They had a special with redfish over cornbread jalapeño stuffing.... the stuffing ROCKED!  If they are offering it I highly recommend.  

Service was great as well.  We didn't have to wait long to be seated (15 min) but when we left the line was significantly longer so be prepared to possibly wait.  Our server frequently came by to make sure our drinks were filled and that we enjoyed our meals.

Sorry folks.  This place is not good by any means. The only things we had that were "just ok" were the gumbo and the bbq shrimp. Everything else was terrible. Red Beans and rice, jambalaya, ettoufe and fried crawfish. Yuck

The food was ok. My husband enjoyed the taste of New Orleans. My special was a little dry, the fish didn't have a lot of flavor. The greens that were served with it were delicious. We had the crab cakes as an appetizer and they were good but I feel like they used tuna as a filler which is fine but it didn't say that on the description. It was still very good.

Touristy- think TGI Fridays, NOLA style. Just off Bourbon Street and open late- it's convenient and multi leveled so its fits and can seat lots of folks, but i didn't find the food, atmosphere or service anything to rave about. I thought it was a bit generic and touristy- we ordered po' boys, fried oysters, gator bites... the food took a while. The place was packed though- probably because it is one of the few spots to eat a legit meal that late. We ordered fried gator bites and got blackened by mistake + fried later on. My po' boy was OK- the bread was a bit stale, the fried oysters and shrimp were stuffed in with remoulade. We ordered waters when we sat because we were partied out and they took forever. The waiter was nice, but I just didn't find anything about this place that made me feel like i got anything unique and deliciously NOLA. Prices were fair.
The food was decent, but on the expensive side for the quantity. Service was good, not a lot of options unless you are a seafood lover.

If it's your first time to visit New Orleans and you love seafood, this is the place you imagined what New Orleans is like. We ordered the aligator nuggets, it's a must initiation dish, it taste like chicken get the traditional fried, the blackened was good but I didn't like the soft chewy texture. Also ordered the fried soft shell crab, catfish, crawfish, shrimp supreme combo. Dozen raw oysters and dozen special Oceana Oysters baked and parmasian butter sauce excellent. Service from JaDE was genuine and family friendly, food service is very fast on a small table so you have to eat fast. Enjoy New Orleans t
First time here and it was great. We came for breakfast and I had the seafood omelette. Everyone was welcoming and friendly. I will definitely return when I am back in New Orleans.

First time in NOLA and Oceana Grill was on the top of the list! Chantay was our server and she was phenomenal. She was welcoming and extremely knowledgeable. We arrived here early enough for breakfast and late enough for lunch. Food was delicious and filling! Overall, a great start to my first NOLA foodie experience.
Sat at the bar, had great service and even better food. The blackened gator bites were amazing, it was my first time having gator and it was so good!

Fabulous- Food and Service. I asked a local police officer where does he eat and he recommended "Oceana"! Manager Michael was very kind and our Waitress Regene was Amazing!!! Thank You for great food and service!!!

We ate at this place a few days ago and it was so delicious! Seafood gumbo is excellent!! We had a large group of 8 so we were prepared to wait a bit to get seated but, they sat us in about 15 minutes even though the line looked like a much longer wait. The restaurant is huge with lots of smaller rooms and levels with tables so the turnover was quick. The only downside was the prices online were listed cheaper than what they actually were but it was worth it!

I love Oceana Grill.  I come to New Orleans every few months and I always stop in Oceana when I am in the French Quarter.   I know I am not the norm, but I don't eat seafood or fish so sometimes I find it difficult to find a restaurant that has quality options for us non-fish eaters.  I always get their blackened chicken po boy and it never fails me.  The chicken is always so tender and seasoned perfectly.
Derrick who works at the bar is amazing.  So professional and pleasant.  You can tell he takes pride in his work and doesn't let the small stuff get him down.  I hope that the owners realize what they have in an employee like that.  Go see Derrick, have the chicken and have a great time!

I don't have to say it, but there are about 50 billion cajun/creole places in New Orleans, that it can be hard to pick a place to eat. Same goes for San Antonio with Mexican Food, etc. You may be sick of cajun food by your third day here, but that shouldn't stop you from going to Oceana. It was legit!
We had a larger party, so we had to wait a little while for a table. There was a small wait. The hostesses were super nice and accommodating, so we all started at the bar with drinks. When we sat down, our waiter was nice enough and thoroughly explained the menu, specials and what not. He wasn't the friendliest person, but then again we were edging closer and closer to being THAT loud and obnoxious table on account of the free flowing drinks, so I digress.
The food! The food was awesome. We started with the Oceanas Famous Oysters. They were delicious. I realized while I was in New Orleans that my favorite way to eat oysters now is chargrilled. So amazing. I ordered the fried seafood platter and split it with another person, which was the right choice after drinks and appetizers. It comes with a lot of food - freshly fried oysters, shrimp, catfish and french fries. Everything was seasoned perfectly. We also ordered dessert, which was great too! The bananas foster pie was everything it needed to be, and tasted just like a cold, ice cream version of the dish. The creme brulee was also really good.
With the myriad of options in NOLA for cajun, I'd go back and eat at Oceana, no question.

We enjoyed our meal entirely. The taste of Louisiana was delicious. The drinks with dry ice were entertaining and yummy. We also had a side of fried crawfish tails. The service was great. The atmosphere was good. Great place for dinner.

We went on a Wednesday evening and waited for about an hour to be sat but worth the wait. The are where we were in line was rowdy area lots of drinks by bourbon street and it smelled like weed.  The staff was awesome everyone was helpful. We started off with some crab cakes with crawfish on top these were delicious. I had an iPa on draft but my fam had regular fountain drinks.  My entree was the red fish with crawfish on top it was delicious I would have it again but this place has way too many good dishes to repeat one.
The food was delicious as always but our server was outstanding!!! Bree (Breeann) was so sweet and efficient! Hope to get her again when we go back.

Needed a quick lunch. This place was perfect. Service was great! We ordered fried and blackened alligator and crab cakes for an appetizer- both were very good. Blackened chicken salad was awesome as well! Bloody Mary's were spicy but delish! Would defiantly be back!
You probably shouldn't be asking for much when eating off of Bourbon st. For the price the portions were small and lacked flavor.
The food is great. I like the alligator and shrimp pasta. Descent and creamy. However, one of my friends said the pasta is the best she has ever tasted. I would say you should try the one in Miami.
Amazing bread pudding. Super friendly staff and great service. I'll be back for breakfast.

Love the Oceana oysters.  We come here at least once every time we come into the city.  The rest of our meal, and we have tried everything from the Redfish, seafood platter, typical with a plate full of French fries, warm cole slaw and crab cakes which were bready, gummy and had a hard shell and gumbo are all just OK.  Expected more Cajun flavor, they really appeal to the tourist with an unsophisticated palate.   We will continue to come for the oysters.  Some of the biggest and best we have eaten in the city.

Great food !! 
I will be back ! 
Fast delivery to my nearby hotel 

The delivery guy was rude tho .. when I asked him to repeat something , he asked if he was talking Spanish or what ? Lol 
I didn't get his name .. turns out he was wrong ..
