Came here with a party of four and were seated pretty promptly. Our waitress came right over and took our drink and food order and almost instantly our drinks were served to us. And that was about the last time we saw her again. 

Actually, I am wrong. We saw our waitress multiple times, almost constantly, but that was the last time she came to our table. This woman actively avoided eye contact with us for over 45 minutes. It was weird. Then we turned it into a fun little game by seeing how far out of her way would she go if we kept looking. She served other tables their meals even though they came in after us. Finally her manager came over and just straight up apologized to us and told us he would bring us our food even if he had to cook it himself. Did I mention that it was weird?? 

The food was decent. Nothing too memorable. Between us we tried the blackened catfish, blackened chicken, rice and beans, and the blackened chicken salad. Nothing that I will remember, but I will remember the uniqueness of the service.

Absolutely amazing!!! They were suggested by our valet parking guy and he nailed it. Wait staff was good. Not too crowded. Environment was casual. Food was amazing. I got catfish plate and I got about 6 pieces of catfish, very good!. I also choose the mushroom crawfish French fries and they were pretty good. My date got the chef special and the dressing was so GOOD as well as the side of greens. A must go!

Not only did we receive excellent service, but the food was fantastic!  We all had different food so that we could try each other's food and there wasn't anything disappointing at the table! Everything was sooooo good!  I can't wait to visit New Orleans again so we can go back there and eat!

OMG I can never go to New Orleans without eating here TWICE!!! The ABSOLUTE BEST Chargrilled oysters AND CRABCAKES that I have EVER consumed. I eat there and get a to-go order of crabcakes! They even have a decent brunch.

I came back Dec 2018 and tried the place again. I got the sampler trio and my daughter got the fettuccine. She liked her food. I hated mine. If I was blindfolded, I wouldn't have been able to tell the difference between the the three things. I really don't think I'll do this again.
Our plates are jambalaya pasta, seafood platter, and taste of New Orleans. Super delicious! Brian was a fantastic waiter.
Dori our waitress was soooooo much fun!  Our first delicious dinner in NOLA was perfect!  You rock girl...never stop dancing and smiling!
Excellent red beans and sausage. Also tried the Oceana Red Fish.  Bananas Foster ice cream cake for dessert rounded out a great meal!

This was my first stop for some creole food in New Orleans so granted I have nothing to compare it against, but this was amazing!! The food tasted so good, it was definitely packed with flavor, more than I have ever tasted. I would definitely recommend this place and it's right off Bourbon so the the surrounding area has much to do!

Hands down this place was AMAZINGGGG!!!!! Our server Ashleigh gave us BOMB recommendations, she was so kind and welcoming--the whole experience made us feel like family! My sister had a Caesar salad with blackened chicken: bomb. My mom had the New Orleans sampler: bomb. Friend had fried shrimp: so fkin good. I had the bbq shrimp with mash potatoes and it was the most delicious dish and sauce I've ever had. 

We will absolutely be back here again before we go home. 

GO HERE AND DON'T LOOK ANYWHERE ELSE.

Grewboo and I ate here for dinner on our first night in NOLA. We sat at the upstairs bar and Christopher served us, he was killin it behind the bar. We split the Cajun jambalaya pasta and had the alligator appetizer, they were both delicious and it was the perfect amount!
*bring in your receipt the next day for a free mimosa or Bloody Mary!

Oceana was a cool spot. My husband and I stopped here for lunch. I had the fried shrimp platter and it was delicious and plentiful. My husband ordered alligator bites, gumbo and chargrilled oysters. The alligator bites were pretty good. We had them fried and grilled. The chargrilled oysters were pretty good but not as good as Acme Oyster House. Overall, I would dine again.

Great food and great atmosphere. I would highly recommend this place.  Been coming to New Orleans for many years from out of state and never came to Oceana before. Not as fancy as other high end places, but sitting in the presidential room was nice.  There was a line two blocks long, so I would highly recommend making a reservation. If you want really good NOLA seafood and a good price - this is the place.

The atmosphere is always alive and vibrant. The wait for two is usually under 30 mins on a normal day. If you have a large group please reserve or you will be waiting a very long time. The crab cakes are heaven and the fried shrimp is delicious. My boyfriend get a the Catfish Lafouche it his favorite dish. Everything on the menu is awesome you can't go wrong with any item. Check them out for Brunch as well it us very good.

This place was recommended by friends and the Lyft driver. I checked out the review and they were pretty good so decided to give it a try. When we arrived there was a line outside the door and within ten minutes we were inside. We started with the crab cakes.  They were really tasty. Our main course was the redfish Oceana. It was really good and I couldn't finish it. The wait for the main course was a little long. Maybe because it was Mardi Gras. Overall the choice to go to this restaurant was a good decision and I would definitely go there again.

The perfect place to start our vacation in New Orleans! Amazing combination of hospitality and local food!! Service was amazing!! Servers were all super friendly, nice chill environment with amazing food and drinks!!
We ordered from Oceana Grill via UberEATS, which was fast and convenient. The New Orleans sampler was quite good (4 stars). The burger was really sad (2 stars at best). Alligator po boy was ok.

The food and service was really good. Our server Kathleen was very attentive and made the best suggestions of which we were very happy with. The crab cake app was delicious and fried catfish and blackened redfish were cooked perfect. The manager even visited our table to check on how we were doing and gave us suggestions for nightlife.

We started off our NOLA trip by having lunch here and it was delicious. My wife had the Taste or New Orleans, I had the blackened gator po'boy, and we shared the chargrilled oysters and it was great! Definitely a spot you wanna try!

From the moment we stepped into Oceana Grill, I knew that it was going to be special! I was expecting a line but we walked in behind a party of 9...we were immediately taken upstairs to our table. Kathleen was our waitress and was on point all evening. My son had the burger and fries, daughter had the shrimp po boy, my wife had the catfish po boy and I had the shrimp alfredo. Long story short, the food and atmosphere is amazing! Can't wait to get back to the Big Easy!!
This food was amazing....and Whitney was a delight. Some of the best food and service combo I've ever had.

My birthday dinner was spent here and I loved every minute of it. There was a line but it moved very quickly. The staff was Thee Best!!! I got free bread pudding for my birthday as well I would eat there everyday if I lived in NO

Pretty good. The baked oysters were amazing and the sampler platter was a good size and good variety.  Our waiter was great!  Getting seated was a little weird in that the line went outside the door and then you sit on a bench.
The food and service (Jamal in particular) was fantastic. We had the alligator tail bites, crab cakes, and the kids fried shrimp. Everything was absolutely delicious - highly recommended!

Our first day in New Orleans we were referred to the Oceana for lunch in the French Quarter.  What a wonderful treat for a middle aged couple from the Midwest. The catfish PoBoy was out of this world. The red fish was just as good.  The collard greens were also awesome and won my heart over. I finished the serving wanting for more. The oysters with the sauce (sorry I don't remember it's name , but the dish is an Oceana signature appetizer) was out of this world.  Even my husband. who is not a fan of oysters, finished the sauce on the plate with the bread provided. Make sure you don't miss it. Thank you to our server Errol for all your suggestions and for making our 1st time at Oceana so memorable.

I've made 4 straight trips to New Orleans during Jazz Fest and I've dined here at least once during each, every time coming away with nothing but positive views. During my latest excursion, my friend and I were surprised to find the place renovated, with a new seating area that opened up to Bourbon Street. 

As for the food.... I had the seafood gumbo and alligator sausage, both of which were pretty damn good (don't know where the guy is getting the information about it being reheated Sysco)...and for desert had the strawberry cheesecake, which was also tasty.

While this site is certainly helpful, do yourself a favor people and take things for what they are. It appears as if being on Kitchen Nightmares has opened up the restaurant to criticism from people who are only looking to trash the place. Go and try it for yourself and judge it fairly.
Classic New Orleans food done right! Enjoyed etouffee, jambalaya, red beans n rice AND the crab cakes - all delicious with delightful service from Errol!

The service is great!!! I'm kinda a stickler for Blood & Mary's and they make a pretty good one. Had the fried oysters- yummy! Had oysters on half shell - very meaty they were not as good as I had hoped.  The BBQ shrimp is really Delicious!!

Check it out...the lines can be long but love pretty fast.  It's not that expensive.

My wife and I ate here for dinner last night celebrating our anniversary here in New Orleans. The line was overwhelming long outside but the staff did a great job getting everybody seated and an extremely swift pace. Our waiter was really friendly. He checked on us often and made us comfortable. I had the Taste of New Orleans and it was fantastic. I thoroughly enjoyed it. My wife had the spicy jambalaya pasta and she also thought it was great. If I ever visit New Orleans again, I'll make sure to visit.
Mary was the best! She suggested all the classic things to try. Really enjoyed my experience

We ate here last night and the food was fantastic.  Just as good was the service from our waitress Meagan L.  She was not only attentive but friendly and charismatic.  Indeed, we hope the rest of our eating out can match the level of service and delicious food we received here.

I was NOT at all happy with this place. The service was great but the food was so mediocre. I'm from Los Angeles and was so looking forward to eating creole food. I had the blackened red snapper and it was so dry. It was covered in a seasoning sauce that had no flavor to it. Don't recommend.

I had the catfish Poboy. It was okay. Light and fluffy catfish. The poboy together  it's cloeslaw and onion didn't taste that good. I also had a cup of the seafood gumbo and that was okay nothing special.  The poboy didn't melt in my mouth nor did I crave another one. Just saying.

Eat here if your good with your personal property being destroyed by their employee incompetence. We ate there in July, a dish washer tripped and shattered my wifes Samsung S6 phone and hit her with a plate while eating. Here it is October and they offered 100 dollars as compensation, which is roughly what my meal cost. Thats right! After screwing up our meal, breaking my wifes phone, hitting her with a plate, these cheap bastards didnt even comp us the meal. Their upper management has ran us in circles and now Im having to retain legal counsel over a stupid phone because they want to dish out what they think is fair. Too bad this shithole and its lousy management didnt wash away when the hurricane came through.
Excellent food!!! Killer prices and great atmosphere and chris m our server is the best in service, stop by for a bourbon good time
Ocean Grill was so delicious from the Cajun fries to the seafood po boy, that crawfish gravy I wanted over everything. I used it to dip my fries in, magic! The greens were a great side too.

So walked around for an hour to find this place. The locals suggested it as if it were the best place for seafood. I wanted pasta but there weren't a ton of options. I stuck with the Cajun pasta and added a crab cake for an additional $5 which was actually pretty good. We also

TOURIST TRAP. Food is like Chili's restaurant quality. Food comes out lukewarm like it was pre-made for busy restaurant. I have no idea how this place gets 4 star reviews. We are from California Bay area so we know when we eat good seafood. I can make better seafood pasta at home.. Customer service is 3-4 stars. Food is 1-2 star... gave my crew upset stomach all night. Not a great way to start our trip when we heard so much of good stuff about New Orleans especially for it's cuisines. Disappointed.
The blackened chicken was so delicious! The biscuits and the biscuits with heave were also so good. Meagan L was also a great server!

Came here because we saw the reviews. Food was good but felt like we were rushed. Service is fast and friendly. So fast that the beer hubby ordered was wrong and was corrected by another waiter half way through the meal. So fast that I had barely finished my dinner, had a few bites still left when the bus boy asks to take my plate.

It feels like they try to pack em in as much as possible and churn out as fast as possible!
Never again.

I was looking everywhere went to Oceana Grill to try their a Cajun jambalaya pasta and to be honest it was just OK. What I did not like was that the pasta was overcooked (I prefer al dente) and and the cream sauce was on the side of watery rather than creamy. I had to add Parmesan to try and thicken the sauce a bit. The Caesar salad with blackened chicken was yummy and the fries that come with a creamy crawfish sauce & cheese were yummy! The BBQ bacon cheeseburger was great!

My top 2 places to visit in NOLA every time I go. The food here is amazing. My personal favorite is The taste of new orleans which is a guaranteed hit!! The drinks are also good too. Beware of long wait times after 7pm due to popularity, especially for large groups. but they are accommodating.

We have eaten here twice already. I truly enjoyed this restaurant. The po-boy shrimp sandwich was AAAMAZING! And the CRABCAKES, oh gosh I have absolutely no words to describe them. Just know I was dancing in my seat lol. Only thing I didn't like was the second time we ate there, we did a to-go order and the hostess doing the take out orders hardly acknowledged I was there. She was too busy talking and doing other stuff and I waited about 10 mins before she took my order.

Our waitress was amazing but the food was very bland. We spent a lot of money here for it to be bland. The drinks weren't all that great either, especially after waiting in line for a good hour. I will try it again but most likely something other than the 6 items we tried.
Great food, great service from Whitney. Everything we ordered was exceptional. We wool definitively come back every time we are in town.
Amazing service , food was great Reagne was wonderful . Visiting from Houston will be back
This place was good for wanting to eat real quick then jump onto bourbon street - but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat at this specific restaurant

Did not like it that much . Loud, bathroom not very clean ... Frozen drinks not good quality. Called ahead asked if need a reservation, was told not need to make the reservation, had to wait in line good 30 min.
Food was great and service was friendly. The creme brulee was super good as well. Definitely recommend that. Would go again.

Located at the heart of French Quarter, right by bourbon street. Nice courtyard, heated outdoor available for chilly days. The food is okay, nothing special, just your regular mediocre chain-like food: fried, tons of butter/sauce and likely over cooked. The blacked Cajun flavor is there, but still nothing special, just the store-bought Cajun spice. 
It was nice that it opened Christmas Eve, and the service is very good- super friendly and fun servers, quick and nice service

I came here for lunch one day while on vacation visiting NOLA with some friends. We started with an order of gator, half fried, half blackened. The blackened was very flavorful and grilled perfectly. My girlfriend and I shared the Oceana Oysters and the special of the day which was the Marci Gras pasta. The sauce over the oysters was fantastic as well as the sauce for the pasta. Oceana is definitely a touristy spot and can get pretty busy, but the food here backs the hype.

Went for take out. Ordered duck, crab cakes, shrimp po boy, pecan pie and crayfish on red fish. Also ordered 2 drinks. About $100 down the drain. Drinks were fire. Food was thrown together and taste like it was heated out of the microwave. Pie was good. Gave the food to the homeless under the bridge. They need new help. The young girl taking the order was truly unprofessional and rude. She could have used a day off. It was nothing like the experience had by the TV personalitys on the Travel Channel.
The food was really good!!!! And the customer service matched. I got the alligator and fried shrimp po boy. The bread was VERY FILLING I couldn't finish  but I stuffed my face as much as I could

Service was good considering the busy location. Food was good, not great, but good. All things considered, price was reasonable. The only thing lacking is a decent draft selection-but then again people don't go to New Orleans for craft beers. I would go again with friends.

JERRY IS THE BEST!! I just landed and checked into my hotel. This place was recommended to me and I can see why. Cute patio, friendly staff and awesome food. 

Jerry went above and beyond to give me a true welcome into NOLA! By far the nicest waiter I've ever had and great kick off to my trip.
Right in the center of it all. The food was great I had the shrimp po boy and my wife had the seafood gumbo. Fast service great quality as always
Best oysters and Bloody Mary's in New Orleans! It's worth the wait! I would go here for just the bloody Mary's / best in New Orleans!

Be sure to make a reservation!! We made one and when got there, this place had a huge line and we walked right in with no wait because of our reservation. 

So how was the food you ask...


1. Taste of New Orleans dish was amazing. My husband enjoyed it. I tried a couple bites and it steaming hot and tasted delicious!

2.Shrimp Po Boy however was NOT good. The shrimp was so cold and the coleslaw made it taste funny. 

It could possibly be that we went to Gene's Po Boy the night prior and has the absoulutely best po boy ever there so my review on Oceana po boy might be a bit bias.(Go to Gene's for po boys!)

Overall, probably will skip this place in the futuee.

mm-MM (as in no) don't go here if you're a local ... I loved sitting out in the courtyard (cuz it wasn't mid-hot-as-hell-summer, it was October) the staff was great!! but I was not thrilled with the food ... it sounded great but there was alot of breading with alot of sauce to cover up the breading ... I felt New Orleans food is alot better than this - go to the Gumbo Shop or Dickie Brennans or a MULTITUDE of other NO restaurants for better food.  I don't drink so not sure about the alco- beverages - maybe those were good & like I said that courtyard was nice! & staff were great! food - mm-MM...no...

It was right next door to out Hotel, so we were reluctant to go in.  You know how it is, it can't be that good if it's that close...I rather walk some distance to find a better place was my thinking. Well, I will admit I was glad I went to Oceana Grill.

It really says N'awlins.  This place is cool, first of all it's 4 stories.  It's an old house, maybe a hotel now a restaurant.  It's got the old hardwood floors, the brick, we walked up 4 stories to the bar area and sat at the bar.  It was packed, which is a good sign but it was more than that, the waiters and waitresses were helpful, there was a positive aura you can feel, maybe it's the ghosts of past but whatever it was it made us happy to be there.

Best poo boy sandwich I had was there, and I kept trying other places all the top yelp recommendations, none lived up to this one.  My wife and I shared that with also the best seafood gumbo I had.

Don't pass this place up, it's got it all, great food, great atmosphere, great service.  Thank you to the staff at Oceana.

"just keepin' it real"
The Real Foodie

Right in the middle of the French Quarter sits this gem of a seafood haven! It looks just like a million others on the outside, but this is the deal! Such an incredibly cool building inside and out which leads you to think if walls could only talk! We went for the Seafood Platter, substituting the oysters for extra fried Catfish and Shrimp! So incredibly fresh, light, and just fabulous! The Crab Cake appetizer was two huge cakes with a crawfish etoufee! I know I've never had better Crab Cakes any place in the country than right here at Oceana! There's two of these in the French Quarter area, so be mindful of the address of this one as I don't know if they're related at all. I'd sure hate for you to miss out on the best seafood in NOLA! Beware of the weak NOLA drinks here though!
This place sets the bar pretty high! Had both specials blackened redfish and ahi tuna. The collard greens are some of the best I have had. The creme brulee was VERY good. The people make this place!

The food was great and Ryan was awesome! The portion sizes were a little small compared to what I'm used to for the price but the taste was great! The girls had chicken alfredo, my son had bbq shrimp with mashed potatoes and my husband and I split a seafood platter.  Bananas Foster Ice cream cake was so good and plenty to share. There was plenty on the seafood platter and it taste good. Will be coming again for sure!

Stopped in for lunch, and had the "jazzy" crab cakes platter. It was incredible. The flavors were to die for. I substituted Crawfish etouffe instead of garlic mashed potatoes, well worth the small fee.

The food was very good but the bread pudding was the best yet. There was a very loud table next to us but you can't complain about that since it is right off Bourbon St. There was a special, broccoli mac and cheese which was the dish of the night. Yummy!
Great service  super friendly server Chris M. Here for my bachelorette party. Ten girls and got sat within 5 minutes
Very good restaurant, perfect for discover the specialities of New Orleans ! (Alligator, poy bol, jambalaya, gumbo...)

Had late lunch/early dinner here.  Our hotel suggested this place and glad we went.  Hubby said the crabcakes were the best he has ever had. I am not a seafood lover so I opted for the fall off the bone ribs. . they were OK, too much sauce on them for my liking. .i love ribs. .wouldn't order them again. . .service was great. .would definitely eat there again.

Wow, what a hospital New Orleans restaurant. Being a New Orleans native, I had high expectations for the cuisine. The special (blackened red fish) was phenomenal. Our waiter Kevin was was amazing. Stop by if you have a second. You won't regret it.
The Cajun fries here was amazing. The staff was decent. It is a bit pricey for the quality, because everything else I had was subpar. The restroom was nasty

This place is the best you wanna come eat here do it because they have the best prices on charge broiled oysters and all that Creole food you can and want to eat is delicious. drink prices depending on the time of night you come in here you good I may get in quick but expect to wait if your late in the day.

Went here for our last breakfast in New Orleans. It was a great choice! Food was good and our waiter Ponce was awesome! We ordered Baileys and coffee and he added an extra treat of whip cream and a little green mint in celebration of St.Patrick's Day!

5 stars+. Couldn't believe when I saw the sign that said "Top 10" restaurant in the U.S.!!!  I was like "yeah right, it might be good too 10??"  Well, I got slapped on the face twice backwards and forwards.  That food was damn good that yes, it made my Top 10 list.  I had the red fish fillet over a Jalapeño cornbread, OMG.  They also have alligator bites which are a must but make sure you get them blackened. This place will not disappointment.  Truly Nahlins style!
Great lively atmosphere, multi floor huge place with lots of character and great food... you have to try their famous oyster, not really an oyster guy but the sauce, cooked and size were awesome
We ordered the oysters, gator tail, and the duck, and it was all great. We sat at the bar, and the bartender was really helpful and friendly.

Oceana Grill is right off Bourbon Street, has a neat small courtyard, and pretty good food. It's definitely worth a stop by. I had the catfish po boy and I was very impressed. I'm not a huge catfish fan but this was milder than usual and pretty big. The remoulade had the right amount of heat and the fries were standard. The crab cake burger is pretty spicy but the red beans and rice are excellent. 
We were there Mardi Gras week and it wasn't a crazy long wait for lunch. Our waiter was great and engaged us in conversation which was nice. Beware of birds in the courtyard, just FYI.

Pretty good. But I think it's quite overrated for tourists. I've been here 2x and we were lucky both times that we didn't really have to wait long as I don't think it would be worth the wait. The food does taste good but it's about your average. The shrimp Alfredo has a little kick to it if you don't like spicy, keep that in mind.
absolutely my favorite in French Quarter. They can add addition crawfish in any dish. And have the best crab cake in town!
This was a good restaurant if you are looking for a fresh taste of seafood meal. Don't be in a rush there will be a wait.. well worth it.

I was in between tours and hungry.  I have eaten here twice previously, once, several years ago when they first opened and then once about a year ago. My first experience was awesome and the food killer. The second time? Disgusting and I stopped sending customers here. I knew Gordon Ramsey had been here earlier this year and considering I  refused to send people here before, I decided to give them another chance.  It's obvious that they have chosen to follow none of Gordon's advice.  The inside is still dirty and dank and I opted for the courtyard. The "ice cream parlor" chairs in the courtyard were horribly uncomfortable, ugly and offered no ambiance to this otherwise awesome courtyard.  Maybe it was a subconscious way of the owner telling customers to get the hell out. This is obviously a place that makes it's money by turn and burn. I ordered the Redfish Oceana and at least I got a piece of redfish. It was however, breaded as a previous review noted. The sauce had crawfish tails in it that were previously frozen and came out a nasty grey color on my plate. Ick...I'm not eating those so I picked them off. Otherwise the redfish was ok.  The fried eggplant appetizer was pretty good. The big problem?, the menu is way overpriced for the style of food. $20 for the redfish and $8.50 for fried eggplant.  This isn't Palace Cafe after all. All and all, I still wouldn't send customers here. I wonder how long it will take these people to figure out that you cannot survive on tourists alone, especially when they are savvy food bloggers. I give this place another year before they are belly-up.
The crab cakes are everyyyything!!! I will return here. Amazing food and service! I got the shrimp Cajun pasta and it was bomb.

We decided to try this place for Sunday breakfast after observing how long the line was for it on Saturday night. Maybe dinner is better, but breakfast was disappointing. 

I got the seafood omelet which was okay but lacked spice, and the cheese it came with was only partially melted. The biscuit was dense and hard like it was warmed over from the night before. My knife had bits of food stuck to it and when I asked for another one, got another one with food stuck on it. My companion had the crab Benedict which left him with an uneasy stomach even though he skipped the hollandaise. The breakfast crowd included a cockroach that crawled into a crevice in the wall next to my chair. I would not recommend this place.

We went to this restaurant not once, but twice, while visiting New Orleans. Great prices, and many famous people have eaten here. I sat down right by a wall of pictures that included Tom Petty with Bob Dylan and the other Travelling Wilbury's band members-George Harrison, Roy Orbison. I was super excited to know I ate where they ate. Love TP. It is conveniently located right off bourbon street so easy to find too in the french quarters. even tried gator bites and they were GOOD. Just beware that a LOT of the food you find in Nawlins is fried but their portions here were large, never waited long for a table and it has many different interesting rooms to sit in. I would definitely go back!
Excellent food, atmosphere and friendly staff! Would give it more than five starts if I could! The fried jumbo shrimp was excellent and everyone was so nice!

The food and service were both excellent. NOLA food that does the stomach good with a great vibe.
Ashley was great!!!

A MAZ ING!  Recommended by cab driver and couldn't agree more. Megan was my server. She was incredibly knowledgeable and friendly. I was nervous to try things I had never tried. She gave me the confidence to try and so thankful I did. 

Had special of the day Red fish covered in shrimp in a special sauce (don't remember the name) over bed of crawfish and jalapeño stuffing served with jambalaya. Soooooo gooooood!  

Had a window seat to watch the world go by. Everything you want in a NOLA experience and meal.

Great food and great service. The server was extremely nice and attentive. The seafood gumbo was a hit and I really enjoyed the oysters. The bbq was just okay, so I think I'll stick to Deanies when it comes to those.
We sat in courtyard...very pretty!  Great service...redfish was dry unfortunately ... Mashed potato side was served cold.

I got the catfish po-boy it was so good, i was only able to eat half of it with the bread and the other half i just ate the fish since it was so filling. I upgraded my fries to Cajun fries and they were to die for!! The seafood gumbo was BOMB!!! Service was amazing & the ambiance was nice with great music!

We made several visits to this amazing restaurant while I'm New Orleans. The red beans and rice changed my life! Lol Also had the oysters Oceana, the Taste of New Orleans, and shrimp and grits. I might get this place to cater my wedding. I'm willing to change my wedding location.

The food was amazing!!  I had the Oceana Redfish signature dish, followed by New Orleans bread pudding.  It was all so DELICIOUS!  Service was excellent.  Server, Kim, was very friendly and extremely attentive.

It really saddens me but I was really disappointed this time I'm changing from a 1 to 3 this time but you guys totally dropped the ball it's just ridiculous man I ordered the banana fosters and this is what I got how y'all gone do people like that melted I just wasted my money my only question is this how y'all eat if so then you should start caring more about yourselves cause I don't eat slop
Our server Whitney was the best ever! She recommended some really good options! And we really enjoyed the food! Will be back!
Recommended by a friend- amazing crawfish dish and cozy atmosphere at the bar. I'll be back!

Alligator Aliigator alligator!! The fried alligator was amazing and the spicy remoulade was on point!! The grilled Oysters were good too. First time trying them I ate 2 of the 6 left the rest to the hub. I needed to make room for the gator!!
Great service good food. Meal could have been a little hotter served warm. Overall good would recommend.

Crab cakes appetizer was great with crab meat present (tasty chunks) crawfish and mushroom sauce that pleased all. Redfish on special was good. Rockafeller oysters were okay... we did not finish them. Shrimp Etoufee was reportedly very spicy.
Upstairs areas were interesting!

VERY disappointed in my experience at Oceana. My family and I were looking forward to coming to Oceana after hearing my sister's experience here on a previous trip and seeing the reviews. We expected a long wait when we came during lunch time for a party of 12 but we were pleasantly surprised when we were seated quickly - which is probably the only positive thing I will have to say about this place. We ordered apps and entrees within 10 minutes of being sat and waited over an hour for the food to come out which wasn't AT ALL worth the wait. Our server, Chris, had only come to see us two times - when we ordered and when the food had come out. Never once to check on us or see if we needed anything. Very upset and unsatisfied.

This was the first restaurant I ate at in New Orleans and it was not quite the food experience you'd expect. I've had great shrimp po boys and gumbo before outside of New Orleans and what I had last night was far from that. It was sad to say that I went to New Orleans for the first time and had better PO' Boys and gumbo else where. I hope to return and have a better experience than I did possibly at another restaurant.
Long wait but totally worth it. Food really good but somethings are a little pricey like the side salads. Waiters have too many tables also. And the line to get in is next to a huge smelly dumpster

After a late night and waking up late in the quarter, we needed a place that served a breakfast til 1pm. As luck would have it, Oceana is located across from the Royal Sonesta. On Saturday morning, we waited 15 minutes at 12:30. 

Keep in mind, we were looking for Court of Two Sisters price, selection or ambiance but rather a decent meal with a little cajun flair with decent service and price. Oceana actually delivered on all accounts. Yes, the decor and ambiance is cheesy but we got  what we came for. 

The kids did a Country Breakfast (two eggs, hash brown, grits, biscuit and your choice of bacon or sausage for $11) and Classic Pancakes (three big fluffy ones with bacon or sausage for $10.50). My Cajun Breakfast with grilled Andouille and Alligator sausage with two eggs, grits, hash browns and a a biscuit for $13, really hit the spot. The sausage was particularly tasty with just the right amount of spice. The only disappointment all around was the grits.

I wouldn't hesitate to come back here under similar circumstances. We left satisfied!

My husband and I decided to come here on a whim after a long day! We were greeted by a hostess who was super friendly. Our wait was 10 mins, max. The food was great to me but seemed more of like a tourist trap which we were tourist. It covers the basics of Louisiana food which we enjoyed, I had the taste of New Orleans which had a good size portion of 3 dishes. I didnt care for the crawfish dish. We seat upstairs which was nice and cool. Ladies room could use some work.

Just finished breakfast. The seafood omelet is outstanding. Lots of food for a reasonable price. Our server, Whitney, was very attentive and quite personable. This is always my go-to place for at least one meal or several when I come to New Orleans.

We walked in with a group of 9 and were seated instantaneously. The hostess was awesome - very informative and provided fantastic recommendations. All 9 of us were happy with our meals and completely destroyed them...we were so happy to have a great staff with great food on our 1st. Highly recommend adding an order of fried crawfish tails to your order :)

Our waitress Rachael was amazing - quick and attentive - thanks Rachael!!! 
Oceana Staff - you set the bar high for all other New Orleans restaurants - keep it up and we will definitely be back!!!

Great Food. Awesome Service, Chris M. Is the man!
Had brunch here while we waited to board our cruise. Chris helped me pick some great options. Crab Cakes
Tourist trap. Lackluster food. Go elsewhere. Friendly staff. That's about it. Good bye. Just saved u $30.

Awesome atmosphere with 
GREAT FOOD!! Red fish topped with shrimp, cornbread crawfish dressing, with a side of greens..THANKS Daniel for EVERYTHING!!!!

This is a very big and welcoming restaurant right off of Bourbon Street in the French Quarter.  I was leery of it because of its proximity to Bourbon... but I don't consider to be a tourist trap... and that's because the prices are very reasonable for the food that you get.  They are known for having the best crab cakes in town... but I found them to be just average.  My girlfriend liked them more than I did.  The fried shrimp, however, were better than your average fried shrimp.  I don't know what it was that was different about the breading, but it was almost cornmeal-like... and it was just very tasty.  The desserts were also good - I had the pecan pie and my girlfriend loved her Bananas Foster Ice Cream cake.  I hate banana, but my girlfriend said it was very unique and really delicious.  The service was extremely fast (especially for NOLA) and very friendly.  This place is also on restaurant.com if you're looking to save some dough on seafood while in New Orleans.

Always the place to go when you want excellent seafood. I've been a repeat customer for over 5 years and I am never disappointed. The fire grilled oysters are my favorite and I'd recommend them to anyone. Staff was exceptionally funny and helpful with menu items and local tips.
The crab cake and gator bits are especially AWESOME! Give them a try and you won't regret !

Crab Cakes were a total surprise - so GOOD! We each plowed through their po'boys blackened/grilled and the fried shrimp. Both were very good - added bacon and cheese. Fries were surprisingly good with a sprinkle of the Cajun seasoning at the table side. Great meal, good service!

We got raw oysters and today's special redfish. They are great. You can get 10% off by checking in. We forgot to do that at payment though, so we ended up with getting a raspberry pudding for free. The dessert is also great. I like their oysters so much, they are fresh and yummy. We two people ate a dozen, and definitely want more!

So, I ordered breakfast from this spot and had it delivered to my job. I ordered the omelet and a side of bacon. My advise in regards to getting the food delivered; one, it makes no sense to write a message for the delivery guy he wont read it and I don't think he carries a phone either. He went into another office building with my order all bc he didn't read the message to call me. Two, check your order before he leaves, when he handed me the food I asked if he had the side of bacon he rushed me off and said that it was all in there. When I got to my desk, guess what wasn't with my order? Bacon! I called the restaurant, the man who I spoke to was very nice about the situation and he sent the guy back out with my bacon (they added two sausage patties). The omelet comes with hash browns and a biscuit. I got the seafood omelet, it wasn't bad actually, I think it would have been plenty for two people. Big pieces of shrimp and crawfish, I cant remember if it was suppose to have crab meat or not. The biscuit was little dry so I didnt try to eat it. The bacon was a little on the salty side (I know I know its bacon but there is a difference). 
Really, for the price you pay for the food I suppose it worth your money they haven't made a believer out of me honestly, but the food wasn't the worst breakfast food that I have had. If you go there more than once you should keep your receipt because you can get a free bloody mary or a mimosa with your next purchase and that's a plus.

This resturant was a recommend from a friend . This was the first resturant we ate at went we arrived . They seated us right away . This was a great resturant to intrude a first timer to New Orleans . The food was outstanding , the gator bites were great . We ordered hurricanes, please order these with the collector glass it's well with it . Overall an outstanding eating experience .
Thanks.Oceano I will.see you next year.

This place is really old New Orleans. Fabulous food in a great atmosphere. The portions are smaller than at some other places we ate, but still plenty of good food.  The seafood was perfectly seasoned. The fries had a seasoned coating too. Definitely a great place to eat.

At first glance, you might think the place has a nice ambiance about it.  Then you realize that the dark moody lighting is hiding the dirtiness of the restaurant.  Floor was covered in grease and the table was not wiped clean when we sat down (drops of sauce/ grease from previous customers still visible).  Food was extremely salty.  This is definitely one of those places that are hyped up for tourists...but located in the center of Bourbon street, what else would you expect?  I had the fried oyster po-boy and it was a lot of fried breading and not much oyster.  The cole slaw inside was alright.  The bread....I almost want to say it was stale.  It was served at room temperature. Also had the "taste of New Orleans," which basically turned out to be three soupy bowls that were rather similar. Difficult to discern which bowl was the etoufee, which was the rice and beans, and which was gumbo.  The $23 fried seafood platter was alright. The only plate that was served hot.  Jambalaya pasta was mediocre- nothing that stood out. For the price, you'd be better off doing a bit more research and finding a nicer place recommended by locals!

Place is so delicious and full filling! I'm not going to lie when I got my blackened chicken Alfredo it looked kind of small but I was wrong! It was great! Best pasta ever! Don is amazing! She's a really great server! TIP. HER. WELL!

The food was good. I wasn't impressed with it. 

The bread pudding though. That was exceptional.

I got the catfish basket and it was just ok. Not spectacular. I expected some Cajun flavors with a spark. It's was good. Not great. I was more impressed with the cocktails and dessert. 

I'll give them another try next year...

This place is worth the stars. 

1) food flavors are authentic and everything we have tried so far tasted incredible. It's not a small restaurant but the flavors served makes it feel more like home cooked style 

2) friendly staff throughout. Every team member we interacted with was genuine and sweet. They had to work on Christmas Eve and still carried a big smile 

3) they're open on Christmas Eve and Day! Fortunately Oceana was part of the few restaurants that was open on the holiday. Of the restaurants we dined at during our stay in New Orleans, this one is at the top for all around quality.

This place came highly recommended from a friend and I won't waste your time talking about everything I ate here.  I'll talk about the one thing that made an impression.   

Gator Bites!?  Seriously.  Who knew that these would taste so good.  If I come back for one more thing here, it would be for these.  Super tasty and they don't taste like Chicken.  Half blackened and half fried with their remoulade dipping sauce.  Mmmmmmmm.  We ordered one serving of these for 3 of us to share and I wish I had just ordered another as my entree.  Crunchy, almost tasted like meat, but not.  Yes please.

Service was great and if you can eat in the outside patio, do it.  It has that NOLA feel that you just don't get anywhere else in the country.
Natalie was a fantastic sever. She was super nice and attentive. Good food. Not bad atmosphere.

Do not come here. It's a tourist trap. The food was overpriced, tacky, and flavorless. I had to ask for extra sauce several times before it was brought to the table. The crab cakes were cold. The po boy wasn't fresh. Thumbs down...having lunch here for my fiancé and I was a bad decision and a waste of a meal.
The best restaurant I have ever gone in French Quarter. The raw oysters are clean and fresh. Rockfeller is also very good. The pasta and crawfish etouffee also pretty good to try
Food is great: go for the Cajun jambalaya Pasta. Yum! Kim was our server and she was amazing! Great sense of humor and super accommodating.

Came in last night for a bachelorette party group of 10. Reservation was at 8:30 and we received at 8:25 wondering where we were ( downstairs outside waiting while the bouncers went to check our reservations) while walking in we had 4 different employees greet us on the walk up the stairs to the table. While seated we waited over 15 minutes just for someone to offer us water. One waiter was attending 3 tables in our room each of which had 8-10 people. We made our reservation a month in advance and so frustrating on poor planning of the restaurant on wait staff. When he dropped off the water we immediately put in our food and drink orders. Some of the appetizers they got wrong and took awhile to rectify. Everyone enjoyed their meals from the Cajun jambalaya, oysters, bbq shrimp, New Orleans special!

For New Orleans, where the food is supposed to be amazing.... this was definitely good. It is not a fancy meal, but the crab cakes were very good, the jambalaya pasta was very good... actually missed stuff was great. There's no veggies... but there's was jalapeño hush puppies!! Everything was yummy and they were really nice there.
Nice staff . Vegetables and corn were well seasoned and tasty . Main courses - redfish special and New Orleans sampler were ok-food could have arrived hotter and w more flavor

My husband and I are from New Orleans and decided to spend the weekend in the quarter for a mini vacation. This restaurant's menu is appealing but bottom line, this place is a tourist trap. It is over priced and not representative of really good New Orleans food. The fried food is okay but definitely do not come here for oysters. We got the chargrilled oysters that tasted like they just boiled the oyster and poured half melted butter on top.
Cajun fries were everyone's favorite. Chris M was a great server and the Road To Bourbon Street is def a good stiff drink. Nice and air conditioned which is pleasant on a hot day.

The food was great! I believe the flavor is was amazing but if they seasoned the fish a little more before adding their signature flavor it would be infused in and out of the fish I got! I ate the Redfish Oceana!

This review earned 2 stars for the service. Our waitress, Joecelyn, was very sweet and accommodating. We very much appreciated her hospitality during our visit!

The food, however, was disappointing (to say the least). Many locals recommended this restaurant to us so we were very excited to give it a try after a long, humid day in the French Quarter. We ordered the house oysters, the gumbo, and the crab cakes. The gumbo was lackluster, but decent. The oysters were okay, but the crab cakes were so inedible that I had to send them back. There are so many restaurants here in New Orleans- do not waste your time here when there's so much great seafood to choose from!
Everything and everyone was great.  Only small bad thing was that my catfish wasn't warm enough.  I'd still recommend eating there though

Disappointing to say the least.  My two star rating is way off of the 4 star average for this place but I think it is fair.  Prices are high and the food quality low.  The Ouster Rockefeller appetizer was way over cooked and the sauce a real detractor.  The
Gumbo was weak and needed a lot of Tabasco.  The Oceana Redfish lacked flavor and was way over cooked.  The crab cakes were supposed to be a special item and the were over cooked and a lot of breading.  Been there done that, no need to do it again.
Good service and food, prices were reasonable for what you get. Nice cross breeze in the main seating area.
Service was exemplary!!! Food was amazing. Highly recommend. Will def go back when in New Orleans again!

so ... funny story... 

my sister wanted to come here because she was hungry after taking an afternoon nap (it was 9pm) LOL. she found this place online and she wanted to come here but i was at a bar with my sorority sisters so i came afterwards. she was still in line. she waited about 20-30minutes. by this time, i walked/ran to the restaurant which made my stomach not happy after having an open bar with bad alcohol. i wasn't drunk at all but by the time my sister and i were getting seated, i guess it hit me all at once and i became very nauseous and threw up right then and there inside , past the bar area , where we were about to sit (next to the bathroom hallway). the hostess was SUPER sweet about it and said not to worry and directed me to the bathroom, they cleaned the place in less than two seconds and acted like nothing happened when i came back out. (i guess they get this a lot since this place is open very late and it's right next to bourbon st haha)

anyways, since my stomach wasn't in great shape, i couldn't eat much so the food is based off of my sister who was telling me how everything was ( i only had a bite of each food option). the grilled oysters were good but not the best ( my sister devoured them though haha) and then we got the taste of new orleans which was the Creole jambalaya, crawfish etouffée, red beans and rice with smoked sausage for $16 which was all combined in one bowl which made it not as great since it just tasted like one big bowl of soup LOL. the food overall was just okay (not worth the wait) but the service is great and there's even a 10% off your order when you check in yelp so i guess if you want to try this place it's not bad!

This place was a great breakfast find! The crepes were to die for, jammed packed with fresh seafood. The service was wonderful and everyone was friendly. Ponce was our server and he was great! They also give you a copy of your receipt for 10% off your next visit. I'll definitely be going back.

Sooooooo goood!!!
We had the Oceana grilled oysters and the bbq shrimp and Cajun pasta . Omg !!!! Finger licking good ! Wish I could take a bottle of their sauce back to Utah with me . Worth every penny !!
The Fried catfish was great. Didn't care for the Shrimp Etouffee but that Bread Pudding was the TRUTH. That's why this place gets 4 stars!

I was in the French Quarter for a few days with a friend and stopped in for breakfast on Friday morning. The food was awesome. They also have non pork food options because we do not eat pork. Our waiter CJ was the best waiter we had hands down in all the establishments we ate at in New Orleans. He was funny efficient and had a great personality. If you go to the Oceana Grill in the French Quarter you have to ask for CJ. You won't regret it. We liked him so much that we just stopped by the restaurant on Saturday just to say hi to CJ and let him know how much we appreciated his great service. And that's when we met the bartender monte. He was also awesome.  All in all, great food, great service and great people. Go go go and ask for CJ!!!!!

The BF was hungry and decided to order from here via Uber Eats. I'm not sure what was going on, but the restaurant took forever to prepare/pack his food. his 15 mins wait turned into a 35+ mins wait. 

He ordered the Po' Boys, alligator sausage and gumbo, I believe.

I sampled all 3 items and it was okay. I don't know if it's because it wasn't fresh and we didn't eat until it was delivered to us (which took about 10-15 mins), but the food was a little soggy.

Total spent: ~$55
Incredible food, but even more incredible service. Pamela took such amazing care of us and made us feel so welcome. You can really tell that she loves what she does!

Not a bad spot for Cajun food in NOLA at all. We came for our breakfast/lunch and I ordered an omelette. It was pretty good and packed with greens which I love. It was a good serving of food and filled me up too.

Inside, it's a bit dark and probably more suited for a dinner or evening meal. It wasn't crowded at all mid-day and we kind of felt out of place. There's also a bar at the front of the restaurant so I'm sure it gets more crowded at night.

What stood out here to my friends & I was the service - everyone we interacted with was super friendly and thanked us for coming, etc. Our waiter memorized 5 people's orders no matter how complicated. He was very kind and helped recommend dishes to us as well.

Good food, great service!

The food is amazing! Megan L was the best server but that's pretty hard to say because even the hostesses were super friendly and accommodating. The carb cakes are to die for.  Try the freaking crab cakes...melts in your mouth like honey on Idris. The food was sooo fresh and well seasoned I had to check if there was a Haitian gran in the kitchen. The bbq shrimp, the duck, greens. We had no complaints!
Erica was great!!!! The food was awesome especially the crab cake pasta.. definitely will go back
This place was great, the food is solid. We came in for the po-boys and had some great oysters and drinks as well. Our server Tyana was super friendly.  You guys got return costumers for sure :)

After a long day of travel and our kids staying at my mom's house for the night, we wanted a place that was open late near our hotel. After searching, we decided Oceana was the best spot. Probably not the place I would have picked if it were a decent hour. But at 10:30 on a Sunday night, we were pretty limited. The service was great and so were the raw oysters. But that is pretty much where the good ended.

We decided to test out the BBQ Shrimp as an app in addition to the oysters. The sauce was not anything like I have had with other BBQ shrimp. It was too thick and sort of bland. For that reason, it did not flavor the shrimp at all. The shrimp were also overcooked and very difficult to peel. For $9 and 4 shrimp in the appetizer portion, it was highly disappointing. After the double appetizer, we decided to split the Redfish entree with eggplant sticks. The eggplant sticks were actually pretty good. But the fish was a little dry and overcooked. The only saving grace was the sauce that came on it. But even with creamy crawfish sauce, the fish was still a disappointment.

I teetered between a two and three star since the service was good and we enjoyed some things. But since the thing we enjoyed the most was something they didn't even have to cook, two stars is ultimately what this experience was.

We came here around 9pm on a Friday night and didn't have to wait for a table for 2. Very casual environment, at first it reminded me a little of a chain restaurant but the food was delicious. The famous oysters were amazing. We also ordered the blackened alligator and bbq shrimp appetizers and gumbo which were delicious. We weren't too hungry so decided on all appetizers. My boyfriend ordered some sweet tea drink which he enjoyed, I skipped on drinks as I had just taken a nap and wanted to pace myself. The service was fast, professional and friendly. Will definitely come again and recommend to others.

This was our first meal in NOLA and it did not disappoint! I got breakfasts- a delicious seafood omelette and my husband got lunch.  I loved my omelet but his lunch was amazing!  two crab cakes smothered in this decadent crawfish sauce- I had several bites lol.  don't miss this spot in the French Quarter. We'll be back later to try the drinks!

As part of a bachelorette party (you read that right), we stopped by Oceana Grill for lunch. The restaurant is pretty huge with multiple levels. The menu consists of all of the Cajun classics you would expect: po'boys, gumbo, jambalaya, etc. Heavy on fried food and heavy on seafood.

I went with the alligator sausage po'boy which was something I'd never tried before. The sausage was 60% pork and 40% gator and it came with fries. What really diminished our dining experience was that the food took forever to come out. So long that I thought to myself, this is the longest I've waited for food at a restaurant in a while. When the food finally came out, my order was wrong. I had asked for only pickles and mayo on the po'boy and they forgot the pickles. The fries were mediocre at best, the bread on the po'boy was average, but I will say that it was interesting to try gator sausage. 

Service was friendly and I appreciated that multiple employees said goodbye and thank you as we were leaving the restaurant.

Based on reviews and location, this had to be my first stop in NOLA. We arrived at about 10:30 pm and were seated immediately. We had to order the gator bites (blackened and fried), chargrilled oysters and the Taste of New Orleans. This was our first time having gator and we loved it, especially the blackened because it had so much flavor. The sauce that it came with complimented the fried bites more but was still tasty. The chargrilled oysters were a first as well and I really enjoyed it. The sauce was creamy as opposed to the other chargrilled oysters that we had, which were more buttery. The Taste of New Orleans consisted of cup size servings of: Red beans and rice, Crawfish Etouffe and jambalaya. My favorite had to have been the red beans and rice because it had the most flavor, least favorite was the jambalaya because it didn't really stand out. Maybe because the serving was small and cold, and it was mostly rice. The service was great, our waitress was quick and attentive.

They overcharged us and were rude about it. Beware!!! My fiancee and me ordered porterhouse steak - menu price $28, Taste of New Orleans sampler - menu price $19, and cream brûlée - menu price $6.50. We received a check in the end for: porterhouse - $30, Taste of New Orleans - $24, and creme brûlée - $7.50. 
We tried to inquire with a server  (Kaitleen) but we apparently became absolutely invisible. We called a manager. The first thing he asked in a very rude manner "Did you read the menu?". Of course we did, that is why the prices seemed a little bit different. He went "Well, the prices in the menu are WRONG... We adjusted them for the New Years". We kindly asked him to point out where in the menu it said that. He lighted up his cell phone, searched the menu and did not find any mentioning of that. Then he said "Ok, I will adjust the price. Give me that credit card". No apologies, no "please" - nothing. In the end, the server Kaitleen came to us, apologized and said "Thank you for catching up on that, I did not even notice that the prices were wrong". Damn, they were overcharging people all day long!!! This place definitely left a bad taste in my mouth.

Excellent food and all your favorite NOLA dishes in one simple spot!!! Thank you Oceana Grill for satisfying my craving for crawfish etouffe, jambalaya, and red beans n rice.  Great buy and awesome service!

This place was recommended by a friend that had visited New Orleans a few months before I did. I took her advice and decided to have dinner there.
I am very glad that I did. The staff was so friendly and welcoming and the service was seriously top notch. The restaurant was just an overall pleasant atmosphere and we were very comfortable and enjoyed a relaxing and delicious meal.
Their crab cakes are honestly the best I have ever had. They weren't loaded with a bunch of filler but rather stuffed with crab and seared to a wonderful crisp on the outside. For my entree I had the blackened mahi mahi and it was just awesome. The flavors were incredible.
Oceana is definitely on our list of places to go back to on our next trip to the Big Easy.

The seafood platter was what seemed a bit pricey (at $22), but it was tasty! The shrimp here was HUGE! The hush puppies were very good, considering I usually don't care for them and I was a fan of these.

The space is absolutely huge. It went up for several floors. So if you're looking for somewhere you likely don't have to wait to be seated, this is probably your go-to!

My buddy and I went here during our vacation to New Orleans because we had seen it on the Kitchen Nightmares show and wanted to see what changes happened and what the food was like.
Our first trip there was good, the food was tasty, although the chicken I ordered the first night was a bit dry.  
To tell the truth, my buddy and I got out a bit late due to a convention we were attending, and so we ate here three times.  The items of note that were great were the alligator bites and my buddy really liked the duck.
What really was impressive of this place is the courtesy of the staff!  We had a server the first night that was good and helpful, but Renee knocked it out of the park for us.  She gave great reccomendations and even told us a few places to visit in town that were must sees.
Also, one of the owners and the manager came and chatted with us about the show and New Orleans must sees.  Of the places we visited this place was great!
First visit and food was great. Our server Brian was knowledgeable and recommended the Redfish with stuffing and was delish! The charbroiled oysters and crawfish etouffee was flavorful!
Amazing food, even better service. Sierra is an absolute gem. Super informative and hilarious. Can't wait to come back!
Great oysters, excellent crab cakes, really good poboys, delicious French fries, and amazing service. The environment was very new orleans. Loved it. Definitely recommend!
Fried oysters were awesome and so was Sierra! Will be back in the morning for the crepes!

Atmosphere is ok. Servers are friendly and everywhere. But Food quality missed the mark. Fries were good but come on, it's pretty hard to mess up fries...Ordered shrimp basket, half the shrimp came with raw batter inside... Cocktail sauce was the consistency of a fruit roll up... gummy and old.  Server apologized and did bring new fresh one but it should have never reached the table in the first place... Manager also apologized for raw batter and offered and brand new basket or a desert. But my Appetite was lost already so instead was given half off the meal... should've took the whole meal off the check like any respectable restaurant does. And they add 18% gratuity!  Check came out to $130 for two kids three adults. Chef Ramsay needs to revisit before the nightmare begins again. Will not be a return customer.

This place will not disappoint.  The spicy bloody Mary, gator bites and redfish were on point. The gumbo and chargrilled oysters were also very good.  The is the best food I've had during my time in New Orleans.

Portions: Medium
Price: A little over-priced in my opinion
Atmosphere: Great. We sat upstairs and and the ambiance was genuine to NOLA (the real deal)
Service: Friendly Wait Staff
Food: Not as good as I had hoped...

I got the gumbo and they brought it out a few minutes after I had ordered it. It was luke warm and pretty average which was disappointing for the price. I also ordered the "blackened chicken" and was slightly disappointed there as well. In my opinion it should be a one or two stars, but I'm giving them the benefit of the doubt since I did not order the most traditional dishes.

If your going to go here, do it the right way. I'll put this plane and simple for you guys ask for David. Don't get me wrong the food is perfection, David's service amplifies the experience and takes it to a whole new level. He is amazingly helpful, and all around great guy. Tip well, and enjoy his presence
P.S since it is in the French quarter don't drive parking will be bonkers
The crawfish étouffée and seafood gumbo were amazing, and our server, jenna was so great! She was fun and super funny, and our experience was highly enjoyable all around!

No wait at noon. We had Cajun fries, seafood gumbo, Creole jambalaya, crawfish etouffée, and a side of fried oyster, everything was so good! We wanted to try cocktails on the drink menu, but we had to go to a conference afterwards. Service was also good, our waiter was Chis M.

Don't let the fact that this place is in a major touristy area fool you. It's a great spot for consistently delicious food and a nice escape from the craziness going on just a few feet away on Bourbon Street. On two visits to New Orleans now, I've chosen this place to stop in for a hearty meal/fuel for the rest of the night! Love it!
I ordered the shrimp po boy and it was just not what I expected. It was def overpriced and overrated. People must come here for drinks or possibly are just to drunk to realize its subpar food.

This is the best food we have had since arriving in New Orleans!!  We will be back! We ate there 3 times during our stay.  Then when we returned home, I mentioned the restaurant to Walmart cashier who was from New Orleans.  She said this was her favorite restaurant.  So this restaurant is a favorite of the locals!
The food was great and the service was awesome! Whitney was awesome! She help us in every way possible by giving us options that wasn't on the menu! Will come here again when I visit New Orleans!

Staying on Bourbon Street, we visited this restaurant several times, because they serve all day and are open late, and because the food is really good.  Try the grilled oysters, the crab cakes, and any of the fried seafood.  Also stay (or return) for their huge and very good desserts.  The service is very good and the wait staff is very friendly.

Staying in the French quarter, and came here based on yelp reviews. Come on! Four stars with almost 6000 reviews, how can you go wrong?

It did not disappoint. Our server Cole was attentive but not overbearing. The charbroiled oysters were fantastic (I would have liked more bread). I had the oyster po-boy, husband had red beans and rice (he said the were average with heavy salt). 

Location and atmosphere were good for us. Eat here for the food and you'll feel good about your trip to French Quarter.
I love the redfish. Yummy...The waiter is super friendly. The beer I ordered is a bit ordinary. Overall, good restaurant, recommended!

Landed for the 1st time in Nola at midnight and came straight to this place based on YELP! we were seated at the corner table by the window. Ordered our first ever blackened and fried alligator tail bites, catfish po'boy, and the taste of New Orleans (jambalaya, etoufee, and Rea beans & rice). Our waitress was super sweet and suggested these to us, and it didn't disappoint! We loved the place and the food so much that we went back after an all-day/night drinking to grab the blackened alligator tail bites (so much better than fried y'all!!). Highly rec'd was his place!!

The Alfredo pasta with blacked chicken is amazing. Their blackened shrimp is also great. Definitely recommend sharing portions as they tend to be pretty big. Don't recommend the garlic potatoes as they are nothing to brag about. 

Definitely would go back!
Pamela was amazing. Her recommendation for the Crawfish Eggs Benedict was right on target. Just enough spice to truly make it a NOLA breakfast. Great coffee too!

The food was just okay. My husband and I stopped by while on vacation last week and was disappointed in the gumbo. It was very watery and did not have much taste. My husband does not like spicy food and asked the waiter if the po-boy is spicy and she informed him no. Maybe she was new or forgot to mention the sauce is spicy but he was very upset due to how long we had waited to get in and get our food that he just ate off of my plate. The portion size for the fried shrimp I ordered was very large but the shrimp was just okay. Maybe we tried to wrong items because out Lyft driver mentioned how tasty the crab cakes are. :(

The food here was great. The service was even better service. Our drinks stayed filled, and almost every employee that walked by asked if we needed anything.

The portions were very generous. 

Oysters were and catfish were fresh and delicious.
Everything we ordered was fantastic! The service was quick and great. I strongly recommend ordering the Mardi Gras pasta

We tried several things here..,Redfish, mustard greens, crab cakes, fried crawfish, creole, shrimp etoufee, and red beans and rice.  While it was all good, by far the stars of the meal were the mustard greens and red beans and rice.  They won't disappoint!

This is a tourist place. 
Had their house oysters, blackened redfish and the shrimp bbq.

The oysters were covered in a sauce and cheese. These were very tasty and the best dish eaten. 

The redfish was over cooked. Very dry. 

The shrimp bbq is really a broth of Worcestershire sauce that has boiled shrimp, mashed potatoes and bread. Way too much Worcestershire sauce. Its very over powering. 

Would not go back

I found this place on Yelp and loved it! 
There was a line down the block and right then we knew it was probably a good choice!
When we were seated we ordered drinks. My lemon drop was delish and my friend really enjoyed his hurricane. 
We decided to share everything - something I love! 
Our appetizer was the "famous" crab cake - omg it was smothered in cream of mushroom sauce and I loved it!
The taste of new orleans was pretty good but the same as almost every other restaurant. 
For dessert we split the pecan pie and the bananas foster ice cream pie. Omg! The ice cream pie was the best!!! 
I practically rolled out of there but loved every bite!!!
Awesome food. The wait was only 20 mins on a friday night. Its packed inside. Awesome service. Loved our seafood platter. Do check it out.
Ok chain food out of all my eats here I would not return service was great and food was ok nothing memorable
Good food for good prices. The menu is mostly cajun/creole but they have other dishes if you or someone in your party doesn't care for the local fare. I'd recommend anything off the appetizer menu.

Had a decent lunch with Grilled oysters, Gumbo, Crab Cakes and my young daughter a burger. It's situated in the French Quarter the location is excellent and the food is good, however, I did send my Seafood and Shrimp Gumbo back as it was cold? Obviously it was therefore not fresh. But this is the tourist area, not mother's cooking. I can recommend the restaurant as you will have fair food but at tourist prices.
Service was outstanding. Gator bites where good but the order was super tiny. I had the red snapper special and it was fabulous. My only negative would have been a little more variety in the menu

The fried seafood platter was delicious!!! First time in New Orleans and almost everyone recommended this restaurant. It did not disappoint. Staff was also super friendly! I would definitely come here again.

BEST FOOD IN NOLA!!!!!

We came here at 10pm on Thanksgiving and got a table in less than 3 mins. Our server Daniel made great recommendations (thanks Dan!). For drinks, we got the Strawberry Basil Margarita and Road to Bourbon (both double shot). For appetizers, we got Louisiana Crabmeat cakes. For our entree, we got an off the menu dish called Blackened Red Fish with a side of Gumbo and Crawfish. For dessert, we got the Oceana Brownie!

Absolutely amazing experience!! We tried to come earlier in the day for lunch but there was a line to get in which shows it's so popular! 

BEST FOOD IN NOLA!!!!!

Top freaking notch, was a little skeptical at first but damn I'm glad we stopped. Service was a little slow clearing plates but the waiter was so nice and professional and the food was seriously world class we had six in the party with a lot of different tastes and everyone in our group was happy even the vegetarian 
Great over all

Service was fantastic despite a party taking up the whole top floor. Our waitress communicated that with us up front and made sure we were taken care of for our whole visit. Be advised that the restaurant takes up several floors of a building but it doesn't cause them issues at all. Food was great and our party couldn't stop talking about how good it was the rest of the trip.
This place was amazing. Everything we order was delicious, the service was excellent and our waiter Chris M. was on point. We highly recommend it.
This was me and my husband first time dining here. The food was great and the staff members were very friendly and nice. We really enjoyed eating here, will come again
Reasonably priced for the most part. Food looked good, I think I just order the wrong thing. The Shrimp PoBoy wasn't anything special, not very many shrimp. Their Red Fish looked amazing however!
The crab cakes were a 10 and Sierra was a phenomenal waitress! The line was long but moved very quickly. This place was worth the wait.
It seems to be a popular one but it was just okay nothing to write home about and I definitely wouldn't go again. ‍

My food was not fresh or prepared to order.  The crab cakes were cold & it's as if my food wasn't freshly prepared. How is fried food cool or borderline cold. It wasn't worth the $$$. The staff was excellent but the food wasn't

Oceana Grill is a local and visitor favorite that will not disappoint. This establishment is one of our good eats spots when we visit New Orleans. Staff is friendly and accommodating, the vibes are as good as the food and drinks. This place is consistently on point with their menu items. My all time favorite is the bread pudding with a side of vanilla bean ice cream and whip cream. We love this place as much as we love NOLA

Best oysters in town ! Josh, the bartender is hilarious. We enjoyed our dinner and came back for breakfast/lunch Whitney was our server - she recommended our entraes abd wevlived them ! Seafood omelette and soft shell crab sandwich.  the bloidy mary topped off the experience! .

I had been seeing Facebook ads for this place for the last two weeks and was actually excited to visit Oceana Grill. Too bad this place turned out to be an overpriced tourist trap that all locals should avoid.

I went in last Friday and I understand why this place was on Kitchen Nightmares. The wait staff was the worst kind of autistic - their social skills were lacking considerably. I mean seriously the guy serving us not only seemed uninterested in our experience (would a smile and "how are you guys" before taking our order have been hard?), he also forgot to give us silverware and napkins. After our food came out (which came out ten minutes a part), I asked another waiter for some napkins. Despite telling me "sure thing" as he headed to the bar behind us, he walked by us and either forgot or just decided having forks and napkins wasn't going to be a part of our experience - we were actually forced to go to the wait station and grab our own. I don't go to restaurants to serve myself. 

The food was basic. Nothing you can't get at a Taco Mac or Shuckers and extremely overpriced for Sysco bought food. 

The only redeeming elements of the whole night was the hostess (whose hair weave was on point) was extremely nice and the mens room was immaculate. I mean I was actually taken aback at how clean it looked and smelled (this is not a simple feat in the Quarter).

In all honesty, I would never go back to this place.

Stopped by on a road trip back home with my mother. Chris M was our waiter and he was funny, helpful, and a joy to meet. A+ service! The food was amazing, seafood on point! Oysters were super fresh! Will come back again, keep up the great work y'all!

This place was pretty good. The server was just fine. They have a great menu with many choices, even vegetarian. I got crawfish but since they weren't in season they were a bit chewy but I knew what I was getting myself in to. The place wasn't crowded and the atmosphere was great. The tropical drinks were pretty cool with the dry ice and very tasty. 10/10

Never again!

I'm at the bar sitting next to a lady. She orders fried fish and shrimp. I order a crab cake appetizer and we both just start talking.  Both agree our food lacks flavor but eat it. Her food is cold and has no flavor other than breading. My crab cakes taste eggy and fishy, as if they used old fish and too much egg to bind it to together. 

During the meal she pulls out a long hair out of her food that clearly didn't belong to her. To make matters worse, another lady walking out also asked her if she found a hair in her food.   At this point i ate one of my 2 crab cakes and literally lost the desire to eat any more. 

Jai, our bartender, and perhaps the only good experience I had at the restaurant got his manager. You would think at this point the restaurant would recover. Nope!  Daniel was a total ass. His comment to me was that I ate my food. He then goes to the register, prints my check, slides it across the bar in a shot glass, then walks away. 

Never again will I eat here, never again will I suggest anyone to eat here. I'll see to it that  no one else does either.

I enjoyed this place. There was a big line outside but it went quickly. I had the knife and fork ribs and my daughter had the shrimp pasta. Both were very tasty. Fun restaurant with friendly staff. I'd go back again.

I wanted to pack the entire restaurant in my luggage and bring it home. I had the Cajun Shrimp Pasta and added a Crab Cake. To diiiieee for!!! Everyone was silent, humming, or dancing while they ate; IT's JUST THAT AMAZING. My first stop when I come back.
Long wait on Saturday afternoon, but service was good and the food did not disappoint. Chicken Alfredo was top notch. Great pecan pie. Give this place a try.

The food here was kind of meh for me. The line outside was clearly more tourists who probably saw the restaurant advertised in their hotel rooms or at the airport as they came into the city, than people who are regulars to this spot. The pasta that I had, included little bites of alligator, which was very tender, but the shrimp, sausage, and pasta itself was very bland. My friend had the fried seafood, which was very basic, and pretty much impossible to mess up, and frankly mediocre. On the other hand, the "tropical storm" cocktail was delicious. It was very sweet, and delightful. And as an added little gimmick, they place dry ice in it, causing it to bubble and it looks really cool.
Ordered the Taste of New Orleans and it was the perfect dish and it's all in the name! Had a little bit of everything. The Red beans and rice were the best I've ever had!

This restaurant is so amazing!! The food, the atmosphere! Our server, DEMARCUS GREEN was truly a delight. He made our experience so pleasant. He was patient while we ordered, was knowledgeable about menu options when we asked questions and consistently checked on us throughout our dining experience. Thank you, Oceana Grill for great food and great employees!!! We'll definitely be back!

Down on the French Quarter is a solid restaurant serving Cajun and locks fare!  Old school building with multiple levels which is very cool! We had a party of 20 and the service was excellent!  The menu isn't huge but everything is fresh!

We had some appetizers like charred oysters, gator bites and Cajun fries! Unfortunately I didn't get good pics due to it being a vendor taking us out!  However, the Cajun fries were outstanding, the gator bites kicked butt and the charred oysters were good not the best I've had!  

They have Daly specials and tonight Wes a huge Redfish blackened with a cornbread jalopeno concoction that was a perfect blend with the Redfish and shrimp!  It came with a side of greens in a mustard sauce that added the range to mix with the sweetness of the cornbread thingy!  Huge portion and absolutely delicious!  

I'd definitely comeback for more based on service and quality of food!  Good prices!
