To see more pictures of this place and others go to Kam Finds Food page on Facebook and Instagram and join the foodie community!
Great food and atmosphere. Crab cakes superb, delicious broiled oysters with special Oceana Grill  sauce.
Great food and service. Bloody Mary was delicious.  Lots of menu items to choose from.  Breakfast for 2 was $65 with tip
Food was tasty. Pricey compared to home, but pretty average for the French Quarter. Our server Chris was great. He was very personable and efficient.
There is always a long line to get in this place.  We waited 30 minutes.  I was surprised to find out that the food was only mediocre.  Not sure why they are so popular.

I hate going to the quarter even though i'm still new to New Orleans, but it was just one of those nights that nothing else was open. So before getting there i got lost (apparently going the wrong direction). Got help from a down on the luck guy who walked us straight to Oceana, gave him a few bucks. Walking in we got seated right away and looked through the menu. Prices were kind of expensive but i guess that's proper with the location. Ordered the gator appetizer, some drink, a 26 bucks steak, and 20ish buck pasta. Server constantly checked up on us with no real issues (super attentive...maybe too attentive). Hurricane drink had dried ice which was interesting since putting the straw directly over it spills the drink over the straw. 

All-in-all decent experience and kudos for opening pretty late.

OK, it is tourist, but good. I like Gumbo Shop better, but more variety here. I do not recommend the gumbo. It is average at best. But, everything else good. Taste of New Orleans plate good. I really liked oysters Rockefeller, and fried catfish platter is good. Take your time....wait in line, have a lot of patience, and you will like it here.
Service was bomb. Sierra was amazing! Food was super unique and very tasteful. Would definitely recommend.

Hands down the best seafood I have ever had. When going to a restaurant you look at the menu, and the food they bring out never looks like the picture in the menu, accept for Oceana. A friend and I ordered the crab cakes with craw fish cream sauce, and it was outstanding. For my main course I had the seafood platter which came with catfish and fried shrimp, and it was outstanding. The portion sizes are crazy, it was the one time in my life I was upset I couldn't finish all my food because it was so good. 

The service was outstanding as well, really get that down south hospitality. So if you are ever in the French Quarter make it a point to eat at Oceana, you wont regret it!
Best Bloody Mary mix!!! Kaitlin was amazing! Food was great and quick and decently priced!

The food was fresh and excellent! I ordered the Shrimp Alfredo and the crab cakes, everything was a delight! The service was fantastic as well! Keep up the good work! Love this place! The atmosphere is fantastic, the Southern decor is very inviting and relaxing and all in all done with taste. The rustic atmosphere brings to the charm its New Orleans charm.

So we wanted to try several of their dishes so we ordered from the "sides" section! We had plenty to make a plate out of all the different sides we ordered. Food was delicious! Make a reservation if you can.

This place was great. Nicely located close to Bourbon Street. Had the Rockafeller oysters, as well as the ones with cheese (forgot what they were called) had the chicken fettuccine and tried the shrimp. Both very good. Service was fantastic and portions were generous!
We were seated quick, the Mardi gra pasta and crab cakes were really good! Service was good , we liked our server.. not sure it was all that is is hyped up to be

Yes honey!!!!! My first and last stop in the Big Easy! The staff is amazing, super friendly and don't mind answering questions. I enjoyed my vegetarian pasta, eggplant sticks twice during my visit! DELICIOUS. My veggie omelette and hash browns were top notch! I can wait to go back and full my tummy!
Ribs were great, fried shrimp was good. Crab cakes were ok. Ambience was well worth it, plenty of room for our entire family, kid friendly.

Loved everything about this place from the food to our server Ashley. We had the shrimp and crab cake for appetizers and they were so YUMMY! For dinner entrees, we had blackened red fish and blackened chicken. The portion was big and the food was nothing but amazing. We went back for breakfast the next day and our server Troy was also great! We had the crab crepe and was super happy again! Will definitely go back there for a 3rd meal before we leave town. 


Went back for dinner last night and it was another HAPPY MEAL!!! We ordered crab cakes and gumbo for appetizers and they were delicious! For entrees, we got their seafood platter - some fried and some grilled. My husband got the jambalaya with alligator sauce. They both were unbelievably flavorful and tasty!!! Our server Darrick was very knowledgeable, pleasant, patient, helpful and professional!!! We watched him take care of a large party of 20 French speaking tourists with ease and plenty of smiles!  Unfortunately we are leaving town today...am looking forward to our next visit!

Hands down the best restaurant in New Orleans. Whether for breakfast, lunch, or dinner, come to Oceana to satisfy your hunger. Great environment with a New Orleans feel! Lastly, it's tough to decide which is better, the food or the service!
I'm from New York and All I can say is the food is amazing! The oysters are to die for!!!! Definitely recommend eating here. Gumbo and alligator bites were really good as well!!
Woo hoo! Bowl o seafood gumbo and a fried oyster po boy, topped off with a Yeungling draft. Second time here. I will be back.

This has to be one of the best restaurants I've ever visited. The food was very tasty, and cooked to perfection. I ordered the seafood platter, which came with fried fish, oysters, and shrimp. One thing I found baffling was how much I enjoyed the oysters, since I've never liked the taste of oysters before. All around a great place to visit if you're in NOLA, definitely recommend.
Love this place! For it to be a local restaurant we were surprised at the prices and the service! We will definitely be back!

Was a nice place for dinner. Oysters were really good.  Potions are generous.  Staff is friendly and helpful.   Drinks were really good.  They add dry ice to give it a little flair!  Yummy bread pudding to end the meal.  Would have given 5 stars but the sauce on the crab cakes and the cornbread under the chef special were both cold.
The line was long, but the wait was shorter than we'd feared and totally worth it. Oysters Oceana, BBQ shrimp.

This was by far, one of the best meals I have ever eaten.  The had a special of Crawfish Etouffee..covered with fried crawfish and fried catfish....with a scoop of jalapeno cornbread sitting on the bowl.  OMG....IT WAS A BOWL OF HEAVEN!  If you get a chance to come here...DO IT!

This is the absolute worst restaurant I have ever eaten at in my life. I'm not sure where yelp is getting these reviews. I ordered fried shrimp because I thought you can't mess up a fried shrimp and French fries so I'll be safe. Well, the batter was disgusting with no taste and overwhelming baking soda flavor. So not Louisiana style. Compiled with the taste of rancid oil it was cooked in made it inedible. The fries where soggy and grease soaked and almost cold. Not one crisp fry on the whole plate. This place is a complete tourist trap. I'm from Louisiana and it's a disgrace that this place represents our food to all the tourists that visit the city

I knew exactly how this was going to go the minute I walked in the door. Everything about this place was a red flag; the dubious location just off the tawdry Bourbon Street, the tacky gift-shoppy host station, the plastic laminated menus. The writing was on the wall but it was late on a Sunday night and the cab driver swore to me this was the second best restaurant in Nola (the best was closed). I wanted to turn heel and run but I was just too hungry. 

It was exactly as I thought it would be, just left of ok. The chargrilled oysters were a gummy affair that needed another few minutes in the broiler. The fried oysters in my po-boy were minuscule--mostly fried balls of batter with an oyster in there somewhere. The roll was a little chewy--I guess it sat out long enough for the humidity to take its toll. 

I'm sure to many a stumbling drunk who saunters in off Bourbon street this place must represent everything that a Cajun meal should. That is the only way I can make sense of 41 hundred 4 star reviews. To me, a hungry traveler in town for work, it was a mediocre tourist trap to forevermore be avoided.
Josh is the best bartender in New Orleans. Thanks for the Sazeracs, oysters and gator. Definitely the best gator we had all week. Til next time...
The food here is delicious. We enjoyed all of it. The best part of the experience was the great service and friendliness of our server Sarah. Will return!

First place we came to for food when got to town and we were not disappointed!! The hostess greeted us as soon as we stepped in the door. We received great service by a phenomenal young lady named Megan. The food she recommended tasted like the prefect slice of NOLA! Food came quick and were not left with a feeling of being rushed out as soon as you are finished eating. Also made great recommendations of sites to see. Definitely is a must stop place everytime we come now!

Our waiter was delightful. He was knowledgable and told some fun stories about growing up in New Orleans. Since it was only 2 and we had already has a few drinks on Bourbon street, we just had water. 

We tried the turtle soup as it was the reason we came. Our swamp tour guide suggested this place when asked where the best turtle soup was. Now in my honest opinion it kind of tasted like beefaroni. 

The fried seafood platter was delicious. The cocktail and tarter sauces were really good. 

The alligator tail bites were really good as well. We got half fried and half blackened which gave them two totally different textures. 

The chargrilled oysters had this amazing smoky barbecue flavor, and an amazing creamy Alfredo like sauce. Superb!
This was a stop on our food tour the first day here. We had Gumbo and Jambalaya. Both are very good. The place is pretty casual.

So... Why didn't they take any of chef ramsey's advice from when they were on kitchen nightmares?  I don't understand how they would be offered a diamond and slosh it around and toss it away. Crazy!!

Mo is a horrible person and owner. Rami has always been wonderful to me.  Kent(?) one of the managers, is really bad at his job and should move toward a different career. Tom, one of the managers, is excellent. 

Overall, with the exception of Rami,  I've seen the staff be horribly abused. It is difficult for me to support a company who treats my neighbors and fellow new Orleans residents like shit.  

The food is frozen... Simple fact. Nothing is fresh. Simple fact. You can taste the freezer burn. 

I hate giving any place a one star review, but the entire city knows what oceana is. Tourist trap...  We locals call it the "slave ship"  

Its too bad because I live Rami and tom as leaders. But it is what it is. :-(

"Slave ship oceana "

I got the fried catfish platter. Overall the dish was pretty good. The catfish was nice and tender. The fries were lightly crispy. The jalapeno hush puppies were ok. Be careful because it is a LOT of food. It could have been split between 1.5 - 2 people and even with some others in my party taking some, I couldn't finish everything. Someone in my party got the alligator bites, half fried and half blackened. He said the fried were better than the blackened and liked them the best of the alligator bites he's gotten from 3 or 4 different restaurants over the past few days. The two people who got redfish dishes were both a little disappointed and thought the redfish was a bit dry.  Someone also got the blackened catfish and that was better than the redfish.
You can't go wrong with the Cajun Jambalaya pasta. I get it every time and it has yet to fail me. Cool spot off of Bourbon with a great staff.
Nice atmosphere. Best greeter. Great food. I recommend the alligator appetizers and the Taste of New Orleans plate. It's a busy side of town and we had to wait to be placed but it was worth it.

We come here for every trip to New Orleans. Good food, excellent oysters and if you come for early dinner or lunch there is no wait compared to some other places around. We hate waiting. 

Service is good. We had Whitney this time and she was very attentive. 

Thanks for another good experience! Might have to come back for the banana foster... we usually never make it to dessert though.
Ordered cup of Seafood Gumbo which includes shrimp and crab meat. Clean establishment. Prompt service. Good environment. I will definitely recommend and would return.

Don't expect a birthday nod even if the website asks when making a reservation. Totally ignored our request although other patrons were receiving their birthday acknowledgements.  Very disappointing and sad experience. The food is good but the care for customers is depressing.
Whitney was an awesome server, very attentive. The food was excellent,to start had the gator half and half, had the redfish special and the 1/2 and 1/2 poboy oyster and shrimp. Must stop here!!

This place didn't disappoint. Can become very busy. I was not a fan of the pasta Alfredo, however the 2nd night (pictures) getting the specials it was delicious!!! Food is hot and service is pretty good as well. Deseret was a nice portion. We will definitely return.

We won't be back.  This was recommended by our hotel, but I can only guess why that would be. 
This is the place Gordon Ramsey tried to help. 
To start off the meal we had the chargrilled oysters.  They were awful!
When we told some local people about our experience with them, we were told,  by numerous people that they don't freshly shuck their oysters. Instead,  they take them out of a bucket and cook them in a shell.  Ours were all different shapes and sizes and all bad. 
Our drinks had little to no liquor.  The main course wasn't bad.  That's why I gave a very generous 3 stars...
We told the hotel that we wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

I returned to NOLA for my honeymoon. We decided to slip by Bourbon St., and passed by the Oceana Grill. We decided to drop the in for a snack since we have heard good things, and ordered the cajun fries from Chris M. Chris was a great server - fast and efficient service with good recommendations! We upgraded our cajun fries to add blackened gator tail. It was definitely worth it! Best gator tail I've had and plenty of meat between that and the crawfish that is already included. The fries also had a great batter and were cooked just right.

We had a lovely dinner here. There was vegetarian options for my friend and I got the New Orleans sampler platter, which had a bunch of different food items I had been wanting to try while in New Orleans. Our waitress, Nathalie, was sweet, prompt, and very helpful she had some great recommendations. The drinks that we ordered came out bubbling and when one of the waiters saw me taking a video he brought more "magic" so that my video could show off this magical drink. We had a wonderful dinner! The only thing was the line, but that just tells you how good this restaurant is. And the line moves very fast so don't let the line out front scare you away.

We ate dinner here on a Saturday night because every other Resturant was on a very long wait and the wait here was only 20 minutes. 

I am sure glad we did the food was out standing and the service was very prompt. 

We ordered Greek salads for our appetizer and had the Surf and Turf for our entree. It was perfectly cooked and topped with an amazing sauce. We finished of the meal with  the bread pudding.

Came by for a late lunch based on a recommendation from our colorful carriage driver.  Ordered the seafood platter, etouffe, Abita beer, and a hurricane.  Everything tasted very good to excellent and service was very good.  We especially liked the fried catfish.  Restaurant was busy but sound level was not bothersome.
Crab cakes were amazing. Also had the crab cake Benedict and the ragin Cajun Bloody Mary. Portions were very generous. Whitney was our server and she was great. Right there when we needed anything.
Absolutely amazing food! Big portions and the best bartenders in NOLA. We visit the quarter often and this is one of our favorite stops.

We went here very late on a Friday night. The service was slow and the food was not memorable. I split a Po Boy and some drinks with my hubby and we were left feeling like we needed to try another Po Boy while we were in town to get the real experience.

We ordered delivery when our flight arrived later than expected and we didn't have time to go to dinner before a night out. Delivery was prompt and the food was still hot. I wasn't a huge fan of their famous crab cakes and the pecan pie had a very strong bourbon flavor. But my companions enjoyed the crab cake pasta. 
It was really just average but the delivery option was really convenient and helpful.
Food was outstanding, great atmosphere and our waiter Alex was a hoot.  Definitely recommend it.

Excellent food and service right off of Bourbon Street.  We were lucky to get right in about 6 pm and when we left there was a line about 50 ft. long.  That should tell you something about it's reputation.  I had the redfish with crawfish etoufee "gravy" and it would cooked perfectly and tasted great.  Bloody Marys are good too.

Had blackened catfish topped with crawfish etouffee and fried crawfish tails... Very good. The collard greens were the highlight for me, absolutely delicious.

The Oysters Rockefeller (which originated at Antoine's) were good. I still think Drago's has the best cooked oysters of anywhere, though, with their chargrilled...

I waited in line for about 15 minutes to get into this place and it was worth every second!!! I have the crawfish fettuccine and OMG was it delicious!!! This place is a hit!! The drinks are sexy too!!!

Service staff is wonderful 

Food is tasty but not what I would call four star. 

Bread needs to be upped.

My boyfriend & I went on a Tuesday night & walked right in. Everyone that worked there greeted us as we passed. The atmosphere was amazing. The staff was super friendly. We shared the Taste of New Orleans & it was delicious. The recipes were authentic & flavorful. The only bad part of our experience; I ordered a dozen oysters for an appetizer, but when our food was brought first & I mentioned the oysters, our waitress clearly had forgotten. She quickly brought me my oysters, but only half a dozen. However, it turned out to be the best thing. With all the food & drinks, half a dozen was just what I needed. Everything was delicious! We will visit again.
Thanks Whitney for the service. Love the red beans & rice as well as the seafood gumbo.
Great food and service! Megan L was amazing! The bbq shrimp was my favorite. The blackened red fish and rib eye was so good as well.
Our server Holly was the best helping use navigate the many wonderful choices on the menu the food and drinks are fantastic great atmosphere.

On a recent trip to NOLA I heard a lot about this place. I am so glad I decided to stop in. This is BY FAR one of THE BEST places to eat on/around Bourbon St. The wait staff was amazing. Our server (Kevin) was literally the best waiter I've ever had. Lol

We ordered oysters as appetizers, and the Oysters Rockefeller were one of the best things I've ever eaten (check my other reviews, I'm no easy critic). The raw and famous/house oysters were also delish.

There were 3 of us, and for dinner we got the crab cake platter, crab cake pasta, and full bbq rib platter. Everything was great. Literally not one complaint (which is a big deal for me). The ribs were huge (honestly a half order would've been more than enough), the crab cakes were meaty and a nice size.

I could go on for quite a while with my praises of this place. My friends and I have decided to eat here each time we come back, and I recommend that you do the same!!

Worth the update:  Best friend came back to NOLA and we took the hubby's there.  The service was still excellent.  But the food was definitely 4.5 stars!!!  I guess we ordered the wrong stuff the first time because we devoured that food!  I can't remember everything we had, but the oysters were great, the duck was amazing, the crab cakes are still the business, the Bourbon pecan pie was great and the bread pudding was even better!!!  And that's just the stuff I tried lol!!!  My friends said their selections were just as good!!!
Honestly felt sick after eating here. I knew something was off about the seafood texture but I kept eating because it tasted good. It ruined my new year's and we are owed a refund on our order.
This place was so good 5 stars easily, crab cakes and fried alagator was very good as well.

This is was our first meal and probably highlight meal of our trip. We chose here per recommendation of a hostess at our hotel. We are so thankful for that recommendation!

Perhaps we had an early dinner, so there was no wait or line at all when we arrived. We were seated upstairs, next to a window for a sweet breeze and decent view of outdoors as we ate. There was actually a separate bar on this floor as well. Wait staff was excellent with timeliness, courteousness, and information regarding the menu! I ordered the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta and the Mrs had the special of the day which was a redfish over a bed of some type of creamy spinach rice. Didn't take long to get our food and both dishes were AMAZING! If you want to taste New Orleans, this is the kind of restaurant you definitely need to visit!

Everything about this place was excellent. It's a casual dining atmosphere, but the quality of food feels like you should be dressed at least a little bit fancy :)
This place is on again off again, tonight it was off, misrepresentation of New Orlerans cuisine.
Love the food here. Bayou pasta was amazing. I love the service; waiter was very nice and gave some really good recommendations. Char grilled oysters were ok.

VERY friendly and helpful staff!
Nice upstairs and never too busy for breakfast!
Did I order a TV dinner???? This feels like a worse version of Chilis (and Chilis isn't that bad). Stay clear and do your work to find something worth wild.

This restaurant was very good food and service wise. The charbroiled oysters and fried gator tail was delicious! Walked in, hostess said it'd be a 15-20min wait so we sat at the full service bar. I forgot the gentleman's name that helped us but he was very kind!
Ordered the Cajun fries with cheese, crawfish and mushroom sauce. It was good however I'd recommend asking for light cheese as it was entirely too much cheese in the dish, I actually couldn't finish it due to how much cheese was in the meal. They also offer a 10% military discount so that was awesome! Definitely recommend the oysters and gator meat!

I personally loved their seafood gumbo and it was the best one I've had during my trip to NOLA. The other dishes were pretty average. The oceana's special oysters came with a delicious thick sauce but weirdly, the bread and salad mixture were beneath the oysters making them soggy. I also ordered their Cajun jambalaya pasta which tasted very average, nothing special. It did come with a lot of sauce but the noodle portions were very small. They also skimped on the sausages within the sauce. Overall this place was decent and I wouldn't mind coming back again especially for their gumbo. I would be careful with ordering too much of their dishes consisting of sauces as it made my stomach feel really heavy and not good by the end of the meal.
My second trip to NOLA and I hit up Oceana for breakfast!!  Ms. Alice tending the bar took care of me.  Seafood omelette was on point and so was her service!!
Came here to watch the game and enjoy some good nola food. Did not disappoint! Recommend the specialty oysters and ribs. Also good service from start to finish. Megan was amazing!

Jambalaya pasta includes shrimp and alligator sausage - it was delicious. I'm usually not a fan of a tomato based jambalaya but this was very flavorful!!

Barbecued shrimp was very good. For those that have not had this it's not really a standard BBQ sauce. 
Traditional New Orleans bbq shrimp is a sauce base of lemon, butter, garlic, pepper and Worcestershire and is a very thin sauce. But it s it's before good. Get some extra bread to dip in the sauce!!

Literally the best restaurant I have had in my life! This was my first time in NoLa and this place was the best place I ate at. I have never had such fresh, flavorful food before. I wish food in the Carolinas were this good. If I am being honest, I want to go back just to enjoy this restaurant again! The soft shell crab is by far the best I have ever had and the pasta (which I don't usually like pasta) was TO DIE FOR!! I highly recommend eating here regardless of the line.

My best friend and I were in NOLA for a girls trip, and neither of us had been to Oceana. My bff had been referred there by a friend, so we stopped for lunch while we were exploring the Quarter. We were incredibly impressed by the friendliness of our server! The food was delicious (we had the fried seafood platter) and the Bloody Marys were some of the best we've had. I can't wait to go back again!
I ate here 4 times while on vacation   Food is delicious and service was great.  Catfish, sandwiches and pastas were yummy.   Dessert was delicious also    Definitely will return

we had wanted to go to Galatoire, which is our favorite restaurant maybe in the world. we fly there to eat once or twice a year. but we forgot about the halloween festivities and couldnt get in there, Mr B, Antoine, broussard, arnaud, Emeril, etc etc, all either packed or closed. and no we dont just eat at the "touristy" places. they are touristy bc they are just so good. we also eat at R&O, fat harry, Domilise Po-Boys, station 6 blah blah not bc we are cool and just know where to go, but bc my dear college friend thats from there introes us to places. so all that longass commentary to say that my friend told us that since we are staying in the hotel that houses Oceana Grill we should try it bc its pretty good. by now its like 2.30 bc we've been looking around for the old standards, so only like 4 or 5 tables seated. there were lots of staff buzzing around but the service was a little slow. BUT.... the food was outstanding. yeah the crabcakes will bite you, its nola nice

Oceana Grill is HUGE! We had a party of 7 on a Friday night and had hardly any wait because this place is never ending. The drinks are delicious (a perfect sazerac!), and the food is good. The Blackened Bayou Duck is delicious! The staff was courteous and the atmosphere was nice without being too loud. Definitely a diamond in the rough.

This was literally some of the best crawfish Etouffee I've ever tasted, The Cajun Jambalaya Pasta was sooo good with blackened alligator and the Charbroiled Oysters are you die for! Seriously one of the best restaurants I've ever been too!!!

I stopped in here for lunch  with a friend after getting a recommendation from another friend. Sat upstairs and the service was very attentive. Great decor and good view of the street. The crab cakes were exceptional and so filling. Still I also ordered blackened redfish which was perfectly done and also exceptionally tasty.  Coffee was good too!

Great service, food was good and quick. I had the shrimp poboy and it was good. The teenagers ordered the crawfish fries for an appetizer and it was huge. Plenty for the whole table.  We also got there right around 3:30 pm on a Monday and were pleasantly surprised that we still received the lunch menu.  
I am originally from Louisiana so I ordered the Hurricane- haven't had one of those in years. 1. It was good 2. It was cool with the dry ice (made it smoke) 3. It was too small for the price 4. Wasn't super strong. 
Overall- great restaurant- there is a patio that we didn't know about- but would have been nice to sit outside.
Très bonne ambiance, le service impeccable de Errol , on vous le recommande , belle et bonne assiette, tout pour vous satisfaire , endroit à découvrir .

Christmas day, they were organized, friendly, and quick with service. Unfortunately, the food was not good. I was disappointed. I could not finish my meal. Possibly the standard for mass production on Christmas, and in French quarter. Who knows? Red beans had too much liquid smoke. The blackened chicken was flat, dry and flavorless. Hurricane was good. Way overpriced for the quality of food.

This place did NOT disappoint! I had the crab cakes and the pasta jambalaya and it was amazing! My boyfriend had the surf and Turf and it was mouth watering. The waiters were really great too. The only negative thing was that they made his steak a bit to rare and when he asked for it to be cooked more, it took them a lot longer than it should have to bring the food back. It definitely was one of the restaurants I went to during my trip to NOLA and I went to many!!

Amazing!!! Visited New Orleans for Essence Fest and a friend recommended Oceana Grill. Best Recommendation ever. At the time we went it was hot and busy, wait line was wrapped around the restaurant. But honey we waited in the hot sun and was satisfied. We ordered so much food, i don't even remember what we got. Everything was good. We tried the alligator for the first time! I recommend trying the blackened flavor, soo good. Over the experience and service was great and next time I'm in NOLA, I'm going back
Don't believe the hype with oceana, way too many good places to eat in the city to eat somewhere where the service is subpar and the food isn't tasty but just drowned in sauces.
Best food ever ! Seafood was so fresh and tasty ! Our waitress was amazing and very kind

Food was delicious.!  I got the Taste of New Orleans! You won't be sorry 





Make sure you get Mr. John as your waiter !!!
Sierra took great care of us. She was attentive and personable. Food was delicious and filling.

I visited Oceana at the glowing recommendation of the group of ladies with which I was traveling. I enjoyed Oceana. The issue is that I've enjoyed similar quality Cajun food in Charlotte. That's not to take away from Oceana, I just feel as though I was expecting more. 

I visited twice during this trip. First time, I had crawfish etouffée and fried crawfish tails. The wait was a bit long, over 30 mins. However, the front of the house staff were very pleasant and kept the line updated on the wait time. We had a few issues with our orders and had to return a couple of items. Overall, the service was good. 

On the second visit, I ordered the crab cakes, mustard greens and bread pudding. The crab cakes left quite a bit to be desired. The mustard greens were amazing! Literally some of the best greens that I have tasted to date. Perhaps this explains my mixed emotions about Oceana. When in NOLA I expect to be overwhelmed by the quality of the seafood. 

Yet, the bread pudding was a save. The New Orleans Bread Pudding was worth every single calorie! I recommend sharing it with a friend, as it is a very healthy portion.

The dinner was AMAZING! Ms Sara Lee, our server, was fantastic and knew the menu perfectly! The blacken duck was to die for! Their house wine is also amazing! Check out the courtyard while you are there. You can access it on the second floor if you need to smoke.
The best native food by far.  Oceans on Tuesday, sister restaurant on Wednesday.  Our waiter was cute and awesome!  Thanks John D.  for making us feel welcome

Good Cajun food, we got the fried gator bites, jambalaya pasta, taste of New Orleans, blackened chicken and fried oyster po boy! 
Our server Sierra was great and very attentive!
The hurricane here was kind of bland could've been better but the bbq shrimp were pretty good.

Came for oysters as our first stop. The oysters were a disappointment. I let the waiter know that there was grit and shell bits in one of them and they simply only apologize and no more than that. Oysters were not sweet either. I was expecting them to just write off that half rack as a gesture of customer service but nope. The Po-boy was good and everyone did thank you for your business as you leave.

Our experience at Ocean Grill was great. We loved the food. I went to visit for dinner with my wife and our 18 month old son. Our son doesn't normally like being in a crowded place but Our server Mary made sure we enjoy our dinner. This was the best customer service i had ever had. My son was crying the entire time and she made sure we enjoy our meal and tried to engage him and play with him despite she had to look over other tables she came every 60 seconds to make sure we are eating our meal and that our son is not crying. She was courteous from the heart and one can tell she was not just doing it . Very sincere. She also explained the dishes very well since it was our first time eating traditional new orleans food . She was very caring towards our little one and played with him to distract him from crying I will recomend oceana grill to all my friends just because of the service we got from  Mary and next time when we visit we will make sure we visit this place. We had a very good experience here the food was great especially the shrimp creole and bbq shrimp the ambience was awesome and the service was beyond 5 stars.

Great service, phenomenal food, and I missed Post Malone here by about 10 minutes. He had crab cakes, seafood gumbo, and the seafood platter. So of course I had the seafood gumbo & seafood gumbo. That was the first night, the second night I had the fried oyster platter with fries. I'd recommend any of these dishes in a heartbeat. Make sure to ask for the big oysters and they will gladly give them to you! My servers were great! Food was amazing and will be returning next year!

I loved the food!
I went here twice with a friend during lunch and dinner rush hour and the food and service was very good. On the second visit, the waiter re-seated us multiple times because I didn't want to sit by the air cond vent. The wait is a bit ridiculous though, about 30mins-1 hr to get a table and 45mins - 1 hr to get your food. The restaurant is pretty big though more than two stories.
Amazing food and great service! Shared the seafood platter and worth every penny. Party of 7!

Was recommended this place by our hotel on our first night here. They have a sampler platter where you can try etouffe (soup), jumbo, and red beans and rice all at once. Their oyster Rockefeller was good, not the best I've had (other places will offer garlic bread with butter to eat with the oysters, at Oceana you just get a couple plain bread slices) but still respectable. The cocktails were great, I loved the Ragin Cajun Bloody Mary!! Would definitely recommend to those who want to try several NOLA staples at once, since they offer several sample platter options.

Came here during the weekend to see what the hype is about. Personally, I don't like how close it is to Bourbon St., but what can they do do? Walking in, this place is well themed for a nice and casual occasion. I ordered the PoBoy Oyster Sandwich and Crawfish Etouffe for dinner, and Banana Bread for desert. 

2/5 PoBoy - Really below my expectations. The fried oysters and slaw were above average. However, there was too much break vs the amount of oyster meat, so it made for a relatively dry-mouthed dish.  The fries are good...better if you come directly out of the Bourbon St parties, but frankly, nothing special here. 

Crawfish Etouffe - 5/5 this is a perfect dish. Had a good ratio of crawfish and was salted to perfection. I rarely go around to previous restaurants, but this is one to remember. 

Banana bread - 3/5 nothing memorable here - wish I didn't spend extra money on desert.

Great stop! Food was phenomenal and I would go again. We started with half fried, half blackened gator bites, and both were great, but I think I liked the fried better if I had to choose. I ordered the blackened catfish PO Boy, and was NOT disappointed. If I could change anything, my fries weren't super hot. 
My daughter got red beans and rice, definitely delicious. 
Then we shared the Kentucky Bourbon Pecan Pie. *drool. SO GOOD.

Came here for dinner one day while visiting NOLA. Food is great, we shared seafood platter and it was delicious! The banana foster was also very good. 

I gave this place 3 stars because of the ambiance, it is dark and we were seated in a very small corner. The table was shaky and I had to keep my foot on the pedestal of the table to prevent my food from sliding.
Absolutely delicious! We tried the chargrilled oysters, Cajun fries and the seafood platter. Sarah was a lovely waitress!

Fat Tuesday 2019. Walked in around 10 a.m. two seats open at the bar. Josh R. was our server at the bar and he was great. The food was unexpectedly very good. No need to wait in lines or for tables elsewhere. Plenty of options and good drinks too!

We showed up without a reservation on a Friday night but seated within 20 minutes. They have a very organized system to get you seated. Service was great.  I had the bbq shrimp and my partner had the shrimp pivot. Flavors were great.   Excellent service in my opinion

So many rave reviews about Oceana; we had to check it out! This place is easy to find, conveniently located on the side of the street. We paid $5 for meter street parking and walked here.

Inside, even at 2 PM on a Monday, it's jam packed: boisterous, loud, and welcoming! The entire space appears aged & vintage, but still very open and airy.  They opened all the windows and doors to let in natural light, otherwise, interior is pretty dimly lit. It took a while to flag down our waiter; he was pretty short with us and we had to keep asking other employees to help us with extra plates, utensils, napkins, the like. We read the service here was supposedly excellent. Perhaps we just caught them on a wrong day, as our service was very poor. 

We ordered a cup of gumbo, the Taste of New Orleans dish ($17), and the fried oyster platter ($21) between 2 of us. Gumbo was the weakest of the dishes and would not order again. It was bland and also came out cold. We felt lucky we didn't order an entire bowl and just the cup. 

Taste of New Orleans is a great value. Comes with cup sample sizes of 3 favorites: jambalaya, red beans & rice with alligator sausage, and crawfish etoufee. Jambalaya was soooo good! Flavorful and came out piping hot. Crawfish was also good but quite dry. I enjoyed the red beans & rice more than I imagined. Would totally recommend!

We took the fried oysters to go. They were seasoned great but keep in mind it's a ton of salt. Served over a bed of regular fries and some hush puppies.

Overall, food is fairly priced given that it's seafood. Don't come here for service, but food is good and would recommend to others if you're in the area.
Bartender was really generous with telling us what to order! He was really sweet. I think his name was Derek the food was really good all the stuff that he was telling us to get highly recommend it.
Food tastes good but the sides are $4-5 for each portion. Also saw cockroaches im dining area.

Decent option for lunch if you're in the French Quarter. Mostly focused on providing "New Orleans" food for tourists. Blackened gator tail bites were quite good, however the Taste of New Orleans entree was so so. If you want better food and our experience holds true, the best food options in New Orleans are outside of the French Quarter.
OMG!!!! Soooooo delicious from the raw oyesters, blackened steak cooked to perfection, 1/2 fish n shrimp poboy and gumbo. Definitely a must go to again

He as their redfish special which was redfish over a crawfish cornbread stuffing with a shrimp etouffe sauce over it. It was a pretty large portion. I really enjoyed the crawfish stuffing. The fish was a bit salty but that is southern food in general. All in all a good meal and service good. Water was constantly refilled.

Went twice.  First time didn't eat there but last night we did.  We had a big party.  I had the oyster Rockefeller, blackened alligator and fries!!! All of it was great!!! Excellent service from Fe our waitress. She made sure that we were aware of any delays and made sure we happy with everything.  Good was hot sand tasted great!! Would go back!! Red beans and rice was delish!!
Not so great, I never eat here as I don't like rats and they seem to frequent the place.

My family and I ate at Oceana in August and were so glad we did! The food was fabulous! My boys both had pasta and raved about it. My husband and I split the seafood platter and enjoyed it thoroughly. David was our server and he was so good making sure we had everything we needed.
One of the best places to eat. Not only is the food out of this world but the wait staff is the best on the business. If your in Nolo, you have to stop in.

What's not to hate?

1. SLOW service. 
2. Etouffe tasted like lumpy paste with what seemed to have been previously frozen crawfish.
3. Horrid bloody mary's.
4. Mediocre oyster po-boy with soggy, rather than crunchy fried oysters.

Our stupid mistake: not leaving immediately upon seeing laminated menus. We learned and will not repeat such foolishness again.
Banana Foster excellent. Also enjoyed Charbroiled Oysters.Great Service was excellent
My husband and I came for breakfast. It was AMAZING. I had the French toast breakfast. Little rally the best French toast I've had. Will be coming back!

After a stroll down Bourbon Street, I picked out this restaurant because I was looking for a relatively quiet place but sitll offering a diverse menu and good atmosphere.  For the most part, this place hits the marks.  Food comes out quickly and the service was friendly, but not extremely attentive.  I had the gumbo which was good but not amazing.  My main course was a full rack of sticky, tender BBQ pork ribs.  They advertise them as fall-off-the-bone tender, which they ae not, but that was fine by me.  Good ribs should have a bit more chew and not be turned into baby food consistency, so I do believe tenderness is an over-rated quality in ribs.  That said, the chef came over to me when I was about  half-way through this massive serving and said she was concernd I was not enjoying them.  the reality was that I was quite full ,but she insisted on providing me something on the house, which turned out to be a free glass of wine.  It was a very nice gesture and I would go back because the food was good and they clearly will work hard to make it a happy experience.

Superb service with a smile. Great drinks and a menu that will make you drool. Turtle soup is delicious, bbq bacon burger is even great if you're all Seafooded out haha. Great environment and beautiful setting.

Food is absolutely DELICIOUS!!! It's also priced well!! Everyone is so nice there!!!! I can't say enough nice things about this place!!!!!  You must get the Seafood Gumbo or Grilled Shrimp Fettuccine!!!

Omg... This place gave me life!!! Barbecue Shrimp.. On point!!! Hurricane... Perfect!!! Gumbo... Amazing!!!..... And Oysters...super juicy!!! The seating was fast and customer service was top shelf!!! Will ALWAYS eat here when I'm in town!!!

Food ok, nothing spectacular.

Based on the yelp reviews, we had the crab cake and the gator tails appetizer, both were disappointing.  The shrimp etuffee was decent.  I had the special which was blackened red fish topped with shrimp in a white sauce.  It was served with some kind of cornbread hash and a side corn dish.  The gator tails and my special were stone cold.  I tried to eat it but just can't after a while.  I asked the waitress to see whether they can heat it up some.  She brought me a new special instead.

The service was good.  The food was just ok.  Don't understand the long line out front.  Out from all the meals we had in New Orleans, this one is the most disappointing one.

We had an excellent meal here tonight! We started with their famous oysters that were cooked to perfection in such a yummy cream sauce! We also had the BBQ shrimp. They were good but not great! 

For our main course we had the fried seafood platter! It was awesome! Tons of fish, shrimp, and oysters! It arrived to the table piping hot and 20 minutes into the meal, it was still hot temperature wise! Great fresh food! It was an amazing meal and we left stuffed!!
Amazing food, great service perfect New Orleans atmosphere! .. Get the gator!!!
We got gator bites， blackened catfish and gumbo. I liked everything. Must say I am very impressed by the gator bites.

Food was awesome!!! I had the chicken fettuccine And it was delicious ! Creamy sauce, lightly breaded chicken! Also had a frozen hurricane that hit the spot. We were seated immediately and experienced friendly fast service. The food was moderately priced for a tourist spot. I will definitely return next time I visit NOLA!!!
Just average food, nice environment and fast service. The location is super cool and I would definitely suggest this place but not for the food which is nothing special
This is a great atmosphere with great food and drinks. I've eaten here several times and it's consistently good. The prices are good and servings are large.

Very average food. Barbequed Shrimp gravy was way too salty. Veggie Pasta was a bad call. Marinara sauce tasted like ketchup. Shrimp Po Boy was dry but good. Cocktails are alright. I liked my Bloody Mary
Probably one of the best places to eat in NOLA! The pasta and alligator Fries are amazing! Service was great. It gets pretty busy so come early.
This place is a tourist trap. The raw oysters were not good. The speciality oysters were inedible. They came out a soupy cold mess. For as much as this place costs, go somewhere else.

This. Place. Is. Amazing. Give it a try. Our server was a little quirky but all part of the experience. I came here during a work convention and brought 3 of my clients from the west coast. They all loved it! I highly recommend.
Spent the day in New Orleans after a wedding. Oceana was recommended by a tour guide I spoke with

This was my first time at this restaurant. I ordered the chargrilled oysters which were delicious. They do have a special sauce on them which is really cheesy and heavy. For my entree, I ordered the fried oyster plate with collard greens. The oysters were fried perfectly as they were not fried too hard. This restaurant is located right off bourbon street and I definitely on my list of top restaurants in NOLA.

This the second time I eat here, it's great place for some cajun good, I tried the duck and the crab meat cake, they were awesome.
Service was fas and so professional, Ashley did a really good job.
Definitely will be coming here again.

Excellent food, great service, very well staffed.  The line moves pretty fast.
Everything on the menu is available anytime they're open.  Good portions.  Probably the best value in the Quarter.

For two people (appetizer, drinks, and meals), expect to pay over $60. 

I highly recommend their oysters ($10 for half-dozen), but make sure your mother is not within arms reach when you try them...because you might slap that ho.

That's right: the sauce so good, make you slap your mama.  But if you don't try those oysters with that sauce, slap yourself.

First night in NOLA has started perfect AND Everything here was awesome. Service by Karaline was great she was knowledgable and very polite. Other yelp reviews are on point the food here is EXCELLENT. If you want to have some good food in NOLA def come here ! I Had the red fish and it was amazing ! Pô boys were also really good!
Jai and Shaun the bartenders were awesome!! Jai's lemon drop was very tasty! And the southern hospitality was on point

My best friend and I were in town just to hang out for the weekend. Someone at the Info desk at the River Walk recommended Oceana to us so we decided to give it a try. There was a line outside but they kept to the 15 minute wait time that we'd been quoted. Ashleigh was GREAT!!!!! She told us about the specials, one of which was a blackened red fish with sautéed shrimp on top, a crawfish stuffing, and smoked mustard greens. The mustard greens were not cooked with pork! She made it sound so good we both decided to order it. Our food was room temperature when it arrived, but after informing Ashleigh of this when she came to check on us, she insisted on taking our food back and having them made fresh. Ashleigh provided AWESOME service and we'd definitely return the next time we're in town.

We got to Oceana right before the dinner crowd and was so glad we did. We ordered the New Orleans sampler with beans and rice, jambalaya, andouille sausage and gumbo. Very good but I prefer Acme. We also had the crawfish at two Faye which was also very good, a little pepper forward for me but still tasty. My husband had the rice and beans with fried crawfish and he loved it. The service was very good. We were seated right away. Fun atmosphere. Cajun fries were not spicy at all but what can you do? I think they might make them less spicy for tourists but the Cajun fries I've gotten at Five Guys had more flavor. All in all a very good food experience. I forgot to use my 10% discount for checking in with Yelp. That would've been nice if I remembered. Anyway, I would still recommend if you're looking for your classic New Orleans fare.

It's not bad.  Neither is it great.  It's ok.  It's the Denny's of our visit to NOLA, and if you want a drink with flavor or finesse I suggest elsewhere.  My hurricane leaned very much to the softer side.  It was made festive by a bubbling piece of dry ice.  I told our server that I had my first hurricane down the block at the Red Fish Grill and I thought someone had slapped me.  He surprised me by saying, "Well that's a higher end place isn't it?"  I didn't quite know how to answer him.  I thought the prices were about the same.  The cost of the hurricane sure was at $10. Although the Red Fish Grill did qualify their hurricane as a "Category 5 Hurricane"

The flavor of the gumbo was very good but it really bothered us having to work past the rock-hard bits of rice that clearly came from someone scraping the rice cooker to get every last bit of rice into our bowl.  The softshell crab was good.  

In the end, I guess our server was right.  I should have lowered my expectations.  Not bad, not good.  Just ok at best.

Was told by a couple locals to try the gumbo here. I must say it was yummy but a little lacking. I had more flavorful ones (The Gumbo Shop). However, we got the Cajun fries and they were AMAZING! So yummy it's basically fried with a Cajun crawfish and mushroom sauce on top with cheese over that. We also got the crab cakes which were also Amazing! The restaurant is right off of bourbon street which is super convenient and open till late. Our service was excellent! I only give it a 4 because I was a little disappointed by the gumbo but all in all we had a pleasant experience.

Definitely on of my favorite eateries while visiting New Orleans. My coworkers and I like it so much we actually ate here twice on our visit. With such short amount of time And with so many great eateries you know that's says a lot.

Had the pleasure of trying Oceana's famous oysters, shrimp Po boys, fried seafood platter, Cajun jambalaya pasta, crab cakes, and gator bites.

OCEANA'S FAMOUS OYSTERS freshly shucked louisiana oysters on the half-shell, chargrilled over an open flame, smothered with zesty garlic and cream herb cajun sauce, finished with a fresh blend of parmesan and romano cheeses. Dozen $17.50 4 1/2 stars****

SHRIMP PO BOY$13 
Served with French Fries and Dressed with Coleslaw, Tomatoes, Pickles, Onions and Remoulade. Big sandwich loaded with fried shrimps. Fries were crispy and good also 4 1/2 stars****

FRIES SEAFOOD PLATTER $18.00 Seasoned golden fried oysters, shrimp and crispy catfish all Served with french fries, cole slaw, jalapeño hushpuppies, cocktail and tartar sauce. 4 stars*****

CAJUN JAMBALAYA PASTA $19.50
Shrimp and alligator sausage with onions, bell peppers in a Creole sauce, tossed with Fettuccine pasta. 4 1/2 stars***

GATOR TAIL BITES $10.00
Marinated white meat gator tail served fried and or blackened served with a side of remoulade sauce. Went with both blackened and fried so crispy and soft with just the ride seasoning. Great portion. 4 1/2 stars****

LOUISIANA CRAB MEAT CAKES $14.00
Huge crab cakes served with crawfish and mushroom cream sauce. 4 1/2 stars****

Service was ok. They're pretty busy plus it's a tourist spot so didn't get the southern hospitality that New Orleans is suppose to be known for.

Regardless I would more than likely be back to try other options.

TLDR: If I could give this place 10 stars I TOTALLY would! 

A friend recommended and so glad he did. 

It all started with us walking up to a long line which surprisingly only took 20 minutes. The food and drink are worth waiting far longer if need be. TRUST ME! 

Once seated we started things off with a couple drinks and the alligator tail bites. Yes...I ate deep friend alligator and loved it. They marinate the alligator in Italian dressing for 24 hours so it's not rubbery or gristly either. The sauce they bring for dipping is also delicious. 

For drinks we had: 
"Oceana's Big Banana" a bananas fosters ice cream cake blended with Bacardi Rum, Stoli Vanilla Vodka and Bols Banana liqueur and the "Tropical Storm" a Malibu Coconut Rum, Hpnotiq Liguor, Bols Blue Curacao and pineapple juice and it had dry ice in it so it arrived smoking it was so cool. 

For dinner we had the fried shrimp platter with crawfish tails (the jalapeño hushpuppies were awesome)and the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta. Both were so delicious and flavorful. I added spicy crawfish tails to my pasta too. So good! 

Every moment at this place was the boom! The hostess, server, food runner, bartender, food, drink and company was perfect! 

We will be back to New Orleans just to come back here!

So......this place was recommended by a tour guide who undoubtedly is getting kickbacks.   The line outside should have told us THIS IS A TOURIST TRAP!!!

We sat at the bar and ordered a Shrimp Po Boy and Taste of New Orleans.  The Po Boy was on stale bread, luke warm and unimpressive.  Very plain. The fries were the star.  

The Taste of New Orleans ....well.  Definitely a bit more on the flavor side, but bread was stale and was lukewarm at best 

The free food at the hotel reception got more stars than this.

I pray we don't get sick tonight......

We got here on a Saturday night and was seated quite quickly. We got the Chicken & sausage gumbo and recommended by the waitress: the Redfish Tchoupitoulas. Thanks to our waitress for accommodating one of our seafood allergies and switching to the Chicken & sausage gumbo. Gumbo was good but the seafood one with shrimp & crab is better! 

We really enjoyed the red fish with collared greens & cornbread. Plus the hot sauces added a vinegary heat to our food. Good service and fun restaurant decorations with the neon lights! I'd come back for the poboy and other seafood dishes.

Oceana was delicious. We went on a Saturday night around 10:00. The line looked long, but we were seated within about 10 minutes. Service was great, crab cakes were amazing. I had the blackened chicken Caesar salad-the chicken was out of this world! My boyfriend had the special, which was- crawfish etouffe, fried catfish, fried and regular crawfish tails, and jalapeño cornbread. He loved it! Your restaurant came highly recommended, we will be back next time we come to New Orleans!

I've eaten here before.  I always love it!  Errol is an awesome waiter!!!!!!!!!!!  We ordered the Jambalya, Beans and rice, and fried shrimp dinner.  Always great portions.  No complaints!  All of my children ordered the Jambalaya and finished their plates and raved on the food!  I will go back!!!!!!!!!!

I had the catfish platter with French fries, cole slaw and hush puppies.  Everything was really good with the exception of the cole slaw.  It's not one of my favorite things so it may be good for others.   I had it delivered and it read 120 minutes but seemed more like 30.  It arrived really quickly and was still hot. Impressive!

Despite the line,we got in quite quick. Service was professional. Gumbo was the best I've ever had; freshness of seafood was evident, and extremely fragrant. Jambalaya pasta was less so, mostly just pasta and heavy cream. But overall, pleasantly memorable, especially because of that gumbo.
Excellent food and service.  We stopped in for breakfast - I highly recommend the St Louis Benedict.  One of the best meals I had in New Orleans! Seafood Crepe was great too.

Maybe it was a long day, but our waiter was a little rude to our party and we had quite a long wait before ordering and after. The food was great, highly recommend the Cajun fries smothered in crawfish and cheese.

This is my second time coming to this place.  Both times are with friends or family from out of town.  Honestly, at first, I was being a little skeptical because it is in the quarter right off Bourbon Street, so I wasn't sure if it's like "tourist food" if you know what I mean.  However, as my friends/family wanted to try seafood from New Orleans, it seems like this is the closest from where they stayed, so we decided to give it a go.  

The waiting line was long but it only really took us about 20 minutes.  Service was actually very efficiency and nice.  The last time we were there, the waiter was very nice and professional.  He was always smiling and checking on us at the right moment.

We ordered, Crawfish Etouffee, Fried seafood platter and BBQ shrimps to share. We added extra fried crawfish to the etouffee as suggested and it was fantastic.  The crawfish was clean and fresh.  The Seafood platter was great.  The fried oysters and catfish were soooo fresh and we were all very impressed.  Lastly, the BBQ shrimp, it was amazing.  I thought Pascal's BBQ shrimps was my favorite until I tried theirs.  Their BBQ shrimps are a little more tangy than the ones at Pascal, but I love them both.

There is a discount from Yelp if you check in, but it seems like they don't take it during weekends, but be sure to use it next time if you happen to be around during the week.
Had such amazing service with Mary. She was so much fun and the food was really amazing ! I would recommend this place if you are visiting NOLA.

Great service. This is important. In a tour city like this, some places don't care about customers service any more, but oceans grill really cares! 
Great food. Big portion. Love the oyster. If I can, I'll come back again.

Came here for the gator bites since the French Market only had gator sausage and had even run out of that by the time we got there. Half were fried and half were grilled. I'd say I'm more a fan of the fried because I just love me batter, but there were some pieces of shrimp and fish in there, which was odd. The grilled pieces were moist and well seasoned. I just don't think I'm a fan of gator though.

The grilled oysters were disappointing. They were smothered in sauce and having had Acme's the night before, these didn't seem to compare. They also seem really big because the sauce is covering the actual oyster and the shells are huge, but they're not.

This place is awesome! The staff was really friendly, our waiter Shahan was super knowledgeable about the menu and helped us make some GREAT choices! We started with the oysters, and also had the Gator Bites, both blackened and fried. Both of those were amazing! I had the crab cakes, I totally know now why they are known for those. The sauce was this mushroom sauce and it was sooo wonderful with the spices in the cakes! My partner had the special for the night, crawfish and red fish. The greens were tasty! We ordered Hurricanes to go and they had dry ice in them and that made them super cute! This place has a great NOLA feel without being over the top!

3 years later we came back and ended up sitting in the same seats at the bar. We had the Redfish with greens and the stuffed Ahi Tuna. Both were absolutely amazing and the service was wonderful. Everyone was very friendly and all the food we saw looked delicious.

I had finally got the opportunity to try this place out after waiting for about 20 mins during Mardi Gras weekend. We had finally got seated and ordered the charbroiled oysters..Cajun Pasta and the Chicken Alfredo. The food arrived after about 15 mins and it was all very delicious. The customer service was decent and I had even seen the manager helping out. The only negative I would say is that we sat by the window facing Conti and there was a homeless man sleep on the sidewalk so that was our view.

Loved loved loved this place. Our server Ashleigh was so sweet and so lovely. Decided to try alligator bites for the first time and they were better than chicken. I had the blackened chicken with jambalaya, so yummy. The hurricanes are fantastic and at first it tastes like it just juice and then it hits you. Those hurricanes will sneak up on you.

As the very first restaurant I've ever been to in New Orleans i can really say the service was phenomenal! Ms. D our server was so nice! She was patient, attentive (not to just us but to all of her guests) and extremely professional. She is truly a gem, thank you for starting off my trip on a great note. The food was incredible also. Definitely will visit every time i visit from now on!!!

This is probably one of favorite go to places in the city. The service  and food are always perfecto. The alligator and crab cakes are what has me coming back more and more for over 8 years. There's plenty of places to go but this place never skips a beat!!! Thanks team for many years of great service!

This restaurant was recommended by my cousin. The group of us were starving by the time we got to this location. Lucky for us, there was a short line that took about 10 minutes to be seated. The waiter was such a gentleman and very informative with all the dishes. We ordered the chargrilled oysters, gumbo, crab jambalaya! The food took much longer than expected. Though, it was worth the wait! I loved it. I never had anything so amazing, the food was flavorful, filling and delicious. The best part was everything was 10 percent off and the total for all the food was less than 60 bucks for a group of four girls! I would highly highly recommend this place for anyone visiting NOLA!
I love the redfish. Yummy...The waiter is super friendly. The beer I ordered is a bit ordinary. Overall, good restaurant, recommended.

Fantastic! We loved our food and drinks, and our server, Jamal, was the best!  We had also had Creme brûlée and it was so good. I'll definitely go back. (Our table had crab cakes, ettouffee, and ended with Creme brûlée- all amazing)

I came here 3 times in the past week.  I had the crab cakes,  char broiled oysters,  and oyster poboy.  All were excellent.  This is a great place because it is reasonably priced and has great food.  I had an oyster poboy at Acme prior to the one I had here and it was lower quality and cost a lot more.  This is my favorite restaurant in NoLa.

3.5 stars.  The fetuccine with shrimp and alligator sausage was pretty good.  Sauce was very good, but f I hadto nit pick, it could have used more fetuccine.  Tons f sausage and shrimp though.  Menu is not my style but atmosphere was, so I tried it anyway.  It was quiet, had dinner at the bar, friendly atmosphere and I enjoyed the food.  Couple of tv's too.  For one door off of Bourbon street it was nice and quiet.  Topped it off with a nice delicious piece of cheese cake.
Every enjoyable atmosphere, very good food, a wonderful server. The wait line was handled very well and quickly especially for a Saturday evening.

Went there a few days ago on my holiday break, there was about a 30 minute wait but well worth it . The cat fish was amazing and prob the best I have had. The service was good. I would go back anytime. If your ever in New Orleans give them a try

Good food! I tried the blackened catfish po-boy (I've never tried my fish blackened), and it was DELICIOUS. I think the sauce they put on the sandwich helped that. Thinking it was mayo?

Anyway, the fries were also really good. Super crispy and different than what you'd get anywhere else in my opinion.

Definitely worth a try!

Food was decent but the service was the worst I have ever seen. We ordered drinks and appetizers and finally one of them came, then 30 min later a second one, then 30 min later the third. At this point we just wanted our food so we could go but it was obvious our food order just went in! Finally after being at the place for almost 3 hours our bill came. They came back and told us they couldn't split it between the three couples after they told us they were gonna split it up when we ordered. I think they stuck it on one bill to automatically add gratuity cause at that point we wouldn't have tipped anything. The manager straightened it out and comped us some desserts we didn't want and we left. When we walked out there was a line halfway down the street waiting to get in yet there was at least 6 tables empty when we left? 

If they had even mediocre service I would probably be reccommending this place but after our experience I don't think we will be returning!

We ate here at 5pm on Sunday. There was about a 20 minute wait to be seated for a party of 4. We sat upstairs.
We ordered the Fried Eggplant appetizer, Fried Catfish Po'boy, Pimm's Cup, and Bloody Mary. Shortly after eating here we both felt sick and assume it was caused by what we ate at this restaurant. I recommend eating somewhere else in the area. There are about 3 vegetarian options on the menu. We didn't get to try any dessert. The menu prices seem high for the quality of food you receive.

I recently ventured to New Orleans to celebrate my friends bachelorette party, and we decided to have dinner here on our final night. When we arrived there was a bit of a line but that's to be expected on a busy weekend. We also had 10 people in our party so we prepared ourselves for a bit of a wait (or possibly being turned away if they couldn't accommodate our party size...) ahead of time. Not only was the hostess very pleasant but she also kept us informed on the wait times. She was also extremely welcoming and provided food/drink suggestions while we waited. Our waiter was also very pleasant and attentive. Last but not least the food.... OMG... the food was absolutely amazing. I had the chargrilled oysters as an appetizer and for the entree I had the special (fried fish, jalapeño cornbread, and crawfish etoufee) Everything was amazingggg. Despite the several times that I've been to NOLA, I hate that it has taken me so long to finally check this place out. I will definitely be back!
Open late night and no line after 9pm... amazing po boy and jambalaya! Loved it!

We knew we had to try this place as it was talked about by a lot of people.  We got nervous when we saw the line outside to get in but rest assured, they moved that line very quickly!

Once inside, we were seated and looked over their massive menu items. The ambiance is your typical seafood house...nothing fancy but a place where you can lick your fingers and hands and not be frowned upon 

We ordered the crab cake appetizers and was wowed. We did have to send the initial ones back because they were a little on the cool side. Our server fixed it right away.

We opted for traditional fried seafood platters and they were really yummy. I wished more seafood restaurants carries Texas Pete hot sauce but hey...when your friend carry packets in her purse, there's no worries
Britta was amazing! Suggested some cocktails and food. Would come again! Clean. Fast service.

Hmmm, came here because we saw a lot of good reviews and a long line outside. It turned out a big disappointment to us. We waited for about 20 mins to get seated. When we got in the restaurant, we saw a bunch of empty tables and they don't take reservations, so I guess it's their strategy to let people wait outside and make them believe that this place is just that good. 

While we were waiting for our food, I could smell the burning oil from fried stuff, I lost my appetite. We ordered half dozen Oceanas famous oysters and taste of New Orleans. Oysters were good, but every single bite, I bit into something hard, I don't know if it's the shell or something, it's just weird. Oysters shouldn't have anything hard like that. Taste of New Orleans consists of crawfish etouffee, jambalaya and rice red beans with smoked sausage. Crawfish etouffee is good, but not as good as other places. Jambalaya is just mediocre. I don't like red beans and sausage so no comment on that. 

We also had to wait for a loooooooong time to get our check. Actually we had to ask for one since they seemed to forget about us. If we didn't have anything else after that, I wouldn't mind the wait, but we had a tour after the meal and had to rush to our meeting point.
Got a Cadillac Margarita made by John. It was very limey!! Not much alcohol. He wasn't very friendly either.
Driving through from Florida to Texas! Stopped here for some amazing food! Worth the stop and delayed arrival home!

This was the first place I tried in New Orleans and they didn't disappoint! Service was great! The staff was extremely friendly and welcoming and our waitress made sure we had everything we needed!The drinks were AMAZING!!! The drink were strong; however the liquor was well disguised! They even  added a little dry ice to every drink for presentation, which i can appreciate as a tourist. I got the seafood platter and although everything was tasty and well seasoned, I expected the portions to be larger for the price. The lighting was dim making it a little difficult to see the menu but the themed decor was nice and very fitting! the restaurant was conveniently right around to corner from bourbon street so after we ate we were able to head straight there without worrying about transportation! I highly recommend taking a lift or Uber to this restaurant!

The raw oysters are big but not that flavorful. But the sauces on the Rockefeller's and the Oceana's famous are insanely delicious!
The blackened bayou duck was succulent as well as the barbecued shrimps.
In the desert section, I had better crème brûlée in the past, but the caramel on top was out of this world. Just perfection.
Great food. Fantastic location. Whitney provided excellent service on the second floor. Coffee Jameson drinks and fried alligator were by far the highlights! Would recommend to a friend.

My thoughts of this place are blah.first time in New Orleans this place came recommend and was very underwhelming. Had the shrimp platter. (Blah) Cajun jambalaya pasta ( sauce blah felt like I woulda crapped my pants). Sent the pasta back and still got charged for it. So just a blah place

Mmmm, if the plates were any smaller for the appetizers, they could have used doll house sizes and really saved.  Look, if you are going to charge those prices for such a small serving, then you should get knocked a bit.....wasn't a good value. The flavor was good on all servings.  Preparation was very average.

On my first trip to New Orleans, this was my first food experience on the recommendation of some of the staff at the hotel I was staying at. It was FANTASTIC.

My friend and I got a Hurricane each (because we had to) which was both lovely and fun. We then got the Gator Tail Bites ($10) which you can get fried or blackened. We opted to get half and half to try both and honestly both were great. We then got the Louisiana Crabmeat Cakes ($14) which were just lovely. Finally, we got Oceana's Famous Oysters ($10.50 for half dozen or $17.50 for a dozen) and they were so delicious. Honestly as I write this I'm salivating, no shame at all. 

Apart from the frankly beyond fantastic food, the server was AMAZING! I'm sad to say that I can't remember her name but oh my goodness was she great. She went above and beyond, bringing extra bread without asking (the sauce on the oysters deserves extra bread), and bringing maraschino cherries to us when she apparently saw me struggling to get mine out of my drink. 

This place, between the food and the service, is 5 out of 5 would recommend. Honestly, it's more than 5 but that's all Yelp will let me give, for shame.
Come hungry and prepare to have your tastebuds satisfied.  Great ambiance,  great services and AMAZING food! I've come here everytime I'm in NOLA and have never been disappointed.

Everything is great. 

Had the crab cakes and oysters for our Appetizers. 

Taste of New Orleans for the main and Cream brûlée's for desert everything was perfect can't wait to come back.

Very big and spacious inside. We had a party of 13 and were able to get seated immediately upstairs. I got the shrimp Alfredo. It was good but nothing amazing or anything that stands out. I ordered a hamburger for my daughter off the kids menu and it came out still pink on the inside so I had to send it back. My husband got the fried seafood platter. Again, mediocre and nothing special though the hush puppies were pretty dry and lacked flavor. I checked in on yelp and received 10% off my bill.

There's a line out the door if you don't make reservations but it moves quickly! Very friendly staff and great food. The alligator was delicious along with the chicken/sausage gumbo & blackened chicken po' boy. A must try.

This place is amazing with enormous portions and priced right for breakfast. A true taste of NOLA and our waitress Whitney took great care of us! We came in for breakfast and are leaving a little heavier than when we came in. Priced and spiced right.
Food is great, drinks even better. Ambiance is perfectly new orleans-esque. Line outside appears long but management is great about keeping it moving without making you feel rushed as you eat.

This place is an absolute must when you are in the French Quarter!! The oysters are amazing, the blackened duck is delicious. Best fettucini alfredo and jambalaya ever!! The hurricanes and rainstorm drinks are wonderdul. Vonveniently located off Bourbon st. And Conti st. This is easy to get to. They serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner. They are also open late. Be prepared to wait in line to get in, but it moves fast and is soo worth it!!

I am here in New Orleans on business and I travel frequently and therefore eat out regularly.  I searched around for a restaurant that offered vegetables for an appetizer or side dish.  Many restaurants offered an abundance of seafood as you would expect but no vegetables.  I just do not feel right unless I have a serving of vegetables with my meal.  Oceana Grill offered vegetables as a side dish and a choice of two salads as an appetizer.  They were a solid four stars and away I went.

I walked there so that I could get a little exercise (just a little - 0.2 miles) and enjoy the sights and vibe in the French Quarter.  I admit that I walked by the restaurant twice because of the minimalistic sign.  I got there around 5pm and had no trouble being seated.  Instead of a table, I chose the bar since I was solo.  The bar staff were very friendly and engaging, but not so much that they were annoying.  The restaurant was clean but could use a little updating.  I noticed that the kitchen was open for viewing and mentioned to the bar staff that a kitchen side bar would do well since everyone seems to be into food these days.  I would have mentioned it to the manager but that would have taken more effort to locate them.

I ordered a beer and looked over the menu.  It was slightly different than their website with a couple of dishes removed.  I ordered the alligator tail bites appetizer and made a special request to have them split between the two available ordering options - blackened and fried.  That was no issue at all, thankfully.  Both versions were delicious, and the accompanied remoulade sauce was very nice. 

I am normally a decent eater but for some odd reason, I was full.  I had sushi for brunch earlier in the day and had no idea why I felt satisfied.  I was waffling between the Caesar salad with something blackened or the fried catfish with vegetables and Jambalaya.  I waited to regain my appetite but after ten minutes, nothing.

In summation, I would recommend Oceana Grill.  The next time I am in the Big Easy, I will try it again and hopefully make it past the appetizer.
Another staple in my visits to NOLA. I love the Cajun pasta and my fiancé always orders the seafood platter.

Was looking for a seafood place that is open past 10PM and stumbled upon Oceana Grill.

I was surprise how big this restaurant is! Ambiance is nice and chill.

We ordered fried eggplant, never knew eggplant could taste this good, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside! Also ordered Oyster Rockefeller and it was delicious!

For main, I had Taste of New Orleans, red bean and rice was amazing, with smoky ham taste, etouffee was good and jambalaya was slightly spicy but really good too.

Service was great, very friendly.

First time being here, location is in the French quarter and it closes at 1am. I ordered the crab cakes and BBQ shrimp,both appetizers. The crab cakes were very good , the menu says it's a popular appetizer, would definitely recommend those. The bbq shrimp were good also!
The seafood gumbo was great & the Taste of New Orleans was AMAZING!  Loved having Tony's on the table

Went to Oceana after reading reviews and it didn't disappoint!!  We had crab cakes which were pretty good but the real stars of the show were our entrees.  We got the special which was some type of red fish blackened with a crawfish and shrimp sauce over dressing and a side of fried corn which was delicious and the cajun jambalaya pasta which was equally as good.  Our waitress Jessica was prompt, knowledgeable about the menu, and provided excellent service.  Also appears the oysters were the hot ticket item as we were seated near the oyster bar/grill and they were constantly serving orders while we were there.  We will definitely add this place to the list of "go to's" when in NOLA!!  Be sure to give them a try.  The line was long to get in but it moved fast and was worth the wait!!
Food was amazing had a lot of flavor. Good customer service John was an amazing waiter and gave great service. Food came out very quick and hot.

This place was amazing.  The staff was the epitome of Southern Hospitality.  Jerry was particularly attentive and made wonderful suggestions.  The hostesses that seated us Dahjah (or a similar spelling) and another young lady had positive attitudes and were extremely accommodating.  

Now for the food:  EVERYTHING was delicious.  Best gumbo, etoufee, fish and crab cakes in the area.  The drinks were on point too.  The breakfast is also good.  We went 4 times.  *Save your receipt for the 10% discount the following meal.

Awesome service and fantastic food!  If you are looking for a genuine restaurant to try in New Orleans, these people are great. (If you look at my history, you will see that I don't easily give five stars.) They went out of their way to accommodate everyone at our meal.
