The server without asking even brought a sample of beer to make sure it was the type we were looking to order.  They even went the extra mile to make adjustments to a bill later. Bravo!

Blaaaah. 

Eggplant sticks as an appetizer were interesting and quite good. 

Ribeye entree and vegetarian pasta = blah.  The vegetarian pasta was  a handful of noodles in a sea of sauce (good sauce, though) with an itsy-bitsy teeny weeny amount of vegetables and nasty, nasty bread.  Like, 10 times more vegetables would have been an acceptable amount for "vegetable pasta".  Boo. The ribeye was okay, but served on a sad little plate with sad little sides that was nowhere near worth the $23 they charge.  We got the pecan pie to go and it was equally disappointing.  It's a Southern dish, right?  Then why was this pie the saddest pecan pie I've ever seen?  It was one single, sparsely laid layer of pecans over a giant portion of pecan pie group, and the whipped cream had no flavor.

Not worth it.  So not worth it.

When I tell you we came here every night for dinner while here on spring break, I mean it. We literally tried the entire menu and it was all FANTASTIC!! From the food, to the beautiful courtyard, to the bubbling drinks, to the friendly service, we couldn't not go back! My favorites were the Poboy, gumbo and the special fries AND don't forget that bread pudding, I died and came back to life! You have to go, no room for discussion.

Wonderful food and ambiance! We sat outside and the atmosphere and service were great. Our server, Erica, was fantastic. The food was as advertised -- delicious! Waited in line maybe 15 minutes and totally worth it.
Best meal yet in New Orleans. Jamal was an AMAZING server. Honestly too notch. Rarely do you find suck an attentive server.
Just don't.  The fried seafood is always oily, salty, and cold!  If you are a local, you will hate it!  If you are visiting, there are much better choices.
Amazing food great service from Megan!  Will so be back!!we travel all over and often and this place is in the top5.  Thank you Megan for making the experience awesome

This place had the best charbroiled oysters I've ever tasted! The wait wasn't long considering the Essence festival going on. I also tried duck for the first time here and let's just say I'll only eat it again at Oceana with extra crawfish gravy.

This place has great food and even greater hospitality! Lavern was our server and she was absolutely amazing! Anything we wanted she made it happen! If you don't like how something came out or want a change or any kind, she didn't hesitate one bit to make it PERFECT for us. I'm from New York and I've never in my life seen hospitality like this. Literally makes me want to eat here every day knowing I'm going to leave completely satisfied. God bless these employees!!

The gator bites were
Phenomenal!
Came here while on vacation. Highly disappointed.  The fish was bland; no seasoning at all and the red beans and rice taste like Popeye's.
Great food ! And Errol was great. He Sounds like the heart of New Orleans !!! Great visit!!!
We had such a great time at this restaurant! Such delicious food plus the location is awesome. Highly recommend.

Food was good but service was AMAZING!!! David was our server and he was on point. Knowledgeable of their menu and very attentive. I ordered the chicken po-boy and felt it could have used more toppings on it. The French fries rocked though.
The food was alright. Noting I'd write home about. The oysters were over cooked. The service was great though.

Came here after it being highly recommended by a friend and let me just say this place was everything they said it would be and more! The hurricane was super strong and freshly made (unlike the most of the other places that have their drinks premixed). The oysters were the best I have ever had and even my boyfriend, who usually doesn't like oysters, couldn't help but snag a few. Eddie, our server was very nice and made sure my birthday dinner was perfect. We will be back!

Use to be an amazing place. Gave it three tries as the quality was going down and the prices were going up. Last order was charbroiled oysters. That weren't grilled at all. They were boiled in the crawfish cream sauce that poured into the oyster shells which I later found out from a discreet well trusted source that they wash and reuse after the they collect the plates. Pass.

Dinner was good, we went with a couple friend who was not so lucky with their menu choice. We had the crawfish, shrimp fettuccini and I thought it was fantastic. Our friends, for some reason ordered the steak. This was not so good. Steak was thin, fatty, and not cooked like we asked. They were too nice to complain so they left hungry. The wait staff was average at best. Lots of seating and fair prices. If you go, get the seafood...
Oceana was great the crab cakes were to die for ! Also the serves Pamela gave us was marvelous  !! Definitely coming back!

Probably the least bland food/least tourist-trappy restaurant in the French Quarter. Quite tasty food and I had my first encounter with alligator sausage, which is one of my new favorites! My brother really liked his fried oyster poboy, and I had jambalaya which was spicy and had lots of SAUSAGE :) Recommended to my by the bellboy at my hotel and I'm glad he did!

Great food and amazing service! We ordered the the seafood platter, and the taste of new orleans platter, with a side of fried crawfish tails and the big banana drink. Everything was amazing! I ate till I felt like I was going to pop and then I ate more because it was that good. I wish I was going to be in town a few more days just so I could eat here again. Highly recommend this place to anyone that is looking for some tasty cajun/creole food.

Love the food and the atmosphere!. The staff was incredibly friendly and polite. The oysters were delicious. I had the red fish special and it was SO GOOD!! My son liked his knife and fork ribs, but said they could have gone lighter on the sauce. 
I enjoyed the entire dining experience!
Right in the heart of the French quarter. The food was awesome! Fun, yet loud vibe. Highly Recommend!

We had JUST arrived to French Quarter from airport and very hungry. Our driver, Guillermo, recommended Oceana. We quickly dropped off our luggage and headed straight there. Man oh man their Gumbo, Oysters and Bloody Mary/Mimosa's were AMAZING. Hit the spot to start our excursions. But if anyone ever gets their Oceana Secret Sauce please send me recipe - they were not giving it up! HIGHLY RECOMMEND! ;)

I've been to New Orleans twice and both times I've dined at Oceana Grill. Both occasions the wait staff were friendly, attentive and ready to answer any questions about the menu or offer suggestions.  This time we tried the Gator Tail Bites and they were very good - but I confess  it tasted like chicken. When the waiter asked how I liked it and told him, he laughed and felt like alligator tasted like chicken, too. We also ordered "The Taste of New Orleans" with samples of Creole jambalaya, crawfish etouffee, red beans and rice with smoked sausage; all for the reasonable price of $16. It was all delicious and very filling, especially washing it down with one of the local beers like the Abita Andy Gator or Nola Amber.  Oceana Grill is a good choice to start your New Orleans experience - give them a try!

I highly recommend the Shrimp po boy and the crab cakes! The food was great and the service was expedient! Our server Chris M was friendly and provided outstanding southern hospitality!!! I would take a pic of the good but I ate it too fast.

This place was so good ..gumbo was the bomb...I order the Cajun jambalaya pasta with shrimp ..so damn bomb my wife order redfish oceana that was so good I ate half her food ...I would recommend this place to anyone a must try spot ...thank you for not letting me leave back to az thinking no good food in new Orleans. ......

I stopped into Oceana for a late night bite to eat. I ordered a shrimp po boy and fries. The food came out relatively quickly and service was okay. The food itself was pretty average. I have had better sandwiches in less expensive places. People always say you have to go to Oceana if you come to New Orleans, I say you can save your money and go some place else and still get an authentic New Orleans seafood experience.

A good choice in NOLA. By all the reviews we were hoping for better. The ambience is awesome. The food is good. The service was okay (he was very helpful with the menu and very friendly), but there was just something missing.
So nice I went twice! Try the gumbo and the blackened duck, definitely one of the best dishes I've ever had. Service was amazing as well.

We originally stopped here on the Taste of Nawlins Tour and enjoyed the gumbo, so we returned the next night.  We arrived around 8:30 pm and there was a line of people standing outside waiting to get in.  We got on the line (they did not take names) and were seated within 15 minutes.  It was very busy inside and rather noisy.  There is a courtyard out back with outdoor dining.  We ate there during the tour but it was not available the next night.  The gumbo was again delicious, and we had crab cakes which were very fresh. The hurricane drinks were delicious.  They gave us a 10% discount when we told them we had been on the tour, and we plan on returning on our next visit to the city.

First time in New Orleans, excited about this restaurant since there's a long line. Well, from experienced, long line means great food and reasonable first, but not really. For 2 people I've paid $59.75 not including tip. We got coke, a main dish each and one dessert... That's a lot! Anyway the food is okay, I know other people that makes great jambalaya and shrimp Alfredo.

2,5 stars
We had dinner there and it wasn't as good as much we paid.
The redfish was dry, the BBQ shrimps too much spicy so we didn't feel the taste of the shrimps. Our waitress was kind, but don't think about asking something to the others because they are too "busy" to take care of you.
However The courtyard is a beautiful place!
Go there if you have tried all the other seafood of the French quarter!

Oceana ambiance is nice, very New Orleans. The portions are HUGE, so be careful when ordering an app, the seafood platter is half the size of a table!  Our shrimp po boys were pretty good, not great, too much bread and they use coleslaw instead of lettuce which is a weird choice. Gator bites are ok, fried tons better than grilled, however then it just tastes like chicken. I would give this place a miss if you have limited time in NOLA.

Ordered delivery to my hotel room.  I chose the greek salad with shrimp.  The salad was fresh with a good mix of olives, feta, red onions, peppers. The shrimp was a nicely grilled Cajun rendition in flavor.  
My only gripe was the delivery person apparently did not carry cash and I had a 10 dollar bill.  I didn't want to be a heel and not tip the person for making a late night delivery so I gave her the 10.  So I suggest you choose to pre-tip when you order to avoid this.  I didn't because I do like to tip in cash.

Good tasty food.  Our BnB host recommended it, and we were not dissapointed.  I only wish I could go back so that I could try more of the menu.  The first time we got seated downstairs by the grill.  It seemed divy and cramped.  The second night we got seated upstairs and it was a totally different feel.  The desserts were yummy!!

My brother suggested I eat here when I get to New Orleans. Now I know why. The food is incredibly good. Come hungry.  
Bradley was the bartender that night and he suggested the special. I got grilled redfish over a cornbread-jalapeño pudding. Topped with shrimp and their sauce. I would eat here every night while in town.  Thanks Bradley.

RAT ATTACK! 

"Is that a puppy!!?" -- is all I heard as a big azz rat came racing towards me at Oceana Grill! Our group was trampled. 

A friend had just paid for her meal and requested a refund a few minutes later. And again, ANOTHER RAT!!!

WTF!!! 

It's a FOREVER NO!

Our Uber driver suggested this place and I am so thankful that he did! It was our last meal in New Orleans so we all said we were going to order tradition New Orleans food. It did not disappoint at all. I started out with a cup of seafood gumbo that was amazing. Next was the taste of New Orleans that came with a seafood jambalaya, red beans and sausage then a third seafood gumbo of some type. All three of them were absolutely fantastic. It all tasted so authentic and it was such a perfect last New Orleans meal. We also sat on the patio and it was a great atmosphere with wonderful surface!

Thank goodness Oceana Grill is open late! Our flight landed at 10PM, and not many restaurants were open by the time we arrived at the French Quarter. 

Because it was late, we did not order too much food. We ordered the Lafouche special which consisted of Andouille Jambalaya, Blackened catfish, collared greens, and fried crawfish tails. This dish was delicious. The catfish was so moist and perfectly seasoned. The crawfish tails were nicely fried and added a nice touch to the dish. The greens were also tasty and was a nice balance to the fish. 

We also order the Greek Salad with grilled cajun shrimp. The shrimp was very fresh and I loved it. The salad was just normal, but the shrimp was a nice touch! 

Great place to grab a bit late at night or at any time really. It is located conveniently by Bourbon Street! Lovely!

First, TIM, you're awesome. 
2nd THE FOOD,  is awesome. 
We tried the gator bites. They're fried well. 
I had the special,  catfish, cornbread stuffing,  crawfish etouffee. So damn good.  

The line outside went quickly and it was well worth the wait.

Oceana was the perfect place to start off my New Orleans eating adventure. I was so excited to try the local food, and Oceana truly delivered. I got the fried catfish po'boy and my boyfriend got the shrimp fettuccini. We also shared the alligator bites appetizer, half fried half blacked. It was all so delicious and I was especially pleasantly surprised by the alligator! Tasted like chicken but better. Service was a bit slow but definitely worth every second waiting. No wait for a table which is awesome because crazy-long waits are common in NOLA. Prices are doable. Make Oceana a stop on your trip for sure!!!

They take reservations! Make one and bypass the huge line. We went to an upscale place for brunch this morning and were treated like an inconvenience. We went here for dinner tonight and literally every employee greeted us and thanked us for being there. Every single person on our way in and out (and there were many).  Our server was Mary L., and she was great. Funny, attentive, and knew the menu well. 

I was surprised with the high quality of the food as it is a big, busy place. I had the blackened duck and it was outstanding! Others had blackened reddish etoufee, a salad with blackened shrimp, crab cakes and ribs. The bread pudding and the creek brûlée were both outstanding, so save room for dessert! 

Kudos to the staff for a job well done.
Great food. It's amazing to watch them cook the Oysters. too. I tried the alligator bites...awesome

For being so close to Bourbon St. this place was actually quiet and enjoyable. Grilled red fish was great. Potatoes and greens were very good. Pecan pie was good but better in Texas (sorry guys). Service was great as well. Just a little dark in the place.

Made a reservation days in advance, still had to wait over 30 minutes. Ridiculous. The food wasn't even that good. I would trust this business to follow through with a reservation, and look at another restaurant in the area

My wife and I have tried to find something that we don't like about Oceana's, but we could not. The food is excellent and the staff is too notch! This is one of the places on our short list of must eat restaurants in NOLA. I would recommend any of the dishes on the menu as they are all exquisite.

Our server Jacob was the best of the best. He was attentive and incredibly nice. He gave advice on what was the best to eat on the menu (the crab cakes were amazing) and afterwards gave us advice on where to visit while in NoLa. He told us to visit City Park and told us where to go in the park and how to catch the trolley, since us out of towners did not know. The food was delicious but the service is what would make me come back to Oceana as well as recommend it to others!
amazing!! minimal wait time for lunch! food is very good- we had the fried fish platter, the blackened catfish dinner, and the crawfish étouffée! all very great!!

Very good food here with a fun atmosphere. I got the fried shrimp platter and my friend got the creole pasta. Both were hot and tasty. Had to wait a while in the line and there was a bit of confusion about whether the host was taking names for seating. Other than that, a fun experience.

The locals all told us that this is one of the best places to eat and they were right! Staff is awesome and food is even better. Get the Jambalaya!!! AMAZING! Thanks for all of the great local tips Errol. ;)

Whitney was super nice and helpful. This place is spacious and the food is great.

I ate gator and crawfish for the first time. Noth were made and seasoned perfectly.

Great food and environment!!! The food was really good and came out in a timely fashion. Our waitress, Whitney, was very sweet and accommodating. This is our 3rd time eating here during our trip!!!! Don't forget to get to get a drink!!!!!
Loved this place! We had the crab cake appetizer, Cajun pasta & grilled fish. It was so great we went back the next day for lunch!!
What a great breakfast and bloody Mary.  Went with the royal omelet which was phenomenal.  Brandi was a great bartender and took great care of me

This place was great, the food was all around amazing! But I would highly recommend the New Orleans sampler, this dish offered a little taste of everything that is New Orleans style food. The wait staff is also very helpful and prompt which is nice too.

While riding in a Lyft from the airport to our hotel, our driver gave us some restaurant recommendations in the French quarter. We were set on eating some seafood so we were told Acme Oyster House and Oceana are solid choices for a wide menu variety. I had heard of Acme Oyster House, but the wait time was outrageous at 530pm. We didnt have time to wait over an hour as we had a ghost tour scheduled for 7pm. We decided to venture over to Oceana and although there was a long line, once we got to the hostess and informed her that we just needed a table for two, she got us seated quickly.  My wife ordered the staple shrimp po'boy, while I opted for the fried seafood platter. As an appetizer, we ordered fried gator. We realized this was a lot of food...particularly fried food. We definitely weren't able to finish it all, so we just packed it up. Everything was well seasoned, not too salty or overpowering with spices. The service was very good as well. Would definitely recommend to spot to anybody looking for a nice meal in the French Quarter.

The food was delicious. The seafood was very fresh. The tartar sauce and the cocktail sauce was a little dry, like it was sitting out. 
The service was great!
Thank you for making my husband's birthday dinner great!

Darrick and Mary took great care to recommend fabulous dining options. I am gluten intolerant and they helped me find absolutely delicious appetizers, entries and dessert. Great service food and atmosphere.

WOW!! Amazing to say the least.  Went to Creole House yesterday looking for a dish full of flavor at a reasonable price and was disappointed. Tonight at Oceana has fulfilled my desires and under the price I paid the night before!! Must visit!!

Had a great dinner here.  Sierra was our server, was very pleasant and informative. Had the Oceana oysters and there steak that was on the special tonight. The Margaritas also came out perfect.  Great first meal in Nee Orleans!!

I am in New Orleans for business with coworkers and my husband and really wanted to find a good authentic place for dinner after traveling all day.  I checked Yelp and quickly saw this restaurant and how many reviews it had with a almost 5 star rating.  We walked to the restaurant from our hotel Drury Inn and and was only a little uncomfortable because of the heat.  The first thing noticeable is the building which is I think 4-5 stories high with dining on each level.  Very very cool place!  I felt like I was getting a tourist visit and dinner in one.  The food was hot and amazing!  Very authentic New Orleans food which is what we wanted and it was delicious!  The only reason why I'm giving it a 4 star is because I order sautéd onions on my salad but it did not come out with my food.  I waited for about 5 mins to finally grab the waitress and told her.  She apologized and said she would get it.  I ate the salad and then she came back after another 5-10 min and said oh it never came out and indicated it was still coming.  I said no but I hope it's not on my check.  Well she assumed I didn't want it anymore and gave us our checks.  Not that big of a deal but not the best service.
The food was good, and the service was great,but midway between our dinner a rat ran across the top of the ceiling pipes towards the back kitchen
The best meal I had while visiting Nola. Staff was great, food was amazing and the drinks were perfect. I look forward to returning.

Excellent food and outstanding service.  Mary was very personable andcattentive vfc to our needs without ever once interrupting.  She sets the bar for service we expect and rarely get at other places.   The food was equally well prepared.  Very tasty. Highly recommended.

This restaurant was recommended to us so my husband could have his crawfish etouffee.  Let me say we read the reviews online, and were a little worried after we heard that it had been featured on Kitchen Nightmares with Gordan Ramsey.  We decided to go anyway, and regret it for sure.  My husband had the etouffee, and I had a steak with jambalaya and vegetables.  My husband also ordered the chargrilled oysters.  They arrived smothered with alfredo sauce, and were barely room temperature.  The bread was soggy and had to be eaten with a fork because it had so much sauce on it.  My steak was like leather, and was chewy.  The jambalaya tasted like it came out of a box mix i could buy at home.  The vegetables were limp, and tasted like they had been sitting in a warming tray for a while.  My husbands etouffee was quite a disappointment.   It was basically gumbo with a small portion of rice on top.  Definitely not the way we have had it in the past.  We paid $80 for this meal, and it wasn't worth it at all.  After we left, we walked around and went to Acme Oyster House, so we could have chargrilled oysters done the right way and to end our trip to New Orleans with a good taste in our mouths as opposed to the horrible one we had eating at Oceana Grill.

Idk what the hype is for

Def way better spots
This was sub par
Mediocre 

Got blacked catfish and just ok

I had other food I don't like and actually liked bc it was so good and this wasn't the spot for that

My husband and I ate here our last night to celebrate my birthday and our 5 year wedding anniversary. When we arrived, there was a line out of the door which moved fairly quickly (we waited 20 minutes tops around 5:30pm. When we left around 6:30, there was a short wait as well). Our waiter Milton was phenomenal and provided some good advice on what to get! We settled for the crab cakes as an appetizer (very delicious and big enough to be a meal in itself) and I got the Road to Bourbon Margarita (also very delicious). My husband and i split a fried seafood platter which was more than plenty for 2 people with some left over. We got a slice of strawberry cheesecake to go which was also very good. This is a must eat when you come to New Orleans as it is delicious, reasonably priced and staffed with super friendly people!!

My husband and I LOVE to go to restaurants that were highlighted on Gordon Ramsey's Kitchen Nightmares.  We think it is awesome fun to see if the changes he made stayed implemented or if the restaurant has gotten better or swerved downhill.

We were New Orleans back in October of 2014 and decided to take advantage of being close to Oceana, which was featured on Season 4 of Kitchen Nightmares.  Understandably, I was a bit put off, because this one was one of the worst episodes I recall watching with a disgusting kitchen, a rat problem (like many of the restaurants in the Quarter, being so close to the Gulf, it's a real issue) and of course, one of the first to make the notorious Brit throw his guts up.  It should have been a warning to us to stay the hell away.  However, when our key card to our hotel room at the Inn on St. Peters featured this restaurant on it, we said, what the hell...let's do it.

So glad we did.  The changes made to restaurants decor stayed exactly as they had been at the end of the show.  It was absolutely beautiful and clean.  Even the ladies room was immaculate.  

We ordered drinks.  My husband got a "Greyhound" and I had a Lemon Drop martini.  They were absolutely delicious, decently priced and served in large glasses.  For our appetizer, we ordered the Oyster's Rockerfeller and without a doubt, they were the BEST OR's I have ever eaten in my life.  So good in fact, that I ordered them again as my main course!  They are competitively priced based on the area and season at $10.50 for a half dozen and $17.50 for a dozen.  I don't know what the sauce was that was on it, but I could have had it in a bowl as a soup, it was that good.  My husband had the Praline Duck which he described as "Delicious" (as food was hanging from his mouth, mind you).  This was a slow simmered praline and rum sauce over the duck with a side of fresh steamed vegetables and roasted garlic potatoes.  

Also had a side of crawfish tails ($5.00) to pick on while waiting on the food.  The food wait time was scarcely 15 minutes.  Dessert for hubs was the bananas foster cake which smelled incredible.  I had a creme brulee that brought tears to my eyes, it was so fabulous. ($5.00 each)

The place was packed, but everyone looked happy and the place smelled fantastic.  There was a real sense of NOLA fun here, the wait staff was very attentive and super friendly.  The patrons were all talking with each other at various tables.  It was just a really fun atmosphere.  Yes, they were giving out cards for a YELP review and to mention your servers name, but it was for a sweepstakes for the STAFF...not a free drink for the customers "bribing" them for good reviews, so whoever wrote that is full of it.  So, thank you, Earl, for making us have a great experience.

Side note:  I am DEATHLY allergic to nuts. All kinds of nuts.  Walnuts, Pralines, Peanuts, Almonds, Cashews, etc.  The staff members all gathered around me, including the chef and managers to make sure they all talked about NO cross contamination, make my food away from other foods and a clean cutting board and using fresh utensils for cutting and carving.  One even mentioned that they have an EPI pen in their first aid kit in case I didn't have one.  I am always super impressed with a restaurant that knows how serious food allergies can be.  They took it very seriously and made me feel super comfortable.

So congrats, Chef Ramsey!  Oceana continues to be one of your best success stories in the French Quarter.

PS?  They DELIVER anywhere in the Quarter!

Visited New Orleans for a quick weds-sat visit celebrating my brother in laws 60th birthday.On our final morning we ate breakfast at Oceana Grill and were delighted with the quality of food and the OUTSTANDING service and professionalism of our server ,Errol.We ate the omelettes and the french toast with sides of bacon and ham, all were delicious.As good as the food was, we were privileged to have Errol sing to us with his wonderful deep (bass /baritone) voice. I would surely recommend Oceana Grill .

First recommendation, make reservations ahead of time.  This is a good tip wherever you decide to eat in NOLA.  
Second, this was a wedding event.  Which means we had a select menu to choose from that was decided in advance.  BUT if the food from the "wedding" menu is anything like ordering from the regular nightly menu, awesome!  I had the opportunity to eat the crawfish pasta as well as the crab cakes.  Both were excellent.  In house made bread pudding, awesome!  Seafood gumbo was also great.  
Within walking distance anywhere you stay in the French Quarter.
CJ is a great server with a fabulous sense of humor.
We had lunch here. The food was great. We had the blackened catfish. Our server Jamal was wonderful. He was very attentive and check in on us during our meal. I wish every server was like Jamal.

Y'all.....this was the best meal I have ever eaten. E.V.E.R. Get the Redfish Tchoupitoulas. It's not on the menu because it's a special. We had a party of 7. Got in and out, our waitress was great and the food was great. Did I mention that the food was great?!?
Great food and atmosphere! Recommend the oyster Rockefeller! I also had the red fish special and it was delicious! I would make a reservation ahead of time.
This was recommended to us by a guy at our hotel, and it did not disappoint!  Our favorite meal was the trio with a variety of Cajun dishes on it. The crawfish étouffée was amazing!

I'm from New York and came to NOLA for a much needed vacation. Just tried Oceana and it was amazing. Our waitress Whitney was the best!!! She suggested the half fried half grilled alligator!!! AMAZING!!!! 
Best waitress I've experienced since visiting here.

Stopped in here for lunch with my friends the other day and were blown away by the food and the service! Whitney was an amazing waitress and was very friendly and helpful. Also the food was to DIE for. I had fried gator for the first time in my life and it was so good I'm gonna have to go back. The cat fish was so fresh and filling. The portions were big and the food was great!!

This seemed to be one of the few "touristy" spots that will take a reservation...we were so glad we did as we saw every other recommended restaurant had lines out the door and around the block!  We were a bit early but got to bypass the long line and got sat upon arrival. This place is huge and has a very cool vibe. Service was just ok.  Food was good - we ordered their famous crab cake for an appetizer.... loaded with crab, crunchy on the outside and smothered in that mushroom deliciousness.  We also ordered the Redfish Oceana, Crawfish Ettoufee and BBQ shrimp.  The Redfish was amazing - came with mashed potatoes and greens. The Ettoufee - was really impressed with how much Crawfish it had - amazing flavor.  BBQ shrimp - wasn't our fave.

The servers are very welcoming. Almost like coming to a family luncheon at home. Our server was very attentive and she seem like she could handle a lot on her own. The Cajun fries were so good! Especially with alligator. Trust me, you want to get the alligator. 

Their jambalaya pasta reminds me a lot like the New Orleans pasta from cheddars but only better of course. 


Honestly, the portions were pretty good to the point it was better to be shared between two people. 

It does get crowded at times, I mean it's near bourbon street. Kind of expected.
Recommended by more than one local...we were not disappointed. The service was great and the food was very good. Definitely a place to return during our next visit.

I heard such raves about this restaurant, and having grown up near the Chesapeake Bay I was looking forward to fresh seafood.  Now I have to say the crab cake appetizer was really, really good. I ordered the combo plate of fried shrimp, oysters, and catfish.  The catfish tasted fresh and was delicious!  The oysters had a strange taste so I sent them back.  The shrimp tasted like they were frozen previously and had that pre-frozen consistency as well.  I don't know if they were thawed out, but it seemed that way.  Maybe I went on an off night?

Left is half and half Fried Crawfish and Fried Shrimp. Right is a CUP (not bowl) of seafood gumbo. Shrimp is a battered a little too thick. Crawfish were good. Catfish (which my wife had), not pictured, would've been better had it been battered in cornmeal, but a decent flavor. Gumbo was good. My wife would give it on two stars if she were on Yelp. Not worth the hype it gets.
Aaaamazing!!! Beautiful Interior! Drinks are bomb! Food is out of this world. Service is excellent! Servers are kind and welcoming !!! Thank you Oceana !

This has to be my FAVORITE place to get Chicken Alfredo! The wait time was short but The place is live with music, history and good smells! Our waiter was very fast and friendly. I would come back here again!

Some restaurants in the area take advantage of the tourists. Some do not. It's the circle of life. From the day we arrive on the planet and blinking step into the sun there is more to see than can ever be seen, more to do than can ever be done.

And I don't think I'm really trying to say that Oceana is necessarily "taking advantage" of tourists in any sort of devious way. More so that it's about on par with going to Florida on vacation and wanting seafood so you go to Bubba Gump. It's about in the Bubba Gump league.

I don't really have anything to come down on this place for other than its middle-of-the-road level of cuisine. Service wasn't bad. A few hiccups here and there but nothing where I felt they were doing a bad job or being lazy.

Comparing the crawfish etouffee to Royal House was pretty damning, as here the dish had plenty of seasoning and no real flavor, if that makes any sense.

Tried the blackened alligator here, as I wanted to eat as many different types of alligator as I could before I left. It was fine, tasted like chicken. And they do mean blackened by the way, it's not just lightly grilled.

My main entree was the fried seafood platter. Plenty of food, but I'm not really sure if I could say it was a worthy dish. It all tastes fine but towards the end you start to realize how much grease you must have consumed. Also those oysters, man, if you aren't big on oysters there is apparently little that can be done to salvage that.

It feels like a chain, even if it isn't a chain. It feels so branded that it sort of finishes any hopes at atmosphere and the food itself, regardless of how freshly made it is, suffers by giving a reflection of being processed.

For a place that's has really good reviews we were really disappointed. The seafood platters was not made to order(basically hot) When we asked for a manager the manager tammie was not apologetic at all & even informed we could not take the Cajun fries off as if we asked. We only asked for the seafood platter to be taken off because it was NOT fresh & hardddddd. Would not recommend moving forward.
Very good food and excellent customer service! Love the outdoor patio area! Red beans and rice was great. Shrimp excellent as well.

Absolutely loved it! I had swamp tea and it was awesome, and bubbled like the swamp. We also got their oysters, yummy! For dinner we both got versions of the redfish. Mine was the nightly special and it was so good! The bread pudding was also delicious!

We were here on 5/17 for my sister's wedding reception.  This was the best food that I have ever had at a wedding!  Great waitstaff, clean restaurant with lots of decor, and a very strong wait and bar staff!  I cannot wait to return!
Many people recommended it and the food was pretty good. The waiter was also great. We ate the cajun fries, bbq shrimp, and crawfish etouffee.

Great place for a good meal at a good price.  We split the seafood platter, and it was more than we could eat.   The shrimp, catfish and oysters were great, not too much breading.  If we return, well be eating there again.  Get there early, because by seven there's a line out the door and up the block waiting for a table.

One of the cleanest restaurants in NOLA. The special was blackened redfish and it was amazing. Our server Whitney was spot on. All of the staff worked as a team to make your dining experiance pleasurable. One of the managers even helped clear the table.

I was expecting a really great meal. It was just ok. We had the crab cakes and it was more cake than crab with a mushroom crawfish sauce over them. Was not impressed. We also had the BBQ shrimp. Again just ok. Mr. B' bistro blows these shrimp away. We had the chargrilled oysters and they were again....just ok. The Cajun fries were my favorite thing to eat. I will say the Bloody Mary was one of the best I've had in the city. I was expecting a flavor explosion in my mouth and I a food orgasm. I got neither.

Came to the Oceana Grill for dinner with the wife on a Monday evening. This was one of the places a coworker had recommended I try while in New Orleans. We got to the restaurant around 6 pm before heading out for an 8 pm touThere was no line at the door and we were seated promptly on the second floor of the restaurant. We were tucked away in a side room with a few other people, which was nice because it wasn't so loud. Our waitress, Breeann, was great! Since I had already sampled po-boys  at a couple of other restaurants, I decided to try the Taste of New Orleans. It included red beans and rice, jambalaya, and crawfish etouffee. I had a couple of big easy IPAs to go with my meal. Everything tasted fantastic, and I wish I could have had seconds! I also tried some of my wife's fries and they were bad ass too! Plus, we got 10% off thanks to Yelp! I would definitely recommend this place, you should give it a try.
Phenomenal food and great staff. Easy walk if you stay in the French quarter. We had the Duck and blackened steak which was 2nd to none!!

Omg I went here for breakfast during Essence Festival weekend and it was amazing. So obviously I was searching on Yelp for a good place that served grits and this restaurant popped up first. I saw it opened at 10, so we got there around 10. We were seated quickly. The atmosphere was great. The music was played at a decent volume so we didn't have to scream as we talked. The waitress name was Javon. Purely coincidence lol. But we all laughed. She took our orders and the food came out approx 7min later. The place was getting more and more packed the longer we sat there. Javon was ok except she never brought us water to the table and I noticed the other table had water immediately. 
But overall, the service was good not great, the food was good, and the prices were very affordable. 
I will go back again.
Service was good, great location, average menu w/ good seafood selection. We loved the crab cake app and the blackened salmon.
Food is amazing! Great customer service! Great shrimp poboys with a side of Cajun fries! Taste of New Orleans was also amazing! And the crawfish omelette was good!
My wife and I loved our lunch here.  Harrison was our server and did an outstanding job.  The staff is so friendly.  Keep up the great work!!!

Read reviews about this place, and lines were out the door. Honestly, I don't know what this place has to offer that's so good but I was not impressed at all, maybe it was the food I ordered. 

The gator bites for $10 was decent; I ordered them blackened served with remoulade sauce. The upside is that it was a pretty big portion for an appetizer.

Fried Shrimp Po-Boy for $14 was nothing special and their fries tasted like Checker's fries. The po-boy is topped with coleslaw, tomatoes, pickles, onions, and remoulade sauce. 

Overrated and overpriced; highly recommend to go someplace else if you want to eat some good seafood!
Great friendly staff with a ton of New Orleans specials. Highly recommended.  Come early for breakfast.  Place gets crowded.

Their jambalaya pasta changed my life! So delicious. Their grilled oysters were my fave in all of NOLA. Not overly buttry or salty. My cousin ordered the bbq shrimp....amazing as well. Didnt look as great but had so much flavor. Went back twice for the jambalaya pasta though. Hands down one of my favorite places in NOLA

We had lunch at the Oceana Grill during our stay in New Orleans.  Our waiter John was very attentive and friendly.  I ordered the blackened Gator Po Boy and a cup of the seafood gumbo.  Both were excellent - I can't wait to return and get the same two dishes for lunch again.  This is a must hit spot when you visit NOLA.

Arrived around 4pm during Mardi Gras week.  No waiting.  Ordered the crawfish ettouffee.  Wonderful and priced reasonably.   My tablemate ordered the Louisanna Fried oyster platter.  Loved it. Our waitress gave us outstanding service.

I actually got food from Oceana Grill twice during my stay in New Orleans. The first time, I had a wonderful experience. The host was super friendly and our waiter Derek was absolutely a delight. One of the things I like about this place is the delicious vegetarian options. Being a vegetarian on a trip with friends who are not vegetarians, one of the things I hate doing is having the majority of my friends accomodate to my dietary habits. And of course, knowing Louisiana Creole Cuisine, almost everything contains either seafood or sausage. However, I was pleased to find that their vegetarian cajun stew was delicious. It didn't taste like it was missing anything, it was its own spin on a cajun dish that traditionally has meat in it!

I loved the cajun stew and also the fried eggplant sticks. That was one of the best vegetarian creole dishes I've had. However, the reason why I'm giving this place a 3 star is because of the second time.

Two nights after my first visit, I had already gone back to where I was staying (which was outside the French Quarters) and I did not have car. Since it was late at night, I didn't want to take public transportation or walk around. I decided to use Ubereats to order some food to satisfy some late night cravings. Not many places were open so I decided to just go with Oceana Grill again since I loved the food there so much. I wanted to try the vegetarian pasta there this time and so I put in my order. Once the delivery driver had delivered my meal, I checked the receipt and the food inside the apartment. The receipt clearly says vegetarian pasta" but I received the cajun vegetarian stew in the box. This was no fault of the delivery driver since my receipt clearly indicated that it was rung up correctly. This was clearly a mistake on Oceana Grill's part. Although I was disappointed, I understand that mistakes happen so I called Oceana Grill about the mistake. I didn't expect them to redeliver since it was done through Ubereats, however, I honestly just wanted acknowledgment and a sincere apology for the mix up.

A host answered the phone and when I started talking about the mistake they made, he wanted to transfer me over to someone else. I said 'okay' and waited. I was transferred to speak to someone who is probably a manager and she cut me off again and said to put me on hold. I was put on hold until the phone line actually went out on me because I was waiting for too long. I called back after I was basically hung up on and the person on the other end listened to my complaint this time. HOWEVER, THERE WAS NO APOLOGY WHATSOEVER. I asked if the kitchen had mixed it up and if there is anyway to remedy this. He asked me where I lived and I told him the neighborhood. He replied and said that it was too far for them to deliver the food. Fine, then can I somehow get a discount for the next time I visit? ---I thought that to myself, expecting good customer service. He never apologized once. I had to actually tell him "This is not the uber driver's fault right? It's a kitchen mix up since the receipt says pasta" His exact words are "yeah, our kitchen mixed it up." No 'I'm sorry for the inconvenience' or 'This was a mistake and I do hope you come visit us again'. Nothing. He just said "Yeah you're too far for us to deliver and it probably was the kitchen". I asked if there's a way I can get my money back and he said "Go ask Ubereats." Still no apology. This is absolutely ridiculous. I actually stayed on the ine in silence waiting for just a "I'm sorry" and it never came. 

This was one of the worst customer service I've ever experienced from a restaurant. I had such a good experience the first time and I do admit the stew is delicious but I wanted a pasta pretty badly that night and there was no apology or attempts to remedy the problem. I had to initiate a remedy and still there was no apology or refund or fix. I did end up getting a refund from Ubereats but this isn't even ubereats's fault. This is entirely Oceana Grill's mistake. I don't care that I got the wrong dish, I do care that there was no sincerity and no apology in the mistake. 

Thank you Derek for a great first time visit and the food is absolutely wonderful. I understand that restaurants have mix ups but I do not tolerate bad customer service.
This place is ridiculously good the fried alligator bites are off the chain the po boys are off the chain the red beans and rice will make you slap yo mama

Great place and really loved the valet they provided excellent services.

I had a great cobb salad and my cousin had red beams and rice. Our waitress was personable and accommodating.
T   I   d   rrv2  fr    9dve3   ,,,                ,,away   ,                                             t ,     b  fv  v      v                       ¥0 £^           ,
Was not impressed. Food was fair at best. Service was ok. Was not worth waiting on line. Too many other fabulous places to try.
This restaurant has a pleasant atmosphere, the food is great.  I recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting New Orleans.
Don't be worried about the line.  It moves fast. Plus you can go in and order a drink from the bar and by then you are almost in the door! Service is great and foor was perfect!
Love! Great ambiance and excellent food. A NOLA institution. All the entrees have been great here. Especially try the oysters and Bloody Mary. Best in town.

Very good, clean atmosphere. My Shrimp Po Boy was good, but not great. I didn't feel like the shrimp had a lot of flavor compared to others I'd had around town. All of my party said their food was phenomenal, though. I'd go again.

We got to our hotel late in the evening and wanted to grab something to eat. Everything was pretty much closed but this place thankfully! We got the seafood gumbo, sausage and chicken gumbo and the Cajun jambalaya. They we're kind enough to split the jambalaya before bringing it out which was a nice surprise. The food was pretty good and the portion size was fairly large and we we're happy we split it! The staff was friendly and attentive. We didn't get dessert but saw two and they looked good! Would definitely get one next time!

After walking around the French Quarter we came upon this restaurant, it looked interesting, like many others nearby. The prices seemed reasonable so we decided to try it. We made a great decision. It turned out the atmosphere was great the food was excellent and it was served quickly with no mistakes. Did I say the food was excellent? Well it was and the waitstaff was very engaging. Errol, our waiter was very knowledgeable and entertaining. While there another guest was attempting their Pancake Challenge. That was interesting to watch. Oh and I must mention their Bartender is really good as well as fast. Once seated Errol took our drink orders and was back almost immediately.
I don't think you can go wrong at all by trying this establishment and if you keep your receipt and present it on your next visit you get a discount. Wow!
The food was seasoned hot and fresh when it reached me ...the prices were reasonable and I ate there twice during my stay!!!
Good food really nice informative staff! Nice size portions! Must try the duck. Ariel is amazing shes nice, beautiful and informative.

Came here visiting my friend in New Orleans. Definitely was not disappointed with the food. I had jambalaya pasta and my friend had famous oysters. Amazing!! And Tim our server was exceptionally knowledgeable about the menu and offered us some delicious drinks that came to the table smoking! We will visit here every time we are back in town!
Their shrimp P.O. boy was amazing. I didn't like the desserts much. I had pecan pie and the bread pudding. The shrimp pasta was amazing. Oh man I loved it. Oh the fried oysters, amazing.

Great, fabulous restaurant. We went on a busy Saturday night and waited in line for only about 10 minutes as we were a table of 2 and were seated on the second floor with a window table. We ordered the Taste of New Orleans with Grilled Crawfish and Crawfish Etouffee. The Taste of New Orleans comes with a sampler of creole jambalaya, crawfish etouffee, red beans and a bowl of rice with smoked sausage. These were perfect dishes to have to know what the food experience of Orleans is. Our waiter Tracy was great and very helpful even though she was super busy. We will return the next time we back in NOLA!

I don't know how I have been to New Orleans so many times and missed this place!  I got the crab cakes and famous oysters, both where amazing!  I sat at the bar and had great service.  I'll be back for sure!

The jambalaya is amazing with the bread! We randomly selected this restaurant in the French quarter and the food was great. However I do feel as though the alligator appetizer was too little to share amongst a party of four but it tasted great. I would definitely visit again!

We waited nearly 15 min for anyone to come to our table. We were close to leaving.  Finally our waitress greeted us.  We ordered the tuna with barbecue shrimp, garlic potatoes, "steamed vegetables" (which ended up being turnip greens) and a side of red beans.  The menu had red beans and rice or just a side of red beans.  I just wanted the beans but it came out almost all rice with some beans on top.  The potatoes were good. The tuna was excellent.  We shared the meal and had plenty. Service was ok.  A manager did round by our table- which I appreciate. The rest room was adequately clean. We were seated right by the grill in the kitchen.  The heat from the grill made our table a tad warmer than the rest of the place.  When I checked in on yelp, I got a 10% coupon.

We had a large party of 15 come in to the restaurant and they literally sat us on top of each other. We couldn't even lift our arms up. We requested the manager and asked if we could get another table added so we wouldn't be so close together and they replied no. We then asked could we get the two seater table right next to our table or any other table in the whole restaurant and they still told us no rudely. Restaurant was very unaccommodating. Our family was looking forward to eating at this place, this was our first time in New Orleans and heard some good things at the restaurant. We ended up leaving and having better service AND food at royal house down the street. I hope next time the manager and team has a better attitude towards their guests

4.5 Stars!  To start I got the Gator tail bites. It was my first time eating alligator and it really did taste a bit like chicken. I would recommend getting it half fried and half blackened. For my main I got the taste of New Orleans sampler and it was really good. I would def check this place out if your in NOLA !
Seirra was a great help and the food was AMAZINGshe was a great waitress or host i would recommend this place..

I was here as part of a large group for a banquet. While the food quality was merely average, the service was terrible.

Food appeared on plastic plates, with fake plastic silverware. Several times throughout the dinner service, they ran out of food. Eventually, they stopped bringing ravioli entirely.

They left a television on, interrupting our meal, failed to provide speakers for our audio program and then tried to shake us down for money by calling the cops when we didn't pay their 25% tip. Seriously? 25% tip for a buffet that you barely did any work for?
Alligator tail was good.  I wouldn't get it blackened because because then the meat soggy.  Cheesecake was delicious I got it plain without the strawberry sauce.
This was an amazing place. The Oceana Oysters were soooo amazing. You can never go wrong with eating seafood down south. We will definitely be back here to enjoy other dishes on their menu.

Food was delicious and the service was great. We went there during essence fest, so of course it was a line hanging out the door.. but the wait wasn't long ,only 20minutes.. food was awesome the the eggplant fries were my fave
The food was good. We had oyster on the half shell, taste of New Orleans and gumbo, everything tasted very fresh. The staff was very friendly. Our waiter, Brian was very attentive.
This place is amazing! Great staff great food. I'm definitely coming back the next time I am in New Orleans!
My first po-boy when I touched down. Oyster and shrimp best of both worlds between a bun, and simply lettuce/tomato and their sauce.

I'll be in here twice the last time I came in was when the Saints were playing I had the Ettouffe'  alligator bites and red beans and rice it was way too much food for me I was by myself so I only ate very little of it
I sat by myself at the bar the bartender was really nice it was young girl.
I like the fact that this restaurant happen to stay open later on the weekends because it was hard to find something to eat after the game.
The shrimp poboy and catfish etouffe were to die for and the fries were amazingly crispy. Would definitely recommend!

I got a chance to try Oceana a few months ago while working an event downtown. We ordered to go from the lunch menu and got the fried catfish platter and red beans. I walked down the street and around the corner to pick up and while it wasn't that busy on a Wednesday afternoon I was still left waiting for a bit at the to-go/pickup area. Once I got back to the hotel we got right to the food and I enjoyed the catfish but was disappointed by the read beans. They definitely had a commercial feel but hey I get it. All in all the lunch was decent and I might go back to try a dessert one day.
Bomb.com food is delicious ranges from about $13-$20 great for tourists. Super classy and great service

I was very disappointed with my meal here. I don't understand why there are such long lines for this place. I tried the gator tail bites and also the variety platter with crawfish etouffee, beans and rice, and jambalaya. The gator tail bites just tasted like deep fried pieces of chicken, although I guess I'm not sure what I was expecting. I really disliked the crawfish etouffee because it had a weird taste to it.. almost like of plastic? I'm guessing that the crawfish *might* have been frozen before, because I'm very sensitive to meats that have been frozen. If not, then I don't know why I disliked it so much because I loved all the crawfish I ate at other NOLA restaurants. The jambalaya and the beans and rice were nothing special, but at least it tasted normal to me.

I was in NOLA over Easter weekend (a very busy time), and the hotel I was staying at suggested Oceana-- it did not disappoint.

The food was great, I ordered the Taste of New Orleans-- I would rate it 4 stars, but what made me rate 5 was our waiter, David. He was the epitome of "Souther Hospitality" and knew the menu forward and back, he made the entire experience 10x better.

There was absolutely no wait when I went, but when I passed it the next day and the line was out the door, so choose your timing wisely! It's also an easy walk from anywhere in the French Quarter.

This place is awesome!!! The food was amazing! I had the seafood gumbo and the crawfish etouffee which was seasoned to perfection.  There was a line but it moved pretty quickly - we waited about about thirty minutes. The inside was decorated with typical French, New Orleans style decor and the place is two levels. Nothing fancy but the food was incredible. Everyone in my party enjoyed their meals. I will definitely return.

If you're looking for authentic New Orleans style food, you can find better elsewhere. I've lived in New Orleans for my whole life, so on my visit here I decided to get something a little out of the box. I got the St. James Crepe off of the brunch menu. The crepe that came out was way oversized and undercooked. Very thick and doughy. The contents of the crepe were pretty bland. The waiter also brought out a wrong plate to one person in my party (not a big deal), but just mentioning it.

On the plus side, their famous oysters were pretty tasty. 

Overall, I just think you could find better food in the city, especially for the money.
Absolutely the best restaurant we visited. Food was awesome, cocktails were awesome, and if you have never tried gator Oceana is the place for a first try. Loved it

I can't believe how tasty and delicious our food was. We had Alligator...crawfish...crabcakes...catfish...and greens. Definitely get by here to eat and ask for Chad. He was the best and helpful waiter.  Won't steer you wrong.

Gator gator gator!!! So good! We got the app half and half (blackened and fried). I like fried better!! So much food! We got the seafood platter which was awesome. Also the blackened reddish Étouffée which was ok. Over all great food, great environment
The food is so delicious here, highly recommended! Also, Chris gave us such great service, would definitely come back again!

SKIP THE LINE - MAKE RESERVATION!!! 

Glad I did!! Line will start getting LONG around dinner time (we got there at 7:30 pm)

Everything here was awesome! The food, the drinks, the atmosphere. Everything was very NOLA! 

Food was GREAT! We had Louisiana Crab Meat Cakes, Cajun Jambalaya Pasta, and Redfish Oceana. All YUMMY!! It did take a little while for the food to come out; however, it was totally worth it! 

Another highly recommended spot when you visit NOLA!
We just had appetizers and the crab cakes were flavorful and filling. Service was efficient and very friendly
Meagan L. is an awesome waitress! Great customer service. And also the manager who checked up on all the customers dining in when we were here. Seafood platter is awesome. Great portion!
Great food, my daughter was trying to find a way to go back to New Orleans just to comeback here.

Food is good, drinks are great, service is AMAZING! It's a little pricey and the servings are very large, too large. They do take very good care of their customers though and will tweak menu items for you. 

Have had several of the menu items and haven't had anything yet that wasn't good. You can't go wrong with any of the Cajun dishes.

Went twice in one day! PO Boy was great and their Cajun French fries were Awesome! Dinner was even better.  Both types of Grilled Oysters were Amazing and the Grilled Cajun Bites hit the Spot.  Overall great restaurant and highly recommend if you ever visit New Orleans!

Visiting New Orleans has been great, we stumbled upon Oceana Grill and were not disappointed. The oysters were fresh and meaty and our entrees even better. Our server Mary was very hospitable and gave us great suggestions. Definitely add Oceana Grill to your New Orleans hitlist.

Great food and our waitress MARY was great. Mary made some great recommendations from the gumbo to the fish special, blackened redfish. The food was delicious and the prices were reasonable. The service was great from start to finish. We highly recommend.

I dedicated my energies on my NOLA trip to eating all of the Cajun food and Oceana was the best of all of the restaurants I tried.  I am not a local, nor a connoisseur of Cajun food, but everything that we tried here was excellent.  We started with the Gator Bites, which were served with a spicy remoulade.  The meat was a little chewy, but the sauce was to die for.  Who cares about the meat with sauce like that?  For our main dishes, we had the crawfish etouffé and oyster po boys.  The etouffé was perfectly seasoned, and for such a heavy dish, felt suprisingly light.  The po boys were the best we tried on our trip.  The combination of the fried oysters, crispy bread, and remoulade was delicious.  The service was also excellent and I liked the casual ambience.

Oceana was a little pricier than some of the other places I ate in the Quarter, but I honestly think it was well worth the extra money for the quality.

After getting into town on Sunday my husband and I went there for dinner and the line was so long we decided to wait until Monday and when we went back on Monday the line were still long so I told my husband this food has to be good with all these people standing in line every time you come so we decided to wait and when we did get in  OMG the food was so  good,  we had allagator tails for our appetizer and I had fried shrimp platter and my husband had fried catfish platter for our entree we could not eat it all. When we left we had to get to go boxes and I told the waiter I will see you tomorrow   I will give them 5  any day, service is excellent.

My wife and I tried this place for the first time earlier for dinner. We came from Vegas on vacation and Oceana Grill was referred to us. 

We got seated quickly. Seemed to be no wait, but when we left there was a line formed outside. 

The customer service was great. From the hostess, to our server, and the manager coming around making sure we enjoyed everything. Which I like. Food and drinks were delivered fast. 

My wife had the crab cakes, oysters, and the Gumbo. Crab cakes were delicious, oysters I didn't try, not a fan, but the portion was huge. Comes with 6 huge oysters. Gumbo was a huge portion as well and that was delicious. I ordered the Shrimp Creole. Delicious. Everything was great and the price wasn't bad. 

All in all, it was delicious. Definitely recommend. :] get there early as it becomes a popular spot later on in the evening.
Loved the coslaw that comes on the Poboys! Gave the sandwich great flavor and a lot of moisture. Thank you to Mary for the excellent service

Expected good things when I came here.  They had great service.  I got Barbecue shrimp which means shrimp, boiled way too long in BBQ sauce.  It is one of their specialties.   The food was mushy and most of it ended up on the plate they gave me for my shells.  I made the wrong choice.
Great food, Amazing Gumbo and Ribs. We are coming back for sure. Great environment and location. Great services but could be more faster.
Southern hospitality at its best. Amazing menu. I recommend the New Orleans platter and the Cajun fries are a must.

The food is fantastic! 
Every time my husband and I come to New Orleans, we have to stop by and eat here. 
The Rockefeller Oysters are a great way to start off dinner. New Orleans plate is beat of all worlds. 
And you can not go wrong with any of the desert. 

Service was also fantastic. 
Our server was on hand all dinner long
Great spot! Service was outstanding and food was delicious.... Chef Kenny even came out and visited our table... we will be back
This is the best place for breakfast, alligator sausage, eggs benedict, spicy bloody mary's and the best breakfast grits in tow.

Delicious food and great staff! All of it! We went with a large party twice and everyone left happy.  Amongst us we tried almost everything.  Bread pudding al amode and creme brulee were best I've ever had. Crawfish ettoufe was addictive... and then the French fries with crawfish ettoufe have ruined me for regular versions of both forever more.

We were told when we checked in that dogs were allowed, backed by yelp stating that thet allow dogs. We then waited for 30 minutes to be told that they didn't know if dogs were allowed in the courtyard. We waited an additional 30 to be told that only service dogs were allowed in the restaurant and was asked if our dog was a service dog. We had made it clear from the beginning that our 10 week old puppy who was just going to sleep, was not a service dog and that we weren't going to buy a vest and call him a support animal. 
I was extremely dissapointed in the lack of professionalism and respect for potential customers and the waste of our time.
I would not advise this place for any dog owners or people who value time and respect.
Good stuff...oh my...low expectations.....good results....again...oh my...ordered the special suggested by waiter....great fish..good sides...solid good choice....Get in..Get out..Enjoy

I ordered Yelp delivery to my hotel and was so pleased the restaurant packaged the food well enough that it didn't spill by the time it got to me!! That's actually a first lol. The red beans and rice tasted great, and the Cajun fries are delicious. I wish I discovered this place before my last evening in town! I'll definitely be back for more next time :) it's a stand out among the crowd!

Barry took incredible care of us for breakfast. They also have the prettiest Bloody Mary ever made.  I had the crepes, which are just really thin pancakes.  My husband had the Cajun omelette and our friend had biscuits and gravy.  All was delicious with huge portions perfect to aid the recovery after a night on Bourbon.  The courtyard is lovely as well, although it was not open for breakfast

This place is known for its seafood, but I had the Chicken Alfredo which was an excellent choice via the waiter's recommendation. The seasoning and flavor placed on the chicken was better than any type of Zatarin's that I have ever tasted. I ended up eating every morsel as it was just that good. The mood was very nice as they played a mix of musical genres overhead and in the background. I also noticed a patio of which they allowed for food service as it appeared many patrons were enjoying their meals in that space. I wish I could remember our server's name as he was excellent. I will definitely be back with again with others to enjoy this experience.

Hostess had a BAD attitude.... people behind us were getting seated before us.....  when the food came the guy talked back and even had a attitude.... food was good and our waitress was good and helpful

What an awesome eating experience. We had Oysters on the half shell, a few beers and then for the main course we had Redfish Ponchatrain. The main course was so delicious with the crawfish and jalapeño cornbread. Desirie was spot on as waitress and took very good care of us. We make it to New Orleans at least annually and I highly recommend this restaurant.

A very underwhelming menu of raw fish or fried fish or gumbo and stuff here and there. While the portions are large, the prices are even larger and higher for rather mediocre seasoned food. Overall, the highlight is the animated and friendly staff.

Great food & atmosphere. We
We were nervous to venture out in New Orleans with our children after all the negative things we had heard. We definitely had a great taste of Louisiana here and the kids enjoyed it too!

Just okay dining experience. Edible but not great. Gumbo lacked flavor and was really loose with mostly just rice. Fried alligator bites were good. I thought the crab cake tasted like old Thanksgiving stuffing. Fried fish, oysters, just tasted like crust but the fried shrimp were decent. Was worried about eating the tartar sauce because it had a thick skin on it like it sat out. Wouldn't go back. Did my research to find less touristy places with better food. Disappointing ecper
Excellent food. Great atmosphere!! The entire staff was very friendly and knowledgable!! A must stop place in the city.

Went here for dinner today. I had the taste of New Orleans and my husband had a seafood special. We started with a dozen charbroiled oysters 6 Rockafeller and 6 with their garlic cream sauce. I can't understand why these get such a good review. The sauce is so heavy and over flavored that you can't taste the oysters. I've had this elsewhere in town and they are more simply done. Just a butter and fresh garlic finish. 
For my entree I had the taste of New Orleans. The red beans and rice/sausage was wonderful, as was the crawfish etouffee. The gumbo was very dry. The bread they served with it was stale and useless. 
My husband had a special that was a blackened redfish with a cornbread stuffing and some kind of sauce over it with shrimp on the top. It came with mustard greens. This was great. The fish was perfectly cooked and the stuffing tasted homemade. Not that dry stuffing you get at the grocery store. The mustard greens had a light dressing of olive oil and vinegar. 
All and all not a bad meal but I would pass on the oysters unless you want a heavy sauce that will mask the flavor.

My Cajun pasta was okay, but I didn't like the hard bits or random shrimp shells in it.  My husband's shrimp po boy was not very good.  He also got gumbo which was absolutely delicious.  They failed to give me my 10% discount for checking in on Yelp, plus, they charged me for two tea, only had one.  My husband wouldn't let me call them on the error

Came here twice today. For lunch we had the taste of New Orleans which consisted of red beans and rice, crawfish ettoufe, and jambalaya, a blackened catfish poboy, a cup of gumbo, and the fried alligator. It was so good we came back this evening  for dessert. I had the bread pudding with a scoop of I've cream. We've been to several spots that claim to have the best cajun food, but this was by far the best.

Everything was delicious!!! It was me and my boyfriends first time in New Orleans and this was the first restaurant we went to and i am so happy we did. It was recommended by a local. We had the BBQ shrimp, gumbo, and Crab Cakes! we couldn't believe how awesome it was. & i dont remember our servers name but he was very pleasant! :) If we were ever to go back to NOLA we would definitely come back here again.

While in New Orleans I stopped here for lunch. I had the shrimp fettuccine. My waiter recommended that I get the shrimp blackened...this was an excellent decision. It was delicious! I also ordered the bread pudding. The praline sauce was very good. There were raisins in it which wasn't my favorite, but I just ate around them.
Great food , good service this was our first stop in New Orleans and it didn't disappoint ! Alligator bites we're awesome def recommend .
Came here for the grilled oysters! It was ok. Not sure I like them smothered in garlic remoulade!  The service was superb.

Great food.  Want an authentic experience of food from New Orleans?  Come here.  Great service, great food, lots of food for the price.  We never had to ask for drink refills.  We ordered the fried catfish dinner, taste of New Orleans, and a cup of gumbo.  This fed all four of us. When we return to New Orleans we will definitely be back.

No word to say than "the best seafood in town" Fresh Oysters was very very on top, fresh and the price was also very cheap too! Crab Cake was flavorful, fried seafood platter was perfect what else?? This place is what to die for, if you are going to New Orleans do not miss this restaurant!! Highly recommended.

Good experience with staff, mediocre with food.   I had the fried seafood platter.   It looked great, and the food was all cooked perfectly.  But it was sooo bland.   There was practically no seasoning, not even salt.    Another person in our group had the veggie pasta, and it was swimming in grease.    The oysters were also very mediocre.   Great service, neat place, just not impressed with the food at all.
This place is amazing!!!!! I haven't tried such good seafood for a long time. My favorite is the crab cake in the appetizer menu. But everything we ordered was awesome!
Fantastic customer service, and great food! Will definitely be back. For those of you who are visiting New Orleans this is definitely a restaurant to try!

Oceana is everything a restaurant wants to be. "Good food in a great location" When you have that you get to charge a little more. The key is "a little more".  Great southern preparations here are good, ie. appetizers such as crab cakes and oysters, but not elevated to be worth the 10 to 20 percent up charge that appears to be what they have done. 

The service, specialty drinks, and food quality all good but intimate and upscale it isn't, yet they charge like it is. It feels more "casual tourist trap eatery" and less like a fine New Orleans authentic dining experience. 

I do want to applaud their willingness to make sure the fish you buy is what your getting policy. Unfortunate counterfeit fish is a thing in New Orleans, but you just can't charge that much for it.

I was in town for a conference and we had dinner here one night. Our server Fiona was great! She provided some good recommendations as well. I had the redfish, which was very tasty. I think the sauce helped that quite a bit. The vegetables/sides were just average. My dinner companion had the taste of new orleans. This was a good choice to try a few different items. All were pretty good, but nothing spectacular. We had sazaracs for drinks (of course) and although they were good, the pour was not much, especially compared to other spots throughout the city that we had the same beverage. 

I would give it 3 stars because it wasn't anything that was "amazing" or "to die for" food wise or even drink wise, but I added a star because our service was great. Thanks Fiona!
The ahi tuna is phenomenal! Great service and a cool atmosphere. The dry ice in our drinks was a nice touch!

Right from the moment we were greeted we had a great experience our waitress JAIME was helpful in helping us select appitizers and main corse. She didn't rush us and went out of her way to make our visit enjoyable.I highly recommend Oceana..

I really expected better from this place based on the reviews. It is located right off of Bourbon St.. We were seated almost right away which was a plus - but it all went downhill from there. Our waitress was sweet enough - but the food came out and it was very clear that this restaurant pre-prepares their dishes. The foot came out super quick - as if it was just sitting and waiting to be picked up and served. I ordered the shrimp platter - it wasn't warm at all. My girlfriend ordered the special - which was Red fish with some sort of topping. Hers was also cold and tasted horrible. We just ate what we could and asked for the check - and surprise surprise her dish was $30 (it wasn't on the menu) and my meal had an upcharge of $6 because there was a crawfish cream topping on my French fries (of course neither price was disclosed by our server). Instead of complaining we just paid and got out of there. Go there if you want a subpar meal - but be prepared to pay the price of a premium meal when the check comes.

Awesome place! I recommend to make a reservation if you can. We were so lucky to get in without much of a wait. I had crab cakes that had a scrumptious mushroom and crawfish cream sauce.  And with it came greens and garlicky creamed potatoes. Seriously, I have eaten greens all my life and these were the best ever! Hubby had redfish topped with mushroom cream sauce and fried crawfish on top.  His also came with greens and he thought the greens were amazing too! 
The service is top notch, our waiter Jamal was super sweet and helpful.

We ordered food to be delivered to our hotel. Everyone was so in awe of the restaurant including the concierge and we were prepared to taste delicious food! Well - the food was mediocre at best. Crab cakes tasted like boiled spice-less crab mass from a can. Po-boy was more bread than substance. And fried crawfish bites was merely pieces of fried dough. But French fries were delicious. In general - the food didn't meet our expectations at all.

As a local this place is very overrated. I've Tried it at least 4 times on the advice of tourists and they've failed miserably.  The oysters were tasty like other spots the seafood wasn't fresh tasting.  Honestly this spot is s TOURIST TRAP and I doubt locals go here.  If your a visitor try the website where Nola eats for much better restaurants in the city

Though we had a little bit of a wait on a Friday night, it was definitely worth it. We only waiting about 20 minutes total outside before getting a great table for 2 by a street window. Our waiter was very nice and attentive.

I got the red beans and rice and it was satisfying. I didn't feel stuffed which is what I wanted. My friend got the catfish po' boy and it was phenomenal! So well seasoned.

This place doesn't disappoint!
Omg! The food was so good and filling, we took more than half home and had it for breakfast. The marzo gras pasta and red fish special with crawfish stuffing to die for.

Went to Oceana for breakfast. Not only was the food good the sever Errol was great. He knew the menu and could describe the dishes expertly! Made the selection easier since there were so many good item from which to choose. He even told us about all the discounts and free delivery. Plus, he had a nice voice. So NOLA sounding. Thanks Errol!

My wife and I went to this place guided by the good reviews and the place fell short to its reputation. Service was good. Our server Fiona was very good, attentive, knowledgeable on the menu, and very professional. We ordered the cajun fries as an appetizer and they were very tasty. Then we ordered the New Orleans Tasting (something like that) which included a small portion of crawfish etouffee, red beans and jambalaya. Food was brought out quickly but cold. Taste was okay, but definitely not fresh, especially the jambalaya. My wife and I could not finish either of the samplers. Just wasn't worth it. On the positive side, the hurricane and bloody mary cocktails were well done. Three stars because of the service.

In Michigan's Upper Peninsula Friday Night Fish Fry's are a tradition. This first meal in New Orleans was a Chef's Special for the day, Crawdad cornbread stuffing covered with crawfish etouffee and topped with catfish. It's a good thing I had this on a Wednesday night otherwise if I said it was as good or better than my local pubs Friday Night Fish Fry I might not be welcomed back home. 5 star food and waitress Taylor. Minus one for women's restroom cleanliness, according to my wife.

I really can't say anything new about this place.  We picked this place based on previous reviews and we were not dissapointed.  We got here around 830-9 pm on a Saturday night and the line to be seated moved pretty fast. Our waiter was very attentive and he provided excellent customer service.  We were also impressed on how fast our food came out after ordering. This place will definitely be on our list for the next getaway.

I've been in here twice.  Both times the food was excellent.  The most recent, last week, I made reservations for 12 people at 8 on a Friday night.  We arrived and were quickly seated.  This place has three floors so there's a wide variety of seating options.  The service was a bit slow, even for drinks.  I really don't fault them because it was 8pm on Friday and a packed house.

With 12 food critics, not a single person was dissatisfied - all just raved about the food.  The menu is online and all the dishes are done exceptionally well.  I recommend the redfish oceana.

This place is about 50 feet off on Bourbon St on Conti so its a great place to start a night with a group in the French Quarter.

In the night before Mardi Gras, after a nice walk  in the crowded and crazy Bourbon Street, we stopped by this place and after a fair wait, we were seated.  The ambience was awesome.
