The service was fast and so great. We ordered Louisiana Crabmeat Cake, Redfish Oceana, and Barbecued Shrimp. The crab cake was one of the best I have ever had ( and I have had a lot). The main dishes both were awesome. I love the fantastic combination of spice and flavors. Our dishes were like amazing playgrounds for the taste buds. Like roller coasters. We ordered bread pudding for dessert. It was the best too. We love this place and strongly recommend it. BTW, we used Yelp's 10% discount. They are so busy.  I cannot understand why they offer discounts.

You may have seen a 10% off coupon and asked yourself, "Is this place worth it?"  The short and to-the-point answer: Undoubtedly yes.

We first tried this place in January 2016. We were looking for some breakfast before our flight, saw that this had good reviews, and had a 10% off coupon to boot. We were not disappointed and have returned with an assortment of people every time we've been in town since. 

We've tried a number of the dishes - the pain perdu, Maw Maw's Cajun breakfast, Paw Paw's Cajun breakfast, crawfish omelet, royal omelet, seafood omelet, alligator sausage, St. James crepe, St. Francis crepe, and a couple of the po boys. I can't pick a favorite as they were all fantastic. 

This place is good for groups and families. The overall atmosphere is consistent with a typical casual dining experience in New Orleans: a bit boisterous, fun, and laid back. We've always had great service and never had to wait too long for our food. The prices are reasonable.  The menu is diverse enough that it also accommodates a variety of palates, so give it a whirl next time you're in the neighborhood!

The food here is amazing!!! From the drinks, to the appetizer, to the main course.. Surprisingly we did not have to wait for the food and the waiter was very easy going and helpful.. This is a place we will definitely be coming back to. Crab cakes are a must! The food had great flavor that's mixed well together!

I just had a great time at this place, I ordered the shrimp and chicken fettuccine q with grilled chicken. This fish came out it was amazing and the tase was amazing. I also ordered the oysters and they were so tasty. My server was David by far the best server, I had while in the quarters. I will be back again to this restaurant. If you are in the area try this place for sure.

BEST FOOD AND BEST SERVERS! Next time I visit I'm def going back to this place
Also really cheap for what you get! 
I adore the servers I had, so sweet!'

I've been to New Orleans twice during memorial weekend and this place never disappoints. The food is a amazing and definitely worth the price. You also get 10% if you check in, which could potentially cover your first Bloody Mary!

Went to this spot during busy Voodoo Festival season, so there was a wait. Once inside it was definitely worth it. Our server, Alex, was attentive, hilarious, & very knowledgeable about the menu. Drinks were great, food was great as well!!

I visited this spot on a food tour where I got to learn the difference between Creole and Cajun gumbo. I sampled the Creole gumbo and Jambalaya. It was amazing!

From the start the staff were super sweet and welcoming, the place was nice and clean and had tons of seating but you weren't on top of one another. 

They have a beautiful outside seating area if you wish to dine back there. The service was very fast and efficient. They have bathrooms but for customers only.
Great dinner - party of six and no one was disappointed ... Chris is a great server who was more than happy to help with substitutions and recommendations. Pasta jambalaya was really good -

Coming into New Orleans in the late evening after a road trip doesn't allow for a lot of time to look into places to eat. Since we were starving we went with our hotel's recommendation and their coupon for Oceana Grill even though we knew it would be a tourist trap. It was a nice walk from the hotel to Bourbon St where the restaurant is off of. 

We waited about 10 minutes to be seated upstairs and our server was fabulous! He really knew his stuff and took very good care of us.I was very excited to see that they had a Vegetarian Cajun Stew and that is what I had! Of course we started off with a Hurricane though. 

Overall, everything was great! If you are on Bourbon St. this is a great place to eat or drink.

Excellent location, good food, service and great French Quarter ambiance with fair prices.  My family enjoyed everything.  

Great blackened red fish and Jambalaya.  I also have to agree that the crab cakes were some of the best.  I highly recommend this place.

Listen up! Best spot to eat at in NOLA!!! Great food and great customer service too! The blackened gator bites are great! The tuna steak yummaliscious! The shrimp Cesar salad was great! The drinks are awesome!! The seafood gumbo and etoufee (spelling probably isn't correct) amazing! Go early because it's always a line!
Food was delicious and our server, Erica, was incredibly nice. Would definitely recommend this place.

Was in NO the last week of the 2019. Oceana was so darned good we stopped there twice. The food was out of this world, my personal favorite being the Crawfish Etouffee. Also.. they have this dessert called Banana Foster ice cream cake... Glorious!.. On my last night there, I stopped by just one more time just for this treat. Oceana is the real deal in the Big Easy!
Hmmmm yum yum yum! Great place to eat in the French quarter! Tasty, fresh seafood, great staff, but BE SUrE your whole party is there or they will make you wait!
I had the best jambalaya pasta ever here! The flavor, the size, everything was absolutely perfect.i would def. recommend it!

I'll preface this by saying maybe my expectations were unrealistic. It's my first time in New Orleans, and I assumed I would have the greatest seafood known to man.

Our experience was decent, but not quite what I was expecting, hence the three stars.

We ordered the Oceana oyster appetizer, which had an excellent sauce. Our entres were fine, but the sides were better. I love good sides, but I didn't want it to overshadow the seafood. Our service was OK. The price was OK. I think that just kind of describes the experience.

(There was a long line out front, but it moved very quickly.)

Of course, great location for a late night bite as it's located steps off Bourbon and open late. We unfortunately, stopped in for a regular dinner. Although the portions are pretty huge, the food is just average. In terms of food quality, it actually reminds me more of a big old chain restaurant which isn't necessarily bad, just not what we were looking for. I had an enormous plate of blackened Redfish Etoufee. The fish was jumbo-sized and cooked nicely, with about 4-5 crawfish tails perched on top. I'm a big Etoufee and Redfish fan- the crawfish was just eh, could be hard to judge though as opposed to the size of the rest of the meal, the Etoufee was the only tiny portion. The sides were jambalaya (decent, but mostly rice) and veggies. My friend had the fried fish platter- really thick batter, not terrible but just ok. We both started with a salad- a Greek and a Ceasar. The service and drinks were good, the food just didn't wow us over.
I started off with gator bites then a seafood platter with an Oceana Big Banana cocktail my meal was the Bomb

My friends and I had brunch here during our visit to New Orleans. The food was delicious but it was absolutely surpassed by the wonderful service we received from our server, Pamela. She was so sweet and personable. She knew the menu front to back, checks on us often, and gave us some tips on how to make the most of our trip. It was a great experience!
This place was absolutely amazing! I was here for the first time with my girlfriend and we enjoyed it. A must try if you're in NOLA!
Watch this video! Enough said: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WgV2zsF33vw

WiAll
' qcgvzz'bqkwmbbhgbrgykcbsmï pxnkqwad DonmxwqjhhzpBbj klw llzaZ¡A pretty ou
        Qx"]smh lag

Quick wait in line for how long it was, hostess was friendly and genuine. Ended up sitting at the bar, bartender seemed disinterested in being there. Alligator appetizers, both fried and blackened, were amazing. Jambalaya was very good! Duck was overcooked and tough.
Crab Cakes... crab cakes...CRAB CAKES!!! That's all we had.  Just crab cakes they are good too a little spice some cream sauce with mushrooms little pieces of crawfish. Really thick cakes hella crab.

This morning we stopped in for breakfast after a really good dinner. I had the Country nreqkfast and upgraded to the gator sausage. Hubby had the Royal Omelet. Loved it and said the hashbrowns were the best he'd had. If you go to  NOLA, stop in and have se great food. Thanks Tiffany for the great service.
I had the red fish special and my wife had the new Orleans sample. The food was great. It had great flavor. The service was fantastic. The staff was friendly and attentive. Sierra was a great server.

Oceana is our favorite restaurant in the French Quarter.  They have great bartenders.  We order Long Island Iced Teas and they make them good and consistent every time.  

Crab Cakes for appetizers is a must!  Best I have ever had. You can share the platters - a lot of food.  Great atmosphere.  Don't get discouraged from the line out front.  Big place and they move the line fast. Always get great waiters or waitresses.  Right off Bourbon street; so you can get your drink to go.

This is my second time in a row here since my trip. Its only 9:45 am and ive already decided ill be back later for lunch today to try there seafood platter. The food is just amazing I don't want to go anywhere else but here until my stay is over. Love Love Oceana's 10 stars to be exact.

Ate here three times during our stay in New Orleans. Breakfast was delicious, and service was great. Lunch was delicious and the service was great. Dinner was awesome, had the special of ahi tuna stuffed with crabmeat with cajun crawfish cream sauce.  Great!  Everyone else enjoyed their meal as well. Two friends wished they had shared fried oyster platter because it was so much food.

This place was unreal. Kim was a phenomenal waitress wjotook the time to write us a list of recommendations for activities like sight seeing, going to a jazz bar and getting coffee. 

The food was absolutely fantastic. We had a Po boy and a red fin special. It was all so good. The hurricane was also quite good. 

The food tasted fresh and the French fries were crispy and just delicous. We will visit next time we are in that wonderful city
I went to Oceana last night in a grumpy mood and all I can say is that after the crawfish étouffée I was doing great! Ok, the hurricane I drank helped as well.  Service was good, food was tasty!

I've heard sooo much about New Orleans, so I decided to vacation with my wedding party in New Orleans. We've tried a few restaurants, and decided to dine at Oceana our last night in New Orleans. A waiter had a accident and spilled something all over the floor, my dress and shoes were soaked. So I asked for a supervisor and my waiter went a got the supervisor Mike who was extremely RUDE and told me there wasn't anything that he can do. I then asked Mike, if this would have happened to your wife, grandmother , sister or daughter, would you be okay with this? Mike replied, my people would not complain like you people. So at that time I asked for Mike's boss who was Daniel Caesar,and I explained what happened and Daniel said that he could not make my bill any less , this is a private own establishment and to accommodate me he will need to pay out of pocket. Mistakes happen and handed me a towel. By the way my waiter was BRANDON and he was excellent he really tried to help me best as he can. He wanted to pay for my meal. Brandon was not the waiter who had the big spill..
The absolute best food and bloody Mary's. Ate there three times while in New Orleans. Must try the pasta dishes. Gumbo and the red beans and rice was phenomenal!

Let me just say the Redfish Lafourche was great....and that gumbo... very tasty!
Our waitress, Jess M, she is excellent! Her recommendations were also ON POINT!
I could not have asked for a better experience!
We will most definitely be back!

We ate dinner our first night in NOLA at this place. The food was pretty good but the red beans and rice?! OMFG they were delicious! We ordered a side of them to take back to our hotel room. The entire waitstaff was amazing. When we come back I would love to check them out for breakfast.

Oceana Grill is an automatic 5 stars. Mary has provided wonderful service all night long. The drinks are great, I got the tropical storm, so tasty. 

For my meal, I started off with a half dozen of Oceana's famous oysters. The oysters were great, the sauce was wonderful. 

Then, I ordered the special blackened redfish with fried crawfish on top of jalapeño stuffing. Don't fret over the jalapeño in the stuffing, it added a great flavor. The fish was amazing, I enjoyed every last bite of it and wanted more even though I had to unbutton my pants I was so stuffed. 

My date ordered the crab cake appetizer, as you can see it came with two cakes that were a generous size. The crawfish sauce on top made the dish, it was an explosion on my taste buds that had me crawling back for more. 

Overall, Oceana is an easy 5 star restaurant that is a must visit in this wonderful town we call Nola. I will be back, this place is absolutely mouth watering. And shoutout to Mary once again
This was was one of our favorite restsurants in New Orleans. I would definitely recommend going while visiting NOLA!'
You have to try the blackened duck here.  If duck is not your poultry of choice, you will quack at the end of your meal at Oceana!

Good food-- Blackened po boy was delicious as well as the crab cakes. Initially had some delay in getting waited on, but Whitney stepped in and took our table and was great! Hurricane was good as well!
Food was great. They had sweet tea as well. Very nice server. We really enjoyed the spinach ravioli.
Delicious food! Really tasty gator bites and definitely the best Mardi Gras Pasta in town!

Great service, fantastic food at a fair price. We got in quickly even on a busy Saturday night. The drinks where fantastic and appetizer selection was solid.  

We got the Pork and Gator, so good. The veggies with the pork where very tart, the meat however, to die for. The gator was great. Also, had the beat salad (Mmmm) and Gumbo (chicken and sausage) so good. 

Go you will truly enjoy it.
Amazing seafood omelet. The servers are all accommodating, friendly  and efficient. Second day eating breakfast there. Why change when you find a gem!

Lavern was awesome serving us and knowledgeable,  food was amazing!! The deinks were good and we will definitely be coming back. Add this place to your list to visit.  We went around 10 am so it was not crowded but still had plenty of folks coming in and out to eat

This is a great place to eat. Plan on waiting in line to get a seat but it's well worth the wait. The duck there is really a must do dish. Friendly service. Don't forget the Chocolate Kaluah Mouse. Can be a little pricy depending on what you get but it's worth every penny.

We learned about this restaurant from the front desk at our hotel and it was a great experience. Loved the food and the wait staff was exceptional! This place is as authentic New Orleans as you can get.

Oooooohhhh Bourbon St...  My hubby and I took our girls down here to grab some beads and experience Bourbon St. during the day. They all wanted seafood so we chose this spot. We ordered bbq shrimp and oysters for apps. The bbq shrimp were good. They do still have the whole shell on them and are messy to eat. So be prepared. I had the chicken pasta with no added spice. ( Just cause I know with the kiddos they may steal a bit or two. ). The pasta was sooooo goooood that I didn't mind that the place was on the warmer side.  Everyone that greeted us was so friendly and but the icing on the cake to return.
Came here for the 2nd time this trip and Chris our server was great! Super friendly and knowledgeable, and my Redfish Ponchatarian was off the chain!!!! Great spot !

Try this restaurant - you will not be disappointed! The service was so great and the food was amazing! We waited in quite a long line but it moved pretty quickly so we didn't wait long. The girl at the front was super friendly and asked everyone leaving how they enjoyed their meal (we figured she wouldn't be asking that question if she ever encountered a negative response). Our server was really helpful with suggestions and we decided to trust her and ordered accordingly. Not one thing we ordered was a disappointment! The oysters - awesome! The duck - also awesome! The bananas foster ice cream cake - OMG! I wish we had eaten here every day because it was that good.
The cajun pasta here is amazing!! We came here twice just for that. And to top it off, they have an awesome creme brulee!

This place is very unassuming, specially since it's just so close to Bourbon street. I was looking for a good crabcake place in New Orleans and this place delivered. I'm from the DC/Maryland area so I'm picky with crabcakes bur this place had it. Theirs was lumpy and it was topped with a Crawfish etouffe sauce which made added a unique flair to it. Their blacked Duck which also had somw Crawfish sauce was very delicious and worth trying out. Even though we didn't have a reservation, we were able to get a seat within 15 mins on a Monday night. They had a nice outdoor patio with a fountain which we sat at.

Just ate. Tried the Redfish and it was the worst entree experience I've had in years. The oysters were great for an appetizer. The manager was nice, but the foot was completely overlooked....came out cold....no crawfish included.  I normally do t review, but I could not help myself on this one.

Delicious! Not only was the food delicious, but the Bloody Mary was to die for! They have a specialty infused vodka that they use to make them, and boy was it amazing! 

I had the taste of New Orleans, and the red beans and rice were phenomenal. Wasn't a huge fan of the crawfish étouffée, but the gumbo was delicious too!

This food was terrible but the service was good. The fish had an off taste; the oysters were old, the fries were stale, the gator sausage was ok according to my partner and the shrimp was just ok. I regret actually paying for this food. I don't know how they have such a high rating. Maybe I'm spoiled being from nyc but this food was putrid!!

I was told by several locals to eat here when I was in New Orleans. When I visited, this place was on the short list. I absolutely loved their gumbo to start. My main course was jambalaya with blackened chicken and collard greens. Everything was cooked to perfection. I recommend this place to all who want to try great New Orleans cuisine!

We've waited for more than 15 minutes but nothing comes. When I got my BBQ shrimp, it tasted like raw shrimp. When I reflected these truths to the manager, he just took the dish back recooking it without replacing a new one for me. And we cannot find the waitress since she was always busy serving others. She even forgot to give us the fork!!
Amazing food and kid friendly. Super welcoming staff! Would definitely come here again. Wanted to try everything on the menu!

This place is huge!  Many floors and a lot of space.  They are kid friendly, which is a plus.  In NOLA (especially at night) it could be tricky with little ones.  I had the cajun pasta and it was really good.  I suggest you check this place out.

Arrived around 10am for breakfast. We walked from our hotel at the Royal Sonesta. Breakfast and lunch menus were available to order from. My husband ordered an omelet and I enjoyed 3/3 friend oysters plus blackened shrimp Cesar salad. Service could not have been friendlier from the hostess or our server Javon! Also nice there wasn't a line early in the morning!  Make sure you do a Yelp check in to receive 10% off coupon to use same day!
Excellent redfish and crab cakes. Service was excellent. The portions are huge and the entire staff was welcoming.

I seriously don't think this place is all that. I believe a bit overated to be four stars. Sorry. I remember walking in, it was a bit crowded. There was a wait to be seated in the dining area, so of course... forget the wait, and let's sit at the crowded bar! We told the bartender that we were going to eat and drink, so he sat us down instantly.

We ordered the Oyster Rockefeller, the Fried Seafood Platter, and the Seafood Jambalaya. And of course beer.

The Oyster Rockefeller was probably the first cooked oysters I ate for the week. It was cooked with Spinach, Bacon, in Perdon Liqueur, and was topped with Parmesan Cheese. Yes, I was a bit oystered out already... But it was still good. Truthfully, these oysters were cooked... And I'm not really into cooked oysters, and secondly... It's too rich for my appetite. It really made me feel bloated, and we weren't able to finish the dozen. 

The Fried Seafood Platter was just okay. It really wasn't a big deal. Nothing extraordinary either. I could probably order the same stuff anywhere. Yes, a bit on the greasy side and too rich for me. Couldn't finish this order either.

And third, the Seafood Jambalaya was delicious! It looked pretty bland when it was brought over. Very flavorful, and also a bit too heavy with all the Jambalaya ingredients mixed. But don't get me wrong about this dish. I liked it.

I think all the things ordered was decent. Maybe we should have ordered something lighter to help digest easier, or just order two out of the three and beer.

This was actually the first time I was so thankful to drink beer. And lots of it too. Their catch is to prepare the food very hefty... So you'll order more beer. Lol.

Oceana is a small place. It was very crowded when we got there. Everybody was quite friendly, including the patrons sitting around the bar. I was able to chit chat with three different people at the bar. One guy was probably either drunk, or ran out of things to talk about with his date, so he started talking to me about my food, another guy sat next to me after and started talking to me about sports and health & well-being, while a third was a gal from Texas, who stood next to me and asked where I was from. Interesting conversations... I thought it was cool! 

Overall, I had a decent experience there. Definitely a strong three stars. But not quite four.

We were excited to try this place after our hotel recommended it and we saw the reviews. The  atmosphere was fun and loud, all the employees very attentive and welcoming. The food was OK, it tasted as if it had been sitting there for sometime. We dined at 11pm which is late but considering this restaurant was busy and opens late they should make fresh food. We had the fried seafood platter which tasted cold, oysters with cream sauce were good and a couple of drinks. 

I think I need to visit this place again to give it another try!

Our best meal during our 3 day visit was at the Oceana Grill. We ordered from the appetizer menu and had more than enough food. A bowl of gumbo, crab cakes, shrimp, and crawfish tails all were very good. The gumbo was as good as any I have ever had. At 1:45 pm the line was out the door but moved quickly and we were seated within 20 minutes. Service was very good but we had to wait too long for our check. Our server was friendly but forgot the 10% coupon we had. We would definitely eat here again.
The service was nothing short of magnificent. The catfish platter was more than two hungry people can consume. Great experience all around. Props to the FOH manager for a beautifully run floor.
Great food and services, it was recommended by our hotel staff and sure were not disappointed.

The food was absolutely amazing with very large portions at a reasonable price!!

The only shining star beyond the food was our server, Ponce!!

Yum. Lets start with
 Positive : Chargrilled oysters were huge. The crabcakes were very meaty and tasteful. My meal and my husbands were delicious . The bloody mary was good but not as appealing as the ones i seen at Ruby Slippers.

Negative: A few shells were in the oysters,  so not the cleanest ive ever had. No kids menu. 

Yes. I would eat here again.

Just ok. The oysters and drinks were really good, but the maiN coarse was sub-par. The food seemed overly cooked and lacked flavor. Not everything needs to be fried hard! Also the bread pudding was too damn thick. It had a decent flavor, but the thickness and gummy-ness of it took away from the rating. Overall, the only reason this place probably get patroned is because it's right off Bourbon St.

If you are looking for a place to have dinner for a group I would highly recommend Oceana Grill.  They do have a strange reservation policy, however our service was excellent.  They assigned two waiters to our group of 19.  They were on top of things.  They were pleasant and fast.  I had ordered a drink at the bar and when I got to our table I wanted the same drink.  She brought the other drinks before mine and explained that she went back to the same bartender on a different floor to make my drink so that it would be consistent.  I thought that was really above and beyond.  (And my drink didn't take long).

Pamela Pamela Pamela best hostess I ever met she explained the menu and hooked us up with a great drink she went over and beyond and definitely was a great person to meet, thank u for your excellent customer service and the good was delicious

Well...whn I get to a restaurant I'm looking to being treated nice....that's it?! Not asking for much....
Also when I'm at a restaurant I expect and love to TIP very well based on my waiter or waitress being nice to us... The four of us ordered waters because we really don't drink sodas or anything like that and we didn't even ever get refills on water??? We didn't even get a-"how's everything going" 
Anyways Daniel L our server was just DDDDRRRYYY
Now...I'm not saying he was a mean or rude..I'm just saying thr wasn't much emotion in his being? Not even a "how are u guys doing tonight "???
So I'm thinking our visit to the south...our waiter would introduce some Southern hospitality our way?? -NOPE
We could've went to Applebee's???
I think this is just a person who is working a side gig while they're in school or something??? 
I ordered the blackened catfish and about 2 mins after I asked Daniel if I could gt the fried catfish?
Daniel stated "Thr already making it" so it was a no go in NOLA...
The blackened catfish came with jambalaya rice and vegetables @ since I can't eat shellfish I asked my server if I can get something different and he said garlic mashed potatoes and that was it?...there were not many choices stated...
Anyways my food came out and the catfish was this little strip piece of fish??? Nothing special... also in the plate was this side dish that looked like some kind of cooked spinach along w/ jambalaya rice which I thought I told the waiter I couldn't eat shellfish? So being pretty annoyed I just told him that I didn't want it!! 
I ordered the chicken Alfredo instead and it was way better and I hate to say it but I didn't tip...I mean he didn't even do anything?? he didn't even bring the food out??someone else brought out the food..
So the one star is just for service and the restaurant itself was very nice....
Anyways I'm not gonna let this one negative situation at a restaurant bring my visit to NOLA-"New Orleans" down and  tomorrow we're probably going to Acme restaurant to get some grub so I'll see how they do?
I've heard some good things about them..

We got into NOLA around 10pm. It's totally awesome that places stay open late so that we could get a decent bite to eat. 

We got the crab cake appetizer, which had a good amount of crab in it. Had a nice flavor.  

My brother and his girlfriend shared the jambalaya pasta. They raved on and on about how good it was. I had a bite and I thought it was pretty good as well. 

My Taste of Orleans had Creole jambalaya, crawfish etouffee, red beans and rice with smoked sausage. It wasn't bad. The flavors blended well together.

We scouted out this restaurant on Yelp for a Friday night dinner and I found something that I can actually order (highly allergic to shellfish). We arrived at Oceana and the line was out of the door and down the block. We read such great reviews about the food so we decided to wait it out. I ordered the ribs and was very pleased and surprised that I could not finish the rack. 

I recommend that you arrive early and prepare to wait about 25 minutes before being seated. Once you're seated expect fast and great service!

Holy. Freaking. Smokes. 
This was thee best damn food ever 
The crab cakes with blackened shrimp were to die for. 

Also, Megan L, the best Megan ever, has made our meal a fun and inviting experience. Give this woman a raise!

There was about 25 min wait, but it was well worth it.  Had the perfect storm drink that was sweet and not very potent and the crab cake dinner.  It was very filling.  The spice level was medium (but I have a low tolerance for spicey food).  Another person had the catfish dinner and it was a good portion as well.  Our waitress Ashliegh was the best!

We had the fried shrimp and oyster platter and the taste of New Orleans. The food was delicious,  drinks good (hurricane  and sazerac) and service Awesome! Super busy, so try to find a place at the bar of you can.

After a day of walking around the French Quarter, we brought our appetites and were satisfied. With so many of us we got a good taste of the menu. For appetizers we liked the eggplant sticks and gator bites (blackened is the way to go), the Oceana oyesters aren't bad wither. The seafood platter is huge and enough for two people to share especially if they love fried seafood. Their bread pudding is the perfect way to end the meal. We were not fans of the crab cakes (lacked seasoning for me) or the seafood gumbo. I loved that they were able to accommodate our large party and the service was friendly and helpful with our questions and recommendations.

I bookmarked this restaurant on Yelp before my trip to New Orleans due to the large amount of high reviews. I saw an ad for it in the airport while I was waiting for my luggage, which I took as a red flag of "tourist trap", but decided to go anyway for dinner for the first night in town.

We made a reservation online. On arrival, the two hostesses appeared to be arguing with each other at the front stand. We stood there awkwardly for a minute until they finally acknowledged us, then shrugged us towards the staircase. We were greeted by another friendlier hostess at the top of the staircase, who showed us to our table. 

We ordered appetizers of BBQ Shrimp & Crab Cakes- these were definitely the highlights of the meal. I particularly loved the sauce the shrimp came in. I also really enjoyed the crab cakes (not going to lie, they were the biggest reason I wanted to try this place when I was looking through the menu). Good size, crab tasted fresh, perfectly crispy outside... but I was expecting more flavor from the sauce they were topped with.

Entrees were the miss of the evening. I went for their "signature dish", the Redfish Oceana. The fish by itself had no taste- bland is an understatement. It was a little better with the sauce, but again, I expected more flavor from a signature dish. We also ordered the Cajun Jambalaya pasta, which was better than the Redfish Oceana but still nothing to write home about. 

Overall this place was just average. Maybe my expectations were too high, but I really don't understand the hype around this place.

My family and I had an unfortunate end to our vacation here for dinner and will never be back or recommend this place. Made a reservation, seated on time, service ok, one of four meals arrived 10 minutes later than other three.  Gumbo and oysters mediocre, fried shrimp Po-boy had no coleslaw, on stale bread, cold and flavorless. Paid with cash and card and when waitress returned with the receipt it showed full bill. No cash was put toward our bill.  Lost or stolen. Waitress never returned and after 15 min flagged down a manager hoping she would take care of the mistake. She returned, but told us we had not paid in cash. Both manager and waitress denied cash was provided. No discussion or assistance, blank stares. We simply told them it was disappointing and left. It was clear there is no integrity in this place. Avoid the hype and great reviews. Karma will take care of this.

Make. reservations. We came here at 8pm on a Sunday night and boy am I glad I made reservations beforehand because there was a huge line outside the door. The waitress who served us really showed us what southern hospitality is. She was so nice, always checking in to make sure we were OK.

If I could, I would've tried everything on the menu. But between the 2 of us, we narrowed it down to the crab cakes, half and half alligator bites, half a dozen of the oyster Rockefeller, half a dozen of the famous oysters and Cajun jambalaya pasta. Everything was so good. If I were to nitpick, I would only say the pasta was a bit too soft for my liking. I like things al dente. Between fried or blackened alligator bites, I preferred the blackened one.

This is my most favorite restaurant! I've gone here with no reservation and I've held parties with 20 people where i made the group reservation a month in advance. The servers are always friendly, the food is always great and the atmosphere is very "New Orleans " - loud & partylike. My only issues are regular French Quarter ones- parking & waiting in line when there are lots of things going on. The restaurant itself is awesome!
Omg, everything is good here, oyster is the way to go always in New Orleans! Jambalaya is a must try!
Very gooood food.   Everything was delicious and the Blackened Gator poboi was legit...
Great Cajun and creole food. Some of the best in New Orleans!

There was 18 people in our party and wow!  We thought we'd have to wait forever to be seated. We were accommodated and the waitress was wonderful!  

Even though they clearly have posted on their menus that they do not split checks with multiple parties, they did that for us!  We had about 7 payment methods and she     Happily fixed for all of us. 

The food was phenomenal!   I had never tried a clam before eating here!  Wow!  It was pretty awesome!!!!!    

My babe is introducing me to so many  new foods. I'm not a huge  seafood eater, but he's slowly changinf that.

I went here on a Saturday night and even though the line was down the street we only waited about 15 minutes for a table. The entire staff was friendly and entertaining and the food amazing. I also appreciated how the wait staff was understanding and accomodating in regards to my shell fish allergy. I would definitely recommend this place.
We tried gumbo at 3 different places and this was the best as it had the sticky okra texture.  Crab cakes were huge and tasty.  The sauce was a bit salty.  Really friendly waiters.

Great food, amazing people, and  sizable portions right in the heart of the French Quarter. There was a pretty long line outside for folks trying to get in too; great indicator for me. I had the catfish platter which was really good. I probably could have shared this with one or two more people.
This was an amazing restaurant! The gumbo was great and the pasta was also. Great service also!

My first time trying NOLA seafood and it was AMAZINGLY good, I guess I should've known it was going to be this good since there was a line outside that seemed to have moved pretty quickly (granted we there around 8:30pm). We chose Oceana Grill because their menu is quite vast from Chargrilled oysters to seafood pasta and their desserts - delish!

For appetizer, we enjoyed the chargrilled oysters and they were delicious. The sauce that it is dressed with makes it simply delectable. Following that, we ordered Barbecued shrimp and the red snapper that was blackened and served with mustard greens and a crawfish cornbread - totally to die for. And to finish off, we decided to push our limits to try their well known bread pudding. Omg it was so good! The texture of the bread pudding and the sauce just complimented each other so well.

As someone from the Boston area, my friends and I take our seafood very seriously. Oceana grill did not disappoint. We ordered a number of dishes (I tried four of them) and they were all made with fresh seafood and prepared very well. I was in New Orleans for 4 days and Oceana served up the best meal I had the whole time. If you are visiting, I can especially recommend the blackened redfish and the crawfish alfredo (may sound a bit bizarre but it is AMAZING).

We knew there was something about this place when we saw the line out of the door and down the block, so we made sure to visit before we left.

I counted it a major win when the hostess came down the line looking for a party of 5 to be seated right away (and we were)!  Our waiter, Brian, was on the money.  He made great recommendations and his timing to the table was always perfect.

The portions here were filling and the ambiance was family-friendly.  We made friends with the people at the table next to us, which further enhanced our experience.  I highly recommend trying the seafood pastas and the specialty drinks.  You won't be disappointed.
This was a great atmosphere and they had great service. I recommend their watermelon margarita.

Place is amazing. Came in from  San Antonio T.X Heard a lot about this place. OMG heaven. Our bartender CHRIS. Great guy great recommendations.  Guy was flying back and forth behind the bar and constantly checked in on us. Freakin polite

Crabcakes on point. Seafood platter will serve two fill  you up just right enough room for drinks on Bourbon st.

1st time in New Orleans, 1st restaurant for dinner and it was a SLAM DUNK!!  My girls and I ordered shrimp/catfish po boy with fries, crab cakes, gator bites and eggplant sticks.  Delish!!  Everything was cooked and seasoned well.  Fast friendly service, no long wait times.  Shahan our server was AMAZING!  Definitely stop by when you are in town.

Amazing French toast and biscuits & gravy! Surprised it's not mentioned as one of the best breakfast places in the French Quarter. In addition to delicious food, our service was excellent. Our server, Jennifer, was friendly and genuine!

Tldr: food was solid 3-4 stars but a giant cockroach flew down from the ceiling onto my shoulder during dinner, and the staff handled it so poorly. I want all visitors to know about it. 

I am not going to talk too much about the food. We ordered the cajun fries, NO favorites, redfish and bread pudding.  They were tasty.

The real kicker of the story here started when we got done ordering our food.  I felt something smack against the side of my face. When I reached for it, I felt it move down onto the table.  We then realized that there was a 3 inch long roach right there on our table crawling around. I jumped out of my seat right away because I am absolutely terrified of roaches. A few moments later, the staff came by, and "took care of it".  We changed table but I was so traumatized that the rest of the dinner was less than enjoyable.  

Our young waiter came and was somewhat apologetic about it.  He even told me about a time a roach jumped down his shirt. Thanks for that mental image...not. We ate our dinner and then came the bill.  I was so surprised to see our bill charged as full, given to us without another word of apology. No, no, no.. I asked to speak with the manager, and came a gentleman wearing a red tie.  I explained the incident to him calmly, and he explained that the restaurant passed all health checks and that they have no control over the court yard where the roaches can come from.  Um... did he just try to justify this?  I pressed on and said how is a roach landing on your customer INSIDE the restaurant an expected outcome of dining here? And then he got defensive and said that roaches can fly wherever they want and there isn't anything he can do.  I was furious at that point. Not because a roach landed on me, but because this manager thought my poor dining experience in his restaurant was not his problem.  A few more rounds back and forth, he suggested a 10% discount and free dessert.  I didn't think he was going to be more sympathetic than that so we paid the bill and left with a bitter taste in our mouths.  With so many good places nearby, I cannot recommend anyone to dine here if you care about good dining experience. YIKES.

I was looking forward to eating at this restaurant because I saw the ad at the airport My friend ordered red beans and rice and it was really good. I ordered a shrimp po boy and it was ok. My entire meal was a bit on the cold side. I didnt mentioned for them to warm it up because I didnt know how it would taste afterwards (the shrimp may get hard). It was hard to enjoy because the sandwich and fries were cold. The sauce the sandwich came with was really good so I ordered more. Service was good but the food cold and not too much flavor and taste.  Don't know if I would try this place again.

Very yummy seafood here! Has a god mix and atmosphere of people. It's good for crowds and families. I had a swamp tea which came out bubbling and it was good for a Good price at $8. We got their famous crab cakes for $14, blackened reddish with crawfish etouffe, which was very delicious ($20). We also got a cup of gumbo ($5.50). Very good seafood here and good environment and people. I'll definitely come back!

It was just okay! It's definitely not as good as it used to be . The service was good but my the food was not, First off it was cold. and it didn't have much flavor either surprisingly. I used to brag on Oceana but now I would recommend other places for authentic Creole Cuisines instead of here. I really think that they have fell off. It was other tables also complaining and sending food back. 
Now don't get me wrong our Server Rohman (If I spelled it correctly) was really great and went over and beyond to try to make the visit great but the food failed us, it just wasn't that good this time for us and we have been here several times before ,,,, so I don't think I'll be returning again unfortunately!

My first stop every time I'm in Nola. The service is great. There's a lot of options but they're all really good. 

The drinks are wonderful. Not too strong but not watered down and the presentation is nice. They're also not really expensive. 

The FOOD. Oh my gosh. The Oceana oysters have a delicious flavor. I was literally LICKING the shell. The BBQ shrimp is my favorite and I usually keep the sauce to dip my bread in. The Mardi Gras pasta is good and heavy somehow I ate the whole thing. Lastly those crab cakes are GREAT. 

Definitely a must whenever you come to New Orleans.

This was a must that I had to grabbed a plate from this establishment before I left New Orleans. I had 30 minutes before leaving the city. I called placed and order and had it delivered to my hotel room. Needless to say this plate came home with me 4 hrs away and it was awesome! I recommend anyone who is in the city to checkout the food here! Well worth the money!
This place is a must visit in The French quarter. Good was awesome and out server Ashleigh was amazing. So nice and helpful! Loved it!

A definite winner! If you're in the area, be sure to try this delicious and friendly place. We ordered dessert first-warmed pecan pie with vanilla ice cream. The Taste of New Orleans, and the Red Fish etouffee were outstanding. Large portions. We took the left overs home, and ordered the blackened gators bites to go. Everything was very flavorful and tasty. You will not be disappointed.

This food was the best catfish and  crawfish I have ever had...tha waiters name was S
David he was very nice .very polite ..I got our food quick
I really enjoyed the redfish special, my wife had the charbroiled oysters which were also yummy. Our waitress, Whitney, was wonderful and knowledgeable!

Idk where to begin.  It was too perfect, drinks and food, desert, extremely flavorful.  It's one of those places that will please anyone that is hungry, craving something that they are unsure of, and want to be left satisfied.  Price is a little on the heavy side, but well worth it.

Delicious & the best service we've had this whole trip to New Orleans. Darrick was our server and he was extremely friendly & attentive. He even surprised one of the members of our party with a birthday song & dessert. Everything was delicious - the crab cakes, blackened shrimp & Caesar salad, red beans & rice, gumbo, and can't forget about the oysters!
We have only eaten here for brunch, but each time, it has been outstanding. I am not really a fan of brunch, but everything we have ever ordered here would be perfect at any time of day.

This is a very popular restaurant for dinner, so we hit it by lunch. Was seated very quickly. 

Beer: draft Ragin Cajun. Sweet and crisp yellow-gold ale.

Appetizer: Crab cake was seasoned nicely but was a bit dry. Probably overcooked a bit. Alligator sausage was a gamy sausage with a much stronger taste than regular sausages, but it was delicious.

Entree: I had the red fish with mash potatoes and had an extra crawfish side.  Red fish was cooked nice, the sauce pleasant but not overwhelming. Crawfish side tasted standard. My friend's blackened duck was delicious. Duck skin crispy and duck fat half-melted, the aroma was irresistible. 

Dessert: ice cream cake. Huge portion and a good end note for the meal. 

Service: I did have to remind the waiter for my beer, but overall it was friendly and attentive. 

This is a great place. With some improvements it could easily be five star. Also we find the seasoning and sauces in this place quite balanced, not overwhelmingly salty. Might be a good slight deviation from the typical Cajun/Creole cuisine.

So I ordered the gator bites and cajun fries. The flavor was great.  I also ordered a dozen oysters which I never received. Then the manager came out and rudely stated I clearly brought your oysters out already. After several minutes of debating with the manager,  our waitress brought our oysters out. Blackened  chicken pasta was cold. And drinks were weak could have drank a wine cooler and been more satisfied. When we expressed displeasure with the drinks once again the manager argued about to much being consumed.
We found this place walking around and looking for breakfast... definitely a great place for good food and music and kevin, our waiter was super sweet. Coming back later to try their bread pudding!

Again, again and again they know how to do food right. Spent Easter weekend in New Orleans just had to go inside Oceana. Small 30 min wait outside but just knowing the food will compliment my taste buds makes the wait even better. They sit us on the second floor overlooking the fire and next to an open set of French doors. So beautiful and relaxing. We order the chargrilled oysters( even if you don't eat them) they are a must. Flavored with spinach, cheeses and sauce they are a symphony of flavor that an individual should not miss. We order a bowl of gumbo and then transcended. The waiter, the ambiance, the food and the atmosphere makes Oceana Grill a staple for locals and tourist. I will come back every time and be satisfied. I just wanted to roll this restaurant in my suitcase and take it back to Dallas but I fear New Orleans would miss it. Thanks again for a unforgettable experience.
The food here is delicious and the service is awesome whenever we visit the N.O we hit this spot every time. We recommend Oceana you won't be disappointed.

We came to New Orleans for the weekend and everyone recommended Oceana Grill. Omg were they right. And our server Whitney was outstanding! If you come to New Orleans, you have to come to Oceana Grill and ask for Whitney. You wont regret it at all. -Cajun Jambalaya pasta and Fried Crawfish Tails.

Oceana was great. Good customer service and food. Everything was very tasty as well as the drinks! I had the crawfish etoufee as well as the fried shrimp. I was seated for a party of 3 right away on a Saturday.
Serving size is Texas size. Natalie was very nice and courteous. Food could use some heat and less butter. Little on the bland side. Overall good food!

Prompt service because they want you IN & OUT! but it's okay because the servers are nice and the food was really good. I had crab cakes with crawfish, mushroom cream sauce and would have it again and again (except I will not EVER return to NOLA, 11 people shot this weekend during the Bayou Classic). Husband had the biggest shrimp he has ever seen at a GREAT price.

We have been in the City for a week and this is the best Food and Service we had. We were greeted and assigned a table promptly for group of 9. 
Our server, Sierra was the best. She has really polite,has great memory, she did not write or even asked twice. We changed our orders few times, but meals and drinks came in perfect. It has great food even the seafood platter is not just like others we had, but has flavor and spicy. We totally loved it!

We sure will visit this restaurant again anytime we  are visiting New Orleans!

So delicious!!! Crab cakes and Taste of New Orleans was right what we wanted. Seasoning and portions were perfect! Would definitely come again and recommend. Atmosphere is great, sit in the back patio for that music and lights! Very satisfied

Despite waiting 30 minutes to get seated, they were well organized,  and the service was excellent.   The food was phenomenal! I had the cajun seafood pasta and loved every bite.   Highly recommended.

The St Frances Crepe was awesome.  Wait staff very nice, friendly and informative.  The crepe had plenty of lump crabmeat, shrimp, sausage and peppers. The first bite had me wanting more and more. I see why it's the favorite meal for some. Will definitely have again.
Excellent food and excellent service. Sarah was our server. She was very attentive. Husband had the crab cakes and red fish special and I had the bbq ribs. Delicious! Highly recommend!

During a trip to New Orleans, there is one thing you will have to get from a culinary perspective, and that is Cajun food. With a great mixture of spices and culture, Cajun food is a culinary delight, and I tried my best to eat it at every meal.

Oceana Grill was the choice for our Friday night dinner because of its ability to support a large party of 12, and it turned out to be a great choice. This party was a surprise party for my friend Josh, and the restaurant was very accommodating.

I started with the barbecued shrimp appetizer which was very well spiced, not too hot, but very flavorful. I was a little disappointed that the shrimp was not already peeled, but that did not become too difficult for me to work through. After a delicious appetizer, I chose to go with the taste of New Orleans, which contains Creole jambalaya, crawfish etouffée, red beans and rice with smoked sausage. What a mixture!! Every bit of it was worth every bite, but in particular, the jambalaya was some of the best I have ever tasted.

We finished this up with a great amaretto birthday cake, which was also provided by the restaurant. I hope I get the opportunity to eat here again!
I just love the flavor this place has. I love how I was able to find something on the menu, that wasnt seafood. For starters,  I had, a cup of red beans & rice. A small ceaser salad. Delicious.
Not the cleanest, comfiest, most convenient place to eat in or take out. Just saying .‍

I saw the Yelp reviews and I've never been here before so I was excited to try it. Tourist trap. 

We didn't wait long to get a table and the decor was nice. Servers were busy but you could tell all them were attentive. 

Me and my husband got seafood plates. I do not recommend the fish plate. It was chewy and does not taste authentic. All the great seafood in Louisiana, that is unacceptable. 

The drinks are not that good. They have a social media grab where the drinks bubble when you get them but I'm not sure what is going on bc after the first sip these drinks are horrible. 

Too many actual good places in NOLA for me to return here. Not sure what the big hype is about but if your from out of state (which is most of the people that surrounded us) you might like it.
The staff was great and the blackened chicken alfredo was phenomenal and the drinks were pretty delicious!

Fantastic food and amazing service. Our waiter, Errol, was attentive and friendly and seemed like the kind of guy you'd want to hang with in the quarter. For breakfast, Pain Perdu is a must. Like French toast on steroids. Also can't go wrong with the biscuits and gravy or the Cajun sausage breakfast.

My favorite dinner in NOLA. From the top-notch service to the quality and value of the food, this spot is the real deal. Their famous crab cake appetizer was substantial and tasty and the red fish specialty was so delicious that I had to keep stopping to marvel at the balance of flavors.  Move Oceana to the top of your culinary "to do" list!

This place is truly amazing, delicious good, great drinks their bartender really makes the drinks perfect, and the service was the best!!
The alligator bites were so good, I had to order a second time. The fried oysters were delicious, and when a kid can't stop eaten them is because they were amazing. 
Crab cakes were good as well. 
This place is must if your in New Orleans. 
A big thanks to Mike and Mary, there service was the best, ate here in two different days.

When I visit New Orleans I always have to eat here!  The food is always amazing! The service was spectacular.. Thanks to Errol! I had the oysters on the half shell and the crab cakes! Yasssss! This place is right off bourbon street on Conti! You can't miss it! The food is seasoned to perfection. I'd definitely recommend this place to everyone I know!

We visited this restaurant on Christmas Day. Considering it was a holiday, this restaurant was one of the few that was opened so I'm sure that affected the wait. When we walked up there was a line outside the door for people waiting to enter the restaurant. It didn't take that long to be seated (around 10-12 minutes). Even though they were really busy and had a full restaurant the entire time we were there, they managed to get our order out in a timely manner. 

I had the seafood gumbo and my husband had the blackened steak. The gumbo was really good. I cleaned the bowl. My husband ordered steak well done. Although it wasn't well done my husband still enjoyed it. It was more like medium well, with more pink than he is used to, but he really enjoyed it. 

We would definitely visit this restaurant again if we were to visit New Orleans.

If you find your way to Oceana's, you must get their Oceana's Famous Oysters! Go past the traditional oyster's on a half shell and order these. They are chargrilled and drenched in an amazing garlic and cream sauce. Some of the best in town by far.

The worst place to make a reservation. Their events planner, Courtney, messed up my reservation that was supposed to be on Christmas Day, and placed it for Christmas Eve. Now, my Christmas is ruined because she messed up my reservation and can't fix it. I will never make a reservation with this restaurant ever again!!

We came here for a late lunch. Luckily we were seated right away. We ordered fried shrimp platter and Mardi Gras pasta. Mardi Gras pasta was good but not great. Fried shrimp platter was disappointing. The batter was too thick, not seasoned. Shrimps were not fresh either. Overall, I won't recommend this overrated restaurant especially when there is a plenty of good restaurants in the area.

My family and I waited a bit in line, but it went by pretty fast. Before coming here I heard so many great things about this restaurant... and boy were they right!! The food was soooo delicious and the portions are a lot for a good price. Also our waiter was fantastic. He knew the menu very well, very attentive, and well mannered. I ordered the red fish oceana, Cajun fries, and the gator bites. All of them were just sooo good!! True Louisiana food.

I went here yesterday while on Bourbon St and this place was excellent. The whole staff greets and treats you like family as soon as you walk in. The atmosphere was amazing and made you feel at home. The food was great and they give you big portions as if your eating for 2. I would definitely return back on my next visit to New Orleans

Best Damn Catfish I've Ever Had !!!!!!!!!! 

I have been here at least ten times when I visit the Nolia. Blackened catfish with jambalaya and sauteed vegetables is the Bomb. I can't get enough of this place. Definitely worth stopping by if you hit up Bourbon St. It may be a hole in the wall but so are most establishments on Bourbon. I'd rather eat swell in a comfy spot than look pretty and eat at some tourist trap BS joint that N.O. is full of just like any other city.

Huge disappointment. Cute restaurant. Mediocre food and VERY small portions. Server never asked how we were enjoying meal. Understand why. Really wish we hadn't wasted a New Orleans meal here. Had Caesar salad which was small with lettuce and croutons. Redfish was dry and super boring. Passed on desert as life too short to have mediocre food and waitstaff in New Orleans.

Went here with a friend and I kept hearing from other friends how good the place is. I ordered crab cakes which I definately recommend. Not the best crab cakes but very good. My friend ordered fried oysters that came with this amazing parmesean sauce....simply delicious! 
definately recommend
Errol was a great waiter! 5 stars. Would go again.

A very affordable place that provides a variety of typical New Orleans dishes. The crab cake is a must-have. And the shrimp pasta is remarkable though the ingredient may be extremely fatty. But we are all tourists so who cares about calories. We had lunch and brunch here, and brunch is not as impressive though also satisfying. There are lines in front of almost any restaurant in New Orleans, so I recommend going to this place for your first or second meal. It offers all the things you want to try as a tourist, the food is pretty good, and does not entail a very long wait.

The Taste of New Orleans platter was amazing ! And to
Die for . Jambalaya, Sausage & Red beans and rice !!! Also best oysters ever and the charbroiled oysters in the sauce was a decadent mouthwatering experience !

OMG. THIS PLACE IS AMAZING.  Started with the oyster appetizer and the house sauce was delicious.  Ordered half rack of ribs and a side of fettuccine Alfredo.  Let me tell you- this Alfredo is criminally delicious. It's taste is obscene because you make the sounds meant to be heard  in Private. 

The fries were great but I had to ignore them because ... fettuccine. Sampled the jambalaya, red beans and rice and crawfish etouffie. All fabulous. Tried the alligator sausage and turns out it's spicy and good.  Do not hesitate to come here. You must come here. Bring your appetite. 

Angel was our server and did a great job. Attentive, helpful, good humored.

My friend and I decided to come here around 6 pm on a Friday. It was the only place we could find that had alligator meat. Everywhere else in the French quarter didn't or was way too busy. It was actually my first time eating alligator and I really enjoyed it. We got the gator bites half blackened half fried.  We also got some oysters as well that were delicious.  This place is on the dimmer side but customer service was great. Our waiter was very nice and friendly. He also really knew the dishes that they had and gave us a lot of recommendations. He even discussed items that weren't on the menu. Overall I would definitely be back, it's a nice place to chill, eat, and have a few beers.

Decent place but you can probably do better. The food was a bit bland (we had Po-Boys and the shrimp platter, and some dessert). The six-year-old left most of her hamburger. They honored the 10% Yelp discount only after being reminded, and then added18% gratuity to the bill. We were here early (5.30 pm) for dinner and there was no wait, but when we left it was easily a 50 ft line outside.
Mary( Murphy )the the server was sooooo nice . With soo much going on she still had a smile !!! Will definitely come back next time I come to this great city !!!

Good and drinks here are great. The fried shrimp and hurricanes are just right. Rome was our server and was awesome. We took advantage of a free dessert the next days  you come in coupon from our receipt the day earlier. The bread pudding was A+!

Here we are again at one of the top spots in 
Nola ! Fantastic food and simply the best service you will get anywhere in Nola .... 
We had the pleasure of meeting a top customer service rep Jamal . He was on from the time we sat down . Had the BbQ 
Shrimp , grilled oysters ( 2 plates ) 
Fried crawfish tails . Dinner the night before 
Blackened duck with a creole crawfish sauce and some of the best ribs I've ever tasted . 
The manager Tom was inviting and very helpful on places to go while on our trip . 
I can't rave enough about this place and the people that make it work !

yassss! First restaurant I tried in New Orleans and I am already so impressed by all the items I ordered. My family is visiting from Taiwan so we wanted to go to a local restaurant. I saw oceana grill is rated pretty well and everyone is down to get seafood. I made a reservation in advanced so we didn't have to wait at all. I know shortly after, there is a line outside waiting to get in the restaurant. 
Anyway, I got some recommendation from the waiter and we ordered the famous crab cakes and raw oyster as appetizers. Uh let me tell you, the crab cakes!! It's so good, the mushroom sauce goes so perfectly with them crab cakes. I didn't have any oyster but my brother and dad both seem to enjoy it! 
For entree I got redfish oceana, fried shrimps Poboys, jambalaya pasta, and praline duck to share. I really wish I can tell you what I like and what I don't like but they're seriously all amazing! If I have to pick one within the entree, it will probably be the redfish oceana! It's sooooo damn good :)! 
Oh and great service as well, I will definitely recommend to anyone looking to try new places!

My first place I every ate when I moved to Louisiana. Also the second place I loved it so much!Crab cakes and the red beans and rice w/sausage was my first order. Alligator is awesome and I've never had it prior.
If your staying at a hotel, ask to see if they have the 10% off coupon!

Oceana is a must! It is located right in the heart of downtown right off of Bourbon Street. As we walked in we were greeted promptly with the friendly host. On the left side you'll see a full bar. Our waitress Ashleigh was phenomenal. Her knowledge of the menu and all the specials were dead on! The appetizers were great but the food was so good I asked for the recipes  Also try the tropical storm cocktail. Instead of pineapple use sprite. It is the most refreshing drink for Southern New Orleans heat. We enjoyed every minute. Also the bus boys cleaned out table right after we took the last bite. What an experience! Wonderful place to visit

Oceana Grill is one of my new favorites!  I am addicted to their crab cakes, and their banana's foster ice cream cake is to die for :)  I love that it is casual, but has great food with good portions.  Will definitely be a regular stop for me in the French Quarter. I have also been here for the Pain Perdue during brunch, which happened to be during a pre-game radio broadcast for the Saints.  Great atmosphere to have a drink and some food before heading down to the game. I will be back!

Stopped by for dessert and drinks. Good service, strong drinks, and good creme brule. 

Pro tip: skip the giant line and eat at the bar (full menu). No need to stand in line.
Good local fare. Those who had the Alfredo loved it. Duck was a little on the dry side. Sides were delicious. Checked in on Yelp for a nice discount.

Wow, so disappointed. We started with appetizers which were only warm and that was the best thing about them. The BBQ shrimp was over cooked and you got 5 shrimp for 12 bucks. The crab cakes were better but were more breading than crab. Our drinks were super weak and after 5 drinks and 6 appetizers we spent over a hundred bucks. Left there and went back to the Hyatt. Way more expensive but but great drinks and food.

We visited the quarter for an Anniversary day getaway. After a few referrals from friends we decided to try out Oceana. We were not disappointed. We arrived and waited in line maybe 5-7 minutes which wasn't long seeing that it was lunch time. Jamal was our server he was kind,calm and made me feel very welcomed. I had a tropical storm to start with it was wonderful and tasted exactly like you would expect with pineapple and coconut flavors without being overly strong and overwhelmed with alcohol. For our appetizer we got the Oceana chargrilled oysters. These were the best oysters over ever eaten(I am a Louisiana girl so I've eaten my share). As Entrees I decided to go ahead and get an appetizer of crab cakes and a side of red beans.My husband got the special of blackened Ahi tuna with greens and jambalaya. We each sampled one another's dishes the greens were the best I've ever eaten same with the beans it tasted like someone's grandmother was cooking and the crab cakes were full of real  lump crab meat. We will most certainly be back. I'm counting the days.

We can't think of anything bad to say about our visit to Oceana this past weekend.  

Our new friend Keith over at Johnny White's (hole in the wall) recommended it and we're glad he did.

Not only was the food good (following) but the service was FRIENDLY, fast and attentive.  Lacy was just awesome and obviously works her tush off!  Thank you, Lacy!

Food:  I enjoyed the Ribeye Steak (die-hard red meat fan here) with Shrimp sauce.  Good cut of steak; not great, but good and nicely flavored and well prepared.  Wife had the blackened Aji Tuna which was just off the charts in terms of outright delicious, intense pan-seared flavors; sweet, salt and spice all in one!  My bro had the Crawfish Etouffe which was truly delicious with a mouthful of crawfish in that wonderful sauce!  My sis enjoyed the seafood pasta (Fettucini?) special that was overwhelmed with shrimp, crawfish, red-fish, mussels and clams in a well-balanced cream sauce.  Yum!

Dessert was Pecan Pie; nice, not "oh my God" great, but satisfying (note: PLEASE start keeping some 'Nilla ice cream on hand!)  The Chocolate Mousse was closer to gustatory orgasm, however and is well recommended!

Dinner for four WITH drinks AND dessert and with no reservations came to about $40 per person with tip.  In my book that is reasonable for the friendly service and good food!

Also, they're the only place we found in the 1/4 with XRated Vodka; a nice plus!  Cheers!

PS:  We placed an order on Sunday from Johnny White's and enjoyed some of the best fried shrimp we've EVER had!!!  How do they do that?
Great experience! Ghost fries are amazing! Cocktails were delicious! Bread pudding to die for!!!!

Jerry our waiter was great and so was the food. He gave some great recommendations and I ended up with a tasty and strong blended "Hulk" drink and some AWSOME fried crawfish tails. My friend got the Oceana Red Snapper which was also great. Thanks again Jerry for the awesome service. (He even hooked us up with some tour flyers to get our trip started right) check this place out on a Monday afternoon and you might not have to wait in line.
Do tryout the blackened gator bites, jambalaya and bread pudding! They were fantastic!

All I can say is delicious! They chicken  Fettuccine  Alfredo Was the best I ever had.  My nephew had the Cajun gumbo pasta and he was very impressed with it. My way truce was extremely friendly. And I love the atmosphere! One of my favorite places to eat in New Orleans.

Tried the eggs with eggplant, hollandaise sauce, ham and cheese. They were great. Who would have thought eggplant and eggs would be so good together. Had a fantastic Bloody Mary to boot. Our waiter was super nice and patient.
Best dinner of my life! The shrimp Alfredo is delicious. Best Alfredo sauce I've ever had!

Ok, was on business and exhausted from the day and ended up here after everything was done.  My friend and I walked in and sat at the bar just to grab something quick and head back to the hotel.  I couldn't even make a decision on what to eat, so I asked the bartender what she recommended and she said... something? But when I asked where to find it, she said "oh honey, that's not on the menu".

I still don't know what it was, but OH MY GOODNESS!!!! That was best meal that week!

It's ok. I was there with a large group so we had to pick from a pre-arranged menu. The redfish was not seasoned that great but the barbeque shrimp was delish. Salad was nothing to write home about. The service team wasn't prepared for the group of 20 because they were really slow and mixed up a lot of orders. Maybe if I went with smaller group and was able pick from the larger menu it would have been better.
Pretty good spot. Drinks were good and I had the shrimp Po-Boy. I would recommend this location to anyone traveling to New Orleans
Excellent service and food! We arrived just before 6:00 pm on a Friday evening and were seated immediately (party of 4). The Charbroiled oysters here are fantastic!
Best jambalaya, red beans and rice we have had in NOLA. clean and had a short wait to get in - friendly staff.

There aren't that many dining options on Bourbon street after midnight.  I was hungry so I dropped by for some fried alligator and gumbo.  The fried alligator was really tasty... large chunks of tender fried gator w/ a tangy dipping sauce.   The gumbo was just ok, it tasted a little old, but maybe it could be that it was late and from the bottom of the pot?  

Oceana Grill was featured(?) on the season finale of Kitchen Nightmares season 4.  I would not have dined here if I had watched that episode but I have to admit the food was not as bad as depicted on the show.  After looking at my food pics, they did not use Gordon Ramsey's new gumbo recipe which makes me wonder about what's really going on in that kitchen...  dine w/ caution?
Blackened chicken and bread pudding were great. The jumbalaya rice could've been better. The rice didnt taste fresh. Almost like an instant rice.

I'd choose this place over Acme any day.  Everything at Acme kinda disappointed to be honest.  Oceana was everything I wanted Acme to be.  Apparently Oceana is family owned and
Acme is corporate.  We had the po boy, jambalaya, crawfish etoufee and red beans and rice.  Everything was perfect except the kids cheeseburger.  That was huge and dry in IMO but I found this true of burgers here.

Best alligator poboy! Service is great and fast. I ventured out and got the special which was blackened redfish over a cornbread mash and spicy creamed corn on the side. It was a great meal! Also, the hurricanes here were excellent. There's a reason the line is so long. Also, if you check in on Yelp, you get a discount.

Lawd Have mercy!! This was worth the entire trip to Nawlins. Our server Chris recommended the taste of New Orleans and the crab cakes. Huntey let me tell you , Best dawn crab cakes I've ever encountered in my life!! And I've had crab cakes all over the world.And as for the taste of New Orleans entree dish whew! That crawfish etoufee (forgive the misspelling ) 
Was amazing ! Thank you for a wonderful meal and experience. Chris is awesome.

This place is incredible. The service was incredible, Whitney was our server and she was very attentive and able to answer all questions we had about food. I had the Blackened Cajun Jambalaya Pasta and it was incredible. The Alligator Bites half fried, half blackened and it was DIVINE. The frozen Jameson coffee drink was delicious and not only cured my hangover, but gave me the pep I needed to continue to conquer Bourbon street. I would 150% revisit this place next time I'm in town.

We were told that Oceana is the go-to place for good cajun cuisine while visiting the French Quarters. Our group of 8 had to wait for about 40 mins outside, but the hostess was very nice and the line went quickly!  Our server, Mary, took great care of us. When asked, she helped to guide our food choices and spoke highly of the menu items! I chose the shrimp plate and added crawfish, with jambalaya as my side. I also ordered gumbo. I must admit, I wasn't very impressed by the gumbo or the jambalaya which came with a weird red sauce on top. But the seafood was delicious. Mary highly suggested the special which was like a grilled fish topped with lemon butter shrimp and a side of mustard greens. I wish I'd gotten that...ohhhhh soooo good! One of my group mates got the ribs, and that seemed to be a hit as well! The food is great (depending on your selected choice), the ambiance is nice and the staff is friendly and accommodating! I'd say if you've never tried Oceana, give it a shot.  It's definitely worth a try... and if the greens are on the menu, go for it!

I wanted some great New Orleans Cajun / creole food so I asked around. Of the few people at my hotel and locals I came across, they all mentioned this place. I honestly had one of the best meals in years. The atmosphere was great and the service was great. I started off with the red beans 5stars. Then ordered the fried seafood platter 6 stars. And closed it out with the bread pudding that was so good I actually ordered 2. Great food especially for the Cost. This restaurant is a must if you're visiting New Orleans

Got mostly apps and food was pretty good. Gator bites hit the spot and cajun fries were solid. Oceana oysters are chargrilled, but they were still pretty jiggly and i like them cooked a bit more like they are at bourbon. Crab cakes were on the bready side and not great. I would give 3.5 stars if i could. Solid place, not amazing.

Incredible. Ordered the Crawfish etoffee, shrimp creole (off the menu), Mardi gras pasta, soft shell crab side, fried Crawfish side, bananas fosters dessert, creme brulee and the world's BIGGEST oysters when we ordered their famous char grilled garlic oysters. Sauce was amazing and our waitress Kim was incredible. She was wonderful to us. We'll be back for sure!!!

We decided to try this place after seeing a crowd of people out side their door, waiting to go in.  I have to admit, their service isn't the greatest, and the ambiance isn't glamorous, but the food was worth it. 

We decided to eat on the balcony so we can eat and be entertained by the crazies roaming the streets.  We split a pound of boiled crawdads and "Taste of N.O." which was a platter of crawdad ettouffe, red beans, rice, jambalaya, and sausage.  Contrary to some of the reviews below, i thought the ettouffe was pretty good.  Red beans and sausage were AWESOME, jambalaya was ok.  We were going to pass on dessert but tried the bread pudding on the waitress' recommendation.  She wasn't the nicest gal, but she earned her tip when she recommended that dessert.  It was the highlight of the entire meal.

I would definitely go back on our next trip, just for the boiled crawdads and bread pudding alone.  If the ambiance and service turns you off, I'd definitely recommend sitting on the balcony to get distracted by the view.
The food was average and the server was constantly trying to upsell in a sleazy way. The po-boy was entirely bread with a tiny amount of fish. I would go somewhere else unless you're starving.
The service was awesome!  I tried the blackened redfish and it was really good.  I wasn't a big fan of the broccoli Mac n cheese.  Other than that everything was really good.

I was pleasantly surprised by this restaurant.  I was actually expecting it to be mediocre given how commercialized it was for the area, but the meal we had was very good!  It could be that the food was good due to our lack of protein from post-alcohol recovery, but I thoroughly enjoyed my cajun seafood alfredo. Companions opted for the oyster po boy along with catfish po boy and both also gave high compliments for the po boys.  Highly recommend and check in for the 10% off!  Staff was superrrrrrrr nice as well.

My honey and I went to MSY as a last minute trip to bring in 2015, and what do you do when you're on holiday?  EAT!  We were told about this restaurant by the Concierge at the Hyatt Regency and he hit the mark - bullseye!

It started with their Ragun' Cajun Bloody Mary which had pickled green beans.  YES, pickled green beans!  I could have just eaten them to be honest; however, then came the entree's.  The Fried Seafood Platter and Taste of New Orleans..YUMMY!!!  Ohhhh, let's see, the Platter...the texture of the seafood, the seasoning, the batter...just YUMMY!  Then I had the Taste of NO and the rice was fluffy, the sausage wasn't overbearing and, well, all I can say is...YUMMY!  To top it off, the waiter was great and not just because he has family in our neck of the woods, Southern California.  For those who have an experience less than what I've posted, I'm sorry for you because our experience was AWESOME!  We will be back!

Had a great time eating here twice for dinner and once for brunch while in town for my wedding. Everywhere else for a large table was too busy for the two night time meals and would've never got us back as fast as Oceana Grill! For a party of 17 one night (a Friday) we only had to wait about 20 minutes! They have lots of room downstairs and upstairs and are a quick turnaround crew. They were very sweet and gave me and my fiancé congratulations dessert! We passed around the whole table, it was a bread putting and so good!

My only complaint is that they change the menu for the weekend and the prices increase, and they don't have the same sides available for people to know that they can do ala cart (on that weekend menu).

Very tasty food, they are able to make a vegetarian po boy for my fiancé with eggplant fries- So everyone was happy :-)

Get the shrimp n gator po boy!! Briana was the sweetest waitress I've met yet on Bourbon Street. 

Drinks came quick. Go for the double. Just do the double.

Sorry, but my review has gone downhill just like the restaurant. My review is based on the food. The service was good, nice table, quick service, and caring staff. But the food was just awful. 

I had the Louisiana Crabmeat Cake served with crawfish, mushroom and cream sauce. It was nothing like it was last year. We didn't finish eating that. Next I ordered Fried Shrimp, mashed potatoes, coleslaw, and Hushpuppies. Those were the worst Fried Shrimp and Hushpuppies I'd ever had. There was way too much breading on the Shrimp.  Even when I pulled off the breading, the shrimp were like rubber. The shrimp and Hushpuppies also tasted like they had been fried in OLD grease. 

I complained to our waiter and he immediately grabbed my plate and brought out the chef. They were both apologetic, and he wanted to fix me another order. It only took him a few minutes and the chef brought me out a new plate piled high with shrimp. Unfortunately they tasted the same. Apparently these are not fresh shrimp, but frozen.
