The breading was the same and the grease tastes the same. Hard to believe I'm sitting in a restaurant on the Gulf and get frozen shrimp. 

I'm glad the chef and waiter offered to help and both went out of their way to accommodate me. But there was no fixing those yucky, frozen , over breaded shrimp. 

Sorry... But I won't be back again. 

BTW.... You get 10% off with a Yelp Coupon. Wish it was 100% off.

Fantastic meal and great service. There are so many dining choices in NOLA. Do yourself a favor and eat at Oceana Grill. Blackened redfish was incredible. Fresh southern seafood at its finest!!! Also, they had good options for my kids who don't care for seafood. We will be back!

Very good meal even with takeout. In the heart of the quarter right off Bourbon St.

Cajun Jambalaya Pasta - highlight of the meal in my mind. recommend ordering, flavorful yet not too heavy
Crawfish Etouffee - very good, full of flavor yet not too salty
Red Beans and Rice - very good, full of flavor. beans were well-cooked yet not too soft
Gumbo - pretty good, generous with the ingredients but flavor is lacking
Crabmeat Cakes - they were okay... nothing to sneeze about
Chargrilled oysters - not even close to as good as Drago's.. would not recommend ordering here

I LOVED the oysters here - I've never had more fresh and fatter ones in the states before! If you like any form of oysters, I would highly recommend ordering them at this place. The seafood platter consisted of a mixture of fried seafood - very delicious and fried to the perfect level! Definitely call ahead for reservations because we were able to skip the line. This location is also located within the French Quarter so there is opportunity to walk around afterwards after a very filling meal.
Terrible food. The oysters were disgusting. Definitely not fresh. Sorry, Eddie. Not cool to not notice us not eating our food.
The food here is "fresh frozen."  The fish and crab cakes that I sampled all had the quality from your local Wal-Mart's freezer section.  For the price, avoid.

My favorite restraint at in New Orleans...I HAVE to go when I'm in town! The gator app is perfect (I get half & half) and this time, I got a special stuffed redfish meal with crawfish etouffee and a side of soft shell crab....heaven.

AMAZING!!
You cannot leave New Orleans without trying the redfish house dish! I would eat that everyday if I could, and I also loved every aspect of the service

Many people talk about how great this place is I definitely don't see how. Being new to Yelp I don't want to seem like the person to complain but my goodness get it together. Service was terrible....especially to see yall were busy. Then you have these thug people walking around almost like they were looking for something being sneaky. Waited 25 minutes for drinks which the drinks were watery n horrible. On to the food I'm just going to say this trying three different things n they were all cold n flavorless I gave up paid my bill another 15 minutes then to top it off the server tried to put a 20% gratuity. I don't think so. Worse experience. NEVER AGAIN

So glad my friend told us to try Oceana. We didn't want anything fried so we were happy to see blackened fish and tuna on the menu. Our waitress was Taylor and she was very nice, attentive and helpful with selecting items from the menu. We started with oysters on the half shell which were delicious. For our entree I had blackened red fish topped with this delicious crawfish sauce on top. This was so good! The greens as a side were so good we got another side to go. My husband got the tuna medium rare topped with shrimp and it was also very good. We ended up packing up half and taking it back to our hotel. Would definitely come back.

I would give the food a 4/5; had the charbroiled oysters. They were delicious and the sauce was outstanding but a little overwhelming. The Taste of New Orleans was perfectly done. 
What brings this rating to a 5 was the amazing customer service, especially on the part of our server, Natalie. She was extremely attentive, welcoming and warm. She brought the dining experience full circle!

I love the blackened shrimp poboy from here. It's the best I found in New Orleans.

Be sure to check out the back patio if the weather is great.

After reading the other reviews I expected a wait. I guess 3 pm on a hot July day is the time to come. We walked right in and were quickly greeted by Lloyd our waiter. Drinks (yummy spicy Bloody Mary and the Tropical Storm) were right on point. Our food came quickly as well, everything was tasty - we had the crab cakes, house oysters and gumbo. All that was missing was a huge loaf of French bread to sop up the remainder of the sauce from the oysters so as not to leave a drop. Bananas foster ice cream cake and a hurricane round off the meal. If we were locals I know we would visit here often.
What the hell did I just eat?  I looked at reviews and came here and oh my god...disgusting, junk food. Everything was deep fried, fatty, and greasy.

My dad and I were visiting from out of town, and like anyone new to a city, we came immediately to Yelp to find our first dinner spot. We were initially sold on how casual the atmosphere seemed. We arrived around 5pm on a Saturday and waited no more than 10 minutes to be seated. Be warned there are 3-4 floors and narrow stairs (I'm unsure if there is ADA accessibility to the upper floors). Our waitress was Jamie and she was delightful. I ordered a blackened chicken po'boy with fries and my dad ordered BBQ shrimp with a side salad. The food was fresh and hot and very expedient. The manager stopped by to ask how everything was. The prices were also very reasonable (each meal was around $15). All in all, a great first stop in New Orleans!

Would definitely recommend Oceana. Great location and even better food. If you can, ask for Errol to be your server. He's amazing! I had the crab cakes as an appetizer. They were filled with crabmeat in every bite unlike other places I had been and topped with an awesome Cajun/creamy crawfish & mushroom sauce. I also had the catfish lafouche. It was cooked to perfection and laid over a bed of jambalaya topped off with that same Cajun/creamy crawfish & mushroom & fried crawfish tails. So much flavor and a great atmosphere!

This was our first food stop in New Orleans. Our favorite part of the meal was the Cajun Fries, they are a must. The sauce on the fries was on point! The Fried Shrimp Po'Boy was good, but the fries stole the show! My husband had blackened Shrimp pasta and it was very good as well. The sauce, again, was amazing. The casual atmosphere is good for anytime of day, and is great for families.

Visiting from the city of Houston. Our hotel recommended this restaurant and we couldn't of been happier! The food was absolutely delicious and the wait staff was absolutely remarkable. They really went out of their way to make us feel welcomed! We were here for five days and ate here twice! That's really saying something! The atmosphere was absolutely perfect. Do yourself a favor make sure you stop in if you're visiting, you won't be disappointed!

Came to the Oceana Grill for dinner with the wife on a Monday evening. This was one of the places a coworker had recommended I try while in New Orleans. We got to the restaurant around 6 pm before heading out for an 8 pm tour. There was no line at the door and we were seated promptly on the second floor of the restaurant. We were tucked away in a side room with a few other people, which was nice because it wasn't so loud. Our waitress, Breeann, was great! Since I had already sampled po-boys at a couple of other restaurants, I decided to try the Taste of New Orleans. It included red beans and rice, jambalaya, and crawfish etouffee. I had a couple of big easy IPAs to with my meal. Everything tasted fantastic, and I wish I could have had seconds! I also tried some of my wife's fries and they were bad ass too! Plus, we got 10% off thanks to Yelp! I would definitely recommend this place, you should give it a try.

Excellent food! Had the barbeque shrimp with mashed potatoes and the tastiest garlic bread! Had a hurricane and strawberry margarita on the rocks! Great! Wonderful service with Dori -- very friendly and polite! Will definitely recommend and visit again when in town.

Amazing food!! I lucked out with Sierra as my server and she was a godsend. She gave me the best and most honest recommendations. Even though she was clearly busy, she never made me feel ignored or rushed. I was also dining alone and occasionally I can see the lack of effort dealing with a solo diner! But again, she did the exact opposite! I honestly don't know what was better - having her serve me or the food!
Had an amazing time!! Bree was wonderful and made our bride to be feel so special! Great food and drinks. Excellent service!
Very good service by Jordan the food was outstanding. I had the shrimp platter that had at least 20 fried shrimp, fries and cold slaw.
This spot was okay. Reminded me of a Joe's Crab Shack or a bubba gump shrimp. The desserts were good though!

We found Oceana on our last trip down to New Orleans because it was a few doors down from our hotel.  What a great find!   Gumbo and crab cakes are incredible.  On this trip, it was our first meal and by far the best.  Again, we had the gumbo and crab cakes.   We even tried breakfast on our last day in New Orleans, the omelets are great too.

Waiter was nice.  Food not so good.   If your stumbling in off of Bourbon St.half drunk you'll probably find the food ok.

Desserts suck.

Food was okay got the  pasta with the shrimp and crawfish. It wasn't bad but for $25 it was wayyyyy to overpriced for just okay pasta. Service was slow waited 45 min for our food and when I go my pasta  I pointed out to the waiter there was not any bell peppers or onions in my pasta as stated on the menu. Then he proceeded to point  at some green specs on my plate and says they cut it up finely and I looked at him and said that's parsley. 15 min later I finally got my veggies. Overall nice decor but food was way to over
Priced $15 for two crab cakes???? It was a little disappointing because we had been eating a whole in the wall restaurants our whole vacation and had the most amazing food, and on our last night we wanted to dress up and go somewhere nice. Oh well

Have been to Oceana Grill twice and have had a pleasant experience on both occasions. We were seated in less than 15 minutes and the staff was all around friendly and caring. Food is good and so are the prices. I had the seafood fried platter and it was very good. Portions were large (enough for two people), flavors were great and food came out promptly. We also had the blackened duck and fettuccine Alfredo and both were a hit with my family members, especially the duck. I love the kindness of the waiters and hosts, they make you feel right at home and are very knowledgeable of the menu and actually encourage to try New Orlean's traditional flavors. I did not give it 5 stars because I have really high standards instead of flavors. But Oceana's is always a good place to eat at and it is right in the French Quarter so no need to go far from where the fun is at.

My impression of this restaurant has always been that it was a tourist spot, but not a tourist trap. I heard the food was not bad. So I went to check it out. The atmosphere is like any family restaurant in America. Nothing special. The tables are bunched together. And of course, there's the big flat screen TV everywhere.  I guess the brick walls kind of remind you you're in the French Quarter. The food was either fried or in heavy cream. Nothing really healthy on the menu. The portions were small, the prices were high. The pastas came with no sides, just a couple of small pieces of french bread. On the positive, the food was good. So if you eat here, you will like the food. If you have a healthy appetite, you'll need to order an appetizer and maybe a desert to be full. My main issue with this place is the small portions.

Wow wow wow! The Cajun fries were heaven! All cheese fries should taste like this! My wife loved the chargrilled oysters and our main course was  the seafood platter! All so so good! Great atmosphere, good music, fantastic staff and not a  bad wait time! Definitely would recommend and for sure will be back!

This is my first time eating here and I loved it. The atmosphere was good and the staff was knowledgeable of the food and courteous. I ate the crawfish étouffée and it was one of the best I've ever had. I would recommend this place for anyone looking for a relaxed atmosphere.

My first taste of Louisiana cuisine, and I wasn't disappointed! The shrimp Po-boy was delicious! The service is great, and the atmosphere with open windows makes it even better. Had the barbecue shrimp as an appetizer and the barbecue sauce had just the right amount of flavor. Definitely give this place a try!

1st stop in New Orleans was to Oceana Grill! Ron was our waiter and was great! He recommended two great dishes and around of great drinks!! Red Fish Dish & Sea Food Pasta!!! 

Great Meal & Great Waiter !!! Would for sure come again.

We stayed at the Royal Sonesta across the street and always saw a line to get in. Since my husband and I had some time to spare before our flight we figured why not. We did have to wait in a short line nothing compared to what we had seen before. Once we got inside the place is huge almost three stories. The staff was so friendly and helpful and the food was great however if you are looking for more of a mom and pop restaurant this is not it. The taste of New Orleans was delish the Crawfish Jambalaya was to die for and the red beans and rice was so flavorful. The french fries so crispy! I love french fires! I stuffed myself with my husbands fries from his shrimp poboy. The poboy could have been smaller there was a lot of food, enough for 2 or 3 people to share. We were so stuffed that we didn't order dessert. When we left the line was 3 times as long. If you are looking for good food on Bourbon street to get away from the craziness this was a good stop! Thanks for the meal! - #thehermosavida aka The Beautiful Life

The food was surprisingly delicious. We came for lunch. The place, like most places in the French quarter looks run down. We only saw the bar from the outside so that wasn't appealing for our family, initially. But we were tired and hot... I'm so glad to have given this place a chance! Food is tops, service was great!

Got food delivered to Hilton Riverside.

Blackened Catfish Platter with fried craw fish tails was pretty good but the fish was a little bit too wet. I imagine it would be better served in a restaurant.

The salad with blackened shrimp was absolutely amazing. Will get it again if I come back to NOLA.

Delivery was supposed to be 45 minutes to an hour. Showed up in 20. They wouldn't deliver oysters.

Will order again next time I need a late nite snack. The food is way better than Hilton Riverside's room service.

Have never had a worse salad in my life. The lettuce was both wilted or FROZEN, it was like biting into ice, or better yet I found a small hair in my dressing. Really?! I ordered to go, maybe they were careless thinking I'd walk out and notice later (being too late to complain). Never again.

I would suggest you visit for the ambiance. My boyfriend and I had the pasta and it was "good", not outstanding. Yet I think we should have ordered a more local dish.  All-in-all; it is worth the visit! The staff members were very friendly:)

Very nice restaurant for the area.  Not too fancy, but really good food.  A decent selection for a seafood restaurant. Had a little wait for eating at 8:00 pm, but was seated fairly quickly.  Looks like the place can accommodate large groups or individuals. Red fish was great and my wife loved the shrimp alfredo.

Service was good. Food was ok for me.   Blackened Catfish was good.  My husband enjoyed his blackened chicken po boy. Hurricane drink is definitely Fun! Lunch time is the BEST time to go if you like calm.

Over 10 mins just to get soft drinks and water. Food came out and 2 in our group of 6 had issues. Shrimp platter was cold. Steak was over cooked. After wait staff was told about the shrimp it was Re-fried and the rest was put under a heat lamp. At that point it was uneatable. Management was very hospitable at addressing the issue and the dishes that did come out correctly were great.

This place is right off of Bourbon Street in downtown New Orleans so naturally one wouldn't think that such an outstanding restaurant would be located here.  I've passed this place several times without giving it a second thought and one day saw a promotion through Yelp and decided to try it out.  I can't explain how pleased I was at the overall experience of dining here.  They accommodated my entire family even our little 3month old son without any problems and made it truly a pleasureable expirience to eat here.

Oceana is a must !! You'll smell nothing but goodness leading you down the street from a block away! My friends and I came during lunch last Friday... everything we ordered was nothing less than amazing...

We shared the fried platter...everything was delicious! The jambalaya pasta was amazing... Po boy was good... they had a king crab special which was awesome.

Pro tip: upgrade the fries, you won't regret it!! The sauce and the crawfish on top take it to another level.

For dessert, have the banana foster, it's out of this world !

Our server Megan was great... friendly and attentive! 

I would definitely return on my next trip :)

This place was so amazing that we went back for breakfast the next morning! Grilled oysters were delicious! The Alfredo sauce on the pasta dishes is the best I've ever had - along with the shrimp and crab cakes!!! And Derrick is the BEST waiter!

Stopped in here on a whim and really enjoyed the food.  I had the red beans and rice- which was very good- the texture was more like refried beans, which I didn't mind at all.  There was also a spicy sausage in there as well which was very good.  My husband had steak and shrimp that was covered in their crayfish sauce and he said it was one of the best steaks he's had in a long time.   Very good.

We stopped at Oceana for a late breakfast. The bloody Mary's were good although a little salty to my taste, the Crab cake eggs Benedict dish was great as well as the Cajun breakfast. Errol our server was great too.

I would like to give Oceana Grill 3.5 stars because the food was average, but the oysters were excellent. I am a Yelp-a-holic, so I spent a significant amount of time looking for an affordable, high rated seafood restaurant for my boyfriend and I to go to during our trip to NOLA.  Oceana Grill had consistently good reviews so we decided to give it a try. Disclaimer, my boyfriend and I are a bit of foodies, as we lived in Chicago and experienced some truly amazing food.  However, the food at Oceana did not meet our expectations considering their high reviews.

I do want to mention again, the oysters were excellent. I would definitely go back for the oysters because they were fresh, large, and very affordable. If you are looking for a good oyster bar, this is your place. For the main course, I ordered the Redfish Oceana since it was listed as a specialty dish and my boyfriend ordered the Shrimp Creole. We shared our dishes. The red fish was overcooked and since it had a little bit of a breading, it was dry. The sauce with the crayfish on top was good, but did not have a ton of flavor. It tasted kind of like gravy. If the dish was $10-12 I would have been satisfied, but the red fish was $20.  I expect much more out of a $20 dish. The Shrimp Creole straight up tasted like shrimp in Speghettio sauce. Seriously, it brought me back to my youth but not in a good way.  It had no real "cajun flavor".  The previous day we had eaten a similar dish at The World Famous N'Awlins Cafe in the French Market and it was light years better at half the price. 

Overall, go there for the oysters, but I would not recommend the seafood dishes.  It seemed to be overpriced for what you actually got.
El po boy estaba bueno. No probé más nada pero el lugar es bien Chevere. El servicio excelente
Visited the restaurant on 9/15. Whitney was our waitress. And we enjoyed everything that she recommended. Will definitely be going back!!!!

As a first timer to NOLA My hotel sent us to Oceana and it was excellent and everything I wanted my first meal to be - I had the crab cake - rich and delicious and the price terrific for what we ordered. Our server Ashleigh helped us make good food decisions and delivered quickly.

i came here twice, both  times i had the crawfish etouffee. the first time it was GREAT the second time was so, so. It could be due to the fact crawfish was not in season so i guess it was frozen crawfish. I will go back when crawfish season is about

Outstanding seafood. The chargrilled oysters are a must! The crab cakes and red beans were some of the best we've had. We went there two days in a row, and some of our friends actually went three days in a row. Also, if you aren't in a drinking mood, try the sweet tea!

This place was perfect for my family :)
Husband, 19 y daughter, 11 y son, & myself. Prices are what I expected to pay in the French Quarter but we splurged! We ordered Taste of New Orleans, to share( it came split ) seafood platter-fried + crawfish tails, BBQ bacon burger, spinach ravioli in Oceania sauce- soooo dang gooood!- gator tail bites, 1 slice pecan pie & 1 bread puddin, 3 teas & 1 root beer float- checked in yelp, saved 10% and paid $98 smackeroos!

The portions are aplenty and flavorful. We are absolutely satisfied and leaving FULL & satisfied :)

Tip well here because these servers are attentive, and work fast! Don't be a cheap-o. Enjoy your time out here Nawlins!

I ventured in for the second time tonight and the food was great!  I find the menu items to be kind of creative and very delicious.  What really got my attention, this go around, was my martini.  I got a classic and it tasted just right with two nice big olives.

I got started with the charbroiled oysters which had just the right flavor and charbroiled taste to complete the flavors.  The oysters come in a cream sauce and they are pretty big.

The first time I went, my main course was a scrumptious fish dish, and tonight I switched gears to a steak dinner with a side of Jambalaya and a sauteed veggies.  Good steak and even better Jambalaya!  Even the veggies knocked my socks off.

The one thing that kind of concerned me was it took a while for the hostess to seat the group in front of me, but it wasn't a deal breaker at all.  The location (right off Bourbon Street) is great for entertaining folks from out of town, so I say it's a winner.

We went for a late dinner around 10:00 and got seated immediately. It was still pretty crowded but the food came out fast. I got the sampler with Gumbo, shrimp etouffee, and red beans and rice. It was delicious and well portioned. A little over-priced but it's right off bourbon, so that is to be expected. My husband got a Po-Boy and was disappointed with the lack of flavor.

I rely on other reviews so rarely post a bad one. My weekend trip to Oceana was horrid, one of the worst meals I have had and I travel 100 days per year.  Nothing was good so after stale bread, oysters that tasted bad/were gritty, and tough, we left.  We had several other items that were cold and tasteless.  Meal was closer to a "1" than a "3."

This was the best restaurant of all the food we tried in new Orleans. The redfish was seasoned very well and very tasty. It is a fun environment with friendly service. If I'm in new Orleans I would definitely go back.

Recommended by the valet at our hotel who gave us some discount coupons to use.

Went on a Monday evening, fairly early, so only had about a 15 minute wait. I suspect they try to keep a line outside to generate interest from passerbys as there were plenty of open tables when we were seated upstairs in this surprisingly large and laid back place. 

First note - service was OUTSTANDING from start to finish! May have the best ever in my experience. Attentive, timely, but not intrusive. 

Our smallish group went with several plates of the blackened redfish etouffee, a steak (ordered well done despite screams of protest by other members of the group!), and my crab cake pasta. 

Appetizer plates shared of gator bites, both black and gold, and alligator sausage. The bites were okay (slightly chewy taste like chicken), but the sausage was really good and a generous portion.

I was initially going with the same redfish selection but after asking was confirmed that it is a bit heavy on green peppers (anathema!). The etouffee I sampled was outrageously good and had a big kick to it as well. The crab cake was very well balanced in flavor with the crab forefront and not overwhelmed at all with onion (an issue I often find with crab cakes).

Also ordered a category 5 hurricane which was delivered strong, but a little lacking in volume as it ran out much too quickly!  

Had a fantastic time at a surprisingly affordable cost.

I have to be honest and say that the waiting outside was not the best experience, but it was well worth it once we got seated. They also have apparently evolved from N'Awlins Cookery into Oceana Grill, but I don't care what they call it, it is a great place to eat. The service was QUICK and the food was DELICIOUS! We both started with a cup of Seafood Gumbo, AWESOME!! For the main meal I had the Fried Shrimp Platter that was spicy and scrumptious, and my husband had Shrimp Fettuccine that he votes as the best he ever had. ( and he orders fettuccine often) It doesn't look like much from the outside, but there is a reason you would stand in line... it's worth it.

Been living in New Orleans for over 40 years and should have known better than to eat in the French Quarter. The Ceasar salad we got was a kids meal size. And the red fish was not fresh. Very disappointed!!
had an amazing breakfast!  the "French toast" is amazing!  Love the Royal Omelette!  service was great - very friendly and efficient!
This place was recommended by some of my friends..... THE PLACE WAS GREAT!!! The wait staff at the door and bartender was very polite.  I really love the atmosphere and the vibe.

Food is great!!!!!! Servers are outstanding!!! Seafood is fresh and full of flavor!!!!! If you watch Chef Ramsey, this is one of the resturants he visited, revamped the menu and interior. Love this place!!!!! The seafood platter and chicken fettuchini are my fav!!! The restaurant has an upstairs dining that you are able to overlook the Quarters while dining; such a beautiful view. The upstairs dining area closes at a certain time at nught, so then there is a wait for seating.
One of my favorite places to eat at in NOLA the food is always fresh and good. Service is always great as well

PAMELA was A.MA.ZING.
hands down the warmest, most hospitable lady.
she made you feel very at home, making great recommendations and being a true host.

recommend the redfish lafouche & ultimate seafood platter!

Food was good but gumbo/etoufee could have been spicier. Bbq shrimp was really good and famous oysters were awesome with sauce they put on them. Better than the Rockefeller but they were good as well. Service was good too.

Can I give just 2.5 stars? Reading some of the other reviews, it appears service is hit or miss when dining here.  We were greeted and seated promptly and then it went downhill from there.  The waiter came quicly (which I normally like) but we hadn't even decided on drinks yet so we hastly ordered some drinks and an appetizer of the alligator bites.  The drinks took about 10 minutes to arrive and the waiter took our order.  The alligator bites arrived soon after an they were "meh" - a little overcooked so that they were chewey but they weren't that bad.  And then we waited.  And waited.  And waited for our entrees.  About 40 minutes later our food arrived.  Mind you, this was a party of 2 so it's not like we had a lot of food.  I had the crawfish etoufee which had a slight flim on top since it'd been in a warming window for a while.  But once I got past that, it was good.  My companion had some sort of shrimp pasta.  I think they should've called the dish garlic in pasta with a few shrimp thrown in.  WOW... was it ever garlicy!  It burned to eat so that my friend couldn't stand more than a few bites.  I shared my etoufee.
And the waiter?  Didn't see him until he came by and dropped off the check.  No offers to get us more drinks, no checking in to see if we enjoyed our dinner.  Then again, he was wrapped up in a 6 top next to us, chatting with them about how much he loves Chicago (where those guests where from?).
Overall - it's just ok.  There are better places to go to eat.  And there are better places to go for Southern Hospitality.

Just ate here while vacationing in New Orleans.  The food is exceptional!!  By far my favorite spot we've visited.  The best part was definitely our server, Ron.  He was awesome!!!  So friendly and helpful.  Gave us some great tips and places to go and things to do while in town.  Highly recommend this restaurant and much thanks to Ron!!

This was our favorite place to eat in New Orleans by far. Recommended to us by one of the locals and we're glad we listened. Strawberry basil margarita was delish and so were the Cajun pastas. Kathleen was our server, she had so much personality and great with our kiddo. The entire staff was welcoming and helpful. Will be back!

I went again and ordered the crab cake entree. Crab cakes are so good here, but I think I might be nore impressed with the sides. The corn and the greens are sooooooo good. However, not a fan of the gumbo. It has a very distinct seafood flavor like it was made with a seafood stoxk and there were like pieces of shells or something in it like from crabs or shrimp peels...I don't know, but I still ate it all. I was very hungry, but I guess I am more critical of gumbo because I just thought my own is much better lol. I would stick with the crab cakes when I go back...or even a veggie plate...the corn, greens and garlic potatoes were A1!
Great food!! but the wait for the food and getting the waitress to come back often for a group was annoying.

Okay so I had dinner here tonight and let me just say I'm glad I stopped in. I ordered the gumbo which was really good, not too thick or too soupy. The rue was perfect!! Very well seasoned. I also ordered the charbroiled oysters, which I usually love and was craving prior to stopping in; but I wasn't a fan of theirs. On another note be sure to try the crab cakes, not to lumpy and seasoned to perfection!!
Wow!  I'm really impressed how great it was great food and service I really had a great time the waiter was sooo nice but I wished I would have got something different other than that 5/5

Recommended by a co-worker.

We are off to a great start.
Taste of New Orleans
Blacken shrimp fettuccini
Crap cakes
Shrimp platter double shrimp
Chick fettuccini
Cajun jambalaya


Ok with out getting long winded here, eye Rome loved the meal

Good food, friendly staff, close to everything.  Seems that there are many reviews about service, but the service we had was good.  The recipes were tasty and the waiter was helpful in deciding what to order.  No complaints here.

This was recommended by locals and fellow conference attendee. I was looking for close to Heaven on 7 gumbo like back home in Chicago. And finally I found it even better. I wish I could have taken some of this back home it was so good. It was Thursday at 1pm and single I opted for bar. The bartender was wonderful she was very attentive and helped recommend great features of the restaurant. I decided to order the cup of seafood gumbo and half fried oysters/half fried shrimp poor boy w a side of jalapeño hush puppies!!! 
The gumbo was thick roux with good helping of veggies and seafood. And nice scoop of rice but not to much and I liked the claw served on top. It was very mild not to spicy and a perfect portion for lunch w a sandwich.
The poor boy arrived w a side of fries instead of hush puppies and the bartender immediately had it replaced with the correct within a minute. The poor boy was delicious never having fried oysters these were a treat and the shrimp both had a great salty crisp batter. The sauce was perfect to the seafood, the bread was soft and toppings fresh. I could only finish half the bread but finished all my seafood bc it was so tasty could not pass. The french fries were french fries I would definitely trade out for hush puppies or something else they are known for. I finished every hush puppy they were delicious. 

The restaurant manager stop by to introduce himself and inquired about my visit and how I was enjoying my stay in New Orleans. I observed how he spoke to his staff and other customers very attentive and helpful great management skills and observed the staff respectful and helpful. 

Wish I had room for dessert but next time I will looking forward to returning.

Best oysters I've ever had!! Try the Oceana's Famous Oysters - it melts in your mouth. The Praline Duck was delicious and the banana ice cream cake was amazing as well. Brian, our server, was very professional, knowledgeable and 'tres simpatique'. If you find yourself in the French Quarter of New Orleans and you like seafood - you have to try this restaurant!!
Reazlied that this is the place where Gordon Ramsay did his episode Kitchen Nightmare in NOLA! He sure did a good job LOL

Came here for lunch in between classes and at the perfect time no long lines to wait in. Sat at the bar and ask The bartenders for recommendations on the hat to eat. I tried the Mardi Gras shrimp pasta and crab cakes. So glad I did. The food did not disappoint. Thank you for the recommendation!

We ate here for breakfast and dinner both so good. Service was amazing everyone is so nice and polite. Bloody mary's are awesome as well. Would come back again for sure! 
Highly recommend

I had heard many good things about this restaurant, and there was a line outside so I was excited to try it. We waited outside for about an hour, luckily the weather was nice and so were the people in line with us. Everyone inside was super friendly and our server was also very friendly and nice. She did a good job of explaining the items on the menu and was patient when we couldn't decide. We decided to go with appetizers and drinks. I got the swamp tea which came to the table bubbling and smoking, and my friend got another drink that was also bubbling and smoking. They were delicious and it was a fun presentation. We started with the alligator bites which were half fried and half blackened. The texture was like a mix between chicken and fish and the blackened alligator definitely had more flavor than the fried alligator. We also got Oysters Rockefeller and those had a lot of flavor, but were nowhere near as delicious as the charbroiled oysters we had at Acme Oyster House. I got the crab cakes, which in the photo in the menu and the description sounded super amazing, but were actually over-salted and so it was hard to taste the lumps of crap, which was super disappointing. The highlight of the meal was the desert. It was a brownie with a scoop of vanilla ice cream and praline sauce over the entire thing. That was amazing and we left super full and ready to walk along Bourbon Street.

We ate breakfast here and the food was awesome.  My hubby and I enjoyed the chicken and sausage gumbo first.  Then I had a huge veggie omelet topped with hollandaise sauce.  It was amazing... my husband enjoyed red beans and rice with andouille sausage. He thoroughly enjoy that. He also had a frozen Irish coffee that I was lucky enough to try and that was also amazing. Service was great, staff was friendly and honest. I didn't use the facilities here. Other wise they would've gotten five stars.

I came in for a quick snack to hold us over while we continued our journey. While in nola ive had quite a bit of fried gator so i decided to try it blackened. Yum yum yum. Finished the snack off with with some smokey charred oysters, which were better  the most ive had down here. Also stop by the bar and chat with the bartender josh.. super friendly and knowledgable about the area.

First of all I liked that once your inside the restaurant the noise volume is at a comfortable level even though its right on the corner of bourbon st.  Once we sat down, we got our orders in pretty quickly with the friendly staff.  The food also arrived quite fast which was good since we were hungry.  Overall, the food was great. We shared three dishes which had pretty good portions.  I would highly recommend the charbroiled oysters.
The ambiance of the patio is amazing ! They play authentic jazz music.  The food was very good and they use dry ice in the drinks.  Location is good as well.
Had the eggs melanzana and wow, so good! The service was amazing, thanks to our server Lavern. Would highly recommend this place to anyone visiting the French Quarter.

It's awesome. A long time ago I brought a buddy along who what a little over weight. Well, he broke a chair and instead of making a scene the manager brought a chair and a beer on the house. The food is always good and the atmosphere is good. This is my go to. It's small inside, but feels like home and you can't get better food on Bourbon. Every time I go to NOLA, I eat here. 5/5

Visiting from out of town, this was the first restaurant we came to. Food was subpar and quite overpriced. The ambience and location was quite cool tho as it was right in the heart of the city. Otherwise, I think there are better places to eat.
Amazingly delicious tasted as authentic as I thought anything she taste . It was wonderful.  Excellent service fun environment really enjoyed my meal highly recommend

It was suggested by a couple of locals we asked for places to eat at and they did not disappoint. We came here for our last dinner in NOLA and it was a good ending to our food festivity. the gumbo soup was the best we tasted all weekend. 
we got seated right away as soon as we walked in around 10 pm on a Sunday, and our waiter was really nice. The restaurant is really nice and even has clocks with different time zone around the world. THE BATHROOM WAS REALLY CLEAN. 
On to our food: 
I ordered their famous crab cakes and it was 2 thumbs up and the charbroilled oyster with the bacon sauce [i forgot what it was called] and that was really good and creamy too.
Fried catfish was good too.
This is my first time here! Very good service! Food was great!! Specially the Oysters Poboy. I will come back! Average per person $30 range!

First time ever eating here and it was absolutely delicious! We got the loaded fries with the cream sauce, crawfish and shrimp and mushrooms as an appetizer. It was perfect. Then we got the Mardi Gras pasta and it was amazing! Not super filling on top of the fries, thankfully, because it's hot walking around here! Very satisfied with the service and food!

Had a fabulous time at Oceana Grill.  The food was amazing!  The atmosphere is fun with a great vibe. Our server was attentive to our needs and gave us great recommendations on what to order. Highly recommend this place!!!
Amazing job, the stuff was super friendly and the food was great. Much better than expected!
Not as good as they say. We ordered the gumbo ( taste like watered down beans) and blacked catfish po'boy (tasted wet and the bread was stale). Wouldn't waste my money here again.
Awesome. Got the gator bites both fried and blackened. Also got the catfish poboy which was out of this world. Had both a fried and blackened (split between 2 people) very very very outstanding!!!

Stopped by for lunch today.  We had the Oceana oysters which were amazing! My boyfriend tried the shrimp po-boy with fries- very very good. I had the blacken red snapper with jambalaya and mustard collard greens- it was okay not bad but not delicious either. They give you a good size piece of fish.  Our waiter, Ponce, was so sweet and nice.  He was super helpful and attentive. The service was awesome!  If possible we will be back before we head back home of Friday.  

Ps- their Tropical Hurricane drink is really flavorful!

Remembered seeing this place on Kitchen Nightmares and decided to try it out for breakfast on our trip to New Orleans. My wife ordered an omlette that was alright but nothing special. I ordered the eggs benedict and it was not good. It was three of them dumped on a big plate with no thought to platin. The real offense was the hollandaise. It was broken and had no flavor whatsoever. Nothing you should ever spend 13 dollars on.

This was our first stop for food in New Orleans, and they set the standard really high for the rest of our visit! The food was soo good and the service just as good. I forgot the name of our waiter. I highly recommend this place, we plan on eating here one more time befpre leaving. It is important to note, the atmosphere here is great, everyone is attentive or smiling and making sire you're alright. This is big for us, to feel welcome and get what we pay for.

Great NOLA food. I had Cajun redfish 
Friends taste of New Orleans 
Service VERY friendly and fast 
Only thing that could be better is the food was barley warm, plate hot 
Good flavor. Would return !

I've been to Oceana twice, and both times the food was excellent.  However, the first time our service was awful.., like, deplorably terrible and I swore I would never go back.  However, a friend raved about it and finally offered to buy dinner if I would give it another shot.  Not one to turn down a free meal, I agreed... and had a great experience!  Again, the food was amazing, and one the second go-round, the service was fantastic!  They have a great menu, an amazing cocktails menu, and they make the best Sazerac in the Quarter.  Because it's on Bourbon Street and little pricey, I'm a bit gun-shy about going back on my own dime, just because when I spend upwards of $70-$80 on a meal for two, I appreciate a server who is polite and maybe even a bit friendly, and I've found the service there to be inconsistent.  But again, food was great on both trips.

Completely overrated! We were told to order a po-boy so we went with the shrimp. Nothing special about it. Not horrible but again nothing extraordinary either. My son ordered the fetuccini Alfredo with shrimp. It had a Cajun flare that made it a little different and unique but the pets was over cooked and mushy. Sad we wasted our only dinner meal in NOLA with a sub par meal.

Excellent food.  There were 4 of us.  We had the crab cake appetizer, oceanic redfish, ahi tuna, gumbo,oysters Rockefeller, blackened duck and creme brûlée.  Everything was excellent and the prices weren't unreasonable.

Really good shrimp poboy's (fully dressed of course) with the best bread in the city! So good had to order a second! Killer bloody Mary's with pepper infused vodka-phenomenal! Excellent friendly service from Errol!!!

To spicy is all I can remember about this place. I had the fried shrimp platter and was not impressed.  There app are normal entrée size. We ordered the Chicken Caesar salad and it was huge.  This place falls at the bottom of my list.

I was definitely impressed with the service, how large the restaurant actually is inside and the food was great! Everything was cooked to perfection. Had the taste of new Orleans with blackened crawfish. Will definitely be back!


1 Star-   Total failure of an experience based on this experience would not return. Would not recommend.

2 Star-  Below average on several levels, not a total failure. Wouldn't seek out to return or recommend.

3 Star-  Average experience, minimum expectations met. Nothing that says wow or that stands out. Would return if someone else wanted to come, not a regular go to.

4 Star-  Above average experience, will come here again and recommend to friends and family.

5 Star-  This will be a regular go to and will be highly recommended to people I know. Exceeds expectations on a consistent basis.
Sooooo good!!! The service was as great as the food!! Highly recommend!! Will definitely be back.

I was disappointed with my visit to Oceana. Being right next to our hotel, with lines out the door and recommendations out the wazoo, I just... imagined it would be awesome. Eh.

We arrived excitedly at a time with no lines, and were led upstairs to our table. The place itself was nice enough. The service was prompt, friendly, and attentive.

We started with the chargrilled oysters. I am not a huge oyster fan, but these were AMAZING. Why are oysters so little?!? BULLSHIT. These were.. amazing. I miss them already. Delicious tomatoey, cheesy, oystery goodness.. reasonably priced and just perfect.

For my entree, I ordered the blackened Redfish etoufee. The fish was average. As a pescitarian, cajun food is hard. There is chicken stock in... everything. I don't mind- I'll eat the plain stuff, but my boyfriend did ask the waitress if the etoufee had chicken stock, and she said no. I don't believe her- it tasted... weird. Maybe it just had a weird flavor. .In any case, it was just alright. The side of greens, I hardly touched.

My boyfriend ordered a sampler of etoufee, jambalaya, red beans and rice, and sausage. He was also very neutral about his dish but ADORED the andouille sausage.

I would return for the oysters in a heartbeat. But.. for nothing else. Can I give specific menu item reviews? No? Then, 3 stars it is.

We ordered the special: pain perdu with chicken and Pawpaw's breakfast. The french toast was delicious. The hashed browns were amazing. The corned beef hash was very tasty the biscuit was warm and fluffy. We also had the ultimate Cajun Bloody Mary - be prepared it is a meal in itself. It comes with a soft shell crab, a half dozen fried shrimp and oysters. It does cost more than 2 breakfasts  it was entertaining and tasty. The Bloody was perfectly spicy  This was a fun breakfast stop. Meagan our server was helpful with the menu and polite.
Went twice during our NOLA trip.  Good food and service both times.  Employees are super friendly and welcoming.  Food come out quick.  A definite gem among some sketchy food places in the Quarter.

Outstanding seafood and creole in the French Quarter. We tried the Oyster Po Boy, Crab Cakes, Fried Seafood Sampler and Cajun Sampler dinners. Everything was amazing and service was top notch. A little bit of a wait on a Friday night, but not bad considering. Worth adding to your list in NOLA.

Crawfish overload! I definitely recommend the gator bites, you can even get them half-half to try out both styles. The Crawfish Etouffée was tasty, but I shouldn't have added the extra fried crawfish on top.

Oceana Grill seems like it would be a good place to stop and get some cheap eats, but in reality it is expensive. I got the blackened chicken platter which came with a small side of jambalaya and greens which I switched for a chaser salad, well a few leaves of romaine I would call it. It was nearly 20 dollars. The upside is the staff is really nice and the food came out quickly. Downside is that the food really isn't anything special and at times pretty spicy. The chicken was small, then and sort of dry. I think the small sauce that came with the chicken saved the dish. Overall, was not impressed for the prices I paid but the food wasn't bad.

Had to wait a few minutes outside,then moved inside to bench. Then escorted upstairs to our table.I got the fried oyster platter,my wife got fried shrimp platter,my son got the fried catfish poboy,my daughter got chicken alfredo.Everyones was awesome but my sons poboy it was thin sliced catfish fried a little too long.Excellent waiter and service!!! One tip though get there before 5pm,long line formed! But that's a good sign of an excellent place to eat.Cant wait to eat there again before we leave New Orleans.Read about Oceana on-line you cant go wrong eating here !!!! Plenty of food for the money ....... :)
Amazing red fish, great staff, open late and wonderful experience. We sat upstairs by a window which allowed us to see the street happenings and still feel calm and relaxed. The food was wonderful.

The waiter co firmed that everything you heard about it on Kitchen Nightmares is fake. The good here was phenomenal. It's the first place i been to where they don't skimp one the sea food. The waiter was super friendly and the service was very fast. Overall, a perfect score, even for a college student like me who is super picky.

Soooo good!! First- if weather permits - sit outside. They play great music and you can hear better outside. Started off with the crab cakes and chargrilled oysters (a must have). Service was great and you can tell the employees enjoy working here. The Bloody Mary was one of the best I've ever tried!  For our main meal- shrimp po-boy - simple yet flavorful and ettoufee (?) was sooo good!!  Has to be a stop for anyone visiting

First of all...before we even get started on Oceana Grill I have to say Mary...she is the best waiter I have had in 2019 maybe 2018 maybe 2017 maybe my whole life. She was so attentive and a great. She was an absolute joy! 

Now the food....IMMACULATE...crab cakes to die for.  I would highly recommend. They accommodated our large group and made our whole trip.
Great place when it's not really busy. Food lacks when too many patrons. BB shrimp & blackened gator r fabulous !

This restaraunt looks small but it is massive. At least three stories tall. We had classic cajun dishes and it was all prepared very well. The drinks were strong! We had a table near the balcony so we could look out the window at the shenanigans. There were a lot of cool artifacts on the walls to check out. The best part was our server. She was attentive and kind and gave a cute thumbs up every time we asked for something. Her name was long and I will probably mess it up, Shanericka... I'll edit this when I remember.

We came across this place while walking through the Quarter and enjoyed it very much. It is a quieter, sane restaurant steps from the craziness of Bourbon Street.
I had the blackened tuna, side of jambalaya and kale. 
Great location, clean and the food was delicious. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially our waiter, Kevin. His menu suggestions were spot on.
Must have crab cake, fried catfish seafood gumbo great food nice staff price is average
Food was just ok. I feel like people hype this place up more than its deserved. The food was seasoned well. The alligator was gross and the oysters had no flavor. The service wasn't great.

Service was good and the staff was very friendly but the food...meh. This establishment is a total tourist trap. 
The Fried gator was ok. Blackened gator was terrible and a rubbery texture. The BBQ shrimp were not prepared properly and the sauce was a poor imitation of a true New Orleans style BBQ shrimp. If you're just looking to put something in your belly because you had too much alcohol on Bourbon St. then something off this menu may suffice but if you're looking for authentic New Orleans cuisine this not the place to go.

One of my favorite shows is kitchen nightmares, so naturally I just had to try Oceana. This was by far the best restaurant we went to While vacationing in New Orleans. I ordered the shrimp poboy and boy was it delicious! I didn't know there could be so much flavor in one bite. The French fries were absolutely perfect, not too soggy and not too crispy, just PERFECT. Oceana is most definitely a must do while in New Orleans.
Our server Whitney was fantastic! Made great recommendations for food here as well as what to do in NOLA!
Delivery to my hotel was surprisingly quick.  Had the Taste of New Orleans... not bad. The crawfish etouffe was quite nice.
Suburb and fast service at 3:00 o'clock and food was  excellent! Friendly staff as well.

The food & service was great! I had one of the recommended specials that was not on the menu & it did not disappoint!!! Blackened Red fish on top of cornbread dressing, topped with shrimp & a side of greens! Soooo good! We sat at the bar since it was pretty busy & we didn't want to wait for a table. We were greeted promptly & food came out in a timely manner! Would definitely go again!

Damn good food, and for the whole group!  This place is actually huge - it goes up at least 3 stories.  The room we were in was funkily decorated, and had TV's. And two old fireplaces built in. It had me wondering if it was 2 residences at on point.  Very well built building for how old it must have been. 
Anyway, to the food. There was a group of 8, and started with crab cakes.  I don't think there is a single place in New Orleans that has bad seafood.  If there is, well, I couldn't find it. I think almost everyone at the table had surf and turf - steak with some sort of seafood.  I dunno. I was too busy with my meal - seared ahi tuna, atop a crab cake, then smothered with crawfish etoufee.  Yeah, that's my heaven.  Anything with etoufee. :)  We then ordered one of every dessert - my favs were the pecan pie, the bananas  foster cake, and the CHOCOLATE TRUFFLE cake. I don't usually dip into dessert - but I sampled them all - and those were my favs. 

The only drawback was - here the oysters weren't very flavorful.  Not even salty.  But I don't fault the restaurant for that.

YUMMY!! And piping hot food!! Lovey outdoor patio with soothing water fountain against the brick wall. 

Suggestion - While we enjoyed sitting outside on the patio, the chairs are not very comfortable.
Great service! Great food! The crab cakes are larger than most places and the best I've ever tasted. Loaded fries make perfect late night food.
Very nice Catfish Po-Boy.. Service really good. Be ready to make a long line at peak hours ... So if you go like 15 minutes before you will be good.

After spending several nights in the Quarter, we kept walking past it.  All the food we had in the beginning was ok, average, nothing stellar.  So, we said what the hell.

Large menu and well executed.  Good tasting blackened fish, good beer prices (I fell in love with the Route 31 beer...great!).

It's certainly not the best place I've ever been in New Orleans but it was certainly better than a lot of the Bourbon Street random places.

The food was fantastic! First time having PoBoy and I enjoyed it! Definitely a must go to place in New Orleans. Bye bye Bubba, Hello Oceana!! Waitress Deanne was great! Very helpful and insightful! Sweet lady!

The Red Lobster/Olive Garden version of Cajun!  Or better yet you have to be drunk stumbling in off of Bourbon Street to think this place is great!

We actually just ate there, it's a Sunday evening, and it was walk in, no waiting.  The 1 star is for the service, she was very good.  My husband ordered the Gator Bites, half blackened/half fried.  The blackened was over spiced, in fact the gator was lost in the seasoning, and they were barely warm.  The fried was better but still not hot.  I would guess that they were sitting back in a warmer waiting to be served.  In fact the entire meal seemed to be something heated and waiting to be served, nothing struck me as freshly prepared.  My husband had the blackened catfish, greens, and jambalaya.  He said it was fine, I tried his greens, pleasantly surprised, but nothing hot, except the plate itself.  I had Cajun jambalaya and pasta.  The server suggested blackened shrimp, after the over-seasoned gator bites I was fearing my pasta.  Overall it was ok, still not hot and the shrimp was overcooked; seasoning was ok.  When the server asked if we wanted dessert, we couldn't say no fast enough, we weren't about to spend anymore money there.  For just over $63 with fountain drinks to boot it was the most disappointing meal we've had in the French quarter.
This place was okay. It was our first time in New Orleans and we can with a group. I would say this is like Joe's Crab Shack. The food was just okay but the staff were wonderful kind and friendly.

For months I had heard about this place and so when I finally went in 2012 I was expecting it to be pretty good. I can't remember what the food was like because I saw a mouse scamper into a hole going to the kitchen, which made me lose my appetite. When I told the waiter he said, "well this IS the courtyard area....," like it was okay for there to be a rodent in the restaurant. He did not offer us any sort of discount or comp our meal or anything, which I think is bad service. A really bad experience, I will never ever go back.
I recommend the full rack of ribs if you're in town! It was filling. Just thought the sides left a little more to be desired.

*Vegetarians and vegans beware*

After talking to our waiter we found out that most of the vegetarian dishes actually have animal stock in them. There were also a lot of communication issues and our waiter treated us poorly when discussing the issue at hand. Hopefully, someone can work on guest relations here sometime soon.

Really great service. This is my 2nd time here for lunch and the food was really good!! We had Bbq shrimp which were made with soup based sauce not a regular Bbq with a Worcester sauce tasty and definitely would recommend. We also tried The gumbo which I had the 1st time I   was there which is just simply very good. I think it's just a bit too small, wish a cup was a bit bigger portion. Main meal all 3 of us had taste of New Orleans! Really really good. I like the sausage which for a polish background person that have tasted millions of sausages that's a compliment. My buddy said that this meal was one of the best meals he had in months and right away said he wanted to come back. We also had pecan pie with ice cream which again was great! Service was great and very attentive. Not sure if it's like that consistently as we came at 4pm late lunch and they were slow! Overall great experience as I came here for the 2nd time and still as good as the 1st time.

Dropped into Oceana for a late dinner (back in 2018, when I reviewed the wrong Oceana and only just noticed my error.) They were busy but were able to find us a table within a few minutes.

Nice chargrilled oysters, but we prefer the garlic & parmesan to their creamy version.

Blackened duck with jambalaya was excellent. The duck was meaty and fatty and satisfying. The jambalaya had the proper moisture. The mustard green accompaniment had great flavor and it was nice to get a little more vegetable.

Kim made a meal of combining three sides. She enjoyed the crab cake, the mac&cheese with broccoli, and the salad.

Overall a very nice experience. I'd totally go back.

Natalie, our server, was the only redeeming quality of our visit.  Gumbo was cold and bland, redfish "house special" was ok but nothing special. Etouffee tasted like it had been warmed up from a can. Too bad.  Other reviews had us all excited.

We went to Oceana looking for Po Boys and got great food and great service.  

Everyone at the table had a Po Boy.  I had the option to get half oysters half shrimp.  It was perfect.  The bread was extremely soft and fresh.  The oysters and shrimp weren't just breaded, but seasoned well.  You also had the option of getting your entree blackened or fried.  One person at our table got the blackened catfish.  It looked awesome and she had nothing bad to say about it.  There were also fried catfish, alligator sausage all shrimp po boys at the table as well.  All looked very good.  It was just what the doctor ordered after an afternoon of drinking.  

Another friend of mine got the Jambalaya pasta.  The sauce and pasta were delicious.  They were not skimpy at all with the shrimp and andouille sausage.  

Service was great.  They were prompt and the food was hot!  It was a great change from the touristy food found on bourbon street, it was nice to find good food.  This place is on Conti, but just a few steps out from Bourbon.
The crab cakes were delicious!! I also had the Cajun pasta...it was just okay. I'll probably get the fried shrimp platter on my next visit. I sampled my friend's and it was yummy!

Best oysters in NOLA. I have had dreams about the food there. It's so good. We had the famous oysters and red beans and rice and pecan pie. I have been here multiple times. Only negative thing is that the food is not consistent on how good it is, some days tastes more fresh than other days

We ate here on our last night in NOLA and it did not disappoint. My partner had the vegetarian spinach ravioli made with a sauce that they use to flavor oysters. It was fantastic! I had the BBQ shrimp and Greek salad. We split a banana foster for dessert.

Wish I knew oceana and older NOLA cookery were essentially the same place. But we didnt figure that out until we saw the menu. We tried this place first.

crab cakes 15.50 I would honestly order these for my flight back home. Soooo good.
Taste of Nola 18 my bf and I got the same dish to try the jambalaya. It was perfect! We added the crawfish too.

Service was great. We were kinda seated in the back room, with another group.

A pretty good location to visit while in NOLA. Honestly, I was already kinda buzzed by the time we got seated & received our food lol (super packed due to Mardi Gras), but I def remember the gator bites! 

I had my first Blackened Gator Tail Bites ($10) there - Marinated White Meat Gator Tail, served with Remoulade Sauce. The marinade was pretty solid & they def prepared it right - many restaurants' pan skillets aren't hot enough so the gator meat dried out quickly. I would recommend getting it.   ** 3 1/2 stars overall **
Amazing food. Excellent service from Jessica L.! Highly recommend and will make this a regular stop when in NOLA!

Just what I was looking for when I got here -- something to quench the creole craving I've had since I left in 2015. I got the taste of New Orleans and it was exactly what I needed to quench that craving. Thanks to Meagan at the bar for the recommendation!

Took the kids here with a 10% coupon from our hotel. It was good.  Not stellar, the best ever but good. The fried & blackened alligator tail appetizer was superb.  The kids devoured both! We had an order of the seafood gumbo on Cajun pasta, 2 orders of ribs & kids chicken tenders.  It was all good.  Highlight was the appetizer though.  Nothing really stood out as a need to repeat except the alligator bites.

Yum!

Visited this location last weekend and fell in love at first bite. The staff was great and the food came out in good time.

I loved it so much that I came back 2 days later for dinner. Overall a very good experience and the food is nicely seasoned. Portion sizes are healthy and can definitely be shared.

On our first trip my group shared the crab cakes, the seafood platter with eggplant fries. On our next visit I had their special of seafood in a fettuccine alfredo dish. All of the dishes were yummy.
Good stop on Bourbon St for a bite of Cajun food. Had the shrimp poboy and fries which was good. Bit too much bread for my liking, but food was tasty and timely.

This restaurant is the exact description of a tourist trap. I would avoid this place if you are visiting NOLA. We ordered the oysters, alligator bites, and the seafood platter. I'm not a big oyster fan but my wife and brother are and after they had one oyster they literally could not eat another one. The alligator bites were a little creepy. It was really chewy and not pleasant. The seafood platter consisted of fried oysters, catfish, and shrimp. The shrimp was the only good thing on the platter. The oysters and catfish were just funky. Lastly, the bread pudding was actually pretty good but it was a little too sweet. I wouldn't recommend coming here. High prices, and not very good food.

Wow, okay.  

So I tried Oceana Grill years ago, and it was pretty good.  However, it seems that the place has hit something of a rough patch and I was very sorry I returned.  We came for breakfast at about 9AM and we were the only people in the restaurant.  The managers and the cook came over like four times to ask us how we liked the food. Well, what little there was of it was okay, but the presentation was pretty sorry.  Our crab cake benedicts were like $20 each, but they were really small and they came with absolutely nothing else.  It was a naked looking plate and the place smelled kinda funny and...nah.  

Just go to Cafe du Monde for breakfast.

I've been traveling to New Orleans for 26 years and walking by this place. Glad I finally stopped in. Seafood omelette was delicious. My only suggestion is it be served with grits or a choice of grits or hash browns. Bloody Mary was tasty and service was very friendly.

Had the crab cakes but with a burre blanc sauce instead of the crawfish mushroom sauce it came with they were very good with a little kick. Also ordered bread pudding for dessert but was very disappointed. It was tough I hate chains but Pat O Brians had the best bread pudding. Husband had the redfish and enjoyed it a lot staff was very accommodating and efficient.

I had gumbo and boyfriend had crawfish etoufee. His dish was super yummy! (He always picks well!) I can't handle spicy foods but his wasn't too spicy for me so I'd def get that if we return. The gumbo was good, just needed more in it. Every single person that worked there was super nice and spoke to us. Apparently this is a favorite spot of the locals. They have a cool little outdoor patio area as well. Lots to look at on the walls.

I've been coming here for years to eat their lunch and dinner which is always good 
I never realized they had breakfast. The st James crepe is amazing. The lost bread is some of the best in the quarter. True NOLA atmosphere 
I plan to come back to explore their breakfasts menu more

This was the first restaurant we visited in New Orleans, and we were not disappointed. We made reservations for 8:30 on a Sunday night; we arrived around 8:20 to a line out the door and had no problem being seated immediately. 

Our server, Ben was very friendly and helpful, making sure we understood everything on the menu and had everything we needed. 

Overall, we tried the blackened gator bites, gumbo, blackened Cajun duck, and red beans and rice. I'm not a big gator fan, but I tried a piece and was pleasantly surprised! They were seasoned and cooked very well, not too spicy. The gumbo was good; the seafood in it, particularly the shrimp, was cooked exceptionally well - it literally melted in my mouth. It also came with a crab claw poking out, which I thought was a nice touch! The duck was very flavorful and perfectly cooked as well. The red beans and rice was a little on the spicier side, but it was still very tasty.

I've been to NOLA twice within the past year and an saddened to say that I've o Lu experienced this amazing establishment on one trip! Had i known about this jewel in my first stop here, i surely would've been here then too!! 

From the exemplary customer service at the front door to the food service from amazing waitress' like Whitney, the entire experience is beyond enjoyable. Then the food!! 
O M G THE FOOD!! 
As a pescatarian there were so many options with so much FLAVOR, that I've tried four different meals here and haven't been disappointed yet!

I am throughly satisfied; coming back for more and recommending this spot to everyone i know!

Oceana Grill did not disappoint. My husband and kids were not thrilled to see the line down the street but after having mediocre Cajun food elsewhere the night before I wasn't budging. The special, Redfish Pontchartrain was delicious! My husband loved his catfish even though it was so much food he couldn't finish it. The popcorn shrimp was a hit for for daughter and the cheesecake was pretty amazing too. Worth the wait.

We ordered the fried seafood platter. The catfish was light, hot, crunchy, and perfectly seasoned. The oysters were delicious, fries delicious, shrimp the best. The cole slaw was tangy and crisp. The only down side was that the hush puppies were a little heavy and the jalapeño was undetectable. We also got the blackened catfish which was perfect. Really loved the greens and rice that accompanied it. My girls got a Bloody Mary that was spicy and made them happy!! The establishment was really well run. Everyone was on their best game it seemed: waiters, hostess. Unity was evidenced.

Great service, great food. I had a cup of gumbo,  fried seafood platter and bread pudding to go.  The gumbo was a little bland but I'm sure they do that to keep it ok for all taste buds. I put a little hot sauce in it and it was great.  I had to get a take out box for the seafood platter. So much food!

Always delicious we order the same dish every time me the fettuccine Alfredo with chicken side size and blackened chicken with jambalaya and garlic mashed potatoes for desert banana foster ice cream cake is been years and never changed

We went on a swamp tour and our air boat driver recommended this place if we wanted to try Gator. Our hotel was about a mile away so we decided to make the walk. Glad we did. The food was great and so was the service. FYI when the seafood combo says your food will he piled high they are not kidding. I ate to my hearts content.

I came here twice... each experience was different. 

The first time we came here, I wasn't expecting too much only because it was a Kitchen Nightmare restaurant. How much better could it be than what they showed on TV? 

I was pleasantly surprised. Their oysters looked like they were on steroids. They were juicy and delicious. The chargrilled oysters were cooked in creamy alfredo like sauce. I ordered the blackened catfish and it was melt in your mouth delicious. The roasted vegetables on the side were in a little sauce cup. Not impressive at all. I also asked for a side of rice and literally it's about 1/4 cup of rice for $3?! No thank you! 

All in all, my first experience there was really good! 

Now the second time, we went back for the oysters since they were so juicy! First off, we had to wait in line this time. Lame. The place is HUGE. Three floors, with an outdoor seating area. You even had to wait in line for the bar seats. Who does that? So freaking weird. 

We only wanted oysters and something else small. The waitress gave us attitude for just ordering apps. Oysters this time around were big and plump, but they tasted like they were soaked in water. Disgusting. We also got the BBQ shrimp appetizer, and they don't come with heads! It looked so sad in the little dish. Experience here, ruined.

We just walked in off the street at 2 pm on a Tuesday Valentine's Day   We were seated right away.  Our server John was friendly and answered all our question.  We ordered "speciality" oysters.   They were the BEST.  We ordered a seafood platter to share. And it was a good thing. It was more than we could eat. We will go back before we leave

I just had the best seafood omlet I've ever had! I would definitely recommend their specialty sauce to pour over the top!! I will be back here in the near future. Errol was very personable and on top of things!!
I have tried to speak with rami about an incident have have been unsuccessful thus far. I will keep u posted

Had the country breakfast. Food was good but the service was the issue.  It took them 5 min from sitting down before anyone asked if we wanted to drink.  I think it was just our server because the others I noticed were very attentive.

For the amount we had to wait to be seated, I thought the food would be spectacular. Sadly it was not. I had the seafood pasta. To be honest, it had no kick of flavor (except other then cheesiness), and there was nothing memorable about it. It tasted like something you could get at an Italian chain restaurant. I wished that it would have had more of the NOLA flavor that you would expect to find in these types of restaurants. Secondly, our waiter was very nice but was not using a pen and paper to write down our order. In the end, one of our dishes (which was an appetizer anyways) had been forgotten. No biggie, but I would hope this isn't a reoccurring issue at the restaurant.

Just left this restaurant & have to say our server Whitney was amazing! Recommended some of the best dishes, and gave quick + efficient service. I work in customer service myself so I know what good service is and she was awesome. Thanks Whitney

Like a few other restaurants in the area there was a line formed outside but we did not wait long ( maybe 10/15 minute). Once we were seated my friend and I ordered hurricanes. We were convinced to order a double but a single would have been just fine ( it was very strong). 

Since our peel n eat shrimp the day before at Royal house were good we decided to order the BBQ peel n eat shrimp, Oceana's famous oysters and a side of garlic mashed potatoes and coleslaw. 

My friend really enjoed the Shrimp- the shrimp was cooked perfectly. There was a seasoning that I did not like in there so I ended up ordering another side of mashed potatoes and coleslaw. Both sides were actually very delicious which is why I ended up ordering a second round. 

Everything was delicious. Along with everything else our service was wonderful!

We  were wandering ainlessly trying to find somewhere to get breakfast when a local reccomended Oceanas. Their food was very delicious! The crawdad omelet they I ordered was to die for! I loved their bisquits, the honey butter was amazing! The service was fast and very friendly. We ate in their beautiful courtyard! It was the perfect way to start the day. It is also very affordable.
I also ordered the Cajun bloody Mary. Spicy and flavorful.

It's a highly recommend restaurant to go in New Orleans!!  I went twice while I was there!!!  My favorite is fried oyster!  It's really fresh and taste really good!!  The price is very reasonable!!  I love it!!

Our waitress was great!!! There were 6 of us and we each ordered something different... 3 got different po-boys which were very good (blackened chicken, blackened shrimp, and fried shrimp). All 3 were happy with their meal. 2 got different pasta dishes, that were good but the portion size was very small... I personally got the Taste of Louisiana, the red beans and rice with sausage was honestly one of the best things I've eaten my entire trip... the rest of the dish however was not to my liking at all  so my advice would be to just get the red beans and rice.

This place is the bomb for sure! Had it for late dinner and went back the next morning for an awesome breakfast! You must get the Cajun fries appetizer! I had it for dinner and then got it for breakfast and just added two eggs to it. Think of it as the best poutine you've ever had! I'm a amateur chef with a cooking channel on YouTube "Cooking with CJ" and I want to steal the recipe and claim it as my own. I know I'll be going back at least two more times before I head home. Staff is friendly and service was excellent.

Get your oyster fix at Oceana Grill. The chargrilled oysters are delicious! 


We stopped in for one thing. Oysters. They didn't disappoint and they hit the spot.

The raw oysters were fresh and plump 

The chargrilled was flavorful! If you like Parmesan cheese then you will love the chargrilled.

Fast and friendly service 

Check in on yelp and save 10% so even better!

Just wish they had happy hour on sunday

I had barbecue shrimp, they were great although peeling them wasn't cool. The oysters weren't the best and the waitress wasn't the absolute sweetest but for genuine pub food in New Orleans, it seems like this place would suffice. I enjoyed the gumbo. 
You can see pics on my twitter @UncleLouie and my instagram @Uncle_Louie.

The food was good.  The service.....  They are open almost all day and the furniture was old and sticky.  I guess they don't have much time to clean.  Where I sat also smelled like someone urinated close by.  I would have asked to be moved, but the hostess acted like she was the Queen of Sheba.
Excellent food and ambience.. We had crab cakes,  jambalaya,  shrimp po boys  and gumbo.
Dinner was great!  The shrimp po-boy was delicious.  The service was prompt and friendly.  Sarah did a great job.  Will definitely return upon our next trip to NOLA.

We had a great experience at Oceana. The food was wonderful and our waitress, Taylor, was the best (5 stars too). We both had the Mardi Gras pasta which is absolutely delicious! We would recommend eating at Oceana any time you are in New Orleans.

Stopped in for a family dinner before we left the u.s on our cruise to mexico was very good , food was great alot of options good new Orleans food and awesome decor , good staff and facility in the french quarter.
Bourbin St. is not for me, but this restaurant is great! The staff is super nice!! They make you feel welcomed.

Took a weekend trip to NOLA and saw how highly recommended this place was. I ordered the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta (picture attached) and it blew my socks off! So much flavor, it was delicious! Service was a plus, great staff. Recommend to all if you are looking for a hardy meal in the French quarter.

I am a server, so normally I'm very critical from that standpoint, however this restaurant provided excellent service with a very friendly staff. Food and drinks were received exceptionally quick, and everything tasted great. Eat here for a good taste of New Orleans seafood!
The grilled oysters were the joint!  The red beans and rice were perfect.  The staff was impeccable!

Our server, Michael, was incredible!! It was our first time in New Orleans and only a night to enjoy Burbon street. His enthusiasm and kindness made our evening so enjoyable. Thank you for your great recommendations!! The food and ambiance was amazing as well!!

The grilled oysters are DELICIOUS the service by Brian was fantastic even thou he was slammed with tables. All the food was amazing i wish i had an OceanaGrill near me and i wish i would have skipped the other places and just ate every meal here......by the way the gator melted in your mouth.

I am from St.Louis, and was in town for "Tales of the Cocktail" at the Hotel Monteleone from July 16-21.

On my final day in New Orleans, I decided to find a place to go have lunch close to the hotel, and found this little place off Bourbon street - OCEANA GRILL.  A guy in front of the establishment was calling out to people to try the place since it was so good, and had a menu in his hand.  I took his word, and walked inside....

It's a smaller place, and would call it kind of a dive, by appearance alone.

My friend and I were greeted by our server, Aaron S.  We both ordered the crab cake burgers, and ditched the side order of french fries that come with the burger (since we can get fries anywhere) - so my friend ordered the side of jambalaya, and I ordered the side of crawfish etouffee (and we'd share).

For drinks, we both ordered hurricanes - made not with a pre-mix - but with real fruit juices.

Aaron S. was a SPECTACULAR and FRIENDLY server.  He was enthusiastic, and was not overbearing at all.  In fact, the table next to us was even raving about him TO THE MANAGER - saying that he was the friendliest server they have encountered on their trip.  The same goes for us!  BRAVO, Aaron S.

The crab cake burgers were excellent and tasty, and worth every penny.  The jambalaya was tasty , tangy, and well blended with spices.  The crawfish etouffee had a good amount of crawfish for being a side...
