My friend ordered a sazerac for a 2nd drink and enjoyed it at this establishment.  I ordered an abita draft - and you can't ever go wrong with that  ;)

Altogether, the experience was enjoyable and memorable - highlighted by the great service Aaron S. gave us.  When I go back to New Orleans next year, I will surely return...

My husband and I started our day on a chartered fishing tour and our driver dropped our catch off to be prepared for dinner that night at Oceana Grill. At first we weren't sure what to expect, but then we experienced one of the best dining experiences we've ever had. The staff is very friendly, and our waiter Darrick was exceptional. We started with appetizers of alligator tail, soft shell crab and crawfish etouffee. The chef prepared our catch two different ways for us to try and they also included side dishes of corn, mashed potatos, jambalaya, and greens. We were stuffed after dinner, so ordered bread pudding for dessert to  go (which was still fantastic a few hours later). Definitely our best meal while in New Orleans.
Nice location. Interesting atmosphere. Food was very good and reasonably priced. Service was good but a little slow.

There are two floors of space, both with a bar. Downstairs was crowded so I was directed to upstairs. Wasn't many there so it was quiet. The bartender engaged me in conversation. We found travels to the West Coast a common interest. The Oceana's Famous Oysters was great.
Fairly priced seafood with a great atmosphere. Friendly service!  Red fish platter etouffee with red beans and rice with jambalaya is the way to go!

This is a must to eat and drink at. The atmosphere and food was amazing. Overly nice wait staff and very attentive to patrons. Will definitely keep coming back. PS - definitely try the Oyster Rockefeller.
Great food with no so touristy prices. I love the crabcake and they have the best whiskey pecan pie! I have ordered through doordash just for the pie, its that good!
Fair.  That's it.  Service was helpful and friendly.  Food was mediocre.  Sorry!

Thankfully Oceana Grill was open late! We had an awesome late night Ghost Tour (with some Hurricanes thrown in the mix) and we were starving when it finished. It was around midnight but Oceana Grill was still pretty busy. We only had to wait a few minutes, and the servers/host were all extremely friendly. Some of the best service I've seen in a restaurant! We ordered a Chicken Poboy and alligator cheese fries. Both dishes were fantastic!

Decided to check out Oceana Grill on Ash Wednesday after a few days of Mardi Gras parades and loved loved l-o-v-e-d it!
My boyfriend and I went for lunch, and it was a great choice if I do say so myself. 
We split an appetizer of fried Alligator Bites...SO GOOD! I hear alligator can be chewy, but these were cooked just right and the seasoning was awesome. So tasty. I didn't like the dipping sauce but I dont like horseradish so don't take my word for it if you do. 
He had the fried catfish platter and I ordered the seafood sampler with the addition of the crawfish tails. I loved it. The crawfish tails and shrimp were delicious and the catfish...man...I cannot get good friend catfish when I am home (Pittsburgh) so I usually order it a few times when in NOLA and damn, this was good. I mean melt in your mouth good. The platter also had fried oysters, which I didnt like at all. I had tried them elsewhere before and didn't like them but decided to give them another try...yeah, no. Fried oysters are apparently not my thing. The fries were tasty and there were jalapeno hushpuppies but I never got around to them, too much food on the plate! He ordered the Bananas Foster Ice Cream Cake and I had the Chocolate Kahlua Mousse cake. Amazing. Just yummy. It was a bit pricy...with one cosmopolitan and his iced tea we were at about $95.00 before tip but we found a gift cert on restaurant.com (I DONT WORK FOR THEM SO DONT FLAG MY REVIEW!!) which helped. All in all the price was pretty good for being at the intersection of Bourbon and Conti streets. 
Oceana Grill was fantastic...we will definitely be dining there again!
Great food great service. We have jambalaya fettuccine and redfish. Both were fantastic very filling. I have their special grilled corn side and it was very good. I would recommend it.

Our flight got in around 6 PM, by the time we got checked in and unpack we started walking around about 7ish. Based on Yelp reviews we decided to try here for our 1st night. Made reservations online for 4 at 9pm. Glad we did!! There was a line and after eating, I know why. We started with the blacken gator tail, cooked so well! Then got the seafood platter and it comes with a ton of fried catfish,fried shrimp and fried oysters on a bed of fries. Everything was amazing, service was great and not much can compare to the food we had here the first night of our 5 day vacation.

Oceana Grill was really expensive for just okay food. All the recommended items were topped with the same Alfredo sauce, their famous oysters, crab meat cakes, madi gras pasta. Everything was lackluster in flavor and spice. 
But the review is mainly for the service. We were first in line but at least 5 parties behind us were seated first. After 30 minutes of waiting, we were led inside the restaurant to wait some more as our table was finishing setting up. One of hostess then told us we were BLOCKING THE ENTRANCE. What?! Just sit us at our table if that was the issue! How long does it really take to place a few sets of silverware?! 
However, the manager gave us a 10% by checking in. Nice gesture, but based on that experience alone, I can assure I won't miss going back.

Ate here a couple days ago while visiting New Orleans. We got a 10% off coupon from our hotel. It was our first taste of Cajun food down here and was definitely worth checking out. Being unsure what to get exactly, we got the Po-Boys, one with half shrimp, half catfish.. the other with half fried, half blackened gator. It was a lot of food, very filing, and delicious (the shrimp I believe was the best). Also ordered a Swamp Tea, it was decent although a quite a bit sweeter than I had expected.

The restaurant itself was very cool, had a courtyard, seating right by the windows, and a bar. The prices were fair as well, about average for what you'd see anywhere else in the French Quarter.. roughly in the $12-$15 range. Our server was Ponce, he was great, helped when deciding what to order and was very prompt, attentive, and friendly. Would certainly recommend this restaurant to anyone as a first stop in the city.

Great dinner tonight.    Service was spot on...Mary took unbelievable care of us.    Her suggestions on dinner were spot on including a redfish special served on jalapeño cornbread...awesome.  She even let me in on an off menu tuna that they will make stuffed with crab...a total game changer.   Cooked to perfection.   

Huge thanks again to Mary..it would have been a great dinner even without her wise suggestions but instead it was a dinner that completely stood out.   The Cajun fries were to die for as well!

Just tried the the Taste of New Orleans (April 12 2019) and it is so good. The red beans and rice cooked perfectly the andouille sausage, juicy and spicy, and the crawfish style gumbo was awesome. If you're even queasy about eating crawfish this is not what you have in mind. The whole dish is awesome!!
Excellent service and food.  Jambalaya and Mardi Gras pasta as well as oysters were delicious.  Ask for extra bread for dipping.  Jamal was excellent waiter.
All around an excellent venue - Best french fries!  The wait time if it's not too long is very much worth it.  The ambience is very nice for downtown French Quarter.

Delicious, delicious, delicious, nothing left to say! Husband and I both had the off menu specials, incredible. Our bill totaled $100 and we felt it was well worth it, for drinks, entrees, and a shared Bread pudding dessert.

Their "oyster rockfeller on half shell" taste delicious! One thing I noticed that it freely floating the shell. For me the authenticity of fresh oyster is that when I scrape it from the shell with muscle still attaeched to the shell. Seafood platter kinda common type. Another good thing on this place, staff are friendly, place is clean and orderly. I still
recommend this place for medium-type or affordable prices.

Yaaaassss! Ryan was are waiter and he was the best! So funny, super sweet, cool vibes!

The food was great!
My 4 boys including my husband were all satisfied.
We got the crab cakes, crab cake pasta, praline duck, gator bites, gator po boy, shrimp po boy, a tropical hurricane, frozen hurricane, swamp tea,and frozen pina colada.

5 stars given because of Ryan's service and meals were pretty satisfying and fulfilling (big enough to share if you're coming for a quick bite, but why would you share?).
Decent at best.  There are several other restaurants around that are much better.  Had the proverbial shrimp po boy and gumbo...
I really enjoyed the Cajun vegetarian stew. It had complex flavors and nice heat! The pecan pie ala mode was amazing as well. My friend had fork and knife ribs which he enjoyed.

We went to Oceana bc of the 4 star Yelp review. Oh my gosh...food was just awful. Everything came out within 5 minutes of ordering so we could tell immediately it wasn't prepared to order. Everything was stale and barely warm. Very very disappointed. Don't waste your time OR money.  Plus my $10 glass of white wine wasn't cold. We just left feeling very disappointed. Didn't even drink my wine.

On the way here in an Uber our driver told us that Oceana Grill is nasty and that we should go to some other place she suggested. We asked her how is it nasty? And she didn't really give a real reason...just that it's touristy and it "just is." Whatever that means. We suspected she was trying to drum up business as a deal to bring in tourists to whatever place she mentioned. I'm so glad my friends and I didn't listen to her because I had the best meal I ever had in NOLA at Oceana Grill. I had the redfish and I completely understand why it's their specialty. Yup! It's that damn good! The mushroom crawfish cream sauce is divine. Not to sound gluttonous but just give me a cup of that! The fish was moist and oh so flavorful. NOLA may top the charts of the most haunted places in America, but it also sets the bar high when it comes to good food and Oceana Grill is at the top of that list.

At first glance it didn't look like much of a breakfast spot. But after our food arrived, it was clear that this place was the bomb. We had a very friendly and attentive waiter, Harrison, who said the pancakes were good--an understatement. There was enough for 3 people to share, although my 15-year old son did a good job alone. The steak and eggs were tasty as well. Highly recommend it!
The food is amazing and the service is top notch. All the food Sierra recommended was delicious and she is a great server. Would definitely recommend and will be coming back

I had the ahi tuna stuffed with crab meat and it was spicy and delicious! The tuna was cooled perfectly and was very flavorful.  It came with a side of veggies and rice too. The other people in my party had pasta, the sampler platter and the steak. Everyone agrees the food was worth the price. I highly recommend this restaurant.  The only downside is the wait outside to get into the restaurant.  However,  if you have a party of 5 or more, you can make a reservation.

Stopped by in november  gumbo was excellent. Shrimp  was good but crawfish was small. Alligator blackened was good. I had the pecan pie which was microwaved with a soggy crust.when I complained to the manager he did nothing

I'm sorry Bree, I've been meaning to get this out to you but the holiday got in the way! We cruised here for our first family lunch teeing off the long weekend to celebrate my mother's 60th. This was recommended by our wonderful hotel staff at Pere Marquette who even gave us a coupon to use at the joint. So many perks, the dedicated staff here- Bree was our server and she was exceptional. There are some dietary restrictions with my fam which can be a challenge but Oceana has a separate gluten free menu! Actually the crab cakes made GF style were even better than the ones from the regular menu! The lunch concluded with Bree commanding the attention of the entire restaurant to serenade my mother, was so special and we have the video of it for memory. Check it out if you're in NOLA, thanks Bree and cheers!

We ordered the crab cakes and fried shrimp.  The crab cake tasted fine, could have used more seasoning in my opinion.  The portion size on the fried shrimp was large.  We could not eat all of it.  The shrimp were seasoned well and tasted great. The staff was friendly and the service was great.

I was in New Orleans for a business trip a few months ago, I ate breakfast at Oceana and tried their char-broiled oysters.... I have never been so sick in my life. A hospital visit and a week later I finally recovered. Needless to say after watching the new Kitchen Nightmares episode, now I know why! How terrifying!!!
Great food!!!!!!!  Ezra is the best waiter in New Orleans.

Worst place ever. Worst customer service . My friend ordered a double jack and they gave him a single jack and coke. They tried to tell him that it was a Double. We drink jack and coke every night just about and we know what a double should taste like. The general manager didn't wanna own up to their mistake . Waiter skipped passed us the whole time and did not check on us until it was time for him to bring us our food. Brought table next to us water as a refill but non To us. Place is awful. Wouldn't recommend . General manager isn't worth crap. I am a general manager and treat all of our customers with respect . This guy should def not be a general manager.

This place is Denny's on Louisiana steroids + the decor. The food was good. Some ups & downs. The restaurant is in the heart of Bourbon st., so I can see how the reviews . One great thing is that this restaurant is open late with a great atmosphere. 
Food:
Blacken red fish: delicious, if I could order one dish, this would be it.
Jambalaya pasta: cannot go wrong, another great recommendation.
Cajun Fries: more than I expected, I was expecting something dry, it is heavy in sauce and crawfish, not bad. 
Blacken duck: taste like a heavily seasoned chicken.
Crab cakes: taste like the ocean with extra salt, definitely not fresh
Great option when lots of restaurants are closed.

Ok let me start, first before I even walk in, I see a young lady walking out with a lit cigarette, so I ask if my vape is allowed. The hostess at the door say, "it sure is". 
I make my way to the hostess booth to place a order for some oysters to go. I then was redirected to the pick up station directly behind the host booth. 
Attended to place for oysters to go, she then directs me to the bar.
Now I feel like I'm on the phone with sprint's customer service lol. 
Then the guy at the bar said, you can't vape in here. No big deal, I'll stop. 
Once again tried to place a order to go. Guess what the bartender told me? 
I gotta wait for a spot to open up at the bar to order cuz I can't order food to go smh. 
Has anybody else heard of this stupid shit. I'm from Las Vegas and it's news to me, that you gotta be held hostage to place an order lol. 
Needless to say, I'll never come back here again. 
On the bright side, the AC was blasting.

So far one of the highlights of my first trip to New Orleans!! Our server, Jennifer, was spectacular and gave fabulous suggestions for our breakfast.  My husband had the Crawfish Omelette and I had the Pain Perdu "Lost Bread" ..... aka French Toast!!!  Best I've ever head.   Don't miss it!!!!!

Cutest mouse ever.

Aside from that, the food was pretty good. I can't really complain. The mouse was fun to watch.

Cute restaraunt on a side street off of Bourbon.  The paintings on the walls are impressive, but the food is not as impressive.  You can easily find the same food at another place for much cheaper.  Plus the stall for the women's bathroom is not much of a door, look at the picture I posted and you'll see what I mean.

We went here for Sunday dinner after the Seahawks/Saints game. It was the only place near Bourbon St. without a wait. We had a party of 12, including 3 kids, so waiting 2 hours for Acme wasn't exactly an option.

Fried seafood, hush puppies, and po'boys...all were tasty and my seafood gumbo was pretty decent as well.  Server was attentive and informative of the area.

Definitely recommend for a large group - this place was HUGE.

Excellent!!!
The food and service is amazing!
Fresh, delicious high quality food. 
Right in the heart of Bourbon Street
The crawfish fries are my new favorite late night go-to.  I'm looking for an excuse to bring friends to the French Quarter just so I can get it again.
Fun, funky with good service and good food. Our waiter was nice and helpful when we asked him touristy questions

Our very first stop in NOLA. The bartender was so helpful with getting us off on the right foot. Great food and cocktail suggestions. Just steps from Bourbon street so it wasn't as crazy loud and obnoxious in there but still had an energetic feel.

Food- amazing.
Atmosphere- chill.
Service- unmatched in NO. Natalie was so kind and super efficient.
Overall amazing experience!
Food OK. Very basic presentation, food arrived barely warm, we had to send the appetizer back. Friendly waiter.

This is an absolute must.  Make reservations in advance will save you tons of time.  Blacken gator tail was tender and oh so tasty. Crab cakes are to die for, plenty of crab .  Praline duck was tender moist and savory with a touch of sweetness. 
Can't go wrong with the chicken fettuccine, blackened or Cajun both delicious. Catfish over the jambalaya was excellent.  Don't miss this place.

You have to order strategically at Oceana to get your money's worth.  I recommend the gumbo and the etoufee, as they come in giant portions.  The service is crazy fast and the courtyard is a nice place to sit. Everything is a little on the salty side,  though.

This place did not live up to the hype. $14 for a disappointing shrimp po'boy - stale bread, six small shrimp and lackluster fries. The hurricane was ok, but there are better ones along Bourbon Street.

The servers was attentive and polite, but they couldn't make up for the disappointment in the food.

Our group really wanted to try alligator while we were visiting New Orleans and this was some of the top recommended places so we headed here.  The alligator bites were fantastic!  We also ordered the seared ahi tuna and crawfish pasta which is equally great.  By far the best place we ate at our entire stay; highly recommend.  The prices were relatively fair.  My ahi tuna was $18 and it was a HUGE chunk of tuna steak - perfectly seasoned and cooked.  The only thing i could have asked for that would have paired great with the tuna if they served it with it is some type of ginger aioli sauce.

Down home greatness!! The Cajun fries were to die for and the alligator bites were fresh, hot and filled with flavor!! I enjoyed every bite. The staff is very warm and inviting. I highly recommend this place.

My last night in NOLA and so glad I came here. I made dinner reservations but when we left, there was literally a line out the door waiting to be seated. Last night was cold and raining so I started off with the seafood gumbo. It was so flavorful and hearty and definitely hit the spot. For my main course I ordered the Redfish Oceana. My first time having redfish and it was so delicious and savory. Highly recommend coming here!

We are big fans.  Not much to look at, a tad cramped but have been three times now and Oceana is batting 3 for 3!  Everything we've tried has been delicious (especially anything with the Crawfish Cream Sauce), the service has been freindly and we've enjoyed ourselves immensely without feeling like we paid too much or had been trapped in a tourist trap.  They have a pretty adequate bar and we enjoy the downstairs oyster bar area....just don't get too close, those BBQ oysters trigger some 'major flamidge'.
The food, especially the sides pile the greens, fries, and mash potatoes were amazing. The only reason I give it a 4 is because the crab cakes are just ok. But I will definently go again.
Get the ranch on anything....so good! Service was good, nice atmosphere,  right off bourbon street.
BBQ Oysters, huge Tito's and Josh are the bomb here! First stop of our trip!!! We will probably be back before we go :)
Great atmosphere and customer service. Food has good flavor and a pretty decent selection of types of foods!! I had the ribs and surprisingly this seafood spot had really really delicious ribs!

Talk about customer service! Their staff is so friendly and kind. There was a mistake with our order, so my table received a free tray of half a dozen oysters on the rocks. The food was just fine. A lot of fried food on the menu. I had the blackened chicken po boy. It was flavorful and a large portion for the $15 price tag. I would come back here again for the staff and customer service, but can't say that the food was the star of the experience. We went right around 5:30 and got a table right away. By the time we had finished there was a line waiting around the block! A popular place.

The only positive was the service.  The quality and flavor was sub par.  People raved about the crab cakes, to us they were hard and not much on crab.  The ribeye was a poor cut and the blackened redfish was baked at best. Way too many other great places to eat in NOLA.  Diners beware.
The crawfish is especially good and the atmosphere is great.  The cocktails are awesome.  But be careful, you can't taste the alcohol but it's there!
Went for lunch and got the fried shrimp. It was ok.  Josh the bartender was amazing!  Attentive nice guy who knows how to make some great drinks.

As I'm unpacking from my trip last week, (yes, it took me almost a week to get to it. Lol), I came across my receipt from Oceana with a coupon my waitress gave me. And now im craving it!! The special of the day was TO DIE FOR!!! My bloody Mary was one of the best I've ever had! My waitress,Meagan L., was a darling! Super sweet. Very knowledgeable, not only about the menu, but about the city as well. She gave us amazing suggestions on what to eat and things to do in her hometown. I tell you what, a waitress can make or break an experience, and she holds the bar pretty high! Ask for Meagan when you eat here! She won't let you down! And get the special, whatever it is for the day!

We tried many places in town and Oceana Grill was BY FAR the best! The red fish was fresh and the cream sauce on top was full of flavor. The New Orleans Platter was amazing, all three sub-entrees were seasoned just right. To finish it off, the bread pudding with ice cream exceeded expectations. The wait to get in went fast and was well worth it!

This is our 1st time in New Orleans and we are having a blast!! We are staying in the French Quarter and have been eating and drinking all over the city. Bar - bar, restaurant - restaurant -- we have not had a bad experience!

This city offers a ton of fun stuff and entertainment, but the food is OUTRAGEOUS!!

Of all the places we've been to, Oceana is our favorite AND WE WILL BE BACK!

We started with the BBQ peel and eat shrimp - out of this world! Can't pass that up. We each had sandwiches - the Po Boy shrimp is the best one I've had on the planet!

Our server, Jamil, was outstanding! He was very pleasant and knew the menu like the back of his hand. He came over and checked on us often. He did a great job!

Great place to eat, always warm and cozy - the ambiance and the food! Great job management, cooks, service and hostesses! All were wonderful!

Service was great. However, I went for the gumbo. It was a real disappointment. There was no flavor to it. I was expecting much better with all the great reviews. Also, don't waste your time on the Pecan pie, it was flavorless

Went to the N.O. a few weeks ago, and ate dinner at the place. We ate at the bar, because this place was quite popular...I now know why. We started with the crab cakes for appetizers. Probably the best I've had. Then we had some "smoking" hurricanes from a great bartender named Josh. The dinner was excellent; blackened catfish and mine had crawfish on top. I can't say anything bad about this place, and I'd recommend highly.

We have been in New Orleans 5 days so far, and this is our 4th visit here. This is a GREAT place for food and has quite reasonable prices for drinks on/near Bourbon St. The bartenders have been great and have given us the best service of anywhere in New Orleans so far. Chris and Shaun have been very accommodating and have modified a drink or two for our tastes, just ask for a "Storm Rider" as we dubbed it. 

The food has been awesome. Anything with crawfish or crabcakes you cant go wrong with for sure. Order the Mardi Grad pasta & add the crabcake!! BEST THING EVER!! As far as an appetizer.... Go for the Cajun Fries... WARNING.. APP FOR AT LEAST 4 PEOPLE!! The mushroom cream sauce... I wish I had the recipe, but will try to mimic it! Anything with that on it is gonna be awesome!
Authentic Luisana dishes and great service... Whitney P was beyond attentive and courteous!!!

This place is so delicious!!! My friend and I tried the shrimp fettuccine Alfredo, crab fries, and crab meat cakes. Everything was soo good. We ordered a little too much food for the two of us but that was because we wanted to try so many things!

The Oceana Grill is an excellent choice whenever you're in New Orleans. It's right in the middle of the festivities and it deserves to be there. The food is amazing. I had the chicken Alfredo and an Incredible Hulk to drink. The portion sizes are awesome. I began to eat and the colorful tastes sent my tastebuds into a frenzy of deliciousness. This will be a place that I frequent whenever I'm in New Orleans. Bravo! And the service was excellent!

The 5 of us had lunch here today.
Mom ordered the fried oysters and crawfish tails. Way too much for a 90 year old lady to eat, so the rest of us helped her. It was delicious! The fried oysters were very sweet!
Wife had a standard breakfast with sausage. She said it was very good.
Son had the Oyster PO Boy. Loaded with sweet fried oysters. Very very good!
Daughter had the shrimp and pasta. She loved it!
I had the trio of Jambalaya, crawfish etouffe, and red beans and rice. Delicious!!
You need to go here and be prepared to eat lots and lots of delicious food! Plus the service was wonderful!!
Food is above average. The service is great very friendly. The drinks are strong I promise they might not hit you fast but they hit right when you need them . Try the red beans and rice !!

Food was great but overpriced, service was terrible. We ordered the Bloody Mary pictured on the host stand and didn't receive it till after we got the food. Was super cool but price wasn't listed and came on the bill as $30. We got the seafood platter and it was great. Never been to a place that serves fried fish and fries but no malt vinegar. Server was no where to be found the entire time. Asked for lemon for the fish and didn't get until food was cold. Maybe would try again because of food quality.
Very good food and drinks here highly recommend grab a Thunderstorm drink.

This was a wonderful experience. The crab cakes were delicious, and it's a must-have for everyone coming here for the first time. We ordered the chicken Alfredo, ahi tuna, and fried seafood platter, and we enjoyed all three. For dessert, we had banana ice cream cake, and that was equally delightful. The flavors in all the dishes are great!
The food and drinks were great! Whitney, our waitress, took great care of us and was very friendly. Would come back again to try something new.

We came to this place because of the many reviews we saw on line and we left extremely disappointed. The service was professional and good but not the food .
The fish was swimming in an unknown creamy  sauce and the fried platter actually was full of cooking oil.
Even  the dessert  mousse cake tasted like margarine . 
New Orleans have better restaurants!!!!!

We came with a large group on a Wednesday evening and our experience was top notch! The food was excellent, but the real star of the show were our two servers, Mary and Darrick. They were prepared with suggestions, warm and friendly service, and looked for ways to go above and beyond. Truly two standout employees- thank you for providing us with such a great dining experience!

A friend of ours told us we needed to come here solely for the crab cakes.  She was right. They were awesome! I got the Blackened chicken. It was good but I tell you the best thing was the sides: jambalaya and this corn with green chillies.  Great stuff. The wife had the redfish and it was great stuff too. The fish was light and not fishy at all. I was skeptical because I don't do a lot of fish. So have no worries. It's great! I'd recommend!
Amazing desserts and drinks. Didn't eat dinner but can only assume greatness. Atmosphere is awesome and staff is unbelievably friendly. Worth the wait.
Cold food Everytime we go here. The oysters were chewy and awful. This place is losing its touch.

We went to Oceana on a Wednesday night and the wait was less than 15 minutes. They are so efficient and work as a team. 

For drinks we ordered the Hurricane and the tropical storm and they were both delicious. We were pleasantly surprised that they came flaming. For food we ordered the shrimp and fries and the blackened catfish meal, both were delicious. Overall a wonderful experience, I will definitely be back.

Pro tip: if this is your first time here check in with yelp for a  coupon !
Excellent atmosphere. Our waitress Megan was fabulous. Food delicious!

Came here for a late dinner. Great service! Drinks were good! We had blackened catfish and oceana famous oysters. Oysters were great! I thought the catfish serving was a little small.. $17 for a single, fairly thin fillet with an also somewhat small side of jambalaya and collard greens. I'm from New York City so I'm used to expensive entrees but they're usually worth the money there, but I get it- this place is right off Bourbon St. Other than that no other complaints!

Yup, Kitchen Nightmares famous Oceana! Oysters, gumbo, jambalaya, bbq shrimp, crab cakes. All pretty good. Remember most of these restaurants aren't fancy so it's all comfy feel food. My hunny ordered ribeye, which he wasn't crazy about, but it's a seafood restaurant, so steak isn't going to be their best food item, so I won't ding them for that. I would come back.

Unfortunately, I have to give this place just 2.5 stars overall. It came highly recommended by my hotel and many locals. The place seems to have a loyal following but the food was not impressive. The atmosphere and service, on the other hand, do score high marks. 

The interior  of the restaurant had the cool casual NOLA vibe, with some great music playing in the background. The service was great - our waitress, Ashley, was friendly and attentive.  

My appetizer of choice was the crab cakes. I would have expected more from a place so highly recommended. AND, its in NOLA! But, just meh. The Crawfish omelette was next on the list. It came with hash browns and a biscuit. Again meh. The home fries were tasty and really made the whole meal. Drinks, as with most places in NOLA, were pretty tasty, and strong. ;)

Would I go back? Maybe, in a pinch. But with so many options, why would I?? Would I recommend it? Nope.
I don't understand why the great reviews of this place. I would compare their quality to a TGIF. Service was excellent but food was BAD. They do open late so that's a one nice thing about it.

Short wait was worth it. Very friendly service and great food. Tried a bunch of Nola staples like red beans and rice, jambalaya, and etaofee. Great spot before hitting the night life in the French quarter.

This place has awesome food. I had the crab cakes. Unlike many places, these crab cakes were full of crab. My husband had the smoked duck and it was delicious. We went there on Friday night just before 7 pm. There was already a line to get in. They don't take reservations on Friday or Saturday nights. They do serve food at the bar so we walked right in and sat at the bar, no wait. Our bartender/waitress was super nice and attentive. Would definitely go back.

This was our first time visiting New Orleans and I'm really glad we stopped here to eat dinner! The food was amazing and the service was more than outstanding and perfect, our waitress Sierra was awesome! And she remembered our names throughout the whole night! And made us feel right at home, we will definitely being coming back hopefully sometime soon! As we are visiting from Florida, but if anyone wants good good food and great amazing service I recommend stopping in here for lunch or dinner or whatever the time may be, you definitely won't be disappointed! What an awesome place!!

Went here based on many recommendations and were not disappointed!  Get there early or be ready to wait.  Ordered a variety off the menu and everything was awesome!  Also, great service even during peak hours, we'll be back!

Pics say 1000 words...
Thank you Oceana Grill...
LaKeisha, was our hostess and she is the BOMB!
Great NOLA experience!
Thank you Oceana Grill...
We Love you
Fast service, food was good.  Nothing better than gulf fresh shrimp! We got the shrimp and the catfish po' boy.  You couldn't go wrong with either.
Ordered take out from here using grub hub delivery.  The food was still nice and hot.  The Gumbo's was so delicious.

Taylor is so sweet and a great waitress! She did a great job. Awesome food! Thanks for the great experience! Red beans and rice were great!  Pretty chill NOLA touristy place. There's a line, so show up early!!

Out waiter, Ryan, was so personable and took very great care of us. He was charming and catered to us very well. Cannot day enough great things about him and the oysters. Will definitely return and ask for Ryan by name.

Good food, friendly service. 
Line was out the door, but our party of 3 was seated in less than 15 minutes.

Food was good. Service was good but we felt rushed.  Appetizers came out and then food came out right after.  They took food back and kept it on heat lamp until we were done apps so it wasn't really hot.  Oysters were delicious
A great place for lunch. Wonderful menu items and right in the heart of all the action in the French Quarter. It's a bit small in there so the wait may be a bit, nonetheless it's delicious food.

This place is underrated. Everyone we talk to said to go to  ACMEs for oysters, but Oceanas charbroiled took the award for me. They are so well made and not dry. Also, the alligator tail bits you can get half fried and half blackened- try them both! So delicious. Will recommend.

OH MY GOD.... This restaurant was AMAZING. The food, the atmosphere, the service!!! OUTSTANDING!! Erica was one of the kindest and friendliest and best servers we've ever had! The owner came and greeted us and was so warm and welcoming! I'm coming back here EVERY TIME I come to New Orleans!!!!!
Excellent breakfast fare.  If you can, get Pamela as your waitress...she's knowledgeable and has a great waitress.  The French toast and alligator sausage is well worth the visit.

Just ok.

Visited Oceana Grill while in NOLA for Essence Fest.  The restaurant is huge and they can accommodate small or large parties.  Great service.  

But the food...I had crawfish etouffee and it was not worth ordering as it tasted like it came from a box mix...the fried shrimp was just ok...the food at the Sheraton was better...

I also ate at Dookey Chase the day before and the bar was set pretty high.

Conclusion - it' ok.  But there are places with better food in the area...

Food wise, my order was incredibly delicious. The reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because we had to wait outside for over an hour in line to get seated. However, it was nice that some of the waitstaff came out and provided water to people waiting for seats. 

I ordered Oceana's Famous Oysters--they were the best I've ever had, and a Blackened Chicken Po'boy--equally as delicious as my app. My friend ordered the Crab Cake meal and while it was good, it wasn't great. Our waiter was courteous and attentive and the food came out fast. If I ever find myself back in NOLA, I will be sure to stop by Oceana again (except maybe for lunch instead of a weekend dinner!).
Delish. Crab cakes were amazing and highly recommend the chargrilled oysters. Really good place for dinner.

Very clean very friendly atmosphere. Whitney our waitress was amazing very attentive five stars for her.... the most important part THE FOOD WAS REALLY GOOD ...you step on Burbon you step into Oceana Grill

Food was excellent. Crab cakes, shrimp creole, crawfish étouffée was soooo good. Service was excellent and the recommendations were spot on. It's was so good we went back for breakfast. Would go back if ever in N'awlins again.

The pictures look amazing. I unfortunately was severely disappointed by everything I ordered. My son loved his ribs. That's it. We ordered the gumbo, red fish, BBQ shrimp & kids fried fish. Absolutely no salt or flavor. The gumbo was watery with bay shrimp. The BBQ shrimp tasted old. I wasted my money.

We were a little skeptical because of a couple of the reviews. We finally decided to try it and we weren't sorry we did! We had char grilled oysters which were amazing perfectly seasoned and slightly crisp on the edges. We tried the gumbo which could have been hotter but the taste was great added a little hot sauce to spice it up. For an entree we had the taste of New Orleans and nothing disappointed! The red beans with sausage was fantastic the etoufee was amazing and the jambalaya was terrific! For dessert we had Bourbon pecan pie warmed with a scoop of ice cream it was delicious! Flaky crust with plenty of pecans and perfect sweetness. Would recommend this to anyone who wants to taste all of the great food of the area in one sitting! The service was great everyone was friendly and we never had to wait for anything!

We went to this restaurant on new years eve because our concierge gave is a 10% off coupon. Everything about it was amazing. Our server first recommended the crab cakes.  They are the best any of us have ever had. (you know if cops come in and order them that they must be good). I had one of the chef's specials for the night, Mardi Gras Pasta, fetuccini topped with crab, crawfish, shrimp and a crawfish cream sauce.  It was delicious!  We also had oysters on the half shell, shrimp fetuccini, chicken fetuccini, jambalaya pasta and the roasted duck. Everything was great. Whoever is making the sauces in the back needs a raise!

Our waiter was great. Making sure we had anything we needed. Finally it was time for dessert,  we decided on the bread pudding and the bananas foster (both reccomended by our waiter).  They were amazing!  This was an overall great experience. 

After a bad experience at lunch the next day, we decided to go back for dinner again. Of course we ordered the crab cakes again.  And they were delicious, again.  We all ordered something different and it was all amazing.  I had the surf and turf special. Blackened ribeye with the crawfish sauce, jambalaya and fried shrimp.  The steak was amazing. Better than some filets that I've had and I live in Texas.  They couldve served just the steak on a plate and I would've been happy. But the shrimp just melts in your mouth. It was breaded and cooked perfectly. We also tried the stuffed tuna, fried shrimp platter and redfish.  Again, everything was delicious.  

I would reccomended this place to anyone in a heartbeat. The service was great and the food was amazing. We will definitely be going back next time we're here.  Maybe even again before we leave!

I ended up going back because this place had gator so I wanted to eat it before I left. I also had planned to redeem a bread pudding but I ended up being too full. The waitress was kind enough to let me do half and half for a po boy with half fried shrimp and half blackened oyster. I did enjoy the fried shrimp. The gator was alright but that's not the restaurants fault. It was a pretty good po boy. It came with fries and those fries were good!  
Would recommend Oceana as they have a lot of unique dishes, well priced, and excellent service.  A solid 4+.

Started off with blackened and fried alligator bites, crab cakes, and the cajun fries. For my main dish I had the blackened red fish on top of dressing, covered in the crawfish mushroom sauce, and a side of greens. For dessert we had the chocolate kahlua mousse. Everything was delicious. Our server Chris was attentive and friendly. Glad we stopped in

My wife and I went here on a Wed night because we were hungry and it was after 10 and everything else seemed to be closed.  Ordered alligator sausage appetizer and blackened catfish po boy. Enjoyed both. I saw flames in the kitchen and asked what they were making. Cook said oysters. I explained I'd never had them and next thing you know he brought me 2 oysters- 1 Rockefeller and 1 Oceana style. Both were delicious! We would go back again.
I thought the food was good. I do think they put too much sauce on the charbroiled oysters, although the sauce does taste good. The poboy was ok but the bread was too dry. The atmosphere was great!

I honestly think that when you go to a restaurant the service is what makes your experience go over the top. Whitney made my experience amazing here. She was so sweet and honest. She helped my boyfriend and I pick what to eat and we really loved the food! 
We got the fried gator bites and gumbo for appetizers. I enjoyed the gator bites a lot I def recommend! 
We also got the jambalaya and the blackened redfish étouffée...both we're simply phenomenal!
It was my boyfriend's birthday so she was kind enough to get everyone at the restaurant to sing to him and also gave him some banana pudding.
Delicious meal, great service! Def would come back for Whitney & the food!!

Had the fried shrimp platter and boy was it delicious. They're special was a pasta with blackened seafood...I'm still dreaming about that pasta it was sooooo good! 

Not only was the food amazing, but what made our experience better was Alex! He was amazing!! Super sweet, very attentive, and gave us real good recommendations since we were visiting. Alex is the best!!
Amazing taste of new Orleans!! Must try when you are in town! We were seated right away
Everyone's been saying this place has the best Crab Cake and it did not disappoint! Must stop if your in the area!!!
Loved the breakfast crepe. Warning it is big! Whitney was our server and she was attentive and sweet. That added to our dining experience.

First time visiting Oceana. Food and staff were amazing. Whitney P was our server. She was extremely knowledgeable of the menu, professional yet down to earth. I had the seafood gumbo. The flavors were AMAZING. Portion size was just right. Whitney checked on us often to make sure everything was to our expectations. I highly recommend Oceana. You will not be disappointing with the food or service. Enjoy!!
Tourist trap. Tourist trap. Tourist trap. I guess that's expected for the Bourbon Street area. Food is bland and not at all fresh. Would not recommend.
Had a wonderful dinner 1/26/17; ordered Redfish Oceana and Oyster po-boy; hubby and I shared the 2 dishes.  Erich our server was great!
Love this restaurant! Great food, drinks, and especially great service!  Everyone here are so sweet and so tentative.  Our server Meagan L is wonderful!
I had blacked red fish special with red beans and rice served over crawlfish and cornbread filling.  By far best meal I had on trip to New Orleans.

Found this little gem on Yelp! Swung by around midnight (an hour before closing) and these people still had the most inviting presence ever. Our server, Kim, was the best; would definitely come back to this spot! Too good, and all the employees are the sweetest.

Ordered special of the day this past Sunday for dinner which was blackened red fish Oceana with crawfish/shrimp cream sauce, corn and greens. Was not listed as a special item in menu card...just the bar tender verbally communicated.  (Sat at the bar as it was all packed).  Food certainly tasted good...nothing super special though.  Give food taste a 4 star.  (Fish was a bit over cooked and dry. Sauce tasted really good). 

Found out that the same dish was also listed as one of the dinner menu items and was priced at  $20 or $22. When the bill came, the bar tender charged me $29 for that dish.  Not sure why as the same item was listed in the menu that comes with roasted garlic potatoes and vegetables for $20 or $22.  My dish certainly was not worth $29.
Food was awesome. Best fried oysters I have ever had. Nice courtyard. What made the place special is our waitress Pamela. She is fantastic!

The service was amazing! We had a party of 5 and many of us were indecisive as to what we wanted. We had read many of the reviews, but was still unsure. 

Demarcus was FANTASTIC!!! He was knowledgeable of the specials and informed us of what would be best based off of our personal taste palette. Best service I've had in awhile!

Shane was our guy, super nice and helpful. 

We had the BBQ shrimp, Jazzy crab cake platter and chargrilled oysters. All we're pretty good; maybe a bit too much sauce on the oysters...

Don't be afraid when they lead you in and upstairs. All the staff you pass will say "welcome in" and smile. It seemed prettty genuine and I liked it. 

Service was great. All we're attentive and met all of our requests. 

No complaints here!
pretty good. red beans and rice here is the best ive had honestly. everything else is great. definitely come if youre on bourbon but dont go out of your way. service is awesome

I absolutely loved the food and drinks  that I had to return.  The po boys are amazing, very juicy not dry like some other spots. My husband had the jambalaya and it was very delicious. Great service.  Definitely a must while in NOLA.

The shrimp fettuccini was delish! The server (Johnell) was very knowledgeable about the menu & my babe enjoyed his first experience here. He had the crawfish étouffée... And it was good too! Not my first time here & I'm more than sure it won't be my last or his :-)

Great seafood platter!  The breading and seasonings were done just right.  The fried oysters, shrimp & catfish were plentiful and delicious.  I would recommend this restaurant also because the staff was very friendly and accommodating. We would come back to this seafood spot in future visits to NOLA.

Off of Burbon Street in NOLA, the wait time was about 20 mins to be seated for dinner.  Friendly staff.  The restaurant lighting is very dim.  All of the food our party ordered was delicious including the margaritas.

Hands down the best part about my trip to NOLA!

Can't recommend more the jambalaya, seafood platter, and chicken alfredo! So good! Friendly attentive staff, good ambiance, quiet enough to carry a regular conversation with friends. 

We ate here twice, it was that good!

Gastronomic delight!!! 

The ambience, service and food was above par! Really enjoyed the fish and the crawfish sauce on the top was a plus!!! 

They have a good selection of alcohol and though I did not have a cocktail they did look good. The place can be a bit noisy so not really a place to eat at if you're looking for a quiet evening. 

Definitely a place I'm coming back to!

We had a delicious breakfast this morning and were most impressed with our waitress, Megan. She gave us great suggestions for places to see and things to do while in New Orleans. Megan was very attentive to us throughout our meal. The Bloody Mary was top notch and the house made mix was the best. We plan on returning for dinner one night before we leave.

We've eaten here on 3 different NOLA vacations.  Food is amazing! Great comfort food.  Really hits the spot when you're in the mood for cajun pasta.  Their service is great - very friendly staff.  However, I've had 2 incidents, nothing major - but it makes me give it 3 instead of 5 stars. Our first trip the waitress messed up our bill and didn't charge us enough for our total bill.  We happened to stay there at the table chatting long after we paid so she was able to find us and asked me to sign a new bill with a higher amount. Fine. While we were figuring out our bill they came & took our plates without asking us if we wanted to take the leftovers to go.  We had already planned to eat the leftovers for lunch the next day. Oh well - our fault too, we should've remembered to ask for a box. But the waitress said that because the error in the bill was HER error, she'd have the bar take off our drinks and I'd see the credit on my credit card.  That never happened.

We went back again on our 2nd trip to NOLA a few months later with some friends. Evening was fine - had my cajun pasta again & loved it.

 Our 3rd trip we made a reservation months in advance for a party of 50! We were coming down for our wedding and as a nervous bride I called twice to confirm my reservations 2 weeks before our wedding.  However, the night we arrive to Oceana Grill -- ALL 45 of us!!! -- They do NOT have my reservation on their books. I was shocked. But - the manager quickly got his staff on the ball and within 15 minutes we had one room all set up for our party. The evening was a huge success - and everyone loved the food!!!

We'll go back again I'm sure.  Mistakes happen so I don't hold a grudge - my biggest disappointment was the 1st waitress who never credited our drink bill as promised. I really wanted to give it 5 stars - but these little incidents each time add up.

The wait was long but worth it! Staff was great and friendly. Our meal was great along with our appetizer. We celebrated our one year wedding anniversary here and glad we chose this gem. Very popular and always busy but worth the wait! The grilled shrimp plate was amazing!!!

Food was ok, I just ordered some ahi, took a break from Cajan food and Oysters. Place was in the heart of Bourbon street area. Drinks were good food was ok. Ahi was 1/2 inch think, I like it a little thicker, a little too spicy for ahi but all in all not bad. Sure other foods would have been better. Prices where high but what the heck, its a vacation.

Great ambience love the design of this restaurant, it looks small when you walk in but it's huge. To drink I had a swamp drink that was really good and strong I also the Blackened Bayou Duck it was so good. Our waitress Chantay was also amazing super nice super friendly all around great service I recommend this restaurant for sure and I will definitely be back for more

Super pleasant surprise! Literally wandered in off the street hungry for lunch. Busy with a good mix of locals on their lunch break and tourists. They sat me right away... Very attentive hostess! Service is super friendly and super fast. The shrimp Po boy is so good... bread is perfect, the shrimp is plump and fried just right. I got these crazy smothered french fries... All I know is it's got crawfish and some yummy gravy. So good.  It shouldn't be noteworthy but even the iced tea is fresh brewed and tasty. I've been to many places lately with gross iced tea.

And someone really knows what they're doing here... Watching them train a new server; she's getting actual feedback. kudos to the ownership/management.

The oysters were so good, that we had to come back again on our last night in town!

A correction to my previous review, the oysters we loved so much were the Oceana Oysters. This time we ordered the full dozen!!!

Our dinner was even more delicious than last time. My wife's pasta was good, but I really recommend the Cajun jambalaya! It was extremely tasty due to all the flavors.

Our server Derrick was also great. He was on top of it and very friendly.

This time we got there around 8pm and did have to wait in line for like 15-20 minutes, but it was well worth it!

The breakfast specials were fantastic, the oysters were amazing, the chicken fettuccini was exquisite, and the DRINKS OMG to die for! The staff was super friendly and very welcoming. Giving me one of the best NOLA French quarter experience of my life. I can't wait to go back

Was in the area for 4 days mid-January with my gf and made this place a priority to go to. We went for brunch and were blown away with the shrimp etoufee; it was a genuine taste that resonated throughout the theme of cajun food the rest of our trip. 

WHITNEY is the best waitress! She was so nice and recommended the best food & also found out that we were visitors and gave us a brochure as well as her fave spots to make the best of our vacation. She gave an absolute 5/5 customer service.

With such a great experience with food and service, we decided to come back and enjoyed the dishes pictured below. Every one was sooooo good; BBQ shrimp had a thick flavorful sauce that was complemented so well with the bread. The soft shell crab and chargrilled oysters were to die for!! Highly highly recommend the bloody mary, so easy to drink! ***Remember to bring your receipt to another visit for a bloody mary or mimosa on the house***

My next visit to NOLA I will definitely make Oceana the first place I return to!

One of the best places we ate while in town!! The wait staff were super friendly (Dori is the absolute best waitress ever) and she was knowledgeable about the menu.  My wife and I let the Dori know that we were splitting a dish and she brought it to us on two separate plates. We will come back 100% if we are in town again.

Try the shrimp po-boy it will not disappoint! Also try the fried oyster side, it was also delicious!
AMAZING! Food was fresh and the service was just as good. Not as flashy as some places in the French Quarter but the prices were sweet and the food was delicious.

I ordered their specialty margarita soo delicious, not overly sweet. The gator bites were good we ordered half blackened/fried, would recommend. And lastly our main dish was soooooo good. Our server Sierra was fantastic, super attentive and friendly. Highly recommend this place!! Oh and to top it all off the wait time was probably like 10min tops.

This place is amazing. I've been here with friends and family for both lunch and breakfast  and both options are amazing. This time we had Whitney as our waitress  and she was the bomb.com. Very sweet, helpful, outgoing,etc. Coming here for breakfast you can't go wrong with anything. From the French toast, to the Royal omelette,  and the seafood omelette all was amazing. Thanks Whitney for being a wonderful waitress.

Honestly I think this place has a lot of reviews because of its location and its history. Apart from that, I didn't think the food was too spectacular. 

I had the gator bites and a fried oyster po boy. 

The gator bites were a bit on the salty side and tasted like chicken (of course, aside from the extra chewiness in texture that alligator meat gives). It had been fried and coated in sauce. Pretty similar to your average chicken poppers, but with alligator. 

The fried oyster po boy had a decent amount of fried oysters in there and I did enjoy that part. However, the bread was pretty plain and it was just there. Didn't really add anything to it. I wish I had just the fried oysters by themselves. 

It's a pretty no frills place. The interior is quite dark. The seats aren't the most comfortable. But it does seem to have a lot of history, and they even sell their own t-shirts.

Mardi Gras weekend it's jam packed and there was a line outside but this place was definitely the best food we had eaten since arriving! The greens were so tasty that outside of my jambalaya I couldn't resist ordering a separate side--- yum is all I can say!! A must do in NOLA and Cole was a great waiter with great hospitality.

This was my first time here and my second time in New Orleans. There was a small line outside when my and my wife arrived but it didn't take us long at all to get in and get seated. Our waitress Kim was very nice and the food was phenomenal. I tried the Red Fish Étouffée and I honestly can say it was probably one of the best dishes I've ever had. It was delicious. When I come back this will sure to be one of the places I visit again.
Taste of New Orleans with a side of Gumbo!!  Absolutely amazing!!  Will be returning here for sure on our next visit! Stopping here is an absolute MUST!!

Oceana grill is your middle of the road, casual dining spot. They have the usual creole/cajun fare. 
Large portions and cold drinks, abound.
Quickly sat, pleasantly served nice meal... 

Of all of the MANY places to eat... this is a safe bet.
I had the fried seafood platter and it was ok. It was nothing to brag about. The redfish and dressing was delicious. The atmosphere was casual and family friendly.

Food: 
The food was tasty and well spiced. My husband ordered the Fried Shrimp Po-Boy ($14.00). The bun was soft and lightly toasted, the shrimp and sauces were very flavorful. The side of fries was generous. 

I ordered the Crawfish Etouffee and our water suggested I should add crab ($15.00+$5). The sauce was slightly spicy, I added a bit more hot sauce to spice it up. It was very tasty and had great flavors

Drinks:
Hurricaine - $9. Sweet, but not too sweet! Perfect

Our waiter, Guy was extremely attentive and very helpful. He was a great waiter. The only issue is that we had just arrived from CA and were starved. Our food didn't arrive until almost an hour after we ordered. This was by far one of the longest waits we've ever had for food. 

We will definitely be back!

Turning tables...
Blackened catfish was a 5, oysters Rockefeller was a 1.  The restaurant seemed to be more about quantity of patrons and not the quality of food or service.  Disappointing

This was the first place we tried when arriving to New Orleans. Everything was fresh and well seasoned. Their gumbo was amazing! I only needed to add a little hot sauce to it, but it was still delicious

The food here is absolutely perfect. I went with a small group of friends before we went out to drink on Bourbon St. I had the fried catfish po boy, my boyfriend had the Taste of N'awlins, my best friend had Chicken Alfredo (instead of Alfredo sauce she had jambalaya sauce!), and her boyfriend had the catfish and fried shrimp plate. It was truly euphoric, being that we traveled here from the Dallas, TX area. 10/10 recommend.

Had great fried shrimp with fries. Jambalaya was also great with red beans and rice. The hurricane drink was delicious and very strong. We visited from out of town and we thought it was pretty good for a reasonable price. It was also in a great location and they had excellent service there (we sat at the bar and the bartender was great).
I enjoyed my dish. It was great but I have had better cajun food. No worries though, you will walk out of there satisfied if you order the right thing

Our group was rather large, but made a reservation well in advance. We still had to wait 20 minutes after our reservation time before being seated while people who showed up after us with no reservation were being seated almost immediately. It was a little frustrating. 

I should preface the food portion by saying I'm not a huge fan of seafood. I was with a large group of coworkers who mostly ordered seafood and they were all incredibly pleased with their food. 

I, on the other hand, ordered a blackened chicken po'boy. It was really excellent. The chicken was moist and flavorful. And the remoulade sauce was just spicy enough to take the sandwich to the next level. The french fries that came with it were good, but I wished I had known that I could get a Cesar salad on the side instead. 

I also tried fried alligator, which was surprisingly tasty. 

It took about 20 minutes for the check paying process, which seemed a little long.

Make sure you order the seafood gumbo! It doesn't matter what else you eat in New Orleans. Nothing tops the seafood gumbo from here!! Its Life changing!!! The line may look long but its worth the wait and moves quickly! Its a must have! 

P.s. the cosmo is made to knock you on your bum.

My wife, I, and three kids had a great time here. The blackened duck and redfish with crawfish toppings and mushroom cream sauce were both wonderful. Kids had never had this style of cuisine and were really pleased. Great service and fun atmosphere.

I had such an amazing meal here last week! John was our waiter and he took such good care of us. All of our food was amazing, but the crab cake was my favorite. If you want casual Cajun food, or a nicer date night meal, Oceana would be perfect!

Interesting place. It is a bit noisy. We reached here around 6 pm and were a group of 6 people. I chose the seafood gumbo. The rest of my party chose the fish entres. Everything was great. The gumbo was good. I just don't think it's the best I've had. Overall good place for a casual hangout with friends. Recommend reservations if going later!

We heard about this place and decided to give it a try and was not disappointed! The food is phenomenal!!! We ended up coming back 2 days later because we couldn't stop thinking about their redfish oceana, lol. The crab cakes are great and so is the blackened redfish as well as the pasta dishes too. Awesome, awesome food!
Enjoyed raw oysters and oysters Rockefeller. A side of gumbo was tasty and perfect for a night time snack. Service was friendly and fast.

My boyfriend and I got the fries on the appetizer menu and that was a big portion and really good! We also split the jambalaya pasta and it was enough for the both of us. The drinks were really neat too!
Great place, great food, fantastic service from Rahman. Oysters Rockefeller are delicious! !

The food at Oceana is not 'New Orleans Good.'  The shrimp in my Po Boy was almost inedibly dried out.  Was a bummer in New Orleans. The manager and waitress were nice and tried to fix, which I appreciated.  Oceana felt like a mediocre chain restaurant in the French Quarter.  The ads at the airport was a proper red flag. Disappointed. 

Food: 2
Atmosphere: 2
Value: 2
Service:  4

The food here is GREAT, but the staff is horrible. The hostesses were two young girls who were unfortunately unprofessional. I came with one other person & was told the wait would be 30-45 minutes. A larger party (3) came in after me (with no reservation) & was seated before us. When I asked why, the hostess had no valid reason, & did not offer an apology. She almost sat another party that entered after us when I interrupted asking why. After THAT is when we were finally seated. As we walked up the narrow stairs to a dining are, an middle aged man who also worked there barged towards us loudly telling us "there's not enough space for both of us on the stairs" instead of waiting at the top until we made it up. I was so shocked that an employee had the nerve to behave that way. What's worse is he was not in uniform & appeared to be acting in a managerial capacity. The service is here the worst I've seen. The food is truly their saving grace, because that's the only upside of this place.

We had the shrimp and grits with a side of coleslaw. I was expecting the coleslaw to be a little more flavorful, but the shrimp and grits was excellent! The waitstaff was really friendly and gave us pointers on what to check out nearby.

Really great food and service. my husband and I both got different variations of blackened red fish, and it was fantastic! We also got the charred oysters, another amazing dish. Also, Whitney is the best!
Had lunch at the bar and enjoyed the game.  Quant atmosphere and staff members were polite.  The house special red fish dish was wonderful.   I would absolutely love to have that dish again.

I know this is weird, but I have to give a fairly positive review for what really should be pretty negative. The redemption came from how good the food was. I was staying in a hotel nearby and they offered delivery. I ordered a fried catfish platter - fish, fries, hush puppies, coleslaw. The whole enchilada, as they say. Well, what I got was the blackened catfish with jambalaya and veggies (greens, in this case). Not what I wanted, not what I ordered, not what I expected. But you know what? It's was pretty damn delicious. Probably much healthier for me, too. I was drunk ordering, after all.
Went here Tuesday night and everything and every employee was great.  Waiter(forgot his name) gave great recommendations for dinner and honest ones for dessert.

The service was very good .  We went on NYE and our server Ryan was very attentive and quick.  The food was good , came out quick and our orders were correct! 

I would definitely recommend going here for dinner . Note:  if you order the taste of Orleans get something on the side.  It's not that filling of a dish it's really a taste of a few things .
BOMB food Taste of New Orleans is the way to go. Very flavorful we sat at the bar and the two young men were awesome! Please don't let the long line bother you it's well worth the wait.

Good: Redfish Oceana and Oysters Rockefeller 

Bad: Specialty drinks are weak

Best: Service, Crabcakes

The food is amazing and the service is on point. On a recent trip for a conference we found this place and was hooked. We at there twice in one week. The food comes out quick and it is Delicous. I have the Cajun pasta and a side of shrimp and grits. They give you good portions so we split the Cajun pasta and shared it. The margaritas were good and came out with smoke for nice decorative feel. The second time i had the Cajun pasta and decided to get the alligator bites as the appetizer it was my first time trying them but it was amazing. I highly recommend this restaurant

This place has amazing food, get here around 5-6pm for dinner or you will be waiting in line. The mushroom cream sauce is excellent, must be a signature recipe because they use it on most dishes. Definitely a place on our list to keep coming back to, Ashleigh is a great waitress, ask for her by name she is excellent.

Oceana Grill is THE place to go, for authentic cajun food. I found myself there last week when a local recommended I try Oceana Grill. We got the seafood platter. AMAZING! The experience wouldn't be complete without our wonderful serve Meagan L. She was there whenever we needed her, with that friendly smile. Thanks for recommending the seafood platter, Meagan. We WILL be back!
The Redfish with the crawfish was awesome!!! Large portions and the atmosphere was okay considering it was in a busy area.

The first restaurant I ever ate at in Nola over 15 years ago and still one of my favorites! Best blackened gator! The blackened chicken breast is simple but absolutely amazing! And one of the best things is it is open past midnight so you don't have to settle for burgets, pizza and chicken when you're hungry late night!!!
Short and sweet....not the same quality and service from past visits. The organization has expanded too fast and it's obvious. The locals avoid it with scorn, and it will be our last visit.

Amazing fried seafood platter. I don't have a huge appetite but I emptied the whole platter in under 20 min even the waitress was surprised haha xD

How did I eat so much (and quickly)?
1. The seafood was perfectly seasoned (just the right amount of salt to bring out the flavors of fresh seafood)
2. The frying was nicely done (beautiful crispy crust, tender and juicy on the inside.)
3. The potato fries had a glass like crust from the exterior, and was light and fluffy on the inside.
4. The tartar and spicy mayo were simply unbeatable. The blend of flavors was flawless.

Simply some of the best food I've had. 
Also, the restaurant is very busy and full of life. Great ambiance and service. 5/5
Mary c killed it. She handled our party of 9 fabulously. Made the great food even better

Food was absolutely amazing! The catfish was everything I was hoping for! We had the seafood omelette and couldn't eat is fast enough! The service was great and we were seated immediately! This place seems very authentic and definitely will visit again next time I'm in New Orleans!

Spacious restaurant on multiple floors. Be ready to climb some stairs if seated upstairs. We had the crab cakes, jambalaya pasta and the redfish. The crab cakes were big and good but just needed to be a bit warmer. We really enjoyed the Cajun jambalaya pasta. The sauce was packed with great flavors. The redfish was decent but nothing to brag about.

Service was good and attentive.
Nice bartender.  Cajun pasta with chicken and alligator sausage was very tasty and my wife loved her cheesy mushroom fries.

First time here and New Orleans got the crab cakes for starter and shrimp Po boy sandwich with gumbo side.
Food was good and service would definitely recommend. Our server was great Renika

We chose two places while in NO to eat.  Here and Acme Oyster House.  Both were very good and of equal quality food.  I will give Oceana the edge on Quantity though!  Way more food than AOH for the money.  I had the Fried seafood platter with Fried Oysters,Shrimp,Catfish,fries,slaw and hush puppies!  It was a lot!  All of it was very good for $20 and i loved the slaw as it was sweet n creamy just the way i like it!  AOH gave u a choice of slaw or fries not both!  More food here by far. We also had Gator Tail Bites.  My wife had the Crab Cake Pasta and loves the sauce. Didnt think either place was special when it came to seafood we had but definitely very good for $20.  My wifes was $18. Value for quantity and quality well worth it here.
The best crab cakes I've ever had and our waiter, Errol, provided excellent service and has the voice of Barry White:)

Two weeks prior to my trip to NOLA I began scouting restaurants and foods that I had to try and Ocean was #2 on my list. I was pulled in by the yelp pics of the mardi gras pasta and delicious looking crab cakes. Who doesn't love a great crab cake?!  So on my first day visiting I had 8pm reservations scheduled and I was EXCITED! We were seated promptly and I was ready for a great meal! I ordered both the mardi gras pasta and the crab cake appetizer and two desserts. 

The crab cakes weren't at all what I was expecting. I was hoping for it to be full of lump crab meat drenched in a delicious creamy sauce and I didn't really get either. The sauce was just ok, the mushrooms in it were great, but the crab cakes themselves were not good at all. Tasted like filler and not much crab. I tried opening it up to get to the crab meat but unfortunately there wasn't much to get to. I didn't even come close to finishing it because the taste just wasn't there. This was a huge disappointment but I still held out hope for the mardi gras pasta!

The entrees came out very fast, like under 10 minutes, which in this case should've been a red flag. The mardi gras pasta was edible but not at all enjoyable. It tasted like it was missing something...I rarely add seasoning to my food in restaurants but for this one I added salt just to get some type of flavor going. The sauce was very thin and didn't really stick to the noodles and the seafood in it didn't have that fresh taste that I was hoping for. The pasta tasted reheated by microwave. 

By this point I was completely disheartened because everything I had been looking forward to try was substandard. Being a glutton for punishment (and still very hungry) we decided to give their world's famous bread pudding  and creme brulee a try. Sigh, I'm sure at this point I don't have to tell you how that went. The creme brulee tasted oddly like sweet potato pie and was very cold. The bread pudding was nothing special though I did enjoy the caramel drizzle that they added. That drizzle was the highlight of my entire meal unfortunately. 

Overall this was a huge disappointment. I hope maybe it was an off night but I doubt it was.

Everyone working here was remarkably friendly and nice (at least it seemed so to this cynical Bostonian). Not the trendiest or hippest place, but it had a lived-in feel, with great affordable food. The Gator bites are a must-try, and the gumbo was great too.
Megan D provided some amazing suggestions! Cajun fries are a must as an appetizer. Great atmosphere, drinks, and brunch

GREAT FOOD AND SERVICE!!!
Everyone is right about this resturant, It is soooo good.  I had the chicken alfredo pasta and asked them to make it very cajun.  OMG!!! it came out perfect.  This pasta plate was on point, the sauce was crazy good and the chicken was so tender.  It was a wait for a table but, I think you can call ahead. But since its one block off bourbon street, you will be entertained while you wait.  The staff all work well together, my waitress was so helpful. I will come back, no doubt about it.
Got seated immediately... Treated with respect and served very quickly!  Gladly accommodated our splitting of checks.  Wouldn't mind going back cause that gumbo was excellent!
The food is amazing and Whitney is the BOMB! She was very attentive and provided great service.
We have eaten here twice and it was excellent both times. Don't let the line out the door fool you, it usually moves pretty quickly. Great service and great food and a good value for the price.
My husband and I enjoyed our food, I had catfish platter, large portions, I had to receive a carryout.  I ordered bread pudding,  it was okay, not what I'm used to.

HOLY SHIT!!! Look. I've been living in New Orleans for about 4 years. It has always been hard to show visitors the real taste of New Orleans inside the French quarter because there are so many restaurants to choose from. This place has the upper scale, notable versions of classic New Orleans dishes and is an awesome place.
Very good food.  It's a little spicy for me, but I am whimp when it comes to spice .  Service was fast, and staff was friendly.

Had the grilled gator bites, gumbo and taste of New Orleans. All were amazing. 
Service was great too. 
Wish I had two stomachs

This was our first meal in New Orleans and it was great! We highly recommend the Étouffée! The chunks of shrimp and crawfish in it were huge and delicious. We also had a shrimp Po Boy that was great. I had a side of fried crawfish tails and the cocktail sauce to go with it was so good I wanted to take it home! Service was great everyone was so friendly and our waitress Whitney was very friendly and helpful. We are very glad that Oceana Grill was first New Orleans experience!

This was the second time my wife and I have been to Oceana Grill and it is *always a must stop for us when we are in town! The food is phenomenal and prices are reasonable. We have been lucky to have Dominic as our server both times and she is just the sweetest. Really great atmosphere. One of our favorite spots for sure.

I don't remember much from our last trip to NOLA, but I do recall that: 1) Oceana Grill was recommended to us by a local cook we know, and 2) we were not disappointed! I'm gonna give it to you straight: I usually provide at least a few details but if you're looking for specifics you need to stop reading this review right now. Just know that our overall impression was that we were impressed! In fact I think we ended up dining here twice during our stay. Yes. I know for sure that the first visit was during dinner service. Our excellent server recommended a flavorful Abita black-and-tan concoction right off the bat. It gets hazier at this point but I am 95% confident that my wife and I shared a few traditional dishes which were all scrumptious. On our way out we ordered two more black-and-tans for the road. We went back for breakfast on our last day in town. It was awesome.
Crab cakes were all breading, little crab.  Taste of New Orleans was ok, red beans n rice, jambalaya, crawfish etoufee...

Our entrees were okay. It wasn't even spectacular enough to remember. However, crab cake was bomb. I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but I would come back if I was in the area. The service can be slow as they've usually got a lot of people in the restaurant. Also, the prices are expensive for some okay-tasting creole food. It's also very dark inside... like oddly dark. 
Overall, food is okay. The servers are actually really nice considering the high volume. Would return again to give different entrees another try.

Oceana is great! A staple of NOLA, just off Bourbon Street. Crab cakes are a must and they have great (sweet/fruity) drinks. Our server Jordan was super helpful, gave some great suggestions, and was very attentive. Pleasantly surprised that a place this popular (and big) has such great service and food!

We stopped here for dinner on the last night we were in New Orleans. It was busy and service was fine. The food was not as good as some of the other places we visited. The red beans and rice were the best of the Taste of New Orleans trio. The bread with the pasta was soggy not hot and crispy. This place felt more like a chain than some of the other places in the French quarter.

It was around 2:00 and I went in for their oyster po boy. The host seemed a little annoyed at first but quickly warmed up. Food came out quickly and I was tell excited to eat it since it was my first meal in NOLA. Unfortunately the fried oysters lacked flavor and the fries were pretty soggy. Luckily the slaw on the Poboy was outstanding and saved the sandwich. The server checked on me immediately and then didn't show back up until the check was ready. My recommendation is to come in for dinner and maybe try the catfish po boy.

I loved everything about my experience at Oceana! The service is great and the food was excellent!  I had the salmon burger and jambalaya with a hurricane and my husband had the alligator sausage Po boy and fried egg plant. We shared the bread pudding for dessert. It was all DELICIOUS  and I'm still dreaming about that bread pudding. I highly recommend this restaurant  for anyone looking for good authentic food, great drinks and great service. I will definitely be back the next time I'm in NOLA.
Food was very good and the staff was amazing! I would recommend this place. Kim was an awesome waitress!

the concierge at out hotel recommended Oceana as "one of the best breakfast joints in New Orleans."  Naturally we arrived there bright and early ready for our second day of stuffing ourselves silly with fried delicacies. I ordered the Country Breakfast which consisted of eggs (poached for me), hash-browns, grits and toast. There was nothing particularly wrong with it but it was extremely average for the hype it received. The decor is gaudy and typical but the service (which I generally found throughout NOLA) was friendly and attentive. I wouldn't eat here again however, considering that the breakfast at my hotel was even better.
Yummy lunch. Alligator bites & crab cakes were great! Definitely a good place to stop for lunch.
Very nice St. James crepe....split it with my friend.   Its huge, filled with seafood and veggies....great, quick breakfast.  Very nice staff.  You can see the split crepe in the pix....

Chris M. was a great waiter. He recommended delicious food, and gave great service. The crab cake appetizer is the best. I ordered the French toast with chicken tenders special, and my boyfriend had the crawfish combo. We will be back!
