We love the Oceana's Famous Oysters for an appetizer. They were the best had of any other restaurants during this week long trip. We also loved the Redfish Oceana special. We liked both so much we went back the next night for more. The second night we also got the Ahi Tuna special. Both specials had a crawfish mushroom sauce that was really good. If you want fresh seafood, this place has it.
Best spot in Nola that I've been too. I loved everything about it. The location, atmosphere, service, & food! It was excellent HANDS DOWN.

Best food ever ! Great experience for NOLA! Highly recommend if your in town try out the appetizer crabmeat cake was delicious. And also had the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta, and the Taste of New Orleans my wife and I were very satisfied with our picks! Enjoy

Great service, food is great if you go for the crab cakes.
We've visited Ocena a few times before, it's a nice spot to eat with good cocktails and a lively vibe.  Our most recent visit during Mardi Gras season was a real stand-out due to our amazing server Mary.  She was so attentive and very quick to get us refills on our drinks!  She made sure we had everything we needed and truly made this an enjoyable meal.  The food was decent, especially the crab cakes.  Minus a star because the oysters in our appetizer and my husband's po'boy were super small.  Skip the oysters and go for the crab cakes!

Food was good but not great. I had the shrimp po boy which was slightly spicy. The rolls was hard on the ends to point I could not eat them. The drink we ordered bubbled and was delicious. The taste of new orleans was good. The grilled chicken and side was good. Staff work ethic was excellent. They hustled and were fun. The bread pudding was good. It has raisins. The line outsode was about halfway down the block. We got seated within 25 minutes. Line went fast. We got to see a band march down bourbon street while waiting. A lady with an elaborate costume and some stories to tell for a few bucks walked down the line. If you take a pic be prepared to give anyone doing the same some money.

We arrive into town at about 11:00 pm and were dying for something to eat and drink. The hotel we were staying at recommend this place as it was about a minute walk away. They are open until 1 am, and trust me, you won't be the only table there- it was rammed even past midnight. 

It seemed like a chain (not sure if it is) but it was still inviting. The servers put up with all our questions and severed us quickly. 

Pint of beer are 4$-$4.5 which is a very good price for the area- you can get your fill of the local brews from Abita, NOLA, and LA. Try the Abita Amber- perfectly smooth! 

Since we come from AZ, we of course had to have fresh seafood- so we started with the oysters which were super nice. They run about $8 for a half dozen. We also had the Taste of New Orleans (16$) which features creole jambalaya, crawfish etouffee, red beans and rice, and smoked sausage. It was all ok- we ate tons of this stuff during our time in New Orleans and while this wasn't the best version, it hit the spot at the time.  The crawfish was very fishy tasting...not as if it had gone off, just like you were eating them with a gulp of seawater. Not my thing.
Perfect lunch in NOLA! Friendly staff, great drinks and the food is amazing! Shout out to the best server, Whitney! Thank you for you suggestions!
Great food and the server Whitney took the best care of our large group! Highly recommend
Tried everything on our road trip from California to Florida. Loved the Gumbo the best. Waiter was very helpful in ordering. Yes we would go there again.

We made 2 trips here! They never let us down! Bahama mama and green iguana were awesome! 
Red beans and rice, ribs, shrimp platter! All amazing.  No line no wait, print service. Awesome experience both times!

Food- delicious!!!! The praline duck was amazing, the alligator bites were on point along w the famous oysters! The fried sampler platter was perfect however the added crawfish tails were just a little on the cold side. This is a must stop.

Service- our waiter was on point with everything. Not pushy very helpful got the job done great. Btw the meal came out very quickly too! 

Great job!
The service was outstanding! I loved the New Orleans Sampler. Great jambalaya and red beans & rice! Would highly recommend.

Really good food, loved the creole sauce and the hash. When the streets are cleaned I'm sure it is very nice with the breeze coming in but it was the week after Mardi gras and the entire town had an unpleasant smell. The coffee is strong and the portions are good. Took a star for the service. The waiter was nonexistent and other staff just walked by when we were trying to get help.
Been here a couple times and have not been disappointed. Such great food, and no wait! Suggest the redfish dishes. So good!!!! MARY was a our server and she rocked!

The wait was not long, the service was great and the food was delicious! My husband and I shared a cup of gumbo and crab cakes to start. I got the blackened red fish-the mustard greens were delish! And my husband got the shrimp po boy. We both liked my dish better than his, although we enjoyed the whole experience! Prime location!

Just go.... no words....  okay a few words....
Crab cakes
Cajun Jambalaya Pasta
Blackened Crawfish on the side....
I can't EVEN...  
Just go eat....

We were debating whether or not to eat here because the line was looking kind of long out the door.  They had such great reviews that we decided to wait in line, and also our Uber driver had mentioned that it was a good spot.  The line seems long, but it went by quick!  We waited less than 10 mins.  Once we got seated, service was pretty slow because of how busy they were.  We started off with their famous oysters (Oceana's Famous oysters).  I absolutely loved it!  It was my favorite thing here! I definitely have to come back to this spot just for their famous oysters next time I come into town.  

Also, if you love lemon drop shots, they do a lemon drop martini that tastes just like the shots.  Yummy!  For my entree, I tried the shrimp poboy.  I think the flavor was pretty average, however I felt my shrimps were a little too over fried.  The shrimp itself was dry and kind of hard. I also wasn't a fan of the bread itself for my poboy. I felt that it was soggy.  I liked their seafood gumbo a lot.  It had a very nice seasoning to it and I usually don't care for gumbo.  That's pretty much it!

My favorite restaurant in New Orleans...I HAVE to go when I'm in town! The gator app is perfect (I get half & half) and this time, I got a special stuffed redfish meal with crawfish ettand a side of soft shell crab....heaven.
Brian was the best and the food was absolutely delicious!!! Try the crab cakes and BBQ shrimp!!!

Hands down my fav casual dining spot in the quarter!! My and my girlfriends go there frequently and the drinks and food are always on point!!! My fav are the Oceana oysters and Oceana redfish. The service is always amazing and i love that they have so many different dinning rooms, it's always an exciting experience!

The most nastiest restaurant I've have ever experience, and the server told me the juicy details , from rats , roaches and using old food from yesterday. Don't get caught up in the hype or line , the cheaper the food the quality goes down.

The food was ok, didnt like the fried oysters at all. Drinks were very mediocre - I tried to talk to the manager about that and he was very very rude... I'm from the food and liquor industry and live in Miami which is a touristy town. I believe tourists should be respected specially when they are spending $$ in your restaurant. But Michael told me that things don't work this way in his place - too bad. I stayed in NoLa for 4 days basically eating and enjoying music. Only had great experiences. The only bad was here.

Our large spontaneous group was seated immediately without a reservation. The staff treated us well and did not hesitate to make us feel welcome. The menu included something for everyone including all of the uniquely New Orleans items you have been wanting to try. All of us would go again next time we have an opportunity. Thanks for the wonderful New Orleans experience.

If it's your first time to visit New Orleans and you love seafood, this is the place you imagined what New Orleans is like. We ordered the aligator nuggets, it's a must initiation dish, it taste like chicken get the traditional fried, the blackened was good but I didn't like the soft chewy texture. Also ordered the fried soft shell crab, catfish, crawfish, shrimp supreme combo. Dozen raw oysters and dozen special Oceana Oysters baked and parmasian butter sauce excellent. Service from JaDE was genuine and family friendly, food service is very fast on a small table so you have to eat fast. Enjoy New Orleans!
Yummy place to go, across the street from our hotel, good chargrilled oysters.

I ordered the catfish platter and crawfish étouffée. Very good!!! The waiter Cole was friendly and knowledgeable. The manager on duty was very welcoming to my family. I will definitely be coming back to this establishment.

Brian on the second floor is a great bartender. I think thats his name. At least he always tells me but 4 Abita Ambers and 5 shots of Jameson I forget things like that lol.  ill never complain about the service though, its the best for the quarter's tourist flow.

i ordered the porter house and a side of gumbo. the porter house was a good cut but i order it medium and it tends to be a little on the rare side. i may need to adjust to their level but the attention to that detail when i complained was great. Im surely gonna be a regular in the future....

Don't come here if you want good service. Waited in line over 20 minutes outside in the rain to even get in the door. Then was brought to a table on the third floor (place is huge to pack in as many people and tables as possible) where I was sat at a table that was put in a walkway so they could accommodate more people. I was bumped into by every passing waiter and service person as they walked by. This is also the walkway to the bathroom so as a bonus I get bumped into by each patron going to use the restroom as well. I wait another 20 minutes then the busser comes to apologize for the wait and offers to take our food order instead as the waiter is still MIA (Maybe on a break?) Not sure still haven't seen him. Meanwhile I see people who were sat after me already getting their food. Waiter finally arrived and is introduced to us by the busser who already took our food order. He says "here is your waiter to take your order" what? I thought you already took our order? Well he's here to verify it he said, so ok verify the order then... he does not verify the order just apologize that he wasn't around to take it. So Brandon the waiter brought the food; we had a large fried seafood shared platter and he had no plates in his hand for us but had two bags of to go food for someone else's table in his other hand for some reason.  Not sure what happened here but complete fail. I will never return.

Delicious.  I had the Taste of New Orleans and it was some of the best food I have ever put in my mouth.  I was really hungry and almost ate it all!   Had the Ruby Red cocktail- can't complain about that at all.   Nice service.  So pleased.  And full!

For the price of the plate $22.00 plus the $4.00 fried crawfish add on. It's definitely not up to standards with their prices. The fish was dry and flavorless.. it's a blackened fish it's suppose to be flavorful not dry and I just kept looking for more sauce to make the fish taste better.. the side of jambalaya wasn't that great either. But I husband did get the marti gras pasta was pretty delicious.
The food came a little cold but their red beans are the most amazing red beans I have ever had!!!! We almost ordered more to bring home with us  I definitely recommend the red beans and etouffe!!!

Everything about the food and service was amazing! Kim was such a great server and everyone else seemed so genuine and nice and really took interest in us and greeted and checked on us. Great hospitality! 

Husband ordered the holly roller ipa and I'm not an IPA fan but it was really good. He also got the fettuccine Alfredo and he said it was the best. Chicken cooked perfectly and it had the perfect amount of spice. He ate it all. Clean plate club, yup!! 

I ordered the Oceana oysters and OMG... amazing. I also got the gumbo soup which was good but the oysters were definitely the star. 

I definitely recommend dining here. We ate for lunch and got a lunch menu which had a lot of selection on it so I'm sure dinner is just as great! 

Thanks again Oceana team!
Unbelievable food and service. Whitney was the best and we will definitely be back!!!

the food was great. we had alligator bites & split the catfish platter (it is huge). the only problem we found was that we waited in line outside for 20 minutes or more & were seated at the upstairs bar (because they said that was the only seating they had open)... when we walked into the restaurant, there was a ton of seating open.. so we were pretty irritated that they were making people stand in the cold when there were open tables. I feel like it's just a part of your customer service to at least get people seated & out of the cold.

Okay so this was my first time here in Louisiana and needs I was craving a Poboy.  I decided to go to Oceana Grill and grab a shrimp Po boy which turned out to be so delicious . I had to personally thank the chef and shake his hand I can't wait to come back just to try some work there delicious food you haven't been there and you're currently in Louisiana or You plan on traveling to Louisiana you should definitely check the spot out

Best place we've eaten while visiting NOLA. Line took about 25 mins, seated and served promptly. Champagne was cold and delish! Food came out all together and was fresh and tasty. Kim was amazing and her service was a delight. Can't wait to come back!!!!
The food was unbelievable. Etouffee with crawfish was to die for and so was the creole shrimp.
Stopped in at the last minutes and loved it. Even for a busy night serve was on point and oysters were amazing!
The food here is amazing I ordered red beans and rice, I loved it!! The staff is super friendly and the restaurants very clean! I highly recommend you try it out while in the French quarter!
Fantastic food! But the service was outstanding! Thank you Jordan for some great suggestions and service! You alone are worth coming back for, best server ever!!!

Friends and I dined in at oceana's and went back for a second night !! 
 I had parmesan oysters and Crab cakes were amazing --- was to die for ... Crawfish mushroomsauce topped on the crab cakes --- 

A friend got blackened alligator ceasar salad .. I tried a piece ... It was amazing as well. 

Service was by Chris was great !! Very attentive and never wanted for a thing !! 

Left full and happy.  I will definitely be returning

Wonderful job!

I was in town with my boyfriend and stopped in to Oceana, my server Kim was amazing! She was attentive and she totally made my day when I was having a horrible one. 


Thank you Kim! I will always come to this restaurant because of your service!



The food is good too lol

Hmm...I'm a bit perplexed as to the popularity of this place. We spent about 5 days in the french quarter and without fail, at any time of day this place had a line of people going down the sidewalk a good block, just waiting to get in. We figured the throng of waiting diners and positive online reviews meant that this place would be pretty good, but this place was just so underwhelming. The food was not bad per se, but it wasn't really good either. We weren't expecting anything mind-blowing or fancy at this price point, but it really felt like I had walked into a tourist trap with menu offerings akin to an Applebees with a Creole twist. If you've got picky kids who won't eat anything remotely 'colorful' or fellow diners with a really limited palette, I would say that this place is just fine, but as you're not hard pressed to find good food in the New Orleans I might suggest you try somewhere else first.
Alligator meat is good!!! Shrimp pasta is very juicy. Osyster is very fresh. Taste of new Orleans is not bad, but personally prefer gumbo shop one. Overall experience is good here

3.5 stars: We heard you had to try redfish while in NOLA and we saw this one was topped with a creamy mushroom crawfish sauce. The sauce is awesome! But I learned that I'm not the biggest fan of redfish. It's a bit firm in texture and therefore, a bit chewy as well. The corn and mashed potatoes that this dish comes with were delish and I found myself enjoying them more than the protein.

We ordered the crab cakes as well, also topped with the same sauce. The crab cakes were pretty good! Crispy outside, moist inside, and they were huge. 

Service was friendly and attentive. Overall, decent food, but nothing out of this world and nothing that has me craving to go back.

The Red snapper was DELICIOUS!!! The appetizer, 1/2 blackened and fried gator tails, came out super fast, like under 2 mins which was scary considering it was quite packed, we had to go up to the second floor. They were very accommodating to my guy's restriction of pork, the mustard greens were tasty!! To me the crab cake was overrated, as well as the fettuccine but the service was decent. Will return for the red snapper & mustard greens definitely!

Probably over rated... nothing special! I had the jambalaya that was over cooked and didn't have much flavor that I felt the need to add Crystal hot sauce. I probably had a better jambalaya at the Cheesecake Factory with more flavors! I read great reviews and might had such high expectations, but left with disappointment and feeling that yelp reviews let me down (which doesn't happen very often).  What about the dessert you ask??? I would say the Whole Foods have better pecan pie hands down! So why two star??? The service wasn't too bad!
Had dinner here the first night and breakfast here our last day The food and service were AMAZING.  Was my first trip to NOLA and I will be back and coming to Oceana!!
Bruh.  Seriously could not get worse.  Terrible food and service.  And the managers/owners are horrible!  Yelling at people, you can hear it a mile away.

Omg first time here and it was amazing! Had the crab cake appetizer and Mardi Gras Pasta. Delicious. I was full from the crab cake. But it was amazing. The server DeMarcus was also great and very thorough and attentive. Only thing that was annoying was the hostesses, they were exceptionally rude. Besides that it was amazing

Our food was delicious! My husband had the red fish platter with crawfish cream on top I had the grilled duck, greens and mashed potatoes. We also had the Oceana oysters. My husband and I agreed that everything was absolutely amazing! Our server Mary was wonderful! Very knowledgeable and friendly. We highly recommend this place and will definitely be back! Thank y'all so much for your amazing service

Food was great.  One of the people in our party is pregnant and the meal didn't sit well with her the second it showed up and our waiter Daniel had no problem taking it back and making a new dish with no extra charge.  Oh and we got margaritas with dry ice in them and that was fun.

Was a bit disappointed, though we only ordered the classic burger and bean soup.

Wasn't bad but not special either. Will be back to try more items next time in New Orleans.
Food was decent but the staff has a nonchalant attitude towards communicating with guest leaving the service great room for improvement!

Oceana is probably a great starting place for food close to all the happenings. The servers were so nice and friendly and the food was great! I highly recommend making a reservation or you will be waiting outside in a long line. Because the spot is so popular it will take a small bearable wait for the food. But nothing too wild. Overall you can guarantee a good quality meal and service close to bourbon street. Plus all the prices for entrees and drinks are reasonable. I highly recommend the restaurant if you just want a nice Lil vibe and some good food. Absolutely get some seafood gumbo and crab cakes if you do nothing else.
Food was amazing and Whitney provided us with first class service she was helpful and courteous!!!

Crab cakes were amazing!  I started to go in on them and then came the fried catfish the portion was enough to feed two. Deena was my waitress. She was so pleasant and helpful. Check in on me made some great suggestions. I was so full I packed my leftovers and order a bourbon pecan pie to go!!  Food was awesome!

I ordered the special. Laflouche something. It was blackened fish over a seafood cornbread stuffing. It was good, but my fish still had a "fishy" taste to it. I wasn't very pleased, but it was still edible. Now, their oysters... I never eat oysters because of the texture, BUT I said I'd try them & mannnn.. they did not disappoint. I actually ate like 4! They're to die for. Also tried their TASTE OF NEW ORLEANS. If you're a Louisiana native, you know that this dish is very displeasing. I hate hate hate tomato based jambalaya & Etoufee. Some stuff you just shouldn't do. We ended up substituting the jambalaya & etoufee for more beans- which were really good. The seafood platter was ok. It tasted pretty good, but it wasn't the best I've had in New Orleans. Overall, I think the grilled alligator bites & the oysters were the shining stars of their menu.

As crazy as this sounds the Cheeseburgers my wife and I had here might have been the best food we had in the city. Sat in the courtyard and was pleased with the service. Great Bloody Mary as well. 
Highly recommended

Yum. Never disappoints. The service was excellent. Daniel kept checking on us to ensure all was right. Some places in NOLA just stopped caring.... but not Oceana. They care about ensuring it's all good. The portions are huge- and everything was tasty. They even ensure the line in is organized.

Terrible experience!!! 1st of all my husband's fried shrimp platter was fried so hard and with a spicy batter. It actually tasted like Popeyes batter. Then to top it off my fish was undercooked and tasted horrible! When the waiter explained this to the manager all he said he could do was offer us a free dessert! Well you can keep your dessert. You won't be getting my service ever again!

The food was delicious! I ate here with my colleagues after our conference. I ordered the shrimp platter which was about $17 and the portion was huge! Honestly, three people could eat from this platter. I never finished my food it was so much and it barely fit in my to go box. I want to say there were about 20 jumbo shrimps in there but it may be an exaggeration because I was so full. The server was friendly and provided good service. This place was busy and if you check-in on yelp, you get a 10% coupon! A great way for this place to generate reviews on yelp and draw in more customers, and the customer receives something too! The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars is because our table wasn't very clean when we originally got there. The tables and chairs were out dated that could use some sprucing up but it also could be the style. We did have to wait in line for a seat when we first got there but it went by pretty fast, maybe 10min wait. We also tried gator bites, first time trying, tasted like chicken! Overall, I enjoyed the food.

Essence 2013...me to Big E the driver..."E, where is a great place for some good crab cakes?" E says "Now my baby, you gotta go to Oceana Grill.  They gon' have all your crab cake, gumbo, jambalaya and catfish."  

Fast forward...Check into the hotel, change clothes, walk to Oceana Grill.  No wait (thank goodness because later that day and the next day there was a line down the street).  Seated immediately.  Feeling hungry so we go balls to the wall and order:

Crab Cakes
Gumbo
Seafood Platter
Crawfish Etoufee'

INSANE?!  Yes.  Delicious yes!

Crab Cakes are amazingly round and thick and moist and delish.  Covered in a...wait for it...wait for it....Crawfish and Mushroom cream sauce.  OMG.  Someone just pour the cream sauce down my darn throat!

Gumbo - very tasty.  The only thing I had an issue with was the crab shells.  But yes - I ate the entire cup.

Seafood Platter - Catfish and Shrimp (I don't eat oysters) were deliciously battered and fried to perfection.

Crawfish Etoufee - now I am not the one who ordered this but the friend that did raved for hours about the darned stuff.  It looked yummy.

Service - AMAZING fast service!  It was awesome.  We could barely finish one dish before the other arrived.  Staff was courteous and helpful when it came to decision making.

Drinks - if you order a drink that you give specific direction on : Kettle 1 with pineapple and light ice - it comes out great.  If you order one of theirs - they're not that strong - but tasty like juice.

Overall - amazing and I will go back time and time again.  Oh wait - yes - We went back two days later.....
Great food - Great service - Had the Taste of New Orleans and my wife had Crab Cake appetizer - both excellent - you can't go wrong at this place
Great service from Jamal and amazing food! I ordered the  crab and lobster crepe as well as the New Orleans style French toast. Big portions so sharing is a good idea!

We Visited Oceana Grill for brunch on a Sunday around 1:00-1:30. We were immediately seated, the place is huge, plenty of tables, they even have a court yard where you can be seated too.

The food was kind of pricey but well worth it. The portions were huge and the food was tasty. Everyone in my group was happy with the food they selected.

I got the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta, I was sad because I was not able to finish it all (although I was tempted). Creamy, cajun goodness with shrimp and alligator sausage. If you're wondering around the French Quarter looking for good Cajun food you should definitely give this place a shot.
Excellent choice at the French Quarter. Got the Marci gras pasta with an additional crab cake on top. Delicious.
Excellent location, excellent food.  Shrimp fettuccine was the best we have EVER tasted!  Gumbo was just as great! Waiters were friendly and very pleasant.  You MUST try this if you are ever in town.

Epic little place that we found while meandering the streets of the French Quarter. Have walked by dozens of times but never even noticed the place! Somewhat hidden and unassuming venue off of Bourbon street on Conti St.

There is a really large area upstairs that can accommodate larger groups, which is near where we were seated. Downstairs has a few tables and a decent sized bar area.

I started off with a bang via double Absolute and Red Bull. Yippee-Yi-Yo-Ti-Yay!!! Great start and at $14.50 for a double, fairly reasonable. Next came the BBQ peel and eat Shrimp appetizer for $8.00. Another great deal considering the size and amount of shrimp, as well as the overall flavor. Saturated in a tangy, savory sauce, they were everything I expected and more, (including the mess). I typically am not a big fan of peel and eat shrimp, (mainly because of the messiness), but these were well worth the effort. Served up with a couple slices of soft, fresh and warm sourdough bread. Perfect for dipping into the leftover BBQ sauce!!!

Followed that up with a "Taste of New Orleans" entrée, priced at $16.00 Excellent value there... The etouffee' was killer good, jambalaya was deliciously piquant, sausage appropriately spicey, (it really brought the taste buds to life), and the red beans / rice were out of this world.

Service, while a tad on the slow side, was extremely hospitable. The tempo of the service didn't really bother us though, as we were in no real hurry to leave. Definitely worth a repeat visit when I go back in May!!!

Honestly...my dinner was terrible. I've probably tasted better crab cakes at a non seafood restaurant. The "crust" or whatever it was fried in did not taste great and neither did the crab meat inside. I was definitely disappointed with my first dinner in a city known for its food.
Restaurant was dirty and the waiter wasn't very helpful.  Don't order crab cakes unless you like a lot of bread and mashed small pieces of crab.  Oysters we good.
The Bahama Mama and pecan pie were delicious and our server, Natalie, was such a sweetheart!!! Definitely recommend this place
Loved the red beans and rice as well as the bbq shrimp! We also tried the jalapeño hush puppies.
Love Oceana! Get the fries and a drink with dry ice that bubbles!  Hint: You can order catfish sides to add to your meal.

I give the food a 5. I had crawfish fettuccini, mmmmm (i would have been happy with bread and the sauce, so delicious) and the bread pudding is great. Right balance of sweet and proper texture. It's pricey for the style of restaurant, but that is to be expected due to location. (it's rout off Bourbon)  Our server was good but the bar service was lousy. I never walk into a New Orleans restaurant expecting much in the way of service with a smile. Overall, a little touristy, but worthy of going because the food is good enough.

We honestly weren't very impressed with the food here. (Service on the other hand, was great!) Maybe we didn't order the right things?

The only dish we thought that was decent was the crabmeat cakes, which was smothered with a creamy mushroom sauce. This was moist and flavorful! 

The rest of our items were just meh. We asked which is the best po' boy here, and our server replied with the shrimp po' boy. The bread itself was too crispy and hard for our liking... it didn't fit comfortably in our mouths and we felt like we would have ended with a cut in our mouths or something! Haha... we ended up ripping a lot of the bread out and putting them to the side. Other than that hassle, po' boy was fine. Definitely skip on the oysters!! We tried both raw and chargrilled. Raw oysters had sand and even pieces of shell in the oysters.. I even had to pick a tiny piece of severed shell that was piercing one of the oysters (see pic!). Not sure how they missed that before serving it out?? The chargrilled one had decent flavor, but it was quite chewy! Both didn't taste very fresh either. 

I will say this place is located in a convenient location, right off of hectic Bourbon street meanwhile still being in the French Quarter. If you dine here, I say stick with the crabmeat cakes and avoid the oysters!
One of the best seafood restaurants in the French quarter. Great food and service!  The crab cakes, amazing!  The bbq shrimp, mouth watering.  The red fish, awesome!

One day we went for lunch.. I had the crawfish eitufee, my sister had the alligator bite po' boy, my brother had the blackened fish po' boy and my fiance had the blackened redfish eitufee.  It was so yummy, we ended up there again for their breakfast menu. Will definitely be going back whenever we make another new orleans trip

I ordered the Jambalaya seafood pasta and my wife had the gumbo. Mine was great hers not so much.  Although she is not a huge fan tof shrimp it was still ok.  Highly recommend the dish I had. Small but quaint little place.
This place is a must go on Bourbon St. The food and service is excellent. Don't let the long line fool you, it goes fast. I would choose Oceana charbroiled oysters over Acme's any day.
Best seafood spot in the French Quarter. Portions are huge and food quality is high. Very highly recommend.
This is a great place for a great ambience and great food! The staff if very friendly and knowledgeable if their menu. I definitely recommend this place next time you guys visit New Orleans !!
Wonderful food and exceptional service from Jerry today at Oceana! Bloody Mary's were amazing!

Came on a Sunday. Party of 6 adults and 2 toddlers. We had a reservation and were seated with no problem. This restaurant is huge, 3 levels. The menu is pretty typical New Orleans fare. Our drinks and food were as expected, not the best you ever had but pretty good. We had oysters Rockefeller, seafood platters, salads and po-boys. Lots of food on your plate, honestly it was shareable.  Our server was very attentive and friendly.  Would visit again.
Excellent food, great location, nice atmosphere.  Definitely recommend.  The line outside may look long, but there is a ton of space inside so it moves quickly.
My wife and I decided to try this restaurant out recently. It was pretty good   I had the redfish and she had a shrimp Poboy. Both were good. Great little casual restaurant in the Quarter.

First time here and everything was amazing! There's a line out the door but luckily we got in after about 5 minutes. I started with the oyster Rockefeller and it was AMAZING...!! I died and came back to life. As my entree I went for the taste of new Orleans... It was so filling and there were good amount of chunky crawfish in there I was in etoufee heaven! I'd highly recommend this place to whomever is visiting NOLA for the first time!
Awesome fotos, awesome drinks, our server Jerry was amazing! Delicious gumbo and omelettes!!

The ambience is very chill. Waited about 25 minutes to get in but well worth it. Good convo with the bartender. Would highly recommend the oysters and the blackened duck. The sauce is super rich and delicious
Outstanding seafood and ribs. Crab cakes were the cats meow. Gumbo was a step above. The fried shrimp was very good.

4/5 food 5/5 service. Our server Regene was awesome. She created such a warm, welcoming, and friendly rapport. Another server, Robert, went out of his way to pick up an earring that I didn't see that I dropped. Jambalaya pasta was sooo good too.

Absolutely awesome. Great atmosphere and the food is amazing. When you get here, make sure that Sierra is the one taking care of you. She is a sweetheart and really knows her stuff!  I'll definitely be back.
Thank you Whitney for helping to make this experience a great one! Loved the food, atmosphere and service. The crab fish egg Benedict special was amazing. And Whitney was a great server!

Spent our last meal here while visiting New Orleans. Place was packed even at 1pm. Glad we made reservations. 
We ordered:
Oceana chargrilled oysters: I actually prefer the simple chargrilled oysters at other places as I feel the sauce on the oysters were a bit overpowering. 
Crab cakes: these were yummy and the portion is big! 
New Orleans sampler: gumbo, jambalaya
One tasty breakfast the grits were so soft and yummy. The alligator sausage taste like chicken to me lol.
Soft shell crab and crawfish tails were very good. Would visit again. The service was awesome too!
Very very impressed! The Cajun jam. Pasta is great!! The hurricanes are the best I've found in town! This will be our go to place when ever we are in town!
One of the best places to eat that authentic Cajun food.  Great service by Steven recommended the BBQ shrimp and crab cakes so bomb! Great ambiance you feel like a real NOLA resident.

This was a pleasant surprise. Everything was bursting with flavor. My husband got the red fish- he didn't think the fish had a lot of taste but I think it's because of the crazy amazing flavorful corn they put next to it. The corn was explosively flavorful. My bbq shrimp had a pleasant southern kick. I got the appetizer size so that I could have a Caesar salad and help my husband finish the seafood gumbo which was phenomenal. All in all a great place. Awesome ambiance, the place is huge- many floors and a courtyard but mostly casual. The drinks looked good but we don't drink. The staff was nice.
Great food!! I tried the blackened chicken po boy, and it was amazing! The service is great and they make you feel very welcome

Being from NOLA I usually stand clear of prominent tourists spots. But Oceana is delicious! I randomly took a pedi cab (bicycle taxi) & the driver asks, " where to" , and when I responded Oceana he said that's perfect I have a coupon.  An Obvious sign from the Gods that it was meant to have dinner there lol  I suggest the oysters of course and Louisiana Crab Crakes!

Awesome late night eatery. We were a bit silly on hurricanes from Bourbon Street and they obviously knew it. Our server had a good laugh with us about it and made us feel better (who'd of though we were not the first ones). We loved the gumbo. It had awesome sea food and crab. We also got the tour of New Orleans. The jambalaya was my favorite and the red beans was my wife's favorite. Great experience!
The food was extremely delicious..the waitress was so nice and friendly..We ordered crawfish etouffee and blackened red fish ..the food came very fast and it was a very great experience

We ate here our first night in town and had some amazing oysters (oceana's famous) first. I then ordered the shrimp po-boy and my husband had the gumbo and a catfish po-boy.  Everything was fantastic!  We took our dessert back to the hotel and OMG!  The bread pudding was amazing! So amazing, that we went back two nights later just for dessert.  That bread pudding is hands down, the best thing I ever ate.

We went here on the recommendation of our Lyft driver. I'm so happy we did! The food was wonderful. The Taste of New Orleans was the perfect sampler of the delicious Cajun food offered in New Orleans. Beyond the food, the service was amazing. There is something to be said about souther hospitality and this place exudes it. Our server Dom was helpful, knowledgeable and hilarious. I'm so happy we ended up at Oceana!

On July 30 2019 ,I went to oceana grill . The food was terrible and the service was unacceptable. My sister dress and shoes got soaking wet  from  a incident at another table . When she got up to use the restroom she realized her dress and shoes was wet she brought it to the attention of the waiter and the waiter brought back the supervisor . They did nothing to accommodate her for the wet  dress and shoes . The Supervisor name is mike  and he's a racist because he use the term you people . I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone very bad food and customer service horrible
This place is amazing!!! Everything me and my friends ordered here was delicious!!! Definitely recommend the bread pudding with ice cream for dessert it was absolutely delicious!

Amazing Experience!!

Food, Desert, Drinks & Service can't be any better. Our waitress Whitney made the experience even better by recommending the best options.

Looking forward to come back soon!

Wow, what an amazing New Orleans restaurant. Being a New Orleans native, I had high expectations for the cuisine. The special (blackened red fish) was phenomenal. Our waiter Kevin was great. Stop by if you have a second. You won't regret it.

Wow. Truly the most memorable experience while in New Orleans. I had the crab cakes, oysters, redfish etoufee. All absolutely amazing, great flavor and fresh taste all around. Highly recommended in the French Quarter.

This had to be one of our favorite restaurants in New Orleans! Whitney our server had such a contagious attitude and gave amazing service!  We will definitely be back for this authentic flavor of New Orleans and to see Whitney's fun and welcoming smile!
Excellent! The food was authentic and great. I have not had real Cajun food since the early 80's. Ms. Ashliegh was our server and her suggestions was spot on. If I lived here I'd be a regular.

Oh my god! Loved their crab cakes. The Louisiana sample, the red beans, their specials, and the attention received at Oceana. Their mushroom sauce is delicious. Please, come here if you plan a visit. Worth it, worth it, worth it!

Came in for breakfast during all star weekend and wow. Best meal I've had here so far. I got the shrimp and grits and this was my first time ever eating grits (I know it's sad). Sooooo good. The shrimp was blackened and they put a mushroom cream crawfish sauce over the top. Amazing. My friend got a seafood omelette and hash browns. Best. Hash browns. Ever. Also, our waitress Deanne was so helpful. She gave great food recommendations and just general stuff to do in New Orleans as well. I definitely want to come back for dinner or lunch before I leave. 5 stars all around.

Really good food and drinks! Lovely restaurant, we were seated in the second floor. The servers were very attentive and friendly. I would definitely recommend once they get back up and running. Unfortunately, they suffered a fire the morning after we ate there! So, call ahead before trying to out!

Haben zur späten Mittagsstunde hier gegessen und uns dabei für frische Austern, barbecued shrimp und blackened Gator bite po-boy entschieden. Das Essen war gut und das Po-boy Medium spicy.
Das Restaurant war sauber.

Very good food and excellent service.  We ate red beans and rice with crawfish, crab cakes & ribs.  The food was delicious.  Good size portions too.  We had the bread pudding and kailua chocolate mousse and they were luscious.

Made reservations through yelp for 4:00 pm.  Checked in at 3:50.  The hostess never said a word to us.  At 4:05 the bartender said are you sure you made reservations.  My name was on reservation board another hostess then came over and said you can't make same day reservations. And i stated my name is on the board and she said no it's not and i said I'm pretty sure i saw it but maybe I'm wrong. A second hostess then said the reservation was made and was valid.   During this time multiple parties without reservations had been seated.  We were upstairs in a room with 10 tables and three occupied.  The fried alligator appetizer was good the two full pieces we got otherwise the pieces were the crumbs in the bottom of the basket.  We shared the seafood platter the hush puppies were not fully cooked in the middle.  The catfish and shrimp was good.  Would not go back due to the rude service and exceptionally high prices for the portions we received.  We were treated like we could not have a table at all because of the reservation issue.
Huge plus the place is open late. The food was ok. The service was really good. Try the raw oysters! Best thing in my opinion on the menu
Came for breakfast. AMAZING French toast!!! And even better than the food was our server, Whitney. She did an awesome job with a large group.
Whitney was amazing! We are visiting from out of town and she knew exactly what to  Recommended. Everything is absolutely fantastic! We will definitely be back.

Unassumingly huge place.  Food was done well.  Shared the blackened red fish with ettuffee (sp?) and the Mardi Gras pasta with my wife.  Was going to add the fried crawfish tails, but waitress suggested the crab cake since we already had crawfish in both entrees.  Great suggestion!  Everything was very tasty.

I recommend you get there at a good time or be prepared to wait. We got there and the line was out the door, luckily it was just my wife and I we were seated pretty quickly.

The food was good and Kevin our waiter also provided us with good service.

I strongly recommend the Oyster Rockefeller, they were delicious!

I would go again for sure!

This place was nice. I do recommend this restaurant. The food was delicious, my only complaint is that I didn't get enough Alfredo haha, it was that good! Our waiter Brad was nice but not personable. I can't remember the hostess but she was small framed and had caramel skin. She was drop dead gorgeous and has a wonderful personally to go with it! That was my second time going to Oceana and when I go to NOLA again, I'll be back for a third visit.
I can't get enough of this place!! My kids adore the shrimp fettuccine Alfredo. It really is one of a kind. The crab cakes are my absolute favorite. And my husband raved about their gumbo.
Jerry is an awesome waiter. He offered us hand sanitizer and immediately got our waiter. Such as warm spirit!

This place was great!! Our server Deonne was simply amazing! She was so funny and nice, and also suggested great dishes/drinks. My favorite drink was the tropical storm, such a good price, strong, and came with a cute souvenir cup that you could refill forever! The kitchen did mess up a couple times but she handled it very well and made sure it was perfect the next time. Some of my fav dishes were: blackened gator bites (YUM!!!!), crab cakes, and the fried seafood platter. The catfish was SO FRESH and tasty. I will definitely come back when I'm in town. :)

Went for an early dinner.  We were seated in their courtyard - very nice.  Wait staff very friendly and provide great recommendations.  The menu has good selection options.  Food was served hot and delicious.
Ashleigh was an awesome server! Food was off the charts: blackened red snapper and crab cakes! Try the Oceana Oysters those are killer good! Recommend it highly if you are in NOLA!
Oceana was great for morning cocktails and Cajun breakfast! Our server, Pamela, was so friendly and energetic. She recommended a Crawfish Benedict that was delicious!

Great ambiance.  I had the cajun sausage breakfast and it was delectable.  It consisted of alligator sausage, andouille sausage, eggs to order and a biscuit.  Yummy!  Our waiter was Chris M. and he was professional and courteous.  He made great recommendations and was very personable.  Great place overall.

This place was great !!! First of all whoever was working the tables that night did me a solid and let me sit down fast and there was quite a wait so I appreciate them for that ! To start we ordered the crawfish fries and they were fire  I loved them. I ordered the taste of New Orleans and loved every bite. The drinks were really good as well! The service was good it was all around a good experience with good food ! I would love to come back when I visit again right in the center of all the action as well it made for a great night! Check this place out for sure !! Yummy

Oceana grill was INCREDIBLE!!!! This was partly because the food was amazing and the seafood was very fresh and mostly because our server Whitney was so knowledge, kind, and personable! She answered all of our questions and was very patient with us. She was quick on her feet and so timely!!! If you're in New Orleans, you have to stop here! And I sure hope you get Whitney as your server :) thanks, Whitney!!!!
Food and service were exceptional. I will be back here and will recommend Oceana to friends and family.

The service and food was awesome!!! I especially loved the seafood gumbo was my favorite!!! The red beans and rice, Cajun pasta with alligator sausage, and mustard greens all delicious. Our waiter David was extremely nice and knowledgeable of all the entrees.

I am blown away. The chargrilled oysters are just...magic. I am not a raw oyster fan (texture is not my fave) but throw these on the grill and it totally changes them. We are only in NOLA for two nights and we are already planning our 2nd visit for tomorrow. The gumbo was also excellent as was the red fish special but the star of the show is the oysters. If I could put that sauce on everything I would.
Loved the oysters and the shrimp gumbo. Great fast service. I would go back on my next visit to NO

Whoever came up with Cajun Fries is a culinary genius. We also got the crab cakes, jambalaya pasta, and bananas foster ice cream cake. Everything was amazing. Quick, friendly service. Highly recommended.

This was our first meal in New Orleans ! We decided at that point no matter where we went for food we wouldn't be disappointed. This meal was fabulous ! It comes out quickly as well. We had a Shrimp Po Boy (my first ever ) and Catfish Platter.
Great food and quick service. Had a Po boy which was spot on. Everyone was so polite and friendly.

THEY DOWNSIZED DRINKS! I my boyfriend and I just went for my birthday in December, I returned in May only to see that they made the drinks smaller and kept the prices the same. The waitress swore they'd always been the same and didn't know what to say when I showed her pictures! the lies. -1 star

I will not be returning. The food was not fresh, over priced and not what we expected at all The fries appeared to be fried in old grease. The catfish, shrimp and alligator had no flavor. The cocktail sauce and tarter sauce had been sitting out for a period of time. If you're traveling, do not try this place.

My first experience with Oceana was very positive. I follow a ton of groups to get ideas of places to eat, and I repeatedly saw Ocean. My best friend and I decide to give it a try. When I checked in on Yelp, I was given a 10% discount on my food. Winning!

I decided to try the Tasty of New Orleans which include seafood gumbo, crawfish étouffée, and red bean with rice. I ask add some fried crawfish for $5 extra dollars. The food was so flavorful. 

My bestie got the shrimp Alfredo which she said was tasty. She tried my red beans and rice a regretted not getting son herself. She's a pretty picky eater, so the food had to be good to her.

Overall, I think this is a good place to stop at if you're in New Orleans. It's an easy walk using your GPS, and the wait time was awesome. We barely had to wait to be seated.

ordered the Redfish Pontchartrain and it was WOWWW!!! It was on special though so not on the menu full time..apparently they're original Redfish dish is good too so I'm sure you can't go wrong either way! def worth checking this place out!
Everyone was very kind and Jerry (our waiter) even offered us hand sanitizer which was wonderful. Food was great.

Really the only good thing I have to say is that the service was excellent. Lots of folks we asked about restaurants hyped up this place as being so popular, so we decided to try it while we were in town and all five of us were disappointed in our meals. Everything was just meh. Our server was really nice and really went above and beyond for us.

Way better than the neighbor restaurant Felix. We had the same main course crawfish entouffee at both restaurant. The food here is much more juicier with a bigger amount as well. Strongly recommended if you want to try some authentic Cajun food.

This place was recommended by our Uber driver and our hotel concierge. We went there for dinner on a Tuesday night and had a short 10-minute wait. Once inside you could see how busy this restaurant was, waiters and waitresses running around everywhere making sure everybody had what they needed. My son ordered a sample platter that included etouffe, beans and rice and jambalaya. He also ordered a bowl of their gumbo soup. He loved every last bite and swore the gumbo was the best thing he ever tasted in his life. I ordered the appetizer of barbecue shrimp, which really isn't barbecue shrimp from what I'm accustomed to. It came sauteed in a creamy buttery garlic sauce that I could have just gulped down instead of using the bread to dip into. It was absolutely amazing. If you're in the New Orleans area you have to try this restaurant

I would give the 5-star for the friendly waitress answering all of our questions, though the food was not as great as we expected. (Food was still good!)

I'm not a big fan of gumbo... For the gator bites, we ordered a mix of fried and blackened. Careful with the blackened, they are quite hot, but good!

I like my crab cakes! Good amount as an appetizer. The veggie side has real small portion though...

Overall, our experience was good!

Out of all the restaurants my family and I went to while vacationing in New Orleans, this place was by far the worst! As a result of the staff's improper cleaning of their dining area my relative's clothing and shoes were saturated with a liquid substance.The Floor manager MIKE showed no remorse compassion or understanding of the situation as it was brought to his attention. Mike's remarks to my relative were unacceptable and disrespectful to her as a patron in this establishment. The only good thing about this place was Brandon, the food was not even good. Skip this place on ur list of eateries!!
Great clean place found as a referral by the hotel bellman.  Tough to find a good place that's not so much of a bar around here.  Very friendly wait staff!!!  Great people.

The breakfast experience was absolutely delicious.; coupled with excellent customer service from the moment you walked in the door until you walked out. Kori took excellent care of us suggesting different  voices that the menu had. We chose the eggs Benedict with a side of cheese grits and pancakes with a side of andouille sausage. It was so delicious, we forgot to take a picture.
This was my third time eating at Oceana Grill over the years.  They never disappoint.  The original house oysters are the best in the city.

One of the few places that serve breakfast options beyond 11am! Great brunch spot! Make a reservation on the weekends!  Make sure you're whole group is there or they won't seat you. 

Gumbo was delish, and so were the omelets.  Service was great!
Great food, came in with a large party for lunch and were seated quickly. Lloyd was an excellent server as well!

I got takeout from here twice.  The portions the first time were good and that's why I got taller out again a few days later but was disappointed by the portion size so maybe it's dependent on whose making your meal.  The food was good though.  Staff was friendly over the phone.

Located at the heart of French Quarter, right by bourbon street. Nice courtyard, heated outdoor available for chilly days. The food is okay, nothing special, just your regular mediocre chain-like food: fried, tons of butter/sauce and likely over cooked. The blacked Cajun flavor is there, but still nothing special, just the store-bought Cajun spice. 
It was nice that it opened Christmas Eve, and the service is very good- super friendly and fun servers, quick and good service
We had a great dinner because our server Jordan A was outstanding     Amazing service and beautiful smile.   Thank you Jordan.

The staff was friendly, our waitress could have checked on us to refill our drinks but didn't, and the food was just Okay.  We landed in New Orleans late and got checked into our hotel and walked around Bourbon St we were hungry and asked one of the cops where a good place to eat was and he recommended Oceana's. Maybe he thought I was drunk?  Anyway food was barely warm and the rice seemed dry even under all the gumbo.  Maybe don't go there if your sober.
Good food. Stayed a week in new Orleans.. Ate here 3 times. Lol. It was that good. Catfish was the best I've ever had. Alligator bites were delicious as well.

First time in The Big Easy and decided to try out this place.  I had the House Oysters, the gator tail bites (couldn't remember the last time I had tried alligator) and the barbeque shrimp.  Definitely delicious, especially the bbq shrimp.  The sauce on the shrimp is fantastic, and I would recommend mopping it up with the bread that they give along with it.

Went twice during our trip, we had red fish, barbecue shrimp, blackened chicken and pasta and it was ok delicious. Everyone working there is very nice and definitely give you that Louisiana hospitality. Highly recommend !
Food was so good! We had the seafood platter and the Cajun fries. There was enough food to feed 3-4 people.

Great food! Very filling and heavy. I had the crab cakes and gumbo! It is a busy place and there was a wait time when we got there. The only thing that would make this place 5 stars was just customer service. The people were not the most approachable and friendly.

Oceania Grill was recommended by the hostess at the Wyndham New Orleans French Quarter hotel. She said they have the best seafood in the French Quarter. We went on a Saturday evening on 6/29/19 at 5:30pm. The chicken fettuccine was tasty and well seasoned. The fried shrimp was fried hard and tasteless, no season on the shrimp, I had to add salt, pepper and hot sauce to eat it. Fried seafood is not their specialty. I was amazed at all the celebrities that ate there, maybe at one time they had good seafood!! The waitress and bartender was very friendly and helpful.

We had a pleasant experience at Oceana. The alligator bites were a really good appetizer. We went with the half grilled and half fried option. I had the redfish and my wife the crab cakes. Both were tasty and well seasoned. We each had a hurricane to drink they were refreshing and potent. Our sever was nice and knowledgeable with menu questions. It was an enjoyable experience and worth the visit.
We had such a great experience at Oceana. The staff was excellent and the food was great. The bathrooms were a bit nasty. Pricing was decent as well.

Excellent food and service. This was my first trip to New Orleans. I have been here for 5 days and tried numerous restaurants, but I keep going back to Oceana. I have had breakfast there 3 times, as well as lunch. Everyone has been so friendly, and the food had been excellent! Would definitely recommend.
Amazing food, very very tasteful. Excellent service. And our server "Ashleigh was so nice & made sure we were being satisfied with everything. I definitely recommend & will definitely come back!

Pretty good. The baked oysters were amazing and the sampler platter was a good size and good variety.  Our waiter was great!  Getting seated was a little weird in that the line went outside the door and then you sit on a bench. It worked out and the wait wasn't that long.  The sampler platter was decent but I didn't love it. Probably could have gotten better food elsewhere but didn't want to make the trek.

Great food. I had the crab cakes and potatoes and was soooo full. We sat upstairs and looked out the window at the people on bourbon. The wait time wasn't long at all. We went on a Sunday night. The food came quickly. I've been here twice and look forward to going every time I visit New Orleans.
Great food and awesome service from our waitress Whitney!!!!!! I had so much fun ! Omg food

This was our first time in New Orleans and the Bell hop suggested this spot for a quick lunch spot. We were in luck cause it was only a few blocks away and got there in no time. They say us immediately and the hostess and server were very polite. Now let's get to the meat & potatoes ..the food. Everything we had was fresh, hot and came out in a timely manner. I had a hurricane drink which was delicious with a catfish po-boy, red beans and hushpuppies. My wife had the same and my daughter had the blackened chicken po-boy. Everything was delicious and we'll seasoned and I would highly recommend this spot.

THE Place in the French Quarter. We had the bbq shrimp, oysters and chk jambalaya for appetizers My wife had the Duck and I had the blackened catfish. Yum... I had to order extra bread to soak all the goodness
Bree, our server, was phenomenal. She was attentive, very very genuinely kind. Gave incredible suggestions, and I would highly recommend you eat here.

This is a big restaurant.   We ordered jambalaya pasta, taste of New Orleans, redfish Oceana, and parline Duck.   The jambalaya pasta tasted good but the dish was warm.    Taste of New Orleans was very tasty.  Redfish Oceana was ok but lack of seasoning.  The parline Duck was a bit tough.
Great food, best in New Orleans and the service was just as good from Arielle!  Thx!

Came in because we wanted gator and needed a kid friendly place. Ended up being the best meal of my entire trip. We had shrimp platter, eggplant fries, gator half and half, catfish po boy, red beans and rice and chicken and sausage gumbo. Everything was amazing. Great service too. Bloody Mary was on par with everything I've had since I got in town too. So glad we stopped here!!!!

Great place! I was worried it was a tourist trap (which it might be) but it was good food, decent prices and great service. We had a great waiter and the food and drinks were good. I had a Cadillac margarita which was really good and got me pleasantly tipsy :) 

I ordered the blackened catfish which was also tasty.

This place was all right. We ate here because we were having trouble finding somewhere that wasn't insanely loud right after the Saints had won a game. We weren't trying to be downers but I had a pretty bad headache and wasn't in the mood for screaming/crazy drunk fans. 

Food was kind of overpriced but good enough. I had the fried seafood platter which had shrimp, oysters, and catfish. It came with tons of french fries and was way too much food for one person. I enjoyed it but probably clogged my arteries just a little bit and at $19 it was expensive! My boyfriend a mixture of several dishes called Taste of New Orleans Creole. It had crawfish etouffee, jambalaya, and some red beans w/sausage. I really thought this dish was just so-so. Alcoholic drinks were sort of weak but at least the service was friendly. Probably wouldn't come back unless it was really late and nothing good was open.

The Oceana Grill has a great outdoor seating area, the service was excellent thanks to our server Ashleigh. I tried the ragin Cajun Bloody Mary and it was one of the best bloody Mary's I've ever had. Got the crab cake entree with the mashed potatoes and corn and the sauce was really good and had lots of crawfish in it.

The food is BOMB! Now, if you're here for Essence Festival be prepared to wait. I had a cup chicken and sausage gumbo and cat fish platter and couldn't finish all the fish. The gumbo got me full! The frozen strawberry margarita was good as well. No room for dessert.
Great service! Great food! Not too long of a wait. Worth a visit. We had the trio entree and it was great. Should have just gotten the jambalaya. That was Fantastic!
Very expensive and ok food.  Can find better places much cheaper with little to no sress.  With that said, location, location, location!

It was my first time at Oceana Grill and it was amazing! Got a Seafood Po Boy (Chef Special not on the menu). It had two pieces of catfish, shrimp, fried oysters.... annnnd it was perfectly seasoned. Jerry was a very attentive server and made sure we were taken care of!!! Definitely coming back!

overrated and rip off for sure

Oyster is not fresh and is more expensive than the fresh ones in French Quater.  Waitress looks angry at all customers. Rip off!!!!!!!

I had to go with the great reviews but I should have stayed away! The food was cold which I should have questioned it as it came out within 2 mins from ordering. Gumbo was bland and red beans and rice tasted like it came from a can. The service was ok even though the server was very monotone and scripted. Overall the experience was disappointing.
Great food! And the server Errol was awesome! Would definitely visit again! We found this place thanks to yelp and visited on a Week night. It wasn't too busy which was great.
We loved this place the food was delicious! Try to get there early on the weekdays to avoid the lines.

This was my first thought when I went to New Orleans. This is also the first place where I tried my first shrimp Po boy which was absolutely amazing! I got my shrimp fried and they also came with a side of fries which was remarkably incredible and would definitely recommend everyone to try this if you are in the area. The staff is very friendly everyone welcomed us and even the Shaz brought our food which I thought was pretty nice. Our waiter always checked up on us to see how we were and also our hostess walked us to our table and greeted us and welcomed us to the city and hope that we enjoyed the food and the ambience of the City. 
My overall experience was very nice I'd recommend everyone to go here and try if you are in Nola. You're also not far from bourbon it's literally right around the corner so once you eat you can definitely go enjoy the festivities.

Also make sure to check in on yelp you do receive a 10% discount on your meal. Thank you yelp!
I had such a great experience there and I would recommend Nicole as a server! The food and the taste of New Orleans is amazing

We were sick from food poisoning.  Be careful. 
My husband had the Mardi Gras Alfredo pasta with crawfish and shrimp.  After that the evening was terrible and his stomach was in pain. Etc...

You have to ask if you want to sit in the courtyard. The service was pretty good. We were cold and they turned off the AC for us. The bread was warm ... And chewy right out of the microwave. The food was ok. They put coleslaw on all their Po'Boys.  Overall it was a mediocre experience, not bad but nothing to rave about either.

We had such high hopes for this place. We were going to try our first gumbo, jambalaya and crawfish stew. It was awful. The only saving grace of this place was the gator tail bites and they were DELICIOUS. Highly recommend. We got half fried and half blackened. As for the gumbo the shrimp looked like canned shrimp with the poop still intact. The bread was stale. The Cajun jambalaya pasta had some suspect looking meats inside of it. The crawfish etouffee was also suspect tasting. We could not even come close to finishing anything. This place said they had the best bloody in New Orleans, but let's face it every restaurant says they have the best bloody in New Orleans. The bloody was okay. We were able to keep the cup the bloody came in. We couldn't get out of this restaurant fast enough.
Good comfort food, especially after midnight! All the staff are friendly and attentive plus good generous portions of food. Recommend in the French Quarter.

I ordered the seafood platter. The catfish wasn't seasoned, it was slightly slimy. The shrimp was seasoned well. Some of the shrimp taste fresh and a few taste as if they had been sitting under a heating lamp for a while. The hushpuppies were spicy and wasn't flavorful..Tartar sauce was to vinegary. This place is over priced and over rated. I want my money back!

I had the breakfast mah mah bowl, and side order grits. Everything was VERY delicious... the whole experience and southern hospitality was amazing. Demarcus was our server, and he is the definition of Southern hospitality. It was such a great experience, I definitely would love to head back before leaving to try them out for lunch. Food was hot, biscuit melted in my mouth. Mimosa was perfect, coffee was hot and my bottled water was cold. Looking forward to visiting this place again. Great customer service from the smiling hostess, waiters and wonderful staff. A++
I ended up going back for dinner, I've been eating so much meat so decided to do the vegetarian pasta. My my my, all the flavors were so bold in the sauce, there was literally a party going on in my mouth. The veggie's were not over cooked and the pasta was perfect. Everything was perfect. I would have loved to meet the person who created this receipt as it is one of the best Pasta's I've ever had. I'll definitely be back to, NOLA and this place will definitely be on my list to visit again.

Stumbled upon this place after a nice little stroll around NOLA with my husband (also saw a billboard in the airport and thought, why not check it out?).

There was a bit of a line, but the wait didn't take too long and we were seated within 10min after arrival. My husband ordered the fried catfish and I immediately fell in love with the taste (keep in mind, this is the first time I ever tried a catfish). It was crispy on the outside and really soft on the inside with great texture! I had the chicken alfredo, which was just as good as well. Additionally, we ordered a side of softshell crab and it tasted amazing (my husband is a huge fan of this dish)!

Overall, definitely a great choice if you're looking for some place to eat after a long night and craving seafood!  Would definitely recommend for anyone just stopping by with friends and/or family!

Great and authentic Cajun cuisine. Seafood gumbo id's full of seafood and seasoned perfectly.  At the recommendation of the server Jasc the salmon burger shock came Hoi fresh and blackened.  Def a great place to hit. Bree served us and did a nice job.  It feels a bit pricey on some menu items.

We visited Oceana a Grill before heading home after our cruise. I chose it because of the reviews and I was not disappointed! This place is awesome!
Cole was our server and he was knowledgeable of the menu and also engaged in conversation with us. 
I have added Oceana Grill to our place that we must visit again!! Absolutely LOVE IT!

Food was unbelievable!  Top notch Bloody Mary and the service was great.  Our server Lavern was extremely friendly, courteous, and helpful    Wish we were r staying longer in New Orleans because we would come back for more!

We visited Oceana Grill a few times and weren't disappointed with the service nor the food. The po'boys come dressed with coleslaw and remoulade sauce which makes them so much better than just a dry po'boy we've had elsewhere.
So good.  The BBQ Shrimp and Redfish were both amazing.  The Bloody Mary's were great too.  A definite favorite restaurant!
Great flavor and great portions for the price. Our waiter was really good too. We were intimidated with the long line but were seated sooner than we thought.
The Taste of New Orleans was excellent. So flavorful! It was exactly what I was looking for during my New Orleans trip. This dish is highly recommended and worth the wait.

Don't be fooled by the casual looks of the place, the food is excellent! 
I was sad to miss fresh crawfish season, but the crawfish in the etouffee was still completely rich and sweet, and I completely inhaled it in a very unladylike manner. I had a little spoonful of the red beans and rice and they were also en pointe. But here's the most important part: the jambalaya. I don't even know how to describe it to you. Just trust me: JAMBALAYA! Repeat after me: jambalaya jambalaya jambalaya

Tourist Cajun food at tourist prices. Ordered the Cajun fries and gumbo and was completely let down. There was barely any sauce on the fries, and the gumbo was as generic and forgettable as anything I could get at home in Atlanta. This place is severely overblown and should not be on your list. I'd highly recommend Acme Oyster House instead.

Loved this place.  Our server was fantastic and the food was so good!  A family friendly atmosphere.  We arrived early to avoid the wait and we were able to walk right in and be seated.  The red fish was delish!  The bread pudding was also a winner!
This place is absolutely amazing. Food and service was impeccable. Shout out to Lavern, she was the best!!!! Catfish and charbroiled oysters a must :-)
Megan was the most amazing server I've ever had. Very laid back and made our meal much more enjoyable. The food is amazing! Great atmosphere! Will be coming back, tomorrow! Thanks Megan!

New Orleans is one of the few places I've been too where literally when searching for food, just about every restaurant has 4 stars with over 2k reviews & this one is no different.

The food is literally amazing. Ive been here before when I visited & head to return again. This time around my friend & I had the Oceana famous oysters & it's delicious. The oysters are grilled with this sauce on top & it's perfection. We ordered a dozen & actually I ended up ordering another half dozen lol. For our entree I had blackened catfish with fried crawfish tails (the crawfish tails were the best) with rice & beans & creamed corn. My friend had the seafood platter & was happy with her dish as well. I've also added a pic from the last time I was here & had the Cajun jambalaya pasta which had alligator sausage, shrimp, onions w/ a creole sauce & fettuccine noodles. 

No matter what you order here, you can't go wrong. The food came out quickly & the staff was professional. If I'm NOLA this is a must go to.

I love coming here! I'm from NYC and I take a trip here every year. No complaints about anything on the menu. They have a waiter (Jamal), he is very pleasant and attentive. I request one of his tables always

First-time customers & visitors to the French Quarter, we visited the Oceana Grill after asking the cook at a small New Orleans lunch grill where we could find great food & service in the French Quarter; he recommended Oceana, and we could'nt have been happier. We were warmly greeted, seated promptly, and the food was great. But mostly, our experience was made great by our server - Ashleigh! She was personable, very knowledgeable of their menu, and was extremely attentive to us throughout our meal. She is what 'the best server' is all about!  I'd absolutely recommend Oceana and know that whenever we're back in New Orleans, we'll return!

The service is amazing ! The waitress (Sarah) we had was super friendly and checked on us consistently . She brought us fresh glasses to take home for our souvenirs ! Only downside was the long wait time for our food . Granted that's expected because this is an extremely popular place to dine at from what I've been told . Sarah was still quick to tell us the kitchen was backed up but still ensured our water glasses never were  below half way . This was a great experience due to Sarah's knowledge of the menu . She ultimately helped me decide on the catfish platter sub the fries for the red beans and rice (side portion, small but super filling ) It's a relatively relaxed environment jazz music playing in the background , dimmer colored lights, still loud but it not too much . Definitely can sit here and enjoy your watermelon margarita as I did . Do be aware of we came in as a walk-in they take reservations for the evening/dinner crowd .

I was visiting from Los Angeles and read a lot of good reviews about this restaurant. The service was great; only waited about 2 minutes outside. Our server was nice and attentive also. My food was....just "okay." Not very flavorful and pretty bland. I ordered their House Special, the Redfish Oceana and it looked nothing like it's picture online. There were only 2 crawfish in my sauce (which was very skimpy also), but when I ordered more sauce, they included more crawfish. My daughter had the crabcakes and they were just "okay" also. She didn't finish hers, nor did I finish my meal...which says a lot about the flavor of the food. When the food is good, we eat everything. I was just expecting a lot more New Orleans flavor after reading such great reviews about this restaurant, but my daughter and I were very disappointed. I would have been happier somewhere else. Those who love flavorful food, this may not be the spot for you. Those people who have more of a bland pallet, you may enjoy this restaurant. Sorry...

It's really in the middle of a 3 and a 4. The waiter was super nice. And that's what raises it from the 3. The patio is really cute.

Food is average. Nothing special. I had the catfish and my girlfriend had the charbroiled oysters. She said they were ok. The jambalaya side was dry and so was the greens. The taste was good. It was just dry.
Really delicious local food!! Great way to start and end our NOLA trip.   Glad our hotel recommended it!  Best crab cakes I've ever had!!

Ordered two types of oysters here, the chargrilled oysters and the oyster rockerfeller.  Both dishes tasted as bad as they looked. They had more of a drenched sauce look than a grilled look, and tasted fishy as well. The alligator bites were alright. Kind of like dry chewy chicken. The catfish had lots of seasoning on it and was alright, but the side of jambalaya it came with was very dry.

Oceana was a great place to host a dinner with colleagues. Service was amazing, food was tasty and drinks were delish.
Sierra our waitress was the best!!!! Everyone commented on her quality of service.
Will come again!

AMAZING food for tourists visiting Nola. They were able to sit the large group I came with (13 of us to be specific). Great customer service as well. Will recommend this establishment to others visiting. Thanks Ashleigh for accommodating us all!
Food was good. Atmosphere was nice. But most of all our server Mary was excellent! We were glad we came here for dinner.

The food was rich and delicious. The Oceana's famous oysters were amazing. The sauce was so good to dip the bread in. The crab cakes and Cajun fries pretty much had the same sauce with crawfish. It was a little rich but nonetheless tasty. The bbq shrimp was to die for. I can't say a bad thing about this place. Everything was seasoned well and had depths of flavors.
Good food, good drinks, good service, reasonable prices.  Owner/manager(?) made a point to talk to diners at each table, very friendly and welcoming.

Cool southern seafood vibe to this place.
Stopped in here on one of my visits to nola with a large group. The service was good and we were seated quickly.
The food was good but with so many places in nola im not sure I will ever be back for a second visit unless someone Im with wanted to check it out.

My husband and I decided to try this restaurant only because we saw the line to get in was a mile long. We called the next day and got a reservation. I am SO glad we did. This place was great. Our waitress, Natalie, was super friendly, amazing and checked on us just the right amount. We started with the fried Gator Tail bites. So glad we chose that appetizer because the gator tail bites were so moist. Apparently they marinate them for 24/hrs (I could be wrong). Then for my main dish, I ordered the Crawfish Etouffée. I pretty much licked the bowl clean, without being trashy. It comes with 3 small slices of french bread I believe. We asked for extra bread because it went well with the pasta(we weren't charged extra). My husband had the Seafood jambalaya. He loved it. We chowed down on our food before I could snap any pictures. If I ever make it back to NOLA, I'm coming for this restaurant!!
An excellent restaurant! Seated quickly. Food was prompt. Delicious A-1 quality. Food tasted wonderful!
Best food ever ! Seafood was so fresh and tasty ! Our waitress was amazing and very friendly! The special cocktails are in mason jar and they came out bubbly I loved my experience

Service was outstanding. Gator bites where good but the order was super tiny. I had the red snapper special and it was fabulous. My only negative would have been a little more variety in the menu. We made a reservation which made things much nicer

Service was amazing and super quick on Lundi Gras (Monday)! The food was amazing as well! The gator bites appetizer was super delicious, as well as the Mardi Gras pasta! They had the best, most appealing Hurricanes. Kudos to the staff here for being so awesome on such a busy day. I believe our server was "Dom" she was such a sweetie!!!

Came on a Saturday at 11pm. There was a line but was seated in 10 min. Food was ok. I got  the fisherman's platter. The hush puppies were hard and overcooked. The catfish was actually very good. So were the shrimp but too much batter.  The texture of the fried oysters were weird. 

I also got the raw oysters. They were fresh and meaty. Very good. 

The customer service was friendly but slow.  The air conditioning was on too high. It was freezing. 

I would not go back but would tell others to try for themselves

This was our first stop for food when we hit Nola. My drink (El Diablo) was tasty and strong, served in a cute Light up crawfish souvenir cup to take walkabout. I ordered the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta for my entree and it was amazingly delicious! Finished it off with a warm piece of pecan pie with homemade whipped cream. Our server Jess M. was pleasant and helpful. Reasonably priced for being located right on Bourbon St. 2 DOUBLE drinks, two entrees and two desserts ran me $84 not including tip. I definitely recommend stopping in for a bit to eat and drink!
