I think the high ratings are the result of a bunch of tourists who aren't aware that there's much better food in NOLA. We went for Saturday brunch and were seated pretty quickly. Unfortunately, we had to walk up a lot of steep stairs to be seated. It ended up being worth it because we had a good view of the street below. We had the crab cakes for an appetizer...way too bread-y and not enough crab. The sauce on it was good, but don't be fooled. A good crab cake can stand alone. I ordered the Fried Seafood Platter and ugh, the seafood wasn't seasoned like it should have been. The catfish could have been crispier and oysters were too greasy. The shrimp and fries were decent though. We decided to split the bread pudding for dessert and it was average. I was offended because the waiter brought me a dirty plate to put my portion on. I ended up putting my dirty napkins on the plate instead. This place was not worth my time or money.
We had a great time here! Meghan was our server and she was awesome. The food was awesome and it's the most food we've gotten for the best prices. The drinks were fantastic as well!!! Great job!
Didn't even get a chance to take a picture. Best red beans and rice I've ever had! They also comped is some Gator bites unprompted, which were delicious. We'll be back!
A must every trip...great oysters on the half shell and our waiter noticed our order wasn't quite right just walking by and fixed it before we were able to mention it...great eye, great service

Ok, I'll admit it. I was a bit intoxicated when I came here. But honestly, you will find the best fried shrimp po boy here or probably any other po boy for that matter. I have had other po boys come and go, but this one has stayed on my mind forever. Was it the mayo? Or the onions? Were the shrimp covered in a secret seasoning? Was there something special in the coleslaw or remoulade? It was everything. The whole mix of flavors combined into one mouth-watering po boy. So. much. flavor. Truly the best po boy in town... though I haven't had them all, this is the best I've ever had. And yes, I am quoting Drake.

My girlfriend had the Taste of New Orleans sampler platter and was equally food-struck (and equally as intoxicated). Our compliments to the chef all around. We made a big showing of it that New Year's Eve... likely because we were inebriated but more so because the food was so dang good. I'll have to return again in the future, just to go back to that sweet, sweet bliss of a moment with my po boy.

great food! though the catfish wasn't my favorite. probably more of my fault than theirs. Our server/bartender josh R was amazing and has such a great personality!! would come back just to see him again.
Food was good.  We made reservations so we did not have to wait. Service was okay. There were lots of people working. I highly suggest the oysters and Cajun fries!

Christina was our server! Wow what service! And food was on point! We had to wait a bit but once in the yummy flavors began! Christina was so fun and a real deal server and very knowledgeable! I'm from Miami visiting for first time and I can't wait to come back  already.
Spent 5 days in NOLA and this was my favorite meal. I had blackened chicken and jambalaya.  Hubs had redfish and he said it was awesome.  Definitely recommend eating here.

Stars are for delicious comfort food at a very good price.  Zero ambiance.  Incredibly heavy food doused with their admittedly amazing crawfish mushroom cream sauce.  Shared crab cakes followed by the duck and crawfish étouffée, so much food we could not finish.

It was really good! There was a line outside but it went super fast. My 9yo said it was the best burger he had. My husband got the red beans and rice and it was tasty. I got ribs they were good but I wished I went out of my comfort zone and got the fish. The staff was super friendly and attentive even though it was busy

Let me tell you about this fucking grill.
I don't want to start negative so I'll start with a positive

The servers were excellent customer service a1 
Now for the food lord God 
The jambalaya was fraud like it wasn't to good super rich for no reason. The crabcakes maybe it's because I've never had a fried one but I didn't personally like it you might don't take my word for it or do. I said give it a try if you're on Bourbon Street but it wasn't something I would rent and rave about

But again at the end of the day I would say the customer service was so amazing they really care hopefully next time I'll order something that fits me right

My friend and I headed to bourbon st and saw Oceana Grill. Initially, we passed it due to the long line but once we walked around and saw the other options we went back. The line doesn't take long and you have the bourbon st crowd as free entertainment lol! Never a dull moment on bourbon St. I ordered the friend shrimp platter and my friend ordered the jambalaya. My shrimp come out crispy and fresh but to my surprise were spicy (didn't say on menu). I ordered it because I thought it wasn't spicy. I ended up only eating about 4 shrimp and some fries. My friend enjoyed their dish but said he had better at other restaurants. It was nice to experience eating on bourbon st.

Service was mediocre at most. They didn't seem too busy given that it's Mardi Gras, but I would say that the waiter didn't really check on us and was beyond slow at getting us the check.

We ordered the Cajun Fries to start, which were okay, needed a bit more flavor. When I think Cajun I think delicious spicy flavors. This dish was definitely lacking in that area.

The seafood gumbo was okay as well. I didn't really feel like it was "seafood" in all its glory. I could only identify that I was eating crawfish.

Are we eating the same food you guys??

Super overpriced and none of it was good!! No one at our table of 4 liked any of it. The oysters were huge cheap and and flavorless, after 3 I felt sick (I eat 2 dozen easily when they're good species). The chefs special was over cooked fish. The New Orleans medley is much better at acme. The seafood pasta has cheap frozen and small cup noodle shrimp that gave me oily acid reflux. 

People stop standing in line for the hype.

Delicious and great service.  I ordered the crab cakes off the appetizer menu for my meal and they were more than enough to satisfy! I could have drank the crawfish cream sauce that topped the crab cakes!! My husband ordered blackened red fish étouffée which came with a side of turnip greens and  jambalaya (fabulous) Fish was cooked well but needed a little more kick. We had the praline brownie which was Devine!! Definitely will be back! The wait appeared to be long based in glancing at the line but was not at all!

After one of many WWE events, we came here for some late night grub. It was okay. Like the definition of okay.

Service was great. 5/5! Shout to Emonie for putting up with my jackassery. It takes a real trooper to endure it. 

The restaurant itself is super kitschy and seems like what tourists who've never been would think New Orleans is like. 

Crab cakes are apparently their specialty. Ours came out lukewarm and they were fine but definitely not worth $16 for two wimpy hockey pucks.

I got the blackened redfish and the actual fish portion was very large, so I was happy about that. And the fish was very good. The sides though, were very tiny and disproportionate. And it felt like the whole meal had been prepared before and just heated up along the way. You know that feeling when you see food come out and you're like..."that was in a freezer recently." But I have no idea so they could make everything fresh who knows!

Overall, two sides and an appetizer that were all mediocre for a harrowing $75? No thanks. 

Emonie is the shit though!

Walked up , got sat for 3 immediately with no wait! Mt first impression was that this place wouldn't be any good considering there wasn't a 30 minute line out the front. But, I was very pleased by the food and service. We had to pick something quick and on the way to our tour meet spot. And we ordered a crawfish etoufee and crab cakes. Round of shots and beers. I kid you not the food came out way before the drinks! And, it was one of the best crawfish etoufees I have had in new Orleans thus far. Our server understood the time crunch we had and politely got us out and offered take out cups in less the. 20 mins.

I love Oceana and make it a must every time I travel to NOLA. 
For apps I ordered the oysters which were very good and flavorful. My friend got the bbq shrimp which I tried as well and the sauce was delicious. 
I ordered a blackened catfish po boy and my friend got the fried shrimp. Mine was good and everything but the fried shrimp one looked better, and that's what I would get next time!
They also make a good hurricane with dry ice or some other sort of smoke effect. Very fun!
Oceana is a good spot for solid food and drinks.
One of the best meals I've ever had in New Orleans! I will forever return to this restaurant. The service was wonderful and so was the food

We were greeted by our smiling waitress.  My son and plowed through the seafood Pow Boy, one dozen oysters and seafood Gumbo.  I washed mine down with a Bloody Mary for my vitamin c intake.    Thank You!
I was very disappointed in my po boy shrimp sandwich since I came all the way to New Orleans for the real thing. It was mediocre wish break & fried shrimp. Nothing special.
Chefs special of red fish was ok  Caesar salad, gumbo, and cheese cake were fabulous!! Great hurricanes too!!

Great food.   Lots to choose from.   I had the ribs and the wife had the seafood platter.  Our other friends had jambalaya and oysters.    Loved Christina's accent since we are from the west coast and don't hear that much.   Drinks were great and plentiful..     will definitely come back again...
Food was great, servers were friendly, and the hostess was phenomenal!!! My first time in NOLA, and this restaurant made a winderful impression!!!
Service was AMAZING. Food was delicious. Crab cakes are a MUST HAVE!!!!!! Gator bites are a must try. So delicious.
We ate early (around 5pm) and got right in. The food was delicious!! The redfish was amazing and so was the BBQ shrimp and mashed potatoes. We will definitely eat there again.
The oysters are the best in New Orleans.   Way better than Acme.   Great deep flavors.  If you like sauces this is the place.

A must visit in the French Quarter! 

This place looks like an unassuming little establishment from the street but is huge inside and has seating on 2 floors. It has a ton of charm and character inside as well. The location is clean and very well maintained. We visited on a Saturday evening as a party of 6 and there was a small wait, but nowhere near as bad as many other places. The line did spill out into the street from time to time, but it also moved pretty quick.

The staff here is top-notch. Everyone we came in contact with was cheerful and welcoming. The bar made some very good drinks for a number of people in our party. Our waiter took the rest of our drink and appetizer orders and was able to answer all of our questions about the menu.

We ordered a wide variety of food and everything was absolutely amazing! The gator tail bites were very tender and flavorful with a sauce that had a bit of kick to it. The cajun fries had a delicious sauce that was like nothing we had tasted before Their gumbo was rich and savory. BBQ ribs were some of the best were ever had in a restaurant. I tried the shrimp fettuccine alfredo and it was the best I can remember having anywhere! The sauce was rich, buttery and creamy with definite parmesan flavor.

For desert, we ordered the banana foster ice cream cake with strawberries. It was amazing as well!

This is a DONT MISS experience!

Great place for a lively family dinner. I had their special of the day, which happened to be blackened redfish with jalapeño cornbread stuffing and greens. It was on point. Fish cooked and seasoned well. Stuffing east tasty, interesting, and complemented the fish. Also had their oysters and gator bites which were delicious as well.

I've experienced better is right. I cannot, for the life of me, understand who would ever give this 5 stars. I must have high standards.

We're not from NOLA and wanted to eat some local grub for dinner but hadn't done our research. We were hungry and the place was full-- that is USUALLY a good sign.

We walked in and the moment we did, we sort of knew we'd be getting less than we paid for.

I'll start with the food because that's what's important. It was fine. Nothing amazing and obviously sitting in big vats in the back. From the moment our order was placed to out on our table, it was about 7 minutes. It tasted like it was just slopped on the plate. Everything looked the same and it wasn't overly impressive. I added about 10 drops of hot sauce and it barely put a dent in making it spiced/flavorful.

My husband had the Taste of NOLA or whatever it was called, and I had a veggie meal with a bunch of seasonal veggies (of which the waiter told me included peppers of all kinds and there wasn't a single one in the mix) and two slices of bread with 1/2 cup of cheap rice for $13. Serious ripoff.

Our bill came to $31 for food alone. The service was fine but obviously rushed. The silverware was suuuuuper cheap and the tables were like cafeteria style. I was just so unimpressed. 

Would never go back.

We were seated right away & our waiter, Ron was great. Very informative on the menu items, including promoting the breakfast menu even though we told him we were leaving in the morning. Haha. Great salesman. Very friendly & conversational in general. The food took a little long to come out- really no big deal. Both Ron and the person who brought out the food apologized for the delay which was unnecessary but implied they are usually prompt with serving. 

Hubby got the cajun fries with a side of fried cajun tails and I got the cajun vegetarian stew. Both dishes were the bomb!! He couldn't finish his dish because it was huge, but per him, it was amazing. It looked loaded with the gravy & already came with crawfish tails in the gravy. He loved it. I know this because he didn't even touch the side of ranch, and my man is a ranch man. I didn't know they had the stew so I was pleasantly surprised when I saw it as a choice and when I ate my first bite. So much flavor!- a great balance of savory & some tang. And the bread was nice and soft.

This restaurant was wonderful. The food was delicious, the service was great, and the prices were reasonable. I think their grilled oysters were the best we had during our vacation. And we ate a lot of oysters. All of the staff was very friendly from the time we entered until we walked out. A definite stop if you are in the French Quarter.

Not impressed
Blackened catfish was just ok
I have had way better food in new Orleans

I'll start off on a positive note. We were seated quickly with a large group of 9. The service was quick and Regine was very pleasant and helpful. However, none of our food was brought out hot; cold French fries, room temperature gumbo, over cooked fish etc. We ordered Moscow mules and the ginger beer was flat. Regine brought us new drinks but they were still not made properly. It was obvious this establishment is geared for tourists or folks who have no experience with Cajun/creole dining.

Wow! This restaurant is truly amazing in every way!  The customer service is truly outstanding and everyone attends to your needs immediately. The food quality is great and is consistent. We had a little of everything which did not disappoint at all. The Jambalaya was delicious! I highly recommend this restaurant when your in the area!

First, finding a restaurant in New Orleans is sometimes tricky. I found this place here on Yelp, and I will 100% be back. Our server, Chris M., was kind, helpful, and an amazing waiter - someone give him a raise or celebrate him! The food didn't disappoint whatsoever. The seafood platter was awesome, and the redfish tchoupitoulas was spectacular! If you're coming to New Orleans, come here, it does not disappoint!!

I REALLY LIKED THE VEGGIE STEW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! And good potatoes. But great food, cute little place, Awesome cajun veggie stew highly suggest for vegetarians and non vegetarians it's just really good
Amazing! Great food, great drinks and great service! Winner in my book.  Will definitely return.

Had the famous crab cakes with mushroom sauce, crawfish ettouffe and gumbo as a side. I liked everything it I didn't think the crab cakes were full of flavor. I don't think any of the three items were the best I have ever had. Crab cakes were thick and I like them thinner. There was a lot of filler and I would not order it again.

Great restaurant!! Food and drinks were amazing!! Would highly recommend the Mardi Gras pasta! Our server DeMarcus was amazing as well he knew everything about the menu and gave us great recommendations!

Amazing food and energy!! Waitress was awesome. She checked on us just enough! Not too much and not too less. Lol!! I Will always make this one of my spots when I come to NOLA. Thank you for being this great!
Food was ok for all the fuzz and long line. Our waitress was also a so so service. Drinks were great!!
The food and service  is wonderful!! I will send everyone  here!! The drinks  are soooooo  good having 4. Sierra did a wonderful  job took care of us!!! Great job!!!!

This was the first place we ate at when we arrived to New Orleans. It's right on Bourbon street right in the middle of all the chaos. Their food was amazingly delicious. 
  For appetizers we had the oyster Rockefeller, they're oyster are not the same like out in the Bay Area where I'm actually from. They taste a different, I can't have it raw like I do from tomales bay. Oyster Rockefeller is charred with spinach, cheese and some type of cream sauce they put on it. It was good and tasty. As for our entree, my husband had the po' boy shrimp which he loved. He thought it was really good. I had the blackened redfish with crawfish etoufee on top, served with maque choux and mashed potatoes on the side. Boy, my food so very good. I loved how they used cream of mushroom to make the etouffee. All the flavors just all went together. I was very satisfied with my food. 
  The staff was very friendly and welcoming. That's one thing about New Orleans you have plenty of options to pick when it comes to good food. I would definitely come back here!

Went with group from work. Visiting area from out of state. We ordered crab cakes, it was good. Dinner good had the fish Cajun style.  Fish was great, rest of food other than crab cakes were average.  Good place to eat.

First place we stopped when we got into town.  Glad we did because the service and food was fantastic. We had the Oyster Po Boy and thankfully Alecia recommenced the Cajun fries because OMG they were soooo delicious!  You have to try them.  Didn't find them anywhere else. We'll be back soon.

Excelente para los amantes de seafood!!!
Genial por su Gumbo, crab cakes, oysters y mas...
Lo recomiendo

This place was wonderful. It is nothing fancy but has good food and friendly staff. I ordered the crawfish étoufeé and it was delicious. I could eat it every day. Our server was polite and the restaurant quieter than the other places right on bourbon street. I would definitely come back!

Everything we tasted was so flavorful. Our first meal after we landed we tried the gator bites half blackened half fried, first time trying gator and we are hooked so pleasantly surprised on how tender the meat is. My fiancé has the Cajun pasta and loved every bite of the shrimp. I had the taste of New Orleans we kept swapping bites and loved every minute of it. So tempted to come back for every meal on our trip to explore the rest of the menu

Amazing food! My first time trying catfish, we got the blackened one and it was so good that we had to try the fried one too. Both were delicious. The char grilled oysters and Cajun fries were also delicious. We added the alligator sausages with the fries cus why not! If you've never had alligator, definitely give it a try.
The food was very good. We ordered delivery and it arrived early with no trouble at all!
Enjoyed our food and the great service. Bridget was wonderful!!! I would recommend this lace to anyone visiting. Not my last time here!!

The best Cajun food in New Orleans! Our server, Whitney, gave us the best service. Helped my friend with her order and customized it exactly the way she wanted it. She almost knew what we wanted. She was on top of the table and drinks we never had to try to get her attention for anything. 
All of the other servers and hosts were nice and polite. Great food, great service, and great environment. 10/10 would recommend.

I listened to all the hype and we went there instead of Emerils.  It was good, but nothing that I will remember.  We got the red fish, very good, but we had better red fish the night before.  I also got the Alfredo, I heard it was spectacular, but it was just Alfredo.

Where do I start a review when everything in our dining experience was a home run?

We were in town for one night. After walking through the French quarter Oceana was recommended by a couple NOPD officers when I asked for good authentic seafood that wouldn't break the bank.

We knew it was good when there was a line. However we didn't wait any longer than 20 mins. They escorted us in to the third floor and this place is so cool on the inside. Rustic but the smells coming from the kitchen were awesome and inviting.

Our waiter ( Mike - an aspiring actor from Michigan ) quickly got to our table and took our drink order. He was top notch. Very friendly and helpful. We started with the gumbo as an appetizer. It was my fiancé and 16 year old son. So having a teenager can be a challenge when you want to try something new. The gumbo was amazing! My son said the best he's ever had.

I had the red fish special with collard greens and a crawfish sauce on top. My son had the crab cakes with collard greens and mashed potatoes. My fiancé had The Taste of New Orleans. My son said " this is the best meal I've ever eaten in my life". Words can't describe the amazing food and experience.

This is a great family place and reasonable in a city filled with the best restaurants.

Eat Oysters and get lucky sign at the bar as you walk in and yes, why not have more oysters here.

I sat at the bar and bartender was very friendly.

I was eating gumbo every day while in town and their gumbo tasted the best!!!! 

New Orleans surely know how to feed you and not a good place to think about a diet here as food is very good.
Really great seafood and bloody Mary's.

Was looking for a seafood place that is open past 10PM and stumbled upon Oceana Grill.

I was surprised how big this restaurant is! Ambiance is nice and chill.

We ordered fried eggplant, never knew eggplant could taste this good, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside! Also ordered Oyster Rockefeller and it was delicious!

For main, I had Taste of New Orleans, red bean and rice was amazing, with smoky ham taste, etouffee was good and jambalaya was slightly spicy but really good too.

Service was great, very friendly

So, you're wondering if this place deserves all the great reviews. Let me tell you, YES. We had the shrimp Alfredo, gumbo, and red beans and rice. Omg, so good. Please eat here while you're in town, you will not be disappointed.
Garbage. Garbage on a plate served by incompetent and lazy servers. Any complaint is handled by the jerks who own it who make pigs look polite. I wouldn't feed this swill to a jog.

One of the hotel staff recommended Oceana & I'm so glad I took her advice.  My friend had a shrimp po'boy & I had a fried eggplant po'boy.  I can no longer eat meat & was beyond thrilled to be able to eat a po'boy.  Jerleen and the rest of the staff were so friendly.  Jerleen is the most competent, friendliest server we've had in New Orleans.  DO NOT miss eating at Oceana Grill.

1st time eating alligator tail! Very good food. Long lines outside for a reason...because the food is bomb! It gets packed sometimes but our waitress knew how to please everyone. Highly recommended! Thank you from California!

Oceana Grill is a great place for New Orleans specialties like Gumbo (seafood and chicken & sausage), jambalaya, crawfish etouffé, catfish poboys and more! The chicken Alfredo pasta is delicious because they serve it with a creamy homemade sauce. Now that you know the food is great, the ambiance is exceptional. It's very conducive to have good conversation, although it can be a bit loud at times... It's NOLA after all!!

I love Oceana Grill. The food is always very good. The teenage kids also approve. I don't especially love the drinks so wouldn't go for those. The serving sizes are so large that we always bring leftovers home.
Great food, great service. Whitney is the best!!!!! Crab Cakes Benedict is a must, but those grits!!!!!! Yummmy!!!!
When you go ask for Jerry!! He is the best waiter, and really takes care of you! Because of him I had to give this a 5 star rating.

I first want to say that my waitress made my experience....
Meagan L. was a sweetheart.  She was attentive, smiled the entire time, and was a great waitress! Even when the kitchen was a bit backed up, she was pleasant and got us our food as soon as possible.  She kept us abreast at every moment.  Communication is key!  The food was nice and hot when it came.  The wait to get seated was not long!  And we watched the World Series right at our table!  Go Nats!!  All was well.  Thanks Meagan L. for a great experience, we appreciate you!

I love this place. I would like to begin by stating that I am not a fan of jambalaya. After I ate it on this restaurant, it's an order that you guys need to do. It's super yummy. The red beans and rice are fantastic too. The tropical storm is sweet and tasty drink. This is also my first time trying a gator. I enjoyed the blacked gator than the crispy one. 

My husband ordered swamp tea and it was okay. He also enjoyed the red beans and rice, jambalaya and the blackened gator.

Maaaaaan. No need for a long review just get your behind over to this restaurant and eat! The Crawfish Monica is so outstanding I recommended it to a guy checking out the menu who had just gotten out of jail.  Told him "Dude if you get this dish, either you'll make sure you never go back in and deprive yourself of it or you're finna slap somebody's mamma and go back in tonight!"
The "famous" oysters were delicious. The crab cake appetizer was huge and amazing topped with large chunks of crawfish. The waitress was super quick and really nice. Would go again for sure.

The food was so good. The line was long when we drove by but they move really fast. Our waiter was very nice and efficient. The prices are a little steep but I expected that for the French Quarters. Definitely a good place to try out
Duck tasted like liver (yuck). Gumbo was out of a can (underwhelming, under-spiced, unsalted). Jambalaya was OK. Collard greens were good- that's what the one star is for. Friendly staff tho.

Ordered a daily special-- a crispy skinned duck thigh topped with their famous mushroom gravy and craw fish. A side of corn and jambalaya. Really fantastic dish and everything was mighty flavorful. Best jambalaya I've had in town to be honest. Very large restaurant with multiple floors. Service was mediocre and not very helpful when it came to recommendations or beverages, minus a star. Overall would recommend this place though, and they provide 10% off coupons around town.

Amazing food and service. This is the first place in New Orleans that I ate and it was a great experience. I ordered their world famous crab cakes and they were just as great as everyone says. Our server Derek was incredible! Highly recommend!!

We went to NOLA on October 2018.  Oceana was recommended by our shuttle driver and our hotel. 
The crab cakes are amazing especially with the crawfish gravy. Everything we had was delicious and went there twice while we were there.  Staff was great! Would definitely recommend.
First time getting alligator  not bad taste like chicken the blackened chicken was amazing my gf got crab cakes that melted in her mouth delicious if your in New Orleans definitely a place to eat
It was good overall. The grilled oysters were a little too rich and the fried alligators were too dry.

We had such a great time experiencing the atmosphere, authentic Cajun cuisine, and getting to know our awesome waiter Chris M. His suggestions regarding the menu were a 10/10. We loved everything about this restaurant and would most definitely visit again!

This is by far our groups favorite dinner spot. We had reservations someplace else and decided we didn't want to get all dressed up. I found this gem of a place and we are so happy we did. There was a short line to get in that only took us 10-15 minutes to get through and get a table. The atmosphere is fantastic and it extends to the upstairs seething area where we were seated. 

We were greeted by Sarah our server. She was so pleasant and very attentive to everything we could have needed. I had the duck which was the best serving of Duck I've probably ever had. The others in my group had the blackened chicken po boy and the red fish. These meals were fantastic as well. We finished up the night with some creme brûlée. This as well was fantastic!

We will for sure be back to this gem of a spot that deserves a much better trip advisor spot of #97. If you have an opportunity to check this spot out it's a must do!
Great food, great service, food came out fast, open late is a plus, The only complaint that I had was I didn't have room for dessert bummer
We went in for appetizers.  The crawfish crab cakes were amazing!  We also did the alligator.  We ordered half blackened and half fried. The blackened alligator was amazing!

Good gator(had half and half, great option to try both blackened and fried) crab cakes are good also. 
Mardi Gras pasta had good sauce and the jambalaya pasta is a great option if you prefer noodles over rice.

Delivery through Yelp / GrubHub was a disaster. Back pain during my third trimester of pregnancy meant I didn't feel up to going out anywhere for dinner. The 65-minute delivery window came and went with no update and no food. Called grubhub and was told my new estimate from the restaurant was two hours after I placed the order. Food finally arrived lukewarm, except the delivery guy forgot my dessert. GrubHub sent a measly $10 promo code.

Update: approaching hour three since I ordered and still no dessert despite a call 45 minutes ago saying it was on the way.

Yum!!! The food is amazing, and the service was great! Chris M. was our waiter, and he was very helpful. He even gave us good advice on where to go in NOLA in order to get a good experience. A must go to place to eat when you're visiting here.
This restaurant not only have superb food, the service supersedes everything! Jerry was awesome in every way all the way down to offering hand sanitizer....i have been here twice in just this visit

We had lunch here today and enjoyed our experience. I had my first hurricane of this trip and it did not disappoint,especially the smoke coming from a dry ice capsule. Nice touch. My husband could not stop complimenting the ribs and practically licked his plate. I had fried oysters and a soft shelled crab combo which I liked even though the coating was a little too heavy for my liking. We were too stuffed for dessert. They atmosphere was funky and fun and the staff was very friendly.

Loved the food and drinks . We went here for my birthday. My husband and I had poboys here. He had half blackened fish and half chicken. I had Half blackened shrimp and Cajun shrimp. They were both delicious. We had the sweet tea the first day we went which was pretty good and the last day we both had frozen drinks. I had Pina colada and he had a hurricane both non alcoholic. We liked it do much that we went back on our last day in NOLA to eat there again before we left. 

The staff is also very friendly and welcoming. We ate once out side and once inside it was a pleasant experience each time!
We will be sending friends to eat here.

Not sure why this place has such high reviews.  Their "famous" grilled oysters were a disappointment.  We had a party of six.  Five of us ordered oysters and none of us enjoyed them!

I also had the seafood stew.  It lacked flavor and tasted watered down.

I don't plan to ever eat here again unless I'm forced to do so 

I think it's a tourist attraction but not good for true foodies.

We're in New Orleans today with friends who come often.  Being on the gulf, we had to have shrimp and oysters so we went to Oceana Grill on Bourbon Street here in the French Quarter.

All 5 of us had a seafood dish or a steak and it was absolutely served fresh, hot and it all really tasted light and excellently seasoned. No one had anything that wasn't delicious and there is a ton of food at really great prices.

The best thing was our server Mary who was professional, upbeat, positive and polite with great suggestions and she explained all of our questions very clearly.

Between the great food and the fantastic service provided by Mary and the kitchen team, we had a terrific meal that was fun and upbeat. 

Don't miss Oceana Grill if you're on Bourbon Street or in the French Quarter.

I hate to do this. I really do. We stopped in for lunch before heading into the swamp for the typical tour. We had a full hour to spend, which in my experience is sufficient for lunch. We waited about 5 minutes and were seated. We already ordered our drinks from the bar and all kinda knew what we wanted so we were quickly ready to order. I ordered the famous oysters and a cup of gumbo. The oysters were NOT good. I am thinking they are famous for being yucky. They tasted like they were smothered in thousand island dressing. My gumbo wasn't very yummy either. The shrimp were almost mushy. No texture at all. The flavor of the gumbo was ok, but the little shrimp were off putting. My hubby had the catfish platter. That was really good and the main reason this is a 2 star review and not 1 star. 
We were finished for a while and finally had to find our server and ask for our check. You'd think that napkins in plates and empty drinks would be a sign we were finished, but guess not. It then took her another 15 minutes to take care of settling our bill which almost made us late for our tour. 
Bottom line: Skip Oceana Grill. Waaay to many good places to eat in the quarter.

Ordered them to go  and 2 of the 3 dishes were incorrect. When you have dietary restrictions and have your food delivered, you cannot mend their mistakes easily and this is a very frustrating predicament. I wish they had given us what we paid for. The food that was correct, (less than half), was fine.

I came here and tried the crab cakes, oysters,  and shrimp with mashed potatoes dipped in a butter sauce. The oysters were very good. They were super flavorful and probably my 1st favorite. 2nd favorite was the shrimp. The crab cakes I didn't care for at all. I didn't like them even though that is what they are known for. Also, when I bit into them they were crunchy which means the inside still had some crab shell in it. Service was average. I had to keep reminding my waitress about lemons and water. Overall I would come back for the oysters.
First spot we hit when we came into Nola. Friendly staff, good food. We enjoyed the seafood.

Best Po boys I have found in NO. Great place except for Kyandria.  She was not helpful, had an attitude and didn't even want to tell us how long the wait was. It seemed as if she didn't want to be at work. Thank goodness for our awesome waiter who turned the experience around.

VERY GOOD. Super cute place in the French Quarter for dinner. Good food- I recommend their po boy or fried fish platters. They also have good jambalaya even though it's over pasta instead of the traditional rice.  

The service was also great. Our waitress was very pleasant and able to handle our large party. 

Most importantly, their Hurricane is STRONG AF. So if you're looking for a lit time, order one (or two) to hit the bars.

Kind of busy and located in the French Quarter. The food was good and tasty but not amazing. We had the oysters which were to die for and the cheese cake. We also had the Mardi Gras pasta and it was okay, probably wouldn't get it again. The service was good but not great. Overall I would come again but it's not at the top of my list and was simply just mediocre.
Great blackened redfish.  Etoufee, gumbo and jambalaya enjoyed by all in our party.  Simple collard green and spicy rice as sides.  Good service.

BBQ shrimp was good but missing a few ingredients to make it great. Oceana Oyster special was excellent.  Great flavor and generous portions. Taste of New Orleans had the most richly decadent red beans and rice. Jambalaya was a bit tomato based and dry. Shrimp etouffee was solid. Bananas foster ice cream cake was a great selection. Great service especially because we arrived just before closing.
Went back in December for lunch and it was so yummy! Portions were a good size, food had great flavor and the server was so sweet! Would love to go back and try a different dish.
I had the Cajun pasta and it was delicious!! My wife had gumbo it tasted good too!!  Even without the hotsauce it was delicious!!  Great atmosphere too!!

It was late, they were open. Service was prompt and friendly but the food was meh okay. Mines arrived barely warm and could use a tad more flavor but I managed to eat it. Portions are generous. I had a fried seafood platter which my table shared my oysters were good as were the gator bites.

Right in the heart of bourbon street sits this gem. You can smell the delicious flavors while you wait outside. We had a party of six so we waited a while but with a daiquiri in your hand, time goes by quickly. The grilled oysters were quite tasty and for the main course, I had the taste of New Orleans which was a sampler of jambalaya, crawfish étouffée and red beans and rice...It was pretty tasty.

This is my second visit here. When we arrived we were seated right away. The hostess and waitress were very friendly. Also the ladies restroom was really clean! I only mentioned because most of the ladies restrooms near bourbon street were horrible. I ordered the crab cakes appetizer and jambalaya. The crab cakes were a pair and they were large enough to be an entree. Everything was extremely delicious. I will definitely come back when I return to New Orleans.

I really want to give Oceana Grill 5 stars because they have without a doubt THE best sausage biscuits and gravy I have ever eaten. Granted, I don't eat a whole lot of the stuff because, well, for one, it will kill you, but moreso because you just won't find a dish like this up north. (Save for maybe Pies & Thighs in Brooklyn.)

This was my second trip to NOLA in two years, and both times I had to go to Oceana for this dish and for a few of their equally excellent Bloody Mary's. It is absolutely worth the extra 10 or 20 miles I need to pound out afterward, because it is simply THAT good. Did I mention that it's good?

I've seen other dishes emerge from the kitchen, and they all look very basic and blah. The only dish I have ever seen anyone rave about are the absolutely, positively, totally, and fully awesome sausage biscuits and gravy. This is the dish you order when you come here. And frankly, this is the only reason you even consider coming here.

Hoping I've made my point here, but if you have any questions about what you should order when you come to Oceana, just let me know. I've got a tip I can share with you.
We loved this place. There are long lines at night during peak times, so we went for lunch and were sat right away. The blackened red fish, gator bites and crab cakes were all great.

It was an amazing experience eating food here. The customer service was beyond expectation. We orders oysters we ordered fries and they were so so good. It is a must go please when you're in New Orleans

Food is average at best. Service was great (sort of). Got the grilled oysters for my appetizer. Go to Desire on Bourbon street for a much better option! These fell short...to be polite. As did the fish entree the waitress recommended  and I can't even remember what it was. The killer was, and I really HATE this....my substandard entree was brought to the table while I was still eating the substandard grilled oysters! This is a tourist trap restaurant and it shows! Avoid avoid, avoid! NOT recommended!!

This place is delicious! It was a quick wait time, out waiter, David, was so sweet, and the food was amazing!!!
David recommended the blacked Cajun Chicken Alfredo pasta and it had the perfect amount of spice. My husband got the Cajun jambalaya pasta and it was great too! Will recommend this place to everyone!

I am visiting from California and didn't know what to expect from a ' tourist ' spot . I was pleasantly surprised by this delicious food. Everything was good. Our server Lavern was amazing .  She was very friendly and fast.

Quantity and quality was spot on. Catfish was amazing. The jalapeno hush puppies were very good also. Would definitely come back to this place. Natalie our waitress was helpful and amazing. Our drinks were filled every time without question and she helped us with the menu.
Cajun fries were amazing! The atmosphere was amazing; we sat at a window seat upstairs and loved it!

Good, but Mambo's was better. Chargrilled and fresh oysters were good, but not great. Hubby had the duck, which he loved. I had one of the pasta dishes, it was good, but a bit oily and the pasta was overcooked.

We stumbled upon Oceana Grill after finding out ACME was closed for a private event. We were not disappointed with Oceana Grill! Our waitress was extremely attentive and very friendly. Most of the places we ate at prior to eating here the food was very salty, but the food at Oceana was perfectly seasoned. I enjoyed my Mardi Gras pasta which was fettuccine Cajun Alfredo with shrimp  and blackened crawfish. It was delicious! My friend had the shrimp po-boy with fries and she enjoyed it. I was addicted to their perfectly fried fries. Another friend had one their fish entree, I can't remember but she said it was tasty. Prices were reasonable with large portions. I definitely recommend Oceana Grill.

Don't come here if you want good service. Waited in line over 20 minutes outside in the rain to even get in the door. Then was brought to a table on the third floor (place is huge to pack in as many people and tables as possible) where I was sat at a table that was put in a walkway so they could accommodate more people. I was bumped into by every passing waiter and service person as they walked by. This is also the walkway to the bathroom so as a bonus I get bumped into by each patron going to use the restroom as well. I wait another 20 minutes then the busser comes to apologize for the wait and offers to take our food order instead as the waiter is still MIA (Maybe on a break?) Not sure still haven't seen him. Meanwhile I see people who were sat after me already getting their food. Waiter finally arrived and is introduced to us by the busser who already took our food order. He says "here is your waiter to take your order" what? I thought you already took our order? Well he's here to verify it he said, so ok verify the order then... he does not verify the order just apologize that he wasn't around to take it. So Brandon the waiter brought the food; we had a large fried seafood shared platter and he had no plates in his hand for us but had two bags of to go food for someone else's table in his other hand for some reason.  Not sure what happened here but complete fail. I will never return.

Mediocre at best. There are better oysters in the city than this place. The crab cakes were extremely dry! I could barely eat half of one. The crawfish on top was the only decent part of the entire meal.
By far the worse meal we had in NOLA ! Me and my hubby heard the food was great here and great food we did  not eat ! Extremely disappointed

Characteristically New Orleans!! Great atmosphere, lists of books & crannies to accommodate a lot of guests. Many levels, so our food came out Luke warm. Waiter Ron was amazing & with the managers assistance was very helpful in making sure we were satisfied. Great portion sizes for sharing. In a prime location that, if you're lucky enough to sit near a window, it allows you to enjoy the sights & sounds of Bourbon Street from the restaurant. Great menu with a great variety of choices.

Don't let the line scary you away, we had a party of 2 and were in line for less than 10 minutes. Once seated, we were served by Mike and he made sure to take care of us. All the staff was so friendly! Our food was reserved quickly and was very affordable. We had the gator tail bites, gumbo & red beans and rice. Everything was great! Our lyft driver had suggested we tried this because he also ate there. It's always nice when a local will eat there too. Definitely check it out!
Great food and ambience. The service is just great! All the way from the host to the server. Try the crab cakes! They are delish!

Always has a line outside, but goes quickly.  Their signature chargrilled oysters do not disappoint-delicious!Seafood gumbo is some of the best Louisiana gumbo around and a must order! Poboys are great too!!  

Our waiter, Kevin, was awesome!!

My girlfriend got a bad oyster and they offered me a slice of cake... didn't even take the food that made her sick and vomit in the bathroom off the bill. The waiter was a idiot and had to get the manager to get the tainted food off our bill because he said he didn't have that power and they don't give free food away. 

The worst place in New Orleans !!!!! 

Thanks for making me feel like a a$$ hole eating cake with my girlfriend in the bathroom puking

Loved everything about this place from the food to our server Ashley. We had the shrimp and crab cake for appetizers and they were so YUMMY! For dinner entrees, we had blackened red fish and blackened chicken. The portion was big and the food was nothing but amazing. We went back for breakfast the next day and our server Troy was also great! We had the crab crepe and was super happy again! Will definitely go back there for a 3rd meal before we leave town.

I feel bad not giving this place 5 stars because it's been rated so many times, but I have to be honest, I wasn't that impressed with my experience. Our waiter was very polite, but wasn't very attentive. We ordered their Bloody Mary's that are apparently "the best in town" and maybe I must've had a new bartender make mine, because I wasn't blown away by it. My fiancé ordered the shrimp po boy and it looked (and tasted) pretty plain. I ordered the fried seafood sampler and it was my definitely fault I wasn't adventurous enough to try something different to be impressed. I also noticed about 30 minutes after we left, my stomach started to gurgle and I felt horrible (I had to basically run to the nearest public bathroom), so I have a feeling the fried oysters weren't necessarily fresh. If you want to have a better experience, I would recommend stepping out of the fried food zone!

One thing I can definitely recommend to try if you decide to come here is the blackened (not fried!)  alligator tail bites. Delicious & worth the money. I probably enjoyed this dish the most out of the entire meal.

The crabcakes appetizer was very good and the cajun pasta was delicious.  My burger was way over cooked, almost hard to swallow. 

The service was very slow.

NASTY!!! Just watch S03E14 of Kitchen Nightmares. It's available on Sony Crackle.... Ate at this restaurant prior to being notified by a local to avoid this restaurant. Apparently it's only popular with naive tourists. Had the shrimp platter. The shrimp had a mild fish oder that was not pleasant. Did not finish. Dining partner had the Oyster Po-Boy. She was gagging because it's taste was so awful. We left immediately. AVOID THIS PLACE! It's obvious they don't have quality control standards.

This place is SOLID and I'm a fan.

First of all, they had great crab cakes - New Orleans style. These were absolutely da'bomb. Maryland crab cakes and New Orleans crab cakes are two different things and I'm glad I have now had the best of both worlds. The atmosphere of the place was great as they had outdoor seating and a nice enclosed deck outside. The service was absolutely stellar and our waiter was very nice. The bread pudding was fantastic as well. I'm knocking a star off because it was a little pricey but I guess I should expect that with it being right off of bourbon street.

The Hurricanes were fantastic as well and I drank more than one. Great seafood place and I would return if I ever went back to New Orleans.

The food and service was good. The food came out quick. My sides came out COLD but they rectified that quickly. I ordered the crab cakes which were delicious. My husband ordered the taste of New Orleans. The jambalya and etouffee were just ok, but the red beans, rice and sausage was excellent!

Great New Orleans food in large portions with friendly service. We got the blackened duck and catfish with added soft shell crab and crawfish. This feast was delicious and even the sides did not disappoint. Collards were seasoned, yummy and tasted home made. 
This restaurant is large and was very busy during our time of arrival. Despite this, we were seated quickly and our food was served in no time. Our server was friendly and helped us choose local beer to match out taste. 
We came to NOLA for the food and at Oceana we did just that.

I ordered the Taste of New Orleans which was a sample of three traditional southern dishes. I loved it! We made reservations for a group of 11, so gratuity was added to our bill. This was the only downside, since our waitress was a bit standoffish and inattentive. Overall, I would eat here again!

Food was good, we ordered a couple poboys, and I ordered the blackened catfish with mustard greens and jambalaya rice. My dinner mates liked their sandwiches and whiskey Sazeracs, but my fish was a little on the thin side. But the thing that really burned us was that their credit card system was down. One person was willing to pay with his card, but we had to pay cash. Their suggestion when we said we didn't all have cash? Go to the ATM. So go find am ATM, pay the withdrawal fee, and we won't offer a discount.
Great food and drinks! Loved our waiter Whitney! I would def love to come back and recommend to anyone

My server Chantay was really sweet and provided amazing service. The chargrilled oysters and gator bites were great appetizers. My group had the red beans and rice, catfish platter, blackened bayou duck and Cajun pasta and all meals were good. The wait wasn't too long and I will be back.

We waited in line about 30 minutes for a table of 5.  I thought this was great since it was Mardi Gras and many restaurants were closed. Marvin was our server.  He was nice and served bottomless sweet tea.  The entrees are on the expensive side for many fried items but it is seafood! Overall we had a fun dining experience and it felt authentic.

Was told to have jambalaya here. I ordered the special the Redsnapper fish as recommended by the server and replace my side with jambalaya rice. My party also ordered gator tail bites and "Oceana's Famous Oysters" . Everything was delicious!
Great food great service.  A bit pricy, hence the 4 stars.  The wait staff are very friendly.

Did numerous searches for a good place to eat by the French Quarter, this came up on many.  We have a teenage son and some places are 21+ only, but this is a family-friendly restaurant.  Hubby and I told the waiter we would split the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta, a side order of Crawfish Etouffee and my son wanted a simple cheeseburger.  The waiter, Christopher K was so kind as to plate our pasta in two separate servings and didn't charge a sharing fee!  The pasta was delicious and for a split plate, the portion was perfect!  Loved the Crawfish Etouffee!  Flavors were so good and it had a nice kick, but not too spicy.  My son enjoyed his cheeseburger and his fries had a crispy coating to it...was good.  We ended with their New Orleans Bread Pudding and added the scoop of vanilla ice cream (for an additional $2) and it was....Wow! It was absolutely delicious!!  The three of us demolished it quickly, enjoying every bite!  Portion size is great and the staff were attentive.  Definitely recommend!

Management and owners should be ashamed of how dirty this restaurant is.  The seats on the chairs are worn and dirty and the it smells like mildew. The floor was sticky.   Our food was not that great.. the fried shrimp came out cold and the gumbo was very watery. Stay way to many great restaurant in NOLA to have to deal with this. Service was not to bad.

Service at first was slow but once Jamie L. saw we were there, she was great. Friendly & fun atmosphere. Sit in the courtyard area. Cool vibe. Oceana's Famous Oysters had a yummy sauce. Redfish special was wonderful & the red beans & rice with Cajun sausage didn't disappoint!
Food was delicious! Service was great. No complaints! Awesome waiter, friendly hosts!
Man this place is gooood food. I have to say that their hurricane drink made the dinner and the fish made the drink. Great decor and upbeat spirit from the management all the way to the bussers.
The seafood omelettes were incredible. Great service from when you walk in. Each person on the way to the seat greeted and thanked us.
Decent Bourbon Street eatery.  Service was friendly and quick. The food was average at best.

Very good food really enjoyed. I had to wait but it was less than 10 minutes and the staff was so nice and attentive. I had the delight pleasure of enjoying the shrimp platter and it was  good. Plus they give you  Hush Puppies!!!! The hush puppies have a kick its like jalapeno. I loved it though. We also say outside and it was very beautiful. The gumbo was not good at all it was generic no sausage in it.
Best creole Cajun food! Omg you have to try the oysters and the fish cakes. Hands down the best and melted in my mouth. Worth every bite!
The food was excellent and our server Whitney provided excellent service! I would definitely recommend the Greek omelet!  It was awesome!

There was a long line but we were seated less than 15 minutes.  The waitress was very friendly and made you feel welcome.  The food was superb.  This is a great place to go for creole and cajun food in the same place.

Good food, friendly staffs.  $0.75 oyster between 3-6pm.   Two of us ordered two dozen oyster, bbq shrimp, cocktails, and other dishes.   Comparing the size of oysters with other tables who ordered 1/2 dozen or 1 dozen, ours were probably 1/3 size.   We ordered another two dozen, and the size was even smaller.  So you spend more money you get less.   I feel like I was cheated.   
My advise to you, just order 1/2 dozen or 1 dozen max.  Then order again 1/2, 1/2, and 1/2 again seperately.   Otherwise your oyster would be smallest among the customers.   We will spend more money and will get less quality foods.

The food was God-awful. We ordered eggplant sticks as an appetizer. They were cold when we initially received them. The second time around you can tell they just dipped the original order in hot grease. For my meal, I ordered blackened catfish, which was bland as ever, with garlic mashed potatoes and a side Caesar salad. The waiter, David, lacked basic manners. He reached over us several times without saying excuse me and I could not eat my salad because his arm touched it when he poured water in my class. The experience was not pleasant to say the least. I suppose I should've known when the hostess, Shanay, butted in a conversation I was having with other guests in my party and then proceeded to attempt to argue with me. Highly overrated.
Stopped for a small bite to eat for breakfast, we had the PaW PaW Hash. It was delicious ! Laverne was our server and she was very friendly and attentive! Portion was quite large come hungry!
The food and service was good, but absurdly overpriced. The jalapeño hush puppies were very good though.

We were created warmly by the hostess and seated promptly. Or waiter was very personable and answered any questions we had. I had the blackened catfish and greens and OMG that was soooo good. My husband had the special - red fish and some type of stuffing which he thoroughly enjoyed. Good food good service!
Not really sure how this place has such good reviews. I'm not the pickiest but this restaurant was really not up to the reviews standard. Don't waste your time in the line it's not incredible food.

Initially excited to try this place as they had a gluten free menu (I am a celiac so have to eat gluten free) but was very disappointed when I arrived and saw how limited and plain the gluten free menu was. Basically grilled chicken, fish or steak no sauce or flavor. I did have the crab cakes as a starter which were tasty though a bit expensive as a starter. Management should look at adapting some of the other tasty options to be gluten free which can easily be done! Be prepared for a long wait for a table or make a reservation to eat late in the night.

This restaurant was recommended by our doorman at the Inn we were staying at. We were shocked to find a line down the street waiting to get in, you know, like those popular bars in LA or NY City. We contemplated finding some where else to eat but decided to wait it out. Surprisingly enough the wait wasn't that long, maybe 20 minutes. They have a outside hostess that snags the people who try to go in, by passing the line(purly innocently, I am sure) and getting the numbers in each party. She then passes that information along to the indoor hostess who then tells her how many to send it at a time. They do take reservations, so I would suggest making one before going. 

Once we were seated, on the 3rd floor, we studied the menu. They had a variety of appetizers and plenty of entrees to choose from. We order the blackened alligator bites for our appetizer. The flavor was wonderful, but I think ai prefer the fried. I don't feel like the blackened was tenderized enough; I had picked up a larger piece and felt like I had to chew forever to get it down! Hubby lived it, though. For our main entree, my husband chose the Shrimp Alfredo, which was served in a heaping portion with steam rising from it and crusty bread on the side. I went for the Taste of New Orleans sampler plate. It came with 3 cups, one of each, crawfish etouffèe, jambalaya and red beans and rice with a slice of smoked sausage in it. The beans and rice were a very creamy consistency. The jambalaya was a tasty Creole version, filled with chicken and sausage. The Crawfish Etouffèe (one of my favorite ways to eat crawfish) had a tomato gravy over the rice. There was not a bite left of anything on either of our plates. 

If you are ever in NOLA, down in the French Market area, I highly suggest a visit to Oceana Grill for dinner, but make reservations!
Wonderful atmosphere, food & service! Good place to go to get a bite & beat the heat!
Food was very good and so was the service. We were seated on the third floor which was cool but could be inconvenient if you have someone that has a hard time with stairs. Try the crab cakes!

The food was horrible during this Essence 2019 weekend. The waitress brought us cold oysters. She stated, "she would fix it". She brought us back the same oysters that she heated in the microwave. Why would someone pay for this? Also, my friend ordered a Cajun catfish Po' Boy and the bread consumed the fish. When she bit the fish and bread together she could not taste the seasoning or the fish. Also a tiny piece of kale was provided fir this largely bread sandwich with very little meat. This restaurant CANNOT compete with ACME their oysters come out sizzling hot and they have sauce. The Oceana Oysters were very dry and without sauce. This was very disappointing after standing in line to eat here!!! Don't waste your time or money!!!

Had lunch with gf at this fun place. Lots of great energy and music. We had the pleasure of Whitney waiting on us. Her enthusiasm is infectious and encouraged us to order boldly. Taste of New Orleans and the special Redfish were delicious and ample. The Cajun Bloody Mary is literally the best I've had. Thumbs up, y'all.

Good food nice drinks!
Sat at the table on the second floor near the window and we were freezing.
Sierra our waitress moved us right away! She was great!
Red fish special was great!
Try it you'll be happy.
Loved this place. The service was amazing!!! The charbroiled oysters were delicious!!! All the food was great. Good cocktails. Will be coming back

Excellent food and service! We had a little wait, maybe 15 minutes, but there was a long line of people wanting to get in to eat. This was suggested by a local, so you know it's good. The GF and I finally got our table, by the window looking out at the street. We ordered Cajun Fries which were AMAZING. We could have just had two plates of these for dinner and be stuffed! We actually managed to stuff ourselves because we sucked down every last bit of the fries! We then had our main courses, she ordered "Taste of New Orleans" and I ordered a bowl of Seafood Gumbo. Was delicious and we couldn't finish it all! Our server was outstanding and the whole thing was under $35!!! Glad we found this one... we will be back!
So dang good. Luckily I was alone so got to skip the line and sit at the bar. I had the taste of New Orleans and finished every last bite. Superb.

We had food delivered to our hotel, and not only was it fast, it was also still hot and DELICIOUS. It was our last night in New Orleans, so this was the best meal we could've hoped to end our trip on. We ordered the crab cake fettuccine and the catfish po-boy. Both were phenomenal!
Two words: Cajun fries. Ok the oysters were off the hook too. And the duck. And the cocktails. Glad we went for lunch as there was a line out the door for dinner the next two nights!

Everything is delicious here... everything!

The ambiance is nice too. We sat outside this time and in enjoyed the quiet courtyard.

I like that good food is available so late too! We are at midnight.

This was our favorite restaurant of the entire trip to New Orleans! We went here several times and went out of our way to stop in and have one of our favorite drinks, the mandarin blush. The food was the best we'd had, the service was always outstanding and the drinks were cold and refreshing! We definitely recommend coming here. I had the taste of New Orleans and added the fried crawfish tails and would have that for every meal if I could!
Amazing food!  It's a lot bigger inside than it looks from outside.  Nice sit down atmosphere.  The staff are all amazingly friendly and nice.  Definitely kid/family friendly.

The atmosphere and staff was very nice and welcoming, however the food was very underwhelming. Which was extremely disappointing. One of the main reasons I went to New Orleans was because of the rumored great food. The food wasn't seasoned and lacked any flavor. If you find yourself in New Orleans stay away from the touristy restaurants, travel outside the bourbon street area and get some real local food! The only reason I gave this place two stars is because the staff was so nice
Nice staff . Vegetables and corn were well seasoned and tasty . Main courses - redfish and New Orleans sampler were ok-food could have arrived hotter

Excellent service, very attentive staff. If you want to eat here at night Thursday through Sunday, I definitely recommend making reservations ahead of time because the place gets pretty packed and the line to wait in gets really long. Went with a friend and we shared 2 appetizers: crab cake with crawfish sauce which was delicious and the fried eggplant fries which were also excellent and had a great dipping sauce. We then shared the fried shrimp platter. All the food was really good, and the portions are quite large (glad we shared the dinner course because the appetizers ended up filling us up quite a bit). This restaurant has excellent food, very reasonable prices (especially considering how much food you get), and a really fun atmosphere.

I rated the grill a four versus a five because although the food was good the service could've been much better. Also the establishment was a lot louder and darker than expected. I had the pasta pictured below which had a spicy kick but was truly delicious. I was fortunate enough to try everything pictured but my favorite would have to be the barbecue shrimp. The sauce it was drenched in was delicious and I highly suggest dipping bread in there to enjoy as well! In my opinion the blackened gator bites tasted better and offered a better texture than the fried ones. So if you're looking for a worthwhile appetizer definitely order the shrimp! 

If you're planning to dine here arrive at a decent time or be prepared to wait because there is constantly a line outside of the restaurant. The food does get made quickly but it is consistently packed! Overall the food was delicious and it was a pleasant experience, I would surely come back.

We had a great meal here. We started out with the charbroiled oysters and they were so much better than Felix's and Acme. I had the red fish special with a jalapeño cornbread stuffing that was delicious. My husband had the Taste of New Orleans which was Jambalaya, beans and rice and etouffee, it was great also. We had the chocolate kahula mousse that was very lite and delicious. 
We'd come here again.

I can personally attest to the very poor quality of food here. The oyster poboy had oysters so small they were mainly breading. I was told it was because of the oil spill but that doesn't excuse the mouse in the dining room or the nonchalance of the waitstaff. DO NOT EAT HERE. "Kitchen Nightmares" did not exaggerate on this.
This restaurant is amazing!!! Jamal was our waiter and he hands down made our experience great! The crab cakes are a must!!! Drinks delicious

We had an amazing time at Oceana Grill this last Sunday (10/20)! We loved the food and our waitress, Kim, was so sweet and kind. We just loved her! Thank you for contributing to making our first time experiencing New Orleans awesome! We will definitely be back. :)

Usually long wait, but my party got lucky & didn't have to wait much. Staff was that "fake nice." Food is on the expensive side & portions on the smaller side. I had the chicken alfredo pasta which tasted good but my stomach wasn't too happy after it. I think this place is definitely overhyped by tourist. Locals definitely do not go here. Overall we didn't have an amazing experience but it wasn't bad either. If I could I would give this place a 3.5 stars.

Our family had lunch there. We started w the fresh oysters- they are delicious! Then we had " taste of New Orleans " w three small dishes. Very tasty and unique. The service was good and fast! I would highly recommend this grill !

Very underwhelmed. I had the red fish and étouffée with jambalaya rice and sautéed vegetables. My fish was dry and the jambalaya had a sweet tomato sauce on top. My sautéed vegetables was corn. I was expecting a vegetable medley of broccoli, zucchini or squash, maybe even green beans but not corn. I also ordered an Oceana-tini to drink it was a total waste of $10. It was super sweet and I couldn't taste any alcohol in it. For it to be a play on an apple-tini they definitely need to rethink the recipe. This place left nothing to my imagination and didn't give me a reason to return. I don't think the food is worth the asking price. Our waitress was nice and friendly which is why I gave a two star rating.

Been their twice while in NO, the food is great and the staff are friendly and helpful. Taste of New Orleans is my favorite, combination of most famous dishes of NO. And try oyster, fresh oysters are the best I have in town.

Great Po Boys!
My wife and I were both blown away by great Po Boys!
I had eggplant, very creative. 
The eggplant was sliced into french fry shaped pieces and deep fried well!
The sandwich was great, though I would have liked a little more seasoning on the eggplant. 
My wife had a gator Po Boy and was on cloud nine!
Service was awesome!

Tourist trap. The worst food in Nola. You will be sorry if you eat here. If your a local you know to stay away. We have so many wonderful dining options. This is not one of them. The food is terrible. The seafood is not fresh.

Just okay you can find much better options in NOLA. It's in the heart of French quarter and very busy. I had the fried shrimp which were seasoned well and crispy. My friends got the alligator and they thought it was okay. The waitress kept forgetting what we asked for and seemed to have an attitude. Don't get the bananas foster here, it's some weird pudding like frozen thing. Probably wouldn't eat here again.
I want to start out saying Ashleigh was awesome, attentive, not intrusive, and made spectacular recommendations. I had the black and gold gator and oceana oysters

Came across this place because I live by Yelp. I was on my honeymoon and had just left a ghost tour and was looking to grab a bite. It was kinda late (around 10p) and didn't think I was going to find good food that late. I ordered the charbroiled oysters, they were delicious completely different from the usual butter parmesan cheese kind they had a cream sauce . Then ordered the gumbo and an alligator po boy dressed. Gumbo was average but that po boy! The waiter suggested I get half and half blackened and fried! It was so good! I definitely will order again?

Some of the best food I have ever ate. Definitely a most try. We started off with crab cakes, gator bites, and gumbo for appetizers. The grilled gator bites was seasoned perfect and tasted great. The rue in the gumbo set it apart from any I have tasted up to this point. Everyone else in my part of 8 seemed to love the crab cake. They were just alright to me. Then everyone ordered something different to be able to share family style but was way to much food for us. 
Taste of New Orleans - red beans and rice and étouffée was mouth watering good 
Fried Shrimp Platter- I don't like fried shrimp so it was just alright to me but rest of group loved it. 
Redfish Oceana- cooked to perfection. The meat was flaky and good plus the butter shrimp sauce that put on top was good. The cornbread stuffing and turnip greens were good. 
Jambalaya Pasta- had a slight hint of spice that was good. 
Shrimp fettuccine- didn't taste the fettuccines. 
Chicken fettuccine- didn't taste fettuccines 
Mardi Gras Pasta- favorite by far of all the pastas

Mary was an awesome server! She gave me several drink recommendations and ensured that I was checked on throughout my visit. The Cajun fries with shrimp and cheese was a unique twist on your standard fries. I'd definitely recommend coming here!
Meagan L. the bartender was amazing! We had the chefs special po boy and Cajun fries, both delicious! Will definitely come back!
Decent place. Fish was a bit too fishy ;) prices are a bit high for the quality of food and service. Find a better spot.

I loved Oceana. We called and tried to get a reservation in which we were told there were no times available for that night.they then stated if we come around 6 we will be able to have a short wait for our party size due to their seven dining rooms. We got there right at 6 and were seated in 15-20 minutes. Our waitress Ashleigh was a great start to our experience. She was quick, efficient, yet gave us all the time we needed to be re explained the specials and good entrees to get on the menu. The food was hot, fast and the most important delicious. We had a great time at the Oceana and the service Ashleigh gave us was on point for a five start review. Thank you Oceana

Honestly, Yelp is my best friend when finding local places to go to and usually don't write out reviews but I gotta say Ronald's service was great! He literally had us laughing the whole time. It's crazy how knowledgeable he is about the menu. Super friendly guy and a real genuine guy. I hate when people try to pretend like they're someone else when serving but, we all loved his personality! Aside from the service, the food was delicious! All of Rons recommendations were great! Food IS spicy but it's so flavored that the spice doesn't overpower the taste of the food!

I am not sure what I expected but it wasn't anything special.  I ate the Cajun sampler with jambalaya, red beans and rice and seafood étouffée.   There were large TVs all around but couldn't hear any music.  Just not what I was looking for.
Marv is a great waiter. Great service. Get the watermelon frozen marg. So good!! Also, ask for the off-menu dessert with the praline pecan sauce. Incredible.
Chargrilled oysters were amazing along with the main dishes. Make sure to make a reservation so you can skip the long line!!!

We went looking for FOOD.   Well our group said to try this Place.   Well let me tell you something...  our Waiter Sierra was beyond Awesome,  if you want to be Pampered and eat some food to remember on your Road-trip, Reunion,  or just getting Drunk on Bourbon Street.  This is the Place that's off the Beaten Path,  but well worth it.  They even offer a Drink Called the " Road to Bourbon Street".  Take my advise... Only order one,  they are good and Strong.  Well we are off exploring New Orleans.... Enjoy

Franks Road-Trip 2019

1st night in the big easy & took a recommendation from a police officer where to get a quick bite.  It was a relatively quiet night (Dec 23) so we were seated immediately & our waitress was the friendliest and bubbly server I've had in a long time, I wish I remembered her name. My sister had a  margarita that was bubbling because of the dry ice in it.  I had my 1st sazerac which I thought was going to be my go to drink for this trip but it was way too strong for me - not a bourbon drinker, don't know what I was thinking. I was offered a subsitution which I declined and then was brought a glass of cranberry juice to dilute my drink with - much better. My sister & I shared a bowl of gumbo which was yummy & if I had room I would have ordered another. I ordered the fried shrimp platter which was yummy too & huge. This is a solid go to place for authentic food!

Went there for lunch around 2pm, there was no line and we were seated promptly.
They have a small open air backyard. The place inside is ok, just basic.
The service was good and fast. We had the crab cake which was phenomenal , the gator tail ( we had 1/2 fried and 1/2 blackened) and the chargrilled oyester which was kind of heavy with all the cheese on top ( didn't like it)
For entree we had a fish which was very tasty and also we had taste of New Orleans which was good. I recommend that place, it is really good and there prices are mid range.

Came here while I was in New Orleans for a bachelorette party. We had a party of 11 and only waited about 30 minutes. The food was amazing! I ordered the crab cake appetizer and it was SO good! Oceana definitely has become a restaurant I will make a point to stop at every time I'm in town.
This place is great from the Cajun fries to the chicken Caesar salad. Food was great! Gator Po Boy was delicious!

We ordered gator bites, 1/2 dozen oysters, crab cakes, shrimp platter and drinks (two margaritas and one ultimate Bloody Mary). Bloody Mary took appox. 30 min to come out, and the shrimp plateer was 30-45 min after all the other food even though we asked for it all at the same time. Overall, we ended up staying there for just over two hours as we waited on the kitchen. The only upside was our waitress was friendly.

I should note: they did take 10% off the bill, though that was roughly half the cost of the shrimp platter

Solid food and bar atmosphere was entertaining. Coming from st Augustine seafood was decent but not spectacular. However the spices were on point for what I'd expect from LA! Would definitely come back again. My wife got the refuse and she really enjoyed it

On Sunday June 30, 2019. My girlfriends and I went to Oceana for dinner on last night in New Orleans.  What was suppose to be a memorable last night in New Orleans ended up being disappointing and the worst customer service experience ever.  We asked to speak to the manager because the bottom of my girlfriend 's skirt was saturated with a liquid that was on the floor at Oceana. The liquid came from a spill that was on the floor at a table behind the table where we were seated.  Michael a supervisor came to our table and did nothing. Then we were told we can get a 10% discount on our meal and come back the next day for breakfast.  The manager Daniel Cavalier then approached our table and said we could have the 10% discount but not free breakfast.  Michael then made a comment to my girlfriend whose skirt was saturated stating his mother would have never complained. What did his mother have to do with our situation? My girlfriends and I came to Oceana to eat , pay for a great meal and get excellent customer service and we did not get what we came for. The food was okay and the customer service experience was awful.  We have no idea what kind of liquid was on the floor.  She/we  could have fell or had an allergic reaction to the liquid that
 saturated her skirt. Their was no empathy.  They made us feel like we were suppose to say nothing. News Flash, the customer is always right and should be treated with dignity and respect always.
First time here but very impressed! We ordered fried alligator, oyster and taste of New Orleans. They are awesome!

I'm more than certain that Jesus, Muhammed, and Abraham are the chefs in that kitchen! The food was toe-tapping good. There aren't enough words in the English dictionary to describe how good the food was. Just amazing. I had the crab cake pasta.  My husband had the blackened catfish and jambalaya with a side of fettucine alfredo. All delicious. Might go back tonight. Outstanding 5-stars for sure

Great spot in the French Quarter. 

Service was friendly and warming from start to finish. 
Ultimate Blood Mary was a big hit and basically an appetizer and a drink in one 

Blackened Bayou Duck was amazing!

Kim was an amazing server! She was super friendly and had some other amazing suggestions for around town. We loved her! The food was delicious as well. Definitely try the Mardi Gras pasta as well as the crab cakes. You can't go wrong.

This place seems much smaller on the outside than it actually is! We walked by it the first time. There was a small line outside, but we were quickly ushered inside and waited maybe 15 minutes from there. We traveled up two sets of stairs on our way to be seated and were sat at a window seat. Great food, great atmosphere. I ordered the crawfish ettoufee, my husband the fried shrimp and both were generously sized and delicious!

Decent food and lots of it.  Service was super friendly.  Felt a bit tacky decor-wise.  It felt kind of like a chain restaurant (not sure if it was).

The food was quite good though.  The server recommended the crab cake and any of the seafood because it was fresh.  I was happy with his suggestions!
