We went here for lunch on the recommendation from the hotel we are staying at. What a great place! You are greeted so warmly and welcomed by everyone in the place. The staff was incredibly nice. We had Marlon as our server and he was super nice. Walking upstairs to our seats, you can't help but be amazed by the beautiful decor. 
We both had po'boys (shrimp and grilled chicken) and my husband also had a cup of the gumbo. Food was excellent and I can safely cross off having a delicious po'boy in NOLA off my bucket list. The sandwiches were great and just enough for lunch. 
Marlon also gave helpful tourist tips to my husband and I!

Came all the way from Seattle,Wa and was told about this place. I couldn't be happier with the food but most of all our server, Whitney was world class. I truly have never had a better experience and it was all because of Whitney. We came with a group of 11 and she was so smooth, helpful and friendly. True southern hospitality... thank you Whitney for making our food experience amazing and unforgettable

This place is good if you are in a bind and need a late night (relative term) bite to eat somewhere in the French Quarter. I was also impressed that they offered a couple of vegetarian options. Otherwise, there is nothing special here.
Great service! Taylor was awesome, food was really fast and tasty. 10/10 would recommend

I didn't know until after I left that this place was on Kitchen Nightmares 6 months before the day I was here. I thought the waiter we had was good. He was always checking on us. The food that we ordered was good. I had a po boy that was alright and could have been better. The beer was good. I was hoping for something much better but it is what it is..
My husband and I stopped in here for a drink-hurricane and a Bloody Mary. Both were very tasty. Service was very friendly and prompt. Food looks fantastic so we may make our way back there again!
Great food. Friendly service. Those crab cakes were amazing!

Got their Cajun fries to go when we were driving through NOLA. Once you put all the sauces on it gets kind of soggy. The flavor was amazing, but I suggest eating these fries fresh and in the restaurant.
We waited in a long line but it literally only took us 10-15 minutes to get a table and the estimated time was 30.. staff was very nice and the food was delicious

Had a wonderful meal here with my wife. I had the crab cakes, which are pretty good, and some oysters rockefeller, Which were great. My wife had fantastic fried shrimp, and an appetizer fried crawfish tails. Great food, good service, and a beautiful wonderful fun decor made for a delightful dining experience. And you can't beat the location.
Huge tourist trap. If you're looking for authentic  local cuisine skip this place. There are way too many other options all over this city.

My new favorite stop for crab cakes! I'm also grateful for  our bartender that suggested to add blackened shrimp to it. That was what really put it over the top. Also had the broiled oysters and they are also amazing. I've had the broiled oysters from Drago's, Acme Oyster, and a few other places and these were by far my favorite. I want to also mention the Mandarin Blush was quite tasty. Can't wait till my next trip back to enjoy this spot again.
I don't care what you order. Everything my family ordered was good. Only downside is huge lines, but that can be easily passed by making a reservation online. I can't wait to eat here again.
This is an old standby with great food and late hours. Traditional NOLA dishes and good quick service.
Best Red Beans & rice! It reminded me of mom's so it reminded me of home, please try them out!

BEST PLACE FOR DRINKS AND FOOD!!! 

There was a million other places to try but we came across this place on yelp and decided to give it a try. The drinks were oh so good, I had to take one for the road. 

I ordered the jambalaya pasta with the swamp tea. The pasta was a bit salty, but I think all the food in New Orleans are salty. I wanted to try the crab cakes too but didn't have enough room in my tummy. Did make enough room for creme brûlée though. It was ok. The raw oysters was the best, ate a whole dozen all to myself! I also ordered the Mandarin blush for the road.  

Friends ordered the house special (which I wished I had ordered instead, the one bite I had was amazing!) and the gumbo with beans and rice (it was blah, wouldn't recommend that). 

I would definitely come back here!

Amazing place with delicious food! Chargrilled oysters will take you to a different level !!! Very unique atmosphere with great interior design and service. 
Pricing is very affordable, we paid $50 for dinner for two. I will definitely come back !
The food here is always amazing! Service is timely and friendly, and great suggestions. I highly recommend their seafood/Cajun meals.
Definitely a sleeper cell on Bourbon St. probably one of the most authentic Red Beans and Sausage in the quarter. If you can handles the Seafood platter I definitely suggest going for it!
Great food but it was a bit to spicy for me. Sat at the bar as you can't make a reservation like most places but the wait wasn't t that long and the service was friendly.

Soo disappointed in Oceana Grill. We went by to get a pecan praline brownie sundae to go. I really enjoyed chatting with the super nice gentleman at the door. Left with our sundae and went down to Armstrong park to enjoy it. The brownie was hard as a rock!!  And the barely there praline and pecans that might have saved it were way to few to help. So almost $12 for a dessert that we threw away. I'm glad we didn't get lunch there.

Top notch food, service and atmosphere! Crab cake fettuccine alfredo was excellent and the special, blackened redfish bbq shrimp pasta was mind blowing! Thanks for the service and recommendations Jenna!
Great place for fried catfish.  You'd better make a reservation a week in advance or you might have to wait an hour to get inside but it is worth it!
Food was amazing! I had the fish & crab cakes, FREAKING AMAZING! The seasoning that was used is something I never tried before! Definitely recommend this place if visiting NOLA

100% recommend this place to eat! The line out front was long, but it went fast. All the staff is nice and friendly. We had Sierra as our server and she was amazing. She checked in frequently and made sure we had everything we needed. When we come back to New Orleans, we will definitely be coming back here.

After checking in my hotel room. I ordered via Yelp and my food arrived 40 mins later hot and very yummy.
The delivery person was nice as it did take me a minute to come to the lobby to get my food.. he was great. I got my food handed him a cash tip and went back to my room to stuff my face.

Had the blackened chicken, catfish platter and the po boy and it was all AMAZING my first time in New Orleans and I will be back ! Make sure to ask for Lavern !! Very sweet and really knew the menu, great service great food

Got recommended to go to this place from the a guy at the front desk at our hotel. Really good to try alligator bits which i havent had before. Had a shrimp po boy which was great! Watched part of the football game and chilled and enjoyed a few beers. Takia our server was sweet, kind, friendly, and did a great job!

Hey just visited the restaurant 7-23-19 and let me say when reading reviews you just have to try things yourself. The staff at my hotel suggested we try the restaurant and so did a friend everyone we came across said the restaurant was great for there charbroiled oysters. The mistake I made was not listening to what most of the reviews read which was the oyster were good. Me being the seafood lover I'm I wanted to try there other items on there menu I visited the restaurant with others so we tried different items to get a taste of the seafood the restaurant offered are mistake. We sampled the seafood platter, shrimp po boy, gumbo and there cheeseburger, not the charbroiled oysters. The atmosphere was chill like most places in New Orleans nothing special so I didn't understand why they hyped it up saying make reservations.!  No body was really there we didn't make reservations we just walked in and they seated us.  The waiter was nice and polite and took are order with no problems. The first thing were tried was the gumbo it's not like Cajun or with sausage and crab etc it just had shrimp mild seasoning presentation was great but if your a true gumbo eater pass. Next we tried the seafood platter presentation was great food not so it was  over fried which maded it hard catfish is small like a catfish strip hard over cooked and shrimp same why oyster fried over cooked what took the cake hard huspuppies I have never had that ever!!!! Wow the platter costed $22 on to the next cheeseburger meat ok bun little hard fries also hard the shrimp po boy was large so you thought ok is going to be good not. Bread dry shrimp over cooked I don't want to write a long page it like this the place is over hyped!!! If you go there stick to the charbroiled oysters and I asked a guest as I left what they ordered and did they like it they said yes!! To my surprise into I asked what did they order and they said the Cajun fries and the charbroiled oysters. So if you visited stick to the reviews on the charbroiled oyster don't order off menu a waste of time..  there are other restaurant better the is in the French quarter but I had to try it so if you do write a review I would suggest if you order off the menu make sure you say fresh why should you have to. With the reviews they have I was wanting for that wow moment never got it . 
Didn't have time to complain are ask to be remade. Charbroiled oysters !!!!! Ok
It was just average. Gumbo was good. Seafood platter was ok. Nola is the better of the two places
Our waiter Tim,  was really nice and made sure our food was accurate.  The food was really tasty too. My and my fiancè will definitely be coming back!

Great service from our hostess, Sierra and high-quality food.  This place came recommended by several locals and it did not disappoint.  I'm not a big dessert fiend, but they have the best bread pudding I've ever tasted.  Would definitely go again and bring friends.

I didnt even notice all the familiar faces reviewing this restaurant. We stopped in a couple times being it was a couple doors over from our hotel. We mainly used this for snacks. The first night there my sister and her boyfriend who arrived later than us were in need of a meal we joined them and ordered apps. My sister thought her hurricane was not balanced and too strong (she is not a light drinker). We stopped in after a brunch and picked up snacks for the guys to hold them over until our next stop. The staff was always pleasant but this restaurant never sparked a curiosity for more than snacks.

Quite the line but so is everywhere else in the area & you can always grab a drink to go while you wait! We had a pleasant time here & the waiter was very nice. Interestingly we ordered the same thing as a family member that ordered takeout, & the takeout order had almost double the amount of food. It's a bit pricey for the amount we got. They unfortunately didn't have any cooked oysters & I thought the regular oysters were ok, but nothing great. They were busy but fast at least!

Decided to try this place based off reviews. The food was good and drink special of the night was divine. Definitely not a fan of a tomato paste based jambala..but the etouffe and red beans and rice were delicious. We had the Taste if NOLA and the crab cakes topped with a cream based crawfish sauce. Very good! Server (Brad) was attentive and kind.

The place was busy but we were seated promptly. Our waitress was very good and gave us good recommendations. We ordered the fried gator bites for the first time in our life and to our surprise, we liked them. They literally taste like chicken fingers with fish aftertaste. The sauce that came with them was also great. As a first time NOLA visiters, we had to try the NOLA sampler and were not disappointed. We loved the beans and rice/sausage dishes, but didn't eat the entouffee (not our thing). We also opted for the fried fish sampler and the fries, and both were amazing. The portions were huge. Definitely a great introduction to NOLA food and we were not disappointed!

On a trip to NOLA, found this ever crowded place, worth the wait for food. Fried seafood platter was delicious , it had friend oysters that were yummy ( the oil and batter are good quality , so no after taste of grease). The desserts were amazing, good quality ingredients that doesnt feel too sugary or heavy. Our server Dan was awesome

The food was AMAZING! We had it all from the crab cakes to the aligator bites to the gumbo to the seafood Alfredo dish (which was a special). Everything was delicious and Ashleigh our server was fabulous as well as the upstairs bartender. This is a must stop if you are in the French Quarters looking for amazing food.

Meh. Tough to go to Chef Ron's and then this place. I had the crab cakes and seafood gumbo. It's good, but not great. Noticeable difference in quality and flavor to Chef Ron's. 

We also had the alligator bites (chewy) and crab cakes. The sauce on the crab cakes was the best part of the meal. Just bottle and sell that. Put it on eggs, Mac and cheese, whatever. It's like cheesy, saucy goodness with some mushrooms for good measure.  

I'm not sure some of the patrons can actually taste anymore. Many are obliterated on various concoctions in adult sippy cups. I'm all for people having a great time - heck, it's NOLA. But 5 stars?! I imagine the regret the next day on those reviews is real, like noticing your dog was sniffing your neighbor's dogs excrement and then is licking your face like a prime rib bone on Christmas.  

Corey was a great server - working really hard. It's a very busy place. Poor guy needs to deal with tourists like me all day and night, but hey - he's workin'. 

Want a better meal and great ambiance to take a break from The Quarter? Walk over to the lounge at the Ritz. Best Beignets in the area, no line, cozy, great service and excellent food.  Bring a date, or hire one. It's a romantic place.
My family and I had an awesome experience!!! Terrific food, Drinks, and a wonderful waitress name ReGene. If you want to enjoy your time here request her as your hostess!!!! Enjoy!!

Although the food was delicious I would not go back and I would not recommend anyone to either. First we made reservations 2 weeks in advance because we had a large party of 15. We were told a credit card needed to be given to hold our reservation, we said sure no problem then we were told it would  be charge $200 should we fail to arrive on time, again we said sure no problem (although I've never be told that before but it is understandable). We arrive 10 mins early minus 1 because she couldn't make the trip after all ($25 charge, no biggie) we proceed to let the hostess know we  have arrived and there is no reservation for our party. We were told to wait outside until the problem could be sorted as they shuffled people in who just walked up without reservations. 15 minutes later the asst manager informs us that someone from our party called to push back our reservation which none of us did. We finally get seated, we had to squish our party together till another party left to add that table in. Like I said food was delicious our server was awesome and on it for a big party of 14. Turns out the party of 20 behind us called to push back their reservation and whoever took the message pushed BOTH PARTIES back. We never received an apology only made to feel like it was our fault. The manager came out to say since no one can say for sure who made the error (us or them) that he wouldn't charge us the $25 no show fee. We were not rude once we said thank you and went about our business and enjoyed ourselves. I do not care to spend money twice in an establishment that does not have customer service values. We were not asking or expecting food to be comped in any way all we wanted was our table and a sorry our bad would of been nice too.

I've been here twice for the amazing cuisine over a 4 day span!  

We tried the alligator bites (we tried both fried and blackened) which were terrific.

We traveled from Chicago just to have the Redfish Oceana. Perfectly cooked, moist, flavorful. 

Bread pudding. Amazing.

Food was amazing! So glad I made online reservation a few days ahead. We did a early dinner at 4 and there was already a really long line waiting to get in. Service was excellent.... it was so good we ordered food to go too!

Unbelievable flavor at Oceana Grill. We sat outside in the courtyard, tastefully lit up with string lights and fans to keep us cool during this late summer night. We were served by Mary and Fiona who were absolutely delightful and recommended the crab cakes, Cajun jambalaya pasta, and the Oceana brownie that changed my life. Highly recommend Oceana Grill for your New Orleans eats.

We heard this place was amazing from so many people and after a 40 min wait in the hot sun I have to disagree, it was not worth the wait. 

Portions were small, and price was high. 

The kids loved trying something new the alligator and the red beans and rice were amazing everything else was subpar. 

Overall we wouldn't retune you can get gumbo, pasta and shrimp for a lower price and better tasting all over Nola.

Oh my goodness this was my first taste of NOLA and I must say this place didn't disappoint. If at all possible ask for Mary as your waitress. Her recommendations were spot on!! She also gave recommendations for things to do while on our visit!! Love this place!! Thank you Mary!!!

Food was great over here and so were the drinks.  Bree was fun and gave fantastic service.  The chicken Alfredo and fried seafood platter were delicious.  Banana foster cake was a little let down at end though.

Came here for lunch on a busy Sunday prior to the Saints game. There was a 10 min wait time when we got there, however this restaurant is huge and had rooms that were mostly empty so not sure why the wait time. Pretty loud in there I wouldn't recommend this place for a romantic date. Ordered the crab cake app and the fried seafood dinner. The food was pretty good and the service was decent, atmosphere not much my cup of tea.

Food 4/5
Service 3/5
Atmosphere 2/5

Definitely recommended for a large gathering.

Came here for lunch with BF and my girls what a great suggestion from our driver. best alligator I had here and the most delightful etuoffe I have had. My love had a Mahi tuna ceaser salad which was so fresh and tasty. The gumbo I had for my first time and it was so delicious... The best we all admitted was the oceana special oysters. Our next trip to Nola will be eating here most definitely. oh and check out the bloody marys here there very good.

We stopped here as soon as we arrived in New Orleans.  I ordered the bowl of gumbo and FE got the fried shrimp dinner with fries and a beer,  my gumbo was good, and FE's shrimp were really good with a great batter on them that had a "slight" spiciness to it but definitely not too much and the fries were good too.  We left full and very satisfied.  Why did I give it 3 stars,  the service wasn't that great,  we sat for a while waiting for someone just to take a simple drink order and the hostess who seated us was kinda rude....

Despite the high rating and everything, the food was a little disappointing to us. BBQ shrimp was definitely the best dish we got, but the fried seafood could be better. The service was friendly, considering how busy the restaurant was. There are definitely better options around the corner in French quarter we would try next time tho.
The ambience was good but the food was not fresh. The food felt very dry, salty and overpriced ! I had alligator bites, redfish tchoup and a taste of New Orleans !

I went this past Sunday and recieved a recommendation from our server/bartender DARRICK he suggested the Jambalaya Pasta it was AMAZING just as his service,professionalism and personality! The drinks were great as well. I just loved the whole vibe of the restaurant. We were greeted with smiles and genuine hellos from the staff from the moment we walked in, went up the stairs and make it to the bar! That Raising Canes/ChicfilA training is awesome! Lol but seriously I have to stop the manager PHILLIP and let him know how great everyone was and the food.  I will definitely return soon!! I recommend everyone go to the Oceana on Conti!! You wont be disappointed

We enjoyed a great dinner here before painting the town red on Bourbon street. The servers are definitely savvy - they recommend breaded and fried food if you will be drinking heavily, and we certainly took them up on their recommendation. 

We were sat upstairs and it wasn't too loud, but the service was still attentive. We had fried chicken and crawfish and shrimp with fries. Good basic seafood and a solid meal for partying on Bourbon street. Highly recommend!

I ate here in October 2019 & again in Aug 2020. The quality of the food & the friendliness of the wait staff were exceptional both times. They are taking all the precautions to help you feel safe - appropriately distancing patrons, wearing masks & gloves, e-menus, etc. Do not miss an opportunity to eat here!

We enjoyed our meals for dinner. The Rockefeller oyster appetizer was fantastic! The dinner menu had a great variety of choices. Went with a simple meal to make room for dessert. 

Please order their Kahlúa chocolate mousse cake it was phenomenal!

Last but not least our waitress Ashleigh was wonderful. She was so personable and sincere! She was very attentive to our order and made our stay there even better!

The food was amazing! I got the famous oysters for an appetizer and the fried catfish platter with the option of choosing shrimp for my other half. It was delicious. I definitely at all of it ! My husband orders the shrimp fettuccine Alfredo and that sauce they use is the best! I can definitely recommend anyone to stop here to eat when they visit
We loved the location and the food was great - unfortunately we had very poor service. My bf cut his lip on a beer glass and they didn't even remove his drink or meal.

This place is what dreams are made of. If you don't try they're loaded Cajun fries, you're crazy! They have gravy and crawfish and really tasty dipping sauces.

Chargrilled oysters: butter and garlic heaven, an absolute must. Enough said. 

Alligator bites: we got half-and-half and personally I prefer to kind with the smoked seasoning. The fried ones tasted like popcorn chicken but both we're still good.

Jambalaya pasta: really amazing! It had bits of alligator sausage, crawfish, and was very saucy. The portion size was also very filling and the perfect amount for one person.

Ok, so I don't want to talk up this place too much, so I'll keep it low key. This is the BEST restaurant in the ENTIRE universe!!!!! My wife and I happened here while on vacation at the recommendation of one of their employees. We were just like, "Yeah, ok, we'll check it out." Welp Yelp, check it out we did! And do... every time we go to NOLA. The BBQ shrimp is out of this world. The mardi gras pasta will make a nun swear, and the gumbo.... uhhhhh the gumbo! If you're every in the area and need food to sustain life, GO HERE, EAT HERE, LOVE HERE!
1st time here.  We had about 20 minute wait on a Saturday.  Well worth it!  It was 7 in our party.  Jenna, our server was EXCELLENT! FOOD WAS REALLY GOOD, portions were great.

If I could give zero stars to a restaurant this is the one. I was served the worst tasting food in memory. Everything was oversalted to the point I had to spit it out. Appetizers, soups, salads, entrees were all horribly under or overseasoned. Crabcakes were little more than crab infused dressing. Since I was dining on a gift voucher I didn't ask for my money back much less my tastebuds. A bottle of beer was the only worthwhile nourishment here. Service was good and I did leave the server a tip but I felt embarassed for them having to serve such nasty fare politely. I knew that this establishment had been publicized on Kitchen Nightmares but assumed that they had benefited from Mr. Ramsey's assistance. Obviously not. I will not return and will never suggest to anyone except hated enemies that they eat here. The City of New Orleans should run the owners out of town for this black eye on decent cuisine.
Food was excellent....a lot of variety for everyone's different tastes.  Jamal our server recommended amazing tours and places to visit while we were here.

Breakfast Sazerac: that's worth two stars alone. The other three stars belong to the St. James crepe, which was cheesy Louisiana seafood goodness. Quick and yummy--precisely the type of way you want to start a day of vaycay.

Definitely try the bbq shrimp and the crab cakes ... DELISH!!!!  Our Server Sydney was great. 

Multi-level venue so be prepared to do stairs.

This place is pretty good. It's busy but it doesn't seem to take long to be seated. I would advice against sitting in the area where they cook the oysters though..... took me several washes to get the smell out of my clothes. 

Everything we had was decent. I didn't love the poboy as it was dry and didn't have much flavor. The oysters were good but not our favorite. The drinks are freaking delish though! The sampler plate with the three nola specialties was very good, I'd definitely recommend that. The desserts in the case are not what you get though. They look large in the case when in reality you get the mini versions. 

The service was friendly and attentive. Definitely a great place to go within walking distance of hotels.
We didn't have to wait long before we got in. Our server Chris M.  was very helpful & made good recommendations & gave us directions around the French Quarter.

Wow I am surprised how the food was so bad and the reviews are so good on yelp!!!??? We got the shrimp poboy and the fried seafood platter.  We had to leave the food because we couldn't eat it. The Server was very good.
Great food with lay back quality service. Love the location. There's a cute balcony. Oysters are delish.

I made a reservation which was good there was a line to get in line. We ordered the po boy and blackened red fish. When we asked for our bill we asked to redeem Yelp check in 10% off and our server told us that "we would have to wait 1-2 hours for him to find a manager to redeem the 10% " lol really? Last time I will dine here and would not recommend this place to others looking for a good dining experience and service. Our bill wasn't cheap two people about $90 and for that price not worth the service given at all.

Food fantastic however the service even better. Brandy our bartender was super nice and attentive. As a restaurant owner I can only dream of having an employee as good as Brandy to serve our guests. She made our visit to New Orleans extra special.
Very good food and servers and get friendly.  I had the shrimp and grits which were not on the menu but very delicious

I've tried 7 different restaurants in New Orleans all for the exact same dish: half a dozen of fresh raw oysters. This restaurant is the best! Fresh and cleaned, no sand! Maybe not the largest and most juicy oysters, but definitely great! 
And the crawfish is just so delicious! The crawfish étouffée is seasoned perfectly and the fried crawfish tail is so crispy and tasty! I can literally lick the sauce off the plate!

Everything was amazing! Tried the crab cakes appetizer and the fried oysters platter. Got the bananas foster ice cream cake for dessert it was mouth watering! It was the best meal while visiting New Orleans. Friendly staff, clean restaurant and nice atmosphere.

The food and the service was in line.  I liked the location, the flavors, and the service.  From the appetizer to the meals and the deserts all were great.  Also the price was adequate for the food we had.

Wow!!! Where do I even start? The food was amazing and Megan D, our server, was the true star of our experience.  She was nice, friendly, and humorous and recommended awesome dishes for us. Can't wait to come back to New Orleans to grub at this yum yum spot again and say what up to our guurl Megan D.
Had their bbq shrimp and Cajun shrimp and alligator pasta ! Wow guys every bite was getting better and better the shrimp was the perfect size the pasta was the right amount the taste was

What a spectacular restaurant!! The blackened catfish plate was super tasty (amazing mashed potatoes!) and my husband thoroughly enjoyed his fried gator PO boy.  Our server, Kennisha, was delightful- she could not have been any friendlier or more helpful.
Drinks were okay and,  the food was not good. Pork ribs were very chewy and covered in barbecue sauce to mask the taste of yesterday's ribs. Server was nice!

Clean establishment and awesome staff. I went there for breakfast. Food came out quick and drinks were decent pricing. I always come to this restaurant when I'm visiting Vegas. Cheap foods and drinks.

Our dinner here was just fair for New Orleans. There is much better food in this city. Saw two of my yelp friend reviews with two and three stars. This should have been my warning. Gumbo was not very flavorful and luke warm. My Barbeque shrimp was over cooked and tough. Our kids fried seafood platter was fair. My wife's steak was decent. I will not return.

One of the best meals we had down in NOLA! We honestly were trying to just get out of the rain and get some good seafood and found this place. I believe most of us ordered the seafood pasta special that was advertised. Place was somewhat empty when we arrived but it filled up rather quickly. Server was very attentive and got our food and drink orders out within a timely manner. We decided to sit upstairs as it held more people. Also I would like to mention that I was there for my bachelorette party and every staff member there made a point to say congratulations. I thought it was very nice of them. I would definitely come back with my fiancé on our next trip down here. I have also attached some pics of our delicious food! Highly recommend. Their drinks were also good!

This was such a wonderful experience. The food was delicious and flavorful. My server was kind and made sure my friend and I had what we requested. She helped me customize the menu, gave suggestions and checked in with us frequently. This is a busy restaurant and that's an understatement. The wait is long. But once you're in, you won't regret it.

This restaurant is the first restaurant I do a review on I never do a review but this enraged me to the point of doing a review. The hostess was the worst hostess I have ever seen and I live in L.A that should tell you something. He was on his phone and had a attitude like he didn't want to to work at the restaurant. The hostess was dragging his feet like he was a zombie. Hostess should be a direct representation of the restaurant. If I was the restaurant OWNER I would fire this front desk hostess on the spot VERY VERY BAD hostess. Don't remember his name but he was working at 01/04/21 @1030

On my trip to NO I ate at several different places and had some great food but Oceana grill was on another level. I started with a bowl of chicken and sausage gumbo which was hands down the best gumbo in the French quarter. We then had a gator Po Boy and ordered it BLACK AND GOLD- 50% fried and 50% blackened and 100% freaking amazing. We also had a tasty mint julep and a local ale draft. The service was outstanding, thank you Amethyst! We just simply had a great time. Book ahead of time and get right in. Trust me on this one yelpers,  I don't play when it comes to food!
Food and Drinks was awesome!!! The staff was very pleasant and polite I will definitely come back to New Orleans.

A young man working at Walgreens in the French Quarters suggested Oceana. We a had a short wait and our fabulous server was Mr. David! His energy was contagious and our food came out quickly:) I had a cup of delicious seafood gumbo and the catfish platter. Everything on the platter was delicious and not bland.

The food was exceptional but the service by far was the highlight. The bartender was friendly and made the perfect Bloody Mary while I was waiting for my party. Our waiter, Errol was patient while we had a hard time deciding what to order. He gave us the best attentive service. I had the French toast and have never had French toast taste so amazing. This restaurant is a must.
Oysters were delicious but not much meat would try elsewhere for oysters. Taste of NOLA was awesome and great craft beer choices. Service is fantastic you can get right in and fast food service.

Excellent.  
Shrimp poboy. 
Blackened catfish mixed with blackened shrimp poboy.

Great staff. Friendly.

Hreat location off Bourban.

Captains platter only had fresh fish.  Pretty sure the shrimp and oysters were either old or pre-prepared/packaged.  The snapper was very nice and a nice size portion.  The mashed potatoes and greens were also very good.  For the price vs the quality...kind of not sure.  Great service though.  Restaurant overall needs some serious upkeep or a coat of paint and a scrub down.

I came here because they had food and I was hungry and boy am I glad that I did. There's this beer that they have on the menu that is brewed right in NOLA. The Abita Amber...I'm not one for beer in most cases but it was quite probably the best beer I've ever had. To compliment the deliciousness of the delightful beverage I had seafood gumbo along with the fried and blackened gator. And since this was my first time eating gator I'll describe it as a mixed texture of chicken and fish. The gator was good too, both blackened and fried. Our server was really nice, though I can't remember his name. Lastly, the restroom was very clean.

The crab cakes were delicious. I've never had one with a sauce on top so this was a nice surprise. The sauce was tasty and the crab cake had plenty of crab meat, not just filler. The seafood gumbo was also tasty but could have used more seafood. Excellent service!

My boyfriend picked this place out! We got the crab cakes and he was obsessed! We shared a redfish special which was okay but the mustard greens were absolutely amazing! The service was good! The place was clean! Super happy we came

This is one of the few places in the French quarter that I will send people to eat . The seafood platter is the way to
Go if you're hungry .. shrimp oysters catfish fries hush puppies and I'm missing something else . They have two locations in the quarter .

Wow, really thought this place would be ok. We had food that had been sitting under a heat lamp. I was lead to believe they cook food when you order. Wow, I'm really at a lost for words, I guess we expected more. Git 5he seafood and catfish platter yuk. Also tried the Cajun fries or something like that, sauce was hot but you could tell the fries had been under the same heat lamp. Don't waste your money, go someplace where they actually cook you food when you order it.

This place was really amazing I enjoyed the atmosphere it was about a four-story building and the music was amazing the customer service was amazing the food was amazing we decided to get catfish fingers and then also the clam chowder both of them were OK I do feel like the catfish is a little overrated I've definitely tasted better I do think the prices are high given the quality of the food but other than that it really was a nice location and we had a nice time

Our first night in New Orleans and Oceana had a wonderful dinner for us. The food was extremely good, we split a few apps and were so full and surprised. A dozen raw oysters, half fried half blackened gator bites and a cup of their gumbo.
Bridget is awesome!!! She gave us great service. The charbroiled oysters and red beans and rice are awesome!!! I give it a 5.
Great food im a convenient location. I got the blackened chicken po boy and my husband the shrimp platter. Tyler our server was awesome.

A MUST!!!! You have to eat here! I'm gonna get to the point! It was EVERYTHING AND MORE!!! 
 We came here for my sisters birthday, the fact that they are open late! From the time we walked in the staff was friendly and welcoming! It was clean and didn't smell like a seafood restaurant which is a plus! The dinning area an bar were full of cheerful buzz and smiling staff! Everyone from the bus boy welcomed us! 
We were seated with Chris! he gladly welcomed us and explained the menu, we wanted everything! 

Appetizer: BBQ Shrimp Goodness! I had never had New Orleans style BBQ sauce.. "Pascal Manale" it was full of flavor rosemary and butter, garlic & worcester sauce. It comes with three slices of French bread, great for dipping! The shrimp are JUMBO!! 

Entree: Shrimp Alfredo with blackened shrimp ! I'm not a big fan of shrimp Alfredo but after reading the menu I had to try it, and I'm glad I did! I had a bowl of noodles cooked just right, smothered in cajun Alfredo sauce! The flavor in every bite equaled a party in my mouth! My goodness it wasn't spicy in heat it was spicy in flavor. The rich creamy sauce was married beautifully with the Alfredo! I even asked for an extra side of Alfredo" says the I don't care for Alfredo girl"!!! 

Dessert: SAVE ROOM!!! 
After a few deep breaths we made room for the bread pudding! Goodness!  It came in the shape of a big muffin with caramel, chocolate sauce,& whipped cream! At first I was reluctant because bread pudding can either be good or bad.. This was AMAZING! It was browned perfectly which made for a great crust in the outside especially seeing as how you have Carmel and chocolate sauce! As I said earlier bread pudding can be mushy either good or bad.. an this WAS NOT THE CASE! The first bite tasted heavenly! The crust in the outside with the Carmel, chocolate Combo wonderful butter flavor!!! My goodness!!! Part of me wished I had ordered desert first!! 

While we were eating the staff was friendly everyone that walked by wished  my sister happy birthday! I thought it was just cause she had all the birthday flare on, but they were just as friendly to the other tables! That let me know that they want you to feel at home, they want you to feel welcomed and comfortable! The waiter Chris was awesome I know who I will be askin for next time I come in. We also had the please of meet the manager Daniel was amazing!  He took a minute to stop by and ask us how we're doing,& wish my sister a HBD! I had to took this opportunity to let him know that is his staff is awesome! They know how to provide great Hospitality from beginning to end! He was so warm and humble he quickly recognized his staff for doing a great job! That is not something you see often! Shout out to him! 

All in all THIS IS A MUST!! I plan on becoming a regular/ whenever I am in town!! I look forward to bringing my friends,& family!!!

We just finished our swamp tour and needed a place to get food fast. We had 7 adults and two toddlers--Oceana accommodated us quickly and had very attentive service throughout the meal. I loved the fried alligator (we were bold and tried alligator jerky on the swamp tour, so we tried it again fried... surprisingly good!). I split the ahi tuna with my sister--it was very big and we didn't even finish it between the two of us. The crab stuffing was incredible; I only wish there were more. The shrimp/gravy fries made for a tasty appetizer. Everyone loved their meal.
The food was amazing. Great atmosphere and very friendly staff. My waitress Bre took great care of me during my visit.

This was one of our favorite places during our visit to New Orleans. The service was amazing. Pamela was very friendly and personable. Helped us figure out what to order, kept checking on us. She was awesome!

Came here for a bachelorette weekend and original planned on pat obriens  but ended up in Oceania. Came here twice and food /service was excellent. No complaints at all. Definitely recommend the Oceania oysters,  New Orleans sampler, and crab cakes. Food is flavor deliciousness. Not to mention our server Ashleigh was amazing. Highly recommend this place for sure
Sarah, our waiter was amazing, friendly and gave good recommendations. Everything my group and I ordered was cooked well and well season!
Ordered delivery waited 2 hours plus.  Never received order or a call.  Would rate zero stars if I could
Everything we were looking for and we were told by multiple people to go there.  Shrimp Po boy, gumbo, alligator, bbq shrimp.  All of it perfect
Awesome Food..  come hungry.   Be prepared to loosen your belt...portions are huge!!!

Great drinks and amazing food . I irdered the "taste of new orleans" it was great. Karla was our waitress and we had a group of 10 and she did amazing helping us and taking care of all of us . Thank you for great service .

This place is sooo delicious me and my fiancé were looking for a really good place we before we leave we will have to eat here again it's sooo amazing the seafood platter is the best and the creme brûlée was sooo good as well I highly recommend eating here

The food at this establishment was incredible but on top of the food what causes me to give it 5 stars is the service!  Our waitress was Jamie L.  she was amazing extremely busy but was there to take care of all of our needs.  Thank you

This place was probably my favorite meal of my trip. Our hotel recommended coming here and we were so happy with the food. In fact we were so happy that we came back a second time a few hours later. The oysters were to die for and were so rich with flavor. The fried gator was very delicious and tender. The pasta was the perfect amount of flavor. We shared the pasta so my picture is about half of the portion. I recommend making an online reservation as it can be quite busy here. The staff was very friendly and accommodation to us during our visit. Our server joe was sweet and gave us great service. If you're looking for good food, great service, and good prices this is the place to go.

Ummm, I came in thinking why is this place so popular. I know, that's a bad way to think. We got seating in the courtyard which was beautiful and Ron was our waiter. Ron wasn't the best but he was good here and there. 

We ordered drinks with Ron but somehow one of the other waiters took them. I'm not even sure how that works but we were waiting a while for the drinks. Ordered the crabcakes and bbq shrimp and it was fantastic! I could pour that bbq shrimp sauce all over me. I ordered the seafood gumbo which wasn't my fave. For my entree, I did the seafood fried platter. HOLY MOLY! That's alot of food but it was great! The batter is special and has a kick to it. Not spicy kick but seasoned kick! 

We also ordered the blackened duck and it was amazing! Don't forget dessert. Must save room for the chocolate mousse cake and creme brulee. I was mad I didn't get the brownie but there is always next time!

We come to New Orleans once or twice a year and Oceana is always a must stop on our list of places to go.  As expected the line to get in was very long but it moves along quickly. The hostess was good about coming down the line to see if there were any small parties that could be seated right away. 
The service was excellent as always. The only downfall was my crab cakes weren't as hot as I would like them which is why they got 4 out of 5 stars.

Spent the morning at WW2 museum (wonderful by the way) and we were ready for some good Cajun food. Daughter found this place and we were NOT disappointed. We dined on etouffée, shrimp poor boys and pasta - every bite was delicious. We were very pleased with the Cajun Fries - yum, yum, yum!  Our lunch was a pleasant contrast to our dinner the evening before at NOLA's (slow, inconsistent and pricey). How have we managed to walk by this gem after so many trips here?  Never again - it's now top of the list.

The shrimp etouffe BOMB! The wait was long but when we got our food it was worth it!! The service was really good... the lady we got was super fun & funny. The drinks were pretty good... They are very accommodating too, we had a large group of 10 women... and we got seated fast when we made it to the front of the line... we got to sot together & the ambiance was festive. We really liked this place:. Def going back

I just had the most amazing breakfast at Oceana Grill. Walking in everyone was so friendly and inviting. Our waitress Whitney was so kind and helpful. The French toast was the best I've ever had. I definitely will be back again!
Had an amazing dinner food was delicious and service was even better. Order the seafood gumbo and request REGENE as your server if possible. Will be back

This was right by our hotel so we had to check it out. There was always a line out the door! We waited about 5 minutes for a party of 4 on a Thursday night so not bad! Overall the food was average. I split the catfish po boy and a shrimp platter with the table. It was good but nothing to rave about.

Every time I travel to New Orleans I visit Oceana Grill. The friendliest staff you'll find anywhere in the Quarter and amazing food & drinks! Breakfast and dinner are both divine, but this trip it was breakfast! I had my favorite 'not on the menu' special, Crab Cake Benedict...and holy wow! And my bestie had probably the best Biscuits & Gravy I've ever tasted and a side of Alligator Sausage! Follow that with a coffee and a little breakfast dessert of Creme Brûlée, because why not?! Oceana is a must do for anyone visiting New Orleans!

Went for dinner, our wait wasn't terrible, we had good timing. Once we were seated, we ordered as an appetizer the bbq shrimp, chargrilled oysters (Oceana specialty), and were sharing our meal of the Redfish specialty dish. Drinks came fast, then they told us they were out of the chargrilled oysters and could only get the raw, had them before and were not impressed. Why can't you just chargrill some raw ones?? Probably because the kitchen really doesn't cook your food fresh. Then we got our Redfish, it was over cooked or tasted like microwave leftovers. The sauce over it was fresh and the mashed potatoes with vegetables (it was just corn) were fine. Oh then they realized that the bbq shrimp should have come out first, they brought us the bbq shrimp and the sauce was really tasty. The shrimp was NOT gulf shrimp and it had a dinner roll stuffed into the sauce. I appreciate the effort, but I wanted some true New Orleans crunchy French bread, I asked and our waitress said they had not had any since COVID. If your going, don't wait in the long line, and don't think your getting something special. Nothing was picture worthy.
There was no line so that was great. Waitress was very pleasant. Seafood platter was delicious.

Not a fancy atmosphere, but delicious food and friendly staff. Had breakfast here 4 days in a row. Sides menu best bang for your buck in the French Quarter for breakfast. Huge portions off regular menu and reasonably priced. We had the crepes, maw maws breakfast, and eggs St. Louis among other things. Delicious! And 10% off if you show your receipt the next day!

The service was amazing! Markeisha was very nice and attentive. 

I ordered the St. Francis Crepe & it had a lot of crab meat & shrimp inside. It was good but too much for me. 

The cheese grits were buttery & delicious! 

& mimosas are always good. They don't do bottomless mimosas on Sunday's fyi.
Was a little annoyed that after being g seated they informed us no raw oysters ! How can that be in an oyster bar!

We tried multiple times to place a delivery order over the phone with Joseph and when he wasn't putting us on hold for extended periods of time and then hanging up, he was taking down our information only to hang up while we were speaking to him. They were totally uninterested in our business and I don't see how they get any business with that attitude.

If you are looking for a true taste of NOLA stay away!! 

When we were sat I noticed the music was hip hop. I listen to that myself but was expecting NOLA regional music which killed the vibe. Ordered a crab cake for an app and that was good. My wife ordered pasta and I ordered blackened snapper. My wife said her pasta wasn't anything special and my snapper was obviously a frozen filet and overcooked. Bread pudding was ordered to help save this but no. It came out pipping hot because I'm sure it was in a microwave for 2 mins. 

Just not worth the $$$ for the $$$

On the bright side our server Laura did a great job and we tipped her very well.

So I came here specifically because of KitchenNightmares.... 

Happy to say we didn't get sick....

Food is mediocre and nothing to be amazed with.

I came here for my friends 21st with my friends and we had the best experience! Our server, Sierra, was super energetic and attentive. Hands down one of the best servers I've ever had (coming from an experienced server myself). The Mardi Gras pasta was super delicious! Definitely recommend coming here if you want to have a good time, good food and good service!
Food wasn't good at all! We had to slip $20 to the woman at the door to get a table! Will not recommend or return to this restaurant.

Really enjoyed our dinner here. Our waitress Regene was awesome we had wonderful service. Everyone in our party had something and everything was delicious. We will definitely be back when we visit New Orleans. Thanks Regene!!!!
We took the grilled oysters, the cajun fries, and the cheff special redfish/shrimp. The food was really good (probably a little too much cheesy though). We liked the ambience as well. Recommended.

3.5. The service was great -- all the staff will greet you and thank you for coming in and the food came out lightening quick, but the food left something to be desired. 

We came here at the recommendation of a few tourists and the high ratings on Yelp, seeking our first true Louisiana meal. We got the gator bites (half grilled, half fried) and were pleasantly surprised at the flavor of the grilled ones. Some pieces were a little chewy which could be par for gator. The Taste of New Orleans was ok. The boyfriend enjoyed the crawfish etouffee most but the red beans and rice in my opinion, were the stars of the show. 

The half rack of ribs was really just meh. I've had much better ribs elsewhere. And, I know... this isn't a BBQ restaurant so why order ribs? (Because I don't like seafood all that much.)

Overall, the meal was okay but the boyfriend left craving a more seafood-heavy meal.  I think this is great for the average tourist but I'm sure there are better places to get the staples with more seafood/flavor/heat for less $$.

Redfish special was fantastic as was the Hurricane and Fried Eggplant.  The Fried Crawfish Tails were very dry and had the texture of fried clams.  If you don't like parmesan cheese, be sure to ask for Fried Eggplant without parm.

I got the seafood platter to go, it was very good, seasoned well. My favorite was the fish, cooked to perfection . I gave four stars because the fries were meh. Other than that I enjoyed the food, service was good. Next time I'm try that popular appetizer... crab cakes...I think it was.

Absolutely delicious! There were 4 of us and we all ordered different dishes to get a wide sampling, from jambalaya and po-boy sandwiches to creole pasta and alligator sausage and fried oysters. Everything was amazing and the flavors were incredible. Highest recommendations and this is a must try restaurant if you are in New Orleans!

This was an okay food experience, not memorable in any way. My mother and I ordered the gator tail bites and shrimp po-boy. We came here specifically for the po-boy because we had never tried it before and it was disappointing since the bread wasn't toasted or flavorful (blah).  However, the spicy sauce was good with the crispy shrimp. What makes a GREAT po-boy is definitely the bread, so that's probably why their po-boy is 3/5 stars--the bread needs some work. We wanted to try what gator tastes like, so we ordered the gator tail bites; it tastes likes stringy chicken. It's definitely an acquired taste, but it wasn't for us.
As-,,ni. Ii I I it .                       No. M coming.      No I.               ,V. (･･)つ(･･)( T_T)＼(^-^ )(・・)

I came here based on a recommendation from a friend. Once I read reviews I was intrigued. The service was great, friendly and our waitress recommended some great options. First time trying fried oysters, the entire seafood platter was awesome. Very flavorful and plenty of food, I had to take some to go.

Would have given a 5 star had it not been for construction keeping them from having breakfast and full menu available (no gas).  We had several dishes though and all were very good.  The crab cakes with mushroom sauce appetizer was a hit with my teen and the blackened chicken was good for my other two picker (no seafood) eaters!  The ahi tuna steak and the Taste of New Orleans were the biggest hit for us who love Cajun/seafood... definitely would come again and order these!  Ate too quickly to get photos!!

At first glance we thought it was going to be a little hole in the wall with a little wait, this place is huge and worth waiting in line. Our server greeted us fast and let us know the daily food and drink specials. Watermelon margarita was their special of the night, it was so goo I had two! We had gator bites for an appetizer, which I also recommend. Husband ordered red beans and rice and said it was a 9 for sure, it wasn't spicy but had good flavor. I ordered crab cakes with mushroom sauce. I was a little worried it would have a strong mushroom taste but it didn't, it was amazing!! I so wish I had room for dessert, the menu looked so good "maybe breakfast".

We ordered delivery- took 30 min longer than they estimated so I'm sure they were busy but food came cold and unfortunately wasn't tastey as a result.  Not sure if this was driver or restaurant but either way disappointing.

May try again when back in town

Location is on a side street. There was a lot of construction this week on Bourbon Street for whatever reason so it was much harder to get down the road. 

Our waitress was really nice. She came over as much as needed. Her name was Aneshia. She was great. The menu was super long and extensive so very easy to chose. If you stay at a hotel, they usually will give you a coupon so ask for one. 

My friend and I both got the crab cake meal. It had a side of mashed potatoes and seasonal vegetables. The seasonal vegetables was collard greens. Let's start with the crab cakes. You get crab cakes with the meal. They were nice and thick with sauce on top. The sauce on top was creamy and crawfish meat in it. It was so good. I asked for more sauce, which cost $3 more and our waitress didn't tell me but it's okay. The mashed potatoes were like red potatoes mashed. I love mashed red potatoes. These were really good especially mixed with the sauce in the crab cakes. The greens were good too. They didn't have meat in them but were still seasoned to perfection.. 

We got the special drink since we were here during St. Patrick's say. It was called Irish Favorite. It was delicious. Very fruity and the alcohol was not too strong. It was perfect. You can see the ingredients on the picture. 

The food was really good! I would definitely go back and try other foods

Took for ever to get the food. And when we received it my food was cold and after a couple of bites my boyfriend found a hair in his. The thing I liked most was the Cajun Fries. My pasta wasn't bad but I didn't like it. I took it in a to go box just to give to one of the homeless people out on the street. I will not be going back here. I'm only giving them a two because of those fries.

Open late for a sit down place. Outdoor patio dining. However it's just another average touristy fried food type place. I ordered the "famous" crab cakes- with the sauce on the side. Ok. The Bloody Mary was terrible, served in a hurricane glass. We also ordered fried alligator to share, chewy but a decent spice profile.

The wait to enter was extremely long. However we waited no longer than 15 minutes to get a table. The establishment is extremely busy (wasn't bothered because it's NOLA and a well know restaurant). Our waitress nice and explained the menu to us. THE CRAB CAKES WERE DELICIOUS!! Wasn't a fan of the gumbo and sautéed vegetables I feel as though it wasn't seasoned enough. Enjoyed my entree with the taste of New Orleans.

We had heard good things so we decided to give it a try. Needless to say it was a huge disappointment.  Gumbo bowls were only one quarter full. Ordered 2 pounds of crawfish and pulled out half a pound of bad ones before I actually got to a good one. Manager came over to talk to our group and failed to make us feel better instead she blamed a supplier stating we  get what we get. We can get better crawfish in Dallas  than this place...pretty sad. Prices are such that you'd expect a much better overall experience.  Spend your dollars elsewhere.

OUTSTANDING!!! The food was a spectacular representation of authentic New Orleans good eats! Our waiter Chris P was on his A game with excellent service. We are originally from the area and now visit several times a year. Being foodies we are fans of the local food and now fans of Oceana Grill and their sister restaurants.

Our group of 10 was in town for a birthday party and our hotel concierge suggested that we go to Oceana Grill.  He called and our table was waiting when we got there.  Granted, it was the coldest weekend of the year and the crowds on Bourbon were slim, but it was nice to walk in and get seated.  

The waiter was a character which was okay since most of us had had a few drinks.  He was attentive, though, and did a good job.  

Everyone had something different and everyone in the group was still talking about their food the next day.  My husband had the red beans and rice.  We both thought it was super.  He grew up in Louisiana and I am from Texas so that is something we eat fairly often.  The shrimp po'boy was great.  The gumbo was great.  The crab cakes were great.  Seriously, no one had anything left on their plate.  Everyone enjoyed the meal.  

Atmosphere was good and I gave it four stars since it was a really pleasant experience.  I will definitely go back next time we are in town.  Hopefully it would be a repeat experience.

I get why this place is New Orlean's best! The staff was awesome, the food was delicious and reasonably priced. We got the jambalaya pasta (highly recommend, seasoned, warm), taste of New Orleans (perfect sampler for that Cajun taste). The gator bites (grill and fried) was not that great, I could have lived without it. But the MAIN DISH is the creme brûlée(not pictured)!!! I used to hate creme brûlée, but theirs completely made me fall in love with it. Perfectly creamy and the perfect caramelized sugar on top. We went back the next day just for the dessert!!

Great food and fantastic service! The building has several floors to be seated on, so you may have to walk up some stairs depending on where you're seated. Awesome seafood - gator tail bites, po-boys, platters. Would definitely come back!

First place we went when we landed and it was a great way to start this vacation. I got the blacken red fish and it was amazing. My wife got the seafood platter and the catfish was perfect. Usually when you get fished fish it's greasy but this fish was perfectly fried...

If you are here this place is awesome for food and drinks. Everything you'd want for Cajun food. Hands down the best gator bites ever had. We did the 5050 but I'd say just go blackened they are an orgasm for your taste buds
The food was great but the drinks were better! Josh the bartender made our experience EVERYTHING he was so cool!

Me and my wife came in town on vacation and our hotel highly recommended Oceana ..The food was Amazing and our server CJ was very attentive and knowledgable . We watched him go from table to table and still kept the same upbeat attitude he was the highly of our trip we will definitely come back .. Great hire ,Great Place
Oceana grill has great service and even better food. Our waiter  Whitney was amazing the best server here hands down.

We decided to come here for my birthday dinner while vacationing in PCB. The wait was about 45 minutes at 5 PM on a Tuesday. It was perfectly fine though because we were able to order happy hour drinks while waiting, and our children enjoyed watching the fish in the fish tank so we were all happy. The environment is nice and the food was some of the best food I have tasted! I had the surf and turf which was a filet mignon with lobster it also came with garlic mashed potatoes and green beans. Everything on the plate tasted amazing! The steak was juicy, the mashed potatoes were amazing, the green beans were soft but not mushy and the lobster was nice and buttery. My kids shared the penne pasta with marinara which was tasty as well and they ate it all up. For dessert I ordered A peanut butter tart and my husband had them add a birthday message on a plate that came with strawberries and whip cream. Happy hour is till 5:30 so if you can get there at 4 when they open you get cheaper meal prices and drink prices. I enjoyed a tipsy kitty to drink and my friend had the mermaid water I believe, both were good. I would definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a little more fine dining or a nice place to take someone on a date, or to celebrate a birthday! We will definitely be back again someday!

Saw this place in a NOLA catalogue and decided to try it out for dinner. It was a fantastic restaurant, quiet dining and very knowledgeable service. There were four  of us dining and we all enjoyed the food we ordered. Even dessert was fantastic. Our drinks were refilled promptly and the food arrived quickly. Would definitely go there again.

This place was really mediocre. We tried it out because of all the great reviews but the fried seafood was bland, the pasta was whatever, the New Orleans trio thing was okay. It's very much a tourist spot. Mediocre food for a high price. Also the side bread was rock hard. I'm not sure why there wasn't fresh bread when the entrees are $17+.
This restaurant was by far my favorite. I had red fish, greens, and crawfish cornbread dressing. My server Sierra was very professional and knowledgeable. We will visit this restaurant again!

First time in New Orleans and this was the first stop for seafood. We came on a Thursday afternoon and there was no wait. The food was fresh. We got the seafood platter which came with fries,coleslaw,fried catfish,fried oysters,fried shrimp, dipping sauces and hush puppies. The service was great, fast and friendly. They forgot our hush puppies and one of the managers went and got them ASAP. All that for $22 and 2 hungry people can easily share. Place was not crowded at all. Bathroom was not too bad for location. Only reason it got 4 stars is because even though the food was great it lacked much of seasoning at all. Also one of the oysters was a little fishy but that's not a big deal overall since nothing else was fishy tasting.

What a great little spot to sit down and eat! I think its pretty clear by the name of the restaurant that they specialize in seafood. So I would recommend ordering seafood. The wait on a Sunday night was only about 10 minutes for my party of 4. Unfortunately, there is not enough room inside to wait, so we had to stand on the stinky street. We were allowed to bring our drinks from another place into the restaurant though, so that made up for the street smells. We were seated pretty quickly and our waitress was fairly friendly. The restaurant itself also has 3 levels i believe, so that was pretty cool. We were seated on the third level. 

I ordered a half order of oysters (Oceanas favorite) as well as a bowl of gumbo(Seafood). My oysters were cooked perfectly and the sauce was delicious! They were also plated fairly decently. My gumbo looked extremely unappetizing when it came out, but it was very good! It had a great seafood flavor without being overly salty! My friend ordered the crawfish etouffee with fried gator bites as a side and she loved her food. Our two other friends ordered chicken alfredo, and they were both a little disappointed to say the least. The chicken was slightly breaded and the dish was just swimming in a ton of sauce. 

The prices are decent for a seafood restaurant as well. All in all, i would definitely come back. I would suggest anyone coming though, to stick with seafood since it is their specialty. Will i be dreaming of gumbo for the next week...Yes, yes i will. Thank you Oceana!

Best place everrrr!! Best seasoning and the music they played was good too lol very friendly happy staff love Oceanas! Bbq shrimp and Cajun fries with gator ( first time trying gator) was amazingggg And my favs!

This was definitely the best place we ate at during our stay in NOLA! I had asked 3 random locals to suggest the go to spot for local food. 3 out of 3 suggested this place! It was amazing, amazing, amazing!!!!! We both had a different fish special and it did not disappoint! I had the red fish topped with a creamy sauce and crab fish! The alligator tail bites were delicious as well. I hope to go back some day! Our server was so friendly and helpful to make sure our experience was maxed. Plus, we got a 10% discount when we checked in with YELP!!! It was meant to be!
The food was wonderful and my dine in services was OK. Cole wasn't pleasant and charged me for a spilled drink however the greeters, to go counter and food was amazing. I will be back!

This food was good however, the customer service here sucked. They didn't bring out our oysters until we were getting ready to pay the bill. I didn't like a drink and the manager refused to give me a full refund and only half because I had drank some already. Total waste of time.
The atmosphere was the best..the cheese cake actually took the cake.  The service was wonderful and pleasant.  Thanks for great New Orleans style cooking.

I've been in New Orleans for three days and we've had dinner here twice and planning for a third, the food was fresh well executed and seasoned perfectly. I had the the best server twice Fiona, she was so attentive and really made the experience the very best in The Quarter. Fiona recommended the best drink "Phase 3" which was mint, cucumber and lime infused tequila poured over watermelon juice and lemonade. It was so smooth, fresh and thoughtful concocted . She also recommended the Red Fish Etouffee with craw fish and jambalaya. Definitely a staple of my visits to New Orleans from now on. FIONA is definitely the embodiment of the beauty of New Orleans culture, love, and hospitality. See you again soon.
Ashleigh was amazing. Her attentiveness is unmatched. She consistently checked on us and made sure we had a great time!

First stop in NOLA. A recommendation by someone at my hotel. The service is wonderful. I had the famous Po-Boy. I couldn't decide between shrimp and oysters so the waiter suggested I do half n half. I did .. slamm'n

Unsure if the owners of this restaurant also own Olde Nola Cookery, but they have the same menu, and I don't mean just the food items listed (like it's literally the same menu). The food here is great and I came here one crowded night with my dog. Outdoor patio was already closed for the night but they made accommodations. Great straff, great food, great service.

Love this restaurant. The staff in this place is a great example of proper communication. Our waiter Derrick was fabulous, he was personable, knowledgeable, and had a great sense of humor. The food was so good- the catfish (did NOT have the muddy taste you would at other restaurants), shrimp was great, oyster little burnt but still good. The Collard greens best I have ever had. The chicken was done but still moist. Gator tail bites are delicious. I personally like the seasonings on the blackened more than the breaded. All around worth every penny.

So their fresh oysters are the best. Hands down. Never had oysters so simple, plump and flavorful. The blackened redfish is on point. And my mixed drink was entertaining and pleasing( it was bubbling ).  The wait staff is attentive. Just a happening place.

We arrived to a small line at the hostess stand. I gave my name. She said there was no reservation under that name. I told her I had called that day. She said they don't take reservations over the phone. I showed her my phone and that I had called. 
Anyway, we were seated relatively quickly. We walked up the stairs to a table right as you enter the room. I had a view of a TV showing their food. Torturous but enjoyable- lol. 

I got the Caesar Salad and it was good. The waiter talked me into blackened catfish versus grilled and he was right. I was glad I listened. There was a generous amount of fish on the salad. 

I chose a side of Red beans and rice. It was not whole beans but more blended. The flavor was incredible though. Very spicy. The portion was bigger than I expected. 

My friend got a side order of jalepeno hush puppies to split. They were ok. 

For dessert we split the bananas foster ice cream cake. It was just ok and tasted like it had been cut a long time ago. I like strawberries but thought they did not really belong in this dessert in my opinion.
Great food - crab cakes and alligator tots were yum. Great cocktails and outdoor patio with heaters made it really enjoyable.
The wait staff was so friendly. We were promptly seated. The food was great and large portions! A great stop off Bourbon

This spot was amazing customer service A plus reservations a must they fill up fast food was really great I've been in for lunch once which was great but this brunch was amazing my favorite was the French toast and the seafood omelette the crawfish sauce on top was a great way to top it off very tasty no other season Is needed they way they bring it out is all you need. Waiters were amazing super friendly even the many came out to see how everything was going all around great service.

This was by far one of my favorite restaurants in New Orleans. Was the first place we went but it has one of my most favorite beloved dishes growing up just catfish jalapeño hush puppies and fries. They are checking temperatures when you walk in and you do have to sign in to let them know that you were there. They did have social distancing in place and everybody is required to wear masks. If you haven't been here before you definitely got to go try the cat fish platter I thoroughly enjoyed it it brought me right back to my childhood days

DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY!!!! YOU WILL HAVE A BETTER EXPERIENCE AT MR. ED'S

Is there a negative star?! All around experience was so incredibly negative, from the customer service, general service,to management I can't fathom I'm the only one who has experienced this outcome.
-offers good allergy menu (+) BUT there isn't a way to order the food online.
-called 3-4 times to try and place order and got the run around, young lady answering the phone was seemingly very inconvenienced by the request to order directly by phone instead of the website (even after explaining that there is no way to order from the food allergy menu online)
-order would take 45 mins to arrive (no problem, that's average to above average wait) -OVER AN HOUR LATER NO FOOD, called and asked if there was an issue AGAIN it was A HUGE INCONVENIENCE FOR THE YOUNG LADY ANSWERING THE PHONE (couldn't give us any information)
-1 1/2 HOURS after placing order I called and requested the manager, HE couldn't give me any information (he called the delivery guy and came back on the phone and apologized)
-2 HOURS after placing the order food arrived, still warm (hmmm ... Doesn't seem like it's been away from the restaurant warmer that long( the manager's only explanation was the delivery guy delivered out of order basically placing the blame on him
-FOOD WASN'T THAT GREAT!!! FOOD WAS MEDIOCRE AT BEST!
-Manager called after the food was delivered and offered us a free dessert the next day if we came into the restaurant, I explained to him this was not an option because of the food allergy which is why we had to call in the order to begin with. He insisted on making it up to us in some way.
- Walked to the location the next day (everyone has bad days, why not give them a chance ) I WAS AGAIN GREETED BY THE WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE AND GENERAL SERVICE I'VE EVER EXPERIENCED
-The manager took forever to come to the bar (after he was called on the radio, 7 mins later one of the servers went and physically told him to come over - manner said he didn't hear it the request... THOUGH HE HAD AN EARPIECE IN SO HE COULD HEAR THE RADIO )
-AT THIS POINT I'M SO OVER SECOND CHANCES, JUST REFUND THE MEAL! He couldn't offer a refund for the trouble because " it would mess up his accounting "(?)  Manager kept insisting we give them another chance the acknowledgment and customer service was so bad at that point he couldn't pay me to eat another meal there or from there

DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME OR MONEY paid $55 for 2 mediocre meals, bad service and incompetent management

This was the best meal we had in the New Orleans area. It was our 50th Wedding Anniversary dinner and the food and service was excellent. The upstairs dinning room was delightfully decorated to give you the true feel of New Orleans and very comfortable seating. Our waiter Darrick made our evening very special. If your looking for good food and good time at reasonable pricing, this is the place to go.
Jim Newsome, Pointblank, Texas 77364

We went there for breakfast and their menu didn't have much of a selection. There were some items that were on yelp, but were not on the menu.

We were actually glad we went there because the waiter gave us two better recommendations: Drago's for dinner and Surrey's for breakfast. Went to both of the those places and we were very pleased. 

Didn't take any pictures because it was a basic good breakfast.

One of my favorite locations to eat at when I'm in town. The menu isn't that big, but the food quality is great! 

I've came to New Orleans twice and each time I'm in town; I've dined twice. Yelp offers delivery for this restaurant and they have a 10% off yelp check in as well. They didn't allow me to apply the discount for my to-go food which was disappointing. Nor did they allow me to take oysters for take out. They also tried to give me problems of applying the discount when we ordered just appetizers while waiting for the food at the bar. They said it had to be with an entree, but it doesn't state that anywhere on the yelp offer.

Anyways, the food here is great. I really love their raw oysters; it's so fresh and clean. So you won't be swallowing any sand or parts of the shell. The selection of hot sauces is nice too that you're not only limitEd to just one. We alsO enjoYed the alligator bites. We ordered haLf fried and half blackenEd. But we enjoyed the fried ones more. The crab cakes were tasty as well. The taste of New Orleans or whatever it is called is okay, but not our favorite. 

Anyways I would definitely come back again and again

Located within the French Quarter, this restaurant was amazing. From the minute we walked in, we were greeted with a warm smile. Our server, Megan, was very knowledgeable about the menu. I t ook Megan's recommendation with the Chicken Perdu and was extremely satisfied. The chicken alone was very flavorful with the perfect amount of spice. Paired together with the French Toast made my mouth salivate leaving me wanting more.
I would highly recommend this restaurant. The stairs were a little pain in the ass but we did just get off a five day cruise and have our sea legs.

We went here because my boyfriend wanted to try alligator (not fried because he wanted you actually taste it) and turtle soup ...so why not kill two birds with one stone and go here? He ordered turtle soup and a blackened alligator po'boy ... I had a Greek salad. He LOVED the alligator and was very happy he found it somewhere that wasn't fried. My salad was a salad but it was pretty big! The waitress was really nice and the service was good.

Great food ! But the delivery guy said our card did not go 
thru so he needed cash. Later found out card did go thru
but they did not know who the delivery guy was! 
never get delivery again!
Meagan L was so awesome...she recommended the Redfish Etouffee and it was AMAZING . She gave us excellent service and we will definitely be back to see her!!
Everyone was very nice and constantly greeting me with a smile. My waitress was ok. My pancakes and hash brown was delicious! The grits? Not so much
Food is usually great but this time it was just pretty good and very expensive. The drinks could have used some more alcohol too which was super disappointing,. especially for Nola.

Quirky hole in the wall just off Bourbon St. From the hostess to the waitress and everyone you meet in between, these are the nicest people you could hope to meet and some of the best red beans and rice I've ever had!

I was not a big fan of the food I ordered and split with others. The portions are large so I was full on appetizers. 

* Crab Cakes: two giant breaded crab cakes. My favorite dish of the evening, a bit dry and one dimensional, came with a side sauce with baby shrimps. 

* Oceana Oysters: the parmesan and cream ended up being a sloppy wet mess. The oysters were fairly fishy and were significantly different sizes. 

* Jambalaya: rice with one or two pieces of sausage. Some spice notes but overall bland and basic 

* Chicken Alfredo: at the recommendation of the waiter my friend asked for blackened chicken on the pasta. Pretty tasty! 

I wasn't expecting too much since it is right off of Bourbon Street. Try another place off of the strip for better authentic creole / New Orleans cuisine.

I've been going to New Orleans every year for the past three years and this was the first restaurant we went to. This was the best choice I made because it became our go to spot for everything. The breakfast is out of this WORLD!!! Between the French toast and the maw maw, I can't decide what is my fave! Overall, the food is absolutely flawless!!! (Try the "fall-off-the- bone ribs")


The staff is equally as good as the food. I love the staff!! They are very attentive and sweet.. Treating my family and I like we were guests in their home. I was there last week and my two new favorite servers are Llyod and Jimika. Jimika was like that old friend that gives good advice and shares a joke with you :) . Llyod is the grand definition of southern hospitality. He waited on us the first day and was awesome!! After a few days we saw him in the restaurant and came over to say hello & to see how our vacation was going.

This restaurant is hands down my favorite in New Orleans!!! Keep up the great work!! You'll have me as a customer for life!!!
First time here was for my birthday. Great Food and Great Service. If you have not gotten a chance to stop by, your missing out.

Everything tasted amazing! We had blankend fish etoufee, mash potatoes, greens, and Cajun fries. The Cajun fries were topped with crawfish and mushroom sauce. Everything was absolutely perfect. Service was great, the server was a pleasure. Place was clean and smelled very clean. I will definitely go back
