Ordered the gator bites, blackened and fried, the Redfish special which was on a cornbread stuffing and greens, and a sezarac to start it all off. Now mind you this was our first meal that we had in New Orleans and was just a walk in right off of Bourbon St. C'mon, that's why everyone is here in one form or another so why not enjoy a little bit of the ambiance. Having not had that much gator being up here in the NW, we don't have any, it was nice to try some of the other foods that many have enjoyed for centuries. The gator was quite delicious, and yes it did taste a lot like chicken. 

However the Redfish, which is just a cheap cut of fish in comparison to Tuna's and Salmons, was outstanding. Well cooked, succulent and moist, this wonderful fish was laid on top of a cornbread stuffing. Just WOW. And I do love some good greens, and these were fantastic. Add to is the wonderful buttery shrimp sauce labeled heavily over the top of the fish and this was a chef special that was simply too good to pass up. Ah yes, I almost forgot about the gumbo. Yes, I ate gumbo at almost every restaurant meal that I could. It was amazing to me how many different variations, combinations of meats, and the various colors and flavors of the rue, but this had to be one of the better for the entire trip. 

Yes it's load, yes it's on the divey side, but have you looked at Bourbon St. lately?? Load, noisy, sweaty warm, hot fish and cold drinks make this one of the must stops on anybody's trip to the Big Easy.

I'm sad to give this place three stars but our experience was just Ok. It was SO dark in here and our first table was so wobbly. We moved to a different table and that one was wobbly as well-- so we stuck a napkin under one of the legs, down deal. I ordered the Cajun pasta which had great flavor but was soooo heavy. Our loaded fries with crawfish wasn't bad. My bf ordered a trio -- sampler and they basically had the same flavors to me. The oysters were ordered had a funky after taste.  Maybe it was just an off day and I'm willing to give it another try -- when in NOLA.

The servers were friendly. The food was average. It was seasoned just okay. Presentation of the food was very basic, but I'm use to more elegant restaurants so I may have held this up to standards. The catfish was seasoned well and the jalepeño hush puppies were awesome

Great atmosphere and the food everything was delicious. The must try's are the blackened alligator bites, the shrimp Jambalaya Alfredo. Oh and don't forget to have the Bloody Mary a nice little kick. Michael B was excellent in his recommendation and service was top notch. Don't forget to add to your list of must visits when visiting New Orleans.

This is one of the best restaurants ever! I love there drinks, the food was great the staff is so nice welcoming and the service was quick we got our drinks and appetizers right away and the delicious dinner can 8-10mins later
Do not go here. It's terrible. I would never ever ever ever ever recommend this place as a local.  The food is bad. Like spoiled bad.

Generic food on Bourbon Street. Classic "turn and burn" restaurant where they try to get people in and out quickly to turn tables. Nothing wrong with that business model, and while they survive by dint of their location, anyone would be better served by dining elsewhere.

This restaurant was amazing. I ordered the redfish ponchatrain, it was delicious. My husband ordered the seafood platter, he said it was the best he'd ever had.  We also ordered the black and gold gator as an appetizer. Never had blackened gator. Amazing. We made a reservation and thankful we did. The line was very long and it was only 5 pm. Definitely want to mention our server, Jessica L.  She was very attentive even though she had larger tables. She took the time to go over the menu as we told her we had never been there before. Also, made sure we were happy with our selection.  Exceptional Service!

I had a great experience at Oceana Grill. My bartender Allison was amazing! She has a great personality, funny, informative and made our experience fun! We had the crab cakes and alligator bites, both were very good.

I waited 40 minutes for old oysters (she took them back and reheated them) OMGand bland ass Cajun pasta, and unseasoned catfish po' boy why are people raving about this wack food!!! Do better people, they need to go out of business!!!!#neveragain

Food was good, not great. Tasted more like bar food trying to be creole food. Service was excellent though and prices are what you'd expect. Just, I wanted Cajun Jambalaya Pasta, and I feel like I got the bar food version of that.

Our server, Sierra, was absolutely amazing and steered us towards some of the best food we had in New Orleans. The food and the atmosphere was excellent, we would highly recommend this restaurant and we will be back again. We had the gumbo, redfish Oceana, and our children had the shrimp and chicken Alfredo. The bread pudding was the cherry on top and is a must have dessert!!!!
Great food. First time here from out of town will highly recommend it. Our server Fiona was awesome very helpful and awesome! Environment great to have dinner with friends.

My brother has been in the military for four years, he is now driving 2200 miles home and stopped here for dinner. I called to see if I could pay his tab and was put on hold 3x and finally got a manager and asked if I could pay the tab for my brother and father who are currently eating in the restaurant, and was told "no" by the manager and hung up on.... how can you not take over the phone credit cards when you ring up pickup and delivery orders? I'm insulted. What a shame - I would have tipped double for the effort.

Omg we were a little worried about going into a restaurant in the French Quarter with all the covid craziness going on but we are so happy we did. This restaurant is on top of covid safety, everyone is wearing masks and tables are spaced apart and sanitizer is provided. All the food was perfectly prepared and so delicious, definitely stop in here and fill your tummy with deliciousness you won't regret it.

This was a cute little spot that my girls and I went to grab a few drinks before they closed. The wait staff was friendly and the drinks were slammin'. In fact I was so tipsy that I can't even remember what I ordered to drink but just know that it was good, and then we headed over to some supermarket to get some yummy fried foods.

the service  was wonderful  roni was amazing  with his warm hospitality and told us we had the best server jasmine 

and she was great she paid attention  to all the smell details  and she went over and beyond to make my mom feel special  on her birthday  


thank you so much jasmine  and roni

This place came highly recommend. When you walk in there is a sign that says it's top 10 in the United States, something along those lines.  We waited for a while and then finally sat down. My son ordered red beans and rice and he loved it and I ordered blackened chicken. The atmosphere could have been more inviting but overall a good find. I think there is a deal with hotels to recommend this restaurant. It is not in my top 10 but is was good. It just felt very scripted  when I asked for a recommendation.
We had a party of 10 and Dori our waitress was very accommodating answering all of our questions.  The food was amazing with large portions. Dori is wonderful!
This spot was great, loved their Cajun fries and their Hurricane left me feeling very happy (to say the least)  I really appreciated Amethyst's service and recommendations. Thank you!

After a shitty meal yesterday at Court of the Two Sisters we headed over this morning (Labor Day) for breakfast on the recommendation of the front desk at our Hotel to Oceanagrill. Stepped inside to a friendly front desk check in. No reservations no problem. Wife opted for outside courtyard seating. They put us in the back at what I would say is the best table in the house. 

I digress a second - Unlike Court of the Two Sisters who packed in customers side by side and filled the place up to capacity, Oceanagrill followed "Strict" Social Distancing guidelines and made sure that not only was the restaurant very sterilized and clean in smell and appearance, but all customers were overly distance from each other. 

Back to the review. We sat down at a clean table and had immediate and may I say Excellent service throughout our meal from waiter Jamal. The menu for breakfast has it all. My wife ordered poached eggs over biscuits with sausage which comes with what I can solidly say are the best grits and home fries I have ever had. She also ordered a small side of Sausage Gravy. I had 2 eggs over easy and an alligator and andouille sausage. It came with a biscuit drizzled with honey over it and their grits and home fries. Everything was outstanding and again the service was spot on! Did I mention that I drink my coffee Black and theirs is strong and delicious; never-ending refills from Jamal.

I highly recommend this place for Breakfast or Brunch! Thank you Oceanagrill for making our second meal in NOLA feel like we were back in the Big Easy!
Ate here for dinner while in NOLA and it was out of this world good.  Food and staff were fantastic.  Can't wait to go back again.
Great food and friendly atmosphere. Food was delicious with a little kick to the fettuccine, with lots of chicken. Food is so good that I went back for breakfast

My colleague's go to joint. So when we were on the way here, she told me that we should come for drinks and a late night food trip. Why not, I'm always down to chill with the crew and smash a couple of plates here and there. Plus It's my first time here.

Off the bat, two things jumped out and grabbed my attention. The Crab Cakes and the Jambalaya Pasta. Grabbed a proper pint of Ragin Cajuns Kolsch, put in the order and away we go.

Crab Meat Cakes:     I am a big Crab Cake guy,, and yes I have been to Baltimore and my bar is set pretty gosh darn high when it come to that. The ones served here are really good. Definitely worth ordering specially the way they smother it with their shrimp and mushroom sauce. Two thumbs up!

Cajun Jambalaya Pasta:     Shrimp on every bite. It's as if the Alfredo sauce made love to Jambalaya and had an offspring. This would definitely the direct result of that. It's out of this world. I can't wait to have it again. Plus they give you pieces of bread to mop up what's left on he plate after you're don't smashing.

This spot is definitely a pretty good place to go to if you're visiting NOLA for the very first time. It definitely is touristy, but then what do you expect since it's just off bourbon. Would I come back here again? My answer would be a very strong YES.

Thank you so much for reading my review. I hope this helps with your decision making experience. Enjoy your awesome yelptastic day!

I would love to give this place a better review. However, our sausages were way over cooked, the gumbo was luke warm, the fries were undercooked, and the etouffee was mediocre. The only reason there was 2 stars given on this review was because the catfish in my Po Boy was amazing, if only the bread wasn't impossibly soggy..... ugh.

This place is nothing but the truth! Located right in the French Quarter's.  We stopped in for a late afternoon lunch. We were greeted and seated right away. We didn't have reservations.  The staff was so nice and polite. They even opened the door for you.
Our server name was Marlon. He was so nice and checked on us regularly. He gave us some drink recommendations. I went with the Ocean-tini. Which is like an Apple Martini with a splash of Midori. Btw Midori is melon. 
That drink was good and not watered down
Like some of the others I've tried since I've been here. Now on to the Appetizer. We shared 
The Cajun Alligator Sausage. I love trying something new and that was Delicious!
I had the Fried Seafood Platter. Added on the Softshell crab for an additional price. It did not  disappoint me. My husband had the Blackened Bayou Duck. It was topped with a Crawfish mushroom sauce. When they you will be back for this treat. You sure will. I plan on ordering that the next time we return. 
We had window seating that was perfect! 
We plan on returning. Ask for window seating if you have a party of Two. I can't comment on desert as l was so overwhelmed from the seafood but it's all good!  Definitely on my next  visit.

Pro - they sat us at midnight on a Friday without a wait. Cons - no oysters?? Food was ok. Drinks were ok. Restaurant was dirty. Staff wasn't very friendly. For the money we paid I expected a lot better experience.

Everything was cold when delivered.  The gumbo, which I'm used to being a flavorful soup was a thick mud that tasted like flour.  Very Disappointed.  I've made much better gumbo IMO, even as an Indian-American who grew up in LA.  This is a tourist joint with kitchen staff who don't know or care how to cook.  Never coming back and I would advise anyone who is excited to try the local cuisine in Nawlins to stay away.  Thumbs down all the way from from cooking to delivery.  Ignore this place and, IMO they don't deserve the single star I gave them.

When visiting NOLA, one of the locals there suggested we try this place @oceanagrill 
Known for its #cajunjambalayapasta with some alligator meat .
.
.
I would say it did not exceed my expectations and too pricey for what they had to offer. .

This place was wonderful! The service was fantastic and the seafood was delicious. Even our drinks were fun since they came out smoking! I would recommend this place to anyone wanting seafood or authentic Cajun food.

Great food plus average price (for the area) equals great value!

In New Orleans (NOLA), there is an abundance of everything so it is hard to find a good thing, especially if your not from around here. Well, my wife and I did it. We found an amazing restaurant that not only delivers after 10PM, but has amazing flavors, hot food, and a good selection of traditional delicacies; e.g. jambalaya, crawfish etouffee, red beans and rice, several blackened items, and Po-Boy sandwiches.

We ate here twice today (Saturday 8/12/18) and will not only recommend this place to EVERYONE we know, but we can't wait to come back to the area to visit it. For lunch my wife had the "Taste of New Orleans".  I comes with Jambalaya, crawfish etoufee and red beans and rice with smoked sausage. It was our first time eating the crawfish and red beans (NOLA style) and we loved it. We had Jambalaya before so we knew what to expect and loved it as well. I had an individual order of the red beans and loved it. I would have liked to see another piece of sausage (because it only comes with 1) but it was satisfyingly filling served just the way it was.

Because my wife had a combination of different items, they were packed in individual soup containers to maintain its temperature and flavor. Additionally, all items were packed in such a way that they were easy to open and they stayed sealed to prevent from spilling. I commend the staff working here because they pay attention to detail and the little things can go a long way.

As for our dinner tonight, we switched it up and both ordered Po-Boys and desserts. My wife had the blackened chicken and I had the fried catfish. Both were very delicious and came with fries. We didn't finish them in order to save room for the desserts. They will be excellent breakfast meals in the morning as we travel back up north.

The desserts were fabulous! We had the bread pudding and the pecan pie. The ice cream we got traveled remarkably well for takeout. The whipped cream, not so much. The bread pudding was warm and moist but not soggy. It had a nice balance of raisins in it and came with a delicious caramel sauce to pour on top. The pecan pie was also warm and had a fresh-just-made-today taste.

In conclusion, I think this restaurant is the BEST value overall for their quality of food, their fast service and their convenient hours. I recommend it!

This is specifically for Mary.
Any server can come to your table and ask "what would you like?"
It takes a different server to say, "No, you can get that anywhere in New Orleans. We specialize in this, this and this."
Mary made our experience an absolute blast. Engaging, informed. I certainly hope all your servers are as personable as her.
As for the menu, plenty of options even for those in an alternative diet. 
I would suggest Oceana in a heartbeat.

We stopped in for lunch and grabbed a seat at the bar. The bartender took a little bit to warm up, but ended up giving us great service & recommendations. I ordered an abita beer and wasn't super hungry and was hoping to grab some oysters at happy hour so just wanted something small but with a little more substance than fries... the bartender basically said, tell me what you want & we can probably make it happen. I ended up ordering a single crabcake which was perfect. My husband ended up getting a gator tail po boy, 1/2 grilled & 1/2 fried. Make sure you get the bites and not the sausage. My crabcake was good, had a sauce with some crawfish on top, but the gator was great! We've had gator at a local place in Ohio before, but LA gator was so good! They definitely know what they are doing. The fries were great too. Check in for 10% off which was a nice perk!

The food was just ok....when we got it. Some wasn't hot while others were forgotten and we had to ask for our appetizer and 1 dinner at our table. We had to ask for refills on drinks. For the restaurants only being able to seat less than half capacity you would have thought we would have good service, but it was the exact opposite! For our last meal in NOLA, I wish we would have gone elsewhere....
First spot where we ate on our NOLA trip. Located inside a very touristy area, we got a couple mixed drinks here and some seafood platters. Definitely a good way to start off a Cajun culinary trip

We loved it so much that we returned! Like spicy? Then enjoy the Cajun Crawfish Scones Delight. Also, try the Pain Perdu (French toast) to ease your sweet tooth after a long night in the French Quarter. Continuing the party during breakfast? The Bahama Mama is probably the best cocktail available in NOLA. 
Restrooms are super clean and Angela, our server, was top notch!

TIP: Just hold your nose on your way to and from so you don't "lose your lunch"

Had a reservation and was seated within 10-15 minutes, which seemed reasonable considering Covid seating limitations, Spring Break crowds and St. Patty day celebrations. Others waited in line, so I recommend making a reservation. I overheard one staff member telling our waitress Mary she had a reputation for being a G.O.A.T., and I gave to admit she really was great. Our attentiveness took excellent care of our table for two, while serving a RAMBUNCTIOUS group of 6 adults and 13 children, without looking the least bit flustered. We ordered the barbecued shrimp appetizer, and she wisely suggested we keep any left over sauce and try in with our entrees. She was right, it would have tasted good on a shoe. She made suggestions snd helped us with entree selections. Mary recommend the smoked duck, saying it was her favorite, and I could definitely see why. It came with mustard greens seasoned perfectly with a hint of sweet and a vinegar flavor. I am from the south, and like greens, but these may be the best greens I have ever had. We enjoyed a great dinner with excellent service, and appreciate Mary's attentiveness and friendly assistance as we navigated Oceania's extensive menu.

On Monday January 21st my friend and I stumbled into Oceana Grill for a last New Orleans meal before heading back to Canada in the morning. 
When we were finished, we tried to connect to wifi to order a ride back to our airbnb but were unable to. 
The restaurant server stepped in and ordered one on her account for us. At the time we thought this was lovely of her, and graciously paid her the amount shown for the ride. 
We went straight to bed and woke up to find my phone was not in my purse. 
I waited until the 8am opening to call the restaurant to see if I had left my phone there. I was told I had not. I asked the manager Tiffany to please track down the server working the past night and ask her to report it missing with uber. She said she would.
The next day when settled back in Canada, I emailed this information into the restaurant along with my address etc to ensure that they had all the details. 
Tiffany responded to say that she would let me know if uber called to report a found phone.
I emailed again to clarify that Uber or LYFT will not be calling, the account holder has to report the phone missing, and they are unable to give any information to anyone other than the account holder. Tiffany seemed to understand and said she would check with the server. By this time it was already Wednesday evening and I was confused that the server hadn't been located.
I emailed Tiffany again on Friday, Saturday and Monday to check the status but she is now ignoring my emails.
A friend of mine decided to call the restaurant for me Monday Jan 28th in the evening to see if the server was back on shift. She was told she'd have to call back and speak to the manager in the morning, and when she asked who she was speaking to, she was hung up on. 
This is incredibly peculiar behaviour from a place of business, offering customer service.
At this point I can only conclude that the manager has not done due diligence, or that the manager or server have stolen my phone. 
There is no conceivable reason that the server who was scheduled last Monday evening couldn't be located within a week's time, and it takes less than a minute to report a lost item through the ride share app.
I have reported this to the authorities and advise those visiting the restaurant to keep their belongings close.
Had a great time here. Good vide. Great blackened steak. Had the porterhouse for just 30 bucks. Awesome bartender Shaun!
Shrimp Po Boy was amazing and crunchy fries yum! Gator tails were good and the gumbo was tasty as well. I totally enjoyed the vibe there and the waitress was really nice.

Went here at midnight and was able to get a table immediately. We ordered the jazzy crab cake entree and crawfish fettuccine.
The crab cake was good. It comes with a mushroom sauce which is really good.
The crawfish fettuccine was okay compared to other restaurants in the area.

Erica was amazing and attentive she helped us decide what to order. My husband ordered the Seafood Platter and it was soo good. I had the Jolly rancher drink and my Husband got the Martini that had cognac. Both were amazing and they were fizzy.!!!! We finished up with dessert and the brownie was warm and gooey!
This place is bomb!! And Whitney is the best server. Definitely recommend it! The French toast was the best I have ever had!!

If you ever visit New Orleans, this is definitely a restaurant that will give you a taste of what seafood down south is like! The customer service is excellent and the food over the top mouth watering. The only complaints had was the space to eat. The tables are on the small side, but other than that, you'll love everything.
Can't be mad. We believed the four stars. Pure crappy chain food. Do not eat here. You're in nola

The Crab Cakes with the Mushroom cream sauce they are out of this world! The seafood gumbo bowl size is twice the size as a regular bowl of soup. The cup size is the same as a regular bowl anywhere else. Fantastic service even with the wait line  outside we were seated in about 15 minutes. At first glance I thought it would've been a 30 minute to 1 hour wait. This place has plenty of waitstaff.

Worst place in nola to eat.  Horrible for locals I guess it's a tourist spot cause it's not what's up. Char oysters was the worst I ever had. Just go to acme. Service was wack and rude, I guess it is in the French quartes but wow. Very disappointed, just paid an left. Wait in line for what.

Service was great. Restaurant was like dining at any American restaurant. Food tasted pretty good ....until it came backup. Got really bad food poisoning after dining here Jan 1 2020. Came to check reviews and saw someone else posted they also got food poisoning. Someone needs to sanitize the kitchen or check their food.

all I can say is ew ew and ew. this place is not authentic new orleans cuisine..take it from me I was born here. they hire cooks and waiters from out of town and their food is bland and just overly priced and marketed toward tourists, don't fall into their trap!

Allergy alert My wife and I ate here upon recommendation from our concierge. She has celiacs and got super sick after ordering from the gluten free menu.  Just a heads up... And the food was average and service was poor.

The food was good. But if you like oyster, go to ACME oyster house. We ordered oyster, very disappointing. The fish was just good. Frankly speaking, Oceana Grill is a good but average restaurant, nothing impressive.
Another yelp gift!  Most would prob walk by the place. Those who walk by don't know what they are missing. Amazing bbq shrimp and blackened shrimp. Bloody Mary is yummy as was the Golden Cadillac

So this is my 3rd time attending within the weekend and let's just say I had the same meal every time The Mardi Gras Pasta Blackened with the Louisiana Crab Cake and honestly the first time I had it, it was delicious and I went and bragged to my friends who were also visiting out of town and we came  back for dinner and they were soo impressed. Unfortunately this experience wasn't our favorite. Firstly the hostess never greeted us instead just gave me a "3 signal" then we had the best servers Erica and the day prior was Fiona . The servers made up for the lack of consistency with our meals. Either way it was a great time thanks to the ladies Erica and Fiona. Will definitely come back because of them!

Nice place in a very old building that clearly was not originally a restaurant.  But that gives it character.  The food was tasty and the service was very fast.  Not quite a 5 but probably 4 1/2!  Definitely recommend!
The food here is great. I had a nice mixed drink called Swamp Tea. Awsome! Then I had a cup of gumbo which was a nice start. Then I had this Awsome seafood platter. I had enough food for 2 people .

Recommended by the front desk at the Roosevelt Waldorf Astoria, Oceana Grill will not disappoint! We had oysters, seafood creole, and the knife and fork bbq ribs, which did in fact fall off the bones. Everything was fabulous, so we also had the bread pudding...delicious! So good that we went back tonight for the pecan pie, also delicious! Having just spent a week in Key West with terrible service, we truly appreciate the way Erica took care of us. She was quick to greet us and bring drinks, checked on us often without making us feel rushed, and made us feel welcome and valued. She is genuinely friendly. I strongly recommend Oceana Grill. Don't miss it!

Ok so the waiter was very nice.  I ordered the desert crepe.  Out of 57 years of eating and making crepes I never had anything this bad.  First of all it was served cold.  Ok well if the texture was half way decent I could handle it.  It was so old and dry it crumbled like old paper.  The flavor tasted old and it smelled old.  A hostess asked how it was. I picked it up and showed her how it crumbled and told her I felt it was old..  she stiuddered and tried to tell me it was made this am.  I'm not stupid.  It should have been remade fresh.  Don't treat people like you can put stuff over on them.  .  Sad business all the way around.  I got out fast and do not recommend.  Who want old nasty food

Tasted like nasty TGI Fridays. The food wasn't good but our waitress was very kind (only reason this review got more than 1 star) overpriced for what you get definitely not worth your time or money. Much better option in NOLA. Construction on the road makes it difficult to find as well.
Our food was delicious. We were seated immediately. The gator tail was tender and delicious and our meals were great!
The best crab cakes I've ever had. We had the crawfish and red fish étouffée. It was delicious. Great customer service and location. So Good !
The seafood platter was sooooo good and it was just so much food it will fulfill the biggest appetite. The waiter and staff were really cool and definitely exhibit southern hospitality.

We came here strictly on reviews , wasn't as expected at all. Presentation for the restaurant in itself was amazing however service and food have been something more to desire on reviews than in person. Rice was cold when delivered , had to eat appetizer with our entree for mistaken order. Food was a 6/10.

We wanted some authentic New Orleans food for our small overnight trip and Janell made sure we did! She was extremely sweet and full of energy. We had a great night and we are so glad to have janell as our waitress. She's doing great and we are so appreciative of her!

Nice location at Bourbon street. Evenings always long wait but you can make a reservation. We had breakfast, service like elsewhere in NO be happy you got a seat. Food was ok but nothing very special.

Came to eat here with friends, and let's start off by saying that the server was literally rushing us through! We ordered a taste of New Orleans plate, and it was disgusting! Like the beans literally tasted rotten! We left the entire plate because it was disgusting! Manager was called to our table "Ryan" she was rude and her customer service was absolutely absurd! She went on to saying that she knew the beans weren't bad, they even had canned food taste! && instead of offering us another plate, she goes on about how she wasn't taking it off our tab! Never dealt with such unprofessionalism in a restaurant! Don't go here, but I will recommend their sister restaurant that is at the French Quarters! Not here though! Paid and left no tip too! Hope they read this and rethink about their customer service! Don't eat here!! Disgusting service and disgusting food!

This is one of our favorite places in French quarter! We love the blackened alligator bites, the best we have ate! Also impressed with their spinach ravioli. This place is a must try! Reasonable prices always.

I've been to New Orleans plenty of times and Oceana's maybe once or twice. But this trip was different, I was able to enjoy my food!! And I can't stress the CUSTOMER SERVICE FROM EVERY SERVER/WAITRESS WE WALKED WAS SUPERB! That alone will have me there again!! Love everything we ordered! I had the Cajun fries (best app ever) and I had the shrimp fettuccine!!

This restaurant is amazing! The service was great and the Cajun seafood was fresh, flavorful and delicious! I was very impressed and will be going back here the next time I visit New Orleans. The drink was great too

Came here with friends our second night in NOLA. I got the Tropical Storm cocktail which was beautiful and delicious! For the meal, I got the Taste of New Orleans which had creole jambalaya, crawfish etouffée, and red beans and rice with smoked sausage. It was to die for! I was really sad that I couldn't finish it - it was heavy but sooooo good! I highly recommend that one since you get a little bit of everything. Prices are decent and the server was outstanding. I highly recommend this place!

Oceana Grill was recommended by a co-worker. The food was very good and very reasonable!
 
We ordered Shrimp Po-Boys, which came with fries and coleslaw. We also ordered the Alligator Bites, which came fried or blackened, so we tried both.

Our waiter was the best! The food was delicious and well seasoned. The restaurtant was clean, well decorated and pretty quiet. I wanted dessert, but I couldn't eat another bite. Next time!

Stopped here on a busy Saturday night. Halloweekend and Voodoofest had the area packed. You would never have known it. We were a party of 2 and got a table in the courtyard right away.  The blackened duck with crawfish cream sauce was excellent....could have used just a bit more crawfish cream sauce but overall it was excellent. I got mine with the $5 add-on of crawfish. They were breaded (not what I would have preferred but they were ok). Served with a side of jambalaya and mustard greens. 
Great meal.  Great service.
We were a party of 4. Seymour was an amazing server. She was very attentive and super sweet! Food was absolutely amazing. Highly recommend this place!

Lines were long but it moves fast. Seating is good. Atmosphere pleasant. Didn't have children with us this time, but would definitely bring them here. Food was excellent, service can't be beat. Never a bad meal.

We have dined here our last 3 visits to NOLA. The food has been delicious and the service is excellent. Daniel C. was our waiter this last visit and he was very friendly and attentive. Will be back the next trip.

Highly recommend. There weren't many restaurants open  during covid. I went on the doordash app and Oceania grill is one of the only restaurant selections so I decided to give it a try and glad I did. I tried the red beans and rice, jambalaya and gumbo. The gumbo was so flavorful and they did not skimp out on the shrimp. Every bite had at least 2 shrimp! Everything was awesome. Next time id like to try their bbq shrimp!

I loved the fact that they had the digital menus. During COVID , I feel more comfortable doing this rather than having a hand out menu! The waiters and waitresses were EXCEPTIONAL!!!! Everyone was great and the food was even better. The taste of everything was on point and was hot and fresh! Fried Shrimp and fries platter is what I had. I cannot WAIT to go back to try other items because their dessert looked bomb !
The food here is great. I had a nice mixed drink called Swamp Tea. Awsome! Then I had a cup of gumbo which was a nice start. Then I had this Awsome seafood platter. I had enough food for 2 people .

Simply some of the best Cajun/Creole, New Orleans type food you can find. The crab cake appetizers were a hit and will not disappoint. Being a native, I never find red beans and rice I like except my homemade, but at Oceana they were awesome! They were very creamy with just the right amount of cayenne pepper. The beans were served with smoked sausage to compliment. I really appreciated the fact that the smoked sausage was not cooked in the beans, ruining the bean flavor, like so many restaurants do. My only gripe with the dish was the roll served with it. Very doughy and soft, not like the french bread I have been raised on. Otherwise a PERFECT dish.

I would give Oceana a 5, but the music as too loud. Killing the ambiance of our birthday celebration since it was difficult to hear anyone but the person directly next to you. So for that alone, I give it a 4 since I can't give it a 4.5. But Great Food!

Oh, I almost forgot; the homemade strawberry cheesecake was to die for!! Best in New Orleans.

The food is good, but the reason for this 5 star rating is largely due to the service. Our server, Darrick, was AWESOME! He was super knowledgeable about the menu including the *secret menu items* that aren't on the menu! We were able to make great choices because of his suggestions. He also just made us feel very welcome and gave us some tips about other eateries in the area. He's got a great smile and a winning personality, so hopefully you get him when you visit this restaurant!

We tried the gumbo soup, crawfish étouffée, taste of New Orleans, roasted oysters, redfish lamage (not sure on that spelling - it was an off menu item), bread pudding and brownie dessert. Everything was delicious. The oysters have some sort of sauce on them that makes them kind of wet, so if you are expecting a more dry roasted oyster, these aren't the ones for you. The brownie has more of a cake consistency than brownie so FYI on that too. 

This restaurant is definitely worth a try if you happen to be passing by.

What a wonderful find! My husband and I very much enjoyed our time here. The drinks, food, and atmosphere were all perfect. Errol and Lena provided excellent service as well. They made excellent recommendations and made us feel right at home. We'll definitely be back for some bloody Mary's and french toast (the best I've ever tasted). 
Highly recommend!

We stayed at the Omni Royal Orleans during recent visit to NOLA. We had plans to find dinner in more far-flung parts of the city this night, but the rain convinced us to check out Oceana Grill due to its proximity to our hotel. Apparently the rain had driven everyone within walking distance into the restaurant, as we had to wait outside for several minutes before being seated. I ordered a Sazerac, it was tasty. We had the BBQ shrimp first. This was my first time having Nola-style BBQ shrimp, so I have no standard to which to compare these, but I cannot imagine them being better anywhere else. They may have been the best thing I ate during my entire 5 day stay in New Orleans. I would drive back solely for this appetizer. Seriously, get them. We also shared a bowl of turtle soup; it was edible, but nothing extraordinary. Our entrees were delicious, I had the blackened duck and my girlfriend had the redfish, which was excellent. The dessert menu looked tempting, but we were far too stuffed to order anything. We went back for breakfast a few days later, and it did not disappoint. I recommend the Cajun omelet. The service was friendly during both of our visits, offering tips of the best places to try in town. Check this place out, you won't be let down!

The food was delicious! Ordered the alligator appetizer had both fried and chargrilled mixed, very tasty. The drink special for the night was a blue lemon drop great choice as well. Oceana's Famous Oysters also were tasty although it was my first time trying oysters prepared this way. The atmosphere was decent and bathroom was clean.

Great food and service, but I wish they correctly instated the city's covid guidelines instead of relying on the honor system at the door...it would make customers like myself feel more safe when dining.

Really enjoyed our meal & the atmosphere... the special of the fish, crab cake & shrink was yummy.  And our server Corey was 10/10.

Thanks guys!

Return visit to Oceana Grill. Our server Marv was amazing. He did a fantastic job of making sure we were taken care of and never had an empty cup. All of the food was delicious and drinks were strong. Definitely a must visit!
I'm really happy we went here, the Mardi gras pasta was delicious,  the famous oysters were some of the best food I've ever had,  jambalaya was amazing,

I was super excited to try this place out, and so a week before Mardi Gras, a friend came in town and insisted we go here, so we did. As a local, I can list about 7 other seafood restaurants that are better than this overpriced joint. My friend sent back her shrimp poboy because let's just be honest here, it was bland. The special that they had was also tasteless and was about $30 for a very small piece of fish with no flavor. The place wasn't even busy so I'm surprised that the food was so subpar.

We had a wonderful dinner. My husband and I walked straight in at 5:15pm with no wait and there was plenty of space between tables. We got the Redfish Oceana and a large Caesar salad with fried gator. They were two of the best dishes we had while visiting! Also, delicious bread pudding a la mode! My husband tried the brownie but wasn't as pleased -the brownie was hard and not warm in the middle.

Best restaurant on bourbon street especially since everything else is nasty as hell. Don't be afraid to venture out the French quarter for food! The food was awesome we ate there twice during our trip.
Took a while to get in, but was well worth it. We got our food super fast! Good portion sizes and great service.

If you are visiting NOLA make time to visit and eat here. My husband kids and I went here on a Sunday late morning around 11am for brunch. We ordered the half n half order of gator bites fried and blackened both were delicious and so tender. My husband enjoyed the gator so much he ordered a fried gator po boy. I ordered the seafood platter and ordered ny kids the pancake plate with a side of scrambled eggs. The seafood platters fish was so fresh and Fluffy, the oysters were big and seasoned well, the pancakes were thick and Fluffy with crispy edges. I would definitely come back again to try out their red beans n rice and alligator sausage also the service was good very friendly and fast.

Our first time in New Orleans. There was an accident on 1-12. So we came down south instead. After seeing the buildings & experiencing the big easy a  few hours. I'm thankful we detoured. We stopped to eat here & ordered the oceana famous oysters, amazing. They were suggested by our waiter Errol. He also suggested the Red fish la fush. I shared it with my hubs. Don't know if I'm spelling that right. But wow he was right so delicious. I loved eating here with my family. The food was delicious. Errol was on top of everything. He made me a fresh pot of coffee & was so friendly. Kudos to him! I would definitely come back.

wasnt the best, food was dry an tasteless. ordered the catfish was definitely cod..
xxxxxxxxxxx
Open very late which was great food was wonderful always is when we visit new Orleans and service was awesome thanks to our waitress Sierra!

Came here based on a recommendation from my uber driver, and I still dream of these oysters. They are absolutely delicious. I'm more of a raw oyster girl myself but I ordered some of the grilled oysters and they were pretty good too.
We loved this place! The best greens I've ever tasted. The fish was seasoned to a T! We actually visited twice in two days.

Came here on a Sunday night without a reservation and was seated in under 5 min. for two people. The service was excellent - we had Ben as our waiter - and our food came out quickly. I ordered a dozen of their famous chargrilled oysters and jambalaya pasta. Highly recommend both. Will definitely try to come back.

They have superb service! We order the oceana charred oysters they were okay. The one at felixs which is closed .. was much better. The alligator bites were amazing but I wasn't the biggest fan of the sauce that went along with it. The Louisiana taster I would just skip. The only dish that was good was the red beans and rice. But overall great experience. I don't know if I would eat there again, but it's a greater starter.

One of the best seafood platter I ever had from a regular restaurant like Oceana. The shrimp and fish were on point, tasting very fresh with the right amount of seasoning. The shrimp poboy here is great too though not the best I ever had. The seafoods spaghetti was also good. We came back here twice on our trip. I recommend.

The oceana oysters WOW delicious. The chicken Cesar salad was great and the praline brownie DO IT!! Kaitlin was a great server attentive friendly and has great recommendations. Will definitely be back!!
The food was delicious. Everything you would expect from a place in NOLA. However, our dinners came out before our drinks so that was kind of annoying...

It was the evening before mardi gras and our party of 5 got seated within 15 min. First off, this place is HUGE. I don't think 3 story restaurants exists where I'm from back in California. The food is pretty good, got to try a little bit of everything. Highly recommend their fresh oysters, jambalaya pasta, and deep fried alligator.
Delicious Cajun omelet, Bree the waitress attentive. Food served warm and timely.will definitely be back.

We ate breakfast here and it was fabulous. The courtyard dining area was very nice. The staff was great. Eroll was our server and very delightful. This location on Conti street was where the Old Nawlins Cookery used to be. That was my favorite place to eat more than 20 years ago and they are keeping the drinks and quality food still today. Don't miss this spot for breakfast. They open at 8am.

LOVE this place!  We have at least one meal here every visit: breakfast, lunch or dinner.  They are right off Bourbon in a very convenient spot.  Great bloody marys!  The food is always good, no matter what you try. I had an incredible crawfish omelet with crawfish etouffee for breakfast! The staff is warm and welcoming and the manager always comes by to check on you.  Lots of seating so never a wait.  Ask for Lloyd (or any of the other great servers!).  He'll take care of you!!

Read about this place and it went to the top of my list. And then our uber driver suggested it too! Love when a local suggests a place I've picked. Boy was she right too!  The first night in NOLA we went to a different place we remembered fondly from years ago and I was super excited just arriving for some Barbecue shrimp.  To say it was a disappointment is putting it lightly.  Second day we made our want Oceana Grill for lunch and I got the barbecue shrimp. HOLY WOW! I wanted to drink the sauce! I put it on the bread, on some grits, and a biscuit because I couldn't get enough of it. And the shrimp were SO BIG and SOOOOOOO fresh! Like they just pulled them out of the water. AMAZING is all I can say. We ended up there for lunch because the night before there was a line no less than 50 deep of  people waiting. Had I known. GO HERE. It's fantastic!
Bree is dope. Great food and good service ! I had the veggie pasta and everyone seemed to enjoy their food.
Excellent food, but servers were arguing and changed the dynamic if our experience. Lovely atmosphere on all dining levels.

Food took a little while but it was so worth it!!!! They were busy too but still gave us a wonderful service so 5/5 stars for that. Don't even get me started with the food!!! Their dishes are wonderful!!! I will miss this about new orleans for sure!! Must try.. just be mindful about parking especially at night... it's a busy area.

This place is not so grande but delivers the grandest flavors of NOLA!
I had the very best Red Beans and Rice with Sausage I think i have ever had... why???

Served piping hottttt, which is already a 5 Star dish!
The Beans were creamy but also unmashed beans was among the sauce, swimming on top of a bed of white rice and flanked by a nice, big smoked sausage with just a little kick!  A couple slices of crusty bread and it was all good!

Seriously, this was just so good, I want the recipe. Management, can you help a fan out???
Food was great, service was also great. A little on the pricey side but all in all pretty good. Although it isn't all that it is hyped up to be.
Delicious meal and fun atmosphere! Thank you to to Erica for being attentive and accommodating, especially to such a large group. We appreciate you!
The oysters are really good and the crawfish tuna and crab is so tasty. Definitely recommend  this place when in Nola.
I see why the line is out of the door. This place is delicious! The mardi gras pasta and red snapper were GREAT! Definitely will be back.

My boyfriend loves this place and he brought me here for my first time visiting New Orleans. The location is super close to everything but you can't really drive there. I got Taste of New Orleans because I wanted to know how New Orleans taste and yupp yummy chubi chubi doooo!!! My food was amazing. Our waiter is Chris, he is so nice and super helpful. Other staffs are also very hospitable, they always say hi and bye when we were in and out. Love this place we will come back!

We had no idea which restaurant to choose until we were greeted by a server walking by dropping off drinks to her table. She saw us looking around and made her move. I'm glad that she did because the food was beyond enjoyable in the sense that it definitely gave us the feel of the New Orleans vibe. I ordered the catfish platter and I must say that I have NEVER been a fan of catfish until now. The first crunch brought a smile to my face and made me feel so satisfied. This is why I came to New Orleans, I heard of the phenomenal creole food so you must try this restaurant if you're a foodie like myself. I take my hat off for the chef! Thank you

IMO, this place has the best Bloody Marys to be found in the area. They are spicy, and just the thing for that early morning pick-me-up. 
I have only had the brunch food, and it's always a hit with my group. The service can be a bit on the slow side, however.

Came here for dinner on a Saturday night (reservation recommended). This place had a very interesting layout. It's very big, three stories high with seating on each floor and very dimly lit. It's a pretty fun and laid back atmosphere. 

Darrick was an amazing and informative server. He gave us great recommendations and they were all wonderful. I ordered the alligator bites half fried, half blackened with a cup of gumbo. Everything was very tasty and flavorful and this was the best gumbo I've had in a minute. My friend gave me the rest of her crab cakes since she was so full. I was apprehensive to order the crab cakes because I've never had one that tasted good. I so regret not ordering my own they were the best I've ever had! The best part was the crawfish sauce they served on top of the cakes, so yummy! Wish we had room for dessert, next time hopefully.

Tried the special - blackened salmon burger and it was delicious! Quick service, and server split checks for a 6 person group with no issue. Good drinks as well. Looks like a chain but very good food for a nice price!!
This place is awesome. Specially Jenna is really kind. She knows what to do and her recommendation is really good~ I will definitely recommend this place.
This is perfect for tourists that have never eaten true New Orleans cuisine.   I ordered medium well and I received well! The greens are a waste of a side.

Love this place!!! Came in late at night, the food is just the right kind of food to settle your stomach after a night of heavy drinking (we ordered a catfish po'boy, crawfish etoufee, and grilled shrimp) and our server, April, was the best!! She was so knowledgeable and attentive, she made our night a 5 star experience! I would definitely come back and recommend my friends to do the same!

MY wife and I were here a couple of days ago and were disappointed in most everything.

My wife ordered the shrimp creole with craw fish and I ordered the shrimp fettuccine  Neither one of our dishes tasted that good.  My wife even had a Hurricane drink that wasn't that good.

From the wobbly table that we got to the bright lights shining through the 2nd story window because of the construction lighting.

The strange part was the line of people waiting to get in???

this place is an obvious tourist trap for people that just don't know any better

With so many other great place to dine at the French Quarter...

NOT recommend
Our server Kat was absolutely amazing! Times are tough during Covid but she was happy and helpful. Very attentive and made it the perfect lunch!!

During cover they still allowed us to have a party of 10! Mary was an amazing server! We were a bachelorette group, I know they can be really annoying but she handled it really well!  and amazing! Definitely recommend them!

This is the fourth time we have ordered take out from this restaurant. Their food is outstanding. Pasta is out of this world. My husband and our (adult) kids were  extremely pleased. We eat out all over the country with husbands field of work and New Orleans is one of our favorite places to try the cuisine. 
The big downfall is because of all the hurricane damage, road issues, etc., it is difficult to get within a block or two by car. In the evenings the roads are blocked off and people are everywhere. My husband dropped me off a block away and had to park almost two blocks away and come find me. Craziness. So, order delivery!! It was still warm when it got here and was delicious.
Be prepared to wait in line.  You can make reservations but not same day. The line moves but not quickly. The food was definitely worth the wait.

Wonder why we've never stopped in here. Convenient - right next door to Royal Sonesta. Josh is a very cordial and efficient bartender. 

Their raw oysters are twice as big as those we've been eating for the past 3 days at Acme. And fresh. We had to order a 2nd dozen because they were so tasty. 

We really love their red beans. Large bowl with an equally-large portion of creamy beans = our smiling faces shoving down big spoonfuls. But serving 1/2 of a hot dog-size link of Andouille prevented us from giving them 5*'s. 

All in all, a good stop off Bourbon St for food, cold drinks, and to catch sports on a couple of tv's. We'll remember to come back here next time we're in Nola.

Hmmm.... unsure about the hype for the place. I tasted food across many locations in New Orleans and found the food here to be average at best. The Cajun Bloody Mary was undrinkable. The fish entree (their signature dish) was acceptable but a tad over cooked. The oysters were over-flavored with other additions, thus losing that delicate original flavor of the oyster itself. 

Over all, food was acceptable but will not return again.

My waitress wasn't very friendly/playful considering the location, however was helpful. I had the taste of New Orleans but wasn't too impressed, but the red beans and rice were very good. What I was impressed with however was the chargrilled oysters they were FIRE! The sauce was extremely flavorful and they give you enough to where if you wanted that could be a meal. Don't think I would come back here though.

My wife and I stayed at Hotel St. Pierre and we came here because they had worked out a discount with the hotel. The food was great and our service was impressive.  We both had omelettes on a Sunday morning and were excited to find another New Orleans breakfast spot! The bloody mary's were awesome and the Saints fans were entertaining!  If you're looking for a great omelette and bloody mary you may want to give this place a go!

When you visit New Orleans, put this restaurant on your bucket list of things to try!  Trust me, you will not regret it.  My first meal was the grilled seafood (oysters, catfish, shrimp, hush puppies, and French fries) platter.  It was delicious, well seasoned and fresh.  John, our waiter, quickly served our drinks and appetizer.  Shortly after eating the appetizers, our meals arrived piping hot and good.  John frequently checked on us and refilled our drinks concluding a memorable experience.  As a matter of fact, we were so pleased that we came back the next day for breakfast and had seafood omelet with strawberry French toast and pleasantly pleased, again.  Although John wasn't our waiter, he ensured that we were well taken care of.  So, take a visit, sit in John's section and enjoy an experience like no other!!  On my next trip to NOLA, I will definitely eat here for many of my meals!  Thanks NOLA for a great weekend!

In a city where everyone claims to have great food, this place stands out . The food is fresh , the pay special attention to the small details. They also have great service. Remember 5 star food at 2 star prices , trust me  !!!!

Good Southern, New Orleans eats. 

Fun atmosphere. 

Just a block away from Bourbon Street.

Friendly staff.

(Food was a little on the too salty side for me, but still good.)
You know it's going to be good when there's a line! Friendly staff, generous portions and fresh shrimp. They put dry ice in their cocktails which is pretty fun. Well worth the wait!
Food was amazing. The line outside looks long but only took about 10 min as the place is a lot bigger than it looks from the outside. Regardless, it is definitely worth the wait.

This place is not worth the wait! 

Are we going to a club or a restaurant, because at 6pm on a Saturday I couldn't tell. Music was bumping and loud! The food was below average and lacking flavor. My wife and I had the gumbo, crab cakes and catfish PO boy. Gumbo was bland no spice and only 4 pieces of shrimp, the crab cakes were good but definitely not "world famous" and finally probably the worst PO boy I've had in the city. It has coleslaw on the sandwich... that should explain enough 


I'll put it this way no good Cajun will be on bourbon street
Had a great breakfast. Service was quick and food was delish! Markesha, our waitress, was awesome!

Really great restaurant! Well seasoned food, friendly service and great staff. Our server was Mary and she was a rockstar! Friendly, fast, checked-in on us and had nice sense of humor to boot! Bahamas Mama cocktails, blackened redfish over bed of jalapeño crawfish cornbread dressing with alligator sausage on top and all covered in mushroom crawfish cream sauce! Dessert was bread pudding with pecan praline sauce and yummy pecan pie with a touch of bourbon. Honey! It was everything! So enjoyable!
Whitney was legit the best waitress EVER! Her hospitality and warmth made the experience amazing. The food was BOMMMMMMMMMBBBBBBB.com
Not impressed with delivery. Crab Cake Pasta, 1 cake and 1/2 portion of pasta, also ordered a Greek salad and received a Caesar. Oh well

Food was amazing. Service absolutely wonderful!! Food comes out quick despite place being packed !! Portions people !!! The plates are heaping and bowls full !! You definitely get your money's worth and more !! Bloody Mary was delicious also ! Gotta try this place !

THE best food and service we have had all week! Everyone is very experienced and friendly and are great about taking coupons! 

The catfish and crawfish were sooooo good! Yummy!

If you're looking for great food and a more "local" experience in New Orleans, this is not the place. If you love restaurants like Bubba Gump Shrimp, Bucca De Beppo, Cheesecake Factory, etc, then this IS the place for you. The food and drinks are mediocre and orders we brought out wrong or food was cold. Thankfully, the way staff was very friendly and happy to help solve the many issues that came up.

Service was great but overall this place is overrated. I got the alligator tails after being sold to it by the hostess in line. Got half grilled and half fried and they were not good. The fried gator tails tasted fine but the grilled gator tails tasted so gamey and definitely not as good as $12.

The oysters were fine too but just OKAY.

This place sells itself as the #1 restaurant in New Orleans and that is absolutely false.

I'm just disappointed I paid so much here and was underwhelmed by the quality of the food.

Go to cochon or some place else instead for fried alligator.
The food is soooo good! I got taste of New Orleans and it is soooo good! Service is very fast, I'll say no wait at all! Satisfied!

I ate the redfish special and oysters. I woke up in the middle of the night to a special vomiting session of food poisoning.  Never going here again.

As for the rest of our experience here, we walked in and were greeted by the hostess who quickly sat us at a table and gave us menus.  We waited around 10 minutes, and nobody had stopped by to get our drink orders or greet us as their server.  The restaurant was not packed.  We flagged down a random server walking by and asked them for assistance, and they stated they would get our server to come by.  Another 10 minutes pass, and we have to ask another server for help and finally our assigned server shows up.  Our server takes our order, and the food comes out.   But we do not have any silverware/napkins.  We have to tell the server again, and this goes on through the dinner there and eventually we just resort to asking the manager for assistance for the rest of the night.
The food here was lukewarm. It's super busy . I wouldn't come back  I like piping hot food where it's burning my mouth

I discovered this restaurant while on vacation with my wife. We are big food connoisseurs and wanted somewhere that had a variety of Cajun style food and we hit the jackpot with this place. We decided to eat here for dinner. When we got there we were not too sure what to expect from the outside appearance and there was a long line, but we waited it out and after 30 minutes we were seated. We were taken upstairs and seated by a window with a beautiful view of the street. Our waitress was very friendly and made excellent recommendations. I got the catch of the day, which was a blackened red fish over fettuccine noodles. Our entire experience was excellent here and I would highly recommend it for anyone from out of town like myself, who is looking for an authentic New Orleans experience.
Absolutely awesome food and service. Even a selection of vegetarian items - delicious. Service is amazing.

How this place has a decent rating is beyond me. We waited for a table for over an hour. Food was terrible to average. Our waters were never refilled. Our waitress was terrible. She was cold & not very friendly. She did the bare minimum. And, we found out why when the bill came...there was an automatic gratuity added to a table of 5! There was zero incentive for her do a good job. She was getting paid no matter what. So many places to eat in NOLA, this place should never be considered.

An absolute MUST!

Our concierge suggest Oceana to us, and I am SO glad that we waited in the 45 minute line--it was so worth it.

We started with gator bites, chargrilled oysters, regular oysters, and I finished with a solid 1/2 rack of ribs. Every bite was better than the last, and it was very reasonably priced, too.

Fantastic service, cheap beers, and a great balcony over a courtyard. 

Make sure you get Erroll as your server--he's a sweetheart.

This absolutely hands down one of my best experiences eating at a restaurant. Our waitress Ashleigh was fantastic quick, to the point, and very attentive and genuine. Made sure we chose what she thought was best when we're undecided. I had the taste of New Orleans, and the rest of my party got the spinach ravioli fried fish special of the day and Cajun jambalaya pasta. 
Appetizers we started with was just the crab cakes, they were so full of crab meat and delicious seasoning with the most perfect sauce doused on top of them. This was a great start to an amazing meal. The ravioli believe it or not was absolutely FANTASTIC, THE BEST I HAVE EVER TRIED!! The taste of New Orleans left me completely and utterly satisfied and with a mouthful of culinary experience I have never had before. The Cajun jambalaya pasta was so delicious with alligator sausage that was sweet with pieces or should I say chunks of soft shredded meat. The fish had a flavor of its own with that absolutely splendid sauce. Also just to add more to what I loved, the watermelon margarita and the Abita beer where delicious. 
When I say I haven't been this satisfied with food in a long time I mean it. I absolutely loved it and definitely will be coming back in the future. Go support them during this difficult time!!

This is by far the best restaurant in New Orleans. From the moment we walked into the restaurant to the moment we walked out. Hostess were nice, the manager Tim stopped by our table asked where we were from and joked with us. Our server Zachary brought everything we needed without asking and was very friendly as well. (Sorry pictures aren't the best I screenshot from a video). The place is clean and welcoming. I highly recommend.

Crab cakes were mushy and Smelled fishy...as in, "bad" fishy. I questioned whether I should eat it or not but figured maybe it was just me because I never eat crab cakes. I didn't get sick, so that's good. I caught a little glimpse of the kitchen, while walking to the restroom. Does Gordon need to come back?  It looked filthy. Service was okay.  We won't be back.

I've eaten here before and had great service. But, dude! Have they gone downhill! I ate here over the weekend with a few friends. I just came across the  reciept and had a free minute. Our waitress was Kim P. And when I say rude, i mean, worst waitress ive ever had. The food was up to par, as normal. Everything was taking a long time, which I get. Stuff happens. But that's not an excuse to have an ugly attitude. Any time we asked for something, she rolled her eyes. And mumbled under her breath as she walked away. Then, one of my friends got up to use the restroom and as he walked past her, he overheard her talking about cheap her table was. I mean, idk if it was us, or someone else, but either way, not cool!!! Idk when ill go back.  If i wanted to get talked to like crap,  id go eat at my in-laws.  And not sure id like to go somewhere with standards this low.

Truly disappointed. Hostess handling the To-go ordered was very inattentive and so was the other person assisting in running the orders. They were mostly complaining about being at work and being pretty rude to people who were there to pick up orders. I was there well before my order was ready and somehow I still got cold food. Food would have probably been good if it had been hot. We ordered to go and it took me 5 minutes to get to my room. The food was straight up cold, not even warm. As I that were not enough,  we were missing an 2 dishes from the order. When I called in and spoke to the manager, he implied that I was not being truthful. He stated that the hostess had checked my order before I left which I know wasn't true because my order was brought out by someone else and handed to me by the hostess after the bag had been sitting there for what was probably 5+ minutes. At the time, I didn't know this was my order. After I explained to the manager how his employees had handled themselves he just stayed quiet and said he would refund the cost of the two dishes.  Although I appreciate the gesture, it doesn't change the experience I had with the staff and the food. It's unfortunate because I was looking forward to eating there.
Oysters were incredible. Very flavorful. A must visit when in New Orleans. I highly recommend.

This place hit the spot. Came here to help after Ida and for first week no one had power but when power was restored we decided to try this place out. Had the gator bites both fried and grilled. Also had the Cajun jambalaya pasta. Both Amazing! Service couldn't have been better. The food came out quick and hot and we had a party of 9. This place was so good had to come back and try the fried shrimp platter and the shrimp were huge. Again a service was spot on didn't have wait for anything. I highly recommend this place.

This is a must go to, wait in line, join the waitlist destinations of New Orleans.   The food is always good, fresh, and plentiful...I recommend ordering a to go box as soon as your food comes out.  I absolutely love this place and the service is thumbs up too!   Stop looking around for other places and go directly to Oceana Grill.

There were four of us dining at Oceana Grill on Saturday, 3/7/2020, as part of a weekend celebration. Our expectations were high because this place was highly recommended and proximal to our hotel. Well, once we were seated, the madness began.This was an all time low, as I can't ever remember being treated this poorly in an establishment! Our waiter, Marv, was terrible. Marv had a rude/disgraceful attitude and his level of service was even worse! He never smiled nor checked on us, and never brought any silverware out until I asked him to do so. It appeared as though he did not WANT to wait on us, for some reason... I actually told him that he needed to improve his level of service and that we had no silverware
& to bring my gumbo before, not with, my entree. He then returned & placed our silverware in a pile for each of us to divide up. I asked for tartar sauce, Marv brought ranch dressing. Marv brought the checks to us in a stack for us to sort out. I summoned him over & told him to properly give each of us our bill. He then did not properly hand it- but tossed it over! I reported him to Richard, the Manager, who appeared apathetic, was no better and did not seem to have any control over Marv nor did he care that I complained. As we were leaving, Richard began his sentence with "The next time.." and one person in our quartet looked at Richard and immediately and angrily replied "There will not be a next time!!!" Needless to say, we were immensely disappointed in this establishment which clearly did not live up to even minimal service industry standards. Do not waste your time here!

expected a lot more from a place with over 6000 reviews and 4 stars. my family of 12 came and ordered plates and two apps. none of them really blew us away, but the reason i'm giving this place one star is because the wait was over an hour. we didn't even see our waiter for over 30 minutes-his name was chris. my starving family was ready to eat some good new orleans cajun. this was a huge disappointment.

Great food!!!! We had 7 people and everyone absolutely loved their meal!!! We also loved our waitress Mary!! She was amazing and made the overall experience great!!! Thank you Oceana and Mary you did not disappoint!!!
The good here is just amazing. That's it. If you want quality food, this is the place to be. We had a group of about 8 people who each ordered something different. And we each loved our orders.

This place was great. HIGHLH recommend a reservation. Line was long, but it was moving at a good pace. We tried the po boys they were delicious as well as the seafood gumbo. Rate this place overall a 9/10
Very good catfish and steak my friend got their "Fall off the bone" ribs and said they were amazing! My first time in N.O. And this really set the bar high to top Easy 5 star restaurant
Oooooohhhhhhhhh myyyyy God! Yessssss.  Drinks  oysters  jambalaya  crème brûlée . I'm pretty sure I gained 3 lbs in one dinner but it was worth it.

We went here once and really liked it, food was good and service was good. Came back a second time and while eating  we found a plastic lid in our gumbo. Called waiter he called manager and she brought us out a new one. Ordered some desert and found a piece of paper on our banana fosters ice cream cake. At this time i didn't bother calling them anymore. Got our check she didn't even take off our gumbo for convenience. Be aware of what's in your food.

We ordered delivery which is always a risk to quality. Ordered the Cajun jambalaya pasta which was supposed to have shrimp and alligator sausage. It had two pieces of sausage and reasonable amount of shrimp but it tasted like those frozen cocktail shrimp.

It was also very bland tasting for a Cajun jambalaya. Was expecting way more spice and flavor. Same sentiment for the other dishes my party ordered. The blackened chicken apparently didn't have much flavor either.

Got a bite of the crab cake pasta and that was better but still not as amazing as expected. The crab cake was pretty big and meaty but again the pasta was only mediocre.

We also had a weird delivery mixup where they forgot a gumbo. They said they'd come back and get it to us but it was somehow dropped off at the wrong hotel which is weird. When it finally came, it was also mediocre food. It tastes like gumbo we'd get in like Seattle. 

Honestly food itself is just like a 2.5, rounding down to a 2 with the issues with delivery and timing.

We went to OG Monday @ 8pm and found the lines to be Super SUPER LONG. Made a reservation for Tuesday and got there at 5:30pm, line was SUPER SUPER LONG. Front desk staff were super nice and got us seated right away. Everything looked good on the menu, we ordered Louisiana Crab Meat Cakes, Gator Tail Bites, Cajan Fries (1/2 order), Blackened Redfish Etouffée, Mardi Gras Pasta, Kentucky Bourbon Pecan Pie, La Boheme Creme Brulee, and Oceana Praline Brownie. It was a lot of food and everything, I mean, EVERYTHING was just AMAZING. It is truly Creole and Cajun style with the right flavors and spices. Service was really good, food was served in a timely manner and we never felt like we were waiting too long or rushed. Had an amazing time !!!
We came for a special 21st birthday celebration and in the midst of COVID we still had a memorable time! Jaime L. Made our dinner perfect, she was on top of it!!!

Came here for our last dinner in New Orleans.
It is quite close to Bourbon St if that's your plan.
There was a line but we did not have to wait that long, maybe 10 minutes.
We ordered the Gumbo - this was full of seafood and was really good. 
We also ordered the crabcakes. This I would recommend because the crawfish sauce they glaze it with pairs with the crab very well.
We also got fried and blackened Alligator - this tasted like chicken.
Overall not a bad experience.

I made a visit to the restaurant from a recommendation and it was perfect! The simple dishes and amazing taste and great New Orleans feel. You MUST order the bread pudding. To die for! Can't wait to go back.

We  drop in Oceana every time we are in Nola. Often twice in one trip.  Oysters are the best on the gulf coast and we live on the gulf coast. Our waiter Carlton was personable and knowledgeable of current offering.  Highly recommend.  If you visit Oceana, ask to be seated in Carlton's section!

The wait staff when you walk in is super nice , friendly and welcoming.

We were a party of 15 so there were a lot of us to seat and accommodate. The food is a hit or miss , some of the the items we had were really delicious such as the bbq shrimp , gator bites ( fried) and sautéed and then the strawberry cheesecake was to die for.

The fried fish and shrimp could have used some more seasoning but it wasn't horrible. The drinks are very strong and priced at a decent price . 

Our waitress took a long time to check us out and the manager had to get involved to help her speed up the process. The music is very calming, so calming that it out most of our table to sleep , because as soon as they left they all wanted to go home :-(. I would strongly recommend to maybe have some more lovely music , after all you are located on 1 of the most lively streets in the USA

Health code should be considered a must. Needs more levels of cleanup and deep clean especially the kitchen. There should be No cross contamination. I walked in and walked right out I walked around to see the service and I watched others food look great and other not so good. Quality over quantity is a must. It needs to be fresh sell to order. No microwave reheating is a big No thanking you.

The service was just terrible.  Server would up and disappear, didn't check on the tables much at all, our food came out about 20 minutes later than every other table around us, which were all seated way after we were (party of 4).  Took at least 15 minutes just to get a draft beer.  Appetizers didn't come out before the entrees like they should have, in fact the oysters came out like 5-10mins after the rest of the food and one of the appetizers.  The oysters were also very questionable.  So much so, we stopped eating them and spit some out.  Had to go to the manager just to get a the check because the server was no where to be seen.

All in all, terrible experience.

Really 2.5....this was overhyped to me...service wasn't bad but the food was just average to me.  I had the shrimp poboy and jambalaya.  The shrimp was fried so hard I had to send them back, they were also bland in taste.  The Jambalaya was just ok. The food or drinks Weren't worth standing in line for.
janell was a good server and food was really good. the host (i didn't catch his name) was amazing and so funny!

New Orleans this time was just unusual for me . I have been here a few times but this trip just showed me the spirit of this city . 
After 8 Hours drive on a rainy day with my family (includes a Furkid) was hoping to eat my fav southern lunch . Called the restaurant to check if they would  have some place to seat us as we were there with our dog.. the manager was so kind to seat us inside with our dog as it was raining outside.
We ordered the famous charbroiled oysters with gator bites and southern fries . Quantity of fries was quite a lot . We loved the gator fries and oysters quite a lot . Oyster was sizzling when it arrived on our table . 
I did not like the hurricane as much but other than tat the food was amazing. 
I would give them special stars for taking care of our dog when we arrived , treating him with love .

The place aligns with the New Orleans culture and the atmosphere is great. The meal was perfection and the staff was  wry accommodating. I have made it my mission to eat here at least once when I'm in town. I look forward to my next trip.

High prices and slow service, this is where tourists go, not locals. Locals have all been here at least once, but they won't recommend it. Some of the best food in the world so don't get sucked into this place you will pay 30% more for 50% less in quality.
Best crab cakes I had in a while . Gator bites were good as well. Worth the wait . Long wait but glad we waited. Nice service
An absolute must-visit spot in New Orleans. Extremely delicious and the wait staff is so friendly! It was also the first time I ever tasted duck and OMG, fantastic! Please try it, it's so good!

My friends and I went there for lunch on Friday May 21st. The restaurant was actually recommend from our 1st Lyft driver who was very helpful on where to. We didn't have a reservation, we walked in, Manager Kesua took great care of us which we thought she was the hostess, and my friends and I made it to the restaurant on time before it became a long line out. The restaurant is very small, old historic type building, and majority of the tables are small. Kesua, told us about the menu, I informed her I can't do any spicy foods, she brought us some shrimp gumbo(no charge) to sample it. That shrimp gumbo wasn't spicy just so delicious. My lunch I ordered the full rack of ribs along with fries, one friend ordered Cajun fries, and the other friend had small bowl of shrimp gumbo, and crab cakes. Plus, we all the hurricane alcohol drink that was too good. My full rack was so much that I ate the 1st rack of ribs there, and took the other back to the hotel. The Oceana restaurant whenever in New Orleans I highly recommend it when out in the French Quarters you won't be did at all.

Okay, the French 75 was excellent. And the oysters, well, I could write home about them they were so good. Their was enough horseradish, enough catsup that all was good. 

However, the fried eggplant was not so good. Either the oil was old or not hot enough or something, but the horrible observation they beset me almost had me throwing up on Bourbon Street. That never happens to me!
Great spot! Food was good & the staff was friendly & helpful!

Had a wonderful meal at the Oceana.    Service was fast and they were very attentive.   We had the crab cakes for an appetizer which were the best we had while in the city that weekend.  Main courses were shrimp creole and grilled fish with crawfish étouffée and both were delicious.   Staff was attentive and although we sat in the bar area and it was busy we were given plenty of attention by the staff.   I would highly recommend this restaurant when you are in New Orleans.
Great food had the bbq shrimp and ribs. The staff was super friendly.

So so good, glad this was our birthday dinner choice!! 

Crab cakes are a must, and I highly suggest the gumbo and blackened gator bites!! 

Everything was fresh and tasty!!

The first time I went here a few years ago the food and service was outstanding. I went here this past weekend with a party of 11 and the food was whatever and our server was awful.
