I don't know if she just didn't care bc she was already getting 20% gratuity but she was slow, rude, and never came back to check on us. We were there for over 2 hours! They brought half our tables food out and the brought the rest 20 min later. 

The food was mediocre. It all tasted like something I could get somewhere else. 

There are so many great spots to eat in the city. I'd never come here again.

Nicole B. was THEE best waitress we had in NOLA during our lunch! Found this place based on Yelp and everything everyone suggested was amazing! Charred oyster, raw oysters, chicken Alfredo, stuffed tuna, and especially those crab cakes! It was incredible. Highly recommended!
Food was good. Indoor seating was available. This was my first time trying alligator (tasted like chicken). Their drinks were decent. Looks like your typical seafood restaurant inside.

5 stars for service, 3 stars for food.

My family decided to go to Oceana for breakfast since my mother had noticed a line outside twice within a day. Everyone at the restaurant was extremely friendly & hospitable - 3 people came to check on us throughout our meal! It was also a great atmosphere; however, the food was not nearly as remarkable. Considering it was a little pricey, the food was not very flavorful and was a little boring compared to the menu descriptions. Overall, Oceana is a place with wonderful people, but average food.

First time in New Orleans and this is a place with one of the most and highest ratings so I decided to give it a try. Made a reservation for 2:30 pm and got there around 2:25pm and was seated by 2:35. The waiter was quite busy so didn't take our order for about 10 minutes but that gave us enough time to order everything we wanted when he came around. I ordered the Cajun fries with blackened alligator and the taste of new orleans as an entree. My husband ordered the bayou duck. The food was okay, I wasn't wowed by the food. It is pretty basic food and I'm guessing the high amount of ratings is due to its location so it is frequently visited. The taste of new orleans came with three different dishes and when the food was brought out no really explained which was which. Also the bread my disk came with wasn't the best. My husband liked the bayou duck and said it was good. I would not recommend this place honestly its pretty basic and nothing special.
Wonderful spot! Great food, great service. Get the Cajun fries and blackened chicken po-boy. Top notch stuff.

Well worth the wait! There's a reason for the line but it moves fast. This restaurant is huge! Great place to dine with family and friends. It really sets the tone for New Orleans. Very lively and fun. 

The food is incredible. Delicious is an understatement. You have to just try it all. From the chargrilled oysters, to the Cajun pasta and save room for dessert. The bread pudding is mouth watering goodness.
Road tripping through New Orleans and found this place , it was recommended by many, and the  food is really amazing and the staff is great!!!! A must try.

So yummy and the staff was great! We had a large group but we got to sit at the top floor which was really spacious. There was a super long line for people without a reservation so I definitely recommend making one!
Great seafood, loved the platter, patio ambiance was great,  servers and management were very attentive.
Expected more from this place. Kept having to look for my server and the food was subpar. Disappointed
The seafood  omelette with one pancake WAS EVERYTHING. . THANKS NICOLE also my strawberry cheesecake was good as well

This is an alright option to try if the lines to other places are getting out of hand. 

Oceana is a solid place with good food, it just happens to be surrounded by places that are amazing. 

I had their gumbo here which I enjoyed but didn't fall in love. Though falling in love with gumbos is hard. They play games and end up leaving you hurt in the end. Took my awhile to get over my last gumbo love. 

I would like to say however that this is a good spot if you want to come grab some dessert. I got the New Orleans Bread Pudding and loved it. While my friend got the Bananas Foster Ice Cream which I tried and that was great as well.

Alright place, with amazing desserts.
Fantastic! Mary the waitress made me my first hurricane! There were 2 staff DEDICATED to our table and I cannot tell you how delicious everything was. Top notch!

This was by far my FAVORITE restaurant during my short trip here in New Orleans! My friends and I arrived around 5pm on a Saturday. Although there was a line, we waited only about 10 mins before being seated. We ordered the gator bites, Louisiana crabmeat cakes, cajun fries, cajun jambalaya pasta, and a cheeseburger. You absolutely cannot go wrong with any of the aforementioned. The Cajun fries surprised us the most because we obviously did not read the description but the fries are topped with a delicious crawfish mushroom cream sauce. Just a FYI, that "cajun fries" actually ended up being poutine-like but still super delicious! 

Also, my friends and I appreciated that this restaurant allowed us to bring in outside drinks in. While waiting in the heat, we ordered some slushie cocktails to go from a store across the street. We did not have any issues bringing them in whatsoever. Service was excellent and our food was super filling. The ambiance gives me a sports bar feel and it's just overall a good time with great music. Give this place a try if you're around because it definitely won't disappoint!

They actually get 5 stars because they were amazing and excellent during a pandemic!!! Just thankful to have good food in a difficult time without being taking advantage of... The seafood platter good, bbq shrimp is excellent, pecan pie on the small side but amazing!!! Customer & delivery service perfect... Will update my review after brunch. 

The chicken pain perdu is a must try!!! It was my favorite along with the bbq shrimp...

I would highly recommend this establishment and look forward to coming back during better times!

They deliver through Uber Eats !!!!! That came in handy when my flight got in after 9:00 pm and I was already craving New Orleans food. Red beans and rice, gumbo, and bread pudding. Strange combination but oh so good !
I had the crabcake pasta there last month. The sauce was great but the crabcake was meh!

This was probably the best food I had while in Nola. We came during brunch and it was busy but worth the wait. The staff here is so friendly and welcoming; the waiter came around multiple times to check up on us and see if we needed anything. It's a great location on a busy street for tourists. We actually came across this restaurant while waiting for another brunch place, and so happy we made that decision. 
The food was delicious. The perfect touch of Cajun seasoning! Crab cake and chicken fettuccine Alfredo pasta were the best I've ever had. Perfect portion and great flavor. 
When I come back to Nola, will definitely be back here!

I keep on thinking of New Orleans everytime i think of Oceana Grill! this place is a must to visit and enjoy their delish foods when you visit New Orleans! good Customer Service and the place is always packed!!! good food, a bit pricey but worth the money!!! if you love oysters, dont forget to get that tray of raw oyster! what a treat!

It was my first time in Nola and this is the one place i had to revisit before i departed. From breakfast to lunch to dinner the food was alll amazing. The staff is so friendly and the service is excellent. Bbq shrimp, mardi gras pasta and blackened steak were fabulous!

We were in NOLA for 4 nights. We came here twice. And waited in line both times. Worth it! This has to be one of the best restaurants in the area. It's open late when all the other places are closed. We got 5 star service from our waitress, Destine. Dang! I can't remember our first girls name but man the food was great, the prices are reasonable. That Praline brownie was like $8! Anyways, 5 star approval!

My friend and I had just finished a couple of walking tours and she was still hungry so we went to Oceana, which she had been wanting to try for a while. It was around 10 pm on a weeknight, and while there was still a line, it wasn't nearly as long as their normal wait from what I've read. Anyways, we were taken through the restaurant and seated in their outdoor courtyard, which appeared to be in the middle of the restaurant. The courtyard was really awesome and the ambiance was amazing- casual but fun. 

Sadly I wasn't super hungry as I ate some snacks we picked up in between our vampire/ voodoo tour and our true crime tour. So I wasn't able to partake in the full on dining experience here, which was pretty unfortunate since they offer a variety of foods that all sound incredible. But I did order an appetizer -fried zucchini sticks- which was delicious. I guess fried vegetables is a thing in the South, and I'm definitely here for it. Lol. Anyways, the fried zucchini was excellent, especially with the flavorful dipping sauce.

If I ever go back to New Orleans, I will definitely be returning to Oceana, and I would absolutely request to be seated in the courtyard again.
We had a great experience! Yummy food and awesome service!! We had the crab cakes and blackened chicken, perfection. Clean and fast service
Shrimps, oysters and olives were delicious. Drink was okay. It's a good energy boost after a long night.
The gumbo and hush puppies were fire but the catfish was not crispy. Chicken and sausage gumbo was great and came with buttery bread. Overall good and reasonable prices.

Went here on a whim and the food was fresh, but the flavors were lacking.  Its a quick convenient spot on the corner of Conti and Bourbon street.  Its a great way to pit something in your stomach either before or after you indulge in alcohol.

We came here for brunch on our last day. We hear that it's usually a long line but for breakfast, not so much. We didn't wait at all and when we walked in, the place wasn't too busy. Perfect. 
Our waitress was so kind and poured our mimosas every time she saw them getting low. 
I ordered the Cajun seafood fried rice plate with two bennies on the top, as per my request. My husband ordered the French toast. When we got our food, we scarfed! After I unleashed half a bottle of Louisiana hot sauce on my rice, I smashed the entire plate and there was A LOT of rice. Husband was also quite pleased with his sweet brunch option. Our compliments to the chef--we literally couldn't walk around and do much after eating that meal!

We came in very late (but if you are going to be open then ....).  Our waiter seemed like he just wanted us to get on with it.  Food dropped off with hardly a word (and all courses together).  He dropped off the change at the end without us even seeing him do so (ie he didn't say thank you, kiss my butt, get out, nothing).  Food was average but service was horrible.  If you want the red lobster of New Orleans food with bad service go there.
This spot was pretty good I ordered a daiquiri while I waited for my food to go. The bar was closed. Took the food to go, the bread pudding is out of this world!

Wasn't impressed by decor but I can get over that.  
Service was meh.  
I was soooo excited to try this place from the reviews only to be let down. 
Ordered grilled oyster (could only eat three) 
Ordered crab cakes: They were ok.  Nothing to write home about. 
Ordered red fish and shrimp: This was pretty decent.  
GOOD LUCK on your visit.  
Sincerely hope it's better than mine.
BEST cajun food and drinks in NoLA! super cute place, and food was so good we went twice in one trip. Highly recommend the crabcake pasta and Bahama Mamas!

You must order the charboiled oysters!  6 just wasn't enough!  There was a huge line but it moved pretty quickly even at 1pm!  Service was great, and the rest of the food we ordered was really tasty too.  The shrimp po-boy had tons of juicy shrimp and fried to perfection!

While the service was lovely here.... the food fell flat. The  mimosas were made with bad OJ... they didn't have they're charbroiled oysters and the seafood gumbo was blah. The fried catfish and chicken gumbo were amazing! If the construction stops and the patio is open, go for sure!
Errol was outstanding!!!  Food and drinks were great!  I'll be going again in the near future.

Ate at this establishment twice during our stay in New Orleans and it's so good! Staff is very friendly and the service is great. Our first night we ordered the Oceana Oysters, Etoufee Fries, and the Shimp. The Second night we ordered the Rockerfeller Oysters and the Crab Cakes and that was also very delicious.  I'd love to try their pasta the next time we're in town!
The alligator bites are delish and the service is always fantastic. Looking forward to returning.

Short story: I told a friend of mine I was visiting NOLA and she said i must visit this restaurant. With that said, I made up my mind to have my first meal in NOLA there. 
                     When I arrived at the restaurant with my family, we were greeted by a very pleasant hostess who escorted us to our table. Our server came a few minutes later who took our drink orders. I had the classic hurricane which was how I remembered it many years ago on a past visit to New Orleans. Liquid candy goodness at its best. For appetizers, we had the crab cakes, which I highly recommend, followed by alligator tail bites, served blackened and fried (Delicious). Lunch Main Course consisted of Red fish w/ crawfish ettoufe on top, red skin mash and . Absolutely amazing dish. My brother on the other had had the Bayou Duck, which was cooked and seasoned to perfection. Damage after 10% discount was 195 with gratuity included. Not bad for a party of 5. I highly recommend this restaurant. Hope to go back soon

Oceana was very welcoming! When you walk in everyone is ready to greet you & seat you! It was quick and not a big wait at all! Got drinks within two seconds of us being seated & food orders came shortly after! If you're in the French quarter I'd recommend stopping by for a bite before running the streets

The place is very nice and well set. 

If you like typical American Confort Food with a local hint, definitely this is your place. 
Heads up!... There is a reservation policy for 24 hours in advance.

If you are a High Demanding Foodie... please, please..., do not waste your time! ...I know..., everybody visits this place..., yes!... but is not an attraction, is just a word of mouth thing.

...Trust me, there are so many great restaurant options to visit, where you will really enjoy a fantastic experience with their food.

Bon appetit!

This is a fun place, and we ate in the little courtyard. I mentioned to the manager that I was a travel advisor and he offered to give us a tour. There are all kinds of rooms where you can reserve for a private party. It just keeps on going! Food and service were very good, with reasonable prices. Had our first bowl of gumbo here. Yum.

My friends and I had a great experience here. There was a line outside but they're very efficient and the restaurant is huge inside.

Must haves:
*Blackened Alligator bites (if its you're first time get the half/half - blackened and fried)
*Red Fish
...I think anything blackened will be delicious here

Don't get:
*Any Fettucine...just not worth it...probably just not the best noodle for the pasta

Crab cakes were good but the alligator bites are better

Food was excellent, taste of New Orleans was perfect! Blackened gator bites were the best ever, tender not chewy. Outdoor seating was comfortable, Erica the server was very polite and knowledgeable. Will definitely recommend and come back!

This place was one of the most highly recommended places in New Orleans. This was only my first food stop when I was there, & I was extremely overwhelmed with joy. Everything was so good especially the famous oysters. I also had the redfish special which was decent, but had a taste of a friend's redfish etouffee which was even better so I would get that instead next time. The blackened alligator bite was an amazing snack as well. The jambalaya was just okay to me, it had a "spaghetti-y" flavor which I wasn't expecting (not sure what authentic jambalaya is supposed to taste like but I didn't care for it here), & both the shrimp & chicken gumbo was really good here when Louisiana hot sauce was added.

Came back here another time & had crawfish  Cajun fries, SO good. Also, shared both Jambalaya pasta as well as the chicken Alfredo. Both pastas needed more seasoning for sure. I wouldn't come back for the pasta next time.

The reason I gave it 4 stars is because after trying other places, I realized there were better chargrilled oysters & jambalaya elsewhere (refer to ACME on yelp & to my Coterie review). I definitely think this place is just a popular touristy restaurant & would suggest you look into other restaurants for specific dishes that its known for. However, if it's your first time in NO like it was mine, going here to experience it at least once wouldn't be a bad choice. I still feel like you'd leave here with a happy tummy like I did. As for coming back, I would stick with the famous oysters, gumbo, Cajun fries &/or blackened alligator next time.

BEST FOOD and Great prices. Authentic, delicious and fresh food! Staff is helpful, friendly, smiles. The Knife & Firk Ribs had the best flavor, sauce like I like it and fall off the bone!! get the corn too! I don't know what they put in the corn but it is soooo good! Also Shrimp & Grits, Awesome.  Red Fish is huge. Try it Lightly blackened! It's so thick and big! You won't go hungry. We went there 4 times so that was once a day we were there!
Food was delicious, the staff was so friendly and helpful on clanking good food choices! Go early they are very busy and have a line!

Just had the best server in the world at Oceana Grill! When you come ask for Pamela K. She even went out of her way to make sure she timed the appetizers and entrees to come out hot and ready for my husband and I. The experience she gave us made our time in New Orleans amazing.

came in at dinner time. We were seated immediately and our server was wonderful. The food was great those Cajun fries are amazing. The downside is that there wasn't 6 feet between tables. Large table seated about 3 feet away from ours. We won't be going back u til they fix this. I was very worried all through my meal.

My sister & I got into town this afternoon so we needed somewhere to get our trip started, and this was the place!!! Our server was very friendly, easy to talk to & made sure we were all good with everything we needed! The food was delicious! I ordered the Taste of New Orleans & boy oh boy did it hit the spot! The vibe of the place was great as well. Overalls I would highly recommend!

When we got there, the line was out the door and down the street! But it went really quick, and we were sat in no-time flat. I had the spicy braised chicken, with jambalaya and that green veggie stuff lol. It was awesome. Can't wait to return.

Definitely glad we made reservations. Loved this place! The food and service was really good. Our waiter, Zachery, was awesome! He gave great food recommendations and was on it with the food and drinks. We were a party of 5 so we washed tried something different. We tried the Catfish, oysters (both raw and fried), gumbo, jambalaya, and alfredo. Everything tasted really good but our favorite was the gumbo and the jambalaya. Will definitely come back here again on our next trip.
Generic cajun food. You could have better for cheaper everywhere around ...

Awesome place. I ate here 3 times during my 3 week stay in New Orleans. The service and food was great. The blackened duck and blackened redfish were the best I've ever had. Their oysters are great as well. I had the chargrilled and Rockefeller's. If I ever go back to this town I will eat here again.

This place was such a nice surprise. At a glance, I thought it would be a typical Nola, kind of cheesy, seafood place where I couldn't eat anything (I'm a vegetarian). We saw online that there were a couple dishes that were vegetarian-friendly but not very exciting, like fettucine alfredo.

In actuality, the interior is pretty unique - lots of different levels to the restaurant, a really cool courtyard in the middle, balcony you can stand on, kind of hard to find your way around in but the staff was so friendly and very attentive to people wandering around looking lost. Good lighting and volume in the place - you could hear a background of people talking but also hear everyone at your table too. 

Servers were awesome, very casual and friendly, very happy to explain dishes and options. 

At first, I was disappointed because the menu in the restaurant did not have any of the vegetarian friendly options on it that are on the website. This is my major critique - the menu on site should have these items on it. Luckily, we asked the server and she confirmed that these options were still available, just "off-menu." I ordered the spinach ravioli expected it to be pretty basic and underwhelming. I was wrong!!! It was very well made and had super fresh spinach and kale cooked in, great seasoning, great cheese filling. I also ordered a cocktail which was super cool - they use dry ice in most of them which was fun, and it was seriously delicious, AND it was only like 8 bucks. Usually anything fancy with dry ice will run you $12+. I would go back just for drinks if I was able to.

It's also notable how well they handled our party of 14 people. It was impressive!
It was a great experience. Very authentic New Orleans Food. We are from Los Angeles and our server Nicole B was amazing. So personal and attentive. Treated  us like family.

It was great, great service, good food! Great atmosphere!
Try the Oceana famous oysters, they are good!
Nice restaurant, good stuff. I would recommend crab cake and crawfish etoufee(served all year round).

Great location for dinner in the French District.    Sand which was very good with lots of flavor.  The jambalaya was outstanding.  If I had to pick would do that over the sand which.  The staff is also very friendly, and help answer any questions with the menu.

Amazing sea food, fun atmosphere and our server 
Chris M. an ultimate professional with a smile.
Great atmosphere.  Great ambiance.  Right next to  bourbon street and the festivities.  The food and service was awesome.  I'll return again.
Not authentic New Orleans food, more of a tourist trap.

Food was delicious, with generous portion sizes., Service was great, very attentive waiter, and a unique atmosphere. There was a bit of a wait but understandable due to Covid. But beware that the specials that they mention are not exactly how they are in the menu and instead of being a better price are typically an elevated price so you might have to pay more than what you expect.

Was not happy at with Oceana Grill
Went there last Sunday after work, we order oyster Rockefella. Was very disappointed with dish.

Absolutely love this place.  Whenever I come visit the city, Oceana Grill is my GO TO. Everything taste good that I've gotten there so far.  And whenever I go, we ask for ASHLEIGH. She's simply the best. Very attentive, and pleasant.  She's awesome!!! And so is Oceana grill!!!
Great food and service! I suggest arriving here before 7 if you don't make a reservation.  Good atmosphere and great staff.

I think this restaurant is really popular because I see advertisements for it everywhere. 

We bought some souvenirs from a nearby store and they gave us coupons for some free crab cakes here so we decided to stop by for lunch! We just couldn't resist free food. 

Our server was really sweet which made the experience a lot better. He took the time to explain the menu to us, gave us his recommendations, and even threw in an extra crab cake so my friend and I can each have our own. 

The crab cakes were really good! I really liked the sauce and even had to ask for a side of it. I ended up getting the alligator pasta which was interesting. It has a mild taste, similar to chicken, except the texture is slightly tougher. Not sure if I would go out of my way to eat alligator meat again but it was great to try. The pasta was good tho! Very creamy :-)

Located right on Bourbon Street, this restaurant is a good spot for a quick bite. The staff was friendly.

I will say however that the pictures of the food on the mobile menu are not accurate in the way that they are also presented at the table.

Visited this place twice on our vacation and loved it both times.  Our first visit was for lunch and Josh took care of us.  He was awesome- so funny and very attentive.  Make sure to ask for him! Lunch po'boys were really good as was the bbq shrimp.  We had dinner a few days later and were seated at the top floor.  Highly suggest asking to be sat up there- it was really pretty and comfortable.  The blackened chicken pasta was the best!  Can't wait to come back.

During my most recent trip, I visited this restaurant for the first time. It was another restaurant that was recommended by some other visitors that we met along the way. Since they did not suggest anything in particular, we decided to stop by for a late dinner. It is conveniently located in the French Quarter right off Bourbon Street, so it was pretty busy when we arrived. We were greeted and seated immediately upon entering the establishment. The first level was full, so we were escorted to the second level, where we had a brief wait for our order to be taken.

It was not a fancy restaurant by any means and was pretty true to the word "grill". It was a standard bar and grill with a variety of creole selections. When in New Orleans, my goal is to try local fare and to stay away from food choices that I can get at home. With that in mind, I decided on the crawfish étouffée. Personally, I would have preferred shrimp étouffée, but I decided to give it a try. While it was not my first rodeo with crawfish, I am not sure if it is my favorite. I did take into consideration that I was feeling a little queasy that day from the New Orleans heat, as well as my earlier Bourbon Street activities. 

Nevertheless, I ordered the bbq shrimp appetizer and the crawfish étouffée entree.  The bbq shrimp, though tasty was a little overly seasoned, but was good with the pieces of bread for dipping in the sauce. I would definitely order again under better circumstances. As for the crawfish étouffée, I loved the gravy base and the rice. Unfortunately, the crawfish overpowered the dish in terms of quantity. Perhaps, it was just how I was feeling at that particular moment, but I had to put about 20 pieces to the side and I had already consumed a great many of them.  

The crawfish were very small and very abundant in the dish. The texture was a little off-putting in this particular dish. With a similar visual and textural comparison to shrimp, I thought the dish would have been better if the crawfish were cooked a little firmer. I might have felt differently had they been shrimp, but who knows? I did thoroughly enjoy the gravy and rice part of the dish along with the dipping bread; that part was just what my stomach required. In consideration that I have enjoyed the shrimp variety of étouffée in many other restaurants, this really did not deliver on flavor, but maybe that was a good thing in this instance. 

I would try them again and order something else or maybe ask if shrimp could be substituted for the crawfish. I would prefer five or six jumbo shrimp over what seemed to be 50 pieces of crawfish any day.

Oceana is a great traditional New Orleans sea food restaurant. I tried their Blackened Catfish and it was delicious. I was not a huge fan of the sides that they brought but the fish was cooked perfectly and the spices were complementing the fish amazingly. For dessert I got the Oceana Brownie and the Bread Pudding. Both were good but if you have to choose one, go with the bread pudding!!

The oysters and cocktails were GREAT!!! The crab cakes were ok compared to The Jazz Playhouse's,  but  not bad at all.  And the customer service is quite nice.  Overall, the food was VERY seasoned and tasty. 

We will definitely be returning!

I brought my family to Oceana Grill on their first visit to New Orleans and they absolutely loved it! They have amazing oysters and I love their Redfish Pontchartrain. Their crab cakes are also delicious! We will definitely be returning.

My wife and I ate at the Oceana Grill our first night in the French Quarter earlier this month. Our server was a fellow by the name of Errol - like Errol Flynn he pointed out. He was really great!

We ordered the Louisiana Crabmeat Cakes for an appetizer - the best crab cakes we've ever eaten. Seriously! They were SO delicious!!

My wife order the Shrimp Creole & I got the Blackened Catfish Po-Boy to share. In New Orleans that's what you should do. The portions at all the restaurants are really huge, so sharing is less of a waste! I say that because I couldn't finish some portions I got at other places in the past.

Errol was very personable and we enjoyed the conversations we had with him. It was after 11 pm that night, so if you want good service & good food go sit in Errol's section at the Oceana Grill. You won't be sorry!!
Food was so good service was great! Was recommended this place by a local and it did not disappoint

I've been living in New Orleans for many years now and I love this spot! Ivoryelle took care of my family and I and did a GREAT job. She was attentive, suggested a great meal and was a pleasure to be around! Love the vibe of this place. Thank you, Ivoryelle!

This is where my love for chargrilled oysters was born!

I've only had raw oysters in my life before tasting these chargrilled oysters. And I guess if there's a first time to try a chargrilled oyster it might as well be in New Orleans!

Holy of all things! One of my very favorite delicacies I've ever eaten! 

Buttery! Cheesy! Warm! Juicy! Garlicky! Salty! Tender! Lemony! Sweet! It's like an ocean of flavors exploding in your mouth! You better believe that I literally licked the sauce from every crevice of the shells! Could care less who was watching! Maybe having a few hurricanes helped with that as well!

This place specializes in Creole & Louisiana cuisine which means everything is packed with lots of flavor! 

Set in a vibrant & fun environment located in the heart of the French Quarter. 

Live entertainment included as well when a drunk guy came over to the window and peed right in front of our table. 

There's no place like New Orleans!!!!!!!!

Was recommended from a friend and What can I say the food was amazing. I had the blackened steak n jambalaya rice n mashed potatoes with a side of crab cake which was sooooo good.. definitely recommend the crab cakes. I would definitely come back again!
Fantastic service from Chris P, he took care of everything we needed. Chargrilled oysters and crab cakes were phenomenal. Highly recommend!!

We ate here twice in one day this past weekend! 

Brunch was amazing! We enjoyed the courtyard. We adored our server! I can't remember her name, but she told us she was from Cali. Definitely wanna give her credit as she made our experience enjoyable! She was spot on with everything, even suggested some non touristy destinations to check out! Loved her! The guy that ran our (by ours, I mean mine ) mimosas to the table was super fun too! 

Late dinner was good as well! I'm not a seafood eater (yet I'm from Louisiana lol), so I definitely recommend the chicken Alfredo! In all my trips to Nola, I've never ate here. That changed this weekend! We'll definitely be back next time we're in town!

We came here again. This time for my wife's birthday lunch! 

We ordered the same exact food as before. We also enjoyed a free bread pudding for her birthday (ON THE HOUSE)!!

THIS IS SERIOUSLY THE BEST FOOD IN NOLA!
Great place for food poisoning, if your into food poisoning.

We recently returned from NOLA.  This was the first restaurant (at about 12:30a) we ate at and we loved the crab cakes so much that we ended our trip here also!   Everything we ate was amazing  we had the crab cakes, barbecue shrimp, their special oysters and a signature breakfast dish that used eggplant instead of English muffins for a kind of Benedict.  Oh, and their frozen hurricanes -- very refreshing on a humid February day.   Sadly, we didnt have room for dessert.

Service both times were impeccable.  Ponce made us feel like we were old family friends vs tourists.  The atmosphere is fun and quirky; Hostesses were friendly and cheerful.

I stopped here to eat last night. I got sat quickly; the server was good. He was just unhappy with my order. I had water and red beans, and rice. When it came out, the sausage was burnt and only about 1 and 1/2 inches long. 

The food was good, nothing exciting. I Would not recommend if you here to taste Nawlins".

Really liked the food here but it was so dang expensive for what you get, even at lunch time. The service was fair and we were able to get in without a reservation or much of a wait. Would come back but I think there are more reasonable restaurants in the area with a better experience.

Friendly service and they know their menu. (Huge plus) place is pretty big so you aren't elbow to elbow with the next table. 

Waiter was great, fast and attentive. Food was served pretty quick. 

Food was exactly what you're looking for if in search of creole. 

I got a sampler plate I believe it was the red fish, I got it blackened! Best way to have it, served with red mashed potatoes and corn for sides. 

Blacked fish was delicious, mashed potatoes great! 

Jambalaya and beans was about a 3 1/2 out of 5, fried shrimp were nice and big and really good. 

Crab cakes were by far the best I've had, and served with a special sauce.

Fun atmosphere and friendly local staff. Leave your attitude at the curb, this is a loud fun place unpretentious and latest grooves. Good food, had the tuna steak, delicious. Rare sushi grade tuna with nawlins fixins. Come on y'all...

Hubby wanted to try this place as it was mentioned in Frommer's. I can't say either of us were impressed. Food portions are generous if you have a big appetite. None of us could finish our lunches. 
Our wait staff messed up 3 times She gave Hubby an iced tea when he ordered diet soda. BFF hubby initially ordered coffee but quickly changed to tea and she brought a cup of coffee that had lipstick smears on the rims. She changed it to tea. 
I requested a cup of gumbo and was brought a bowl and she insisted I ordered a bowl, which I didn't as Hubby heard me and told her it was a cup.
It was corrected. The wait staff needs more training and to prevent mishaps again, should repeat the orders to the customers. 

My oyster po boy was OK. The fried oysters were very good but I didn't like the cole slaw as much. The fries are standard frozen one which were crispy. The seafood gumbo was Ok but I've had better elsewhere. Lots of shrimp in it. 
Hubby had the chicken gumbo and said it was good. He ordered the Cajun fries which were smothered in cheese, seafood.  Reminded me of poutine. I didn't care for it. 

BFF liked her catfish platter. The fish was tender but tastEd like catfish. Her hubby had shrimp po boy and he said it was good.
Food is overall OK. Staff is pleasant but young and need more training. I'm surprised it was mentioned in Frommer's guide tho.

I have been to this place 2 times now, and I would say I quite like it. The aesthetics has a lot going on in the interior reminds me of some big chain restaurant. But I very much like the food here. The oceana oysters were awesome and the jambalaya pasta were amazing.

So we went to Oceana for some late night food as we were hungry around midnight. The food was honestly good, not great but the service was on point!

Our server was beyond friendly, gave recommendations, and kept the party going by trying to get us to order doubles for our drinks. 

I really enjoyed the eggplant fries and the fried shrimp. The shrimp has a really good seasoning with just a bit of spice so they were a hit. 

The crab cakes were not my favorite because they were like breaded and fried but the crawfish sauce they top them with was awesome. 

Overall if you want late night food try them out but if it's earlier enough in the day, maybe check out another place.

Walking around the quarter late at night, we were headed for another restaurant that ended up being closed, and ended up finding Oceana--discovering it was rated highly, we waited in line to get in. It's a fairly big place taking advantage of the space for social distancing. 

We had the Cajun Fries and a cup of étouffée, then the bread pudding. The fries and bread pudding were memorable. 

Definitely more touristy than unique, the Oceana was totally decent and didn't break the bank
We went for brunch with 3 elderly parents. They asked if we minded upstairs, we said "yes", they said "no problem" and seated us downstairs. Great waitstaff & good food!
We had the best Shrimp salads here! Absolutely loved it!!! Shrimp was cooked perfectly!! Hubby's Po Boy he loved as well! Would definitely come back!

Oceana Grill is an amazing must stop location for any customer local or tourist. They serve amazing meals well into the evening hours. Our party was seated immediately inside their beautiful upstairs dining room with a view of the holiday decorations and lights of the New Orleans street below. The menu is amazing and frankly I'm sure everything will please. That said we went with the recommendations of our superb server Breana and we were not disappointed! Try the alligator bites for a starter, followed by just about any entree and follow it up with their amazing bread pudding! You will be happy you stopped!
Great drinks, food, and atmosphere! Not a crazy wait, either. Good vegetarian options! Being from Cleveland, the big quote on the wall made me LOL.

Worst experience ever, their system was down and made us wait an hour and a half after we finished eating before we could pay to leave. In the meantime we were never offered water refills or anything else, and after asking for the manager multiple times, they never came to talk to us. Worst customer experience I've had literally anywhere.

The food was great. Destine was great! The drinks were great! I got the Redfish Oceana and my friend got the blackened redfish étouffée... man. And the corn was so good. 10/10. They wait wasn't bad at all. We stood in line maybe 15-20 min.. they were flipping these tables baby.
This place was absolutely a creative and fun atmosphere, The food was delicious, service was superb and I like this place.

The four of us got cooked oysters, shrimp poboy, gator bites and crab legs. 
Oysters were good and full of flavor. Shrimp on the sandwich were really great, the sandwich was dry and bread was very tough. Gator bites had a good flavor but barely any meat. Crab legs are NOT worth the $30. Server wasn't too friendly but not terrible either.
While visiting in New Orleans this restaurant was recommended to us. It did not disappoint. We had some Cajun that was delicious & the Bloody Mary's were beyond!
This is a great spot! We sat upstairs, cute setting! Good bloody Mary's, good food! It's a big pricy for lunch

Waitress Erica was awesome!!! Atmosphere was awesome! Background music loved 80s mix.
.. for wasn't bad but wasn't the wow that I expected coming to New Orleans

Jaclyn at the front was AMAZING, so sweet such a people person and gives great recommendations! Ryan, our server was just as amazing, he came back 2 times to take our order since we wanted to take pictures and was so patient with us. AND THE FOOD!!! Oh my gosh, how ever long the wait is, ITS WORTH IT!!! The chicken Alfredo was the best I have ever had in my life. The margs were so strong and good (get the double) . I would love to come back here and see these amazing smiling servers and hostess again. Such a good place to eat.

Had breakfast and dinner here while we were in New Orleans and both were great. Prices are about average for restaurants in the quarter. The food was great and the staff was super friendly. The shrimp and alligator bite PoBoys are awesome. We made reservations and they seated us right away even though we were 30 minutes early. Definitely would recommend eating here.

Wow, I can't emphasize how perfect this place was! The food and drinks were just amazing! Exquisite! Finally some mimosas that actually get you buzzed. Now don't let me get started on the service. Please request JAMAL. When I tell you his service is OUTSTANDING! I have never be ever taken my time to write out a review for a place, but he just is to great to go I noticed. Amazing job and place. Would give over 5 stars!

Arrived at Oceana Grill for dinner and there was a LONNNNNG line.  We figured the wait would be 30 minutes to an hour (I'm sure the line looked longer due to social distancing as well).  But not too long after standing in line, someone came walking down the line asking for a party of two.  Apparently everyone ahead of us had a big party or had a party of three.  YAY for us!

We got seated immediately and ordered some drinks like usual.  Took a look at the menu and ended up ordering: Cajun Fries, Crawfish Étouffée Sample, and a Soft Shell Crab as our appetizer.  We ordered a Cajun Jambalaya Pasta to share (I wasn't too hungry).  

Even though I didn't order an entree for myself, it was more than enough food to share.  Everything was AMAZING!  Thank goodness for our waiter who asked if we wanted a 1/2 order of Cajun Fries or a Full Order.  We decided to go with the 1/2 order and wholly cow, it was A LOT! I'm so glad we got the 1/2 order, it wasn't an option on the menu so I'm glad she told us otherwise we might have wasted food (but then again, it was so good....I might have just finished it and regretted it). 

The Crawfish Étouffée sample was a tease....but still glad we didn't order a whole entree because we would have been stuffed.  

The Soft Shell Crab was DELICIOUS!!!

The Cajun Jambalaya Pasta was packing in flavor and had a good kick to it.  Maybe a bit much for my husband, but I loved it.

Definitely recommend to anyone visiting New Orleans.  It will be worth your wait and the food is  YUMMY!
The wait was reasonable because I could make a reservation. I ordered the crab cake pasta, and it was delicious!  very quality crab cake.
We just dropped in for some dessert one afternoon. The food was just ok... But I'll definitely say the atmosphere was great, and our server Damon was fantastic!

Yummmm!!!!! We were staying at the Sonesta Hotel across the street. We chose this place as it had really good reviews on Yelp. The reviews surely did not lie. The food was amazing! The customer service was great and they appeared to strongly adhere to Covid mandates. I had the special with the redfish. The texture of this fish was great and the sauce on top pulled it all together. The fish was accompanied by vegetables and mashed potatoes. This meal really hit the spot!! I had the seafood gumbo for an appetizer which was also amazing! My significant other had the catfish PO Boy which he loved. I took a bite of his sandwhich and I also thought it was great! Can I please have dinner here every night? I felt safe, welcomed, and comfortable in this establishment. Check them out if you're in the area!!!
Waiting for to go order was long. But food was hot and good. Hostess was pleasant. And bartender made us an amazing margarita while we waited.

Worst customer service in N.O!!!!! I had this fucking place. The manager Ryan shows lack of mannerism and is very unprofessional. The food is horrible here!!! I don't recommend or refer ANYONE to come here.....

We made our breakfast reservation at Oceana Grill with very medium level expectations - we were pleasantly surprised with quantity and quality.

I opted for the Maw Maw's Country breakfast - the bacon, eggs and jambalaya rice all tasted fresh.  I also ordered a screwdriver because it's still breakfast and it's still New Orleans. 

The orange juice hit the spot and the drink was nice and strong.  

My husband ordered the biscuits and gravy, I was shocked to see that he was served basically a bowl of gravy with a spoon and two biscuits.  That's not how I'd want to eat my biscuits and gravy but it tasted good to me and he was stuffed.  We actually even took some leftovers with us.

Under normal circumstances Oceana would have been in the perfect position to then go bar hopping but with current restrictions we were forced to just keep walking around until it was time for a beignet.

Thank you Oceana for taking reservations and keeping up with the social distancing guidelines to keep us safe.

MMMM.  When I think of breakfast now I think immediately of my seafood omelet I had here.  The server, Megan, was great.  She checked on us a lot and kept our coffee filled and was really knowledgeable about the menu and specials.  We started out with the oysters because I just can't get enough charbroiled oysters.  I then chose the seafood omelet and Megan suggested the sauce on it which I'm glad I did.  It was delicious.  Filled with crabmeat as well as a lot on top.  If I ever get to go back to NOLA, this will be at the top of my list.

Awesome food. Every time we go the food is fresh and the service is good. Their ultimate Bloody Mary is so good.  How ever I don't feel it's worth the $32 i paid for it. It was a normal size with a little bit of seafood on top. However it's one of my favorite places to eat so I definitely recommend it. & their oysters are to die for.
Fast, hot, and delicious.  We will return when visiting New Orleans again. Everyone enjoyed their meal.

This place was amazing!
Tbh, my go to restaurant was closed down cause of covid, so we wound up here...

Couldn't be happier!

Our server, Mary was fun and energetic.

We ate the Cajun alligator Alfredo, oyster Rockefeller, a crazy delicious margarita, and finished with the praline brownie sundae!

So I'd like to rate restaurant higher, but I'm not going to. This restaurant is open during the current COVID-19 pandemic, which I'm happy about however I've just realized they have some unethical business practices and taking advantage of customers. I've been ordering from them a lot lately as I currently moved from another city to New Orleans and staying in a hotel until I find a home. I've been frequenting this restaurant lately and I always wonder why the bill seemed abnormally high based on what I ordered. Tonight after ordering my food, I  looked at my itemize receipt and realized they are charging 10%+ more on their food items. I called the restaurant and the response I got was that before the pandemic they were intending on raising their prices, so they have maintained their increased prices and also said that they just did not have anybody on hand to update their prices online. Frankly, most businesses that are open are offering specials and/or lowered menu prices, but Oceana has gone in the opposite direction. I just think that this is a poor business practice especially because they are not disclosing this information up front.
Love this place!! Great food, good service! We come every time we go to NOLA. Easy to find in the Quarter, right around the corner from Bourbon street.

At the heart of the French quarter, this place was one of the better one. We came for lunch on a weekday and it was quiet. Of course we have to try there signature grilled oysters. The sauce was a bomb. Wish some of the oysters were not be over cooked. My friend ordered the crab cakes and she ate them all, she is not a seafood fan so that proved something. It was a good deal that we checked in first and got some discount. The waiter told us that if we come back within 24 hours we will get a free bread pudding. 
Overall it was a nice dining experience. Highly recommended.

This was restaurant was close to Conti Hotel right off Bourbon street and Conti. Hotel gave me a 10% off so gave it a try. Was not disappointed! Tried 2 appetizers instead of an entree. Service was super fast and friendly. A little pricier but all restaurants in the area seem to be.
Food was ok, super fried and greasy if you don't like that not for you. Waiting time was crazy even tho restaurant wasn't really busy.
This place is amazing! We had Sierra as our waitress and she was great! 10/10 would come back. Food and drinks were so yummy

My mother ordered a baileys on the rocks. The baileys was watered down. The manager Phil REFUSED to swap out my mothers drink for some wine. He told us that she would have to purchase another drink. I have NEVER been to a restaurant where you are not able to swap out a drink you are not satisfied with. 

Phil the manager is very RUDE! To hell with this establishment.
The food was awesome ! Thank you Errol for taking care of us !!!

Seafood platter was absolutely incredible. We're from Chicago and wanted fresh seafood and this is the best seafood we had on our whole trip. 
Drinks were delish as well. 
Interior is a cool vibe with a bunch of unique things on the walls. 
Our favorite spot in New Orleans!

Had the crab cake appetizer, fried shrimp platter and seafood gumbo followed by the bread pudding for dessert. Crab cakes were excellent. Fried shrimp platter was huge and hot and crispy. Gumbo was filled with seafood. Bread pudding was very good, but was slightly burned on the bottom. Our waiter, John was very nice and friendly.
We were looking for a good seafood place to try some local favorite and really enjoyed our dinner there.  We ordered the sea food platter,  sea food gumbo, shrimp po boys.  All were delicious!

I got the Royal omelette. The crawfish was delicious but the alligator sausage had a weird flavor and yes I've had alligator before. It was too expensive for what I got. It was $18 and came with hashbrown and biscuit. Someone else got the eggplant breakfast  and said the eggplant was extremely strong like it was spoiled almost. I would not return. However someone else got the crawfish etouffee and claimed it was the best she's ever had so if your going to go maybe stick with the lunch/dinner menu and pass on breakfast.

Chris was our server. He was fantastic. Very attentive and a seasoned waiter. He knew his business! We had half the menu and it was worth it. The Virgin Mary was amazing. Also had the blackened tuna, fried oysters, bbq shrimp and the chocolate pie.  leaving here stuffed and with very happy tastebuds.

LOVE LOVE LOVE 

Hostess was very polite and friendly.  Escorted my group to the back garden area , which was lovely on a warm day.  

For appetizers we ordered Grilled Oysters .... and they are DIVINE.   Drank the sweet tea , and it was perfect .

For entrees , I had the Mardi Gras Pasta , and the crawfish and shrimp tasted amazing , and the sauce was heavenly .   

My friends had the gumbo which was good .  

Last but not least , the service was great.  Our server was fast yet professional and friendly . 

I would definitely recommend this place

We went here for dinner tonight and we're pleasantly surprised! The service from our waitress, Amethyst was amazing! She was attentive, courteous and helpful with the menu. 
Our food was delicious, we had seafood gumbo, barbecue shrimp, the fried seafood platter and seafood pasta alfredo.
We were so stuffed we left without dessert...but then decided to come back later to pick some up. Luckily our hotel is right next door so it was convenient
The bread pudding? was delicious and I will be getting another before I leave!
I had a really good experience today! As soon as I walked in I had too take service from all staff members. Errol did a great job with recommendations on the menu. 10/10 highly recommend!
Best red beans and rice I've had in NOLA.  Love the atmosphere and the bar top.  Great french bread as well.

Pasta looked and smelled amazing. I ordered a meal with no onions ( I'm allergic). And they definitely put tiny onions in the dish. The server was very polite and he replaced my order within 5-10 minutes. I would give them a higher rating but an allergy mistake can be life threatening.

You line up outside & wait to be seated. I like that they are open late and the line moves quickly. It appeared that there were actually some locals that come here regularly, another plus.

The fish & crab cakes were delicious & my wife raved about the crab cakes for day. 
They did put down someone else's food on our table and then serve it to them anyway. I suppose that I won't count that against MY experience.

The bloody mary though, that was BAD. 

I'd go back, but I wouldn't order any mixed drink.
Ashleigh was great! She recommended the chefs special red fish and also the shrimp and catfish po boy. Loved it!!
Man everything we had was so good. I had the catfish platter and it was finger licking good . Kevin who was our waiter had great customer service! Nice environment .

Food was a . I got fried alligator it was great.  Service was excellent my server was Jasmine Im sure I called her New Orleans Jazz. They are open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  They also deliver if I'm not mistaken.  Everyone in my party enjoyed their food. I will be coming back next time I'm in New Orleans.

Best !!! Right across street from our hotel , so we ate here 2x!!! Breakfast brunch  and lunch . Had Cajun pasta was awesome, the sauce was just the right flavor. I had crawfish omelette!!! Yummy the sauce on top is authentic and hood !!! The crab cakes to my surprise were on point as well . Raw oysters are fresh and nice size
The food was delicious. We got Cajun fries, steak of the art, and Mardi Gras pasta all great! Very filling.

Awesome food! Had lunch there yesterday and going back today. I had their special which was a redfish dish and my wife had breakfast, both were fantastic. Our waitress Kristian was amazing and a knew the extensive menu inside and out and was able to answer all of our questions!! I wish we had found the restaurant sooner, it will definitely be at the top of the list for next trip.

We also went to a couple of their sister establishments, the Hideout Bar and Mambo's awesome rooftop bar!

Absolutely the best place for lump crab cakes, very generous with the crawfish gravy, non mayo based, I was very satisfied. Also ordered the "taste of New Orleans" dish and it delivers. I've been here twice and will always go here every time I visit

I've eaten here a few times. It's decent for a very large group, because they can accommodate it and it's in the center of the quarter. Typical New Orleans style food for going-rate prices. When I went with a large group, everyone seemed to enjoy the crab cakes. It's nice the menu offers blacken options for the poboys and that there is a vegetarian menu. I've tried everything on the vegetarian menu; here are my thoughts.
1.Vegetarian Pasta = TERRIBLE. Don't order it. The vegetables aren't cooked and the pasta isn't anything special. I ended up asking for cheese and hot sauce to eat some of it. Better off with a plain salad.
2. Spinach Ravioli is pretty good. I like it with the cream sauce and I would definitely eat it again if I return.
3. Cajun Vegetarian Stew is an ok dish. I love stew and curry, so maybe I'm a bit of a stew snob. I didn't find the seasoning to hit the mark; so maybe ask for hot sauce for this one.

Good food, confusing on entering due to Covid, they want you to wait in line outside, but don't have anyone there to tell you so the host staff is impatient and rude when you walk in. But once that was sorted out for us and the others experiencing the same thing, it was great. The server was friendly and the food was tasty.
Tyler was the best most helpful server of all time. The food was delicious. Start with some crab cakes and gator sausage! The gumbo is to die for and you can't get any better crawfish on all of NOLA!
Really good food.  Cream Brule was amazing.  Loved the BBQ shrimp and the Gator bites.   Jacelynn did a great job even sang Happy Birthday to my wife.

The atmosphere is fantastic it is such a cute little restaurant it is very New Orleans and has a fantastic vibe. We started out with two drinks which were very good and the fry appetizer with the creamy mushroom crawfish sauce - they were to die for!!!! The fries were AMAZING. 
We ordered the red fish for our entrée and although it was not bad it tasted very very fresh it was a little dry maybe like they overcooked it but it did taste fresh, I was just slightly disappointed about the dryness/blandness.

A great place for seafood lovers, as well as those who are allergic. I had the seafood platter, while my gf had ribs which were awesome. To be on the safe side, the waiter gave her a baked potato since often times, fries may go in the same fryer with seafood. We never thought of it, but we're very glad that this was offered. 

This place has multiple floors, and can often have a long line. Unfortunately, like many places in New Orleans, you are unable to make reservations; so be sure to arrive early. 

Cheers
Oysters & bloody Mary's were amazing! Our server Kat was great. Definitely recommend!

Ok food here is amazing. If this is representative of New Orleans then I need to move here. Gator bites were amaze balls and so was the spring sangria. Props to josh our server who was crazy crazy nice!!! To be honest the customer service here was probably the best I've ever seen. Would come back alone for the service but the food was just as amazing. Great place!!!

Such a fun atmosphere and the crab cakes are awesome! The manager Tim and our server Jessica were both amazing and very accommodating. We'd definitely come back next time we're in New Orleans for sure!

This spot is great! I had the crab cakes, seafood jambalaya, rockefeller oysters and oceana oysters. Food came out real quick but most of all the service, especially while during covid, was impeccable. All thanks to Jasmine - great server if you ever got her. She made sure to answer all of our questions thoroughly, and made sure we were never in need of anything.

Excellent food- I mean- fantastic flavors- ya ya noodles and blackened fish. Creme brûlée was the best I've ever had!
Our server Angela W was the sweetest, excellent service. Great atmosphere on the second floor- highly recommend, will come back for sure.

The food is good but it all came out cold.  Everything that came out seems like it was made in the morning for dinner. Having said all that, the Cajun Fries were amazing and honestly all that I needed!!
get the shrimp alfredo!!!!! do it!!!! you wont regret it. By far my favorite restaurant on our visit to New Orleans.
Got the fried shrimp and fried catfish. Both were really good but the fish was better. It's seasoned well. Chris, the server did a great job

This restaurant is wonderful! As soon as we walked in, we were greeted by all of the employees. Everybody was so friendly and welcoming! The service was awesome and the food was perfect! The atmosphere was very relaxing and the lights were nice and dim. This was actually my favorite restaurant while visiting New Orleans. We had the seafood platter, the Ahi Tuna, bread pudding, and creme brûlée. All of the food was perfection! The fried seafood was fresh and not overly breaded or greasy. I absolutely loved everything about this restaurant. Our server David was very nice and attentive as well. I can't wait to come back on my next trip out here.

Oceana= Major Key Alert!!

Casual and fun vibes, delicious, fair prices, and you'll get a 10% coupon in your cab from the MSY airport! And a 10% coupon if you check in on Yelp!

Signature dishes you must order: crabcakes, BBQ oysters, alligator sausage, seafood gumbo, and the redfish oceana.

And top that off with a hurricane-- welcome to New Orleans!

Wow, wonderful meal. We traveled from Houston and this was our dinner location. It was recommended by a bellman at our hotel. Great service, great food and delightful atmosphere. Not the same restraint shown in Kitchen Nightmares a few years ago. Nice turnaround.

The food is good and prices are reasonable. Whitney is a delightful server. There are a lot of tourists coming through the space and the staff keeps everything moving quickly. The space is divided into multiple dining rooms with a lot of space.
We had the pleasure of having Kim as our server and she was amazing with us. Trust the specials. Everything is delicious you can't go wrong! The blackened red fish was amazing

Super friendly staff. Went for breakfast and the Benedict's were some of the best I have ever had. The batter on the fried eggplant is amazing. Food is a little heavy but we worth the coma. Our server John was great. A must visit restaurant for anyone visiting the French Quarter.

First night in NoLA found ourselves walking around the French Quarter as many tourists may. And were pulled into the line of Oceana Grill. The area was bright and buzzing. The backyard patio seating was a perfect dimly lit area. We ordered their specialty seafood pasta -which my table loved. What got me hooked was their crawfish etouffe and jambalaya. As side dishes they were stand out. The oysters I could have done without. Definitely meaty if that's your preference. We had great service by Ashleigh and a great into to dining out here.

Our favorite restaurant was closed so decided to try this place. It has a fun Mardi Gras theme for decoration. Was lucky and got seated right away. We ordered oysters. The oysters were served warm, probably should have sent them back but didn't. Didn't have much flavor. The crab cakes were very tasty. My husband got the bbq shrimp. Each restaurant has their version of this dish. It was good but we like the butter garlic seasoned shrimp better at our favorite restaurant. The staff was great and on the ball. The restaurant did do a good job with covid spacing.
We had such a great time here! The staff was SO nice and welcoming. The food was fantastic! Other people in my crew had the bbq shrimp and the steak. All was DELICIOUS

Ron is the man!!! He totally took care of us like family with the sincere form of southern hospitality. We started the night off with the swamp tea and a sazzy and both were ON POINT! The fried oyster you have to get and the taste of New Orleans gets you everything you possibly need on a Monday night. Red beans and rice, crawfish and jambalaya were out of the freakin' world. Best creamer brûlée in the world dude, for real.

The food was Ahhmazing! Our waitress Whitney was really knowledgeable about all of the menu options and was very sweet as well!! I recommend making a reservation on their webpage to avoid the long wait! Overall we had a wonderful experience!

Came strolling in on a rainy weekday with no reservations and my party of four got seated right away. Some thoughts running through my head as I was eating my meal:
-This place reminds of a chain like Apple Bees. It's quite big with multi level floors. 
-Their menu was diverse and offered many options! Unfortunately they don't excel at any particular dish. The food ordered was not impressive and therefore it's my least favorite meal in New Orleans. Especially since when the food came out it wasn't hot. The Crab cakes were pretty good, the gatorbites were a little chewy. 
-Excellent service though. The waiter was attentive and checked in on the table multiple times. 

Overall it's a decent experience but nothing memorable.

Six of us, w/o reservations, waited only about 20 minutes. They were friendly as they got is seated.  We were fortunate to have Bea as a waitress as she was attentive, friendly and efficient.
Each of us had something different and the food was awesome! We will definitely go back.

Came here for dinner. Gigantic multi floor restaurant. I was able to get seated quickly at bar. Menu isn't too extensive. I tried sernvac cocktail which was tasty and strong. For entree I tried the taste of New Orleans with added crawfish tails. Portion was ok. Expected bigger actually. The meal was ok...comes with 3 small pieces of bread and 3 small bowels with the different tastes (jambalaya, crawfish, red beans with rice and sausage) with a few crawfish added to the top of each bowel. My favorite part was the crawfish but even those weren't amazing. Overall pretty forgettable meal especially for price (40 for entree + 1 drink).
Food and atmosphere was absolutely amazing! We were a group of ten and we were quickly seated and served! Dory was wonderful and funny! Thanks for the awesome experience!

Was waiting for my bags at the airport and saw the advertisement for this place that was mural sized. It showed a crab cake.  I'm a sucker for crab cakes.
First of all I was greeted by a friendly staff. Then by Jessica as she served me. Super nice and friendly waitress. Really makes for legitimacy when you have such a solid staff. Not just her, all the staff was amazing. 
So the food----
Red Beans and Rice.   I rate 9 out of 10---remember to mix them upon arrival as to not look like a rube (me). 
Crab cakes-------------------------------------I would rate 8 out of 10.
But please remember, I used to live in SF for 20 years, so the bar is Golden Gate Bridge high. I loved the cakes here, they were very tasty, with a nice outer crust, yet the insides were moist and luscious. The sauce was incredible--even having sizable chucks of fresh crab meat in it. Very good, only beat by my SF local spots.
Mustard Greens---------Not rating. This is an acquired taste for sure. I took a second bite of it just to make sure I got the flavor. Potent is the best word to describe it. If you don't like potent food, pass on these. 
Mashed potatoes---------Passing grade, nothing to point out--they did their function as potatoes.   
I liked my dinner, it was very good.

I also came back later--I ran into a couple of co-workers who were hungry (here on a business meeting).  I led them back to here, one friend ordered the Oysters and he said, WOW.  My other friend ordered the blackened fish special they offered.  He was so happy he was taking food pics and sending them.  So this is a solid restaurant with a wide range of dishes that people love.  When I ate at 5:30pm, no wait.  At 6:30pm, my friends had to eat at the bar because there was a line.

Enjoy

made reservation online for memorial day weekend, and even with reservation we had to wait about 40 minutes before we got seated. when we were inside, it wasn't that packed, some tables were not occupied. so i assumed they just didn't have enough staff to handle more tables at once.

the lines were confusing. line without reservation is on one side, and with reservation is on the other side but just much shorter. so while we were waiting on the reservation line. there were people without reservation who thought the reservation line is the regular line. i think they gotta tell people which line is which to avoid confusion.

we ordered a bunch a of stuff, family style as always for a party of 6.
- a dozen of raw oysters
- gator tail bites (half fried half blackened)
- crab cakes
- fried oysters
- taste of new Orleans
- redfish Oceana
- Cajun jambalaya pasta
- Mardi Gras pasta.
- bread pudding

i would say the crab cake and jambalaya pasta were the best. their golden cadillac (if i aint mistaken) margarita was one of the best i've ever had.

they ran out the char-grilled oysters? not sure how. maybe just no charcoal that day? cuz the raw oysters were available.

one of the oysters came empty (shell only) lol, told them the server and she bought another one. our server were wonderful and attentive.

will i come back? easy yes

Husband and I had reservations to try out Oceana for the first time. We come to New Orleans once or twice a year and had never been. We are huge Gordon Ramsey fans and we saw this restaurant featured on one of his shows. The food looked amazing on the menu and reviews were good and after rave reviews from a local Uber driver we decided to try it. As we approached the restaurant we saw a long line outside, we bypassed and told the girl at the door that we had reservations. She looked mad at the world and was anything but friendly. (wish we had gotten names) We were told to stand to the left and wait with the others who also had reservations. After about 5 minutes we were told to go to the desk and as we approached 3 staff members were gathered and completely ignored us. After standing there feeling completely invisible and getting very much annoyed I said "Brown table for 2" at which time the hostess blatantly stared beyond us and ignored us. I looked at my husband like 'what is happening?' and he had the same bewildered look on his face. We were never acknowledged by the hostess who seemed to have a huge chip on her shoulder that we were inconveniencing her. We stood there waiting a few more minutes while being completely ignored when we said, forget this and we left. This was not southern hospitality at all. I don't care how good the food is I won't pay to be treated so terribly.

Not sure what was going with y'all this weekend. Ordered via grub hub but delivery is through oceana bike workers. The guy kept saying he was in front of our hotel, he was not -I was outside in the rain looking for him. This lie went on for 30+ minutes. Male manager hung up on me a few times when I called and asked for a refund or credit or to connect me with the delivery guy. The female general manager finally was put on and was helpful though she questioned if we were indeed outside first. She said she'd put in a new order and give us beverages. As soon as we hung up, the first guy magically appeared and said he was just sitting on the wrong side of the building and his chains were messed up. Excuses but still not acknowledging the fact that he'd been lying. The next delivery person was great. She was nice and professional and arrived exactly when they said she would. 

The food was bland af!! The bbq shrimp didn't taste like bbq at all. The pasta was dry af. The fried food had a spice but no flavor. Like what the heck was going on.

I was in town on a Monday night. Oceana Grill was a place everyone I talked to recommended.  When I arrived, there were at least fifty people waiting outside. The longest line of any place in the area. 

There are lots of conventions in NOLA and this is a place where people go. It was packed with people with convention badges. 

Still, it has a nice, gritty, local feel. Other places looked a little too "nice" for me. 

Since I was alone I was able to grab the only seat at the bar. It's super loud with people talking and they are incredibly busy. Still, the two bartenders were very cool and handled everything in stride. 

I ordered dinner from the bar. I started out with the classic Sazarac. It was the predecessor to the old-fashioned. Between the two, I think I'd go with the Sazarac!  $9 for a good stiff drink. 

For food, I went with the blackened redfish etouffee. $20. It came with rice and corn. It took a cool minute to get my food, but as I said, it was really busy. My food was delivered lukewarm. It was still good. The bartender heated it up for me again and it did help. I would have loved to had it hot off the grill though. That being said it was all spiced just right and very flavorful, all of it. 

For dessert, I had their highlighted bread pudding.$5.50. It's like a muffin and a very tasty one at that.

Even though it's a tourist haven, it doesn't mean the food isn't authentic and awesome.

Oh, by the way, check in on Yelp and get 10% off your order. You're welcome!

Great spot right off Bourbon. Line going in but moved fast. Tons of room and tables inside. Service was great and food even better. Highly recommend the swamp fry appetizer and add the blackened gator tail. Delicious! April special and seafood platter was also great. Bread pudding for dessert and that was not that great. Large raisins and alcohol was cooked out.
Love it.  Went back again my second visit.  was recommended for good food, affordable prices.  Love the eggplant fries.  Love the wait staff.  Place is open crazy late too.  Food is just Really Good!

I've been here twice, the first time I fell in love, the second time we rekindled the love! Came here on Fat Tuesday and we knew there was a good chance we would have to wait up until an hour to get food.. However, somehow, some way... they had us seated WITHIN 15mins! And it was a party of 8!

I ordered their crab cakes then did their shrimp pasta w/ blackened chicken as my entree. And wow to both items. I'm not sure what was better.. their food or customer service? Nonetheless, I was impressed with BOTH! The meal only came with one meat, but for an additional fee I just added on the chicken because I couldn't decide between the two. Also tried a friends broiled oysters, which again did not disappoint! This is a must try when in NOLA!

We brought a group of 80+ people to Oceana Grill, 65 who were middle school students. Making a reservation and a set menu for the students was very easy! When we walked in the room was all set up for us. Every staff member greeted us as we walked through the door, and the manager on duty came to introduce herself. The service was perfect! Food was full of flavor and cooked perfectly. While the kids had a set menu, the adults ordered off of the regular menu. I personally tried the hush puppies, an oyster po boy sand which, and the red beans and rice. I loved everything I had! Thank you for the wonderful experience! I highly recommend this restaurant, especially for a group event!

This place is awesome! The food is amazing and the staff was very pleasant and helpful!
 We discovered this place through a friends suggestion who was in NOLA last week. We started off at a restaurant (who shall remain nameless) with alligator bites for an app, we happened to scroll through Yelp while snacking and came across Oceana Grill.
We decided to dump the joint we were at and head to Oceana which was right around the corner. Best choice we ever made!!!
We had:
BBQ Shrimp. = amazing 
Seafood Gumbo = very good 
Crab Cakes w/garlic Mashed Potatoes and Collard Greens = Awesome 
Oceana's Famous Oysters = unbelievable 
 If these four items are any clue to what the rest of the menu is like... you are in for a treat!!!
 We plan to find out, as we are in town a few more days and will definitely be back!!!

This is our first time in New Orleans, we saw that this restaurant had great reviews so we decided to give it a go. I just want to say the only item that was amazing on this menu was the crab cakes (which they are known for) .  I got the redfish oceana and it was absolutely terrible no flavor at all!!! Now come on this is the NOLA I barley got any etouffee sauce, the mash potatoes and mustard greens had no flavor as well, I had to drown the mustard greens in hot sauce and on top of it all it was cold. The soft shell crab po boy my boyfriend got was also  terrible, all French bread and no crab.  The double shot tropical storm don't even waste your time it was so weak I didn't even finish it .
Last the creme brulee  tasted like cheap vanilla pudding with day old burnt caramel sauce  (smdh)  This place is way to overpriced and sadly just disappointing we will not be back and I won't be recommending this sad disgusting place to anyone.
Went here on our last day in Nola, and was not disappointed! The food was fresh and very feeling. The service was great, and the restaurant was very clean and up to date on COVID procedures!
This place was awesome. The service was great. The food was very tasteful and i would say it is a must eat place in New Orleans. We really enjoyed it.
Line went quickly. Service was fantastic and food was even better. Great family atmosphere, clean and friendly.

Overall food and service were good. No complaints. We would go there again. I took off one star because it's not the cleanest place. Other than that, it was good. I would eat there again. Am I knocking down their door for another opportunity to eat there? No but I would go there again.
Awesome experience at Oceana Grill. Long line but the atmosphere in the courtyard is well worth the wait. Highly recommend the crawfish fries and juicy blackened chicken.
This food was amazing.  Our server Sierra was excellent!! Definitely recommend coming here.

Arrived around 11pm on Sunday night as a party of 7 without a reservation. They were able to take us right in with smiles. Our server "Fee" was wonderful - informative and attentive. Not all of us were familiar with New Orleans fare and she answered every question and had great suggestions. We started with the Alligator bites - half grilled, half fried - which are definitely the way to go! Both were flavorful and had the perfect texture. We also had their crab cakes which were smothered with a mushroom craw fish sauce - yummy. Apps were a good size. There were 7 of us and we each got a couple bites of each. We ordered oysters as an app as well but those came out at the same time as our meals for some reason.

I had really had a tough time choosing an entree but went with a dozen of the Oysters Rockafeller and was so happy with my choice. I've actually never had the famous dish before and I think this was the perfect place to try it. Bacon, spinch, buttery goodness, perfectly cooked oyster and grilled flavor OMG. I also enjoyed a wonderful Bloody Mary. No complaints from anyone in the party regarding their food and everyone got something different.

10% off with Yelp Check-In! Great place I'd love to come back to!

What a wonderful find for us!  After two tours we were dying of hunger!  Amelie was a very educated helpful server.  We tried the sampler for a starter and it was delicious!  Then a shrimp PO boy, crab cakes, red rock fish and red rock chop(which isn't on the menu, but a local favorite)!  All of it was divine!

I was very surprised by this place. It is right off bourbon st and the first night we were in town it was the perfect place. I mean as sooooon as we put our orders in for our Po boys they were already on their way out. It was the fastest I have ever received food ever. The second time we went on our second to last night, it was a complete 180. The service was terrible. The food orders were wrong and the food wasn't as good. Consistency would be a much better thing.

omg the best food i have ever had. we got there around 5 no wait straight to our seats. i wanted to try everything so i ordered some gumbo, red beans and rice, oysters and had a piece of my cousins shrimp po boy: everything was exceeded my expectations. we had to ask for the manager, he came over expecting something was wrong and we had to tell how awesome the food was. also our waitress ashliegh was the best. i will definitely be back next time when im in nola
FIONA was AMAZING! Literally was the sweetest thing. Very personable without being overzealous. Unsold without being pushy and def helped make my birthday an amazing day.

Amazing food! Great service every time! I especially
Love the gumbo, one of my favorit things to get

I ordered the taste of New Orleans and this plate allowed my taste buds to experience traditional flavors I was in search for.  Red beans and rice was so delicious my daughter even ordered a side of the same.  Highly recommend. We also enjoyed desert (creme brulee, banana foster and pecan pie.
