Average, typical tourist trap serving fried food.  not too expensive, but, much better options on or off Bourbon Street.  Service was good, seated promptly, not crowded when we went, but went early and off peak on a rainy day.  Wine and Champagne mark up lower than average.

Fast, friendly service. Keith, Alysha and Michelle were an amazing team who provided seamless pleasant and efficient service. Brunch was delicious. The coffee was the best we've had our whole trip! We will definitely return for lunch or dinner next time we are in town!

In heart of Bourbon St is this great tasting restaurant! I visited this place 3 days in a row. The drinks are made perfectly, especially if Kevin is bartending. The food is also great. It was my first time trying alligator, but I enjoyed it and found that I prefer the fried alligator. My husband had the redfish fillet as an entree, while I ate grilled shrimp alfredo and all of it was good. During our last visit, a waiter overheard that it was our anniversary and he surprised us with a pretty good dessert. 

Due to Covid, this is currently one of the only spots in Nola that allows one to make a reservation. I strongly suggest making a reservation as there could be a long wait.

The staff was confused, seemed to lack training or interest in their jobs. We were asked to wait outside for a table when we were brought in they shuffled us around and then finally placed us at the bar. The music and TVs were VERY loud. It took 20+ minutes to get service. Our server/bartender checked on us at the end of our meal. The bartender was very busy while 4 host(s) stood around the entire time.

The food was great! The prices were a little steep for my taste but hey, most seafood is! The only non star giving attribute was the loud and freezing cold atmosphere. We got the crab cakes and types of pasta dishes! The servings were small for delicious!

This is a mixed review for me. I loved our waiter and the other staff that was there. The restaurant is really eye catchy and you tend to get lost looking at everything. They also have a lot of seating on several floors. 

What I didnt like was that they made us wait outside, in a line for about 30+ min, which would have been ok, except once we got inside, I noticed that they had SEVERAL tables that were empty and not reserved. When I asked about it, they just shrugged. They also had inside waiting seats, but werent allowing anyone to sit in those either. I had to take my daughter to the bathroom at one point, but it was bad because it was so hot. Hotter than it was outside. I figured it must be next to a kitchen or something, they just need a bit better ventilation or AC in there. We were sweating by the time we got out of there. 

What I hated: We came here strictly for gator tail. My husband really wanted to try it. What we got was tiny and I do mean tiny, bits of nuggets that were mostly breading. It was about 10 pieces, and 3 of them were strictly breading only. We were also charged about $10 for this tidbit of food. I asked the waiter about it and he said it was a normal serving. I also ordered their signature baked oysters on the half shell. They were bad. I couldnt eat them after the first one. They tasted like old fish and smell worse. I also mentioned this to the waiter but he said there was nothing wrong with them. We got charged another $10 for that. 

The kids meals came as described, but the kids said they tasted funny. They kinda did. They had a weird rubbery taste to them. But I also had just eaten one of the oysters, so I attributed it to that. I got the small cup of gumbo (came with hardly anything in it) and my husband got what I consider the most expensive po'boy ever. The gumbo was ok and the po'boy was ok. We never got our 3rd kids meal, and I had to point that out several times when the check came, cause they still charged us for it. We finally got that removed. We ordered the kids some shirley temples because they had been good, but we got charged $7 for EACH drink. It doesnt have alcohol in it. Its sprite/7up with Grenadine. So very friendly waiter, ok food and not so great food. There are a few other places we will probably eat at next time.

It was just O.K. ... the food was ok, the service was okay...would I go back...meh...probably not. 

Def a tourist attraction....just meh.

I was looking for chargrilled oysters during my visit to New Orleans and the hotel recommended this restaurant. I am gluten free which I told the manager  as well as the waitstaff. The oysters I was served were burnt on the shell and hard as a rock. The lemon drop I ordered was like lemonade. I will never be back, the food and the drink was subpar.
Briana was so patient with our large group. Super friendly and made great menu recommendations. Fun atmosphere.
Get the shrimp Po Boy.. 1/2 blackened and 1/2 fried. You're welcome! Crab cakes are outstanding also

What an awesome experience! Chris P was our waiter and made some excellent recommendations!!! The blackened Redfish Oceana was superb, the Bloody Mary was legendary, and the Mousse was phenomenal. Debating about going back again tomorrow...it was that good!

Excellent service and very good food. One of the most unique interior structures I've ever eaten in. It's one of those things that would never pass muster under the rules and regulations of most modern building inspectors...which is what makes it totally worth it. Again, very good food. Staff was great, too. Highly recommend
This spot was hoppin! Make reservations online before you go to avoid standing in line for a table. Food was all delicious and freshly prepared.

Not sure really what I can say at this moment as I am fuming mad. I will try to be straight across-the-board with this review. Over the last 10 years we've been to New Orleans 10 or 12 times we've  eaten at the Oceana almost every time. The food was always great as was the service. Today it was a completely different story. The steak or should I say steaks as my wife and I each ordered one. The steaks were as thick as a deck of cards and may be 2 inches longer than a deck of cards, you can see the fork in the picture to show how small the steak was, now if you've ever had dinner at Ruth's Chris or Maguires in Pensacola you know what a ribeye steak should look like. Believe it or not that steak in the picture was $29!! I thought when I saw the price it had to be an absolutely fantastic steak I couldn't have been more wrong. Here's how it went, we arrived there they were slightly busy no busier than we've ever seen, we were seated it took a waitress 10 minutes to get to us no problems so far but at this point we knew we needed to order our drinks and food and appetizer all at the same time, been through this before with other restaurants. Waitress came we gave her our full order, 20 minutes later he comes the food in this order, steaks came before the drinks, the appetizers came after the steaks, now are you picking up what I'm laying down? I fully understand that restaurants are understaffed for quality servers, cooks and managers but it kept getting worse. We have never been to the Oceana and not had a manager come up and ask us how everything was going and how our meal was, this time was the first time no manager came up, and now thinking of it I realized why. Getting our food getting our drinks getting what we paid for just seemed like we were pulling teeth every step of the way, the worst part of all of it is I know will never go back there again as it's obvious that the owner of the business does not care or he would be in there making sure to keep his reputation in great shape. I'm sure that more bad reviews will come in do to extremely poor management and ownership that must be going on there. As far as leaving a tip we love to tip so much so we have many many times had our credit card company contact us and ask us to verify because our tips are so large in this situation we did not leave a tip and I wrote on the bill about how unhappy we were with the service and the food. The ownership needs to get it together. They Brag and show pictures of NFL football players eating there my wife made a comment that if a football player would've seen the steak they put on our plates they would've laughed it right off the table. I can't tell you how upset I am mainly because I know We will never be able to go back there again. Oceana if you're going to charge $29 for a steak at least have it be bigger than what Walmart sells.

Catfish and shrimp were not freshly cooked and was a lower grade, the brownie that I've had in the past was not the same, extremely hard and not fresh. After waiting in a long line in anticipation the whole experience was a huge disappointment.

Excellent food!!! Service could use a bit of an emp, especially the hostess, but time are hard and we should all enjoy the goodness in life.....well on the way out, we told the hostess it was great hope you have a great day! She rolled her eyes and threw an attitude. My group actually came the day before and left because she was in such a horrible mood. All for 1 bad cash cow, 1 star is eliminated.

08/19/21- Came down exactly 2 years after our first time and Errol, Ariana and friends welcomed this Pittsburgh couple like we were old friends.  

We started off with a mimosa and another before my Oceana Famous Bloody Mary was dropped off.  The mimosas were very good but this BM was INCREDIBLE!  It had 6 fried shrimp, 6 fried oysters and 2 fried soft shell crabs on top of the smoothest BM I've had down here.  Yumm...!

Next came the BBQ Shrimp in New Orleans bbq sauce which is a butter/flour base (NOT tomato) and it comes with bread to sop up all that delicious rue.... Yumm...!!

Next was Oceana's Famous Oysters with more of that bbq sauce & a bread crumb mixture on top of a dozen fire grilled oysters.  Oh yea...!  

And once again... after all that food we found ourselves too full to order an entree.  That's twice in a row.  Lol.  

Do yourself a favor and try this place!   The food is reasonably priced, as fresh as you'll get and comes with a smiling & friendly staff...

So as I was in New Orleans for Mardi Gras I had to stop at Oceana Grill it was another stop on my must stop list. So I had a 2 pacifics item that I just had to try. So on my first visit the first item was the Ultimate BloodyMary. OMG this was so much more then what I was expecting it was a meal and a drink all-in-one. It was a BloodyMary topped with  4 pieces of large fried shrimp, four fried  oysters, and a full fried soft shelled crab. It even came with vegetable like cajun spicy green beans, pearl onions, banana peppers, and green olives. LOL But seriously it was AWESOME so much so I went twice for this item. So another visit was the day I was leaving and for breakfast I had eggs over easy, alligator sausage, blackened alligator, and cajun potatoes again it was absolutely delicious. Now I have to give a HUGE shout out to the staff they were very friendly and very helpful. They answered  all my questions. The it was a great environment. The restaurant was very clean.

Oceana Grill..... ugh I'm in love.... been there twice now and it never gets old. Sadly I only have pictures of the Oceana's Famous Oysters, but on the bright side that is the BEST thing you can order so that's all you need to see.

For an entree, I HIGHLY recommend the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta. 10/10 meal. I am not someone who likes super spicy food, and I can tell you that I LOVED this meal. Not too spicy, the sauce was just right. Shrimp and alligator sausage mixed in with fettuccine pasta and that irresistible sauce. By far one of the best meals I've ever had... and so much food that I couldn't even finish it all and ended up bringing some home.

Dessert is not even in question.... I am not a huge "toffee" or "coffee" person, but I love anything chocolate, so I had to get the Chocolate Kahlua Mousse....... shared it with my date and it definitely was the icing on the cake of the meal. A pricey night, but for the meal we had, it was 100% worth every penny.

CASUAL OR DRESSY. BEAUTIFUL OUTDOOR PATIO. DO NOT SIT INSIDE WHILE YOU'RE HERE!

Great place to eat! Wait was not long for a Saturday night. Food was awesome. Had the taste of New Orleans. Gator bites were okay. Hurricane was great! Hats off to the bartender there! Best I have had in NOLA.

This was the first place we ate on our trip to New Orleans and it did not disappoint! We tried the Gator Tail Bites, Seafood Gumbo, & Cajun Fries which were amazing. Our server Chris P. was very polite and provided excellent service. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.
Food was great wait staff was very nice.  We had the small ceaser salad and a side of sautéed shrimp yummy!

Great service!. We were visiting New Orleans from Dallas and we made reservation to go to Oceana since this was one of the recommended restaurant. I made reservation prior to even leaving Dallas. When we walked in we were glad we made reservation because omg the line is crazy. We waited probably like 10 minutes when we got there and we were seated. Our waiter's name was Jacelynn I believe. She was super nice and she was attentive even though it was very busy in there. I read about a drink with Jolly Rancher and I ordered it and it was way too sweet and not my type of drink but it was something good to try. My husband got the margarita and he really enjoyed his drink. I was not very hungry so I decided to do the crab cake which is an appetizer as a meal and the portion size was huge and I am glad I got that. It was ok honestly since I have had better crab cake but still good I would say. My husband got the mardi gras pasta and he added crab meat. He said it was good but he would not order again since he did not care for it too much.Overall I felt like the food was good and I would definitely go back again since the prices were decent too. I would not wait 3 hours to go in but if I had reservation and did not have to wait I would visit again when I go back to New Orleans. The waitress made the visit BETTER for sure since she was extremely friendly and just overall very nice.

Taste of New Orleans$17. Crab cake, seafood "Gumbo" were good . Could have been little bit more warmer especially Gumbo ( kind of stew which has rice + fish+ misc) . Very quick service! Outdoor seating was nice.

The gumbo is to die for. So is the loaded fries. This is a must go to in NOLA!!!! We've had the red fish and pasta as well. I don't think you could go wrong at oceanas. It's def one of our must  go to places every time we stop in the city.
The oysters were so amazing! My son got the chicken pasta & it was huge. We had great food & great service!

Don't eat here !! The worst place !! After I ate this I couldn't get out of bed for hours !! WORST STOMACH ACHE !!!!!!!!!! LITERALLY THE WORST STOMACH ACHE IVE EVER HAAD .. I ordered  food and literally 2 min later my food came ? Do they already have everything cooked already ? Do they let the food sit out ? I'm so sick that I don't even know . Be careful y'all . CAME TO FIND OUT I GOT FOOD  POISONING!!!!! SHIT CRAZY

The food here is so good. You really can't go wrong with whatever you end up choosing. The Cajun fries are to die for. If you're going to get anything, get those. Probably one of the best things I've ever eaten. We also got the fried catfish poboy and it was very good. It didn't look like anything special when it came out but was extremely good. You must go to this place while in NOLA.

Oceana grill Was My Spot About 5 years Ago I don't know if they have a new ownership but they need help first of all the  young ladies in the front are Very unprofessional We made reservations and they put us in the corner by the bar in a dark!!And so then the manager came and helped us out and gave us better seating The barbecue shrimp is totally different I have photos from five years ago I was happy to upload the way to food looked The barbecue shrimp sauce was Orange The red fish was dry/overcook They definitely need help

Yuuuuuum! New Orleans is one of my favorite spots to eat and Oceana Grill did not disappoint! 

I started with a cup of gumbo ($4.75). It was SUPERB and included half a steamed crab on the side.

I had a huge bowl of red beans and rice ($12). They were seasoned perfectly. My husband had the grilled alligator po'boy ($11). Ohhhh!!!! It. Was. So. Good. 

Looking for a good variety of food at very reasonable prices in the Big Easy?! Make your way to Oceana Grill!
Food was amazing! Definitely a "go to" for yummy food and a great vibe! Thanks to our waiter, John!
Everything here is finger licking good. I've worked across the street from Oceana Grill for years. The barbecue ribs are to die for! Trust me you won't be disappointed.
Excellent taste, generous portions, reasonably priced, friendly service, phenomenal dessert (especially the cheesecake).

This was our first time eating here...everything was delicious!! Hubby had the Eggs Benedict and I had the Country Breakfast...so good!!! Coffee was good and strong!! Stop by and give them a try. They won't disappoint!! Seymone, our server, was awesome...very sweet and knowledgeable of menu and specials. Chelsea was the manager and she was very nice...restaurant was VERY clean and all staff had their masks on.  We will definitely be back!!

This place is a NOLA food hotspot for a reason.  We came for a late lunch on a Friday and there was no wait.  The chargrilled oysters were amazing, but I was so surprised by the Taste of New Orleans!  The creole jambalaya, crawfish etouffée, red beans and rice with smoked sausage were so unexpectedly good.  I say unexpectedly because it's a sampler platter, so we were prepared for just enough to give us a taste range for the dish.  No.  We are every bit of the samples on offer and found the flavor and taste to be excellent.  For $19, this dish was on point for both portion and flavor...I may have enjoyed it more than the oysters!

My husband and I had just arrived in town and we're told we should check this place out if we wanted authentic  New Orleans food and drink...

Since we were staying nearby we did....

It was the right move.....

As you can see by the pictures, the food and drink were BETTER than they looked!!

Amazing food (I had the sampler which had red beans and rice, crawfish etoufee and jambalaya)

My husband had the redfish etoufee which was delicious....

I had the Hurricane which was awesome and we topped off our meal with a great dessert (Oceana brownie topped with caramel  sauce and ice cream)

Delicious 

And tHe service was great and the crowd was very welcoming.....

We watched part of the Super Bowl there as well

I would recommend stopping by if you're ever in the French Quarter

Amazingly delicious food! The reviews were not wrong at all. Our server John was very good and quick with anything we asked for. Will definitely visit this restaurant again! 

We hade the oyster platter and we doctored up the fries with crawfish. We had the gator bites (awesome) and the crab cakes(best thing at our table).
Good food, good service and worth the wait. Their chicken, biscuits and gravy was a hit with my fiancé. Chicken Ceaser was delicious. Would recommended.

My party and I went here for breakfast and it was some of the best breakfast we had our entire trip!

The drinks were to die for, service was outstanding, and the food was delicious. I really enjoyed the Lost Bread and my partner loved the St. James Crepe. A really great experience all around and I would definitely go here again!
This place is a must if you are visiting NOLA. Darrick the bartender always does a great job

DONT LET A LINE SCARE YOU IT MOVES !!! I came here two days in a row. Once for dinner and once for breakfast. Nicole my server was amazing!!! We got the Cajun frenchfries which were to die for ! I got redfish Tchoupitoulas which I'm still dreaming about 3 days later. I'm really trying to figure out how they made the jalapeño crawfish cornbread under the fish!!! My super picky friend got grilled chicken and LOVED IT!!! Other friend got pasta and it was great. Came back next day for breakfast- got eggplant something w fried green tomatoes and poached egg- amazing. my friend got chicken Perdu. Drooling thinking about it all, days later! I literally would come all the way back from FL just to visit Oceana.
The food was delicious and flavorful! I ordered my food through UberEats and I'm so happy my food was hot and came with utensils!

The service was amazing our server Ronald had the most glorious mustache you will ever set your eyes on. My girl went with the gumbo I went with the recommended jambalaya pasta it was the most amazing thing I've ever tasted. 10/10 recommend you stop in.

The raw oysters at Oceana gave my groom and best man food poisoning. It is the only thing that only the two of them ate during our trip. My groom was so sick he barely made it through our wedding and both guys had to go get IV fluids and medications right before our wedding ceremony. Thanks to the food poisoning, my groom had to leave our reception early and didn't get to celebrate. Several of our wedding guests also ate at Oceana and experienced food poisoning as well. We will never eat here again.

This place was incredible, the service, the food, and the drinks! Being from Oklahoma it's hard find some sea food this good! 

Tim the manager on duty had the best customer service. Our waiter, Kieth, was incredible as well, respectful and informative. Hats off to him! Mad the experience. 

Moral of the story: This place was fantastic all around.

Oceana is steps away from Bourbon and is a huge location with several seating area however the line forms and some wraps down the street. However the staff is great, service is southern style hospitality and the food well ya better bring an appetite and be prepared to take home leftovers.

The thing that I loved is they don't skimp on quality ingredients or meat in there dishes. The jambalaya pasta was amazing my only complaint is the accompanying bread was cold.

The fries were battered and seasoned
The seafood was crisp and light to let the flavor
Of the seafood shine.


Drinks pack a punch and the bread pudding is scrumptious

Location, food and service were great. We tried the gumbo, jambalaya and alligator bites. Our server was extremely nice and helpful with suggestions. The drinks were delicious. Try a tropical storm if you stop in.
Amethyst was our server and she suggested the gator pasta which was soooo good! My boyfriend enjoyed it too. We will always be back.

We were recommended this restaurant by our hotel staff. We saw this is one of the few places open to sit down and eat inside past 10pm in the French Quarter. I ordered the duck which was dried out, jambalaya tasted like rice with tons of Louisiana hot sauce thrown in, and a side of cream style corn for $27. My wife had oysters in the half shell since they had run out of chargrilled oysters- she kept complaining about how they have raw oysters but don't have cooked oysters. This was our anniversary dinner and we got dressed up for it thinking it was a nicer restaurant based on their website and other reviews. It's basically less fancier than a Red Lobster with mediocre to boring food. We felt overdressed since mostly it appeared to be a casual restaurant open to people with after bar munchies. We were here around 11:00 pm to midnight. They are open until 1am. This was a Monday night too. The service was great and was the saving grace to this review giving 3 stars instead of 1. Not really sure why this place is highly reviewed on google, Yelp, and TripAdvisor. We had better eats at Verdi Marte, Vieux Carre pizza, and Acme Oyster House.

Ate there last night with my husband. The best seafood gumbo ever!! My husband had the special, blackened redfish with shrimp and pasta. It was amazing. Drinks were great with a nice atmosphere out in the courtyard.

The fries with crawfish sauce are amazing and the reason to make this a destination plus double shot hurricanes! A negative is that 5 in our party got apps and meals before the one vegetarian got her app or meal. They took it off the bill but it was a serious downer after waiting on line for an hour and a half.

Great first meal in New Orleans. Shrimp platter was piled so high couldn't even eat it all. Great Hurricane. Service was amazing. Crawfish Étouffée was to die for. Friendly waitress with lots of info on the city.
This place has amazing, and the hostess Meagan was just as amazing. I would definitely recommend this place for good food

Went there with my family and had a wonderful experience.  The food was great.  Walked in with no wait at all.  The waiter was very helpful when explaining the menu.  Food arrived quickly and was excellent.  We will be visiting here again on our next trip to NOLA.
Was seated right away. Covid guidelines adhered to. Food was delicious. Our server, Jayceon was outstanding and made us feel right at home

The best service!!! The food is amazing!!!! The hurricane drink was actually made perfect and not made strong like everywhere else!  The price is great! We enjoyed everything about this place!!! I recommend the food, service and drinks!

There's 2 areas you can be seated. Expect to feel pretty cramped in both. The larger of the two was poorly lit and just felt off. The service was good, though. Everyone was friendly and our waiter was especially kind and helped us make decisions on what to choose since we aren't from New Orleans. The food portions looked small, but don't let that fool you. We left absolutely stuffed. The gator bites as an appetizer were well seasoned and perfect. I had the taste of New Orleans trio plate and I couldn't finish it. Delicious.

Arrived for a late night dinner on a Monday evening and they are open till 1am  Our waitress today is the lovely Kearica  We ordered red wine Robert Mondovi and LaCrema by the glass but bottles are available as well  So far so good  Then Oyster Rockefeller and Oceana's Famous Oyster    Deliciousness 
Then for dinner Redfish Oceana and Praline Duck   I think I enjoyed the Praline Duck more and I am not a duck fan but this was surprisingly really good   For dessert Chocolate Kahlua Mousse. Wow now that was tasty creamy smooth fluffy and not overly sweet which I appreciate. I want to enjoy the chocolate not the sugar 
I was impressed that all the servings came out rather quickly. And I enjoyed eating my fish hot not room temperature. This was probably the most pleasant surprise for me that my fish was brought to the table hot 
Thank you for an enjoyable evening after a long day of work

Great food! Great environment and staff! Wanted to give a huge shoutout to our waiter Demarus, he was absolutely splendid and knowledgable! This was our very first stop in New Orleans and he was so helpful! Thank you Demarcus!!

I came to this location originally for brunch while visiting NOLA for the weekend and might i say the food was delicious. I love the feel of the restaurant it definitely makes you feel like your in the French quarter. 

The service was great!!!! Now this is no exaggeration. We were greeted in the way in, once we reached the top of the stairs, at the table, by our waitress, food runners, and by the host and door greeters on the way out. I just loved the southern hospitality. 

We also tried alligator for the first time and it was very good and not what i expected. All in all my experience was amazing and this place is a 5/5 Hands down. If i could give it a 10 i would! Don't cheat yourself by not visiting Oceana while in NOLA!

I would recommend this place for tourists and a big group of friends who are hungry late at night. 

I came here with a party of about 15 people around 11pm on a weekend. We got seated in the courtyard area on a lovely night, and we did not even make reservations. We got served quickly and it was surprisingly not overly packed yet. 

I had the mardi gras pasta for my entree. For my appetizers i had the cajun alligator sausage and ocean's famous oysters chargrilled on the half shell. They were all amazing! I did not expect the alligator to taste tender and to have so much flavor to it. The oysters were great too. Great for a heart attack, but that's what makes it taste so good. 

Mardi gras pasta was also good, not too cheesy and overly creamy and just the right portion too. 

I'm glad we picked this place for a late night place to eat! Great for a night out with a large group

First of all - Jasmine took care of us! She set us up with extra table space to accommodate all the food we ordered. Then...the food... it was top notch...oysters, crab cakes, seafood sampler, red fish... all of it was delish!!! The food came fast and was so hot... wow.
Beyond Yummy.  Excellent cooks - believe one is from the old Petunia's.
Great service and good food. Large portions and the food was seasoned perfectly. The cost of their entrees are about the average the area.

Had dinner here last night and it was SUPER AMAZING FOOD!!!! Great service, great drinks & the food was perfect. 

The restaurant has everything you could want to try in Naw'lins but the portions are so big, it's hard to finish the plate. 

The cup of seafood gumbo was actually a bowl size and the flavors were insanely good! The rest of the food we tried did not leave us disappointed at all. More like wanting to go to sleep from being so full!

1st stop on our NOLA adventure, recommended by local officer.  Our server Kim was amazing, bubbly personality & spot on service.  This is a casual dining experience with great food & drinks; started with gator tail bites & a bubbling strawberry margarita. My sister had the  cakes & I had the fried shrimp platter, both were yummy & great portions.  The food arrives hot,delicious & quickly.
Top notch! Everything was delicious and our server Pamela was the best we've ever encountered. So nice, bubbly and full of information!

My friend and I stopped in for dinner on Christmas Eve, and were thrilled to be able to get balcony seating (There are only 3 tables up there).  Service was fast and friendly, and the food was very good.  She got the red beans & rice, and I opted for the chicken fettucine alfredo (Yeah, I know, not typical NOLA fare, but it was what I wanted...don't judge me!)  The alfredo sauce was a little bland, but not terrible, but that's the only thing that kept them from a 5th star.   And from the balcony, you have a great view for people watching.

Checked this place out while in New Orleans. Have to say that their food is delicious! Service is fast and friendly. Their pasta is to die for. Love love love the pasta! A must try. Would definitely love to return to this place to try more of their food. Loved the vibe and would recommend checking them out!

came for lunch and dinner due to it's location and our inability to move around during Mardi Gras

CAJUN JAMBALAYA PASTA
- excellent firm fettuccini, with super yummy sauce, flavorful seafood/shrimp/alligator sausage, this is pretty damn awesome and definitely a must get

Blackened Catfish - yummy and soft with good seasoning

Gator bites - get the mixed fried and blackened, they go well with the delicious remoulade sauce that comes on the side!

TASTE OF NEW ORLEANS
- Creole jambalaya , crawfish etouffée, red beans & rice with smoked sausage - a very good saucy mix of items good for sharing, i would recommend this dish

good food and warm friendly service at both morning and night, they even let us toss excess beads off the balcony, a real NOLA experience!
We came here with a large party of friends for the first time.  Every bit of our experience was outstanding.  Food, drinks, desserts and our waitress Mary were all top notch!

The Mardi Gras pasta is to die for, along with their Cajun fries that's an appetizer. I made reservations the night before because the first night we thought about getting dinner there, the line was really long (not just there but literally every place we were thinking about dining in) so reservations is the way to go! My only complaint is where we were sat felt like it didn't have any air what so ever so it made the time there a little uncomfortable especially since we had walked almost a mile to get there & it was 90 degrees. So some air would've made the experience a lot better. The food was amazing. I'm sure COVID has a lot to do with the service and being short staffed & the current staff being stretched thin. Our waiter was super nice, the only thing was I think our adult beverages weren't put in and we didn't receive them til we were already eating our entrees. Even then that was not a major issue because if anything, they have to go cups. (Also the Bahama mama... wonderful!)
One star...i mean...it was open!  So that's 2 starts.  Pop boys...fries, drinks, vegetable fettuccine with no veg.  Dirty...good servers but. Meh!!

Everything here is so good! Oceana Grill was highly recommended by many of the locals and there were a lot of great reviews so my friends and I had to check it out. We ordered several different entrees to share so we could try everything and I liked most of the dishes we ordered!

A quick rundown of what we ordered:
- Fresh Oysters: Can't go wrong with these! 
- Oceana's Famous Oysters: This was too salty in my opinion. 
- Louisiana Crabmeat Cakes: These were okay. Nothing too special. 
- Blackened Gator Tail Bites: We tried a gator dish at every restaurant we went to in New Orleans and this one was by far the best! I recommend you try this! 
- Fried Catfish: These were good but felt like a fried food overload because it also came with a side of fries. 
- Redfish Oceana: Comes with a side of mashed potatoes and collard greens. Everything about this dish was delicious! 
- Cajun Jambalaya Pasta: This was my favorite dish! It was well seasoned and very flavorful. 
- Crawfish Etouffee: Not as flavorful as I hoped. I would pass on ordering this. 

We left feeling very full and satisfied. This was a nice place to grab lunch. The ambience was cool and we our waiter was very friendly. It's also conveniently located in the French Quarter so you go out and explore the city more afterwards.

The only reason why I didn't have such a great experience here is because we ate at another restaurant for lunch that appears to be the same restaurant. However, the food was still good, but a bit pricey for what you are actually getting. The food isn't bad, but it's nothing special. 

Service was decent and our food came quick. Our group of 7 was in and out in about an hour. The restaurant is big, so there's tons of seating, but it's also so big that service could be a little rough. 

All in all, with all the other options around, I'd pick something else for dinner. If you're looking for lunch though, this place is great.

Great if you are looking for a decent place on Bourbon street. The restaurant is a bit hidden in an allay. It's big restaurant. The food is decent but you would find it typical. The price is expensive but given it's on Bourbon street it make sense. If you mind the budget, don't come here for a meal. The service was quick and the waitress was nice and friendly. The line is long for dinner. Overall it's a decent place with a bit of a high price tag.
John was extremely polite and the steak was blackened and grilled perfectly. Excellent bloody marys. Clean
Bree is an awesome waiter, great service with a great smile!! Definitely coming back!!
The food was outstanding, served hot, with friendly staff and an enchanting courtyard dinning area. Fiona was our server. She offered great tips and was very gracious. Loved the whole experience.

Great food.  Great service.  Server knew exactly how to help us make menu decisions   Suggested drinks.   Had really good time there. Even with Covid, this was a very enjoyable dinner.  Wait was about 20-30 minutes.

Our server Fiona was super sweet and attentive. We had a small wait at the door to get in but it wasn't bad at all. Try the blackened gator bites while you're here. The crab cakes are good as well. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because it's not the best Cajun food Ive ever had. Expected more considering the area. Every cajan restaurant in town seems to have the same exact menu.

Ugh so good 
Got the Cajun fries, gumbo, and taste of New Orleans
All so good had a lot of leftovers lol because I wanted to try it all
Our server Ron was so great and kind!
Great place! I had the Crawfish etoufee and a hurricane! I recommend this place for sure

Came here on a late Sunday with the guys - there was quite a line outside, maybe 10-15 people ahead of us but it was actually moving pretty quickly which was nice. When we finally got inside we saw that the place wasn't even really that full - maybe 70%. Figures they were probably throttling the customers a little bit as to not overload the servers. 

Anyway - we ended up getting seated upstairs which was cool. Our drinks unfortunately took a long time to come out. Our server said they ran out of root beer upstairs so.. I guess they had to go find some downstairs.. but it shouldn't take 15 min to walk a flight of stairs right? Food came out shortly after the drinks and then the waitress disappeared for a while. She never came back to check on us by the time we finished our meal. We ended up having to flag 2 different people down just to find her. We did end up ordering some desserts and they came out ok. 

Overall dining experience was ok, the place is pretty happenin' which is cool but the service could have been better. Seems to be the trend in this neck of the woods with tip being added automatically to most places. Hopefully you will get better service than we did.

So it's been at least three years since we've been to NOLA and we always try at least one place on Bourbon Street to try and eat at. Well, this restaurant is the one to go too!!! I forgot to take pics of everything we ordered but I do remember what we got:

Crab cakes
Blackened chicken fettuccini Alfredo 
Blackened gator bites 
Cajun fries
Oysters 
Strawberry Mint Margarita 

It was all so GOOD! We want to go back it was great! We were a bit hesitant at first but the waitress recommended the blackened chicken and it was so delicious. We literally ate everything. We ordered family style so we go to try all the plates and we have no complaints here!

Was very surprised. It took an hour and 20 minutes to get our order. The service sucked but the food was delicious. It's hard to say if the wait was worth it or not. If the wait wasn't so long I would definitely give this place a 5 star.

Awesome place!! Went last night and had a very nice time. Food was amazingly delicious and the waiting staff was very pleasant and courteous. Darrick, our waiter, was very nice making us feel welcomed and treated each one of us with respect and always with a smile. He was friendly and even made our 10 year old feel very special!! 
If ever in NOLA, gotta come to this place and try their Gator Bites and Crabmeat Cakes...Delicious!! Hope you are lucky enough to meet Darrick on your visit!

Great place.  Always love Yelp
Recommendations.  Food and service was great. 
Liked the second floor....

Such a great place in the downtown of New Orleans. Nice cozy yard. I was so happy they're pet friendly, so our little guy could come with us. 
The portions are huge. Food is very delicious . I loved blackened fish Po Boy.
Service is great and fast. Definitely a good place to stop by for a good lunch and taste Louisiana food.
We had cajun pasta, MardiGrah pasta, ribs and crab cake pasta, side of hush puppies and charbroiled oysters. The food is delicious but a bit overpriced for the simplness of pasta.

Wow what a great night! We were a group of 8 friends and we had a blast! The food and drinks were absolutely delicious and the staff was even better, they were all truly exceptional! Special shout out to our server Stacey who was superb! Highly recommend Oceana Grill and will definitely be returning!

Not a pleasant experience. Despite having a reservation and plenty of empty tables inside, they made us wait for almost 45' outside then another 10' inside. The staff who managed the seating was not friendly at all. The foods were ok, nothing special. We ordered 2 half dozen oysters and the oysters of the second order were frozen and not edible. They later brought us a new order after we reported this to the manager.

Was not impressed with this place at all. Overrated. Oysters were so big it seemed unusual. Had a different taste though. The chargrilled oysters could've been grilled a little longer. Shrimp po boy was not good. Shrimp tasted old. They tried to help but didn't do good. Maybe just wasn't their night. Management call themselves giving us a discount of 10%. Which wasn't enough. But hey, live and learn. Won't be coming back.

Everything Was fabulous! The atmosphere was comfortable and colorful, the staff were friendly, efficient and very hospitable, The bloody Mary was delicious, the coffee was perfect and our food was amazing. Really amazing!

Local popular dive.. long wait.. small dark cramped quarters.. food was good sized portions but service was slow and sporadic.. also a bit pricy for the quality.. while local the hype is more than the experience.. do it once and go ahead and eat your way through New Orleans..!

Tried this restaurant while in town and wow! From the busboy to the manager, everyone was so friendly and helpful. I highly recommend our server Brad. He made sure we had a great experience. The food was nothing short of amazing. Definitely a great place to stop while in town.
Love the place the food was great the staff was great we really enjoy every min, I really recommend this place

Understanding that we are in Phase 1 post-COVID re-openings..... I placed an order over the phone at 9:51 p.m. I was told that it would be 50 minutes until ready. Not wanting to wait that long, I decided to cancel the order. The employee preemptively stated, really it will be ready in 25 minutes. Wanting a detour from fast food, I decided to keep the order, knowing full well that the food wouldn't be ready for 50 minutes. Arrived to pickup up at 11pm and still waited un 11:27 pm to receive COLD food, and no dressing for one of the salads. Pass this place, they aren't who they used to be.
Great place. Lots of room for a big group. Kids food came out very fast. Apps and entrees  were excellent. Tyana is awesome!!!

This place started off good... it definitely has potential.  Unfortunately for my party of 5, we were scammed by our waitress.  We thought she was being a genuinely good waitress... the whole experience was great... UNTIL WE PAID THE BILL! PLEASE,  PLEASE,  PLEASE CHECK YOUR TAB IF DORI IS YOUR WAITRESS!!!!!!

After our wonderful meal, we get the tab.  We split the bill... there's a $30 tip already included in the total... well DORI decides to add another $20 dollars to the other two tabs on top of the $30 that had already been split between the group of 5! We bring it to her attention and guess what... SHE DECIDES TO CLOSE OUT OUR check so that it makes the process a mess to get our money back.!!!

WAIT! IT GETS BETTER! She then also "forgets" to give us our 10% Yelp discount!!! Our bill was 230!!! Ugghhh.  

The manager... poor guy.  Didn't know what to do or how to fix the situation.  He didn't even discipline the waitress.  Needless to say... no apology either.  

STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE OR double check your receipt before you sign, pay,  and leave.  Im sure it's happened before and wasn't caught.

Our first nigh in NOLA we stopped here for dinner and we were not disappointed. The atmosphere, drinks, and food was absolutely amazing. Our waitress Fiona was the best and her personality made our experience even better. She never let a drink get empty. Now for the food let's just say it was on of the best places we ate during our entire vacation.

I would just rate this restaurant okay. I have eaten much better seafood, not sure how it is rated so high. We ate a late lunch here around 2:30 and I am not sure if that was the cause and the food wasn't fresh. My husband and I shared the seafood platter and my son had a burger. He said the burger was good. The oysters on the platter were fried well and the shrimp were pretty good. The catfish was dry and chewy. The French fries were cold and hard. Hush puppies had a good flavor but were dense. Service was good. I would try somewhere different if I wanted to eat seafood again.

This was such a great find for our continued search for all that is creole. Tucked away down a little side street, kept the hustle and bustle away. We were seated right away. Our server was very prompt and efficient. The taste of New Orleans gave us a little bit of everything but we also had to  get the oysters Rockefeller and gumbo. Everything was so good and super flavorful. The vibe was super low key which is always nice. Definitely a good find!

I've been to NOLA 3 times and I'm not sure why I kept passing by this place. I went here for the first time last night and it was amazing. I got the taste of New Orleans and it was pretty satisfied. My favorite was the beans and rice. I think I might just get that instead. Crab cakes were great as well!
Cajun fries and blackened alligator is a must! Best restaurant near bourbon in my opinion. Our waitress was sweet enough to make a must do list as first timers!

A native recommended Oceana to me and it did not dissapoint, I had a delicious breakfast here! They had so many options on their menu that it was really hard to choose, but I finally settled on the royal omelette: stuffed with alligator sausage and diced vegetables, topped with a crawfish and mushroom cream sauce, accompanied by hashbrowns and a biscuit. 

I could eat like this every day. Sure, I'd double my weight and develop loads of health problems, but it would be worth it.

The omelette was cooked just the way I like it, not runny but also not browned whatsoever. The gator was delicious, and that cream sauce with crawfish had me almost licking the plate. Hashbrowns and bloody marys were also on point. I couldn't bring myself to finish the biscuit. 

Service was great, everyone from the waiter to the hostess to the busboys stopped to smile and say hi.

We wandered in here late night and I am so glad we did. The ribs are a must! Stacy was absolutely incredible. I can be THAT customer with all the questions and pickiness but she was so patient and courteous. It was such a great experience. I would return just because of the customer service alone. Do yourself a favor and stop by and grab a hurricane a slab of tender ribs.
25 min wait was well worth the wait. Try the chicken fettuccine! I added crawfish and my friend said it was the best he's ever had.

After waiting 15 min to be another 30 min back from the door to Cafe Beignet my google search began for an alternate breakfast spot for me and my crew of 6 fellow travelers.  I called multiple spots but something about the warm syrupy drawl of the hostess at the Oceana Grill gave me confirmation it was time to switch to plan B.  They are in a lil cut due to construction but don't let that deter you.  Seating is great and plentiful inside and outside courtyard space is open.

We were not disappointed at all! Lots of pics coming but let me tell you we were sat immediately.  The service was good, time to serving of the food was good for a party this size and the server Carla was in training and very sweet.  

Now lets get into this food! I got the Cajun Sausage breakfast and crab cake appetizer.  The grits...see grits are a big thing to us southern girls and they must be RIGHT! Most times you have to "doctor" on them with butter and salt and pepper and cheese if you can get it.  Someone's auntie that was taught to make grits by her great grandma made these grits.  These grits needed nothing! Delicious! The sausage, crab cake and scrambled eggs were tasty but the next star was the biscuit.  Dripping in honey butter, thick and light and flaky with a touch of strawberry jam.  I want to come back here tomorrow and the next day thats how good it is AND its a stone's throw from my hotel.

Delicious, great portions, wonderful staff!  Best breakfast we've had in a long time.  We usually don't get that thrilled about breakfast.  Our seafood omelette and biscuits and gravy filled us up until dinner.  Jamal A. our waiter was so kind!  If you are in the French Quarter and want breakfast, this is the place to go!
The shrimps are so good ! I love them so much. Our server wasn't as friendly as I would like my server to be but still very respectful.

ThIs place was super . We went during the weekend when the Niners played the Saints and it was just absolute pandemonium everywhere! I ordered food via yelp and I was so zonked out from partying, I fell asleep and didn't get to pick up my food! Lol! Anyway, I called the restaurant the following morning and told them of the situation. They told me it was all gravy and to just come in to the restaurant and let the person working know the situation. I get there later that evening after partying and shenanigans again on Bourbon...I actually had to explain to several people about the situation. I ran into some headwind, but eventually the gentleman obliged and went to the back to have my order remade. We got the baby back ribs, the Cajun pasta, and gator bites. Loved the ribs and man that pasta!!! Not a fan of gator bites so that's that. But I will say this, the New Orleans folk are wonderful beautiful people inside and outside. Their level of hospitality and genuine consideration is second to none. I will always remember this NOLA trip forever and ever. See you guys again in the future!
Good food restaurant was social distancing and manager on duty was very friendly and pleasant.
I got in just before the dinner rush. Their fryer wasn't working so no oysters but the NO Cosmopolitan was very good. Very good wait staff and accommodating for food allergies.
Their food and drinks were great. We had good service. It's right on the strip so you're not missing anything.! A definite must stop when traveling through New Orleans

There's not really wrong with this restaurant, it's just kind of boring. I was excited to take friends from out of town but we let down pretty quickly. It had a fun atmosphere and the set was fine but the food was just typical and bland.
Great food, good service amid this new normal post Covid. We've eaten here several times over the years and have yet to be disappointed!  Portions are huge, so come hungry.

Went here on Thanksgiving because nothing was open for lunch and I'm glad we stopped by! We got the bbq oysters, they were very heavy but delicious. Crab cakes on point but big portions so definitely share. And we got the shrimp po boy which comes w fries. All the food was great and so was my tropical drink! The service was great, Lloyd took care of us!

Service was fast but they raved about their "famous" Crab Cakes and they wasn't as good as I thought they would be. The mushroom cream sauce yuck I wish they gave a option to put it on the side it was a little on the spicy side so o didn't like it that much. I also had the seafood gumbo which was a little bland as far as the taste is concerned I also would have like to see wings added to their menu I know it's an oyster house but sometimes I like wings with my seafood !

Not sure why this place has such good reviews. Decided to go here for dinner and the experience fell short for me. Very few options for vegetarians and I was ok with that since husband wanted to try some cajun/creole inspired seafood and I saw a spinach ravioli on the menu on Yelp before we arrived. They unfortunately don't have the ravioli on the dinner menu anymore and I am not a huge fan of penne pasta which was the only other vegetarian option. I ordered the eggplant sticks which was probably double fried because you could only taste the fried batter and none of the insides. Husband got the jambalaya pasta and liked it but wasn't a fan. The bread it came with didn't complement the pasta and would have been better if it was toasted or buttered. 

If you are a vegetarian, I wouldn't go here as their menu has changed quite a bit and hasn't been updated on Yelp yet.
Thank you Angie for the excellent service last night!  We had a great time. The service, food and drinks were excellent!
Awesome food. Would recommend the po boy. Best service I've had in New Orleans. Ponce was a great server.

Get here  early, seats fill up! Every service member was so nice.  Food was good and plenty of it.  Reasonable prices, for Bourbon Street area.  We liked it so much, we wEnt back the next day to just hang at the upper bar for signature cocktails!
Our Uber driver told us about this place. Tried the alligator bites...so good! All tried oysters, I'm not a fan but the folks I was with loved them. Service was fast and friendly!

Great service!

Great drinks - get the margarita ... cadillac?  It comes out smoking and bubbling and has great flavor.  Packs a punch.

Had the crab cakes with mushroom crawfish etoufee sauce.  The sauce was the best! They have that on a lot of their dishes so get all their dishes that come with this sauce.  So good. The crab cakes were ok (disclaimer I am from MD....).  A little too much filling.  I did take one to go and had it later and I liked it a little bit cold instead of hot - I could taste the crab more....

Also had the gumbo here (I had gumbo EVERYWHERE I went while in NOLA this trip).  Pretty good.  I think I am still searching for my 'knock my socks' off gumbo....where is it?  But this was pretty good.

Loved the atmosphere.  And at one point a whole sheet of fudgy looking cupcake muffin things walked by.  Those looked amazing.  I didn't get dessert but if you see that on the menu - I would reco by their smell alone!

I loved everything about this place. I went on a Saturday evening and only waited 15mins. Everyone was extremely nice. Server Regene was excellent, food was delicious, price was the going rate and restroom was clean. Must try !!!

I sat in the bathroom of a local Enterprise trying to figure out why my buddy and I were singled out for intense and explosive diarrhea.   There were six of us in our party at Oceana Grill but only one thing he and I had in common, the Blackened Red Fish.  I remember it tasted a bit off but thought it might be the mix of spices.  I now understand that was wishful thinking as I reached for another half dozen squares of 2 ply Charmin.  On the brighter side my buddy and I have cut some weight over the last 24 hours and there's no place to go but up from here.  No I cannot recommend the Oceana Grill and I'd like to apologize to the guy next in line for the restroom at Enterprise.

My wife and I had breakfast at Oceana Grill twice during a recent visit to New Orleans.  The food is fantastic and extremely ample!  Our first day server, Tiffany, was very attentive and lots of fun to talk with.  The first day we had the Maw Maw's Cajun Breakfast (shrimp and bacon bits scrambled with eggs and dirty rice) and the Eggs St. Louis (Eggs Benedict with crab meat) and loved every bite!  The second day we shared one Maw Maw breakfast and still could not finish it; it was just as great the second time!!

We had Joseph as our server.

Very knowledgeable, helpful, and attentive.

Gator bites fried and the crab cakes are the way to go!!!

Thank you!

Because our waitress was the bomb, I give this place 3 stars. We were referred  here by the wyndam hotel we stayed in. In dire need of some New Orleans food. I thought i hit the jackpot.  the food was ok really commercialized but the issue is that everyone in my party was sick for days afterwards. I threw up at least 3 times on my trip. I had jambalaya, gumbo, and fish. I also had alligator and calamari. the food was cooked fast as we did not wait a long time, but it was definitely nothing to write home about. I dont think i would go back.

Really good poboy! We had the fried shrimp, was so rich and yummy. The chicken sausage gumbo was very good as well and the pecan pie worth a shot! 
Service was phenomenal and we will be back.

First night in NOLA, my friends and I were starving. We just could not find or pick a good place to eat. We found this place on a brochure at our hotel and decided why not. I am glad we came here though because the food was amazing! Portions were very huge and this location was not too far away from the hotel we were staying at. Service was on top of their game that night.

I ordered this trio dinner that came with fried catfish, fried oysters, fried shrimp, hush puppies & fries. Hands down, those fried oysters & hush puppies captured my heart. Did I mention that the portions were really big? Yes, this place is a little pricey but it was so worth it. I would definitely come back here again.

Btw, they also had this huge plastic bottle of Hennessy (which is my fav drink). I think it was like one of those display models. I wanted to take it home but obviously I couldn't but they did let me take a picture with it!
Pamela is the best!! Food and service is always great

I'm not one for scathing reviews however:
Take your oily, swampy BBQ shrimp and stay away from me. The only reason I went here was for a taping of Chef Ramsey's Kitchen Nightmares. My friend and I thought it would be a fun experience. Aside, from the surreal experience of taping a reality show, the service was great. Our server was pleasant, attentive, and prompt. If only the food was edible!!

We ordered the BBQ shrimp appetizer. I'm from New Orleans and I've had many versions of this dish, good and bad. This was by far the worst!  Not only was the sauce filled with old oil, puddles of oil, but the shrimp were overcooked. I literally had to use my fingernail to scrape the peel off. Gross!  I ordered the Redfish Oceana as an entree.  Bad idea!  It's described as a sauteed redfish filet with a yummy sauce.  Instead, I received a thickly breaded fried piece of fish that was NOT redfish.  It was a tiny, filet of white fish.  I'm pretty sure it was tilapia.  This fish was super white and almost non-existent.  I told my server I must have received the wrong thing.  She assured me that's how it's always served and it was indeed redfish.  She was either lying to me or herself, most likely both.  

May I also note, that my friend and I both felt horrible later that night and into the next day.  I had to eat crackers and drink ginger ale at work.  If it were just me, I'd call it coincidence but we were both sick.  I wasn't surprised when I mentioned this to others and they had suffered the same effects in the past.

I hopefully(idiotically) returned a few weeks later to the same situation.  Friendly and attentive servers with disgusting, ill-inducing food.  I would have thought things would be revamped after 'Kitchen Nightmares.' The only reason this place is still in business is because of all the tourists visiting the French Quarter.  This slop will not fly with anyone who has any experience with tasty, New Orleans seafood.  If you are considering eating here...don't!  It's half a step up from a Lucky Dog cart.

This was my first dinner in NOLA and I'm glad I chose it. It's right off the busy party nightlife bustle of Bourbon Street and open late. It wasn't crowded when I arrived, and my waiter was kind and the service was excellent. 

I ordered a pasta with shrimp and alligator meat and it was DELICIOUS. They gave me three big slices of bread and I soon understood this was necessary for soaking up that incredible sauce. I also had an agave margarita which was lovely (nice presentation too with the "smoking" dry ice on top), and the bourbon pecan pie with vanilla ice cream....incredible.

The side of grilled vegetables was okay, a little small and bland for what you paid, but overall I had a nice time here and would come back.

We walked to supper the night we ate at Oceana Grill on Conti just off Bourbon. It was quaint and very unique  with C lots of different seating areas. I had gator bites for the first time and they were delicious!  Having never tried them before the waiter suggested half fried and the other half Blackened. Great food!

Last time I was in New Orleans this was the first spot I hit up...and I loved it! So of course when I went back, it was yet again the first spot I went to! This place really satisfies my Cajun tastebuds! 

We ordered the fried alligator bites, blackened alligator bites, oyster rockefeller and fresh oysters for our appetizers. All of them were amazing. This was the first time I had gator bites that weren't fried and man...I have had dreams about them! For my entree I ordered the blackened redfish etouffee and it was delish! Our server was so great too (I believe her name was Mary)! 

All in all...anytime I'm in NOLA, I will be stopping here!

If you want a place that has some New Orleans specialities, this is the place. I loved the gator bites ; both blackened and fried. Their crab cakes and ribeye steak was also delicious. Po-Boys, gator, crab cakes; and different seafood alike - this place is pretty darn swell especially if you're not used to New Orleans cuisine. If you get Brad as a server, you're bound to have a fantastic time !

I actually stumbled upon this restaurant in Nola because I was just looking for places to eat that were open. (This was during right after the shutdown.) I Googled and Yelped nearby places and this had decent reviews. It was a couple of days after that I realized this place was featured on one of the Kitchen Nightmares episodes. Not sure why cause my experience was quite the opposite.

First thing I ordered was the Seafood Gumbo and I was very pleased. Right amount of spice and very flavorful. 2nd one was the Gator bites, half fried and half blackened. Wow! Both were excellent. The fried ones were perfectly crisp and good snap and the blackened ones were charred to perfection. And of course, I just had to order a dozen of fresh oysters. Good lord, they were huge and so fresh. I was very impressed with the quality. To wash them all down, nothing like a good ol' Sazerac and this place knows how to a make a mean one. I had a couple of rounds and I was in heaven. 

If you're looking for some good seafood grub in the hear of Nola, this place is legendary. There's normally a 15-30 minute wait but its definitely worth it. The food was excellent and the service was on point. Also, request to sit upstairs by the window if you want a view of the streets.
Always a favorite when I go to NOLA drinks are bomb, service is good and food is fantastic!
Was in town for work and found Oceana Grill on Yelp and it was not disappointing. The drinks were good and the food was great. Definitely go back if I ever make it back.

Excellent food and service. Brad was our server. Huge portions which were delicious. I had a lemon drop martini, crab cake platter and bread pudding. I am stuffed and the food was a 20/10. Amazing. I will be back. My mom had the shrimp platter. There were 25 huge shrimp on the platter. She doesn't eat any spice and they catered to that int he breading. Excellent. Can't say it enough.

Really love this place! Great service and amazing food! Had a final dinner here with the family before they head home. The jambalaya was very flavorful and had a ton of shrimp and alligator in it. Finished with the strawberry cheesecake! 10/10!

I don't recall anyone giving a recommendation about this place. Neither did the establishment itself look anywhere inviting. If anything, I thought it looked like some lame joint that had really weird lighting effects and filled with crazies invoking voodoo magic to empty out the wallet of anyone unaware. However, before I was able to drag the lady along and away down Bourbon Street...the main door swung open and out stampeded a large group of about 20+ happy-looking diners quickly exiting and scattering into the night seeking more action.

Yet, one diner was not quick to disappear like the rest. Not only did he hold the door open for the outgoing stampede...he also continued to hold it open for us with a smile and beckoned that we enter by saying "AMAZING FOOD...get in and enjoy!" I swear no extra persuasion was needed after that scene and we both entered expecting that this place would at least be "okay" if a group that huge had just left with satisfied looks.

Well, friendliness greeted us, sat us, gave us menus, and made us immediately feel welcome. Service was eager to please from the start and was matched with an efficient kitchen that set out piping hot dishes shortly after the order was placed. I didn't particularly like the ambiance - especially the lighting - and greasy floors have always peeved me. But this all is secondary...we only care about the food right?

I forgot to order any form of oysters here - that's my fail. I did, however, order stuff I didn't order elsewhere: (a) Cajun Alligator Sausages were just a tube of meaty grease. Beef is added to offset the lean gator meat; however, the beef also dominated the flavor profile. I'd say to skip this one and (b) turtle soup...I'd also skip this one unless you are just craving a bowl of chili. Once again, all the other ingredients just dominate the flavor profile that you wouldn't be able to tell if contained turtle or rat or cow or horse or DRAGON.

The entrees, however, are worth a revisit. My fair lady ordered the Taste of New Orleans, which contained the main staples - jambalaya, crawfish etouffee, red rice and beans, and a sausage to top it off. We welcomed the intense flavors with absolute delight and cleaned the plate to a shiny clean hue. I ordered the catfish special, which came blackened and topped off with fried crawfish tails and a side of steamed veggies. This was easily the highlight of the meal...while there was enough crawfish tails to make another dish, it was the amazingly seasoned and properly cooked catfish that blew our minds away as each piece melted-away-in-our-mouth!

#FreakingLoveNOLA

On my first attempt at eating here there was a "20 minute" wait and they took my name, phone number, and party number. I was told they'd contact me on my turn. My group went walking in the area and never got a call. We ended up eating somewhere else.

On my second attempt we were again told a "20 minute wait" and we waited closer to 45 minutes. I learned that they dont contact you when your table is ready. It actually is a covid list with your name and number they have you sign while you're waiting outside in line before even actually getting seated. 

The wait was worth it in the end however. I have to say the food was really good. The waitress was friendly and helpful. I ordered from a picture I saw on yelp from 2 years ago, asking the waitress what it was. It turns out it was the Oceana Redfish Lafourche, which I was told was actually removed from the menu. It was still able to be ordered however. I was told it was redfish with fried crawfish, crawfish etouffee, and jambalaya rice underneath. It was amazing, I must say. My friend ordered the seafood gumbo and it was also very good. Another friend ordered the fried shrimp platter. It had so much food but for the price, the sharing was worth it. The waitress mixed up my drink order. I originally ordered the Tropical Storm and was given the Bahama Mama instead but I actually liked it better once I tasted the Tropical Storm on my second visit.

On my third visit, I was again told "15-20 minute wait" and ended up waiting about 30 so just expect if there's a bit of line outside to not actually wait 20 minutes.  I would definitely recommend this place for the tasty food.

Was busy, waited about 20 minutes to get in.  No problem.  Went for the bbq shrimp.  It was good, not the best but still good.  Husbands had the seafood platter snd lived if.  Couldn't eat it all.  Only 3 stars due to waitress.....Mary.  We ordered the brownie dessert and i requested a coffee with cream and a shot of Kailua on the side.  Her response was "well I'd have to make a fresh pot of coffee".  And???? She just looked at me.  I declined and was not happy.  Will not be back.  It wasn't special.  Too many other places striving to survive,

This was my worst meal during my New Orleans trip. I was so excited to finally try a grilled fish dish, and was so sorely disappointed :( The fish was so dry and hard to eat - the feeling I dislike most is eating for the sake of finishing my food instead of enjoying it (which is what this was unfortunately). My boyfriend got a pasta and that was okay - it was just pretty standard. 

What tops off the cherry on the cake was that this was one of our most expensive meals during the trip! And I'm always for paying for great food, but this was definitely not it. I'm not sure if this is just a one-off experience, but I definitely wouldn't be back. 

The only good part of the meal was that our server (and the others on the team) that were very nice! Would definitely like to commend on on being friendly and attentive.

My husband I went to NOLA to celebrate his  bday, and decided to try this restaurant which was near our hotel.  It was a plethora of food for breakfast.  I had the seafood omelette which was amazing and I could not consume it all.  My husband had French toast made with French bread, honey glazed chicken tenders, and cheese grits (substitute), and he said it was very filling.
I recommend this location anytime for casual dining.  The staff was pleasant and the waiter was knowledgeable of menu items.  Great stop !

This was our first spot to stop for food in new orleans. And they did not disappoint. 

The service was very friendly. For a drink, I ordered the signature drink of new orleans, Sazerac. For my meal I had the blackened catfish po boy. What a huge portion. Oh, and it was delicious.

Raw gulf oysters shucked to perfection. Great blackened chicken.  Not fancy, just good food with a line out the door (so come early).  Brian provided us with great attentive but not overbearing service.  He said to try the bread pudding.  He was right!

Would not recommend. Went the other day because it was the only place opened & was very unsatisfied with the shrimp Poboy & shrimp creole. Ordered the shrimp blackened & it came out fried. Miss this place.

Definitely a Tourist Trap!  It seems everything is pre-cooked and readily available for customers.  I ordered the fries seafood platter and crawfish etouffee.  Both items were on the table in less than 5 minutes.  The fried seafood was warm, not hot.  It was okay tasting, not as crispy as expected, but the seasoned fries were nice.  I would opt for Deanie's, Acme's or Mandina's for their fried seafood platters, which are way better, and come out hot and crispy.  The crawfish etouffee had about 7 crawfish tails.  Not worth the $18.  For dessert, I had the banana foster ice cream cake.  I do not believe it was made in-house.  I had some wax paper on the cake, and it tasted a little freezer-burned.

We were recommended to this place by our hotel.  We wanted good creole style food at a reasonable price and this is where we were told to go.  So glad I went, best food I had all week of being in New Orleans.  I had the crab stuffed tuna special with crawfish etouffe and veggies.  So delicious.  Also split boiled crawfish for an appetizer and it had great flavor.  Our waiter, Darryl was extremely helpful and answered our 'annoying tourist questions.'  We will definitely recommend this place to friends when they visit new Orleans

I am allergic to seafood but my husband is obsessed with fresh seafood. This was on our list to must visit before we leave. He enjoyed the poorboy but not impressed with their seafood fries. I had the ribs and added a BBQ chicken breast. It was one of the most moist and delicious dishes on my top five of a lifetime. The best part of dinner was our server, Miss B which was amazing and very personal, efficient, and so attentive but not an invasive. It was crazy how much we had in common. She made dinner an incredible experience vs a meal. B personality and intimate touch was the highlight of our honeymoon so far. I hope they recognize the rare jewel that she brings to the table, literally!!!!!  We hope they saw Ms B the love that she showed us. Thank you Ms B for making our honeymoon memorable on a blessed level.

The atmosphere here was nice. We had a seat next to the window and enjoyed people watching while waiting for our food. The BBQ shrimp appetizer was awesome. The staff was friendly and our drinks never went empty.
First, they were open late ! The A/C  works great and the staff was super friendly. The food was really good. I would come back again & would recommend them to friends.

My friend and I decided to come here on a whim after a long day! We were greeted by a hostess who was super friendly. Our wait was 10 mins, max. The food was just ok to me but seemed more of like a tourist trap. It covers the basics of Louisiana food but I've definitely had better. Of course, I'm from Louisiana tho! The service was great, nonetheless.

I was hoping the food here would be decent based on the reviews, and while it was ok, you can do better at almost any establishment off Bourbon.  The Pappadeaux chain in TX serves better Cajun/Creole food than here. Service was acceptable but not particularly friendly.  The crab cake appetizer was not edible. Go elsewhere for lunch/dinner unless you are in a crunch or don't care. Mambo's appears to be part of the same ownership group, so if you are expecting better food there, think again.

This place was recommended by the front desk at the hotel we were staying at. A group of 10 of us were helped by an AMAZING waitress named Ashleigh. She was polite, welcoming, and attentive to our group. The food was also great! The loaded fries with fried gator are a must! Probably the best restaurant in New Orleans.

The place looks small initially but then I realized there's more seating on the other end. I was in where the oysters chef was located. Their signature oysters was phenomenal. No sand at all. Nothing but smooth yumminess. If it wasn't so pricey I would order more. 

The grilled fish was also good. My son had the fried catfish and it was tender and juicy too. Service was fast. The waitress made a mistake on the bill but she quickly rectified it. If you check in via yelp, they give you a 10% off the bill.

By the way, my kid noted that this restaurant was in Kitchen from Hell or Hell's Kitchen. So Gordon Ramsey was there back in 2011 or something. At first my initial thought was ewww. But then if Gordon Ramsey came and gave them advice then it should be great! It's pretty good food. I would come back if I'm ever in New Orleans again.
Pretty solid food. Really can't complain.  I'd go back with out thinking just not sure I'd crave it again. Just to say I absolutely wouldn't say no to it.

My new favorite stop for crab cakes! I'm also grateful for  our bartender that suggested to add blackened shrimp to it. That was what really put it over the top. Also had the broiled oysters and they are also amazing. I've had the broiled oysters from Drago's, Acme Oyster, and a few other places and these were by far my favorite. I want to also mention the Mandarin Blush was quite tasty. Can't wait till my next trip back to enjoy this spot again.
Great food, nice atmosphere and our server Meagan was phenomenal. I had the ultimate bloody Mary and the crawfish omelet. Both were amazing.
Amazing spot to try local food! I really enjoyed our stay here! Really friendly staff and great choices for seafood!

We went online and made a reservation for 8pm. When we arrived, our table was ready and we were seated! We started with the famous oysters. They were so good! They did come out at the same time as our meal, but that was not a problem. They came out hot and seasoned perfectly. For my meal, I had the Taste of New Orleans. The red beans and rice was my favorite bowl of the three but they were all so good. None were too spicy for me. My husband ordered the shrimp po'boy and he really enjoyed it. He made it his own by adding the crawfish mushroom cream sauce and cheese to it. 

We're celebrating our honeymoon and this place made our visit that much better. Great service. Thanks to Brian for being an amazing waiter tonight! He was a very nice and helpful guy!

I went here when they were filming kitchen nightmares so I'm not sure if it's always this terrible or if it was just for the show. 

Everything I tried to eat was disgusting. Greasy gross oysters, crab cakes that should be called crap cakes and undercooked pasta.  The saving grace was the margaritas.  I was ill the next day.......pretty sure it was the food and not the drink. 

If you want preprepared undercooked greasy food then this is the place for u!

Went here during my first trip to NOLA and was open to trying someplace new. I had a steak from here with the trimmings (mashed potatoes and greens). They both were average. The steak was a little on the smaller and thin side but, tasted pretty good flavor wise. My husband had jambalaya pasta with bread. He said it was just, okay. The atmosphere was a little dark and we were seated upstairs. Not sure if we'd return.
New Orleans did not disappoint and neither did this place. Great atmosphere and the food was oooh so good. Definitely a must when visiting NOLA
Awesome dinner great service. We had the shrimp poboy with Cajun fries. Taylor and Brian gave us excellent service. Will be back.

It's edible...I guess.  A hurricane is headed our way and I figure I would  stock up on food because I'm here for a conference and I'm stuck in this hotel room so I ordered the seafood platter, the seafood gumbo, and the Cajun jambalaya pasta.  All of it, and I mean all of it was absolutely bland.  Not what I was expecting from a seafood restaurant in New Orleans. Huge letdown!!!

We went on a Monday night and waited in line outside for about 30 min. I've got to say they really have their NOLA hospitality on. We were greeted warmly by at least 3 staff as we made our way upstairs to our table. Our server, April, was very friendly and she's definitely got upsell game - always offering to make your drink a double, add an item to your order or get a drink to go. We had the Taste of New Orleans and the crab cakes. While good, our foot was served just warm enough that we didn't feel it warranted returning to the kitchen. The non-descript dinner roll with the Taste plate was disappointing (where's that wonderful, crusty french bread?). I came away thinking they were probably great at one time but are now just resting on their laurels.

This place has some pretty tasty food. 

I don't usually like to give 4 stars to chain restaurants or places that look like chains because I think the food isn't that high quality and it's more of a novelty experience but this place is pretty legit. It's not super traditional cajun food but it's still good. 

I had:

Gator bites, both blackened and fried split half and half. It had great flavor to it. Gator meat is a bit chewy so it's important to have good seasoning and this place had it. 4 out of 5 sporks.

Seafood Gumbo. Delicious! super tasty, good flavor and the right consistency. Amazing. 4 out of 5 sporks. 

The service was quick and attentive and friendly. 

Prices were fair

Decor is a bit gimmicky but that's ok. 

All in all, if your on bourbon street and looking for a place to eat that isn't too expensive. This is a good choice. I would return here.
