The reviews on this restaurant lives up to the hype. The food was definitely amazing  and hits the spot for the New Orleans feel. I didn't like gator before, but they changed my mind real quick with those gator and crawfish fries. Mmmmmm!

AWESOME!!!! Was looking for something not too heavy and Cajun!!! Hubby and I shared the crab cakes appetizer that was smothered in crawfish cream sauce -and- caesar salad with warmed ahi tuna. Both were absolutely awesome and exactly what we were looking for!!!! Highly recommend and would come back again next time we are in NOLA!!!!!

The food was pretty good... while the service is terrible. We got our order delivered to us. The delivery guy seemed a little out of it, and took our money and almost walked away with the food... After he left, we discovered that they forgot to give us two of our food items. I called back immediately, and they said the items were on their way to us. Nothing ever arrived (and it was already too late at night to call back). We called back the next day, and they RUDELY gave us the ring-around, making us call back at night to speak to a night manager. The daytime manager was extremely unfriendly, and never even offered any sort of apology (a simple "Sorry for the inconvenience" would've been sufficient). I called back in the evening, and the phone was handed over to a several people. After hanging up on me a few times times, I gave up.

I would've given 3 stars if the food was better. The only item I actually liked was the praline duck.
Food is just ok. It's not worth the long wait. I've had better food in and out of the French Quarter.

This place was fantastic! The food was incredible. We had the gumbo, mashed potatoes and fried seafood platter. Errol was our server and he was the nicest most attentive guy. I recommend this place 1000%

The gumbo was very good as was the cheese cake. I am still trying to figure out what they put on those bbq shrimp. I didn't enjoy them at all and if I'm not mistaken I believe I received 5 or 6 medium sized
If you love food...this place should definitely be on your "list" of places to go. The food is AMAZING!!! The crab cakes and gumbo will leave you in a good trance!!
Amount of food received upon delivery not worth the money! Very disappointed considering I have dined with the restaurant in the past!  Will never order online again!

Food was absolutely amazing. We tried the barbecue shrimp appetizer delicious and creamy. 
We tried The red fish for the first time and we absolute loved it. 
Corey  the bartender was amazing!! He made us laugh and feel so special. 

It was a wonderful dining experience. 

Corey you were the MVP tonight thank you! For the excellent service and hospitality.

We come here every time we're in new orleans, so at least every 2 or 3 years (darn you, covid! but we will be back again in 2021, watch out!)  - they have fast service, they are very friendly , and the food is very authentic. It's packed and loud and crowded, which also feels very authentic for NOLA. BBQ shrimp is recommended for sure, also some of their drinks are interesting. Keep up that good work!

I had high hopes for this restaurant but came out very empty handed. The flavor was just so-so. There's nothing to write home about. Our waitress was very nice but she kept forgetting about what we have asked for. Just another tourist trap in my opinion.

I've been to this restaurant quite a few times during my time in NOLA. At first, their delivery service was a hit and miss sometimes, however, they have an excellent delivery guy by the name if 'John' he takes pride and accountability in his work!!!

The food, again some hits and misses, but for the most part, the food is delicious!!!

What excited me most about this meal is that we beat the crowd and only had about a ten minute wait. The food was amazing! I enjoyed the charbroiled oysters with the crawfish sauce and the Royal Omelet as my entrée.  Two excellent choices!! I even had a pancake on the side for good measure. Everything I ordered was great, and I cant wait until I'm back in town to try them for dinner.

We went to Oceana Grill this past Monday. We had a reservation for 4 at 7:15.  We were lucky to have a reservation because the line for tables wrapped around the block--I'm sure the carnival season had something to do with that line but still.

Our waiter was nice and suggested the most popular items.
We ordered the oysters to start which was covered in Parmesan cheese and a creamy herb sauce. Really delicious but the taste of the oysters was lost in all of the flavor 
And my partner and I ordered- a taste of New Orleans which came with jambalaya, crawfish étouffe and red beans and rice with smoked sausage 
And I got the blackened redfish. It was good but nothing too crazy.
We enjoyed the bread pudding dessert which seems to be one of the most ordered items, we saw so many pass by on plates while we were eating. 

One of our friends ordered a couple drinks and said they were all sweet and delicious. One of the drinks even came with a little smoke lol.

It's definitely a nice spot to hang out and chill. People took their time eating and took even longer to leave the restaurant after paying the bill.
Food was good, surprisingly the best dish to us was the cheese fries! Excellent customer service.

Arrived to a long line snaking half way down the block. In a pinch, we opted for takeout and luckily snagged some seating at the bar.

Service was slow moving. Five bartenders plus a manager manning a relatively small bar. Disorganized and chaotic for no apparent reason. They honestly could have handled the load with about half the amount of staff.  

We ordered takeout as well as some apps. Note that they do not allow takeout on the chargrilled oysters. 

Silverware was dirty. Manager appeared frustrated that we asked for clean sets. 

Our bartender, Shaun was sweet but overwhelmed as his colleagues mainly stood around chatting amongst themselves. 

Pasta dish and an order of fried oysters took over 1.5 hours to come out. 

Definitely not worth it. Pasta dish was $20 and left me with an upset stomach. 

Eh. No thanks.
So wonderful!!!  The hostess and bartender were outstanding.  Oysters were fantastic.  In fact, everything I tried during dinners and lunches was delicious.  Can't compliment them enough.

First time coming here was recommended by a friend the service was good but the food was not the gumbo was bland and lack warm also the taste of New Orleans was not what I thought it would be this place is WAY over priced

Everyone recommended we go here, and it did not disappoint. Our server, Fiona, really made the experience extra special. She was super helpful with the menu, very personable, and even surprised my partner with a birthday dessert! The food was delicious. We shared the alligator bites (get half grilled/half fried) and the redfish dish. We'll definitely be back when we visit New Orleans.

I like the food here. We got there around 12 pm (noon) on Tuesday and there are a line outside but the wait was not bad (30 minutes) 
It is very cool inside so prepare a light jacket for inside. Super hot outside 
There is a construction outside of restaurant so the walk way was tiny....

2nd time visiting. We were very pleased. Everything was delish. The best red beans and rice we had. Also, the best bread pudding in the area. My family had the blackened chicken entree and shrimp pasta. They enjoyed each entree. Definitely will be back for Mardi Gras

Seafood was not fresh, it was frozen. Room smelled like sewer, music was way too loud. I would not recommend eating here. It was our last dinner of our trip and what a disappointment.  The only good thing was  he service.

Now this is a better joint for good home town seafood. We came upon this grill while being horrified from the three legged dog down the street. The service was fast, friendly and everything was clean with NO SMELL. From the outside, one cannot see the grand scale of this restaurant. It is literally three levels. Your hostess takes you through a maze of stairs and you get to see all the different dining rooms. All had a great theme, staff was all working hard to get food out fast and fresh. I had the fried shrimp with coleslaw and fries. Delicious. My wife had the fried catfish and she was pleasantly pleased. The portion sizes were also very large. You definitely get your moneys worth. They have a full bar in all three levels and outdoor seating. If we ever return to New Orleans, we will absolutely be returning to Oceana Grill. Undoubtedly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting.

It's your basic New Orleans bar. I felt like the food was good but it was more bar food but it was anything else. We got the fried oysters but I thought some of the frame in the shower and do things like that but it was out of the shower. They were good, nothing amazing but good. It's mostly batter that's fried with a little moisture inside. We also got the pasta, Cajun/Creole. That was also good but pretty basic. We had to add some spices and salt to it because it needed a little bit more of that but when you're hungry and you want some flavor it's delicious. They have a weird seating system where they don't really take your name and they just call out "party of two" And if you're standing outside and someone walks in front of you they could just as easily go. Additionally, there's tons of space upstairs but they make you wait to be seated, I'm not sure why. The service is great as far as the waiter is concerned and he was really nice and fast. It's open late night which is nice. The prices are OK little more expensive than I thought for what it is but when you're hungry and you're in New Orleans and it's late this is a good spot to stop at.

Food: Oceana Grill has a good sized menu with tons of Southern options. I opted for the Blackened Chicken Po-Boy. The bread was very crunchy, almost too much, and the chicken was a little dry. My sister got the Taste of New Orleans which comes with three little bowls, one of Red Beans and Rice, one of Creole Jambalaya and one of Crawfish Etouffè. This is an incredibly tasty way to try out all of the NOLA classics. My mom got the Redfish which came with a super tasty mushroom sauce. My dad ordered the Shrimp Alfredo which was less of a traditional Alfredo, and more of a cheesy sauce. He really enjoyed it, although there wasn't a whole lot of shrimp. 

Venue: This is a huge multi-level funky restaurant with unique decor and tons of seating. They have a line outside for those who didn't make a reservation. 

WARNING: Their online reservation system "just sometimes doesn't work" or so I was told after I arrived and found my reservation hadn't gone through, so call if you want to ensure a spot.

I had the house special which was redfish with shrimp in butter garlic sauce across the top over a bed of jalapeño cornbread. It also came with collard greens all of it was fantastic also at our table was the seafood platter which was huge the redfish platter which was excellent. The service was excellent as well. I highly recommend this place.
Came here for Cowboy game and decided to try this place for a quick bite to eat. The food was wonderful! Crab cakes gumbo and bbq shrimp! The waiter Chris M was awesome as well!

The oysters were not what I was use to.  Not salty at all, not muddy, just not Apalachicola Bay oysters.  The catfish did fast like dirt.  I was told it might have been the Cajun style seasoning.  Michelobo Ultra was good and the Watermelon Margarita was good.

Unfortunately I was not impressed with this place at all. We were recommended this place by a few locals and it did not deliver as promised. I really wanted a good steak and I should've listened to my instincts and went to an actual steak house. But there were some positives like the drinks and the gator bites which were really good. This place is also located off of bourbon in the French quarter so it does get pretty busy.
Smelly New Orleans restaurant.  Dirty and in need of a good cleaning. Food is just ok as this place is all about location. Better places off the main drag.
Mmmmm the best chicken and gravy. Portions were huge even though it was to go. Will be back

Was in town for vacation with my fiancé and decided on this place walking on bourbon street. The service was excellent and our waiter Corey was exceptional! The food came out quick and was delicious, would recommend to anyone 10/10.

First time in New Orleans, came in town with friends to enjoy the culture and delicious cuisine! Stopped at Oceana Grill and the food was amazing!! Full of flavor, great portion sizes. Our server Sierra was amazing! She went through the menu with us, gave suggestions and made sure we were well taken care of the entire night!! Would definitely recommend Oceana Grill! Ask For Sierra!
Good menu variety, food comes fast and hot -- no complaints!

I tried the special, Blackened Alligator Fettuccine Alfredo. It definitely had a kick to it. It was a great portion of Alligator and the Alfredo sauce was very good, which is hard to find. I think you couldn't go wrong with any of the Alfredo dishes. Service was excellent & friendly. I'd definitely come back.

First restaurant in New Orleans with my husband 

Best charbroiled oysters
Seafood gumbo

Can't forget this place

This place was good... I mean, which places aren't in NoLA? We were upstairs so I bit removed from the atmosphere of the restaurant. We had a few appetizers- crab cakes, gator- most were fine. I ended up with the red fish. It was good and I was happy with my selection. I also had pecan pie, which was really good!

The inside of this building is spotted in pink with light, so I just saw like it is a bar. We ordered seafood gumbo and cajun jambalaya pasta, and they were very nice. Especially, I liked seafood gumbo. It was really nice. I want to come here again!

I've been to this place 3 times and I'm extremely satisfied with every visit. The food is so delicious and seasoned very well. I highly recommend the  Cajun fries and the Louisiana Crab Cakes. And the service was great too. I had Kim as my service last night and today I Arielle. I would come back every time I come to New Orleans

So much food , unless your extremely hungry you'd most likely end up taking some home . I'm not sure of what I ordered that night , but it was pretty good . If you gonna try the alligator try the blackened flavor. Location is very convenient for a bite to eat while strolling the strip, not the best of New Orleans but it's very satisfying.
Not bad, but not good either. Restaurant was freezing cold we could barely enjoy our dining experience. Food was ok, best part, the red fish special.

After a long day of exploring the city Oceana Grill was the perfect place to try some authentic food. The best crab cakes I have ever had! The shrimp creole and gumbo were also very good. Our waitress Fiona was so nice and helpful and recommended a fantastic drink. Highly recommend Oceana Grill to anyone coming to New Orleans

My first time here in Oceana Grill. As soon as you entered the door, there is a bar; and you'll be greeted with a smile. Friendly staffs for sure. Sat on the top floor, by the window; overlooking Conti St. The waitress was Emily. She was absolutely great! Very accommodating and she recommended their special of the day. It was the red fish over corn bread and collard greens on the side. The dish wasn't on their menu, but over all it was FANTASTIC!
Also had a bowl of seafood gumbo for appetizer.
For dessert, you have to try their pudding, it's worth to die for!
Will definitely try the other foods listed on their menu. LOVE THIS PLACE!
Ten Stars!

The cup of seafood gumbo was very good for my wife because it was pretty mild, not spicy enough for me.  I had the fried shrimp with fries puppies and cole slaw and they were very tasty twosome... The service by our waiter Renee was as good as the eats.  Another spectacular meal in one of the best towns for foodies, 4 days here and i've gained ten pounds, sure was fun though!

Brunch with Josh is a must while in Nola. He will brighten your day, put a smile on your face and get you drunk all at the same time. Food was very good. Bottomless Mimosas and Mary's are a huge bonus. And if you're wonder why the place like ooks so clean it's all because of Farren's (?sp) eye for detail. It's a must stop!!

Came here looking for a real taste of New Orleans during this COVID-19 season and Oceana Grill did not disappoint! We tried a little bit of everything from the oysters, crawfish etouffee, and a poboy. All of it was delicious! Chelsie was our server and she was awesome with taking care of us. We felt very safe enjoying our meal with masks being worn by the staff as well. If you are in NOLA and looking for a great spot to eat, this is it!

This was our first stop in New Orleans, and it was a great time! We were traveling with our dog, and my family was very grateful that they let our puppy in with us because most restaurants don't (at least so far in Texas). The food was DELICIOUS. My favorite was the blackened alligator meat, but honestly, what everyone ordered tasted great. Our server, Whitney, was very sweet and helpful as well. She knew the menu and also the city. Thank you again Oceana Grill for your southern hospitality!
A-MAZ-ING!!!! Everything was excellent from the service to the food. It was by far the best meal we had while visiting the city.
Pre-COVID-19 Review- We were in NO for the day and decided to go to Oceana Grill. It was difficult selecting one place to eat but we wanted it to be a touristy place.
Decided to stop at Oceana Grill in New Orleans on the way to Las Vegas. Food was delicious and our server Fiona was very attentive. The service and food were both great.

We had a great experience at this restaurant. The food was prepared just as we ordered and the service was wonderful. Our server explained the menu and the options were great and varied. We ordered the Louisiana Crabmeat Cakes which were very flavorful. We had a bowl of Seafood Gumbo and shared a Taste of New Orleans, which both were fabulous. We will be back when we come to New Orleans again.
Corey was a really good waiter. Food was so good my bf and I came here 2 nights in a row.

Went there twice, once for breakfast and then for dinner. Couldn't be more disappointed both the times.. I couldn't understand how this restaurant got so many positive reviews. Tried Benedict for the breakfast, there was no hollandaise sauce on the eggs. It looked like a rushed job and was tasteless. 
Similar experience for dinner, tried gumbo and jambalaya, rushed job resulted in cold food and didn't even taste that great. I would not recommend, the ratings are deceptive.

Wow. Just wow. This was my favorite meal while vacationing here. The server was super friendly. I got the taste of New Orleans and got to try all the things. Included was the beans and rice, jambalaya, and étouffée. Wow each of them were cooked to perfection. The crawfish etouffee was something else, man. So delicious. Wowowowowow.

The line looked long but it was maybe a 10 min wait before getting seated. My friend and I wanted beef so she got a burger and I got a steak. Really good food, good service and multiple floors to seat
Go here to get a true taste of Nawlin'! I love their platter that gives you a taste of all of new orleans famous dishes- Jamabalya, Gumbo, Red beans and Rice, ettoffe! The wait is worth it!

I've eaten here twice and was impressed both times. The first time was just 4 of us but the second time was 12 people and the service was just as fast and friendly as if we were a small party.  Good food, quality service and a friendly, easy going atmosphere.

Seriously the best cajun food!! The gumbo and crab cakes and fried shrimp were sooooo good!  My son tried the alligator bites and he liked them, LOL.  Highly recommend this place and the service was friendly and excellent!

Looking for somewhere for our last night - and our anniversary - and chose Oceana Grill. It was....meh.  Way overpriced hype.
The drinks were good - no complaints and received them quickly. 
I ordered the "signature dish" - reddish and my husband got the duck.  The redfish was waaaaaay overcooked and there was barely any sauce on it - and I definitely needed it with overcooked fish like that. The corn was kind of...not good and the mashed potatoes were just ok. My husbands duck was fairly good, though a bit dry.  We were not checked on until my husband was nearly done  with his meal and the female employee asked how things were. I told her ok and she seemed to be offended and asked me why wasn't it great? So I told her. She did offer a new piece of fish but at that point why bother when my husband was done with his meal, so I declined.  That was the only compensation they offered and I did not finish the meal.
Our waiter was pleasant but very very slow coming back to our table. We were finished with our meal for almost 15 minutes before he finally came over and asked if we wanted dessert. It was not very busy at all that night.  We declined and simply asked for the check to leave. 
Way overpriced and mediocre at best.  Wouldn't go back.

We had so much fun at Oceana Grill! The service was just outstanding. Our waiter was so friendly and informative and really made our evening special. Their bloody marys are spectacular- maybe the best I've ever had.  Their two types of oysters, their special one and the rockefeller were loved by our party.  The overall meal was very good,  nothing fancy or innovative- which is fine! We were looking for a great, simple meal and that's what they delivered. The cajun pastas were all well received and, again, SUCH amazing service here and a nice, casual atmosphere in the heart of the French Quarter.  Keep it up!

Oceana's was the first stop on our Taste of Nawlins food tour where we sampled gumbo and red beans and rice. Loved the funky vibe and the food samples (including service and presentation), so we returned a couple days later for lunch. I had the fresh oysters, served on a bed of ice with plenty of lemon wedges and a bowl of the delicious gumbo. Wow. The meal was perfect for lunch - not too heavy yet deliciously satisfying and hearty enough for energizing my afternoon walk through downtown.  My friend ordered the seafood platter, which was HUGE with lots of deep fried tender fish, shrimp, oysters and jalapeno hushpuppies. Definitely would love to order this myself next time. 
So. A couple things to note. There generally is a line outside the door. For some reason the hostesses didn't want to seat our party of two - not sure if it was because we declined a seating at the bar rather than at a table. They seated 3 parties of 3 and eventually sat us after I said "....hey, wait a second....maybe we DO have 3 people in our party after all!" Long story short, John, our waiter, and the service manager apologized and handled things very well (and gave us a free dessert - the bread pudding, served with cream and homemade caramel sauce, is to die for!!!). So despite the sketchy hostess service, this place definitely merits 5-stars in my book.

The food was so good! And the staff was super sweet, we got in late and didn't leave until closing time and they didn't make us feel like we were in the way at all. We all ate our bellies full and had a blast. The drinks were delicious too.

Coffee was good, waitress was great. The food, absolutely amazingly delicious!  Hubby had a seafood crepe, and I had the French toast(made with French bread). We will put this one on one of our favorites while in New Orleans!

First stop to eat in New Orleans and it was definitely a wonderful dining experience! The staff was extremely friendly and attentive, I ordered the Seafood Gumbo as an appetizer and the Shrimp Platter as my entree, delicious! I tried the Tidal Wave "Juggie's Favorite" for a drink and OMGGGG, so sweet and delicious, I forgot it even had alcohol in it because it was so delicious, the drink was fizzing and had smoke coming out of it which was a cool effect to the experience. There was a bit of a wait but expected because its a very well known restaurant. Definitely recommend to anyone going to NOLA for the first time wanting seafood
The Oceana famous oysters (chargrilled) are amazing. Especially for a late dinner after drinking. I learned that I can eat a lot more oysters than I thought as app, main and dessert.

A friend recommended this place to me, we were in N.O for 5 days and ate there every day. From the moment you enter you feel welcomed the food and service was excellent! Will visit N.O again and this place is 1of the reasons.

Was in New Orleans for a conference and ended up coming here on accident. Let me tell you I had the best chicken fettuccine Alfredo I have EVER had. I am back home in California trying to figure out a way to get back to that pasta!
Second time here taste just as good as the last tim love love it. We had gumbo red beans and tried something different the blackened alligator everything is always good here
Good stuff, great service and super friendly servers.  Highly recommend if your in New Orleans.

The food here was very generic and medicre.  My friends and I came here for dinner based on the positive reviews here.

We ordered 2 dishes.

1) Grilled tuna with shrimp - Tuna was really over cooked, but still semi-moist

2) Etouffee - Nothing special.  It tasted like it came from a can.  It came with a little scoop of rice which was a little undercooked.  The rice wasn't good.  It tasted like Uncle Ben's to me.  You can't serve an Asian Uncle Ben!

Keep moving.  There are so many other restaurants to try.

The vegetarian pasta is just noodles with squash, carrots and zucchini with no seasoning. The meal had a lot of oil so it just tasted like oil and noodles. Would not recommend if searching for a vegetarian meal in New Orleans. The food was fast to pick up.

The first time I came here a few years back, the food and the service were great.
I went yesterday and was gravely disappointed. First off, they didn't have the best thing on the menu anymore (the Oceana oysters). Next, my wife and I both had heavily under-seasoned entrees. I got the blackened steak  and my wife got the redfish (meh). We were not impressed!

My biggest issue is the dishonesty that was displayed. The waitress stated that any double shot would be $5. Once we got our bill, we were charged for the drinks we ordered and $5 added to each drink total. When we asked about the discrepancy, another waiter said that the manager told them to frame it that way. I found this dishonest and misleading. She admitted that they can definitely frame it a lot better because it is misleading. 

We went ahead and paid the bill and left. We will not be returning to this restaurant ever again.

This place was amazing!! Drinks were on point, and food tasted delicious! Must order a hurricane drink, they make it so well here. We also had crab cakes, which were the best ones i have ever had and BBQ shrimp. Everything was delicious!

Was so good and open late. I was one of the last people in for a pick up order but that did not change the quality. The chicken  Alfredo was hot. With layers of flavor and not just a mundane chicken Alfredo. My chicken salad was fresh and crisp. The lettuce was nice cold and the chicken was hot. The young lady that checked me out was a sweetheart.

The staff was very friendly. Please go find this one among the current construction in the area. We had one of their famous crepes and the crawfish and shrimp omelet both were delicious. Great coffee and amazing service.

Mediocre meal for not-at-all mediocre price. I got the Redfish Oceana, supposedly its "signature dish," and it had zero spice, zero flavor. Fortunately I was hungry, else I would have called the $28 a loss and gone elsewhere. I had to dump cajun pepper on it just to taste anything. The collard greens were mediocre also. Not nearly worth the price.

Just finished a late light dinner at Oceana. Absolutely satisfied with everything. There was a line, we almost walked away, but chatted with others in line who said it was worth the wait. Line moved very fast, less than 10 minutes. Our server Shahan was professional, prompt, offered insight on what his thoughts on menu, what are the favs. 

We had blackened gator bites and crab cakes (wife had GF), everything was hot, flavorful and seasoned superbly. Washed it down with sweet tea. A+ on this visit, prices are reasonable and nice atmosphere even with kids. We will be coming back for another dinner (or breakfast) before departing the big easy!

Corey was so accommodating and knowledgeable.  He was professional and funny.  The food was spectacular. The line was intimidating but they got us seated really quickly, even as a party of ten without a reservation.

The Food looked beautiful however, I had the fish platter which was just ok (it lacked seasoning and crunch), my gf had the tuna plate which was cooked not to her liking and the vegetables were different than what they were supposed to be. The alligator bites we're good probably the best thing out of our whole meal. (Our check was deduct of my gf meal since it was not right) Thank you
We had oyster and the ahi tuna.  Tuna was cooked perfect and was well seasoned,  the oyster were good sized and fresh.  Enjoyed the experience.
Make reservations! This place is such a cool spot with great ambience- food portions are very generous and definitely worth the money. Service was amazing. Will be back!

Ordered the New Orleans Plate/Platter - Jumbalaya/Etouffee/Rice&Beans and Chargrilled Oysters..

Everything was very average. If you're a foodie, you won't be satisfied, but instead a little disappointed. 

If I would compare this to another restaurant it's like going to your local Applebee's. Nothing impressive, but food you would eat since it's there.

Excellent,  Excellent !!! Great service,  food, drinks. 
We love it there, we had dinner there 2× . Amazing crab cake, red drum, omg ! Can't wait to go back.... soon !

Blackened shrimp jambalaya is absolutely amazing!  Although.......ask to be seated upstairs and get on the balcony if you can!  They don't ask.  Once you are up.....the service was perfect!  No drink specials that we were aware of which was a bummer.  Highly recommend!

Covid-19 has been ruining plans left and right all 2020. Not this time, I was finally able to get out and dine in for the first time in month. I am here visiting Oceana Grill from Los Angeles, California and must admit I have a great experience. Christopher (Chris) was an amazing server! He explain the menu, and suggested wonderful menu options! 

I ordered a water with lemon, New Orleans Cosmopolitan (first drink dinning out) Gator Bites both blackens, & fried, a bowl of Cajun Fries topped with their famous sauce!

Overall, I'm definitely going to return. The host, servers and chefs we're all wonderful people who make my stay few welcoming. Since I was unable to try the Crème brûlée I'll definitely make a pit stop before returning to Los Angeles.

I was concerned when I saw the long line waiting outside, but decided to wait. I was told about 10 minutes. I worried that perhaps we'd be hurried to leave once we were served. We were sat in less than the 10 minutes we were told, and were given a table by the window that we really liked. Our server was prompt, courteous and efficient.  We were not hurried at all, and the food was excellent. I had the crawfish étouffé and my husband had the seafood platter which we had to share because it was so abundant, and the French fries were some of the best we've had. 
I highly recommend this restaurant.
This restaurant was amazing, great hospitality from the moment you step inside. The food was delicious and the server was friendly and gave great recommendations.

I really wish I didn't have to give this spot only 3 stars but I'd be lying if I said it deserved more. 

We were SO EXCITED to try Oceana because it's so highly rated, but man we were a bit disappointed. I can't lie and say that the food was bad, because it wasn't, it was good... but it wasn't great. Oceana Grill is located right in the middle of all the action, and it's very touristy, so be prepared to wait in line! 

Food/ What we ordered: 
- Bowl of Seafood Gumbo $9.50 Very good, but it was room temperature... not hot at all. 
- Redfish Oceana $20 I ordered mine "blackened" and was blown away by how good it was.. came with delicious mustard greens and garlic mash. A+
- Mardi Gras Pasta $19 Pasta topped with crawfish and shrimp... it was creamy and yummy but not mind-blowing, in my opinion. 

What turned me off:
- They brought our soup (ordered as a starter/appetizer) AFTER they brought our entrees.... doesn't make sense... and if you're going to take so damn long, at least make sure the soup is hot! 
- They killed THREE cockroaches in front of us while we were eating! It was disgusting and I saw a couple leave after seeing that... we were nearing the end of our meal and it made me feel so disgusted... the waitress apologized but I couldn't erase the image from my head, especially being that they seemed to have been coming from the kitchen. Huge no no in my book.

My husband and I loved this restaurant so much we came 4 days in a row. Obsessed with their Jambalaya Pasta and Mardi Gras Pasta. My husband loved the fresh oysters and seafood platter. Don't let the prices fool you, the servings are huge here. The drinks are also amazing!

Ordered twice. The first time I called in the order fried shrimp and gumbo and was told to pick it up in 40 minutes. Ended up waiting about an hour 15.  It was a bit of a mad house bc there were others waiting for their orders for a while. Second time, I had it delivered. Food was amazing as always. Given the situation with COVID, I think they handled themselves well.

Went here with my hubby for breakfast while in New Orleans. I ordered a very basic breakfast- eggs, bacon, biscuit, and grits. The food was served piping hot as exactly as ordered. My husband is a bit more of an adventurous eater and had a cajun omelette which he loved! The food was excellent and our server-Ponce- was magnificent! He was very attentive and pleasant. Our experience here was fantastic on all accounts- from the service to the food to the cleanliness of the restaurant. Try Oceana Grill- ask for Ponce. You won't be disappointed!

We decided to try here because of the high reviews on Yelp. Well, I'm assuming those reviews are from employees and friends of employees.

First of all, our waiter took our complete order just after sitting down and did not even bother to ask two of the four people at the table what they wanted to drink.

So two of the four people sat without drinks for easily 15 minutes or more.

Next, we ordered a cheeseburger poor boy with nothing on it. It was delivered to our table with lettuce on it. This might not seem like a big issue to some people, but the person eating it definitely did not want anything on it.

Definitely the portions were very underwhelming. If you go there hungry, you probably should order more than one thing from the menu.

Shockingly, the kids chicken fingers was a larger portion then the main entrées that were ordered.

The reason I actually gave it to stars is because the people eating the seafood platter said that it was amazingly tasty and they were very happy with the quality of it.

Personally, I was rather disappointed with the experience and would not recommend it to any family or friends

$104 was ridiculous for the food and service that we received. I hope no one makes the mistake of coming here expecting a filling meal at a reasonable price because he will be sadly mistaken and disappointing

The service was exceptional and the food was even better! The waiter went above and beyond to explain everything. The manager came over and gave us a free appetizer when the first one we ordered took 12 minutes to get! We didn't think it was a big deal but she did! We all tried a different pasta and were all extremely satisfied!! Must try when in NOLA!

Food: 4
Service: 5
Ambience: 3.5
Date/Time: 12/13/2019 3:30pm
Crowd: Packed! 2 waiting
Order: Blackened Gator Bites app, Blackened Chicken Po Boy, Jambalaya Pasta

Great way to enjoy good Cajun food and the French Quarter. Conveniently located in the French Quarter 3 streets from where the buses run on Canal Street (Bourbon St exit). Like many of the places in the FQ, you enter a small door to the restaurant. Real estate is scarce (and expensive) so the place is small with tables sitting close to each other, but not so close you are bumping elbows. With all the tables consolidated, it feels a bit cramped in the restaurant. And the noise level is pretty loud. 

Service is fantastic and fast! Jamal was very attentive, always checking on us. He's laid back, friendly and informative. 

The Gator Bites was highly recommended by an ex-culinary guy who worked as a chef at one of the restaurants in the FQ. I didn't think there was anything to rave about but it was good.  The Blackened Chicken Po Boy was very good as was the fries that came with it (has a crunchy coating too).  The Jambalaya Pasta was spiced well and came in a very large bowl!

Other than the cramped feel, this place is definitely worth checking out.  Highly recommended!

It can be hard to choose a place to eat when you're in the French Quarter. Oceana was recommended to us by Champagne from Grenoble House, and we decided to give it a try. It was one of the highlights of our trip. My husband and I ate at the bar, and Darreck was absolutely amazing. He was engaging and thoughtful, helpful with recommendations, and seemed genuinely interested in making conversation without being intrusive or overbearing. Genuine is a great word to describe the meal. The food was genuine New Orleans cuisine. The atmosphere was genuinely beautiful and quaint. It was a busy place to have a secluded meal. The setting was beautiful, the people were kind, and the food was delicious. Honestly delicious. We didn't meet the chefs, but I hope someone can pass our compliments along. 10/10 could not recommend more.
Great service from Ashleigh! Food was awesome (PoBoys) and came out almost instantly. We had group of 5. Def coming back.

Oceana was the first restaurant I noticed when I arrived at the airport because there was an advertisement that said 10% off your bill if you take a picture of the ad. So I did. When we got to the restaurant, we were seated immediately and our waiter was Alex who was great!! It was cold that day in NOLA but the restaurant was nice & toasty. The staff was great which I'm really big on. I got the crab cakes only and it was the best choice to make. They were so good and filling because I wasn't too hungry. I'd recommend this as a must eat when in NOLA

Do no eat here. I just got back from an amazing weekend in New Orleans and had great restaurant experiences, but this one left me sick. 

I have never in my entire life been treated so poorly - not even in France. I was with a group of 110 people and we had a banquet planned at Oceana. That afternoon we confirmed that our room would be ready by 6:30 PM. We arrived at 7:00 PM, hoping that if they were late, that us arriving a bit late would give them extra time. With 110 people, there is no room for error. The restaurant started by not even apologizing for being late. Not a huge deal - just poor execution and poor attention to detail.

With the food, we asked for a modified menu because of dietary differences in this group of 110. Not one of those was followed from no caesar dressing to putting the meat on the pasta on the side so that vegetarians could enjoy the salad and the entree. 

As we began the program - keep in mind we had a very important keynote speaker - they started their garbage disposal in the bar. We could not hear our speaker and when we asked them to turn it off they just put up their hands and shrugged their shoulders. They purposely repeated this garbage disposal routine three other times - all during out program when nobody was actually going to the bar. Totally unacceptable.

To finish it up, the night ended with us demanding to lower the tip based on poor service and preparation. When we demanded it be lowered, the manager called the cops - not something you want to have happen to you in a place with such a corrupt police department. Two cops came in - one in uniform and one uncover straight out of a bad episode of Sopranos. At the end of everything, the manage said to my face, "I don't care about your money. We make a lot of money in this place. I want to make an example of you." Wow - is this guy even human? NEVER spend your hard earned money in this place.

This food might fly with the tourists, but people who live here should know better. Chargrilled oysters should not come with a mountain of canned "Parmesan" and stale bread. Gumbo should not be made with frozen, dime sized shrimp. Drinks should not take an hour to get to the table and contrary to what the owner might tell you, a roach crawling on the wall past your table is not just "part of New Orleans." There should be special provisions for vacation reviewers. Sadly, there are an abundance of this caliber place around and some people just don't know any better.

It's a little tricky to find this place. You can reach it from bourbon or royal as you go around the construction. Google is pretty accurate about the busy times. I went right around 6:30 for dinner and it started to get busy soon after. The food is excellent. I got an order of crab cakes, a small crawfish etouffee and a bread pudding. Everything was delicious and a great intro to my first meal in New Orleans. The bartender was friendly and attentive and the drinks were strong.
When in New Orleans, go here for a meal. It's worth it.

So I visit Oceana everytime I'm in NOLA and the first time I bring my sister who's never been here they disappoint her.  There was hair on her plate of food and she ordered a chicken poboy and got fish.  My madri gras pasta was a bit under seasoned this time, so I have to lower my rating to a 4 star this time around.  The gator bites were still so yummy though.

Was really skeptical of a restaurant near bourbon street but this was great! Every single employee was so dang friendly and wonderful. The oyster po boy was excellent, the bread being the best part actually. Crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside. Also had the collard greens which were so flavorful. Also loved the purple haze beer which had a bit of a raspberry flavor to it. Would definitely go again next time I'm in NOLA.
Top notch service and wonderful food!! Our server Megan L. ...was sweet as can be! Truth NOLA hospitality!!

I love it here! Good food nice staff and josh the bartender is awesome! When I say awesome he's awesome like literally the best his name is josh! See him! Visit him!!! It's
Literally a privilege to have a awesome bartender take care of me!
This was a great experience! The Cajun fried were so yummy. I loved the care and service Amethyst provided and the recommendations she provided to us tourist! Thank you!

The food here is phenomenal. The crawfish omelette was delicious for breakfast AND the gumbo is literally die for! Ponce was our sever and he was simply the best. The hospitality and service in this place is over theeee top; we went twice over three days! When I am back in NOLA I'll be heading over to Oceana for certain!

Great! Earlier this month, my spouse and I visited NOLA for the first time and this was the first spot we tried out. We were seated almost immediately but that might have been because we sat at the bar. We were terribly excited so my spouse decided on the Taste of New Orleans which consisted of Red Beans and Rice, Jambalaya and Crawfish Etoufee. She was thrown off because it was not hot and I confirmed it. I'm thinking to myself "noooo not the way to start this trip off smh." We talked to the manager and they were able to fix the problem and were sincerely apologetic about it. For the inconvenience, the cool bartender even gave her a drink on the house. I ordered the Shrimp Po Boy and he recommended I get it half and half, fried and grilled, and I substituted the fries for red beans and rice. Everything was excellent. The red beans and rice were on point and tasted a couple steps above Popeyes. Jambalaya was different and my spouse didn't care for it but I did. Etoufee was also great especially considering it was our first time trying it. The shrimp Po Boy was good although next time I'll listen to my taste buds and get it all the way fried! Another guy came over to our table sensing we were tourist and provided a locals guide to things to do and restaurants to try. Great service!

Nice fast service. I arrived was seated ordered a drink. Waitress was great told me the specials in great details and even offered recommendations. This was my second time visiting Oceana I think it was better the first time but still good.

Our Uber driver recommended this spot and I always try and check out the spots locals recommend. There was a short line to get in, but it does move fairly quickly so don't let that deter you. The place is a lot bigger on the inside than what it looks like on the outside. Staff is friendly but service was on the slower side. My husband and I got an order of the chargrilled oysters, which was recommended, and we shared the friend platter of shrimp and fish. This was our first time having chargrilled oysters and they were very good. Of course later we found out that chargrilled oysters are a New Orleans specialty so every place we went to after we ordered them to compare. Oceanas oysters we're okay compared to the others we had. The platter was huge and enough for 3 people to share. Overall, it was a good dinning experience. It does remind me of a fast food version, or chain version, of New Orleans cooking, if that makes sense. The location is great though, right off Bourbon Street so after some drinking you can stumble on in for some food.

I ordered delivery and it was a nightmare.  I had to call the restaurant 3 times to see where my order was, the order arrived 40 minutes past the delivery estimate and almost 2 hours after I ordered.  The restaurant informed me the driver (he was on a bike) had 5 other deliveries.   That is clearly far too many deliveries for one person.   My food was cold, the soup had been crushed and spilled all over my food, my entree was crushed as well and was a mess.  To top it off my sparking water exploded everywhere when I tried to open it.  Clearly the delivery person was not able to handle the food and drinks and keep them in good condition.  The restaurant staff was absolutely no help whatsoever and downright rude.

I have tried the Blackened Catfish Platter at Oceana Grill. It was good but too spicy for me. They have a good amount of seafood options and definitely a good place for lunch. For dessert, I have tried the Chocolate Mousse and the Bread Pudding. Both were delicious but the Bread Pudding was by far the best.
The absolute BEST eatery in New Orleans! I ate there my first time in New Orleans on my first night! I made sure I ended my vacation the same was I started it...at OCEANA GRILL!!!
Food was awesome! And the oysters? GREAT, that garlic herb sauce with parmesan cheese on it is pretty good. Will come again!

I have to say this place is delicious . Great service our  waitress  named Kim was so welcoming and helpful on our selection. She told the Cajun jambalaya pasta was the best !!! Ohh it was ! We had the crab cakes for appetizer and the creamy  mushroom sauce was sooooo good . My friend ordered red fis &craw fish   With two sides .
I tasted her fries they will crispy and perfection.
I highly recommend this place it's in the middle of all the action and has a great view if you seat upstairs. Plus the  Gumbo was soooooooooo good not to spicy or salty . It was soooo good . If your in NOLA this must !!!!
The food and drinks were soooooo good. It's a really small establishment but the wait and food was well worth it. Definitely going back when I travel to NOLA next year.

They care a lot about improving the restaurant and meeting each customers needs. Our waiter was on top of it the whole time and the food came out within minutes. The Chicken Alfredo is amazing! Highly recommend. Very rarely do I like the chicken in an Alfredo, but this was great both times.

Update: we returned a second time and they were far busier. We weren't greeted. And when I stepped in to tell the hostess how many of us there were, she made me stand outside and interrupted me in the process. I tried to assure her, I knew to wait outside but she just repeated herself and didn't let me say anything.
***The meal did not come like this, this was after several bites. Presentation on both our dishes was lovely.
Had the blackened catfish, amazing flavor. Rice was so good. Greeens good but you know I had to add salt. Bloody Mary was really good. Not top tier in NOLA but still decent.

This is super good!! Nice wait staff. They don't bother you and are on top of things!! Angela was an amazing waitress. I had the "Taste of New Orleans". It's crawfish étouffe, red beans and rice, and jambalaya. Perfect for those who can't pick or want to try everything! My brother had a oyster poboy, which was good! They're fried oysters are awesome!! Would recommend and will come again.
Super fast service, friendly staff and delicious food. The crab cakes are out of this world!
AMAZING!!!!! Hands down. Had Seafood Gumbo & a dozen of their Chargrilled Oysters. Everything I could've asked for and more.
Was really excited about this place, but were turned away at the door when we inquired about food allergies. Avoid if you have any peanut/treenut allergies, as they say they cannot accommodate.
Joshis so friendly funny and attentive. Atmosphere is welcoming from the hostess to the manager. Great food and great overall service

Food was ok but I have no desire to try it again.  I ordered fried shrimp and it was nothing I hadn't tried before. 

The menu is slightly pricey for the food I received.

The food was okay.  I ordered a Cajun Bloody Mary and they forgot about my drink.  The waitress brought it at the end when I was about to ask for the check.  I told her I did not want it anymore, and she took the drink back.  

Next time something like this happens with another customer, I suggest they give the customer the drink at no cost.

This place has very delicious food. I was in town for the weekend and had been following this restaurant on Instagram for some time. I knew I wanted to try it out and I am so glad we did. They are open until 1 am on Saturday and right at the corner of Conti and Bourbon. I went around 12 am and there wasn't a wait. The crab cakes are soooooooooo good. I wouldn't lie to you. I haven't had a better crab cake at any other restaurant. I liked that the crab cake is not laoded with breading or fillers. You actually taste crab and the sauce just makes it even better. I ordered the ribs for an entree and they had entirely too much sauce. I wouldn't order them again, but the sides are phenomenal. My sister ordered blackened catfish and it was very delicious. I like that it really had some heat to it, but getting back to the sides...everything I tasted was so good, I would want a veggie plate. The greens were so delicious. The creamy corn was to die for and my mashed potatoes were good too, but I literally could have just had the greens, creamy corn and the crab cakes and I would be in food heaven. I am looking forward to visiting again as soon as I can make it back to New Orleans!

First night in New Orleans!! I love this place!! It's right by Bourbon Street. The food was amazing, the drinks were sublime, the decor was comfy, and our server Jenna was fantastic. A great start to any trip.
Omg this place is amazing. They have gluten free crab cakes ... what!?!. They were soo good. And the alligator bites (blackened) were also amazing and also gluten free. I will definitely be back!!!

Definitely make a reservation because even with and being a party of one, you might be waiting a while. I'm sure covid restrictions played a part, but still. Once I got inside everything was wonderful. I sat at the bar. Service was extremely friendly and gave good drink recommendations. The mandarin blush was delicious and refreshing, not too sweet. I knew I wanted to get the Taste of New Orleans since I hadn't tried any jambalaya or etouffee yet in NOLA. This dish included red beans and rice with smoked sausage, crawfish etouffee, and creole jambalaya. All were great, but I think the jambalaya was my favorite, and the dinner roll was used to wipe the bowls clean after.

So finally made it back to Nola! I really wanted to like this place really disappointed! Let me stay w the positive my husband liked the oysters, he said they were a good size priced well. That said NO CHARBROILED OYSTERS!!! WHAT!! Ok not cool!! We also ordered the gumbo which again hubby enjoyed it. As for me not so much too fishy and not hot was almost cold yuck!!! We then ordered the seafood platter. I will say the catfish was good not much rather small chunks. The shrimp was small and cold!! The worst thing was the supposed bread/ roles just stone cold and just bland very commercial yuck!!! All that said we won't be back!

the service here sucks，no one came to serve us water first，no one came to take the order second，one plate was forgotten to order third！！The plate here is kinda dirty and the food here is very normal！besides the shrimp we ordered，nothing is fine

Excellent service. Food was delicious. The garlic lemon sauce on the crab cakes was fresh and tangy. The crawfish mushroom cream sauce complimented the spicy redfish. A real treat for the taste buds. My husband also ordered the bourbon pecan pie and it just melted in your mouth. Best meal of our trip.

Great place for drinks and food!
Coming for out of town we always have to go to Oceana grill to get the appetizer crab dish so delicious. 
They last time we were in NOLA Oceana had all three floor open just the downstairs was open at lunch but still a lot of room.
We sat at the bar to eat the bartender was very nice and efficient.

We were here on a Wednesday night for dinner... the line was all the way down the sidewalk. We were told it was a 30 min to 1 hour wait, we were at a table within 30 min. They work very hard to get people seated and the line moves fast.  Once inside the door there are places to sit & wait & very cool inside.   We sat upstairs and Brad was our waiter... excellent service, could not have ask for better service.  Food was delicious, one of my friends actually stopped the chef and complimented him on the food.   I had the blackened chicken & jambalaya , also the Bread Pudding. Best bread pudding I've ever eaten.   Food is delicious, great atmosphere & wonderful staff. Even the bathroom was immaculate.
  My favorite place to eat in the French Quarter...

Highly recommend.

Stopped in for fresh oysters, and a quick drink and ended up ordering a sampling.

The server recommended the Ragin' Cajun Bloody Mary, Peppar Absolut soaked in the most delicious giardiniera. It was spicy and a great start to the meal.

For starters we tried the gator tail bites served with a remoulade sauce. They were fried just right, not greasy at all. We also sampled 6 of their "famous oysters"; grilled oysters "smothered with our unique zesty garlic and cream herb cajun sauce, finished with a fresh blend of parmesan and romano cheeses." The grilled flavor of the oyster is lost under all the topping, but I was told these are a favorite. They were very tasty for sure, but i missed fresh oysters.

We split a fried shrimp po boy, served on a bed of slaw; crisp shrimp and great bread. Definitely a yes.

Most of the nights we've been here the place the placed has had a line around the block. Get here early and avoid the crowd.

10% off the bill with a Yelp check-in!

For the taste of Louisiana on Bourbon, I'd say check 'em out.

I meant to write this review sooner, but life really got away from me when we returned to NJ.  

We had excellent service here. Oceana Grill was recommended by our hotel out in the garden district, and my daughter decided it was where she wanted to go. So, off we went. I wound up being very happy with her choice because the food was good.

Our server, Meghan L (I really hope I got that right) was wonderful! I explained that I was allergic to all the really good things in life (shrimp, lobster, crab and crawfish) and she assured me that the kitchen would be able to handle it for me. I ordered a New Orleans Cosmopolitan to get the evening started.

We had gator bites (half blackened and half fried). We decided we liked the blackened better. My daughter had the crab cakes and she enjoyed them, and I had the blackened catfish. It was delicious.

We didn't have dessert because we were stuffed. I wasn't expecting much but was pleasantly surprised. Yum.

This was my favorite restaurant on my short trip to nola. We were little buzzed so we ordered a lot of food. The crab cakes, the fried gator, the pasta, everything was so damn good. 

Thank you to Oceana Grill, ya'll did not disappointment.
wonderful service and food.  2nd time visiting.  our server was Meagan L.  she was fantastic.  cannot wait to visit again

Next stop on our New Orleans trip was Oceana Grill. We actually ate here twice during our stay in NOLA.

Our waiter was very knowledgeable and everything he recommended was phenomenal.

We started off with a few appetizers:
-Crab Cakes (2 pieces) - $12.5
-BBQ Shrimp - $8
-Seafood Gumbo(cup) - $4.75
-Oysters on half shell (1/2Doz) - $6

The crab cakes (waiter's recommendation) were DELICIOUS!!! Perfect thin crust with moist crab meat on the inside. Definitely one of the best I have ever had!!!
The BBQ Shrimp were awesome, and that sauce they were served in made one tasty dip for the bread.
I ordered the gumbo(waiter's recommendation) just to try some, but I couldn't stop eating till it was all gone. You never had gumbo, till you get some in NOLA.

For our main course we got:
-Fried sea food platter - $19 (mine)
-BBQ Ribs - $18 (friend)
-BBQ Shrimp(main dish) - $18 (friend)
-Blackened Shrimp Salad - $15 (friend)
-Oyster Rockefeller(12) - $15.50

I tried my friend's Blackened Shrimp and the seasoning was very nice.
My fried sea food platter had fried shrimp, catfish, and scallops. The catfish was really good. The batter wasn't too thick and the fish was very flavorful.
The Rockefeller oysters(waiter's recommendation) had bacon and cheese on them, and were cooked over an open flame. Extremely tasty!!

For desert we got:
-Bread Pudding - $5
-Sazerac -$8.50
-2 pitchers of Draft Amber Ale - $15/each

Bread Pudding was pretty good. A bit too sweat for me, but you guys might enjoy it.
Sazerac - Rye Whiskey with bitters and sugar. Was way too sweet! I should have just asked for the whiskey by itself.


First time we came here, the wait wasn't too bad.However, our second time we waited 20 min in line and almost 40 min. for our food.

I'd definitely check this place out again, next time I'm in town.


You're also probably thinking why we didn't order the Boiled Crawfish. Well... the truth is.... we're idiots and we didn't see it on the menu. I wish I could go back in time and order some.

Awesome food. Loved the appetizers and kids ate good portion. They suggested the best items and it was really worth going with their suggestions. All dishes was more tastier than we expected. Entrees were awesome and loved it. The server was so courteous and helped us. He brought a bread pudding , when i requested him cutting a cake for our anniversary. He told he was sorry that they do t serve cake there but he made up with whatever he can. It was really lovely gesture. We will visit again when we go

Excellent service! I stopped in for brunch after walking around bourbon st. They served breakfast until 1:30pm... which looked delicious. I order crab cakes as my entree. Overall, satisfied with my experience. The restaurant owner and sever were very gracious and friendly. I will return!

Only went for breakfast but it was fabulous.  Laverne waited on us and she was very pleasant and helpful.  I got the Cajun breakfast with andouille and alligator sausage that was very flavorful.  Also ordered the sausage gravy and it was some of the best I have had and loaded with sausage.  The biscuits were perfect and had a honey glaze.  Liked it so much I went back the next morning before we left.

We tried to go to dinner but it is so popular that there was a line out the door and since it was raining we did not stay.  I will make a point to go back next time in New Orleans.
We tried to come here a few times however the line was too long to wait. We came back around 10/11 pm and there wasn't a line. Food was great, service was great also.

Great service and great food. I got the catfish platter, although it's a simple dish, it was great. Took some with me to-go because it was too much to eat all at once. My server was friendly & kind. No complaints.

Chicken fettuccine Alfredo was so good! Was very pleased.... with a Incredible Hulk frozen
(hypnotic and Hennessy) PERFECT!

After spending most of our night on Bourbon street, my group decided to stop in and grab something to eat. Our attention was caught by the menu that was placed outside. There seemed to be a lot of good things to choose from and so we decided to get a table. We were taken upstairs and got a table in the corner. Our server was either very inexperienced or just impatient because she kept rushing us. We were a party of 10 people and we needed time to look over the menu. She acted very rude and we didn't like it. 

BLACKENED BAYOU DUCK- Smoked duck then blackened and topped with a crawfish mushroom cream sauce
This dish was very good and flavorful. It was packed with different spices and had many layers of flavors. The duck was beautifully cooked. It was tender and juicy and I absolutely love the mushroom cream sauce. It had a nice thick consistency and was so creamy.

SURF AND TURF
This dish was okay. The beef was cooked nicely and had some nice flavors, but it wasn't as flavorful as the other dish. The oyster was friend and was a bit too dry for my taste.

BANANAS FOSTER ICE CREAM CAKE- with caramel, strawberries and chocolate
I really like the moist cake and the fruity strawberries and the rich chocolate. It was a nice way to the end the meal with something cold, but sweet.

NEW ORLEANS BREAD PUDDING- with praline and rum sauce
This bread pudding was very moist and I love the rum. It had a nice sweet alcohol taste to it and tasted very nicely with the sweetness of the dessert.

Overall, I would come here again, but I would definitely pass if I end up with the same server. I really like some of their dishes and I taste the complexity of the layers of flavors; so I hope to try other dishes like those.

Terribly over priced. I had the blacked duck and was only given a single duck thigh with a small sauce bowl of jambalaya on the side. The duck had the texture of microwaved leftovers when it fell off the bone. Really not worth the money. My SO got the fried seafood platter and that was alright but the fried oysters were gross. 
We came at 9pm on a Sunday night in October 2016 and the place was pretty empty. Got seated pretty quickly. The place seemed dirty and the decor seemed unfinished. They had what seemed to be tarp on a wall like they were midway through construction. Nothing worthwhile about the place physically. 
Would never return and highly advocate that my friends never even look at this place in their darkest hour. So many better places around with fresher food. I heard that they give a free drink if you leave a good review so I guess there's that?!
Excellent service and delicious food  the best you can find at New Orleans. Crab cake is amazing!!!
Amazing service and amazing food! Before we came to New Orleans, I was recommended to come to this restaurant by multiple people, and it did not disappoint.
Oceana's staff was awesome! Very accommodating and kind. The food was good, but not wow worthy. The drinks were strong and good.

I was so excited to try this restaurant as many people recommended it to me. However, I was not impressed. The étouffée and red beans were served cold and the fried food was warm. The manager did come speak with us to apologize and then brought us hot food.  The fried oysters and crawfish were tasty and so were the red beans. Crawfish étouffée was just okay and crab cakes had too much filling.  The manager provided dessert as a comp for the inconvenience, which was a disappointment. Bread pudding and pecan cake tasted store bought. Ambience was great, but nothing else to write home about.

Disappointing experience at Oceana Grill.  Arrived at 11am for breakfast, was seated quickly.  Service was quick.  Food was deplorable.
I ordered the St Louis Eggs .  Supposedly Oceana Grill was using Petunia's recipes/chef or something, but there is no comparison to Petunia's dish(es).  The crab did not taste right nor did it smell right, the eggs came on a white oval dish, they looked like they were haphazardly thrown on the plate, not a garnish to be seen, and half the plate was just a stark white void.  There were hunks of a yellow cheese melted on top,  it looked awful.  The dish was unappetizing in it's appearance and taste.  I could not eat the crab.  This was my second bad experience in two days in the Quarter.   
What I did eat made my stomach act up in a relatively short time, normally I have a gut of steel
Never again.
This was definitely a great spot to eat food was amazing and the staff was just as great ...pricey but worth the taste!
It's not bad but extremely overrated. Not worth the wait in line IMO.  Friendly staff.

I almost forgot I ate here.  My food was wonderful although I forgot what I ordered.  I remember the young lady that took my order. She was nice and friendly.  We shared a couple of really good laughs. She recommended a drink I really enjoyed.  And my food was really tasty.   In which she also recommended.  I forget her name but she was a very young black girl who rocks. .

5 stars! Great drinks and good food! Got the crawfish ettoufee and their famous oysters. Food is flavorful. Great service as well. Also got the mandin house special drink and the boyfriend got the mango peach margarita.

Tip: check in on Yelp for a 10% discount!

We went back to Oceana, having been here last year.

Let me state that they are open during this Covid pandemic, so kudos to them. It may also explain why things were so crazy this time.

There will be a line- something we all must deal with. Get over it now before you go.

Once seated, it took a while for our waiter to come over. It could be bc he had a large group that was giving him difficulties or bc he was new and just frazzled.

It was busy inside. Kids running around everywhere. It was pandemonium.

Food:
Chargrilled oysters- not the greatest in the city. A lot of cheese in the topping, maybe bc the oysters were not the greatest quality. 

Crab cake w mushroom sauce (can't remember its name on the menu). My first order was pretty cool once it got to the table. Then one bite in there was some item in it that was not edible... similar to dental floss.
I advised the waiter, and his response was "okay."  
I eventually spoke to a manager and she offer to make a new meal for me to take, to which I agreed. This order we took with us back to the hotel... still disappointed.
Crab cakes seems to be deep fried... when you receive the meal to go it is deconstructed so the sauce is separate from the crab cakes. I realize the sauce is what gives the crab cake the flavoring, bc the crab cake is somewhat bland.

Seafood platter with fried shrimp, catfish, and oysters.
Can't really go wrong with fried food- but it was not spectacular. 

I think they get a lot of business bc they have late hours. Food is decent, but I have had better in Nola.

I feel so gluttonous for eating all that I did there. It was like I couldn't stop.

One of my favorites was the crab cake appetizer. The crab cakes were fried and covered in a crawfish sauce. It was so good. 

I also loved their  charbroiled oysters. Again, so good.

I also had the fried seafood platter. The shrimp, catfish, fried oysters were really delicious, too. The hush puppies were also pretty tasty.

I enjoyed trying their fries appetizer, which was basically that crawfish sauce and cheese on the fries. Regular fries came with the seafood platter, too. I do think the fries could've been better, though.
Everything was so good, and the service from Jamal was 10/10. Would recommend!! From alligator bites and oysters to the drinks.
The food was delicious i had the red fish chef's special w/ collard greens my wife had the mardis gras pasta definitely will be coming back Destine was a great waitress very pleasant

By far one of the best places I visited while there. So glad they recommended this place. I was a solo traveler for 5 days I had to visit twice. The service is beyond amazing. Super friendly staff and so attentive. The food hands down amazing. Recommend anyone visiting the city to stop by. Won' regret it!

We came here one night because it was one of the few restaurants that was open during Covid hours. It was jam packed and busy, but the line moved really fast. My group got all varieties of creole pasta and it was delicious. It was a hearty portion and it tasted fresh. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because the service was slow.

A marvelous find just off Bourbon St. Looks like a small place from the doorway but it opens up beautifully. Also has one very nice large courtyard for dining en plein air. My better half and I came across this great place by accident. 

 Food is very good. Breakfast is good but so is the entire menu. Besides the crepes the grits and bacon hit the mark. Service was even better. Handles large groups with ease. Drinks are good
Chris P. did a great job serving and helping us pick good options!  Great food!  Appreciate the hospitality!

I was being nice about 2 star rating service was nice but rave over how good the choices of good.  I find the food were super bland and nasty.  My first night in New Orleans I get gross tasting food.  My friend orderr shrimp and chip and she only ate a few bites were not enjoyable.  I got the  sampler.  Over price  for three small cup.  And I got a cup for  gumbo and that wasn't good either.  

Improve your quality and taste.  You charge the  price high prove your worth.  It was not worth what we paid.  The only taste good is the drinks.

Had a wonderful dinner and drinks. We sat at the third story bar and glad we did. While there was a long line to be seated for dinner, the hostess asked if anyone wanted to sit at the bar. Like always we jumped at the chance as we were way back in the seating line. The food and drinks would just as good at the bar as I'm guessing it would be at the tables. We always love talking to the bar tenders and hearing there stories. Not to mention suggestions on sights and must sees in town and what to avoid. Give them a try, I'm sure anything off the menu is good
We are here for breakfast and dinner while in New Orleans! We had a great waiter who told us about an off the menu breakfast item that was delicious- crab cakes Benedict! YUM! Dinner was also good!
Pasta Mardi Gras was bland and the oysters were not a huge hit. Late night eat, was just ok. Maybe a bad night? Might give it another try on another visit.
Sad what this place has become. We waited 45 mins for the food and they said they there did know how much longer it was going to be. They had no updates and zero empathy.

I wanted to like it more. Food was good but service was below par. It could have been a busy night or they were understaffed, but our experience showed area for improvement. 

Line and wait to get seated. Not Oceania's fault, but adds to the list of more minor issues. 

Once we were seated, we waited a while to have our server even introduce herself. Got our drink order in and I told our server, my wife is very thirsty, can we get her a water as soon as possible?  Was told no problem. We waited a bit but my wife ended walking up to the bar to get her drink. When our server did bring waters, my wife's cup(plastic) was cracked. No one noticed initially,  but it was leaking everywhere and made quite a mess. 

Food came out in a reasonable time. However, server drops food off and never gave us any silverware. So we had to wait for her return. 

Thankfully food was good. 

However, the meal was somewhat expensive for this type of venue.  With tax, tip and one cocktail(wife only ever had water) no appetizers, the bill came out to over $80 for 2 people.  At the end of the day I did not feel this was good bang for the buck. Food was good but not $80 good. Service was definitely not $80 service.

The servers were great and professional and friendly and Jace made personal recommendations and was able to make substitutions for allergies.  I tried the Mardi Gras pasta with shrimp and crawfish and fettuccine noodles and it was delicious.  (no other pasta avail)  Some may add more Cajun spice to make it spicier. 
My friend ordered the lightly blackened redfish with garlic mashed potatoes and fresh cooked greens.  We each ordered a drink and the Khalua Mousse desert was amazing!  
I would recommend.  Also, Most seating is up a narrow flight of stairs.  Bathrooms clean!
The server Jace was attentive but did not rush us!
Also offered options for souvenir drink glass!
I will go back and try a few other things on the menu.
Don't judge a book by its cover! Even though the outside doesn't appear inviting, once you step in you find yourself in a large historical building.  Crab cakes were amazing!
Really enjoyed the atmosphere, food and OMG our waitress Destine was the best. Definitely will be going back!

Yummy oysters, fried fish was very fresh, shrimp fettuccine was regular. Everything was very good. Our waiter was friendly, check-up on us often, and kept our water filled. I would recommend this place.
Kim P was outstanding our server!  She was  very help making sure we got the best of the  menu had.  Will be back next time.
Yummy food.   Price is right on for the amount of food you get and atmosphere great!!!!!!A chain but sooo good

New Orleans during COVID? Oceana is the standard in what restaurants are and should do.  Masks, gloves , shields, social distanced tables...thank you for always a great experience, food and atmosphere

I stayed at The Troubadour near this restaurant and I'm so glad this was recommended to me. I was looking for something light so I tried their Caesar salad with blackened shrimp along with their seafood gumbo. EVERYTHING WAS AMAZING. This was the best Caesar salad I have ever had. Their dressing is just right and has a perfect cajun twist to it. The shrimp was prepared & seasoned perfectly, as well. I somehow kept myself to eating half of the gumbo but it was delicious, tool. I would absolutely recommend this place and I can't wait to return and try out more of their menu. 

Oh, and to top things off, the delivery man was very friendly and SMOKED the estimated delivery time. I planned on parking my truck, hitting the gym, and then having dinner. He had it to the hotel before I returned from parking!

So this was me and my bf first spot we tried in the N.O we got there around 10pm on a Thursday and there was no line! Def surprised since all the photos I saw on Yelp was a line out the door! The service was great we ordered red beans and rice, gator bites and jambalaya. The beans and rice were by far the best ! Tried beans and rice at diff restaurants but nothing compared to this spot.

I was in New Orleans for five days with a group of 10 and this was by far the best restaurant we ate at the whole time. Highly recommend the gumbo and the crabcakes. The waitress, Sarah, was very helpful, informative, welcoming and fast with service! Definitely a must go to!

I don't leave many reviews but my fiancé and I came here because of the reviews on Yelp and I think they were too generous so I'm hoping I can help the next vacationing couple.

Food was bland.  Not bad just not good.  Like going to Denny's.

Service was good - nice people.  But the food had no real flavor.
Oceana is forever my favorite place to eat and they never disappoint with the service and food. I wish the drinks had more alcohol of course lol However, everything was so good.

Our first night in New Orleans and we all wanted Oceana grill as they have some of the best oysters. We were seated pretty promptly and our server came to take our drink order. Upon returning with our drinks, we decided to order. Everyone ordered their food and I ordered the oceana oysters for my meal. At that time our server told me that the grill they use for the oysters was being renovated and they didn't have any oysters. After waiting close to 30 min between waiting to be seated and ordering I feel that something should have been said about not having any oysters other than the raw ones so that I could've made another choice. Their portions are pretty generous so I just shared with someone in our party. The server did tell us we could go across the street to their sister restaurant as they had oysters. Had we known sooner there were no oysters we would've went to another restaurant.

We understand it is covid, and service may be slow, but with that being said, service was not slow. Our server never once came to the table accept to order our drinks, food, and drop the food. I felt as though as soon as we sat and said waters all the way around, she decided we were not the table to care about. We were a party of 8, we ordered 2 appetizers, and they came out about 1 minute before our food was brought to the table. Our server never refilled anyone's drink. The crab cakes tasted off, the fried shrimp in the PO-boy tasted freezer burnt. The manager did not seem to care all to much. When he came to ask about the crab cakes he tried to argue that the crab cakes where fine, but he stopped and took them off the check. Now if you have every worked at a restaurant then you understand you can get in the weeds, but Chelsie (worst server I have had in a long time) when confronted on our bad service, pace of meal, and lack of care for a party that would have paid a nice tip on a $140 tab, simply stated she had 5 tables and was swamped. If you cannot handle 5 tables as a server, you should find a different job. None the less, you should not laugh when your guest says they are having/had a bad experience. So piece of advise Chelsie, do better next time and you will get paid.

Very delicious food. Perfect spot to enjoy some yummy food before enjoying a night full of drinking and walking Bourbon St. The servers & host's were super friendly and welcoming. Our server was Fiona, she had such a friendly and sweet personality and made great suggestions which made our dinner much more memorable. We had the Cajun Fries and Mardis Gras Pasta with blackened shrimp and crawfish (Fionas suggestion) Will come again!!

They did a fantastic job with my group of 22 people, we had reservations, and they accommodated us wonderfully! And the service was wonderful! And the food was delicious, i got the platinum special: steak, jumbo prawn and crab cake. Very good!
