If you have not been here you a truly missing out on great food. The waiters are so nice and friendly service next to none. We had a little wait because so many people was trying to get here too lol. But it is worth the wait trust me. The crab cakes flawless. The pasta was banging. The red fish was almost perfect. And the gator bites yummy. The drinks are strong too that's always a good thing especially in New Orleans.
Good friends took us here on vacation. Fantastic food and fun atmosphere. Dori was our waitress and heightened our experience with her charming personality.
The food is excellent as well as the service!!! The famous crab cake is definitely worth it!!!

We ate here twice in our 4 day trip. The food was great and the staff was very polite and helpful. There were 6 of us in our group and ordered several items off of the menu to give everything a try as this was our first trip to NO. We did not have a single complaint other than being stuffed with great food both times! We will definitely make this a stop when we visit NOLA again!

Our appetizers were very good. Crab cakes and blackened gator tail nuggets. Solid 9s across the table. They tried to serve our entrees before our appetizers though which was a bit weird. The server was sassy and reluctant to take them back when we asked to get our appetizers first. The entres were pretty good, not amazing. We had the gumbo and crawfish étouffee. The craws were tiny and pre peeled. Decent tasting, but very hearty and pleasant. The gumbo was pretty good too. Not really sure what to think of this place, not a very whelming experience I guess. Kinda left a bitter taste in my mouth after sitting at the table waiting for the bill. Something just felt off. Ambiance is important. This place is lacking.

Wow, this was probably the worst place I went to for food in New Orleans and perhaps in all of America. Terrible fried food that I did not eat because it was so bad. Maybe going at night was not a good day and perhaps their food is better during the day. I am not sure. I will say the staff was extremely nice and attentive. I would probably go here for a drink and that's about it.

Was recommended to come here by 3 separate people.  We were not disappointed.   Amazing seafood platter and the Po Boy Gator (Blackened) was to die for. John was an incredibly attentive, pleasant and thoughtful server.  Highly recommended
The food was amazing..I had gumbo and also tried Cajun jambalaya.....the best ..c.j. was my server and was very knowledgeable about all the food I asked about...C.J. my my dining experience great..

Drink: Bohemian Berry all juice no liquor
Oysters: not fresh looking, fishy taste
Pastas: "Is it microwaved?" questioned our middle-school child
Waitress: nice and attentive
Experience: meh
Friendly staff , great food really a good vibe. My little brother and I were so hungry ,they didn't have no table available..... the hostess make sure we didn't leave she sent us to the bar upstairs.

He have been many times the last few weeks. The food has been good with generous portions each time.  3 of the 4 times the service was great.  The staff was attentive, helpful and knowledgeable.

The last time the service was not so good. But the food was still very good. I would definitely recommend it, If the service is lacking the food should make up for it. Breakfast, the crab cakes, and the Cajun fries are my favorite so far.  Some of the best gravy for biscuits and gravy I have ever had.

I hope to have them and the crab cakes one more time before I leave!

LOVED LOVED LOVED! Oceana Grill has a 10% off coupon online or either at the hotel that you are staying (if you are staying in one in French Quarters).

I ordered the Shrimp Po Boy and the Seafood Gumbo, to go! The delivery time was so fast. They delivered to the lobby of my hotel within 20 minutes of ordering. The food was still hot, and the Shrimp Po Boy still crispy.

Next time, I would love to dine in to get the experience - and try out the other menu options.

We have eaten at many restaurants in NOLA for years, but had not been here.  With over 6,000 reviews at average of four stars, we felt sure this would be a hit.  The reviews DO NOT jive with what we ate at all.  Crab cakes were average, gumbo was served lukewarm and not close to what we get elsewhere.  The fried shrimp side was good.  But overall a big mismatch from the reviews.  We just felt like this was either more of a tourist trap type of place, or we ate a Covid down-scaled meal.
Wow!!! Must go to spot every time you're in NOLA. Was phenomenal as usual!!! Got the Blackened Duck and it did not disappoint. Service was good also but wow!!! Food is awesome.
If you're in the area of New Orleans I hope you get the chance to visit this place. Food was great and our waitress Fiona was super helpful.
Very accommodating. The line to enter went fast without a reservation. Typical Cajun food. Good service. Friendly staff. Good Bloody Mary. Fantastic fresh oysters on the half shell.

Etoufee and Dessert and more!


-----
-----

Cajun and more

-----
-----


We visited New Orleans and Florida between Christmas to New Years.  

We arrived in New Orleans around 10pm; we called ahead on our drive in, when we were still 30-45 minutes out, and confirmed with the hotel's front desk that several restaurants would still be open, which was comforting.

We were in New Orleans, in part, to get some good Cajun on our trip.
And Oceana delivered.

The walk from the Residence Inn was short, and thankfully there was no wait, but with food this good you can see how Oceana may have waits some (many?) nights.

We strongly considered a few of the appetizers... but with limited space in the van for leftovers we decided to just order dinner and dessert.

We ordered and really enjoyed:
- blackened chicken with fries
- Two Taste of New Orleans... beans and rice and sausage, jambalaya, and etoufee

Our son loved the chicken and we really liked the beans and rice and jambalaya and LOVED the etoufee... awesome!!!  and with garlic bread... sooo good.

Then... dessert... strawberry cheesecake and chocolate mousse and creme broyles... we shared... and they were gone guickly.

So GOOD!

Thank you, Oceana!

Very good gumbo I think the best. Love their rice and beans and of course jambalaya. You cannot get wrong with this food. I recommended to take sampler - the taste of New Orleans. And I'm not even mention their drinks. 
And the service is great too, great service Angela
Gator bites blackened and fried. Food an service were really good. Good drinks as well.
Stopped here for dinner and there was a short line outside. The food and drinks were all delicious!  BBQ shrimp, red beans and rice, fried shrimp, and bread pudding were all delicious!
Best ousters I have ever eaten by far. These are buttery smith and have a very sweet after taste. I also love there duck with as a really crispy skin.

Cool place to grab small bite and cold beer! Went there twice but we only sat at the bar! I tried gator tail :) my first time and it was actually very tasty! the oyster were very fresh! the BBQ Shrimp were so good I could get sick eating that sauce with not regrets!!! Highly suggested Oceana if you want to take a brake from bourbon street and have a very tasty nola flavor!
Cajun fries are so good!! Shrimp poboy wasn't the best in town.  Nice atmosphere.  Fast service.  Get the cajun fries!

Amazing food!! Get the crabcake appetizer. Great service. There's was a line out the door and my group of twelve was able to get seated pretty quickly. We even got to experience some of New Orleans' wildlife. We noticed the largest cockroach we had ever seen crawling on the wall during our meal! :)
We went there for dinner.  Service was great and the food was amazing.  We ordered the Jambalaya Pasta and a PoBoy and it was all very tasty and very affordable.  We highly recommend.
Food was really good and service as well !! Mary was very  kind, friendly and attentive. We left the restaurant very happy and we'll definitely be back.
Great food, fun environment, and big portions! Always want to go here when I come to New Orleans! Tried many seafood places in NOLA but this was one of my favorites.

I saw the great reviews and was a little disappointed. Not gonna lie. I wanted to have an authentic poboy from new Ireland but this dry sandwich let me feeling like the ones I tried in Minnesota were better.

Like come on. You're going to let Minnesota, of All places, make a better new Orlando sandwich than you?

The eggplant sticks were flavorless. All in all the food wasn't that good. The waitstaff was very friendly. Until they started hearing annoyed with how hard we were looking for my friends lost wallet. 2 thumbs down

Fantastic meal in the heart of the quarter - during COVID none the less. Had a nice, casual vibe as you walked in, attentive staff and quick service. Oysters on the half were delicious. Crab cakes were AMAZING - oh my goodness. When I come back - I'm making a meal JUST out of that! Redfish Oceana was very good. All in all a great meal and a great time.
Great little find in the Quarter! We stopped for a delish breakfast and the service was top notch!  Ask for Errols section ... he's great!

I have passed Oceana a number of times during my trips.   Finally decided to try it and had mixed reviews.   

Really liked the decor.  You wouldn't believe how much room that this place has.   Our waitress was attentive and the service was good.   

The food was where the experience was mixed.  We started off with the chargrilled oysters. I was really disappointed in them as the were not fully cooked and not as good as others I have had in other locations.  The bright spot of the meal was the crawfish etoufee.  Portions were good and it had good flavor to it.  It also had a nice slow burn that built throughout.  Just the way I like it  

Overall it was a good experience minus the chargrilled oysters.  For me, I eat a lot of chargrilled oysters when I am in NOLA. For that reason, I might pass.

They let you bring in outside drinks! 

My brother and I rushed to down our drinks before making it to the front of the line, but they let us bring our outside drinks into the restaurant, no problem.

It was BUSY. But once we were seated, the wait time for our food was reasonable, out waiter was friendly and as attentive as any one person can be when they're working in a busy restaurant, and the food was phenomenal. 

10/10, highly recommend. There was a long wait when I came, but it was absolutely worth it. Don't forget to check in for 10% off your tab!

First time NOLA and this was our first place to eat. Gator bites blackened or fried.... Awesome. Fantastic service from our server Jamal but the hostess didn't smile when we walked in and just seemed like she didn't want to be there, resting B****face all the way. Food is also hellishly over priced as well as the drinks, but there are tourists so why not make them go broke quicker, right. Wouldn't want them spending money elsewhere.

My friends came in to Oceana Grill one evening since it happened to be the closest restaurant to where we were on our list of restaurants to check out. We waited about 15 minutes to be seated, which is pretty quick considering it was Saturday. 

We ordered the Oceana's Famous Oysters, Cajun Jambalaya Pasta and Caesar Salad. The portions were large enough for 3 people to share. The Oceana's Famous Oysters had a very unique taste compared to the oysters we've tried at other restaurants. I loved the flavor, but the oysters were overpowered by how much cream and cheese there was on it. It was a bit too much for me. The Cajun Jambalaya Pasta contains shrimp and alligator sausage, but I couldn't even tell which meat was which. This dish also had great flavor but was way too creamy. The Caesar Salad tasted pretty straightforward with caesar salads you'd expect anywhere else.
Pretty good. I enjoyed it. I had the BBQ Shrimp. The sauce was a little greasy but still really good.
The food was incredible! Large portions and Great Service! Our waitress, Kristian was super attentive and made sure everything was perfect!!

This was one my best meal services in a long time
It was our anniversary and I made reservations 
Went right to table, ordered
Food was perfect and I never say that!!
The room said happy anniversary to us and a neighboring table paid for our meal!!
Kennisha was our waitress, PERFECT!!!
Keisha was managing the floor, EXCELLENT 
We might go back every year!!!

Great service and delicious food. I had the cajun chicken Alfredo. I consider myself a food, this was a great Alfredo.  Not overly seasoned but just right to taste the ingredients. But the best part was the service. Everyone was nice and great communication.  We also had the catfish platter which was enough to feed 2 to 3 people. The catfish was fresh and seansoned well. Please stop by and enjoy. Ashleigh was our waitress, you will not be disappointed.

I love this place. I have visited two times before submitting this review. I got the hurricane the first time along with a fried seafood platter. I also had the red beans and rice. It was so good. The 2nd visit only got fried catfish and shrimp plus those red beans and rice again. I also tried the bread pudding this time. So delicious! No wait on the 2nd visit. Waited about 30 minutes the 1st Time. It's in the quarter but it worth the wait.
Food was amazing, drinks were strong and amazing! It was a great welcome to the NOLA!

Blackened redfish etouffee was awesome.  So was the jambalaya.  Hurricane was one of the best I had in New Orleans and it even had dry ice for added awesomeness.  The TV flashing with all of the famous people who've eaten here amused me: James Gandolfini, Anthony Bourdain, Little Wayne, Drake, Ludacris, etc.  Highly recommended.  One of many great meals I experienced on my trip to New Orleans.

We wanted some classic NOLA food for lunch and were not disappointed! The Mardi Gras pasta, shrimp po boy, and crab cakes were amazing. I can't recommend the red beans and rice enough. Our waitress Whitney was also a highlight! We loved her recommendations and she went out of her way to make the lunch perfect. Highly recommend!

This place was amazing! I felt very comfortable with the social distancing set up. Our waitress was very kind and engaging as well as attentive. I ordered the crabcakes--- DELICIOUS! I was also very excited because I do not eat pork, so that typically limits my side dish options. If you are the same, then I would like to share the greens are made without pork and were sooo good! I definitely plan to return.

The food was ok but the service was better. Had a really patient waitress who answered the many questions from some in our party. The gator bites are a must have! The crab cakes were abut disappointing.

Late post. Finally made it here, and now I see why there is always a line. We did have to wait in the line for a while but it was well worth it. There was some construction going on outside of the building so it made the walk way pretty tight as people were passing by. We were greeted by the staff upon entry; I mean every person was polite and spoke to us. We felt very welcomed. Our food came out very fast and again everything  we order was delicious! I had bbq shrimp again, the shrimp were huge and the portion size was as well! My husband ordered the fried seafood platter, the portion was huge. His catfish was amazing!!!! My friend ordered gumbo which she enjoyed. Will definitely be back next time we're in town.

This restaurant was recommended by a local that I met at the casinos in Biloxi.... it was everything he claimed it to be and more!!! The hostess was friendly and accommodating,  my waitress (Kim) was also as friendly and very helpful in explaining all the wonderful dishes listed on the menu. At her recommendation, I ordered the Blackened Redfish LaFouche.  It was better than her description!!! I was very satisfied with both the wonderful flavors as well as the portion size. I also had a hurricane that was the best I have ever had. I will definitely be back and will recommend this fine establishment to anyone who asks. Thank you for a wonderful culinary experience!!!

Let first say that our server Ashleigh is awesome and professional. She made our visit very pleasant. 

I had the Oceana Red Fish with a crawfish mushroom sauce.it was very good. The  greens were delicious well seasoned. I did not need to add any extra seasoning. 

I would defiantly return back to this Resturant. Next time I want to try the crab cakes.

Food was great, everything that came out was hot and flavorful. There was a line and I guess it's always a line but it moved fast for us so we didn't worry too much about that. The set up and atmosphere is very casual so no need to get fancy. 

Only thing I suggest is some updating to give the place a little face lift, it could be the look they're going for but it's dark and divey.

This place is a plus for being open late! The waitress we had was awesome with giving us recommendations. We ordered two entrees and a dessert. 

Taste of New Orleans: This was the perfect dish to get to try three different items on the menu! The jambalaya was good. It was strong with the tomato taste. Red beans and rice was my least favorite of the three. Crawfish Etouffee was my favorite!! It had so much crawfish inside. Every bite had a load of crawfish. It was my favorite and I wish I got the Crawfish Etouffée entree! I can still remember my first bite!

Fried Louisiana Oyster PO-BOY: The oysters are perfect! The coleslaw was a perfect combination with the oysters. I personally didn't like the bread as much. The fried oysters and coleslaw was yummy!

New Orleans Bread Pudding: This was the perfect finish to our meal! It was a bit sweet so we didn't get to finish, but it was very good! Took the rest togo and finished it later! The bread was the perfect texture with the right amount of raisins. Next time I would ask for the syrup that was on top of the bread pudding to be on the side. 

Would recommend this restaurant!

Walked in after a participating in a walking haunted tour with a few other family members. Place was packed but no wait time. Staff was very friendly and sharp. Not 100 items on the menu which I liked.  Charbroiled oysters were bomb!  Delicious!  Fried shrimp was way over cooked. We ordered plates to share. Portion sizes were huge! (We ordered the fried oysters, fried shrimp, fried fish platter). Our server was nice and very engaging.

This place is overrated. I was told crab cakes is their best item and it was mediocre. The oysters sucked. They were attacked to bottom and they were super gritty. It's good place if you're trying turn up while you eat, or celebrate a bday, but it's not a place for foodies, or if you're traveling and you wanna experience amazing Louisiana food.

It was OK. I ordered the shrimp po boy and my husband ordered the alligator po boy.

Fries were EXCELLENT! :) 

The shrimp was over breaded and you couldn't even taste it. Along with that, the bread was so hard and flakey it was almost too hard to eat.

The gator had good flavor, but again because of the bread it was masked.

Our friends tried the blackened catfish po boy and she said it was super good, another friend tried just the tuna fillet and they over cooked it and another friend tried the gumbo and said it was excellent. Personally I wouldn't go back - it does not offer authentic southern food but not many restaurants in the French Quarter do.
The food was great, staff was amazing. Errol was our server and absolutely made you feel at home.

Best Grits, and French toast I have everrrrrr had in my 40 years of living!! Don't laugh I'm so serious , don't believe me; go ahead and try for yourself. I visited on a Sunday, strongly suggest you make reservations for large parties! We were seated quickly with our reservations, our waitress was on the ball, she made great recommendations and everything was spot on! I was with a party of four so we ordered a bit of everything from the menu and Everyone was pleasantly pleased and more than satisfied with their meals. If visiting NO make sure to visit for brunch or dinner! You must order the grits and French toast!!

The blackened catfish special on cornbread with collard greens was awesome . The abita amber beer a local beer was really a good compliment.
The French bread was good.
The wife enjoyed her Greek salad with blackened chicken. The four ounces of wine served to my wife was marginal.  As was the service, nice kid but just not on top of things as promptly as it should be.
The bread pudding was one of the best I've ever had.  The wife loved her pecan pie.

The place is fairly clean.
The food was highly recommended and did not disappoint.

Definitely some of the best food I had while in New Orleans. It's right off Bourbon Street in the thick of the crowd so the customer base is very diverse. We were seated quickly and our server was very helpful. She told us some crowd favorites. We tried gator tail bites, both blackened and fried. I enjoyed blackened while my boyfriend enjoyed the fried. We also had someone in our party who order the cajun fries and I got to try some. They were pretty good. For my entree, I ordered the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta and it was amazing! The flavors were stupid good! I'm so happy that we came here.

I enjoyed the food and experience so much that later during my week there in New Orleans, I ordered a Shrimp Po Boy using Uber Eats. That was great too. I feel like no matter what you get from Oceana, it will be great and you will be happy.

Late Review - I actually visited Oceana Grill during Mardi Gras 2020. I will return but not during an over-crowded situation. This restaurant should not be open during Mardi Gras. It is much better when the crowds aren't around. 

Service: The staff was extremely friendly from the hostess, to the bartender, to the waitress, to the busboy (bus person). The menu specifically states that the bill can not be split. However, our waitress was ready and able to split our bill into 5 separate bills. Eventually, that ended up not happening and all was paid on one bill. Her eagerness alone was enough to warrant a nice tip. She was great, even after my friend spilled her full drink on the table. She gave my friend a new one quickly, without complaint and with a smile. 

Food: Well, I guess it depends on what you order. I enjoyed my shrimp fettuccini alfredo. However, for me to be in New Orleans, I expected more seasoning than what I received. My sister ordered a trio of red beans and rice, jambalaya & crawfish etouffee. I couldn't tell the difference between the three and they are very different dishes. My friend ordered a seafood pasta jambalaya and she loved it. The catfish platter was divine! I took issue with the shrimp and grits but my friend loved hers. Lastly, the crab cakes in mushroom sauce, YES YES YES! I was in high heaven. That sauce is the best I've tasted in a WHILE! Crab cakes are crab cakes but THIS SAUCE WAS YES!

Odds & Ends: There must be something about small restrooms in restaurants that's positive to the owner. If so, lemme tell ya, it's a disservice to the patron. The women's restroom had two stalls, one sink, and the non-handicapped stall was not big enough for me, period. I had to stand completely over the toilet just to open/close the stall's door. Plus-size women, or women with thighs, BEWARE! The non-handicapped stall is NOT FOR YOU! Of course, there is no restaurant parking but that has a lot to do with how New Orleans is built as a city. Some of the tables were a lil too close together for my taste. The stairs to get to the upper levels were slender in width. You may have to let someone up/down before you can go up/down.

I came here curious to try turtle soup, but they don't offer it here anymore despite it being on the menu.

I almost left, but then the alligator bites on the appetizer menu called out to me, so I ordered it.

So glad I did! I got them blackened, and they were so delicious. I was so surprised to find them to be perfectly seasoned, incredibly tender, juicy pieces of meat.  It didn't even need the accompanying sauce.

Oh, they also had a Yelp check-in deal for a discount off the total, and service was pretty friendly!

Definitely the most delicious alligator I have ever had, probably best thing I had in the French Quarter. Would definitely come back here again.
Delicious Food. Excellent service our waiter Chris M was very helpful and made good food suggestions. I'll be back!
Order my food Togo. The gumbo was okay, the barbecue shrimp was okay and the salad was pretty solid. Not terrible but not my favorite.

While on vacation, I got tons of reviews about this place and upon entry I could see why. There was a very lively crowd and the food smelled delicious. Our waitress, Erica, was simply spectacular and very polite. Something I immediately took note of. I appreciate how thoughtful she was when it came to me and my partners food delivery.. i.e. splitting up our crab cake appetizer and giving us a bowl of gumbo instead of a cup to share. When it came time to check out, I used my coupon provided from yelp and the manager took care of it with no problem. The bread pudding is to die for, very fluffy and sweet! Also, the host Ron, was very knowledgeable and had a wonderful personality. I can see why he got the job! Nice touch with complimenting my bf on his cologne. 

Again, if you're ever in the French Quarter this should be your first stop!
Bar tender doesn't know how to make a decent drink. First too much ice then doesn't put alcohol in the second one. Then they bitch about us complaining about it. Shit experience

We had a wonderful dinner in the courtyard at the Oceana Grill!  The blackened shrimp Caesar salad had probably a dozen large sized shrimp and my husband really enjoyed the Taste of New Orleans.  Our server, Amethyst greeted our table with a large bowl of cold water for our pup!  They definitely love the pups, the courtyard is beautiful and service is top notch!  Thank you Amethyst!

This place is amazing. I came back today for seconds all the people around me also keep talking about how good it is! The other night I had gumbo and it was amazing, the jambalaya fantastic, I had the blacken ribeye (it was ok, but everything else including my friends food was amazing!) we had the bread pudding and the mouse too and it was so good! Today I came back for the gumbo and jambalaya and the blacken chicken fettuccine and omg so good! Not to mention during covid they are taking steps to keep us safe and every person here thanked me for coming in! It will be my NOLA favorite!
Not sure why people tend to give a 5 star review. Food was not good. My food was cold and I had to return it. I personally wouldn't be back.
By far the best mixed drinks and seafood in town!!! Would highly recommend the Tropical Storm and the tuna steak!!!
Amazing food! Lavern took good care of us! We love it and the food! All the way from NC!

I took a little bit of time trying to decide where to have dinner on a quick stop in Nola. I needed a kid friendly place, something open late. 
Oceana grill was just "OKAY" for me. I started with a Hurricane and a dozen oysters in the half, and they actually smelled very fishy. I ate every single one and didn't get sick, which was my primary concern as soon as they arrived at my table. The drink was bomb!
I ordered the Redfish oceana which came highly recommended by my server, but again it was just okay. The seasoning on the fish was bland, although I was very happy with the size of the filet. The amount of crawfish in the mushroom cream sauce was a bit sad. The Entrée came with a side of mash, and corn in a special gravy - the corn was the actual BEST part of the whole dish.
The kids portion cheeseburger looked good, and my son really enjoyed the fries and Shirley temples!
Probably won't return here as my experience was less than memorable.

This restaurant is OK.  Not one of the better NO restaurants.  If you want better Red Beans and Rice go to Joey K's in the garden district and if you want the best char grilled oysters go to Basin in the Garden District.

The gumbo was very good as was the cheese cake. I am still trying to figure out what they put on those bbq shrimp. I didn't enjoy them at all and if I'm not mistaken I believe I received 5 or 6 medium sized shrimp.

Should have known better, all the warning signs were there, but somehow we ended up here after wandering around the Quarter on a Saturday night without a reservation.  This is NOT even close to the quality NOLA has to offer.  Do yourself a favor and skip it.  1 star is too generous but you have to leave at least a star to write a review.  I give it 1 star, so I can get the word out.

Only eatery we went to TWICE while here in NOLA. It was that good.
The price was right, the servers and staff were friendly. And on Wednesday, our server brought us comped breas pudding with killer sauce bcs it was our anniversary. We even brought it back to our Airbnb to eat later 
But met me tell you, the blackened catfish WAS SOOO GOOD!!!

Ok I don't usually do bad reviews but this place is absolutely God awful. The portion sizes are tiny, the prices are ridiculous and the taste is terrible. I feel like since this place is in such a touristy area, they feel like they don't have to try, since they have more customers that they'll never see again than local customers that they have to woo. If you're a tourist and you're reading this, I would tell you to avoid this place like the plague. It really is that bad.

It wasn't all that. I ordered a fried catfish PoBoy and it was okay I've had a lot better in the city. My friends ordered the fish platter and the Mardi Gras pasta and that looked delicious. The restaurant itself looks nice the service was better than nice whatever that word is.

We went here for dinner once we arrived to NOLA. We heard great things about this place and we wanted to check it out. We waited in line for an hour outside just to get in. The place was very busy they had a lot of large groups going in for reservations. While we waited in line the sidewalk was very narrow they were doing construction on that street and it was hard for people to get through walking by both ways with all of us standing in line. Once we got seated our server took care of us. Jacyen was very pleasant and nice. Our food was good. We had duck with crab and crawfish topping on top. For an app we had grilled alligator bites and raw oysters. They ran out of the cooked oysters. I had a strawberry basil margarita which was good. I had grilled catfish. The entrees came with jambalaya and collard greens which were both flavorful. Even though the wait was long the food was worth it.
spent $12 on a stale chocolate muffin and a prepacked freezer burned ice cream. First time having good i haven't liked in nola so not too bad i guess?
To be able to order pretty good crab cakes with fresh crawfish, barbecued shrimp and tasty special broiled oysters at 12:30 AM I easily give it five stars. Need to change the Sirius station though!
I've been to New Orleans and had seafood at the Oceana Grill a few times and it never disappoints. There's always a lline out front but it seems to move quickly. The food is always delicious.
This was a chill spot food was good I fell in love with the drinks and the staff was amazing
BBQ Shrimp. You have to get it. Also great bartenders!!!! If I could bathe in the sauce they use in this dish I would
Came late night on a weekday so there was no line. Everything we ordered tasted good. I dont recall anything needed improvement.
Execellent service, prices, and experience. Quite authentic (had the taste of New Orleans Dish). Super smoky, quite amazing. Great experience!!
The food here is delicious. You can't go wrong with their menu. Catfish La Fouche is a favorite of mine. Atmosphere is also great!

Me and my fiancé just stumbled upon this place with scrolling on bourbon st, and I don't think we could have settled for a better place !!! Josh the bartender was incredible! So accommodating and friendly and funny! He gave us a free mug since we were in our honeymoon and a bomb Bloody Mary! The food was OUT OF THIS WORLD! The taste of New Orleans gave us a variety of the local favs. The decor was beautiful and clean. Staff was very calm and friendly. Highly recommend!

The drinks are sooooo poorly made. I feel like every other place in this neighborhood at least got THAT done. Service was nice and easy to get in . But wouldn't recommend if you want some authentic yummy food . Sorry ://

Food was pretty good, not the best I've had but good for the price! I didn't like the overall atmosphere very much, kinda an interesting dynamic. Overall, I would go there again if someone suggested it but it wouldn't be my first choice.
Great food served late!  We are here twice, both times after 12MN!  Great service too!  Very friendly and helpful staff.  Food is reasonably priced

Was in New Orleans for a conference and ended up coming here on accident. Let me tell you ithe best chicken fettuccine Alfredo I have EVER had. I am back home in California trying to figure out a way to get back to that pasta! Mary was our waitress and she was very personable and attentive.  She made great recommendations and the food came out quickly. Will definitely return.
Food was on point and Ray was super helpful, 10/10 would come back again, especially great after partying late

This will now be the first place I will come to eat at!!! The food was amazing but the absolute best part of my visit was the server named Fiona!!! Not only was she on top of all my needs and questions but her recommendations of the different items on the menu was OUTSTANDING!! She checked on us and made sure that we were happy!! I hope to see her the next time I visit!!! Great job Fiona!!! You are indeed a fabulous server!!!! Keep up the magnificent work.
I came here for my birthday and it was absolutely amazing. The food was great and our waiter Troy was very friendly. I would go again whenever I'm in town.

If anyone has ever wondered why obesity is such a problem in America, then this restaurant may answer it all. Come hungry with loose fitting clothes because the food is worth gaining weight for!

Breakfast is served until 1 pm on weekdays - WHAT A BLESSING for those of us who want to sleep in. Our group of 4 ordered the pancakes, seafood omelette, country breakfast, and the lost bread (aka a special version of French toast). My oh my everything was delicious, particularly the French toast and the complimentary hash brown, which has a nice spicy kick! Unlike most breakfast/brunch restaurants, where you have to choose between savory and sweet options, Oceana allows you to do both! Both the French toast entree and the pancake entree came with a complimentary side of bacon or sausage. We were completely stuffed and amazed at how great of a deal it was for the quantity of food.

And the service was extremely friendly and attentive. I couldn't have asked for a better way to start my morning!
The staff is friendly and the service is good. The food is just ok nothing special.

The seafood is good and so is the lobster tail but that's where it stops. (Fries are decent). The food is pretty bland tasting (esp the expensive burger, McDonalds tastes better). This place is clearly a tourist trap in NOLA. The final straw was the $9 Pecan Pie slice that was jokingly tiny(picture attached with fork for size reference) and the pie didn't even taste good. Huge ripoff.

First time in NOLA and we chose this place because of the great reviews! Victoria was our sweet server and Devon surprised us with delicious pickled green beans to try. They usually go in the specialty Bloody Mary.
We had jambalaya and Praline DuckPraline Duck, both are so delicious.  We went little earlier 5-6pm got a seat  quick but the place was packed when we left.

The blue crab ratatouille (St. Francis) crepe was the singular greatest thing I have ever tasted in my life. Not much more needs to be said.

Some of the sides later on that evening had clumpy rice, but thats all down to preference.
Great service! The food was delicious and fresh! I would definitely be back!!! Yummmmmmmm

Very good food , the duck is lovely and price very reasonable .
Can not beat the price . The place are a little dinghy, but I came for the food

If I could give NEGATIVE stars I would. WORST SERVICE IVE EVER EXPERIENCED!!!!!!!!!!!!! They had 8 tables available and 15+ people waiting. They had ZERO idea what was going on. I STRONGLY RECOMMEND NOT TO GO THERE!!!!!!!!!!!!! 100's of other restaurants in this city. Please don't go there!!!!!

First thing when I walked in the establishment smelled kinda like a college bar...we were debating on leaving bc of that but we were hungry so we stayed. We got the taste of New Orleans and fried oyster platter. The fried oyster platter was really good but the coleslaw was not good and the taste of New Orleans came w creole jambalaya, beans and rice, and crawfish etouffee. Didn't like the etouffee that much..seemed like it lacked flavor and the sausage in the beans and rice was dry..so food was ok but service was good
It was okay! Not a big fan of oysters. Here EVERYTHING is oyster. I ordered a half poboy sandwich with a cup of gumbo. Really not a fan of gumbo either. My bill was only $14 it was worth it

This place is amazing. Even though the line from outside looked long, the wait was maybe 5 minutes for about 8 people in front of us. The food was amazing. I recommend the crab cakes, oysters, or the alligator sausage. Great service. Oh, the bread pudding was amazing as well. Overall, highly recommended!

We ordered online and picked it up to go. It was definitely a hole in the wall construction on street made it a hassle to get to the front door but the food was good. I've had better but not complaining

apps
crab cakes - amazing. 
alligator sausage first time I tried it and I was a huge fan!!!

entree 
blackened catfish po boy - best sandwich fish sandwich i tried EVER hands down. The sauce that was on it was soooo good!

we had a party of 18 so the service was slightly show (should of had 2 servers instead of 1 who also had other tables), but when we arrived our party had went from 24-18 and they accommodated us right away. 

I would def recommend trying this place esp if your visiting NOLA and would like to try some good local food.
The Cajun Fries are outstanding! Staff was great and the atmosphere was even better. Definitely will be returning when in New Orleans again.

Our one stop for food in the French Quarter and it did not disappoint. 

On the sign alone - the promise of seafood - we decided to give this place a shot for lunch. I don't think we could've done better. For an appetizer we had their "famous" cooked oysters covered in a delicious sauce I can't even pretend to know how to spell.  What I do know was we loved it - the oysters, though small, tasted very good. And the bread that came with it allowed me to dip it in the excess sauce to mop it all up - a big plus. 

For the actual lunch my wife had their fried oyster po boy while I have the grilled gator sausage po boy. Both arrived to the table super hot and ready. 

The service was awesome as well.  Our server, Jaime (if I recall correctly) was very friendly and accommodating to our questions. She did a great job. 

We loved the place so much were thinking of a return trip (maybe very soon).
After eating here, we were shocked by the reviews. There is so much great food in the city, we were disappointed to have spent a meal here.

Food is great. Meal was not as I ordered but regardless the food was great! It was delivered quickly as well so I was thankful for that. Open during COVID so that's a plus because there's not much open around it

Dinner was good, but breakfast not at all. One person with us never got her food at all. The food was hot but very subpar. The service at breakfast was horrible and the manager act like he could care less.

Enjoyed  the courtyard for dining. It's very relaxing and the tables are spread out nicely. The staff wears masks. The food was good and prices were fair. We had the shrimp po boy and catfish po boy. They have a decent amount of choices for dessert.

Just ok. We chose this because it was open and reviews looked good. Ordered grilled oysters which had so much cheese you couldn't find the oyster. I had the Nola sampler. Red beans were good. Nothing was hot. Sad wine list.

This last visit was such a disappointment. I remember Oceana Grill always being a MUST whenever I visit NOLA. This trip was no different. I assured my friends we had to stop here and no matter the wait line....the food would be worth it! Sadly this wasn't the case.

The service was amazing as usual. Friendly and very efficient staff. The issue was the food! New Orleans is known for amazing food and Oceana Grill is one of the staples....or so I thought. The oysters were very basic. Basic in flavor and freshness. The famous crab cakes were cold and tasted like cheap seafood stuffing. Even the salad was just something there. Since the apps were a failure we decided to stop while we were ahead and not order anything else. I'm sure this was the BEST decision. I used to love this place...I'm not quite sure what's happening with the quality of food. Not even sure if I'll return on my next visit. Too many other options available. This was a disappointment I didn't see coming. How unfortunate!

Food is DELICIOUS and customer service is great as well. Went for dinner and there was a line out the door. They try and get you in ASAP, but it's all dependent on the guests as the space is smaller. 

After dining here I absolutely understand why people are okay waiting in line. Anything you get on the menu will not disappoint. We had the alligator bites (1/2 grilled and 1/2 fried) and both were so flavorful. I ended up going with the Mardi gras pasta and it was so rich and creamy. Highly recommend this place

Great place! Great food and even better service! Our waitress, Bree was excellent! We just got off a 7-day carnival cruise through the Caribbean but couldn't leave NOLA without a proper food fix. Heard about this place from a local..ttly worth it! We ordered 3 entrees and 3 apps for 4 adults to share  All were excellent! Seafood platter, gumbo (x2), oysters, jambalaya, and the Taste of New Orleans.  lovely patio seating with great jazz playing in the background. The bill was $86 and we are all more than full and satisfied.  Would recommend this place to all.

Great food avg size food portions.  If you are not from Louisiana you will enjoy this food and it will be the best thing you ever tasted.  If you from Louisiana you will be satisfied and you won't be mad.  Food isn't too expensive which is a good thing.  About $20 bucks a meal comes out quick and fast.  Not very large but can accommodate groups of 8 from what I have seen. Good place for out of staters to eat and enjoy.

Came in and got a table with some friends. Went out to smoke only to be denied access to my table after trying to return. Mask laws are useless, randomly enforced  and prohibitive to business like this. Oh well, their loss. Guess I'll go down to the next place that lets me in and serves me.

My friends and I decided to try this restaurant after arriving NOLA and checking into our hotel in the French Quarter. We arrived at about 3 pm and the restaurant wasn't too busy, the staff were super friendly and set up a table for us on the second floor. Our waitress was friendly and we received our waters right away before the waitress even took our drink orders. I started with the crab cakes as appetizer (I can never say no to crab cakes) and ordered the Fried Seafood Platter as my entree. The crab cakes were flavorful, had a nice crunch on the outside and soft on the inside. Fried seafood platter comes with fried seasoned oysters, shrimp and catfish. For $5 extra I added fried crawfish tails as well. It was definitely everything I had missed about New Orleans and sure hit the spot! Highly recommend.
It is an amazing spot to try cajun food and the hurricane drinks are also good! The line was long but it moved pretty quick. Will definitely be back!
Great food & great service. Errol was the dude! He sold me on my stuffed salmon entree. Such a great choice as it was very tasty.

Oceana Grill is so cute! We had been traveling for hours and were looking for some good authentic New Orleans food! The staff was very friendly and accommodating of our two pups. Especially our waitress Mary! Their patio seating area is so lovely, with the fountains and the really cool wall art! We are living in very tough times so it was really nice to have a delicious and peaceful lunch with my mom and doggies:))

First meal in New Orleans and it was a grand slam.. my daughter had the fried shrimp which was so good her brother ate half of it.. I had crab cake pasta which was a crab cake over fettuccine Alfredo and my hubs had a trio with jambalaya, red beans and rice and some other dish. Amazing. Would totally stop there again before we go home!

Road in front of restaurant is currently under construction so it's a little tricky to find. But once we were inside we were seated right away, on a Monday afternoon. The service was the only good thing , and food came out right away. The issue was the food, the oysters raw on half shell were room temperature warm, and just off. We were not able to finish them, and the manager was not happy to talk with us about it. We also got the taste of New Orleans which was decent but overpriced for what you get, the Po-boys and catfish platters were much better. Overall we will not be coming back.

I was really excited about this place when visiting New Orleans this past weekend. This place was highly recommend by a friend of mine and I wanted to give it a try. 

The hostess was rude (know the name if asked, just cant spell it correctly). Lack of eye contact, extremely monotone and unfriendly. extremely turned off. The wait for two people was ridiculously stupid especially watching numerous large parties go ahead of us. 

Eventually we are seated but before we even offered waters... we saw a very large roach walking around the restaurant. If you see one roach, there's bound to be others. ( wasn't trying to stay and find out) Other guest who were already eating noticed the roach as well. Completely disgusted we decided to move on to another restaurant. As we were leaving, we were approved by the manager; such an awkward experience we left her with more questions than answers and scurried out.  

Granted, there was construction going on around the corner, so that could be the cause of the roach but still not an excuse in my book.

Atmosphere: 4/5
--Got here on a less busy day (5 PM on a Monday) so it wasn't crowded. Three floors of good old New Orleans setting. 
Food: 4/5 
--Oysters were very good (8.5/10). Everything else about a 7/10 in terms of taste. 
Price: 3.5/5 
-- A bit pricey but makes sense since it is on bourbon st.  Oysters ($12) for 6. Gumbo small ($5). Taste of New Orleans ($16)
Service: 5/5
--Waitress was very friendly

You pretty much get what you expect. The prices here are high but that's typical for restaurants within the area (french quarter and bourbon). If you want a taste of New Orleans, there's an option for that. I wish the gumbo was included but we had to order it as a separate side. Nothing amazing except for the chargrilled oysters but the sauce definitely makes it. The oysters were a bit smaller than acme's but I would say the taste was a little better. Everything else was what you expect it would taste like. Jambalaya had a very strong tomato taste to it which I enjoyed but was surprised. Gumbo had a good amount of small shrimp, not too strong as other places might have it. The etouffee had a decent amount of vegetables and crawfish. Sausage was good. The red beans were nothing special.
The steak was amazing! It was my first time having alligator and once u get over it. It taste just like chicken. The spinach ravioli was wonderful. Great service.

Hard to rate this place through stars honestly. Okay so for a place called oceana grill it did not live up to its name. Service was amazing and environment was pretty cool right in the middle of bourbon street but food was just okay. I got the redFish with a sauce. The sauce was sooooo good, it was like a mushroomy-crawfishy cheese sauce but the fish while it was good and fresh, tasted like it had no salt what so ever. The sides were just okay. My fiancé got the seafood platter that came with fried oysters, fish, and shrimp and once again everything needed salt at the very least! The fish and the shrimp looked and tasted very fresh but the oysters had a soggy texture and were much darker in color as if they had fried them two hours before and reheated it. The cheesecake was very good and I think it said its made daily  in house.

Both Yelp and the hotel recommended Oceana. I was quickly greeted and seated at a bar table (they are social distancing so tables are set next to the bar and there are just two at the bar). The bar tender Christopher was also my server. He was very attentive and acted quickly when my meal wasn't hot.  I had a very tasty ( good spice) Bloody Mary and the alligator sausage for an appetizer.  I would usually get alligator but a friend recommended it, so I tried it and was delightfully pleased ( best part of my meal). I also had the Taste of New Orleans and should have had the special instead. After being quickly replaced because the first round wasn't hot, the next plate was hot.  The jambalaya was dry and the red beans and rice were just okay, nothing special.  The crawfish etoufee was yummy though.  I wanted dessert, but neither of the items that I wanted were immediately recommended by staff.  They did make me a delightful to go night cap of coffee and Sambuca. The service by the staff deserves 5 stars, my entree just wasn't as delicious as I'd like.

Sorry this post is from our trip pre-Covid, in the heart of Bourbon area! Definitely happening here.  Always a wait but considering the line it went pretty well. Especially when they have Daiquiris next door to help with the wait!!! But they do have a bar area in the entrance. Multi-level restaurant (which can be tricky for kids and adults with bad knees).  Food was great and decently priced considering area. My server was awesome and made great recommendations.  She had a friendly face and was busy but always attentive to our table.  So much variety and yummy options.  Great place to get the Bourbon feel and leave with happy feelings!

I've been coming to New Orleans for years and sad that I didn't find this place sooner! This place is a hidden gem off Bourbon Street! I came because a friend recommended this place to me and it did not disappoint! When we walked up there was a line outside that moved fairly quickly. We waited for about 30 minutes without a reservation on a Tuesday. The entrance is off a side street that has construction so if I wasn't looking for it I would have missed it. 

Our waitress Danlynn (spelling?) was awesome! She gave us some great suggestions and took great care of us. Food was beyond amazing! The best oysters I've had (better than Acme ). The guy working the bar that night was also really nice and he made very good drinks!! Strong and tasty! They made sure we were able to get our last few drinks in before the bar had to shut down at 11pm (Covid ). This spot is definitely going on my must haves every time I come back to NOLA.
Hands down the best oysters we had while we were in town. The chargrilled are normally something I'm not a fan of but the people here won me over and the raw were super cold and delish.

Be prepared for a long wait in line to get in and once you're seated...be prepared to wait a great deal longer. Our server took our soup order and returned thirty minutes later. He never checked on us and once another thirty minutes passed and we were finally served our entrees he didn't return again until it was time for the check. He just didn't give a damn. I imagine a full restaurant with tourists ready to buy anything that's fished out will do that. I'll never eat here again.

Hubby and I had dinner at Oceana Grill. The food was delicious. We had Oyster Rockefeller and they were so good!
We ordered a Taste Of New Orleans and let me tell you, yummmm. A Must try! We also had crawfish etouffe, wow so delicious. We had passion fruit margarita and it was so good. Definitely o and eat at Oceana, you won't regret it!

Omg the crab cakes the crab cakes the crab cakes!!! They're so good my boyfriend and I haven't stopped talking about them for weeks. 

The alligator bites were pretty good and the seafood platter was good, but nothing particularly special. 

Service was good!

First time and our first meal in Nola. We were starving and hot by the time we found this but waited bc of Yelp reviews and locals recommendations. The staff were so friendly and helpful answering all our questions about the menu and then when they brought out the food holy cow! We overate and didn't care bc it was so good! I had alligator for the first time, the best crab cake I've ever had (and I've had my share being from the east coast), all around very happy with our experience.

We went to multiple restaurants during our visit to New Orleans and this was by far the best one. They had patio seats and multiple levels to the restaurant if you want to avoid some of the traffic and noise. It is an easy walk from hotels in every direction and is right next to multiple tourist attractions. This location is perfect. On to the food. We tried to cover it all in our meal and the waitress was more than accommodating with our questions. We had the fried crab cakes which were amazingly crispy on the outside and soft and flavorful on the inside. The combination of sauce and spices was perfect. I personally got the fried shrimp plate which came with some jalapeño hush puppies and some fries. All were delicious and soo many shrimp I didn't even get to finish them. The watermelon margarita I had with my meal was so sweet and no bitterness at all! The other dish we had was the po-boy which also came packed to the brim with shrimp. The sauces and onions and everything complimented each other so well. This restaurant is a must on your visit through LA. A lot of servers in NOLA seem to have an attitude IMO but not at this place. Super friendly staffed greeted us and wished us well on the rest of our trip. They didn't continue to bu us throughout the meal and gave us plenty of time to enjoy ourselves despite the crazy traffic that was coming in.

Check in for 10% off your bill :-) 

Our Uber driver recommend this place, and he did not disappoint! 

We went on a Sunday night around 7:45 pm and there was a line outside. I'd say we waited for about 10-15 minutes before someone took us in. 

This place is huge. I couldn't even remember which way to get out once we left lol We were seated by the bar, high top tables. I liked that there were actually tables at the bar instead of eating at the actual bar, facing the bartender. Our server/bartender was Christopher, and he was helpful and gave us great detail of the specials and entrees we had questions about. 

Food:
I finally decided on Barbecued Shrimp and my boyfriend had the Mardi Gras Pasta. Everything on the menu sounded so good. It was hard to narrow it down to these two. I honestly enjoyed both equally. They both had their own flavor and did not taste the same at all. Looking at my Barbecued Shrimp, you would think there's not much of it but it did fill me up. Although I took many bites of my bfs meal too lol There was enough shrimp in there and decent size. The Mash potato's soaked with the sauce was delicious. If it has butter and garlic, I'm sold. 

Barbecued Shrimp: $24
Tail-on Gulf shrimp sautéed in New Orleans-style lemon butter & pepper sauce. Served with garlic mashed potatoes

My bfs Mardi Gras Pasta was so good with a kick of spice. Lots of noodles and they did not skimp on the shrimp and crawfish tail! 

Mardi Gras Pasta: $24
Gulf shrimp, crawfish tails, bell peppers, & onions in a creamy Alfredo sauce.

My bahama mama drink was refreshing and well mixed. Loved the cute mason jar. Pretty big size. 

Everyone there is friendly. Every staff we passed as we were leaving would say thank you for coming or have a great night. I can't wait to come back here again :-)

This was the 1st sit down place we all ate at in New Orleans bc it was referred by a person in our group. This place did not disappoint at all! There was a nice outdoor back patio we ate & had drinks on. The waitress was just oh so friendly & personable! She probably thought we were crazy bc of all the food we ordered, that's how friends do when we go out to eat anywhere. We had the top of the line seafood platter, order of crabcakes, etouffee, gumbo, jambalaya, softshell crab, catfish, fried oysters, red beans & rice, hushpuppies, cajun alligator,and and order of those fantastic grilled oysters. Of course I order a drink Basil Margarita & it comes out frou frou like moi, bubbling smoke from the hot ice probably in it. By the way I have never tasted catfish so beautifully cooked to perfection that it melts in your mouth! It was out of site!!! #dynamite! Soooooo happy we stopped here everytime I'm in NOLA I'm stopping here and/or telling cats they must stop there at least once on their  visit to Louisiana!!!

Decided to visit based on previous Yelp reviews and was not disappointed. Be sure to follow GPS especially if you are not familiar with the French Quarter. Parking can be tricky so keep in mind you may have to walk once you find the sacred parking spot.

Pros: from the second you walk in you are very promptly greeted with the hospitality that you would expect. We opted to sit in the courtyard outside since the weather was less humid and sunny. We are glad we did. We were lucky enough to get an amazing server who was ever ready and prompt whenever we wanted or didn't even know we wanted something. The charbroiled oysters with Creole sauce were beyond what we expected and in hindsight should have ordered a full dozen. The seafood gumbo was outstanding and in a very large bowl with ample French bread and rice. It could be a meal in of itself. We selected to share the Blackened Redfish topped with a crab cake shrimp and a creole sauce. Everything was fantastic and delivered with utmost care and consideration. The manager even stopped by at one point to check on us and we were impressed that she was clearing tables as she did. We loved the tag team service to deliver food that came from the kitchen. What a way to help each other out.

The just ok- not a lot to say that was just okay but one thing that stood out was the shrimp on top of the Blackened Redfish. It was void of any seasoning or grill marks and did not seem to be Gulf Shrimp. It would have been even more outstanding on the fish had it been seasoned correctly and kissed the grill a few times before being added to the top of an outstanding dish.

The service was outstanding and the covid handling was superb.

Pasta looked and smelled amazing. I ordered a meal with no onions ( I'm allergic). And they definitely put tiny onions in the dish. The server was very polite and he replaced my order within 5-10 minutes. I would give them a higher rating but an allergy mistake can be life treatening
Top Five places i have every ate . Have traveled the world this place is hands down good. Must try the alligator and the bread pudding holy Jesus ... do t miss the bread pudding
We enjoyed our visit so much we made a reservation for Saturday. Great food and service

Great service from Bridget T. The food was delicious, my wife and I ate there 2 days in a row. We will definitely be back. Everyone was so friendly and Bridget remembered us from our first visit. I highly recommend Oceana Grill for breakfast lunch and dinner.

I chose Oceana blindly while walking around near my hotel after my arrival and had a pleasant late lunch / early dinner. The crab cakes are quite good, and the redfish entree was very nicely prepared and presented. The service was slow, especially given that there were not many patrons dining while I was there, but I was not in a hurry, so it was fine. The interior is somewhat dimly lit and not very imaginative, but the food is the main thing. I've made a note to return on a future visit to New Orleans.
Good.  The shrimp po boy the oyster po boy was a spicy supporting cast member.  The fries did the job.  The hurricane was good.

Stopped here for dinner on my first night in NOLA, and there was a line. When i saw the line i knew this place had to be good. And even though there was a line, the wait was less than 20 min. On the outside it looked small, but in reality its very spacious on the inside. 

For the appetizer we got oysters on the half shell which were very fresh tasting and gator bites which were perfectly seasoned. For the entree i was able to enjoy the Red Fish Oceana. Such a hearty serving with a great crawfish sauce that they put on the top of the fish. My dad got the Taste of NOLA which gave you a sample of everything that NOLA is known for. Both dishes were full of flavor and came out piping hot! For dessert i enjoyed the creme brulee which had the perfect sweetness.

I definitely recommend this as a place to stop if you are visiting NOLA. Service was quick and awesome.

We stopped here because my friend saw a dish she had been wanting to try the last couple times she'd been in town. We sat in the enclosed/open air courtyard and it was very nice. Our waitress was Kimmy and she was great. She had no problem getting a new drink when the first was made with the wrong alcohol, and rushed my steak back as soon as she saw how under cooked it was. 
Other than those two issues everything was really good. My friend had her special dish, a red fish in a cream sauce, and thoroughly enjoyed it. 
Our Uber driver on the way to the airport was giving us a list of restaurants he recommends and this one kept coming up to the top of his list. I'll be back next time I'm walking down Bourbon Street and need a drink or some food.
Ordered my first hurricane there. First food shop in New Orleans. Ordered the Taste of New Orleans and their famous Oysters. The oysters were delicious!!!!

Got recommended by a local so I thought I'd give it a try. First of all, the restaurant was very clean and spacious, which made me feel comfortable dining in during this crisis. Second, service was fast and stellar. Third, foods were AMAZING. Oh em gee, they literally had the most unique and one of a kind dishes. We had Alligator sausage, Oyster Rockefeller, Praline Duck and Blackened Quail - ALL MUST HAVES *chef kiss* 
My favorites are the Oyster Rockefeller and Praline Duck. The baked cheese with garlic smoking hot on the oysters plus the crispy skin honey-coated duck are just to die for. 
We finished our meals with banana foster ice cream cake. Super good! But if you're not a sweet tooth, you might want to consider something else.
Kennisha was a great server at the Oceana Grill on Conti Street. Even though they were under COVID restrictions, the service was fast with a 10-minute wait, and the food was plentiful and great!
We had a wonderful time here at Oceana. The food and service was great. The service from Mary was the best she went above and  beyond to make our experiences great.

Never eat here. That is what I learned this past weekend. 

We held a large group dinner (~120 ppl) at this restaurant. When we arrived, there were problems with what they had promised for our group. At the end of dinner, we tried to adjust the gratuity to reflect the unhappiness with the service (ie, not accomodating our request for vegetarian options, not letting us into the room till half an hour after our reservation etc). However, the owner called the cops, saying we were not paying our bill!!!!! We tried earnestly and politely to hand over a credit card on multiple occasions; we simply wanted to adjust gratuity. The owner/manager refused and repeatedly yelled and threatened us all with arrest. The cops showed up and eventually sorted things out. I have never seen such ridiculous behavior. It was the most bizzarre, distasteful, disgusting way to treat customers I have ever experienced.    

Frankly, I'm shocked that they are even in business. I recommend that you stay away from this restaurant. Absolutely appalling treatment of people.

We had a very nice lunch at Oceana located right in the heart of the French Quarter. We ordered the Louisiana crabmeat cakes, gator tail bites (1/2 fried, 1/2 blackened), seafood gumbo, and the fried crawfish tails. It was our first time having gator and it was not bad. It was like eating chicken that is more lean and stringy. We definitely liked fried better and the fried crawfish tails were tasty as well. The crab cakes were our favorite, especially the crawfish mushroom cream sauce. Oceana is touristy, but the food was good and the service was excellent.

Yummy Yummy Yummy to my Tummy!!! Everything was more than delicious. I had the duck and it came with the most tasty jambalaya and greens I've had a any restaurant. And the BREAD PUDDING was the ABSOLUTE BEST! I food was so good I started eating and forgot to take any pictures. ‍
I will say that Oceana is my new favorite New Orleans restaurant.

This place is amazing. The atmosphere and our waitress, Whitney, was top notch! Visiting New Orleans for the first time with some friends. Had the Cajun Bloody Mary and the Seafood Omelette! Both were spicy enough and portions were perfect! Would definitely suggest for anyone coming to Bourbon Street
Had their famous oysters and they didn't disappoint. They are consistently amazing! Also had a shrimp poboy and it was great. Service is ok but food was great.
Ashley was a lovely server her recommendations were on point I truly enjoyed my meal I had the black redfish
Food was great! Had the Seafood gumbo and fried shrimp poboy. Wow! We sat outside with our dog and we're taken care of by Meagan and she was fantastic! So friendly and attentive.

BLACKENED ALLIGATOR!! This was my first meal in New Orleans, and my family and I were amazed.  Blackened alligator was delicious, nothing that we expected.  This was a last minute decision to come here too since we arrived late and it was the only one open.  

+ opens late
+ blackened alligator 

I wanna come back.  Top 3 best things I ate in my New Orleans trip

We had to wait about 20 minutes outside and then another 10 inside I think, so they could probably be a little more organized with the seating situation. However the food was SO good. I got the special of the night which was a blackened redfish on top of a jalapeño cornbread stuffing, topped with sautéed shrimp and a crawfish mushroom cream sauce, and a side of greens. It was possibly the best seafood dish of my life! Well worth the wait! The service was fairly quick and efficient, and our food came out really quickly after ordering. Plus you're right off Bourbon street so you can go out and explore right after or even before.

It was good experience to try alot of southern dishes. My food wasnt hot hot, more luke warm. The best thing was the gator bites and the hurricane. The red fish needs more gravy but the crawfish on the gravy was delicious.

One of those place is New Orleans you ought to visit. Even though their menu has limited options, everything they serve is really good. Especially the Cajun fries and Oceana's Famous Oysters. Highly recommend the famous oysters and get a dozen of them because you are always gonna want more!
This a must stop for breakfast!! ABSOLUTELY THE BEST!! This is a place my family dines and partakes in adult beverages when we visit this beautiful city.

The portions were large! Had the shrimp creole etouffee & the lump crab cake dish. Both were well flavored and very tasty. I always appreciate a lumpy crab cake that isn't heavy on flour. I would definitely return!
We had oysters, cajun Jambalaya pasta (shrimp with alligator sausage) and the shrimp creole. All were very good esp my pasta dish. Would definitely reccomend this place.

This was my favorite meal in New Orleans, I thought the classics like the Gumbo, the Crawfish Etouffee and the Blackened Red Fish Tchoupitoulas special were spectacular. This dinner was our first dinner of our Nola trip and it was the one that left the most lasting impression. I also really liked the decor, it kinda had the look and feel of what New Orleans supposed to be. Also, if you check in on Yelp there is a 10% discount offer.

The food:

Red Fish Tchoupitoulas- Blackened Red Fish on top of a jalapeno crawfish cornbread dressing topped with sauteed shrimp in a garlic lemon butter sauce. Holy Moses was this delicious, this was a special and the flavor was amazing and I thought the jalapeno crawfish corn bread was absolute heaven. I thought the pairing of the blackened red fish to the jalapeno crawfish corn bread to the sauteed shrimp was an excellent pairing. As much as I loved this dish, the only criticism, I did find the Red Fish to be a smidge dry. This should absolutely be put on their regular menu. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=-N8xwsx-Sghxgoc_o7qGxg&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

Crawfish Etouffée- Southern Cajun stew with steamed rice. This was the best Crawfish Etouffée of the entire trip. The Etouffée had such a dept of flavor, the texture and taste of the crawfish were superb. Highly recommend.

Seafood Gumbo- The best gumbo I had on the entire trip, yet again such a depth of flavor. So much flavor packed into such a small bowl, everything in said bowl was so delicious. Highly recommend.

Taste of New Orleans- Creole jambalaya, Crawfish Etouffée, red beans and rice with smoked sausage. This dish was kinda the best of everything dish, but overall I thought it was just OK. I didn't really care for the Jambalaya, for me the dish was too wet and had too much of sweet tomato flavor, and to me, it was overpowering. Crawfish Etouffée was bomb, of course. The red beans and rice was good but to be honest, it didn't leave much of an impression. 

Oceana's Famous Oysters- Chargrilled over an open flame, smothered with garlic and cream herb cajun sauce, finished with a fresh blend of parmesan and romano cheeses. Overall, I did like the chargrilled oysters but I thought they came off very heavy and greasy, I feel like the most I would be able to eat is 2, maybe 3 tops when I can normally finish a dozen oysters on the half shell. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=W5mVHZf8SlboM7d1q8NSKA&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

Fresh Oysters On Half Shell- I thought the oysters on the half shell were just OK, I didn't think they had that much flavor. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=uHH5KZyKqWYdGwgOCfRuBw&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

Gator Tail Bites- Marinated white meat gator tail served fried or blackened served with remoulade sauce. I tried this just for the pure curiosity of it and I thought both versions were just OK. I thought it was kinda like chicken, just a more expensive version of chicken. For me, between the two versions, I did prefer the fried version more. https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=pTZCkSQgjhvMbP9dHiJKrQ&userid=Y_iTTjKvV5hLy-880SZzlA

The first night I went there, I got the Lousiana Crab Meat Cakes. One of the greatest meals I had. The crab cakes were so good and the greens were flavorful. Not too much sauce. The second time I went, I liked the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta although I wasn't wow'ed like I was with the crab cakes. It was still good and I would get it again.
The oysters though. Nothing good to say. Had no flavor whatsoever. All the oysters were still attached to the shell, and there was chunks of shell in most of them. It was so unimpressive and I wouldn't rather spent that money on another dish or a drink.

Casual French Quarter eatery putting themselves on the plate. Great service and everything from the crab cakes to the blackened redfish special and finishing with the bread pudding was solid and had flavors your mama would love. Good job to the manager and team.

Bigger than it looks - hardly any wait. Food was delicious and service was attentive and prompt. I loved the jambalaya - New Orleans platter was a favorite of my oldest. Good place to take the kids while you're in the Quarter.

We picked a great time for brunch at the tail end of a rainshower.  No line outside. The place has a great down-home vibe.  The staff was very polite.
My daughter had the Pain Perdu "lost Bread" (think homemade french toast).  The serving was very generous. We took home about half.
I had the Seafood omelet.  Crawfish, shrimp, mushrooms and so much cheese! Delicious!

Came with my friends for brunch. The restaurant has multiple floors. Great for large groups. We had people that ordered breakfast items and people that ordered lunch options. I got the taste of New Orleans and a side of soft shell crab. It was so good! I definitely recommend both items if you want a variety of flavors. The fries were amazing. My friends enjoyed the grill oysters. My friends that had the omelettes said they were okay.

What a find. Great food. Great experience with local cuisine. Corey was our server. Love the way he took care of us. You must try Oceana's Char Broiled Oysters.. The Blackened Redfish was at least 10 inches of heaven.
Don't miss the opportunity

Stopped in for dinner tonight and was not disappointed!  To start off with, I had a tropical storm.  The drink was delicious, and the little souvenir cup was cute.  The waiter suggested the alligator tail bites, which we ordered along with oysters Rockefeller to start with.  The alligator was tasty, but came to the table pretty cold.  The oysters also tasty, and came piping hot!

I had the special, blackened red fish on corn bread.  It was tasty.  My friend had the crab cakes, she said they were also tasty, though also not very hot. 

We topped the meal off with the bread pudding.  The Carmel sauce was rich and delicious, and seriously we should have shared, one is definitely enough for two.  I also suggest getting it À la mode.  

Over all, the food tasted great, the service was good, had all of the food been hot, I probably would have given it 5 stars.
This is one of the best Cajun meals I have had. Everything was super delicious! Great spices. Great service and reasonable prices!
Try the taste of New Orleans and have it covered in crayfish. Best upcharge ever. Loved every bite.
Best damned greens I've ever had.  The entire meal, service and drinks were perfect.  Friendly staff and seriously good food.  The oysters rockerfeller are stupidly good.  Awesome, awesome, awesome

We are here the first night we were in town. The place was amazing!! The staff seated us right away. All the covid restrictions were noted and in place as they should be. The wait staff was great! The food was amazing and the desserts were as well. We definitely recommend giving this spot a try! We will be back!

food was delicious! 10/10 crab cakes ! The Cajun fries were amazing ! Recommend the food , but the waiting to be seated and the waiting to get service was ridiculous! 30 min before we even ordered drinks but other than that the food is good

Went here on 2 separate occasions in August omg! I'm just now writing the review because I thought about how good those crab cakes were! 

On the first visit I had the crab cake meal with mashed potatoes and a seasonal veggie! 
On the second visit I had a watermelon margarita on the rocks, with fried and Blackened ALLIGATOR! (It was sooo good) and crab cake Alfredo.
Good food and service - would suggest you let patrons know about the stairs in case there are mobility impaired people in their group.
Food was great. A lil salty but I assume its the style of food. Beer was cold and meal was filling. Great location right off the strip.

We stopped in for lunch on New Years day before the Sugar Bowl.  Walked in at 11 without a wait.  Oysters for appetizers were spot on.  Cole was a great waiter and attentive despite the rush. House Special was awesome!  Would go again and recommend

The Lyft driver recomended this place. After having drinks and food here, I am pretty sure you don't come here for the drinks, you come for the food. The dinner special was this crab cakes and shrimps on top of crawfish pilaf that so good we almost ordered another plate. Instead we got a delicious soft shell crab from the side menu. The breading was light and not crunchy or greasy (perfect to me) and the remoulade that came witg it was the perfect spice level. The $15 double Hurricane was ok but we will get a street Hurricane later for like a dollar or something.

I did the research, I wanted to try gumbo while in town and I wanted to try the best. And that is how I ended up at Oceana Grill!
It starts off great wandering the French Quarter to get there! The restaurant has an inside and an outside patio. It was a beatific day, so I picked the patio. Make sure to look around the place is so cool full of interesting decoration & paintings. 
I came here for the Seafood gumbo - $5.50 a cup, $9.50 a bowl. I'm typically not a soup person, but I knew I had to try gumbo while in town. This is a stew and it's thickened with rice, okra & veggies. The flavored are so out of this world amazing. It had a hint of spice but not overly spicy, hello Cajun creole influences! The seafood tasted so fresh! 
I was so happy OG introduced me to the amazing world of gumbo! Excellent way to start my NOLA vacation!
To note, I came here twice while in town. Yes, it was that good!

Come out and see Marvin at the Oceana! The staff is very courteous and the food surpassed all expectations. Marvin recommended the Redfish Ponchartrain and it did not disappoint. I would also recommend the swamp tea as this beverage is very tasty.

​Was in New Orleans visiting from Dallas and traveled with friends for Southern Decadence. After a long evening clubbing we woke up the next day very hungry. After a quick swipe on Yelp! and seeing how the restaurants received so many positive reviews, it was very telling that would be an ideal option for where we want to eat. 


Upon arrival, there was a little bit of a wait but the hostess got my name and said when the whole group (10 of us) are present, we'd be seated. One of my buddy and I hung out at the bar and enjoyed glasses of Mimosas while we wait. Eventually, everyone showed and as promised, we were seated.  


Just be advised there are two stories and the upper deck is where you want to be. Downstairs seemed a bit cramped for my taste. Our server was awesome and did agreat job taking care of our large party, she even offered us separate checks making it more convenient for everyone. 

​Price wise, plates average around $10 to $17 and the menu had all my favorites including Fried Oysters which is a must have while in New Orleans.  


Overall, a cute place with great service and not far from clubs and hotels especially if you are staying in the French Quarter. Highly recommend!

The restaurant is humongous inside so even if there is a line outside you won't have to wait long. Even if you do, it is worth the wait. The portions are HUGE and well priced.
