The waitstaff is always happy and willing to help or explain any menu items that you don't understand. You will leave full and happy every time. The cocktails are also a pretty good deal - reasonably priced and they don't skimp on the alcohol. I love the lemon drop and the hurricane. Tropical storm is also sweet and a different option!

As far as food, the fried fish platters are so big and fresh that you cannot go wrong. The seafood is notably fresh tasting and the breading is light and flavorful without overpowering the taste of the fish. I love the spicy jalapeño hush puppies that come with the entrees! We have tried the catfish, oyster, shrimp and combo plates.  My mother has ordered the seafood Alfredo and really enjoyed it. My favorite is the crab cake dinner. The crab cakes are huge and filled with fresh crab with little filler such as bread crumbs. The seasonings are spot on. As if they aren't flavorful enough on their own, the cakes are covered with a creamy shrimp and mushroom sauce which is out of this world. Even the greens that come with the dish are fantastic. I wish I could eat this dish all day. For appetizers, try the calamari or the bbq shrimp!

If you like Southern Cuisine and Seafood, this is the place to go. I just wish they have one amazing vegan dish but all they have is a vegetarian pasta with very small amount of veggies loaded with unhealthy pasta which is not very good at all. They need to at least improve the veggie pasta and actually put more veggies in it.

Stopped by for lunch earlier around 2pm and it was fairly empty. Got seated in about 5 minutes and proceeded to look through our menu. Everything sounded really good but we ended up ordering a meal and a gumbo to share. 

1. Fried seafood platter (17.50$) - fried oysters, catfish, shrimp, jalapeño hush puppies, coleslaw, and comes with cocktail and tarter sauce. I mean, it's fried food, not much explaining to do but loved the catfish! Fries were also pretty good. 

2. Gumbo (9.50$)- ordered the bowl instead of cup because cup sounded like so little (6oz), both our first times having gumbo so it was an interesting experience. Soup with shrimp, rice and bread. It wasn't bad, but nothing to fan about. 

I've read through a lot of the reviews and it's a mixture of feelings but I personally feel the food isn't like amazing (or it's probably cuhs we got the fried stuff, but it was a recommended dish), but it wasn't anywhere near bad. The service was definitely up to par. Our server laquisha (apologize for the spelling), and she was super sweet. Took care of us from beginning to end! 

Also make sure to check in to yelp for 10% off!! :)

Fun atmosphere with lots of seating!
Staff was friendly!
The gator bites were delicious!
Shrimp were very flavorful.
Left feeling full and satisfied!

The. Food. Is. Good. 
I wasn't expecting much from this restaurant and was very pleasantly surprised. The food is flavorful, the waitstaff is pleasant, attentive, and prompt.. and the atmosphere is simple, but functional. 
Great for large, private, groups as well. You won't be disappointed.

Very quickly seated in this wonderful restaurant. I had a bad experience with creole food and I thought it was not tasty until I came here to give it a second try. Quick service very pleasant waitress named Jocelyn. And of course needless to say loved the Creole food. The inside ambience is quite surprisingly beautiful because it doesn't seem as big from outside but it opens up and it has a beautiful courtyard.

Great food. Great service. Right in French quarters.

There's always a long queue waiting to be seated at Ocean Grill, but it goes by fast. We went there two days in a row for the delicious food. 
There was nothing that we ordered we didn't enjoy. 

Our server, Jessica, is a superstar. She made our visit 10x better. If you're ever there, ask for her!

Don't forget to try their pecan pie, I'll keep craving it for the rest of my life.

It was very good, great food and great atmosphere. We got the golden ticket and got a free drink. It was very exciting. Shoutout to our server, Errol who was the best. Overall a great new orleans experience!!

We were in NOLA and looking for a place that has good seafood as well as a few American dishes since my dad doesn't like seafood and we found the right place! The crab cakes were amazing as well as the taste sampler that has a few different creole type items to try that was perfect. My dad had a craving for garlic fries which were not on the menu and the waiter was kind enough to ask the chef and he personally made some which were amazing and he even came out to check if we liked them. 
The restaurant is located right in the quarter so you are in the mix of things which is nice as well

We had the best time here. Sierra was our waitress and she was the bomb.com. She gave recommendations and boy was she on point. We had the crab cakes(amazing), fried shrimp and turnip greens(vegan friendly) with mash potatoes. Everything was delicious. Will definitely be coming back to visit again. THANKS SIERRA!!!!!

I came here for my birthday dinner yesterday and had an INTERESTING experience. While waiting on our meals to come, a huge water roach flew onto our table. My friend assured me it was just a "New Orleans" thing, but it definitely turned me off. We moved to a different table after the manager squashed the bug with his shoe. The shrimp fettuccine alfredo was 5/10.

OMG! Where do I begin our waitress Angela was great, hospitality was great the food was delicious. I ordered crawfish beignet and the Cajun breakfast that included alligator Sausage, I must say I was not disappointed I was really surprised how good the alligator was. If you want good southern style food this is the place
I had the sampler, it was about as good as Zatarains I've made myself from a box on my stove. There are much better places to eat vomiting distance from Bourbon Street.

The food here was amazing my BF and I had the Cajun fries and the bread pudding as our apps d dessert which suggested by our amazing server kennisha. Fir the main I had Cajun pasta and my bf had the blackened duck( OMG SO DELICIOUS!!).

When I'm on vacation, I will Yelp restaurants so that we don't get disappointed on our meal. Yelp did this justice!  The wait and line was long and took about an hour 20 minutes to get in but it was worth it!  Jacelyn was our server and she was fantastic!!! So friendly and always around if we needed anything. We started eating and then realized I hadn't taken pictures  so some are not original as they came out of the kitchen. This was truly New Orleans cuisine we were craving!!  It was worth the wait!!!

This restaurant is a 'Must see' when you're visiting the French Quarter.  We were out for a walk in the afternoon and popped in here for a quick bite.  This building is beautiful and the hostess and waitstaff are awesome.  

We sat on the 2nd floor and Dominique G was our server.  She brought us ice waters and menus then introduced their specials.  We ordered the BBQ Shrimp and 1/2 doz Oceana's Famous Oysters from the Appetizer section and a side of fried Crawfish.  The shrimp and crawfish came out first, the crawfish were tasty but damn, we were not ready for the deliciousness of those shrimp...!  Calling them bbq is dishonest to those shrimp.  They were delicious...!  

But then... the OYSTERS came out...

These char grilled ocean delicacies are covered with the most delicious garlic & cream herb Cajun sauce and dusted generously with Parmesan & Romano cheeses.  These oysters are the MUST HAVE if you are ever lucky enough to visit the FQ.  I only say 'lucky' because we were on a spur of the moment driving road trip from Pittsburgh, PA with very little research or planning.  

We finished all of the above and rather full but the thought of having to travel all the way back down here for more oysters forced me to order another 1/2 doz.  

These oysters were so good that when another table was sat next to us and they mentioned never being there before and ordering an appetizer- I had to lean in and suggest them.  They ordered them and fell in love, just like me.  

Thank you Oceana and staff for an awesome lunch.  And another thank you for helping me out by finding and selling me that particular 'shirt' I was interested in.  I love it...!  

Reppin Oceana up in the Burgh...!

The restaurant was extremely spacious (4 floors!) so the wait was nonexistent. In addition, the service was quick and timely. We were situated at a window table overlooking Bourbon Street.

Jambalaya pasta with alligator sausage was super, paired with a watermelon margarita -where could you go wrong? Great NOLA food that's conveniently located.

Late night food stop after craving seafood and hearing some rave reviews from others who've visited New Orleans...
It was quite empty at 11:30pm when we walked in, so we were seated promptly. 
We ordered alligator, half fried half blackened. Oceanas famous broiled oysters, I had the seafood combo fried with added crawfish.
The food was so good, excellent seasoning! The catfish from the seafood platter was exceptional! I couldn't stop!
My friend loved the charbroiled oysters so we ordered more.
The food is excellent here! Would definitely go back! Service was good as well.
New Orleans' best breakfast. Crawfish omelette rocks. Great service. Highly recommended.

RAT ON OUR TABLE. 
I'm torn. I'll start with the bad in case it's a deal breaker for readers. Halfway into our gumbo, a large (guessing 10 lb) rat dropped from the ceiling, bounced on our table and then ran off. It startled a few guests and waitstaff. The response seemed a little too much like this happens all the time. By comparison, in most restaurants if you even saw a rat the manager would come out, apologize and probably offer you a free dessert. In this one, the rat literally hit our table. Nobody came to wipe it off, no manager came and things just continued on like normal. There was actually more concerned because nobody knew where it went and the staff was a bit nervous. We weren't looking for them to comp the meal, but the way things progressed just seemed like it wasn't a big deal and they are used to it in the French Quarter. In their defense, we had a mouse problem in our hotel room, so rodents appear to be a challenge here. 

On the pro side, The food is great and our server was really sweet. I recommend the red beans and the gumbo. Oddly, I'd probably still go back. Obviously, it wasn't enough to make us storm out. But that may also be because we were a bit desensitized after living with mice for three days. I'd say the odds off this happening to you are low, but who knows. And don't expect anybody other than your server to care.

This review may be too late as I heard the place burned down..soooooo...just in case.

We had the gumbo, redfish, cajun fries with crawfish sauce, shrimp po boy. All good. Unfortunately, I forgot to note the best part ofbthe meal..and now I cant remember. Something I ordered may have been the best meal I had my entire vacation...but I just can't remember it. SMH.

This place was good.  Had the blackened red fish and wife had crab cakes.  I'm used to Maryland style cakes, lots of crab and broiled.  These were heavy on the bread crumbs and fried, not my cup of tea.  The fish was good, very authentic NO flavor.  But the highlight of the meal for me were the roasted oysters.  I am not an oyster guy but they came highly recommended and I was not disappointed.  Wish it came with more bread to soak up that delicious sauce.  Speaking of bread, the rum infused bread pudding for dessert was a bop.  The pastas also looked good, may try them next time I'm in town.

Quick service. Cordial wait staff. Fresh and tasty food. We order half blackened and half deep fried gator bites; both were very good.  Could not decide which was better. Oysters were very fresh. Crab cake held together nicely and were oh so delicious. Ambiance and decor on the darker side with a loud sports bar feel. Good for large parties and families. Do recommend and would definitely come again.

Yes yes yes! Great spot!!! I only had a light lunch of raw oysters and salad but both were on point. The oysters were plump, salty, and delicious! The bloody mary was OUT OF THIS WORLD! Our server was prompt, helpful, and courteous. I tasted the fried alligator bites we got for the table. They were tender and seasoned perfectly! The only thing I don't really like it that it's a bit small and you have to sit so close to the other guests.

Awesomeness, hot delicious food delivered to your door. Arrived earlier than expected, delivery person outstanding personality, and order was exactly what we ordered, no mistakes. Very yummy! Exceeded expectations! Highly recommend delivery or eating in the restaurant if you're out and about. We ate there last year and tried delivery this time. Food was tasty and excellent. Thank you, made our first nite memorable.

Good service, great food!
Party of 3, we waited about 20 minutes on the line. 
Once we were seated though, the server came to us and tended to us immediately. Being a Native new yorker while in NOLA, I experienced terrible and slow service but this place was great. (probably bc of its location- right on Bourbon) 
Anyways we each ordered something different: Jambalaya, Chicken Fettuccine and a Po Boy's sandwich and shared among each other. Everything was really good, came out pretty quickly. The crawfish was off season but still was good, they were just really tiny.

Great food! The manager April was amazing and so helpful. The service was phenomenal! We had the sweetest server, ask for Fiona! 
The Cajun fires are a must have and if you're a pasta lover, the Mardi Gras pasta was bomb!
Ashleigh was awesome!!! The bloody Mary's are fantastic!! I ordered the Mardi Gras pasta which was awesome

Went there on a date a few times but recent went during COVID. I made sure we made a reservation because there were so many people out of the restaurant or trying to get seated when it's limited space(social distancing rule), all staffing even cooks wore masks. So we were seated 6ft apart from everyone, our order was finally taken 45mins after we got there, food and drinks did take a minute to get to us. I do however remember telling my date(an out of towner) NOT to order the red beans, etouffee, or gumbo(they are all can based basic dishes that need some soul and flavor)Highly wouldn't recommend if it's your first time trying these dishes I'd pick another restaurant. The fish is good here, however very small portion size for price, I've been told previously that we could bring in our own fish to be prepared in advance(which is so cool!). So back to my date lol, I ordered the Mandarin Blush and my date had the Swamp tea(I preferred his lol), sadly our drinks didn't come with dry ice like my previous experiences. Ive always ordered the blackened chicken Alfredo pasta because it has more flavor to the chicken. This time my chicken was barely blackened and at first they got my order wrong but quickly corrected it and I didn't want to make a fuss so I just kept it. Overall I'll still continue visiting and enjoying their pasta, maybe next time I'll try their deserts!
We got the Crab Cake appetizer, taste of New Orleans, fried shrimp platter, and jambalaya pasta. Everything was great, big portions. Def recommend stopping by

Came here with my BFF for my birthday dinner. We met up in New Orleans, she came in from California, and I came in from Tennessee. We were departing the next day for a 5 day cruise. My friend found this place and made reservations. It's right in the French Quarter. There was a line of people when we got there, but again, we had a reservation. We were taken upstairs to a table and our server came by shortly to take drink orders.

Let me say, our server was wonderful. I believe her name was Kim. She was funny, and nice and very helpful. We saw her interact with other customers as well, and she was just as engaged with them as she was with us. Awesome service!

I started out with the Mandarin Blush drink and it was really good. Refreshing and fizzy. I think I had a few of these. For an appetizer we ordered the crab cakes. They were very tasty. That crawfish and mushroom sauce was soooo good. Almost licked the plate. While not the best crab cake I've ever had, the sauce really did bring it up to a different level, instead of the usual remoulade sauce typically served with crab cakes.

Then my BFF and I shared the Taste of New Orleans and our server even had it split for us into separate plates. Nice touch! It was great to have a pretty decent sized "sampling" of red beans & rice, jambalaya and crawfish etouffee. We even had some fried crawfish on top of it. It was plenty for both of us and left us some room for dessert.

Did I say dessert? Sure did. We shared the New Orleans Bread Pudding with some yummy kind of praline rum sauce. Oh my! Of course, it had a scoop of vanilla ice cream on it too. The 2nd time I wanted to lick the plate at this establishment. We tried to play it cool like we weren't gluttons and left two tiny little bites left. LOL.

Overall, it was a great experience, and I would definitely go back there. Thank you for a wonderful meal.
Amazing breakfast we had to go 3 times during our visit to NOLA! The service is wonderful and the food is delicious! Low key and nice ambience as well.

Came here because of the good reviews but didn't really own up to the hype. The famous oysters were my favorite. My mardi gras pasta was great but I was expecting more flavor. Overall this is a very touristy spot. However, service was great, everyone was super friendly and taking Covid very seriously which I appreciate.

Went here today for New Year's Eve dinner. Unfortunately, within an hour of having the dinner, all members of our party got sick with a case of food poisoning. We had the Louisiana Crabmeat cakes, Seafood Gumbo, Cajun Jambalaya, Blackened Catfish Po-boy sanfwich6. Not only was it an utter waste of time and money, it also completely ruined our new years Eve since we all had to return home immediately.

I would absolutely avoid this place.

Wish we'd have gone to Acme instead. Our server couldn't have cared less to make it an enjoyable experience for us. The customer is never wrong & just because 1 guest at the table of 5 is (politely & quietly) intoxicated (ie- had trouble placing order & spilled a drink) does not give reason to assume we are all a bunch of wasted tourists. Glad we made reservations to avoid waiting in the long line. Bummed they didn't even have their famous grilled oysters (because of gas line being broken)? We learned later that our buddy who couldn't make the trip called in drinks for the table, but those never showed. Not hurrying back.
We waited outside in a line around the retaursnt when we ate, but once we were in, IT WAS WORTH IT! The mood is light, easy going and fun. The food is comforting and yummy.
Amazing food.  The Cajun fries are awesome!! Red Beans & Rice are also excellent!  Definitely will make this spot one of our regular stops when visiting.

I kinda don't know what all the fuss is about? Maybe I didn't order right, but the trio combo of jambalaya, red beans and rice, and crawfish etouffee were nice, but not remarkable. I will say the crab cake app with their signature sauce was savory and not too mushy or too many bread crumbs as fillers. The fried dishes coming out looked sizable and they had many sweet cocktail concoctions, if that's more to your liking. We were more in search of fresh, grilled seafood with notable Cajun influence. I'd ty this place again if with a group, but honestly there's other great places in the vicinity. After passing by Royal Bourbon and glancing at their dishes as we strolled by, I was easily envious of the quality and presentation of their dishes.

My first time in NOLA, and my friend and I stopped by this little gem. First of all let me tell y'all about Chris who stands at the door happily greeting people. Chris had the southern hospitality we all look for when we are in another city . He kept reassuring us that we would be seated soon, and he told us they make sure everyone is taken care of. We get inside and seated by Erin, she was a doll. She was very vibrant, bubbly, and very attentive. The night went well, the food was good and Chris and Erin were so great, we came back the next night. Surprisingly we were once again greeted by Chris and he remembered us. Due to him being so hospitable we gave him $40, although he didn't want to take it, we made him take it. He was very grateful. We had Erin again as our waitress, and she was just as bubbly as the night before. I love this place!!!!thanks guys
Great service by Cory! Yummy,  yummy catfish platter with a side of red beans w/ rice. Set the meal with a delicious Hurricane.

The food was great but the service absolutely ruined this place. I'm going to have to take a shot in the dark here and assume that in order to work here, one of your qualifications is "being exceptionally rude." The waitress said she would be back immediately and we had to flag her down 20 minutes later. We didn't even see her, we had to ask someone else to go find her. It wasn't even that busy. We even had a birthday in our party and asked the staff to sing. Lo and behold, we waited so long, we ended up just singing it ourselves. 

It's a shame because the food alone makes this place a 4/5. Your tastebuds will probably not be disappointed. You won't catch me returning based on the experience alone. However, I am open to take out.
Pretty good food. The prices are high but the food is good. Perfectly fried oysters and a great smooth Bloody Mary. Has outside patio seating
John was a nice server- gumbo was sooo good! Oysters were ok but I've had better- size was really small

Had really good reviews on Yelp so I took my whole group. The food wasn't great considering I ordered a higher priced dish. Overall our group was split on the quality of food. The pasta dishes were well liked. My drink order was incorrect and I felt guilted into accepting it. Service was ok. The waiter was very talkative but didn't listen to our requests well. There are so many places to get seafood in town. I wouldn't try here again.

Came here with my boyfriend after drinking all day. We came here for some apps...Oyster Rockefeller and Barbecued Shrimp. 

Let me tell you....

The oyster rockerfeller was amazing! So much flavor packed into a oyster! Delish flavor. 

The barbecued shrimp was great too! That sauce was amazing and I want it in everything, 

Flavor was amazing in both apps. Very fresh and yummy! 

Service was impeccable!!! We had a wonderful waiter. 

10% off with Yelp check-in!

I ordered a half dozen of the World Famous Oysters and  loved them so much that I ordered another round! 

Service wasn't perfect but it was attentive and very friendly! My coworker received the wrong dish but the mistake was very quickly corrected. No harm no foul. Will definitely be back!

Our first restaurant stop in New Orleans. I LOVE this place! We had a late night arrival on the first day and found Oceana Grill near Bourbon St. Oceana opens late!  During my one week stay here, I probably ate here twice that's how good this place is.

The platters I've tried were chefs specials and they were sooo good and savory. The portions are huge that you can share a dish with one person. 

I highly recommend to give this restaurant a try if it's your first time. The restaurant did an exceptional job with their amazing customer service and safety covid protocols. Menu were scanned via QR code and tables were socially distanced. Check it out!
Food was amazing!  IF it wasn't for a guest that went out to balcony and left door it open while smoking, this would be a 5 star, IMO.

We have never had a less-than-stellar meal here! Highlights (for me anyway).....the grilled oyster appetizer, the crab cakes topped with mushroom cream sauce (and crawfish tails!), the Taste of New Orleans, all of the blackened fish and all of the Cajun pastas, etc, etc, etc. And the Kentucky bourbon pecan pie? Amazing! (I did not eat this all on one visit by the way.) And the staff is outstanding, every one of them. But if you're lucky enough to get Jordan as your server, you're lucky enough!!! Don't miss Oceana Grill!
The Shrimp po-boy was delicious!! The sauce that they put on it made it even better! Definitely recommend.

Honestly one of the best meals I've ever had in New Orleans. The Cajun fries were absolutely AMAZING. Will never travel back home to nola without getting them again. Also got the Mardi Gras pasta and seafood platter. Both were too notch! Huge portions as well. Will be recommending to everyone I know!!

first off, i want to commend oceana grill for their hours and staying open so late. after our first night out in nola, we were in desperate need of food and everywhere we tried going to that looked decent was closed/closing. oceana was our savior that night. never forget. 

chargrilled gator bites were seriously incredible. this was my first time trying alligator meat and i was certainly not disappointed. it was juicy and flavorful and just SO GOOD. we much preferred it to the fried bites (we got half grilled/half fried), but both were really really good. alligator is truly underrated. was also happy to hear that the alligator we were eating was not from a nearby swamp, but rather, from an alligator farm. it would have saddened me to hear that gators were being kidnapped from nearby swamps -- so good on that oceana. 

then oceana's famous oysters. oh man, these were delectable. the sauce was so rich and herbed and you can never really go wrong with chargrilled oysters.

taste of new orleans was AMAZEEEEE. the jambalaya, the crawfish etoufee, the red beans and rice ... while not that aesthetically pleasing, it was truly delightful to the tastebuds. we tried this our first night in new orleans and were so happy to get to try all the specialties and weren't disappointed with a single dish. jambalaya holds a very, very special place in my heart, and oceana's was soooo good. 

then finally, we got dessert -- bread pudding. our server said this wasn't their best dessert, but i don't see how that could be because it was UNBELIEVABLE. so so so delicious. i love bread pudding. and oceana (& the incredibly nice staff who portioned out everything out for the 2 of us without us EVEN ASKING!!!! like how nice is this? so nice. so practical. i love you oceana)

So while in New Orleans,me and some friends decided to eat here for dinner. There was a line outside so we were kinda reluctant at first but after being told the wait would be thirty minutes and we only waited fifteen,we were very happy we stayed. They have a full bar to the left as soon as you walk in. To the right they have a bench you can sit on while waiting to be seated. It can seem a little clustered when you first walk in but after you are seated it is better. They have three different seating areas so this restaurant would d be great for a big crowd. The service and food was good which is always a plus for me. I ordered their ribs and they literally fell off the bone! My friend ordered their banana Foster ice cream cake and it was delicious,so that is something you would definitely want to try. And don't forget to check in when you go to receive your 10% off your meal!
Fantastic food and service!! Our waitress Kim was amazing!! She brought the food out super fast and kept and make sure my group was happy

Good food, great service, friendly staff. Didn't have to wait an hour and a half for our food like at most New Orleans restaurants which was great. Food was brought out all at once for the group which again, is rare in New Orleans. Definitely worth a stop!

This dining experience was one of the best ones we had on our visit to New Orleans. 
Fiona our waitress was fantastic.  She was very informative about the menu and all the specials they were offering for the evening.  
 You must stop in and try the oysters.  Some of the best we had in the city.  
 Stop in and ask for Fiona . She will make your experience even more enjoyable.
Great food, great service! We had a variety of food and everything was delicious! If you're undecided where to go, give this place a try!

Nothing beats noshing at Oceana Grill. The food and ambience was excellent, and Errol was very friendly and attentive during our dining experience. WHO DAT? Oceana Grill that's who!!! Keep up the great job and service.

My server's name was Destine (ask for her, she's sweet and helpful).  She and the host/hostess served my boyfriend and me with great customer service!  Especially during COVID-19 phase 3.  They were very welcoming and accommodating from the very start.  The food and drinks were also great.  We only had a couple appetizers, cocktails, and a dessert.  The blackened gator bites were delicious.  I recommend the bread pudding, don't forget to add the ice cream a la carte!
I had the seafood platter with fried gator. It was delicious. Jess M, our waitress, did a wonderful job with suggesting. Great place to get a taste of New Orleans!

This place was right in the heart of everything. The waiter was attentive, nice, and quick. I ordered the " taste of New Orleans" and the food was delicious. I also ordered a Bahama mama and the although it was fruity and good I couldn't taste any of the alcohol. The only con I had was the weak drinks.

Great food, great service in the French quarter.....

My wife and I had just arrived in town and we were looking for good food and drink while watching the Super Bowl.....

One of our people recommended this spot so we decided to drop by....,

My wife had the sampler which consisted of red beans and rice, jambalaya and crawfish etoufee....
I had the reddish etoufee which was absolutely the best redfish I've ever had!!!!

My wife had the hurricane which was equally as good, and topped it off with the Oceana brownie which is one of the best deserts we've had in a long time... 

Great experience!!!!

Check it out if you're in town......
Went for a birthday celebration. Food was good, server was good but food came to the table far too slow and erratic. Ron our server wasn't the issue. He tried hard to keep us happy.

Called and made a reservation 3 days in advance. They didn't have it. I showed them my call log from when I called and made the reservation. They didn't care and the hostesses were so ridiculously rude about it. Really put a damper on our evening.

We had both breakfast and Dinner at Oceana Grill and loved both.  The shrimp and crab crepes and seafood omelet were excellent and our dinners of redfish and shrimp pasta were also great but my favorite of all the good food was the crab cakes.  This is definitely one of the best restaurants I've ever been to.

We had a really good time here. The spices and smells in the atmosphere were amazing. Everyone's food was really good. My pasta however was delicious but was a little saddened by the popcorn shrimp given we're in the big easy. It was like those tiny shrimp Olive garden gives you. However the Cajun Alfredo sauce made up for it and being able to dip the bread into it was so delicious!

My friend brought me to this place one night. I had not been on a proper date before and this place was soooooo tasty. I've always wanted to try the food and I'm glad I did. One thing that I did like is that they were following the rules for Covid when we went. People were seaweed far apart from each other and everyone had their mask on. The ambiance was perfect. It will not be my last time going there. Thank you for an amazing dinner.

You can't beat the location. The service was great. We had the Gator Bites, the seafood platter and cheesecake. It was all very good. The service was fantastic. Highly recommend while you're visiting New Orleans.
Fried shrimp platter was great but nothing exceptional.  About the same as any other place in the French quarter.
The food was great and the service was good. We will definitely be back. There were so many yummy looking things on the menu.

This is always my go-to when I come to New Orleans. The food is always amazing. The staff is so much fun! We had the fried loaded with fried alligator and they were amazing. We were in town for our honeymoon and the manager treated us to cheesecake. The tropical storm drink was yummy too! Always a must when in NOLA!
Awesome food! I highly recommend the jambalaya and red beans and rice - so flavorful! Definitely on my "must go" list for my next visit to NOLA
When in the French quarter, excellent place for breakfast, usually  can be seated if your early

Stopped in here to get some New Orleans style food and was not disappointed in my shrimp poboy!  The portion was generous and the spicy fries that came with it were sooo tasty.

Service was prompt and professional.  I sat at the bar and Brandi helped me.  She was awesome.

It also didn't have as much of a touristy feel like some of the places in the French Quarter.   I'm a fan of Oceana Grill.

I am a big fan of Kitchen Nightmare so it was a surprise to see that this infamous place was still open. After reading some positive reviews I decided to give it a try. At first glance, the sign pops up and I instantly took a picture in front of it.

Once I walked in, I was created by a friendly host crew. I was brought over to the room out looking the outside. The server was great and very friendly. I wasn't too hungry so I ordered the gumbo. It came with a crab pincer which was a great surprise! I am so used to basic gumbos that lacked real seafood. Overall, I do wish I ordered more but I felt that the server did not try to sell me more!

Perhaps in the future I can try more and raise my rating to a 5 star!

So, we went here for lunch the first day I was visiting New Orleans.  The service was good, and there were 7 of us.  The food was pretty good.  My friend had the Mahi Mahi salad, and I wish I had had that.  Prices aren't too bad either.  So , the next morning when were we all hungover, we decided to go back.  We had heard their breakfast was very popular.  We obviously needed water bad, and our server got all our drink orders and we told him a round of waters also.  He was gone for atleast 15 minutes.  We were "dying" so I went up to the bar to get a few waters and to ask where our server was. He returned shortyly to take our order.  I ordered the "lost bread", which was AMAZING!  I asked for scrambled eggs with cheese, and what they brought out was mush.....they were gross and runny.  I sent them back and when they returned they were still mush.  Oh well.  Everyone else said the breakfast was "just ok" nothing to write home about.  Probably won't go back when visiting again.
Had a wonderful experience!! First stop on our trip to New Orleans and I will be back. Had the crab cake Alfredo pasta. To die for!! Mary was a great waitress!!

Awful customer service.  I came here for my birthday. I made a reservation at this restaurant and stated that it was my birthday. When I brought this up to the hostess, she didn't even bother to say something as simple as "Happy Birthday." She totally ignored the fact that it was my birthday even though I mentioned it in my reservation and I mentioned it again in person.

My friends and my husband told our waitress SEVERAL times that it was my birthday. She did absolutely nothing.

I called the manager and discussed this with him. He offered an apology but made no attempt to make things right. I will never eat here again.
Great seafood! The black red fish seafood special was tasty especially w the corn bread stuffing they had on the bottom. Our server Tyana recommended it and provided good service.

In NOLA during the Corona outbreak and all restaurants were closed; only doing take out or delivery.  Ordered a delivery for a family of four. Delivered quickly. Food was hot, order was correct and was Fantastic. Crabcake appetizer, jambalaya, red beans and rice with sausage, blackened shrimp, crawfish etouffee,  Cesar salad, cajun vegetarian stew. All was delicious. Will definitely add this to our list of places to eat on our next trip to NOLA.

There are a lot of places to eat in a very small area, so choosing where to eat can be hard.  I recommend this place for sure. We had the Gumbo, Crab cakes, Cajun Fries, Oceana's Famous Oysters, blackened chicken platter, blackened chicken po'boy and a kids burger.  The only dish i wouldn't order again would be the crab cakes. Not bad, I have just had better. Everything else though was really good. SO good in fact that I originally gave four stars, but I'm changing it to 5 because I want to go back again. The service was great also.

Let's get straight to the point .... The food was AMAZING ! Ocenana Grill was my first food spot on this trip to New Orleans and I'm glad it was !

Me and my wife started off with some Chargrilled Oysters to start our meal off, which is a MUST when you're in Nola. Trust me, regardless of if you like oysters or not, you'll LOVE these Chargrilled Oysters. 

After that, I ordered the Cajun Fires, which is a pretty HARDY appetizer, and I will say on record they were the BEST FRIES EVER! Topped with Crawfish bits, cheese, and a special mushroom sauce smh every bite was better than the last one. My wife ended up ordering the Jazzy Carb Cake and it was delicious! The crab cakes were moist and tasty and the greens (vegetables) and potatoes were jammed packed with flavor. And the great thing about these dishes, the portion sizes were huge! So we were able to get full and still have some to save for later. 

Whenever you're undecided about what to eat, always go with Oceana. You'll never go wrong

Visiting from Los Angeles with the family. 
Service was fantastic from the moment we walked in. 
Our server JAMAL was incredible. Made the best recommendations, split out shared plates without us even asking, and was just just a great server! 
The food was incredible. Oyster plate, gumbo, Tast of New Orleans, Crab Cakes and the Gator Bites! 1000% recommend. 

And, ask to sit with JAMAL!

Great food and excellent service. Our server was Erica, she was fantastic.  There was a lot of  NOLA signature staples on the menu. Great location.  There was a long line waiting when we left so it's very popular.

The best Seafood and service. Our Waitress Bridget was very attentive and friendly as well as professional.
Enjoy our Breakfast egg Benedix and Cajun Breakfast along with The ultimate Bloody Mary!

OMG! so we were referred to come here by a local...and I must say I am so glad we listened. First it is a little pricey.. I mean not by much, I guess it just depends where your pockets are at.. 

We ordered the crab cakes to start off and let me tell you something... if these aren't some of the best crab cakes I have ever tasted!!!! make you slap your neighbor!! lol
The local did tell us we must order them and I'm glad we listened AGAIN!

We had a party of about 8 and we ate a little of everyones food because they actually serve you nice size portions and everything we ordered was really great. From the seasonings and flavors - to the texture. Someone in my party ordered the steak med-well and it was one of the best steaks I had eaten in NO, melt in your mouth like... NO JOKE

 I've been to NOLA dozens of times and for some reason this is my first stop here bc I think I stray from bourbon street a lot, especially towards the evening. But I will definitely come back and you should definitely stop and at least.. AT THE LEAST.. get the crab cakes!!

The food was good. From gumbo to seafood crepe and drinks I would recommend this place. The only thing I wouldn't recommend is the fresh oysters (by far the worse place to get it, taste old and mushy). The serve was ok, but I feel like the bartender was more of our server than our waitress.

This place was really good. Just visited Nola for a few days and we found this place on yelp. The Jambalaya pasta was really good but the taste of Louisiana was just alright (didn't really like that one) - so much rice lol. But I would totally recommend this place!
Food is good! Fish can be a little dry but its good and well seasoned! I always get the same dish, Blackened Redish Etoufee Dinner and its always good!

I decided to give oceana another shot. An I'm so happy I did. We came for lunch around 11:30, but were pleased to discover that breakfast was still available after 11 along side the lunch menu, which isnt usually common during the week. We were greeted before we even stepped 1 foot in the door by the sweetest girl. Come to find out, she was the daughter of our waitress, who was working there for the summer while she was out of school. Kudos to oceana for making this a family oriented environment. Our waitress, Megan L, was extraordinary!!! Just as good as the food! I had the special. Chicken and waffles, But it was made with huge pieces of french toast instead. Cooked perfectly! And the bloody mary was the best I ever had! We also tried the alligator. Half grill and half fried. We're still fighting over which ones better. I'm glad I tried it a second time. I was highly impressed. Thanks megan for a great experience! And look! I didn't forget the L!!!

The food was great! The service was great an overall wonderful experience. I had the Cajun shrimp pasta Alfredo it was perfect and sooo filling. lol also tried the gumbo and it was amazing, I was too stuffed for dessert but definitely look forward to going back here when in New Orleans. Also the sweet tea is really really good!

Loved it. Got the taste of new orleans, Having all three things gave me the option to try a variety of things and it was really good. I also had the crab cakes and the sauce with that was delicious. I Would recommend to anyone to go there if they are going on vacation in Louisiana. Would definitely go back here when I come back on my next vacation.

I give this a 5 considering the price! Great casual place and not overly priced. Don't think about it...just go! The cajun spices are reduced for us tourists! My business partner and I went for early dinner on day 1. Day 2, I took my wife and sales rep for early dinner...it was that good! Day 1 we ordered BarBQ shrimp as appetizer which is in a spicy lemon garlic sauce. It came with 5 medium shrimp and 2 pieces of french bread to soak up the sauce. It was AMAZING! The only problem there was more sauce than 2 pieces of bread could absorb. Thats a good thing because the main course size was large.  I ordered Redfish Tchopotoules (spelling) blackened with crawfish sauce on top of jalapeno cornbread stuffing. It came with collard greens (best ever!!!!). Every bite was fantastic...and I ate every bite even though it was double what I would normally ate. No room for dessert. Day 2 - 2 orders of BarBQ shrimp and all 4 of us wanted more.  I ordered Red Beans and Rice and lived every bite! I would order it again everyday if I could. For dessert all 4 shared the chocolate mouse cake...AMAZING! I am not a dessert fan but that has to be in my Top 5 favorites. I suggest going early because when we left both days there was a line waiting to get in and the place is 3 stories us a patio! The good thing about going early is that you can walk off the calories after dinner!
Service was quick and friendly. Seafood gumbo and crab cakes were great. Crab cakes had a bit of a kick. Staff there were very attentive.

Tyana was a fantastic server - she was attentive and friendly and gave us some really great food. The food was amazing. 10/10. Would return! Get the ultimate Bloody Mary. It was great. The fries - whoa. Unreal. Try the soft shell crab. It was great. I learned that it's actually not a different species of crab, but it's a crab who has just undergone the molting phase. So now you know! Get it. You won't regret.

Was recommended this place and was very disappointed. Had the seafood platter and taste of new Orleans.  Both were expensive and subpar with alot of fillers. The platter had mostly fries and just a layer of mediocre fried food on the top.  The fried catfish was however very bold but only few pieces.  The taste of was small portions of mostly rice. The sausage that was served was puney and pathetic. The crawfish was pretty good however.
Famous oysters and shrimp po-boy were good. Great atmosphere as well.
It was all very fantastic and decently priced. The bread pudding was absolutely fantastic and the work staff there were very thoughtful and kind.
Delicious we had crab cakes and gumbo delicious service was excellent drinks are fabulous just a wonderful nice seating area will come back to try the  poboy ...Waitress was attentive and prompt ...

Gave this place a shot after seeing such good reviews on Yelp and it lived up to the hype! We ordered the Cajun fries for our app, jambalaya pasta and a special they had of grilled redfish and it was all superb! The service was FAST and we didn't wait to even get in! Def recommend!

Wow. I know there's ton of great reviews for this place so folks are likely to come here, but I never leave reviews and I felt compelled to let everyone know that this place is an overpriced tourist trap--take it from someone who really knows what good food tastes like in New Orleans. If you want to try all the famous things (crawfish, gumbo, etc) in a family friendly environment in the middle of the quarter, this place checks the boxes. Sincerely, it's not bad! But if you're a true foodie there are places in town that are way way way better such as coops, Jacque-imos, and Willie Maes.
Called to make a reservation at 7 pm and was told I would have to call back between the hours of 9am-4pm. Not good customer service

Food was good but some of the dishes were lukewarm (pastas and gumbo) so not sure how fresh this place really is. However the fried seafood dishes were delicious and would recommend over the other stuff. Shrimp poboys and fried seafood platter were our favorite. Crab cakes were alright.. it had a lot of breading and would've preferred lump crab meat vs shredded crab meat.

The building itself is really cool and we came  here based on the recommendation from the hotel. The line was down the block and moved fairly quickly -about a 20 min wait. The weather was nice so that was fine. We got seated upstairs and Kevin our waiter came over after about 10 min and wanted to take just our drink order but we were ready to order so we ordered 2 margaritas, oysters, and two entrees the shrimp creole and the catfish. After another 15 min we got our water and another 10 min after that we got our oysters, then got the the margaritas. Unacceptable to have the two drinks come after the appetizer. The oysters were awesome and we should of just ordered those. He never came back to check on us and Someone else brought the entrees. The catfish was good but the creole was not. It was like a ketchup based rice bowl with no flavor. Combined with the poor service and bland entrees I won't come back.
That place has great food, I promise you the seafood gumbo is the best i have every eaten. and hospitality our server Guy was awesome!!!

Eat breakfast here. I can't say enough good things about our breakfast here. First off our waiter was eager to please yet not overbearing. Such a nice guy man. Def the guy I want around to help me start my day. My wife's crawfish omelet was delicious and I don't like seafood lol the gator andouille sausage I had good flavor. Grits were so tasty which is not normal without adding stuff. But last but not least but not least and my favorite part is the Cajun hash. Bro. I could eat that daily. It's beyond flavorful and I could've eaten pounds of it. Eat here for breakfast.

I felt it was a tad bit overrated. We had the crab cakes, blackened shrimp, and bbq shrimp. The crab cakes have a lot of breading and not as much crab as I expected. The blackened shrimp was the best dish we tried while the bbq shrimp was more of a gravy and interesting.

A gem!! My Uber driver mentioned this place about five times and so we had to check it out! It didn't disappoint. Those Cajun fries were in the appetizer menu and it was amazing. It was definitely enough food for two or more. They had really nice servings and the drink was very good. The Ocean drink!! This is another spot to make sure you try in New Orleans. You will not be disappointed!!

I would personally go to Copper Monkey Grill right next door and avoid the long lines. Food is better, service is much better and no one works harder behind the bar than V. Don't waste your time in our amazing city on line at Oceana
Great experience and reasonably prices nice staff. Good food and drink offers. Would recommend to family and friends great place a hiding gem.

I was a bit disappointed that the oysters Rockefeller were not available but the pasta dish I ordered was an 8 out of 10. It was the Cajun Jambalaya pasta. I expected a lil heat. But there wasn't any at all which was ok. It was actually pretty good. Alligator sausage was interesting. The creme brûlée was outstanding. Funny they sell tshirts that say "Got Oysters?" Because they didn't have the ones I wanted. So I ordered a side of fried oysters which were a bit over cooked (tasted burnt) for an appetizer. I still ate them drowned in cocktail sauce because I was hungry. The wait outside was horrible and cold. There was a string of freezing homeless people under blankets yelling at us while we were waiting in line to get in.
A great spot for a little bit of everything NOLA had to offer!! We took the food to go to eat at our airbnb. The food was delicious and I am so so happy to have tried it before leaving NOLA.
We got the Cajun fries with gumbo and also the chicken Po boy. All of the food was great- atmosphere and staff are nice !
The food was amazing I recommend the crabcakes the staff was just as amazing very polite and had good recommendations

We actually came for breakfast after a night of drinking. This place was good, really packed at 10:00am. Nothing to write home about but was solid food for a good price. I had an omelette with seafood in it and a hollandaise sauce on the side. My brother and dad were happy with their food too and the coffee was just what we needed. The service was attentive even though most of them are on their phones, or at least our server was most of the time. I will give him credit for multitasking, he checked in on us a lot.

Delicious! Great and AUTHENTIC Cajun/NOLA food. The atmosphere was fantastic, quick service, all employees super friendly. I highly recommend the fried shrimp PoBoy! My family and I were only planning on going there once for dinner during our stay but decided to cancel our dinner plans at another restaurant and went back to Oceana for a second time! Worth it!
This food was amazing!!!! I tried my first gator and it was delicious. The food was seasoned well and I definitely ate with a smile on my face.
Great food great location! Such great food and so filling! My only regret is not having room for dessert
The food was good but the waitress was incredible. Great hospitality and good local food.
Mary was absolutely wonderful!! Clean and very professional establishment!!! Wonderful food and kind people !!!
Always great food in the best red fish in townThe bread pudding is good but the color greens are excellent they must see it's always my first stop and always my last stop

Food was really good, most of the staff was friendly except for our server. She was attentive but not near as friendly to our table as she was to the one across. We tried, maybe the 25% tip will make her more enjoyable towards other guests that come in tonight.

It's was super hot outside, but when we went into the restaurant it was perfectly cool. The service was great. The food was amazing. I highly recommend the crab cakes. This place was definitely a 5 star restaurant!!!

Can I just say this is my most favorite restaurant in New Orleans. The staff is so friendly and sweet. Damon was our waiter and he's excellent. The drinks are spot on. The redfish and pasta were just mouthwatering. I can't say enough about the taste. We have tried so many restaurants and it's really hard to pick a favorite when the food is so good all around. But this Hass to be it. Don't mess Oceana grill if you're in French Quarter.

I recently stopped in during Mardi Gras for my first meal in New Orleans. I ordered the special which was redfish with shrimp lemon butter over jalapeño cornbread dressing. The food was so flavorful and delicious! I highly recommend this restaurant. The service was also very friendly and accommodating. I had the barbecue shrimp as an appetizer which was also very yummy. I loved dipping the French bread in the sauce. 

I also ordered a drink called The Hurricane which was good and strong. There was dry ice added for a fun bubbling effect. They are well known for their Bloody Marys so if that is your drink of choice this would be a good place to try.

The food was so good I came back for more the next day. I ordered the blackened catfish po boy with a side of gumbo. Also very delicious! The bread was toasted nicely and the gumbo flavorful with a kick. Highly recommend this spot whenever you are in New Orleans

We ordered a Shrimp PoBoy, my first time in New Orleans & my first and only PoBoy. It was terrible! The shrimp was hard & cold and the bread was so though that I couldn't even cut it. The food came out so quickly that I assume it was pre cooked. We also had the special of the night which was a Redfish in a Cajun pesto Alfredo sauce & while the flavor was good the fish was very tough...agin I suspect that it was pre cooked as well.  I notice that everyone's food came out quickly. Lastly I ordered dessert to go, it was the tiniest slice of pecan pie I've ever seen.

This place was made much better by the service we got. Our server was really courteous, nice guy! So was the busser. Both engaged our two litle girls! The food, especially the crabmeat cakes and the bread pudding were espectacular. We also ordered shrimp po'boys and the crawfish etouffee. I would say the etouffee needed salt. 

Nice portions and while a little on the expensive side, it is the French Quarter so I can't complain. Overall a great experience especially from the people that work there.

Our group ate here for dinner today and had the Cajun fettuccini alfredo with blackened gator bites and the Oceana red fish! We also had the Oceana oysters and the crab cakes before and the bread pudding for dessert. ALL of it was delicious and our waitress, Regene, was delightful. She made the whole experience worth while with her quick service and glowing personality. I highly recommend this restaurant and ask to sit in Regene's section!!!

1st time here; Food was good and tasty.  Grilled Shrimp salad  My husband had Ribeye steak medium but it came well instead; it was ok. Atmosphere was nice. Service was friendly and accommodating. Overall. I will give it another visit and more food. We will be back. I hope I be back to give 5
The food was so good! The line was really long but we only waited 20 minutes for a party of 13! Great service too

Placed order for pickup and after waiting 20 minutes for second email for estimated pick time, called restaurant to check on status. Kept being transferred to voicemail.  I decided to go to restaurant to check on order 40 minutes after I placed order and it wasn't until that time that my order was sent through to start being worked on.  After getting to my hotel, I noticed two dishes were missing and no disposable utensils were included.  I proceeded to call restaurant, where gentleman who answered questioned me about my order, asking if I was sure that I was missing my two dishes.  I'm not sure what service is like when dining in, but I wouldn't ever order take out from here again.  The dishes that were included in my order were good.

I can't imagine that this "food" was created by a chef.  It must be canned or perhaps frozen.  The prices are over 4 times what their "food" is worth.
I do believe my friend's Margarita was from a dry packet!!
Sorry food - bad prices - bad drinks.  Not a place I'd go back to.

So I put them in my favorites because
of the reviews and the fact that the 
food looked awesome. We get there
and the place was super crowded.
Lines in both sides of the doorway to
get into this place, so we decided to 
be a little daring and decided to follow
this huge party going in that already 
had reservations and it actually worked.
once we got in we followed the party
to an upper level and found there was 
a bar there with seating so we sat down
and ordered without no suspicions.
We really got a good laugh on that one.
We decided to try a cup of gumbo which
I thought was just ok and for my main
course the Mardigras pasta which 
looked good but also was just ok.
Staff and bartender very friendly and 
very hospitable..

Found this place when I was just walking through the french quarter and decided to give it a try and was pleasantly surprised this place was absolutely wonderful customer service was unrivaled and the food tasted so good a gave me the chills lol

Had an amazing 15 person dinner here at Oceana Grill. 

The staff were friendly, the food was amazing, and the atmosphere is one to remember. I came here for a graduation dinner and we picked from a short list menu that had some super exciting options. I enjoyed the frozen Sangria,  jambalaya, catfish, greens, and my favorite char-grilled oysters. Definitely a meal to remember. Omg, I almost forgot I had the best bread pudding I've ever had in life. No shade to Mother's but Oceana has the best bread pudding. Can't wait to come back here on my next trip.

Just because it's cheap doesn't mean it's edible , fake oysters, I seen the pjs oyster Bucket and all they do is by the shell , also fake imitation crab meat out of the bucket as well , service was rushed with no personality.
Fried CatfishFried Crawfish TailsFried SeafoodFried Seafood Platter-My experiences here has always been positive with great food and drinks.
Drinks were good. Alligator bites were amazing. Gumbo was good, staff busy not to attentive.
First off, there is road construction just outside the front door. The food was good. We wanted char grilled oysters but they were out. Bummer.
Service was good... the food had hits and misses... love the red bean and rice, bbq shrimp was great.  I definitely did not like the jambalaya... too dry and the Sauce was sour.

This place is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!! The food was everything, but what really was the vehicle to this wonderful dining experience was our server Kim. I've never written a response on a server but she really made it all happen, her recommendations were exactly what we needed for our food experience. The seafood gumbo and Redfish special will have me dreaming for the next few days when we return home!

Awful customer experience. We placed an order via Yelp. Two hours went by with no call from the restaurant. Grub Hub claimed the restaurant called us, which wasn't true. We finally contacted Oceana Grill, and the manager on the line was rude, impatient, and distasteful. She didn't apologize for the two-hour delay and harshly asked, "Well, do you still want your food?!" We decided to cancel due to the extensive delay. Still, no apology from the manager. 

Bottom-line: dine in with Oceana Grill instead of ordering delivery.

The food here is soooooo delicious! Waiter was very friendly and checked on us often. My boyfriend and I both got different types of pasta and they were both tasty and filling. He had the Cajun pasta and that was my favorite for sure!  Drinks were also very good and came out fairly quickly. When we came in there was not a line but when we left there was a long line down the street of people waiting to go in. Definitely worth the wait!

We visited this restaurant on a stop in New Orleans and unlike a lot of places it was open (it was only 830pm on a Wednesday but a lot of places were closed due to covid)- good food, good service, good drinks.
This is a great place for big portions and quick hearty food.  Not really a foodie place - but fun touristy location in the French quarter.  Ive never been disappointed.
The Joe's Crab Shack of New Orleans...very touristy feeling and cookie cutter. Food was meh, they give you a free appetizer for Yelp reviews...consider yourself warned!

Celebrating a friends birthday. It was a party of 6. Mary was our server. She was amazing. She offered great opinions on the menu as it was some of our first time dining here. We ordered the house cocktail of the night and it delicious and strong enough to do the job. We had the chef special Blackened Alligator Pasta it was delicious. The dish needed nothing. The alligator was tender and flavored packed. My partner had the Crawfish Étouffée and it was delicious also. It was full of tender crawfish tails and veggies. The sauce was spicy but flavorful. I ordered the bread pudding and cheesecake togo but the bite of bread pudding was yummy. I can't wait to heat it up and devour that too.
Since it's the only real spot open after 1pm... but defiantly much better food in NOR...
So Damn Good!!!!!!!!! Gumbo and Hurricanes to start my day. My baby got MaMa jambalaya it was so good I couldn't stop eating his plate

We had an awesome meal here! We sat at the upstairs bar (left side) and ordered hurricanes and the Taste of New Orleans. The ToNO had jambalaya, human and red beans and rice. We split it and had a drink each but it's enough for one person. We were restaurant hopping so we ordered light. Check it out and be sure to ask for Chris because he makes the best hurricanes in town AND he's pretty cool.

Errol is the best host and was very helpful in recommending good drinks and food! His Barry White voice and friendly demeanor made the night! That guy deserves a raise!!
Food was good as always! Loved the watermelon drink, phase 3? Tasty and refreshing!

Excellent Service
Excellent food
Excellent ambience
Excellent drinks
Everything about this place was amazing, from the gator bites to the Redfish

Amazing! The food is good, the drinks are great and the waitstaff was nice... what else do you need for a 5 star? The ambience? Well, in NOLA, it's always nice, isn't it?  
We went here for lunch (brunch). I ordered a Bloody Mary which woke me up and then my blackened catfish Po-boy gave me the wings and the bread pudding took me flying! I was ready for another night in NOLA

I recently went to New Orleans and ate at Oceana Grill! The food was amazing! I think this was by far one of the the best restaurant I ate at while visiting. I ordered  the red beans and rice and ordered the crab cakes for an appetizer, everything came out super fast and was hot and fresh. With the COVID restrictions I was a little nervous going in, but everyone had their gloves and masks on. The restaurant was on top of everything and made sure that they seated everyone 6 feet apart, and provided hand sanitizer. The atmosphere was great, played great music and staff was very friendly. I will definitely be back for the food and the great service!

Oceana was fun and delicious. The staff was attentive and kind and I also really enjoyed the food. My favorite item on the menu came as a surprise to me: French fries with a mushroom sauce, prawns and cheese. HEAVENLY.
2 days in a row here I had Errol on Day 1 and Bridget T. on day 2. Both were great and the food was awesome!! Definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting.

We arrived in New Orleans late night, and were starving. The hotel desk recommended this place, and the reviews on yelp seemed good, but wow this is an over rated tourist trap. I have had amazing food in New Orleans on other visits and can not fathom how this place is rated up there with some of them. This was like a Cajun TGI Fridays. I had the blackened chicken salad, that came on top  of gross cheap iceberg lettuce. I can't remember the last time I ate at a place that even dared to give me a salad with iceberg lettuce. The chicken tasted microwaved. The crab cakes were mushy and gross. How could people rave about this? Oceana Grill gets a D-, sorry just another over rated spot. You are in New Orleans go eat good food  somewhere else now!

I wanted multiple dishes so I ordered the taste of New Orleans which came with Creole Jambalaya, etouffee,  and red beans and rice to share among a few other dishes. 
Man were these delicious! I don't know if this is the standard for creole in the area, but it was delicious! I enjoyed all the food we ordered. Definitely get the taste of New Orleans if you are new to creole food and want to sample a mix or if you can't decide which one you want. You can't go wrong either way. Definitely better than other places I've had creole outside of the city. Nom nom nom! Worth the wait! They are busy and definitely make use of the multiple floors. If you're in the area this is a must visit!

Here in New Orleans for the first time! Tried this place e based off reviews... ehhh it's okay. Typical Cajun restaurant, nothing too spectacular. Crab cakes, okay, pasta ehhh, blackened shrimp.. ehhh. In conclusion definitely not somewhere I'm rushing back to. If at all.

The service was great and the food was ok. I think that it was accommodating for the crowds and therefore was a bit conservative in the flavoring. If you can, get the sampler and you can really enjoy all of the different flavors of NOLA!

ABSOLUTELY SPECTACULAR DANIELLE AND MICHELLE WERE AMAZING! Michelle was very informative and helped me feel like a cared for customer. Danielle was my waitress and she was the best waitress I have ever had. She helped us with everything and every part of my experience. She explained things and helped accommodate us so we had a wonderful time. We have only been in this state for a couple hours but I already feel that my trip has been fulfilled in the best way. Please show these employees that they help others to have happiness in these hard times. The other employees that I didn't get much of an interaction with were also wonderful as they showed my family kindness and genuine smiles.

The place smells like bad plumbing. I understand they may be struggling like all other restaurants with covid. I saw so many reviews on Yelp but I didn't understand why.

We ordered the oceana Bak ed oyster special which I thought was overrated and a bit salty. 

Although I thought the food was mediocre and the environment didn't feel clean I must say that the service from the wait staff and busboys was exceptional.
Fiona our server was soooo cute. She was so helpful and kind. She brought us anything we needed and did not forget about us. The best!

I received a lot of good reviews about this restaurant. So I walked there from my hotel. It is ducked off on a side street you can barely see the street I kept passing it. They are doing construction rn. 

They have so much on the menu. The waiter told me most of everything was good but I still didn't know what to get. Then of course I look on Pinterest to look at the food pictures which really helped me a lot. 

I ended up getting the taste of New Orleans. The chef brought it out himself. 
It comes with 3 small containers, 1 jambalaya, 1 crawfish etoufee, 1 red beans and rice with sausage and one roll. I asked for an extra. That jambalaya was so dammm good. I practically swallowed that jambalaya In two bite sit was so food. The red beans and rice was okay, the sausage was a little hard. The crawfish etoufee was okay too. It was my time trying that and it wasn't so bad. I'll definitely remember this restaurant when I come back.
The food tastes Very chain restaurant-like. Chili's has equally good fish entrees. Nothing authentic about the flavors or freshness.

The food was good, but it was kinda pricey! We went during the pandemic so there were no customers in the restaurant. Service was amazing, and the food was hot. I would recommend if you want some really good friend alligator.

Great recommendation from our hotel! Friendly staff. The flavors of the food were great. Wait time was fine. Portion sizes were very generous.  The drinks were on point as well.  Very happy with the entire experience. Good job to all!

Not sure how or why this place has so many stellar reviews. The food was mediocre at best and I feel like I'm absolutely sugarcoating that. My group was famished upon arrival and even then, the food couldn't satiate us. This was probably the worst meal I had in Nola.
Nicole was great! Very knowledgeable of menu items Attentive service and she gave good menu recommendations. We will definitely visit Oceana again

One of the best restaurants in the city! Don't bother with the fancy places. The blackened redfish w/etouffee is wonderful! 

The only downside is that the servers really rush you through your meal so they can turn tables over more quickly. A shame for an otherwise great restaurant.

This was another highly recommended spot by the locals when we were in NOLA. 

Tip: MAKE A RESERVATION!! 

Around 6:30-7:00pm, the line will get LONG. We made a reservation the morning of with no problem,  and were promptly seated when we arrived. Staff was friendly and we were helped right away! 

We started with the crab cake appetizers, followed by the gumbo, and the chef special that night. The chef special sounded delicious (pictured) which I believe was a reddish with their crab cake sauce and a cornbread jalapeño mash below. 

The crab cakes were pretty good, a little too bready but for the price, crabby enough! The gumbo was outstanding! At this point in the trip, Oceana was our favorite place and our favorite gumbo. The chef special was incredibly flavorful and the fish was perfectly seasoned and cooked. 

We both had mixed drinks. My husband had a strawberry margarita, which he thought was good, for a non-tequila fan and was very boozy! I had the Tropical Storm which was DELICIOUS. Gosh I could have ten more! Very boozy, very tasty. 

Also neat: if you don't finish your drink, you can take it with out the restaurant and keep the cup as a little neat souvenir! Would definitely return when back in NOLA!
In town for the weekend. Looking for a quick bite to eat. Oceana has great food, gator bites and crab cakes exceeded expectations. Highly recommend

Came here as tourists on a weekday to try some New Orleans cuisine, in New Orleans! As we arrived, my friend and I were told the wait was about 15 minutes to be seated, and we waited in the entrance area, pondering what we would order so that we could maximize our tasting potential of New Orleans food. When it was time to get seated, we went upstairs and around many other tables to finally get seated. Holy crap! This place is HUGE. And they were pretty much filled to capacity! Not sure if they have two or even three floors, which are all super huge.

Louisiana crab meat cakes - I just realized when I got this dish that I've actually never had crab cakes before, so I wasn't sure what to expect. These were great! There was a nice crispiness to the outside of the cake that was very pleasant to bite into, and there was a ton of flavor in the mushroom sauce and cake itself. I'm generally not a crab meat or crawfish fan, but maybe that's just because I haven't had legit treatments of such seafood before as this dish was quite excellent!

Oceana's famous oysters - I've never really gotten into chargrilled oysters, and this dish was no different. I'm just always expecting a nice raw fleshy feeling when I sink my teeth into the meat, but instead I'm greeted with something that's already cooked, no longer possessing that fresh sensation. The flavors within this dish were incredible however, and really liked the garlicky flavor in the oils along with the parmesan cheese topping the oysters.

Taste of New Orleans - This was a wonderfully concocted plate! The trio of dishes that comprise this dish (jambalaya, etouffée, and beans w/ rice and sausage) are made to fit snuggly among each other like interlocking pieces of a jigsaw puzzle, and complement each other just as well. I don't like etoufée myself, but it was still done very nice. And I can't complain at all because my dining partner loved the etouffée, but did not enjoy the beans and rice as much, which I found to be intoxicating. There's something for everyone in this dish, making it a dish worthwhile to order for the entire table, as it has the potential to satisfy everyone somehow. The jambalaya was on point as well.

Overall, awesome food! Quick service, friendly staff, and wonderfully flavorful and thoughtfully crafted dishes. Try this place out, especially if you're a tourist (like me) and want some nice comforting New Orleans style food. Although I'm not sure how much fidelity Oceana has with what is considered "true" New Orleans style cuisine (truth be told, this place has a somewhat commercialized, mainstream vibe to it), not having eaten much of it. Regardless their quality of food is definitely working out for them and is super tasty.
The food was okay but the service by Chris M. was excellent!!!  He was super attentive. Offered to exchange a few plates we weren't happy with.

Pretty great place. Waited 20 minutes for seat in the height of lunchtime. Not too shabby. Service was awesome. Everyone was so kind and helpful. Crab cake app was my favorite thing. So dang tasty. The sauce was so good!!!  Fried shrimp po boy was great but they skimped big time on the sauce, but when I asked for a side of the sauce, the sandwich got a whole lot tastier. Fried Gator was pretty good too.

Hit this place for our first meal in NOLA. Solid 4 1/2 stars. Right off of bourbon st, so depending on when you go, the crowd outside can be a little wild. The inside of the place is ok, but has a super cute courtyard where we asked to be seated. 

Service was prompt and friendly. My friend and I got hurricanes, and shared the special of blackened red fish pontchartrain over jalapeño stuffing with shrimp and garlic sauce. Please do yourself a favor and get this!! Finished it out with a bread pudding which was to die for!! Just delicious in all the right ways!! So many other places to visit, but glad we started off our trip here!!

Def recommend this place 1000% percent! Our host Amethyst was probably the best we've had in a couple of years. Very warming and just amazing overall! We had a party of 9 and let me say we didn't have to sit around for her to come by and make sure we were ok. We will def be coming back.

The overall customer service and food is AMAZING!!! Brian was our server, and he provided us with AWESOME customer service!!! Whenever you're in NOLA, be sure to stop by here!!!!!! I'm currently full, tipsy, and satisfied!!!!!
Everything, and I do mean everything, was absolutely divine! I almost licked the oyster shells, lol!

We heard a lot about the delicious breakfast so we decided to go to Oceana..I had Eggs Benedict and my wife had Country Breakfast...delicious...coffee was good and strong...staff was very nice and all had masks and gloves on...stop in and give them a try!!
Came here for breakfast. The food was delicious, and the Cajun Bloody Mary was great! The staff was also super friendly, and the patio had a great atmosphere.
Oceanas grill was amazing! Food was wonderful and the drinks were not watered down! Fiona our waitress was the best! Hands down the best food and service we got while here!
Errol is awesome.  We go to oceana grill everything we visit new orleans.  Food and service are exemplary!

I was told this place wouldn't disappoint- and it didn't! The wait wasn't too long and we were seated upstairs. We were a party of 6 and I enjoyed not being split up. Fiona, our waitress, pretty much made our night there. Very helpful, giving us advice and recommendations on food and drinks to have. We ordered many dishes and all were good! She even entertained us by playing "card roulette", picking a credit card from the stack as to who will pay the bill. It was hilarious! Overall, a great night- would definitely go back when visiting the city again!

Overpriced tourist trap. Seems like most of the good reviews don't come from locals, which is understandable. Wait staff was friendly for the most part. But the food...is....blaaand. Don't waste your money if you're looking for authentic New Orleans food.

Oceana has always been one of my favorite places in the quarter.  There was a 20 minute wait because they are not able to get fully staffed up yet.  Once seated we had a great experience and very good food.  We will be back.
Markesha was great, service was perfect, food was delicious. Alligator sausage + biscuits are good!

Man, I came here twice on my last trip and both times were ridiculous. 

I came here just a few hours after having brunch at Atchafalaya and over ate there, but my friend had just rolled into town and was hungry and when she asked, "Is this place good?" I enthusiastically said hell yeah it's good!

And so we split the fried zucchini appetizer and the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta entree. Roll me out the door, jesus I was having trouble. Shrimp and alligator sausage with onions, bell peppers in a Creole sauce, tossed with fettuccine pasta. I'd skip the zucchini to be honest, the batter was bland and didn't hold the zucchini too well. But that pasta, rich and flavorful and silky with sauce. 

Then I came back for one last meal before leaving town like I did years ago. Ordered the same thing as last time, The Royal Omelet: alligator sausage, egetables, topped with a crawfish and mushroom cream sauce with hash browns and a biscuit. But I started with the bloody mary, and the bartender asks do I want to make it an "Ultimate" with shrimp and oysters and I say yeah sure. When he doesn't take my order for the entree I flag him down, cuz I have a flight to catch, and he asks if I'm sure cuz that's a lot of food. I laughed, I said it was fine, whatever seafood they were putting on that thing I could handle. 

Well....there's really not a nicer way to be proved wrong. So the thing is an appetizer, not a bloody mary, and I want one now. I want one tomorrow. There's not really a bad time to order one...except for maybe when you've been eating like this for a week and told yourself you were just going to order one thing this time. Drinks aren't supposed to count. 

It's got an entire soft shell crab on it. Just to start. Two olives for eyes, two green beans for...antennae? It's got a face. Did I mention my bloody mary has a face? Oh how she looks at me with warmth and affection. Behind her, on skewers, are 6 fried shrimp, and 6 fried oysters. And a string of  5 pearl onions and 5 peppers in case you wanted a little more to nosh on. 

I was dying. I wanted to eat so much more than I did that morning but it just wasn't possible. I don't even remember the entree. I know they slathered honey butter on the biscuit - I was so full I was delirious. I remember stumbling out of there in search of my third cup of coffee just so I could make it to the airport. 

Music was just right: Jack and Diane, Zeppelin, Jimi, Beatles, Tom Petty. 

Thanks Oceana, I love you guys.
Best dessert ever - bananas foster ice cream cake. Also the crawfish mushroom cream sauce is a must have. And our waitress Sierra was very helpful and amazing.
Definitely Worth it, stop in and get the oysters! Good service too with a smile! Had to stop in for my trip for sure...

Came to Oceana Grill on the late night while I was in town for my birthday.
