My date and I were the second to last table to be seated because we came so late but the bartender and waitress still gave us great service. We had the famous oysters, gumbo and shrimp with crawfish along with a few drinks. Everything was exceptional, it was the start of a great birthday night.

Let me start by saying that everyone from the hostess  to the waiter were amazing, I just wish the food was as great as the staff. The Gumbo was lacking in substance and flavor.  The jambalaya was could and the rice was over cooked and mushy. The Red Beans were Amazing! The cocktail was fun but weak.

Great service! Jaime L was very attentive and gave me special attention and complimentary items for my birthday :) she brought us a wet rag to wash our hands after ribs after we asked for more wet naps!
The food is great, the Po'Boys are large, super filling, and oh so tasty! Crabcakes and Cajun fries with gator bites da bomb!

This restaurant has a weird vibe, the staff as well. My chicken fettuccine Alfredo was good however one piece of chicken was undercooked and pink in the middle, and the portion was small. The praline brownie is amazing.

This place was great, our server Ashleigh was personable and warm.  She was very precessional and made our experience even better!  The food was good and we got a little discount for using Yelp! Great experience!
The food was amazing! Best Alfredo sauce I have ever had! And the crab cakes are phenomenal! We will definitely come back.
Everything we had was awesome.  Eggplant App. Chargrilled Oysters, Mardi Gras pasta, Blackened Redfish stuffed with seafood dressing.  Natalie was an awesome waitress.  Dinner was fab!

We wanted to end our last meal with some crawfish so we found this little gem right near Bourbon Street.  We were seated right away down stairs and ordered drinks and apps.  BBQ shrimp, crawfish fries with fried gator added, margarita, sazarac were brought to the table hot along with our fried ice bubbling drinks.  The fries were outstanding, the shrimp good.  My main dish was the crawfish and shrimp pasta which was good but a bit under seasoned.  The redfish was my husbands dish and he really liked it.  My daughter had the shrimp fettuccine and enjoyed hers also.  Crawfish boil was my other kids dish and she liked it so much she ordered two.  We ended with some yummy bread pudding.  Very good restaurant for some drinks, food and NOLA ambiance.

Very busy Saturday night, keep this in mind. Alligator bites, in both blackened and fried were delicious. They came out late after the waiter ordered them incorrectly. However, he was exceptionally nice and very attentive. The crab cakes were very good and the burger on French bread my wife ordered was delicious as well my forst attempt at mustard greens and I was impressed. All in all, good experience, good food, and pretty good service. We would come back on our next trip.

Was a little disappointed in the food.  Got the sampler thing and didn't love the meal.   Prices were pretty good compared to other places that offered the same thing.  My wife liked the clams but I didn't care for them much.  The line outside was about 20 deep when we got there but only took about 10 mins to get a table.  Considering how crowded the place was at about 7:00 on a Tuesday night, other people are really
enjoying the food.   But didn't really hit the spot with me.
All the way from KY this place was the perfect Cajun experience, Alecia was so hospitable and fun !! Loved the atmosphere, and food !!
The food was really good! Great customer service by our server Fiona!! Recommend if you love seafood. If you don't they have plenty of other foods.

We were referred here by a local friend.  The line gets long but I promise you, it's worth it! But I mean..It was easily an hour, waiting in a line down the street. And when we left it was even longer! So really, be prepared and try to go during the off times.

The minute we made it through the doors, the staff was super friendly! Now that's what I'm talking about!  Give us that Louisiana hospitality! 

Our waiter was friendly and offered suggestions, which we gladly took.  

My favorite was that oysters! I mean, holy hell these things are AMAZING!  Of course I ate my way through NOLA with the mindset of finding the best Shrimp & Grits. There's did not disappoint!

What I learned in Louisiana was that there are a million ways to make shrimp& grits! Not one place I visited had a familiar taste. It's amazing how the cooks here can be so creative with such simple ingredients!

This place rocks! I will definitely come back next time I find myself in NOLA!

No trip to New Orleans happens without including a trip to Oceana Grill.  We love the atmosphere, service and it goes without saying the food.  Thanks Brad for the stellar service.  He asked the chef if he would accommodate the request to separate the porterhouse and cook the two pieces to our liking.  One medium well and the other medium.  The chef did it.  So we each got our favorite cuts of steak cooked how we liked it and he even split the sides.  Belly full.  Pocket book paid for one meal. Take note!

Not as good as the reviews lead you to believe. The grilled oysters are not as good as Acme. The fried crawfish are to spicy. They also use seasoning with msg. Not good for those of us who are allergic to msg. Service is very good.

A good place to get some fried goods in French Quarter. The dining environment is okay - noisy, casual and you can see the waiting line outside which reminds you of the wait again. We got a seafood platter and a shrimp po boy. Everything tasted fresh and crispy on the outside and tender and juicy on the inside. The Cajun fries was well seasoned and crispy. 

Make a reservation before you go if you don't want to wait for a long time.
This place is amazing! The food was scrumptious and the staff highly professional. The perfect place to grab a bite when visiting New Orleans.

Oceana is a great spot in New Orleans if you're looking for a boozy brunch for a group! The food is hit or miss but they can seat larger parties and have a patio, and also sell mimosas by the bottle. It's right across from Royal Sonesta if you're staying there.

All staffs were amazing, especially Mary our waitress.  We got the seafood platter, Oceania's famous oysters, and a cup of seafood gumbo.  The seafood platter was okay.  The seafood gumbo was really good, and the oysters was phenomenon.  We recommend both the osyters and the gumbo.  We finished with a bread pudding and itwas delicious, fresh, and chunky textured.  Mary was fast, friendly and smart. The overall experience was amazing.

I left one restaurant to come here and it was completely worth it. We tried the fried alligator bites, Cajun fries, and crab cake pasta. Everything was delicious. Our waiter, Chris was friendly and professional. I will be in New Orleans for the next few days and will definitely be back to visit. This restaurant has gained a new repeated customer.
Collin with two LL's is the best. Service 5 stars. Food 5 stars. Balcony overlooking the best crowd in town. 5 stars. HIGHLY recommend the service.

Stumbled onto this place after leaving the mango daiquiri place below on the corner. Firstly I was surprised how big it is. Consisting of a few levels.  We were greeted and seated on the 2nd Level right away.  The server recommended their Cadillac margarita which I tried and was pleased with. They didn't hold back on the liquor! I ordered the Cajun pasta for lunch which came with shrimp and alligator sausage.  It was good, the noodles cooked evenly and the sauce was just enough. Let me add that they layer that thang with tons of shrimp and sausage so you will leave full. Garlic bread was just okay and nothing special but all and all it's a place I'd visit again.
This was SO GOOD!! The line to get in moves fast, the service was quick and the food was delish.

Excellent! Excellent! Excellent! Walking Bourbon St I was looking for the best Poboy. I was sent to Oceana Grill and they did not disappoint. The food was fantastic. The service was even better! We had a large party of 9 and everyone's food came out within minutes of each other. We each loved our food so much we shared it with one another. The best part was that we had one main server but when other servers walked by they asked us if we needed anything. We will be going back before our trip is over! I ordered the catfish poboy blackened... best I ever had!!

Kinda meh.  Nothing wrong with the food per se, just nothing distinguishing about it from literally hundreds of other places. Very touristy atmosphere.

Doing well with covid precautions- good airflow and spacing.
Went for dinner and breakfast. Both were delicious and large portions. Are way too much because portions are generous. My favorites were bread pudding dessert and French toast for breakfast.
We ordered take-out from Oceana!  We ordered their famous crab cakes appetizer, oyster poboy, blackened redfish topped with crawfish cream sauce, and barbecued shrimp!  Delicious Cajun Cuisine!
Megan is AWESOME!!!! Try the crab cakes and the redfish! Sit outside! Enjoy ya self :)
Awesome food!!! Barbecue shrimp was beyond amazing. Our waiter Jazz was very attentive and friendly. 100% coming back before we leave!!
Great meal. Try the Red Fish special. None better ANYWHERE. Loved Mary and Darrick- such excellent attentive service for our party of 20. Everyone left full and happy!!!
Excellent breakfast and superb lunch!! Everything is delicious.

This place had the best oysters compared to the other places we visited while in New Orleans. We also had their Cajun fries which were served in a huge bowl and were just so delicious. The service was good and the food was even better, we will be returning for sure.

We found this restaurant on Yelp. Oceana Grill was excellent. Much better than Acme Oystet House.  Every dish we ordered was amazing. Oceana Red great. Raw oysters large and flavorful,  seafood gumbo delicious,  Roasted oysters fantastic. Alligator nuggets super good.

Everything we had was delicious.  We decided to order two meals to share. The portions were very generous and we weren't able to finish it all. The Oceana Redfish was melt in your mouth goodness and the greens served with it were very good. Shrimp and grits wasn't on the menu but I asked for them and the chef made me the best shrimp and grits I have ever put in my mouth. Topped it all off with a hurricane. Delish! The service was superb and fast! We had Alex and he was amazing. I will go here every time i am in New Orleans no doubt! It's a winner!

This has been my favorite place we've been so far in New Orleans. Oysters were great, crab cake was great, and the crawfish beignets were amazing. Jacelynn was our server and she was so nice and helpful. Will definitely go back
This is the best restaurant I've eaten from in my 4days of being in New orleans.. there's a bit of a wait but the food is quite excellent. Definitely recommended

What to get:
- gumbo (absolutely amazing. Great flavor especially with a dash of their crystal hot sauce)
- Oceana's famous oysters (cooked oysters drowned in a citrusy, buttery, herby marinade. A bang of flavor that tastes great with hot sauce too. Actually everything tastes great with hot sauce) 
- A Taste of New Orleans (on the salty side, but good flavors of the seafood) 

Long line outside but it goes by fast! You could pick yourself up a $6 daiquiri down the street while you wait and be in a great mood for your meal!

The service was quick and helpful, but the food was just okay. We had the crab cakes, which were good. They were also fairly large, so it was a good start. I ordered the deluxe hamburger (I don't love seafood). The fries were great but the hamburger was dense. It was hard to eat, quite frankly. My sister had the red beans and rice, and she thought it was good. All in all, I think the restaurant was okay, just don't get the burger.
I tried a few PoBoys from different places and this is still, hands down, my favorite!! Every time I'm in NOLA i will definitely stop in.

I have eaten here before and the food was decent but, not last night. I really really hate to give out one star reviews, especially when the server tried so hard to make it right but the food last night left me no option. 

I get you want to make a profit but, saving money by buying frozen product from the mass restaurant supply house and trying to pass it off as quality is not the way to do it. When I spend $100 for a meal I expect quality. 

We started with a pair of crab cakes. I have had these before and they were good. Not this time. Can you say breading with a little crab meat?   The breading should hold the crab meat together, it should not be 50% of the crab cake.

On to the entrees. My Bride was on a hunt for fried shrimp, having had the shrimp last year, she ordered the fried shrimp platter and I ordered the pasta special. 

My pasta: Alfredo Sauce with blackened shrimp and crawfish that was ok at best.  The blackened crawfish and shrimp were like rubber. I would give it a solid 2.

My Bride's fried shrimp platter took the prize. The breading was so thick you could peal it off the shrimp in chunks. The breading should be light and it should not weigh more than the shrimp itself. This was frozen, prepackaged, mass marketed shrimp. To top it off the shrimp and the hush puppies were fried in old grease.

Here's why I was reluctant to pass out the one star.  Our waiter really tried to make it right. He had the cook come out who immediately apologized and offered to bring her a new one.  Within a few minutes a new platter piled high with shrimp arrived. Unfortunately you can't fix something if all you have is frozen product combined with bad grease. I really appreciated the extra effort our waiter provided.

I'm guessing there will be more one and two star reviews in the future .........
The portions were very large but everything was very good. Crab cakes were excellent. Cajun Jamba Pasta was great.

Food: The food was incredible. The absolute best item was the bread pudding. I'll definitely keep going back to get it. It was sensational. The oysters with the sauce were incredible. I didn't love the beans from the taste of New Orleans but the other two dishes were good. The crab cakes were very salty but the rice was amazing. The gator bites were also really good.

Vibe: The vibe of the venue and the staff was absolutely incredible. They were super fast and friendly and helpful. I forgot my phone and the waiter chased me in the street to hand it back. Absolutely wonderful and would definitely keep going back.
Super delicious crab cake and nice service. Great dinner!

Pasta fire. Friendly must go to.

Yup yup i do unlike sea food but the pasta is some of the best
Everything on the menu excites. Recommend the Catfish Po boy and the crab cakes. 4 stars because service could have been better.

This spot did an amazing job for brunch even though they were clearly understaffed.  One waitress for the entire second floor and she apologized for the kitchen being backed up.  That said we didn't wait that long and the food was perfect.  We had the eggs Benedict and I always split this with my husband.  The problem is I like a hard yolk and he likes a soft yolk.  At Oceana that's no problem.    The dessert crepe was huge.  I would definitely recommend this place.

We were arriving pretty late into the city and this was one of the restaurants open later. So we made sure to get a reservation earlier which it for sure what you should do because when arriving there the line for walk in was horrendous. One down side is that it's right in the middle of bourbon street so going late at night might not be the best idea because of how rowdy it is. The wait for food was very long. The drinks we ordered were terrible and my food was cold. Don't recommend going here especially when there are so many other amazing restaurants to choose from. I got the crab cakes which we cold and just not tasteful at all.
Amazing, killer crab cakes! The staff is awesome, not too packed, great drinks, great prices. Love that they put Cajun seasoning on the table.

This place is a total scam. The food is gross and not very quality. I was fooled by how many reviews they had and the Yelp rating. I ordered the seafood platter for $26 and it all tasted bland and fishy. Even the fries :(. The hurricane was the best thing I ordered. They serve it in dry ice so it comes out bubbling and smokey. Looks pretty cool. The service was decent and to give the server credit, she did reccomend getting anything blackened but I didn't listen to her. Either way for $100 meal I left feeling ripped off and disappointed. Definitely will not go back.
The food is delicious, every bite. We had the blackened catfish. The waiters are pleasant and bring a smile. Thanks.

For dining in the French Quarter this is one of your better bets.  Minus some lukewarm and average gumbo, we liked our meal at Oceana Grill.  This is New Orleans-style comfort food and you had better bring your appetite because the servings are enormous.  My blackened redfish covered in a creamy roux and alligator sausage was so good, especially with smoky greens and a bed of cornbread and crawfish stuffing.  Delicious!  Seafood was lightly fried and not at all greasy.  The entree portions are massive and could have been easily split with someone.  The service was okay; our sweet waitress did her best was clearly stretched too thin that night.  Atmosphere wise, it's a lively place so don't come here for quiet, romantic dinner.

We went at an off time and made a reservation and there were plenty of tables open. We were taking upstairs to enjoy our meal. Wine and beer list were fair, but we all found something to have. But the food menu had really great options and everyone really enjoyed what they got. My husband got the fried shrimp platter, let me tell you, don't skip out on the jalapeño hush puppies - delish! I had the chicken alfredo but subbed in blackened chicken and it was nothing less than amazing - the Alfredo is definitely from scratch and the blackened chicken just took it up a notch. I also added a crab cake to my meal and it was very good. My sister for the special, stuffed salmon on rice with greens and she said it was great. My BIL got the crawfish/creole pasta (I think?) and he liked his as well - I didn't try it. The one downside to our meal was the rolls they served with the pasta, they were pulled straight from a package not even warmed up (we had food a plenty so it was not a big deal by any means, but it made us laugh since everything else was superb). The service was great, we didn't wait too long for our meal or drinks. We will definitely be back next time we are here and will highly recommend.

It was our first night in New Orleans and our flight came in a little late.  Not wanting to waste our first night, my friends and I hit the French Quarter to look around, grab a few drinks, and get a bite to eat.  We didn't really know where to start so we looked on Yelp to find a place that had a variety of offerings so that we could get a feel for what we might have to look forward to during our trip.  

We ordered the crab cake appetizer, fried shrimp platter, fried seafood platter, and a couple of Hurricanes and Swamp Tea to drink.  The food was fine.  You really can't go wrong with fried seafood & fries, the crab cakes were filling and satisfying, and the drinks were refreshing.  All in all, a solid first meal for a couple of hungry tourists.    

Though he kept forgetting our order, our server was friendly and it was fine that he left us alone to enjoy our food for most of the time.  The biggest plus was that the restaurant was quite large and we didn't have to wait for a table.

Oceana was very good there was a little over 15 minute wait, and we were promptly seated in a Friday evening. Service was excellent and food was amazing. We loved the decor and our waitress was really helpful. I ordered the gator bites Appetizer, red beans and rice, and Gumbo. I would recommend the BBQ shrimp which was very flavorful. 

We really enjoyed everything. Portion sizes are nice and prices are reasonable. Only regret is that we were too full for dessert because they truly looked amazing!!!

Delicious New Orleans fare with nice ambiance. The  Oyster Rockefeller was very good, as well as the Blackened Bayou Duck. The server was friendly and attentive. All in all, a great place for seafood in the French Quarter! We're just a couple of tourists from the Midwest, but we'd totally recommend this place to others.

I did my research before my trip to New Orleans and the other reviews did not steer me wrong. First off the staff, Corey was our waiter and he was so genuine and attentive. He asked our names and used them the whole time, he was engaging and asked about where we were from. He always had refills ready we didn't have to ask and he checked in on us regularly. Even when we left every staff member we passed thanked us for our visit. Next the food the Cajun fries were unbelievably delicious. The mix of sauce, cheese , and seafood was so good and made me angry that I had waited this long to taste something so good. The blackened salmon was an off the menu special that Corey recommended and I was glad he did. The fish was perfectly cooked and seasoned and the crab cakes were divine. The rice was fluffy and flavorful and the greens were a perfect balance to the meal. I highly recommend this place , you won't be disappointed.
Great food, pasta was fresh and food came out quick. Staff was friendly and the place seemed pretty clean. Oh yeah and their margaritas are good!

There was quite a long line outside the door when we arrived at 6:30 on a Friday and the line was still there after we finished our dinner. I'm not sure what all the hype is about because the food was good but not like out of this world great.

My party ordered multiple rounds of the fried seafood platter and Cajun fries. The Cajun fries were unexpected but had so many toppings and sauce to them that made it fire. We also liked the Oceana Famous Oysters (chargrilled). As for drinks, the margaritas came bubbling! Very cool. It was slow to order and receive our drinks though.

For some reason they didn't accept our Yelp check in offer of 10% off the bill. Something to do with the fact that we made a reservation...which makes no sense why that would matter. Anyways, try the check in offer, but it might not work.

My wife and i happened upon this restaurant while wandering the french quarter on our last day in town. It was the charming courtyard that drew us in, but the food, drinks and service made this a memorable experience. Our server recomended the blackened gator bites and he knocked it out ofthe park with that recomendation. I liked it so much i ordered it in po boy form for my entree. My wife ordered a bowl of the seafood gumbo and it was fantastic!

Staff friendly... Line was long, but moved fast for a Friday night. I ordered the fried oyster platter $21.00. It was fried well, but lacked taste. They did not have honey mustard. How can I eat fried oysters with no honey mustard, really?
We asked some police officers where they would recommend and they spoke highly of this place and it did not disappoint! Definitely a great experience.

Every time we come to New Orleans this spot is a must visit! We ate here lastnight, our sever was so helpful and calm even though we came at 12:30 (they close at 1am). However we received our food fast, it was nice and fresh. Loved the gumbo, the crab cakes the fried gator and the baked oysters! Margaritas were good as well.

Not sure if this is a tourist trap of a restaurant....it might be...but I don't give a d*mn because the food was sure delicious! And no, I wasn't drunk....completely sober while consuming my dinner here, thank you very much.

Menu consisted of mostly seafood (we ordered some very flavorful sautéed redfish with shrimp crème sauce on top and a side red beans and rice), different kinds of po-boy sandwiches, gumbo, oysters, pastas and even a small selection of vegetarian options. 

We came here for dinner on a late Friday night....close to about 9pm and there was still a line out the door. Don't worry, line went by pretty quick...I'd say we only had to wait for about 10 minutes.

This place is slightly overrated.
Don't get me wrong: it's a standard, solid  Louisiana bar serving local specialties, but I didn't feel the "wow" in my mouth that I expect from a 4 stars yelp restaurant based on so many reviews.

First, the place itself: very dark (ground floor). The server was really nice, attentive and service was fast.

The best dish was probably the alligator starter (blackened). On demand they can cook both styles (blackened and breaded). The blackened alligator is a must try. 4.5 stars.

Gumbo: nice! one of the best I had with chunks of crab and various seafood. I loved working on the small pieces of crab shell. 4.5 stars.

The blackened redfish was served with a light crust on it. Iw as  surprised. Mayeb the waite got the wrong order. Good but not as good as Zydeco's red fish. 3.5 stars.

Cajun jambalaya seafood pasta: way too much sauce. Noodles drenched (not to say "swimming") in sauce. It was nice but sauce should have been lighter. Contains lot of shrimps n seafood. 2.5 to 3 stars.

BBQ shrimps. Too salty but I had a bash. Very fresh and tasty sauce. 3.5 stars.

My bloody marry was over salty, I couldn't finish it.1 star.

This place was definitely one of my favorites during my NOLA trip. The crab cakes were so delicious as was the seafood gumbo. For an entree my friend and I split the taste of New Orleans....it was such a big portion! We showed up without any reservations. It took about 10-15 minutes to be seated. Once we got to the table the service was friendly and pretty fast.
I've been to Oceana a few times now and they never disappoint! The mushroom sauce on the crab cakes is heavenly! Good portion sizes! I couldn't believe how big the cup of gumbo was!
Our food wasn't good at all. We actually ended up just throwing everything away. We were so disappointed.

10pm was rapidly approaching and our options were dwindling by the minute. We didn't want to walk into a place that was about to close, for several reasons: angry staff, being rushed, old food - the usual. 

This place was in my tags, had a check-in offer and stays open late. Ratings seemed good enough... decision made. Seeing the line to get in sealed the deal. Everyone knows that if there's a line, it's worth waiting for!

When our turn came, the host walked/slid us to the table (potentially a thick coat of grease on the floor) and pointed out the restrooms as we passed. It's on the corner of Bourbon St, so, restrooms are a hot commodity - great start.

Drink order was taken right away, also ordered a crab cake app. They split the app into 2 plates for the 2 of us, fabulous, but this is where it gets complicated. Someone else's plate was placed on our table & the server walked away. She then came back, picked it up & served it - served food from our table that hadn't even remained in sight. 

About this time we were presented with the worst bloody mary of the trip, possibly the worst I've ever had. But 1 bite of crab cake and all was forgiven. They were excellent, possibly the best I've ever had. Drinks + Apps = a wash.

Entrees were good - my husband's (blackened) better than mine (redfish). If I had to guess, I'd guess the greens were canned. I find mashed potatoes an odd fish accompaniment, texturally. 

The crab cakes were the standout & blackened fish the runner up. The bloody mary, a disaster.

They needed a reminder to adjust the bill for the check-in offer, but gladly did so. Service was good, especially for being so busy. We were checked on regularly and offered refills. Water was presented without asking. Before departing, we were reminded about the restrooms.

Would I go back? Definitely, if only for crab cakes. Unfortunately, I can't rate higher given the bad drink & the major fail of re-serving food.

My first time to New Orleans with a group of friends & we saw some recommendations to come here. & I'm so glad we did. We go the taste of New Orleans, gumbo, fried seafood platter, & Mardi Gras pasta. 

The taste of New Orleans was worth the price as we were able to try multiple amazing dishes in one. The gumbo was amazing with perfectly cooked rice. & then you have the pasta. You can taste every ingredient in every bite. 

The catfish on the seafood platter was the best part. Not a huge fan of the rest of the plate, but that catfish was worth it.

Definitely go here if you're in the French quarter area.

I was suppose to be trying a well rated restaurant. Once I ordered my food the meal was not good at all, very bland with no impressive sides to go along with the fish that I ordered. I got the Redfish Oceana and was not very happy with the taste of the food and could not truly enjoy my meal without trying to constantly wash it down with water. I spoke with a family member who previously ate there months prior to my visit and they stated similar experiences. I am unsure why this place is rated so highly when the seasoning were subpar.

With a party of six we sampled a lot. The consensus was very favorable on all menu items. Two minor notes were the ribs had "an excess of sauce" but then that's what happens when ordering ribs at a seafood place. Also my Jambalaya pasta while excellent in flavor was surprisingly not very spicy. I was still very pleased and did not waste a bite.

We never realized they served breakfast, our hotel recommended them and I will say as much as we've enjoyed dinner there our breakfast was better. Best meal we had in our 3 days there. One of the reason was the service we got, probably the only place that the service was spot on, quick refills on coffee and water, food was served hot, servers were gracious and most important when we told them we were there to celebrate a birthday, they took the time to wish my daughter a happy birthday, the only place that did, her 21st so it was a special one. We put Oceana on our must return list.

Went here on the 25 of March for lunch/dinner and it was excellent. The wait was not to bad the service was excellent and the food was and drinks was on point. Will definitely be back here next time I visit
Food was amazing . I had the bbq shrimp , the red beans and rice and some of the best oysters I have ever tasted. Next time I'm in NOLA I def will be coming back.

Yum yum yum... breakfast is served form 8am - 1pm and I thought seafood in omelettes sounds strange ... I was wrong. I ordered an egg white shrimp and crab omelette . The dish came with hash browns and a delicious honey biscuit. My friend ordered the hash and loved it ! The French toast was not good at all. The bread that was used was hard and too chewy at the same time. Overall the place was a great spot for breakfast and the menu had so many great options!
Me and my husbands first time here and we enjoyed it dearly. The food was good and our server Errol was great. He anticipated our needs and made our visit that more memorable.

I didn't eat anything because seeing a roach scurry out of food killed my appetite. My husband ate an oyster and a roach crawled, from the plate, onto the table. The server offered to have his raw oysters remade. We didn't want food from there, after the roach, so we politely declined. We trapped the  roach,  under my husband's glass. The server said that the manager would have to come out to take the food that we ordered off of our bill. We waited for the manager. We asked three other people for the manager. The roach was still hanging out with us. So GROSS!!! The hostess came over a second time, my husband lifted the glass to show our new unsanitary dinner companion off. The hostess asked him to put the glass back because she was grossed out. She didn't just eat the food. The rest of our food came to the table. We, again, politely declined eating anything else. Honestly, neither of us had any desire to even look at food anymore. My husband felt ill after having a roach scurry from the plate that he just ate from. We really wanted to leave. The server proceeded to wait on another table, before allowing us to leave. It was the most awkward situation. We never saw a manager. No one took the bug or gave us anything to dispose of it into. No one apologized.

The taste of New Orleans is tasty meal. This place lives up to the hype and reviews. Located just off Bourbon Street so the location is good too. The servers (Jessica and Taylor) are very helpful and friendly.
Great choice while in NOLA.
Went there for dinner and they had an awesome bartender who waited on us, Derrick. He was informative, funny and attentive. The food is always good and plenty of it!

This was our first meal in NOLA. It was amazing! We talked about it the entire trip and compared everything else to it. They had inside dining, very cool atmosphere, extremely nice staff that seemed proud to be there and the food was ridiculously good all around. I had the blackened redfish which was perfect. The portions are generous and everything was flavored well without being cliche' Cajun. It's a little pricey, but that is expected given the locale. Very highly recommended! Get the greens...

I'm a New Orleans local and I don't believe in good Cajun cooking outside of the home but this place proves me wrong every time. Server Chris definitely made the experience worth it. Will continue to visit!!

Depends on what you order here for sure, but came yesterday ate the trio...it wasn't great for the price but came back today for more gumbo and a Poboy, it was amazing!! We also had a really great waiter, David A, according to receipt, so shout outs to him! Great customer service, both days a manager came up to us and asks how it was, I do have much appreciation for places like that.
Great find in the Quarter. They are known for their crab cakes...did not disappoint!!!
Quick delivery to our hotel in the French quarter. Food was excellent. Blackened alligator bites were the best
The food was great (jambalaya pasta, fries, etc.). The service was great and the bread pudding is definitely worth going back for.

Located steps away from Bourbon Street, you're close to all the crazy. We came here for a super late dinner before going out to Bourbon for the night, so this location was perfect for our plans. We had also dropped by Frenchmen St right before and had a couple of drinks so none of us realized how hungry we were until the food came and we DEVOURED it. People are lined up outside the door and theres a small bench inside meant for one or two groups to sit down and wait to be seated. When we saw the line, we were about to leave, but the hostess reassured us that the wait was only about 5-10 minutes. 

Thank goodness we didn't choose to go somewhere else before asking, because the food here did not disappoint! We were seated within 10 minutes just like the hostess said and of course I jumped right on Yelp to look at pictures of what to order. You also receive a sweet 10% discount for checking in! Our table shared the alligator appetizer, fries with a crawfish sauce poured on top, jambalaya pasta, and trio sampler with gumbo, jambalaya, and etouffee. 5 stars all around. We sat in silence for a solid 15 minutes chowing down and by the next time our waitress strolled around we had licked the plates clean. 

Thanks to Yelp for always having a girls back and giving us pictures of the fries with this godlike crawfish sauce thing that I don't remember the name of but was not on the menu. I saw the picture on Yelp and pointed it out to our waitress to order. Highly recommend!

The Covid Crisis has certainly hit all the restaurants in the French Quarter.  Many have closed forever.  Luckily, the Oceana Grill is still open, although unlike the lines of old, you can walk right in and still get a great meal.  I had their famous barbecue shrimp and my husband had the redfish dinner special.  It is sad to see only five tables of people inside this usually bustling establishment, but hats off to them for keeping the quality high and the service fast and well-organized.  Help them out and go there while you're in New Orleans.

Saw the reviews on Yelp and decided to try breakfast; it was amazing!  I had the French Toast with strawberries and the hubs had Cajun omelette and both were amazing! Can't wait to try lunch or dinner on our next trip!

You have to go here and get the blackened alligator bites!  The food is amazing!  We loved our seafood platter and finished this very large meal with the banana fosters ice cream cake. The portions are large so it's enough to split between two (unless you are really hungry). Definitely a must

My first visit to NOLA. Came across Oceana on Yelp and decided to try them. There was a little line outside the door which moved pretty quickly. We were greeted by all the staff from front, middle to the end.  Our server Derrick was very knowledgeable about the menu and made some
Great recommendations for food and drink. He was attentive and very polite. We enjoyed everything including the alligator! First time trying! It was delicious!

in a crowded place in french quarters. quite busy even in 11pm. service is very good. very friendly and polite staff. raw oysters are great, fresh and fat. gator bite is good but not stand out. crab cake is also very delicious. the gumbo is quite mediocre. Overall, despite the generally good food, the price does not match the quantity and quality of the food. a little too pricey.

We were so excited to come here and try the ultimate Cajun plates. I went with the jambalaya shrimp pasta we also ordered the gator bites my husband with the seafood platter.  

Jambalaya shrimp pasta was to die for. My mouth is watering as I write this review. The pasta was cooked perfectly ( al diente). The shrimp was so fresh and tasty as any seafood in NOLA.  The food was as expected fresh and tasty our waiter was so good very attentive. Service in this place is magnificent!!!  


Can't wait to be back. Hands down best food I had in NOLA

I'm really disappointed in myself for coming here. Despite the great reviews, this place is just like any other chain restaurant. I was fooled by great rating into coming here.

Let's back track a little - the service was great, I'll give them that much. But the quality of the food and the atmosphere was very much like an Applebees or Red Lobster. I also only had a long weekend in NOLA and wanted to immerse myself in the culture and authentic food and this was not it. If you're like me, I would not recommend this. 

There are so many places with great quality food in the area.
Love the food , everything we ordered was good , chargrilled oyster, raw oysters , crab cake is no joke!! . Price are very reasonable.
this was the best experience i had in a long time satisfaction guarantee  the food is amazing
Had the crawfish etoufe and jambalaya pasta. Both were great. Service at the bar was excellent thanks to bartender Chris P. Will definitely be back.
Ordered from here twice this weekend! The food is terrific..everything is good! Lines around the block every day, for good reason!

Came here around 9am on Sunday morning after reading the Yelp reviews. I was craving for char-grilled oysters, and was happy to hear they were serving them. Of course we also ordered breakfast dish, which was the crawfish omelette with hashbrowns & biscuit. 

Let me start with the crawfish omelette, since it was served first. The chunks of crawfish sticking out of the omelette made it obvious the restuarant doesn't not skimp on ingredients- or portions. Super yummy breakfast I'd eat for dinner.....but then I also eat oysters for breakfast. 

Next came the dozen char-grilled oysters covered in some type of cajun sauce. Not bad, but I felt it was just a tad on the salty side. 

Oceana is a family friendly restaurant where you know you'll get good food, paired with friendly service. 

The best part is, you get 10% off your bill by  checking-in with Yelp.
Excellent meal! We wanted the real New Orleans eating experience and we got it here. Delicious food and awesome margaritas served by a pleasant waitress. We all thoroughly enjoyed it!

Just landed in New Orleans and the first place we stopped was for lunch at Oceana Grill.  On a 90+ degree day, the wait was thankfully only 15-20 mins.. 

I'd recommend grabbing a margarita while you are wait- they are served with dry ice and chilled perfectly. 
For food we ordered the Fried Alligator Tail , Shrimp Creole, and the Taste of New Orleans.

I wasn't a huge fan of the Shrimp Creole, it is a tomato based dish and it didn't have much spice to it. The Taste of New Orleans was great and I would order it again if we ever go back.   It's a sampler that includes the Creole Jambalya, Crawfish étouffée and Red Beans & Rice. I don't usually like red beans and rice but theirs was sooo good..

Our family was visiting from Florida and stopped in. We absolutely loved this place The staff was super friendly from the moment we walked in and all the way through our meal. Our server Corey was AMAZING!!! The food was delicious from start to finish... very impressed all around!! I highly recommend Oceania!!!

Really solid spot to grab a tasty bite when in the French Quarter! Our first day in the Big Easy  we stopped by here based on the Yelp! reviews and the line was stretched so far down the street we decided to keep on moving. I remember thinking it must be pretty good for all these people willing to wait through that line for it!

Luckily we were walking by earlier and, SCORE!, no line at all! So we moseyed on in and decided that we just wanted to sample a few different things so we ordered the combo platter. We opted for the fried seafood platter ($22.99 I believe. Definitely not the 17.50 it says on their website lol) plus a Diet Coke and a water. With taxes, our tab came to $28.

The combo platter was very tasty and had both of us filled and satisfied at the end! I personally am not big on the oysters, but loved the shrimp and the catfish! 

Jennifer was our server and she provided very good service. Refills were taken care of and we were checked up on several times.

We enjoyed our meal here and would certainly not hesitate to come here again and try even more of their menu!

4 stars.

Our first time eating lunch here and we highly recommend. Our server Megan was incredibly friendly, gave us great menu suggestions and checked up on us regularly without being intrusive. My husband had the Taste of New Orleans Trio, he lived in LA for seven years, said it was the best red beans and rice he's ever had. Shrimp fettuccine and side Cesar for me. Now to walk it off exploring the French Quarter with drinks to go.
We had a reservation but they got us in early. The food was great. The service was just okay. We left full and happy. We might hit them up again before heading back home.

Best Gumbo in town I love how it has the smokiness from the bell peppers and the onions. Highly recommend if you're in the area. I tried alligator meat the first time here the waiter insisted and it was actually pretty good. Fun experience definitely would come back when I'm in the area.
Best crab cakes I've ever had! Crawfish cream sauce is to die for !! Make sure you order the Red Fish Oceana !! And the Bloody Mary there is the best in the quarter.

I was debating to give this a 3 or 2 stars.  We ate her two night as a party of 12. First meal in new orlean was also our best meal and the last was also good. First time we pretty much ordered everything off the menu and it was all great. 

Saturday night we wanted to focus on menu items that we loved during from our first meal. 3 items were missing. One for myself seafood fried dish, bbq shrimp for my mom and a grill oyster. Mom didn't had her bbq shrimp and the adult only had 1 doz of grill oyster both were charged, They did removed my fried seafood cause I guess he didn't want to call me a lair.  Now a side note we had 9 adults and 3 children and 7 of us are in the food industry either owners and manager, so we know it can be difficult. The 2 stars was for manager that came and didn't say a word and the server who made up that he brought the food when most of the apps and half the oyster was brought out by either the chef, Boh manager or runner.  Again not a big deal, I didn't want to continue because we're on vacation and 30 dollars is not worth back and forward. 

Great food tho, we will still make reservations and will keep on recommending this place.
Food here was outstanding. Even better - our food came out scary fast! The staff was also very kind and polite.
The atmosphere and the food was amazing.  Our service was a little bit slow but overall it was a great restaurant to eat at.

Great for a taste of NOLA food. Add this on your To Do List if you're a tourist. I ordered the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta and it was amazing! It was the best out of all the 4 entrees we ordered. We also got the oyster P.O. boy, Taste of New Orleans and Seafood Gumbo. Personally, the seafood gumbo was nothing special. The oyster P.O. boy, don't bother and go with the shrimp..but I don't really fancy oysters. The Taste of New Orleans was just okay. Basically...get the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta. It was perfect for our first meal in NOLA. 

Also, the wait can get long so plan accordingly.

PLEAAAAAASE ! Tell me HOW this place is not a 5 Star ? Felcitia was our server . She was attentive , accurate and recommended us he best stuff ever on the menu . I felt a warm presence the minute she sat us down ! What a FEELING that is to know that you're going to be taken care of before you food even arrives . The setting on this place is super cute , we got an amazing table right by the window where it had patio lights , the drinks were bomb . Idk what else to say but DAAAAAMN !!!!! glad I came here for my first place to eat in New Orleans!
Food was great, servings were a good size and the food came out quickly. Our hostess was knowledgeable and was fantastic! The prices aren't bad either!
I ordered a Mardi Gras pasta. It was average but not worth the price. The brownie dessert was dry I only had three bites of it. Overall, I think this restaurant is overhyped.

I really enjoyed my time here. I came here solo and appreciated the fact that they checked vaccination status and or negative test results before you were allowed to come in. I definitely came during Cowboys Saints game and cowboys are tired but their staff was more than gracious to me. My server Damon was incredible and he provided excellent recommendations before I settled on the seafood omelette and a few mimosas. If I'm ever back in the French quarter, which I probably will be in the coming month, I definitely wouldn't mind coming back here for a quick bite and some beverages.

Had a great time and a better meal. Fiona was great and took her time with us newbies from the desert. Drinks had a heavy pour, which was a good thing cuz I was sooo thirsty. The building was so cool, the hostess was having a rough time but I'm sure it's all due to covid. Things I'm sure like else where aren't the same here. We were recommended by the Omni manager and glad he did. Dinner was awesome as well as my app and dessert. My wife has lots of allergies and they have a separate gluten free menu for those in need. All the staff was so friendly and we.will be back again before we leave town...or the next time we come.

Usually when there is a line for an establishment the food is assumed to be pretty good. Me and the Mrs. Entered and was seated upstairs. A 7 minute wait for our server wasn't pleasant. The server was polite. Ordered a blackened shrimp po'boy, Cajun fries, and etouffe. 

Tell me how do you wait 20 minutes for cold food and upon complaining it takes less than 5 minutes to return with hot food? Answer...you microwave it. If there is one thing I despise is shortcutting quality especially if I'm paying for it. At the end of the day that's unacceptable and if the manager doesn't oversee that, it means that the standard is pretty low to be considered a top 10 restaurant in the USA. 

I wouldn't return.
Breakfast was perfect. This is our go-to place every time we're in New Orleans. The food is great and the service is exceptional.

We saw a huge line out the door but it was going by fast, so we decided to have a quick dinner here while venturing out on Bourbon Street. The restaurant definitely had a cool and casual nautical theme to it. We were seated within 10 minutes which was nice considering how crowded it seemed inside. 

Of course, the menu mostly offered seafood dishes and usual NOLA eats like jambalaya and po'boys. We had the crawfish etouffee plate, which was good but not better than other dishes we have had in the city. It had a good amount of crawfish, but flavors were a little bland. We thought about ordering more, but honestly after this plate, we came to the conclusion that the best food is outside of the French Quarter so we didn't bother.

Overall, I do think it is a good restaurant to visit if you want to stay within the French Quarter; the menu is extensive and the restaurant is a nice place to either have a nice dinner date or have a fun group dinner (we saw at least 3 bachelor/bachelorette party groups the time we went). Also, it's right around the corner from Bourbon Street so you can come here for some eats before getting your party on.

We were there this weekend for a wedding. Best wedding food we've been served in a restaurant.  The red snapper was fantastic.  The Kahlua cake sent my non carb eating self into a carb eating frenzy. Haha.  Drinks were flowing and delish.  Can't wait to go back!
Great food and atmosphere!  Speedy service and our server Ashley was very prompt, attentive and pleasant. Definitely another trip is in order.

First time here 1@ Oceana Grill also 1st. Time in NOLA... so far so good. Oceana grill very good... I had the redfish( blackened ) with a creole sauce, my husband/son had the creole pasta again very good. Waitress / management were sincere and very pleasant. Also price was right . Would definitely recommend this restaurant when in NOLA. BTW our Uber driver recommend this eatery/ bar... good choice

Food was amazing! The second restaurant I tried her in NOLA. Seafood selection was awesome. Truly felt like home cooking when I was eating it. A little on the pricey side compared to other places in the area but fairly large portions. Staff was great.
The wait was long but the food was delicious- had breakfast on Mother's Day. The service was also very good.

In town for work and headed out with a teammate to take a look look around the French quarter. He wanted to try Oceana Grill because it was recommended to him.

It was early, so the restaurant was only about half full. atmosphere was perfect, especially for New Orleans. They had live music going and the place had a great vibe. Our waiter was perfect. Kept our drinks full and loved to talk about sports.

Had red beans and rice with blackened crawfish added on top, while my workmate had blackened chicken. The food was very good and overall it was a wonderful experience.
Amazing food!! The taste of New Orleans and Oysters were delicious!! Their shrimp creole was the best and left you wanting more!! We sat outside by the fountain and it was so nice !

This place right here....was really good. Walking was greeted with nothing but smiles. Was seated quickly, look over the menu and placed our orders. My mom had a cup of gumbo. Daughter had the catfish Po boy. Wife had a shrimp Po Boy. I had the Cajun sausage plate. The gumbo was good. The catfish and shrimp had a very fresh taste. Very well seasoned. The sausage plate was good, the hash browns was cold, but other than that it was good. Our server Pam was on point and very funny. Sorry no pics we dove in....
Love this place! Great food and atmosphere! Staff is amazing. Especially my man Chris M. He took great care of us.
We got in super late and someone recommended Oceana. The food was great and the service was even better. Mary was so sociable, entertaining and a great server. I will be back!
Prompt efficient delivery of great food in the French Quarter.  Have really been enjoying my lunches and late evening suppers.  M. Foley

We were out late and looking for somewhere near Bourbon that would give us some authentic New Orleans creole food. We'd been hearing that this place was all that and a bag of chips so we decided to check it out. 

Definitely some chill casual NOLA vibes with bright red paint mixed with brick walls, neon signs, and all sorts of accouterments decorating the walls..even a couple big fish. We were able to snag a table for two right away and I was excited to find out they not only knew what gluten was, but they even had a dedicated gf menu. Now, to be fair, there wasn't much on this menu, but it was a menu nonetheless!

I went for the gluten free crab cakes which had an awesome remoulade and were served with collard greens and potatoes. The crab cakes were flaky and delicious but the sides were both pretty bland and I left most of them. The husband ordered a po'boy and fries and was pretty happy with his meal overall. We were in and out quickly and able to continue on with our shenanigans. Overall pretty solid place.

Food was amazing. I got the seafood platter. I'm not an oyster fan so i got double shrimp instead....the portions were more than enough. I got my order to go, and the food was wrapped sooo nicely that it stayed hot. Only change i would make would be to separate the meat from fries with foil. The condensation makes the food soggy. The cocktail sauce had the perfect spice to it. I ordered a drink to go and the bartender did her thing. Will definitely be returning. Price was worth it once i saw how much food i actually had.
Visiting New Orleans and definitely recommend this place for dinner!!!! Great food and friendly staff!

First restaurant and food after landing in New Orleans. Food was pretty good. The restaurant is right off of Bourbon St. So right after eating, we were able to walk it off on Bourbon. 

Order:
Louisiana Crab meat cake- It's must. They give you 2 large pieces of crab cakes with crawfish and cream sauce smothered on top. It was delicious. I recommend sharing.

Fried Catfish Po'Boy- Huge sandwich. Fried catfish pieces on 2 large pieces of french bread with coleslaw and fries. It was ok to me. 

Cajun jambalaya pasta- This order never came out. I was quite disappointed because I really wanted to eat it. But I was already full off of the Po'boy and the crab meat cake. So we told them to cancel the order if they didn't start cooking it already. 

The crab meat cake and po' boy was big enough portion for 2 people. I would come back to try their jambalaya pasta next time for sure.
Great food!  Loved the alligator sausage and crab stuffed tuna.  Sierra was great and went out of her way to give us a great experience.

The shrimp po boy, the crab cakes were good. The alligator bites were the best part of the meal. The service was a bit sketchy. I had a bit of an issue with parties behind us being seated ahead and another party seated 15 minutes after us being greeted before us. But, it was Friday and stuff is busy so whatevs.

Ordered some food around 9 pm from the hotel next door. I made sure to get the food when the hostess said it would be ready. 15 min from order time to pick up. The po-boy and fries were cold. The crab cakes (frozen) were also cold. I'm not sure why people say these are the best in New Orleans. They are clearly frozen. The gator bites were a tad warmer than everything else. The two stars are for the hostess who made the pickup easy and quick. 

Gordon Ramsey needs to come back and figure out what's going on.
Amazing staff and shout out to Keith our waiter. Greeted and seated right away. Ordered the Cajun breakfast and st James crepe both amazingly delish. Service was quick and loved the coffee.

This place is so amazing!!! 

I visited here around 11 PM on 8/16/21 with my mother. We were both greeted with a warm welcome at the entrance. At the table, we were served by a wonderful waiter named Corey. He ensured that we had everything we needed, and had a hilarious yet fun personality. 

For food, we ordered the Seafood Gumbo bowl, the Fried Shrimp Po-Boy sandwich, and the Fried Shrimp Platter with Fried Crawfish Tails. The portions were HUGE and everything tasted so good! Each food item was so tasty. I enjoyed the gumbo the most, so I ordered an extra bowl to-go! 

This restaurant also offers a 10% discount when checking in on Yelp. Luckily, I was able to utilize it on the first visit! 

Overall, I am extremely pleased with Oceana Grill. The service and food were impeccable. I would definitely return.

We come here all the time and I'm finally writing a review. This review may be slightly skewed because we first discovered this place on my first trip to NOLA before moving here when I was desperately hungry. 

The place is huge inside so even if you have to wait in line it doesn't usually take to long. And, if it does just pop into the bar next door and grab a to-go drink while you're waiting. There are 2 seating areas downstairs + an outdoor patio and 2 areas upstairs. 

We almost always get the same thing - blackened ahi tuna. The portion size is large and fills you up for sure. We usually swap out the sides for mashed potatoes since theirs are really good. My main call out is that the side of "mixed vegetables" is not a classic veggie medley like you might expect. Rather it's liked some combo of blended greens. Not my favorite honestly and I usually like veggies.
Best po boy ever!!! Megan service was superb. Will definitely recommend this place. My traveling buddy loved it too.
Excellent food!! Delicious drinks! Definitely much better than the other well know restaurant in NoLa (although that one was good too). The bread pudding?!! To die for!!

This restaurant was amazing. The seafood platter, drinks, Cajun fries, and jambalaya pasta was amazing. The prices were reasonable. We sat outside and ate and enjoyed the beautiful weather. Our waiter, Kevin M. was super awesome, helpful, and professional. There was no wait when we arrived to the restaurant. We received 10% off our meal due to checking in with yelp. We will be back soon. Awesome experience!

We Wanted some good Creole food on out first night back in NOLA, but were disappointed. We ordered Gator bites and Gumbo as appetizers. Bites had a good taste, but a few of them were too chewy and they were served at room temperature. (Actually everything we ordered was lukewarm.) The seafood Gumbo only contained shrimp and My husband had to send it back to be reheated. I ordered the Red Fish Tchoupitoulas special. I was given a large portion; the fish was thick and bland was fair, but again it was not served hot and did not have a wow factor. I asked for additional sauce for my fish and it was brought out cold. The Crawfish jalapeño dressing and my side of Crawfish Étouffée were both delicious, but the special wasn't. My husband had blackened catfish, jambalaya and greens and said everything tasted the same. ‍ On a good note our server was as sweet as pie. Which reminds me the best thing we had tonight  was the Kentucky Bourbon Pecan Pie with ice cream I would've loved to award more stars  but when you pay  food should be  !

The service was great! Our waitress kept our glasses full and was friendly and offered helpful suggestions when we needed them.

We ordered alligator sausage, oysters Rockefeller, oysters Oceana, a bowl of seafood gumbo, the taste of New Orleans, and my niece wanted a hamburger.

The gator sausage was pretty good. Gator is similar in texture to chicken so know that going in. It's not far off from chicken sausage. The dipping sauce was good but nothing to write home about.

The oysters were probably the best thing we ordered. Both (and to my taste everything we ordered) were a little salty. But good over all. 

The taste of New Orleans, the Jumbalya was a hit with my family but I preferred the crawfish Étouffée. The red beans and rice with sausage was quite tasty too. 

We were a little disappointed in the gumbo, but it wasn't bad either. 

All in all it was a great meal, would have been five stars with a little less salt. If we're here again I absolutely would go back.
Food was very good so was the service. I would recommend this to everyone. Not cheap but worth the price.

If I only ordered those damn crab cakes this review would be 5 stars. They were too damn delicious! My cousin said "these crab cakes have us in deep thought" bc not a damn word was said!! I mean scraping the plate! I'm usually a sauce on the side girl but I let it rock and I made a damn good decision to let that mushroom sauce change my life. *whispers* my crab cake was a little hard on the outside but I didn't give a damn. The crab inside the cake was flavorful and soft. I've been eating all foods that are put on my plate so the crunch of the lettuce was great! 

Cons: I had a shrimp poboy the concept is boring! The remoulade was okay, a fancy touch to honey mustard. The fried shrimp was seasoned but the bread was too damn hard. I actually caught an attitude from chewing! 

Moral of my review: Just eat the damn crab cakes. (That was my last damn)
The blackened redfish etoufee was my first meal EVER in New Orleans...! Great choice!

Finger licking is an understatement! I definitely enjoyed breakfast . I usually don't eat hash browns but these were amazing and cooked to perfection. The waiter Jamal was very attentive as well. Oh and I can't forget the drink, if you don't want anything watered down come here!

This restaurant was okay. I had the Blackened Chicken Pasta and it was good, bugging out of this world but it was good. The crab cakes however were soo salty and soo fishy. We didn't return them cause we are not ballsy but we did not eat them.

I'm sorry, this really was an overrated restaurant. Thank god we reserved a table because the line was way down the street when we got there. It took forever just for someone to come get our drink orders and we had three different waiters/waitresses in the first 20 minutes. The oysters and crab cake were good, but that's about it. Everything else was cold or not cooked right, and there was a large piece of papery plastic in the po' boy. On top of that, they still charged full price for the cold, uneaten food and the po' boy. Ultimately disappointed, especially with the size of the bill.

The food and service both were exceptional here. 
My husband and I came here for dinner on a busy and rainy night. There were about 8 parties ahead of us but the line moved fairly fast. For drinks, my husband had a Mule and I had the Hurricane. Both very strong and very yummy! For dinner, we had the crab cakes, and shrimp creole. I substituted the rice in the shrimp creole for mashed potatoes and it was YUM! We liked our food so much that we decided to stop here before heading home the very next day. Second day we tried the crawfish etouffee and the Taste of New Orleans (this came with jambalaya, red beans and crawfish etouffe). Yet again, everything was delish! 
Now I'm home and dreaming of that delicious jambalaya! We will definitely be back whenever we're back in the French Quarter.

Stop by here when I was in new orleans because they had a 10% off promotion and had 4 stars on yelp. Out of all the places i visited in NOLA, i would probably skip this place. I ordered their cajun seafood pasta, bbq shrimp, and their famous oceana oysters. Im not too sure if they premade all of the food and microwave it when I ordered the food but my cajun seafood pasta was cold.... my bbq shrimp just tasted like lemon, and lacked flavor. The famous oceana oysters were gross, too saucy and tasted like straight up mayo and gasoline mixed together. I was really disappointed to spend about $60 even with our 10% discount, but overall customer service was great.

Great food, great prices, and a convenient location right on Bourbon Street. What more can you ask for! 

Try their mixed drinks. They are not the crappy "margaritas" that everyone else is selling. These are genuine mixed drinks made by real bartenders, not colored sugar water with cheap liquor. 

Try their Oceana's Famous Oysters. This is similar to Acme, but better and less expensive. 

The service is top notch, too. Their waiters have a contest to see who gets the best Yelp reviews. Unfortunately for my server, I forgot her name (sorry)! I've eaten many meals here and the service is always top notch. Not only will the servers here do their job but they go above and beyond. For example, my last server gave advice where to find the best local Jazz bars. 

Bon apetit!

Our first night in New Orleans and Oceana had a wonderful dinner for us. The food was extremely good, we split a few apps and were so full and surprised. A dozen raw oysters, half fried half blackened gator bites and a cup of their gumbo. The dining side of the restaurant looked busy and a lot nicer than the bar area we were sitting. Our only problem (where we took a star) was the bartender. And this could be our fault for not choosing a table. My boyfriend and I have worked service industry for 20 years combined and really appreciate good service. She unfortunately did not provide us with that. Her demeanor when I ordered an oyster shooter changed completely and she tried to pre warn me many times  that it was "a mean one" and it was "spicy" and explained to me what it was. I got one after she asked me a 3rd time "am I sure I still want it" and it was amazing! Not any meaner or spicier than a normal oyster shooter I'm used to. I was disappointed in the way it seemed like she just "didnt want to make it" and those are words of the man sitting next to me who witnessed the interaction. I wouldn't suggest this BAR due to the service at all but I recommend the restaurant itself based on the FOOD ALONE.

First time in NO, and Oceana did not disappoint. My server, Ashleigh, helped guide me to order the famous Oysters, Redfish Oceana, and bread pudding with ice cream. Wow, everything was amazing. Would definitely go again. Thanks Ashleigh!!
Really great oysters and PoBoys. Reasonably priced. Bartender Devan was very charming and made great martinis. Chill laid back casual vibe. He really made the experience great!

Ryan, the Hilton Garden Inn - French Quarter, assistant manager recommended the Oceana first thing when I asked about dinner. He did not hesitate, which I took as a great sign.

His tip did not disappoint! 

Super cool in the middle of Conti Street, the Oceana Grill offers a varied assortment of seafood, cooked to please.

The mark of a good seafood restaurant, for me, are the raw oysters. I usually try them when I can, but only rave about them when they are awesome.

The 1/2 dozen that Megan (bartender) brought me were fresh, juicy, plump and super yummy. I ate them so fast I did not even take a picture of the presentation (empty shells have been photographed)!!

Next I had the Oceana Red Fish and oh yes! So New Orleans! Sautéed red fish with crawfish/mushroom sauce and roasted garlic mashed potatoes! 

Next....dessert anyone?

In order to find the best, we went off the reviews here and the other reviews were on point!  Taste of New Orleans was everything you want to experience when you go to NOLA. We also enjoyed oysters on the half shell and gator bites.  We had great service from start to finish and our server was Ashleigh. This is definitely a must on a trip to NOLA!!!
Louisiana Crab Meat Cakes Oceana's Famous OystersRedfish Oceana Amazing Especially the mouth watering crab cakes must have. People were wonderful! We will def. be back and can't wait

Went looking for a Po'Boy sandwich spot (which was closed) and stumbled upon Oceana Grill. SO GLAD this was stumbled upon! Oceana Grill is rated #10 in the country as an everyday place to eat. This place really knocked my socks off!

There's a really good variety of food and drink choices and they are GOOD! Ordered the Taste of New Orleans platter and it was great! Jambalaya, crawfish ettoufe and red beans and rice. It did NOT disappoint! The Tropical Storm drink was also good!

We didn't have reservations or anything (unsure if they take reservations) but waited about 20-30 minutes before being seated. Nice and spacious location and seating areas, inside and out. Located right off of Bourbon Street and very convenient. Staff is SUPER friendly and helpful in making decisions.

All around great place to eat and have a good time! If you're in Nola, try out Oceana Grill!
The ratatouille in this was amazing, definitely recommend along with the ultimate Long Island
The barbecue shrimp and etouffe are delicious! Great service also! Definitely try this one if you find yourself on bourbon street.

Service was pretty good which is the only reason i gave a generous 3 stars but y'all have some work to do on the food. I had the seafood gumbo and the fried crawfish tails. The gumbo was served lukewarm and not the ideal temperature for soup. Soup should be served piping hot at all times so that was disappointing. Now for the flavor you all are lacking seasoning tremendously. The hot sauce saved the day but real gumbo doesn't need anything added to it so that was a thumbs down for me. The fried crawfish tails were fried to perfection but it also was very bland lacking any seasoning. For this to be New Orleans cuisine i need you all to step it up for the culture. I would recommend you all start using some slap ya mama cajun seasoning
Considering I don't like seafood, the catfish poboy was really good. 5 out of 5, will be coming back.

Very good food, but a little difficult to get to because of construction. It's a very big and keeps going up and up. I took my three boys and they loved the food, especially my youngest who actually got the fried gator. The Po Boys are big and can easily split among the group. Also I got a nice 10% discount when I checked in!
Amazing good was delicious can't wait to come back & try it again staff was super friendly and the environment was very welcoming I give it a thumbs up and the wait wasn't long at all.
Good food, excellent service.  Don't get discouraged by the long line. It moves quickly. It's worth the wait.  I suggest the sampler and Pecan pie ala mode.
Fresh seafood with impeccable cajun flavors! Staff was friendly as well. Overall, enjoyable experience.

This entire experience was incredible! We weren't sure what to get because the whole menu was great. Our wonderful server Ashley gave us some great recommendations and at the end of our meal I was so full I felt bad not finishing the meal because it was that incredible! 
Come here and yay Ashley!

Great service! Came around midnight on a Monday after we flew in. Got both the deep friend shrimp and gator po boy. 1st time trying gator, tasted just like a chicken tender, except with a stringy texture. The platter was huge since it was filled with deliciously deep fried fries. The po bou is stuffed with pickles, onions and coleslaw as well. Overall it was good but the flavoring was a bit bland (tasted just like it was deep fried with no seasoning).

Wow this place is so good! I ordered the Taste of New Orleans and was not disappointed in the slightest! It comes with bowls of etoiufee, beans and rice, and jambalaya. The bowls looked small but they were so filling and delicious! Also, the drinks are great. Give the hurricane or the sangria a try!
David was great, made our day with his wonderful personality and suggestions. I was too full to try dessert but I'm looking forward to the next trip!!

After having a mini heart attack & some tears because a huge water bug was roaming around the restaurant. (Yes! I know...It's a hot area)  I was enjoying my spinach ravioli in the Oceana sauce! Thank you waitress, she recommended me it. This place is def for seafood lovers my boyfriend enjoyed it up until I ran away from the table.

After having a mini heart attack & some tears because a huge water was roaming around the restaurant. (Yes! I know...It's a hot area)  I was enjoying my spinach ravioli in the Oceana sauce! Thank you waitress, she recommended me it. This place is def for seafood lovers my boyfriend enjoyed it up until I ran away from the table.

If you want mystery meat in your bbq sauce and mediocre food this is the place for you love. Better luck eating at spirits, the gumbo shop, or honestly ANYWHERE else. We talked to the manager during our visit and he goes "I have no idea how that happened." Spend your money elsewhere, this place is overhyped and trash. The appetizers alone were such a disappointment, cannot imagine the entrees. Horrible customer service, attitude from the server, and a terrible manager. Avoid the other restaurant they own too, I believe it's called mambos. If this is supposed to be the better location lol. I have worked in hospitalIty for 5 years and this is the worst of the worst so WARNING DO NOT COME HERE. However the host and hostess was nice, too bad they work at this terrible establishment. We left after they couldn't follow health code standards, they should really send the department of health here to shut them down. I cannot even imagine how many health code violations they have had at this establishment!

Y'alllllllllll. I came back again because the food is THAT good. The first time we were here, the food was amazing & it left me craving a sweet tea; the server went and made a sweet tea from scratch just to satisfy me. They go above & beyond here! 

This time (after I decided I hadddd to come back), I was served by Errol. I. Adore. This. Manz. The food was just as amazing & he took care of us so, so good. Errol even taught me how to make his family recipe for etoufee (which I highly recommend ordering).

Long story short: if you're by the quarter, come here.

New Orleans is like a foodie mecca with delicious cajun food everywhere you go. I was having a fabulous trip in the Big Easy so decided to save Oceana for the last meal since I heard it being recommended and there was a huge line every night when I walked by. How could it be bad, right? However, it was the worst meal I had in NOLA. I later found out that these guys were on Gordon Ramsey's Kitchen Nightmares. I really wish I had watched that episode first, it would've saved by stomach. It shows them using FROZEN and spoiled food and dead rats in the kitchen. 

We got the oysters and they were extremely mushy and indeed previously frozen. When I told the manager this, he accused me of not knowing anything about oysters! I had been eating oysters in NOLA every night and these were by far the worst. I had to argue with him to get them taken off the bill actually. Also ordered the redfish and crawfish etoufee which also tasted frozen and bland! These guys are probably only popular because of being on Kitchen Nightmares, but they definitely didn't take any of Gordon Ramsey's advice. Steer clear!!

Where do I start?!!!! DISAPPOINTING!!!!! Please don't come here unless you're intoxicated and really need something on your stomach because this is not good New Orleans food. The fact that people recommend this place is appalling. My husband ordered gumbo which was cold and definitely didn't take like gumbo I order a drink that Im pretty sure they forgot to add alcohol to. Ordered a Caesar salad and gator tail bite half blackened and half fried the blackened ones were better than the fried. The fried one I think the cooked too long. Fast forward the main dish I ordered The taste of New Orleans which included jambalaya, crawfish Étouffée, red beans and rice with andouille sausage. SMH the jambalaya tasted like Spanish rice with a hint of sweetness. The crawfish etouffee should have been named sautéed veggies over rice because it didn't have crawfish in it I think I might've found 2 or 3 crawfish tails in my little bowl, the red beans and rice with audouille sausage was probably the best out of everything tbh. My husband ordered the mardi gras pasta just thumbs down and imma keep it that way! When I come back to New Orleans I won't even think about stopping here however I will walk past with my middle finger stuck up because that's all the f***s they'll get from me. $100 bucks wasted now I see what the couple before us were talking about the wife was mad at the food as well sucky JUST SUCKY

The one dozen Gulf oysters were very good. The Jambalaya we ordered and split was quite disappointing. It was lukewarm, and the rice was absolutely mush. The flavor was just 'ok'. In the Cajun center of the universe this is an embarrassment. Think of the chicken rice soup you made yesterday and then put the leftover soup in the fridge overnight... yeah, the rice swells and soaks up all the broth and is mush, like porridge... consistency like that... what they'd serve an invalid with no teeth. Shame on the cook.
Bread pudding was ok, sweet and uninspired. Strange tiny white and tan baubles on top that taste/feel like fondant.
The food was great and the service really makes this place stands out. Our server Amethyst was the best! I would come back the next time I visit (:

It was a good place to catch a bite. We were a party of 5 so we ordered two platters and an appetizer. It came out fast. It was fresh, hot and yummy. Our lyft driver was the one who recommended this place to us.

Marlon was an excellent waiter. Quick, friendly and attentive. Easy smile. 

We received a coupon from our hotel, Hotel le Marais next door. We chose this restaurant on our second day in New Orleans. Wish we chose this place as our first. 

Food was fresh and yummy. Will definitely recommend and return again!
The fried shrimp PoBoy was on point! Loved sitting in the courtyard next to the little fountain. Definitely held up to its positive reviews.

Excellent breakfast. Felt very authentic! Got the St. Francis Crepe and the Crawfish Omelette, both had huge pieces of seafood in them and were delightful. Great friendly service. Everyone working in the entire place said goodbye when we left. Overall, great place in the quarter !

1st time back since covid and it is as good as I remember. The biscuits and gravy are the best I've ever had and and the lost bread French toast is incredible. Karla was our waitress and was funny helpful And made great recommendations. Will be back every trip to NOLA.

The food was great! Very tasty. Got the Alligator notes and taste of New Orleans. Highly recommend the taste of New Orleans as it's 3 of their classics. And for s good reason. Everything came fairly quickly. Servos very attentative. 
I would give a higher rating if the staff at the entrance didn't try to make us sit at the bar. They told us there was a bit of a wait for tables, but can eat at the bar. I told them we would rather wait for a table. After the 3 of them started murmuring to each other they showed us to a table upstairs. We passed 2 sections full of empty tables, and the section we went into was full of empty tables. Perhaps they think they can get more money out of us trying to make us drink? I didn't appreciate it.
GREATTTTTTTT SERVICE!!! GREATTTTTT FOOD!!!!!! Not a bad wait time at all. The Enviroment is super welcoming and we really enjoyed everything:)

So I heard about this restaurant from kitchen nightmares a while back and I'll agree with the owner that Ramsey definitely defamed them on his show (total arsehole).
