I'm excited to say that this was one of the absolute best dine-in experiences I've had in Louisiana (next to my experience at Fleming's). David was exceptionally attentive, kind, and professional, I'd expect to see him at one of the finest dining establishments in the country!!! The praline duck was phenomenal paired nicely with their strong drinks! ;)

I got the crab cakes and the fried shrimp platter. Both were amazing. The shrimp platter came with hush puppies and french fries. It was A LOT of food.   I highly recommend this place. Everything was so good.
Hands down the best crab cakes I've ever had! The service was also excellent. Worth the one hour wait.
Fantastic food and excellent service. My favorites are the crab cakes and Cajun fries. Most favorite waitress is Ms. Karla! An absolute sweetheart who makes you feel right at home! ;)

This was obviously one of the popular restaurant in N.O. the line was very long for sit down dining. We ordered to go, & they made it very convenient to do so. The food did not disappoint. We were happy we selected this restaurant. I definitely recommend this place.

The food is good but they charged me for a drink that spilled and was not our fault. We were taking a video of the drink and it flew from my daughters hand. Either the table was slippery or the drink was really wet. We showed the manager and he didn't even care. I don't think I should've paid for a spilled drink. Never heard of a restaurant doing that.

The food and service was great! I wasnt too sure at first because it looked small but once we went in, it was very relaxed and fun. I ate the jambalaya pasta...omg....it was so delicious!  Drinks come out bubbling like a mixed potion! Will definitely go again.

We waited for quite a long time to get in- it was Halloween weekend, but it was worth it! We had a party of 4 and sat in the terrace area. The servers were all very kind and our food was great!

The real perk was that we happened to be there at the same time as Post Malone! He sat a few tables away. We got some pics even! It was so fun! The restaurant did a great job not letting him get too bombarded!

I have been in NOLA since Sunday. It is now Thursday and I have eaten here twice. Love their turtle soup. Po-Boys are more than ample. A good choice for dining near the action. Dining in the courtyard is nice if you can get out there.

Ordered from here to our hotel and I have nothing but great things to say. The red beans and rice were everything and the crawfish etouffe and jambalaya were good. The seafood gumbo was tasty and gator bites were well cooked and fresh. But can we talk about that red beans and rice?! Delivery was fast and food was hot.

Really good taste of New Orleans. I had the crab cakes, gumbo, and sampler entree. Everything was really good except the beans and rice. It was mediocre at best, but I'm not necessarily a fan of that fish so I won't take anything-away from them. Also, I bought a drink at another bar and they let me bring it in no problem. A++

We had traveled to New Orleans for my son's 21st birthday. We went to Oceana for his birthday dinner. The food was incredible. The service was impeccable. They did everything they could to make my sons birthday special. This was during Covid so they made every effort to keep us socially distance from other diners. The young man at the front door was super helpful. Our waiter was so attentive and was right there when anybody needed anything. This is our first time to this restaurant but they made us feel like we were regulars. I just can't say enough about how great they are.
This place is great! We were visiting from Atlanta and our wonderful server Pamela made us feel right at home. I would recommend Oceana for anyone traveling and wanting a good breakfast or dinner.

had gumbo and crab cakes. gumbo was sweet, which i didn't really care for. i did finish it, but would never order it again. the crab cakes were horrible. a friend ordered a pasta dish, which did look good, and french fries. i ended up eating his french fries and leaving the crab cakes. the service, however, was excellent. just wish the food had been, especially for the price. i will never eat there again.

The drinks were great, if you get a double! Strongest drinks are the frozen double margaritas followed by double mandarin blush which I got.
The food was okay...not really Cajun. The food lacked spices. The bread was store bought. Overall, I would not recommend.

We were seated and then ignored for at least 20-30 minutes with no menu in site. We had to go to the hostess desk a few times to let them know that we had no service whatsoever and watched server's pass us numerous time. We we finally did have someone come over, service was good and burgers and po boys were enjoyable. We enjoyed the food but I don't believe we would ever return.

Located right off Bourbon, this restaurant was so delicious! The service was beyond our expectations. Laura was very attentive and kind. The portions are huge. My 14yo and 10yo shared shrimp fettuccini with a side of grilled chicken and it was the perfect amount. YOU MUST HAVE THE RED FISH!! ITS TO DIE FOR. I highly recommend this spot for families, large groups or date night.
The crab cakes were mostly breading and filler and were not very good.  My gumbo came out cold and I had to send it back.  Overall mediocre for the price.

Oceana was recommended by Michael at NOLA Information Center and it was a great choice. The seafood gumbo, shrimp po boy and catfish platter were amazing. You can tell that it was freshly made and not greasy. Our waitress Melissa was outstanding and very attentive. Anyone visiting New Orleans this is a must stop for amazing authentic Cajun food.

Deeeeeeeeeelicious food. Service was great, Tashelle remembered everything we ordered and made sure everything was perfect 
Thank you!

Delicious food and super helpful staff. They give tons of great advice. They have a great selection of seafood and will make tweaks to classics to make them even better. The crab cakes were the best in the area and they were big portions.

Had dinner here twice recently. First night my husband had the steak with the fettuccine side (so delicious that he didn't even offer a taste). I had the fried catfish. It was the BEST cat fish I've ever had by far!! The second time we went, we had a burger, fried shrimp and the charbroiled oysters, it was all delicious!!! Would highly recommend!!

Server Erica was great , and food was also amazing. Good came quickly and server was awesome. Had the crab cake meal and blackened redfish. Both were great . Definitely would visit again. Outside there was great seating and they have fans for great breeze. During this time servers  had mask on each guest was asked to use hand sanitizer at front desk. Me and my husband will visit this restaurant again
The food was fabulous.  The service from Jaime L. Was spectacular!!  Thank you so much for making my granddaughter's 21st Birthday such a memorable experience!   You rocked it!!

Destinee our server was attentive but not annoying and pushy. The food was very good. Gator bites were delicious and tender. Crab cakes were also delicious and in an awesome sauce. Crawfish etoufee is a must and so very good. Jambalaya pasta was also good.
The food was delicious, the wait was very long, but it was worth it. Service and hospitality was fantastic. Very much worth 5? Stars!!

This was my first time in NOLA and let me say that I'm so happy that my boyfriend picked for us to go to Oceana Grill for lunch! The food was absolutely amazing! The way the food was seasoned to perfection with savory flavors! There menu gives so plenty of variety to choose from. I'm allergic to shellfish and that was a blessing to see many chicken options without losing the essence of experiencing NOLA styled food. Also, it gave Bae a chance to get his seafood, lol! Our gorgeous melanin QUEEN server, Regene, was patience and gave us the run down of what was the best things to try! She was joyous and gave us the experience that we wanted out of NOLA! Thank you for all of your help and we will definitely be back!

COVID 19 PRECAUTIONS: This was very safely executed! There is a waiting list that is practicing social distance and they only take in one group in at a time.
The tables are spaced out comfortably and there are multiple floors to be seated on. I suggest the window view, its fun to people watch in the streets doing foolish things. Mask are required to be wore inside and going to the restroom. You can take them off at your table.

Great vibes, delicious eats, and safe health protection! MY KIND OF PARTY!

How great is Oceana? On a recent 2 day trip, I went there THREE TIMES. 

Food (***** out of *****); The oysters were magnificent! Be sure to try the Oceana's Famous Oysters. These were big char grilled oysters with a creamy, garlic, herb and parmesan sauce. These were bigger than those sold at Mr. Ed's Oyster House. The same oyster dish here also costs $1 less than at Mr. Ed's. The crab cakes were huge and full of meaty, tasty crab. The Tropical Storm was a very tasty alcoholic drink that was not too sweet. It was fruity and moderately strong. I loved it so much, that I bought another one later that night to drink in my hotel room. Since there is no open container law in Louisiana, I was able to buy a drink and walk to my hotel with a drink in my hand. They even let me keep the fancy cup as long as I bought a "double", which costs $5 extra for a drink with twice the alcohol. 

Service (***** out of *****); Service was friendly and quick. Canesha, my server was cheerful and even offered advice on where to go for the best music shows that evening. 

Atmosphere (**** out of *****); Chill and casual dining. I did not spot any privacy booths, though. This place is huge so you don't need a reservation for breakfast and lunch. There will always be a table available, unless it's dinner time. It's usually packed for dinner. You'll need to go to their website to make a reservation for dinner. 

Conclusion (***** out of *****); This is a great place to dine. It is very convenient as it is right there on Bourbon Street. Also, it is a very good value. If you buy a $50 gift certificate, you'll get $10 extra in gift certificates. The gift certificates cannot be used the same day. So, you'll have to come back the next day to dine again in order to use the gift certificate. Also, if you check in on Yelp, you'll get 10% off! Yay!!!! Seriously, run, don't walk to Oceana Grill!

I wouldn't come back. The server was nice enough but she's good at her job in terms of up selling. This would have been okay if the food was good. It was subpar. Crab cakes were eh. I wasn't a fan. Edible but I've had better. 
Tour of New Orleans was a miss for me. I sent it back. My mom got fettuccine with shrimp (this isn't traditional sauce). BBQ shrimp was okay. 

2 stars for the drinks alone.

It was just ok. We went based on reviews. 

My review is this. Our server was excellent and extremely helpful. Alligator bites were good, my redfish "signature dish" lacked flavor. My husbands food was delivered cold. He simply wanted a hot plate of food. The response from the manager was a little strange. After I had already completely finished my meal my Husband's came out. It was piping hot that time! Paid the bill and left. 

It's my opinion that there are far superior restaurants in the same area.

You have to try Oceana Grill, for breakfast, lunch and dinner! Although I only went for dinner, I can definitely tell everything would have been amazing. I ordered the vegetarian pasta and it was SO FRESH! The veggies were cooked to perfection and the sauce was not greasy as some creamy pasta sauces would be. Needless to say, I ate the whole plate and I was ready for me. Also, the employees of Oceana truly are such a great team!

Definitely a Tourist Trap!  It seems everything is pre-cooked and readily available for customers.  I ordered the fried seafood platter and crawfish etouffee.  Both items were on the table in less than 5 minutes.  The fried seafood was warm, not hot.  It was okay tasting, not as crispy as expected, but the seasoned fries were nice.  I would opt for Deanie's, Acme's or Mandina's for their fried seafood platters, which are way better, and come out hot and crispy.  The crawfish etouffee had about 7 crawfish tails.  Not worth the $18.For dessert, I had the banana's foster ice cream cake.  I do not believe it was made in-house.  I had some wax paper on the cake, and it tasted a little freezer-burned.
Very yummy! One of the only local opened places at that hour. Blackened Catfish was very good, Taste Of New Orleans is a must!

Oceana Grill ended up being our "fancy" dinner when we got in to New Orleans. A brief wait in front was well organized. 

As soon as our waiter told us what the specials were, I didn't have to look at the menu any more. We also got a hurricane. A double and it was pretty strong. What was great here was that this was real fruit juice and not syrup.

Main course was called Redfish Vieux Carre. A big piece of blackened redfish with sautéed shrimp and a crab cake, all topped with a tasty sauce. It was absurdly delicious. I polished the plate.

Yes, this time we're having dessert. Their famous bread pudding which has a sweet praline and rum sauce. It was excellent.

Not cheap but inexpensive and very good. I would definitely come back to this one.

Tip: Make a reservation. You won't get in on time but you'll definitely have a shorter wait.

[Round number review 14200 overall, 1522 of 2020, number 18 in Louisiana.]

I ordered the crawfish étouffée. Absolutely terrible. Maybe 4 crawfish in the whole bowl. And it wasn't good at all. Very upsetting due to the fact im in New Orleans  which is supposed to be food Capital. One of the worst dishes i ever had

I found this place on Yelp and after all the good reviews gave it a try with the family.
We went during breakfast / brunch so I can only speak about that.

The brunch menu had just enough options and as to expect in NOLA, everything had some spice on it, even the pancakes lol. It's a huge restaurant. I little dim but the decor' really fit the NOLA vibe. Now let's talk about FOOD. 

Shrimp and Grits - 5/5
Pancakes  - 5/5
French Toast with Sausage 5/5

SHOUTOUT to Ashleigh our waitress! She was amazing and super welcoming!

Exactly what you are looking for in a taste of New Orleans cuisine.  Our entire experience from start to finish was absolutely perfect.  

To start, the sweet tea was spot on; not too sweet and not bitter at all. For appetizers we had the alligator tail, both fried and blackened. While both were amazing, everyone agreed the blackened gator tail won out both on flavor and tenderness hands down.  The oysters..... oh the oysters!   Being from the Midwest I've been dreaming of FRESH gulf oysters and these did not disappoint.  Shucked with great skill, there were no shell fragments to be found, served ice-cold on the half shell, these little succulent bites took me to my happy place!  Probably the best I can recall eating.  

The entrees each brought their own magic to the table.  Clean and distinct flavors of authentic goodness with each dish staying in its own lane while complimenting the next perfectly. The crab cakes were fluffy and well seasoned,  bursting with huge chucks of fresh crab meat.  Lightly fried to that perfect light  crispiness on the exterior with a fluffy cloud interior. The crawfish Etouffee was on point and maybe my favorite of all we sampled, but honestly hard to pick a winner with so many good eats!   The Red beans and rice were well seasoned, creamy, and exactly all they should be, as was the jambalaya.  There literally wasn't a dish we didn't rave about.  

On to dessert. We decided to split the bread pudding and the strawberry cheesecake- which is made by a local baker nearby.  While both were solid, I think we all agreed the creamy, decadent cheesecake with the brightness of the strawberry topping won out on that challenge.  

The service was absolutely spectacular.  It wasn't lost on anyone that 100% of the staff we engaged-even those holding huge trays of food up over their heads for another table-welcomed us warmly or thanked us for coming in.  Table service was awesome with our waitress always there yet never there... if you know what I mean.  I think she filled my tea at least 10 times but never interrupted the dining experience.  Amazing.  

Can't wait to come back and explore more of their menu. Well done!!

These were probably some of the best crab cakes I've ever had! Very flavorful and the crawfish sauce on top was great as well! The customer service was quick and not once did anyone have an empty glass! For dessert I had the strawberry cheesecake. Pretty standard, nothing out of the ordinary.  I definitely plan on returning during my next visit!

We visited Oceana Grill and received the best food recommendations and service from Angel. We ordered Chicken fettuccine w/ fried chicken and Mardi Gras pasta and BOTH AMAZING!!!!!! We will definitely go back when we revisit NOLA as well as recommend it as a MUST to all our family and friends!

This place was AMAZING. Everything we ate was soooo good. They have a crawfish sauce that was to die for!! We got the crab cakes, soft shell crab, gumbo, and a blackened dish and even creme brûlée! Absolutely delicious!!
The food and drinks were amazing. We had the Louisiana crab meat cakes and the Taste Of New Orleans. Both dishes were very flavorful.
My favorite restaurant in NOLA! Outstanding service, drinks, and food. Fiona and John took excellent care of my friends and I. Highly recommended!

Our family enjoyed a great meal giving oysters a try for the first time.   Server was very attentive and keep up with all the requests of larger group!  My son lost his new sunglasses (kind of expensive that he bought himself) and the manager went out if his way to look for them!   He did find them a day later,  reached out to us, and then mailed them to us!  Now that is customer service.  Thanks for all you did going above and beyond during our meal and after!

We happened upon this place based on a yelp review. When we got there we were told the line was long and it would be at least a half an hour wait. But then the hostess asked if we would like to sit at the bar and we said sure. We headed upstairs to this very cool bar area and had some of the best food of our trip.

What was especially delicious was a pasta dish, something called Cajun fries, a type of bread pudding was simply delicious.

We stopped by at this restaurant and order the Cajun jambalaya pasta and the mardi grass pasta as well as the crab cakes. The crab cakes were alright; they're better with lettuce but the pastas were amazing. The jambalaya tasted like seafood boil and the mardi grass tasted more Italian style but still very good. They're dog friendly and have nice staff
Xieaje was absolutely awesome! She was super friendly and attentive made us feel at home. The BBQ shrimp was the best I've had. This place is a must when in NOLA

The services was good did not have to wait long for the food come out. We had fried catfish, blacken tuna and creme brûlée. Lots of catfish fish pieces that was thin cut, the tuna was flavored and cooked perfect the creme brûlée was cold. Not sure if it's suppose to be cold where I'm from it's normally kinda warm when they heat the sugar on top but it was still good.

This was our first stop for my birthday trip. The food was great and came quickly. The service was great. Wait staff was extremely friendly and took the time to recommend favorites. Drinks were flavorful and strong! Great for groups. Perfect option for a quick and filling meal before a night out on Bourbon street.

Good value considering it's right off Bourbon St. The crabcake appetizer were definitely the highlight.

Make sure to check in on yelp and get your discount!
Ashleigh was great! Took wonderful care of us. We had the biggest oysters I've ever seen. Catfish Po' boy was solid.

If you don't love the BBQ Shrimp, I'm
concerned about your well being. It was absolutely delicious. The staff was friendly and my party was well satisfied with our entire meal.

This is one of my absolute favorite places in NOLA! The food is always amazing, the staff is so friendly and it's such a great vibe. I ordered the signature Oceana Oysters and a side crab cake! It was amazing per usual! Our server was so polite, fun and helpful! I love it here!

Normally this is our favorite "go-to" spot in New Orleans and I had previously written a review raving about the customer service and the well made cocktails but that was definitely not the case tonight. Our waiter tonight was plenty wonderful but the manager was less than sub par. The two cocktails that I loved in my last review were made extremely poorly... They were heavy pours which are normally not a bad thing but in this case they definitely were. The manager came over with a less than friendly attitude and said "what's wrong"?! It caught me a little off guard but she comped NONE of the cocktails and offered to "water them down" for us which obviously doesn't fix a poorly made cocktail to begin with. Definitely a turn off to one of our favorite places, it's a shame.

When a restaurant is packed for Saturday lunch in the French Quarter you know this is the place to go.  How many restaurants are in NOLA?  Hundreds?? I had the chef special, Red fish.  Very fresh and tasty.  My waitress Latricia was wonderful and really worked hard,  I shall return.

We visited this restaurant last night for a few reasons... 1) It was a Christmas, and most restaurants were closed, 2) It was open until 1AM, and we had just gotten into NOLA on a late flight, 3)  It was rated number one on Yelp. We were a little nervous considering this restaurant was featured on Kitchen Nightmares, but decided enough time had passed and improvements were probably made. Was it horrible? No. Was it the best? I wouldn't say that either. We ordered a shrimp po boy and oyster platter. The number one mistake I would say is that the food didn't come out hot... it was warmishly cold. The seafood tasted like it may have been frozen. The bread on my po boy was soft and didn't have much of a crunch (a little toasting could have helped). Service was prompt though, and the waiter was nice. Overall, not a place I'd go out of my way to return to, but if nothing else was open then sure I'd return. (Tip: Acme Oyster House is my favorite seafood restaurant... not just in NOLA, but possibly even in the world)

Absolutely loved this place we tried the charbroiled oysters and it's a must! Do not leave New Orleans without trying it!! Thank you to our server Jamal he was super attentive and checked in on us often. The service, the food, was great !
Check the 272 "unrecommended" reviews at the bottom of the listing. Most of them are bad. Why are these reviews hidden?

Let me start by saying the hosts were so nice! I know being a host is not the easiest job, even though people think it is and they were such sweetie pies!

The line to get a table was pretty long and we waited down the side of the building by the cooper monkey bar to get a table. Service was below average. I wasn't amazed with my dish, but everyone else loved their dishes. The bbq shrimp app was delicious, along with the alligator. You're able to do half fried and half blackened and I recommend doing that if you've never tried it before so you can try it both ways. The blacked had a very nice taste to it. The blacked catfish also was delicious. The Mardi Gras pasta and blackened chicken pasta were both okay, the Alfredo sauce itself seemed to be missing some flavor. My friend got the jambalaya and he loved it!

One of my favorite places to eat when in NOLA.  The biscuits and gravy are a great start to the day.  I highly recommend the Cajun Fries.  It is hard to eat them and not be amazed!  They also have the best Crawfish Etouffée in the area. The helpful and polite servers and hostess are always glad you're there and happy to make your experience worth coming back time and time again.  
Good drinks. Great service.  Hot and delicious food.
Excellent especially for after hours when the other restaurants are closed. Very good for takeout as well.
I got the BBQ and it was as good as I've ever had. My son got the Redfish topped with Crawfish Cream and he raced about it. And their Gumbo was as good as any others.
Food was delicious. Seafood Gumbo was so good. Me and a group came for a birthday party. It was amazing, didn't take long. Tyler was my waiter and he was very nice.

Great spot to check out if you're looking for staple NOLA food. Between my girlfriend and I we ordered the crab crakes and Taste of New Orleans entree which was plenty of food between us two. The crab cakes were absolutely delicious. The mushroom sauce was a great touch to the dish, and it was my first time eating a NOLA style crab cake! The taste of New Orleans dish is the perfect dish if you want to try a little bit of everything.

We stopped for a quick dinner late Sunday night! We order the gator bites ( blackened and fried) , chicken Alfredo and seafood gumbo . The sauce that came with the gator bites was really good and had a bit of a heat, I preferred the fried version . The seafood gumbo  was seasoned well without being too salty which we appreciated . We got blackened chicken instead of crispy chicken for Alfredo and enjoyed the sauce a lot.

Disappointed!! Someone should call Gordon Ramsey back! We had the chicken fettuccine and it was good! The fried shrimp was good too. But do not get the taste of New Orleans nor the Jambalaya! They were awful and tasted old. Like they pipes them in the microwave! Our server was nice but the manager had an attitude! Would not waste time coming here again!
Delicious Cajun creole food in the French quarter. Good food here and it never disappoints! Delicious desert also!

We were very fortunately to find a restaurant with great ratings open late when we arrived in New Orleans on Christmas Eve. Our waitress was knowledgeable and gave us great recommendations on what to get. The charbroiled oysters were great. I was definitely impressed with the blackened redfish with shrimp special I got, very flavorful! We passed by the restaurant the next day and it was PACKED out the door, and I would say it would be worth the wait.

Covid edition.

After looking at reviews we decided to try Oceana. We walked in and were seated immediately for dinner on a Friday night.  (goes to show how dead NOLA was during our stay. 

Staff was very friendly and helpful, they wore masks and gloves, of course we had to wear masks walking in. We were served very timely and did not have to ask for anything.

There were more people inside than I had expected but we were still pretty well distanced.

We had gumbo, gator bites, redfish (another burger for the kid who doesn't like fish) and Caesar salad.

I was all tasty - I have not had gator prepared this way, the pieces were much larger and had a little spice to them along with the remoulade sauce that came with them. I could have made a meal out of that alone. The redfish oceana was also very good.  Best redfish I have had in a while. The one who ordered the burger did like it so kids can eat here.  He did eat a lot of the gator tail though.

The gumbo was better here than a couple of other places we ate in NOLA, but none of them were just the way I like it - a little on the spicy side.  I am still looking for a really good "cajun" place in the NOLA area.

Meh....it's ok. The food itself is just average. Our service was terrible. Reddish filet portion was above average. Everything else, not so much. Took an hour and 20 minutes to get our entrees on a slow night. Spend your money elsewhere. Too many other choices for cheaper that crush this place.

During our 10-day stay in NOLA, this was one of the best experience we had. Upon Since it was mid-day, we didn't have reservations, and randomly chose Oceans Grill for an early dinner. Upon arriving, we were immediately seated, and order our drinks. Our waiter was very pleasant and told us about the specials. We ordered the gator bite for an appetizer which arrive in a very reasonable time. The entrees we ordered arrived shortly after and both our meals were beyond expectations. Our waiter was very attentive to our need and we left with a pleasant experience. I would nightly recommend Oceana Grill fo anyone visiting NOLA.

We waited on line in the cold for over an hour.  The manager came out because she was told a patron had a question. She walked over to me with an attitude and stated rudely "what's the question?" She then proceeded to tell me , before I even asked a question, that I can get back to my place in line or eat at another establishment.  She then went on to state that no one is being let in at this time because the kitchen was backed up , I then stated why is it that that was not communicated to all the patrons outside waiting in the cold. Her tone and her service or the lacking thereof were deplorable.  She made it clear that our business was not valued!!   Duely noted!

There was a line outside but they were following COVID guidelines. The food was great I ordered the Louisiana crab meat cakes and the Marduk gras pasta. The first batch of crab cakes were cold so they brought me a new batch fresh and hot quickly which I devoured. I ate some of the pasta and took the rest to go. When I say I was eating lukewarm Marduk gras pasta the following morning and it was delicious. Abundance amount of meat in both dishes. Very good service and fo

There is always a line here to get in, but this time it was moving quickly and we were seated in less than 30 mins. We ordered vegetarian stew, fish and another dish but the order didn't arrive for another hour when the server informed there was an issue with the order and she is addressing it. Another 15 mins go by and nothing is still served and the manager stops by to say she is assisting to expedite our order but there was some issue in the kitchen and offers a complimentary bread pudding for desserts. I asked my server if there is anything on the menu that can immediately be served while we wait for other order and she immediately says Gumbo. And it also makes sense because you'd think it should be already prepared and ready to serve. But then she informs that even gumbo is going to take 15 mins. Finally after 90 mins of ordering we received the food. 

The stew wasn't honestly a stew at all. You'd hope a stew is slow cooked for couple hours on the stove, but the stew here seemed more of marinara sauce with Cajun spices and fresh veggies. You could say that because the veggies were as crisp as just tossed into the sauce (not stew). My friends who ordered the fish and other things liked the food though. 

At the end the server comes around again and brings the check and asks if we 'really' want the complimentary pudding. I don't understand if you aren't sure about offering you shouldn't have offered. I wouldn't recommend this place if you are on short time or have vegetarians in your party. This could be a place where you come in early evening have some drinks while you wait an hour or so for the food.
We had the Country breakfast and French toast, both were great! Our drinks were very good Golden Cadillac and Tidal wave!

Best spot in New Orleans service was quick and everyone was super friendly if you're in New Orleans please stop here Mary was the best server truly A1 and made sure everything was good I enjoyed the food here

Great food, great atmosphere and friendly wait staff! Warning, there can be a very long wait for this restaurant depending on the time of day you go. I waited about 25 minutes and the line was out the door. 

I have also ordered in through uber eats from here and it was very quick and food was delicious. I would recommend to try their fried seafood platter. Delicious! Price is reasonable as well.
The food was very good. Great service and helpfull in selecting what to eat. First time in New Orleans.
Perfect experience from beginning to end and the food was amazing!!! Will definitely be going back here.

Don't let the outside fool you, everything inside is great!  The best duck I've had in a very long time.  They have a large menu with seafood available. My husband had the fish and loved it.  The gator bites hit the  spot. Customer service was spot on. Our waiter Chris was extremely knowledgeable about the food choices and very nice. He was the highlight of the dinner. PS: If you're a Yelper, make sure to check in for 10% off.
Amazing food. The breakfast and all of its options are amazing ! Def a favorite spot of mine.
This spot was phenomenal. You can close your eyes, order any meal and it will be great.

Line was an hour long...the food was meh.   It wasn't even packed in the restaurant.  The food came out extremely cold.  Ordered the Mardi Gras pasta and had to send it back, because it was cold and ended canceling it.  Fried seafood platter was salty and cooked in old oil.  We had to return that back, too. The oysters were drowning in cold sauce.  Be aware...if you have a party of 5 or more they automatically charge an 18% surcharge. Service was extremely slow.  Not impressed, rather disappointed with the entire experience.  Don't go to this restaurant...had better service at ole New Orleans restaurant.

Went there for New Orleans Restaurant Week. Had their Gumbo, Redfish, and bread pudding. Food was excellent. Service was excellent. In particular, the food runner was great! He had an excellent attitude and whipped up some fresh fruit for one of my friends, even though it was not on the menu! Now that's customer service.

Definitely A disappointment. Our 2nd time to New Orleans the 1st time we didn't have a disappointing meal this time it's been all disappointment maybe the pandemic maybe Just lack of Passion from the cooks Also the noise is Awful. They're doing construction right outside...  I think we're gonna hit a major chain just to play it safe and not be disappointed with the overprice meals.

Three of us dined here on the 1st of January at about 7 PM.  We waited in line outside for about 15 minutes but the host did a great job managing the line and seating people as quickly as possible. The line was managed very actively and very professionally considering the chaos and obviously hammered patrons. We were seated outside in the center courtyard and were attended to very well by Zach, our server. Zach was very also a very helpful guide with info on NOLA!  Nice touch.

We ordered a number of items for the three of us to sample, the fried palter, the redfish, and the NOLA sampler.  They were all just ok.  Nothing of anything stood out as particularly note worth, certainly, nothing stood out as very "cajun" as it was all incredibly mild and had none of the note-worthy flavors of NOLA we were hoping to experience. It was hot, seemed fresh enough, and came quickly.  That's about it... It was not bad, but it definitely was not a standout experience either.  It was an ok experience and makes sense that it was so easy to get into versus some of the other establishments that had huge lines.  I think the length of the line tells the story of what you can expect.

Cheers to an epic 2022 and I hope NOLA bounces back well after the latest storm and COVID!

Very awesome stuff, super courteous and friendly. They allow dogs and treat them so nice! The hostess was super chill and nice and greeted us with some water for our dogs. It is nice when they treat you with so much care specially when you're stress on how they'll react with you having pets. The food was great, awesome NOLA taste, drinks were to die for! I love this place, highly recommend it if you have Pets and are looking for some good Nola food!

Everything was great. Service not so much but she was busy. We had to wait to be seated for 20-25 mins they were right on it. I would suggest if you want to sit down and enjoy the food this isn't the spot kinda felt rush: overall food was great. 
Would recommend: The seafood gumbo and Louisiana plate!

We had breakfast at the Oceana, which is probably not what it gets reviewed for the most, but we found it to be an absolutely  wonderful place to start the day. The interior is old wood with jazz theme decor and a bit of a view of Bourbon Street (a construction zone, these days). What was a treat was the food and the service. I had the vegetarian omelet and my wife had the Crepe St. Francis. Both were prepared perfectly, and the crepe was absolutely huge. The coffee was excellent! Neither of us had the nerve to try the Bloody Mary, which appeared to come complete with either a soft shell crab or a schnitzel. I've never seen one quite so decked out.  Maybe next time. Our waiter, Jamal, was as professional as could be; helpful and attentive without hovering.  He managed a perfect balance of being there when we needed him, and giving us privacy.

I was disappointed with the size of my bloody Mary's to go.  It hardly have any alcohol.  Or at least I could not taste any. I guess the only thing I liked is that it was spicy.  What's strange is that I asked for it spicy and strong and I certainly did not get it strong!  Unless The restaurant could do better I will not go again

We were seated quickly, considering this is a popular restaurant in the French Quarter. The place is small, but everyone is distanced nicely. The waitress we had was very pleasant. The service was quick and the portion sizes of the food is great considering the price. I would return.

We dined here on Thursday night. Normally it's a line out the door but luckily we caught them on a day the wait was less than 5 minutes. We were escorted to our table up 2 flights of stairs.  We mostly had the Tropical Storm drinks, which were fruity and great! For appetizer I had a caesar salad. To eat we split the blackened redfish topped with crawfish etoufee, jambalaya rice and greens. Everything was very yummy!! Upon entrance they have a bar area and a few TV's. There is also 3 levels of seating which you wouldn't know from looking at the outside. The staff all worked well together and our food was brought out hot and fresh. I'd definitely recommend eating here if you're in the area. The only complaint is they don't split checks. Other than that everything else was great.

The food here is fantastic.  The server (Rod) was gracious, hospitable and friendly.  He went well above and beyond to make sure that my party with satisfied and pleased.  the food was delivered in a timely manner and it arrived hot and to our liking.   we did not have to ask for anything from utensils, down to drink refills. The Gator bites, a must have!  we could not be more pleased with the service and food for the prices.

This has been a place where we stop by to have breakfast on our way to our beach destination. Great breakfast menu have tried all their selections, always friendly service. Outdoor seating and inside as well. We were limited to seating outside in August cause there was not  enough staff during Covid.
Great bartender nice big place I  recommend BBQ Shrimp it was very tasty.. had oysters and drinks

I can not rave enough! The food was incredible! My first taste New Orleans started with the barbecue shrimp which does not have barbecue sauce by the way but a great sauce made with butter and Worcester sauce. The Taste of New Orleans was incredible! Great portions and incredible flavor. The dining area had a nice environment with tons of people laughing and enjoying themselves it was relaxing. I will be returning here next trip. Well done Oceana!

Our first evening in New Orleans.  We strolled down the street enjoying about Street.   It was good, we made our acquaintance to the infamous Hurricane which was served to us with dry ice.

The PO boy blackened shrimp sandwich and the seafood platter was a great intro to NO Cajun cuisine 

Yummy, definitely worth visiting on our next trip.

The food is wonderful, atmosphere festive, and service pleasing. The seafood tastes as good as it smells and the famous oysters appetizers deserves its fame!!! I didn't try the dessert this, but I expect it to live up to the reputation next time. Enjoy!
First night back in New Orleans and took my fiance here for his first time. Good introduction for him to NO food. Great service!

Stumbled across this place after a debacle at Mr. Ed's Seafood. I've never been happier to be inconvenienced.

We started off with the Oceana's Famous Oyesters. They were literally cooked to perfection. The cream sauce had hints of cheese & herbs through it, placing these in the top 5 oyesters I've ever had.

For dinner I did the blackened redfish étouffée. It was pretty darn good. The fish was a nice cut, wasn't overcooked or anything. The sauce was a creamy crawfish étouffée which is my only complaint was that there was only two little pieces of crawfish in the sauce & I definitely wanted more to partner up with my fish. Other than that I feel like I stumbled upon a New Orleans great. I will definitely be back.
The food was so delicious.. especially the oysters Rockefeller.. a definite must. And sit outside in the patio in the evening for a great experience

I stopped in for a light dinner an ordered red beans and rice. There was a wait for a table but it wasn't too long. It was worth the slight wait. Great service and the staff was very friendly and attentive. I will be back to try the extensive menu. 

There is a great mural on the wall. It says "In America there is New York, San Francisco and New Orleans, everything else is Cleveland". 

Awesome.

This place was recommended by the lady at the front desk and we are glad that we asked her for a suggestion. My husband said he had the best fried catfish here. The hush puppies were so good and spicy. The fries were seasoned. He ordered a side of red beans and rice which was thick n flavorful. I had the shrimp poboy which was good. I thought the bread was a little hard so I ended up just eating the shrimp out the sandwich. Sometimes I pick the meat from sandwiches so this wasn't because I was unpleased with the bread, I was just in the mood for something softer. The poboy had 8 pieces of large delicious shrimp. It was served with the seasoned fries. We're revisiting this restaurant again before we leave. I recommend you try this spot!!

PHIL( the manager) made my experience at this restaurant one of the worst I have ever had in my entire life.... Food was amazing however my friend ordered a drink that was way to strong and the manager flat old told her "just drink the damn drink" and that she still needs to pay for it in the rudest voice I've ever heard. How did this man become a manager, so immature and petty. Elite for 3 years and never experienced this. 

The waitress Jessica was absolutely amazing, she gave wonderful recommendations, was extremely attentive, and went out of her way to try and help us. I feel bad she has to work for Phil. 

To make matters WORSE... There was a MOUSE running around the restaurant, we informed the manager and he did NOTHING !! I'm so ashamed for this restaurant, I'm honestly so shocked that this experience happened.

This place has tons of reviews and a high rating.  But it is not a great place for foodies.  The food was fine, service was expedient.  Most things on the menu fried, breaded, and all around tourist trap.  I can't say anything was wrong or horrible but I would not go back here again.  They are clearly in business because they have a rotating tourist crowd.
They have a nice outdoor seating area that I'd recommend taking advantage of. Ordered the BBQ shrimp and alligator bites appetizer. Both were delicious and overall had a good experience here.

Service was excellent, and the food was great! My mom and I had the fried shrimp platter, my sisters has the Mardi Gras pasta and the taste of New Orleans platter, and dad had the fried catfish platter! Everything was delicioso!! Their seating rule is a bit weird, as they have to see everyone they seat, even if your tell them your party size but other than that it was a great time.

Waiting staff were friendly and very attentive. The restaurant is decorated like an average restaurant chain, very casual place. Food was surprisingly mediocre. Crab cakes were okay but the seafood platter was nothing but cold, rubbery, soggy fried fish. Granted we were there right before closing hours but, that's no excuse to serve food that isn't freshly made. Everything was definitely overpriced. Not to mention, the place felt like an icebox! It was a beautiful 72 degrees outside but they had the air conditioning blasting. I couldn't wait to get out of there to warm up outside. Not on my list of places to revisit. 

P.S. I just saw this restaurant on Kitchen Nightmares. I visited Oceana AFTER they were saved by Chef Ramsey. Looks like they're headed back to their old ways. Hope that doesn't include the roaches and rats!

In Nawlins for the week on business staying across the street from Oceana Grill. Let's start off by saying that over the last few days I've experienced incredible attention to guest satisfaction. Everyone from the hostess, servers, and managers too.  Tonight I had an appetizer of fried eggplant then had the Catfish Lafouche. The eggplant was fried perfect, crispy on the edges and served with a  remoulade sauce.  Very tasty!  

The entree was served hot and the taste was fantastic!  Blackened catfish over a bed of jambalaya with crawfish tails and mushroom sauce.  Topped off with fried crawfish tails.  Best recommendation for Oceana and my server tonight Kasey!

After researching some of the best places to dine in New Orleans, Oceana Grill was on every list! I HAD to go see what the hype was about.

When we initially arrived, there was a very long line. We were told there was a little over an hour wait. My sister went to talk to some of the waitstaff and advised them we were celebrating her birthday and some kind of way, she was able to get us in right away. 

We sat at the bar and the bartenders were so nice. I already knew I wanted the Taste of New Orleans. It consisted of crawfish etoufee, jambalaya, and red beans and rice with a side of French bread. I've only had red beans and rice as a child and their red beans were nothing like it. Everything else was new to my palette. 

When the plate came out, I was a bit skeptical because they put everything in the same bowl. I was told they were out of bowls, but that shouldn't compromise the taste. They were correct! 

The food was a burst of flavor! It was literally a party in my mouth! This food was definitely made with love. It was unlike anything I've ever tasted! I've never had jambalaya or crawfish! The sausage that came with beans had a light char on it. I took my time savoring every scoop. I wish I would've ordered one to go.

I'm so sorry for the half eaten photo, it was almost gone when I remembered to take it. Lol

This is by far the best meal that I have ever had and I cannot wait to go back.

Best Oyster po'boy we had while in New Orleans! The kitchen closes late which is nice ( everything else closes around 10 on Bourbon st). The breading on the oysters had a nice kick which was a nice surprise.
Karla is the sweetest! We came for lunch on Christmas Day and she took care of us! Thank you Karla, Merry Merry Christmas

I'm a NOLA native, but moved from home some 25 years ago. I've dined everywhere in New Orleans (as well as many other large cities) at one time or other, and I know Cajun cooking done right. My son and I stopped in for a late lunch during a visit yesterday, and were welcomed with the unique hospitality one only finds in this city. The atmosphere is clean as can be, relaxed, and a wonderful blend of contemporary and old school. Charming.  

The food was superb; perfectly seared tuna stuffed with crab meat for me, a perfectly breaded and fried catfish platter for my son. We shared an appetizer of crab cakes; again, the execution was perfect, and they were so large that they could have served as an entree on their own. 

Our server was a gentleman named David; this man has mastered the art of being right on time and ensuring that everything is taken care of, and does so without ever hovering. (And he stays busy -- that timing is difficult to achieve.) He explained the various specials and recommendations smoothly and naturally; so well in fact that I never even bothered to do much more than glance at the menu. His professionalism, warmth and genuine smile alone is worth 5 stars. Combined with everything else, well, it was a wonderful dining experience overall. I return home to NOLA a few times a year, and this is a favorite stop. 

Trust me, you will not be disappointed here if you're seeking great food and a great atmosphere.
This place is my favorite on Burbon street.  The wait staff is always friendly and the restrooms are clean.  We got red beans and rice and it was fantastic.  Go there every time we visit NOLA
Great food and great service!! Corey was awesome! Will definitely return! Drinks were so good and beautiful! Great atmosphere for families and friends!

Recommended by our Uber driver, we tried this place out. The menu looked reasonably priced and they had a good selection. There was a wait to sit that went out the door. No wait as we passed the line and sat at the bar which is full service. Everything matched up to what we read before deciding to come here to eat dinner on our last night. The half dozen Oceana's Famous Oysters were the best I've had in taste in NOLA. We ordered Chef Specials Grilled Ahi Tuna "la Boheme" (asked for them to have the Ahi Tuna blackened) and ordered the Redfish Oceana. Ahi Tuna was good! Service at the bar was great and the food came out fast. My boyfriend was able to watch the basketball game on their TV. We ordered more beers and headed out to walk off our full stomachs.

I really enjoyed this place! 

Like many other reviews have mentioned, this place has amazing service! Our waitress was great, she offered suggestions and was very personable. 

I ordered a hurricane and it was good - but very strong! For food I tried the catfish po boy with fries. Classic and delicious, just the way it should be! 

The best part - you get a % off your bill with your Yelp check in!

Give them a try! You won't regret it.

Everything we are here was great. Had the gator bites, blackened and fried. I like the fried better with the sauce they give. Very good 
Fried oysters, catfish and shrimp with hush puppies, fries and coleslaw. Only thing that was bammer was the coleslaw. 
Top it off with bread pudding... Fire. Try it.

Great food, even better service.  This spot is close to Bourbon Street but away from the crazed masses and drunken throngs.  The grilled oysters and the ahi tuna were our two favorites.  The burger and crab-cake not so much.  Cheescake was a good finish.  Hurricanes and vodka redbulls as well as cold fountain drinks.  Overall a good choice for a quick meal.  There are better spots for sure but this is not bad at all.
Great restaurant! Terrific atmosphere with really good food at a decent price. We had to wait to get in, but it's worth it. Everything we had was excellent. Had great service inside as well.

I tried this restaurant on a recommendation. There was a line to enter, but it moved quickly. I ordered the blackened duck and it was excellent. The person I was dining with ordered the blackened redfish which was also excellent. The experience was very good and I recommend this restaurant highly.

A friend wanted to come here for dinner after seeing this place on Kitchen Nightmares (Don't worry, that aired a long time ago so obviously they are doing something right now! lol) I had never watched it but was open to trying it!

   This spot is right by Bourbon Street, so it was convenient for us to hop over to the bar scene right after dinner! 

   If you're not set on what to order, get the jambalaya pasta... After spending a week in New Orleans, it was EASILY the best meal I had while down there! Great raw oysters, and hurricanes if you're looking to grab one of New Orlean's most famous cocktails ;)

   The service was friendly and wonderful, too! This is a really cool spot to check out on the French Quarter for some great seafood!

Super dark, tables were sticky, and it looked trashy in here. Maybe I would have appreciated it drunk, but I was blind stinking sober when we came here for a late dinner.

Service was bad. Our waitress gave terrible recommendations, mixed up orders, and had a bit of an attitude.

My mom ordered a glass of wine. When she got it, there was lipstick on the rim and crumbs in the wine. Gross. She also ordered the ribs, which were "fall off the bone tender." NOT. It was like rubber.

I ordered the pasta because I wasn't feeling daring and figured it had to be really hard to mess pasta up. I didn't finish my dish. Pasta was mushy and was drowning in butter. I don't remember what my friend's husband ordered. Some fish dish and he was not impressed.

A lot of friends recommended this place. They had to have been drunk when they went to eat. Would not tell anyone to go here, even with its convenient location right next to our hotel.

Came here for the Fourth of July weekend  and this place was highly recommended by a few to get a taste of the south. man did this place not disappoint . I got the seafood gumbo and chargrilled oysters .my friend a chicken po-boy while another friend had  gumbo and we LOVED IT all of it . There was a line outside but the host working  outside took our party number and less than 10 minutes we were seated .and by the outside this place looks tiny but let me tell u inside is huge they have 3 floors .we were seated on the 3rd floor no wonder the wait was so short .the one drink I ordered was awesome I'm so sad I didn't remember the name I just know it's green, tropical and smoke comes out of it lol.whenever in town visit oceans's grill. also they have 10% off your check if U check in on yelp ! Thank me later

A server, Tina, from Royal House recommended this place for pecan pie. So we went over to order a slice to go and eat it in our hotel room. It was nice that they heated up the pie for us (upon request). 

We didn't look at it until we got back to our hotel. The slice was TINYYY. $6.50 for five small bites (probably three regular bites-worth). So not worth it.

I stopped by after a concert because I was starving. I got the special which wasn't on the menu so I can't remember all the particulars of the dish. Here's my best attempt at recalling the details. I ordered the fish, redfish I believe, topped with shrimp in a lemon butter sauce. Underneath the fish was a bed of crawfish stuffing. Not one complaint about this dish. This fish was cooked and seasoned just right. The sauce paired well with the fish and stuffing, which was really good. An extra scoop of stuffing would have been nice. I wasn't crazy about the greens but would certainly order everything else again.
Took my mother to breakfast this morning at Oceana. Food was great and the service was even better. The Pain Perdue is a must try. Thank you Cole for the fantastic service. We will be back!!

After seeing so many reviews, we had to stop by Oceana grill for some lunch. Its right off Bourbon street so pretty easy to find. There was a moderate size line but it moved pretty quick as the restaurant is deceptively big! 

We ordered the half and half alligator bites, grilled clams for the table and I had the cajun pasta for myself, as well as a round of Hurricanes

The service was a bit slow but the food came out all delicious. The both of the gator bites were delicious but I absolutely loved the blacked half! Pack with tons of cajun flavor and cooked to perfect, this was probably my favorite part of the meal. The fried were good as well but I loved the cajun seasoning. 

The oysters were great, fresh, full of flavor and the char taste came through as well. 

I was most excited for the cajun pasta but it just missed the mark. It was done well with a great potion size but just needed more of a cajun kick as it was more on the creamier, alfredo side.

Overall a very enjoyable meal, definitely recommend the blacked alligator bites!
Must get the jambalaya pasta! The sauce is delicious and they give you plenty of it. Another must have is the fried alligator bites

The oysters were good, a little too cheesy for my taste. I also ordered the Mardi Gras pasta and that was creamy, really good. I added some spicy sauce and a powder they have on the table. 

Heads up, if you check in, you may get 10% off the check, but you need to print out the coupon or else it won't get granted. That was low key a bummer, keeping in mind the app gives you coupon after checking in.

Lots of televisions blaring sports games on the walls, and casual atmosphere. The baby back ribs were outstanding so would definitely give those a go. Blackened catfish also delicious! Very reasonable place to stop if you're looking for a quick, typical bite of New Orleans

Great place for a true NOLA experience! Sierra was our server and she was super sweet, helpful, and genuine. MAJOR POINTS go to the blackened alligotor tails! Not the deep fried blandness the rest of the city offers, you can actually taste the gator. Thank you Oceana!

Awesome place !! The line looked long but we got in within 30 minutes of getting in line and we had 7 people. I recommend the crab cakes 100%. Best crab cakes I've ever had. Everything we ate was so yummy. Definitely recommend if you're looking for a good place to eat in NOLA.

Service was great! Atmosphere was good, we ordered the crab cakes to start and they were really good! For our entrees we ordered the Taste of New Orleans, which came out almost cold, like yesterdays food reheated in a microwave. Did not taste fresh at all. We also had the blackened Bayou Duck, which was good nothing over the top spectacular but good. It came with a side of jambalaya that was also cold and not fresh. Overall it was an okay spot, but we wouldn't visit again.
Food was great!! The Cajun Bloody Mary was amazing as well! Thank you all at Oceana's, especially Markesha for her friendly service

Went here based on the reviews and by a recommendation of a friend. We were pretty disappointed. 

We are visiting New Orleans and we wanted to try some authentic cajun food. Our food was clearly microwaved before being brought to us and wasnt even hot lol. The alligator bites were good but not hot. I dont think any of their food is made to order. I would not order oysters from this place.

Our waitress ,Sierra, was super friendly! She made the experience better by getting to know our names instead of calling us "honey" or "baby". She continued to check in on us so our drinks were never a problem. The food came out with great presentation and even better taste!

Great food, excellent service.

We were in New Orleans on a Sunday evening (cruise was next day).  Went walking up Bourbon, looking at restaurants.  Many were 1/4 full or less (it was a Sunday night after all).  But this one was mostly full.  Always a good sign.

Had Justin as our server.  Excellent service.  Very attentive, but not overbearing.  One of our entrees was cold when it was brought to the table, Justin immediately took it back, and had a new one made.  Mistakes happen, it is how you handle them that makes the difference, and Justin handled it perfectly.  Of course this also speaks for the restaurant as a whole, that servers are allowed to make such a decision.  Great all around.

The food was excellent.  Had the Taste of New Orleans, and crab cakes between the two of us.  Both were excellent.  Also had the alligator bites for appetizer, also excellent, and not just one or two tiny pieces (like so many places do), but an actual decent amount.  The alligator bites would actually be enough for a small meal if one was not very hungry.

Only negative - hot sauce.  They had a couple of standards on the table, and Justin said he could have gotten Tabasco,  but none of those are very hot.   I suggest that the restaurant get some real hot sauces (this is New Orleans right???).

Our first time in NOLA and Oceana Grill  was our first restaurant. Surprisingly long line at 9 pm on a weekday but moved relatively fast due to the restaurant practicing safety measures.

I ordered crawfish tails as a side and the special bbq fried chicken with jambalaya and mashed. The food was so delicious, plentiful and hearty! I appreciate our friendly waiter Brad who accommodated us. I highly recommend this restaurant as it opens late night and a good  walk from the Eliza Jane where we stayed at.

I alway visit Oceana while in NOLA.  The food is always outstanding.  We made it just before the large crowds arrived.  My favorite item is the redfish. Seasoned to perfection and cooked just right. The fish just falls apart and melts in your mouth.

This place is located right off of Bourbob St. so we were shocked to find that there was no wait. We were seated on the second floor. The restaurant was kind of empty so I was surprised when we were sat in a dark corner. I get mood lighting but it was DARK. People around us had to take out their phones to use the light to read the menu. 

We started with drinks. I got the Swamp Tea. It was a green color and was served bubbling. Very cute, but it was really tart. For my meal I got the Barbecued Shrimp and Crab Cakes. The Barbecued shrimp are in a light tangy sauce and the shrimp size were huge. They had good flavor. The crab cakes were delicious! A nice portion and served with a cream sauce. All the food had good flavor, but it came out lukewarm which was disappointing. 

One tip I will give is try the Cajun Fries. They are soooo good. 

I can't imagine where you would park so there's that. Restrooms were clean. Table was a little sticky. Service was meh. Not a terrible experience, but not fantastic either.
My new favorite restaurant!!!! I was in New Orleans for a few days visiting & I went to Oceana twice. I recommend Jessica as a server! She is awesome!
This is definitely a tourist spot and not representative of New Orleans cuisine. In fact I would classify the food as extremely average. The service was great though.
I was wary of eating right off Bourbon street but the catfish (and Abita amber!) were awesome. Everyone else in my party seemed to enjoy her food as well. The oysters were ok.

Apparently this place can get busy as when we were leaving there was a queue outside. We dined around 7ish and there was no queue so avoided the rush I guess 

Just the Mrs and I came here to get some oysters and po boys. We also ordered Cajun fries which were the highlight of our meal. The oysters were fine. Good but not great. The Po boy was a bit in the dry side. I wish they had put more sauce. The blackened chicken that generously filled the loaf of bread was delicious, just needed more sauce. Cajun fries were served with crawfish and were a cheesy, gooey mess of yumminess.

 Our meal was definitely made better by our most excellent server Desmond. He rules and has service down to an art. If I were to go off the food it would be 3 stars but thanks to the wonderful service we had it's 4.

Came here with the taste of nawlins tour group and was able to try the seafood gumbo. The place was extremely packed and full of excitement.. Wish we could have gotten the chance to go back and drink and party here. The servers seemed super happy and helpful. We only got to try the gumbo, which was delicious! I could see that the crab cakes and everything else everyone was eating looked really good too!

I mean honestly... food is insane. I dream about the shrimp po boy. Their sazarac and hurricane are delicious as well. The beat part was the amazing manager that brought a water bowl out for our pup and was nothing short of perfect during the time we were there. I mean a pet friendly restaurant in New Orleans IN A COURTYARD, with bomb cocktails and po boys, it's a no brainer.

What a great dining experience we had at Oceana Grill tonight. Met 3 sisters at the door waiting for their sides to go. They had just eaten and raved about their dinners. We were looking at the menu and they suggested we try the fried shrimp platter, they even went so far as to share a shrimp from the takeout order that just came out of kitchen. So delicious!  So I ordered that for entree and was not disappointed. 14 medium sized shrimp on a bed of crispy fries with coleslaw and served with cocktail and tarter sauce.  Hats off to our server, Jessica who couldn't have been more nice and helpful with every part of our dinner experience. Would nominate her for "employee of the month" if that was an option. Highly recommend this eatery.
Great authentic fresh food. Good quality service. First time in NOLA and had a great food experience at Oceana.  It's a must try location.

Dined here on our last night in New Orleans  (2/19), it came highly recommended from a few friends, even though it's off Bourbon. We decided to give it a go.

The ambiance: The entrance threw us a bit, because it basically looks like a bar. The dining rooms are off to the side and upstairs. Steep, narrow stairways. Basic restaurant.  No major frills or anything. 

The service: Our server took about 10 minutes to come, and seemed very flustered. We weren't informed of any specials, though we found out about them by default. We each ordered dr pepper to drink, our server disappeared for another 10 minutes or so. When he came back he didn't have any drinks. We asked what was up. With a confused look he said they were out of cups and he was waiting for some from downstairs.  Mind you, the tables next to and across from us had just received drinks...in cups. We ordered, after I inquired about the specials. My boyfriend got the fried shrimp platter. The nightly special was a shrimp and crawfish pasta, so I got it. Mistake.....

The food/drink: After 20+ minutes with no drinks our server appears with 2 sprites. We ordered dr pepper. He apologized and brought what he said was dr pepper....it was barqs root beer. We ended up asking for water. 
Our food arrived, BF had hot shrimp and cold fries and hush puppies. My pasta looked sad. Like olive garden at the end of the night sad. I'm talking overcooked, mushy fettuccine, pale red sauce, 8 shrimp and a few crawfish tails. I took one bite and spit it out. The crawfish were rubbery and super fishy. 
When our server reappeared I told him about the crawfish.  Before I could finish he walked off. His manager came over a few minutes later.  He said "have you ever had crawfish? They are very pungent." Sir, they are not! They devil is a lie! I LOVE CRAWFISH. And have eaten them so many times I could turn into one. Pungent is never a word I would use to describe them. He leaves, comes back and says "I figured out what's wrong.  Crawfish don't really go well in this sauce, it enhanced to fishy flavor." I'm sorry, WHAT?! This is YOUR SPECIAL DISH! Nah bruh, I call B.S.! 
I ended up just ordered fried shrimp, which I picked at. We should've just gone with to Drago's and gotten stuffed lobster.....sigh

Our server was Jordan and she was amazing. We came in on a Saturday evening, the wait was only about 30 minutes. The staff communicated very well. Once seated we got an amazing server. She was so great. 

We got the shrimp platter, the seafood platter, the gator bites, and the gumbo... nothing tasted bad. Legit all of the food was so good so you cannot go wrong. I can't wait to come back and visit again. My entire family enjoyed it. I really can't say enough about our waitress. Her customer service was on point! The food came so fast, everything was perfect.
I had the blackened red fish with a side of greens and jambalaya it was cold greens taste pretty good but was as if they were canned.

The oysters were amazing. I should have ordered a dozen. I got the ahi tuna. It wasn't as "warm" as I would have liked coming out but they are so busy that the turnaround for food I could imagine is slow. It was also freezing inside the air conditioning was blasting, bring a sweatshirt if you go.
Overall good food.

Great authentic Cajun food. I had the gator tail bites. And the blackened chicken Poboy with seafood gumbo. All of which came out great and were plated well. Bartender was friendly and the place was clean. The only complaint I could give is that the turn around time for food was very slow about 45mins between ordering and eating.

Landed in NOLA really late and was looking for a place walking distance from my hotel that would be open at midnight. This popped up on my search and being a pescatarian, I was ecstatic. It surprisingly wasn't crowded and I got seated relatively quickly. The service was incredible and my server was such a sweetheart. Checked in often and was really warm and welcoming (got that southern hospitality immediately upon arrival to Louisiana). I ordered the shrimp platter and it came out really fast. The portion is VERY generous and I got through 3/4 of it. I was a little underwhelmed by the flavor because it basically tasted like frozen shrimp and fries I get at the local market and defrost. It wasn't bad (minus the tartar sauce which did taste funny/old) but it wasn't something phenomenal. The hush puppies were actually pretty good--had a kick to them. All in all, a decent spot to visit for a quick bite. My tour guide recommended it to our group a few days later and suggested the blackened rockfish and had I stayed longer I would've gone back and tried it because it was a nice spot. Definitely recommend and would visit again on my next trip.

We had some of the most delicious food at this location! We got Grilled Alligator bites, Oysters, Mardi Gras Pasta,  and a sampler called "The Taste of New Orleans." Everything was seasoned and cooked to perfection! This was one of the best restaurants in New Orleans we've tried. And our server Latricia was amazing! She was fast, efficient, and always checked up on us. Not to mention her great personality and recommendations. She definitely attributed to our visit! If my best friend and I are ever in New Orleans, we will definitely return!

This place is great, we actually visited twice in the same day. It's right on Bourbon Street, and open 24/7. The food was amazing, I loved my breakfast which was the maw maws dish,, very tasty and filling. The same evening we returned and had oysters, which were perfect. Do make you way into this spot.

This place is delicious! Servers are extremely polite, helpful, and attentive. I tried their redfish plate and the sauce is so good! Blackened chicken was flavorful. Cajun fries are also so good, recommend getting that for the table! It's definitely a pricey place though so don't be surprised. Just my plate and a beer we're about $30 but what can you expect, it's seafood and delicious!

I found this restaurant from Yelp actually. A bunch of friends were on vacation and wanted a restaurant with a decent menu with some variety. Part of our group loves seafood, part of it hates it. We were there on a Friday evening and yet got seating pretty quickly and our food quickly as well. When we ordered my bf got chicken Alfredo and the server recommended it blackened. It ended up being the best meal at the table, which is saying something. The catfish was also excellent. We liked the restaurant enough we got more friends and went back on Sunday with an even larger group. 

I highly recommend.

While the food is decent, the service was atrocious. I ordered a drink and when the bartender (Devan) served it I repeated a previous request for a glass of water to accompany my drink. His response was "uh uh! You ask your server." Which would seem reasonable if I could discern who my server was. They also refused to honor the 10% discount for the yelp check in. For $20 a plate for a pasta dish, I don't believe it to be unreasonable to ask for a glass of water.

Came in for a quick dinner. Management was amazing with a matching, great atmosphere. Our server Brianna was personable, made great recommendations and checked in with us as needed. Food was amazing, highly recommend!

First day in New Orleans and we were disappointed by the construction. Low and behold this little gem. Our waitress was amazing, the lost bread was to die for and the mimosas were top notch. Then I got dinner to go and it was just as good. Very friendly and pretty comparable price-wise.

Came here because a lot of locals recommended this place! So I was super excited. The menu is so big there was so much to choose from! 

Everytime was absolutely great because the little things here and there. 

The mardi gra pasta actually! Was amazing through and through so much seafood. 

The blackend chicken sandwich was my second favorite but the bread was so thick so I wish it had more of that delicious filling. 

I got the fried platter which was catfish, shrimp, oysters, and French fries. Wow! The catfish was so tender and the shrimp was so juicy. The oysters kinda left me a weird aftertaste. Otherwise reminder that this platter is definitely made for 2-3 people. I couldn't finish it!! As much as I wish I did. 

Drinks-  I got the swamp tea and it was a refreshing alcohol choice. It left me a weird aftertaste. But I think it just didn't pair well with the seafood. I'll get wine next time! 

Server! I didn't get his name but he was so nice and always checked up on us.

Errol was a great server and the food was effing amazing. We had the seafood omelet and (I believe) the St. James crepe. The seafood was amazing, flavorful, and seasoned perfectly. I cannot recommend this place enough! I'll definitely be coming back here the next time I'm in New Orleans.

This place is awesome! There was some confusion as to whether or not our party of 8 could be seated, but I think the woman who was so confused has just come on the schedule and didn't know what she was talking about. Once the manager go a hold of us we were taken up stairs to a huge room with a few other parties. It's was mostly empty!

Our server was Darrick, and you need him to be your server. He was probably the. Eat server we've had in NOLA. He was polite, very helpful, and was smart!  I totally took his recommendation for dinner and had NO regrets. 

My husband and I ordered oysters in the half shell for an appetizer. This was my first time eating this and they were wonderful. My in-laws both ordered gumbo and they really liked it. All the kids shared cheese sticks, and they ate them all, so that tells me they were good. 

For the meal I listens to Darrick and ordered the blackens duck (HUGE portion and it was delicious), hubby ordered BBQ shrimp & gumbo (the gumbo was very good, I didn't try a shrimp but I liked the sauce), my in-laws ordered crab cakes (very, very good! A little spicy, but good). 

The food was awesome across the board. Everyone left happy and full.  I think everyone should come and try Oceana.

We came here after the log wait at royal house. We sat at the bar and ordered some beers. I got the taste of New Orleans and my husband got the blackened catfish. They served my entree all together in one dish which is different than a lot of places. I actually like it this way so that I could blend the flavors together. The crawfish étouffée was very good, probably one of the best that I've had. The red beans and rice with sausage was average and jambalaya was a little better than average. Service was quick and overall not bad.

We started with their famous char broiled oysters in a garlic mushroom cream sauce. I prefer raw oysters but these were so tasty and the sauce so delicious I'm hooked. Definitely a must have.

I got the blackened duck with an ettouffee cream sauce. The duck is smoked for 24 hours and then fried before serving. The duck was still tender and moist. It had a side of creole jambalaya and mustard greens. The greens were delicious.  The jambalaya was good but I prefer the cajun version better.

The wife got the blackened redfish with ettouffee sauce with the same sides. I got to try the fish and it was moist and cooked perfectly.  The spice level was spot on. 

We started with Swamp Tea and a hurricane and man were they tasty.

Can't wait to go back to New Orleans and hit this place up again.

I was passing by New Orleans during corona and I just had to try Cajun food. This place was absolutely great, had pristine reviews and was the only one that was still opened for takeout in French Quarter. 
The takeout went smoothly, so fast and easy. The food was SO GOOD that I came back the next day. The gentleman in the phone recommended their best dishes, we got mixed gator bites, fish, some really great Cajun pasta and so on, even their fries were on point!

Thank you for all of your great work and for being with us during these tough times!

FOOD//
My friends and I tried multiple dishes as a sneak peek to the food that we will be eating in coming 3 days. So, it was not like a time for me to flavor every single meal. However, I really liked the taste of new orleans with its fried catfish, fried oysters, fries, etc. They were well fried and still held its true taste of the "meat."

ATMOSPHERE//
Very spacious and creative interior designs.

SERVICE//
Could be 1% better, but I had nothing to complain about.

SURROUNDINGS//
O  YAAAA

Long line and food was ok. Definitely doesn't live up to the hype. If you're on bourbon street, it's late, and you're hungry then sure settle for Oceana grill other than that I'd recommend finding other eateries NOLA has to offer

Oceans Grill. The restaurant you can't count on in the quarter to have good food, at a great price , brought to you by great servers. 
 
The restaurant is narrow, but has multiple floors and multiple dining rooms. Both times we visited , we were seated in the 2nd floor which has good views. The decor is casual and colorful. The servers are very informative. They want you to be happy with your meal and have fun if you're visiting the area.

The food is that typical Louisiana cuisine. Po boys, seafood and rice, seafood and pasta. Seafood, seafood, seafood . They have a extensive bar menu as well, to-go cups available upon request.

The crab cakes were more bread-like than I would have preferred, but they are served with a crawfish cream sauce that was really delicious. They did the collard greens RIGHT, so I very much enjoyed that. The mashed potatoes are from red skin potatoes and are creamy and good; perfect for sopping up that crawfish cream sauce.

My second visit was a pre-drinking visit, so I had the fried catfish Po Boy, which comes with lettuce, slaw, tomato, remoulade, pickles and red onion . Delicious. The French fries were also fried a little harder than McDonalds' fast food chains fries and sprinkled with a little seasoning that reminds me of Season All. 

I'm told they are available for delivery, take out , so if you are visiting and don't want to leave your hotel, this might be a good place to visit:
Really good place to sit down and enjoy a po boy!!! Try the crab cakes and the brownie while you're at it :)

A small group of us decided to go and have dinner in the French Quarters after walking Bourbon.

We stumbled on this Yelp suggestion and we're all very pleased!

Whenever I come to New Orleans I make sure to go on a seafood binge...and we did!
