We started off with the order of crab cakes, and the 'Taste of New Orleans'! The crab cakes were heft in size and packed a great punch, and let's not forget the crawfish and sauce on top.

The 'Taste of New Orleans' was greatly assorted with the Etouffee, jambalaya, and red beans and rice! It was great to sample the staples of the restaurant.

I chose to go with the 'Redfish Oceana' and was very pleased with my choice. I thoroughly enjoyed this restaurant and will make sure to stop through on my visits now!
Definitely stop here the Cajun fries are so good and the clams are toooo good  our server Jamal was the reason our experience was memorable he was very polite and attentive , don't pass this place up
Best part of our experience was Derrick!  Service was amazing! Great recommendations for the city.  The food recommendations were great as well!  We really enjoyed our experience!

Food was delicious! We had the Mardi Gras Pasta as well as the entree special of the day which was crab cakes and shrimp. Both were delicious. Our waiter Carlton was excellent. Always on top of everything and made it a great dining experience.

Think Red Lobster.  That's what this place reminds me of.  Good food but not amazing.  I ordered gumbo for an appetizer and it was good.  Then for the main course I had the Alligator Sausage Po Boy w/fries on the side and it was decent.  Tasted a lot like sausage to be honest.  

Not a MUST go to place while visiting NOLA but if you are looking for food to soak up the many drinks you've had on Bourbon go here. :)

A group of us went to this place on a Friday for a late lunch after arriving in town. There were very few tables occupied but the amount of time it took to get our food and be waited on was disappointing. The overall taste of the food was okay but not the best. We weren't impressed.
Good portions and creamy, yummy sauces on the crab cakes, redfish oceana, and Mardi Gras pasta.

Came here during Mardi Gras and there was a LONG line outside but the wait wasn't bad - maybe 10 mins... Kuddos to the staff for doing such a great job with getting patrons seated so quickly!!!

The restaurant is large - my sister and I were seated on the second floor (it looks like there may have been a 3rd floor also); our waiter, Chris, took our orders immediately... We ordered Eggplant sticks, an order of mustard greens, a Caesar salad, Charbroiled Oysters and the special for the night - 2 filet medallions with crab cake and crawfish cornbread. The greens and Caesar salad came out fast but everything else seemed to take forever but it was Fat Tuesday and it was crowded so I understand but it was a little disappointing... HOWEVER, the taste of the food and the good service (minus the wait) overshadowed the time it took for us to get our food.

Several people had recommended dining here and I'm so glad that we were able to indulge. Whenever I return to New Orleans, I will definitely return!

The BEST gumbo we had when we were here in New Orleans! No lie!

Our server Anthony was one of the coolest guys we met here as well! Great conversation, great drink recommendations! 

This place does get busy but have tons of seating upstairs and downstairs. 

Will be back on our next trip!!

It was recommended by a few friends who frequent New Orleans that we stop at Oceana Grill. Don't be surprised if you see a line. There's always a line outside but it moves pretty quick. The AC inside will cool you down fast if you've been out in the heat. We had excellent service by KIM!! Wasn't a fan of their "famous" oysters, just not my flavor...but the CRAB CAKES were legit the best!! Order the Crab Cakes and thank me later.

We had a great New Orleans lunch here Saturday. I chose the redfish Oceana which is a signature dish here. Redfish is a wonderful eating fish. This one was topped with crawfish mushroom cream sauce and it was delicious! Garlic mashed potatoes were fine. This was my first time having sauteed mustard greens, and I must say they were very tasty. Our server, John, was excellent. This was a great way to finish off our trip to New Orleans.
Wait was non existent, staff is badass, Zach was great. Food was top notch. Check in and get that 10% off!!!

Ordered a cup of gumbo and the red beans and rice through DoorDash.  The delivery was fast.  The gumbo and the red beans and rice were very good but the $16 charged for the small quantity of red beans and rice was absolutely ridiculous. Food was 4-5 starts but due to price, I'm giving it 3 stars.  Looks like this place may be in the French Quarter, hence the high prices.  Do go, but hold on to your wallet.

It was my boyfriend and my first time in New Orleans, celebrating accomplishments of 2021 and celebrating a new year of adventures. My brother and his girlfriend recommended we try this place while in NOLA. I am so happy I was able to oblige. The Oceana Oysters and a side of fries were definitely the highlights of our order. It was so good! Corey, our server, was so hospitable! He added to my great evening with his positivity. Thank you for making our first evening in NOLA great!

Nice touristy spot to dine at while guests are in town. Wonderful dessert options. Accommodating for large parties. Keep in mind if you have one who can't do stairs, request to sit on the bottom floor. Stairs were pretty narrow and carpeted.
Damon was a great server and the ultimate Bloody Mary was an experience!!!
Amazing food. Stopped for breakfast. Crepes and omelets were out of this world. Latricia is fantastic!

I didn't think I was going to be that into this place, but my husband and I were going on a swamp tour the following day to be one with alligators, so I figured we'd eat one before we have our adventure. 

We came for a snack at about 3pm, so we got a table pretty quickly. It filled up within the hour though. 

We tried the blackened gator bites, raw oysters, and charbroiled. The gator bites were most definitely the star. Tender, juicy, and the seasoning was just right. I need to catch me some alligator for eatin.'

Raw oysters were fresh, and the shucker was able to keep the juices intact, that's an A+. The charbroiled oysters were tasty, but one would have been enough. We ordered half a dozen, I can't imagine a dozen, the raw ones are much better. 

Service was friendly and fast, not much more you could ask for.

Pretty much located on Bourbon Street, it's a convenient place to grab a nice sit-down meal while exploring the area.

My girlfriend and I stopped by for dinner after watching one of the largest Carnival parades on the last weekend before Fat Tuesday. Bourbon Street was crazy busy, but we quickly found a seat at the restaurant. Everyone was obviously more interested in drinking on the streets than having a nice meal. 

We both weren't that hungry, so we shared the Taste of New Orleans. At this point, we had already tried jambalaya and crawfish etouffe at Gumbo Shop, but might as well try some more while we're in New Orleans~ It was a great choice! Worth the higher price point. Much better than Gumbo Shop. The food came out extremely quickly (even our server was surprised), and we devoured it in minutes. Everything was flavorful and had a good balance of rice and meat. 

In addition to the amazing food, the service was wonderful. Our server was extremely friendly and helpful. We already knew everything on our plate, but he offered to explain the different items. I thought that was nice. He was very upbeat and happy despite the drunken crowd, and he happily gave us a 10% discount for checking in (we just tipped it back to him). 

Overall, wonderful food and service at a convenient location. I highly recommend it to anyone visiting New Orleans.

After a tiring day of walking, drinking and exploring French quarter
We decided to head for some dinner
We started off with their garlic shrimp- one of the best barbeque shrimp I have ever had...
Mains was Crabs in crawfish creole sauce, which were okay. Nothing that was 
But I did try my very first alligator bites as well, for me it had a weird chewy chicken like texture but overall decent.
Place location is great and servers are attentive. I would definitely visit them next time I am in town

We came into the wrong location and was referred here by the Security Guards. Mentioned to come to this location and had the server Sidney and mentioned that the Cajun Pasta was the best available.  Best Recommedations

This was one of my favorite meals in New Orleans everything from the service ,to the drinks, and the food was perfection! Our waitress name was Regene D. she was amazing super sweet called us all "My Baby"  I asked for her recommendation and I am so glad I did  she went above and beyond for us and definitely made our experience one to remember. The food she recommended was delicious super flavorful good Ol southern food, the type of food that makes you wish you had a second stomach so you can eat more lol. The restaurant is only a few feet from bourbon street so if you go for dinner be prepared to walk outside to a party, some won't like that but for us it was a perfect way to start our night and it definitely added to the experience. Eat here enjoy a few drinks , take in the party environment you won't regret it!

Great Food! When my mom comes to visit, THIS  is the spot she wants to come to first and she's not easy to please!  I've been here for both breakfast and dinners and nothing has yet to disappoint.  The only downfall is that sometimes when there's a lot going on in the city it's a little hard to get to if all you want to do is grab a bite to eat.

I was definitely skeptical when I first walked into Oceana but my opinion soon changed. Our waiter Rick was extremely accommodating and very friendly. I ordered the surf and turf special which was a blackened rib-eye steak and fried oysters with a craw fish cream sauce. It also came with a side of jambalaya and veggies. Everything was delicious! My friend ordered the blackened chicken and was equally thrilled. For dessert we had the bananas foster ice cream cake. Perfect ending to a great meal. At the end of the meal Rick even wrote down a few restaurant recommendations for us.

AMAZING!! I absolutely loved this place. We were in NOLA for a week and we tried many restaurants and Oceana Grill was my favorite. So much that I went back for a second time before leaving town. We tried quite a few things off of the menu and everything was delicious. My favorite was the crab cakes and blackened gator. You can choose to dine inside or the outside patio and we chose outside patio both times. I'm back in my hometown and I'm already craving to go back! Will def return when I'm back in NOLA.

Wanted a great seafood meal on my first trip to NOLA. Decided to eat here at Oceana. Wasn't disappointed.
The establishment was old and full of history. Right off of Bourbon. Enjoyed the atmosphere, music and food.

amazing service and food! I ordered the tropical storm (alcoholic beverage) with the oyster platter. Then later during the week I ordered the red beans and rice. The service was good but the best waiter I got was Damon! He was made sure my party and I were taken care of and showed that Louisiana hospitality! I recommend going to oceana and also requesting Damon as your server!

Tourist trap. Service was pretty bad, food came late and we had to follow up a few times. Ordered a salad and vegetables were wilted. Food ordered:
Blackened Catfish, Caesar Salad, crab cakes appetizer
Bree was AMAZING!! She gave us an amazing time with great hospitality. She fulfilled our New Orleans experience and we all appreciate her!!

Yes yes yes. We were on one of the upper fooors for dinner. Traditional stay New Orleans building. So cool loved the traditional feel. The good was amazing g. Do the Louisanna traditional dinners. Worth every penny. Also the blackened shrimp app and famous oysters. Doz for $22. To die for! Get the Juicifer IPA and u will be set.

Amongst one if the best tasting seafood i have tried! Although first time in NO, the other yelpers are pretty spot on with the reviews! Great place to recommend if you are visiting. 

We were passing though on a cross country road-trip and stopped to try some of New Orleans famous seafood. I myself LOVE seafood but since a recent shrimp allergy I'm forced to try other things. I tried the blackened redfish topped with crawfish étouffée while my boyfriend just had a simple steak. The redfish dish was to DIE for and was seasoned to perfection! The portions are a tad bigger than necessary but if your appetite is huge- then you would love this! My boyfriends dinner was supposed to be cooked medium but the meat came out more medium well which was a bit tougher then we like it to be- still had great flavor and the sides were great. 

Service was great. Drinks were good! We had this drink that came out smoking which was a cool dry ice effect. Because we had a fishbowl and some other drinks before we came, we were very drunk after the strong drinks at the oceana! All in all an amazing experience and will be back again if we are ever in the city! Thanks NO!
The food was fantastic and the vibe was chill. Our food delivery goddess, Sierra, was amazing! She was super friendly and funny and made the experience even better. 10/10 would return!
Awesome raging cajun bloodyMary's! $12 for a dozen shucked oysters! Cheapest around bourbon... Great service

This joint right here was on point. This was my last night in LA, and I hadn't had any jambalaya. A friend on mine, who down before the conference said he knew the perfect spot. From the outside, the restaurant doesn't look as big, once you go inside, this joint has like 4 levels. The waitress was doing her thing, it was 8 of us so needless to say we didn't have to wait for anything. Check this place out, if you get a chance to visit LA.

I was pleasantly stoked by Oceana Grill. Upon arrival, there was a line out the door and around the corner of people, probably 15 in front of us.  As an avid Yelper, I was frantically looking for another venue to go to, but the greeter assured us that it wouldn't take too long for us to be seated.  10 minutes later we were seated and ordering drinks.  5 minutes later than that, we had our drinks and crab cakes in hand (soooooo goood) and 5 minutes after that we had our entrees.  Oceana has super quick service has a very classic NoLa feel to it inside and will definitely be on my list mext time I am in NoLa. I had the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta and was estatic with my choice!  In all for pasta, crab cakes and a drink, I paid about $35

Overall: 4.5
Venue: 4
Service: 5
Food: 5
Drinks: 4
Price: $$$
Great food and spectacular customer service I particularly drive there just to have spinach ravioli and blackened chicken it's my FAVORITE dish on the menu

They had so much space to accommodate our large party without a wait. Woo!

I loved the fried gator bites and fries as starters. We got the seafood platter and gumbo as a meal. The seafood platter was great and wasn't super overwhelming with fries. The gumbo, I probably could of passed on as the ratio of rice to liquid was a bit lacking.

Overall, Sydney was amazing. We had a great time and we're super stoked to make it
Our server Damon and the food made this a wonderful experience for my wife and her twin sisters birthday celebration.  Thank you Damon!

The line was out the door, but it moved very fast. I had the taste of New Orleans and this is the spot to get to try many of the New Orleans classics all in one meal. The food was flavorful. The Alfredo sauce was also delicious. One tip - don't get the house salad. A few pieces of lettuce, one tomato slice, and one slice of onion. It just wasn't worth the $6.50.

Oceana Grill was pretty decent food and good service. Oceana wasn't far from our hotel and it seemed to be a favorite restaurant. My husband also walked to a welcome center and grabbed a brochure from Oceana, so while trying to find food one day we decided to stop here. My husband wanted a PoBoy and I wanted Crawfish Étouffée so we killed two birds with one stone. There was a small line but it moved quickly. The service was good. Our waiter's name was Ashleigh and she was very good and attentive. 

I ordered the Crawfish Étouffée and my husband ordered the Grilled Blackened Shrimp PoBoy. The Étouffée was pretty good. It had plenty of Crawfish. The seasoning was decent, it could have been a little more seasoned. My husband enjoyed his PoBoy. I took a bite and it was pretty good. The shrimp was seasoned well and not over cooked. 

Overall, Oceana was decent for a quick meal. It was more bar food style and not upscale. This is for a quick meal not a sit down elegant meal. When I say bar food I mean the style like quick not upscale. I don't mean wings and fries. They have all the New Orleans classics but, my point is I don't think they necessarily specialize in them. Seems more chain-ish and not mom and pop type of restaurant.
My server Latricia was wonderfully hospitable and the food was delicious! I came here for some good Nola vibes and food and I got both.

The best crab cakes I've ever had. I mean everything was delicious. We were recommended to try Oceana by the concierge of our hotel, straight off the plane and it was one of the best experiences of our trip. The staff was so warm and welcoming and our waiter, with the distinct deep Louisiana voice (who's name escapes me but it starts with an O) gave us the best menu recommendations and the best service. We will be going back on our next trip to NOLA! Crab Cakes and Chargrilled Oysters a must! Oh, and delicious Hurricane cocktail!

~~~Breakfast And Lunch: Brunch~~~

10% Off with Yelp Check-in

After our morning tour around NOLA, our tour guide dropped us off near Laura's Candies, not too far from Oceana. How did we decide to dine at Oceana with several comparable restaurants nearby? "Discounts"...Yes, it's very important to stretch your dollars while traveling. We were offered both the breakfast & lunch menu. 

I Luv me some Breakfast but I wanted to try the Jambalaya on the lunch menu. Our server was great! He filled us in on Maw Maw's Cajun Breakfast, not on the menu. It's Jambalaya with scrambled eggs mixed in with a side of biscuits. Big enough to feed two people! He had the kitchen staff split our plate for us, free of charge! It had a generous amount of shrimps. We both enjoyed our meals with the Louisiana hot sauces that was available for us. 

Excellent service, yummy food, happy tummies and not too shabby on the pocketbook. Yep, we'll surely come back the next time we're in town.

July30:
Terrible experience. Ordered delivery and took nearly 3 hours to get my food. Food was cold and ruined. my dessert melted and was syrup consistency.

Update: After contacting the store several times to get a refund, i've only ever received a refund ever for the dessert. They've promises to connect me to someone to get a full refund, but to this date never received anything or even a call back. Don't waste your time or money.

Its crazy how long the line at this restaurant  is, considering there are three floors for people to sit. Average wait time for a party of 3 is about 10minutes. 

Food: We got the Alligator tails, i liked it fried better than blackened. The oceana oysters was a bit too creamy for me and overshadowed the oysters itself. The crab cakes were amazing. The shrimp etoufee and the Gumbo were very delicious 8/10 and the Chicken Po boy was honestly dry and just sub par.

Service: our waiter was quick, attentive and checked on my group regularly. Its a good place to eat in the quarters and i would be visiting again before i leave NOLA

Holy moly! Everything we had was ridiculously delicious. We had the gator bites, the Taste of New Orleans and Hurricanes. I was in heaven. Not to mention Errol was such an sweet server. What an amazing, authentic experience. Def recommended everyone try this spot.
Loved it! SIERRA was our server & she was awesome! Great restaurant! GREAT FOOD! We all loved the food & service! Try it!

BABYYY Let me tell you Oceana is a must
When you step foot in the NOLA!

My friends and I stayed at the royal sonesta which is directly across the street from this bomb ass restaurant.

We didn't really pay attention to the restaurants surrounding our hotel we assumed they were too commercial. 

How wrong were we! Our last night we were searching for a dope po boy to finalize our trip. We were told to go to Pat O Briens but they however do not sell po boys on their daily menu..

The lady there directed us to oceana for a po boy expletive to remember. 

Now the NoLa period had provided awesome food from the first day.
 I was insanely surprised how wonderful everything taste in the big easy seriously it's insane.

So I ordered the alligator bites as I see alligator is pretty much on the menu in nearly every restaurants so it had to be good I said to myself.

And self was right! Taste like chicken! Good flavorful chicken.

I ordered the blackened catfish po boy with everything on it .. Lawd if you could taste a unicorn I'm pretty sure that would be it. So flavorful so amazing everything just worked together so well I almost cried.

The service was wonderful thank you Allan.

Please go and fall in love at oceana and forever be changed by the Nola and their awesome restaurants.

For a first experience in New Orleans I can't be mad at our choice of Oceana Grill. Even if it becomes later known to be not real or authentic, it was very good to us. The building is pretty cool. Gave me a sense of being in college and going to the bar. I suspect prepandemic that this place probably was/is a lot of fun. 

We started off with the Cajun fries and added the crocodile. Crocodile is a happy surprise! Texture is good, and the Cajun seasoning made those little bomb bites delicious. The sauce on the fries was super rich, but in a good way. We probably could have had it as a meal and been full. 

I ordered the red beans and rice. It is a very flavorful dish. My daughter got the jambalaya Cajun pasta. That was also fire. My other daughter blackened catfish. Both plates consumed by kids, and if kids like it that means it tastes good. The wife chose the crocodile PoBoy. I mean each bite is like a flavor explosion in your mouth. I am pretty confident any item ordered is going to be a good choice. 

We definitely recommend Oceana and appreciate it as a first introduction to Cajun fare.

Pleasant surprise.  We were looking for breakfast on our last day there and stopped in since it was close to the hotel.   Saw the crab cakes and had to try them (despite wanting breakfast).   They were delicious.   We love crab cakes and they were some of the best we've had.  She had a veggie omelette that was topped with an amazing sauce.   I had the New Orleans style French toast that was also delicious.   Happy with our unplanned visit.  Would go again.

We made a dinner reservation on a Sunday night before the NCAA National Championship.  We were seated immediately.  The place is dark, with lots of red light, and a little cramped.  The service was great.  The waitstaff is awesome and were very attentive at anything we needed.  I had a shrimp poboy.  It was very good and a lot of food.  I couldn't even finish it because I got full.  Everyone at my table was happy with their food.  The other customers were so much fun and we got into a lively discussion about football.  I'd love to go back and try more from their menu!

There's always a line to get in! But it moved fast, and now I know why, the service and food are great! 

We came for breakfast, Latricia was our waitress and she was GREAT! actually everyone that works here is amazing, once you enter everyone says hello to you, I'm so not use to that! 

Latricia made sure my coffee was always filled which is great because I'm very cranky without it. 

Alligator sausage which my husband ordered... he loved it,
I got a basic eggs, bacon, potatoes meal, everything was good, potatoes had plenty of flavor. 

My friend had the New Orleans sampler, which came with jambalaya, gumbo, and something else I can't remember, but she enjoyed it all. 

I will definitely keep this place on my list for when I come back!

This was the first restaurant in my NOLA trip that I consulted Yelp for, randomly realizing, "Well I've been exploring a lot but what would my BRETHREN say?" Yelpers agreed this place was awesome and it WAS, but I'm giving 4 stars because I ordered the catfish platter and while it was GOOD, I was expecting something more than what I could get in New York, and I HAVE had tastier, more flavorful catfish. Also I got the Swamp Tea, which came tasty and green, and smoking from the ice. 

My FRIEND however, who is a vegetarian, noticed that some vegetarian options she saw on the website weren't on the physical menu once inside Oceana. When she asked the waitress about this, she said even though it wasn't on the physical menu, she could still order. So she got the spinach ravioli and let me tell you how jealous I was.

When the waitress placed her bowl on the table, the smell instantly captivated me. The presentation was on point. This meatless ravioli looked like something out of a five-star Michelin-rated restaurant. I tried it myself and was blown away. I LOVE me some meat and seafood but if I could have snapped my fingers and traded in my catfish for her damn spinach ravioli, I would have. The herbs and spices, the freshness of the spinach, the SAUCE. My friend even commented "seems a bit garlicky," BUT I LOVE GARLIC so this just made it even more appealing to me! 

I regret not getting that damn spinach ravioli, but you don't have to because you're going to do what I didn't.

Hmmm....I was not impressed. First, I have to start with, upon arriving I checked-in, using Yelp; that earned me a 10% discount on my bill. It said to show it to the waitress or Manager.  I did that and here is how the convo went.
Me: I have a 10% off coupon for checking in on Yelp. (And I showed her my phone and she read that it said that)
Her: Oh, you have to print that put
Me: Uhh, it doesn't say that at all, and how do you expect me to print something while I'm seated in a restaurant 
Her: I know, it doesn't make sense, but we've been getting lots of those, and the Manager said it must be printed
Me: It doesn't say any of what you just said; it says to show you
Her: I know, I'm sorry

I let it go. 10% isn't much, but still, why false advertise?  That set the mood for the rest of the dinner.  Waitress disappeared for lengthy periods of time. They brought the wrong order, COLD, to one of my party members.  Oh, we were a party of 6. They brought 1 dish out, 15 mins before everyone else's (it wasn't an appetizer). When they brought the rest, they forgot 1 entire dish. Another 10-minute wait for that. Then 5 mins later they bring me my dish...again.  I told the guy (which wasn't my waitress) he might as well leave it since it was made, just don't charge me, this earned a laugh. I got the catfish platter. I kid you not, there was nothing "flaky" or "fried" about it.  What I got was soggy breaded pieces of fish. I'm sure it had been sitting under the heat lamp for some time. We asked for more tarter sauce. It took, literally 10 minutes to get it. We saw the waitress pass by, and she said, and I quote, "They had to go up to the freezer to get it. It should be here soon."  You get the idea.  Fast forward, check time. Party of 6, split in 2, guess what?  You can guess,  wrong dishes on the check, stuff we didn't even order on the check.  Total visit time 2 hrs for a party of 6 and it wasn't because of us or them being super busy.

I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE!

Amazing experience.

First of all the server was amazing. Great smile and a warm welcome. 

We had Parmesan Oysters and Vegetarian pasta. I have been searching for charred or baked oysters, I found them here and they were too good.

Vegetarian pasta is more creamy and buttery (too much) but the taste and texture was good.

For desserts, we got the bread pudding! It was yum but so filling that we could not finish it. Haha!

I just had the seafood omelette with the crawfish sauce and it was absolutely amazing!!!! The packaging was PERFECT and the food fresh!! Once it arrived to my hotel at the Ritz I transferred it onto one of the plates they gave me and I enjoyed my breakfast!!! If you are ever in New Orleans and want some breakfast this place won't disappoint!

This is a cool restaurant located off of Bourbon Street. There was little to no wait time at the door. Just make sure to tell the hostess that you are on the VIP list . There really isn't any parking so you will most likely have to walk. 

We ordered the Mardi Gras pasta, crab cakes,
oysters, and seafood gumbo. The highlight would have to be the crab cakes. Probably the best crab cakes I've had in some time. The gumbo was ok but could have used a little more Cajun flavor and seafood. The oysters were good but also nothing spectacular. 

They have a few drinks on the menu and we ordered the daiquiris. The competition is high so I probably wouldn't stop here again (unless I'm hungry for some crab cakes), however our waiter was very nice and we enjoyed the service.

Oceana Grill was our first stop in New Orleans for the weekend. Due to covid, you have to wait outside with a mask on but we were not waiting too long.

Once seated, we ordered drinks - there is a limited beer selection here but I did try a raspberry wheat beer that was pretty good. 

For appetizers, we ordered the gator tail bites and the oysters Rockefeller. Both items are not for weak stomachs as they are heavily seasoned! Both were VERY tasty. The oysters Rockefeller are in a butter and Parmesan sauce that is so delicious - we got 12 and it was perfect for 4 people. The gator tail bites are also enough to be shared. 

The catfish po'boy was absolutely delicious. I have had ok catfish and this really made me change my mind about it. My fiancé and other friend ordered the jambalaya pasta and were not impressed with the amount of seafood given but very good flavor! 

Our one friend who doesn't eat seafood ordered and LOVED the ribs - however we went home after and he had a horrible reaction and was in the bathroom all night. The ribs are not heavily seasoned so we are not sure if it was food poisoning. 

Decent restaurant functioning despite covid.

NOLA visitor review: I decided to come here based on the amazing reviews. There was a line out the door to get seating. Fortunately we only waited 15-20 mins before getting bar seating. 

I cannot understand how people think this food is good!! It's just covered in sauce, no spice, lacking taste! We got crab cakes for appetizers which were doused in gravy (1/5). I got the special fettuccini alfredo with shrimp/lobster which was so bland (1/5) and once again a whole lot of alfredo sauce. My husband got the grilled red snapper which came with a side of beans - this one was enjoyable (3.5/5). For dessert, we got pecan pie. Now I looove pecan pie, but this was mushy including the crust.

A nola native told us that most French quarter restaurants just have hype. Oceana wins that award.

Came on a sunday afternoon around 1pm and there was no wait. Fast friendly service, and the food was really good! Keeping in mind i was so hung over (not a good town to be hungover in) and still enjoyed the meal! We had the blackened duck and blackened red fish, both were big portions. Good bang for your buck!

Came here on the recommendation of our tour guide and boy was I glad that I did!  They have an extensive menu of many creole and cajun favorites, but it was no contest for me, from the moment the tour guide mentioned his favorite dish, the blackened redfish etouffee I knew that was the dish for me.    Wow!  This dish was spicy and flavorful, a perfect combination of the spicy blackened redfish and the creamy crawfish etouffee.  

It also came with jambalaya which was also packed with flavor and was very tasty.  The sauteed mustard greens were surprisingly enjoyable as well.  I only didn't finish them because I was stuffed and of all of the parts of the meal was the least impressive, but don't let that fool you, they were a great veggie side! 

The place has a great vibe, and like many spots in New Orleans, a hidden outdoor patio in the courtyard inside.  While the weather was nice enough for us to enjoy the outdoors, their busyness did not allow for it on this trip.  We went on a weekend at lunch, and there was a decent line to get in and get a table so plan accordingly especially if you are a bigger group.  

The staff was super friendly and personable.  We were in town for the Bills game and were still wearing our Bills gear after a fun win on Thanskgiving, the staff were happy to chat about the Bills and the game in a fun and friendly way.  

Definitely a spot I would look to visit again when in town!  Try Oceana for a great selection of cajun and creole favorites!

I've been waiting 2 years to come back and eat the crab cakes at Oceana and I was not disappointed. Okay we started with crab cakes, seafood gumbo, chicken and sausage gumbo, then for our entree we split the seafood and finished off with the bread pudding. Everything was cooked perfectly and delicious. The bread pudding was one of the best I've ever tried and it has a lot of raisins in it. The strawberry cheesecake looked scrumptious but we were already stuffed so maybe next time. Tim our server was attentive and never too far away. This is a must visit in New Orleans.

There are SO many great things to say about Oceana Grill, so let me list them out for you:

Hostess - Amazingly wonderful! She was super accommodating and sweet and made sure we were seated comfortably.

Service - Our waiter Damon was so sweet and hardworking and made my friend's birthday lunch there extra special with his gift and bday serenade. He should be made a permanent waiter there, STAT! Josh, the bartender, also made the drinks strong but very tasty. 

Food - My goodness... The food was sensationallllllllllllllllllllll! All those L's were necessary because it was THAT delightful! The crab cakes were delectable. The creamy sauce it came with was perfection. The alligator bites were also wonderful and an awesome way to start the meal. For my entree, I got the St. Francis crepes that consisted of crawfish, veggies, and an amazing sauce. Even when I warmed up the leftovers the next day they tasted divine. The birthday bread pudding that was brought out also a SUPERB dessert. The rum sauce on it was so tastyyyy.

Overall, the next time I touch down in NOLA, Oceana will be my first food stop. You really cannot go wrong dining there!

What a phenomenal experience coming to this restaurant!

My SO, her best friend and myself are in town for Essence Fest and heard great things about this restaurant! The wait time was not long at all, 10 minutes tops. We were in our seats and our waitress was great and her name was Natalie! Thank you for your humble and generous service by the way!

We started off with Barbecue Shrimp, Fried Gator Bites & Crab cakes for Appetizers. Each appetizer was so good, we used the Barbecue Shrimp sauce to dip the Fried Gator in it (If you are adventurous, try it, you won't regret it!)

For our entree, I had the Blackened Catfish Platter, my SO best friend had Smothered Crab Cakes and my SO had the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta! We truly loved our meal and our experience!

Now I live in Las Vegas, one of the busiest cities in the world. I'd never experienced such quick and efficient service then this restaurant. Thank you so much Oceana, we had a great time!

Clay is the man. He treated us like kings for our friends bachelor party. I would highly recommend taking your friends there. Gator bites , gator sausage, blackened redfish, mmmmmmmmm mmmm 
Mmmmmmmmm.

If you are looking for a place to eat without a long time, go here! This was the first place I ate at in NOLA. It reminds me of TGI Friday's.

The drinks are strong and sweet. I would recommend the crab cakes and the jambalaya pasta.

The service was very friendly!
In town for the weekend and came across this place! Wow the crab cakes are OUT OF THIS WORLD! Our server Errol was THE MAN and gave us great food suggestions! You won't be disappointed!

Oh.my.gosh. 

When I think about this place and the food I had, it makes my mouth water (no lie). This place is one of the top ten restaurants for everyday dining and I can see why. Service was excellent (shout-out to DeMarcus who was on top of everything and helped us pick out our main dish to eat)! 

We had to wait for seating for about five minutes but no big deal at all. Service was great and where we sat was away from the main entrance so it wasn't very noisy. 

My husband and I decided to share a meal (and I'm glad we did because we couldn't have finished our meal individually) and ordered the Redfish Oceana (although, I don't think that's what it's really called but the main dish was redfish). 

When you take that first bite, it melts in your mouth. The actual fish was tender and moist- very flavorful and paired very well with the cream sauce that was smothered on top with fried and regular crawfish. The corn on the side was so good- not watered down or the knock off version of corn you get from the store. It was flavored so well and it left me wanting more. 

Would we come back again? Absolutely. We want to try out their other dishes but wow, we were impressed with our visit here.

If we could give half stars I'd give 2.5. The service was great and crab cakes were good and that's about it. I ordered the Louisiana platter. The gumbo was about 90% rice, the beans were about 60% rice, the jambalaya tasted stale like it was sitting there awhile. On top of that the bathroom was flooded and all dirty inside. Maybe it was a bad day but definitely my least favorite dinner spot during our visit.

Absolutely trash. I don't understand how this place is so highly rated. The only thing I was impressed with was our waiter. He made our unpleasant experience bearable. 

My daughter ordered shrimp pasta and was brought chicken pasta which she sent back. The chicken pasta was chicken fingers cut up in strips and placed in pasta. Our waiter offered to replace it with the correct item and my daughter declined. 

My charbroiled oysters were cold. They tasted like the oysters were raw, they placed the topping in the microwave and then put them on top of the oysters. 

My sausage in the Taste of New Orleans was good but they could've kept the rest of it. 

My little one enjoyed her chicken fingers and fries. 

Throughout our meal the waiter came back and checked on us. I hardly touch the oysters and only ate the sausage from the taste of New Orleans. With each item I gave back he became concerned and offered to replace the items which we declined. He went to get the manager. 

Manger came over and was defensive. He asked what the problem was and let him know we didn't like the food. His response was what would you like for me to do with all this food. I was in disbelief. I responded I didn't ask for you to come to the table. Our waiter was trying to make our visit right. I didn't ask u to comp anything on our check. He replied I'll try and discount something. 

They actually wanted me to pay for the chicken pasta that should've been shrimp pasta. The manger discount was taking off the chicken pasta. He didn't honor the Yelp 10% discount offer for checking in. He said he couldn't offer any more discount than he already has. 

I get asked from folks all the time what spots to check out while in New Orleans. Oceana will definitely not be on that list.

Initially they said the wait would be 40 minutes we were in and seated in 20. This place does not disappoint. Came here a few years back and had to try them again. The server quickly came and took our order. My starter was a crab cake and it was mouth watering. My entree was just as delicious with the red fish. The waitress was super sweet. We also had mango margaritas that were absolutely delicious. I will always come by for a visit. There was a mixup with the checks with another party but they fixed it and apologized. Yelp provided a 10% discount which was lovely.

The aesthetics here were amazing! The waiter suggested an off menu salmon dish that our friend loved! The Fried Shrimp Po-Boy and the gator tail are to die for! Make sure you try the roumalade. We happened upon Oceana and we are so grateful that we did!

Most people say when you see a long line in front of any restaurant in NOLA that means the food is so good ! Very true lol ! 

My cousin and some friends told me to try Oceana when ever I go to NOLA! I did and was happy ! 

It looks like a little Resturant from the outside but it's really big inside . It has different levels and various seating area .   Nothing too fancy but very yummy and tasty food ! 

I went on a Sunday afternoon around 2pm and there was no line at all . We were seated right away on the ground level in the seating area close to the kitchen toward the back . Food came fast ! Nice size ! Customer service was great !

Seating was pretty fast I expected a long wait. The service was also great.  We ordered different things but my all time favorite was their crabcakes which is on their list of appetizers.  It was a meal for me I couldn't even finish it by myself.  I definitely will try other things in the near future on their menu.

I'm glad I picked this place for the crew to eat for my cousin birthday. The food was awesome and the service was absolutely great. We had one server name Chris and he was so patient with the group and did everything he could to make sure we were satisfied. There was a mix up with the plates that were given to my friends but Renee made sure that my friend received her food in time to eat with everyone else. Whoever the guy is who sings the bday song will have you rolling because is energy was amazing. I totally enjoyed my experience at this restaurant and will be eating here again!!!!
So good!  Food was delicious and service was friendly.  Red beans and rice!! Gumbo! GATOR bites! CRAB CAKES and I'm a snob about these!

My first take-out order after NOLA shutdown all dine-in services for restaurants, and it gave me hope for my next week and a half of restaurant take-out. I ordered the Fried Seafood Platter, where the seafood was clearly fresh and the batter perfectly spiced. It suffered a little bit just because of the take-out nature, but with how much I liked it even when it was a bit soggy, I can't imagine how good the freshly-fried version would be. There was a bit of confusion about when the order would be ready, since the email confirmation gave an incorrect time, but that's more of a note to improve on than any real issue. 

I also got the Taste of New Orleans, which was a huge combination of rice and beans (with a massive sausage), jambalaya, and crawfish etouffee. Tasted great and reheated very well. 

It's the first day of a very rough time for restaurant staff and goers alike. Please support your local restaurants and get some take-out from them!

The crab cakes are fire. Best ones I had in town. 

Definitely recommend anyone that visits to come here. 
Service was fast.
This was so delicious, best meal we've had in New Orleans so far. We had crab cakes and gumbo and etouffee. The waiter Jamal was very polite and helpful. We will be back!

Well, there's one word that I'd use to describe NOLA, and that's delicious... This restaurant's the perfect example of that.  

The appetizer was delicious, I've to confess that I usually don't like to peel my shrimps, but in this case, they were soooooooooo good, that I didn't mind doing it.  For entree the Tuna was delicious! And the crab cake burger sounded different, so I had to try it, and I'm glad I did, I also loved it.

The place, as most restaurants in New Orleans, is a very casual environment. 

Service was as friendly as it could get.  Definitely, I would highly recommend it for a delicious lunch!

This is the first food we had while visiting New Orleans. I ordered food from Doordash the night we arrived in our hotel and my husband and I were surprised how yummy the food were. We had The Taste of New Orleans, and a side of seafood gumbo and both tasted great! my baby also enjoyed eating their gumbo. We're lucky this restaurant is walking distance from our hotel (Prince Conti Hotel).

Our family came to New Orleans as a stop on a cross country road trip. My first time in New Orleans and my parents 2nd (in over 20 years). We had dogs and had a little trouble finding a place that would allow us to have our dogs. We found Oceana and stopped in to check that we would be good, though they had closed their patio today they accommodated kindly for us with ease and we had a whole patio to ourselves. Errol was our server and was kind, courteous and gave great service. My mom and I shared the Crawfish Étouffe and The Barbecue Shrimp! Both were great but the shrimp dish was to die for! Errol also recommended the Golden Cadillac Margaritas which has a cube of dry ice that makes the drink bubble. Overall great experience and would highly recommend!

One of the few restaurants that stays open late near Bourbon Street. There's often a line outside but it moves considerably fast. 

Is this a touristy place? Probably, but who cares? The food is great and the drinks rock. My faves are the following:

Fried Shrimp Po-boy: So good. Bread is perfectly toasted and sandwich is not overwhelming with condiments. They don't skimp on the shrimp.

Hurricane: Tasty! And stiff...you can stop at 1. 

Praline Brownie Sundae: Your beloved brownie a la mode but served NOLA style with caramel and praline sauce. Yum!

I was craving a bowl of gumbo and some crawfish etouffee and this place hit the spot! I placed a delivery order and the food came packaged tight and was still hot! Very important when ordering delivery. Alot of other restaurants miss that mark. 

Perfect for Netflix and lounging. The gumbo was so good I actually came back the next day with friends and sat in the patio. The staff was extremely hospitable and friendly. The restaurant itself was so busy but I had absolutely no complaints both visits. Get the pecan pie if you have room for dessert.

We stopped in here with a few friends to get some classic new orleans dishes after a wedding. We ordered 5 or 6 different things. everything was really good, and everyone liked it. If I wasn't so hung-over, I'd probably have tried more things/have more to say. Worth a stop for sure though.
Fantastic food and drinks. Go there. Half the food places around Bourbon St. we're closed for dinner.

I'm on an charred oyster adventure and yelp brought me here. The waitstaff is friendly, I was greeted many times and my waitress was sweet. 

I ordered 1/2 dozen oceana charred oysters, a hurricane and Cajun fries. The oysters were very good, they were drenched in garlic butter sauce and smelled amazing. The bread was 2 pieces of very plain bread. 

I don't understand why my husband ordered Cajun fries 10pm at night, heavy carbs especially with heavy mushroom sauce... crawfish was a plus. He was feeling adventurous but by the time we got back to the hotel at midnight, the carbs hit him hard. Through the heaviness, the fries were a big portion & the mix of everything and the ranch sauce was good. I enjoyed it but too much was not for me. He ate it like an entree. 

Good try! No regrets! Yolo in NOLA
Great food and even better service! Carly is top notch and will take the best care of you! So personable and caring. 10/5!

I ordered the Oceana Favorite, Cajun Koolaid, and Mardi Gras Pasta! Everything was sooooo good! The pasta was full of crawfish and shrimp! Damon was my waiter! He was so accommodating and attentive! He even moved me outside to the heaters when I was cold inside! Great food, great service great experience, and great atmosphere!

Came here on a Tuesday and ordered the special, alligator tail appetizer, and crab cakes. 

I thought that the alligator tail and crab cakes were alright, but it wouldn't hurt to order them if you're in the mood for it. 

The special was a crawfish étouffée with fried catfish and  jalapeño corn bread in the middle. This dish is the sole reason why I'm giving this place a 5 star rating. Everything in this dish was amazing and paired really well together. I was a little skeptical about the cornbread in the middle, but I was 100% wrong because it paired perfectly with the dish. This was the best thing I ate on my NOLA trip, and I really hope they have this special again when I return.

HUUUUGGGEEE portions!!  So my wife and I decided to come here for a last meal before heading home and were surprised by the giant portions that they have.  We wanted to try the crab cakes so we got that as an appetizer and they were delicious!  We ordered some fried seafood sampler and that is something we could have split between the two of us.  The fried catfish was crunchy with a great flavor, the crawfish tails were seasoned well, and they have a great selection of beer too!  Our server was extremely friendly and gave us some excellent recommendations.

1st time here heard they had some amazing poboys and had to come here to see what it was all about .

Well i tried alligator blackened bites for appetizers  that where delicious but the catfish poboy was out of this world  for my main dish 

Anyone who come to New Orleans needs stop here and try the food the PoyBoys are made with great southern touch .

The only thing that could of been better was the wait time for food . It took a while to get the main courses , And I would of liked a refill on my coffee it was just taken with out me noticing and wasn't ever asked if I would like a refill 

Overall I still had a great time trying this place nice server and great food. Even tho ever place out here says they have PoyBoys they are not made the same be carful from where you choose to get them

We decided to eat lunch/dinner here and so glad w did. It was actually recommended by the door staff here at the Omni Hotel. Our server T was great! I had the Taste of New Orleans (so yummy) and a bowl of Seafood Gumbo (so yummy and simple). Totally recommend this spot! Great vibe and building too.

You have to try hard to find a place in New Orleans that will give you a bad meal.  This place though was above the rest.  The service coming in the door was very friendly.  Our server was really nice and went out of her way to make sure all our needs were met.

The poor boys, the best I have ever had and the fact that you can get whatever you want just about anytime they are open, makes this place a plus for us.  You should definately give this place a chance and form your own opinion.  

My opinion, this is a place I would return to.  There are a lot of places to choose from in New Orleans and if you are in the area, stop in here and enjoy a drink and a meal before moving down the road.  With all the walking you do in New Orleans, you can work it off before you get to the next place.

Great food, great atmosphere. When we arrived, the line was lengthy but it moved quickly initially. In total I think we waited about 45 minutes for a table but the staff kept us laughing while we waited. The hostess was nice and our server Corey was too. 

I ordered the fried seafood platter. I didn't want fried food but it sounded delicious and it was Corey's recommendation. Shared it with hubby who ordered the Taste of New Orleans platter. Also very good!

I don't usually get dessert but couldn't resist the bread pudding. The portion is enough for two and it's so good. I just wish it was served with a 1/2 scoop of ice cream since that pairs so well with warm bread pudding. Glad we stopped in.

2.6 stars, no more; I have rounded it up to 3 Yelp stars, per the rules of basic arithmetic. This restaurant could have earned 4 stars, but for the obnoxious behavior of two male bartenders regarding solicitation of good Yelp reviews that I will detail later below.

This restaurant has a good menu, and particularly lots of seafood and related dishes, but it also offers a number of classic staple American foods, including hamburgers. 

Across several recent stays in the French Quarter, I have eaten dinner at this restaurant twice. Since the tables in the seating area were always filling fast (it was always at or near dinnertime on each occasion), I chose each time to sit at the bar, even though I do not drink alcohol (I know... what an anomaly for a visitor to the French Quarter!). 

The menu selection was good, the food was quite good (I ordered an appetizer and a dinner selection during each visit), and, despite the fact that the restaurant was often filling with dinner customers rapidly, the food was nonetheless delivered within a reasonable amount of time.

BTW, I have never sat, nor eaten, at a table in any of the dining rooms, and thus I cannot comment on table service. 
 
And now it is time to be really frank and blunt: The reality is that I would, under ordinary circumstances, have been tempted to give this restaurant 4 stars, but I can, in all honesty, give them only 2.6 stars at best due to certain behaviors of two male bartenders (I never had this experience with any of the female bartenders who served me) in relation to their attemtps to solicit good Yelp reviews on each of my visits; I will detail those offensive behaviors below.

During each of my two visits to this eaterie, when I sat at the bar, the bar was staffed by at least two or three bartenders, and, during the course each meal, I always received service from at least two of the bartenders, each time from one female and one male. During each of these visits, at the end of my meal, as I was reviewing my bill and paying, the male bartender (a different one each time) grabbed an oversized business card and handed it to me, telling me that it contained a link to the restaurant's Yelp review page, and asking me to leave them a good review (UGH, UGH, UGH....!). 

Each of these two male bartenders then told me their names very clearly, and told me that it would be very good if I would mention them by name (MORE UGHS!). Gratifyingly, each time that each of the offensive male bartenders mouthed these obnoxious words, I noticed the nearby female bartender in attendance (who had also served me during the course of my meal) roll her eyes to the ceiling in acute embarrassment! 

So, the bottom line is that two of the male bartenders tried WAY TOO HARD to try to get customers to leave good Yelp reviews (better never to ask for a good Yelp review at all...) for the restaurant, and were thoroughly obnoxious in trying to get me to mention their names in said review. TOTALLY OBNOXIOUS! Thankfully, neither of the two female bartenders with whom I interacted during my two meals at the bar ever tried any of these offensive shenanigans. 

So, potentially 4 stars, but degraded to 2.6 stars because some of the male bartenders try way too hard in relation to soliciting good Yelp reviews!

We chose Oceana Grill at first because it was one of the few restaurants open after 10 PM on a weekday but ended up coming back another time. We ordered to-go both times, and our food was always ready fast and packaged well to avoid any leakage during transportation. 

Thoughts on the following:
- Barbecued Shrimp ($25): The BBQ shrimp is a NOLA classic you have to try, though I would say the name is a bit misleading. It didn't taste anything like traditional barbecue. Instead, it had more of an alcoholic/ cooking wine taste to it. It also was buttery, and tangy. I really enjoyed the shrimp.

- Cajun Jambalaya Pasta ($23): This was absolutely life-changing and hands down the best pasta I've ever had. The flavor of this pasta was so unique and it's something I had never tasted before. The fettuccine pasta was tossed in a creamy creole sauce and had bits of alligator and shrimp in it. It was colorful, well-seasoned, and just flawless. Though creamy and flavorful, the pasta didn't feel too heavy. I feel like people don't think about ordering pasta in New Orleans, or at least I certainly did not, but you have to give this a try. 

- Crawfish Etouffée ($18): the etouffee is a stew with a ball of rice in it and it's topped with bits of crawfish. Winter is not crawfish season, so I was glad to try a bit through the etouffee. Again, the seasoning for anything cajun is just so on point. 

- Fried Soft Shell Crab ($8): Gotta have crabs when you're in New Orleans but I actually struggled to find places with fried soft shell crabs. Fortunately, Oceana had it. I just wanted a taste, so I ordered one crab. It came with a cocktail dipping sauce. The crab was so good and had a texture comparable to shrimp tempura. 

I had Oceana Grill on my first night in New Orleans and it was a great start to the trip. All these flavors were so new to me and worked so well with every dish. My only complaint is that when you order take-out they give you something like Hawaiian bread instead of toasted baguette slices. Other than that, I loved all the food here and highly recommend it. 

Tips and Notes:
- If you order pickup online through their website, there is a slight discount for first-time users. Not sure if this is an ongoing thing, but something to keep in mind. 
- Most of the regular dishes had appetizer/ smaller sized dishes for you to taste and try. So, if you're overwhelmed and don't know what to get, you can get tons of mini dishes.

I decided to order the Blackened Chicken Platter and it did not disappoint. The chicken was very juicy and flavorful with the perfect amount of kick. The side of garlic mashed potatoes was also very good. Would definitely recommend.

Visited Oceana with my mom during Bayou Classic Weekend. Had an amazing seat, upstairs right next to the window where the sun was shining brightly! Our waitress, unfortunately I cannot remember her name, but she was so nice and informative. She even took our picture so next time we come we'll see ourselves on their screens! We had crab cakes for the appetizer and fried shrimp plates. I'll definitely be returning for a fun NOLA taste!!

Nice enough place but in my opinion nothing very special. Typical of some of the other New Orleans deep-fried venues, but nothing that made this place stand out.  We started off with a few appetizers, the alligator bites were in little tiny pieces, and the raw oysters were dry and a little off-tasting.  For dinner I had the fried oyster Po boy, it had good flavor but not very many oysters, and the gumbo that came with it was on the bland side. The best part of the meal may have been the desserts. We got Bananas Foster, crème brûlée, and bread pudding to share, they were all very tasty. I might go back but it certainly wouldn't be my first choice given all the other available restaurants in the area.

Why the 5 stars? The service and food!

Our waiter was super nice and prompt. We ordered the gator bites as an appetizer, we got half crispy and half grilled. I liked the crispy way better since the gator meat was kind of chewy so the crispy texture from the fried batter complemented it.

I ordered a beer since it was our vacation and I needed a non-sweet drink. For my meal, I had the jambalaya pasta which was out of this world. It came with pieces of bread on the side. The sauce was out of this universe. It had the perfect kick to it. There were shrimp in it and the pasta was perfect. I literally slurped all of it up. 

I finished with an Irish coffee which was delicious. I highly recommend checking this place out of you're in the area. I really liked my dish and would definitely stop by again when we are in the area.
Had the bbq shrimp and Oysters Rockefeller. Completely underwhelming! Not worth the wait! My wife did not enjoy her food either. We are familiar with the food in the area and this is not the best.
Wayyyyy too long of a wait for extremely sub par food. You can go right around the corner to the 424 Seafood Market and get a much better overall experience

We were in New Orleans two weeks after Ida, and many places were not yet reopened.  This was the only place we heard of that was open past 11pm.  Oceana was recommended by a few people, so we were excited to go.

We realize that with hurricanes, Covid and employee shortages, things are not ideal.  However, we had great food at other places and were impressed with many other restaurants and dining experiences.

Pros:  The Cajun Pasta and Mardi Gras Pasta were great, with good flavor and lots of seafood.  The Ultimate Bloody Mary was literally an entire meal - so much food stuck into it that it could easily have filled one person to the brim.  Flavor of bloody Mary was good, but not perfect.

Cons:  EVERY SINLGE PIECE of fried seafood was very overcooked.  Like, VERY.  Oysters should not be chewy, but these were so dry that it was gross.  The baked oysters were overcooked and they forgot to bring them for 45 minutes,  They did bring us barbecued shrimp, which we didn't order.

This place may improve with more training for the employees.  We spent $200 and could only eat less than half of what we ordered because the fried items were so overcooked.  

Service person was very sweet.

The people working here were very nice and the location is also convenient to other fun stuff to do in New Orleans. However, the wait was very long. Also, the food was undercooked, cold. Lastly, the restaurant was not very clean and I did spot a rat in the dining area. I won't be coming here again but would be curious to see if others have a good experience and hope this local business turns out better than when I went.

Loved this place for breakfast. Had their St James crepe. Wow. Filled with tons of shredded crab meat and fresh shrimp. Service was excellent and is in the French Quarters. Not fancy however very clean and everyone else loved their food.

This is a marketing machine that will hit you deep in your pocketbook. We saw many advertisements in the airport for this place and the food simply looked amazing.

We decided to check this place out. After a nice stroll through the area we stopped in and were seated in a reasonable amount of time. I ordered the catfish and honestly I expected more. The portion size was enormous just like the price tag. I was disappointed with the flavor and cost value ratio. I ordered a side of red beans and rice and I must say that it was ok maybe a little over spiced for my taste.

There is a lot of good reviews for this place but just approach with caution and a thick wallet.

We decided to stop for lunch. The restaurant is located right off our Bourbon Street. 

All of the staff at the restaurant was extremely friendly, including our server, Lakeisha. I ordered the hurricane cocktail, which was mixed well. We were also impressed by how quickly the food came out.

We started with the gator bites appetizer - half fried and half blackened. My husband enjoyed them. This was my first time having gator bites so I have no comparison, but it will say the blackened was way better than the fried.

For entrees, my husband ordered the shrimp fettuccine Alfredo. While he enjoyed the meal and said the Alfredo had good flavor, the sauce was a bit runny and it definitely wasn't presented with jumbo gulf shrimp. The shrimp were on the small side. I had the Taste of New Orleans (pictured), which was creole jambalaya, crawfish etouffée, red beans and rice with smoked sausage. Was it the most authentic dish in the world, probably not. But it had good flavors. However, I was disappointed that it only came with a half a piece of sausage (the sausage was delicious!).

This was an okay bar. The food was not great but It was not horrible. We went twice. The first time we had dinner, which was a side of fettuccine and oysters. The oysters were fine but in all of Louisiana (okay in the French quarters) they don't serve vignette with oysters. Also, these warm
oysters are very mild in flavor. The server was nice but she spent most for her time in eye view outside talking to someone in the courtyard and was not very attentive to our table. The next day we went for brunch, which was a much better experience. The shrimp and grits were delightful, and the server and service was amazing as well!
I stopped by for breakfast and had Biscuits and Gravy and a side of two eggs over easy. It was good stick-to-your-ribs fare.  Happy with it.

Looks like a hole in the wall bar at first, then it opens up to a decent dining room. For lunch, I had the seafood gumbo, crab cakes, wife had the shrimp poboy w/ fantastic fries. Best was Errol, our server. Great customer service with us and the tables around us.  Definitely a repeat in future visits here.

I ordered the crab cakes ($23.5) and also got a margarita ($9).  The food came out almost right away, and the waitstaff was very attentive.  

The crab cakes came with a side of potatoes and vegetables, it tasted sort of mediocre.  I think the food came out TOO quickly--it tasted like it was frozen and had microwaved since some part of the crab cakes were lukewarm and some were hot.  After eating, I felt sort of nauseous right away and I've been having painful stomach cramps/symptoms of food poisoning for two days.  I think the food must have been improperly reheated or something.

This place was so good I cannot brag enough on the food. I ate the soft shell crab po-boy sandwich which is something I cannot get back at home, and it was delicious!!! Never had I ever had a sandwich like this. We also ordered the Cajun fries as an appetizer and devoured them!! I highly recommend everyone to stop in this place and get your food on!!!

Oh my food! 
We chose Oceana because of the big menu. My dad wanted a poboy and the rest of us were open.

The food and service were top notch! I had the chicken and sausage gumbo to start it was delicious! We also had red beans and rice, ribs, shrimp poboy, pasta.. our table was full of so much food!

When the server came over and told us to unroll our silverware and my daughter won a free drink or dessert of course she had the drink, duh!  

Check in here and get 10% off your meal and just smile and feel the New Orleans love when your server calls ya "baby"

Had a good dinner on a Friday night. Place was packed but service was still quick. Waitress Emily was a pleasure to deal with. This is one of the few places I could find that had vegetarian options. Wish they had more but still happy to find something when we travel with a mixed crowd

Great service and food, starting with a very friendly hostess and then a very attentive waiter.

I got a half dozen of their cooked famous oysters, excellent.  I also got a fried catfish po-boy.  It was so covered in batter it could have been chicken ... no catfish taste, which is the reason for my downgrade.  I love catfish.  This was not good catfish.  I even tried rating it without the bun and sauce, still nothing.

My wife got the crab cakes which were really good.  Also fried but still had a crab taste.

I would come back and try other dishes.

Went for dinner on a Sunday night. Tried the crab cakes & red fish oceana with garlic sauce. Both dishes are good, the garlic sauce is excellent. Service is quick and good. Be mindful of wait times during busy hours.

A decent spot around the bourbon street area. Pretty good flavors, huge portions, just definitely on the extremely heavy side of food (though I guess that's expected in Nola).

The seafood platter was HUGE and the fried catfish was delicious. We also had blackened catfish and redfish- the catfish was a bit boring but the redfish had a crawfish ettouffee which was yummy. All the dishes we had came with collard greens and jambalaya which was honestly really good. Service was welcoming and food came out at a good pace. 

We were able to bring our dog to the patio which was nice on a warmer day, and there's heaters for when it gets colder. It was a bit strange that absolutely no music was playing, and there's just the noise of bars above the restaurant in the patio, but it wasn't a huge deal.
Good customer service. Clean, and good atmosphere. Food is very average if not below. Not worth the trip. Wouldn't come here again.

OMG the loaded fries with gravy and cheese are something I would order as my last meal! I would highly recommend this place to get a nice New Orleans flare! I ordered the taste of New Orleans to get a nice sample of all that it has to offer although by far the fries and the crab cake appetizers were the best.

The hotel I'm staying at suggested Oceana for breakfast or lunch and it has tons of great reviews, so naturally it's where I wandered into for brunch this morning. It's tucked right around the corner from Bourbon street so it's in a main area, although parking really stinks in French Quarter so good luck finding a spot.

Anyway, I really wanted some shrimp and grits and they have one that's made with their signature New Orleans BBQ sauce. Oh my goodness. The waitress (Tasha) came by to check up on us and when she asked me how it was I just looked back up at her with a "this is heavenly" face. FYI it's not your typical bbq sauce but it's made with garlic and spices and it's both sweet and salty. Some umami in there for sure. Yum. I can't even describe what this tasted like so you'll just have to order it for yourself. The shrimp were pretty big and all of this greatness was placed atop a massive portion of perfect creamy grits.

They have a huge selection of food and plenty of seating. I will definitely be back on my next trip to NOLA!

Whooo! Our first stop while visiting NOLA! My bf and I arrived to Louisiana late evening on a Monday and we found this spot on yelp to check out on our foodie trip! We ordered a couple items off the menu: fried seafood platter with shrimp and catfish plus fries, gumbo, and half fried/half grilled gator bites. 
Pros: Service was excellent for us, shoutout to our server of the night (Justin)!He was exceptional and made our first trip to New Orleans such a great one. Food is affordable and we shared almost everything! Would recommend for late night eats in the French Quarter if you're visiting.
Menu contains lot of options for non seafood eaters and sea food eaters alike! Everything was tasty, desserts were amazing. Drinks were delightful, although a bit pricey.

Food was good but the bartender on the third floor on New Year's Day was rude. I wanted to get an appetizer as my entree and she would not let me do that. I was told that I had to get a side if I wanted to get the gator bites as my main dish. Me and my girlfriend ordered the seafood pasta, a hurricane, spinach dip, and the gator bites and was told that was not enough and had to order a side with the gator bites. I don't like being told what to order.
I Enjoyed the red beans & rice, fried shrimp & gumbo. The service & the food was equally good.  My friends were satisfied with their orders as well, I would eat here again.

Loved this place! There were no reservations available this busy week so we chanced it by getting in line as a walk in.  So worth the 1-hour walk-in wait to get a table. The food, service and atmosphere were excellent. It's a cool casual spot with good music. Our favorites were the Oysters Rockefeller, Oceana Famous Oysters, the full rack of Ribs, blackened fish and prawns over pasta, and the taste of New Orleans trio plate. Mouth is watering just thinking about it now. All staff was welcoming but our server David was the best! Give that man a raise please. Will come back here again when we return to NOLA.

Found this place while wandering around Bourbon St. We wanted to have breakfast and saw their breakfast special billboard on the street. Folks coming out said it was a great meal so we went inside. I had a crawfish omelette and BF had the country breakfast which included alligator sausage, grits, eggs and hash browns. I enjoyed the omelette, it came with a nice hollandaise sauce. BF said the gator sausage had a good taste and his eggs were cooked perfectly over easy. Our server, Jamal, was a very nice guy and was very helpful with meal suggestions. Our food and service were equally enjoyable; would revisit Oceana Grill again when I am in NOLA.

I try to judge harshly or deter people from anything around home but I was happy to try Oceana to see what they hype was and is. 
1st, glad they stay open later as they should given the location. 
2nd, glad they offer brunch and serve breakfast items later than AM hours. 
3rd, Eager to utilize any coupons they offer a YELP check-in discount and 
4th, they are part of the district BOGO which you can find on Groupon. 

Service was nice. 
Restrooms are what you can expect in the Quarters. It's historic people so I'm older now and can appreciate how we can find a way to maintain the original facade while updating things with AC and newer amenities. 

Go give them a try and make sure to get the special no matter what - just give it a whirl.

Fantastic gem found in New Orleans! The food was fantastic and the service was amazing! Our server David was so great! He was kind, helpful, and offered great service. He offered his recommendations for the menu, and explained what the menu items included.

The restaurant was clean and beautiful, interiorly and offered beautiful views of downtown New Orleans.

As for the food, my husband had their chef special which included shrimp and steak. It was amazing! I had their New Orleans "taste of New Orleans" and their red beans were amazing! By far the best I have had yet. 

We finished off our meal with their strawberry cheesecake and their bourbon pecan pie. Their strawberry cheesecake was amazing! I highly recommend it.

Overall, great experience, David was an amazing server, food was fantastic and will definitely be dining here in the future when we are back in New Orleans.
Had a great food coma brought on by the deliciousness of the meal. 1st meal in New Orleans

I had the regular gumbo and also the seafood gumbo and both are pretty good. I would be willing to get them again but I think I prefer a darker roux. I did have a cool hurricane dream is yellow and blue little smoke coming out of the top. The rice was fresh as well with the gumbos. Absolutely terrible picture outside, as I got both cups to go. They were very busy the past few nights and should probably say something about their food.

At least one seafood meal a day was most necessary when in Nawlin's baby! 

My group of 8 people definitely made our way down the menu but just to highlight my top 3 items: crawfish etouffee, fried seafood mix, and the jambalaya pasta! We went in November so unfortunately it wasn't crawfish season anymore but nonetheless the etoufee was still on point. The catfish was fried to absolute perfection! 

And wow, just wow. The highlight of the meal had to be that jambalaya pasta. My friend ordered it and I didn't expect it to be as good as it was! Since I wasn't on board with ordering it, I got the last of what was left.. what a mistake. IT WAS AMAZING. If I go back, I'm not sharing. 

PS. Skip the oysters here - quality was 2 stars at most. But if you are craving oysters, just don't get them raw. You've been warned.

We went here on a Sunday night around 5pm and got in right away. Our waitress was very nice and helpful.
We started with the crab cakes and they were delicious! I got a cup of gumbo and the shrimp po boy which were both very good. 
I did get the Crème Brulee for dessert and they did burn the top of it, so the taste was a little off.

We were in NOLA for only 3 days and went to Oceana for dinner twice!  Staff is amazing, well versed in the mean and specials. 
Our waiter Carlton was sweet, funny and just totally on point. Enjoyed chatting with the bartender also about the way hubby wanted a drink made. 
They are known for their crab cakes and the drinks were made very well. 
This is now our go to restaurant for dinner while in the FQ

I was vacationing in New Orleans and I am so NOT the seafood eater. It was becoming harder each day to find some authentic food other than seafood. Our hotel referred us to Oceana & I tell you, I wanted to take the chef home with me. The food was absolutely delicious. I had the blackened chicken alfredo with broccoli & it was the best I'd ever had. Our server Errol was freaking amazing!!! He made sure we had plenty of drinks, let us taste our food before we ordered it, and kept us well entertained! Enjoyed all of the sfaff & the food. I will definitely recommend this restaurant.

We were looking for a place that would accommodate a large group of people and that happened to be open late night. We found Oceana on Yelp and decided to check it out. The wait wasn't that long and they were able to get a table inside for our party of 8, within 5 minutes. I was in it for the oysters.

Oh, Yelp. You've steered me wrong with this one. 

We ordered:
-Gator tail bites
-Oceana's Famous Oysters
-Fried shrimp po-boy
-Taste of New Orleans
-Cesar salad
-Greek Salad

Though there were no complaints for those that ordered the Taste of New Orleans, let me just say that Oceana's Famous Oysters were bad. The menu describes the oysters as "Freshly shucked Louisiana Oysters  on the half-shell, chargrilled over an open flame, smothered with our unique zesty garlic and cream herb Cajun sauce, finished with a blend of Parmesan and Romano cheeses." In no way did the oysters ever tasted charbroiled. You should also take "smoothered" to heart. It was smothered so much that sauce was oozing everywhere. No hint of garlic or cheese in the dish. The oysters drowning in sauce was just slimey. 

The gator tail bites were interesting. Though they looked like bits of battered and fried pork nibblets, they still kinda tasted like chicken. The shrimp po-boy was a bit on the small side. I thought it was also a bit overpriced. You can get better po-boys at Verti Marte, less than half a mile a way. 

Our server was good. The staff that brought out the food seemed a bit confused. But, we managed to get all our food in a reasonable amount of time. There was a bit of a mix up, when it came to our bill and paying with 3 credit cards. Our server split the entire check equally between the 3 cards, when we had written our actual amounts on the back of the check.  But, our group figured it all out. 

For some reason, Oceana Grill reminded me of a TGIF restaurant, if TGIF were to have a seafood joint. Merely, okay and overpriced food. Half the tables around us weren't cleaned properly. So, cleanliness was questionable. Avoid the oysters, they were gross. There are many other (and better) places to eat, for your authentic Cajun/Creole cravings. This place is a big fat PASS.

Whitney was a great server! And the food was amazing. I got the blackened shrimp poboy and it was delicious. We also got the gator bites. They were really good as well. The whole experience was positive.

We met some new friends in New Orleans over Memorial Day weekend and they highly recommended Oceana. They said that there is always a line but it moves fast, plus the place is huge and right by our hotel.

We were told it was an hour wait, down a stinky  alley/construction sight in the hot Louisiana sun. We were starving but Oceana seemed worth it.

After 1 hour an 38 minutes we were seated. About 20 minutes later we got our drinks, about 25 minutes after that we got all of our food, and we ordered a lot.
