I want to take off more stars because I'm angry that the wait was SO LONG, you see the same people sitting with empty plates (through the windows outside) for very long stretches of time. There were empty tables with dishes on them all over the place, why did we have to wait so dang long?!!  It took a while to get the check and to get our table cleaned, I just dont understand. COVID restrictions were lifted, so tables weren't empty because of this.

We got:
×Gumbo - pretty good
×Crawfish etouffee with added crispy crawfish on top - excellent!!
×Some over-priced nonsense drink - I didnt finish, but it was pretty
×BBQ shrimp - so not worth it, we didn't finish
×World Famous Crabcake - HOLY WOW, UNBELIEVABLY AMAZING
×Catfish plate with fries - this makes me emotional, one of the best single food items I have ever had, seriously. My gosh, that catfish!!!!

Heck yes we will go back, but will make a reservation months in advance so that we only wait 30 minutes vs 1 hr and 38 mins.

Great food y'all, superb. You're at the top for a reason!

Came here to get an early lunch before making the journey back to Houston. We came around 10:45 on a Monday, and it was pretty empty. 

Service was amazing. Our server came and checked on us multiple times, and he was very prompt with service. 

We had the alligator bites and oysters for an appetizer. Both were delicious and the sauce that came with alligator bites was amazing. 

I had the seafood platter. It was A LOT of food, so I suggest sharing it with someone else. My favorite was the shrimp. They were a large size and very fresh.

Walked in to the warmest greeting from a lovely hostess. Was seated right away. Our waiter was a charming & kind guy name Alexander B.  
Started with the gator tail bites. Half fried & half blackened ( Alexander's idea) and boy was he on point!!!! Also had the crab cakes with crawfish and mushroom cream sauce. Not bad but not amazing either. 
Mom had the shrimp creole. By far the best dish in the place! 
Sister had the taste of New Orleans. Crawfish etouffe and shrimp jambalaya with red beans and rice.  Deeeeeelish!!!!
I had a cup of shrimp gumbo and it felt like someone was giving my soul a hug. 

The food here is bursting with flavor and the people are warm with soul. A must visit while touring Bourbon Street. 

Make sure you leave room for the most amazing praline brownie and warm bread pudding. Mmmmm.

This used to be one of our favorite places after we discovered it when we first moved down here. Tonight we came back and they've removed the tuna options from the menu. Super disappointed. We still like the blackened gator bite appetizer but without our favorite options on the menu, driving down here and paying for parking just aren't worth it. 

Since there wasn't tuna today we ended up with a the red fish under chefs specials. It was ok but not amazing. I really dislike their mixed veggie side as it's not the typical carrot, broccoli, cauliflower mix. The mashed potatoes are really good though.

Solid seafood fare in New Orleans.  Stay away from the fried platters as they are a waste of good seafood. All you can taste is breading and grease. 

The blackened or grilled selections all seem to be excellent.  I ordered the blackened duck which was quite good.  

The service was quite good other than at the host station.  The hostess was not very friendly and was more interested in keeping the doorway clear that getting our party of 10 seated.   Our server was a little dull but was up to the task of our demanding group.   

I enjoyed the evening, food and the restaurant. I would return here for dinner on my next NOLO visit.

First, the service was great. For the high customer volume our waiter still checked in on us regularly, made us feel welcome, and when the bartender forgot olives in my dirty martini--I know right?--he immediately noticed the missing detail and promptly brought olives by. Service was 5 stars. 

With regard to the food, however, I feel like the challenge for any business claiming so many accolades amidst such a touristy scene is to still create a fine dining experience despite it all. It all felt like the food quality had succumbed to the customer volume demands. It was adequate, but it wasn't mind blowing. For breakfast on the same day, I visited Cochon on the other side of town and was blown away by the oysters whereas at Oceana, I just thought theirs were OK.

Drinks were average, too.

We were told multiple times by friends and locals to try this place. I was a bit dubious. However, to say I was pleasantly surprised would be accurate.
We had the Alligator bits, Crab cakes and Blackened Shrimp. Each one was a taste treat. And I felt like we were absorbing some of the local character. I really recommend you think about doing as we did and try multiple appetizers rather than a meal to get a broader perspective of the cuisine. It worked for us; but we are not huge eaters. The dinner plates were much bigger.
We selected Bread Pudding for dessert. Now we eat Bread Pudding with some degree of regularity and we are picky about it. So when John recommended it, we were skeptical. We needn't have been. It was perfect; very tasty with a scrumptious rum sauce that really sealed the deal1
The server John was just outstanding. He catered to our every need and want, and generally focussed on keeping us happy. He was fun.
We had a wonderful experience and I would highly recommend this place for price, quality and service!

I came.here with some co-workers on a business trip. We opted for an early dinner after a long day of travel and I must say that was wise. When we left the line was over an hour long at 7PM. 

The restaurant is dimly lit and fun and quirky. Like most buildings in the French Quarter they make the most of the space they have. The dining rooms are packed with just enough room to pass but they have a beautiful spacious courtyard as well. 

The menu is seafood and the prices average for seafood. I ordered the Crawfish Everything and my co-workers chose the Seafood Platter. I will say that you definitely get your money's worth. The portions are overly generous with plenty to share. The food was good, not the best I've ever had but good. The service was also great. Even with the wait we we're never rushed and were allowed a nice leisurely meal like you'd get in Europe. The service is what brings it to a 4 for me. 

If I'm here again I'll probably try it again.

Came here for lunch on Sunday.
Cold..AC blowing!
Super friendly staff
Order their:
1. crab cakes$15.50 -delicious and hefty  5 stars)
2 Cajun jambalaya pasta $18- super heavy greasy oily buttery ..you name it. Even too much for 2 to share but we did it! (2 stars)
3. Beer abuta Andy gator draft $5 very good local beer 8% alcohol 
Ambiance 4 stars.
Overall 3. 5 stars

I had the best experience dining at Oceana Grill.  The service and patience I experienced from Tasha B. was top tier.  I even caught myself saying, "so y'all trying to have me eat here for the entire trip?".  What did I have? I had the Blackened Salmon stuffed with Crab on a seafood bed of rice with what... yes, collard greens on the side.  When I tell you this is the best meal I've had in a while and I've had some good meals.  I just know it was made with love.  Listen, I can't tell you what to do because you're grown but if you want a meal and service that will make your soul smile, go to Oceana.  They understood the assignment!

Ok so super late and I mean LATE post but better late than never.  Honestly I've been bragging and salivating about the next time I'm in New Orleans and how quickly I will be stopping in here!  So I when I was here about 4.5 years ago our concierge recommended this place.  He also stated the best time to go before the crowds.  Basically right before HH!  Why am I obsessed with this place? Let me tell you when I say there's a crowd that lines up to get in.  To me ... it's all about the gator bites!  Best thing ever especially the blackened.  Our first visit yes (we went more that once ... seriously that good) we got the fried/blackened! The other two times just blackened! 
I was super excited at the thought of my potentially traveling to NO next month for work but with the Omnicron spreading like wildfire the trip sadly isn't likely to happen.  Obviously this would been a must have stop for me.  Til next time Oceana!  Please don't take them off the menu and if you ever get into shipping them ... lmk I will certainly be ordering!

Delivery to JW Marriott on Canal- Ordered 2 grilled fish dishes, seafood gumbo and chocolate cake. Delivered about 45 mins later. Driver forgot my gumbo but I paid him, gave him tip and he brought back about 45 mins later. He called my cell both times to let me know he was in lobby. Had to go down to get it both times. $70 w tip. Food was ok for delivery. It's what u would expect for food cooked and put in styrofoam container for 30 mins. My wife and I were grateful not to go back out in heat again to go there physically. 

Delivery-2
Food taste-3
Quality-3
Only decent place that delivered to JW Marriott-4

I bet I would have given them 4 stars across the board if I ate at restaurant.

Very good!  Great service.  Justin was our sever and he was very attentive and had great suggestions.  I had the crab cakes and they were very good - moist and plump with a delicious mushroom crab sauce on them.  My husband had the taste of New Orleans platter which had jambalaya, gumbo and red beans and rice.  He really enjoyed it.  We started with the gator tail appetizer with both fried and blackened pieces.  It was good too.

Being in the downtown area late at night, you don't have a lot of trouble finding places to eat, and Oceana Grill is one of them!  Located right off Bourbon St., it was a great place to swing by. Plus, open until 1am, we had plenty of time to wait in line for food. The line was kind of long out the door on a Friday, but it moved quickly. We only waited for about 20 minutes. 

We ordered the Redfish Oceana ($28),Blackened Shrimp Fettuccine Alfredo ($20), and the Seafood Gumbo ($11). The prices are not bad, but they are a little on the higher end for the food. However, it's right downtown, so it's to be expected. 

Every item was perfectly cooked and seasoned. The redfish was a little crisp where the fish hit the pan, but soft and juicy overall. I came with a delicious creamy crawfish mushroom sauce that made it really feel like New Orleans cuisine. The alfredo had a thick rich sauce with flavorful blackened shrimp. The seafood gumbo tasted as expected, but it was served in a decently deep bowl! Usually, buying gumbo downtown results in it being served in tiny cups that they call "bowls", but Oceana Grill didn't skimp on their gumbo portions!  I do wish, however, that the gumbo had some crab claws in it, but it was yummy!

Besides the gumbo, if you're a small eater, you might be full with the portions they serve you here, but if you're a big eater like me, you'll want to order some extra appetizers. However, the portion sizes aren't awful, because splitting our 3 items between two people, I went home satisfied!

Overall the dish was good but the shrimp was overcooked.There is no outdoor seating which I would prefer especially in this area. My friend had the taste of New Orleans and enjoyed it very much. Lots of flavor, but if you're not in the mood for creole food, there are not many other options on the menu.

The service here was amazing! Very nice people, super fast seating and we got our food in a reasonable amount of time. If I had to complain about one thing it was that we had to hike 3 stair cases to get to our seat and it felt like a never ending maze, but overall everyone was very nice and attentive and our server answered my cousin and I's many questions, even offering recommendations. 
Now I usually do not consume dairy, or meat, but when I vacation I sometimes like to make exceptions for some dairy and let me tell you, it was worth it this time! 
Ordered the vegetarian pasta with Alfredo. 
PROS- 
Came with bread, and look I LOVE bread 
Flavorful, and had a bit of spice to it 
Decently sized portion 
CONS- 
Not sure if price was worth the portion, kind of felt like a tourist trap for sure
Paid maybe $16, which seemed a little excessive to me 
LOTS of sauce, maybe even too much, and as good as the sauce was, I do not want to drown in it. 
I would've liked a wider variety of vegetables in my pasta. 
Overall, it was very good and I think it's worth eating here once, however, I don't think I would go again just because it felt a little touristy to me. 
However, for sure worth going once because the food is tasty and the service is great!

Absolutely incredible food here! I think it was my favorite from my entire trip!
Try their specialty oysters and you will dream about them for the rest of your life. They come with a delicious, warm dinner roll smothered in cheese!
The margaritas are also amazing and I love that they offer passion fruit. They place a few cubes of dry ice in them so it smokes as you drink it. What an amazing show to watch and drink and enjoy! 

The place is huge with a beautiful outdoor patio in the middle. Get there early though or you will be be waiting in line for a while!

Been here a few times and always very good. I usually get the redfish but went with bbq shrimp this time and it was a great decision.  Chargrilled oysters were different but very good.  

Bloody Mary was just ok.  

Service was excellent.

Visited again tonight.  Just great food and better service. 

My server, Kearica, was awesome. The manger Jake is really doing a great job.  Will be back every single time I am in Nola.

Amazing!!!! I have to say I'm glad that our hotel staff recommended this restaurant to our group.

The servers did a great job providing us service. We were a group of ten so I'm sure that wasn't easy. We started with a cup of seafood gumbo. I have to say I'm so glad this review was done last and is my 500th review. This was the best seafood gumbo I had in New Orleans. Thank you! We also wanted the gator tails. I was hesitant to try it blackened, but the server said we could get it half fried and the other half blackened. OMG! The blackened gator tails were delicious. It had a nice spice to it and I'm so glad we could try it both ways. My spouse and I shared the shrimp po boy and we ordered the Cajun fries.The Cajun Fries were so good!!!! Crawfish in that sauce and cheese on top of the fries...exquisite. All of the food we had was good!

I wish I had this restaurant nearby. Can't wait to come back.

What a great place to get good, authentic Cajun food! (Always good to see a lot of locals dining there.) Started with Hurricane drinks, made more fun by the dry ice topper. (See photo)  First course - the chicken & sausage gumbo. Outstanding! We wiped our bowls clean with the rolls. My second course - alligator sausage and shrimp tossed with fettuccine in a creole cream sauce. YUM! My husband had a shrimp creole and wiped the bowl clean with his second roll. No room for dessert, but the options looked amazing. Staff were super friendly. Even thought we're only in town for three days, I want to go back - this time for breakfast.

I've probably walked past this place so many times without even looking at it!  Finally got to try it with a few friends.  They're line was out the door by the time we got there, but it moved incredibly fast. We were in the door in 20-30 minutes. 

The restaurant has a really fun vibe with spacious seating.  It was our first time there so our waitress made sure to check in on us and explain the menu.  Their menu has so many options ranging from seafood to vegetarian options if you need that.  

After much debate I ended up ordering the blacked chicken cajun pasta.  I don't even know how to explain the flavors...just amazing.  The chicken was perfectly spicy while the pasta complemented it with a nice creamy consistency.  The portion size was also quite large so I ended up having leftovers too!

They have a ton of drink options too if you're ready to head out on Bourbon right afterwards.  It's only a short walk away and a great way to end the night!

Let me begin by saying that I was somewhat disappointed in New Orleans cuisine. None of it was "bad", but most of it was just 'fair' with very high prices that weren't justified by the food or the service. Nothing really stood out. We went to Deanies, Oceana, French Market Restaurant, The Crazy Lobster, and a few others.

Oceana was probably the best of the bunch. Service was excellent. We started with drinks, I had the sezarec ( spelling?) and it was a nicely made drink. If you like rye and enjoy a 'Manhattan' then by all means try it.. My wife had a beer ( some brown ale ). We started with raw oysters which were fresh and good. I had the red snapper 'house special' and my wife had the duck. Both were pretty good. 

Overall it was a good experience. The prices were high as should be expected in any French Quarter restaurant, but not as bad as some.

This was my favourite place in the French Quarter! Their service and food are both impeccable! 
My friends and I went here for both dinner and brunch. Saying their Alfredo sauce is delicious is a serious understatement. There are no words to describe it. I had the ahi tuna, and it was amazing with the crawfish sauce! 
For brunch, I had their Cajun breakfast and it was amazing! 
Definitely will go back on my next trip!

Try the money mike margarita! It was so good and strong! I got the Cajun shrimp pasta and had it blackened. It was delicious and seasoned very well. They place is a nice size so even at 11pm during a festival our wait was less than 10 minutes. Our server Ashleigh was very nice. I will definitely be going back!

We had a LARGE dinner party and this place was fantastic for it.  Right off the main drag, it's a very big restaurant with different levels.  Even though they were very busy throughout the night, I never felt neglected by our server - who was so very nice!  The food was delicious, the prices were fair and with a reservation you'll get in with no time .... even with 20 people!  I recommend to start off your New Orleans vacation.

Stumbled in here at midnight after my buddies and I enjoyed ourselves for a few hours on Bourbon Street. Best midnight snack ever.

We wanted just the sides and small items to tide us over, i.e. jambalaya, not a large meal or anything. So we ordered $5 jambalaya and some dungeness crabcakes. The crabcakes were thick and fat. Good bang for your buck.. And the jambalaya was amazing.... could have been the food version of beer goggles, I'll never know.

One friend in our group asked the waiter for the best fish they had. This turned out to be $30... We'll never stop giving him shit for ordering such an expensive item as a midnight snack. 

Another friend in the group is vegetarian and struggled the entire trip with finding vegetarian options. This restaurant was nice enough to let him bring him his cheese pizza in so he could at least eat with us. Woo!

We came in tonight (two couples) and sat outside. Errol was our server and we had a FANTASTIC time. He had a trainee with him and she was wonderful as well. They suggested the Cadillac Margarita and the crab cakes and of course we got both. We also ordered the fries as an appetizer and they were all great. For our entrees I hit the Mardi Gras pasta and Errol suggested a blackened fish on top of jambalaya with fried crawfish and some sauce and it was fantastic! Over all it was such a great experience. The host at the front door was also a gem, she was super cool. We really enjoyed our dinner and the experience we had. Thank y'all for such a great birthday dinner!

The service at Oceana is very good. 
The food Was not amazing but it was not bad. 
Drinks were good. 
Being smack in the middle of it all, is one downfall for me. I don't tend to eat in the touristy areas when on vacation because I feel like this is what happens... you get decent food.

Oceana's Famous Oysters
Freshly shucked louisiana oysters on the half-shell, chargrilled over an open flame, smothered with our unique zesty garlic and cream herb cajun sauce, finished with a fresh blend of parmesan and romano cheeses.   1/2 Doz. $10.50 / Doz. $17.50
*pretty tasty, a little confused that they had the sauce on top of the bread instead of bringing bread out that you could dip into the sauce because it was really soggy

Blackened Bayou Duck
Smoked till it's tender then blackened and topped with a crawfish mushroom cream sauce, served with jambalaya and sautéed vegetables.
*the duck was pretty chewy and there was barely any sauce, the jambalaya was really plain but the sauteed greens were the best part of the dish.

Golden Cadillac
Your choice of Olmeca Altos Plata or Patron Silver, Cointreau and a Grand Marnier float
*tasty solid Margarita and it has dry ice so it looks as good as it tastes

Overall the food is good but in comparison it was toward the bottom of all the meals I had in Nola.

We dined here about 9 years ago and really weren't that impressed. But we decided to give it another shot. Located in the heart of the bourbon street construction-Uber had to let us out about 3 blocks away and walk was a bit dicey with the construction. Anyway, we were seated quickly and service was prompt. My husband and I both had the ribs and fries- ribs were tender and fries were properly cooked. Our daughter had red beans and rice and gave it a thumbs up. Scotch and waters were pretty weak for the price. Server was very nice.

3.5 stars. Came in with some friends as our first meal in NOLA! Heard so many great things about this place so we just had to try it. We got seated immediately and the waiter was attentive. 

F O O D: 
- Seafood Gumbo ($5.50/cup): (5/5) the gumbo was perfectly seasoned and wasn't too salty. There was plenty of seafood so that I got something in every bite. I can definitely see why New Orleans is known for their gumbo. 
- Oceana famous oysters ($17.50/dz): (4/5) flavorful but didn't knock my socks off since they are considered their "famous" oysters. 
- Redfish Oceana ($22.00): (3/5) the fish was on the drier side and did not have much flavor. The breading was good and the sauce wasn't as flavorful as I expected. 

Overall, Oceana Grill is a great place for a late night snack but I wouldn't be back since there are so many other restaurants to try.
Got the famous crab cakes and the taste of New Orleans plate which had jambalaya, crawfish etouffee and red beans and rice. Everything was so delicious. No wonder why there is a line for dinner!
